Streptococcus  n. (pl. -cocci) bacterium of a type often causing infectious diseases.  streptococcal adj. [greek streptos twisted, kokkos berry]

Habituate  v. (-ting) (often foll. By to) accustom.  habituation n. [latin: related to *habit]

Anabolism  n. Synthesis of complex molecules in living organisms from simpler ones together with the storage of energy. [greek anabole ascent]

Deci-  comb. Form one-tenth. [latin decimus tenth]

Arrester  n. Device for slowing an aircraft after landing.

Fart  coarse slang —v. 1 emit wind from the anus. 2 (foll. By about, around) behave foolishly. —n. 1 an emission of wind from the anus. 2 unpleasant or foolish person. [old english]

Unmitigated  adj. Not mitigated; absolute (unmitigated disaster).

Exotic  —adj. 1 introduced from a foreign country; not native. 2 strange or unusual. —n. Exotic person or thing.  exotically adv. [greek exo outside]

Inevitable  —adj. 1 unavoidable; sure to happen. 2 colloq. Tiresomely familiar. —n. (prec. By the) inevitable fact, event, etc.  inevitability n. Inevitably adv. [latin evito avoid]

Anniversary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 date of an event in a previous year. 2 celebration of this. [latin annus year, verto vers- turn]

Colloquium  n. (pl. -s or -quia) academic conference or seminar. [latin: related to *colloquy]

Ankle  n. 1 joint connecting the foot with the leg. 2 this part of the leg. [old norse]

Huckster  —n. Aggressive salesman; hawker. —v. 1 haggle. 2 hawk (goods). [low german]

Hype  slang —n. Extravagant or intensive promotion of a product etc. —v. (-ping) promote with hype. [origin unknown]

Arbitration  n. Settlement of a dispute by an impartial third party.

Rupiah  n. Chief monetary unit of indonesia. [related to *rupee]

Unruly  adj. (-ier, -iest) undisciplined, disorderly.  unruliness n. [related to *rule]

Distrait  adj. (fem. Distraite) inattentive; distraught. [french: related to *distract]

Floe  n. Sheet of floating ice. [norwegian]

Toyshop  n. Shop selling toys.

Mermaid  n. Legendary creature with a woman's head and trunk and a fish's tail. [from *mere2 ‘sea’, *maid]

Enchant  v. 1 charm, delight. 2 bewitch.  enchantedly adv. Enchanting adj. Enchantingly adv. Enchantment n.

Perlite  n. (also pearlite) glassy type of vermiculite used for insulation etc. [french perle pearl]

Explicit  adj. 1 expressly stated, not merely implied; stated in detail. 2 definite. 3 outspoken.  explicitly adv. Explicitness n. [latin: related to *explicate]

Knell  —n. 1 sound of a bell, esp. For a death or funeral. 2 announcement, event, etc., regarded as an ill omen. —v. 1 ring a knell. 2 proclaim by or as by a knell. [old english]

Probe  —n. 1 penetrating investigation. 2 small device, esp. An electrode, for measuring, testing, etc. 3 blunt-ended surgical instrument for exploring a wound etc. 4 (in full space probe) unmanned exploratory spacecraft transmitting information about its environment. —v. (-bing) 1 examine or enquire into closely. 2 explore with a probe. [latin proba: related to *prove]

Titian  adj. (of hair) bright auburn. [titian, name of a painter]

Profanity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 profane act or language; blasphemy. 2 swear-word.

Import  —v. 1 bring in (esp. Foreign goods or services) to a country. 2 imply, indicate, signify. —n. 1 (esp. In pl.) Imported article or service. 2 importing. 3 what is implied; meaning. 4 importance.  importation n. Importer n. [latin importo carry in] 

March  n. Third month of the year. [latin martius of mars]

Precision  n. 1 accuracy. 2 degree of refinement in measurement etc. 3 (attrib.) Marked by or adapted for precision (precision instruments).

Biddy  n. (pl. -ies) slang woman (esp. Old biddy). [a form of the name bridget]

Hymn  —n. 1 song of esp. Christian praise. 2 crusading theme (hymn of freedom). —v. Praise or celebrate in hymns. [greek humnos]

Fiesta  n. Holiday, festivity, or religious festival. [spanish]

Immaterial  adj. 1 unimportant; irrelevant. 2 not material; incorporeal.  immateriality n.

Fork  —n. 1 pronged item of cutlery. 2 similar large tool used for digging, lifting, etc. 3 forked support for a bicycle wheel. 4 a divergence of a branch, road, etc. Into two parts. B place of this. C either part. —v. 1 form a fork or branch by separating into two parts. 2 take one road at a fork. 3 dig, lift, etc., with a fork.  fork out slang pay, esp. Reluctantly. [latin furca pitchfork]

Holm  n. (in full holm-oak) evergreen oak with holly-like young leaves. [dial. Holm holly]

Fleshly  adj. (-lier, -liest) 1 bodily; sensual. 2 mortal. 3 worldly.

Paprika  n. 1 red pepper. 2 condiment made from this. [magyar]

Corsair  n. 1 pirate ship. 2 pirate. [french: related to *course]

Numinous  adj. 1 indicating the presence of a divinity. 2 spiritual, awe-inspiring. [latin numen deity]

Flitter  v. Flit about; flutter. [from *flit]

Leer  —v. Look slyly, lasciviously, or maliciously. —n. Leering look. [perhaps from obsolete leer cheek]

Tailpiece  n. 1 rear appendage. 2 final part of a thing. 3 decoration in a blank space at the end of a chapter etc.

Vary  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 be or become different; be of different kinds; change. 2 make different; modify. [latin vario: related to *various]

Impeccable  adj. Faultless, exemplary.  impeccability n. Impeccably adv. [related to *in-1, latin pecco sin]

Stallion  n. Uncastrated adult male horse. [french estalon]

Wireless  n. Radio; radio receiving set.

Trilateral  adj. 1 of, on, or with three sides. 2 involving three parties. [latin: related to *tri-]

Sorority  n. (pl. -ies) us female students' society in a university or college. [latin soror sister]

Holmium  n. Metallic element of the lanthanide series. [latin holmia stockholm]

Curio  n. (pl. -s) rare or unusual object. [abbreviation of *curiosity]

Effigy  n. (pl. -ies) sculpture or model of a person.  burn in effigy burn a model of a person. [latin effigies from fingo fashion]

Schnapps  n. Any of various spirits drunk in n. Europe. [german]

Swapo  abbr. (also swapo) south west africa people's organization.

Scoria  n. (pl. Scoriae) 1 cellular lava, or fragments of it. 2 slag or dross of metals.  scoriaceous adj. [greek skoria refuse]

Drudge  —n. Person who does dull, laborious, or menial work. —v. (-ging) work laboriously, toil.  drudgery n. [origin uncertain]

Paschal  adj. 1 of the jewish passover. 2 of easter. [hebrew pesah]

-ation  suffix 1 forming nouns denoting an action or an instance of it (flirtation; hesitation). 2 forming nouns denoting a result or product of action (plantation; starvation). [latin -atio]

Tragedy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 serious accident, disaster, etc.; sad event. 2 a play dealing with tragic events and ending unhappily, esp. With the downfall of the protagonist. B such plays as a genre. [greek tragoidia]

Detriment  n. 1 harm, damage. 2 cause of this.  detrimental adj. [latin: related to *trite]

Bailey  n. (pl. -s) 1 outer wall of a castle. 2 court enclosed by it. [french: related to *bail2]

Unequaled  adj. (brit. -alled) superior to all others.

Archaism  n. 1 use of the archaic esp. In language or art. 2 archaic word or expression.  archaistic adj.

Ellipsis  n. (pl. Ellipses) 1 omission of words needed to complete a construction or sense. 2 set of three dots etc. Indicating omission.

Infuse  v. (-sing) 1 (usu. Foll. By with) fill (with a quality). 2 steep (tea leaves etc.) In liquid to extract the content; be steeped thus. 3 (usu. Foll. By into) instil (life etc.). [latin infundo -fus-: related to *found3]

Engender  v. Give rise to; produce (a feeling etc.). [related to *genus]

Gong  n. 1 metal disc with a turned rim, giving a resonant note when struck. 2 saucer-shaped bell. 3 slang medal. [malay]

Diminution  n. 1 diminishing or being diminished. 2 decrease. [latin: related to *diminish]

Remnant  n. 1 small remaining quantity. 2 piece of cloth etc. Left when the greater part has been used or sold. [french: related to *remain]

Cyclic  adj. (also cyclical) 1 a recurring in cycles. B belonging to a chronological cycle. 2 with constituent atoms forming a ring.  cyclically adv.

Reserve  —v. (-ving) 1 put aside, keep back for a later occasion or special use. 2 order to be specially retained or allocated for a particular person or at a particular time. 3 retain or secure (reserve the right to). —n. 1 thing reserved for future use; extra amount. 2 limitation or exception attached to something. 3 self-restraint; reticence; lack of cordiality. 4 company's profit added to capital. 5 (in sing. Or pl.) Assets kept readily available. 6 (in sing. Or pl.) A troops withheld from action to reinforce or protect others. B forces in addition to the regular army etc., but available in an emergency. 7 member of the military reserve. 8 extra player chosen as a possible substitute in a team. 9 land reserved for special use, esp. As a habitat (nature reserve).  in reserve unused and available if required. Reserve judgement postpone giving one's opinion. [latin servo keep]

Perpetuity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 state or quality of being perpetual. 2 perpetual annuity. 3 perpetual possession or position.  in perpetuity for ever. [latin: related to *perpetual]

Lethal  adj. Causing or sufficient to cause death.  lethally adv. [latin letum death]

Stuffy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 (of a room etc.) Lacking fresh air. 2 dull or uninteresting. 3 (of the nose etc.) Stuffed up. 4 dull and conventional.  stuffily adv. Stuffiness n.

Drumbeat  n. Stroke or sound of a stroke on a drum.

Polyethylene  n. = *polythene.

Foetid  var. Of *fetid.

Barbecue  —n. 1 a meal cooked over charcoal etc. Out of doors. B party for this. 2 grill etc. Used for this. —v. (-ues, -ued, -uing) cook on a barbecue. [spanish from haitian]

Septuagesima  n. Sunday before sexagesima. [latin, = seventieth]

Insatiable  adj. 1 unable to be satisfied. 2 extremely greedy.  insatiability n. Insatiably adv.

Bogy  var. Of *bogey2.

Prospective  adj. Some day to be; expected; future (prospective bridegroom). [latin: related to *prospectus]

Systemic  adj. 1 physiol. Of the whole body. 2 (of an insecticide etc.) Entering the plant via the roots or shoots and freely transported within its tissues.  systemically adv.

Wavelength  n. 1 distance between successive crests of a wave. 2 this as a distinctive feature of radio waves from a transmitter. 3 colloq. Particular mode or range of thought.

Tuscan  —n. 1 inhabitant of tuscany. 2 form of italian spoken in tuscany; standard italian. —adj. 1 of tuscany or the tuscans. 2 archit. Of the plainest of the classical orders. [latin]

Vertiginous  adj. Of or causing vertigo. [latin: related to *vertigo]

Apprehend  v. 1 seize, arrest. 2 understand, perceive. [latin prehendo grasp]

Literature  n. 1 written works, esp. Those valued for form and style. 2 writings of a country or period or on a particular subject. 3 literary production. 4 colloq. Printed matter, leaflets, etc.

Demonstrative  adj. 1 showing feelings readily; affectionate. 2 (usu. Foll. By of) logically conclusive; giving proof (demonstrative of their skill). 3 gram. (of an adjective or pronoun) indicating the person or thing referred to (e.g. This, that, those).  demonstratively adv. Demonstrativeness n.

Martian  —adj. Of the planet mars. —n. Hypothetical inhabitant of mars. [latin]

Postgraduate  —n. Person engaged in a course of study after taking a first degree. —adj. Of or concerning postgraduates.

Denary  adj. Of ten; decimal.

Jewellery  n. (also jewelry) rings, brooches, necklaces, etc., regarded collectively.

Parkland  n. Open grassland with trees etc.

Sterol  n. Naturally occurring steroid alcohol. [from *cholesterol, etc.]

Schnitzel  n. Escalope of veal. [german]

Whig  n. Hist. Member of the british reforming and constitutional party succeeded in the 19th c. By the liberal party.  whiggery n. Whiggish adj. Whiggism n. [whiggamer, -more, nickname of 17th-c. Scots rebels]

Desultory  adj. 1 constantly turning from one subject to another. 2 disconnected; unmethodical.  desultorily adv. [latin desultorius superficial]

-ess  suffix forming nouns denoting females (actress; lioness). [greek -issa]

Uninhabited  adj. Not inhabited.

Sr  symb. Strontium.

Sturgeon  n. (pl. Same or -s) large sharklike fish yielding caviare. [anglo-french from germanic]

Arris  n. Archit. Sharp edge at the junction of two surfaces. [french areste, = *arête]

Polyethene  n. = *polythene.

Hanker  v. (foll. By for, after, or to + infin.) Long for; crave.  hankering n. [from obsolete hank]

Northerner  n. Native or inhabitant of the north.

Matrices  pl. Of *matrix.

Fa  abbr. Football association.

Idiocy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 foolishness; foolish act. 2 extreme mental imbecility.

Serviceable  adj. 1 useful or usable; able to render service. 2 durable but plain.  serviceability n.

Microscopy  n. Use of microscopes.

Florist  n. Person who deals in or grows flowers. [latin flos *flower]

Semantic  adj. Of meaning in language.  semantically adv. [greek semaino to mean]

Send  v. (past and past part. Sent) 1 a order or cause to go or be conveyed. B propel (sent him flying). C cause to become (sent me mad). 2 send a message etc. (he sent to warn me). 3 (of god, etc.) Grant, bestow, or inflict; bring about; cause to be. 4 slang put into ecstasy.  send away for order (goods) by post. Send down 1 rusticate or expel from a university. 2 send to prison. Send for 1 summon. 2 order by post. Send in 1 cause to go in. 2 submit (an entry etc.) For a competition etc. Send off 1 dispatch (a letter, parcel, etc.). 2 attend the departure of (a person) as a sign of respect etc. 3 sport (of a referee) order (a player) to leave the field. Send off for = send away for. Send on transmit further or in advance of oneself. Send up 1 cause to go up. 2 transmit to a higher authority. 3 colloq. Ridicule by mimicking. Send word send information.  sender n. [old english]

Indrawn  adj. (of breath etc.) Drawn in.

Luck  n. 1 good or bad fortune. 2 circumstances of life (beneficial or not) brought by this. 3 good fortune; success due to chance (in luck; out of luck).  no such luck colloq. Unfortunately not. [low german or dutch]

Hms  abbr. Her (or his) majesty's ship.

Shine  —v. (-ning; past and past part. Shone or shined) 1 emit or reflect light; be bright; glow. 2 (of the sun, a star, etc.) Be visible. 3 cause (a lamp etc.) To shine. 4 (past and past part. Shined) polish. 5 be brilliant; excel. —n. 1 light; brightness. 2 high polish; lustre.  take a shine to colloq. Take a fancy to. [old english]

Millefeuille  n. Rich cake of puff pastry split and filled with jam, cream, etc. [french, = thousand-leaf]

Sand  —n. 1 fine loose grains resulting from the erosion of esp. Siliceous rocks and forming the seashore, deserts, etc. 2 (in pl.) A grains of sand. B expanse of sand. C sandbank. —v. Smooth with sandpaper or sand. [old english]

Aficionado  n. (pl. -s) devotee of a sport or pastime. [spanish]

Fully occupying the available space etc. (capacity crowd). 2 mental power. 3 position or function. 4 legal competence.  to capacity fully. [latin: related to *capacious]

Unseal  v. Break the seal of; open (a letter, receptacle, etc.).

Collie  n. Sheepdog of an orig. Scottish breed. [perhaps from coll *coal]

Presumptuous  adj. Unduly or overbearingly confident.  presumptuously adv. Presumptuousness n.

Degree  n. 1 stage in a scale, series, or process. 2 stage in intensity or amount (in some degree). 3 unit of measurement of an angle or arc. 4 unit in a scale of temperature, hardness, etc. 5 extent of burns. 6 academic rank conferred by a polytechnic, university, etc. 7 grade of crime (first-degree murder). 8 step in direct genealogical descent. 9 social rank.  by degrees gradually. [latin gradus step]

Slobber  —v. 1 dribble. 2 (foll. By over) drool over. —n. Dribbling saliver.  slobbery adj. [dutch]

Zend  n. An interpretation of the avesta. [persian]

Bouncing  adj. (esp. Of a baby) big and healthy.

Squib  n. 1 small hissing firework that finally explodes. 2 satirical essay. [perhaps imitative]

Rehear  v. (past and past part. Reheard) hear (esp. A judicial case) again.

Recapitulate  v. (-ting) 1 go briefly through again; summarize. 2 go over the main points or headings of. [latin: related to *capital]

Estate  n. 1 property consisting of much land and usu. A large house. 2  modern residential or industrial area with an integrated design or purpose. 3 person's assets and liabilities, esp. At death. 4 property where rubber, tea, grapes, etc., are cultivated. 5 order or class forming (or regarded as) part of the body politic. 6 archaic or literary state or position in life (the estate of holy matrimony).  the three estates lords spiritual (the heads of the church), lords temporal (the peerage), and the commons. [french estat, from latin sto stat- stand]

Usage  estate duty was replaced in 1975 by capital transfer tax and in 1986 by inheritance tax.

Airlock  n. 1 stoppage of the flow by an air bubble in a pump or pipe. 2 compartment permitting movement between areas at different pressures.

Chimpanzee  n. Small african manlike ape. [french from kongo]

Intravenous  adj. In or into a vein or veins.  intravenously adv.

Popinjay  n. Fop, conceited person. [arabic babagha parrot]

Skim  —v. (-mm-) 1 a take a floating layer from the surface of (a liquid). B take (cream etc.) From the surface of a liquid. 2 a barely touch (a surface) in passing over. B (often followed by over) deal with or treat (a matter) superficially. 3 (often foll. By over, along) go or glide lightly. 4 (often followed by through) read or look over cursorily. —n. Skimming. [french: related to *scum]

Cheesecloth  n. Thin loosely-woven cloth.

Acupuncture  n. Medical treatment using needles in parts of the body.  acupuncturist n. [latin acu with needle]

Unrestrained  adj. Not restrained.

Se  abbr. 1 south-east. 2 south-eastern.

Monologue  n. 1 a scene in a drama in which a person speaks alone. B dramatic composition for one performer. 2 long speech by one person in a conversation etc. [french from greek monologos speaking alone]

Intransitive  adj. (of a verb) not taking a direct object.

Stampede  —n. 1 sudden flight or hurried movement of animals or people. 2 response of many persons at once to a common impulse. —v. (-ding) (cause to) take part in a stampede. [spanish estampida crash, uproar]

Unaware  —adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By of or that) not aware. 2 unperceptive. —adv. = *unawares.  unawareness n.

Ricotta  n. Soft italian cheese. [latin: related to *re-, coquo cook]

Cicada  n. Large transparent-winged insect making a rhythmic chirping sound. [latin]

Testa  n. (pl. Testae)  seed's protective outer covering. [latin: related to *test2]

Aircraft  n. (pl. Same) machine capable of flight, esp. An aeroplane or helicopter.

Blast  —n. 1 strong gust of air. 2 a explosion. B destructive wave of air from this. 3 loud note from a wind instrument, car horn, etc. 4 colloq. Severe reprimand. —v. 1 blow up with explosives. 2 wither, blight (blasted oak; blasted her hopes). 3 (cause to) make a loud noise. —int. Expressing annoyance.  at full blast colloq. At maximum volume, speed, etc. Blast off take off from a launching site. [old english]

Jackanapes  n. Archaic rascal. [earlier jack napes, supposed to refer to the duke of suffolk]

Leaning  n. Tendency or partiality.

Armhole  n. Each of two holes for arms in a garment.

Attitude  n. 1 opinion or way of thinking; behaviour reflecting this (don't like his attitude). 2 bodily posture; pose. 3 position of an aircraft etc. Relative to given points. [latin aptus fitted]

Unrecognized  adj. (also -ised) not acknowledged.

Sometime  —adv. 1 at some time. 2 formerly. —attrib. Adj. Former.

Deplore  v. (-ring) 1 regret deeply. 2 find exceedingly bad. [latin ploro wail]

Elector  n. 1 person who has the right to vote in an election. 2 (elector) hist. (in the holy roman empire) any of the german princes entitled to elect the emperor.  electoral adj.

Mattins  var. Of *matins.

Origin  n. 1 starting-point; source. 2 (often in pl.) Ancestry, parentage. 3 math. Point from which coordinates are measured. [latin origo origin- from orior rise]

Sticky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 tending or intended to stick or adhere. 2 glutinous, viscous. 3 humid. 4 colloq. Difficult, awkward; unpleasant, painful (sticky problem).  stickily adv. Stickiness n.

Tomb  n. 1 burial-vault. 2 grave. 3 sepulchral monument. [greek tumbos]

Parasol  n. Light umbrella giving shade from the sun. [italian: related to *para-2, sole sun]

Gingerly  —adv. In a careful or cautious manner. —adj. Showing great care or caution. [perhaps from french gensor delicate]

Atheism  n. Belief that there is no god.  atheist n. Atheistic adj. [greek a- not, theos god]

Whine  —n. 1 complaining long-drawn wail as of a dog. 2 similar shrill prolonged sound. 3 querulous tone or complaint. —v. (-ning) emit or utter a whine; complain. [old english]

Dogfight  n. 1 close combat between fighter aircraft. 2 rough fight.

Incident  —n. 1 occurrence, esp. A minor one. 2 public disturbance (the march took place without incident). 3 clash of armed forces (frontier incident). 4 distinct piece of action in a play, film, etc. —adj. 1 (often foll. By to) apt to occur; naturally attaching. 2 (often foll. By on, upon) (of light etc.) Falling. [latin cado fall]

Ethane  n. Gaseous hydrocarbon of the alkane series. [from *ether]

Tribesman  n. (fem. -woman) member of a tribe.

Irrupt  v. (foll. By into) enter forcibly or violently.  irruption n. [latin: related to *rupture]

Dendrology  n. The study of trees.  dendrological adj. Dendrologist n. [greek dendron tree]

Fleshpots  n.pl. Luxurious living.

Blurb  n. Promotional description, esp. Of a book. [coined by g. Burgess 1907]

-ible  suffix forming adjectives meaning ‘that may or may be’ (forcible; possible). [latin]

Rhizome  n. Underground rootlike stem bearing both roots and shoots. [greek rhizoma]

Denature  v. (-ring) 1 change the properties of (a protein etc.) By heat, acidity, etc. 2 make (alcohol) undrinkable. [french]

Skid  —v. (-dd-) 1 (of a vehicle etc.) Slide on slippery ground, esp. Sideways or obliquely. 2 cause (a vehicle) to skid. —n. 1 act of skidding. 2 runner beneath an aircraft for use when landing.  on the skids colloq. About to be discarded or defeated. Put the skids under colloq. Hasten the downfall or failure of. [origin unknown]

Populace  n. The common people. [italian: related to *popular]

Taxidermy  n. Art of preparing, stuffing, and mounting the skins of animals.  taxidermist n. [greek taxis arrangement, derma skin]

Scapula  n. (pl. -lae or -s) shoulder-blade. [latin]

Extra  —adj. Additional; more than usual or necessary or expected. —adv. 1 more than usually. 2 additionally (was charged extra). —n. 1 extra thing. 2 thing for which an extra charge is made. 3 person engaged temporarily for a minor part in a film. 4 special issue of a newspaper etc. 5 cricket run scored other than from a hit with the bat. [probably from *extraordinary]

Wording  n. Form of words used.

Flee  v. (past and past part. Fled) 1 (often foll. By from, before) a run away (from); leave abruptly (fled the room). B seek safety by fleeing. 2 vanish. [old english]

Tactless  adj. Having or showing no tact.  tactlessly adv.

Stet  v. (-tt-) (usu. Written on a proof-sheet etc.) Ignore or cancel (the alteration); let the original stand. [latin, = let it stand]

Projection  n. 1 projecting or being projected. 2 thing that projects or obtrudes. 3 presentation of an image etc. On a surface. 4 forecast or estimate (projection of next year's profits). 5 a mental image viewed as an objective reality. B unconscious transfer of feelings etc. To external objects or persons. 6 representation on a plane surface of any part of the surface of the earth or a celestial sphere (mercator projection).  projectionist n. (in sense 3).

Sexless  adj. 1 neither male nor female. 2 lacking sexual desire or attractiveness.

Therapeutics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Branch of medicine concerned with cures and remedies.

Obligate  v. (-ting) bind (a person) legally or morally (was obligated to attend). [latin: related to *oblige]

Mash  —n. 1 soft or confused mixture. 2 mixture of boiled grain, bran, etc., fed to horses etc. 3  colloq. Mashed potatoes. 4 mixture of malt and hot water used in brewing. 5 soft pulp made by crushing, mixing with water, etc. —v. 1 crush (potatoes etc.) To a pulp. 2 dial. A infuse (tea). B (of tea) draw.  masher n. [old english]

Taught  past and past part. Of *teach.

Quaff  v. Literary 1 drink deeply. 2 drain (a cup etc.) In long draughts.  quaffable adj. [perhaps imitative]

Steeple  n. Tall tower, esp. With a spire, above the roof of a church. [old english: related to *steep1]

Granular  adj. Of or like grains or granules.  granularity n. [latin: related to *granule]

Hydroxide  n. Compound containing oxygen and hydrogen as either a hydroxide ion or a hydroxyl group.

Ashcan  n. Us dustbin.

Ternary  adj. Composed of three parts. [latin terni, = three each]

Cryer  var. Of *crier.

Pennon  n. 1 long narrow flag, triangular or swallow-tailed. 2 long pointed streamer on a ship. [latin penna feather]

Bleeding  adj. & adv. Coarse slang expressing annoyance or antipathy.

Concordance  n. 1 agreement. 2 alphabetical index of words used in a book or by an author. [medieval latin: related to *concord]

Enthral  v. (us enthrall) (-ll-) captivate, please greatly.  enthralment n. [from *en-1, *thrall]

Deserving  adj. (often foll. By of) worthy (esp. Of help, praise, etc.).

Tubercular  adj. Of or having tubercles or tuberculosis.

Uprising  n. Insurrection.

Dwelling  n. House, residence.

Shocker  n. Colloq. 1 shocking person or thing. 2 sensational novel etc.

View  —n. 1 range of vision (came into view). 2 a what is seen; prospect, scene, etc. B picture etc. Of this. 3 a opinion. B manner of considering a thing (took a long-term view). 4 inspection by the eye or mind (private view). —v. 1 look at; inspect with the idea of purchasing; survey visually or mentally. 2 form a mental impression or opinion of; consider. 3 watch television.  have in view 1 have as one's object. 2 bear (a circumstance) in mind. In view of considering. On view being shown or exhibited. With a view to with the hope or intention of. [latin video see]

Mortar  —n. 1 mixture of lime or cement, sand, and water, for bonding bricks or stones. 2 short large-bore cannon for firing shells at high angles. 3 vessel in which ingredients are pounded with a pestle. —v. 1 plaster or join with mortar. 2 bombard with mortar shells. [latin mortarium]

Thong  n. Narrow strip of hide or leather. [old english]

Octet  n. (also octette) 1 a musical composition for eight performers. B the performers. 2 group of eight. [italian or german: related to *octa-]

Unquenchable  adj. That cannot be quenched.

Fiddly  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Awkward or tiresome to do or use.

Tapestry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a thick fabric in which coloured weft threads are woven to form pictures or designs. B (usu. Wool) embroidery imitating this. C piece of this. 2 events or circumstances etc. Seen as interwoven etc. (life's rich tapestry).  tapestried adj. [tapissery from french tapis carpet]

Aconite  n. 1 any of various poisonous plants, esp. Monkshood. 2 drug from these. [greek akoniton]

Halloo  int. Inciting dogs to the chase or calling attention. [perhaps from hallow pursue with shouts]

Token  n. 1 thing serving as a symbol, reminder, or mark (as a token of affection; in token of my esteem). 2 voucher. 3 thing equivalent to something else, esp. Money. 4 (attrib.) A perfunctory (token effort). B conducted briefly to demonstrate strength of feeling (token strike). C chosen by tokenism to represent a group (token woman).

Aha  int. Expressing surprise, triumph, mockery, etc. [from *ah, *ha1]

Bronchitis  n. Inflammation of the mucous membrane in the bronchial tubes.

Chunk  n. 1 thick piece cut or broken off. 2 substantial amount. [var. Of *chuck2]

Kilolitre  n. (us -liter) 1,000 litres (220 imperial gallons).

Sisterhood  n. 1 relationship between or as between sisters. 2 society of esp. Religious or charitable women. 3 community of feeling between women.

Circadian  adj. Physiol. Occurring about once per day. [from *circa, latin dies day]

Congregation  n. 1 gathering of people, esp. For religious worship. 2 body of persons regularly attending a particular church etc. [latin: related to *congregate]

Doubtful  adj. 1 feeling doubt. 2 causing doubt. 3 unreliable.  doubtfully adv. Doubtfulness n.

Emporium  n. (pl. -s or -ria) 1 large shop or store. 2 centre of commerce, market. [greek emporos merchant]

Buccaneer  n. 1 pirate. 2 unscrupulous adventurer.  buccaneering n. & adj. [french]

Jaundice  —n. 1 yellowing of the skin etc. Caused by liver disease, bile disorder, etc. 2 disordered (esp. Mental) vision. 3 envy. —v. (-cing) 1 affect with jaundice. 2 (esp. As jaundiced adj.) Affect (a person) with envy, resentment, etc. [french jaune yellow]

Locality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 district. 2 site or scene of a thing. 3 thing's position. [latin: related to *local]

Nobelium  n.  Artificially produced radioactive transuranic metallic element. [from nobel: see *nobel prize]

Jetsam  n. Objects washed ashore, esp. Jettisoned from a ship. [contraction of *jettison]

Milligram  n. (also -gramme) one-thousandth of a gram.

Duple  adj. Of two parts. [latin duplus]

Semolina  n. 1 hard grains left after the milling of flour, used in milk puddings etc. 2 pudding of this. [italian semolino]

According  adv. 1 (foll. By to) a as stated by (according to mary). B in proportion to (lives according to his means). 2 (foll. By as + clause) in a manner or to a degree that varies as (pays according as he is able).

Interment  n. Burial.

Usage  interment is sometimes confused with internment, which means ‘confinement’.

Remodel  v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 model again or differently. 2 reconstruct.

Reinsert  v. Insert again.

Contentious  adj. 1 quarrelsome. 2 likely to cause an argument.

Elastomer  n. Natural or synthetic rubber or rubber-like plastic. [from *elastic, after isomer]

Conduce  v. (-cing) (foll. By to) contribute to (a result). [latin: related to *conduct]

Crystalline  adj. 1 of, like, or clear as crystal. 2 having the structure and form of a crystal.  crystallinity n.

Indigent  adj. Formal needy, poor.  indigence n. [latin egeo need]

Grandparent  n. Parent of one's father or mother.

Imitative  adj. 1 (often foll. By of) imitating; following a model or example. 2 (of a word) reproducing a natural sound (e.g. Fizz), or otherwise suggestive (e.g. Blob).

Sacking  n. Material for making sacks; sackcloth.

Minder  n. 1 (often in comb.) Person employed to look after a person or thing (child minder). 2 slang bodyguard.

Vodka  n. Alcoholic spirit distilled esp. In russia from rye etc. [russian]

Solemn  adj. 1 serious and dignified. 2 formal. 3 awe-inspiring. 4 (of a person) serious or cheerless in manner. 5 grave, sober (solemn promise).  solemnly adv. Solemness n. [latin solemnis]

Monophonic  adj. (of sound-reproduction) using only one channel of transmission. [greek phone sound]

Integrity  n. 1 moral excellence; honesty. 2 wholeness; soundness. [latin: related to *integer]

Balk  var. Of *baulk.

Cuss  colloq. —n. 1 curse. 2 usu. Derog. Person; creature. —v. Curse. [var. Of *curse]

Caribbean  adj. Of the caribs or the w. Indies generally.

Earshot  n. Hearing-range (within earshot).

Mandible  n. 1 jaw, esp. The lower jaw in mammals and fishes. 2 upper or lower part of a bird's beak. 3 either half of the crushing organ in the mouth-parts of an insect etc. [latin mando chew]

Whimsical  adj. Capricious, fantastic.  whimsicality n. Whimsically adv.

Single  —adj. 1 one only, not double or multiple. 2 united or undivided. 3 for or done by one person etc. 4 one by itself (a single tree). 5 regarded separately (every single thing). 6 not married. 7 (with neg. Or interrog.) Even one (not a single car). 8 (of a flower) having only one circle of petals. —n. 1 single thing, esp. A single room in a hotel. 2 (in full single ticket) ticket valid for an outward journey only. 3 pop record with one item on each side. 4 cricket hit for one run. 5 (usu. In pl.) Game with one player on each side. 6 (in pl.) Unmarried people. —v. (foll. By out) choose for special attention etc.  singly adv. [latin singulus]

Versicle  n. Each of a priest's short sentences in a liturgy, answered by the congregation. [latin diminutive: related to *verse]

Pathetic  adj. 1 arousing pity, sadness, or contempt. 2 colloq. Miserably inadequate.  pathetically adv. [greek pathos from paskho suffer]

Carborundum  n. Compound of carbon and silicon used esp. As an abrasive. [from *carbon, *corundum]

Forbid  v. (forbidding; past forbade or forbad; past part. Forbidden) 1 (foll. By to + infin.) Order not (i forbid you to go). 2 refuse to allow (a thing, or a person to have a thing). 3 refuse a person entry to.  god forbid! May it not happen! [old english: related to *bid]

Hornbill  n. Bird with a hornlike excrescence on its large curved bill.

Cosy  (us cozy) —adj. (-ier, -iest) comfortable and warm; snug. —n. (pl. -ies) cover to keep a teapot etc. Hot.  cosily adv. Cosiness n. [origin unknown]

Truly  adv. 1 sincerely (am truly grateful). 2 really, indeed (truly, i do not know). 3 loyally (served them truly). 4 accurately (is not truly depicted). 5 properly (well and truly). [old english: related to *true]

Woodpigeon  n. Dove with white patches like a ring round its neck.

Gradient  n. 1 stretch of road, railway, etc., that slopes. 2 amount of such a slope. [probably from *grade after salient]

Cash  —n. 1 money in coins or notes. 2 (also cash down) full payment at the time of purchase. 3 colloq. Wealth. —v. Give or obtain cash for (a note, cheque, etc.).  cash in 1 obtain cash for. 2 colloq. (usu. Foll. By on) profit (from); take advantage (of). Cash up count and check the day's takings. [latin: related to *case2]

Hereabouts  adv. (also hereabout) near this place.

Jain  —n. Adherent of an indian religion resembling buddhism. —adj. Of this religion.  jainism n. Jainist n. & adj. [hindi]

Sly  adj. (slyer, slyest) 1 cunning, crafty, wily. 2 secretive. 3 knowing; insinuating.  on the sly secretly.  slyly adv. Slyness n. [old norse: related to *slay]

Velour  n. (also velours pronunc. Same) plushlike fabric. [french]

Constipate  v. (-ting) (esp. As constipated adj.) Affect with constipation. [latin stipo cram]

Ten  adj. & n. 1 one more than nine. 2 symbol for this (10, x, x). 3 size etc. Denoted by ten. 4 ten o'clock.  ten to one very probably. [old english]

Manipulative  adj. Tending to exploit a situation, person, etc., for one's own ends.  manipulatively adv.

Colonialism  n. 1 policy of acquiring or maintaining colonies. 2 derog. Exploitation of colonies.  colonialist n. & adj.

Flew  past of *fly1.

Infrared  adj. Of or using rays with a wavelength just longer than the red end of the visible spectrum.

Intrust  var. Of *entrust.

Violist  n. Viol- or viola-player.

Hive  n. Beehive.  hive off (-ving) separate from a larger group. [old english]

Malapropism  n. Comical misuse of a word in mistake for one sounding similar, e.g. Alligator for allegory. [mrs malaprop, name of a character in sheridan's the rivals]

Inapt  adj. 1 not apt or suitable. 2 unskilful.  inaptitude n.

Lactic  adj. Of milk. [latin lac lactis milk]

Ampoule  n. Small sealed capsule holding a solution for injection. [french: related to *ampulla]

Ember  n. (usu. In pl.) Small piece of glowing coal etc. In a dying fire. [old english]

Spirit  —n. 1 person's essence or intelligence; soul. 2 a rational or intelligent being without a material body. B ghost. 3 a person's character (an unbending spirit). B attitude (took it in the wrong spirit). C type of person (is a free spirit; a kindred spirit). D prevailing tendency (spirit of the age). 4 a (usu. In pl.) Strong distilled liquor, e.g. Whisky or gin. B distilled volatile liquid (wood spirit). C purified alcohol (methylated spirit). 5 a courage, vivacity. B (in pl.) State of mind, mood (in high spirits; his spirits were dashed). 6 essential as opposed to formal meaning (the spirit of the law). —v. (-t-) (usu. Foll. By away, off, etc.) Convey rapidly or mysteriously.  in spirit inwardly. [latin spiritus: related to *spirant]

Pollen  n. Fine dustlike grains discharged from the male part of a flower, each containing the fertilizing element. [latin]

Homophone  n. Word pronounced like another but of different meaning or origin (e.g. Pair, pear). [from *homo-, greek phone sound]

Busybody  n. (pl. -ies) meddlesome person.

Hanky  n. (also hankie) (pl. -ies) colloq. Handkerchief. [abbreviation]

Waiver  n. Law 1 waiving of a legal right etc. 2 document recording this.

Criterion  n. (pl. -ria) principle or standard of judgement. [greek, = means of judging]

Usage  the plural form of criterion, criteria, is often used incorrectly as the singular. In the singular criterion should always be used.

Urbanize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make urban, esp. By destroying the rural quality of (a district).  urbanization n.

Unjustifiable  adj. Not justifiable.  unjustifiably adv.

Autograph  —n. Signature, esp. That of a celebrity. —v. Sign or write on in one's own hand. [greek grapho write]

Um  int. Expressing hesitation or a pause in speech. [imitative]

Polytheism  n. Belief in or worship of more than one god.  polytheist n. Polytheistic adj. [greek theos god]

Edge  —n. 1 boundary-line or margin of an area or surface. 2 narrow surface of a thin object. 3 meeting-line of surfaces. 4 a sharpened side of a blade. B sharpness. 5 brink of a precipice. 6 edge-like thing, esp. The crest of a ridge. 7 effectiveness, incisiveness; excitement. —v. (-ging) 1 advance, esp. Gradually or furtively. 2 a provide with an edge or border. B form a border to. 3 sharpen (a tool etc.).  have the edge on (or over) have a slight advantage over. On edge tense and irritable. Set a person's teeth on edge (of taste or sound) cause an unpleasant nervous sensation. Take the edge off make less intense. [old english]

Gherkin  n. Small pickled cucumber. [dutch]

Sacristan  n. Person in charge of a sacristy and church contents. [medieval latin: related to *sacred]

Condom  n. Contraceptive sheath worn by men. [origin unknown]

Alum  n. Double sulphate of aluminium and potassium. [latin alumen -min-]

Footpath  n. Path for pedestrians; pavement.

Intention  n. 1 thing intended; aim, purpose. 2 intending (done without intention).

Supreme  adj. 1 highest in authority or rank. 2 greatest; most important. 3 (of a penalty or sacrifice etc.) Involving death.  supremely adv. [latin]

Greatcoat  n. Heavy overcoat.

Smoke  —n. 1 visible vapour from a burning substance. 2 act of smoking tobacco. 3 colloq. Cigarette or cigar. —v. (-king) 1 a inhale and exhale the smoke of (a cigarette etc.). B do this habitually. 2 emit smoke or visible vapour. 3 darken or preserve with smoke (smoked salmon).  go up in smoke colloq. Come to nothing. Smoke out 1 drive out by means of smoke. 2 drive out of hiding etc. [old english]

Doric  —adj. 1 archit. Of the oldest and simplest of the greek orders. 2 (of a dialect) broad, rustic. —n. Rustic english or esp. Scots. [from doris in greece]

Stroboscope  n. 1 physics instrument for determining speeds of rotation etc. By shining a bright light at intervals so that a rotating object appears stationary. 2 lamp made to flash intermittently, esp. For this purpose.  stroboscopic adj. [greek strobos whirling]

Anyhow  adv. 1 anyway. 2 in a disorderly manner or state (does his work anyhow).

Bilberry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 hardy n. European shrub of heaths and mountains. 2 its small dark-blue edible berry. [scandinavian]

Meritocracy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 government by those selected for merit. 2 group selected in this way. 3 society governed thus.

Obelus  n. (pl. Obeli) dagger-shaped reference mark (†). [greek, = pointed pillar, *spit2]

Auburn  adj. Reddish-brown (usu. Of hair). [originally = yellowish white: from latin albus white]

Coloring  n. (brit. Colour-) 1 appearance as regards colour, esp. Facial complexion. 2 use or application of colour. 3 substance giving colour.

Tracer  n. 1 bullet etc. That is visible in flight because of flames etc. Emitted. 2 artificial radioactive isotope which can be followed through the body by the radiation it produces.

Flipping  adj. & adv. Slang expressing annoyance, or as an intensifier.

Clipboard  n. Small board with a spring clip for holding papers etc.

Rondeau  n. (pl. Rondeaux pronunc. Same or) poem of ten or thirteen lines with only two rhymes throughout and with the opening words used twice as a refrain. [french: related to *rondel]

Schoolgirl  n. Girl attending school.

Lint  n. 1 linen or cotton with a raised nap on one side, used for dressing wounds. 2 fluff. [perhaps from french linette from lin flax]

Chasm  n. 1 deep cleft or opening in the earth, rock, etc. 2 wide difference of feeling, interests, etc. [latin from greek]

Toadflax  n. Plant with yellow or purple flowers.

Walloon  —n. 1 member of a people inhabiting s. And e. Belgium and neighbouring france. 2 french dialect spoken by this people. —adj. Of or concerning the walloons or their language. [medieval latin wallo -onis]

Muggins  n. (pl. Same or mugginses) colloq. Gullible person (often meaning oneself: so muggins had to pay). [perhaps from the surname]

Tea  n. 1 a (in full tea plant) asian evergreen shrub or small tree. B its dried leaves. 2 drink made by infusing tea-leaves in boiling water. 3 infusion of other leaves etc. (camomile tea; beef tea). 4 a light afternoon meal of tea, bread, cakes, etc. B = *high tea. [probably dutch tee from chinese]

Combustion  n. 1 burning. 2 development of light and heat from the chemical combination of a substance with oxygen.

Clockwork  n. 1 mechanism like that of a clock, with a spring and gears. 2 (attrib.) Driven by clockwork.  like clockwork smoothly, regularly, automatically.

Hey  int. Calling attention or expressing joy, surprise, inquiry, etc. [imitative]

Parvenu  n. (pl. -s; fem. Parvenue) (often attrib.) Newly rich social climber; upstart. [latin: related to *per-, venio come]

Majestic  adj. Stately and dignified; imposing.  majestically adv.

Wright  n. Maker or builder (usu. In comb.: playwright; shipwright). [old english: related to *work]

Careful  adj. 1 painstaking, thorough. 2 cautious. 3 taking care; not neglecting (careful to remind them).  carefully adv. Carefulness n.

Monseigneur  n. (pl. Messeigneurs) title given to an eminent french person, esp. A prince, cardinal, archbishop, or bishop. [french mon my, *seigneur]

Dandle  v. (-ling) bounce (a child) on one's knees etc. [origin unknown]

Puma  n. Wild american greyish-brown cat. [spanish from quechua]

Senseless  adj. 1 pointless; foolish. 2 unconscious.  senselessly adv. Senselessness n.

Automatic  —adj. 1 working by itself, without direct human intervention. 2 a done spontaneously (automatic reaction). B following inevitably (automatic penalty). 3 (of a firearm) able to be loaded and fired continuously. 4 (of a vehicle or its transmission) using gears that change automatically. —n. 1 automatic machine, firearm, or tool. 2 vehicle with automatic transmission.  automatically adv. [related to *automaton]

Brucellosis  n. Bacterial disease, esp. Of cattle. [sir d. Bruce, name of a physician]

Bougainvillaea  n. Tropical plant with large coloured bracts. [bougainville, name of a navigator]

Cardboard  n. Pasteboard or stiff paper, esp. For making boxes.

Thursday  —n. Day of the week following wednesday. —adv. Colloq. 1 on thursday. 2 (thursdays) on thursdays; each thursday. [old english]

Plurality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 state of being plural. 2 = *pluralism 2. 3 large number. 4 us majority that is not absolute.

Suntrap  n. Sunny, esp. Sheltered, place.

Slender  adj. (-er, -est) 1 a of small girth or breadth. B gracefully thin. 2 relatively small, scanty, inadequate. [origin unknown]

Creole  —n. 1 a descendant of european settlers in the w. Indies or central or s. America. B white descendant of french settlers in the southern us. C person of mixed european and black descent. 2 language formed from a european language and another (esp. African) language. —adj. 1 of creoles. 2 (usu. Creole) of creole origin etc. (creole cooking). [french from spanish]

Petition  —n. 1 supplication, request. 2 formal written request, esp. One signed by many people, appealing to an authority. 3 law application to a court for a writ etc. —v. 1 make or address a petition to. 2 (often foll. By for, to) appeal earnestly or humbly. [latin peto petit- ask]

Birthplace  n. Place where one was born.

Passkey  n. 1 private key to a gate etc. 2 master-key.

Posit  v. (-t-) assume as a fact, postulate. [latin: related to *position]

Nugatory  adj. 1 futile, trifling. 2 inoperative; not valid. [latin nugae jests]

Remission  n. 1 reduction of a prison sentence on account of good behaviour. 2 remitting of a debt or penalty etc. 3 diminution of force, effect, or degree (esp. Of disease or pain). 4 (often foll. By of) forgiveness (of sins etc.). [latin: related to *remit]

Prosecution  n. 1 a institution and continuation of (esp. Criminal) legal proceedings. B prosecuting party in a court case. 2 prosecuting or being prosecuted (in the prosecution of his hobby).

Trucker  n. Esp. Us long-distance lorry-driver.

Atrophy  —n. Wasting away, esp. Through disuse; emaciation. —v. (-ies, -ied) suffer atrophy or cause atrophy in. [greek a- without, trophe food]

Capacitance  n. 1 ability to store electric charge. 2 ratio of change in the electric charge in a system to the corresponding change in its potential.

Riddance  n. Getting rid of something.  good riddance expression of relief at getting rid of something.

Knitting  n. Work being knitted.

Bridgehead  n. Fortified position held on the enemy's side of a river etc.

Circumnavigate  v. (-ting) sail round (esp. The world).  circumnavigation n.

Nones  n.pl. Day of the ancient roman month (the 7th day of march, may, july, and october, the 5th of other months). [latin nonus ninth]

Turbo  n. (pl. -s) = *turbocharger.

Unstudied  adj. Easy, natural, spontaneous.

Cavil  —v. (-ll-, us -l-) (usu. Foll. By at, about) make petty objections; carp. —n. Petty objection. [latin cavillor]

Soever  adv. Literary of any kind; to any extent (how great soever it may be).

Adjust  v. 1 order or position; regulate; arrange. 2 (usu. Foll. By to) become or make suited; adapt. 3 harmonize (discrepancies). 4 assess (loss or damages).  adjustable adj. Adjustment n. [latin juxta near]

Urchin  n. 1 mischievous, esp. Ragged, child. 2 = *sea urchin. [latin ericius hedgehog]

Undercroft  n. Crypt. [obsolete croft from latin]

Greasepaint  n. Make-up used by actors.

Weekender  n. Person who spends the weekend away from home; weekend visitor.

Quarrelsome  adj. Given to quarrelling.

Shipwright  n. 1 shipbuilder. 2 ship's carpenter.

Boost  colloq. —v. 1 promote or encourage. 2 increase, assist. 3 push from below. —n. Act or result of boosting. [origin unknown]

Bio-  comb. Form 1 life (biography). 2 biological; of living things. [greek bios life]

Linear  adj. 1 of or in lines. 2 long and narrow and of uniform breadth.  linearity n. Linearly adv.

Shuttle  —n. 1 a (in a loom) instrument pulling the weft-thread between the warp-threads. B (in a sewing-machine) bobbin carrying the lower thread. 2 train, bus, etc. Used in a shuttle service. 3 = *space shuttle. —v. (-ling) (cause to) move to and fro like a shuttle. [old english: related to *shoot]

Hep  var. Of *hip4.

Unstuck  past and past part. Of *unstick.

Dogwatch  n. Either of two short watches on a ship (4–6 or 6–8 p.m.).

Shindy  n. (pl. -ies) colloq. 1 brawl, disturbance, or noise. 2 = *shindig 1. [perhaps an alteration of *shinty]

Sniffle  —v. (-ling) sniff slightly or repeatedly. —n. 1 act of sniffling. 2 (in sing. Or pl.) Cold in the head causing sniffling. [imitative: cf. *snivel]

Corked  adj. 1 stopped with a cork. 2 (of wine) spoilt by a decayed cork.

Dossier  n. File containing information about a person, event, etc. [french]

Whodunit  n. (also whodunnit) colloq. Detective story, play, or film. [= who done (illiterate for did) it?]

Junkie  n. Slang drug addict.

Reorient  v. 1 give a new direction or outlook to (ideas, a person, etc.). 2 help (a person) find his or her bearings again. 3 (refl., often foll. By to) adjust oneself to or come to terms with something.

Lure  —v. (-ring) 1 (usu. Foll. By away, into) entice. 2 recall with a lure. —n. 1 thing used to entice. 2 (usu. Foll. By of) enticing quality (of a pursuit etc.). 3 falconer's apparatus for recalling a hawk. [french from germanic]

Underachieve  v. (-ving) do less well than might be expected (esp. Academically).  underachiever n.

Antiquated  adj. Old-fashioned.

Ascribe  v. (-bing) (usu. Foll. By to) 1 attribute (ascribes his health to exercise). 2 regard as belonging.  ascription n. [latin scribo write]

Toreador  n. Bullfighter, esp. On horseback. [latin taurus]

Uppermost  —adj. (also upmost) 1 highest. 2 predominant. —adv. At or to the uppermost position.

Public  —adj. 1 of the people as a whole (public holiday). 2 open to or shared by all (public baths). 3 done or existing openly (public apology). 4 (of a service, funds, etc.) Provided by or concerning government (public money; public records). 5 of or involved in the affairs, esp. The government or entertainment, of the community (distinguished public career; public figures). —n. 1 (as sing. Or pl.) Community, or members of it, in general. 2 specified section of the community (reading public; my public).  go public 1 become a public company. 2 reveal one's plans etc. In public openly, publicly.  publicly adv.  [latin]

Pipette  n. Chem slender tube for transferring or measuring small quantities of liquids. [french diminutive: related to *pipe]

Pawnshop  n. Pawnbroker's shop.

Hachures  n.pl. Parallel lines on a map indicating the degree of steepness of hills. [french: related to *hatch3]

Caveat  n. 1 warning, proviso. 2 law process in court to suspend proceedings. [latin, = let him beware]

Kilovolt  n. 1,000 volts.

Incurve  v. (-ving) 1 bend into a curve. 2 (as incurved adj.) Curved inwards.  incurvation n.

Innuendo  n. (pl. -es or -s) allusive remark or hint, usu. Disparaging or with a double meaning. [latin, = by nodding at: related to *in-2, nuo nod]

Captivate  v. (-ting) fascinate; charm.  captivation n. [latin: related to *captive]

Furlong  n. Eighth of a mile. [old english: related to *furrow, *long1]

Vale  n. (archaic except in place-names) valley. [latin vallis]

Fallow  —adj. 1 (of land) ploughed but left unsown. 2 uncultivated. —n. Fallow land. [old english]

Carnivore  n. Carnivorous animal or plant, esp. A mammal of the order including cats, dogs, and bears.

Flirt  —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By with) try to attract sexually but without serious intent. 2 (usu. Foll. By with) superficially engage in; trifle. —n. Person who flirts.  flirtation n. Flirtatious adj. Flirtatiously adv. Flirtatiousness n. [imitative]

Augury  n. (pl. -ies) 1 omen. 2 interpretation of omens.

Handbill  n. Printed notice distributed by hand.

Scrutineer  n. Person who scrutinizes ballot-papers.

Interrupter  n. (also interruptor) 1 person or thing that interrupts. 2 device for interrupting, esp. An electric circuit.

Snip  —v. (-pp-) (also absol.) Cut with scissors etc., esp. In small quick strokes. —n. 1 act of snipping. 2 piece snipped off. 3 slang a something easily done. B  bargain. [low german or dutch snippen]

Honorific  adj. 1 conferring honour. 2 implying respect.

Qualm  n. 1 misgiving; uneasy doubt. 2 scruple of conscience. 3 momentary faint or sick feeling. [origin uncertain]

Auxin  n. Plant hormone that regulates growth.

Infusible  adj. That cannot be melted.  infusibility n.

Syntax  n. 1 grammatical arrangement of words. 2 rules or analysis of this.  syntactic adj. Syntactically adv. [greek, = arrangement]

Nutter  n. Slang crazy person.

Conquer  v. 1 a overcome and control militarily. B be victorious. 2 overcome by effort.  conqueror n. [latin conquiro win]

Bagel  n. Ring-shaped bread roll. [yiddish]

Shakespearian  adj. (also shakespearean) of shakespeare.

Piccalilli  n. (pl. -s) pickle of chopped vegetables, mustard, and hot spices. [origin unknown]

Overbalance  v. (-cing) 1 lose balance and fall. 2 cause to do this.

Haunch  n. 1 fleshy part of the buttock with the thigh. 2 leg and loin of a deer etc. As food. [french from germanic]

Tableland  n. Elevated plateau.

Release  —v. (-sing) 1 (often foll. By from) set free; liberate, unfasten. 2 allow to move from a fixed position. 3 a make (information, a recording, etc.) Publicly available. B issue (a film etc.) For general exhibition. —n. 1 liberation from a restriction, duty, or difficulty. 2 handle or catch that releases part of a mechanism. 3 news item etc. Made available for publication (press release). 4 a film or record etc. That is released. B releasing or being released in this way. [french relesser from latin relaxo *relax]

Centurion  n. Commander of a century in the ancient roman army. [latin: related to *century]

Epidermis  n. Outer layer of the skin.  epidermal adj. [greek derma skin]

Academy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 place of specialized training (military academy). 2 (usu. Academy) society or institution of distinguished scholars, artists, scientists, etc. (royal academy). 3 scot. Secondary school. [greek akademeia the place in athens where plato taught]

Chippendale  adj. (of furniture) of an elegantly ornate 18th-c. Style. [name of a cabinet-maker]

Foolscap  n. Large size of paper, about 330 x 200 (or 400) mm. [from a watermark of a fool's cap]

Unsociable  adj. Not sociable, disliking company.

Usage  see note at unsocial.

Jaguar  n. Large american flesh-eating spotted animal of the cat family. [tupi]

Yukky  var. Of *yucky.

Curtsy  (also curtsey) —n. (pl. -ies or -eys) bending of the knees and lowering of the body made by a girl or woman in acknowledgement of applause or as a respectful greeting etc. —v. (-ies, -ied or -eys, -eyed) make a curtsy. [var. Of *courtesy]

Scoundrel  n. Unscrupulous villain; rogue. [origin unknown]

Unadorned  adj. Plain.

Dysentery  n. Inflammation of the intestines, causing severe diarrhoea. [greek entera bowels]

Polyphony  n. (pl. -ies) mus. Contrapuntal music.  polyphonic adj. [greek phone sound]

Oscillate  v. (-ting) 1 (cause to) swing to and fro. 2 vacillate; vary between extremes. 3  (of an electric current) undergo high-frequency alternations.  oscillation n. Oscillator n. [latin oscillo swing]

Sweeping  —adj. 1 wide in range or effect (sweeping changes). 2 generalized, arbitrary (sweeping statement). —n. (in pl.) Dirt etc. Collected by sweeping.

Palliasse  n. Straw mattress. [latin: related to *pallet1]

Fright  n. 1 a sudden or extreme fear. B instance of this (gave me a fright). 2 grotesque-looking person or thing.  take fright become frightened. [old english]

Lbc  abbr. London broadcasting company.

Nominate  v. (-ting) 1 propose (a candidate) for election. 2 appoint to an office. 3 name or appoint (a date or place).  nomination n. Nominator n. [latin: related to *nominal]

Entrust  v. (also intrust) 1 (foll. By to) give (a person or thing) into the care of a person. 2 (foll. By with) assign responsibility for (a person or thing) to (a person) (entrusted him with my camera).

Flurry  —n. (pl. -ies) 1 gust or squall (of snow, rain, etc.). 2 sudden burst of activity, excitement, etc.; commotion. —v. (-ies, -ied) confuse; agitate. [imitative]

Hellene  n. 1 native of modern greece. 2 ancient greek.  hellenic adj. [greek]

Fitter  n. 1 mechanic who fits together and adjusts machinery. 2 supervisor of the cutting, fitting, etc. Of garments.

Approximate  —adj. Fairly correct, near to the actual (approximate price). —v. (-ting) (often foll. By to) bring or come near (esp. In quality, number, etc.).  approximately adv. Approximation n. [latin proximus nearest]

Tornado  n. (pl. -es) violent storm of small extent with whirling winds.  [spanish tronada thunderstorm]

Unilateral  adj. Done by or affecting only one person or party (unilateral disarmament).  unilaterally adv.

Bread  —n. 1 baked dough of flour and water, usu. Leavened with yeast. 2 necessary food. 3 slang money. —v. Coat with breadcrumbs for cooking. [old english]

Sharper  n. Swindler, esp. At cards.

Palatinate  n. Territory under the jurisdiction of a count palatine.

Foreplay  n. Stimulation preceding sexual intercourse.

Airstrip  n. Strip of ground for the take-off and landing of aircraft.

Rushlight  n. Rush candle.

Stead  n.  in a person's (or thing's) stead as a substitute; in a person's or thing's place. Stand a person in good stead be advantageous or useful to him or her. [old english, = place]

Bomb  —n. 1 container filled with explosive, incendiary material, etc., designed to explode and cause damage. 2 (prec. By the) the atomic or hydrogen bomb. 3 slang large sum of money (cost a bomb). —v. 1 attack with bombs; drop bombs on. 2 (usu. Foll. By along, off) colloq. Go very quickly.  like a bomb colloq. 1 very successfully. 2 very fast. [greek bombos hum]

Contrived  adj. Artificial, forced.

Improbity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 wickedness; dishonesty. 2 wicked or dishonest act.

Humorous  adj. Showing humour or a sense of humour.  humorously adv.

Spectra  pl. Of *spectrum.

Trinket  n. Trifling ornament, esp. A piece of jewellery.  trinketry n. [origin unknown]

Derogate  v. (-ting) (foll. By from) formal detract from (merit, right, etc.).  derogation n. [latin rogo ask]

Society  n. (pl. -ies) 1 organized and interdependent community. 2 system and organization of this. 3 aristocratic part of this; its members (polite society; society would not approve). 4 mixing with others; companionship, company. 5 club, association (music society; building society).  societal adj. [latin societas]

Luminary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 literary natural light-giving body. 2 wise or inspiring person. 3 celebrated member of a group (show-business luminaries). [latin lumen lumin- light]

Aloe  n. 1 plant of the lily family with toothed fleshy leaves. 2 (in pl.) (in full bitter aloes) strong laxative from aloe juice. [old english from greek]

Overstate  v. (-ting) 1 state too strongly. 2 exaggerate.  overstatement n.

Bunion  n. Swelling on the foot, esp. On the big toe. [french]

Eyrie  n. 1 nest of a bird of prey, esp. An eagle, built high up. 2 house etc. Perched high up. [french aire lair, from latin agrum piece of ground]

Barbarian  —n. 1 uncultured or brutish person. 2 member of a primitive tribe etc. —adj. 1 rough and uncultured. 2 uncivilized. [greek barbaros foreign]

Proverb  n. Short pithy saying in general use, held to embody a general truth. [latin proverbium from verbum word]

Prosody  n. 1 science of versification. 2 the study of speech-rhythms.  prosodic adj. Prosodist n. [greek pros to: related to *ode]

Esoteric  adj. Intelligible only to those with special knowledge.  esoterically adv. [greek eso within]

Vicereine  n. 1 viceroy's wife. 2 woman viceroy. [french: related to *vice-, reine queen]

Depreciation  n. 1  a decline in value, esp. Due to wear and tear. B allowance made for this. 2 belittlement.

Twister  n. Colloq. Swindler.

Positron  n. Physics elementary particle with the same mass as but opposite (positive) charge to an electron. [positive electron]

Thereof  adv. Formal of that or it.

Labium  n. (pl. Labia) (usu. In pl.) Each fold of skin of the two pairs enclosing the vulva. [latin, = lip]

Priority  n. (pl. -ies) 1 thing that is regarded as more important than others. 2 high(est) place among various things to be done (gave priority to). 3 right to do something before other people. 4 right to proceed ahead of other traffic. 5 (state of) being more important.  prioritize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). [medieval latin: related to *prior]

Bidding  n. 1 command, request, or invitation. 2 bids at an auction or in a card-game.

Phil-  var. Of *philo-.

Astrophysics  n.pl. (treated as sing.) The study of the physics and chemistry of celestial bodies.  astrophysical adj. Astrophysicist n. [greek astron star]

Device  n. 1 thing made or adapted for a special purpose. 2 plan, scheme, or trick. 3 design, esp. Heraldic.  leave a person to his or her own devices leave a person to do as he or she wishes. [french: related to *devise]

Coalesce  v. (-cing) come together and form a whole.  coalescence n. Coalescent adj. [latin alo nourish]

Rethink  —v. (past and past part. Rethought) consider again, esp. With a view to making changes. —n. Reassessment; rethinking.

Diametrical  adj. (also diametric) 1 of or along a diameter. 2 (of opposites etc.) Absolute.  diametrically adv. [greek: related to *diameter]

Unearned  adj. Not earned.

Imperfection  n. 1 state of being imperfect. 2 fault, blemish.

Estrogen  n. (brit. Oestrogen) 1 sex hormone developing and maintaining female characteristics of the body. 2 this produced artificially for use in medicine. [greek oistros frenzy, *-gen]

Maria  pl. Of *mare2.

Carrel  n. Small cubicle for a reader in a library. [french from medieval latin]

Shambolic  adj. Colloq. Chaotic, unorganized. [from *shambles after symbolic]

Unfrock  v. = *defrock.

Ulster  n. Long loose overcoat of rough cloth. [ulster in ireland]

Obstetrician  n. Specialist in obstetrics.

Wych-  comb. Form in names of trees with pliant branches (wych-alder; wych-elm). [old english, = bending]

Cataclysm  n. 1 a violent upheaval or disaster. B great change. 2 great flood.  cataclysmic adj. [greek kluzo wash]

Eolithic  adj. Of the period preceding the palaeolithic age. [greek eos dawn, lithos stone]

Inglorious  adj. 1 shameful. 2 not famous.

Interpolate  v. (-ting) 1 a insert (words) in a book etc., esp. Misleadingly. B make such insertions in (a book etc.). 2 interject (a remark) in a conversation. 3 estimate (values) between known ones in the same range.  interpolation n. Interpolator n. [latin interpolo furbish]

Possessive  —adj. 1 wanting to retain what one has, reluctant to share. 2 jealous and domineering. 3 gram. Indicating possession. —n. (in full possessive case) gram. Case of nouns and pronouns expressing possession.  possessiveness n.

Obvious  adj. Easily seen, recognized, or understood.  obviously adv. Obviousness n. [latin ob viam in the way]

Ankylosis  n. Stiffening of a joint by fusion of the bones. [greek agkulos crooked]

Upbringing  n. Rearing of a child. [obsolete upbring to rear]

Shell  —n. 1 a hard outer case of many molluscs, the tortoise, etc. B hard but fragile case of an egg. C hard outer case of a nut-kernel, seed, etc. 2 a explosive projectile for use in a big gun etc. B hollow container for fireworks, cartridges, etc. 3 shell-like thing, esp.: a a light racing-boat. B the metal framework of a vehicle etc. C the walls of an unfinished or gutted building, ship, etc. —v. 1 remove the shell or pod from. 2  bombard with shells.  come out of one's shell become less shy. Shell out (also absol.) Colloq. Pay (money).  shell-less adj. Shell-like adj. [old english]

Marketeer  n. 1 supporter of the ec and british membership of it. 2 marketer.

Baritone  n. 1 a second-lowest adult male singing voice. B singer with this voice. 2 instrument pitched second-lowest in its family. [greek barus heavy, tonos tone]

Falsify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 fraudulently alter. 2 misrepresent.  falsification n. [french or medieval latin: related to *false]

Procurer  n. (fem. Procuress) person who obtains women for prostitution. [latin *procurator]

Calces  pl. Of *calx.

Spiv  n. Colloq. Man, esp. A flashily-dressed one, living from shady dealings.  spivvish adj. Spivvy adj. [origin unknown]

Dipterous  adj. (of an insect) having two wings. [greek pteron wing]

Lieutenant  n. 1 a army officer next in rank below captain. B naval officer next in rank below lieutenant commander. 2 deputy.  lieutenancy n. (pl. -ies). [french: related to *lieu place, *tenant holder]

Undivided  adj. Not divided or shared; whole, entire (undivided attention).

Scatter  —v. 1 a throw about; strew. B cover by scattering. 2 a (cause to) move in flight etc.; disperse. B disperse or cause (hopes, clouds, etc.) To disperse. 3 (as scattered adj.) Wide apart or sporadic (scattered villages). 4 physics deflect or diffuse (light, particles, etc.). —n. 1 act of scattering. 2 small amount scattered. 3 extent of distribution. [probably var. Of *shatter]

Employ  —v. 1 use the services of (a person) in return for payment. 2 use (a thing, time, energy, etc.) To good effect. 3 keep (a person) occupied. —n. (in phr. In the employ of) employed by.  employable adj. Employer n. [latin implicor be involved]

Hybridize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 subject (a species etc.) To crossbreeding. 2 a produce hybrids. B (of an animal or plant) interbreed.  hybridization n.

Haughty  adj. (-ier, -iest) arrogant and disdainful.  haughtily adv. Haughtiness n. [haught, haut from french, = high]

Syn-  prefix with, together, alike. [greek sun with]

Lamentable  adj. Deplorable, regrettable.  lamentably adv.

Hemlock  n. 1 poisonous plant with fernlike leaves and small white flowers. 2 poison made from this. [old english]

Salting  n. (esp. In pl.) Marsh overflowed by the sea.

Brevity  n. 1 economy of expression; conciseness. 2 shortness (of time etc.). [anglo-french: related to *brief]

Underarm  —adj. & adv. Sport, esp. Cricket with the arm below shoulder-level. —attrib. Adj. 1 under the arm (underarm seam). 2 in the armpit.

Tum  n. Colloq. Stomach. [abbreviation of *tummy]

Malleable  adj. 1 (of metal etc.) That can be shaped by hammering. 2 easily influenced; pliable.  malleability n. Malleably adv. [medieval latin: related to *mallet]

Backwater  n. 1 peaceful, secluded, or dull place. 2 stagnant water fed from a stream.

Price  —n. 1 amount of money for which a thing is bought or sold. 2 what is or must be given, done, sacrificed, etc., to obtain or achieve something (peace at any price). 3 odds in betting. —v. (-cing)  1 fix or find the price of (a thing for sale). 2 estimate the value of.  at a price at a high cost. Price on a person's head reward for a person's capture or death. What price …? (often foll. By verbal noun) colloq. 1 what is the chance of …? (what price your finishing the course?). 2 iron. The much boasted … proves disappointing (what price your friendship now?). [latin pretium]

Decompress  v. Subject to decompression.

Unsubtle  adj. Not subtle; obvious; clumsy.

Etymology  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a derivation and development of a word in form and meaning. B account of these. 2 the study of word origins.  etymological adj. Etymologist n. [greek etumos true]

Anew  adv. 1 again. 2 in a different way. [earlier of newe]

Operator  n. 1 person operating a machine etc., esp. Connecting lines in a telephone exchange. 2 person engaging in business. 3 colloq. Person acting in a specified way (smooth operator). 4 symbol or function denoting an operation in mathematics, computing, etc.

Magenta  —n. 1 shade of crimson. 2 aniline crimson dye. —adj. Of or coloured with magenta. [magenta in n. Italy]

Quarantine  —n. 1 isolation imposed on persons or animals to prevent infection or contagion. 2 period of this. —v. (-ning) put in quarantine. [italian quaranta forty]

Advisedly  adv. After due consideration; deliberately.

Cheat  —v. 1 a (often foll. By into, out of) deceive or trick. B (foll. By of) deprive of. 2 gain an unfair advantage by deception or breaking rules. —n. 1 person who cheats. 2 trick, deception.  cheat on colloq. Be sexually unfaithful to. [from *escheat]

Gnaw  v. 1 a (usu. Foll. By away etc.) Wear away by biting. B (often foll. By at, into) bite persistently. 2 a corrode; wear away. B (of pain, fear, etc.) Torment. [old english]

Prizewinner  n. Winner of a prize.  prizewinning attrib. Adj.

Alert  —adj. 1 watchful, vigilant. 2 nimble, attentive. —n. 1 warning call or alarm. 2 state or period of special vigilance. —v. (often foll. By to) warn. [french alerte from italian all'erta to the watch-tower]

Goalkeeper  n. Player defending a goal.

Resultant  —adj. Resulting, esp. As the total outcome of more or less opposed forces. —n.  Force etc. Equivalent to two or more acting in different directions at the same point.

Manse  n. Ecclesiastical residence, esp. A scottish presbyterian minister's house. [medieval latin: related to *manor]

Teamwork  n. Combined action; co-operation.

Mailshot  n. Advertising material sent to potential customers.

Paralytic  —adj. 1 affected by paralysis. 2 slang very drunk. —n. Person affected by paralysis.

Corporeal  adj. Bodily, physical, material.  corporeality n. Corporeally adv. [latin: related to *corporal2]

Protestant  —n. Member or follower of any of the churches separating from the roman catholic church after the reformation. —adj. Of the protestant churches or their members etc.  protestantism n. [related to *protest]

Breakfast  —n. First meal of the day. —v. Have breakfast.

Scavenge  v. (-ging) (usu. Foll. By for; also absol.) Search for and collect (discarded items). [back-formation from *scavenger]

Mainline  v. (-ning) slang 1 take drugs intravenously. 2 inject (drugs) intravenously.  mainliner n.

Quarrel  —n. 1 severe or angry dispute or contention. 2 break in friendly relations. 3 cause of complaint (have no quarrel with him). —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 (often foll. By with) find fault. 2 dispute; break off friendly relations. [latin querela from queror complain]

Sketchy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 giving only a rough outline, like a sketch. 2 colloq. Unsubstantial or imperfect, esp. Through haste.  sketchily adv. Sketchiness n.

Tectonic  adj. 1 of building or construction. 2  of the deformation and subsequent structural changes of the earth's crust (see *plate tectonics). [greek tekton craftsman]

Ho  symb. Holmium.

Fortnight  n. Two weeks. [old english, = fourteen nights]

Asafoetida  n. (us asafetida) resinous pungent plant gum used in cooking and formerly in medicine. [persian aza mastic: related to *fetid]

Capillarity  n. The rise or depression of a liquid in a narrow tube. [french: related to *capillary]

Gratify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 a please, delight. B please by compliance. 2 yield to (a feeling or desire).  gratification n. [latin: related to *grateful]

Reduce  v. (-cing) 1 make or become smaller or less. 2 (foll. By to) bring by force or necessity (to some undesirable state or action) (reduced them to tears; reduced to begging). 3 convert to another (esp. Simpler) form (reduced it to a powder). 4 convert (a fraction) to the form with the lowest terms. 5 (foll. By to) bring, simplify, or adapt by classification or analysis (the dispute may be reduced to three issues). 6 make lower in status or rank. 7 lower the price of. 8 lessen one's weight or size. 9 weaken (is in a very reduced state). 10 impoverish. 11 subdue, bring back to obedience. 12 chem. A (cause to) combine with hydrogen. B (cause to) undergo addition of electrons. 13 a (in surgery) restore (a dislocated etc. Part) to its proper position. B remedy (a dislocation etc.) In this way.  reducible adj. [latin duco bring]

Guillemot  n. Fast-flying sea bird nesting on cliffs etc. [french]

Quintessence  n. 1 (usu. Foll. By of) purest and most perfect form, manifestation, or embodiment of a quality etc. 2 highly refined extract.  quintessential adj. Quintessentially adv. [latin quinta essentia fifth substance (underlying the four elements)] 

Metalwork  n. 1 art of working in metal. 2 metal objects collectively.  metalworker n.

Cinder  n. 1 residue of coal or wood etc. After burning. 2 (in pl.) Ashes. [old english sinder = slag]

Cutter  n. 1 a person or thing that cuts. B (in pl.) Cutting tool. 2 a small fast sailing-ship. B small boat carried by a large ship.

Workload  n. Amount of work to be done.

Injudicious  adj. Unwise; ill-judged.

Russet  —adj. Reddish-brown. —n. 1 russet colour. 2 rough-skinned russet-coloured apple. [latin russus]

Repoint  v. Point (esp. Brickwork) again.

Splint  —n. Strip of wood etc. Bound to a broken limb while it sets. —v. Secure with a splint. [low german or dutch]

Comet  n. Hazy object moving in a path about the sun, usu. With a nucleus of ice surrounded by gas and with a tail pointing away from the sun. [greek kometes]

Yuck  int. (also yuk) slang expression of strong distaste. [imitative]

Moa  n. (pl. -s) extinct flightless new zealand bird resembling the ostrich. [maori]

Indictment  n. 1 a indicting, accusation. B document containing this. 2 thing that serves to condemn or censure (an indictment of society).

Fortress  n. Fortified building or town. [latin fortis strong]

Intimidate  v. (-ting) frighten or overawe, esp. To subdue or influence.  intimidation n. [medieval latin: related to *timid]

Motorcade  n. Procession of motor vehicles. [from *motor, after cavalcade]

Morose  adj. Sullen, gloomy.  morosely adv. Moroseness n. [latin mos mor- manner]

Mbe  abbr. Member of the order of the british empire.

Inconspicuous  adj. Not conspicuous; not easily noticed.  inconspicuously adv. Inconspicuousness n.

Sit  v. (-tt-; past and past part. Sat) 1 support the body by resting the buttocks on the ground or a seat etc. 2 cause to sit; place in a sitting position. 3 a (of a bird) perch or warm the eggs in its nest. B (of an animal) rest with the hind legs bent and the buttocks on the ground. 4 (of a committee etc.) Be in session. 5 (usu. Foll. By for) pose (for a portrait). 6 (foll. By for) be a member of parliament for (a constituency). 7 (often foll. By for) take (an examination). 8 be in a more or less permanent position or condition (left sitting in rome; parcel sitting on the doorstep). 9 (of clothes etc.) Fit or hang in a certain way. 10 babysit.  be sitting pretty be comfortably placed. Sit at a person's feet be a person's pupil. Sit back relax one's efforts. Sit down 1 sit after standing. 2 cause to sit. 3 (foll. By under) submit tamely to (an insult etc.). Sit in 1 occupy a place as a protest. 2 (foll. By for) take the place of. 3 (foll. By on) be present as a guest or observer at (a meeting etc.). Sit in judgement be censorious or self-righteous. Sit on 1 be a member of (a committee etc.). 2 hold a session or inquiry concerning. 3 colloq. Delay action about. 4 colloq. Repress, rebuke, or snub. Sit on the fence remain neutral or undecided. Sit out 1 take no part in (a dance etc.). 2 stay till the end of (esp. An ordeal). 3 sit outdoors. Sit tight colloq. 1 remain firmly in one's place. 2 not yield. Sit up 1 rise from lying to sitting. 2 sit firmly upright. 3 go to bed late. 4 colloq. Become interested or aroused etc. Sit well on suit or fit. [old english]

Tidemark  n. 1 mark made by the tide at high water. 2 a line left round a bath by the dirty water. B colloq. Line between washed and unwashed parts of a person's body.

Laxative  —adj. Facilitating evacuation of the bowels. —n. Laxative medicine. [latin: related to *lax]

Fistula  n. (pl. -s or -lae) abnormal or artificial passage between an organ and the body surface or between two organs.  fistular adj. Fistulous adj. [latin, = pipe]

Tuff  n. Rock formed from volcanic ash. [latin tofus]

Legitimatize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) legitimize.

Aphid  n. Small insect infesting and damaging plants, e.g. The greenfly.

Inversion  n. 1 turning upside down. 2 reversal of a normal order, position, or relation.

Runaway  n. 1 fugitive. 2 bolting animal, vehicle out of control. 3 (attrib.) That is running away or out of control (runaway slave; runaway inflation).

Ef-  see *ex-1.

Superb  adj. 1 colloq. Excellent. 2 magnificent.  superbly adv. [latin, = proud]

Orderly  —adj. 1 methodically arranged or inclined, tidy. 2 well-behaved. —n. (pl. -ies) 1 male cleaner in a hospital. 2 soldier who carries orders for an officer etc.  orderliness n.

Debark  v. Land from a ship.  debarkation n. [french débarquer]

Unrivaled  adj. (brit. Unrivalled) having no equal.

Haft  n. Handle of a dagger, knife, etc. [old english]

Pterosaur  n. Flying reptile with large batlike wings. [greek pteron wing, saura lizard]

Uninterrupted  adj. Not interrupted.

Median  —adj. Situated in the middle. —n. 1 straight line drawn from any vertex of a triangle to the middle of the opposite side. 2 middle value of a series. [latin: related to *medial]

Overground  adj. 1 raised above the ground. 2 not underground.

Centrefold  n. (us centerfold) centre spread of a magazine etc., esp. With nude photographs.

Polysyllabic  adj. 1 having many syllables. 2 using words of many syllables. [medieval latin from greek]

Sitter  n. 1 person who sits, esp. For a portrait. 2 = babysitter (see *babysit). 3 colloq. Easy catch or shot.

Punk  n. 1 a (in full punk rock) anti-establishment and deliberately outrageous style of rock music. B (in full punk rocker) devotee of this. 2 esp. Us young hooligan or petty criminal; lout. 3 soft crumbly fungus-infested wood used as tinder. [origin unknown]

Of  prep. Expressing: 1 origin or cause (paintings of turner; died of cancer). 2 material or substance (house of cards; built of bricks). 3 belonging or connection (thing of the past; articles of clothing; head of the business). 4 identity or close relation (city of rome; a pound of apples; a fool of a man). 5 removal or separation (north of the city; got rid of them; robbed us of £1000). 6 reference or direction (beware of the dog; suspected of lying; very good of you; short of money). 7 objective relation (love of music; in search of peace). 8 partition, classification, or inclusion (no more of that; part of the story; this sort of book). 9 description, quality, or condition (the hour of prayer; person of tact; girl of ten; on the point of leaving). 10 us time in relation to the following hour (a quarter of three).  be of possess, give rise to (is of great interest). Of an evening (or morning etc.) Colloq. 1 on most evenings (or mornings etc.). 2 at some time in the evenings (or mornings etc.). Of late recently. Of old formerly. [old english]

-oid  suffix forming adjectives and nouns, denoting form or resemblance (asteroid; rhomboid; thyroid). [greek eidos form]

Unsweetened  adj. Not sweetened.

Carcinoma  n. (pl. -s or -mata) cancerous tumour. [greek karkinos crab]

Hunchback  n. = *humpback 1.  hunchbacked adj.

Afters  n.pl. Colloq. = *dessert 1.

Chose  past of *choose.

Outmanoeuvre  v. (-ring) (us -maneuver) secure an advantage over by skilful manoeuvring.

Assuredly  adv. Certainly.

Chevron  n. V-shaped line or stripe. [latin caper goat]

Entrant  n. Person who enters (an examination, profession, etc.). [french: related to *enter]

Yelp  —n. Sharp shrill cry as of a dog in pain or excitement. —v. Utter a yelp. [old english]

Imagery  n. 1 figurative illustration, esp. In literature. 2 images; statuary, carving. 3 mental images collectively.

Everything  pron. 1 all things. 2 most important thing (speed is everything).

Phone  n. & v. (-ning) colloq. = *telephone. [abbreviation]

Yid  n. Slang offens. Jew. [back-formation from *yiddish]

Typography  n. 1 printing as an art. 2 style and appearance of printed matter.  typographer n. Typographical adj. Typographically adv. [french: related to *type]

Cruel  adj. (crueller, cruellest or crueler, cruelest) 1 causing pain or suffering, esp. Deliberately. 2 harsh, severe (a cruel blow).  cruelly adv. Cruelness n. Cruelty n. (pl. -ies). [latin: related to *crude]

Underfelt  n. Felt laid under a carpet.

Moselle  n. Dry white wine from the moselle valley in germany.

Toil  —v. 1 work laboriously or incessantly. 2 make slow painful progress. —n. Intensive labour; drudgery. [anglo-french toil(er) dispute]
