Unwavering  adj. Not wavering.  unwaveringly adv.

Vexed  adj. (of a question) much discussed; problematic.

Heartburn  n. Burning sensation in the chest from indigestion.

Atone  v. (-ning) (usu. Foll. By for) make amends (for a wrong). [from *atonement]

Harem  n. 1 women of a muslim household. 2 their quarters. [arabic, = sanctuary]

Streptomycin  n. Antibiotic effective against many disease-producing bacteria. [greek streptos twisted, mukes fungus]

Server  n. 1 a person who serves. B utensil for serving food. 2 celebrant's assistant at a mass etc.

Medulla  n. 1 inner part of certain organs etc., e.g. The kidney. 2 soft internal tissue of plants.  medullary adj. [latin]

Groove  —n. 1 channel or elongated hollow, esp. One made to guide motion or receive a corresponding ridge. 2 spiral track cut in a gramophone record. —v. (-ving) 1 make a groove or grooves in. 2 slang enjoy oneself. [dutch]

Churchwarden  n. Either of two elected lay representatives of an anglican parish.

Promenade  —n. 1 paved public walk, esp. Along the sea front at a resort. 2 walk, ride, or drive, taken esp. For display or pleasure. —v. (-ding) 1 make a promenade (through). 2 lead (a person etc.) About, esp. For display. [french]

Logbook  n. 1 book containing a detailed record or log. 2 vehicle registration document.

Exaggerate  v. (-ting) 1 (also absol.) Make (a thing) seem larger or greater etc. Than it really is. 2 increase beyond normal or due proportions (exaggerated politeness).  exaggeration n. [latin agger heap]

Association  n. 1 group organized for a joint purpose; society. 2 associating or being associated. 3 companionship. 4 mental connection of ideas. [medieval latin: related to *associate]

Overblown  adj. 1 inflated or pretentious. 2 (of a flower) past its prime.

Deliberate  —adj. 1 a intentional. B considered; careful. 2 (of movement, thought, etc.) Unhurried; cautious. —v. (-ting) 1 think carefully; consider. 2 discuss (jury deliberated).  deliberately adv. [latin libra balance]

Colloid  n. 1 substance consisting of ultramicroscopic particles. 2 mixture of such particles dispersed in another substance.  colloidal adj. [greek kolla glue]

Mayfly  n. A kind of insect living briefly in spring.

Disdain  —n. Scorn, contempt. —v. 1 regard with disdain. 2 refrain or refuse out of disdain.  disdainful adj. Disdainfully adv. [latin: related to *de-, *deign]

Mumble  —v. (-ling) speak or utter indistinctly. —n. Indistinct utterance or sound. [related to *mum2]

Borough  n. 1 a town represented in the house of commons. B town or district granted the status of a borough. 2 hist. Town with a municipal corporation conferred by a royal charter. [old english]

Expansionism  n. Advocacy of expansion, esp. Of a state's territory.  expansionist n. & adj.

Sporadic  adj. Occurring only sparsely or occasionally.  sporadically adv. [greek sporas -ad- scattered]

Messenger  n. Person who carries a message.

Decapod  n. 1 crustacean with ten limbs for walking, e.g. The shrimp. 2 ten-tentacled mollusc, e.g. The squid. [greek: related to *deca-, pous pod- foot]

Blackthorn  n. Thorny shrub bearing white blossom and sloes.

Conjunct  adj. Joined together; combined; associated. [latin from juntus joined]

Unnecessary  adj. 1 not necessary. 2 superfluous.  unnecessarily adv.

Craw  n. Crop of a bird or insect.  stick in one's craw be unacceptable. [low german or dutch]

Diacritical  —adj. Distinguishing, distinctive. —n. (in full diacritical mark or sign) = *diacritic.

Ally  —n. (pl. -ies) state, person, etc., formally cooperating or united with another, esp. (also ally) in war. —v. Also (-ies, -ied) (often refl. And foll. By with) combine in alliance. [latin alligo bind]

Duodenum  n. (pl. -s) first part of the small intestine immediately below the stomach.  duodenal adj. [medieval latin: related to *duodecimal]

Coffin  n. Box in which a corpse is buried or cremated. [latin: related to *coffer]

Hq  abbr. Headquarters.

Pan-  comb. Form 1 all; the whole of. 2 relating to the whole of a continent, racial group, religion, etc. (pan-american). [greek pan, neuter of pas pantos all]

Skullcap  n. Peakless cap covering the crown only.

Pleasant  adj. (-er, -est) pleasing to the mind, feelings, or senses.  pleasantly adv. [french: related to *please]

Manner  n. 1 way a thing is done or happens. 2 (in pl.) A social behaviour (good manners). B polite behaviour (has no manners). C modes of life; social conditions. 3 outward bearing, way of speaking, etc. 4 style (in the manner of rembrandt). 5 kind, sort (not by any manner of means).  in a manner of speaking in a way; so to speak. To the manner born colloq. Naturally at ease in a particular situation etc. [latin manus hand]

Pimp  —n. Man who lives off the earnings of a prostitute or a brothel. —v. Act as a pimp. [origin unknown]

Zealous  adj. Full of zeal; enthusiastic.  zealously adv.

Bse  abbr. Bovine spongiform encephalopathy, a usu. Fatal cattle disease.

Stupendous  adj. Amazing or prodigious, esp. In size.  stupendously adv. [latin: related to *stupefy]

Endure  v. (-ring) 1 undergo (a difficulty etc.). 2 tolerate. 3 last.  endurable adj. [latin durus hard]

Plaster  —n. 1 soft mixture of lime, sand, and water etc. Applied to walls, ceilings, etc., to dry into a smooth hard surface. 2  = *sticking-plaster. 3 = *plaster of paris. —v. 1 cover (a wall etc.) With plaster. 2 coat, daub, cover thickly. 3 stick or apply (a thing) thickly like plaster. 4 (often foll. By down) smooth (esp. Hair) with water etc. 5 (as plastered adj.) Slang drunk.  plasterer n.  [greek emplastron]

Clench  —v. 1 close (the teeth, fingers, etc.) Tightly. 2 grasp firmly. —n. Clenching action; clenched state. [old english]

Iow  abbr. Isle of wight.

Zarathustrian  var. Of *zoroastrian.

Baleen  n. Whalebone. [latin balaena whale]

Seakale  n. Plant with young shoots used as a vegetable.

Undiscovered  adj. Not discovered.

Mow  v. (past part. Mowed or mown) 1 (also absol.) Cut (grass, hay, etc.) With a scythe or machine. 2 cut down the produce of (a field) or the grass etc. Of (a lawn) by mowing.  mow down kill or destroy randomly or in great numbers.  mower n. [old english]

Brainpower  n. Mental ability or intelligence.

Amniocentesis  n. (pl. -teses) sampling of amniotic fluid to detect foetal abnormality. [from *amnion, greek kentesis pricking]

Arraign  v. 1 indict, accuse. 2 find fault with; call into question (an action or statement).  arraignment n. [latin ratio reason]

Absence  n. 1 being away. 2 time of this. 3 (foll. By of) lack of.  absence of mind inattentiveness. [latin absentia]

Viburnum  n. A shrub, usu. With white flowers. [latin, = wayfaring-tree]

Coming  —attrib. Adj. 1 approaching, next (the coming week). 2 of potential importance (coming man). —n. Arrival.

Tremor  n. 1 shaking, quivering. 2 thrill (of fear, exultation, etc.). 3 (in full earth tremor) slight earthquake. [latin tremo tremble]

Paradox  n. 1 a seemingly absurd or contradictory though often true statement. B self-contradictory or absurd statement. 2 person or thing having contradictory qualities etc. 3 paradoxical quality.  paradoxical adj. Paradoxically adv. [greek: related to *para-1, doxa opinion]

Unwelcome  adj. Not welcome or acceptable.

Handball  n. 1 game with a ball thrown by hand among players or against a wall. 2 football intentional touching of the ball, constituting a foul.

Bloodstream  n. Blood in circulation.

Warrior  n. 1 person experienced or distinguished in fighting. 2 fighting man, esp. Of primitive peoples. 3 (attrib.) Martial (warrior nation). [french werreior: related to *war]

Rheostat  n. Instrument used to control an electric current by varying the resistance. [greek rheos stream]

Civet  n. 1 (in full civet-cat) catlike animal of central africa. 2 strong musky perfume obtained from it. [french ultimately from arabic]

Kohl  n. Black powder used as eye make-up, esp. In eastern countries. [arabic]

Llama  n. S. American ruminant kept as a beast of burden and for its soft woolly fleece. [spanish from quechua]

Unmethodical  adj. Not methodical.

Excepting  prep. = *except prep.

Usage  excepting should be used only after not and always; otherwise, except should be used.

Fanatic  —n. Person obsessively devoted to a belief, activity, etc. —adj. Excessively enthusiastic.  fanatical adj. Fanatically adv. Fanaticism n. [latin fanum temple]

Robotics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Art, science, or study of robot design and operation.

Airmail  n. 1 system of transporting mail by air. 2 mail carried by air.

Quicken  v. 1 make or become quicker; accelerate. 2 give life or vigour to; rouse. 3  a (of a woman) reach a stage in pregnancy when movements of the foetus can be felt. B (of a foetus) begin to show signs of life.

Mastic  n. 1 gum or resin from the mastic tree, used in making varnish. 2 (in full mastic tree) evergreen tree yielding this. 3 waterproof filler and sealant. [greek mastikhé]

Bustard  n. Large land bird that can run very fast. [latin avis tarda slow bird (‘slow’ unexplained)]

Apricot  —n. 1 a small juicy soft orange-yellow peachlike fruit. B tree bearing it. 2 its colour. —adj. Orange-yellow. [portuguese and spanish from arabic, ultimately from latin praecox early-ripe]

Tetchy  adj. (-ier, -iest) peevish, irritable.  tetchily adv. Tetchiness n. [teche blemish, fault]

Ox  n. (pl. Oxen) 1 large usu. Horned ruminant used for draught, milk, and meat. 2 castrated male of a domesticated species of cattle. [old english]

Dowager  n. 1 widow with a title or property from her late husband (dowager duchess). 2 colloq. Dignified elderly woman. [french: related to *dower]

Barracouta  n. (pl. Same or -s) long slender fish of southern oceans. [var. Of *barracuda]

Tint  —n. 1 variety of a colour, esp. Made by adding white. 2 tendency towards or admixture of a different colour (red with a blue tint). 3 faint colour spread over a surface. —v. Apply a tint to; colour. [tinct: related to *tinge]

Canine  —adj. Of a dog or dogs. —n. 1 dog. 2 (in full canine tooth) pointed tooth between incisors and premolars. [latin canis dog]

Onomatopoeia  n. Formation of a word from a sound associated with what is named (e.g. Cuckoo, sizzle).  onomatopoeic adj. [greek onoma name, poieo make]

Penta-  comb. Form five. [greek pente five]

Ameliorate  v. (-ting) make or become better.  amelioration n. Ameliorative adj. [from *ad-, latin melior better]

Unpunctual  adj. Not punctual.

Propene  n. Chem. = *propylene. [from *propane, *alkene]

Saddler  n. Maker of or dealer in saddles etc.

Prove  v. (-ving; past part. Proved or proven) 1 (often foll. By that) demonstrate the truth of by evidence or argument. 2 a (usu. Foll. By to + infin.) Be found (it proved to be untrue). B emerge as (will prove the winner). 3 test the accuracy of (a calculation). 4  establish the validity of (a will). 5  (of dough) rise in bread-making.  not proven (in scottish law) verdict that there is insufficient evidence to establish guilt or innocence. Prove oneself show one's abilities, courage, etc.  provable adj. [latin probo test, approve]

Usage  the use of proven as the past participle is uncommon except in certain expressions, such as of proven ability. It is, however, standard in scots and american english.

Writing  n. 1 written words etc. 2 handwriting. 3 (usu. In pl.) Author's works.  in writing in written form. The writing on the wall ominously significant event etc.

Propane  n. Gaseous hydrocarbon used as bottled fuel. [propionic acid: related to *pro-2, greek pion fat]

Clematis  n. Climbing plant with white, pink, or purple flowers. [greek]

Equally  adv. 1 in an equal manner (treated them equally). 2 to an equal degree (equally important).

Usage  in sense 2, construction with as (e.g. Equally as important) is often found, but is considered incorrect by some people.

Everyday  attrib. Adj. 1 occurring every day. 2 used on ordinary days. 3 commonplace.

Epicene  —adj. 1 of, for, denoting, or used by both sexes. 2 having characteristics of both sexes or of neither sex. —n. Epicene person. [greek koinos common]

Curtain  —n. 1 piece of cloth etc. Hung as a screen, esp. At a window. 2 a rise or fall of a stage curtain between acts or scenes. B = *curtain-call. 3 partition or cover. 4 (in pl.) Slang the end. —v. 1 provide or cover with curtain(s). 2 (foll. By off) shut off with curtain(s). [latin cortina]

Gorilla  n. Largest anthropoid ape, native to africa. [greek, perhaps from african = wild man]

Impatiens  n. Any of several plants including the busy lizzie. [latin: related to *impatient]

Resurgent  adj. Rising or arising again.  resurgence n. [latin resurgo -surrect- rise again]

Sweetshop  n. Confectioner's shop.

Jihad  n. (also jehad) muslim holy war against unbelievers. [arabic jihad]

Aborigine  n. (usu. In pl.) 1 aboriginal inhabitant. 2 (usu. Aborigine) aboriginal inhabitant of australia.

Usage  when referring to the people, aboriginal is preferred for the singular form and aborigines for the plural, although aboriginals is also acceptable.

Shantung  n. Soft undressed chinese silk. [shantung, chinese province]

Cry  —v. (cries, cried) 1 (often foll. By out) make a loud or shrill sound, esp. To express pain, grief, etc., or to appeal for help. 2 shed tears; weep. 3 (often foll. By out) say or exclaim loudly or excitedly. 4 (foll. By for) appeal, demand, or show a need for. 5 (of an animal, esp. A bird) make a loud call. —n. (pl. Cries) 1 loud shout or scream of grief, pain, etc. 2 spell of weeping. 3 loud excited utterance. 4 urgent appeal. 5 a public demand or opinion. B rallying call. 6 call of an animal.  cry down disparage. Cry off withdraw from an undertaking. Cry out for need as an obvious requirement or solution. Cry wolf see *wolf. [latin quirito]

Baize  n. Usu. Green woollen felted material, used for coverings. [french pl. Baies chestnut-coloured]

Underdone  adj. Undercooked.

Bosom  n. 1 a person's (esp. Woman's) breast. B colloq. Each of a woman's breasts. C enclosure formed by the breast and arms. 2 emotional centre (bosom of one's family). [old english]

Crazy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 colloq. Insane or mad; foolish. 2 (usu. Foll. By about) colloq. Extremely enthusiastic. 3 (attrib.) (of paving etc.) Made up of irregular pieces.  crazily adv. Craziness n.

Aquamarine  —n. 1 bluish-green beryl. 2 its colour. —adj. Bluish-green. [latin aqua marina sea water]

Birdseed  n. Blend of seeds for caged birds.

Advent  n. 1 season before christmas. 2 coming of christ. 3 (advent) important arrival. [latin adventus from venio come]

Wolfsbane  n. Aconite.

Indiscretion  n. Indiscreet conduct or action.

Minicomputer  n. Computer of medium power.

Scheme  —n. 1 systematic plan or arrangement (colour scheme). 2 artful plot. 3 timetable, outline, syllabus, etc. —v. (-ming) plan, esp. Secretly or deceitfully.  scheming adj. [greek: related to *schema]

Retire  v. (-ring) 1 a leave office or employment, esp. Because of age. B cause (a person) to retire from work. 2 withdraw, go away, retreat. 3 seek seclusion or shelter. 4 go to bed. 5  withdraw (troops). 6 cricket (of a batsman) voluntarily end or be compelled to suspend one's innings.  retire into oneself become uncommunicative or unsociable. [french tirer draw]

Educe  v. (-cing) literary bring out or develop from latency.  eduction n. [latin educo -ere draw out]

Quilt  —n. Coverlet, esp. Of quilted material. —v. Line a coverlet or garment with padding enclosed between layers of cloth by lines of stitching.  quilter n. Quilting n.  [latin culcita cushion]

Viceregal  adj. Of a viceroy.

Speed  —n. 1 rapidity of movement. 2 rate of progress or motion. 3 gear appropriate to a range of speeds of a bicycle. 4 photog. A sensitivity of film to light. B light-gathering power of a lens. C duration of an exposure. 5 slang amphetamine drug. 6 archaic success, prosperity. —v. (past and past part. Sped) 1 go or send quickly. 2 (past and past part. Speeded) travel at an illegal or dangerous speed. 3 archaic be or make prosperous or successful.  at speed moving quickly. Speed up move or work faster.  speeder n. [old english]

Mete  v. (-ting) (usu. Foll. By out) literary apportion or allot (punishment or reward). [old english]

Heart  n. 1 hollow muscular organ maintaining the circulation of blood by rhythmic contraction and dilation. 2 region of the heart; the breast. 3 a centre of thought, feeling, and emotion (esp. Love). B capacity for feeling emotion (has no heart). 4 a courage or enthusiasm (take heart). B mood or feeling (change of heart). 5 a central or innermost part of something. B essence (heart of the matter). 6 compact tender inner part of a lettuce etc. 7 a heart-shaped thing. B conventional representation of a heart with two equal curves meeting at a point at the bottom and a cusp at the top. 8 a playing-card of the suit denoted by a red figure of a heart. B (in pl.) This suit.  at heart 1 in one's inmost feelings. 2 basically. Break a person's heart overwhelm a person with sorrow. By heart from memory. Give (or lose) one's heart (often foll. By to) fall in love (with). Have the heart (usu. With neg.; foll. By to + infin.) Be insensitive or hard-hearted enough (didn't have the heart to ask him). Take to heart be much affected by. To one's heart's content see *content1. With all one's heart sincerely; with all goodwill. [old english]

Made  past and past part. Of *make. —adj. 1 built or formed (well-made). 2 successful (self-made man; be made).  have (or have got) it made colloq. Be sure of success. Made for ideally suited to. Made of consisting of. Made of money colloq. Very rich.

Clement  adj. 1 (of weather) mild. 2 merciful.  clemency n. [latin clemens]

Patriarchate  n. 1 office, see, or residence of a church patriarch. 2 rank of a tribal patriarch.

Credit  —n. 1 source of honour, pride, etc. (is a credit to the school). 2 acknowledgement of merit. 3 good reputation. 4 belief or trust. 5 a person's financial standing, esp. As regards money in the bank etc. B power to obtain goods etc. Before payment. 6 (usu. In pl.) Acknowledgement of a contributor's services to a film etc. 7 grade above pass in an examination. 8 reputation for solvency and honesty in business. 9 a entry in an account of a sum paid into it. B sum entered. C side of an account recording such entries. 10 educational course counting towards a degree. —v. (-t-) 1 believe (cannot credit it). 2 (usu. Foll. By to, with) enter on the credit side of an account.  credit a person with ascribe (a good quality) to a person. Do credit to (or do a person credit) enhance the reputation of. On credit with an arrangement to pay later. To one's credit in one's favour. [italian or latin: related to *credo]

Impossible  adj. 1 not possible. 2 colloq. Not easy, convenient, or believable. 3 colloq. (esp. Of a person) outrageous, intolerable.  impossibility n. (pl. -ies). Impossibly adv.

Flywheel  n. Heavy wheel on a revolving shaft to regulate machinery or accumulate power.

Crimp  —v. 1 press into small folds; corrugate. 2 make waves in (hair). —n. Crimped thing or form. [low german or dutch]

Sobriquet  n. (also soubriquet) nickname. [french]

Dint  —n. Dent. —v. Mark with dints.  by dint of by force or means of. [old english and old norse]

Bookkeeper  n. Person who keeps accounts, esp. For a living.  bookkeeping n.

Satire  n. 1 ridicule, irony, etc., used to expose folly or vice etc. 2 work using this.  satirical adj. Satirically adv. [latin satira medley]

Cervical  adj. Of the neck or the cervix (cervical vertebrae). [related to *cervix]

Pecan  n. 1 pinkish-brown smooth nut with an edible kernel. 2 type of hickory producing this. [algonquian]

Pleading  n. (usu. In pl.) Formal statement of the cause of an action or defence.

Tessera  n. (pl. Tesserae) small square block used in mosaic. [latin from greek]

Numerology  n. The study of the supposed occult significance of numbers.

Milk  —n. 1 opaque white fluid secreted by female mammals for the nourishment of their young. 2 milk of cows, goats, or sheep as food. 3 milklike juice of the coconut etc. —v. 1 draw milk from (a cow etc.). 2 exploit (a person or situation) to the utmost. [old english]

Blighty  n. Mil. Slang england; home. [hindustani, = foreign]

Hound  —n. 1 dog used in hunting. 2 colloq. Despicable man. —v. Harass or pursue. [old english]

Bureaucrat  n. 1 official in a bureaucracy. 2 inflexible administrator.  bureaucratic adj. Bureaucratically adv.

Tray  n. 1 flat board, usu. With a raised rim, for carrying dishes. 2 shallow lidless box for papers or small articles, sometimes forming a drawer in a cabinet etc. [old english]

Oxen  pl. Of *ox.

Niece  n. Daughter of one's brother or sister or of one's spouse's brother or sister. [latin neptis granddaughter]

Enfold  v. 1 (usu. Foll. By in, with) wrap; envelop. 2 clasp, embrace.

Sparrowhawk  n. Small hawk.

Prefecture  n. 1 district under the government of a prefect. 2 prefect's office or tenure. [latin: related to *prefect]

Layabout  n. Habitual loafer or idler.

Lightweight  —adj. 1 of below average weight. 2 of little importance or influence. —n. 1 lightweight person, animal, or thing. 2 a weight in certain sports between featherweight and welterweight, in amateur boxing 57–60 kg. B sportsman of this weight.

Adolescent  —adj. Between childhood and adulthood. —n. Adolescent person.  adolescence n. [latin adolesco grow up]

Replete  adj. (often foll. By with) 1 well-fed, gorged. 2 filled or well-supplied.  repletion n. [latin pleo fill]

Deprave  v. (-ving) corrupt, esp. Morally. [latin pravus crooked]

Tortilla  n. Thin flat orig. Mexican maize cake eaten hot. [spanish diminutive of torta cake]

Brace  —n. 1 device that clamps or fastens tightly. 2 timber etc. Strengthening a framework. 3 (in pl.) Straps supporting trousers from the shoulders. 4 wire device for straightening the teeth. 5 (pl. Same) pair (esp. Of game). 6 rope for trimming a sail. 7 connecting mark { or } in printing. —v. (-cing) 1 make steady by supporting. 2 fasten tightly to make firm. 3 (esp. As bracing adj.) Invigorate, refresh. 4 (often refl.) Prepare for a difficulty, shock, etc. [latin bracchia arms]

Lollipop  n. Hard sweet on a stick. [origin uncertain]

Shoveller  n. (also shoveler) duck with a shovel-like beak.

Brat  n. Usu. Derog. Child, esp. An ill-behaved one. [origin unknown]

Townspeople  n.pl. People of a town.

Gaslight  n. Light from burning gas.

Confection  n. Dish or delicacy made with sweet ingredients. [latin conficio prepare]

Horseplay  n. Boisterous play.

Wafer  n. 1 very thin light crisp sweet biscuit. 2 disc of unleavened bread used in the eucharist. 3 disc of red paper stuck on a legal document instead of a seal. [anglo-french wafre from germanic]

Shorn  past part. Of *shear.

Wheatmeal  n. Flour made from wheat with some of the bran and germ removed.

Foliar  adj. Of leaves. [as *foliate]

Insusceptible  adj. Not susceptible.

Predominant  adj. 1 predominating. 2 being the strongest or main element.  predominance n. Predominantly adv.

Fabric  n. 1 woven material; cloth. 2 walls, floor, and roof of a building. 3 essential structure. [latin faber metal-worker]

Estimate  —n. 1 approximate judgement, esp. Of cost, value, size, etc. 2 statement of approximate charge for work to be undertaken. —v. (-ting) (also absol.) 1 form an estimate or opinion of. 2 (foll. By that) make a rough calculation. 3 (often foll. By at) form an estimate; adjudge.  estimator n. [latin aestimo fix the price of]

Prebendary  n. (pl. -ies) holder of a prebend; honorary canon. [medieval latin: related to *prebend]

Unhelpful  adj. Not helpful.  unhelpfully adv.

Haymaking  n. Mowing grass and spreading it to dry.  haymaker n.

Detonator  n. Device for detonating explosives.

Housework  n. Regular housekeeping work, e.g. Cleaning and cooking.

Cavity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 hollow within a solid body. 2 decayed part of a tooth. [latin: related to *cave]

Robin  n. 1 (also robin redbreast) small brown red-breasted bird. 2 us red-breasted thrush. [pet form of robert]

Innumerable  adj. Too many to be counted.  innumerably adv.

Uncritical  adj. 1 not critical; complacently accepting. 2 not in accordance with the principles of criticism.  uncritically adv.

Monarchy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 form of government with a monarch at the head. 2 state with this.  monarchial adj. [greek: related to *monarch]

Macadam  n. 1 broken stone as material for road-making. 2 = *tarmacadam.  macadamize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). [mcadam, name of a surveyor]

Organist  n. Organ-player.

Quattrocento  n. 15th-c. Italian art. [italian, = 400, used for the years 1400–99]

Hyena  n. (also hyaena) doglike flesh-eating mammal. [latin from greek]

Resuscitate  v. (-ting) 1 revive from unconsciousness or apparent death. 2 revive, restore.  resuscitation n. [latin suscito raise]

Declassify  v. (-ies, -ied) declare (information etc.) To be no longer secret.  declassification n.

Driven  past part. Of *drive.

Depredation  n. (usu. In pl.) Despoiling, ravaging. [latin: related to *prey]

Rh  symb. Rhodium.

Interstice  n. 1 intervening space. 2 chink or crevice. [latin interstitium from sisto stand]

Precisely  adv. 1 in a precise manner; exactly. 2 (as a reply) quite so, as you say.

Graceful  adj. Having or showing grace or elegance.  gracefully adv. Gracefulness n.

Icicle  n. Hanging tapering piece of ice, formed from dripping water. [from *ice, obsolete ickle icicle]

Unheard  adj. 1 not heard. 2 (usu. Unheard-of) unprecedented.

Skillful  adj. (brit. Skilful) (often foll. By at, in) having or showing skill.  skilfully adv.

Contest  —n. 1 contending; strife. 2 a competition. —v. 1 dispute (a decision etc.). 2 contend or compete for; compete in (an election). [latin testis witness]

Seascape  n. Picture or view of the sea.

Agaric  n. Fungus with a cap and stalk, e.g. The common mushroom. [greek agarikon]

Anathematize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) curse.

Temp  colloq. —n. Temporary employee, esp. A secretary. —v. Work as a temp. [abbreviation]

Fierce  adj. (fiercer, fiercest) 1 violently aggressive or frightening. 2 eager, intense. 3 unpleasantly strong or intense (fierce heat).  fiercely adv. Fierceness n. [latin ferus savage]

Jerkin  n. 1 sleeveless jacket. 2 hist. Man's close-fitting, esp. Leather, jacket. [origin unknown]

Straightforward  adj. 1 honest or frank. 2 (of a task etc.) Simple.

Feathering  n. 1 bird's plumage. 2 feathers of an arrow. 3 feather-like structure or marking.

Medalist  n. (brit. Medallist) winner of a (specified) medal (gold medallist).

Teepee  var. Of *tepee.

Ours  poss. Pron. The one or ones belonging to or associated with us (it is ours; ours are best; a friend of ours).

Fresher  n. Colloq. First-year student at university or (us) high school.

Asphalt  —n. 1 dark bituminous pitch. 2 mixture of this with sand, gravel, etc., for surfacing roads etc. —v. Surface with asphalt. [latin from greek]

Stitch  —n. 1 a (in sewing, knitting, or crocheting) single pass of a needle, or the resulting thread or loop etc. B particular method of sewing etc. 2 least bit of clothing (hadn't a stitch on). 3 sharp pain in the side induced by running etc. —v. Sew; make stitches (in).  in stitches colloq. Laughing uncontrollably. Stitch up 1 join or mend by sewing. 2 slang trick, cheat, betray. [old english: related to *stick2]

Exterminate  v. (-ting) destroy utterly (esp. A living thing).  extermination n. Exterminator n. [latin: related to *terminal]

Prim  adj. (primmer, primmest) stiffly formal and precise; prudish.  primly adv. Primness n.  [french: related to *prime1]

Huff  —n. Colloq. Fit of petty annoyance. —v. 1 blow air, steam, etc. 2 (esp. Huff and puff) bluster self-importantly but ineffectually. 3 draughts remove (an opponent's piece) as a forfeit.  in a huff colloq. Annoyed and offended. [imitative of blowing] 

Halitosis  n. = *bad breath. [latin halitus breath]

Scrumpy  n. Colloq. Rough cider. [dial. Scrump small apple]

Pedophile  n. (brit. Paedophile) person who displays paedophilia.

Committal  n. Act of committing, esp. To prison.

Ilk  n. 1 colloq., usu. Derog. Sort, family, class, etc. 2 (in of that ilk) scot. Of the ancestral estate with the same name as the family (guthrie of that ilk). [old english]

Sisal  n. 1 fibre made from a mexican agave. 2 this plant. [sisal, the port of yucatan]

Connective  adj. Connecting, esp. Of body tissue connecting, separating, etc., organs etc.

Hygroscope  n. Instrument indicating but not measuring the humidity of the air.

Salmon  —n. (pl. Usu. Same or -s) large expensive edible fish with orange-pink flesh. —adj. Salmon-pink. [latin salmo]

Conspirator  n. Person who takes part in a conspiracy.  conspiratorial adj.

Gladiator  n. Hist. Trained fighter in ancient roman shows.  gladiatorial adj. [latin gladius sword]

Polystyrene  n. A polymer of styrene, a kind of hard plastic, often foamed for packaging. [styrene from greek sturax a resin]

Slant  —v. 1 slope; lie or (cause to) go obliquely. 2 (often as slanted adj.) Present (information) in a biased or particular way. —n. 1 slope; oblique position. 2 point of view, esp. A biased one. —adj. Sloping, oblique.  on a (or the) slant aslant. [scandinavian]

Mortarboard  n. 1 academic cap with a stiff flat square top. 2 flat board for holding mortar.

Edwardian  —adj. Of or characteristic of the reign of edward vii (1901–10). —n. Person of this period.

Perceptive  adj. 1 sensitive; discerning. 2 capable of perceiving. perceptively adv. Perceptiveness n. Perceptivity n.

Lobotomy  n. (pl. -ies) incision into the frontal lobe of the brain, formerly used in some cases of mental disorder. [from *lobe]

Semiconductor  n. Substance that in certain conditions has electrical conductivity intermediate between insulators and metals.

Deprecate  v. (-ting) express disapproval of; deplore.  deprecation n. Deprecatory adj. [latin: related to *pray]

Usage  deprecate is often confused with depreciate.

Ra  abbr. 1 a royal academy. B royal academician. 2 royal artillery.

Suchlike  colloq. —attrib. Adj. Of such a kind. —n. Things, people, etc. Of such a kind.

Sapphire  —n. 1 transparent blue precious stone. 2 its bright blue colour. —adj. (also sapphire blue) bright blue. [greek sappheiros lapis lazuli]

Nitric  adj. Of or containing nitrogen.

Unsatisfactory  adj. Poor, unacceptable.

Repress  v. 1 a keep under; quell. B suppress; prevent from sounding, rioting, or bursting out. 2 psychol. Actively exclude (an unwelcome thought) from conscious awareness. 3 (usu. As repressed adj.) Subject (a person) to the suppression of his or her thoughts or impulses.  repression n. Repressive adj. [latin: related to *press1]

Coo  —n. Soft murmuring sound as of a dove. —v. (coos, cooed) 1 emit a coo. 2 talk or say in a soft or amorous voice. —int. Slang expressing surprise or disbelief. [imitative]

Sloppy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 wet, watery, too liquid. 2 careless, untidy. 3 foolishly sentimental.  sloppily adv. Sloppiness n.

Henceforth  adv. (also henceforward) from this time onwards.

Archivist  n. Keeper of archives.

Omniscient  adj. Knowing everything or much.  omniscience n. [latin scio know]

Theo-  comb. Form god or god(s). [greek theos god]

Normalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 make or become normal. 2 cause to conform.  normalization n.

Discuss  v. 1 talk about (discussed their holidays). 2 talk or write about (a subject) in detail.  discussion n. [latin discutio -cuss- disperse]

Bud  —n. 1 a knoblike shoot from which a stem, leaf, or flower develops. B flower or leaf not fully open. 2 asexual outgrowth from an organism separating to form a new individual. —v. (-dd-) 1 form buds. 2 begin to grow or develop (budding artist). 3 graft a bud of (a plant) on to another. [origin unknown]

-ial  var. Of *-al.

Number  —n. 1 a arithmetical value representing a particular quantity. B word, symbol, or figure representing this. C arithmetical value showing position in a series (registration number). 2 (often foll. By of) total count or aggregate (the number of accidents has decreased). 3 numerical reckoning (the laws of number). 4 a (in sing. Or pl.) Quantity, amount (a large number of people; only in small numbers). B (a number of) several (of). C (in pl.) Numerical preponderance (force of numbers). 5 person or thing having a place in a series, esp. A single issue of a magazine, an item in a programme, etc. 6 company, collection, group (among our number). 7 gram. A classification of words by their singular or plural forms. B such a form. —v. 1 include (i number you among my friends). 2 assign a number or numbers to. 3 amount to (a specified number). 4 count.  one's days are numbered one does not have long to live. Have a person's number colloq. Understand a person's real motives, character, etc. One's number is up colloq. One is doomed to die soon. Without number innumerable. [latin numerus]

Usage  in sense 4b, a number of is normally used with a plural verb: a number of problems remain.

Jogger  n. Person who jogs, esp. For exercise.

Dialectic  n. 1 art of investigating the truth by discussion and logical argument. 2 process whereby contradictions merge to form a higher truth. 3 any situation or discussion involving the juxtaposition or conflict of opposites. [greek: related to *dialect]

Megawatt  n. One million watts, esp. As a measure of electrical power.

Dormant  adj. 1 lying inactive; sleeping. 2 temporarily inactive. 3 (of plants) alive but not growing.  dormancy n. [latin dormio sleep]

Leaven  —n. 1 substance causing dough to ferment and rise. 2 pervasive transforming influence; admixture. —v. 1 ferment (dough) with leaven. 2 permeate and transform; modify with a tempering element. [latin levo lift]

Peerage  n. 1 peers as a class; the nobility. 2 rank of peer or peeress.

Triangle  n. 1 plane figure with three sides and angles. 2 any three things not in a straight line, with imaginary lines joining them. 3 implement of this shape. 4 musical instrument consisting of a steel rod bent into a triangle, struck with a small steel rod. 5 situation, esp. An emotional relationship, involving three people.  triangular adj. [latin: related to *tri-]

Crumby  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 like or covered in crumbs. 2 = *crummy.

Circumstance  n. 1 fact, occurrence, or condition, esp. (in pl.) Connected with or influencing an event; (bad) luck (victim of circumstance(s)). 2 (in pl.) One's financial or material condition. 3 ceremony, fuss.  in (or under) the circumstances the state of affairs being what it is. In (or under) no circumstances not at all; never.  circumstanced adj. [latin sto stand]

Washing  n. Clothes etc. For washing or just washed.

Staid  adj. Of quiet and steady character; sedate. [= stayed, past part. Of *stay1]

Plateau  —n. (pl. -x or -s) 1 area of fairly level high ground. 2 state of little variation after an increase. —v. (plateauing, plateaus, plateaued) (often foll. By out) reach a level or static state after an increase. [french: related to *plate]

Ulsterman  n. (fem. Ulsterwoman) native of ulster.

Launcher  n. Structure to hold a rocket during launching.

Gory  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 involving bloodshed; bloodthirsty. 2 covered in gore.  gorily adv. Goriness n.

Scythe  —n. Mowing and reaping implement with a long handle and curved blade swung over the ground. —v. (-thing) cut with a scythe. [old english]

Lives  pl. Of *life.

Slattern  n. Slovenly woman.  slatternly adj. [origin uncertain]

Pta  abbr. Parent-teacher association.

Nee  adj. (brit. Née) (used in adding a married woman's maiden name after her surname) born (mrs ann hall, née brown). [french, feminine past part. Of naître be born]

Nymph  n. 1 mythological semi-divine spirit regarded as a maiden and associated with an aspect of nature, esp. Rivers and woods. 2 poet. Beautiful young woman. 3 immature form of some insects. [greek numphe nymph, bride]

Gelatinous  adj. Of a jelly-like consistency.

Plumage  n. Bird's feathers. [french: related to *plume]

-graphy  comb. Form forming nouns denoting: 1 descriptive science (geography). 2 technique of producing images (photography). 3 style or method of writing etc. (calligraphy).

Expire  v. (-ring) 1 (of a period of time, validity, etc.) Come to an end. 2 cease to be valid. 3 die. 4 (also absol.) Breathe out (air etc.).  expiration n. Expiratory adj. (in sense 4). [latin spirare breathe]

Stealthy  adj. (-ier, -iest) done or moving with stealth; furtive.  stealthily adv. Stealthiness n.

Rainwater  n. Water collected from fallen rain.

Dachshund  n. Dog of a short-legged long-bodied breed. [german, = badger-dog]

Horseback  n.  on horseback mounted on a horse.

Starboard  —n. Right-hand side of a ship or aircraft looking forward. —v. (also absol.) Turn (the helm) to starboard. [old english, = steer board]

Detail  —n. 1 small particular; item. 2 a these collectively (eye for detail). B treatment of them (detail was unconvincing). 3 a minor decoration on a building etc. B small part of a picture etc. Shown alone. 4 small military detachment. —v. 1 give particulars of. 2 relate circumstantially. 3 assign for special duty. 4 (as detailed adj.) A (of a picture, story, etc.) Containing many details. B itemized (detailed list).  in detail item by item, minutely. [french: related to *tail2]

Obstruct  v. 1 block up; make hard or impossible to pass along or through. 2 prevent or retard the progress of. [latin obstruo obstruct- block up]

Apposite  adj. (often foll. By to) apt, appropriate; well expressed. [latin appono apply]

Antiviral  adj. Effective against viruses.

Partizan  var. Of *partisan.

Interplay  n. Reciprocal action.

Creeper  n. 1 climbing or creeping plant. 2 bird that climbs, esp. The treecreeper. 3 slang soft-soled shoe.

Circus  n. (pl. -es) 1 travelling show of performing acrobats, clowns, animals, etc. 2 colloq. A scene of lively action. B group of people in a common activity, esp. Sport. 3 open space in a town, where several streets converge. 4 rom. Antiq. Arena for sports and games. [latin, = ring]

Disorient  v. = *disorientate.

Knobbly  adj. (-ier, -iest) hard and lumpy. [knobble, diminutive of *knob]

Intruder  n. Person who intrudes, esp. A trespasser.

Usual  adj. 1 customary, habitual (the usual time). 2 (absol., prec. By the, my, etc.) Colloq. Person's usual drink etc.  as usual as (or was) usual.  usually adv. [latin: related to *use]

Bevy  n. (pl. -ies) company (of quails, larks, women, etc.). [origin unknown]

Epaulet  n. (brit. Epaulette) ornamental shoulder-piece on a coat etc., esp. On a uniform. [french épaule shoulder]

Rspb  abbr. Royal society for the protection of birds.

Grovel  v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 behave obsequiously. 2 lie prone in abject humility.  grovelling adj. [obsolete grovelling (adv.) From old norse á grúfu face down]

Convenient  adj. 1 a serving one's comfort or interests. B suitable. C free of trouble or difficulty. 2 available or occurring at a suitable time or place. 3 well situated (convenient for the shops).  conveniently adv.

Gismo  n. (also gizmo) (pl. -s) slang gadget. [origin unknown]

Insatiate  adj. Never satisfied.

Sandstone  n. Sedimentary rock of compressed sand.

Interchangeable  adj. That can be interchanged, esp. Without affecting the way a thing works.  interchangeably adv.

Wintry  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 characteristic of winter. 2 lacking warmth; unfriendly.  wintriness n.

Require  v. (-ring) 1 need; depend on for success or fulfilment (the work requires patience). 2 lay down as an imperative (required by law). 3 command; instruct (a person etc.). 4 order; insist on (an action or measure).  requirement n. [latin requiro -quisit- seek]

Runny  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 tending to run or flow. 2 excessively fluid.

Shake  —v. (-king; past shook; past part. Shaken) 1 move forcefully or quickly up and down or to and fro. 2 (cause to) tremble or vibrate. 3 agitate, shock, or upset the composure of. 4 weaken or impair in courage, effectiveness, etc. 5 (of a voice, note, etc.) Tremble; trill. 6 gesture with (one's fist, a stick, etc.). 7 colloq. Shake hands (they shook on the deal). —n. 1 shaking or being shaken. 2 jerk or shock. 3 (in pl.; prec. By the) colloq. Fit of trembling. 4 mus. Trill. 5 = *milk shake.  no great shakes colloq. Mediocre, poor. Shake down 1 settle or cause to fall by shaking. 2 settle down; become established. Shake hands (often foll. By with) clasp hands as a greeting, farewell, in congratulation, as confirmation of a deal, etc. Shake one's head turn one's head from side to side in refusal, denial, disapproval, or concern. Shake off get rid of or evade (a person or thing). Shake out 1 empty by shaking. 2 open (a sail, flag, etc.) By shaking. Shake up 1 mix by shaking. 2 restore to shape by shaking.

Aerobics  n.pl. Vigorous exercises designed to increase oxygen intake.  aerobic adj. [from *aero-, greek bios life]

Aflame  adv. & predic.adj. 1 in flames. 2 very excited.

Roulette  n. Gambling game in which a ball is dropped on to a revolving numbered wheel. [french, = little wheel]

Emerge  v. (-ging) 1 come up or out into view. 2 (of facts etc.) Become known, be revealed. 3 become recognized or prominent. 4 (of a question, difficulty, etc.) Become apparent.  emergence n. Emergent adj. [latin: related to *merge]

Lager  n. A kind of light effervescent beer. [german, = store]

Pottage  n. Archaic soup, stew. [french: related to *pot1]

Temporary  —adj. Lasting or meant to last only for a limited time. —n. (pl. -ies) person employed temporarily.  temporarily adv. Temporariness n.

Landscape  —n. 1 scenery as seen in a broad view. 2 (often attrib.) Picture representing this; this genre of painting. —v. (-ping) improve (a piece of land) by landscape gardening. [dutch landscap]

Protest  —n. 1 statement or act of dissent or disapproval. 2 law written declaration that a bill has been presented and payment or acceptance refused. —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By against, at, about, etc.) Make a protest. 2 affirm (one's innocence etc.) Solemnly. 3 law write or obtain a protest in regard to (a bill). 4 us object to (a decision etc.).  under protest unwillingly.  protester n. (also protestor). [latin protestor declare formally]

Convoke  v. (-king) formal call together; summon to assemble. [latin voco call]

Shade  —n. 1 comparative darkness (and usu. Coolness) given by shelter from direct light and heat. 2 area so sheltered. 3 darker part of a picture etc. 4 colour, esp. As darker or lighter than one similar. 5 comparative obscurity. 6 slight amount (a shade better). 7 lampshade. 8 screen against the light. 9 (in pl.) Esp. Us colloq. Sunglasses. 10 literary ghost. 11 (in pl.; foll. By of) reminder of, suggesting (esp. Something undesirable) (shades of hitler!). —v. (-ding) 1 screen from light. 2 cover, moderate, or exclude the light of. 3 darken, esp. With parallel lines to show shadow etc. 4 (often foll. By away, off, into) pass or change gradually. [old english]

Comptroller  n. Controller (used in the title of some financial officers). [var. Of *controller]

Remind  v. (usu. Foll. By of or to + infin. Or that + clause) cause (a person) to remember or think of (reminds me of her father; reminded them of the time).

Rigorous  adj. 1 firm; strict, severe. 2 strictly exact or accurate.  rigorously adv. Rigorousness n. [related to *rigour]

Parsec  n. Unit of stellar distance, equal to about 3.25 light-years. [from *parallax, *second2]

Insight  n. (usu. Foll. By into) 1 capacity of understanding hidden truths etc. 2 instance of this.

Thankfully  adv. 1 in a thankful manner. 2 let us be thankful (that) (thankfully, it didn't rain).

Usage  the use of thankfully in sense 2 is common, but is considered incorrect by some people.

Brickie  n. Slang bricklayer.

Ptolemaic  adj. Hist. Of ptolemy or his theories. [greek ptolemaios, name of a 2nd-c. Astronomer]

Manpower  n. Number of people available for work, service, etc.

Frolic  —v. (-ck-) play about cheerfully. —n. 1 cheerful play. 2 prank. 3 merry party. [dutch vrolijk (adj.) From vro glad]

Lizard  n. Reptile with usu. A long body and tail, four legs, and a rough or scaly hide. [latin lacertus]

Overplay  v. Give undue importance to; overemphasize.  overplay one's hand act on an unduly optimistic estimation of one's chances.

Stuffing  n. 1 padding for cushions etc. 2 mixture used to stuff food, esp. Before cooking.

Encroach  v. 1 (foll. By on, upon) intrude on another's territory etc. 2 advance gradually beyond due limits.  encroachment n. [french croc *crook]

Thorn  n. 1 sharp-pointed projection on a plant. 2 thorn-bearing shrub or tree.  thorn in one's flesh (or side) constant nuisance.  thornless adj. [old english]

Chasuble  n. Loose sleeveless usu. Ornate outer vestment worn by a celebrant at mass or the eucharist. [latin casubla]

Bur  n. 1 a prickly clinging seed-case or flower-head. B any plant having these. 2 clinging person. 3 var. Of *burr n. 2. [scandinavian]

Breadboard  n. 1 board for cutting bread on. 2 board for making an experimental model of an electric circuit.

Which  —interrog. Adj. Asking for choice from a definite set of alternatives (which john do you mean?; say which book you prefer). —rel. Adj. Being the one just referred to; and this or these (ten years, during which time they admitted nothing). —interrog. Pron. 1 which person or persons? (which of you is responsible?). 2 which thing or things? (say which you prefer). —rel. Pron. (poss. Of which, whose) 1 which thing or things, usu. Introducing a clause not essential for identification (the house, which is empty, has been damaged). 2 used in place of that after in or that (there is the house in which i was born; that which you have just seen). [old english]

Colic  n. Severe spasmodic abdominal pain.  colicky adj. [latin: related to *colon2]

Grievance  n. Real or fancied cause for complaint. [french: related to *grief]

Mainstay  n. 1 chief support. 2 stay from the maintop to the foot of the foremast.

Five  adj. & n. 1 one more than four. 2 symbol for this (5, v, v). 3 size etc. Denoted by five. 4 set or team of five. 5 five o'clock (is it five yet?). 6 cricket hit scoring five runs. [old english]

Lego  n. Propr. Toy consisting of interlocking plastic building blocks. [danish legetøj toys]

Paperweight  n. Small heavy object for keeping loose papers in place.

Bode  v. (-ding) be a sign of, portend.  bode well (or ill) be a good (or bad) sign. [old english]

Batwing  attrib. Adj. (esp. Of a sleeve) shaped like a bat's wing.

Jukebox  n. Coin-operated record-playing machine. [black juke disorderly]

Perfect  —adj. 1 complete; not deficient. 2 faultless. 3 very enjoyable, excellent (perfect evening). 4 exact, precise (perfect circle). 5 entire, unqualified (perfect stranger). 6 gram. (of a tense) denoting a completed action or event (e.g. He has gone). —v. 1 make perfect. 2 complete. —n. Gram. The perfect tense.  perfectible adj. Perfectibility n. [latin perficere -fect- complete (v.)]

Jacquard  n. 1 apparatus with perforated cards, for weaving figured fabrics. 2 (in full jacquard loom) loom with this. 3 fabric or article so made. [name of its inventor]

Disorganize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 throw into confusion or disorder. 2 (as disorganized adj.) Badly organized; untidy.  disorganization n.

Compose  v. (-sing) 1 create in music or writing. 2 constitute; make up. 3 arrange artistically, neatly, or for a specified purpose. 4 a (often refl.) Calm; settle. B (as composed adj.) Calm, self-possessed. 5 printing a set up (type). B arrange (an article etc.) In type.  composed of made up of, consisting of.  composedly adv. [french: related to *pose]

Usage  see note at comprise.

Underscore  v. (-ring) = *underline.

Floral  adj. Of, decorated with, or depicting flowers.  florally adv. [latin]

Suggestion  n. 1 suggesting or being suggested. 2 theory, plan, etc., suggested. 3 slight trace, hint. 4 psychol. Insinuation of a belief etc. Into the mind. [latin: related to *suggest]

Outdoors  —adv. In or into the open air. —n. The open air.

Annuity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 yearly grant or allowance. 2 investment yielding a fixed annual sum.

Bezique  n. Card-game for two. [french]

Welshwoman  n. Woman who is welsh by birth or descent.

Gentlefolk  n.pl. People of good family.

Flashback  n. Scene set in an earlier time than the main action.

Schizophrenia  n. Mental disease marked by a breakdown in the relation between thoughts, feelings, and actions, and often with delusions and retreat from social life.  schizophrenic adj. & n. [greek skhizo split, phren mind]

Transmission  n. 1 transmitting or being transmitted. 2 broadcast programme. 3 mechanism transmitting power from the engine to the axle in a vehicle.

Stair  n. 1 each of a set of fixed indoor steps. 2 (usu. In pl.) Set of these. [old english]

Recruit  —n. 1 newly enlisted serviceman or servicewoman. 2 new member of a society etc. 3 beginner. —v. 1 enlist (a person) as a recruit. 2 form (an army etc.) By enlisting recruits. 3 get or seek recruits. 4 replenish or reinvigorate (numbers, strength, etc.).  recruitment n. [french dial. Recrute: related to *crew1]

Evergreen  —adj. Retaining green leaves all year round. —n. Evergreen plant.

Carnelian  var. Of *cornelian.

Nigh  adv., prep., & adj. Archaic or dial. Near. [old english]

Spa  n. 1 curative mineral spring. 2 resort with this. [spa in belgium]

Yokel  n. Rustic; country bumpkin. [perhaps dial.]

Diverse  adj. Varied. [latin: related to *di-2, verto vers- turn]

Plaything  n. 1 toy or other thing to play with. 2 person used merely as an object of amusement or pleasure.

Carton  n. Light esp. Cardboard box or container. [french: related to *cartoon]

Questionnaire  n. Formulated series of questions, esp. For statistical analysis. [french: related to *question]

Ebony  —n. Heavy hard dark wood of a tropical tree. —adj. 1 made of ebony. 2 black like ebony. [greek ebenos ebony tree]

Hurricane  n. 1 storm with a violent wind, esp. A w. Indian cyclone. 2 meteorol. Wind of 65 knots (75 m.p.h.) Or more, force 12 on the beaufort scale. [spanish and portuguese from carib]

Unfilled  adj. Not filled.

Reproduction  n. 1 reproducing or being reproduced, esp. The production of further members of the same species. 2 copy of a work of art. 3 (attrib.) (of furniture etc.) Imitating an earlier style. 4 quality of reproduced sound. reproductive adj.

Groat  n. Hist. Silver coin worth four old pence. [low german or dutch: related to *great]

Festive  adj. 1 of or characteristic of a festival. 2 joyous.  festively adv. Festiveness n. [latin: related to *feast]

Convulsion  n. 1 (usu. In pl.) Violent irregular motion of the limbs or body caused by involuntary contraction of muscles. 2 violent disturbance. 3 (in pl.) Uncontrollable laughter.

Lettered  adj. Well-read or educated.

Camisole  n. Women's lightweight vest. [italian or spanish: related to *chemise]

Jacaranda  n. Tropical american tree with trumpet-shaped blue flowers or hard scented wood. [tupi]

Awkward  adj. 1 difficult to use or deal with. 2 clumsy, ungainly. 3 a embarrassed. B embarrassing. [obsolete awk perverse]

Bungalow  n. One-storeyed house. [gujarati, = of bengal]

Deliverance  n. Rescuing or being rescued.

Feeder  n. 1 person or thing that feeds, esp. In specified manner. 2 baby's feeding-bottle. 3 bib. 4 tributary stream. 5 branch road, railway line, etc. Linking with a main system. 6 main carrying electricity to a distribution point. 7 feeding apparatus in a machine.

Telefax  n. = *fax. [abbreviation of telefacsimile]

Likable  var. Of *likeable.

Usage  the use of like as a conjunction is considered incorrect by some people.

Usage  the use of like as a conjunction is considered incorrect by some people.

Synod  n. Church council of delegated clergy and sometimes laity. [greek, = meeting]

Whatever  adj. & pron. 1 = *what (in relative uses) with the emphasis on indefiniteness (lend me whatever you can; whatever money you have). 2 though anything (we are safe whatever happens). 3 (with neg. Or interrog.) At all; of any kind (there is no doubt whatever).

Oilstone  n. Fine-grained flat stone used with oil for sharpening flat tools, e.g. Chisels, planes, etc.

Embolism  n. Obstruction of an artery by a clot, air-bubble, etc. [latin from greek]

Sync  (also synch) colloq. —n. Synchronization. —v. Synchronize.  in (or out of) sync (often foll. By with) according or agreeing well (or badly). [abbreviation]

Talon  n. Claw, esp. Of a bird of prey. [latin talus ankle]

Uncensored  adj. Not censored.

Minim  n. 1 mus. Note equal to two crotchets or half a semibreve. 2 one-sixtieth of a fluid drachm, about a drop. [latin minimus least]

Nervy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Nervous; easily excited.

Asleep  predic. Adj. & adv. 1 a in or into a state of sleep. B inactive, inattentive. 2 (of a limb etc.) Numb. 3 euphem. Dead.

Turkeycock  n. Male turkey.

Hydrostatics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Mechanics of the hydrostatic properties of liquids.

Synchronism  n. 1 being or treating as synchronic or synchronous. 2 process of synchronizing sound and picture.

Fulsome  adj. Excessive, cloying, insincere (fulsome praise).  fulsomely adv. [from *full1]

Usage  the phrase fulsome praise is sometimes wrongly used to mean generous praise rather than excessive praise.

Blackleg  —n. Derog. Person refusing to join a strike etc. —v. (-gg-) act as a blackleg.

Heresy  n. (pl. -ies) 1  esp. Rc ch. Religious belief or practice contrary to orthodox doctrine. 2 opinion contrary to what is normally accepted or maintained. [greek hairesis choice]

Schmuck  n. Slang esp. Us foolish or contemptible person. [yiddish]

Liven  v. (often foll. By up) colloq. Make or become lively, cheer up.

Distraint  n. Seizure of goods to enforce payment.

Interchange  —v. (-ging) 1 (of two people) exchange (things) with each other. 2 put each of (two things) in the other's place; alternate. —n. 1 (often foll. By of) exchange between two people etc. 2 alternation. 3 road junction where traffic streams do not cross.

Citronella  n. 1 a fragrant oil. 2 grass from s. Asia yielding it.

Bullet  n. Small pointed missile fired from a rifle, revolver, etc. [french diminutive of boule ball]

Gaga  adj. Slang 1 senile. 2 slightly crazy. [french]

Stubborn  adj. Obstinate, inflexible.  stubbornly adj. Stubbornness n. [origin unknown]

At  symb. Astatine.

Rampage  —v. (-ging) 1 (often foll. By about) rush wildly or violently about. 2 rage, storm. —n. Wild or violent behaviour.  on the rampage rampaging. [perhaps from *ramp]

Suasion  n. Formal persuasion (moral suasion). [latin suadeo suas- urge]

Mesmerize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 hypnotize. 2 fascinate, spellbind.  mesmerism n. Mesmerizingly adv. [mesmer, name of a physician]

Evolve  v. (-ving) 1 develop gradually and naturally. 2 devise (a theory, plan, etc.). 3 unfold. 4 give off (gas, heat, etc.). [latin volvo volut- roll]

Constabulary  n. (pl. -ies) police force. [medieval latin: related to *constable]

Charlotte  n. Pudding of stewed fruit covered with bread etc. [french]

Powerful  adj. Having much power or influence.  powerfully adv. Powerfulness n.

Housing  n. 1 a dwelling-houses collectively. B provision of these. 2 shelter, lodging. 3 rigid casing for machinery etc. 4 hole or niche cut in one piece of wood for another to fit into.

Twofold  adj. & adv. 1 twice as much or as many. 2 consisting of two parts.

Vulgar  adj. 1 a coarse; indecent; tasteless. B of or characteristic of the common people. 2 common; prevalent (vulgar errors).  vulgarly adv. [latin vulgus common people]

Arbitrator  n. Person appointed to arbitrate.

Respectable  adj. 1 of acceptable social standing; decent and proper in appearance or behaviour. 2 fairly competent (a respectable try). 3 reasonably good in condition, appearance, number, size, etc.  respectability n. Respectably adv.

Sinful  adj. Committing or involving sin.  sinfully adv. Sinfulness n.

Degrade  v. (-ding) 1 humiliate, dishonour. 2 reduce to a lower rank. 3 chem. Reduce to a simpler molecular structure.  degradation n. Degrading adj. [latin: related to *grade]

Negro  —n. (pl. -es) member of a dark-skinned race orig. Native to africa. —adj. 1 of negroes. 2 (as negro) zool. Black or dark. [latin niger nigri black]

Usage  the term negro is often considered offensive; black is usually preferred.

Vocative  gram. —n. Case of a noun used in addressing a person or thing. —adj. Of or in this case.

Coaster  n. 1 ship that travels along the coast. 2 small tray or mat for a bottle or glass.

Refulgent  adj. Literary shining, gloriously bright.  refulgence n. [latin refulgeo shine brightly]

Corundum  n. Extremely hard crystallized alumina, used esp. As an abrasive. [tamil from sanskrit]

Surrender  —v. 1 hand over; relinquish. 2 submit, esp. To an enemy. 3 refl. (foll. By to) yield to a habit, emotion, influence, etc. 4  give up rights under (a life-insurance policy) in return for a smaller sum received immediately. 5 abandon (hope etc.). —n. Act of surrendering.  surrender to bail duly appear in court after release on bail. [anglo-french: related to *sur-1]

Lumbar  adj. Of the lower back area. [as *lumbago]

Maidenhead  n. 1 virginity. 2 hymen.

Summit  n. 1 highest point, top. 2 highest degree of power, ambition, etc. 3 (in full summit meeting, talks, etc.) Conference of heads of government. [latin summus highest]

Sandpaper  —n. Paper with an abrasive coating for smoothing or polishing. —v. Rub with this.

Lightship  n. Moored or anchored ship with a beacon light.

Bleed  —v. (past and past part. Bled) 1 emit blood. 2 draw blood from surgically. 3 colloq. Extort money from. 4 (often foll. By for) suffer wounds or violent death. 5 a emit sap. B (of dye) come out in water. 6 empty (a system) of excess air or fluid. —n. Act of bleeding.  one's heart bleeds usu. Iron. One is very sorrowful. [old english]

Drawstring  n. String or cord threaded through a waistband, bag opening, etc.

Curlew  n. Wading bird, usu. With a long slender bill. [french]

Uterine  adj. Of the uterus.

Paeony  var. Of *peony.

Went  past of *go1.

Oblong  —adj. Rectangular with adjacent sides unequal. —n. Oblong figure or object. [latin oblongus longish]

Erupt  v. 1 break out suddenly or dramatically. 2 (of a volcano) eject lava etc. 3 (of a rash etc.) Appear on the skin.  eruption n. Eruptive adj. [latin erumpo erupt- break out]

Brainy  adj. (-ier, -iest) intellectually clever.

Fatalism  n. 1 belief in predetermination. 2 submissive acceptance.  fatalist n. Fatalistic adj. Fatalistically adv.

Property  n. (pl. -ies) 1 thing(s) owned; possession, esp. A house, land, etc. (has money in property). 2 attribute, quality, or characteristic (property of dissolving grease). 3 movable object used on a theatre stage or in a film. [latin proprietas: related to *proper]

Basso  n. (pl. -s) singer with a bass voice. [italian, = *bass1]

Dicey  adj. (dicier, diciest) slang risky, unreliable.

Inlay  —v. (past and past part. Inlaid) 1 embed (a thing in another) so that the surfaces are even. 2 decorate (a thing with inlaid work). —n. 1 inlaid work. 2 material inlaid. 3 filling shaped to fit a tooth-cavity. [from *in-2, *lay1]

Telephoto  n. (pl. -s) (in full telephoto lens) lens used in telephotography.

Slantwise  adv. Aslant.

Snowmobile  n. Motor vehicle, esp. With runners or caterpillar tracks, for travel over snow.

Carouse  —v. (-sing) have a lively drinking-party. —n. Such a party.  carousal n. Carouser n. [german gar aus (drink) right out]

Chancel  n. Part of a church near the altar. [latin cancelli grating]

Quieten  v. (often foll. By down) = *quiet v.

Democratize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make democratic.  democratization n.

Psst  int. (also pst) whispered exclamation to attract a person's attention. [imitative]

Delight  —v. 1 (often as delighted adj.) Please greatly (her singing delighted us; delighted to help). 2 (foll. By in) take great pleasure in (delights in surprising everyone). —n. 1 great pleasure. 2 thing that delights.  delighted adj. Delightful adj. Delightfully adv. [latin delecto]

Realign  v. 1 align again. 2 regroup in politics etc.  realignment n.

Newsreader  n. Person who reads out broadcast news bulletins.

Ac  abbr. 1 (also ac) alternating current. 2 aircraftman.

Insular  adj. 1 a of or like an island. B separated or remote. 2 narrow-minded.  insularity n. [latin insula island]

Lumberjack  n. Person who fells and transports lumber.

Cinnamon  n. 1 aromatic spice from the bark of a se asian tree. 2 this tree. 3 yellowish-brown. [greek kinnamon]

Crest  —n. 1 a comb or tuft etc. On a bird's or animal's head. B plume etc. On a helmet etc. 2 top of a mountain, wave, roof, etc. 3 heraldry a device above a coat of arms. B such a device on writing-paper etc. —v. 1 reach the crest of. 2 provide with a crest or serve as a crest to. 3 (of a wave) form a crest.  crested adj. [latin crista]

Delectable  adj. Esp. Literary delightful, delicious.  delectably adv. [latin: related to *delight]

Winkle  —n. Small edible sea snail. —v. (-ling) (foll. By out) extract with difficulty. [abbreviation of *periwinkle2]

Bc  abbr. British columbia.

Twopence  n. 1 sum of two pence. 2 (esp. With neg.) Colloq. Thing of little value (don't care twopence).

Flatmate  n. Person sharing a flat.

Through  (also thro', us thru) —prep. 1 a from end to end or side to side of. B going in one side or end and out the other of. 2 between or among (swam through the waves). 3 from beginning to end of (read through the letter; went through many difficulties). 4 because of; by the agency, means, or fault of (lost it through carelessness). 5 us up to and including (monday through friday). —adv. 1 through a thing; from side to side, end to end, or beginning to end. 2 so as to be connected by telephone (will put you through). —attrib. Adj. 1 (of a journey, route, etc.) Done without a change of line or vehicle etc. Or with one ticket. 2 (of traffic) going through a place to its destination. 3 (of a road) open at both ends.  be through colloq. 1 (often foll. By with) have finished. 2 (often foll. By with) cease to have dealings. 3 have no further prospects. Through and through thoroughly, completely. [old english]

Intangible  —adj. 1 unable to be touched. 2 unable to be grasped mentally. —n. Thing that cannot be precisely assessed or defined.  intangibility n. Intangibly adv. [latin: related to *intact]

Volatilize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) turn into vapour.  volatilization n.

Conclave  n. 1 private meeting. 2 rc ch. A assembly of cardinals for the election of a pope. B meeting-place for this. [latin clavis key]

Hackney  n. (pl. -s) horse for ordinary riding. [hackney in london]

Sunshade  n. Parasol; awning.

Wizard  —n. 1 sorcerer; magician. 2 person of remarkable powers, genius. —adj. Slang wonderful.  wizardry n. [from *wise1]

Unlabeled  adj. (brit. Unlabelled) not labelled; without a label.

Phase  —n. 1 stage in a process of change or development. 2 each of the aspects of the moon or a planet, according to the amount of its illumination. 3 physics stage in a periodically recurring sequence, esp. The wave-form of alternating electric currents or light. —v. (-sing) carry out (a programme etc.) In phases or stages.  phase in (or out) bring gradually into (or out of) use. [greek phasis appearance]

Rpm  abbr. Revolutions per minute.

Frown  —v. 1 wrinkle one's brows, esp. In displeasure or concentration. 2 (foll. By at, on) disapprove of. —n. 1 act of frowning. 2 look of displeasure or concentration. [french]

Carcass  n. (also carcase) 1 dead body of an animal, esp. As meat. 2 bones of a cooked bird. 3 colloq. Human body; corpse. 4 framework. 5 worthless remains. [french]

Helium  n. Light inert gaseous element used in airships and as a refrigerant. [related to *helio-]

Interlocutor  n. Formal person who takes part in a conversation. [latin loquor speak]

Correctitude  n. Consciously correct behaviour. [from *correct, *rectitude]

Perversion  n. 1 perverting or being perverted. 2 preference for an abnormal form of sexual activity. [latin: related to *pervert]

Unworthy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 (often foll. By of) not worthy of or befitting a person etc. 2 discreditable, unseemly.  unworthily adv. Unworthiness n.

Physiognomy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a cast or form of a person's features, expression, etc. B supposed art of judging character from facial characteristics etc. 2 external features of a landscape etc. [greek: related to *physic, *gnomon]

Knowledgeable  adj. (also knowledgable) well-informed; intelligent.  knowledgeability n. Knowledgeably adv.

Precambrian  geol. —adj. Of the earliest geological era. —n. This era.

Ivy  n. (pl. -ies) climbing evergreen shrub with shiny five-angled leaves. [old english]

Readdress  v. 1 change the address of (an item for posting). 2 address (a problem etc.) Anew. 3 speak or write to anew.

Ticket  —n. 1 written or printed piece of paper or card entitling the holder to enter a place, participate in an event, travel by public transport, etc. 2 notification of a traffic offence etc. (parking ticket). 3 certificate of discharge from the army. 4 certificate of qualification as a ship's master, pilot, etc. 5 price etc. Label. 6 esp. Us a list of candidates put forward by one group, esp. A political party. B principles of a party. 7 (prec. By the) colloq. What is correct or needed. —v. (-t-) attach a ticket to. [obsolete french étiquet]

Universal  —adj. Of, belonging to, or done etc. By all; applicable to all cases. —n. Term, characteristic, or concept of general application.  universality n. Universally adv. [latin: related to *universe]

Ovation  n. Enthusiastic reception, esp. Applause. [latin ovo exult]

Vietnamese  —adj. Of vietnam. —n. (pl. Same) native or language of vietnam.

Diplomatist  n. Diplomat.

Cleat  n. 1 piece of metal, wood, etc., bolted on for fastening ropes to, or to strengthen woodwork etc. 2 projecting piece on a spar, gangway, etc. To prevent slipping. [old english]

Fireplace  n. 1 place for a domestic fire, esp. A recess in a wall. 2 structure surrounding this.

Flocculent  adj. Like or in tufts of wool etc.; downy.  flocculence n. [related to *flock2]

Arboretum  n. (pl. -ta) place cultivating and displaying rare trees.

Vole  n. Small plant-eating rodent. [originally vole-mouse from norwegian voll field]

Lode  n. Vein of metal ore. [var. Of *load]

Pabulum  n. Food, esp. For the mind. [latin]

Recording  n. 1 process by which audio or video signals are recorded for later reproduction. 2 material or a programme recorded.

Intercalary  attrib. Adj. 1 a (of a day or a month) inserted in the calendar to harmonize it with the solar year. B (of a year) having such an addition. 2 interpolated. [latin calo proclaim]

Autarky  n. Self-sufficiency, esp. Economic. [greek autos self, arkeo suffice]

Railroad  —n. Esp. Us = *railway. —v. (often foll. By into, through, etc.) Coerce; rush (railroaded into agreeing; railroaded through the cabinet).

Reappear  v. Appear again or as previously.  reappearance n.

Vapor  n. (brit. Vapour) 1 moisture or other substance diffused or suspended in air, e.g. Mist, smoke. 2  gaseous form of a substance. 3 medicinal inhalant.  vaporous adj. Vapoury adj. [latin vapor steam]

Flagstaff  n. Pole on which a flag may be hoisted.

Admiration  n. 1 respect; warm approval or pleasure. 2 object of this.

Epitome  n. 1 person or thing embodying a quality etc. 2 thing representing another in miniature. [greek temno cut]

Valerian  n. Any of various flowering herbs, esp. Used as a sedative. [french from medieval latin]

Flimsy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 insubstantial, rickety (flimsy structure). 2 (of an excuse etc.) Unconvincing. 3 (of clothing) thin.  flimsily adv. Flimsiness n. [origin uncertain]

Project  —n. 1 plan; scheme. 2 extensive essay, piece of research, etc. By a student. —v. 1 protrude; jut out. 2 throw; cast; impel. 3 extrapolate (results etc.) To a future time; forecast. 4 plan or contrive (a scheme etc.). 5 cause (light, shadow, images, etc.) To fall on a surface. 6 cause (a sound, esp. The voice) to be heard at a distance. 7 (often refl. Or absol.) Express or promote forcefully or effectively. 8  make a projection of (the earth, sky, etc.). 9 a (also absol.) Attribute (an emotion etc.) To an external object or person, esp. Unconsciously. B (refl.) Imagine (oneself) having another's feelings, being in the future, etc. [latin projicio -ject- throw forth]

Wacky  adj. (-ier, -iest) slang crazy. [originally dial., = left-handed]

Heady  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 (of liquor) potent. 2 intoxicating, exciting. 3 impulsive, rash. 4 headachy.  headily adv. Headiness n.

Refuge  n. 1 shelter from pursuit, danger, or trouble. 2 person or place etc. Offering this. [latin refugium from fugio flee]

Etiology  n. (brit. Aetiology) study of causation or of the causes of disease.  aetiological adj. [greek aitia cause]

Optimal  adj. Best or most favourable. [latin optimus best]

Needlework  n. Sewing or embroidery.

Nation  n. Community of people of mainly common descent, history, language, etc., forming a state or inhabiting a territory. [latin: related to *natal]

Crack  —n. 1 a sharp explosive noise. B sudden harshness or change in vocal pitch. 2 sharp blow. 3 a narrow opening; break or split. B chink. 4 colloq. Joke or malicious remark. 5 colloq. Attempt. 6 slang crystalline form of cocaine broken into small pieces. —v. 1 break without separating the parts. 2 make or cause to make a sharp explosive sound. 3 break with a sharp sound. 4 give way or cause to give way (under torture etc.). 5 (of the voice) change pitch sharply; break. 6 colloq. Find the solution to. 7 tell (a joke etc.). 8 colloq. Hit sharply. 9 (as cracked adj.) Crazy. 10 break (wheat) into coarse pieces. —attrib. Adj. Colloq. Excellent; first-rate (crack shot).  crack a bottle open a bottle, esp. Of wine, and drink it. Crack down on colloq. Take severe measures against. Crack of dawn daybreak. Crack up colloq. 1 collapse under strain. 2 praise. Get cracking colloq. Begin promptly and vigorously. [old english]

Eternal  adj. 1 existing always; without an end or (usu.) Beginning. 2 unchanging. 3 colloq. Constant; too frequent (eternal nagging).  eternally adv. [latin aeternus]

Multiracial  adj. Of several races.

Brusque  adj. Abrupt or offhand.  brusquely adv. Brusqueness n. [italian brusco sour]

Vindictive  adj. Vengeful.  vindictively adv. Vindictiveness n. [latin vindicta vengeance: related to *vindicate]

Sacerdotal  adj. Of priests or priestly office. [latin sacerdos -dot- priest]

Brittle  adj. Hard and fragile; apt to break.  brittlely adv. (also brittly). [old english]

Royalty  n. (pl. -ies) 1 royal office, dignity, or power; being royal. 2 a royal persons. B member of a royal family. 3 percentage of profit from a book, public performance, patent, etc. Paid to the author etc. 4 a royal right (now esp. Over minerals) granted by the sovereign. B payment made by a producer of minerals etc. To the owner of the site etc. [french: related to *royal]

Voluntary  —adj. 1 acting, done, or given willingly; not compulsory; intentional. 2 unpaid (voluntary work). 3 (of an institution) supported by charity. 4 (of a school) built by a charity but maintained by a local education authority. 5 brought about by voluntary action. 6 (of a movement, muscle, or limb) controlled by the will. —n. (pl. -ies) organ solo played before or after a church service.  voluntarily adv. Voluntariness n. [latin voluntas will]

Invisible  adj. Not visible to the eye.  invisibility n. Invisibly adv.

Chamomile  var. Of *camomile.

Biennial  —adj. Lasting, or recurring every, two years. —n. Plant that grows from seed one year and flowers and dies the following. [latin annus year]
