By with) achieve the same score or place as another competitor (tied with her for first place). 5 hold (rafters etc.) Together by a crosspiece etc. 6 mus. Unite (written notes) by a tie. —n. 1 cord or wire etc. Used for fastening. 2 strip of material worn round the collar and tied in a knot at the front. 3 thing that unites or restricts persons (family ties). 4 draw, dead heat, or equality of score among competitors. 5 match between any pair from a group of competing players or teams. 6 (also tie-beam etc.) Rod or beam holding parts of a structure together. 7 mus. Curved line above or below two notes of the same pitch indicating that they are to be played without a break between them.  tie in (foll. By with) bring into or have a close association or agreement. Tie up 1 bind securely with cord etc. 2 invest or reserve (capital etc.) So that it is not immediately available for use. 3 (often foll. By with) = tie in. 4 (usu. In passive) fully occupy (a person). 5 bring to a satisfactory conclusion. [old english]

Dynamometer  n. Instrument measuring energy expended. [greek: related to *dynamic]

Gibbous  adj. 1 convex. 2 (of a moon or planet) having the bright part greater than a semicircle and less than a circle. 3 humpbacked. [latin gibbus hump]

Probative  adj. Formal affording proof. [latin: related to *prove]

Backward  —adv. = *backwards. —adj. 1 towards the rear or starting-point (backward look). 2 reversed (backward roll). 3 slow to develop or progress. 4 hesitant, shy.

Horrify  v. (-ies, -ied) arouse horror in; shock.  horrifying adj.

Strumpet  n. Archaic or rhet. Prostitute. [origin unknown]

Embitter  v. Arouse bitter feelings in.  embitterment n.

Bicuspid  —adj. Having two cusps. —n. The premolar tooth in humans. [from *bi-, *cusp]

Unrealizable  adj. (also -isable) that cannot be realized.

Jazzy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of or like jazz. 2 vivid, showy.

Talkie  n. Colloq. (esp. Early) film with a soundtrack.

Thriftless  adj. Wasteful.

Budgerigar  n. Small parrot, often kept as a cage-bird. [aboriginal]

Orthography  n. (pl. -ies) spelling (esp. With reference to its correctness).  orthographic adj. [greek orthographia]

Backgammon  n. Board-game with pieces moved according to throws of the dice. [from *back + obsolete form of *game1]

Materially  adv. Substantially, significantly.

Ham  —n. 1 a upper part of a pig's leg salted and dried or smoked for food. B meat from this. 2 back of the thigh; thigh and buttock. 3 colloq. (often attrib.) Inexpert or unsubtle actor or piece of acting. 4 colloq. Operator of an amateur radio station. —v. (-mm-) (usu. In ham it up) colloq. Overact. [old english]

Streamer  n. 1 long narrow strip of ribbon or paper. 2 long narrow flag. 3 banner headline.

Yuk  var. Of *yuck.

Review  —n. 1 general survey or assessment of a subject or thing. 2 survey of the past. 3 revision or reconsideration (is under review). 4 display and formal inspection of troops etc. 5 published criticism of a book, play, etc. 6 periodical with critical articles on current events, the arts, etc. —v. 1 survey or look back on. 2 reconsider or revise. 3 hold a review of (troops etc.). 4 write a review of (a book, play, etc.).  reviewer n. [french revoir: related to *view]

Falsehood  n. 1 untrue thing. 2 a act of lying. B lie.

Calcify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 harden by the depositing of calcium salts. 2 convert or be converted to calcium carbonate.  calcification n.

Duckling  n. Young duck.

Endowment  n. 1 endowing. 2 endowed income. 3 (attrib.) Denoting forms of life insurance with payment of a fixed sum on a specified date, or on the death of the insured person if earlier.

Cuckold  —n. Husband of an adulteress. —v. Make a cuckold of.  cuckoldry n. [french]

Mil  n. One-thousandth of an inch, as a unit of measure for the diameter of wire etc. [latin mille thousand]

Discomfort  —n. 1 lack of comfort; slight pain or unease. 2 cause of this. —v. Make uncomfortable.

Usage  as a verb, discomfort is sometimes confused with discomfit.

Harmful  adj. Causing or likely to cause harm.  harmfully adv. Harmfulness n.

Cure  —v. (-ring) 1 (often foll. By of) restore to health; relieve (cured of pleurisy). 2 eliminate (disease, evil, etc.). 3 preserve (meat, fruit, etc.) By salting, drying, etc. 4 vulcanize (rubber); harden (plastic etc.). —n. 1 restoration to health. 2 thing effecting a cure. 3 course of treatment. 4 curacy. [latin cura care]

Intermarry  v. (-ies, -ied) (foll. By with) (of races, castes, families, etc.) Become connected by marriage.  intermarriage n.

Rightmost  adj. Furthest to the right.

Marry  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 take, join, or give in marriage. 2 a enter into marriage. B (foll. By into) become a member of (a family) by marriage. 3 a unite intimately, combine. B pair (socks etc.).  marry off find a spouse for. Marry up link, join. [latin maritus husband]

Victimize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 single out for punishment or discrimination. 2 make (a person etc.) A victim.  victimization n.

Abduct  v. Carry off or kidnap illegally.  abduction n. Abductor n. [latin duco lead]

Stairwell  n. Shaft for a staircase.

Unlabelled  adj. (us unlabeled) not labelled; without a label.

Trumpet  —n. 1 brass instrument with a flared bell and bright penetrating tone. 2 trumpet-shaped thing (ear-trumpet). 3 sound of or like a trumpet. —v. (-t-) 1 a blow a trumpet. B (of an enraged elephant etc.) Make a trumpet-like cry. 2 proclaim loudly.  trumpeter n. [french diminutive: related to *trump2]

Barn  n. Large farm building for storing grain etc. [old english, = barley house]

Kissogram  n. (also kissagram propr.) Novelty telegram or greeting delivered with a kiss.

Scirocco  var. Of *sirocco.

Safety  n. Being safe; freedom from danger or risk.

Grant  —v. 1 a consent to fulfil (a request etc.). B allow (a person) to have (a thing). 2 give formally; transfer legally. 3 (often foll. By that) admit as true; concede. —n. 1 process of granting. 2 sum of money given by the state. 3 legal conveyance by written instrument.  take for granted 1 assume something to be true or valid. 2 cease to appreciate through familiarity.  grantor n. (esp. In sense 2 of v.). [french gr(e)anter var. Of creanter from latin credo entrust]

Hummus  n. (also houmous) dip or appetizer made from ground chick-peas, sesame oil, lemon, and garlic. [turkish]

Century  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a 100 years. B any century reckoned from the birth of christ (twentieth century = 1901–2000; fifth century bc = 500–401 bc). 2 score etc. Of 100 esp. By one batsman in cricket. 3 company in the ancient roman army, orig. Of 100 men. [latin centuria: related to *cent]

Usage  strictly speaking, since the first century ran from the year 1 to 100, the first year of a given century should be that ending in 01. However, in popular use this has been moved back a year, and so the twenty-first century will commonly be regarded as running from 2000–2099.

Initiate  —v. (-ting) 1 begin; set going; originate. 2 a admit (a person) into a society, office, etc., esp. With a ritual. B instruct (a person) in a subject. —n. (esp. Newly) initiated person.  initiation n. Initiator n. Initiatory adj. [latin initium beginning]

Sanctify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 consecrate; treat as holy. 2 free from sin. 3 justify; sanction.  sanctification n. [latin sanctus holy]

Radar  n. 1 system for detecting the direction, range, or presence of objects, by sending out pulses of high frequency electromagnetic waves which they reflect. 2 apparatus for this. [from radio detection and ranging]

Prow  n. 1 fore-part or bow of a ship. 2 pointed or projecting front part. [french proue from greek proira]

Kelp  n. 1 large brown seaweed suitable for manure. 2 its calcined ashes, formerly a source of sodium, potassium, etc. [origin unknown]

Sampan  n. Small boat used in the far east. [chinese]

Lipid  n. Any of a group of fatlike substances that are insoluble in water but soluble in organic solvents, including fatty acids, oils, waxes, and steroids. [greek lipos fat]

Clown  —n. 1 comic entertainer, esp. In a circus. 2 foolish or playful person. —v. (often foll. By about, around) behave like a clown. [origin uncertain]

Monosyllable  n. Word of one syllable.  monosyllabic adj.

Norwegian  —n. 1 a native or national of norway. B person of norwegian descent. 2 language of norway. —adj. Of or relating to norway. [medieval latin norvegia from old norse, = northway]

Filament  n. 1 threadlike body or fibre. 2 conducting wire or thread in an electric bulb etc.  filamentous adj. [latin filum thread]

Lecherous  adj. Lustful, having excessive sexual desire.  lecherously adv.

Bo  abbr. Colloq. Body odour.

Foremast  n. Mast nearest the bow of a ship.

Riparian  adj. Of or on a river-bank (riparian rights). [latin ripa bank]

Renowned  adj. Famous, celebrated.

Tragic  adj. 1 disastrous; greatly distressing; very sad. 2 of tragedy.  tragically adv.

Goatherd  n. Person who tends goats.

Catlick  n. Colloq. Perfunctory wash.

Had  past and past part. Of *have.

Thyself  pron. Archaic emphat. & refl. Form of *thou1, *thee.

Opportune  adj. 1 well-chosen or especially favourable (opportune moment). 2 (of an action or event) well-timed. [latin opportunus (of the wind) driving towards the *port1]

Ringer  n. Bell-ringer.  be a ringer (or dead ringer) for slang resemble (a person) exactly.

Embassy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a residence or offices of an ambassador. B ambassador and staff. 2 deputation to a foreign government. [french: related to *ambassador]

Rpi  abbr. Retail price index.

Empower  v. Give authority to.

Limestone  n.  Rock composed mainly of calcium carbonate.

Money  n. 1 coins and banknotes as a medium of exchange. 2 (pl. -eys or -ies) (in pl.) Sums of money. 3 a wealth. B wealth as power (money talks). C rich person or family (married into money).  for my money in my opinion; for my preference. In the money colloq. Having or winning a lot of money. Money for jam (or old rope) colloq. Profit for little or no trouble. [latin moneta]

Rinse  —v. (-sing) (often foll. By through, out) 1 wash or treat with clean water etc. 2 wash lightly. 3 put (clothes etc.) Through clean water after washing. 4 (foll. By out, away) clear (impurities) by rinsing. —n. 1 rinsing (give it a rinse). 2 temporary hair tint (blue rinse). [french rincer]

Ent  abbr. Ear, nose, and throat.

Undefended  adj. Not defended.

Polaroid  n. Propr. 1 material in thin sheets polarizing light passing through it. 2 camera with internal processing that produces a print rapidly after each exposure. 3 (in pl.) Sunglasses with polaroid lenses.

Unequivocal  adj. Not ambiguous, plain, unmistakable.  unequivocally adv.

Morphia  n. (in general use) = *morphine.

Retrain  v. Train again or further, esp. For new work.

Scald  —v. 1 burn (the skin etc.) With hot liquid or steam. 2 heat (esp. Milk) to near boiling point. 3 (usu. Foll. By out) clean with boiling water. —n. Burn etc. Caused by scalding. [latin excaldo from calidus hot]

Bury  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 place (a corpse) in the earth, a tomb, or the sea. 2 lose by death (buried two sons). 3 a put or hide under ground. B cover up; conceal. 4 consign to obscurity; forget. 5 (refl. Or passive) involve deeply (buried in a book).  bury the hatchet cease to quarrel. [old english]

Strong  —adj. (stronger; strongest) 1 able to resist; not easily damaged, overcome, or disturbed. 2 healthy. 3 capable of exerting great force or of doing much; muscular, powerful. 4 forceful in effect (strong wind). 5 firmly held (strong suspicion). 6 (of an argument etc.) Convincing. 7 intense (strong light). 8 formidable (strong candidate). 9 (of a solution or drink etc.) Not very diluted. 10 of a specified number (200 strong). 11 gram. (of a verb) forming inflections by a change of vowel within the stem (e.g. Swim, swam). —adv. Strongly.  come on strong behave aggressively. Going strong colloq. Continuing vigorously; in good health etc.  strongish adj. Strongly adv. [old english]

Ennui  n. Mental weariness from idleness or lack of interest; boredom. [french: related to *annoy]

Inadequate  adj. 1 not adequate; insufficient. 2 (of a person) incompetent; weak.  inadequacy n. (pl. -ies). Inadequately adv.

Oscillo-  comb. Form oscillation, esp. Of an electric current.

Chi  n. Twenty-second letter of the greek alphabet (c, c). [greek]

Hydrangea  n. Shrub with globular clusters of white, pink, or blue flowers. [greek hudor water, aggos vessel]

Haversack  n. Stout canvas bag carried on the back or over the shoulder. [german habersack, = oats-sack]

Lopsided  adj. Unevenly balanced.  lopsidedness n. [related to *lob]

Bridal  adj. Of a bride or wedding. [old english]

-ive  suffix forming adjectives meaning ‘tending to’, and corresponding nouns (suggestive; corrosive; palliative). [latin -ivus]

Literary  adj. 1 of or concerned with books or literature etc. 2 (of a word or idiom) used chiefly by writers; formal.  literariness n. [latin: related to *letter]

Armpit  n. Hollow under the arm at the shoulder.

Interdenominational  adj. Concerning more than one (religious) denomination.

Satellite  —n. 1 celestial or artificial body orbiting the earth or another planet. 2 (in full satellite state) small country controlled by another. —attrib. Adj. Transmitted by satellite (satellite television). [latin satelles -lit- attendant]

Koran  n. Islamic sacred book. [arabic, = recitation]

Wage   —n. (in sing. Or pl.) Fixed regular payment to an employee, esp. A manual worker. —v. (-ging) carry on (a war etc.). [anglo-french from germanic]

Michaelmas  n. Feast of st michael, 29 september. [related to *mass2]

Catalytic  adj. Of or involving catalysis.

Electroplate  —v. (-ting) coat with a thin layer of chromium, silver, etc., by electrolysis. —n. Electroplated articles.

Subside  v. (-ding) 1 become tranquil; abate (excitement subsided). 2 (of water etc.) Sink. 3 (of the ground) cave in; sink.  subsidence n. [latin subsido]

Concentric  adj. Having a common centre.  concentrically adv. [french or medieval latin: related to *centre]

Af  abbr. Audio frequency.

Recessional  —adj. Sung while the clergy and choir withdraw after a service. —n. Recessional hymn.

Cantor  n. 1 church choir leader. 2 precentor in a synagogue. [latin, = singer]

Actuate  v. (-ting) 1 cause (a machine etc.) To move or function. 2 cause (a person) to act. [latin]

Diviner  n. Person who practises divination.

Sassy  adj. (-ier, -iest) esp. Us colloq. Impudent, cheeky. [var. Of *saucy]

Bd  abbr. Bachelor of divinity.

Headway  n. 1 progress. 2 ship's rate of progress. 3 headroom.

Monopoly  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a exclusive possession or control of the trade in a commodity or service. B this conferred as a privilege by the state. 2 (foll. By of, us on) exclusive possession, control, or exercise. [greek poleo sell]

Ghq  abbr. General headquarters.

Phylum  n. (pl. Phyla) biol. Taxonomic rank below a kingdom, comprising a class or classes and subordinate taxa. [greek phulon race]

Captain  —n. 1 a chief, leader. B leader of a team. 2 a commander of a ship. B pilot of a civil aircraft. 3 army officer next above lieutenant. —v. Be captain of; lead.  captaincy n. (pl. -ies). [latin caput head]

Sepoy  n. Hist. Native indian soldier under european, esp. British, discipline. [persian sipahi soldier]

Sentient  adj. Capable of perception and feeling.  sentience n. Sentiency n. Sentiently adv. [latin sentio feel]

Quirk  n. 1 peculiar feature, peculiarity. 2 trick of fate.  quirky adj. (-ier, -iest). [origin unknown]

Onward  —adv. (also onwards) 1 forward, advancing. 2 into the future (from 1985 onwards). —adj. Forward, advancing.

Uniform  —adj. 1 unvarying (uniform appearance). 2 conforming to the same standard, rules, etc. 3 constant over a period (uniform acceleration). —n. Distinctive clothing worn by soldiers, police, schoolchildren, etc.  uniformed adj. Uniformity n. Uniformly adv. [latin: related to *form]

Faith  n. 1 complete trust or confidence. 2 firm, esp. Religious, belief. 3 religion or creed (christian faith). 4 loyalty, trustworthiness. [latin fides]

Undreamed  adj. (also undreamt) (often foll. By of) not dreamed, thought, or imagined.

Landfill  n. 1 waste material etc. Used to landscape or reclaim land. 2 process of disposing of rubbish in this way.

Leisurely  —adj. Unhurried, relaxed. —adv. Without hurry.  leisureliness n.

Moat  n. Defensive ditch round a castle etc., usu. Filled with water. [french mote mound]

Thrips  n. (pl. Same) an insect harmful to plants. [greek, = woodworm]

Heartbeat  n. Pulsation of the heart.

Forward  —adj. 1 onward; towards the front. 2 lying in the direction in which one is moving. 3 precocious; bold; presumptuous. 4 relating to the future (forward contract). 5 a approaching maturity or completion. B (of a plant etc.) Early. —n. Attacking player near the front in football, hockey, etc. —adv. 1 to the front; into prominence (come forward; move forward). 2 in advance; ahead (sent them forward). 3 onward so as to make progress (no further forward). 4 towards the future (from this time forward). 5 (also forwards) a towards the front in the direction one is facing. B in the normal direction of motion. C with continuous forward motion (rushing forward). —v. 1 a send (a letter etc.) On to a further destination. B dispatch (goods etc.). 2 help to advance; promote. [old english: related to *forth, *-ward]

Plea  n. 1 appeal, entreaty. 2 law formal statement by or on behalf of a defendant. 3 excuse. [latin placitum decree: related to *please]

Fraught  adj. 1 (foll. By with) filled or charged with (danger etc.). 2 colloq. Distressing; tense. [dutch vracht *freight]

Chisel  —n. Hand tool with a squared bevelled blade for shaping wood, stone, or metal. —v. 1 (-ll-; us -l-) cut or shape with a chisel. 2 (as chiselled adj.) (of facial features) clear-cut, fine. 3 slang cheat. [latin caedo cut]

Honor  (brit. Honour) —n. 1 high respect, public regard. 2 adherence to what is right or an accepted standard of conduct. 3 nobleness of mind, magnanimity (honour among thieves). 4 thing conferred as a distinction, esp. An official award for bravery or achievement. 5 privilege, special right (had the honour of being invited). 6 a exalted position. B (honour) (prec. By your, his, etc.) Title of a circuit judge etc. 7 (foll. By to) person or thing that brings honour (an honour to her profession). 8 a chastity (of a woman). B reputation for this. 9 (in pl.) Specialized degree course or special distinction in an examination. 10 (in card-games) the four or five highest-ranking cards. 11 golf the right of driving off first. —v. 1 respect highly.

Duet  n. Musical composition for two performers.  duettist n. [latin duo two]

Prettify  v. (-ies, -ied) make pretty, esp. In an affected way.

Burp  colloq. —v. 1 belch. 2 make (a baby) belch. —n. Belch. [imitative]

Advisable  adj. To be recommended, expedient.  advisability n.

Merchant  n. 1 wholesale trader, esp. With foreign countries. 2 esp. Us & scot. Retail trader. 3 colloq. Usu. Derog. Person devoted to a specified activity etc. (speed merchant). [latin mercor trade (v.)]

Complex  —n. 1 building, series of rooms, etc., made up of related parts (shopping complex). 2 psychol. Group of usu. Repressed feelings or thoughts which cause abnormal behaviour or mental states. 3 preoccupation; feeling of inadequacy. —adj. 1 complicated. 2 consisting of related parts; composite.  complexity n. (pl. -ies). [latin complexus]

Genteel  adj. 1 affectedly refined or stylish. 2 upper-class.  genteelly adv. [french gentil: related to *gentle]

Disrepair  n. Poor condition due to lack of repairs.

Resolve  —v. (-ving) 1 make up one's mind; decide firmly (resolved to leave, on leaving). 2 cause (a person) to do this (events resolved him to leave). 3 solve, explain, or settle (a doubt, argument, etc.). 4 (foll. By that) (of an assembly or meeting) pass a resolution by vote. 5 (often foll. By into) (cause to) separate into constituent parts; analyse. 6 (foll. By into) reduce by mental analysis into. 7 mus. Convert or be converted into concord. —n. Firm mental decision or intention; determination. [latin: related to *solve]

Bosun  (also bo'sun) var. Of *boatswain.

Complacent  adj. Smugly self-satisfied or contented.  complacence n. Complacency n. Complacently adv. [latin placeo please]

Usage  complacent is often confused with complaisant.

Cockerel  n. Young cock. [diminutive of *cock1]

Dickhead  n. Coarse slang idiot. [from *dick1]

Corollary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 proposition that follows from one already proved. 2 (often foll. By of) natural consequence. [latin, = gratuity: related to *corolla]

Am  abbr. Amplitude modulation.

Warfare  n. Waging war, campaigning.

Pomegranate  n. 1 tropical fruit with a tough rind, reddish pulp, and many seeds. 2 tree bearing this. [french pome grenate from romanic, = many-seeded apple]

Negligible  adj. Not worth considering; insignificant.  negligibly adv. [french: related to *neglect]

Proselyte  n. 1 person converted, esp. Recently, from one opinion, creed, party, etc., to another. 2 convert to judaism.  proselytism n. [latin proselytus from greek]

Imperceptible  adj. 1 not perceptible. 2 very slight, gradual, or subtle.  imperceptibility n. Imperceptibly adv.

Claptrap  n. Insincere or pretentious talk, nonsense.

Bakelite  n. Propr. Plastic made from formaldehyde and phenol, used formerly for buttons, plates, etc. [german from baekeland, name of its inventor]

Centrifuge  n. Rapidly rotating machine designed to separate liquids from solids etc.

Hrh  abbr. Her or his royal highness.

Ornament  —n. 1 a thing used to adorn or decorate. B quality or person bringing honour or distinction. 2 decoration, esp. On a building (tower rich in ornament). 3 musical embellishment. —v. Adorn; beautify.  ornamental adj. Ornamentation n. [latin orno adorn]

Leftism  n. Socialist political principles.  leftist n. & adj.

Extreme  —adj. 1 of a high, or the highest, degree (extreme danger). 2 severe (extreme measures). 3 outermost. 4 on the far left or right of a political party. 5 utmost; last. —n. 1 (often in pl.) Either of two things as remote or as different as possible. 2 thing at either end. 3 highest degree. 4 math. First or last term of a ratio or series.  go to extremes take an extreme course of action. In the extreme to an extreme degree.  extremely adv. [french from latin]

Ambassador  n. 1 diplomat sent to live abroad to represent his or her country's interests. 2 promoter (ambassador of peace).  ambassadorial adj. [latin ambactus servant]

Streaky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 full of streaks. 2 (of bacon) with streaks of fat.

Illegitimate  adj. 1 born of parents not married to each other. 2 unlawful. 3 improper. 4 wrongly inferred.  illegitimacy n. Illegitimately adv.

Meddlesome  adj. Interfering.

Dandy  —n. (pl. -ies) 1 man greatly devoted to style and fashion. 2 colloq. Excellent thing. —adj. (-ier, -iest) esp. Us colloq. Splendid. [perhaps from the name andrew]

Indubitable  adj. That cannot be doubted.  indubitably adv. [latin dubito doubt]

Cnd  abbr. Campaign for nuclear disarmament.

Grandma  n. Colloq. Grandmother.

Boyo  n. (pl. -s) welsh & ir. Colloq. (esp. As a form of address) boy, mate.

Enable  v. (-ling) 1 (foll. By to + infin.) Give (a person etc.) The means or authority. 2 make possible. 3 esp. Computing make (a device) operational; switch on.

Ultramontane  —adj. 1 situated beyond the alps. 2 advocating supreme papal authority. —n. 1 person living beyond the alps. 2 advocate of supreme papal authority. [medieval latin: related to *mountain]

Burk  var. Of *berk.

Sweeper  n. 1 person who cleans by sweeping. 2 manual device for sweeping carpets etc. 3 football defensive player positioned close to the goalkeeper.

Header  n. 1 football shot or pass made with the head. 2 colloq. Headlong fall or dive. 3 brick etc. Laid at right angles to the face of a wall. 4 (in full header-tank) tank of water etc. Maintaining pressure in a plumbing system.

Aquaplane  —n. Board for riding on water, pulled by a speedboat. —v. (-ning) 1 ride on this. 2 (of a vehicle) glide uncontrollably on a wet surface. [latin aqua water, *plane1]

Acquire  v. (-ring) gain for oneself; come into possession of. [latin: related to *ad-, quaero quisit- seek]

Rename  v. (-ming) name again; give a new name to.

Rainstorm  n. Storm with heavy rain.

Tensile  adj. 1 of tension. 2 capable of being stretched.  tensility n. [medieval latin: related to *tense1]

Velodrome  n. Place or building with a track for cycle-racing. [french vélo bicycle]

Stinger  n. Stinging animal or thing, esp. A sharp blow.

Teethe  v. (-thing) grow or cut teeth, esp. Milk teeth.

Unsavoury  adj. (us unsavory) 1 disgusting, unpleasant. 2 morally offensive.

Headscarf  n. Scarf worn round the head and tied under the chin.

Equerry  n. (pl. -ies) officer attending the british royal family. [french esquierie stable]

Demerara  n. Light-brown cane sugar. [demerara in guyana]

Clerihew  n. Short comic biographical verse in two rhyming couplets. [e. Clerihew bentley, name of its inventor]

Seine  —n. Fishing-net with floats at the top and weights at the bottom edge. —v. (-ning) fish or catch with a seine. [old english segne]

Subterfuge  n. 1 attempt to avoid blame or defeat esp. By lying or deceit. 2 statement etc. Used for such a purpose. [latin]

Copeck  n. (also kopek, kopeck) russian coin worth one-hundredth of a rouble. [russian kopeika]

Brood  —n. 1 young of esp. A bird born or hatched at one time. 2 colloq. Children in a family. —v. 1 worry or ponder (esp. Resentfully). 2 (of a bird) sit on eggs to hatch them. [old english]

Inquisition  n. 1 intensive search or investigation. 2 judicial or official inquiry. 3 (the inquisition) rc ch. Hist. Ecclesiastical tribunal for the violent suppression of heresy, esp. In spain.  inquisitional adj. [latin: related to *inquire]

Battered  adj. Coated in batter and deep-fried.

Plug  —n. 1 piece of solid material fitting tightly into a hole, used to fill a gap or cavity or act as a wedge or stopper. 2 a device of metal pins in an insulated casing, fitting into holes in a socket for making an electrical connection. B colloq. Electric socket. 3 = *spark-plug. 4 colloq. Piece of free publicity for an idea, product, etc. 5 cake or stick of tobacco; piece of this for chewing. —v. (-gg-) 1 (often foll. By up) stop (a hole etc.) With a plug. 2 slang shoot or hit (a person etc.). 3 colloq. Seek to popularize (an idea, product, etc.) By constant recommendation. 4 colloq. (foll. By away (at)) work steadily (at).  plug in connect electrically by inserting a plug into a socket. [low german or dutch]

Suppository  n. (pl. -ies) medical preparation melting in the rectum or vagina. [latin suppositorius placed underneath]

Flapdoodle  n. Colloq. Nonsense. [origin unknown]

Inextinguishable  adj. That cannot be extinguished or destroyed.

Rabbit  —n. 1 a burrowing plant-eating mammal of the hare family. B us hare. 2 its fur. —v. (-t-) 1 hunt rabbits. 2 (often foll. By on, away) colloq. Talk pointlessly; chatter. [origin uncertain]

Serous  adj. 1 of or like serum; watery. 2 (of a gland or membrane) having a serous secretion.  serosity n. [related to *serum]

Electronic  adj. 1 a produced by or involving the flow of electrons. B of electrons or electronics. 2 (of music) produced by electronic means and usu. Recorded on tape.  electronically adv.

Residential  adj. 1 suitable for or occupied by dwellings (residential area). 2 used as a residence (residential hotel). 3 based on or connected with residence (residential course).

Piggish  adj. Greedy; dirty; mean.

Coarse  adj. 1 rough or loose in texture; made of large particles. 2 lacking refinement; crude, obscene.  coarsely adv. Coarseness n. [origin unknown]

Granadilla  n. Passion-fruit. [spanish, diminutive of granada pomegranate]

Apparition  n. Remarkable or unexpected thing that appears; ghost or phantom.

Adjutant  n. 1 a army officer assisting a superior in administrative duties. B assistant. 2 (in full adjutant bird) giant indian stork. [latin: related to *ad-, juvo jut- help]

Instrumental  adj. 1 serving as an instrument or means. 2 (of music) performed on instruments. 3 of, or arising from, an instrument (instrumental error).

Gaucherie  n. Gauche manners or act. [french: related to *gauche]

Burst  —v. (past and past part. Burst) 1 (cause to) break violently apart; open forcibly from within. 2 a (usu. Foll. By in, out) make one's way suddenly or by force. B break away from or through (river burst its banks). 3 be full to overflowing. 4 appear or come suddenly (burst into flame). 5 (foll. By into) suddenly begin to shed (tears) or utter. 6 seem about to burst from effort, excitement, etc. —n. 1 act of bursting. 2 sudden issue or outbreak (burst of flame; burst of applause). 3 sudden effort, spurt.  burst out 1 suddenly begin (burst out laughing). 2 exclaim. [old english]

Clarity  n. Clearness.

Soprano  n. (pl. -s) 1 a highest singing-voice. B female or boy singer with this voice. 2 instrument of a high or the highest pitch in its family. [italian sopra above]

Gotten  us past part. Of *get.

Surmount  v. 1 overcome (a difficulty or obstacle). 2 (usu. In passive) cap or crown.  surmountable adj. [french: related to *sur-1]

Proposal  n. 1 a act of proposing something. B course of action etc. Proposed. 2 offer of marriage.

Impound  v. 1 confiscate. 2 take legal possession of. 3 shut up (animals) in a pound.

Fixation  n. 1 state of being fixated. 2 obsession, monomania. 3 coagulation. 4 process of assimilating a gas to form a solid compound.

Strive  v. (-ving; past strove; past part. Striven) 1 try hard (strive to succeed). 2 (often foll. By with, against) struggle. [french estriver]

-ette  suffix forming nouns meaning: 1 small (kitchenette). 2 imitation or substitute (flannelette). 3 female (usherette). [french]

Chicory  n. (pl. -ies) 1 plant with leaves used in salads. 2 its root, roasted and ground and used with or instead of coffee. 3 esp. Us = *endive. [greek kikhorion]

Unremunerative  adj. Not, or not very, profitable.

Jiggered  adj. Colloq. (as a mild oath) confounded (i'll be jiggered). [euphemism]

Manufacture  —n. 1 making of articles, esp. In a factory etc. 2 branch of industry (woollen manufacture). —v. (-ring) 1 make (articles), esp. On an industrial scale. 2 invent or fabricate (evidence, a story, etc.).  manufacturer n. [latin manufactum made by hand]

Poseur  n. Person who behaves affectedly. [french poser *pose]

Echoic  adj. (of a word) onomatopoeic.

Exercise  —n. 1 activity requiring physical effort, done to sustain or improve health. 2 mental or spiritual activity, esp. As practice to develop a faculty. 3 task devised as exercise. 4 a use or application of a mental faculty, right, etc. B practice of an ability, quality, etc. 5 (often in pl.) Military drill or manoeuvres. —v. (-sing) 1 use or apply (a faculty, right, etc.). 2 perform (a function). 3 a take (esp. Physical) exercise. B provide (an animal) with exercise. 4 a tax the powers of. B perplex, worry. [latin exerceo keep busy]

Barbel  n. 1 freshwater fish with barbs. 2 = *barb n. 3. [latin: related to *barb]

Autobiography  n. (pl. -ies) 1 written account of one's own life. 2 this as a literary genre.  autobiographer n. Autobiographical adj.

Sherbet  n. 1 flavoured sweet effervescent powder or drink. 2 drink of sweet diluted fruit juices. [turkish and persian from arabic]

-ence  suffix forming nouns expressing: 1 a quality or state or an instance of this (patience; an impertinence). 2 an action (reference). [french -ence, latin -erie]

Vegetable  —n. 1 plant, esp. A herbaceous plant used for food, e.g. A cabbage, potato, or bean. 2 colloq. Derog. A offens. Person who is severely mentally incapacitated, esp. Through brain injury etc. B dull or inactive person. —adj. Of, derived from, or relating to plant life or vegetables as food. [latin: related to *vegetate]

Osteoarthritis  n. Degenerative disease of joint cartilage.  osteoarthritic adj.

Loess  n. Deposit of fine wind-blown soil, esp. In the basins of large rivers. [swiss german, = loose]

Victim  n. 1 person or thing injured or destroyed (road victim; victim of greed). 2 prey; dupe (fell victim to his charm). 3 creature sacrificed to a deity or in a religious rite. [latin]

Canna  n. Tropical plant with bright flowers and ornamental leaves. [latin: related to *cane]

Warble  —v. (-ling) 1 sing in a gentle trilling manner. 2 speak in a warbling manner. —n. Warbled song or utterance. [french werble(r)]

Pompous  n. Self-important, affectedly grand or solemn.  pomposity n. (pl. -ies). Pompously adv. Pompousness n. [latin: related to *pomp]

Blush  —v. 1 a become pink in the face from embarrassment or shame. B (of the face) redden thus. 2 feel embarrassed or ashamed. 3 redden. —n. 1 act of blushing. 2 pink tinge. [old english]

Sweetheart  n. 1 lover or darling. 2 term of endearment.

Mama  n. (also mamma) archaic mother. [imitative of child's ma, ma]

Dane  n. 1 native or national of denmark. 2 hist. Viking invader of england in the 9th–11th c. [old norse]

Earmark  —v. Set aside for a special purpose. —n. Identifying mark.

Centigram  n. (also centigramme) metric unit of mass, equal to 0.01 gram.

Thumb  —n. 1 short thick finger on the human hand, set apart from the other four. 2 part of a glove etc. For a thumb. —v. 1 wear or soil (pages etc.) With a thumb. 2 turn over pages with or as with a thumb (thumbed through the directory). 3 request or get (a lift) by signalling with a raised thumb. 4 use the thumb in a gesture.  thumb one's nose = cock a snook (see *snook). Thumbs down indication of rejection. Thumbs up indication of satisfaction or approval. Under a person's thumb completely dominated by a person. [old english]

Equipoise  n. 1 equilibrium. 2 counterbalancing thing.

Yew  n. 1 dark-leaved evergreen tree bearing berry-like cones. 2 its wood. [old english]

Autocross  n. Motor racing across country or on unmade roads.

Community  n. (pl. -ies) 1 body of people living in one place, district, or country. 2 body of people having religion, ethnic origin, profession, etc., in common. 3 fellowship (community of interest). 4 commune. 5 joint ownership or liability. [latin: related to *common]

Usage  the community charge, or poll tax, replaced household rates in 1989-90 and is itself to be replaced by a council tax in 1993.

Calm  —adj. 1 tranquil, quiet, windless. 2 serene; not agitated. —n. Calm condition or period. —v. (often foll. By down) make or become calm.  calmly adv. Calmness n. [greek kauma heat]

Dame  n. 1 (dame) a title given to a woman holding any of several orders of chivalry. B woman holding this title. 2 comic middle-aged female pantomime character, usu. Played by a man. 3 us slang woman. [latin domina lady]

Dingbat  n. Slang us & austral. Stupid or eccentric person. [perhaps from ding to beat + *bat1]

Babe  n. 1 literary baby. 2 innocent or helpless person. 3 us slang young woman. [as *baby]

Endow  v. 1 bequeath or give a permanent income to (a person, institution, etc.). 2 (esp. As endowed adj.) Provide with talent, ability, etc. [anglo-french: related to *dower]

Separation  n. 1 separating or being separated. 2 (in full judicial or legal separation) legal arrangement by which a couple remain married but live apart. [latin: related to *separate]

Howl  —n. 1 long loud doleful cry of a dog etc. 2 prolonged wailing noise. 3 loud cry of pain, rage, derision, or laughter. —v. 1 make a howl. 2 weep loudly. 3 utter with a howl.  howl down prevent (a speaker) from being heard by howls of derision. [imitative]

Fratricide  n. 1 killing of one's brother or sister. 2 person who does this.  fratricidal adj. [latin frater brother]

Clad  adj. 1 clothed. 2 provided with cladding. [past part. Of *clothe]

Theatre  n. (us theater) 1 building or outdoor area for dramatic performances. 2 writing and production of plays. 3 room or hall for lectures etc. With seats in tiers. 4 operating theatre. 5 a scene or field of action (the theatre of war). B (attrib.) Designating weapons intermediate between tactical and strategic. [greek theatron]

Tuppenny  adj. = *twopenny. [phonetic spelling]

Colossal  adj. 1 huge. 2 colloq. Splendid.  colossally adv. [related to *colossus]

Tacit  adj. Understood or implied without being stated (tacit consent).  tacitly adv. [latin taceo be silent]

Mafioso  n. (pl. Mafiosi) member of the mafia. [italian: related to *mafia]

Rnli  abbr. Royal national lifeboat institution.

Eventide  n. Archaic or poet. = *evening. [related to *even2]

Encumbrance  n. 1 burden. 2 impediment.

Gait  n. Manner of walking or forward motion. [old norse]

Flexible  adj. 1 capable of bending without breaking; pliable. 2 manageable. 3 adaptable; variable (works flexible hours).  flexibility n. Flexibly adv. [latin flexibilis: related to *flex1]

Heartless  adj. Unfeeling, pitiless.  heartlessly adv.

Starch  —n. 1 polysaccharide obtained chiefly from cereals and potatoes. 2 preparation of this for stiffening fabric. 3 stiffness of manner; formality. —v. Stiffen (clothing) with starch. [old english: related to *stark]

Minibus  n. Small bus for about twelve passengers.

Soapbox  n. Makeshift stand for a speaker in the street etc.

Corroborate  v. (-ting) confirm or give support to (a statement or belief etc.).  corroboration n. Corroborative adj. Corroborator n. [latin robur strength]

Scalene  adj. (esp. Of a triangle) having unequal sides. [greek skalenos unequal]

Kiloliter  n. (brit. -litre) 1,000 litres (220 imperial gallons).

Carob  n. Seed pod of a mediterranean tree used as a chocolate substitute. [arabic karruba]

Mature  —adj. (maturer, maturest) 1 a fully developed, adult. B sensible, wise. 2 ripe; seasoned. 3 (of thought etc.) Careful, considered. 4 (of a bill, insurance policy, etc.) Due, payable. —v. (-ring) 1 develop fully; ripen. 2 perfect (a plan etc.). 3 (of a bill, insurance policy, etc.) Become due or payable.  maturely adv. Matureness n. Maturity n. [latin maturus timely]

Maturation  n. 1 maturing or being matured. 2 formation of pus. [french or medieval latin: related to *mature]

Also  adv. In addition, besides. [old english: related to *all, *so1]

Spare  —adj. 1 a not required for normal or immediate use; extra. B for emergency or occasional use. 2 lean; thin. 3 frugal. —n. Spare part. —v. (-ring) 1 afford to give, do without; dispense with (spared me ten minutes). 2 a refrain from killing, hurting, etc. B abstain from inflicting (spare me this task). 3 be frugal or grudging of (no expense spared).  go spare colloq. Become very angry or distraught. Not spare oneself exert one's utmost efforts. Spare a person's life not kill him or her. To spare left over; additional (an hour to spare).  sparely adv. Spareness n. [old english]

Soppy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Mawkishly sentimental; silly; infatuated.  soppily adv. Soppiness n. [from *sop]

Fearsome  adj. Frightening.  fearsomely adv.

Gasworks  n. Place where gas is manufactured for lighting and heating.

Underlie  v. (-lying; past -lay; past part. -lain) 1 (also absol.) Lie under (a stratum etc.). 2 (also absol.) (esp. As underlying adj.) Be the basis of (a doctrine, conduct, etc.). 3 exist beneath the superficial aspect of.

Pakistani  —n. (pl. -s) 1 native or national of pakistan. 2 person of pakistani descent. —adj. Of pakistan.

Ambidextrous  adj. Able to use either hand equally well. [latin ambi- on both sides, *dexter]

Disproof  n. Refutation.

Brush  —n. 1 implement with bristles, hair, wire, etc. Set into a block, for cleaning, painting, arranging the hair, etc. 2 act of brushing. 3 (usu. Foll. By with) short esp. Unpleasant encounter. 4 fox's bushy tail. 5 piece of carbon or metal as an electrical contact esp. With a moving part. 6 = *brushwood 2. —v. 1 sweep, scrub, treat, or tidy with a brush. 2 remove or apply with a brush. 3 graze in passing.  brush aside dismiss curtly or lightly. Brush off dismiss abruptly. Brush up 1 clean up or smarten. 2 revise (a subject). [french]

Taurus  n. (pl. -es) 1 constellation and second sign of the zodiac (the bull). 2 person born when the sun is in this sign.  taurean adj. & n. [latin, = bull]

Steamer  n. 1 steamship. 2 vessel for steaming food in.

Dd  abbr. Doctor of divinity.

Pms  abbr. Premenstrual syndrome.

Pummel  v. (-ll-; us -l-) strike repeatedly, esp. With the fists. [from *pommel]

Panda  n. 1 (also giant panda) large bearlike black and white mammal native to china and tibet. 2 (also red panda) reddish-brown himalayan racoon-like mammal. [nepali]

Phloem  n. Tissue conducting sap in plants. [greek phloos bark]

Ungrammatical  adj. Contrary to the rules of grammar.  ungrammatically adv.

Snuffbox  n. Small box for holding snuff.

Procedure  n. 1 way of acting or advancing, esp. In business or legal action. 2 way of performing a task. 3 series of actions conducted in a certain order or manner.  procedural adj. [french: related to *proceed]

Tangle  —v. (-ling) 1 intertwine (threads or hairs etc.) Or become entwined in a confused mass; entangle. 2 (foll. By with) colloq. Become involved (esp. In conflict) with (don't tangle with me). 3 complicate (tangled affair). —n. 1 confused mass of intertwined threads etc. 2 confused state. [origin uncertain]

Digraph  n. Two letters representing one sound, e.g. Ph, ey as in phone, key. [from *di-1, *-graph]

Usage  digraph is sometimes confused with ligature, which means two or more letters joined together.

Pleurisy  n. Inflammation of the pleura.  pleuritic adj. [greek: related to *pleura]

Demonism  n. Belief in demons.

Masturbate  v. (-ting) (usu. Absol.) Sexually arouse (oneself or another) by manual stimulation of the genitals.  masturbation n. [latin]

Gangway  n. 1 passage, esp. Between rows of seats. 2 a opening in a ship's bulwarks. B bridge from ship to shore.

Tramlines  n.pl. 1 rails for a tramcar. 2 colloq.  Pair of long parallel lines at the sides of a tennis or badminton court.

Unplaced  adj. Not placed, esp. Not one of the first three in a race etc.

Hypothyroidism  n. Subnormal activity of the thyroid gland, resulting in cretinism.  hypothyroid n. & adj.

Rattle  —v. (-ling) 1 a give out a rapid succession of short sharp hard sounds. B cause to do this. C cause such sounds by shaking something. 2 (often foll. By along) a move with a rattling noise. B move or travel briskly. 3 a (usu. Foll. By off) say or recite rapidly. B (usu. Foll. By on) talk in a lively thoughtless way. 4 colloq. Disconcert, alarm. —n. 1 rattling sound. 2 device or plaything made to rattle.  rattly adj. [probably low german or dutch]

Catgut  n. Material used for the strings of musical instruments and surgical sutures, made of intestines of the sheep, horse, etc. (but not cat).

Monotone  —n. 1 sound or utterance continuing or repeated on one note without change of pitch. 2 sameness of style in writing. —adj. Without change of pitch.

Svelte  adj. Slender, lissom, graceful. [french from italian]

Chore  n. Tedious or routine task, esp. Domestic. [from *char2]

Boffin  n. Colloq. Research scientist. [origin unknown]

Pigeon  n. Bird of the dove family. [latin pipio -onis]

Mocker  n. Person who mocks.  put the mockers on slang 1 bring bad luck to. 2 put a stop to.

Cynic  n. 1 person with a pessimistic view of human nature. 2 (cynic) one of a school of ancient greek philosophers showing contempt for ease and pleasure.  cynical adj. Cynically adv. Cynicism n. [greek kuon dog]

Cowhide  n. 1 cow's hide. 2 leather or whip made from this.

Plushy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Stylish, luxurious.  plushiness n.

Infelicity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 inapt expression etc. 2 unhappiness.  infelicitous adj.

Bacchanalia  n.pl. 1 roman festival of bacchus. 2 (bacchanalia) drunken revelry.

Printout  n. Computer output in printed form.

Galactic  adj. Of a galaxy or galaxies.

Counteract  v. Hinder or neutralize by contrary action.  counteraction n. Counteractive adj.

Centralism  n. System that centralizes (esp. Administration).  centralist n.

Shoe  —n. 1 protective foot-covering of leather etc., esp. One not reaching above the ankle. 2 protective metal rim for a horse's hoof. 3 thing like a shoe in shape or use. 4 = *brake shoe. —v. (shoes, shoeing; past and past part. Shod) 1 fit (esp. A horse etc.) With a shoe or shoes. 2 (as shod adj.) (in comb.) Having shoes etc. Of a specified kind (roughshod).  be in a person's shoes be in his or her situation, difficulty, etc. [old english]

Smooch  colloq. —n. 1  period of slow close dancing. 2 period of kissing and caressing. —v. Engage in a smooch.  smoochy adj. [imitative]

Lubber  n. Clumsy fellow, lout. [origin uncertain]

Staircase  n. Flight of stairs and the supporting structure.

Gannet  n. 1 large diving sea bird. 2 slang greedy person. [old english]

Tl  symb. Thallium.

Incisor  n. Cutting-tooth, esp. At the front of the mouth.

Myth  n. 1 traditional story usu. Involving supernatural or imaginary persons and embodying popular ideas on natural or social phenomena etc. 2 such narratives collectively. 3 widely held but false notion. 4 fictitious person, thing, or idea. 5 allegory (platonic myth).  mythical adj. Mythically adv. [greek muthos]

Disguise  —v. (-sing) 1 conceal the identity of; make unrecognizable. 2 conceal (disguised my anger). —n. 1 a costume, make-up, etc., used to disguise. B action, manner, etc., used to deceive. 2 disguised state. 3 practice of disguising. [french: related to *dis-]

Staggering  adj. Astonishing, bewildering.  staggeringly adv.

Voracious  adj. 1 gluttonous, ravenous. 2 very eager (voracious reader).  voraciously adv. Voracity n. [latin vorax from voro devour]

Carpenter  —n. Person skilled in woodwork. —v. 1 make or construct in wood. 2 construct; fit together.  carpentry n. [latin carpentum wagon]

Ova  pl. Of *ovum.

Navigation  n. 1 act or process of navigating. 2 art or science of navigating.  navigational adj.

Registration  n. Registering or being registered. [french or medieval latin: related to *register]

Caution  —n. 1 attention to safety; prudence, carefulness. 2 a law warning, esp. A formal one. B warning and reprimand. 3 colloq. Amusing or surprising person or thing. —v. 1 warn or admonish. 2 issue a caution to. [latin caveo take heed]

Allergic  adj. 1 (foll. By to) a having an allergy to. B colloq. Having a strong dislike for. 2 caused by an allergy.

Cooperative  (also co-operative) —adj. 1 willing to cooperate. 2 of or characterized by cooperation. 3 (of a business) owned and run jointly by its members, with profits shared. —n. Cooperative farm, society, or business.

Use  —v. (using) 1 cause to act or serve for a purpose; bring into service. 2 treat in a specified manner (used him shamefully). 3 exploit for one's own ends. 4  did or had habitually (i used to drink; it used not (or did not use) to rain so often). 5 (as used adj.) Second-hand. 6 (as used predic. Adj.) (foll. By to) familiar by habit; accustomed (used to hard work). —n. 1 using or being used. 2 right or power of using (lost the use of his legs). 3 benefit, advantage (a torch would be of use; it's no use talking). 4 custom or usage (established by long use).  have no use for 1 not need. 2 dislike, be contemptuous of. In use being used. Make use of 1 use. 2 benefit from. Out of use not being used. Use up 1 consume completely. 2 find a use for (leftovers etc.). [french us, user, ultimately from latin utor us-]

Cracknel  n. Light crisp biscuit. [dutch: related to *crack]

Obsession  n. 1 obsessing or being obsessed. 2 persistent idea dominating a person's mind.  obsessional adj. Obsessionally adv.

Birthday  n. 1 day on which one was born. 2 anniversary of this.

Anorak  n. Waterproof usu. Hooded jacket. [eskimo]

Fraternal  adj. 1 of brothers, brotherly; comradely. 2 (of twins) developed from separate ova and not necessarily similar.  fraternally adv. [latin frater brother]

Chemise  n. Hist. Woman's loose-fitting undergarment or dress. [latin camisia shirt]

Pounce  —v. (-cing) 1 spring or swoop, esp. As in capturing prey. 2 (often foll. By on, upon) a make a sudden attack. B seize eagerly upon a remark etc. —n. Act of pouncing. [origin unknown]

Geranium  n. (pl. -s) 1 (in general use) cultivated pelargonium. 2 herb or shrub bearing fruit shaped like a crane's bill. [greek geranos crane]

Proliferate  v. (-ting) 1 reproduce; produce (cells etc.) Rapidly. 2 increase rapidly in numbers.  proliferation n. [latin proles offspring]

Yea  archaic —adv. 1 yes. 2 indeed (ready, yea eager). —n. Utterance of ‘yea’; ‘yes’ vote. [old english]

Stimulate  v. (-ting) 1 act as a stimulus to. 2 animate, excite, arouse.  stimulation n. Stimulative adj. Stimulator n. [latin: related to *stimulus]

Cavalry  n. (pl. -ies) (usu. Treated as pl.) Soldiers on horseback or in armoured vehicles. [related to *cavalcade]

Wicked  adj. (-er, -est) 1 sinful, iniquitous, immoral. 2 spiteful. 3 playfully malicious. 4 colloq. Very bad. 5 slang excellent.  wickedly adv. Wickedness n. [origin uncertain]

Squab  —n. 1 young (esp. Unfledged) pigeon or other bird. 2 short fat person. 3 stuffed cushion, esp. As part of a car-seat. 4 sofa, ottoman. —adj. Short and fat, squat. [perhaps from scandinavian]

Automaton  n. (pl. -mata or -s) 1 machine controlled automatically; robot. 2 person acting like a robot. [greek, = acting of itself]

Shaver  n. 1 thing that shaves. 2 electric razor. 3 colloq. Young lad.

Tidal  adj. Relating to, like, or affected by tides.  tidally adv.

Enormity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 monstrous wickedness; monstrous crime. 2 serious error. 3 great size. [latin enormitas]

Usage  sense 3 is commonly found, but is regarded as incorrect by some people.

Friable  adj. Easily crumbled.  friability n. [latin frio crumble]

Topcoat  n. 1 overcoat. 2 outer coat of paint etc.

Trattoria  n. Italian restaurant. [italian]

Wail  —n. 1 prolonged plaintive high-pitched cry of pain, grief, etc. 2 sound like this. —v. 1 utter a wail. 2 lament or complain persistently or bitterly. [old norse]

Stature  n. 1 height of a (esp. Human) body. 2 calibre, esp. Moral; eminence. [latin statura]

Mantrap  n. Trap for catching trespassers etc.

Haploid  adj. (of an organism or cell) with a single set of chromosomes. [greek haplous single, eidos form]

Escapement  n. Part of a clock etc. That connects and regulates the motive power. [french: related to *escape]

Hellenistic  adj. Of greek history, language, and culture of the late 4th to the late 1st c. Bc.

Gallivant  v. Colloq. Gad about. [origin uncertain]

Te  symb. Tellurium.

Extension  n. 1 extending or being extended. 2 part enlarging or added on to a main building etc. 3 additional part. 4 a subsidiary telephone on the same line as the main one. B its number. 5 additional period of time. 6 extramural instruction by a university or college.

Prognostic  —n. 1 (often foll. By of) advance indication, esp. Of the course of a disease. 2 prediction, forecast. —adj. (often foll. By of) foretelling, predictive. [latin: related to *prognosis]

Mooch  v. Colloq. 1 (usu. Foll. By about, around) wander aimlessly around. 2 esp. Us cadge; steal. [probably from french muchier skulk]

Vibes  n.pl. Colloq. 1 vibrations, esp. Feelings communicated. 2 = *vibraphone. [abbreviation]

Echolocation  n. Location of objects by reflected sound.

Nautical  adj. Of sailors or navigation. [greek nautes sailor]

Artifact  var. Of *artefact.

Unfair  adj. Not fair, just, or impartial.  unfairly adv. Unfairness n.

Implication  n. 1 thing implied. 2 implicating or implying.

Mcc  abbr. Marylebone cricket club.

Unrecognizable  adj. (also -isable) that cannot be recognized.

Thistle  n. 1 prickly plant, usu. With globular heads of purple flowers. 2 this as the scottish national emblem. [old english]

Lobate  adj. Having a lobe or lobes.

Nether  adj. Archaic = *lower1. [old english]

Interpersonal  adj. Between persons, social (interpersonal skills).

Pyracantha  n. Evergreen thorny shrub with white flowers and bright red or yellow berries. [latin from greek]

Bases  pl. Of *base1, *basis.

Emirate  n. Rank, domain, or reign of an emir.

Ridge  —n. 1 line of the junction of two surfaces sloping upwards towards each other (ridge of a roof). 2 long narrow hilltop, mountain range, or watershed. 3 any narrow elevation across a surface. 4 elongated region of high barometric pressure. 5 raised strip of esp. Ploughed land. —v. (-ging) mark with ridges.  ridgy adj. [old english]

Oversubscribe  v. (-bing) (usu. As oversubscribed adj.) Subscribe for more than the amount available of (shares, tickets, places, etc.).

Dystrophy  n. Defective nutrition. [greek -trophe nourishment]

Ferro-  comb. Form 1 iron. 2 (of alloys) containing iron. [related to *ferric]

Visa  n. Endorsement on a passport etc., esp. Allowing entrance to or exit from a country. [latin, = seen]

Lipstick  n. Stick of cosmetic for colouring the lips.

Yobbo  n. (pl. -s) slang = *yob.

Creditable  adj. Bringing credit or honour.  creditably adv.

Logger  n. Us lumberjack.

Batty  adj. (-ier, -iest) slang crazy. [from *bat2]

Seaman  n.  1 person whose work is at sea. 2 sailor, esp. One below the rank of officer.

Permafrost  n. Subsoil which remains frozen all year, as in polar regions. [from *permanent, *frost]

Non-  prefix giving the negative sense of words with which it is combined. [latin non not]

Kit  —n. 1 articles, equipment, etc. For a specific purpose (first-aid kit). 2 specialized, esp. Sports, clothing or uniform (football kit). 3 set of parts needed to assemble furniture, a model, etc. —v. (-tt-) (often foll.

Gratis  adv. & adj. Free; without charge. [latin]

Envoy  n. 1 messenger or representative. 2 (in full envoy extraordinary) diplomatic agent ranking below ambassador. [french envoyer send, from latin via way]

Unknown  —adj. (often foll. By to) not known, unfamiliar. —n. Unknown thing, person, or quantity.  unknown to without the knowledge of (did it unknown to me).

Multiplicity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 manifold variety. 2 (foll. By of) great number.

Rerecord  v. Record again.

Costumier  n. Person who makes or deals in costumes. [french: related to *costume]

Zappy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Lively, energetic.

Pash  n. Slang brief infatuation. [abbreviation of *passion]

Every  adj. 1 each single (heard every word). 2 each at a specified interval in a series (comes every four days). 3 all possible (every prospect of success).  every bit as colloq. (in comparisons) quite as. Every now and again (or then) from time to time. Every other each second in a series (every other day). Every so often occasionally. [old english: related to *ever, *each]

Misconduct  n. Improper or unprofessional behaviour.

Canon  n. 1 a general law, rule, principle, or criterion. B church decree or law. 2 member of a cathedral chapter. 3 body of (esp. Sacred) writings accepted as genuine. 4 the part of the roman catholic mass containing the words of consecration. 5 mus. Piece with different parts taking up the same theme successively. [greek kanon rule]

Quota  n. 1 share to be contributed to, or received from, a total. 2 number of goods, people, etc., stipulated or permitted. [latin quotus from quot how many]

Hologram  n. Photographic pattern that gives a three-dimensional image when illuminated by coherent light. [greek holos whole, *-gram]

Thimble  n. Metal or plastic cap worn to protect the finger and push the needle in sewing. [old english: related to *thumb]

Furthest  (also farthest) —adj. Most distant. —adv. To or at the greatest distance.

Usage  the form farthest is used esp. With reference to physical distance, although furthest is preferred by many people even in this sense.

Codicil  n. Addition to a will. [latin diminutive of *codex]

Outpatient  n. Non-resident hospital patient.

Marksman  n. Skilled shot, esp. With a pistol or rifle.  marksmanship n.

Quoin  n. 1 external angle of a building. 2 cornerstone. 3 wedge used in printing and gunnery. [var. Of *coin]

Colonel  n. Army officer in command of a regiment, ranking next below brigadier.  colonelcy n. (pl. -ies). [italian colonnello: related to *column]

Configuration  n. 1 arrangement in a particular form. 2 form or figure resulting from this. 3 computing hardware and its arrangement of connections etc.  configure v. (-ring). [latin: related to *figure]

Clot  —n. 1 thick mass of coagulated liquid etc., esp. Of blood. 2 colloq. Foolish person. —v. (-tt-) form into clots. [old english]

Concerto  n. (pl. -s or -ti) composition for solo instrument(s) and orchestra. [italian]

Preparedness  n. Readiness, esp. For war.

Collaborate  v. (-ting) (often foll. By with) 1 work together. 2 cooperate with an enemy.  collaboration n. Collaborative adj. Collaborator n. [latin: related to *labour]

Submarine  —n. Vessel, esp. An armed warship, capable of operating under water. —attrib. Adj. Existing, occurring, done, or used under the sea.  submariner n.

Incoherent  adj. 1 unintelligible. 2 lacking logic or consistency; not clear.  incoherence n. Incoherently adv.

Assorted  adj. 1 of various sorts, mixed. 2 classified. 3 matched (ill-assorted pair).

Wykehamist  —adj. Of winchester college. —n. Past or present member of winchester college. [william of wykeham, name of the founder]

Bbc  abbr. British broadcasting corporation.

Autonomy  n. 1 self-government. 2 personal freedom.

Arbitrary  adj. 1 random. 2 capricious; despotic.  arbitrarily adv.

Devotion  n. 1 (usu. Foll. By to) great love or loyalty. 2 a religious worship. B (in pl.) Prayers.  devotional adj. [latin: related to *devote]

Spurn  v. Reject with disdain or contempt.  [old english]

Undergrowth  n. Dense shrubs etc., esp. In a wood.

Unreserved  adj. 1 not reserved. 2 total; without reservation.  unreservedly adv.

Spate  n. 1 river-flood (river in spate). 2 unexpected occurrence of similar events (spate of car thefts). [origin unknown]

Quip  —n. Clever saying; epigram. —v. (-pp-) make quips. [perhaps from latin quippe forsooth]

Abbot  n. Head of a community of monks. [old english from latin abbas]

Amidst  var. Of *amid.

Photogravure  n. 1 image produced from a photographic negative transferred to a metal plate and etched in. 2 this process. [french gravure engraving]

Trundle  v. (-ling) roll or move, esp. Heavily or noisily. [var. Of obsolete or dial. Trendle: related to *trend]

Unit  n. 1 a individual thing, person, or group, esp. For calculation. B smallest component of a complex whole. 2 quantity as a standard of measurement (unit of heat; si unit). 3 smallest share in a unit trust. 4 part of a mechanism with a specified function. 5 fitted item of furniture, esp. As part of a set. 6 subgroup with a special function. 7 group of buildings, wards, etc., in a hospital. 8  a single-digit number. B the number ‘one’. [latin unus one]

Provision  —n. 1 a act of providing (provision of nurseries). B preparation, esp. For the future (made provision for their old age). 2 (in pl.) Food, drink, etc., esp. For an expedition. 3 legal or formal stipulation or proviso. —v. Supply with provisions. [latin: related to *provide]

Inconsequential  adj. 1 unimportant. 2 = *inconsequent.  inconsequentially adv.

Antacid  —adj. Preventing or correcting acidity. —n. Antacid agent.

Advertise  v. (-sing) 1 promote (goods or services) publicly to increase sales. 2 make generally known. 3 (often foll. By for) seek by a notice in a newspaper etc. To buy, employ, sell, etc. [french avertir: related to *adverse]

Quantify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 determine the quantity of. 2 express as a quantity.  quantifiable adj. Quantification n. [medieval latin: related to *quantity]

Analogous  adj. (usu. Foll. By to) partially similar or parallel. [greek analogos proportionate]

Exhaustion  n. 1 exhausting or being exhausted. 2 total loss of strength.

Inequity  n. (pl. -ies) unfairness, injustice.

Unrealized  adj. (also -ised) not realized.

Ineffable  adj. 1 too great for description in words. 2 that must not be uttered.  ineffability n. Ineffably adv. [latin effor speak out]

Confederacy  n. (pl. -ies) league or alliance, esp. Of confederate states. [french: related to *confederate]

Aspidistra  n. House-plant with broad tapering leaves. [greek aspis shield]

Tarn  n. Small mountain lake. [old norse]

Quoth  v. (only in 1st and 3rd person) archaic said. [old english]

Politician  n. 1 person involved in politics, esp. Professionally as an mp. 2 esp. Us derog. Person who manoeuvres; schemer, time-server.

Loose  —adj. 1 not tightly held, fixed, etc. (loose handle; loose stones). 2 free from bonds or restraint. 3 not held together (loose papers). 4 not compact or dense (loose soil). 5 inexact (loose translation). 6 morally lax. 7 (of the tongue) indiscreet. 8 tending to diarrhoea. 9 (in comb.) Loosely (loose-fitting). —v. (-sing) 1 free; untie or detach; release. 2 relax (loosed my hold). 3 discharge (a missile).  at a loose end unoccupied. On the loose 1 escaped from captivity. 2 enjoying oneself freely.  loosely adv. Looseness n. Loosish adj. [old norse]

Melancholia  n. Depression and anxiety. [latin: related to *melancholy]

Magnate  n. Wealthy and influential person, usu. In business. [latin magnus great]

Rhubarb  n. 1 a plant with long fleshy dark-red leaf-stalks cooked as a dessert. B these stalks. 2 a colloq. Indistinct conversation or noise, from the repeated use of the word ‘rhubarb’ by a crowd. B slang nonsense. [greek rha rhubarb, barbaros foreign]

Distiller  n. Person who distils, esp. Alcoholic liquor.

Cowherd  n. Person who tends cattle.

Albino  n. (pl. -s) 1 person or animal lacking pigment in the skin and hair (which are white), and the eyes (usu. Pink). 2 plant lacking normal colouring.  albinism n. [spanish and portuguese: related to *alb]

Strident  adj. Loud and harsh.  stridency n. Stridently adv. [latin strido creak]

Gnu  n. (pl. Same or -s) oxlike antelope. [bushman nqu]

Hexagram  n. Figure formed by two intersecting equilateral triangles.

Pong  v. Colloq. Stink.  pongy adj. (-ier, -iest). [origin unknown]

Boisterous  adj. 1 noisily exuberant, rough. 2 (of the sea etc.) Stormy. [origin unknown]

Mosaic  adj. Of moses. [french from moses in the old testament]

Urinary  adj. Of or relating to urine.

Vector  n. 1 math. & physics quantity having direction as well as magnitude. 2 carrier of disease. [latin veho vect- convey]

Mesh  —n. 1 network fabric or structure. 2 each of the open spaces in a net or sieve etc. 3 (in pl.) A network. B snare. —v. 1 (often foll. By with) (of the teeth of a wheel) be engaged. 2 be harmonious. 3 catch in a net.  in mesh (of the teeth of wheels) engaged. [dutch]

Wheelwright  n. Person who makes or repairs wheels.

Guile  n. Cunning or sly behaviour; treachery, deceit.  guileful adj. Guileless adj. [french from scandinavian]

Accompany  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 go with; escort. 2 (usu. In passive; foll. By with, by) be done or found with; supplement. 3 mus. Partner with accompaniment. [french: related to *companion]

Bumptious  adj. Offensively self-assertive or conceited. [from *bump, after fractious]

Bias  —n. 1 (often foll. By towards, against) predisposition or prejudice. 2 statistics distortion of a statistical result due to a neglected factor. 3 edge cut obliquely across the weave of a fabric. 4 sport a irregular shape given to a bowl. B oblique course this causes it to run. —v. (-s- or -ss-) 1 (esp. As biased adj.) Influence (usu. Unfairly); prejudice. 2 give a bias to.  on the bias obliquely, diagonally. [french]

Pouffe  n. Large firm cushion used as a low seat or footstool. [french]

Nuptial  —adj. Of marriage or weddings. —n. (usu. In pl.) Wedding. [latin nubo nupt- wed]

Kosher  —adj. 1 (of food or a food-shop) fulfilling the requirements of jewish law. 2 colloq. Correct, genuine, legitimate. —n. Kosher food or shop. [hebrew, = proper]

Mention  —v. 1 refer to briefly or by name. 2 reveal or disclose (do not mention this to anyone). 3 (usu. As mention in dispatches) award a minor military honour to in war. —n. 1 reference, esp. By name. 2 minor military or other honour.  don't mention it polite reply to an apology or thanks. Not to mention and also. [latin mentio]

Combine  —v. (-ning) 1 join together; unite for a common purpose. 2 possess (qualities usually distinct) together. 3 form or cause to form a chemical compound. 4  harvest with a combine harvester. —n. 1  combination of esp. Commercial interests. 2 (in full combine harvester) machine that reaps and threshes in one operation. [latin bini a pair]

Kv  abbr. Kilovolt(s).

Gibber  v. Jabber inarticulately. [imitative]

Waddle  —v. (-ling) walk with short steps and a swaying motion. —n. Waddling gait. [from *wade]

Scurry  —v. (-ies, -ied) run or move hurriedly, esp. With short quick steps; scamper. —n. (pl. -ies) 1 act or sound of scurrying. 2 flurry of rain or snow. [abbreviation of hurry-scurry reduplication of *hurry]

Hillock  n. Small hill, mound.

Sulfonamide  n. (brit. Sulphonamide) any of a class of antibiotic drugs containing sulphur. [german sulfon (related to *sulphur), amide a derivative of *ammonia]

Contemporaneous  adj. (usu. Foll. By with) existing or occurring at the same time.  contemporaneity n. [latin: related to *com-, tempus time]

Caller  n. Person who calls, esp. One who pays a visit or makes a telephone call.

Readable  adj. 1 able to be read. 2 interesting to read.  readability n.

Commandment  n. Divine command.

Psaltery  n. (pl. -ies) ancient and medieval instrument like a dulcimer but played by plucking the strings. [latin: related to *psalter]

Arrive  v. (-ving) 1 (often foll. By at, in) reach a destination. 2 (foll. By at) reach (a conclusion etc.). 3 colloq. Become successful. 4 colloq. (of a child) be born. 5 (of a time) come. [latin ripa shore]

Curvilinear  adj. Contained by or consisting of curved lines.  curvilinearly adv. [from *curve after rectilinear]

Steamship  n. Steam-driven ship.

Vagabond  —n. Wanderer, esp. An idle one. —attrib. Adj. Wandering, roving.  vagabondage n. [latin vagor wander]

Archway  n. Arched entrance or passage.

Aerofoil  n. Structure with curved surfaces (e.g. A wing, fin, or tailplane) designed to give lift in flight.

Sdi  abbr. Strategic defence initiative.

Expectorate  v. (-ting) (also absol.) Cough or spit out (phlegm etc.).  expectoration n. [latin pectus pector- breast]

Totalizator  n. (also totalisator) 1 device showing the number and amount of bets staked on a race, to facilitate the division of the total among those backing the winner. 2 system of betting based on this.

Narwhal  n. Arctic white whale, the male of which has a long tusk. [dutch from danish]

Dieresis  n. (pl. Diereses) (brit. Diaeresis) mark (as in naïve) over a vowel to indicate that it is sounded separately. [greek, = separation]

Toddy  n. (pl. -ies) drink of spirits with hot water and sugar etc. [hindustani tar palm]

Ineffectual  adj. Ineffective, feeble.  ineffectually adv. Ineffectualness n.

Entity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 thing with distinct existence. 2 thing's existence in itself. [latin ens ent- being]

Informed  adj. 1 knowing the facts. 2 having some knowledge.

Sky  —n. (pl. Skies) (in sing. Or pl.) Atmosphere and outer space as seen from the earth. —v. (skies, skied) cricket etc. Hit (a ball) high.  to the skies without reserve (praise to the skies). [old norse, = cloud]

Million  n. & adj. (pl. Same or (in sense 2) -s) (in sing. Prec. By a or one) 1 thousand thousand. 2 (in pl.) Colloq. Very large number. 3 million pounds or dollars.  millionth adj. & n. [french, probably from italian mille thousand]

Transept  n. 1 part of a cross-shaped church at right angles to the nave. 2 either arm of this. [latin: related to *septum]

Ceramics  n.pl. 1 ceramic products collectively. 2 (usu. Treated as sing.) Art of making ceramic articles.

Mistreat  v. Treat badly.  mistreatment n.

Himself  pron. 1 a emphat. Form of *he or *him (he himself will do it). B refl. Form of *him (he has hurt himself). 2 in his normal state of body or mind (does not feel quite himself today).  be himself see *oneself. By himself see by oneself. [old english: related to *him, *self]

Centimetre  n. (us centimeter) 0.01 metre.

Legation  n. 1 diplomatic minister and his or her staff. 2 this minister's official residence. [latin: related to *legate]

Confuse  v. (-sing) 1 perplex, bewilder. 2 mix up in the mind; mistake (one for another). 3 make indistinct (confuse the issue). 4 (often as confused adj.) Throw into disorder.  confusedly adv. Confusing adj. [related to *confound]

Samizdat  n. Clandestine publication of banned literature. [russian]

Effrontery  n. (pl. -ies) impudent audacity. [latin frons front- forehead]

Ramshackle  adj. Tumbledown, rickety. [related to *ransack]

Wharfage  n. 1 accommodation at a wharf. 2 fee for this.

Tickle  —v. (-ling) 1 a touch or stroke (a person etc.) Playfully or lightly so as to produce laughter and spasmodic movement. B produce this sensation. 2 excite agreeably; amuse. 3 catch (a trout etc.) By rubbing it so that it moves backwards into the hand. —n.

Hailstone  n. Pellet of hail.

Soldiery  n. Soldiers, esp. Of a specified character.

Ramp  —n. 1 slope, esp. Joining two levels of ground, floor, etc. 2 movable stairs for entering or leaving an aircraft. 3 transverse ridge in a road making vehicles slow down. —v. 1 furnish or build with a ramp. 2 a assume a threatening posture. B (often foll. By about) storm, rage. [french ramper crawl]

Byline  n. 1 line naming the writer of a newspaper article etc. 2 secondary line of work. 3 goal-line or touch-line.

Fenugreek  n. Leguminous plant with aromatic seeds used for flavouring. [latin, = greek hay]

Erotic  adj. Of or causing sexual love, esp. Tending to arouse sexual desire or excitement.  erotically adv. [greek eros sexual love]

Stress  —n. 1 a pressure or tension. B quantity measuring this. 2 a physical or mental strain. B distress caused by this. 3 a emphasis. B emphasis on a syllable or word. —v. 1 emphasize. 2 subject to stress.  lay stress on emphasize. [shortening of *distress]

Rapier  n. 1 light slender sword for thrusting. 2 (attrib.) Sharp (rapier wit). [french rapière]

Disyllable  n. (also dissyllable) prosody word or metrical foot of two syllables.  disyllabic adj.

Parapet  n. 1 low wall at the edge of a roof, balcony, bridge, etc. 2 defence of earth or stone. [french or italian: related to *para-2, petto breast]

Splotch  n. & v. = *splodge.  splotchy adj. [origin uncertain]

Significance  n. 1 importance. 2 meaning. 3 being significant. 4 extent to which a result deviates from a hypothesis such that the difference is due to more than errors in sampling. [latin: related to *signify]

Swag  n. 1 slang booty of burglars etc. 2 austral. & nz traveller's bundle. 3 festoon of flowers, foliage, drapery, etc.  swagged adj. [probably scandinavian]

Nougat  n. Sweet made from sugar or honey, nuts, and egg-white. [french from provençal]

Virulent  adj. 1 strongly poisonous. 2 (of a disease) violent. 3 bitterly hostile.  virulence n. Virulently adv. [latin: related to *virus]

Diffusion  n. 1 diffusing or being diffused. 2 interpenetration of substances by natural movement of their particles. [latin: related to *diffuse]

Round  —adj. 1 shaped like a circle, sphere, or cylinder; convex; circular, curved, not angular. 2 done with or involving circular motion. 3 entire, continuous, complete (round dozen). 4 candid, outspoken. 5 (usu. Attrib.) (of a number) expressed for brevity as a complete number (£297.32, or in round figures £300). 6 (of a voice, style, etc.) Flowing, sonorous. —n. 1 round object or form. 2 a revolving motion or course (yearly round). B recurring series of activities, meetings, etc. (continuous round of pleasure; round of talks). 3 a fixed route for deliveries (milk round). B route etc. For supervision or inspection (watchman's round; doctor's rounds). 4 drink etc. For each member of a group. 5 a one bullet, shell, etc. B act of firing this. 6 a slice from a loaf of bread. B sandwich made from two slices. C joint of beef from the haunch. 7 set, series, or sequence of actions in turn, esp.: a one spell of play in a game etc. B one stage in a competition. 8 golf playing of all the holes in a course once. 9 song for unaccompanied voices overlapping at intervals. 10 rung of a ladder. 11 (foll. By of) circumference or extent of (in all the round of nature). —adv. 1 with circular motion (wheels go round).

Disintegrate  v. (-ting) 1 separate into component parts or fragments, break up. 2 colloq. Break down, esp. Mentally. 3 (of an atomic nucleus) emit particles or divide into smaller nuclei.  disintegration n.

Slide  —v. (past and past part. Slid) 1 move along a smooth surface with continuous contact on the same part of the thing moving. 2 move quietly or smoothly; glide. 3 glide over ice without skates. 4 (foll. By over) barely touch upon (a delicate subject etc.). 5 (often foll. By into) move quietly or unobtrusively. —n. 1 act of sliding. 2 rapid decline. 3 inclined plane down which children, goods, etc., slide. 4 track made by or for sliding, esp. On ice. 5 part of a machine or instrument that slides. 6 a mounted transparency viewed with a projector. B piece of glass holding an object for a microscope. 7 = *hair-slide.  let things slide be negligent; allow deterioration. [old english]

Matins  n. (also mattins) (as sing. Or pl.) Morning prayer, esp. In the church of england. [latin matutinus of the morning]

Irredentist  n. Person advocating the restoration to his or her country of any territory formerly belonging to it.  irredentism n. [italian irredenta unredeemed]

Crofter  n. Person who farms a croft.

Yours  poss. Pron. 1 the one or ones belonging to you (it is yours; yours are over there). 2 your letter (yours of the 10th). 3 introducing a formula ending a letter (yours ever; yours truly).  of yours of or belonging to you (friend of yours).

Radian  n. Si unit of angle, equal to an angle at the centre of a circle the arc of which is equal in length to the radius (1 radian is approx. 57°).

Ablaze  predic. Adj. & adv. 1 on fire. 2 glittering, glowing. 3 greatly excited.

Metropolitan  —adj. 1 of a metropolis. 2 of or forming a mother country as distinct from its colonies etc. (metropolitan france). —n. 1 bishop having authority over the bishops of a province. 2 inhabitant of a metropolis.

Greenhouse  n. Light structure with the sides and roof mainly of glass, for rearing plants.

Liveable  adj. (also livable) 1 colloq. (usu. Liveable-in) (of a house etc.) Fit to live in. 2 (of a life) worth living. 3 colloq. (usu. Liveable-with) (of a person) easy to live with.

Censor  —n. Official authorized to suppress or expurgate books, films, news, etc., on grounds of obscenity, threat to security, etc. —v. 1 act as a censor of. 2 make deletions or changes in.  censorial adj. Censorship n. [latin censeo assess]

Usage  as a verb, censor is often confused with censure.

Propel  v. (-ll-) drive or push forward; urge on.  propellant n. & adj. [latin pello puls- drive]

Owner  n. Person who owns something.  ownership n.

Bap  n. Soft flattish bread roll. [origin unknown]

Quadragesima  n. First sunday in lent. [latin quadragesimus fortieth]

Inclement  adj. (of the weather) severe or stormy.  inclemency n.

Declaration  n. 1 declaring. 2 formal, emphatic, or deliberate statement. [latin: related to *declare]

Astray  adv. & predic.adj. Out of the right way, erring.  go astray be missing. [latin extra away, vagor wander]

Challenge  —n. 1 summons to take part in a contest etc. Or to prove or justify something. 2 demanding or difficult task. 3 objection made to a jury member. 4 call to respond. —v. (-ging) 1 issue a challenge to. 2 dispute, deny. 3 (as challenging adj.) Stimulatingly difficult. 4 object to (a jury member, evidence, etc.).  challenger n. [latin calumnia calumny]

Scare  —v. (-ring) 1 frighten, esp. Suddenly. 2 (as scared adj.) (usu. Foll. By of, or to + infin.) Frightened; terrified. 3 (usu. Foll. By away, off, up, etc.) Drive away by frightening. 4 become scared (they don't scare easily). —n. 1 sudden attack of fright. 2 alarm caused by rumour etc. (a measles scare). [old norse]

American  —adj. Of america, esp. The united states. —n. 1 native, citizen, or inhabitant of america, esp. The us. 2 english as used in the us.  americanize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). [name of navigator amerigo vespucci]

Dismal  adj. 1 gloomy; miserable. 2 dreary; sombre. 3 colloq. Feeble, inept (dismal attempt).  dismally adv. [medieval latin dies mali unlucky days]

Pourboire  n. Gratuity, tip. [french]

Drosophila  n. Fruit fly used in genetic research. [greek, = dew-loving]

Moron  n. 1 colloq. Very stupid person. 2 adult with a mental age of 8–12.  moronic adj. [greek moros foolish]

Hindquarters  n.pl. Hind legs and rump of a quadruped.

Metaphysic  n. System of metaphysics.

Housetop  n. Roof of a house.  shout etc. From the housetops announce publicly.

Immunotherapy  n. Prevention or treatment of disease with substances that stimulate the immune response.

-fication  suffix (usu. As -ification) forming nouns of action from verbs in -fy (purification; simplification).

Pylon  n. Tall structure, esp. As a support for electric-power cables etc. [greek pule gate]

Isthmus  n. (pl. -es) narrow piece of land connecting two larger bodies of land. [greek isthmos]

Viand  n. Formal (usu. In pl.) Article of food. [latin vivo live]

Ideograph  n. = *ideogram.  ideographic adj. Ideography n.

Sandcastle  n. Model castle made of sand at the seashore.

Solitary  —adj. 1 living or being alone; not gregarious; lonely. 2 secluded. 3 single, sole. —n. (pl. -ies) 1 recluse. 2 colloq. = *solitary confinement.   solitariness n. [latin solitarius from solus alone]

Unpractised  adj. (us unpracticed) 1 not experienced or skilled. 2 not put into practice.

Workforce  n. 1 workers engaged or available. 2 number of these.

Hyphenate  v. (-ting) 1 write (a compound word) with a hyphen. 2 join (words) with a hyphen.  hyphenation n.

Billow  —n. 1 wave. 2 any large mass. —v. Rise, fill, or surge in billows.  billowy adj. [old norse]

Landlocked  adj. Almost or entirely enclosed by land.

Ringworm  n. Fungal skin infection causing circular inflamed patches, esp. On the scalp.

Album  n. 1 book for photographs, stamps, etc. 2 a long-playing gramophone record. B set of these. [latin, = blank tablet, from albus white]

Entomology  n. The study of insects.  entomological adj. Entomologist n. [greek entomon insect]

Limey  n. (pl. -s) us slang offens. British person (orig. A sailor) or ship. [from *lime2, because of the former enforced consumption of lime juice in the british navy]

Purloin  v. Formal or joc. Steal, pilfer. [anglo-french purloigner from loign far]

Truth  n. (pl. Truths) 1 quality or state of being true. 2 what is true.  in truth literary truly, really. [old english: related to *true]

Gillie  n. (also ghillie) scot. Man or boy attending a person hunting or fishing. [gaelic]

Overfeed  v. (past and past part. -fed) feed excessively.

Nb  abbr. Note well. [latin nota bene]

Periphery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 boundary of an area or surface. 2 outer or surrounding region. [greek phero bear]

Consumerism  n. 1 protection of consumers' interests. 2 (often derog.) Continual increase in the consumption of goods.  consumerist adj.

Aslant  —adv. Obliquely or at a slant. —prep. Obliquely across.

Geese  pl. Of *goose.

Signwriter  n. Person who paints signboards etc.

Parse  v. (-sing) 1 describe (a word in context) grammatically, stating its inflection, relation to the sentence, etc. 2 resolve (a sentence) into its component parts and describe them grammatically. [perhaps from french pars parts: related to *part]
