Swan  —n. Large usu. White water-bird with a long flexible neck. —v. (-nn-) (usu. Foll. By about, off, etc.) Colloq. Move or go aimlessly, casually, or with a superior air. [old english]

Granite  n. Granular crystalline rock of quartz, mica, etc., used for building. [italian granito: related to *grain]

Goodwill  n. 1 kindly feeling. 2 established reputation of a business etc. As enhancing its value. 3 willingness to undertake unpaid duties.

Hemline  n. Lower edge of a skirt etc.

Gingerbread  —n. Ginger-flavoured treacle cake. —attrib. Adj. Gaudy, tawdry.

Ride  —v. (-ding; past rode; past part. Ridden) 1 (often foll. By on, in) travel or be carried on (a bicycle etc.) Or esp. Us in (a vehicle); be conveyed (rode her bike; rode on her bike; rode the tram). 2 (often foll. By on; also absol.) Be carried by (a horse etc.). 3 be carried or supported by (ship rides the waves). 4 traverse or take part in on horseback etc. (ride 50 miles; rode the prairie). 5 a lie at anchor; float buoyantly. B (of the moon) seem to float.  6 yield to (a blow) so as to reduce its impact. 7 give a ride to; cause to ride (rode me home). 8 (of a rider) cause (a horse etc.) To move forward (rode their horses at the fence). 9 (as ridden adj.) (foll. By by, with, or in comb.) Be dominated by; be infested with (ridden with guilt; rat-ridden cellar). —n. 1 journey or spell of riding in a vehicle, or on a horse, bicycle, person's back, etc. 2 path (esp. Through woods) for riding on. 3 specified kind of ride (bumpy ride). 4 amusement for riding on at a fairground etc.  let a thing ride leave it undisturbed. Ride again reappear as strong etc. As ever. Ride high be elated or successful. Ride out come safely through (a storm, danger, etc.). Ride roughshod over see *roughshod. Ride up (of a garment) work upwards out of place. Take for a ride colloq. Hoax or deceive. [old english]

Plow  (us plow) —n. 1 implement for cutting furrows in the soil and turning it up. 2 implement resembling this (snowplough). 3 (the plough) the great bear (see *bear2) or its seven bright stars. —v. 1 (also absol.) Turn up (the earth) with a plough. 2 (foll. By out, up, etc.) Turn or extract with a plough. 3 furrow or scratch (a surface) as with a plough. 4 produce (a furrow or line) thus. 5 (foll. By through) advance laboriously, esp. Through work, a book, etc. 6 (foll. By through, into) move violently like a plough. 7 colloq. Fail in an examination.  plough back 1 plough (grass etc.) Into the soil to enrich it. 2 reinvest (profits) in the business producing them. [old english]

Drag  —v. (-gg-) 1 pull along with effort. 2 a trail or allow to trail along the ground. B (often foll. By on) (of time, a meeting, etc.) Go or pass slowly or tediously. 3 a use a grapnel. B search the bottom of (a river etc.) With grapnels, nets, etc. 4 (often foll. By to) colloq. Take (an esp. Unwilling person) with one. 5 (foll. By on, at) draw on (a cigarette etc.). —n. 1 a obstruction to progress. B retarding force or motion. 2 colloq. Boring or tiresome person, duty, etc. 3 a lure before hounds as a substitute for a fox. B hunt using this. 4 apparatus for dredging. 5 = *drag-net. 6 slang inhalation. 7 slang women's clothes worn by men.  drag one's feet be deliberately slow or reluctant to act. Drag in introduce (an irrelevant subject). Drag out protract. Drag up colloq. Introduce or revive (an unwelcome subject). [old english or old norse]

Desktop  n. 1 working surface of a desk. 2 (attrib.) (esp. Of a microcomputer) for use on an ordinary desk.

Eight  adj. & n. 1 one more than seven. 2 symbol for this (8, viii, viii). 3 size etc. Denoted by eight. 4 eight-oared rowing-boat or its crew. 5 eight o'clock. [old english]

Tri-  comb. Form three or three times. [latin and greek]

Strangulate  v. (-ting) compress (a vein, intestine, etc.), preventing circulation. [latin: related to *strangle]

Unexpected  adj. Not expected; surprising.  unexpectedly adv. Unexpectedness n.

Stood  past and past part. Of *stand.

Snow  —n. 1 frozen atmospheric vapour falling to earth in light white flakes. 2 fall or layer of this. 3 thing resembling snow in whiteness or texture etc. 4 slang cocaine. —v. 1 (prec. By it as subject) snow falls (it is snowing; if it snows). 2 (foll. By in, over, up, etc.) Confine or block with snow.  be snowed under be overwhelmed, esp. With work. [old english]

Hazelnut  n. Nut of the hazel.

Artwork  n. 1 illustrative material in printed matter. 2 works of art collectively (exhibition of children's artwork).

Sandbank  n. Sand forming a shallow place in the sea or a river.

Zionism  n. Movement for the re-establishment and development of a jewish nation in what is now israel.  zionist n. & adj.

Blinking  adj. & adv. Slang expressing annoyance etc. (it's blinking stupid).

Tuesday  —n. Day of the week following monday. —adv. 1 colloq. On tuesday. 2 (tuesdays) on tuesdays; each tuesday. [old english]

Mist  —n. 1 a water vapour near the ground in minute droplets limiting visibility. B condensed vapour obscuring glass etc. 2 dimness or blurring of the sight caused by tears etc. 3 cloud of particles resembling mist. —v. (usu. Foll. By up, over) cover or become covered with mist or as with mist. [old english]

Excentric  var. Of *eccentric (in technical senses).

Peppermint  n. 1 a mint plant grown for its strong-flavoured oil. B this oil. 2 sweet flavoured with peppermint.

Ambiguous  adj. 1 having an obscure or double meaning. 2 difficult to classify.  ambiguity n. (pl. -ies). [latin ambi- both ways, ago drive]

Flare  —v. (-ring) 1 widen gradually (flared trousers). 2 (cause to) blaze brightly and unsteadily. 3 burst out, esp. Angrily. —n. 1 a dazzling irregular flame or light. B sudden outburst of flame. 2 flame or bright light used as a signal or to illuminate a target etc. 3 a gradual widening, esp. Of a skirt or trousers. B (in pl.) Wide-bottomed trousers.  flare up burst into a sudden blaze, anger, activity, etc. [origin unknown]

Goat  n. 1 hardy domesticated mammal, with horns and (in the male) a beard. 2 lecherous man. 3 colloq. Foolish person. 4 (the goat) zodiacal sign or constellation capricorn.  get a person's goat colloq. Irritate a person. [old english]

Chameleon  n. 1 small lizard able to change colour for camouflage. 2 variable or inconstant person. [greek, = ground-lion]

Troublesome person or thing; nuisance. —v. 1 cause pain to. 2 (as pained adj.) Expressing pain (pained expression).  be at (or take) pains take great care. In pain suffering pain.

Windward. —v. 1 expose to or affect by atmospheric changes; season (wood). 2 be discoloured or worn in this way. 3 a come safely through (a storm). B survive (a difficult period etc.). 4 get to the windward of (a cape etc.).  keep a weather eye open be watchful. Make heavy weather of colloq. Exaggerate the difficulty presented by. (of fat molecules) containing the greatest number of hydrogen atoms. [latin satur full]

B (also romantic) of the 18th–19th-c. Romantic movement or style in the european arts. 5 (of a project etc.) Unpractical, fantastic. —n. 1 romantic person. 2 romanticist.  romantically adv. Usage  the second pronunciation, stressed on the second syllable, is considered incorrect by some people.

Speedo  n. (pl. -s) colloq. = *speedometer. [abbreviation]

Poky  adj. (-ier, -iest) (of a room etc.) Small and cramped.  pokiness n. [from *poke1]

Derive  v. (-ving) 1 (usu. Foll. By from) get or trace from a source (derived satisfaction from work). 2 (foll. By from) arise from, originate in (happiness derives from many things). 3 (usu. Foll. By from) show or state the origin or formation of (a word etc.). [latin rivus stream]

Angelus  n. 1 roman catholic prayers commemorating the incarnation, said at morning, noon, and sunset. 2 bell announcing this. [latin angelus domini (= the angel of the lord), opening words]

Revelation  n. 1 a revealing, esp. The supposed disclosure of knowledge to man by a divine or supernatural agency. B knowledge disclosed in this way. 2 striking disclosure. 3 (revelation or colloq. Revelations) (in full the revelation of st john the divine) last book of the new testament.

Sophist  n. Captious or clever but fallacious reasoner.  sophistic adj. [greek: related to *sophism]

Technicolor  n. (often attrib.) 1 propr. Process of colour cinematography. 2 (usu. Technicolor) colloq. A vivid colour. B artificial brilliance.

Chough  n. Bird with glossy blue-black plumage and red legs. [imitative]

Duster  n. Cloth for dusting furniture etc.

Sunday  —n. 1 first day of the week, a christian holiday and day of worship. 2 colloq. Newspaper published on sundays. —adv. Colloq. 1 on sunday. 2 (sundays) on sundays; each sunday. [old english]

Spontaneous  adj. 1 acting, done, or occurring without external cause. 2 instinctive, automatic, natural. 3 (of style or manner) gracefully natural.  spontaneity n. Spontaneously adv. [latin sponte of one's own accord]

Smilax  n. Any of several climbing shrubs.  [greek, = bindweed]

Anthology  n. (pl. -ies) collection of poems, essays, stories, etc.  anthologist n. [greek anthos flower, -logia collection]

Sooty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 covered with soot. 2 black or brownish-black.

Salty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 tasting of or containing salt. 2 (of wit etc.) Piquant. saltiness n.

Contemptuous  adj. (often foll. By of) feeling or showing contempt.  contemptuously adv.

Withe  n. (also withy) (pl. Withes or withies) tough flexible shoot, esp. Of willow, used for binding, basketwork, etc. [old english]

Hallo  var. Of *hello.

Prescript  n. Ordinance, law, command. [latin: related to *prescribe]

Homoeopathy  n. (us homeopathy) treatment of disease by minute doses of drugs that in a healthy person would produce symptoms of the disease.  homoeopath n. Homoeopathic adj. [greek homoios like: related to *pathos]

Madder  n. 1 herbaceous plant with yellowish flowers. 2  a red dye from its root. B its synthetic substitute. [old english]

Vermiculite  n. A hydrous silicate mineral used esp. As a moisture-holding medium for plant growth. [latin vermiculatus worm-eaten, from vermis worm]

Esperanto  n. An artificial language designed for universal use. [latin spero hope]

Heliport  n. Place where helicopters take off and land.

Evolutionist  n. Person who regards evolution as explaining the origin of species.

Rockabilly  n. Rock and roll combined with hill-billy music.

Vulgarity  n. (pl. -ies) vulgar act, expression, or state.

Prisoner  n. 1 person kept in prison. 2 (in full prisoner at the bar) person in custody on a criminal charge and on trial. 3 person or thing confined by illness, another's grasp, etc. 4 (in full prisoner of war) person captured in war.  take prisoner seize and hold as a prisoner. [anglo-french: related to *prison]

Error  n. 1 mistake. 2 condition of being morally wrong (led into error).  3 degree of inaccuracy in a calculation etc. (2% error). [latin: related to *err]

Sportswear  n. Clothes for sports or informal wear.

Alphanumeric  adj. Containing both letters and numbers.

Duo  n. (pl. -s) 1 pair of performers. 2 duet. [italian from latin, = two]

Exculpate  v. (-ting) formal (often foll. By from) free from blame; clear of a charge.  exculpation n. Exculpatory adj. [latin culpa blame]

Backhanded  adj. 1 made with the back of the hand. 2 indirect; ambiguous (backhanded compliment).

Stereotype  —n. 1 a person or thing seeming to conform to a widely accepted type. B such a type, idea, or attitude. 2 printing-plate cast from a mould of composed type. —v. (-ping) 1 (esp. As stereotyped adj.) Cause to conform to a type; standardize. 2 a print from a stereotype. B make a stereotype of. [french: related to *stereo-]

Salamander  n. 1 tailed newtlike amphibian once thought able to endure fire. 2 similar mythical creature. [greek salamandra]

Dulcet  adj. Sweet-sounding. [latin dulcis sweet]

Lathe  n. Machine for shaping wood, metal, etc., by rotating the article against cutting tools. [origin uncertain]

Mesembryanthemum  n. S. African fleshy-leaved plant with bright daisy-like flowers that open fully in sunlight. [greek, = noon flower]

Poised  adj. 1 a composed, self-assured. B carrying oneself gracefully or with dignity. 2 (often foll. By for, or to + infin.) Ready for action.

Courtship  n. 1 courting, wooing. 2 courting behaviour of animals, birds, etc.

Poplin  n. Plain-woven fabric usu. Of cotton, with a corded surface. [french papeline]

Alembic  n. 1 hist. Apparatus formerly used in distilling. 2 means of refining or extracting. [greek ambix, -ikos cap of a still]

Childhood  n. State or period of being a child.

Whensoever  conj. & adv. Formal = *whenever.

Target  —n. 1 mark fired or aimed at, esp. A round object marked with concentric circles. 2 person or thing aimed or fired at etc. (an easy target). 3 objective or result aimed at. 4 butt for criticism, abuse, etc. —v. (-t-) 1 identify or single out as a target. 2 aim or direct (missiles targeted on major cities). [french targe shield]

Lace  —n. 1 fine open fabric or trimming, made by weaving thread in patterns. 2 cord etc. Passed through holes or hooks for fastening shoes etc. —v. (-cing) 1 (usu. Foll. By up) fasten or tighten with a lace or laces. 2 add spirits to (a drink). 3 (often foll. By through) pass (a shoelace etc.) Through. [latin laqueus noose]

Pyre  n. Heap of combustible material, esp. For burning a corpse. [greek: related to *pyro-]

Handmade  adj. Made by hand (as opposed to machine).

Embark  v. 1 (often foll. By for) put or go on board a ship or aircraft (to a destination). 2 (foll. By on, in) begin an enterprise.  embarkation n. (in sense 1). [french: related to *barque]

Noticeable  adj. Perceptible; noteworthy.  noticeably adv.

Propensity  n. (pl. -ies) inclination, tendency. [latin propensus inclined]

Titrate  v. (-ting) chem. Ascertain the amount of a constituent in (a solution) by reaction with a known concentration of reagent.  titration n. [french titre title]

Tubercle  n. Small rounded swelling on the body or in an organ, esp. As characteristic of tuberculosis.  tuberculous adj. [latin tuberculum, diminutive of *tuber]

Abstracted  adj. Inattentive, distracted.  abstractedly adv.

Sissy  (also cissy) colloq. —n. (pl. -ies) effeminate or cowardly person. —adj. (-ier, -iest) effeminate; cowardly. [from *sis]

Sillabub  var. Of *syllabub.

Skiff  n. Light rowing- or sculling-boat. [french esquif: related to *ship]

Blarney  —n. Cajoling talk; flattery. —v. (-eys, -eyed) flatter, cajole. [blarney, castle near cork]

Mullion  n. Vertical bar dividing the lights in a window.  mullioned adj. [probably french moinel middle: related to *mean3]

Revolutionize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) change fundamentally.

Uninformed  adj. Not informed; ignorant.

Centric  adj. 1 at or near the centre. 2 from a centre.  centrical adj. Centrically adv.

Rastafarian  (also rasta) —n. Member of a jamaican sect, often having dreadlocks and regarding haile selassie of ethiopia as god. —adj. Of this sect. [ras tafari, title of former emperor haile selassie]

Mo  abbr. 1 medical officer. 2 money order.

Dew  n. 1 condensed water vapour forming on cool surfaces at night. 2 similar glistening moisture.  dewy adj. (-ier, -iest). [old english]

Rejuvenate  v. (-ting) make (as if) young again.  rejuvenation n. [latin juvenis young]

Mooring  n. 1 (often in pl.) Place where a boat etc. Is moored. 2 (in pl.) Set of permanent anchors and chains.

Catkin  n. Small spike of usu. Hanging flowers on a willow, hazel, etc. [dutch, = kitten]

Iambus  n. (pl. -buses or -bi) metrical foot consisting of one short followed by one long syllable (&iambus.). [greek, = lampoon]

Perspiration  n. 1 sweat. 2 sweating. [french: related to *perspire]

Junta  n. (usu. Military) clique taking power in a coup d'état. [spanish: related to *join]

Unopened  adj. Not opened.

Atomize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) reduce to atoms or fine particles.

Uncharitable  adj. Censorious, severe in judgement.  uncharitably adv.

Intersperse  v. (-sing) 1 (often foll. By between, among) scatter. 2 (foll. By with) vary (a thing) by scattering other things among it.  interspersion n. [latin: related to *sparse]

Metallography  n. Descriptive science of metals.

Xylem  n. Bot. Woody tissue. [greek]

Numerical  adj. Of or relating to a number or numbers.  numerically adv. [medieval latin: related to *number]

Scatology  n. Excessive interest in excrement or obscenity.  scatological adj. [greek skor skat- dung]

Homesick  adj. Depressed by absence from home.  homesickness n.

Helpless  adj. 1 lacking help or protection; defenceless. 2 unable to act without help.  helplessly adv. Helplessness n.

Jungle  n. 1 a land overgrown with tangled vegetation, esp. In the tropics. B an area of this. 2 wild tangled mass. 3 place of bewildering complexity, confusion, or struggle.  law of the jungle state of ruthless competition.  jungly adj. [hindi from sanskrit]

Stagnant  adj. 1 (of liquid) motionless, having no current. 2 dull, sluggish.  stagnancy n. [latin stagnum pool]

Epitomize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make or be a perfect example of (a quality etc.).

Sat  abbr. Standard assessment task.

Misgive  v. (-ving; past -gave; past part. -given) (of a person's mind, heart, etc.) Fill (a person) with suspicion or foreboding.

Egalitarian  —adj. Of or advocating equal rights for all. —n. Egalitarian person.  egalitarianism n. [french égal *equal]

Prejudicial  adj. (often foll. By to) causing prejudice; detrimental.

Rsi  abbr. Repetitive strain injury.

Enema  n. 1 introduction of fluid etc. Into the rectum, esp. To flush out its contents. 2 fluid etc. Used for this. [greek hiemi send]

Phonetic  adj. 1 representing vocal sounds. 2 (of spelling etc.) Corresponding to pronunciation.  phonetically adv. [greek: related to *phoneme]

Sternum  n. (pl. -na or -nums) breastbone. [greek sternon chest]

Seek  v. (past and past part. Sought) 1 (often foll. By for, after) search or inquire. 2 a try or want to find or get or reach (sought my hand). B request (sought help). 3 endeavour (seek to please).  seek out 1 search for and find. 2 single out as a friend etc.  seeker n. [old english]

Fop  n. Dandy.  foppery n. Foppish adj. [perhaps from obsolete fop fool]

Morphine  n. Narcotic drug from opium, used to relieve pain. [latin morpheus god of sleep]

-let  suffix forming nouns, usu. Diminutive (flatlet) or denoting articles of ornament or dress (anklet). [french]

Aggrandize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 increase the power, rank or wealth of. 2 make seem greater.  aggrandizement n. [french: related to *grand]

Westbound  adj. Travelling or leading westwards.

Damned  colloq. —attrib. Adj. Damnable. —adv. Extremely (damned hot).  damned well = damn well. Do one's damnedest do one's utmost.

Tern  n. Marine gull-like bird with a long forked tail. [scandinavian]

Someone  n. & pron. = *somebody.

Larynx  n. (pl. Larynges or -xes) hollow organ in the throat holding the vocal cords. [latin from greek]

Implacable  adj. Unable to be appeased.  implacability n. Implacably adv.

Eradicate  v. (-ting) root out; destroy completely.  eradicable adj. Eradication n. Eradicator n. [latin radix -icis root]

Tenner  n. Colloq. Ten-pound or ten-dollar note.

Darned  adj. & adv. Colloq. = *damned.

Vainglory  n. Boastfulness; extreme vanity.  vainglorious adj. [french vaine gloire]

Dissolute  adj. Lax in morals; licentious. [latin: related to *dissolve]

Septic  adj. Contaminated with bacteria, putrefying. [greek sepo rot]

Discordant  adj. 1 disagreeing. 2 not in harmony; dissonant.  discordance n. Discordantly adv.

Den  n. 1 wild animal's lair. 2 place of crime or vice (opium den). 3 small private room. [old english]

Magpie  n. 1 a kind of crow with a long tail and black and white plumage. 2 chatterer. 3 indiscriminate collector. [from mag, abbreviation of margaret, *pie2]

Whereas  conj. 1 in contrast or comparison with the fact that. 2 (esp. In legal preambles) taking into consideration the fact that.

Caraway  n. Plant with tiny white flowers. [spanish from arabic]

Derris  n. 1 tropical climbing plant. 2 insecticide made from its root. [latin from greek]

Mantissa  n. Part of a logarithm after the decimal point. [latin, = makeweight]

Stanza  n. Basic metrical unit of a poem etc., typically of four to twelve rhymed lines. [italian]

Whirlpool  n. Powerful circular eddy of water.

Umbrage  n. Offence taken (esp. Take umbrage at). [latin: related to *umbra]

Rambler  n. 1 person who rambles. 2 straggling or spreading rose.

Equivocate  v. (-ting) use ambiguity to conceal the truth.  equivocation n. Equivocator n. [latin: related to *equivocal]

Vertebrate  —adj. (of an animal) having a backbone. —n. Vertebrate animal. [latin vertebratus jointed: related to *vertebra]

Arise  v. (-sing; past arose; past part. Arisen) 1 originate. 2 (usu. Foll. By from, out of) result. 3 come to one's notice; emerge. 4 rise, esp. From the dead or from kneeling. [old english a- intensive prefix]

Satisfactory  adj. Adequate; giving satisfaction.  satisfactorily adv.

Sailboard  n. Board with a mast and sail, used in windsurfing.  sailboarder n. Sailboarding n.

Deodorize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) remove or destroy the smell of.  deodorization n.

Supplant  v. Take the place of, esp. By underhand means. [latin supplanto trip up]

Disband  v. Break up; disperse.  disbandment n.

Medicine  n. 1 science or practice of the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease, esp. As distinct from surgery. 2 drug etc. For the treatment or prevention of disease, esp. Taken by mouth.  take one's medicine submit to something disagreeable. [latin medicina]

Spanish  —adj. Of spain, its people, or language. —n. 1 the language of spain and spanish america. 2 (the spanish) (pl.) The people of spain. [spain in europe]

Noonday  n. Midday.

Commandeer  v. 1 seize (esp. Goods) for military use. 2 take arbitrary possession of. [afrikaans kommanderen]

Gdp  abbr. Gross domestic product.

Antique  —n. Old object, esp. A piece of furniture, of high value. —adj. 1 of or from an early date. 2 old-fashioned. [latin antiquus]

Coy  adj. 1 affectedly shy. 2 irritatingly reticent.  coyly adv. Coyness n. [french: related to *quiet]

Catechist  n. Religious teacher, esp. One using a catechism.

Acknowledgement  n. 1 act of acknowledging. 2 a thing given or done in gratitude. B letter confirming receipt of something. 3 (usu. In pl.) Author's statement of gratitude, prefacing a book.

Allusion  n. (often foll. By to) passing or indirect reference.  allusive adj. [latin: related to *allude]

Fixer  n. 1 person or thing that fixes. 2 photog. Substance for fixing a photographic image etc. 3 colloq. Person who makes esp. Illicit deals.

Reservation  n. 1 reserving or being reserved. 2 thing booked, e.g. A room in a hotel. 3 spoken or unspoken limitation or exception to an agreement etc. 4 (in full central reservation) strip of land between the carriageways of a road. 5 area of land reserved for occupation by american indians etc. [latin: related to *reserve]

Apparel  n. Formal clothing, dress.  apparelled adj. [romanic, = make fit, from latin par equal]

Squander  v. Spend wastefully. [origin unknown]

Tudor  adj. 1 of the royal family of england 1485–1603 or this period. 2 of the architectural style of this period, esp. With half-timbering. [owen tudor, name of the grandfather of henry vii]

Semiprecious  adj. (of a gem) less valuable than a precious stone.

Bottomless  adj. 1 without a bottom. 2 inexhaustible.

Undertaker  n. Professional funeral organizer.

Correspond  v. 1 a (usu. Foll. By to) be similar or equivalent. B (usu. Foll. By with, to) be in agreement, not contradict. 2 (usu. Foll. By with) exchange letters.  correspondingly adv. [french from medieval latin]

Ragtag  n. (in full ragtag and bobtail) derog. Rabble or common people. [from *rag1]

Lily  n. (pl. -ies) 1 bulbous plant with large trumpet-shaped flowers on a tall stem. 2 heraldic fleur-de-lis. [latin lilium]

Clang  —n. Loud resonant metallic sound. —v. (cause to) make a clang. [imitative: cf. Latin clango resound]

Immaculate  adj. 1 perfectly clean and tidy. 2 perfect (immaculate timing). 3 innocent, faultless.  immaculately adv. Immaculateness n. [latin: related to *in-1, macula spot]

Skillet  n. 1 small long-handled metal cooking-pot. 2 us frying-pan. [french]

Yam  n. 1 a tropical or subtropical climbing plant. B edible starchy tuber of this. 2 us sweet potato. [portuguese or spanish]

Jingo  n. (pl. -es) supporter of war; blustering patriot.  by jingo! Mild oath.  jingoism n. Jingoist n. Jingoistic adj. [conjuror's word]

Jest  —n. 1 joke; fun. 2 a raillery, banter. B object of derision. —v. Joke; fool about.  in jest in fun. [latin gesta exploits]

Ingrained  adj. 1 deeply rooted; inveterate. 2 (of dirt etc.) Deeply embedded.

Asphyxiate  v. (-ting) suffocate.  asphyxiation n.

Tearoom  n. Small unlicensed café serving tea etc.

Bring  v. (past and past part. Brought) 1 come carrying; lead, accompany; convey. 2 cause or result in (war brings misery). 3 be sold for; produce as income. 4 a prefer (a charge). B initiate (legal action). 5 cause to become or to reach a state (brings me alive; cannot bring myself to agree). 6 adduce (evidence, an argument, etc.).  bring about cause to happen. Bring back call to mind. Bring down 1 cause to fall. 2 lower (a price). Bring forth 1 give birth to. 2 cause. Bring forward 1 move to an earlier time. 2 transfer from the previous page or account. 3 draw attention to. Bring home to cause to realize fully. Bring the house down receive rapturous applause. Bring in 1 introduce. 2 yield as income or profit. Bring off achieve successfully. Bring on cause to happen, appear, or make progress. Bring out 1 emphasize; make evident. 2 publish. Bring over convert to one's own side. Bring round 1 restore to consciousness. 2 persuade. Bring through aid (a person) through adversity, esp. Illness. Bring to restore to consciousness (brought him to). Bring up 1 rear (a child). 2 vomit. 3 call attention to. 4 (absol.) Stop suddenly. [old english]

Topper  n. Colloq. = *top hat.

Byplay  n. Secondary action, esp. In a play.

Cesarean  (brit. Caesarean) —adj. (of birth) effected by caesarean section. —n. Caesarean section. [from *caesar: julius caesar was supposedly born this way]

Secure  —adj. 1 untroubled by danger or fear. 2 safe. 3 reliable; stable; fixed. —v. (-ring) 1 make secure or safe. 2 fasten or close securely. 3 succeed in obtaining.  securely adv. [latin se without, cura care]

Godparent  n. Person who presents a child at baptism and responds on the child's behalf.

Acerbic  adj. Harsh and sharp, esp. In speech or manner.  acerbity n. (pl. -ies). [latin acerbus sour]

Fibreglass  n. (us fiberglass) 1 fabric made from woven glass fibres. 2 plastic reinforced by glass fibres.

Howitzer  n. Short gun for the high-angle firing of shells. [czech houfnice catapult]

Rustle  —v. (-ling) 1 (cause to) make a gentle sound as of dry blown leaves. 2 (also absol.) Steal (cattle or horses). —n. Rustling sound.  rustle up colloq. Produce at short notice.  rustler n. (esp. In sense 2 of v.). [imitative]

Demotic  —n. 1 colloquial form of a language. 2 simplified form of ancient egyptian writing (cf. *hieratic). —adj. 1 (esp. Of language) colloquial or vulgar. 2 of ancient egyptian or modern greek demotic. [greek demos the people]

Kindle  v. (-ling) 1 light, catch, or set on fire. 2 arouse or inspire. 3 become aroused or animated. [old norse]

Hank  n. Coil or skein of wool or thread etc. [old norse]

Agony  n. (pl. -ies) 1 extreme mental or physical suffering. 2 severe struggle. [greek agon struggle]

Roasting  —adj. Very hot. —n. Severe criticism or denunciation.

Immunology  n. The study of immunity.  immunological adj. Immunologist n.

Iberian  —adj. Of iberia, the peninsula comprising spain and portugal; of spain and portugal. —n. Native or language of iberia. [latin iberia]

Intramural  adj. 1 situated or done within the walls of an institution etc. 2 forming part of normal university etc. Studies.  intramurally adv. [latin murus wall]

Sherd  n. = *potsherd. [old english]

Decrepit  adj. 1 weakened by age or infirmity. 2 dilapidated.  decrepitude n. [latin crepo creak]

Methanal  n. = *formaldehyde. [from *methane, *aldehyde]

Unviable  adj. Not viable.

Wallaby  n. (pl. -ies) marsupial similar to but smaller than a kangaroo. [aboriginal]

Testicle  n. Male organ that produces spermatozoa etc., esp. One of a pair in the scrotum in man and most mammals. [latin, diminutive of testis witness]

Catechism  n. 1 a principles of a religion in the form of questions and answers. B book containing this. 2 series of questions. [church latin: related to *catechize]

Invention  n. 1 inventing or being invented. 2 thing invented. 3 fictitious story. 4 inventiveness.

Mall  n. 1 sheltered walk or promenade. 2 shopping precinct.  [the mall, street in london]

Waggish  adj. Playful, facetious.  waggishly adv. Waggishness n.

Dripping  n. Fat melted from roasted meat.

Ncb  abbr. Hist. National coal board.

Usage  since 1987 the official name has been british coal.

Carbuncle  n. 1 severe skin abscess. 2 bright-red gem. [latin: related to *carbon]

Drop  —n. 1 a globule of liquid that hangs, falls, or adheres to a surface. B very small amount of liquid (just a drop left). C glass etc. Of alcohol. 2 a abrupt fall or slope. B amount of this (drop of fifteen feet). C act of dropping. D fall in prices, temperature, etc. E deterioration (drop in status). 3 drop-shaped thing, esp. A pendant or sweet. 4 curtain or scenery let down on to a stage. 5 (in pl.) Liquid medicine used in drops (eye drops). 6 minute quantity. 7 slang hiding-place for stolen goods etc. 8 slang bribe. —v. (-pp-) 1 fall or let fall in drops, shed (tears, blood). 2 fall or allow to fall; let go. 3 a sink down from exhaustion or injury. B die. C fall naturally (drop asleep; drop into the habit). 4 a (cause to) cease or lapse; abandon. B colloq. Cease to associate with or discuss. 5 set down (a passenger etc.) (drop me here). 6 utter or be uttered casually (dropped a hint). 7 send casually (drop a line). 8 a fall or allow to fall in direction, amount, condition, degree, pitch, etc. (voice dropped; wind dropped; we dropped the price). B (of a person) jump down lightly; let oneself fall. C allow (trousers etc.) To fall to the ground. 9 omit (a letter) in speech (drop one's h's). 10 (as dropped adj.) In a lower position than usual (dropped handlebars; dropped waist). 11 give birth to (esp. A lamb). 12 lose (a game, point, etc.). 13 deliver by parachute etc. 14 football send (a ball), or score (a goal), by a drop-kick. 15 colloq. Dismiss or omit (dropped from the team).  at the drop of a hat promptly, instantly. Drop back (or behind) fall back; get left behind. Drop a brick colloq. Make an indiscreet or embarrassing remark. Drop a curtsy curtsy. Drop in (or by) colloq. Visit casually. Drop off 1 fall asleep. 2 drop (a passenger). Drop out colloq. Cease to participate.  droplet n. [old english]

Bootlicker  n. Colloq. Toady.

Uncanny  adj. (-ier, -iest) seemingly supernatural; mysterious.  uncannily adv. Uncanniness n.

Garden  —n. 1 piece of ground for growing flowers, fruit, or vegetables, and as a place of recreation. 2 (esp. In pl.) Grounds laid out for public enjoyment. 3 (attrib.) Cultivated (garden plants). —v. Cultivate or tend a garden.  gardening n. [germanic: related to *yard2]

Clanger  n. Slang mistake, blunder.

Medicare  n. Us federally funded health insurance scheme for the elderly. [from *medical, *care]

Anchorite  n. Hermit; religious recluse. [greek anakhoreo retire]

Glen  n. Narrow valley. [gaelic]

Darner  n. Needle for darning.

Precious  —adj. 1 of great value or worth. 2 beloved; much prized (precious memories). 3 affectedly refined. 4 colloq. Often iron. A considerable (a precious lot of good). B expressing contempt or disdain (keep your precious flowers!). —adv. Colloq. Extremely, very (had precious little left).  preciousness n. [latin pretium price]

Nausea  n. 1 inclination to vomit. 2 revulsion. [greek naus ship]

Mayhem  n. Destruction; havoc. [anglo-french mahem: related to *maim]

Dabble  v. (-ling) 1 (usu. Foll. By in, at) engage (in an activity etc.) Superficially. 2 move the feet, hands, etc. In esp. Shallow liquid. 3 wet partly; stain, splash.  dabbler n. [from *dab1]

Interesting  adj. Causing curiosity; holding the attention.  interestingly adv.

Heckle  —v. (-ling) interrupt and harass (a public speaker). —n. Act of heckling.  heckler n. [var. Of *hackle]

Cabman  n. Driver of a cab.

Centerboard  n. (brit. Centreboard) board lowered through a boat's keel to prevent leeway.

Woodcut  n. 1 relief cut on wood. 2 print made from this.

Slake  v. (-king) 1 assuage or satisfy (thirst, a desire, etc.). 2 temper (quicklime) by combination with water. [old english: related to *slack1]

Convene  v. (-ning) 1 summon or arrange (a meeting etc.). 2 assemble. [latin venio vent- come]

Adore  v. (-ring) 1 love intensely. 2 worship as divine. 3 colloq. Like very much.  adoration n. Adorer n. [latin adoro worship]

Fescue  n. A pasture and fodder grass. [latin festuca stalk, straw]

Sewage  n. Waste matter conveyed in sewers. [from *sewer]

Movie  n. Esp. Us colloq. Cinema film.

Lei  n. Polynesian garland of flowers. [hawaiian]

Glasshouse  n. 1 greenhouse. 2 slang military prison.

Kapok  n. Fine fibrous cotton-like substance from a tropical tree, used for padding. [malay]

Handicap  —n. 1 physical or mental disability. 2 thing that makes progress or success difficult. 3 a disadvantage imposed on a superior competitor to make chances more equal. B race etc. In which this is imposed. 4 number of strokes by which a golfer normally exceeds par for a course. —v. (-pp-) 1 impose a handicap on. 2 place at a disadvantage. [hand i' (= in) cap describing a kind of sporting lottery]

Male  —adj. 1 of the sex that can beget offspring by fertilization. 2 of men or male animals, plants, etc.; masculine. 3 (of plants or flowers) containing stamens but no pistil. 4 (of parts of machinery etc.) Designed to enter or fill the corresponding hollow part (male screw). —n. Male person or animal.  maleness n.  [latin masculus from mas a male]

Judgement  n. (also judgment) 1 critical faculty; discernment (error of judgement). 2 good sense. 3 opinion or estimate (in my judgement). 4 sentence of a court of justice. 5 often joc. Deserved misfortune.  against one's better judgement contrary to what one really feels to be advisable.

Herbal  —adj. Of herbs in medicinal and culinary use. —n. Book describing the medicinal and culinary uses of herbs.

Vitrify  v. (-ies, -ied) change into glass or a glasslike substance, esp. By heat.  vitrifaction n. Vitrification n. [french or medieval latin: related to *vitreous]

Squaddie  n. (also squaddy) (pl. -ies) slang recruit; private.

Epoxy  adj. Relating to or derived from a compound with one oxygen atom and two carbon atoms bonded in a triangle. [from *epi-, *oxygen]

Mogadon  n. Propr. Hypnotic drug used to treat insomnia.

Alienable  adj. Law able to be transferred to new ownership.

Write  v. (-ting; past wrote; past part. Written) 1 mark paper or some other surface with symbols, letters, or words. 2 form or mark (such symbols etc.). 3 form or mark the symbols of (a word or sentence, or document etc.). 4 fill or complete (a sheet, cheque, etc.) With writing. 5 transfer (data) into a computer store. 6 (esp.

Open  —adj. 1 not closed, locked, or blocked up; allowing access. 2 unenclosed, unconfined, unobstructed (the open road; open views). 3 a uncovered, bare, exposed (open drain; open wound). B (of a goal etc.) Unprotected, undefended. 4 undisguised, public, manifest (open hostilities). 5 expanded, unfolded, or spread out (had the map open on the table). 6 (of a fabric) not close; with gaps. 7 a frank and communicative. B open-minded. 8 a accessible to visitors or customers; ready for business. B (of a meeting) admitting all, not restricted to members etc. 9 (of a race, competition, scholarship, etc.) Unrestricted as to who may compete. 10 (foll. By to) a willing to receive (is open to offers). B (of a choice, offer, or opportunity) available (three courses open to us). C vulnerable to, allowing of (open to abuse; open to doubt). 11 (of a return ticket) not restricted as to the day of travel. —v. 1 make or become open or more open. 2 (foll. By into, on to, etc.) (of a door, room, etc.) Give access as specified (opened on to a patio). 3 a start, establish, or set going (a business, activity, etc.) (opened a new shop; opened fire). B start (conference opens today). 4 (often foll. By with) start; begin speaking, writing, etc. (show opens with a song; he opened with a joke). 5 ceremonially declare (a building etc.) In use. —n. 1 (prec. By the) a open space, country, or air. B public notice; general attention (esp. Into the open). 2 open championship or competition etc.  open a person's eyes enlighten a person. Open out 1 unfold. 2 develop, expand. 3 become communicative. Open up 1 unlock (premises). 2 make accessible. 3 reveal; bring to notice. 4 accelerate. 5 begin shooting or sounding.  openness n. [old english]

Spathe  n. Large bract(s) enveloping a flower-cluster. [greek spathe broad blade]

Disown  v. Deny or give up any connection with; repudiate.

Technicality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being technical. 2 technical expression. 3 technical point or detail (acquitted on a technicality).

Laudatory  adj. Praising.

Usage  laudatory is sometimes confused with laudable.

Exuberant  adj. 1 lively, high-spirited. 2 (of a plant etc.) Prolific. 3 (of feelings etc.) Abounding.  exuberance n. Exuberantly adv. [latin uber fertile]

Unshockable  adj. Unable to be shocked.

Madly  adv. 1 in a mad manner. 2 colloq. A passionately. B extremely.

Tournament  n. 1 large contest of many rounds (chess tournament). 2 display of military exercises etc. (royal tournament). 3 hist. Pageant with jousting. [french: related to *tourney]

Unsuited  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By for) not fit. 2 (usu. Foll. By to) not adapted.

Backlog  n. Arrears of work.

Iridium  n. Hard white metallic element of the platinum group.

Rediffusion  n. Relaying of broadcast programmes, esp. By cable from a central receiver.

Tarpaulin  n. 1 heavy-duty cloth waterproofed esp. With tar. 2 sheet or covering of this. [from *tar1, *pall1]

Hartebeest  n. Large african antelope with curving horns. [afrikaans]

Millpond  n. Pool of water retained by a dam for operating a mill-wheel.  like a millpond (of water) very calm.

Alto  n. (pl. -s) 1 = *contralto. 2 a highest adult male singing-voice, above tenor. B singer with this voice. 3 instrument pitched second- or third-highest in its family. [italian alto (canto) high (singing)]

Sedation  n. Act of calming, esp. By sedatives. [latin: related to *sedate]

Peccadillo  n. (pl. -es or -s) trifling offence; venial sin. [spanish pecadillo, from latin pecco to sin (v.)]

Villa  n. 1 country house; mansion. 2 rented holiday home, esp. Abroad. 3 (usu. As part of an address) detached or semi-detached house in a residential district. [italian and latin]

Conjoint  adj. Formal associated, conjoined.

Ps  abbr. Postscript.

Pyx  n. Vessel for the consecrated bread of the eucharist. [greek puxis *box1]

Baffle  —v. (-ling) 1 perplex. 2 frustrate, hinder. —n. Device that checks flow esp. Of fluid or sound waves.  bafflement n. [origin uncertain]

Jug  —n. 1 deep vessel for liquids, with a handle and a lip for pouring. 2 contents of this. 3 slang prison. —v. (-gg-) (usu. As jugged adj.) Stew or boil (esp. Hare) in a casserole etc.  jugful n. (pl. -s). [origin uncertain]

Recrudesce  v. (-cing) formal (of a disease, problem, etc.) Break out again.  recrudescence n. Recrudescent adj. [latin: related to *crude]

Headset  n. Headphones, often with a microphone attached.

Ungrudging  adj. Not grudging.

Overpass  n. Road or railway line that passes over another by means of a bridge.

Tyrant  n. 1 oppressive or cruel ruler. 2 person exercising power arbitrarily or cruelly. [greek turannos]

Isomer  n. One of two or more compounds with the same molecular formula but a different arrangement of atoms.  isomeric adj. Isomerism n. [greek *iso-, meros share]

Indenture  —n. 1 (usu. In pl.) Sealed agreement or contract. 2 formal list, certificate, etc. —v. (-ring) hist. Bind by indentures, esp. As an apprentice. [anglo-french: related to *indent]

Kindling  n. Small sticks etc. For lighting fires.

Coachload  n. Group of tourists etc. Taken by coach.

Aetiology  n. (us etiology) study of causation or of the causes of disease.  aetiological adj. [greek aitia cause]

Dressmaker  n. Person who makes women's clothes, esp. For a living.  dressmaking n.

Commiserate  v. (-ting) (usu. Foll. By with) express or feel sympathy.  commiseration n. [latin: related to *miser]

Infirmary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 hospital. 2 sick-quarters in a school etc.

Debag  v. (-gg-) slang remove the trousers of (a person), esp. As a joke.

Cupidity  n. Greed; avarice. [latin: related to *cupid]

Clodhopper  n. (usu. In pl.) Colloq. Large heavy shoe.

Espy  v. (-ies, -ied) catch sight of. [french: related to *spy]

Transmitter  n. 1 person or thing that transmits. 2 equipment used to transmit radio or other electronic signals.

Original  —adj. 1 existing from the beginning; earliest; innate. 2 inventive; creative; not derivative or imitative. 3 not copied or translated; by the artist etc. Himself (in the original greek; has an original rembrandt). —n. Original model, pattern, picture, etc. From which another is copied or translated.  originality n. Originally adv.

Tacho  n. (pl. -s) colloq. = *tachometer. [abbreviation]

Barathea  n. Fine wool cloth. [origin unknown]

Donna  n. Title of an italian, spanish, or portuguese lady. [latin domina mistress]

Odyssey  n. (pl. -s) long adventurous journey. [title of the homeric epic poem on the adventures of odysseus]

Blackberry  n. (pl. -ies) black fleshy edible fruit of the bramble.

Dumpy  adj. (-ier, -iest) short and stout.  dumpily adv. Dumpiness n. [related to *dumpling]

Registry  n. (pl. -ies) place where registers or records are kept. [medieval latin: related to *register]

Spry  adj. (spryer, spryest) lively, nimble.  spryly adv. [origin unknown]

Wholemeal  n. (usu. Attrib.) Meal or flour with none of the bran or germ removed.

Hele  v. (-ling) (also heel) (foll. By in) set (a plant) in the ground temporarily and cover its roots. [old english]

Farther  var. Of *further (esp. Of physical distance).

Alibi  n. (pl. -s) 1 claim or proof that one was elsewhere when a crime etc. Was committed. 2 informal excuse. [latin, = elsewhere]

Usage  the use of alibi in sense 2 is considered incorrect by some people.

Wellies  n.pl. Colloq. Wellingtons. [abbreviation]

Crucifixion  n. 1 crucifying or being crucified. 2 (crucifixion) crucifixion of christ. [church latin: related to *crucifix]

Unimpaired  adj. Not impaired.

Pollack  n. (also pollock) (pl. Same or -s) edible marine fish related to the cod. [origin unknown]

Lurk  v. 1 linger furtively. 2 a lie in ambush. B (usu. Foll. By in, under, about, etc.) Hide, esp. For sinister purposes. 3 (as lurking adj.) Dormant (a lurking suspicion). [perhaps from *lour]

Jackboot  n. 1 military boot reaching above the knee. 2 this as a militaristic or fascist symbol.

Limpet  n. Marine gastropod with a conical shell, sticking tightly to rocks. [old english]

Ream  n. 1 twenty quires of paper. 2 (in pl.) Large quantity of writing. [arabic, = bundle]

Aristocracy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 ruling class or élite; nobility. 2 a government by an élite. B state so governed. 3 (often foll. By of) best representatives. [greek aristokratia rule by the best]

Incompatible  adj. Not compatible.  incompatibility n.

Apiculture  n. Bee-keeping.  apiculturist n. [latin apis bee, *culture]

Inquiry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 investigation, esp. An official one. 2 = *enquiry.

Awning  n. Sheet of canvas etc. Stretched on a frame as a shelter against the sun or rain. [origin uncertain]

Fraud  n. 1 criminal deception. 2 dishonest artifice or trick. 3 person or thing that is not what it claims to be. [latin fraus fraud-]

Unsay  v. (past and past part. Unsaid) retract (a statement).

Tandoori  n. Food spiced and cooked over charcoal in a tandoor (often attrib.: tandoori chicken). [hindustani]

Monsieur  n. (pl. Messieurs) title used of or to a french-speaking man, corresponding to mr or sir. [french mon my, sieur lord]

Doorpost  n. Upright of a door-frame, on which the door is hung.

Abacus  n. (pl. -cuses) 1 frame with wires along which beads are slid for calculating. 2 archit. Flat slab on top of a capital. [latin from greek from hebrew]

Deselect  v. Reject (a selected candidate, esp. A sitting mp) in favour of another.  deselection n.

Repertoire  n. 1 stock of works that a performer etc. Knows or is prepared to perform. 2 stock of techniques etc. (repertoire of excuses). [latin: related to *repertory]

Enshroud  v. Literary 1 cover with or as with a shroud. 2 obscure.

Eventuate  v. (-ting) (often foll. By in) result.

Accusatory  adj. Of or implying accusation.

Devious  adj. 1 not straightforward, underhand. 2 winding, circuitous.  deviously adv. Deviousness n. [latin via way]

Tuna  n. (pl. Same or -s) 1 large edible marine fish. 2 (in full tuna-fish) its flesh as food. [american spanish]

Dreamboat  n. Colloq. Sexually attractive or ideal person.

Streetcar  n. Us tram.

Equal  —adj. 1 (often foll. By to, with) the same in quantity, quality, size, degree, level, etc. 2 evenly balanced (an equal contest). 3 having the same rights or status (human beings are essentially equal). 4 uniform in application or effect. —n. Person or thing equal to another, esp. In rank or quality. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 be equal to. 2 achieve something that is equal to.  be equal to have the ability or resources for. [latin aequalis]

Impair  v. Damage, weaken.  impairment n. [latin, = make worse, from pejor]

Smithereens  n.pl. Small fragments. [dial. Smithers]

Avesta  n. (usu. Prec. By the) sacred writings of zoroastrianism (cf. *zend). [persian]

Hell  —n. 1 place regarded in some religions as the abode of the dead, or of devils and condemned sinners. 2 place or state of misery or wickedness. —int. Expressing anger, surprise, etc.  the hell (usu. Prec. By what, where, who, etc.) Expressing anger, disbelief, etc. (who the hell is this?; the hell you are!). Beat etc. The hell out of colloq. Beat etc. Without restraint. Come hell or high water no matter what the difficulties. For the hell of it colloq. Just for fun. Get hell colloq. Be severely scolded or punished. Give a person hell colloq. Scold or punish a person. A (or one) hell of a colloq. Outstanding example of (a hell of a mess; one hell of a party). Like hell colloq. 1 not at all. 2 recklessly, exceedingly. [old english]

Stepdaughter  n. Female stepchild.

Sanctimonious  adj. Ostentatiously pious.  sanctimoniously adv. Sanctimoniousness n. Sanctimony n. [latin sanctimonia sanctity]

Leap  —v. (past and past part. Leaped or leapt) jump or spring forcefully. —n. Forceful jump.  by leaps and bounds with startlingly rapid progress. Leap in the dark daring step or enterprise. [old english]

Iridaceous  adj. Of the iris family of plants.

Wager  n. & v. = *bet. [anglo-french: related to *wage]

Dilemma  n. 1 situation in which a difficult choice has to be made. 2 difficult situation, predicament. [greek lemma premiss]

Usage  the use of dilemma in sense 2 is considered incorrect by some people.

Malinger  v. Pretend to be ill, esp. To escape work.  malingerer n.  [french malingre sickly]

Decimeter  n. (brit. -metre) metric unit of length, equal to 0.1 metre.

Oneness  n. 1 singleness. 2 uniqueness. 3 agreement. 4 sameness.

We  pron. (obj. Us; poss. Our, ours) 1 pl. Of *i2. 2 used for or by a royal person in a proclamation etc. Or by an editor etc. In a formal context. [old english]

Conquest  n. 1 conquering or being conquered. 2 a conquered territory. B something won. 3 person whose affection has been won.

Crier  n. (also cryer) 1 person who cries. 2 official making public announcements in a lawcourt or street. [related to *cry]

Pentameter  n. Line of verse with five metrical feet. [greek: see *penta-, *-meter]

Wholehearted  adj. 1 completely devoted. 2 done with all possible effort or sincerity.  wholeheartedly adv.

Disappointment  n. 1 person or thing that disappoints. 2 being disappointed.

Pe  abbr. Physical education.

Buddhism  n. Asian religion or philosophy founded by gautama buddha.  buddhist n. & adj.

Cranberry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 shrub with small red acid berries. 2 this berry used in cookery. [german kranbeere crane-berry]

Urban  adj. Of, living in, or situated in a town or city. [latin urbs city]

Cremate  v. (-ting) burn (a corpse etc.) To ashes.  cremation n. [latin cremo burn]

Kafkaesque  adj. Impenetrably oppressive or nightmarish, as in the fiction of franz kafka.

Domain  n. 1 area under one rule; realm. 2 estate etc. Under one control. 3 sphere of control or influence. [french: related to *demesne]

Corpus  n. (pl. -pora) body or collection of writings, texts, etc. [latin, = body]

Christ  —n. 1 title, also now treated as a name, given to jesus. 2 messiah as prophesied in the old testament. —int. Slang expressing surprise, anger, etc. [greek, = anointed]

Prat  n. Slang 1 fool. 2 buttocks. [origin unknown]

Devour  v. 1 eat voraciously. 2 (of fire etc.) Engulf, destroy. 3 take in eagerly (devoured the play). 4 preoccupy (devoured by fear). [latin voro swallow]

Krummhorn  n. (also crumhorn) medieval wind instrument. [german]

Factious  adj. Of, characterized by, or inclined to faction. [latin: related to *faction]

Arrogant  adj. Aggressively assertive or presumptuous.  arrogance n. Arrogantly adv. [related to *arrogate]

Chaparral  n. Us dense tangled brushwood. [spanish]

Greedy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 having or showing greed. 2 (foll. By for, or to + infin.) Very eager.  greedily adv. Greediness n. [old english]

Spectacled  adj. Wearing spectacles.

Ferric  adj. 1 of iron. 2 containing iron in a trivalent form. [latin ferrum iron]

Degeneration  n. 1 becoming degenerate. 2 med. Morbid deterioration of body tissue etc. [latin: related to *degenerate]

Macaroni  n. Small pasta tubes. [italian from greek]

Electroencephalograph  n. Instrument that records the electrical activity of the brain.

Liverwort  n. Small mosslike or leafless plant sometimes lobed like a liver.

Ophthalmic  adj. Of or relating to the eye and its diseases.

Quayside  n. Land forming or near a quay.

Silvery  adj. 1 like silver in colour or appearance. 2 having a clear gentle ringing sound.

Kittiwake  n. A kind of small seagull. [imitative of its cry]

Tropical  adj. Of or typical of the tropics.

Mahatma  n. 1 (in india etc.) Revered person. 2 one of a class of persons supposed by some buddhists to have preternatural powers. [sanskrit, = great soul]

Affectionate  adj. Loving, fond.  affectionately adv.

Twerp  n. (also twirp) slang stupid or objectionable person. [origin unknown]

Suffice  v. (-cing) 1 (often foll. By for, or to + infin.) Be adequate. 2 satisfy.  suffice it to say i shall say only this. [latin sufficio]

Crumb  —n. 1 a small fragment, esp. Of bread. B small particle (crumb of comfort). 2 bread without crusts. 3 slang objectionable person. —v. Cover with or break into breadcrumbs. [old english]

Prestressed  adj. (of concrete) strengthened by stretched wires within it.

Embattled  adj. 1 prepared or arrayed for battle. 2 fortified with battlements. 3 under heavy attack or in trying circumstances.

Filthy  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 extremely or disgustingly dirty. 2 obscene. 3 colloq. (of weather) very unpleasant. —adv. 1 filthily (filthy dirty). 2 colloq. Extremely (filthy rich).  filthily adv. Filthiness n.

Gateau  n. (pl. -s or -x) large rich cake filled with cream etc. [french]

Shall  v.aux. (3rd sing. Present shall; archaic 2nd sing. Present shalt; past should) (foll. By infin. Without to, or absol.; present and past only in use) 1 (in the 1st person) expressing the future tense or (with shall stressed) emphatic intention (i shall return soon). 2 (in the 2nd and 3rd persons) expressing a strong assertion, command, or duty (they shall go to the party; thou shalt not steal; they shall obey). 3 (in 2nd-person questions) expressing an enquiry, esp. To avoid the form of a request (shall you go to france?).  shall i? (or we) do you want me (or us) to? [old english]

Spotless  adj. Absolutely clean or pure.  spotlessly adv.

Gnomic  adj. Of aphorisms; sententious. [greek gnome opinion]

Prosperous  adj. 1 successful; rich; thriving. 2 auspicious (prosperous wind).  prosperously adv. [french from latin]

Dogsbody  n. (pl. -ies) colloq. Drudge.

Whoops  int. Colloq. Expressing surprise or apology, esp. On losing balance or making an obvious mistake. [var. Of *oops]

Touching  —adj. Moving; pathetic. —prep. Literary concerning.  touchingly adv.

Ceremony  n. (pl. -ies) 1 formal procedure, esp. At a public event or anniversary. 2 formalities, esp. Ritualistic. 3 excessively polite behaviour.  stand on ceremony insist on formality. [latin caerimonia worship]

Meths  n. Colloq. Methylated spirit. [abbreviation]

Carminative  —adj. Relieving flatulence. —n. Carminative drug. [latin carmino heal by *charm]

Accusation  n. Accusing or being accused. [french: related to *accuse]

Jaunty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 cheerful and self-confident. 2 sprightly.  jauntily adv. Jauntiness n. [french: related to *gentle]

Apolitical  adj. Not interested in or concerned with politics.

Locution  n. 1 word, phrase, or idiom. 2 style of speech. [latin loquor locut- speak]

Spider  n. Eight-legged arthropod of which many species spin webs esp. To capture insects as food. [old english: related to *spin]

Phlox  n. (pl. Same or -es) plant with scented clusters of esp. White, blue, or red flowers. [greek phlox, name of a plant (literally ‘flame’)]

Presumably  adv. As may reasonably be presumed.

Outweigh  v. Exceed in weight, value, importance, or influence.

Arcane  adj. Mysterious, secret. [latin arceo shut up]

Sombre  adj. (also us somber) dark, gloomy, dismal.  sombrely adv. Sombreness n. [latin sub ombra under shade]

Valediction  n. Formal 1 bidding farewell. 2 words used in this.  valedictory adj. & n. (pl. -ies). [latin vale farewell]

Sedition  n. Conduct or speech inciting to rebellion.  seditious adj. [latin seditio]

Invert  v. 1 turn upside down. 2 reverse the position, order, or relation of. [latin verto vers- turn]

Observant  adj. 1 acute in taking notice. 2 attentive in observance.  observantly adv.

Escutcheon  n. Shield or emblem bearing a coat of arms. [latin scutum shield]

Fleabag  n. Slang shabby or unattractive person or thing.

Crumhorn  var. Of *krummhorn.

Buzzard  n. Large bird of the hawk family. [latin buteo falcon]

Material  —n. 1 matter from which a thing is made. 2 cloth, fabric. 3 (in pl.) Things needed for an activity (building materials). 4 person or thing of a specified kind or suitable for a purpose (officer material). 5 (in sing. Or pl.) Information etc. For a book etc. 6 (in sing. Or pl., often foll. By of) elements, constituent parts, or substance. —adj. 1 of matter; corporeal; not spiritual. 2 of bodily comfort etc. (material well-being). 3 (often foll. By to) important, significant, relevant. [latin materia *matter]

Reprogram  v. (also reprogramme) (-mm-; us -m-) program (esp. A computer) again or differently.  reprogramable adj. (also reprogrammable).

Unhurried  adj. Not hurried.

Diddle  v. (-ling) colloq. Swindle. [probably from diddler, name of a character in a 19th-c. Play]

Haka  n. Nz 1 maori ceremonial war dance with chanting. 2 imitation of this by a sports team before a match. [maori]

Unfortunate  —adj. 1 unlucky. 2 unhappy. 3 regrettable. —n. Unfortunate person.

Siphon  —n. 1 tube shaped like an inverted v or u with unequal legs, used to convey liquid from a container to a lower level by atmospheric pressure. 2 bottle from which aerated water is forced by the pressure of gas. —v. (often foll. By off) 1 (cause to) flow through a siphon. 2 divert or set aside (funds etc.). [greek, = pipe]

Tombola  n. Lottery with tickets drawn from a drum for immediate prizes. [french or italian]

Rain  —n. 1 a condensed atmospheric moisture falling in drops. B fall of such drops. 2 (in pl.) A (prec. By the) rainy season. B rainfalls. 3 a falling liquid or solid particles or objects. B rainlike descent of these. —v. 1 (prec. By it as subject) rain falls. 2 a fall like rain. B (prec. By it as subject) send in large quantities. 3 send down like rain; lavishly bestow (rained blows upon him). 4 (of the sky, clouds, etc.) Send down rain.  rain off (or us out) (esp.

Apse  n. Large arched or domed recess, esp. At the end of a church. [related to *apsis]

Sleepless  adj. 1 lacking sleep (sleepless night). 2 unable to sleep. 3 continually active.  sleeplessness n.

Limit  —n. 1 point, line, or level beyond which something does not or may not extend or pass. 2 greatest or smallest amount permissible. —v. (-t-) 1 set or serve as a limit to. 2 (foll. By to) restrict.  be the limit colloq. Be intolerable. Within limits with some degree of freedom.  limitless adj. [latin limes limit- boundary, frontier]

Summary  —n. (pl. -ies) brief account. —adj. Without details or formalities; brief.  summarily adv. [latin: related to *sum]

Vicarious  adj. 1 experienced indirectly or second-hand. 2 acting or done for another. 3 deputed, delegated.  vicariously adv. [latin: related to *vicar]

Millimeter  n. (brit. -metre) one-thousandth of a metre (0.039 in.).

Chess  n. Game for two with 16 men each, played on a chessboard. [french: related to *check]

Memorabilia  n.pl. Souvenirs of memorable events. [latin: related to *memorable]

Capriole  —n. Leap, caper, esp. Of a trained horse. —v. (-ling) perform this. [italian: related to *capricorn]

Shale  n. Soft rock of consolidated mud or clay that splits easily.  shaly adj. [german: related to *scale2]

Froth  —n. 1 foam. 2 idle or amusing talk etc. —v. 1 emit or gather froth. 2 cause (beer etc.) To foam.  frothy adj. (-ier, -iest). [old norse]

Hermetic  adj. With an airtight closure.  hermetically adv. [from the greek god hermes, regarded as the founder of alchemy]

Trigger  —n. 1 movable device for releasing a spring or catch and so setting off a mechanism (esp. That of a gun). 2 event, occurrence, etc., that sets off a chain reaction. —v. (often foll. By off) set (an action or process) in motion; precipitate.  quick on the trigger quick to respond. [tricker from dutch trekker from trekken pull]

Papa  n. Archaic father (esp. As a child's word). [greek papas]

Peaceful  adj. 1 characterized by peace; tranquil. 2 not infringing peace (peaceful coexistence).  peacefully adv. Peacefulness n.

Creel  n. Fisherman's large wicker basket. [origin unknown]

Recce  colloq. —n. Reconnaissance. —v. (recced, recceing) reconnoitre. [abbreviation]

Antilog  n. Colloq. = *antilogarithm. [abbreviation]

Curiosity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 eager desire to know; inquisitiveness. 2 strange, rare, etc. Object. [latin: related to *curious]

Overstuffed  adj. 1  (of furniture) made soft and comfortable by thick upholstery. 2 stuffed too full.

Erratum  n. (pl. Errata) error in printing or writing. [latin: related to *err]

Hydro  n. (pl. -s) colloq. 1 hotel or clinic etc., orig. Providing hydropathic treatment. 2 hydroelectric power plant. [abbreviation]

Towards  prep. 1 in the direction of (set out towards town). 2 as regards; in relation to (attitude towards death). 3 as a contribution to; for (put it towards her holiday). 4 near (towards the end of our journey). [old english, = future: related to *to, *-ward]

Fabricate  v. (-ting) 1 construct, esp. From components. 2 invent (a story etc.). 3 forge (a document).  fabrication n. Fabricator n. [latin: related to *fabric]

Lout  n. Rough-mannered person.  loutish adj. [origin uncertain]

Musical  —adj. 1 of music. 2 (of sounds etc.) Melodious, harmonious. 3 fond of, sensitive to, or skilled in music. 4 set to or accompanied by music. —n. Musical film or play.  musicality n. Musically adv.

Waltz  —n. 1 ballroom dance in triple time performed by couples revolving with sliding steps. 2 music for this. —v. 1 dance a waltz. 2 (often foll. By in, out, round, etc.) Colloq. Move easily, lightly, casually, etc.  waltz off with colloq. 1 steal. 2 win easily. [german walzer from walzen revolve]

Inductance  n. Property of an electric circuit generating an electromotive force by virtue of the current flowing through it.

Fiat  n. 1 authorization. 2 decree. [latin, = let it be done]

Unvarnished  adj. 1 not varnished. 2 plain and straightforward (the unvarnished truth).

Irritable  adj. 1 easily annoyed. 2 (of an organ etc.) Very sensitive to contact.  irritability n. Irritably adv. [latin: related to *irritate]

Norse  —n. 1 norwegian language. 2 scandinavian language-group. —adj. Of ancient scandinavia, esp. Norway.  norseman n. [dutch noor(d)sch northern]

Inchoate  adj. 1 just begun. 2 undeveloped.  inchoation n. [latin inchoo, incoho begin]

Usage  inchoate is sometimes used incorrectly to mean ‘chaotic’ or ‘incoherent’.

Infinite  —adj. 1 boundless, endless. 2 very great or many. —n. 1 (the infinite) god. 2 (the infinite) infinite space.  infinitely adv. [latin: related to *in-1, *finite]

Footage  n. 1 a length of tv or cinema film etc. 2 length in feet.

Vane  n. 1 weather-vane. 2 blade of a screw propeller or windmill etc. [dial. Var. Of obsolete fane banner]

Yeomanry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 body or class of yeomen. 2 hist. Volunteer cavalry force raised from the yeoman class.

Bole  n. Trunk of a tree. [old norse]

Province  n. 1 principal administrative division of a country etc. 2 (the provinces) country outside a capital city, esp. Regarded as uncultured or unsophisticated. 3 sphere of action; business (outside my province). 4 branch of learning etc. (in the province of aesthetics). 5 district under an archbishop or metropolitan. 6 territory outside italy under an ancient roman governor. [latin provincia]

Barricade  —n. Barrier, esp. Improvised. —v. (-ding) block or defend with this. [french barrique cask]

Yorkist  —n. Hist. Follower of the house of york, esp. In the wars of the roses. —adj. Of the house of york.

Electromotive  adj. Producing or tending to produce an electric current.

China  —n. 1 fine white or translucent ceramic ware, porcelain, etc. 2 things made of this. —adj. Made of china. [china in asia]

Selvage  n. (also selvedge) fabric edging woven to prevent cloth from fraying. [from *self, *edge]

Clergy  n. (pl. -ies) (usu. Treated as pl.) Those ordained for religious duties. [french (related to *cleric) and church latin]

Abhorrence  n. Disgust; detestation.

Postwar  adj. Occurring or existing after a war.

Aphelion  n. (pl. -lia) point in a celestial body's orbit where it is furthest from the sun. [greek aph'heliou from the sun]

Oompah  n. Colloq. Rhythmical sound of deep brass instruments. [imitative]

Unsmoked  adj. Not cured by smoking (unsmoked bacon).

Maximize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make as large or great as possible.  maximization n. [latin: related to *maximum]

Usage  maximize should not be used in standard english to mean ‘to make as good as possible’ or ‘to make the most of’.

Accretion  n. 1 growth or increase by accumulation, addition, or organic enlargement. 2 the resulting whole. 3 a matter so added. B adhesion of this to the core matter. [latin cresco cret- grow]

Dormer  n. (in full dormer window) projecting upright window in a sloping roof. [french: related to *dormant]

Yonder  —adv. Over there; at some distance in that direction; in the place indicated. —adj. Situated yonder.

Quits  predic. Adj. On even terms by retaliation or repayment.  call it quits acknowledge that things are now even; agree to stop quarrelling. [probably related to *quit]

Fastidious  adj. 1 excessively discriminatory; fussy. 2 easily disgusted; squeamish.  fastidiously adv. Fastidiousness n. [latin fastidium loathing]

Preshrunk  adj. (of fabric etc.) Treated so that it shrinks during manufacture and not in use.

Unrealistic  adj. Not realistic.  unrealistically adv.

Vacancy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being vacant. 2 unoccupied job. 3 available room in a hotel etc.

Capricorn  n. 1 constellation and tenth sign of the zodiac (the goat). 2 person born when the sun is in this sign. [latin caper -pri goat, cornu horn]

Obligatory  adj. 1 binding. 2 compulsory.  obligatorily adv. [latin: related to *oblige]

Electrotherapy  n. Treatment of diseases by use of electricity.

Dandify  v. (-ies, -ied) make a dandy.

Conflagration  n. Great and destructive fire. [latin: related to *flagrant]

Shipowner  n. Owner of a ship, ships, or shares in ships.

Romanic  —n. = *romance n. 6. —adj. 1 a of romance. B romance-speaking. 2 descended from, or inheriting the civilization etc. Of, the ancient romans. [latin romanicus: related to *roman]

Echinoderm  n. (usu. Spiny) sea animal of the group including the starfish and sea urchin. [greek ekhinos sea-urchin, derma skin]

Pliers  n.pl. Pincers with parallel flat surfaces for holding small objects, bending wire, etc. [from dial. Ply bend: related to *pliable]

Maori  —n. (pl. Same or -s) 1 member of the aboriginal people of new zealand. 2 their language. —adj. Of this people. [native name]

Gym  n. Colloq. 1 gymnasium. 2 gymnastics. [abbreviation]

Marquise  n. 1 wife or widow of a marquis. 2 woman holding the rank of marquis.

Thespian  —adj. Of drama. —n. Actor or actress. [greek thespis, name of a greek tragedian]

Huss  n. Dogfish as food. [origin unknown]

Miscount  —v. (also absol.) Count inaccurately. —n. Inaccurate count.

Spooky  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Ghostly, eerie.  spookily adv. Spookiness n.

Drainpipe  n. 1 pipe for carrying off water etc. 2 (attrib.) (of trousers) very narrow. 3 (in pl.) Very narrow trousers.

Felucca  n. Small mediterranean coasting vessel with oars and/or sails. [arabic fulk]

Tyrannize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) (often foll. By over) treat despotically or cruelly. [french: related to *tyrant]

Kilometre  n. (us -meter) 1,000 metres (approx. 0.62 miles).  kilometric adj.

Usage  the second pronunciation given, with the stress on the second syllable, is considered incorrect by some people.

Effluent  —adj. Flowing out. —n. 1 sewage or industrial waste discharged into a river etc. 2 stream or lake flowing from a larger body of water.

Ague  n. 1 hist. Malarial fever. 2 shivering fit. [latin: related to *acute]

Tizzy  n. (pl. -ies) colloq. State of agitation (in a tizzy). [origin unknown]

Penis  n.  Male organ of copulation and (in mammals) urination. [latin]

Sibling  n. Each of two or more children having one or both parents in common. [old english, = akin]

Dignitary  n. (pl. -ies) person of high rank or office. [from *dignity]

Miserable  adj. 1 wretchedly unhappy or uncomfortable. 2 contemptible, mean. 3 causing wretchedness or discomfort (miserable weather).  miserableness n. Miserably adv. [latin: related to *miser]

Flaxen  adj. 1 of flax. 2 (of hair) pale yellow.

Capercaillie  n. (also capercailzie) large european grouse. [gaelic, = horse of the forest]

Monorail  n. Railway with a single-rail track.

Capitation  n. Tax or fee paid per person. [latin: related to *capital]

Yaws  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Contagious tropical skin-disease with large red swellings. [origin unknown]

Freudian  —adj. Of freud, his theories, or his method of psychoanalysis. —n. Follower of freud.

Tonal  adj. Of or relating to tone or tonality.  tonally adv. [medieval latin: related to *tone]

Warning  n. 1 in senses of *warn. 2 thing that warns. [old english]

Macrobiotic  —adj. Of a diet intended to prolong life, esp. Consisting of wholefoods. —n. (in pl.; treated as sing.) Theory of such a diet. [greek bios life]

Limitation  n. 1 limiting or being limited. 2 limit (of ability etc.) (often in pl.: know one's limitations). 3 limiting circumstance.

Manicure   —n. Cosmetic treatment of the hands and fingernails. —v. (-ring) give a manicure to (the hands or a person).  manicurist n. [latin manus hand, cura care]

Machination  n. (usu. In pl.) Plot, intrigue.  machinate v. (-ting). [latin: related to *machine]

Mag  n. Colloq. = *magazine 1. [abbreviation]

Landfall  n. Approach to land, esp. After a sea or air journey.

Racoon  n. (also raccoon) (pl. Same or -s) 1 n. American mammal with a bushy tail and sharp snout. 2 its fur. [algonquian]

Pinnace  n. Ship's small boat. [french]

Malarkey  n. Colloq. Humbug; nonsense. [origin unknown]

Eleven  adj. & n. 1 one more than ten. 2 symbol for this (11, xi, xi). 3 size etc. Denoted by eleven. 4 team of eleven players at cricket, football, etc. 5 eleven o'clock. [old english]

Propeller  n. Revolving shaft with blades, esp. For propelling a ship or aircraft.

Broadloom  adj. (esp. Of carpet) woven in broad widths.

Truffle  n. 1 edible rich-flavoured underground fungus. 2 sweet made of a chocolate mixture covered with cocoa etc. [probably dutch from french]

Crampon  n. (us crampoon) (usu. In pl.) Spiked iron plate fixed to a boot for climbing on ice. [french: related to *cramp]

Atavism  n. 1 reappearance of a remote ancestral characteristic, throwback. 2 reversion to an earlier type.  atavistic adj. [latin atavus ancestor]

Foetus  n. (us fetus) (pl. -tuses) unborn mammalian offspring, esp. A human embryo of eight weeks or more.  foetal adj. [latin fetus offspring]

Baseline  n. 1 line used as a base or starting-point. 2 line marking each end of a tennis-court.

Blister  —n. 1 small bubble on the skin filled with watery fluid and caused by heat or friction. 2 similar swelling on plastic, wood, etc. —v. 1 come up in blisters. 2 raise a blister on. 3 attack sharply. [origin uncertain]

Lozenge  n. 1 rhombus. 2 small sweet or medicinal tablet to be dissolved in the mouth. 3 lozenge-shaped object. [french]

Purist  n. Advocate of scrupulous purity, esp. In language or art.  purism n. Puristic adj.

Bubble  —n. 1 a thin sphere of liquid enclosing air etc. B air-filled cavity in a liquid or solidified liquid. 2 transparent domed canopy. 3 visionary or unrealistic project. —v. (-ling) 1 rise in or send up bubbles. 2 make the sound of boiling.  bubble over (often foll. By with) be exuberant. [imitative]

Properly  adv. 1 fittingly, suitably (do it properly). 2 accurately, correctly (properly speaking). 3 rightly. 4 with decency; respectably (behave properly). 5 colloq. Thoroughly (properly puzzled).

Wagoner  n. (also waggoner) driver of a wagon.

Scarecrow  n. 1 human figure dressed in old clothes and set up in a field to scare birds away. 2 colloq. Badly-dressed, grotesque-looking, or very thin person.

Superlative  —adj. 1 of the highest quality or degree; excellent. 2 gram. (of an adjective or adverb) expressing the highest degree of a quality (e.g. Bravest, most fiercely). —n. 1 gram. Superlative form of an adjective or adverb. 2 (in pl.) High praise; exaggerated language. [french from latin]

Asthma  n. Respiratory condition marked by wheezing. [greek azo breathe hard]

Kilobyte  n. Computing 1,024 (i.e. 210) bytes as a measure of memory size etc.

Unsystematic  adj. Not systematic.  unsystematically adv.

Nudist  n. Person who advocates or practises going unclothed.  nudism n.

Binocular  adj. For both eyes. [latin bini two together, oculus eye]

Prairie  n. Large area of treeless grassland, esp. In n. America. [latin pratum meadow]

Thoroughfare  n. Road or path open at both ends, esp. For traffic.

Litter  —n. 1 a refuse, esp. Paper, discarded in a public place. B odds and ends lying about. 2 young animals brought forth at one birth. 3 vehicle containing a couch and carried on men's shoulders or by animals. 4 a kind of stretcher for the sick and wounded. 5 straw etc., as bedding for animals. 6 granulated material for use as an animal's, esp. A cat's, toilet indoors. —v. 1 make (a place) untidy with refuse. 2 give birth to (whelps etc.). 3  a provide (a horse etc.) With litter as bedding. B spread straw etc. On (a stable-floor etc.). [latin lectus bed]

Basin  n. 1 round open vessel for holding liquids or preparing food in. 2 = *wash-basin. 3 hollow depression. 4 sheltered mooring area. 5 round valley. 6 area drained by a river.  basinful n. (pl. -s). [medieval latin ba(s)cinus]

Teaset  n. Set of crockery for serving tea.

Guardsman  n. Soldier belonging to a body of guards or regiment of guards.

Prediction  n. 1 predicting or being predicted. 2 thing predicted.

Foregoing  adj. Preceding; previously mentioned.

Cellophane  n. Propr. Thin transparent viscose wrapping material. [from *cellulose: cf. *diaphanous]

Preponderate  v. (-ting) (often foll. By over) be greater in influence, quantity, or number; predominate.  preponderance n. Preponderant adj. [latin pondus -der- weight]

Destroyer  n. 1 person or thing that destroys. 2 fast armed warship escorting other ships.

Sodden  adj. 1 saturated; soaked through. 2 stupid or dull etc. With drunkenness. [archaic past part. Of *seethe]

Reoccupy  v. (-ies, -ied) occupy again.  reoccupation n.

Kermes  n. 1 female of an insect with a berry-like appearance. 2 (in full kermes oak) evergreen oak on which this feeds. 3 red dye made from these insects dried. [arabic]

Punkah  n. Large swinging cloth fan on a frame, worked by a cord or electrically. [hindi]

Hundred  adj. & n. (pl. Hundreds or (in sense 1) hundred) (in sing., prec. By a or one) 1 ten times ten. 2 symbol for this (100, c, c). 3 (in sing. Or pl.) Colloq. A large number. 4 (in pl.) The years of a specified century (the seventeen hundreds). 5 hist. Subdivision of a county or shire, having its own court.  hundredfold adj. & adv. Hundredth adj. & n. [old english]

Vitality  n. 1 liveliness, animation. 2 ability to survive or endure. [latin: related to *vital]

Togetherness  n. 1 being together. 2 feeling of comfort from this.

Fructify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 bear fruit. 2 make fruitful. [latin: related to *fruit]

Inceptive  adj. 1 a beginning. B initial. 2 (of a verb) denoting the beginning of an action.

Yourself  pron. (pl. Yourselves) 1 a emphat. Form of *you. B refl. Form of *you. 2 in your normal state of body or mind (are quite yourself again).  be yourself see *oneself.

Winceyette  n. Lightweight flannelette.

Advantage  —n. 1 beneficial feature. 2 benefit, profit. 3 (often foll. By over) superiority. 4 (in tennis) the next point after deuce. —v. (-ging) benefit, favour.  take advantage of 1 make good use of. 2 exploit, esp. Unfairly. 3 euphem. Seduce.  advantageous adj. [french: related to *advance]

Rospa  abbr. Royal society for the prevention of accidents.

Bloodshed  n. Killing.

Paedo-  comb. Form (us pedo-) child. [greek pais paid- child]

Promontory  n. (pl. -ies) point of high land jutting out into the sea etc.; headland. [latin]

Juicy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 full of juice; succulent. 2 colloq. Interesting; racy, scandalous. 3 colloq. Profitable.  juicily adv. Juiciness n.

Neurosis  n. (pl. Neuroses) irrational or disturbed behaviour pattern, associated with nervous distress.

Macerate  v. (-ting) 1 soften by soaking. 2 waste away by fasting.  maceration n. [latin]

Got  past and past part. Of *get.

Stranger  n. 1 person new to a particular place or company. 2 (often foll. By to) person one does not know. 3 (foll. By to) person unaccustomed to (no stranger to controversy).

Cunnilingus  n. Oral stimulation of the female genitals. [latin cunnus vulva, lingo lick]

Probationer  n. Person on probation.

Diaphanous  adj. (of fabric etc.) Light, delicate, and almost transparent. [greek phaino show]

Panel  —n. 1 distinct, usu. Rectangular, section of a surface (e.g. Of a wall, door, or vehicle). 2 strip of material in a garment. 3 team in a broadcast game, discussion, etc. 4 a list of available jurors. B jury. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) fit, cover, or decorate with panels. [latin diminutive of pannus: related to *pane]

Relegate  v. (-ting) 1 consign or dismiss to an inferior position. 2 transfer (a sports team) to a lower division of a league etc. 3 banish.  relegation n. [latin relego send away]

Guilder  n. Chief monetary unit of the netherlands. [alteration of dutch gulden golden]

Madrigal  n. Part-song, usu. Unaccompanied, for several voices. [italian]

Kelson  var. Of *keelson.

-ide  suffix chem. Forming nouns denoting binary compounds of an element (sodium chloride; lead sulphide; calcium carbide). [extended from *oxide]

Pull  —v. 1 exert force upon (a thing, person, etc.) To move it to oneself or the origin of the force (pulled it nearer). 2 exert a pulling force (engine will not pull). 3 extract (a cork or tooth) by pulling. 4 damage (a muscle etc.) By abnormal strain. 5 a move (a boat) by pulling on the oars. B (of a boat etc.) Be caused to move, esp. In a specified direction. 6 (often foll. By up) proceed with effort (up a hill etc.). 7 (foll. By on) bring out (a weapon) for use against (a person). 8 check the speed of (a horse), esp. To lose a race. 9 attract (custom or support). 10 draw (liquor) from a barrel etc. 11 (foll. By at) tear or pluck at. 12 (often foll. By on, at) inhale or drink deeply; draw or suck (on a pipe etc.). 13 (often foll. By up) remove (a plant) by the root. 14 a cricket strike (the ball) to the leg side. B golf strike (the ball) widely to the left. 15 print (a proof etc.). 16 slang succeed in attracting sexually. —n. 1 act of pulling. 2 force exerted by this. 3 influence; advantage. 4 attraction or attention-getter. 5 deep draught of liquor. 6 prolonged effort, e.g. In going up a hill. 7 handle etc. For applying a pull. 8 printer's rough proof. 9 cricket & golf pulling stroke. 10 suck at a cigarette.  pull about 1 treat roughly. 2 pull from side to side. Pull apart (or to pieces) = take to pieces (see *piece). Pull back (cause to) retreat. Pull down 1 demolish (esp. A building). 2 humiliate. Pull a face distort the features, grimace. Pull a fast one see *fast1. Pull in 1 (of a bus, train, etc.) Arrive to take passengers. 2 (of a vehicle) move to the side of or off the road. 3 colloq. Earn or acquire. 4 colloq. Arrest. Pull a person's leg deceive playfully. Pull off 1 remove by pulling. 2 succeed in achieving or winning. Pull oneself together recover control of oneself. Pull the other one colloq. Expressing disbelief (with ref. To pull a person's leg). Pull out 1 take out by pulling. 2 depart. 3 withdraw from an undertaking. 4 (of a bus, train, etc.) Leave a station, stop, etc. 5 (of a vehicle) move out from the side of the road, or to overtake. Pull over (of a vehicle) pull in. Pull one's punches avoid using one's full force. Pull the plug on put an end to (by withdrawing resources etc.). Pull rank take unfair advantage of one's seniority. Pull round (or through) (cause to) recover from an illness. Pull strings exert (esp. Clandestine) influence. Pull together work in harmony. Pull up 1 (cause to) stop moving. 2 pull out of the ground. 3 reprimand. 4 check oneself. Pull one's weight (often refl.) Do one's fair share of work. [old english]

Effortless  adj. Easily done, requiring no effort.  effortlessly adv. Effortlessness n.

Amber  —n. 1 a yellow translucent fossilized resin used in jewellery. B colour of this. 2 yellow traffic-light meaning caution. —adj. Of or like amber. [french from arabic]

Elevenfold  adj. & adv. 1 eleven times as much or as many. 2 consisting of eleven parts.

Thwack  —v. Hit with a heavy blow. —n. Heavy blow. [imitative]

Augmentative  adj. Augmenting.

Opportunity  n. (pl. -ies) favourable chance or opening offered by circumstances.
