Culpable  adj. Deserving blame.  culpability n. [latin culpo blame]

Omission  n. 1 omitting or being omitted. 2 thing omitted.

Tunnel  —n. 1 underground passage dug through a hill or under a road, river, etc., esp. For a railway or road. 2 underground passage dug by an animal. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 (foll. By through, into, etc.) Make a tunnel through. 2 make (one's way) by tunnelling. [french diminutive of tonne *tun]

Boastful  adj. Given to boasting.  boastfully adv.

Spirogyra  n. Freshwater alga containing spiral bands of chlorophyll. [greek speira coil, guros round]

Rf  symb. Rutherfordium.

Octave  n. 1 mus. A interval between (and including) two notes, one having twice or half the frequency of vibration of the other. B eight notes occupying this interval. C each of the two notes at the extremes of this interval. 2 eight-line stanza. [latin octavus eighth]

Sinusitis  n. Inflammation of a sinus.

Magi  pl. Of *magus.

Borstal  n. Hist. Residential institution for youth custody. [borstal in kent]

Usage  this term has now been replaced by detention centre and youth custody centre.

Scrapbook  n. Blank book for sticking cuttings, drawings, etc., in.

Replenish  v. 1 (often foll. By with) fill up again. 2 renew (a supply etc.).  replenishment n. [french plenir from plein full]

Predispose  v. (-sing) 1 influence favourably in advance. 2 (foll. By to, or to + infin.) Render liable or inclined beforehand.  predisposition n.

Isobar  n. Line on a map connecting places with the same atmospheric pressure.  isobaric adj. [greek baros weight]

Coupling  n. 1 link connecting railway carriages etc. 2 device for connecting parts of machinery.

Booze  colloq. —n. Alcoholic drink. —v. (-zing) drink alcohol, esp. To excess.  boozy adj. (-ier, -iest). [dutch]

Resold  past and past part. Of *resell.

Bandeau  n. (pl. -x) narrow headband. [french]

Videotex  n. (also videotext) any electronic information system, esp. Teletext or viewdata.

Then  —adv. 1 at that time. 2 a next; after that. B and also. 3 a in that case (then you should have said so). B implying grudging or impatient concession (all right then, if you must). C used parenthetically to resume a narrative etc. (the policeman, then, knocked on the door). —attrib. Adj. Such at the time in question (the then king). —n. That time (until then).  then and there immediately and on the spot. [old english]

Petticoat  n. 1 woman's or girl's undergarment hanging from the waist or shoulders. 2 (attrib.) Often derog. Feminine. [petty coat]

Idolater  n. 1 worshipper of idols. 2 devoted admirer.  idolatrous adj. Idolatry n. [related to *idol, greek latreuo worship]

Wick  n. Strip or thread feeding a flame with fuel.  get on a person's wick colloq. Annoy a person. [old english]

Outcast  —n. Person rejected by family or society. —adj. Rejected; homeless.

Lesson  n. 1 spell of teaching. 2 (in pl.; foll. By in) systematic instruction. 3 thing learnt by a pupil. 4 experience that serves to warn or encourage (let that be a lesson). 5 passage from the bible read aloud during a church service. [french leçon from latin lego lect-]

Sprout  —v. 1 put forth (shoots, hair, etc.). 2 begin to grow. —n. 1 shoot of a plant. 2 = *brussels sprout. [old english]

Widespread  adj. Widely distributed.

Plaint  n. 1 law accusation; charge. 2 literary complaint, lamentation. [french plainte from latin plango lament]

Intrepid  adj. Fearless; very brave.  intrepidity n. Intrepidly adv. [latin trepidus alarmed]

Headwaters  n.pl. Streams flowing from the sources of a river.

Sensory  adj. Of sensation or the senses. [latin sentio sens- feel]

Balance  —n. 1 a even distribution of weight or amount. B stability of body or mind. 2 apparatus for weighing, esp. One with a central pivot, beam, and two scales. 3 a counteracting weight or force. B (in full balance-wheel) regulating device in a clock etc. 4 decisive weight or amount (balance of opinion). 5 a agreement or difference between credits and debits in an account. B amount still owing or outstanding (will pay the balance). C amount left over. 6 a art harmony and proportion. B mus. Relative volume of sources of sound. 7 (the balance) zodiacal sign or constellation libra. —v. (-cing) 1 bring into, keep, or be in equilibrium (balanced a book on her head; balanced on one leg). 2 (often foll. By with, against) offset or compare (one thing) with another (balance the pros and cons). 3 counteract, equal, or neutralize the weight or importance of. 4 (usu. As balanced adj.) Make well-proportioned and harmonious (balanced diet; balanced opinion). 5 a compare and esp

Cotyledon  n. Embryonic leaf in seed-bearing plants. [greek kotule cup]

Sphere  n. 1 solid figure with every point on its surface equidistant from its centre; its surface. 2 ball, globe. 3 a field of action, influence, etc. B social class. 4 hist. Each of the revolving shells in which celestial bodies were thought to be set. [greek sphaira ball]

Mammography  n.  X-ray technique for screening the breasts for tumours etc.

Agrarian  —adj. 1 of the land or its cultivation. 2 of landed property. —n. Advocate of the redistribution of land. [latin ager field]

Fixture  n. 1 a something fixed in position. B colloq. Seemingly immovable person or thing (seems to be a fixture). 2 a sporting event, esp. A match, race, etc. B date agreed for this. 3 (in pl.) Articles attached to a house or land and regarded as legally part of it.

Nut  n. 1 a fruit consisting of a hard or tough shell around an edible kernel. B this kernel. 2 pod containing hard seeds. 3 small usu. Hexagonal flat piece of metal etc. With a threaded hole through it for screwing on the end of a bolt to secure it. 4 slang person's head. 5 slang crazy or eccentric person. 6 small lump (of coal etc.). 7 (in pl.) Coarse slang testicles. do one's nut slang be extremely angry. [old english]

Haycock  n. Conical heap of hay.

Frolicsome  adj. Merry, playful.

Misdeed  n. Evil deed, wrongdoing, crime. [old english]

Eggplant  n. = *aubergine.

Hovel  n. Small miserable dwelling. [origin unknown]

Girlfriend  n. 1 person's regular female companion or lover. 2 female friend.

Evacuate  v. (-ting) 1 a remove (people) from a place of danger. B empty (a place) in this way. 2 make empty. 3 (of troops) withdraw from (a place). 4 empty (the bowels etc.).  evacuation n. [latin vacuus empty]

Throstle  n. Song thrush. [old english]

Wonderment  n. Surprise, awe.

Shit  coarse slang —n. 1 faeces. 2 act of defecating. 3 contemptible person. 4 nonsense. —int. Exclamation of anger etc. —v. (-tt-; past and past part. Shitted, shat or shit) defecate or cause the defecation of (faeces etc.). [old english]

Ampersand  n. The sign ‘&’ (= and). [corruption of and *per se and]

Traditionalism  n. Respect or support for tradition.  traditionalist n. & adj.

Aria  n. Long accompanied solo song in an opera etc. [italian]

Duteous  adj. Literary dutiful.  duteously adv.

Morganatic  adj. 1 (of a marriage) between a person of high rank and one of lower rank, the spouse and children having no claim to the possessions or title of the person of higher rank. 2 (of a spouse) married in this way. [latin morganaticus from germanic, = ‘morning gift’, from a husband to his wife on the morning after consummation of a marriage]

Refund  —v. (also absol.) 1 pay back (money or expenses). 2 reimburse (a person). —n. 1 act of refunding. 2 sum refunded.  refundable adj. [latin fundo pour]

Scaffolding  n. 1 a temporary structure of poles, planks, etc., for building work. B materials for this. 2 any temporary framework.

Jonah  n. Person who seems to bring bad luck. [jonah in the old testament]

Counsel  —n. 1 advice, esp. Formally given. 2 consultation for advice. 3 (pl. Same) legal adviser, esp. A barrister; body of these. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 advise (a person). 2 give esp. Professional advice to (a person) on personal problems. 3 recommend (a course of action).  keep one's own counsel not confide in others. Take counsel (usu. Foll. By with) consult.  counselling n. [latin consilium]

Recourse  n. 1 resort to a possible source of help. 2 person or thing resorted to.  have recourse to turn to (a person or thing) for help. [latin: related to *course]

Tranquilizer  n. (brit. Tranquillizer, -iser) drug used to diminish anxiety.

Averse  predic. Adj. (usu. Foll. By to) opposed, disinclined. [latin verto vers- turn]

Novelette  n. Short novel.

Falcon  n. Small hawk sometimes trained to hunt. [latin falco]

Emotive  adj. 1 arousing emotion. 2 of emotion. [latin: related to *motion]

Usage  although the senses of emotive and emotional overlap, emotive is more common in the sense ‘arousing emotion’, as in an emotive issue, and is not used at all in sense 2 of emotional.

Garment  n. 1 article of dress. 2 outward covering. [french: related to *garnish]

Middleman  n. 1 trader who handles a commodity between producer and consumer. 2 intermediary.

Subnormal  adj. Below or less than normal, esp. In intelligence.

Linen  —n. 1 cloth woven from flax. 2 (collect.) Articles made or orig. Made of linen, as sheets, shirts, underwear, etc. —adj. Made of linen. [old english: related to latin linum flax]

Arduous  adj. Hard to accomplish; laborious, strenuous. [latin, = steep]

Indescribable  adj. 1 too good or bad etc. To be described. 2 that cannot be described.  indescribably adv.

Dubious  adj. 1 hesitating, doubtful. 2 questionable; suspicious. 3 unreliable.  dubiously adv. Dubiousness n. [latin dubium doubt]

Calcareous  adj. Of or containing calcium carbonate. [related to *calx]

Delirium  n. 1 disorder involving incoherent speech, hallucinations, etc., caused by intoxication, fever, etc. 2 great excitement, ecstasy. [latin lira ridge between furrows]

Coupon  n. 1 form etc. As an application for a purchase etc. 2 entry form for a football pool or other competition. 3 discount voucher given with a purchase. [french couper cut]

Gangster  n. Member of a gang of violent criminals.

Specula  pl. Of *speculum.

Laugh  —v. 1 make the sounds and movements usual in expressing lively amusement, scorn, etc. 2 express by laughing. 3 (foll. By at) ridicule, make fun of. —n. 1 sound, act, or manner of laughing. 2 colloq. Comical thing.  laugh off get rid of (embarrassment or humiliation) by joking. Laugh up one's sleeve laugh secretly. [old english]

Everybody  pron. Every person.

Lobe  n. 1 lower soft pendulous part of the outer ear. 2 similar part of other organs, esp. The brain, liver, and lung.  lobed adj. [greek lobos lobe, pod]

Reasonable  adj. 1 having sound judgement; moderate; ready to listen to reason. 2 not absurd. 3 a not greatly less or more than might be expected. B inexpensive. C tolerable, fair.  reasonableness n. Reasonably adv.

Underpopulated  adj. Having an insufficient or very small population.

Bleeper  n. Small electronic device bleeping to contact the carrier.

Humble  —adj. 1 having or showing low self-esteem. 2 of low social or political rank. 3 modest in size, pretensions, etc. —v. (-ling) 1 make humble; abase. 2 lower the rank or status of.  eat humble pie apologize humbly; accept humiliation.  humbleness n. Humbly adv. [latin humilis: related to *humus]

Carotid  —n. Each of the two main arteries carrying blood to the head and neck. —adj. Of these arteries. [latin from greek]

Leaved  adj. Having a leaf or leaves, esp. (in comb.) Of a specified kind or number (four-leaved clover).

Order  —n. 1 a condition in which every part, unit, etc. Is in its right place; tidiness. B specified sequence, succession, etc. (alphabetical order; the order of events). 2 authoritative command, direction, instruction, etc. 3 state of obedience to law, authority, etc. 4 a direction to supply or pay something. B goods etc. To be supplied. 5 social class; its members (the lower orders). 6 kind; sort (talents of a high order). 7 constitution or nature of the world, society, etc. (the moral order; the order of things). 8 taxonomic rank below a class and above a family. 9 religious fraternity with a common rule of life. 10 grade of the christian ministry. 11 any of the five classical styles of architecture (doric order). 12 a company of persons distinguished by a particular honour (order of the garter). B insignia worn by its members. 13 eccl. The stated form of divine service (the order of confirmation). 14 system of rules or procedure (at meetings etc.) (point of order). —v. 1 command; bid; prescribe. 2 command or direct (a person) to a specified destination (ordered them home). 3 direct a waiter, tradesman, etc. To supply (ordered dinner; ordered a new suit). 4 (often as ordered adj.) Put in order; regulate (an ordered life). 5 (of god, fate, etc.) Ordain.  in (or out of) order 1 in the correct (or incorrect) sequence or position. 2 fit (or not fit) for use. 3 according (or not according) to the rules at a meeting etc. In order that with the intention; so that. In order to with the purpose of doing; with a view to. Of (or in) the order of approximately. On order ordered but not yet received. Order about command officiously. To order as specified by the customer. [latin ordo ordin- row, command, etc.]

Realty  n. Real estate.

Outrank  v. Be superior in rank to.

Isotropic  adj. Having the same physical properties in all directions.  isotropy n. [from *iso-, greek tropos turn]

Borrow  v. 1 a acquire temporarily, promising or intending to return. B obtain money thus. 2 use (another's idea, invention, etc.); plagiarize.  borrower n. [old english]

Pewit  var. Of *peewit.

Whiskey  n. (brit. Whisky) (pl. -eys) spirit distilled esp. From malted grain, esp. Barley or rye. [abbreviation of usquebaugh from gaelic, = water of life]

Iconography  n. 1 the illustration of a subject by drawings or figures. 2 the study of portraits, esp. Of an individual, or of artistic images or symbols. [greek: related to *icon]

Thief  n. (pl. Thieves) person who steals, esp. Secretly. [old english]

Floppy  —adj. (-ier, -iest) tending to flop; flaccid. —n. (pl. -ies) (in full floppy disk) computing flexible disc for the storage of data.  floppiness n.

Compile  v. (-ling) 1 a collect and arrange (material) into a list, book, etc. B produce (a book etc.) Thus. 2 computing translate (a programming language) into machine code.  compilation n. [latin compilo plunder]

Ousel  var. Of *ouzel.

Shuttlecock  n. Cork with a ring of feathers, or a similar plastic device, struck to and fro in badminton.

Dudgeon  n. Resentment, indignation.  in high dudgeon very angry. [origin unknown]

Genital  —adj. Of animal reproduction or the reproductive organs. —n. (in pl.) External reproductive organs. [latin gigno genit- beget]

Imply  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 (often foll. By that) strongly suggest or insinuate without directly stating (what are you implying?). 2 signify, esp. As a consequence (silence implies guilt). [latin: related to *implicate]

Caulk  v. (also calk) 1 stop up (the seams of a boat etc.). 2 make (esp. A boat) watertight. [latin calco tread]

Nightly  —adj. 1 happening, done, or existing in the night. 2 recurring every night. —adv. Every night.

Hydrolyze  v. (brit. -lyse)  decompose by hydrolysis.

Unforeseen  adj. Not foreseen.

Gainsay  v. Deny, contradict. [old norse: related to *against, *say]

Defensible  adj. 1 justifiable; supportable by argument. 2 able to be defended militarily.  defensibility n. Defensibly adv. [latin: related to *defend]

Giro  —n. (pl. -s) 1 system of credit transfer between banks, post offices, etc. 2 cheque or payment by giro. —v. (-es, -ed) pay by giro. [german from italian]

Mutilate  v. (-ting) 1 a deprive (a person or animal) of a limb or organ. B destroy the use of (a limb or organ). 2 excise or damage part of (a book etc.).  mutilation n. [latin mutilus maimed]

Escalator  n. Moving staircase consisting of a circulating belt forming steps. [latin scala ladder]

Stopgap  n. Temporary substitute.

Petrol  n. 1 refined petroleum used as a fuel in motor vehicles, aircraft, etc. 2 (attrib.) Concerned with the supply of petrol (petrol pump). [latin: related to *petroleum]

Reconvene  v. (-ning) convene again, esp. After a pause in proceedings.

Polyester  n. Synthetic fibre or resin.

Prohibit  v. (-t-) (often foll. By from + verbal noun) 1 forbid. 2 prevent.  prohibitor n. Prohibitory adj. [latin prohibeo -hibit-]

Floorboard  n. Long wooden board used for flooring.

Lutheran  —n. 1 follower of luther. 2 member of the lutheran church. —adj. Of luther, or the protestant reformation and the doctrines associated with him.  lutheranism n. [martin luther, religious reformer]

Coop  —n. Cage for keeping poultry. —v. (often foll. By up, in) confine (a person). [latin cupa cask]

Unman  v. (-nn-) make weak, cowardly, etc.; cause to weep etc.

Isolationism  n. Policy of holding aloof from the affairs of other countries or groups.  isolationist n.

Thus  adv. Formal 1 a in this way. B as indicated. 2 a accordingly. B as a result or inference. 3 to this extent; so (thus far; thus much). [old english]

Expound  v. 1 set out in detail. 2 explain or interpret. [latin pono posit- place]

Diatonic  adj. Mus. (of a scale, interval, etc.) Involving only notes belonging to the prevailing key. [greek: related to *tonic]

Perceive  v. (-ving) 1 apprehend, esp. Through the sight; observe. 2 (usu. Foll. By that, how, etc.) Apprehend with the mind; understand; see or regard.  perceivable adj.  [latin percipio -cept- seize, understand]

Wallet  n. Small flat esp. Leather case for holding banknotes etc. [anglo-french]

Sighted  adj. 1 not blind. 2 (in comb.) Having specified vision (long-sighted).

Apoplectic  adj. 1 of or causing apoplexy. 2 colloq. Enraged.

Forfeit  —n. 1 penalty. 2 thing surrendered as a penalty. —adj. Lost or surrendered as a penalty. —v. (-t-) lose the right to, surrender as a penalty.  forfeiture n. [french forfaire transgress, from latin foris outside, facio do]

Amorous  adj. Of, showing, or feeling sexual love. [latin amor love]

Discrete  adj. Individually distinct; separate, discontinuous.  discreteness n. [latin: related to *discern]

Fluorite  n. Mineral form of calcium fluoride. [italian: related to *fluorspar]

Underpay  v. (past and past part. -paid) pay too little to (a person) or for (a thing).  underpayment n.

Synonym  n. Word or phrase that means the same as another (e.g. Shut and close). [greek onoma name]

Cabbage  n. 1 vegetable with a round head and green or purple leaves. 2 = *vegetable 2. [french caboche head]

Hairline  n. 1 edge of a person's hair, esp. On the forehead. 2 very narrow line, crack (usu. Hairline crack), etc.

Exclude  v. (-ding) 1 keep out (a person or thing) from a place, group, privilege, etc. 2 remove from consideration (no theory can be excluded). 3 make impossible, preclude (excluded all doubt).  exclusion n. [latin excludo -clus- shut out]

Monomania  n. Obsession by a single idea or interest.  monomaniac n. & adj.

Prod  —v. (-dd-) 1 poke with a finger, stick, etc. 2 stimulate to action. 3 (foll. By at) make a prodding motion. —n. 1 poke, thrust. 2 stimulus to action. [origin unknown]

Ebullient  adj. Exuberant.  ebullience n. Ebulliency n. Ebulliently adv. [latin: related to *boil1]

Bronco  n. (pl. -s) wild or half-tamed horse of the western us. [spanish, = rough]

Dapper  adj. 1 neat and precise, esp. In dress. 2 sprightly. [low german or dutch dapper strong]

Legionnaire  n. Member of a legion. [french: related to *legion]

Guipure  n. Heavy lace of linen pieces joined by embroidery. [french]

Aorta  n. (pl. -s) main artery, giving rise to the arterial network carrying oxygenated blood to the body from the heart.  aortic adj. [greek aeiro raise]

Bandwidth  n. Range of frequencies within a given band.

Scientific  adj. 1 a following the systematic methods of science. B systematic, accurate. 2 of, used in, or engaged in science.  scientifically adv.

Br  abbr. British rail.

Unblushing  adj. 1 shameless. 2 frank.

Girt  see *gird.

Guttersnipe  n. Street urchin.

Sprawl  —v. 1 a sit, lie, or fall with limbs flung out untidily. B spread (one's limbs) thus. 2 (of writing, a plant, a town, etc.) Be irregular or straggling. —n. 1 sprawling movement, position, or mass. 2 straggling urban expansion. [old english]

Exhibition  n. 1 display (esp. Public) of works of art etc. 2 exhibiting or being exhibited. 3 scholarship, esp. From the funds of a school, college, etc.

Flan  n. 1 pastry case with a savoury or sweet filling. 2 sponge base with a sweet topping. [medieval latin flado -onis]

Ruinous  adj. 1 bringing ruin, disastrous (ruinous expense). 2 dilapidated.  ruinously adv.

Commentate  v. (-ting) act as a commentator.

Frequency  n. (pl. -ies) 1 commonness of occurrence. 2 frequent occurrence. 3 rate of recurrence (of a vibration etc.); number of repetitions in a given time, esp. Per second. [related to *frequent]

Tactic  n. 1 tactical manoeuvre. 2 = *tactics. [greek from tasso arrange]

Soon  adv. 1 in a short time (shall soon know). 2 relatively early (must you go so soon?). 3 readily or willingly (would sooner go; would as soon stay).  as (or so) soon as at the moment that; not later than; as early as (came as soon as i could). Sooner or later at some future time; eventually.  soonish adv. [old english]

Motive  —n. 1 what induces a person to act in a particular way. 2 = *motif. —adj. 1 tending to initiate movement. 2 concerned with movement. [latin motivus: related to *move]

Handset  n. Telephone mouthpiece and earpiece as one unit.

Individuality  n. 1 individual character, esp. When strongly marked. 2 separate existence.

Dish  —n. 1 a shallow flat-bottomed container for food. B its contents. C particular kind of food or food prepared to a particular recipe (meat dish). 2 (in pl.) Crockery, pans, etc. After a meal (wash the dishes). 3 a dish-shaped object or cavity. B = *satellite dish. 4 colloq. Sexually attractive person. —v. 1 colloq. Outmanoeuvre, frustrate. 2 make dish-shaped.  dish out colloq. Distribute. Dish up 1 put (food) in dishes for serving. 2 colloq. Present as a fact or argument. [old english from latin *discus]

Largo  mus. —adv. & adj. In a slow tempo and dignified style. —n. (pl. -s) largo passage or movement. [italian, = broad]

Farmyard  n. Yard attached to a farmhouse.

Deduction  n. 1 a deducting. B amount deducted. 2 a inferring of particular instances from a general law or principle. B conclusion deduced. [latin: related to *deduce]

Bacterium  n. (pl. -ria) unicellular micro-organism lacking an organized nucleus, esp. Of a kind causing disease.  bacterial adj. [greek, = little stick]

Pineal  adj. Shaped like a pine cone. [latin pinea: related to *pine1]

Disrepute  n. Lack of good reputation; discredit.

Lunatic  —n. 1 insane person. 2 wildly foolish person. —adj. Insane; extremely reckless or foolish. [related to *lunacy]

From  prep. Expressing separation or origin, followed by: 1 person, place, time, etc., that is the starting-point (dinner is served from 8; from start to finish). 2 place, object, etc. At a specified distance etc. (10 miles from rome; far from sure). 3 a source (gravel from a pit; quotations from shaw). B giver or sender (not heard from her). 4 thing or person avoided, deprived, etc. (released him from prison; took his gun from him). 5 reason, cause, motive (died from fatigue; did it from jealousy). 6 thing distinguished or unlike (know black from white). 7 lower limit (from 10 to 20 boats). 8 state changed for another (from being poor he became rich). 9 adverb or preposition of time or place (from long ago; from abroad; from under the bed).  from time to time occasionally. [old english]

Complement  —n. 1 thing that completes; counterpart. 2 full number needed. 3 word(s) added to a verb to complete the predicate of a sentence. 4 amount by which an angle is less than 90°. —v. 1 complete. 2 form a complement to. [latin compleo fill up]

Barb  —n. 1 secondary backward-facing projection from an arrow, fish-hook, etc. 2 hurtful remark. 3 fleshy filament at the mouth of some fish. —v. 1 fit with a barb. 2 (as barbed adj.) (of a remark etc.) Deliberately hurtful. [latin barba beard]

Catch  —v. (past and past part. Caught) 1 capture in a trap, one's hands, etc. 2 detect or surprise (esp. A guilty person). 3 a intercept and hold (a moving thing) in the hands etc. B cricket dismiss (a batsman) by catching the ball before it reaches the ground. 4 a contract (a disease) from an infected person. B acquire (a quality etc.) From another. 5 a reach in time and board (a train, bus, etc.). B be in time to see etc. (a person or thing about to leave or finish). 6 apprehend with the senses or mind (esp. A thing occurring quickly or briefly). 7 (of an artist etc.) Reproduce faithfully. 8 a (cause to) become fixed, entangled, or checked. B (often foll. By on) hit, deal a blow to (caught his elbow on the table). 9 draw the attention of; captivate (caught his eye; caught her fancy). 10 begin to burn. 11 reach or overtake (a person etc. Ahead). 12 (foll. By at) try to grasp. —n. 1 a act of catching. B cricket etc. Chance or act of catching the ball. 2 a amount of a thing caught, esp. Of fish. B thing or person caught or worth catching, esp. In marriage. 3 a question, trick, etc., intended to deceive, incriminate, etc. B unexpected or hidden difficulty or disadvantage. 4 device for fastening a door or window etc. 5 mus. Round, esp. With words arranged to produce a humorous effect.  catch fire see *fire. Catch hold of grasp, seize. Catch it slang be punished. Catch on colloq. 1 become popular. 2 understand what is meant. Catch out 1 detect in a mistake etc. 2 take unawares. 3 = sense 3b of v. Catch up 1 a (often foll. By with) reach a person etc. Ahead (caught us up; caught up with us). B (often foll. By with, on) make up arrears. 2 pick up hurriedly. 3 (often in passive) a involve; entangle (caught up in crime). B fasten up (hair caught up in a ribbon). [latin capto try to catch]

Savannah  n. (also savanna) grassy plain in tropical and subtropical regions. [spanish]

Vhf  abbr. Very high frequency.

Momentum  n. (pl. Momenta) 1  quantity of motion of a moving body, the product of its mass and velocity. 2 impetus gained by movement. 3 strength or continuity derived from an initial effort. [latin moveo move]

Lamentation  n. 1 lamenting. 2 lament.

Libation  n. 1 pouring out of a drink-offering to a god. 2 such a drink-offering. [latin]

Holdall  n. Large soft travelling bag.

Mulatto  n. (pl. -s or -es) person of mixed white and black parentage. [spanish mulato young mule]

Foresee  v. (past -saw; past part. -seen) see or be aware of beforehand.  foreseeable adj.

Martinet  n. Strict disciplinarian.  [martinet, name of a drill-master]

Caboodle  n.  the whole caboodle slang the whole lot. [origin uncertain]

Offer  —v. 1 present for acceptance, refusal, or consideration. 2 (foll. By to + infin.) Express readiness or show intention. 3 provide; give an opportunity for. 4 make available for sale. 5 present to the attention. 6 present (a sacrifice etc.). 7 present itself; occur (as opportunity offers). 8 attempt (violence, resistance, etc.). —n. 1 expression of readiness to do or give if desired, or to buy or sell. 2 amount offered. 3 proposal (esp. Of marriage). 4 bid.  on offer for sale at a certain (esp. Reduced) price. [latin offero oblat-]

Perspicuous  adj. 1 easily understood; clearly expressed. 2 expressing things clearly.  perspicuity n. [latin: related to *perspective]

Usage  perspicuous is sometimes confused with perspicacious.

Yore  n.  of yore a long time ago. [old english, = long ago]

Twitter  —v. 1 (esp. Of a bird) emit a succession of light tremulous sounds. 2 utter or express in this way. —n. 1 act of twittering. 2 colloq. Tremulously excited state.  twittery adj. [imitative]

Kelt  var. Of *celt.

Wiring  n. System or installation of wires providing electrical circuits.

Photosynthesis  n. Process in which the energy of sunlight is used by organisms, esp. Green plants, to synthesize carbohydrates from carbon dioxide and water.  photosynthesize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). Photosynthetic adj.

Allegro  mus. —adv. & adj. In a brisk tempo. —n. (pl. -s) such a passage or movement. [italian, = lively]

Slurp  colloq. —v. Eat or esp. Drink noisily. —n. Sound of this. [dutch]

Inaugurate  v. (-ting) 1 admit formally to office. 2 begin (an undertaking) or initiate the public use of (a building etc.), with a ceremony. 3 begin, introduce.  inauguration n. Inaugurator n.

Bk  symb. Berkelium.

Cheep  —n. Weak shrill cry of a young bird. —v. Make such a cry. [imitative]

Dislike  —v. (-king) have an aversion to; not like. —n. 1 feeling of repugnance or not liking. 2 object of this.

Sophisticate  n. Sophisticated person. [medieval latin: related to *sophism]

Royal  —adj. 1 of, suited to, or worthy of a king or queen. 2 in the service or under the patronage of a king or queen. 3 of the family of a king or queen. 4 majestic, splendid. 5 exceptional, first-rate (had a royal time). —n. Colloq. Member of the royal family.  royally adv. [latin: related to *regal]

Wilco  int. Colloq. Expressing compliance or agreement. [abbreviation of will comply]

Overly  adv. Excessively; too.

Evens  n.pl. = *even money.

Wedgwood  n. Propr. 1 a kind of fine stoneware usu. With a white cameo design. 2 its characteristic blue colour. [wedgwood, name of a potter]

Fist  n. Tightly closed hand.  fistful n. (pl. -s). [old english]

Destructible  adj. Able to be destroyed. [latin: related to *destroy]

Scurrilous  adj. Grossly or indecently abusive.  scurrility n. (pl. -ies). Scurrilously adv. Scurrilousness n. [latin scurra buffoon]

Hairpin  n. U-shaped pin for fastening the hair.

Splurge  colloq. —n. 1 sudden extravagance. 2 ostentatious display or effort. —v. (-ging) (usu. Foll. By on) spend large sums of money or make a great effort. [probably imitative]

Hah  var. Of *ha1.

Testate  —adj. Having left a valid will at death. —n. Testate person.  testacy n. (pl. -ies). [latin testor testify, from testis witness]

Ecosystem  n. Biological community of interacting organisms and their physical environment.

Confide  v. (-ding) 1 (foll. By in) talk confidentially to. 2 (usu. Foll. By to) tell (a secret etc.) In confidence. 3 (foll. By to) entrust (an object of care, a task, etc.) To. [latin confido trust]

Eleventh  adj. & n. 1 next after tenth. 2 each of eleven equal parts of a thing.  eleventh hour last possible moment.

Uninspiring  adj. Not inspiring.

Earthwork  n. Artificial bank of earth in fortification or road-building etc.

Puzzler  n. Difficult question or problem.

Gunwale  n. (also gunnel) upper edge of the side of a boat or ship. [from *gun, *wale, because it was formerly used to support guns]

Dictatorial  adj. 1 of or like a dictator. 2 overbearing.  dictatorially adv. [latin: related to *dictator]

Perforce  adv. Archaic unavoidably; necessarily. [french par force by *force1]

Fashionable  adj. 1 following or suited to current fashion. 2 of or favoured by high society.  fashionableness n. Fashionably adv.

Modicum  n. (foll. By of) small quantity. [latin: related to *mode]

Knelt  past and past part. Of *kneel.

Shelter  —n. 1 protection from danger, bad weather, etc. 2 place giving shelter or refuge. —v. 1 act or serve as a shelter to; protect; conceal; defend. 2 find refuge; take cover. [origin unknown]

Undercharge  v. (-ging) 1 charge too little to (a person). 2 give too little charge to (a gun, electric battery, etc.).

Sundew  n. Small insect-consuming bog-plant.

Irrefutable  adj. That cannot be refuted.  irrefutably adv.

Cameo  n. (pl. -s) 1 small piece of hard stone carved in relief with a background of a different colour. 2 a short descriptive literary sketch or acted scene. B small character part in a play or film, usu. Brief and played by a distinguished actor. [french and medieval latin]

Stoic  —n. 1 member of the ancient greek school of philosophy which sought virtue as the greatest good and taught control of one's feelings and passions. 2 (stoic) stoical person. —adj. 1 of or like the stoics. 2 (stoic) = *stoical. [greek stoa portico]

Visual  adj. Of or used in seeing.  visually adv. [latin visus sight]

Query  —n. (pl. -ies) 1 question. 2 question mark or the word query as a mark of interrogation. —v. (-ies, -ied) 1 ask or inquire. 2 call in question. 3 dispute the accuracy of. [latin quaere imperative of quaero inquire]

Runway  n. Specially prepared surface for aircraft taking off and landing.

Lengthen  v. Make or become longer.

Brackish  adj. (of water etc.) Slightly salty. [low german or dutch]

Madwoman  n. Woman who is mad.

Tanker  n. Ship, aircraft, or road vehicle for carrying liquids, esp. Oil, in bulk.

Heartfelt  adj. Sincere; deeply felt.

Casual  —adj. 1 accidental; chance. 2 not regular or permanent (casual work). 3 a unconcerned. B careless; unthinking. 4 (of clothes) informal. —n. 1 casual worker. 2 (usu. In pl.) Casual clothes or shoes.  casually adv. Casualness n. [french and latin: related to *case1]

Lampoon  —n. Satirical attack on a person etc. —v. Satirize.  lampoonist n. [french lampon]

Ab-  prefix off, away, from (abduct). [latin]

Debenture  n. Acknowledgement of indebtedness, esp. A company bond providing for payment of interest at fixed intervals. [latin debentur are owed]

Dimmer  n. 1 (in full dimmer switch) device for varying the brightness of an electric light. 2 us a (in pl.) Small parking lights on a vehicle. B headlight on low beam.

Confabulate  v. (-ting) converse, chat.  confabulation n. [latin: related to *fable]

Ministration  n. 1 (usu. In pl.) Help or service (kind ministrations). 2 ministering, esp. In religious matters. 3 (usu. Foll. By of) supplying of help, justice, etc.  ministrant adj. & n. [latin: related to *minister]

Consubstantiation  n. Theol. Presence of christ's body and blood together with the bread and wine in the eucharist.

Peen  n. Wedge-shaped or thin or curved end of a hammer-head. [latin pinna point]

Shareholder  n. Owner of shares in a company.

Vestibule  n. 1 hall or lobby of a building. 2 us enclosed space between railway-carriages. [latin]

Genitalia  n.pl. Genitals. [latin, neuter pl. Of genitalis: see *genital]

Rma  abbr. Royal military academy.

Psychological  adj. 1 of or arising in the mind. 2 of psychology. 3 colloq. (of an ailment etc.) Imaginary (her cold is psychological).  psychologically adv.

Cachet  n. 1 prestige. 2 distinguishing mark or seal. 3 flat capsule of medicine. [french cacher press]

Primordial  adj. Existing at or from the beginning, primeval. [latin: related to *prime1, ordior begin]

Eclogue  n. Short pastoral poem. [greek: related to *eclectic]

Sewer  n. Conduit, usu. Underground, for carrying off drainage water and sewage. [anglo-french sever(e): related to *ex-1, aqua water]

Purposely  adv. On purpose.

Stocky  adj. (-ier, -iest) short and sturdy.  stockily adv. Stockiness n.

Binaural  adj. 1 of or used with both ears. 2 (of sound) recorded using two microphones and usu. Transmitted separately to the two ears. [from *bi-, *aural]

Lac  n. Resinous substance secreted as a protective covering by a se asian insect. [hindustani]

Jehovah  n. Hebrew name of god in the old testament. [hebrew yahveh]

Stabilize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make or become stable.  stabilization n.

Mammogram  n. Image obtained by mammography. [latin mamma breast]

Chip  —n. 1 small piece removed by chopping etc. 2 place or mark where a piece has been broken off. 3 a strip of potato, usu. Deep-fried. B us potato crisp. 4 counter used in some games to represent money. 5 = *microchip. —v. (-pp-) 1 (often foll. By off, away) cut or break (a piece) from a hard material. 2 (often foll. By at, away at) cut pieces off (a hard material) to alter its shape etc. 3 be apt to break at the edge. 4 (usu. As chipped adj.) Make (potatoes) into chips.  chip in colloq. 1 interrupt. 2 contribute (money etc.). A chip off the old block child resembling its parent, esp. In character. A chip on one's shoulder colloq. Inclination to feel resentful or aggrieved. When the chips are down colloq. When it comes to the point. [old english]

Lackadaisical  adj. Unenthusiastic; listless; idle.  lackadaisically adv. [from archaic lackaday]

Spout  —n. 1 projecting tube or lip used for pouring from a teapot, kettle, jug, etc., or on a fountain, roof-gutter, etc. 2 jet or column of liquid etc. —v. 1 discharge or issue forcibly in a jet. 2 utter or speak at length or pompously.  up the spout slang 1 useless, ruined, broken down. 2 pregnant. [dutch]

Yarn  —n. 1 spun thread, esp. For knitting, weaving, etc. 2 colloq. Story, traveller's tale, anecdote. —v. Colloq. Tell yarns. [old english]

Lonesome  adj. Esp. Us 1 lonely. 2 making one feel forlorn (a lonesome song).

Wolves  pl. Of *wolf.

Confirmed  adj. Firmly settled in some habit or condition (confirmed bachelor).

Notepaper  n. Paper for writing letters.

Scarce  —adj. 1 (usu. Predic.) (esp. Of food, money, etc.) In short supply. 2 rare. —adv. Archaic or literary scarcely.  make oneself scarce colloq. Keep out of the way; surreptitiously disappear. [french scars latin excerpto *excerpt]

Allegiance  n. 1 loyalty (to a person or cause etc.). 2 the duty of a subject. [french: related to *liege]

Recluse  n. Person given to or living in seclusion or isolation; hermit.  reclusive adj. [latin recludo -clus- shut away]

Airgun  n. Gun using compressed air to fire pellets.

Defect  —n. Fault, imperfection, shortcoming. —v. Leave one's country or cause for another.  defection n. Defector n. [latin deficio -fect- fail]

Humdinger  n. Slang excellent or remarkable person or thing. [origin unknown]

Holiness  n. 1 being holy or sacred. 2 (holiness) title used when addressing or referring to the pope. [old english: related to *holy]

Mesdames  pl. Of *madame.

Cashpoint  n. = *cash dispenser.

Coulomb  n. Si unit of electric charge. [coulomb, name of a physicist]

Sequel  n. 1 what follows (esp. As a result). 2 novel, film, etc., that continues the story of an earlier one. [latin sequor follow]

Emperor  n. Sovereign of an empire. [latin impero command]

Furore  n. (us furor) 1 uproar; fury. 2 enthusiastic admiration. [latin: related to *fury]

Billion  adj. & n. (pl. Same or (in sense 3) -s) 1 a thousand million (109). 2 (now less often) a million million (1012). 3 (in pl.) Colloq. A very large number (billions of years).  billionth adj. & n. [french]

Sentiment  n. 1 mental feeling. 2 (often in pl.) What one feels, opinion. 3 opinion or feeling, as distinct from its expression (the sentiment is good). 4 emotional or irrational view. 5 such views collectively, esp. As an influence. 6 tendency to be swayed by feeling. 7 a mawkish or exaggerated emotion. B display of this.

Republic  n. State in which supreme power is held by the people or their elected representatives or by an elected or nominated president, not by a monarch etc. [latin res concern: related to *public]

Islet  n. 1 small island. 2 anat. Structurally distinct portion of tissue. [french diminutive of *isle]

Waive  v. (-ving) refrain from insisting on or using (a right, claim, opportunity, etc.). [anglo-french weyver: related to *waif]

Ai  abbr. 1 artificial insemination. 2 artificial intelligence.

Introspection  n. Examination of one's own thoughts.  introspective adj. [latin specio spect- look]

Manure  —n. Fertilizer, esp. Dung. —v. (-ring) apply manure to (land etc.). [anglo-french mainoverer *manoeuvre]

Imposture  n. Fraudulent deception.

Theorem  n. Esp. Math. 1 general proposition that is not self-evident but is proved by reasoning. 2 rule in algebra etc., esp. One expressed by symbols or formulae. [greek theoreo look at]

Discount  —n. Amount deducted from a full or normal price, esp. For prompt or advance payment. —v. 1 disregard as unreliable or unimportant. 2 deduct an amount from (a price etc.). 3 give or get the present worth of (an investment certificate which has yet to mature).  at a discount below the usual price or true value.

Aural  adj. Of the ear or hearing.  aurally adv. [latin auris ear]

Violoncello  n. (pl. -s) formal = *cello. [italian, diminutive of violone bass viol]

Picturesque  adj. 1 beautiful or striking to look at. 2 (of language etc.) Strikingly graphic. [italian pittoresco, assimilated to *picture]

Commitment  n. 1 engagement or obligation. 2 committing or being committed. 3 dedication; committing oneself.

Indefensible  adj. That cannot be defended or justified.  indefensibility n. Indefensibly adv.

Vaporize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) change into vapour.  vaporization n.

Lughole  n. Slang ear.

Allegedly  adv. As is alleged.

Overturn  v. 1 (cause to) fall down or over. 2 reverse; overthrow.

Orangery  n. (pl. -ies) place, esp. A building, where orange-trees are cultivated.

Boast  —v. 1 declare one's virtues, wealth, etc. With excessive pride. 2 own or have with pride (hotel boasts a ballroom). —n. 1 act of boasting. 2 thing one is proud of. [anglo-french]

Reorganize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) organize differently.  reorganization n.

Sensitize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make sensitive.  sensitization n.

Waterfall  n. Stream flowing over a precipice or down a steep hillside.

Mater  n. Slang mother. [latin]

Usage  mater is now only found in jocular or affected use.

Declination  n. 1 downward bend or turn. 2 angular distance of a star etc. North or south of the celestial equator. 3 deviation of a compass needle from true north.  declinational adj. [latin: related to *decline]

Sublease  —n. Lease granted by a tenant to a subtenant. —v. (-sing) lease to a subtenant.

Carpel  n. Female reproductive organ of a flower. [greek karpos fruit]

Chancery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 (chancery) lord chancellor's division of the high court of justice. 2 records office. 3 chancellery. [contraction of *chancellery]

Kaftan  var. Of *caftan.

Haemophilia  n. (us hem-) hereditary failure of the blood to clot normally with the tendency to bleed severely from even a slight injury. [greek haima blood, philia loving]

Momentous  adj. Very important.  momentously adv. Momentousness n.

Aberdonian  —adj. Of aberdeen. —n. Native or citizen of aberdeen. [medieval latin]

Premolar  n. (in full premolar tooth) tooth between the canines and molars.

Nightjar  n. Nocturnal bird with a characteristic harsh cry.

Fallible  adj. Capable of making mistakes.  fallibility n. Fallibly adv. [medieval latin: related to *fallacy]

Thiosulphate  n. Sulphate in which one oxygen atom is replaced by sulphur. [greek theion sulphur]

Breathtaking  adj. Astounding; awe-inspiring.  breathtakingly adv.

Airlift  —n. Emergency transport of supplies etc. By air. —v. Transport thus.

Dat  abbr. Digital audio tape.

Metricate  v. (-ting) convert to a metric system.  metrication n.

Cherub  n. 1 (pl. -im) angelic being of the second order of the celestial hierarchy. 2 a representation of a winged child or its head. B beautiful or innocent child.  cherubic adj. [ultimately from hebrew]

Hubris  n. Arrogant pride or presumption.  hubristic adj. [greek]

Damp  —adj. Slightly wet. —n. Slight diffused or condensed moisture, esp. When unwelcome. —v. 1 make damp; moisten. 2 (often foll. By down) a temper; mute (damps my enthusiasm). B make (a fire) burn less strongly by reducing the flow of air to it. 3 reduce or stop the vibration of (esp. Strings of a musical instrument).  damply adv. Dampness n. [low german]

Hyaena  var. Of *hyena.

Rotisserie  n. 1 restaurant etc. Where meat is roasted or barbecued. 2 rotating spit for roasting or barbecuing meat. [french: related to *roast]

Labial  —adj. 1 a of the lips. B of, like, or serving as a lip. 2 (of a sound) requiring partial or complete closure of the lips. —n. Labial sound (e.g. P, m, v). [latin labia lips]

Toilet  n. 1 = *lavatory. 2 process of washing oneself, dressing, etc. (at one's toilet). [french toilette diminutive of toile cloth]

Reich  n. The former german state, esp. The third reich. [german, = empire]

Roughcast  —n. (often attrib.) Plaster of lime and gravel, used on outside walls. —adj. (of a plan etc.) Roughly formed, preliminary. —v. (past and past part. -cast) 1 coat with roughcast. 2 prepare in outline.

Illustrate  v. (-ting) 1 a provide (a book etc.) With pictures. B elucidate by drawings, pictures, examples, etc. 2 serve as an example of.  illustrator n. [latin lustro light up]

Reinvest  v. Invest again (esp. Proceeds or interest).  reinvestment n.

Ceilidh  n. Informal gathering for music, dancing, etc. [gaelic]

Driest  superl. Of *dry.

Likeable  adj. (also likable) pleasant; easy to like.  likeably adv.

Player  n. 1 participant in a game. 2 person playing a musical instrument. 3 actor.

Upstream  adv. & adj. In the direction contrary to the flow of a stream etc.

Aperture  n. Opening or gap, esp. A variable opening in a camera for admitting light. [latin aperio open]

Oversimplify  v. (-ies, -ied) (also absol.) Distort (a problem etc.) By stating it in too simple terms.  oversimplification n.

Lubricate  v. (-ting) 1 apply oil or grease etc. To. 2 make slippery.  lubrication n. Lubricator n. [latin lubricus slippery]

Recognizance  n. 1 bond by which a person undertakes before a court or magistrate to observe some condition, e.g. To appear when summoned. 2 sum pledged as surety for this. [french: related to *re-]

Coffee  n. 1 a drink made from roasted and ground beanlike seeds of a tropical shrub. B cup of this. 2 a the shrub. B its seeds. 3 pale brown. [turkish from arabic]

Globulin  n. Molecule-transporting protein in plant and animal tissues.

Snivel  —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 weep with sniffling. 2 run at the nose; sniffle. 3 show weak or tearful sentiment. —n. Act of snivelling. [old english]

Matey  (also maty) —adj. (-tier, -tiest) sociable; familiar, friendly. —n. (pl. -s) colloq. (as a form of address) mate.  mateyness n. (also matiness). Matily adv.

Mutation  n. 1 change, alteration. 2 genetic change which, when transmitted to offspring, gives rise to heritable variations. 3 mutant. [latin muto change]

Drachma  n. (pl. -s) 1 chief monetary unit of greece. 2 silver coin of ancient greece. [greek drakhme]

Portfolio  n. (pl. -s) 1 a folder for loose sheets of paper, drawings, etc. B samples of an artist's work. 2 range of investments held by a person, company, etc. 3 office of a minister of state (cf. *minister without portfolio). [italian portafogli sheet-carrier]

Clapper  n. Tongue or striker of a bell.  like the clappers slang very fast or hard.

-ency  suffix forming nouns denoting quality or state (efficiency; fluency; presidency). [latin -entia]

Rollicking  adj. Jovial, exuberant. [origin unknown]

Gunny  n. (pl. -ies) 1 coarse sacking, usu. Of jute fibre. 2 sack made of this. [hindi and marathi]

Abolish  v. Put an end to (esp. A custom or institution). [latin aboleo destroy]

Spew  v. (also spue) 1 (often foll. By up) vomit. 2 (often foll. By out) (cause to) gush. [old english]

Convertible  —adj. Able to be converted. —n. Car with a folding or detachable roof.  convertibility n. [latin: related to *convert]

Roadbed  n. 1 foundation structure of a railway. 2 foundation material for a road. 3 us part of a road on which vehicles travel.

Cocoa  n. 1 powder made from crushed cacao seeds, often with other ingredients. 2 drink made from this. [altered from *cacao]

Corncrake  n. Rail inhabiting grassland and nesting on the ground.

Cork  —n. 1 buoyant light-brown bark of a s. European oak. 2 bottle-stopper of cork etc. 3 float of cork. 4 (attrib.) Made of cork. —v. (often foll. By up) 1 stop or confine. 2 restrain (feelings etc.). [spanish alcorque]

Antipathy  n. (pl. -ies) (often foll. By to, for, between) strong aversion or dislike.  antipathetic adj. [greek: related to *pathetic]

Nucleate  —adj. Having a nucleus. —v. (-ting) form or form into a nucleus. [latin: related to *nucleus]

Cisalpine  adj. On the south side of the alps. [latin cis- on this side of]

Browning  n. Additive to colour gravy.

Baby  —n. (pl. -ies) 1 very young child. 2 childish person. 3 youngest member of a family etc. 4 (often attrib.) A very young animal. B small specimen. 5 slang sweetheart. 6 one's special concern etc. —v. (-ies, -ied) treat like a baby; pamper.  babyhood n. Babyish adj. [imitative of child's ba ba]

Hoarding  n. 1 large, usu. Wooden, structure used to carry advertisements etc. 2 temporary fence round a building site etc. [obsolete hoard from french: hourd]

Gallery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 room or building for showing works of art. 2 balcony, esp. In a church, hall, etc. (minstrels' gallery). 3 highest balcony in a theatre. 4 a covered walk partly open at the side; colonnade. B narrow passage in the thickness of a wall or on corbels, open towards the interior of the building. 5 long narrow room or passage (shooting-gallery). 6 horizontal underground passage in a mine etc. 7 group of spectators at a golf-match etc.  play to the gallery seek to win approval by appealing to popular taste. [french galerie]

Undefeated  adj. Not defeated.

Acoustics  n.pl. 1 properties or qualities (of a room etc.) In transmitting sound. 2 (usu. As sing.) Science of sound.

Ravishing  adj. Lovely, beautiful.  ravishingly adv.

Compatible  adj. 1 a able to coexist; well-suited. B (often foll. By with) consistent. 2 (of equipment etc.) Able to be used in combination.  compatibility n. [medieval latin: related to *passion]

Uncountable  adj. 1 inestimable, immense (uncountable wealth). 2 (of a noun) not used in the plural or with the indefinite article (e.g. Happiness, milk).

Adverse  adj. Unfavourable; harmful.  adversely adv. [latin: related to *ad-, verto vers- turn]

Entreaty  n. (pl. -ies) earnest request.

Teacake  n. Light usu. Toasted sweet bun eaten at tea.

Lover  n. 1 person in love with another. 2 person with whom another is having sexual relations. 3 (in pl.) Unmarried couple in love or having sexual relations. 4 person who likes or enjoys a specified thing (music lover).

Buffalo  n. (pl. Same or -es) 1 wild ox of africa or asia. 2 n. American bison. [greek boubalos ox]

Refinery  n. (pl. -ies) place where oil, sugar, etc. Is refined.

Imperative  —adj. 1 urgent; obligatory. 2 commanding, peremptory. 3 gram. (of a mood) expressing a command (e.g. Come here!). —n. 1 gram. Imperative mood. 2 command. 3 essential or urgent thing. [latin impero command]

Perquisite  n. 1 extra profit or allowance additional to a main income etc. 2 customary extra right or privilege. [latin perquiro -quisit- search diligently for]

Usage  perquisite is sometimes confused with prerequisite, which means ‘thing required as a precondition’.

Missus  var. Of *missis.

Sulphite  n. (us sulfite) salt or ester of sulphurous acid. [french: related to *sulphate]

Proprietor  n. (fem. Proprietress) 1 holder of property. 2 owner of a business etc., esp. Of a hotel.  proprietorial adj. [related to *proprietary]

Friendly  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 outgoing, well-disposed, kindly. 2 a (often foll. By with) on amicable terms. B not hostile. 3 (in comb.) Not harming; helping (ozone-friendly; user-friendly). 4 = *user-friendly. —n. (pl. -ies) = *friendly match. —adv. In a friendly manner.  friendliness n.

Ileum  n. (pl. Ilea) third and last portion of the small intestine. [latin ilium]

Shop  —n. 1 place for the retail sale of goods or services. 2 act of going shopping (did a big shop). 3 place for manufacture or repair (engineering-shop). 4 one's profession etc. As a subject of conversation (talk shop). 5 colloq.

Preventative  adj. & n. = *preventive.

Islander  n. Native or inhabitant of an island.

Soul  n. 1 spiritual or immaterial part of a person, often regarded as immortal. 2 moral, emotional, or intellectual nature of a person. 3 personification or pattern (the very soul of discretion). 4 an individual (not a soul in sight). 5 person regarded with familiarity or pity etc. (the poor soul; a good soul). 6 person regarded as an animating or essential part (life and soul). 7 energy or intensity, esp. In a work of art. 8 = *soul music.  upon my soul exclamation of surprise. [old english]

Adsorb  v. (usu. Of a solid) hold (molecules of a gas or liquid etc.) To its surface, forming a thin film.  adsorbent adj. & n. Adsorption n. [from *ad-, *absorb]

Mealy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of, like, or containing meal. 2 (of a complexion) pale.  mealiness n.

Multimillion  attrib. Adj. Costing or involving several million (pounds, dollars, etc.) (multimillion dollar fraud).

Insure  v. (-ring) (often foll. By against; also absol.) Secure compensation in the event of loss or damage to (property, life, a person, etc.) By advance regular payments. [var. Of *ensure]

Storeroom  n. Storage room.

Fluvial  adj. Of or found in rivers. [latin fluvius river]

Escudo  n. (pl. -s) chief monetary unit of portugal. [spanish and portuguese from latin scutum shield]

Eschew  v. Formal avoid; abstain from.  eschewal n. [germanic: related to *shy1]

Expectancy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 state of expectation. 2 prospect. 3 (foll. By of) prospective chance.

Commuter  n. Person who commutes to and from work.

Grotty  adj. (-ier, -iest) slang unpleasant, dirty, shabby, unattractive. [shortening of *grotesque]

Scourge  —n. 1 person or thing seen as causing suffering. 2 whip. —v. (-ging) 1 whip. 2 punish, oppress. [latin corrigia whip]

Lied  n. (pl. Lieder) german song, esp. Of the romantic period. [german]

Crematorium  n. (pl. -ria or -s) place where corpses are cremated.

Synthesizer  n. Electronic, usu. Keyboard, instrument producing a wide variety of sounds.

Hydrology  n. Science of the properties of water, esp. Of its movement in relation to land.  hydrologist n.

Nightingale  n. Small reddish-brown bird, of which the male sings melodiously, esp. At night. [old english, = night-singer]

Sandbag  —n. Bag filled with sand, used for temporary defences etc. —v. (-gg-) defend or hit with sandbag(s).

Chanticleer  n. Name given to a domestic cock in stories. [french: related to *chant, *clear]

Molto  adv. Mus. Very. [latin multus much]

Stifle  v. (-ling) 1 suppress. 2 feel or make unable to breathe easily; suffocate. 3 kill by suffocating.  stifling adj. & adv. [origin uncertain]

Bible  n. 1 a (prec. By the) christian scriptures of old and new testaments. B (bible) copy of these. 2 (bible) colloq. Authoritative book.  biblical adj. [greek biblia books]

Rosary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 rc ch. Repeated sequence of prayers. 2 string of beads for keeping count in this. [latin rosarium rose-garden]

Thesaurus  n. (pl. -ri or -ruses) book that lists words in groups of synonyms and related concepts. [greek: related to *treasure]

Bookmaker  n. Professional taker of bets.  bookmaking n.

Copilot  n. Second pilot in an aircraft.

Transcend  v. 1 be beyond the range or grasp of (human experience, reason, belief, etc.). 2 excel; surpass. [latin scando climb]

Hothead  n. Impetuous person.  hotheaded adj. Hotheadedness n.

Anal  adj. Of the anus.

Greylag  n. (in full greylag goose) european wild goose. [from *grey]

Umbilical  adj. Of the navel. [from *umbilicus]

Apologia  n. Formal defence of opinions or conduct. [greek: see *apology]

Projector  n. Apparatus for projecting slides or film on to a screen.

Extinct  adj. 1 that has died out. 2 a no longer burning. B (of a volcano) that no longer erupts. 3 obsolete. [latin ex(s)tinguo -stinct- quench]

Susceptibility  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being susceptible. 2 (in pl.) Person's feelings.

Aboriginal  —adj. 1 indigenous, inhabiting a land from the earliest times, esp. Before the arrival of colonists. 2 (usu. Aboriginal) of australian aborigines. —n. 1 aboriginal inhabitant. 2 (usu. Aboriginal) aboriginal inhabitant of australia. [latin: related to *origin]

Multilingual  adj. In, speaking, or using several languages.

Outrigger  n. 1 spar or framework projecting over the side of a ship, racing boat, or canoe to give stability. 2 boat fitted with this.

Admire  v. (-ring) 1 regard with approval, respect, or satisfaction. 2 express admiration of.  admirer n. Admiring adj. Admirlingly adv. [latin: related to *ad-, miror wonder at]

Howler  n. Colloq. Glaring mistake.

Teddy  n. (also teddy) (pl. -ies) (in full teddy bear) soft toy bear. [teddy, pet form of theodore roosevelt]

Omicron  n. Fifteenth letter of the greek alphabet (o, o). [greek o mikron = small o]

Bandwagon  n.  climb (or jump) on the bandwagon join a popular or successful cause etc.

Hijack  —v. 1 seize control of (a vehicle etc.), esp. To force it to a different destination. 2 seize (goods) in transit. 3 take control of (talks etc.) By force or subterfuge. —n. A hijacking.  hijacker n. [origin unknown]

Persona  n. (pl. -nae) aspect of the personality as shown to or perceived by others. [latin, = actor's mask]

Agglutinate  v. (-ting) stick as with glue.  agglutination n. Agglutinative adj. [latin: related to *gluten]

Fisticuffs  n.pl. Fighting with the fists. [probably from obsolete fisty (from *fist), *cuff2]

Appease  v. (-sing) 1 make calm or quiet, esp. Conciliate (a potential aggressor) by making concessions. 2 satisfy (an appetite, scruples).  appeasement n. [french à to, pais *peace]

Homeopathy  n. (brit. Homoeopathy) treatment of disease by minute doses of drugs that in a healthy person would produce symptoms of the disease.  homoeopath n. Homoeopathic adj. [greek homoios like: related to *pathos]

Numerable  adj. That can be counted. [latin: related to *number]

Fluorspar  n. = *fluorite. [fluor a mineral used as flux, from latin fluo flow]

Digestion  n. 1 process of digesting. 2 capacity to digest food.

Ruination  n. 1 bringing to ruin. 2 ruining or being ruined.

Zircon  n. Zirconium silicate of which some translucent varieties are cut into gems. [german zirkon]

Horizon  n. 1 line at which the earth and sky appear to meet. 2 limit of mental perception, experience, interest, etc.  on the horizon (of an event) just imminent or becoming apparent. [greek horizo bound]

Vestige  n. 1 trace; sign. 2 slight amount; particle. 3 atrophied part or organ of an animal or plant that was well developed in ancestors.  vestigial adj. [latin vestigium footprint]

Townscape  n. 1 visual appearance of a town or towns. 2 picture of a town.

Master  —n. 1 person having control or ownership (master of the house; dog obeyed his master; master of the hunt). 2 captain of a merchant ship. 3 male teacher. 4 prevailing person. 5 a skilled tradesman able to teach others (often attrib.: master carpenter). B skilled practitioner (master of innuendo). 6 holder of a usu. Post-graduate university degree (master of arts). 7 revered teacher in philosophy etc. 8 great artist. 9 chess etc. Player at international level. 10 original copy of a film, recording, etc., from which others can be made. 11 (master) title for a boy not old enough to be called mr. 12 archaic employer. —attrib. Adj. 1 commanding, superior (master hand).

Papoose  n. N. American indian young child. [algonquian]

Womenkind  var. Of *womankind.

Thump  —v. 1 beat or strike heavily, esp. With the fist. 2 throb strongly. 3 (foll. By at, on, etc.) Knock loudly. —n. 1 heavy blow. 2 dull sound of this. [imitative]

Dilatory  adj. Given to or causing delay. [latin dilatorius: related to *differ]

Discretion  n. 1 being discreet. 2 prudence; good judgement. 3 freedom or authority to act according to one's judgement.  use one's discretion act according to one's own judgement.  discretionary adj. [latin: related to *discern]

Patriot  n. Person devoted to and ready to defend his or her country.  patriotic adj. Patriotically adv. Patriotism n. [greek patris fatherland]

Determined  adj. Showing determination; resolute, unflinching.  determinedly adv.

Citrate  n. A salt of citric acid.

Puissant  adj. Literary or archaic powerful; mighty. [romanic: related to *potent]

Moccasin  n. Soft flat-soled shoe orig. Worn by n. American indians. [american indian]

Pianissimo  mus. —adj. Very soft. —adv. Very softly. —n. (pl. -s or -mi) very soft playing or passage. [italian, superlative of *piano2]

-dom  suffix forming nouns denoting: 1 condition (freedom). 2 rank, domain (earldom; kingdom). 3 class of people (or associated attitudes etc.) Regarded collectively (officialdom). [old english]

Monetary  adj. 1 of the currency in use. 2 of or consisting of money. [latin: related to *money]

Chromatic  adj. 1 of colour; in colours. 2 mus. A of or having notes not belonging to a particular diatonic scale. B (of a scale) ascending or descending by semitones.  chromatically adv. [greek khroma -mat- colour]

Antelope  n. (pl. Same or -s) swift-moving deerlike ruminant, e.g. The gazelle and gnu. [greek antholops]

Cheshire  n. A kind of firm crumbly cheese.  like a cheshire cat with a broad fixed grin. [cheshire in england]

Fur  —n. 1 a short fine soft animal hair. B hide with fur on it, used esp. For clothing. 2 garment of or lined with fur. 3 (collect.) Animals with fur. 4 fur-like coating on the tongue, in a kettle, etc. —v. (-rr-) 1 (esp. As furred adj.) Line or trim with fur. 2 (often foll. By up) (of a kettle etc.) Become coated with fur.  make the fur fly colloq. Cause a disturbance, stir up trouble. [french from germanic]

Simmer  —v. 1 bubble or boil gently. 2 be in a state of suppressed anger or excitement. —n. Simmering condition.  simmer down become less agitated. [perhaps imitative]

Insider  n. 1 person who is within an organization etc. 2 person privy to a secret.

Edify  v. (-ies, -ied) improve morally or intellectually.  edification n. [latin aedifico build]

Histamine  n. Chemical compound in body tissues etc., associated with allergic reactions. [from *histology, *amine]

Comecon  n. Economic association of socialist countries in e. Europe. [abbreviation of council for mutual economic assistance]

Racism  n. 1 belief in the superiority of a particular race; prejudice based on this. 2 antagonism towards other races.  racist n. & adj.

Circle  —n. 1 round plane figure whose circumference is everywhere equidistant from its centre. 2 circular or roundish enclosure or structure. 3 curved upper tier of seats in a theatre etc. 4 circular route. 5 persons grouped round a centre of interest. 6 set or restricted group (literary circles). —v. (-ling) 1 (often foll. By round, about) move in a circle. 2 a revolve round. B form a circle round.  come full circle return to the starting-point. [latin diminutive: related to *circus]

Disembodied  adj. 1 (of the soul etc.) Freed from the body or concrete form. 2 lacking a body.  disembodiment n.

Ti  symb. Titanium.

Dogmatize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 speak dogmatically. 2 express (a principle etc.) As dogma.

-itic  suffix forming adjectives and nouns corresponding to nouns in -ite, -itis, etc. (semitic; arthritic). [latin -iticus, greek -itikos]

Brochure  n. Pamphlet or booklet, esp. With descriptive information. [french brocher stitch]

Electrotechnology  n. Science of the application of electricity in technology.

Unscalable  adj. That cannot be scaled.

Diversity  n. Variety.

Chinchilla  n. 1 a small s. American rodent. B its soft grey fur. 2 breed of cat or rabbit. [spanish chinche bug]

Pipedream  n. Unattainable or fanciful hope or scheme. [originally as experienced when smoking an opium pipe]

Gaseous  adj. Of or like gas.

Disco  colloq. —n. (pl. -s) = *discothèque. —v. (-es, -ed) dance to disco music. [abbreviation]

Binman  n. Colloq. Dustman.

Brouhaha  n. Commotion; sensation. [french]

Penguin  n. Flightless black and white sea bird of the southern hemisphere, with wings developed into flippers for swimming underwater. [origin unknown]

Foodstuff  n. Substance used as food.

Shotgun  n. Gun for firing small shot at short range.

Irate  adj. Angry, enraged.  irately adv. Irateness n. [latin iratus from ira anger]

Nostril  n. Either of the two openings in the nose. [old english, = nose-hole]

Synecdoche  n. Figure of speech in which a part is made to represent the whole or vice versa (e.g. New faces at the club; england lost to india). [greek, = taking together]

Vise  n. (brit. Vice) clamp with two jaws holding an object so as to leave the hands free to work on it. [vis screw, from latin vitis vine]

Yardie  n. Slang member of a jamaican or w. Indian gang engaging in organized crime, esp. Drug-trafficking. [jamaican english, = house, home]

Skinful  n. Colloq. Enough alcohol to make one drunk.

Acquit  v. (-tt-) 1 (often foll. By of) declare not guilty. 2 refl. A behave or perform in a specified way (acquitted herself well). B (foll. By of) discharge (a duty or responsibility).  acquittal n. [latin: related to *ad-, *quit]

Waggly  adj. Unsteady; waggling.

Asshole  n. (brit. Arsehole) coarse slang 1 anus. 2 offens. Contemptible person.

Archdiocese  n. Diocese of an archbishop.  archdiocesan adj.

Intern  —n. (also interne) esp. Us = *houseman. —v. Oblige (a prisoner, alien, etc.) To reside within prescribed limits.  internment n. [french: related to *internal]

Usage  internment is sometimes confused with interment, which means ‘burial’.

Eke  v. (eking)  eke out 1 supplement (income etc.). 2 make (a living) or support (an existence) with difficulty. [old english]

Overqualified  adj. Too highly qualified for a particular job etc.

Undergo  v. (3rd sing. Present -goes; past -went; past part. -gone) be subjected to; suffer; endure.

Exodus  n. 1 mass departure. 2 (exodus) biblical departure of the israelites from egypt. [greek hodos way]

Pitiable  adj. Deserving or arousing pity or contempt.  pitiably adv. [french: related to *pity]

Thumping  adj. Colloq. (esp. As an intensifier) huge (a thumping lie; a thumping great house).

Quote  —v. (-ting) 1 cite or appeal to (an author, book, etc.) In confirmation of some view. 2 a repeat or copy out a passage from. B (foll. By from) cite (an author, book, etc.). 3 (foll. By as) cite (an author etc.) As proof, evidence, etc. 4 a enclose (words) in quotation marks. B (as int.) Verbal formula indicating opening quotation marks (he said, quote, ‘i shall stay’). 5 (often foll. By at, also absol.) State the price of. —n. Colloq. 1 passage quoted. 2 price quoted. 3 (usu. In pl.) Quotation marks. [latin quoto mark with numbers]

Unawares  adv. 1 unexpectedly. 2 inadvertently.

Tb  abbr. 1 tubercle bacillus. 2 tuberculosis.

Unemployed  adj. 1 out of work. 2 not in use.

Liverish  adj. 1 suffering from a liver disorder. 2 peevish, glum.

Bulk  —n. 1 a size; magnitude (esp. Large). B large mass, body, etc. C large quantity. 2 (treated as pl. & usu. Prec. By the) greater part or number (the bulk of the applicants are women). 3 roughage. —v. 1 seem (in size or importance) (bulks large). 2 make (a book etc.) Thicker etc.  in bulk in large quantities. [old norse]

Dutch  —adj. Of the netherlands or its people or language. —n. 1 the dutch language. 2 (prec. By the; treated as pl.) The people of the netherlands.  go dutch share expenses on an outing etc. [dutch]

Plucky  adj. (-ier, -iest) brave, spirited.  pluckily adv. Pluckiness n.

Parakeet  n. Small usu. Long-tailed parrot. [french: related to *parrot]

Tractor  n. 1 vehicle used for pulling farm machinery etc. 2 traction-engine. [related to *traction]

Monetarism  n. Control of the supply of money as the chief method of stabilizing the economy.  monetarist n. & adj.

Chukker  n. (also chukka) period of play in polo. [sanskrit cakra wheel]

-ous  suffix 1 forming adjectives meaning ‘abounding in, characterized by, of the nature of’ (envious; glorious; mountainous; poisonous). 2 chem. Denoting a state of lower valence than -ic (ferrous; sulphurous). [anglo-french -ous, from latin asus]

Turco-  comb. Form (also turko-) turkish; turkish and. [medieval latin: related to *turk]

Testes  pl. Of *testis.

Muslin  n. Fine delicately woven cotton fabric. [italian mussolo mosul in iraq]

Parley  —n. (pl. -s) conference of disputants, esp. To discuss peace terms etc. —v. (-leys, -leyed) (often foll. By with) hold a parley. [french parler: related to *parlance]

Claim  —v. 1 state, declare, assert. 2 demand as one's due or property. 3 represent oneself as having or achieving (claim victory). 4 (foll. By to + infin.) Profess. 5 have as an achievement or consequence (fire claimed two victims). 6 (of a thing) deserve (attention etc.). —n. 1 demand or request for a thing considered one's due (lay claim to; put in a claim). 2 (foll. By to, on) right or title to a thing. 3 assertion. 4 thing claimed. [latin clamo call out]

Otter  n. 1 aquatic fish-eating mammal with webbed feet and thick brown fur. 2 its fur. [old english]

Pinball  n. Game in which small metal balls are shot across a board to strike pins.

Proverbial  adj. 1 (esp. Of a characteristic) well known; notorious (his proverbial honesty). 2 of or referred to in a proverb (proverbial ill wind).  proverbially adv. [latin: related to *proverb]

Sect  n. 1 group sharing (usu. Unorthodox) religious, political, or philosophical doctrines. 2 (esp. Exclusive) religious denomination. [latin sequor follow]

Fey  adj. 1 a strange, other-worldly; whimsical. B clairvoyant. 2 scot. Fated to die soon. [old english, = doomed to die]

Extraction  n. 1 extracting or being extracted. 2 removal of a tooth. 3 lineage, descent (of indian extraction). [latin: related to *extract]

Firebox  n. Place where fuel is burned in a steam engine or boiler.

Peke  n. Colloq. Pekingese. [abbreviation]

Foursome  n. 1 group of four people. 2 golf match between two pairs.

Plate  —n. 1 a shallow usu. Circular vessel from which food is eaten or served. B contents of this. 2 similar vessel used for a collection in church etc. 3 (collect.) A utensils of silver, gold, or other metal. B objects of plated metal. 4 piece of metal with a name or inscription for affixing to a door etc. 5 illustration on special paper in a book. 6 thin sheet of metal, glass, etc., coated with a sensitive film for photography. 7 flat thin usu. Rigid sheet of metal etc., often as part of a mechanism. 8 a smooth piece of metal etc. For engraving. B impression from this. 9 a silver or gold cup as a prize for a horse-race etc. B race with this as a prize. 10 a thin piece of plastic material, moulded to the shape of the mouth, on which artificial teeth are mounted. B colloq. Denture. 11 each of several rigid sheets of rock thought to form the earth's outer crust. 12 thin flat organic structure or formation. —v. (-ting) 1 apply a thin coat esp. Of silver, gold, or tin to (another metal). 2 cover (esp. A ship) with plates of metal, for protection.  on a plate colloq. Available with little trouble to the recipient. On one's plate colloq. For one to deal with.  plateful n. (pl. -s). [latin platta from plattus flat]

Meritorious  adj. Praiseworthy.

Cerium  n. Silvery metallic element of the lanthanide series. [ceres, name of an asteroid]

Pandit  var. Of *pundit 1.

Indian  —n. 1 a native or national of india. B person of indian descent. 2 (in full american indian) a original inhabitant of america. B any of the languages of the american indians. —adj. 1 of india or the subcontinent comprising india, pakistan, and bangladesh. 2 of the original peoples of america.

Liberalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make or become more liberal or less strict.  liberalization n.

Inelegant  adj. 1 ungraceful. 2 unrefined.  inelegance n. Inelegantly adv.

Subcommittee  n. Committee formed from a main committee for a special purpose.

Superman  n. 1 colloq. Man of exceptional strength or ability. 2 philos. Ideal person not subject to conventional morality etc.

Unemployment  n. 1 being unemployed. 2 lack of employment in a country etc.

Capacious  adj. Roomy.  capaciousness n. [latin capax: related to *capable]

Smacker  n. Slang 1 loud kiss. 2 a £1. B us $1.

Excruciating  adj. Causing acute mental or physical pain.  excruciatingly adv. [latin crucio torment]

Howbeit  adv. Archaic nevertheless.

Choc  n. Colloq. Chocolate. [abbreviation]

Journey  —n. (pl. -s) 1 act of going from one place to another, esp. At a long distance. 2 time taken for this (a day's journey). —v. (-s, -ed) make a journey. [french jornee day, day's work or travel, from latin diurnus daily]

Coition  n. = *coitus. [latin coitio from eo go]

Alligator  n. Large reptile of the crocodile family with a head broader and shorter than a crocodile's. [spanish el lagarto the lizard]

Improve  v. (-ving) 1 a make or become better. B (foll. By on, upon) produce something better than. 2 (as improving adj.) Giving moral benefit (improving literature).  improvable adj. Improvement n. [anglo-french emprower from french prou profit]

Explanatory  adj. Serving or designed to explain.

Shrubbery  n. (pl. -ies) area planted with shrubs.

Polder  n. Piece of land reclaimed from the sea or a river, esp. In the netherlands. [dutch]

Molder  v. (brit. Moulder) 1 decay to dust. 2 (foll. By away) rot or crumble. 3 deteriorate. [from *mould3]

Chopsuey  n. (pl. -s) chinese-style dish of meat fried with vegetables and rice. [chinese, = mixed bits]

Demerger  n. Dissolution of a commercial merger.  demerge v. (-ging).

Marmot  n. Heavy-set burrowing rodent with a short bushy tail. [latin mus mouse, mons mountain]

Polyunsaturated  adj. (of a fat or oil) having a chemical structure capable of further reaction and not contributing to the accumulation of cholesterol in the blood.

Rectify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 adjust or make right. 2 purify or refine, esp. By repeated distillation. 3 convert (alternating current) to direct current.  rectifiable adj. Rectification n. Rectifier n. [latin rectus straight, right]

Baluster  n. Short post or pillar supporting a rail. [greek balaustion wild-pomegranate flower]

Usage  baluster is often confused with banister. A baluster is usually part of a balustrade whereas a banister supports a stair handrail.

Faithful  adj. 1 showing faith. 2 (often foll. By to) loyal, trustworthy. 3 accurate (faithful account). 4 (the faithful) the believers in a religion.  faithfulness n.

Incipient  adj. 1 beginning. 2 in an early stage. [latin incipio begin]

Stump  —n. 1 part of a cut or fallen tree still in the ground. 2 similar part (e.g. Of a branch or limb) cut off or worn down. 3 cricket each of the three uprights of a wicket. 4 (in pl.) Joc. Legs. —v. 1 (of a question etc.) Be too hard for; baffle. 2 (as stumped adj.) At a loss, baffled. 3 cricket put (a batsman) out by touching the stumps with the ball while he is out of the crease. 4 walk stiffly or noisily. 5 (also absol.) Us traverse (a district) making political speeches.  stump up colloq. Pay or produce (the money required). [low german or dutch]

Bulb  n. 1 a globular base of the stem of some plants, sending roots downwards and leaves upwards. B plant grown from this, e.g. A daffodil. 2 = *light-bulb. 3 object or part shaped like a bulb. [latin bulbus from greek, = onion]

Caravel  n. (also carvel) hist. Small light fast ship. [greek karabos, literally ‘horned beetle’]

Delude  v. (-ding) deceive, mislead. [latin ludo mock]

Psychology  n. (pl. -ies) 1 the study of the human mind. 2 treatise on or theory of this. 3 a mental characteristics etc. Of a person or group. B mental aspects of an activity, situation, etc. (psychology of crime).  psychologist n.

Condenser  n. 1 apparatus or vessel for condensing vapour. 2 electr. = *capacitor. 3 lens or system of lenses for concentrating light.

Cloy  v. Satiate or sicken with sweetness, richness, etc. [obsolete acloy from anglo-french: related to *enclave]

Eagle  n. 1 a large bird of prey with keen vision and powerful flight. B this as a symbol, esp. Of the us. 2 score of two strokes under par at any hole in golf. [latin aquila]

Galleon  n. Hist. Warship (usu. Spanish). [french or spanish: related to *galley]

Coagulate  v. (-ting) 1 change from a fluid to a semisolid. 2 clot, curdle.  coagulant n. Coagulation n. [latin coagulum rennet]

Wineglass  n. Glass for wine, usu. With a stem and foot.

Tasty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 pleasing in flavour; appetizing. 2 colloq. Attractive.  tastily adv. Tastiness n.

Aliphatic  adj. Chem. Of organic compounds in which carbon atoms form open chains, not aromatic rings. [greek aleiphar -phat- fat]

Speck  —n. 1 small spot or stain. 2 particle. —v. (esp. As specked adj.) Marked with specks. [old english]

Freak  —n. 1 (often attrib.) Monstrosity; abnormal person or thing (freak storm). 2 colloq. A unconventional person. B fanatic of a specified kind (health freak). C drug addict. —v. (often foll. By out) colloq. 1 become or make very angry. 2 (cause to) undergo hallucinations etc., esp. As a result of drug abuse. 3 adopt an unconventional lifestyle.  freakish adj. Freaky adj. (-ier, -iest). [probably from dial.]

January  n. (pl. -ies) first month of the year. [latin janus, guardian god of doors]

Hemoglobin  n. (brit. Haem-) oxygen-carrying substance in the red blood cells of vertebrates. [from *globulin]

Calico  —n. (pl. -es or us -s) 1 cotton cloth, esp. Plain white or unbleached. 2 us printed cotton fabric. —adj. 1 of calico. 2 us multicoloured. [calicut in india]

Fahrenheit  adj. Of a scale of temperature on which water freezes at 32° and boils at 212°. [fahrenheit, name of a physicist]

Angiosperm  n. Plant producing flowers and reproducing by seeds enclosed within a carpel, including herbaceous plants, grasses, and most trees. [greek aggeion vessel]

Dinner  n. 1 main meal of the day, either at midday or in the evening. 2 (in full dinner-party) formal evening meal, esp. With guests. [french: related to *dine]

Sidesman  n. Assistant churchwarden who takes the collection etc.

Protoplasm  n. Material comprising the living part of a cell, consisting of a nucleus in membrane-enclosed cytoplasm.  protoplasmic adj. [greek: related to *proto-, *plasma]

Collar  —n. 1 neckband, upright or turned over. 2 band of leather etc. Round an animal's neck. 3 band or ring or pipe in machinery. 4 piece of meat rolled up and tied. —v. 1 capture, seize. 2 colloq. Accost. 3 slang appropriate. [latin collum neck]

Camera  n. 1 apparatus for taking photographs or moving film. 2 equipment for converting images into electrical signals.  in camera law in private. [latin: related to *chamber]

Aftershave  n. Lotion used after shaving.

Kibbutz  n. (pl. Kibbutzim) communal esp. Farming settlement in israel. [hebrew, = gathering]

Mortise  (also mortice) —n. Hole in a framework designed to receive the end of another part, esp. A tenon. —v. (-sing) 1 join securely, esp. By mortise and tenon. 2 cut a mortise in. [french from arabic]

Caddie  (also caddy) —n. (pl. -ies) person who carries a golfer's clubs during play. —v. (-ies, -ied, caddying) act as a caddie. [french *cadet]

Siren  n. 1 a device for making a loud wailing or warning sound. B this sound. 2 (in greek mythology) woman or winged creature whose singing lured unwary sailors on to rocks. 3 (often attrib.) Temptress; seductress. [greek seiren]

Swap  (also swop) —v. (-pp-) exchange or barter. —n. 1 act of swapping. 2 thing for swapping or swapped. [originally = ‘hit’, imitative]

Badly  adv. (worse, worst) 1 in a bad manner. 2 colloq. Very much (wants it badly). 3 severely (badly defeated).

Cell  n. 1 small room, esp. In a prison or monastery. 2 small compartment, e.g. In a honeycomb. 3 small, active, esp. Subversive, political group. 4 a smallest structural and functional unit of living matter, consisting of cytoplasm and a nucleus enclosed in a membrane. B enclosed cavity in an organism etc. 5 vessel containing electrodes for current-generation or electrolysis. [latin cella]

Minimize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 reduce to, or estimate at, the smallest possible amount or degree. 2 estimate or represent at less than true value or importance.  minimization n.

Outrun  v. (-nn-; past -ran; past part. -run) 1 run faster or farther than. 2 go beyond (a point or limit).
