Staccato  esp. Mus. —adv. & adj. With each sound or note sharply distinct. —n. (pl. -s) staccato passage or delivery. [italian]

Zap  slang —v. (-pp-) 1 a kill or destroy; attack. B hit hard (zapped the ball over the net). 2 move quickly. 3 overwhelm emotionally. —int. Expressing the sound or impact of a bullet, ray gun, etc., or any sudden event. [imitative]

Listener  n. 1 person who listens. 2 person who listens to the radio.

Duct  —n. Channel or tube for conveying a fluid, cable, bodily secretions, etc. (tear ducts). —v. Convey through a duct. [latin ductus from duco duct- lead]

Inadvisable  adj. Not advisable.  inadvisability n.

Parting  n. 1 leave-taking or departure (often attrib.: parting words). 2 dividing line of combed hair. 3 division; separating.

Septuagint  n. Greek version of the old testament including the apocrypha. [latin septuaginta seventy]

Cutwater  n. 1 forward edge of a ship's prow. 2 wedge-shaped projection from a pier or bridge.

Poetic  adj. (also poetical) of or like poetry or poets.  poetically adv.

Darning  n. 1 act of darning. 2 things to be darned.

Parch  v. 1 make or become hot and dry. 2 roast (peas, corn, etc.) Slightly. [origin unknown]

Supremacy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being supreme. 2 highest authority.

Lovemaking  n. 1 sexual play, esp. Intercourse. 2 archaic courtship.

Chessman  n. Any of the 32 pieces and pawns with which chess is played.

Confidant  n. (fem. Confidante pronunc. Same) person trusted with knowledge of one's private affairs. [related to *confide]

Cedilla  n. 1 mark written under c, esp. In french, to show it is sibilant (as in façade). 2 similar mark under s in turkish etc. [spanish diminutive of zeda z]

Sector  n. 1 distinct part of an enterprise, society, the economy, etc. 2 military subdivision of an area. 3 plane figure enclosed by two radii of a circle, ellipse, etc., and the arc between them. [latin: related to *section]

Packthread  n. Stout thread for sewing or tying up packs.

Schoolteacher  n. Teacher in a school.

Silverside  n. Upper side of a round of beef.

Respectful  adj. Showing deference.  respectfully adv.

Sansculotte  n. (esp. In the french revolution) extreme republican. [french, literally = ‘without knee-breeches’]

Overgrown  adj. 1 grown too big. 2 wild; covered with weeds etc.  overgrowth n.

Mandrill  n. Large w. African baboon. [probably from *man, *drill4]

Timetable  —n. List of times at which events are scheduled to take place, esp. The arrival and departure of transport or a sequence of lessons. —v. (-ling) include in or arrange to a timetable; schedule.

Invest  v. 1 a (often foll. By in) apply or use (money), esp. For profit. B (foll. By in) put money for profit into (stocks etc.). 2 (often foll. By in) devote (time etc.) To an enterprise. 3 (foll. By in) colloq. Buy (something useful). 4 a (foll. By with) provide or credit (a person etc. With qualities) (invested her with magical importance; invested his tone with irony). B (foll. By in) attribute or entrust (qualities or feelings) to (a person etc.) (power invested in the doctor). 5 (often foll. By with, in) clothe with the insignia of office; install in an office.  investor n. [latin vestis clothing]

Aerobatics  n.pl. 1 spectacular flying of aircraft, esp. To entertain. 2 (as sing.) Performance of these. [from *aero-, after *acrobatics]

Pictorial  —adj. 1 of or expressed in a picture or pictures. 2 illustrated. —n. Periodical with pictures as the main feature.  pictorially adv. [latin pictor painter: related to *picture]

Capon  n. Castrated cock fattened for eating. [latin capo]

Pps  abbr. 1 parliamentary private secretary. 2 additional postscript. [sense 2 from post-postscript]

Spunky  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Brave, spirited.

Galleria  n. Collection of small shops under a single roof. [italian]

Gnp  abbr. Gross national product.

Embryology  n. The study of embryos.

Passerine  —n. Perching bird such as the sparrow and most land birds. —adj. Of passerines. [latin passer sparrow]

Ergo  adv. Therefore. [latin]

Liniment  n. Embrocation. [latin linio smear]

Preferment  n. Formal promotion to a higher office.

Commercialism  n. 1 commercial practices. 2 emphasis on financial profit.

Intend  v. 1 have as one's purpose (we intend to go; we intend going). 2 (usu. Foll. By for, as) design or destine (a person or a thing) (i intend him to go; i intend it as a warning). [latin tendo stretch]

Billabong  n. (in australia) backwater of a river. [aboriginal]

Holograph  —adj. Wholly written by hand by the person named as the author. —n. Holograph document. [greek holos whole, *-graph]

Constraint  n. 1 constraining or being constrained. 2 restriction. 3 self-control.

Mess  —n. 1 dirty or untidy state of things. 2 state of confusion, embarrassment, or trouble. 3 something spilt etc. 4 disagreeable concoction. 5 a soldiers etc. Dining together. B army dining-hall. C meal taken there. 6 domestic animal's excreta. 7 archaic portion of liquid or pulpy food. —v. 1 (often foll. By up) make a mess of; dirty; muddle.

Magnesia  n. 1 magnesium oxide. 2 hydrated magnesium carbonate, used as an antacid and laxative. [magnesia in asia minor]

Callisthenics  n.pl. (also calisthenics) exercises for fitness and grace.  callisthenic adj. [greek kallos beauty, sthenos strength]

Goner  n. Slang person or thing that is doomed or irrevocably lost.

Wildlife  n. Wild animals collectively.

Obliterate  v. (-ting) blot out, destroy, leave no clear traces of.  obliteration n. [latin oblitero erase, from litera letter]

Afoot  adv. & predic.adj. In operation; progressing.

Fatty  adj. (-ier, -iest) like or containing fat.

Geld  v. Castrate. [old norse]

Publican  n.  Keeper of a public house. [latin: related to *public]

Reimburse  v. (-sing) 1 repay (a person who has expended money). 2 repay (a person's expenses).  reimbursement n.

Wreck  —n. 1 the sinking or running aground of a ship. 2 ship that has suffered a wreck. 3 greatly damaged building, thing, or person. 4 (foll. By of) wretched remnant. —v. 1 a seriously damage (a vehicle etc.). B ruin (hopes, a life, etc.). 2 cause the wreck of (a ship). [anglo-french wrec from germanic]

Typhoid  n. (in full typhoid fever) infectious bacterial fever attacking the intestines.

Pronoun  n. Word used instead of and to indicate a noun already mentioned or known, esp. To avoid repetition (e.g. We, their, this, ourselves). [from *pro-1, *noun]

Workplace  n. Place at which a person works.

Quin  n. Colloq. Quintuplet. [abbreviation]

Pensive  adj. Deep in thought.  pensively adv. [french penser think]

Triassic  geol. —adj. Of the earliest period of the mesozoic era. —n. This period. [related to *triad]

Greaseproof  adj. Impervious to grease.

You  pron. (obj. You; poss. Your, yours) 1 the person or persons addressed. 2 (as int. With a noun) in an exclamatory statement (you fools!). 3 (in general statements) one, a person, people (you get used to it).  you and yours you and your family, property, etc. [old english, originally objective case of *ye1]

Gauche  adj. 1 socially awkward. 2 tactless.  gauchely adv. Gaucheness n. [french]

Congruous  adj. Suitable, agreeing; fitting.  congruity n. [latin: related to *congruent]

Regenerate  —v. (-ting) 1 bring or come into renewed existence; generate again. 2 improve the moral condition of. 3 impart new, more vigorous, or spiritually higher life or nature to. 4 biol.

Sporran  n. Pouch worn in front of the kilt. [gaelic sporan]

Watchman  n. Man employed to look after an empty building etc. At night.

Haulier  n. Person or firm engaged in the transport of goods.

Satiate  v. (-ting) = *sate.  satiable adj. Satiation n. [latin satis enough]

Corrective  —adj. Serving to correct or counteract something harmful. —n. Corrective measure or thing. [latin: related to *correct]

Denizen  n. 1 (usu. Foll. By of) inhabitant or occupant. 2 foreigner having certain rights in an adopted country. 3 naturalized foreign word, animal, or plant. [latin de intus from within]

Tetrahedron  n. (pl. -dra or -s) four-sided solid; triangular pyramid.  tetrahedral adj. [greek hedra base]

Cartoon  n. 1 humorous, esp. Topical, drawing in a newspaper etc. 2 sequence of drawings telling a story. 3 animated sequence of these on film. 4 full-size preliminary design for a tapestry etc.  cartoonist n. [italian: related to *card1]

Howdah  n. (usu. Canopied) seat for riding on an elephant or camel. [urdu hawda]

Forester  n. 1 person managing a forest or skilled in forestry. 2 dweller in a forest.

Shied  past & past part. Of *shy2.

Snob  n. Person who despises those inferior in social position, wealth, intellect, taste, etc. (intellectual snob).  snobbery n. Snobbish adj. Snobby adj. (-ier, -iest). [origin unknown]

Ounce  n. 1 unit of weight, 1/16 lb or approx. 28 g. 2 very small quantity. [latin uncia twelfth part of a pound or a foot]

Townie  n. (also townee) derog. Town inhabitant ignorant of country life.

Stygian  adj. Literary dark, gloomy. [literally = of the styx, a river round hades in greek mythology]

Erasure  n. 1 erasing. 2 erased word etc.

Strychnine  n. Highly poisonous alkaloid used in small doses as a stimulant. [greek strukhnos nightshade]

Elongate  v. (-ting) lengthen, extend.  elongation n. [latin longus long]

Aristotelian  —n. Disciple or student of aristotle. —adj. Of aristotle or his ideas. [greek aristoteles (4th c. Bc), name of a greek philosopher]

Guillotine  —n. 1 machine with a blade sliding vertically in grooves, used for beheading. 2 device for cutting paper etc. 3 method of preventing delay in the discussion of a legislative bill by fixing times at which various parts of it must be voted on. —v. (-ning) use a guillotine on. [guillotin, name of a physician]

Whop  v. (-pp-) slang 1 thrash. 2 defeat. [origin unknown]

Muckrake  v. (-king) search out and reveal scandal.  muckraker n. Muckraking n.

Radioisotope  n. Radioactive isotope.

Stepson  n. Male stepchild.

-ways  suffix forming adjectives and adverbs of direction or manner (sideways).

Glob  n. Colloq. Mass or lump of semi-liquid substance, e.g. Mud. [perhaps from *blob, *gob2]

Narcotic  —adj. 1 (of a substance) inducing drowsiness etc. 2 (of a drug) affecting the mind. —n. Narcotic substance, drug, or influence. [greek narkotikos]

Unborn  adj. Not yet, or never to be, born (unborn child; unborn hopes).

Valet  —n. Gentleman's personal servant. —v. (-t-) 1 work as a valet (for). 2 clean or clean out (a car). [french va(s)let, related to *varlet, *vassal]

Hessian  n. Strong coarse sacking made of hemp or jute. [hesse in germany]

Failure  n. 1 lack of success; failing. 2 unsuccessful person or thing. 3 non-performance. 4 breaking down or ceasing to function (heart failure). 5 running short of supply etc. [anglo-french: related to *fail]

Gcse  abbr. General certificate of secondary education.

Convocation  n. 1 convoking or being convoked. 2 large formal gathering. [latin: related to *convoke]

Sister  n. 1 woman or girl in relation to her siblings. 2 female fellow member of a trade union, feminist group, etc. 3 senior female nurse. 4 member of a female religious order. 5 (often attrib.) Of the same type, design, or origin etc. (sister ship; prose, the younger sister of verse).  sisterly adj. [old english]

Minima  pl. Of *minimum.

Siemens  n. Si unit of conductance, equal to one reciprocal ohm. [von siemens, name of an engineer]

Purport  —v. 1 profess; be intended to seem (purports to be an officer). 2 (often foll. By that) (of a document or speech) have as its meaning; state. —n. 1 ostensible meaning. 2 sense or tenor (of a document or statement).  purportedly adv. [latin: related to *pro-1, porto carry]

Eyesore  n. Ugly thing.

Tryst  n. Archaic meeting, esp. Of lovers. [french]

Weaponry  n. Weapons collectively.

Turps  n. Colloq. Oil of turpentine. [abbreviation]

Jackpot  n. Large prize, esp. Accumulated in a game, lottery, etc.  hit the jackpot colloq. 1 win a large prize. 2 have remarkable luck or success.

Cypher  var. Of *cipher.

Gerrymander  —v. Manipulate the boundaries of (a constituency etc.) So as to give undue influence to some party or class. —n. This practice. [governor gerry of massachusetts]

Preen  v. 1 (of a bird) tidy (the feathers or itself) with its beak. 2 (of a person) smarten or admire (oneself, one's hair, clothes, etc.). 3 (often foll. By on) congratulate or pride (oneself). [origin unknown]

Orient  —n. (the orient) countries east of the mediterranean, esp. E. Asia. —v. 1 a place or determine the position of with the aid of a compass; find the bearings of. B (often foll. By towards) direct.

Sandboy  n.  happy as a sandboy extremely happy or carefree. [probably = a boy hawking sand for sale]

Daguerreotype  n. Early photograph using a silvered plate and mercury vapour. [daguerre, name of its inventor]

Abortion  n. 1 natural or (esp.) Induced expulsion of a foetus from the womb before it is able to survive independently. 2 stunted or deformed creature or thing. 3 failed project or action.  abortionist n.

Hardship  n. 1 severe suffering or privation. 2 circumstance causing this.

Swab  —n. 1 a absorbent pad used in surgery. B specimen of a secretion taken for examination. 2 mop etc. For cleaning or mopping up. —v. (-bb-) 1 clean with a swab. 2 (foll. By up) absorb (moisture) with a swab. 3 mop clean (a ship's deck) [dutch]

Megaphone  n. Large funnel-shaped device for amplifying the voice. [greek megas great, phone sound]

Miscellany  n. (pl. -ies) 1 mixture, medley. 2 book containing various literary compositions. [latin: related to *miscellaneous]

Crumbly  adj. (-ier, -iest) consisting of, or apt to fall into, crumbs or fragments.  crumbliness n.

Strathspey  n. 1 slow scottish dance. 2 music for this. [strathspey, valley of the river spey]

Barrage  n. 1 concentrated artillery bombardment. 2 rapid succession of questions or criticisms. 3 artificial barrier in a river etc. [french barrer *bar1]

Qualify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 (often as qualified adj.) Make competent or fit for a position or purpose. 2 make legally entitled. 3 (usu. Foll. By for) (of a person) satisfy conditions or requirements. 4 modify or limit (a statement etc.) (qualified approval). 5 gram. (of a word) attribute a quality to esp. A noun. 6 moderate, mitigate; make less severe. 7 (foll. By as) be describable as, count as (a grunt hardly qualifies as conversation).  qualifier n. [latin qualis such as, of what kind]

Commonsensical  adj. Having or marked by common sense.

Inability  n. 1 being unable. 2 lack of power or means.

Vulgarize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 make vulgar. 2 spoil by popularizing.  vulgarization n.

Wan  adj. (wanner, wannest) pale; exhausted-looking.  wanly adv. Wanness n. [old english, = dark]

Salad  n. Cold mixture of usu. Raw vegetables, often with a dressing. [french salade from latin sal salt]

Stenographer  n. Esp. Us shorthand typist. [greek stenos narrow]

Woollen  (us woolen) —adj. Made wholly or partly of wool. —n. 1 woollen fabric. 2 (in pl.) Woollen garments. [old english]

Panto  n. (pl. -s) colloq. = *pantomime 1. [abbreviation]

Pagoda  n. 1 hindu or buddhist temple etc., esp. A many-tiered tower, in india and the far east. 2 ornamental imitation of this. [portuguese]

Thermocouple  n. Device for measuring temperatures by means of a pair of different metals in contact at a point and generating a thermoelectric voltage.

Assertive  adj. Tending to assert oneself; forthright, positive.  assertively adv. Assertiveness n.

Informer  n. Person who informs, esp. Against others.

Straighten  v. 1 (often foll. By out) make or become straight. 2 (foll. By up) stand erect after bending.

Bibliophile  n. Lover or collector of books.

Hydrometer  n. Instrument for measuring the density of liquids.

Grandeur  n. 1 majesty, splendour; dignity of appearance or bearing. 2 high rank, eminence. 3 nobility of character. [french: related to *grand]

Rotate  v. (-ting) 1 move round an axis or centre, revolve. 2 take or arrange (esp. Crops) in rotation. 3 act or take place in rotation (chairmanship will rotate).  rotatable adj. Rotatory adj. [latin: related to *rota]

Pustulate  v. (-ting) form into pustules. [latin: related to *pustule]

Disparity  n. (pl. -ies) inequality; difference; incongruity.

Ocelot  n. Leopard-like cat of s. And central america. [french from nahuatl]

Attest  v. 1 certify the validity of. 2 (foll. By to) bear witness to.  attestation n. [latin testis witness]

Dismember  v. 1 remove the limbs from. 2 partition or divide up.  dismemberment n.

Mccoy  n.  the real mccoy colloq. The real thing; the genuine article. [origin uncertain]

Vat  abbr. Value added tax.

Inedible  adj. Not suitable for eating.

Allure  —v. (-ring) attract, charm, or entice. —n. Attractiveness, personal charm, fascination.  allurement n. [french: related to *ad-, *lure]

Jeopardy  n. Danger, esp. Severe. [obsolete french iu parti divided play]

Bloodthirsty  adj. (-ier, -iest) eager for bloodshed.

Cinchona  n. 1 a s. American evergreen tree or shrub. B its bark, containing quinine. 2 drug from this. [countess of chinchón]

Flaccid  adj. Limp, flabby, drooping.  flaccidity n. [latin flaccus limp]

Propitiate  v. (-ting) appease (an offended person etc.).  propitiable adj. Propitiation n. Propitiator n. Propitiatory adj.  [latin: related to *propitious]

Confessedly  adv. By one's own or general admission.

Puffy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 swollen, puffed out. 2 colloq. Short-winded.  puffily adv. Puffiness n.

Hangdog  adj. Shamefaced.

Caecum  n. (us cecum) (pl. -ca) blind-ended pouch at the junction of the small and large intestines. [latin caecus blind]

Groundsel  n. Wild plant with small yellow flowers, used as a food for cage-birds etc. [old english]

Antecedent  —n. 1 preceding thing or circumstance. 2 gram. Word or phrase etc. To which another word (esp. A relative pronoun) refers. 3 (in pl.) Person's past history or ancestors. —adj. Previous. [latin cedo go]

Wall  —n. 1 continuous vertical narrow structure of usu. Brick or stone, esp. Enclosing or dividing a space or supporting a roof. 2 thing like a wall, esp.: a a steep side of a mountain. B anat. The outermost layer or enclosing membrane etc. Of an organ etc. —v. 1 (esp. As walled adj.) Surround with a wall. 2 a (usu. Foll. By up, off) block (a space etc.) With a wall. B (foll. By up) enclose within a sealed space.  go to the wall be defeated or pushed aside. Off the wall us slang unorthodox. Up the wall colloq. Crazy or furious. Walls have ears beware of eavesdroppers.  wall-less adj. [latin vallum rampart]

Mantle  —n. 1 loose sleeveless cloak. 2 covering (mantle of snow). 3 fragile lacelike tube fixed round a gas-jet to give an incandescent light. 4 region between the crust and the core of the earth. —v. (-ling) clothe; conceal, envelop. [latin mantellum cloak]

Cracking  slang —adj. 1 excellent. 2 (attrib.) Fast and exciting. —adv. Outstandingly.

Couple  —n. 1 a two (a couple of girls). B about two (a couple of hours). 2 a two people who are married to, or in a sexual relationship with, each other. B pair of partners in a dance etc. —v. (-ling) 1 link together. 2 associate in thought or speech. 3 copulate. [latin *copula]

Euthanasia  n. Bringing about of a gentle death in the case of incurable and painful disease. [greek thanatos death]

Refer  v. (-rr-) (usu. Foll. By to) 1 make an appeal or have recourse to (some authority or source of information) (referred to his notes). 2 send on or direct (a person, or a question for decision). 3 (of a person speaking) make an allusion or direct the hearer's or reader's attention (did not refer to our problems). 4 (of a statement etc.) Be relevant; relate (these figures refer to last year). 5  send (a person) to a medical specialist etc. 6 (foll. By back to) a return (a document etc.) To its sender for clarification. B send (a proposal etc.) Back to (a lower body, court, etc.). 7 fail (a candidate in an examination).  referable adj. [latin refero relat- carry back]

Shut  v. (-tt-; past and past part. Shut) 1 a move (a door, window, lid, etc.) Into position to block an opening. B close or seal (a room, box, eye, etc.) By moving a door etc. 2 become or be capable of being closed or sealed. 3 become or make closed for trade. 4 fold or contract (a book, telescope, etc.). 5 (usu. Foll. By in, out) keep in or out of a room etc. 6 (usu. Foll. By in) catch (a finger, dress, etc.) By shutting something on it. 7 bar access to.  be (or get) shut of slang be (or get) rid of. Shut down 1 stop (a factory etc.) From operating. 2 (of a factory etc.) Stop operating. Shut off 1 stop the flow of (water, gas, etc.). 2 separate from society etc. Shut out 1 exclude. 2 screen from view. 3 prevent. 4 block from the mind. Shut up 1 close all doors and windows of. 2 imprison. 3 put (a thing) away in a box etc. 4 (esp. In imper.) Colloq. Stop talking. Shut up shop close a business, shop, etc., temporarily or permanently. [old english]

Martini  n. (pl. -s) 1 propr. Type of vermouth. 2 cocktail of gin and french vermouth. [martini and rossi, name of a firm selling vermouth]

Sanctuary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 holy place. 2 a holiest part of a temple etc. B chancel. 3 place where birds, wild animals, etc., are bred and protected. 4 place of refuge.

Cat  n. 1 small soft-furred four-legged domesticated animal. 2 wild animal of the same family, e.g. Lion, tiger. 3 colloq. Malicious or spiteful woman. 4 = *cat-o'-nine-tails.  the cat's whiskers colloq. Excellent person or thing. Let the cat out of the bag reveal a secret. Like a cat on hot bricks very agitated. Put (or set) the cat among the pigeons cause trouble. Rain cats and dogs rain hard. [latin cattus]

Spice  —n. 1 aromatic or pungent vegetable substance used to flavour food. 2 spices collectively. 3 a piquant quality. B (foll. By of) slight flavour or suggestion. —v. (-cing) 1 flavour with spice. 2 (foll. By with) enhance (spiced with wit). [french espice]

Antinovel  n. Novel avoiding the conventions of the form.

Divination  n. Supposed supernatural insight into the future etc. [latin: related to *divine]

Ko  abbr. Knockout.

Economical  adj. Sparing; avoiding waste.  economically adv.

Derivative  —adj. Derived; not original (his music is derivative). —n. 1 derived word or thing. 2 math. Quantity measuring the rate of change of another.

Redesign  v. Design again or differently.

Onlooker  n. Spectator.  onlooking adj.

Ombudsman  n. (pl. -men) official appointed to investigate complaints against public authorities. [swedish, = legal representative]

Opprobrium  n. 1 disgrace. 2 cause of this. [latin, = infamy, reproach]

Fizz  —v. 1 make a hissing or spluttering sound. 2 (of a drink) effervesce. —n. 1 effervescence. 2 colloq. Effervescent drink, esp. Champagne. [imitative]

Necessitous  adj. Poor; needy.

Smokeless  adj. Producing little or no smoke; free from smoke.

Dependable  adj. Reliable.  dependability n. Dependableness n. Dependably adv.

Meteorology  n. The study of atmospheric phenomena, esp. For forecasting the weather.  meteorological adj. Meteorologist n. [greek meteorologia: related to *meteor]

Took  past of *take.

Lexicon  n. 1 dictionary, esp. Of greek, hebrew, syriac, or arabic. 2 vocabulary of a person etc. [greek lexis word]

Scurf  n. Dandruff.  scurfy adj. [old english]

Dairyman  n. Dealer in dairy products.

Ladylike  adj. Like or befitting a lady.

Twiddle  —v. (-ling) twirl, adjust, or play randomly or idly. —n. Act of twiddling.  twiddle one's thumbs 1 make them rotate round each other. 2 have nothing to do.  twiddly adj. [probably imitative]

Mandatory  adj. 1 compulsory. 2 of or conveying a command.  mandatorily adv. [latin: related to *mandate]

Gamboge  n. Gum resin used as a yellow pigment and as a purgative. [cambodia in se asia]

Compulsion  n. 1 compelling or being compelled; obligation. 2 irresistible urge. [latin: related to *compel]

Uncoil  v. Unwind.

Shier  compar. Of *shy1.

Mme  abbr. (pl. -s) madame.

Raven  —n. Large glossy blue-black crow with a hoarse cry. —adj. Glossy black. [old english]

Breakaway  n. (often attrib.) Breaking away; secession (breakaway group).

Quasi-  comb. Form 1 seemingly, not really. 2 almost. [latin quasi as if]

Vehicle  n. 1 conveyance used on land or in space. 2 thing or person as a medium for expression or action. 3 liquid etc. As a medium for suspending pigments, drugs, etc.  vehicular adj. [latin veho carry]

Frond  n. Leaflike part of a fern or palm. [latin frons frond- leaf]

Deregulate  v. (-ting) remove regulations from.  deregulation n.

Gravedigger  n. Person who digs graves.

Yoghurt  n. (also yogurt) semi-solid sourish food made from milk fermented by added bacteria. [turkish]

Livid  adj. 1 colloq. Furious. 2 of a bluish leaden colour (livid bruise). [latin]

Twelfth  adj. & n. 1 next after eleventh. 2 each of twelve equal parts of a thing. [old english: related to *twelve]

Retroactive  adj. (esp. Of legislation) effective from a past date.

Attributive  adj. Gram. (of an adjective or noun) preceding the word described, as old in the old dog.

Sardine  n. (pl. Same or -s) young pilchard etc. Sold in closely packed tins.  like sardines crowded close together. [french from latin]

Skull  n. 1 bony case of the brain of a vertebrate. 2 bony skeleton of the head. 3 head as the seat of intelligence. [origin unknown]

Terrestrial  adj. 1 of or on the earth; earthly. 2 of or on dry land. [latin terrestris: related to *terrene]

Mutual  adj. 1 (of feelings, actions, etc.) Experienced or done by each of two or more parties to or towards the other(s) (mutual affection). 2 colloq. Common to two or more persons (a mutual friend). 3 having the same (specified) relationship to each other (mutual well-wishers).  mutuality n. Mutually adv. [latin mutuus borrowed]

Usage  the use of mutual in sense 2, although often found, is considered incorrect by some people, for whom common is preferable.

Dextrin  n. Soluble gummy substance used as a thickening agent, adhesive, etc. [latin dextra on or to the right]

Unquiet  adj. 1 restless, agitated. 2 anxious.

Finale  n. Last movement or section of a piece of music or drama etc. [italian: related to *final]

Homonym  n. 1 word spelt or pronounced like another but of different meaning; homograph or homophone. 2 namesake. [from *homo-, onoma name]

Hazardous  adj. Risky.

Crying  attrib. Adj. (of injustice etc.) Flagrant, demanding redress.

Requisition  —n. 1 official order laying claim to the use of property or materials. 2 formal written demand that some duty should be performed. 3 being called or put into service. —v. Demand the use or supply of, esp. By requisition order. [latin: related to *require]

Queue  —n. Line or sequence of persons, vehicles, etc. Waiting their turn. —v. (queues, queued, queuing or queueing) (often foll. By up) form or join a queue. [latin cauda tail]

Eeg  abbr. Electroencephalogram.

Hibernian  archaic poet. —adj. Of ireland. —n. Native of ireland. [latin hibernia ireland]

Mezzanine  n. Storey between two others (usu. Between the ground and first floors). [italian: related to *median]

Consequence  n. 1 result or effect of what has gone before. 2 importance.  in consequence as a result. Take the consequences accept the results of one's choice or action. [latin: related to *consecutive]

Engineer  —n. 1 person skilled in a branch of engineering. 2 person who makes or is in charge of engines etc. (ship's engineer). 3 person who designs and constructs military works; soldier so trained. 4 contriver. —v. 1 contrive, bring about. 2 act as an engineer. 3 construct or manage as an engineer. [medieval latin: related to *engine]

Nt  abbr. 1 new testament. 2 northern territory (of australia). 3 national trust.

Fundamental  —adj. Of or being a base or foundation; essential, primary. —n. 1 (usu. In pl.) Fundamental principle. 2 mus. Fundamental note.  fundamentally adv. [latin: related to *found2]

Formidable  adj. 1 inspiring dread, awe, or respect. 2 hard to overcome or deal with.  formidably adv. [latin formido fear]

Usage  the second pronunciation given, with the stress on the second syllable, is common but considered incorrect by some people.

Pantry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 small room or cupboard in which crockery, cutlery, table linen, etc., are kept. 2 larder. [latin panis bread]

Nightdress  n. Woman's or child's loose garment worn in bed.

Wild  —adj. 1 in its original natural state; not domesticated, cultivated, or civilized (wild cat; wild strawberry). 2 unrestrained, disorderly, uncontrolled (wild youth; wild hair). 3 tempestuous (wild night). 4 intensely eager, frantic (wild excitement; wild delight). 5 (foll. By about) colloq. Enthusiastically devoted to. 6 colloq. Infuriated. 7 haphazard, ill-aimed, rash (wild guess; wild venture). 8 colloq. Exciting, delightful. —adv. In a wild manner. —n. 1 wild tract of land. 2 desert.  in the wild in an uncultivated etc. State. In the wilds colloq. Far from towns etc. Run wild grow or stray unchecked or undisciplined.  wildly adv. Wildness n. [old english]

Proclivity  n. (pl. -ies) tendency, inclination. [latin clivus slope]

Penitential  adj. Of penitence or penance.

Waterworks  n. 1 establishment for managing a water-supply. 2 colloq. Shedding of tears. 3 colloq. Urinary system.

Anyone  pron. Anybody.

Usage  anyone is written as two words to emphasize a numerical sense, as in any one of us can do it.

Saunter  —v. Walk slowly; stroll. —n. Leisurely walk. [origin unknown]

Surfeit  —n. 1 an excess, esp. In eating or drinking. 2 resulting fullness. —v. (-t-) 1 overfeed. 2 (foll. By with) (cause to) be wearied through excess. [french: related to *sur-1, *feat]

Tragedian  n. 1 writer of tragedies. 2 (fem. Tragedienne) actor in tragedy. [french: related to *tragedy]

Jewess  n. Often offens. Woman or girl of hebrew descent or whose religion is judaism.

Lovable  adj. (also loveable) inspiring love or affection.

Teal  n. (pl. Same) small freshwater duck. [origin unknown]

Duffer  n. Colloq. Inefficient or stupid person; dunce. [origin uncertain]

Woeful  adj. 1 sorrowful. 2 causing or feeling affliction. 3 very bad.  woefully adv.

Shrove  past of *shrive.

Aspirator  n. Apparatus for aspirating fluid. [latin: related to *aspire]

Wolfram  n. 1 tungsten. 2 tungsten ore. [german]

Friend  n. 1 person one likes and chooses to spend time with (usu. Without sexual or family bonds). 2 sympathizer, helper. 3 ally or neutral person (friend or foe?). 4 person already mentioned (our friend at the bank). 5 regular supporter of an institution. 6 (friend) quaker. [old english]

Ultramarine  —n. 1 brilliant blue pigment orig. From lapis lazuli. 2 colour of this. —adj. Of this colour. [italian and medieval latin, = beyond the sea, from where lapis lazuli was brought]

Asteroid  n. 1 any of the minor planets orbiting the sun, mainly between the orbits of mars and jupiter. 2 starfish. [greek: related to *aster]

Redouble  —v. (-ling) 1 make or grow greater or more intense or numerous. 2 bridge double again a bid already doubled by an opponent. —n. Bridge redoubling of a bid.

Furrier  n. Dealer in or dresser of furs. [french]

Whitsuntide  n. Weekend or week including whit sunday.

Casement  n. Window or part of a window hinged to open like a door. [anglo-latin: related to *case2]

Exponential  adj. 1 of or indicated by a mathematical exponent. 2 (of an increase etc.) More and more rapid.

Dignify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 confer dignity on; ennoble. 2 give a fine name to. [latin dignus worthy]

Relievo  n. (pl. -s) = *relief 6. [italian rilievo: related to *relief]

Atomic  adj. 1 of or using atomic energy or atomic bombs. 2 of atoms.

Story  n. (pl. -ies) 1 account of imaginary or past events; tale, anecdote. 2 history of a person or institution etc. 3 (in full story-line) narrative or plot of a novel, play, etc. 4 facts or experiences worthy of narration. 5 colloq. Fib. [anglo-french estorie from latin: related to *history]

Moreover  adv. Besides, in addition to what has been said.

Onrush  n. Onward rush.

Dolphin  n. Large porpoise-like sea mammal with a slender pointed snout. [greek delphis -in-]

Decelerate  v. (-ting) (cause to) reduce speed.  deceleration n. [from *de-, *accelerate]

Addendum  n. (pl. -da) 1 thing to be added. 2 material added at the end of a book.

Animism  n. Belief that inanimate and natural phenomena have souls.  animist n. Animistic adj.

Exo-  comb. Form external. [greek exo outside]

Selves  pl. Of *self.

Incomparable  adj. Without an equal; matchless.  incomparability n. Incomparably adv.

Taxa  pl. Of *taxon.

Avocet  n. Long-legged wading bird with an upward-curved bill. [french from italian]

Favorable  adj. (brit. Favourable) 1 well-disposed; propitious; approving. 2 promising, auspicious. 3 helpful, suitable.  favourably adv.

Precast  adj. (of concrete) cast in its final shape before positioning.

Riot  —n. 1 a violent disturbance by a crowd of people. B (attrib.) Involved in suppressing riots (riot police). 2 loud uncontrolled revelry. 3 (foll. By of) lavish display or sensation (riot of colour and sound). 4 colloq. Very amusing thing or person. —v. Make or engage in a riot.  read the riot act act firmly to suppress insubordination; give warning.

Dislocate  v. (-ting) 1 disturb the normal connection of (esp. A joint in the body). 2 disrupt.  dislocation n.

Upstart  —n. Newly successful, esp. Arrogant, person. —adj. 1 that is an upstart. 2 of upstarts.

Tassel  n. 1 tuft of loosely hanging threads or cords etc. As decoration. 2 tassel-like flower-head of some plants, esp. Maize.  tasselled adj. (us taseled). [french tas(s)el clasp]

Senescent  adj. Growing old.  senescence n. [latin senex old]

Somewhere  —adv. In or to some place. —pron. Some unspecified place.

Assess  v. 1 estimate the size or quality of. 2 estimate the value of (property etc.) For taxation.  assessment n. [latin assideo -sess- sit by]

Secretive  adj. Inclined to make or keep secrets; uncommunicative.  secretively adv. Secretiveness n.

Jewry  n. Jews collectively.

Diploma  n. 1 certificate of qualification awarded by a college etc. 2 document conferring an honour or privilege. [greek, = folded paper, from diplous double]

Dead  —adj. 1 no longer alive. 2 colloq. Extremely tired or unwell. 3 numb (fingers are dead). 4 (foll. By to) insensitive to. 5 no longer effective or in use; extinct. 6 (of a match, coal, etc.) Extinguished. 7 inanimate. 8 a lacking force or vigour. B (of sound) not resonant. 9 quiet; lacking activity (dead season). 10 (of a microphone, telephone, etc.) Not transmitting sounds. 11 (of a ball in a game) out of play. 12 abrupt, complete (come to a dead stop; a dead calm; dead certainty). —adv. 1 absolutely, completely (dead on target; dead tired). 2 colloq. Very, extremely (dead easy). —n. Time of silence or inactivity (dead of night).  as dead as the (or a) dodo entirely obsolete. Dead to the world colloq. Fast asleep; unconscious. [old english]

Participle  n. Word formed from a verb (e.g. Going, gone, being, been) and used in compound verb-forms (e.g. Is going, has been) or as an adjective (e.g. Working woman, burnt toast).  participial adj. [latin: related to *participate]

Successful  adj. Having success; prosperous.  successfully adv.

Chalybeate  adj. (of water etc.) Impregnated with iron salts. [latin chalybs steel, from greek]

Phrenology  n. Hist. The study of the shape and size of the cranium as a supposed indication of character and mental faculties.  phrenological adj. Phrenologist n. [greek phren mind]

Censer  n. Vessel for burning incense. [anglo-french: related to *incense1]

Zygote  n. Biol. Cell formed by the union of two gametes. [greek zugotos yoked: related to *zeugma]

Jerrycan  n. (also jerrican) a kind of (orig. German) petrol- or water-can. [from *jerry]

Floodgate  n. 1 gate for admitting or excluding water, esp. In a lock. 2 (usu. In pl.) Last restraint against tears, rain, anger, etc.

Major  —adj. 1 relatively great in size, intensity, scope, or importance. 2 (of surgery) serious. 3 mus. A (of a scale) having intervals of a semitone above its third and seventh notes. B (of an interval) greater by a semitone than a minor interval (major third). C (of a key) based on a major scale. 4 of full legal age. —n. 1  a army officer next below lieutenant-colonel. B officer in charge of a band section (drum major). 2 person of full legal age. 3 us a student's main subject or course. B student of this. —v. (foll. By in) us study or qualify in (a subject) as one's main subject. [latin, comparative of magnus great]

Handicapped  adj. Suffering from a physical or mental disability.

Mosey  v. (-eys, -eyed) (often foll. By along) slang go in a leisurely manner. [origin unknown]

Mini  n. (pl. -s) 1 colloq. Miniskirt. 2 (mini) propr. Make of small car. [abbreviation]

Impart  v. (often foll. By to) 1 communicate (news etc.). 2 give a share of (a thing). [latin: related to *part]

Inflorescence  n. 1 a complete flower-head of a plant. B arrangement of this. 2 flowering. [latin: related to *in-2, *flourish]

Hysteria  n. 1 wild uncontrollable emotion or excitement. 2 functional disturbance of the nervous system, of psychoneurotic origin. [greek hustera womb]

Trigonometry  n. Branch of mathematics dealing with the relations of the sides and angles of triangles and with the relevant functions of any angles.  trigonometric adj. Trigonometrical adj. [greek trigonon triangle]

Creator  n. 1 person who creates. 2 (as the creator) god.

Dynasty  n. (pl. -ies) 1 line of hereditary rulers. 2 succession of leaders in any field.  dynastic adj. [latin from greek]

Ecto-  comb. Form outside. [greek ektos]

Paroxysm  n. 1 (often foll. By of) sudden attack or outburst (of rage, coughing, etc.). 2 fit of disease.  paroxysmal adj. [greek oxus sharp]

Pavane  n. (also pavan) hist. 1 a kind of stately dance. 2 music for this. [french from spanish]

Pedophilia  n. (brit. Paedophilia) sexual attraction felt towards children.

Magus  n. (pl. Magi) 1 priest of ancient persia. 2 sorcerer. 3 (the magi) the ‘wise men’ from the east (matt. 2:1–12). [persian magus]

Parascending  n. Sport in which participants wearing open parachutes are towed behind a vehicle or motor boat to gain height before release for a conventional descent.

Recant  v. (also absol.) Withdraw and renounce (a former belief or statement) as erroneous or heretical.  recantation n. [latin: related to *chant]

Withy  var. Of *withe.

Heading  n. 1 a title at the head of a page or section of a book etc. B section of a subject of discourse etc. 2 horizontal passage made in preparation for building a tunnel, or in a mine.

Baulk  (also balk) —v. 1 (often foll. By at) jib, hesitate. 2 a thwart, hinder. B disappoint. 3 miss, let slip (a chance etc.). —n. 1 hindrance; stumbling-block. 2 roughly-squared timber beam. [old english]

Paperback  n. (often attrib.) Book bound in paper or card, not boards.

Ruminant  —n. Animal that chews the cud. —adj. 1 of ruminants. 2 meditative. [related to *ruminate]

Disavow  v. Disclaim knowledge of or responsibility for.  disavowal n.

Tenant  n. 1 person who rents land or property from a landlord. 2 (often foll. By of) occupant of a place. [french: related to *tenable]

This  —demons. Pron. (pl. These) 1 person or thing close at hand or indicated or already named or understood (can you see this?; this is my cousin). 2 (contrasted with that) the person or thing nearer to hand or more immediately in mind. —demons. Adj. (pl. These) 1 designating the person or thing close at hand etc. (cf. Senses 1, 2 of pron.). 2 (of time) the present or current (am busy all this week). 3 colloq. (in narrative) designating a person or thing previously unmentioned (then up came this policeman). —adv. To the degree or extent indicated (knew him when he was this high).  this and that colloq. Various unspecified things. [old english]

Detergent  —n. Synthetic cleansing agent used with water. —adj. Cleansing. [latin tergeo wipe]

Forbearance  n. Patient self-control; tolerance.

Sluggish  adj. Inert; slow-moving.  sluggishly adv. Sluggishness n.

Contour  —n. 1 outline. 2 (in full contour line) line on a map joining points of equal altitude. —v. Mark with contour lines. [italian contornare draw in outline]

Equivalent  —adj. 1 (often foll. By to) equal in value, amount, importance, etc. 2 corresponding. 3 having the same meaning or result. —n. Equivalent thing, amount, etc.  equivalence n. [latin: related to *value]

Juxtapose  v. (-sing) 1 place (things) side by side. 2 (foll. By to, with) place (a thing) beside another.  juxtaposition n. Juxtapositional adj. [latin juxta next, pono put]

Unrewarded  adj. Not rewarded.

Romance  —n. 1 idealized, poetic, or unworldly atmosphere or tendency. 2 a love affair. B mutual attraction in this. C sentimental or idealized love. 3 a literary genre concerning romantic love, stirring action, etc. B work of this genre. 4 medieval, esp. Verse, tale of chivalry, common in the romance languages. 5 a exaggeration, lies. B instance of this. 6 (romance) (often attrib.) Languages descended from latin. 7 mus. Short informal piece. —v. (-cing) 1 exaggerate, distort the truth, fantasize. 2 court, woo. [romanic: related to *romanic]

Usage  the alternative pronunciation given for the noun, with the stress on the first syllable, is considered incorrect by some people.

Tomtit  n. Tit, esp. A blue tit.

Sac  n. Membranous bag in an animal or plant. [latin: related to *sack1]

Hobgoblin  n. Mischievous imp; bogy. [from *hobby, *goblin]

Police  —n. (as pl.) 1 (usu. Prec. By the) the civil force responsible for maintaining public order. 2 its members. 3 force with similar functions (military police). —v. (-cing) 1 keep (a place or people) in order by means of police or a similar body. 2 provide with police. 3 keep in order, administer, control (problem of policing the new law). [latin: related to *policy1]

Malpractice  n. Improper, negligent, or criminal professional conduct.

Bally  adj. & adv. Slang mild form of bloody (see *bloody adj. 3). [alteration of *bloody]

Expression  n. 1 expressing or being expressed. 2 word or phrase expressed. 3 person's facial appearance, indicating feeling. 4 conveying of feeling in music, speaking, dance, etc. 5 depiction of feeling etc. In art. 6 math. Collection of symbols expressing a quantity.  expressionless adj. [french: related to *express]

Numberless  adj. Innumerable.

Meerkat  n. S. African mongoose. [dutch, = sea-cat]

Does  see *do1.

Abaft  naut. ?adv. In the stern half of a ship. ?prep. Nearer the stern than. [from *a2, -baft: see *aft]

Rowdy  —adj. (-ier, -iest) noisy and disorderly. —n. (pl. -ies) rowdy person.  rowdily adv. Rowdiness n. Rowdyism n. [origin unknown]

Stigmatize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) (often foll. By as) brand as unworthy or disgraceful. [greek stigmatizo: related to *stigma]

Liberty  n. (pl. -ies) 1 freedom from captivity etc. 2 right or power to do as one pleases. 3 (usu. In pl.) Right or privilege granted by authority.  at liberty 1 free. 2 (foll. By to + infin.) Permitted. Take liberties (often foll. By with) behave in an unduly familiar manner. [latin: related to *liberal]

Diktat  n. Categorical statement or decree. [german, = *dictate]

Heartthrob  n. Colloq. Person for whom one has (esp. Immature) romantic feelings.

Chuff  v. (of an engine etc.) Work with a regular sharp puffing sound. [imitative]

Chlorinate  v. (-ting) impregnate or treat with chlorine.  chlorination n.

Brunette  n. Woman with dark brown hair. [french diminutive]

Hydrography  n. Science of surveying and charting seas, lakes, rivers, etc.  hydrographer n. Hydrographic adj.

Variation  n. 1 varying. 2 departure from the normal kind, amount, a standard, etc. (prices are subject to variation). 3 extent of this. 4 variant thing. 5 mus. Theme in a changed or elaborated form.

Anapaest  n. Metrical foot consisting of two short syllables followed by one long syllable (&anapaest.). [greek anapaistos reversed (dactyl)]

Disarrange  v. (-ging) bring into disorder.  disarrangement n.

Charybdis  see *scylla and charybdis.

Growth  n. 1 act or process of growing. 2 increase in size or value. 3 something that has grown or is growing. 4 med. Morbid formation.

Insulate  v. (-ting) 1 prevent the passage of electricity, heat, or sound from (a thing, room, etc.) By interposing non-conductors. 2 isolate.  insulation n. Insulator n. [latin insula island]

Bout  n. 1 (often foll. By of) a spell (of work or activity). B attack (bout of flu). 2 wrestling- or boxing-match. [obsolete bought bending]

Trachea  n. (pl. -cheae) windpipe. [latin from greek]

Intercession  n. Interceding.  intercessor n. [latin: related to *intercede]

Opener  n. 1 device for opening tins, bottles, etc. 2 colloq. First item on a programme etc.

Feudal  adj. 1 of, like, or according to the feudal system. 2 reactionary (feudal attitude).  feudalism n. Feudalistic adj.

Stepchild  n. One's husband's or wife's child by a previous partner.

Provenance  n. Origin or place of origin; history. [french provenir from latin]

Middling  —adj. Moderately good. —adv. Fairly, moderately.

Vista  n. 1 long narrow view as between rows of trees. 2 mental view of a long series of events. [italian]

Mc  abbr. 1 master of ceremonies. 2 military cross. 3 member of congress.

Innocuous  adj. Harmless. [latin innocuus: related to *innocent]

Cockle  n. 1 a edible bivalve shellfish. B its shell. 2 (in full cockle-shell) small shallow boat. 3 pucker or wrinkle in paper, glass, etc.  warm the cockles of one's heart make one contented. [french coquille from greek: related to *conch]

Yaw  —v. (of a ship or aircraft etc.) Fail to hold a straight course; go unsteadily. —n. Yawing of a ship etc. From its course. [origin unknown]

Chinese  —adj. Of china. —n. 1 chinese language. 2 (pl. Same) a native or national of china. B person of chinese descent.

Distributive  —adj. 1 of or produced by distribution. 2 logic & gram. Referring to each individual of a class, not to the class collectively (e.g. Each, either). —n. Gram. Distributive word.

Carapace  n. Upper shell of a tortoise or crustacean. [french from spanish]

Unknowing  adj. (often foll. By of) not knowing; ignorant, unconscious.  unknowingly adv.

Triumvirate  n. Ruling group of three men, esp. In ancient rome. [latin tres three, vir man]

Barbie  n. Austral. Slang barbecue. [abbreviation]

Adam  n. The first man.  not know a person from adam be unable to recognize a person. [hebrew, = man]

Strung  past and past part. Of *string.

Legendary  adj. 1 of, based on, or described in a legend. 2 colloq. Remarkable.

Haulm  n. (also halm) 1 stalk or stem. 2 stalks or stems of peas, beans, etc., collectively. [old english]

Sparse  adj. Thinly dispersed or scattered.  sparsely adv. Sparseness n. Sparsity n. [latin spargo spars- scatter]

Quorate  adj. Constituting or having a quorum. [from *quorum]

Falsetto  n. Male singing voice above the normal range. [italian diminutive: related to *false]

Delineate  v. (-ting) portray by drawing etc. Or in words.  delineation n. [latin: related to *line1]

Dear  —adj. 1 a beloved or much esteemed. B as a merely polite or ironic form (my dear man). 2 as a formula of address, esp. Beginning a letter (dear sir). 3 (often foll. By to) precious; cherished. 4 (usu. In superl.) Earnest (my dearest wish). 5 a expensive. B having high prices. —n. (esp. As a form of address) dear person. —adv. At great cost (will pay dear). —int. Expressing surprise, dismay, pity, etc. (dear me!; oh dear!).  for dear life desperately.  dearly adv. [old english]

Titfer  n. Slang hat. [abbreviation of tit for tat, rhyming slang]

Overexert  v. Exert too much.  overexertion n.

Glut  —v. (-tt-) 1 feed (a person, one's stomach, etc.) Or indulge (a desire etc.) To the full; satiate. 2 fill to excess. 3 overstock (a market). —n. 1 supply exceeding demand. 2 full indulgence; surfeit. [french gloutir swallow: related to *glutton]

Terse  adj. (terser, tersest) 1 brief, concise. 2 curt, abrupt.  tersely adv. Terseness n. [latin tergo ters- wipe]

Rsm  abbr. Regimental sergeant-major.

Travelled  adj. (us traveled) experienced in travelling (also in comb.: much-travelled).

Evidently  adv. 1 seemingly; as it appears. 2 as shown by evidence.

Outgoing  —adj. 1 friendly. 2 retiring from office. 3 going out. —n. (in pl.) Expenditure.

Disclose  v. (-sing) make known; expose.  disclosure n.

Memsahib  n. Anglo-ind. Hist. Indian name for a european married woman in india. [from *ma'am, *sahib]

Senator  n. Member of a senate.  senatorial adj. [latin: related to *senate]

Legalistic  adj. Adhering excessively to a law or formula.  legalism n. Legalist n.

Unadventurous  adj. Not adventurous.

Hussar  n. Soldier of a light cavalry regiment. [magyar huszár]

Intact  adj. 1 undamaged; entire. 2 untouched.  intactness n. [latin tango tact- touch]

Bimbo  n. (pl. -s or -es) slang usu. Derog. Attractive but unintelligent young woman. [italian, = little child]

Freightliner  n. Train carrying goods in containers.

Remittance  n. 1 money sent, esp. By post. 2 sending of money.

Trophy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 cup etc. As a prize in a contest. 2 memento or souvenir of success in hunting, war, etc. [greek tropaion]

Headlock  n. Wrestling hold with an arm round the opponent's head.

Mansard  n. Roof with four sloping sides, each of which becomes steeper halfway down. [mansart, name of an architect]

Philanthropy  n. 1 love of mankind. 2 practical benevolence.  philanthropic adj. Philanthropist n. [greek anthropos human being]

Acropolis  n. Citadel of an ancient greek city. [greek akron summit, polis city]

Overproduce  v. (-cing) 1 (often absol.) Produce more of (a commodity) than is wanted. 2 produce (a play, recording, etc.) To an excessive degree. overproduction n.

Paperwork  n. Routine clerical or administrative work.

Nostalgia  n. 1 (often foll. By for) yearning for a past period. 2 severe homesickness.  nostalgic adj. Nostalgically adv. [greek nostos return home]

Chagrin  —n. Acute annoyance or disappointment. —v. Affect with chagrin. [french]

Neurology  n. The study of nerve systems.  neurological adj. Neurologist n.

Unclouded  adj. 1 clear; bright. 2 untroubled (unclouded serenity).

Pronounced  adj. Strongly marked; noticeable (pronounced limp).

Trinity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 state of being three. 2 group of three. 3 (the trinity or holy trinity) theol. The three persons of the christian godhead (father, son, and holy spirit). [latin trinitas from trinus threefold]

Restless  adj. 1 without rest or sleep. 2 uneasy; agitated. 3 constantly in motion, fidgeting, etc.  restlessly adv. Restlessness n. [old english: related to *rest1]

Reunite  v. (-ting) (cause to) come together again.

Shrill  —adj. 1 piercing and high-pitched in sound. 2 derog. Sharp, unrestrained. —v. Utter with or make a shrill sound.  shrillness n. Shrilly adv. [origin uncertain]

Redial  v. (-ll-; us -l-) dial again.

Germander  n. Plant of the mint family. [greek, = ground-oak]

Martin  n. A kind of swallow, esp. The house-martin and sand-martin. [probably st martin, name of a 4th-c. Bishop]

Lasting  adj. Permanent; durable.

Quench  v. 1 satisfy (thirst) by drinking. 2 extinguish (a fire or light). 3 cool, esp. With water. 4 esp. Metallurgy cool (a hot substance) in cold water etc. 5 stifle or suppress (desire etc.). [old english]

Stagecoach  n. Hist. Large closed horse-drawn coach running on a regular route by stages.

Namely  adv. That is to say; in other words.

-phile  comb. Form (also -phil) forming nouns and adjectives denoting fondness for what is specified (bibliophile). [greek philos loving]

Dairymaid  n. Woman employed in a dairy.

Chipolata  n. Small thin sausage. [french from italian]

Soubriquet  var. Of *sobriquet.

Augur  —v. Portend, serve as an omen (augur well or ill). —n. Hist. Roman religious official interpreting natural phenomena in order to pronounce on proposed actions. [latin]

Quinquennial  adj. 1 lasting five years. 2 recurring every five years.  quinquennially adv. [latin quinquennis from quinque five, annus year]

Prismatic  adj. 1 of, like, or using a prism. 2 (of colours) distributed (as if) by a transparent prism. [greek: related to *prism]

Unwinking  adj. 1 not winking. 2 vigilant.

Springtime  n. Season of spring.

Bang  —n. 1 loud short sound. 2 sharp blow. 3 coarse slang act of sexual intercourse. 4 us fringe cut straight across the forehead. —v. 1 strike or shut noisily (banged the door). 2 (cause to) make a bang. 3 coarse slang have sexual intercourse (with). —adv. 1 with a bang. 2 colloq. Exactly (bang in the middle).  bang on colloq. Exactly right. Go bang 1 shut noisily. 2 explode. 3 (as bang goes etc.) Colloq. Be suddenly lost (bang go my hopes). [imitative]

Unmanned  adj. 1 not manned. 2 overcome by emotion etc.

Empanel  v. (also impanel) (-ll-; us -l-) enter (a jury) on a panel.

Diner  n. 1 person who dines. 2 dining-car. 3 us small restaurant. 4 small dining-room.

Ladybird  n. Small beetle, usu. Red with black spots.

Outfield  n. Outer part of a cricket or baseball pitch.  outfielder n.

Afford  v. 1 (prec. By can or be able to) a have enough money, time, etc., for; be able to spare. B be in a position (can't afford to be critical). 2 provide (affords a view of the sea). [old english ge- prefix implying completeness, *forth]

Snowberry  n. (pl. -ies) shrub with white berries.

Efficacious  adj. Producing the desired effect.  efficacy n. [latin efficax: related to *efficient]

Unintended  adj. Not intended.

Gouache  n. 1 method of painting in opaque pigments ground in water and thickened with a gluelike substance. 2 these pigments. [french from italian]

Sensitive  adj. 1 (often foll. By to) acutely susceptible to external stimuli or impressions; having sensibility. 2 easily offended or hurt. 3 (often foll. By to) (of an instrument etc.) Responsive to or recording slight changes. 4 (of photographic materials) responding (esp. Rapidly) to light. 5 (of a topic etc.) Requiring tactful treatment or secrecy.  sensitively adv. Sensitiveness n. Sensitivity n.

Grit  —n. 1 particles of stone or sand, esp. As irritating or hindering. 2 coarse sandstone. 3 colloq. Pluck, endurance. —v. (-tt-) 1 spread grit on (icy roads etc.). 2 clench (the teeth). 3 make a grating sound.  gritter n. Gritty adj. (-ier, -iest). [old english]

Postnatal  adj. Of the period after childbirth.

Cubit  n. Ancient measure of length, approximating to the length of a forearm. [latin cubitum elbow]

Spay  v. Sterilize (a female animal) by removing the ovaries. [anglo-french: related to *épée]

Dee  n. 1 letter d. 2 thing shaped like this. [name of the letter d]

Coverall  n. Esp. Us 1 thing that covers entirely. 2 (usu. In pl.) Full-length protective garment.

Boer  —n. South african of dutch descent. —adj. Of the boers. [dutch, = farmer]

Harridan  n. Bad-tempered old woman. [origin uncertain]

Figurative  adj. 1 metaphorical, not literal. 2 characterized by figures of speech. 3 of pictorial or sculptural representation.  figuratively adv. [latin: related to *figure]

Speciality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 special subject, product, activity, etc. 2 special feature or skill.

Totality  n. 1 complete amount. 2 time during which an eclipse is total.

Cosmic  adj. 1 of the cosmos or its scale; universal (of cosmic significance). 2 of or for space travel.

Poppycock  n. Slang nonsense. [dutch pappekak]

Thick  —adj. 1 of great or specified extent between opposite surfaces. 2 (of a line etc.) Broad; not fine. 3 arranged closely; crowded together; dense. 4 (usu. Foll. By with) densely covered or filled (air thick with smoke). 5 a firm in consistency; containing much solid matter. B made of thick material (a thick coat). 6 a muddy, cloudy; impenetrable by sight. B (of one's head) suffering from a hangover, headache, etc. 7 colloq. Stupid. 8 a (of a voice) indistinct. B (of an accent) very marked. 9 colloq. Intimate, very friendly. —n. Thick part of anything. —adv. Thickly (snow was falling thick).  a bit thick colloq. Unreasonable or intolerable. In the thick of at the busiest part of. Through thick and thin under all conditions; in spite of all difficulties.  thickish adj. Thickly adv. [old english]

Infinitive  —n. Form of a verb expressing the verbal notion without a particular subject, tense, etc. (e.g. See in we came to see, let him see). —adj. Having this form.

Cantabrigian  —adj. Of cambridge or its university. —n. Person from cambridge or its university. [cantabrigia, latinized name of cambridge]

Melee  n. (brit. Mêlée) 1 confused fight, skirmish, or scuffle. 2 muddle. [french: related to *medley]

Affected  adj. 1 pretended, artificial. 2 full of affectation.

Goldfish  n. (pl. Same or -es) small reddish-golden chinese carp.

Fetid  adj. (also foetid) stinking. [latin feteo stink]

Cubic  adj. 1 cube-shaped. 2 of three dimensions. 3 involving the cube (and no higher power) of a number (cubic equation).

Piglet  n. Young pig.

Jamjar  n. Glass jar for jam.

Cassowary  n. (pl. -ies) large flightless australasian bird. [malay]

Tang  n. 1 strong taste or smell. 2 characteristic quality. 3 projection on the blade of esp. A knife, by which it is held firm in the handle. [old norse tange point]

Eater  n. 1 person who eats (a big eater). 2 eating apple etc.

Bagatelle  n. 1 game in which small balls are struck into holes on a board. 2 mere trifle. 3 short piece of esp. Piano music. [french from italian]

Fivestones  n. Jacks played with five pieces of metal etc. And usu. No ball.

Nozzle  n. Spout on a hose etc. From which a jet issues. [diminutive of *nose]

Retriever  n. Dog of a breed used for retrieving game.

Welt  —n. 1 leather rim sewn round the edge of a shoe-upper for the sole to be attached to. 2 = *weal1. 3 ribbed or reinforced border of a garment. 4 heavy blow. —v. 1 provide with a welt. 2 raise weals on; thrash. [origin unknown]

Rsv  abbr. Revised standard version (of the bible).

Consubstantial  adj. Theol. Of one substance. [church latin: related to *substance]

Olympian  —adj. 1 a of olympus. B celestial. 2 (of manners etc.) Magnificent, condescending, superior. 3 = *olympic. —n. 1 greek god dwelling on olympus. 2 person of superhuman ability or calm. 3 competitor in the olympic games. [from mt. Olympus in greece, or as *olympic]

Particoloured  adj. (us -colored) of more than one colour. [related to *part, *colour]

Extirpate  v. (-ting) root out; destroy completely.  extirpation n. [latin ex(s)tirpo from stirps stem of tree]

Cushy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. (of a job etc.) Easy and pleasant. [hindi khush pleasant]

Enlarge  v. (-ging) 1 make or become larger or wider. 2 (often foll. By on, upon) describe in greater detail. 3 reproduce a photograph on a larger scale.  enlargement n. [french: related to *large]

Footman  n. Liveried servant.

Utilitarianism  n. Doctrine that actions are right if they are useful or benefit a majority.

Binder  n. 1 cover for loose papers etc. 2 substance that binds things together. 3 hist. Reaping-machine that binds grain into sheaves. 4 bookbinder.

Sinhalese  (also singhalese) —n. (pl. Same) 1 member of a n. Indian people now forming the majority of the population of sri lanka. 2 their language. —adj. Of this people or language. [sanskrit]

Spastic  —adj. Of or having cerebral palsy. —n. 1 spastic person. 2 slang offens. Stupid or incompetent person. [greek: related to *spasm]

Electrocardiogram  n. Record traced by an electrocardiograph. [german: related to *electro-]

Edgeways  adv. (also edgewise) with edge uppermost or foremost.  get a word in edgeways contribute to a conversation when the dominant speaker pauses.

Undersubscribed  adj. Without sufficient subscribers, participants, etc.

Commoner  n. 1 one of the common people (below the rank of peer). 2 university student without a scholarship. [medieval latin: related to *common]

Morello  n. (pl. -s) sour kind of dark cherry. [italian, = blackish]

Thermodynamics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Science of the relations between heat and other forms of energy.  thermodynamic adj.

Craving  n. Strong desire or longing.

Situation  n. 1 place and its surroundings. 2 circumstances; position; state of affairs. 3 formal paid job.  situational adj.

Incinerate  v. (-ting) burn to ashes.  incineration n. [medieval latin cinis ciner- ashes]

Lilliputian  —n. Diminutive person or thing. —adj. Diminutive. [lilliput in swift's gulliver's travels]

Booty  n. 1 loot, spoil. 2 colloq. Prize or gain. [german]

Requiem  n. 1 (requiem) (also attrib.) Chiefly rc ch. Mass for the repose of the souls of the dead. 2 music for this. [latin, = rest]

Trail  —n. 1 track or scent left by a moving thing, person, etc. 2 beaten path, esp. Through a wild region. 3 long line of people or things following behind something. 4 part dragging behind a thing or person. —v. 1 draw or be drawn along behind, esp. On the ground. 2 (often foll. By behind) walk wearily. 3 follow the trail of; pursue. 4 be losing in a contest (trailing by three points). 5 (usu. Foll. By away, off) peter out; tail off. 6 a (of a plant etc.) Grow or hang over a wall, along the ground, etc. B hang loosely. 7 (often refl.) Drag (oneself, one's limbs, etc.) Along wearily etc. [french or low german]

Ventilator  n. 1 appliance or aperture for ventilating a room etc. 2 med. = *respirator 2.

Systematic  adj. 1 methodical; according to a system. 2 regular, deliberate.  systematically adv.

Cotton  n. 1 soft white fibrous substance covering the seeds of certain plants. 2 such a plant. 3 thread or cloth from this.  cotton on (often foll. By to) colloq. Begin to understand. [french from arabic]

Harvester  n. 1 reaper. 2 reaping-machine, esp. With sheaf-binding.

Overcompensate  v. (-ting) 1 (usu. Foll. By for) compensate excessively. 2  strive exaggeratedly to make amends etc.

Strut  —n. 1 bar in a framework, designed to resist compression. 2 strutting gait. —v. (-tt-) 1 walk stiffly and pompously. 2 brace with struts. [old english]

Excitement  n. 1 excited state of mind. 2 exciting thing.

Rivet  —n. Nail or bolt for joining metal plates etc., with the headless end beaten out when in place. —v. (-t-) 1 a join or fasten with rivets. B beat out or press down the end of (a nail or bolt). C fix, make immovable. 2 a (foll. By on, upon) direct intently (one's eyes or attention etc.). B (esp. As riveting adj.) Engross (a person or the attention). [french river fasten]

Ramify  v. (-ies, -ied) (cause to) form branches, subdivisions, or offshoots; branch out. [latin ramus branch]

Inexpiable  adj. That cannot be expiated or appeased.

Epithelium  n. (pl. -s or -lia) tissue forming the outer layer of the body and lining many hollow structures.  epithelial adj. [greek thele teat]

Leaf  —n. (pl. Leaves) 1 each of several flattened usu. Green structures of a plant, growing usu. On the side of a stem. 2 a foliage regarded collectively. B state of bearing leaves (tree in leaf). 3 single thickness of paper. 4 very thin sheet of metal etc. 5 hinged part, extra section, or flap of a table etc. —v. 1 put forth leaves. 2 (foll. By through) turn over the pages of (a book etc.).  leafage n. Leafy adj. (-ier, -iest). [old english]

Unaccustomed  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By to) not accustomed. 2 unusual (unaccustomed silence).

Complaint  n. 1 complaining. 2 grievance, cause of dissatisfaction. 3 ailment. 4 formal accusation.

Haunting  adj. (of a memory, melody, etc.) Tending to linger in the mind; poignant, evocative.

Inconvenient  adj. Causing trouble, difficulty, or discomfort; awkward.  inconveniently adv.

Evince  v. (-cing) indicate, display (a quality, feeling, etc.). [latin: related to *evict]

Apologetic  —adj. 1 showing or expressing regret. 2 of apologetics. —n. (usu. In pl.) Reasoned defence, esp. Of christianity.  apologetically adv.

Slogan  n. 1 catchy phrase used in advertising etc. 2 party cry; watchword. [gaelic, = war cry]

Wisp  n. 1 small bundle or twist of straw etc. 2 small separate quantity of smoke, hair, etc. 3 small thin person etc.  wispy adj. (-ier, -iest). [origin uncertain]

Appliance  n. Device etc. For a specific task. [related to *apply]

Ostensible  adj. Concealing the real; professed.  ostensibly adv. [latin ostendo ostens- show]

Doyley  var. Of *doily.

Copulate  v. (-ting) (often foll. By with) (esp. Of animals) have sexual intercourse.  copulation n.

Wavy  adj. (-ier, -iest) having waves or alternate contrary curves.  waviness n.

Absorbent  —adj. Tending to absorb. —n. Absorbent substance or organ.

Fearful  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By of or that) afraid. 2 terrible, awful. 3 colloq. Extreme, esp. Unpleasant (fearful row).  fearfully adv. Fearfulness n.

Bowsprit  n. Spar running forward from a ship's bow.

Smocking  n. Ornamental effect on cloth made by gathering it tightly with stitches.

Chintz  n. Printed multicoloured usu. Glazed cotton fabric. [hindi from sanskrit]

Buff  —adj. Of a yellowish beige colour (buff envelope). —n. 1 this colour. 2 (in comb.) Colloq. Enthusiast (railway buff). 3 velvety dull-yellow ox-leather. —v. 1 polish (metal etc.). 2 make (leather) velvety.  in the buff colloq. Naked. [originally = buffalo, from french buffle]

Larch  n. 1 deciduous coniferous tree with bright foliage. 2 its wood. [latin larix -icis]

Legume  n. 1 leguminous plant. 2 edible part of a leguminous plant. [latin legumen -minis from lego pick, because pickable by hand]

Hypotension  n. Abnormally low blood pressure.

Amir  var. Of *emir.

Igbo  var. Of *ibo.

Hollyhock  n. Tall plant with showy flowers. [from *holy, obsolete hock mallow]

Soh  n. (also so) mus. Fifth note of a major scale. [latin solve, word arbitrarily taken]

Disunite  v. (-ting) 1 remove the unity from. 2 separate.  disunity n.

Electrical  adj. Of electricity.  electrically adv.

Ncp  abbr. National car parks.

Distinguish  v. 1 (often foll. By from, between) differentiate; see or draw distinctions. 2 be a mark or property of; characterize. 3 discover by listening, looking, etc. 4 (usu. Refl.; often foll. By by) make prominent (distinguished himself by winning).  distinguishable adj. [latin: related to *dis-, stinguo stinct- extinguish]

Shoot  —v. (past and past part. Shot) 1  a (also absol.) Cause (a weapon) to fire. B kill or wound with a bullet, arrow, etc. 2 send out, discharge, etc., esp. Swiftly. 3 (often foll. By out, along, forth, etc.) Come or go swiftly or vigorously. 4  a (of a plant etc.) Put forth buds etc. B (of a bud etc.) Appear. 5 hunt game etc. With a gun. 6  film or photograph. 7 (also absol.) Esp. Football a score (a goal). B take a shot at (the goal). 8  (of a boat) sweep swiftly down or under (a bridge, rapids, etc.). 9 (usu. Foll. By through, up, etc.) (of a pain) seem to stab. 10 (often foll. By up; also absol.) Slang inject (a drug). —n. 1 a young branch or sucker. B new growth of a plant. 2  a hunting party, expedition, etc. B land shot over for game. 3 = *chute1. —int. Colloq. Invitation to ask questions etc.  shoot down 1 kill by shooting. 2 cause (an aircraft etc.) To crash by shooting. 3 argue effectively against. Shoot one's bolt colloq. Do all that is in one's power. Shoot one's mouth off slang talk too much or indiscreetly. Shoot up 1 grow rapidly. 2 rise suddenly. 3 terrorize by indiscriminate shooting. The whole shoot (or the whole shooting match) colloq. Everything. [old english]

Barrier  n. 1 fence etc. That bars advance or access. 2 obstacle (class barriers). [romanic: related to *bar1]

Rustproof  —adj. Not susceptible to corrosion by rust. —v. Make rustproof.

Bachelor  n. 1 unmarried man. 2 person with a university first degree.  bachelorhood n. [related to *baccalaureate]

Speleology  n. The study of caves. [greek spelaion cave]

Employment  n. 1 employing or being employed. 2 person's trade or profession.

Sorrow  —n. 1 mental distress caused by loss or disappointment etc. 2 cause of sorrow. —v. Feel sorrow, mourn. [old english]

Flugelhorn  n. Valved brass wind instrument like a cornet. [german flügel wing, horn horn]

Pukka  adj. Anglo-ind. Colloq. 1 genuine. 2 of good quality; reliable (a pukka job). [hindi]

Uranium  n. Radioactive grey dense metallic element, capable of nuclear fission and used as a source of nuclear energy. [uranus, name of a planet]

Caviare  n. (us caviar) pickled roe of sturgeon or other large fish. [italian from turkish]

Coerce  v. (-cing) persuade or restrain by force.  coercible adj. Coercion n. Coercive adj. [latin coerceo restrain]

Preppy  n. (pl. -ies) us colloq. Student of an expensive private school or similar-looking person. [from *prep]

Corrigible  adj. 1 able to be corrected. 2 submissive.  corrigibly adv. [medieval latin: related to *corrigendum]

Monarchism  n. Advocacy of monarchy.  monarchist n. [french: related to *monarch]

Cesium  n. (brit. Caesium) soft silver-white element. [latin caesius blue-grey]

Sincere  adj. (sincerer, sincerest) 1 free from pretence. 2 genuine, honest, frank.  sincerity n. [latin]

Gimp  n. (also gymp) 1 twist of silk etc. With cord or wire running through it. 2 fishing-line of silk etc. Bound with wire. [dutch]

Conspicuous  adj. 1 clearly visible; attracting notice. 2 noteworthy.  conspicuously adv. [latin specio look]

Maenad  n. 1 bacchante. 2 frenzied woman.  maenadic adj. [greek mainomai rave]

Daemon  var. Of *demon 4.

Comprise  v. (-sing) 1 include. 2 consist of. 3 make up, compose. [french: related to *comprehend]

Usage  the use of this word in sense 3 is considered incorrect and compose is generally preferred.

Carnet  n. Permit to drive across a frontier, use a camp-site, etc. [french, = notebook]

Discrepancy  n. (pl. -ies) difference; inconsistency.  discrepant adj. [latin discrepo be discordant]

Clementine  n. Small tangerine-like citrus fruit. [french]

Distant  adj. 1 far away; at a specified distance (three miles distant). 2 remote in time, relationship, etc. (distant prospect; distant relation). 3 aloof. 4 abstracted (distant stare). 5 faint (distant memory).  distantly adv.

Redecorate  v. (-ting) decorate (a room etc.) Again or differently.  redecoration n.

Blob  n. Small drop or spot. [imitative]

Cerebrum  n. (pl. -bra) principal part of the brain in vertebrates, at the front of the skull. [latin]

Spinster  n. 1 formal unmarried woman. 2 woman, esp. Elderly, thought unlikely to marry.  spinsterish adj. [originally = woman who spins]

Trusting  adj. Having trust; trustful.  trustingly adv.

Threadworm  n. Parasitic threadlike worm.

Snoop  colloq. —v. 1 pry into another's affairs. 2 (often foll. By about, around) investigate transgressions of rules, the law, etc. —n. Act of snooping.  snooper n. Snoopy adj. [dutch]

Ewer  n. Water-jug with a wide mouth. [latin aqua water]

Moussaka  n. (also mousaka) greek dish of minced meat, aubergine, etc. [greek or turkish]

Minnow  n. Small freshwater carp. [old english]

Oat  n. 1 a hardy cereal plant grown as food. B (in pl.) Grain yielded by this. 2 oat plant or a variety of it. 3 (in pl.) Slang sexual gratification.  off one's oats colloq. Not hungry.  oaten adj. [old english]

Interplanetary  adj. 1 between planets. 2 of travel between planets.

Endometrium  n. Membrane lining the womb. [greek metra womb]

Lawnmower  n. Machine for cutting lawns.

Travesty  —n. (pl. -ies) grotesque misrepresentation or imitation (travesty of justice). —v. (-ies, -ied) make or be a travesty of. [french travestir disguise, from italian]

Implicate  v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By in) show (a person) to be involved (in a crime etc.). 2 imply. [latin plico fold]

Nationality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 status of belonging to a particular nation (has british nationality). 2 condition of being national; distinctive national qualities. 3 ethnic group forming a part of one or more political nations.

Branch  —n. 1 limb of a tree or bough. 2 lateral extension or subdivision, esp. Of a river, road, or railway. 3 subdivision of a family, knowledge, etc. 4 local office etc. Of a large business. —v. (often foll. By off) 1 diverge. 2 divide into branches.  branch out extend one's field of interest. [latin branca paw]

Towelling  n. Thick soft absorbent cloth, used esp. For towels.

Imbue  v. (-bues, -bued, -buing) (often foll. By with) 1 inspire or permeate (with feelings, opinions, or qualities). 2 saturate. 3 dye. [latin imbuo]

Debauchery  n. Excessive sensual indulgence.

Star  —n. 1 celestial body appearing as a luminous point in the night sky. 2 large naturally luminous gaseous body such as the sun. 3 celestial body regarded as influencing fortunes etc. 4 thing like a star in shape or appearance. 5 decoration or mark of rank or excellence etc., usu. With radiating points. 6 a famous or brilliant person; principal performer (star of the show).

Wide  —adj. 1 having sides far apart, broad, not narrow (wide river; wide sleeve; wide angle). 2 (following a measurement) in width (a metre wide). 3 a extending far (wide range; wide experience). B considerable (wide margin). 4 not restricted (a wide public). 5 a liberal; unprejudiced (takes wide views). B not specialized; general. 6 open to the full extent (wide eyes). 7 (foll. By of) not within a reasonable distance of, far from (wide shot; wide of the target). 8 (in comb.) Extending over the whole of (nationwide). —adv. 1 widely. 2 to the full extent. 3 far from the target etc. (shooting wide). —n. = *wide ball.  give a wide berth to see *berth. Wide of the mark see *mark1. Wide open (often foll. By to) exposed (to attack etc.). The wide world all the world, great as it is. [old english]

Slimy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 like, covered with, or full of slime. 2 colloq. Disgustingly obsequious.  sliminess n.

Enliven  v. Make lively or cheerful; brighten (a picture etc.); inspirit.  enlivenment n.

Carbonate  —n. Chem. Salt of carbonic acid. —v. (-ting) fill with carbon dioxide. [french: related to *carbon]

Tiptop  colloq. —adj. Highest in excellence. —n. Highest point of excellence. —adv. Most excellently.

Taking  —adj. Attractive, captivating. —n. (in pl.) Amount of money taken at a show, in a shop, etc.

Doom  —n. 1 a grim fate or destiny. B death or ruin. 2 condemnation. —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By to) condemn or destine. 2 (esp. As doomed adj.) Consign to misfortune or destruction. [old english, = *statute]

Tingle  —v. (-ling) 1 feel a slight prickling, stinging, or throbbing sensation. 2 cause this (the reply tingled in my ears). —n. Tingling sensation.  tingly adj. [probably from *tinkle]

Gathering  n. 1 assembly. 2 purulent swelling. 3 group of leaves taken together in bookbinding.

Anglo-  comb. Form 1 english. 2 of english origin. 3 english or british and. [latin: related to *angle]

Rugged  adj. 1 (esp. Of ground) rough, uneven. 2 (of features) wrinkled, furrowed, irregular. 3 a unpolished; lacking refinement (rugged grandeur). B harsh in sound. 4 robust, hardy.  ruggedly adv. Ruggedness n. [probably scandinavian]

Solicitude  n. Being solicitous. [latin: related to *solicitous]

Workday  n. Day on which work is usually done.

Abridge  v. (-ging) shorten (a book, film, etc.).  abridgement n. [latin: related to *abbreviate]

Seaborne  adj. Transported by sea.

Cartography  n. Map-drawing.  cartographer n. Cartographic adj. [french carte map]

Choke  —v. (-king) 1 stop the breathing of (a person or animal), esp. By constricting the windpipe or (of gas, smoke, etc.) By being unbreathable. 2 suffer a stoppage of breath. 3 make or become speechless from emotion. 4 retard the growth of or kill (esp. Plants) by depriving of light etc. 5 (often foll. By back) suppress (feelings) with difficulty. 6 block or clog (a passage, tube, etc.). 7 (as choked adj.) Colloq. Disgusted, disappointed. —n. 1 valve in a carburettor controlling the intake of air. 2 device for smoothing the variations of an alternating current.  choke up block (a channel etc.). [old english]

Bromide  n. 1 any binary compound of bromine. 2 trite remark. 3 reproduction or proof on paper coated with silver bromide emulsion.

Outspread  —adj. Spread out; expanded. —v. Spread out; expand.

Epigram  n. 1 short poem with a witty ending. 2 pointed saying.  epigrammatic adj. [greek: related to *-gram]

Automatism  n. 1 involuntary action. 2 unthinking routine. [french: related to *automaton]

Grayling  n. (pl. Same) silver-grey freshwater fish. [from *grey, *-ling]

Listless  adj. Lacking energy or enthusiasm.  listlessly adv. Listlessness n. [from obsolete list inclination]

Unkempt  adj. Untidy, dishevelled. [= uncombed]

Decilitre  n. (us -liter) metric unit of capacity, equal to 0.1 litre.

Unbend  v. (past and past part. Unbent) 1 straighten. 2 relax; become affable.

Unsound  adj. 1 unhealthy, not sound. 2 rotten, weak; unreliable. 3 ill-founded.  of unsound mind insane.  unsoundness n.

Deemster  n. Judge in the isle of man. [from *deem]

Upshot  n. Outcome, conclusion.

Wa  abbr. Western australia.

Uptown  us —attrib. Adj. Of the residential part of a town or city. —adv. In or into this part. —n. This part.

Tragicomedy  n. (pl. -ies) play or situation with a mixture of comedy and tragedy.  tragicomic adj.

Hetero-  comb. Form other, different. [greek heteros other]

Dosser  n. Slang 1 person who dosses. 2 = *doss-house.

Untried  adj. 1 not tried or tested. 2 inexperienced.

Pa  abbr. 1 personal assistant. 2 public address (system).

Punjabi  —n. (pl. -s) 1 native of punjab. 2 language of punjab. —adj. Of punjab, its people, or language. [punjab, state in india and province in pakistan]

Daphne  n. Any of various flowering shrubs. [greek]

Puberty  n. Period of sexual maturation.  pubertal adj. [latin puber adult]

Sulk  —v. Be sulky. —n. (also in pl., prec. By the) period of sullen silence. [perhaps a back-formation from *sulky]

Site  —n. 1 ground chosen or used for a town or building. 2 place of or for some activity (camping site). —v. (-ting) locate, place. [latin situs]

Bask  v. 1 relax in warmth and light. 2 (foll. By in) revel in (basking in glory). [old norse: related to *bathe]

Amid  prep. In the middle of, among. [old english: related to *on, *mid]

Sarcoma  n. (pl. -s or -mata) malignant tumour of connective tissue. [greek sarx sark- flesh]

Zoophyte  n. Plantlike animal, esp. A coral, sea anemone, or sponge. [greek zoion animal, phuton plant]

Corpora  pl. Of *corpus.

Statuesque  adj. Like, or having the dignity or beauty of, a statue.

Excitable  adj. Easily excited.  excitability n. Excitably adv.

Nostrum  n. 1 quack remedy, patent medicine. 2 pet scheme, esp. For political or social reform. [latin, = ‘of our own make’]

Shiite  —n. Adherent of the branch of islam rejecting the first three sunni caliphs. —adj. Of this branch. [arabic shiah, = party]

Lambent  adj. 1 (of a flame or a light) playing on a surface. 2 (of the eyes, sky, wit, etc.) Lightly brilliant.  lambency n. [latin lambo lick]

Creamer  n. 1 cream-substitute for adding to coffee. 2 jug for cream.

Compendium  n. (pl. -s or -dia) 1 concise summary or abridgement. 2 collection of table-games etc. [latin]

Shapeless  adj. Lacking definite or attractive shape.  shapelessness n.

Learning  n. Knowledge acquired by study.

Sundown  n. Sunset.

Pinprick  n. Trifling irritation.

Trig  n. Colloq. Trigonometry. [abbreviation]

Sparkle  —v. (-ling) 1 a emit or seem to emit sparks; glitter, glisten. B be witty; scintillate. 2 (of wine etc.) Effervesce. —n. 1 glitter. 2 lively quality (the song lacks sparkle).  sparkly adj.

Jackknife  —n. 1 large clasp-knife. 2 dive in which the body is bent and then straightened. —v. (-fing) (of an articulated vehicle) fold against itself in an accident.

Overload  —v. 1 load excessively (with baggage, work, etc.). 2 put too great a demand on (an electrical circuit etc.). —n. Excessive quantity or demand.
