Conservative  —adj. 1 a averse to rapid change. B (of views, taste, etc.) Moderate, avoiding extremes. 2 (of an estimate etc.) Purposely low. 3 (usu. Conservative) of conservatives or the conservative party. 4 tending to conserve. —n. 1 conservative person. 2 (usu. Conservative) supporter or member of the conservative party.  conservatism n. [latin: related to *conserve]

Eurasian  —adj. 1 of mixed european and asian parentage. 2 of europe and asia. —n. Eurasian person.

Pleura  n. (pl. -rae) membrane enveloping the lungs.  pleural adj. [greek pleura rib]

Litho  colloq. —n. = *lithography. —v. (-oes, -oed) lithograph. [abbreviation]

Section  —n. 1 each of the parts of a thing or out of which a thing can be fitted together. 2 part cut off. 3 subdivision. 4 us a area of land. B district of a town. 5 act of cutting or separating surgically. 6 a cutting of a solid by a plane. B resulting figure or area. —v. 1 arrange in or divide into sections. 2 compulsorily commit to a psychiatric hospital. [latin seco sect- cut]

Somewhat  adv. To some extent.

Mainspring  n. 1 principal spring of a watch, clock, etc. 2 chief motivating force; incentive.

Sadducee  n. Member of a jewish sect of the time of christ that denied the resurrection of the dead. [hebrew]

Unleash  v. 1 release from a leash or restraint. 2 set free to engage in pursuit or attack.

Eft  n. Newt. [old english]

Cavalcade  n. Procession or assembly of riders, vehicles, etc. [italian: related to *chevalier]

Loggerhead  n.  at loggerheads (often foll. By with) disagreeing or disputing. [probably dial. From logger wooden block]

Vernal  adj. Of or in spring. [latin ver spring]

Schism  n. Division of a group (esp. Religious) into sects etc., usu. Over doctrine.  schismatic adj. & n. [greek skhizo to split]

Heritage  n. 1 what is or may be inherited. 2 inherited circumstances, benefits, etc. 3 a nation's historic buildings, monuments, countryside, etc., esp. When regarded as worthy of preservation.

Thermometer  n. Instrument for measuring temperature, esp. A graduated glass tube containing mercury or alcohol. [french: related to *thermo-, *-meter]

Receptacle  n. 1 containing vessel, place, or space. 2 bot. Enlarged and modified area of the stem apex which bears the flower. [latin: related to *receive]

Eyeglass  n. Lens to assist defective sight.

Lid  n. 1 hinged or removable cover, esp. For a container. 2 = *eyelid.  put the lid on colloq. 1 be the culmination of. 2 put a stop to.  lidded adj. (also in comb.). [old english]

Pacific  —adj. 1 peaceful; tranquil. 2 (pacific) of or adjoining the pacific. —n. (the pacific) ocean between america to the east and asia to the west. [latin pax pacis peace]

Damsel  n. Archaic or literary young unmarried woman. [french diminutive: related to *dame]

Rival  —n. (often attrib.) 1 person competing with another. 2 person or thing that equals another in quality. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) be, seem, or claim to be the rival of or comparable to. [latin rivus stream]

Appellation  n. Formal name or title; nomenclature.

Dwell  v. (past and past part. Dwelt or dwelled) live, reside.  dwell on (or upon) think, write, or speak at length on.  dweller n. [old english, = lead astray]

Flying  —adj. 1 fluttering, waving, or hanging loose. 2 hasty, brief (flying visit). 3 designed for rapid movement. 4 (of an animal) leaping with winglike membranes etc. —n. Flight, esp. In an aircraft.  with flying colours with distinction.

Doing  pres. Part. Of *do1. —n. 1 a action (famous for his doings). B effort (takes a lot of doing). 2 (in pl.) Slang unspecified things (have we got all the doings?).

Maul  —v. 1 tear the flesh of; claw. 2 handle roughly. 3 damage by criticism. —n. 1 rugby loose scrum. 2 brawl. 3 heavy hammer. [latin malleus hammer]

Torque  n. 1 mech. Twisting or rotating force, esp. In a machine. 2 hist. Necklace of twisted metal, esp. Of the ancient gauls and britons. [latin: related to *tort]

Vandal  n. Person who wilfully or maliciously damages property.  vandalism n. [vandals, name of a germanic people that sacked rome and destroyed works of art in the 5th c.: latin from germanic]

Vivisection  n. Surgical experimentation on living animals for scientific research.  vivisectional adj. Vivisectionist n. & adj. Vivisector n. [latin vivus living, dissection (*dissect)]

Subaltern  n. Officer below the rank of captain, esp. A second lieutenant. [latin: related to *alternate]

Disquisition  n. Discursive treatise or discourse. [latin quaero quaesit- seek]

Ravine  n. Deep narrow gorge. [latin: related to *rapine]

Northern  adj. Of or in the north.  northernmost adj.  [old english]

Uninhibited  adj. Not inhibited.

Struck  past and past part. Of *strike.

Meditate  v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By on, upon) engage in (esp. Religious) contemplation. 2 plan mentally.  meditation n. Meditator n. [latin meditor]

Desegregate  v. (-ting) abolish racial segregation in.  desegregation n.

Demonstrator  n. 1 person who demonstrates politically. 2 person who demonstrates machines etc. To prospective customers. 3 person who teaches by esp. Scientific demonstration.

Expresso  var. Of *espresso.

Psychotic  —adj. Of or suffering from a psychosis. —n. Psychotic person.

Notebook  n. Small book for making notes in.

Foliaceous  adj. 1 of or like leaves. 2 laminated. [latin: related to *foil2]

Puttee  n. Hist. Long strip of cloth wound round the leg from ankle to knee for protection and support, worn esp. By soldiers. [hindi]

Classmate  n. Person in the same class at school.

Outlaw  —n. 1 fugitive from the law. 2 hist. Person deprived of the protection of the law. —v. 1 declare (a person) an outlaw. 2 make illegal; proscribe.

Agenda  n. (pl. -s) 1 list of items to be considered at a meeting. 2 things to be done.

Housekeeper  n. Person, esp. A woman, employed to manage a household.

Mafia  n. 1 organized body of criminals, orig. In sicily, now also in italy and the us. 2 (mafia) group regarded as exerting an intimidating and corrupt power. [italian dial., = bragging]

Guide  —n. 1 person who leads or shows the way. 2 person who conducts tours. 3 adviser. 4 directing principle. 5 book with essential information on a subject, esp. = *guidebook. 6 thing marking a position or guiding the eye. 7 bar etc. Directing the motion of something. 8 (guide) member of a girls' organization similar to the scouts. —v. (-ding) 1 act as guide to. 2 be the principle or motive of. [french from germanic]

Venison  n. Deer's flesh as food. [latin venatio hunting]

Chromosome  n. Threadlike structure, usu. Found in the cell nucleus of animals and plants, carrying genes. [greek: related to *chrome, soma body]

Illogical  adj. Devoid of or contrary to logic.  illogicality n. (pl. -ies). Illogically adv.

Sandstorm  n. Storm with clouds of sand raised by the wind.

Fragment  —n. 1 part broken off. 2 extant remains or unfinished portion (of a book etc.). —v. Break or separate into fragments.  fragmental adj. Fragmentary adj. Fragmentation n. [latin: related to *fraction]

Euro-  comb. Form europe, european. [abbreviation]

Demagnetize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) remove the magnetic properties of.  demagnetization n.

Oust  v. Drive out or expel, esp. By seizing the place of. [latin obsto oppose]

Homogeneous  adj. 1 of the same kind. 2 consisting of parts all of the same kind; uniform.  homogeneity n. Homogeneously adv. [from *homo-, greek genos kind]

Usage  homogeneous is often confused with homogenous which is a term in biology meaning ‘similar owing to common descent’.

Zit  n. Esp. Us slang pimple. [origin unknown]

Cerebral  adj. 1 of the brain. 2 intellectual; unemotional. [related to *cerebrum]

Socialite  n. Person moving in fashionable society.

Candyfloss  n. Fluffy mass of spun sugar round a stick.

Magistracy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 magisterial office. 2 magistrates collectively.

Lighting  n. 1 equipment in a room or street etc. For producing light. 2 arrangement or effect of lights.

Vacuous  adj. 1 expressionless. 2 showing absence of thought or intelligence, inane.  vacuity n. Vacuously adv. [latin vacuus empty]

Dependent  —adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By on, upon) depending, conditional. 2 unable to do without (esp. A drug). 3 maintained at another's cost. 4 (of a clause etc.) Subordinate to a sentence or word. —n. Us var. Of *dependant.

Gestapo  n. Hist. Nazi secret police. [german, from geheime staatspolizei]

Comparable  adj. (often foll. By with, to) able or fit to be compared.  comparability n. Comparably adv. [latin: related to *compare]

Usage  use of comparable with to and with corresponds to the senses of compare: to is more common.

Proceeding  n. 1 action or piece of conduct (high-handed proceeding). 2 (in pl.) (in full legal proceedings) lawsuit. 3 (in pl.) Published report of discussions or a conference.

Hypercritical  adj. Excessively critical.  hypercritically adv.

Mayflower  n. Any of various flowers that bloom in may.

Seminal  adj. 1 of seed, semen, or reproduction; germinal. 2 (of ideas etc.) Forming a basis for future development. [latin: related to *semen]

Protagonist  n. 1 chief person in a drama, story, etc. 2 leading person in a contest etc.; principal performer. 3 (usu. Foll. By of, for) advocate or champion of a cause etc. (protagonist of women's rights). [greek: related to *proto-, agonistes actor]

Usage  the use of protagonist in sense 3 is considered incorrect by some people.

Dentist  n. Person qualified to treat, extract, etc., teeth.  dentistry n.

Grandfather  n. Male grandparent.

Folksy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of or like folk art, culture, etc. 2 friendly, unpretentious.  folksiness n.

Saber  n. (brit. Sabre) 1 curved cavalry sword. 2 light tapering fencing-sword. [french from german sabel]

Prosecute  v. (-ting) 1 (also absol.) Institute legal proceedings against (a person), or with reference to (a claim, crime, etc.) (decided not to prosecute). 2 formal carry on (a trade, pursuit, etc.).  prosecutor n. [latin prosequor -secut- pursue]

Network  —n. 1 arrangement of intersecting horizontal and vertical lines. 2 complex system of railways etc. 3 people connected by the exchange of information etc., professionally or socially. 4 system of connected electrical conductors. 5 group of broadcasting stations connected for the simultaneous broadcast of a programme. 6 chain of interconnected computers. —v. Broadcast on a network.

Amnion  n. (pl. Amnia) innermost membrane enclosing an embryo.  amniotic adj. [greek, = caul]

Disgruntled  adj. Discontented; sulky.  disgruntlement n. [from *dis-, *grunt]

Deviant  —adj. Deviating from what is normal, esp. Sexually. —n. Deviant person or thing.  deviance n. Deviancy n.

Formica  n. Propr. Hard durable plastic laminate used for surfaces. [origin uncertain]

Domesticity  n. 1 being domestic. 2 domestic or home life.

Triple  —adj. 1 consisting of three usu. Equal parts or things; threefold. 2 involving three parties. 3 three times as much or many. —n. 1 threefold number or amount. 2 set of three. —v. (-ling) multiply by three.  triply adv. [latin triplus from greek]

Sucker  n. 1 a gullible person. B (foll. By for) person susceptible to. 2 a rubber cup etc. Adhering by suction. B similar organ of an organism. 3 shoot springing from a root or stem below ground.

Dispensation  n. 1 dispensing or distributing. 2 exemption from penalty, rule, etc. 3 ordering or management of the world by providence.

Tankard  n. 1 tall beer mug with a handle. 2 contents of or amount held by this (drank a tankard of ale). [probably dutch tankaert]

Megavolt  n. One million volts, esp. As a unit of electromotive force.

Layman  n. (fem. Laywoman) 1 non-ordained member of a church. 2 person without professional or specialized knowledge.

Unobtrusive  adj. Not making oneself or itself noticed.  unobtrusively adv.

Spacecraft  n. Vehicle for travelling in outer space.

Personalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 make personal, esp. By marking with one's name etc. 2 personify.

Regrettable  adj. (of events or conduct) undesirable, unwelcome; deserving censure.  regrettably adv.

Unseeing  adj. 1 unobservant. 2 blind.  unseeingly adv.

Layer  —n. 1 thickness of matter, esp. One of several, covering a surface. 2 person or thing that lays. 3 hen that lays eggs. 4 shoot fastened down to take root while attached to the parent plant. —v. 1 arrange in layers. 2 cut (hair) in layers. 3 propagate (a plant) by a layer.

Theism  n. Belief in gods or a god, esp. A god supernaturally revealed to man.  theist n. Theistic adj. [greek theos god]

Great  —adj. 1 a of a size, amount, extent, or intensity considerably above the normal or average (a great hole; great fun). B also with implied admiration, contempt, etc., esp. In exclamations (you great idiot!; great stuff!). C reinforcing other words denoting size, quantity, etc. (great big hole). 2 important, pre-eminent (the great thing is not to get caught). 3 grand, imposing (great occasion). 4 distinguished. 5 remarkable in ability, character, etc. (great men; great thinker). 6 (foll. By at, on) competent, well-informed. 7 fully deserving the name of; doing a thing extensively (great reader; great believer in tolerance). 8 (also greater) the larger of the name, species, etc. (great auk; greater celandine). 9 colloq. Very enjoyable or satisfactory (had a great time). 10 (in comb.) (in names of family relationships) denoting one degree further removed upwards or downwards (great-uncle; great-great-grandmother). —n. 1 great or outstanding person or thing. 2 (in pl.) (greats) colloq. (at oxford university) honours course or final examinations in classics and philosophy.  greatness n. [old english]

Wiper  n. = *windscreen wiper.

Corpse  n. Dead body. [latin: related to *corpus]

Falter  v. 1 stumble; go unsteadily. 2 lose courage. 3 speak hesitatingly. [origin uncertain]

Gunsmith  n. Maker and repairer of small firearms.

Slavonic  —adj. 1 of the group of languages including russian, polish, and czech. 2 of the slavs. —n. Slavonic language-group. [related to *slav]

Furniture  n. 1 movable equipment of a house, room, etc., e.g. Tables, beds. 2 naut. Ship's equipment. 3 accessories, e.g. The handles and lock on a door. [french: related to *furnish]

Ceramic  —adj. 1 made of (esp.) Baked clay. 2 of ceramics. —n. Ceramic article or product. [greek keramos pottery]

Swig  —v. (-gg-) colloq. Drink in large draughts. —n. Swallow of drink, esp. Large. [origin unknown]

Infinitude  n. Literary = *infinity 1, 2.

Dynamics  n.pl. 1 (usu. Treated as sing.) A mathematical study of motion and the forces causing it. B branch of any science concerned with forces or changes. 2 motive forces in any sphere. 3 mus. Variation in loudness.

Chair  —n. 1 seat for one person usu. With a back. 2 professorship. 3 a chairperson. B seat or office of a chairperson. 4 us = *electric chair. —v. 1 preside over (a meeting). 2 carry (a person) aloft in triumph.  take the chair preside over a meeting. [greek kathedra]

Reaction  n. 1 reacting, response. 2 bad physical response to a drug etc. 3 occurrence of a condition after a period of its opposite. 4 tendency to oppose change or reform. 5 interaction of substances undergoing chemical change.

Declivity  n. (pl. -ies) downward slope. [latin clivus slope]

Alive  adj. (usu. Predic.) 1 living. 2 lively, active. 3 (foll. By to) aware of; alert. 4 (foll. By with) swarming or teeming with. [old english: related to *a2, *life]

Bandage  —n. Strip of material used to bind a wound etc. —v. (-ging) bind with a bandage. [french: related to *band]

Unwanted  adj. Not wanted.

Record  —n. 1 a piece of evidence or information constituting an (esp. Official) account of something that has occurred, been said, etc. B document etc. Preserving this. 2 state of being set down or preserved in writing etc. 3 (in full gramophone record) disc carrying recorded sound in grooves on each surface, for reproduction by a record-player. 4 official report of the proceedings and judgement in a court of justice. 5 a facts known about a person's past. B list of a person's previous criminal convictions. 6 (often attrib.) Best performance (esp. In sport) or most remarkable event of its kind on record. 7 object serving as a memorial; portrait. —v. 1 set down in writing or some other permanent form for later reference. 2 convert (sound, a broadcast, etc.) Into permanent form for later reproduction.  for the record as an official statement etc. Go on record state one's opinion openly, so that it is recorded. Have a record have a recorded criminal conviction or convictions. Off the record unofficially, confidentially. On record officially recorded; publicly known. [latin cor cordis heart]

Unhampered  adj. Not hampered.

Fore  —adj. Situated in front. —n. Front part; bow of a ship. —int. (in golf) warning to a person in the path of a ball.  to the fore in or into a conspicuous position. [old english]

Bewail  v. Lament; wail over.

Budgie  n. Colloq. = *budgerigar. [abbreviation]

Flyleaf  n. Blank leaf at the beginning or end of a book.

Teleconference  n. Conference with participants linked by telephone etc.  teleconferencing n.

Antibiotic  —n. Substance (e.g. Penicillin) that can inhibit or destroy susceptible micro-organisms. —adj. Functioning as an antibiotic. [greek bios life]

Gleam  —n. Faint or brief light or show. —v. Emit gleams, shine. [old english]

Breath  n. 1 a air drawn into or expelled from the lungs. B one respiration of air. C breath as perceived by the senses. 2 a slight movement of air. B whiff (of perfume etc.). 3 whisper, murmur (esp. Of scandal).  catch one's breath 1 cease breathing momentarily in surprise etc. 2 rest to restore normal breathing. Hold one's breath cease breathing temporarily. Out of breath gasping for air, esp. After exercise. Take one's breath away surprise, delight, etc. Under one's breath in a whisper. [old english]

Venerable  adj. 1 entitled to deep respect on account of character, age, associations, etc. (venerable priest; venerable relics). 2 title of an archdeacon in the church of england. [latin: related to *venerate]

Dreadful  adj. 1 terrible. 2 colloq. Very annoying, very bad.  dreadfully adv.

Toolmaker  n. Person who makes precision tools.  toolmaking n.

Snowline  n. Level above which snow never melts entirely.

Jab  —v. (-bb-) 1 a poke roughly. B stab. 2 (foll. By into) thrust (a thing) hard or abruptly. —n. 1 abrupt blow, thrust, or stab. 2 colloq. Hypodermic injection. [var. Of job = prod]

Fare  —n. 1 a price of a journey on public transport. B fare-paying passenger. 2 range of food. —v. (-ring) progress; get on (how did you fare?). [old english]

Mercantile  adj. 1 of trade, trading. 2 commercial. [latin: related to *merchant]

Oyster  —n. 1 bivalve mollusc, esp. An edible kind, sometimes producing a pearl. 2 symbol of all one desires (the world is my oyster). 3 oyster white. —adj. Oyster-white. [greek ostreon]

Tiara  n. 1 jewelled ornamental band worn on the front of a woman's hair. 2 three-crowned diadem worn by a pope.  tiaraed adj. [latin from greek]

Infighting  n. 1 conflict or competitiveness between colleagues. 2 boxing within arm's length.

Statement  n. 1 stating or being stated; expression in words. 2 thing stated. 3 formal account of facts. 4 record of transactions in a bank account etc. 5 notification of the amount due to a tradesman etc.

Curia  n. (also curia) papal court; government departments of the vatican. [latin]

Mescal  n. Peyote cactus. [spanish from nahuatl]

Abrupt  adj. 1 sudden, hasty (abrupt end). 2 (of manner etc.) Curt. 3 steep, precipitous.  abruptly adv. Abruptness n. [latin: related to *rupture]

-est  suffix forming the superlative of adjectives (widest; nicest; happiest) and adverbs (soonest). [old english]

Udder  n. Baglike mammary organ of cattle etc., with several teats. [old english]

Starchy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of, like, or containing starch. 2 prim, formal.  starchily adv. Starchiness n.

Commute  v. (-ting) 1 travel some distance to and from work. 2 (usu. Foll. By to) change (a punishment) to one less severe. 3 (often foll. By into, for) change (one kind of payment or obligation) for another. 4 exchange.  commutable adj. Commutation n. [latin muto change]

Deaden  v. 1 deprive of or lose vitality, force, brightness, sound, feeling, etc. 2 (foll. By to) make insensitive.

Bourbon  n. Us whisky from maize and rye. [bourbon county, kentucky]

Unlikely  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 improbable (unlikely tale). 2 (foll. By to + infin.) Not expected (unlikely to die). 3 unpromising (unlikely candidate).  unlikeliness n.

Snowflake  n. Each of the flakes in which snow falls.

Reliance  n. (foll. By in, on) trust, confidence.  reliant adj.

Seafarer  n. 1 sailor. 2 traveller by sea.  seafaring adj. & n.

Rearward  —n. (esp. In prepositional phrases) rear (to the rearward of; in the rearward). —adj. To the rear. —adv. (also rearwards) towards the rear. [anglo-french rerewarde = *rearguard]

Termini  pl. Of *terminus.

Checkmate  —n. (also as int.) Chess check from which a king cannot escape. —v. (-ting) 1 chess put into checkmate. 2 frustrate. [french: related to *check, persian mat is dead]

Impend  v. (often foll. By over) 1 (of a danger, event, etc.) Be threatening or imminent. 2 hang.  impending adj. [latin pendeo hang]

Room  —n. 1 space for, or occupied by, something; capacity (takes up too much room; room for improvement). 2 a part of a building enclosed by walls, floor, and ceiling. B (in pl.) Apartments or lodgings. C people in a room (room fell silent). —v. Us have room(s); lodge, board. [old english]

Tenacious  adj. 1 (often foll. By of) keeping a firm hold. 2 persistent, resolute. 3 (of memory) retentive.  tenaciously adv. Tenacity n. [latin tenax -acis from teneo hold]

Deplete  v. (-ting) (esp. In passive) reduce in numbers, force, or quantity; exhaust.  depletion n. [latin pleo fill]

Confluence  n. 1 place where two rivers meet. 2 a coming together. B crowd of people. [latin fluo flow]

Biodegradable  adj. Capable of being decomposed by bacteria or other living organisms.

Parotid  —adj. Situated near the ear. —n. (in full parotid gland) salivary gland in front of the ear. [greek: related to *para-1, ous ot- ear]

Nobleman  n. Peer.

Stertorous  adj. (of breathing etc.) Laboured and noisy. [latin sterto snore]

Impoverish  v. Make poor.  impoverishment n. [french: related to *poverty]

Chicanery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 clever but misleading talk. 2 trickery, deception. [french]

Ond  abbr. Ordinary national diploma.

Concupiscence  n. Formal lust.  concupiscent adj. [latin cupio desire]

Peddle  v. (-ling) 1 a sell (goods) as a pedlar. B advocate or promote. 2 sell (drugs) illegally. 3 engage in selling, esp. As a pedlar. [back-formation from *pedlar]

Immovable  adj. (also immoveable) 1 not able to be moved. 2 steadfast, unyielding. 3 emotionless. 4 not subject to change (immovable law). 5 motionless. 6 (of property) consisting of land, houses, etc.  immovability n. Immovably adv.

Night  n. 1 period of darkness between one day and the next; time from sunset to sunrise. 2 nightfall. 3 darkness of night. 4 night or evening appointed for some activity regarded in a certain way (last night of the proms). [old english]

Silicate  n. Compound of a metal with silicon and oxygen.

Song  n. 1 words set to music or meant to be sung. 2 vocal music. 3 musical composition suggestive of a song. 4 cry of some birds.  for a song colloq. Very cheaply. [old english: related to *sing]

Enthusiasm  n. 1 (often foll. By for, about) strong interest or admiration, great eagerness. 2 object of enthusiasm. [greek entheos inspired by a god]

Decrescendo  adv., adj., & n. (pl. -s) = *diminuendo. [italian: related to *decrease]

Rac  abbr. Royal automobile club.

Heterodyne  adj. Radio relating to the production of a lower frequency from the combination of two almost equal high frequencies. [from *hetero-, greek dunamis force]

Rifleman  n. Soldier armed with a rifle.

Ratty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 relating to or infested with rats. 2 colloq. Irritable, bad-tempered.  rattily adv. Rattiness n.

Demigod  n. 1 a partly divine being. B child of a god or goddess and a mortal. 2 colloq. Godlike person.

Butterfly  n. (pl. -flies) 1 insect with four usu. Brightly coloured wings. 2 (in pl.) Colloq. Nervous sensation in the stomach.

Keystone  n. 1 central principle of a system, policy, etc. 2 central locking stone in an arch.

Greengrocer  n. Retailer of fruit and vegetables.

Pecker  n. Us coarse slang penis.  keep your pecker up colloq. Remain cheerful.

Partridge  n. (pl. Same or -s) game-bird, esp. European or asian. [greek perdix]

Cosmonaut  n. Soviet astronaut. [from *cosmos, greek nautes sailor]

Tom  n. (in full tom-cat) male cat. [abbreviation of the name thomas]

Dynamism  n. Energy; dynamic power.

Contradistinction  n. Distinction made by contrasting.

Gully  n. (pl. -ies) 1 water-worn ravine. 2 gutter or drain. 3 cricket fielding position between point and slips. [french goulet: related to *gullet]

Jay  n. Noisy european bird of the crow family with vivid plumage. [latin gaius, gaia, perhaps from the name gaius: cf. Jackdaw, robin]

Israeli  —adj. Of the modern state of israel. —n. (pl. -s) 1 native or national of israel. 2 person of israeli descent. [hebrew]

Calvinism  n. Theology of calvin or his followers, stressing predestination and divine grace.  calvinist n. & adj. Calvinistic adj. [calvin, name of a theologian]

Mitosis  n. Biol. Type of cell division that results in two nuclei each having the same number and kind of chromosomes as the parent nucleus.  mitotic adj. [greek mitos thread]

Heretofore  adv. Formal before this time.

Mankind  n. 1 human species. 2 male people.

Softball  n. Form of baseball using a softer and larger ball.

Engrave  v. (-ving) 1 (often foll. By on) carve (a text or design) on a hard surface. 2 inscribe (a surface) thus. 3 (often foll. By on) impress deeply (on a person's memory).  engraver n. [from *grave3]

Unpractical  adj. 1 not practical. 2 (of a person) without practical skill.

Reek  —v. (often foll. By of) 1 smell strongly and unpleasantly. 2 have unpleasant or suspicious associations (reeks of corruption). —n. 1 foul or stale smell. 2 esp. Scot. Smoke. 3 vapour, visible exhalation. [old english]

Advert  n. Colloq. Advertisement. [abbreviation]

Phenobarbitone  n. Narcotic and sedative barbiturate drug used esp. To treat epilepsy. [from *phenol, *barbiturate]

Raincoat  n. Waterproof or water-resistant coat.

Babel  n. 1 confused noise, esp. Of voices. 2 scene of confusion. [hebrew, = babylon (gen. 11)]

Fluid  —n. 1 substance, esp. A gas or liquid, whose shape is determined by its confines. 2 fluid part or secretion. —adj. 1 able to flow and alter shape freely. 2 constantly changing (situation is fluid).

Sh  int. = *hush.

Soliloquy  n. (pl. -quies) 1 talking without or regardless of hearers, esp. In a play. 2 this part of a play.  soliloquist n. Soliloquize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). [latin solus alone, loquor speak]

Ideogram  n. Character symbolizing a thing without indicating the sounds in its name (e.g. A numeral, chinese characters). [greek idea form, *-gram]

Spine  n. 1 vertebrae extending from the skull to the coccyx; backbone. 2 needle-like outgrowth of an animal or plant. 3 part of a book enclosing the page-fastening. 4 sharp ridge or projection. [latin spina]

Munition  n. (usu. In pl.) Military weapons, ammunition etc. [latin, = fortification: related to *muniment]

Misrepresent  v. Represent wrongly; give a false account or idea of.  misrepresentation n.

Clitoris  n. Small erectile part of the female genitals at the upper end of the vulva.  clitoral adj. [latin from greek]

Roof  —n. (pl. -s) 1 a upper covering of a building. B top of a covered vehicle. C top inner surface of an oven, refrigerator, etc. 2 overhead rock in a cave or mine etc. —v. 1 (often foll. By in, over) cover with or as with a roof. 2 be the roof of.  go through the roof colloq. (of prices etc.) Rise dramatically. Hit (or go through) the roof colloq. Become very angry. [old english]

Ladder  —n. 1 set of horizontal bars fixed between two uprights and used for climbing up or down. 2 vertical strip of unravelled stitching in a stocking etc. 3 hierarchical structure, esp. As a means of career advancement. —v. 1 cause a ladder in (a stocking etc.).

Seneschal  n. Steward of a medieval great house. [french, = old servant]

Rhapsody  n. (pl. -ies) 1 enthusiastic or extravagant speech or composition. 2 piece of music in one movement, often based on national, folk, or popular melodies.  rhapsodic adj. [greek rhapto stitch: related to *ode]

Distribute  v. (-ting) 1 give shares of; deal out. 2 scatter; put at different points. 3 arrange; classify. [latin tribuo -but- assign]

Usage  the second pronunciation given, with the stress on the first syllable, is considered incorrect by some people.

Usage  the second pronunciation given, with the stress on the first syllable, is considered incorrect by some people.

Pursuant  adv. (foll. By to) in accordance with. [french: related to *pursue]

Headgear  n. Hat or headdress.

Breakdown  n. 1 a mechanical failure. B loss of (esp. Mental) health. 2 collapse (breakdown of communication). 3 analysis (of statistics etc.).

Unambiguous  adj. Not ambiguous; clear or definite in meaning.  unambiguously adv.

Petunia  n. Cultivated plant with white, purple, red, etc., funnel-shaped flowers. [french petun tobacco]

Raj  n. (prec. By the) hist. British sovereignty in india. [hindi]

Jacuzzi  n. (pl. -s) propr. Large bath with massaging underwater jets of water. [name of its inventor and manufacturers]

Philadelphus  n. Flowering shrub, esp. The mock orange. [latin from greek]

Cataract  n. 1 a large waterfall. B downpour; rush of water. 2 eye condition in which the lens becomes progressively opaque. [greek katarrhaktes, = down-rushing]

Hostelry  n. (pl. -ies) archaic inn.

Greeting  n. 1 act or instance of welcoming etc. 2 words, gestures, etc., used to greet a person. 3 (often in pl.) Expression of goodwill.

Tod  n. Slang  on one's tod alone; on one's own. [rhyming slang on one's tod sloan]

Enfilade  —n. Gunfire directed along a line from end to end. —v. (-ding) direct an enfilade at. [french: related to *file1]

Impulse  n. 1 sudden urge (felt an impulse to laugh). 2 tendency to follow such urges (man of impulse). 3 impelling; a push. 4 impetus. 5 physics a large temporary force producing a change of momentum (e.g. A hammer-blow). B change of momentum so produced. 6 wave of excitation in a nerve. [latin: related to *pulse1]

Jink  —v. 1 move elusively; dodge. 2 elude by dodging. —n. Dodging or eluding. [originally scots: imitative]

Argus  n. Watchful guardian. [greek argos mythical giant with 100 eyes]

Heavyweight  n. 1 a weight in certain sports, in amateur boxing over 81 kg. B sportsman of this weight. 2 person etc. Of above average weight. 3 colloq. Person of influence or importance.

Jap  n. & adj. Colloq. Often offens. = *japanese. [abbreviation]

Overripe  adj. Excessively ripe.

Ice  —n. 1 a frozen water. B sheet of this on water. 2 ice-cream or water-ice (ate an ice). —v. (icing) 1 mix with or cool in ice (iced drinks). 2 (often foll. By over, up) a cover or become covered with ice. B freeze. 3 cover (a cake etc.) With icing.  on ice 1 performed by skaters. 2 colloq. In reserve. On thin ice in a risky situation. [old english]

Expose  v. (-sing) (esp. As exposed adj.) 1 leave uncovered or unprotected, esp. From the weather. 2 (foll. By to) a put at risk of. B subject to (an influence etc.). 3 photog. Subject (a film) to light, esp. By operation of a camera. 4 reveal the identity or fact of. 5 exhibit, display.  expose oneself display one's body, esp. One's genitals, indecently in public. [latin pono put]

Elaborate  —adj. 1 minutely worked out. 2 complicated. —v. (-ting) work out or explain in detail.  elaborately adv. Elaborateness n. Elaboration n. [latin: related to *labour]

Oarsman  n. (fem. Oarswoman) rower.  oarsmanship n.

Kestrel  n. Small hovering falcon. [origin uncertain]

Urethra  n. (pl. -s) duct conveying urine from the bladder. [greek: related to *ureter]

Trick  —n. 1 action or scheme undertaken to deceive or outwit. 2 illusion (trick of the light). 3 special technique; knack. 4 a feat of skill or dexterity. B unusual action (e.g. Begging) learned by an animal. 5 foolish or discreditable act; practical joke (a mean trick to play). 6 idiosyncracy (has a trick of repeating himself). 7 a cards played in one round of a card-game. B point gained in this. 8 (attrib.) Done to deceive or mystify (trick photography; trick question). —v. 1 deceive by a trick; outwit. 2 (often foll. By out of) swindle (tricked out of his savings). 3 (foll. By into) cause to do something by trickery (tricked into marriage; tricked me into agreeing). 4 foil, baffle; take by surprise.  do the trick colloq. Achieve the required result. How's tricks? Colloq. How are you? Trick or treat esp. Us children's custom of calling at houses at hallowe'en with the threat of pranks if they are not given a small gift. Trick out (or up) dress or deck out. [french]

Stomacher  n. Hist. Pointed bodice of a dress, often jewelled or embroidered. [probably french: related to *stomach]

Minister  —n. 1 head of a government department. 2 clergyman, esp. In the presbyterian and nonconformist churches. 3 diplomat, usu. Ranking below an ambassador. —v. (usu. Foll. By to) help, serve, look after (a person, cause, etc.).  ministerial adj. [latin, = servant]

Embolus  n. (pl. -li) object causing an embolism.

Bicker  v. Argue pettily. [origin unknown]

Barracuda  n. (pl. Same or -s) large tropical marine fish. [spanish]

Sacrifice  —n. 1 a voluntary relinquishing of something valued. B thing so relinquished. C the loss entailed. 2 a slaughter of an animal or person or surrender of a possession, as an offering to a deity. B animal, person, or thing so offered. —v. (-cing) 1 give up (a thing) as a sacrifice. 2 (foll. By to) devote or give over to. 3 (also absol.) Offer or kill as a sacrifice.  sacrificial adj. [latin: related to *sacred]

Symmetry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a correct proportion of parts. B beauty resulting from this. 2 a structure allowing an object to be divided into parts of an equal shape and size. B possession of such a structure. 3 repetition of exactly similar parts facing each other or a centre.  symmetrical adj. Symmetrically adv. [greek summetria]

Dastardly  adj. Cowardly, despicable.  dastardliness n. [origin uncertain]

Repack  v. Pack again.

Tower  —n. 1 tall structure, often part of a church, castle, etc. 2 fortress etc. With a tower. 3 tall structure housing machinery etc. (cooling tower; control tower). —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By above, up) reach or be high or above; be superior. 2 (as towering adj.) A high, lofty (towering intellect). B violent (towering rage). [greek turris]

Sulphurous  adj. (us sulfurous) 1 of or like sulphur. 2 chem. Containing sulphur with a valency of four.

Mordant  —adj. 1 (of sarcasm etc.) Caustic, biting. 2 pungent, smarting. 3 corrosive or cleansing. 4 serving to fix dye. —n. Mordant substance. [latin mordeo bite]

Affluent  adj. Wealthy, rich.  affluence n. [latin: related to *fluent]

Bred  past and past part. Of *breed.

Extend  v. 1 lengthen or make larger in space or time. 2 stretch or lay out at full length. 3 (foll. By to, over) reach or be or make continuous over a specified area. 4 (foll. By to) have a specified scope (permit does not extend to camping). 5 offer or accord (an invitation, hospitality, kindness, etc.). 6 (usu. Refl. Or in passive) tax the powers of (an athlete, horse, etc.).  extendible adj. (also extensible). [latin extendo -tens-: related to *tend1]

Sc  symb. Scandium.

Referee  —n. 1 umpire, esp. In football or boxing. 2 person referred to for a decision in a dispute etc. 3 person willing to testify to the character of an applicant for employment etc. —v. (-rees, -reed) act as referee (for).

Lineament  n. (usu. In pl.) Distinctive feature or characteristic, esp. Of the face. [latin: related to *line1]

Warranty  n. (pl. -ies) 1 undertaking as to the ownership or quality of a thing sold etc., often accepting responsibility for defects or repairs over a specified period. 2 (usu. Foll. By for + verbal noun) authority or justification. [anglo-french warantie: related to *warrant]

Restaurateur  n. Restaurant-keeper.

Thicket  n. Tangle of shrubs or trees. [old english: related to *thick]

Harmonize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 add notes to (a melody) to produce harmony. 2 bring into or be in harmony. 3 make or form a pleasing or consistent whole.  harmonization n.

Cr  symb. Chromium.

Tranquillizer  n. (us tranquilizer, -iser) drug used to diminish anxiety.

Extraordinary  adj. 1 unusual or remarkable. 2 unusually great. 3 (of a meeting, official, etc.) Additional; specially employed.  extraordinarily adv. [latin]

Implore  v. (-ring) 1 (often foll. By to + infin.) Entreat (a person). 2 beg earnestly for. [latin ploro weep]

Mask  —n. 1 covering for all or part of the face as a disguise or for protection against infection etc. 2 respirator. 3 likeness of a person's face, esp. One from a mould (death-mask).

Compassionate  adj. Showing compassion, sympathetic.  compassionately adv.

Reaper  n. 1 person who reaps. 2 reaping machine. 3 (the reaper or grim reaper) death personified.

Revel  —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 have a good time; be extravagantly festive. 2 (foll. By in) take keen delight in. —n. (in sing. Or pl.) Revelling.  reveller n. Revelry n. (pl. -ies). [latin: related to *rebel]

Wrvs  abbr. Women's royal voluntary service.

Pastel  n. 1 (often attrib.) Light shade of a colour (pastel blue). 2 crayon of powdered pigments bound with a gum solution. 3 drawing in pastel. [french pastel, or italian pastello diminutive of *pasta]

Axe  (us ax) —n. 1 chopping-tool with a handle and heavy blade. 2 (the axe) dismissal (of employees); abandonment of a project etc. —v. (axing) cut (esp. Costs or staff) drastically; abandon (a project).  an axe to grind private ends to serve. [old english]

Culprit  n. Guilty person. [perhaps from anglo-french culpable: see *culpable]

Bollard  n. 1 short post in the road, esp. On a traffic island. 2 short post on a quay or ship for securing a rope. [perhaps related to *bole]

Piracy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 robbery of ships at sea. 2 similar practice, esp. Hijacking. 3 infringement of copyright etc. [related to *pirate]

Skein  n. 1 loosely-coiled bundle of yarn or thread. 2 flock of wild geese etc. In flight. [french escaigne]

Coalfield  n. Extensive area yielding coal.

Pretext  n. Ostensible reason; excuse offered. [latin praetextus: related to *text]

Vermilion  —n. 1 cinnabar. 2 a brilliant red pigment made esp. From this. B colour of this. —adj. Of this colour. [latin vermiculus diminutive of vermis worm]

Aptitude  n. 1 natural talent. 2 ability or fitness, esp. Specified. [french: related to *apt]

Temporal  adj. 1 worldly as opposed to spiritual; secular. 2 of time. 3 gram. Denoting time or tense (temporal conjunction). 4 of the temples of the head (temporal artery). [latin tempus -por- time]

Instead  adv. 1 (foll. By of) in place of. 2 as an alternative.

Mayor  n. 1 head of the corporation of a city or borough. 2 head of a district council with the status of a borough.  mayoral adj. [latin: related to *major]

Twill  n. Fabric so woven as to have a surface of diagonal parallel ridges.  twilled adj. [old english, = two-thread]

Moment  n. 1 very brief portion of time. 2 an exact point of time (i came the moment you called). 3 importance (of no great moment). 4 product of a force and the distance from its line of action to a point.  at the moment now. In a moment very soon. Man (or woman etc.) Of the moment the one of importance at the time in question. [latin: related to *momentum]

Sunrise  n. 1 sun's rising. 2 time of this.

Speechless  adj. Temporarily silent because of emotion etc.

Norman  —n. 1 native or inhabitant of medieval normandy. 2 descendant of the people of mixed scandinavian and frankish origin established there in the 10th c. 3 norman french. 4  style of architecture found in britain under the normans. —adj. 1 of the normans. 2 of the norman style of architecture. [old norse, = *northman]

Lawless  adj. 1 having no laws or law enforcement. 2 disregarding laws.  lawlessness n.

Fractious  adj. Irritable, peevish. [from *fraction in obsolete sense ‘brawling’]

Gamma  n. 1 third letter of the greek alphabet (g, g). 2 third-class mark for a piece of work etc. [greek]

Carry  —v. (-ies, -ied) 1 support or hold up, esp. While moving. 2 convey with one or have on one's person. 3 conduct or transmit (pipe carries water). 4 (often foll. By to) take (a process etc.) To a specified point; continue; prolong (carry into effect; carry a joke too far). 5 involve, imply (carries 6% interest). 6 math. Transfer (a figure) to a column of higher value. 7 hold in a specified way (carry oneself erect). 8 a (of a newspaper etc.) Publish. B (of a radio or television station) broadcast. 9 keep a regular stock of. 10 a (of sound) be audible at a distance. B (of a missile or gun etc.) Travel or propel to a specified distance. 11 a win victory or acceptance for (a proposal etc.). B win acceptance from (carried the audience with her). C win, capture (a prize, fortress, etc.). 12 a endure the weight of; support. B be the driving force in (you carry the department). 13 be pregnant with. —n. (pl. -ies) 1 act of carrying. 2 golf distance a ball travels before reaching the ground.  carry away 1 remove. 2 inspire. 3 deprive of self-control (got carried away). Carry the can colloq. Bear the responsibility or blame. Carry the day be victorious or successful. Carry forward transfer to a new page or account. Carry it off do well under difficulties. Carry off 1 take away, esp. By force. 2 win (a prize). 3 (esp.

Edition  n. 1 edited or published form of a book etc. 2 copies of a book, newspaper, etc. Issued at one time. 3 instance of a regular broadcast. 4 person or thing similar to another (a miniature edition of her mother).

Smug  adj. (smugger, smuggest) self-satisfied.  smugly adv. Smugness n. [low german smuk pretty]

Toffee  n. 1 firm or hard sweet made by boiling sugar, butter, etc. 2 this substance.  for toffee slang (prec. By can't etc.) (denoting incompetence) at all (they couldn't sing for toffee). [origin unknown]

Fakir  n. Muslim or (rarely) hindu religious beggar or ascetic. [arabic, = poor man]

Sepulture  n. Burying, interment. [latin: related to *sepulchre]

Flux  n. 1 process of flowing or flowing out. 2 discharge. 3 continuous change (state of flux). 4 substance mixed with a metal etc. To aid fusion. [latin fluxus from fluo flux- flow]

Breather  n. 1 colloq. Brief pause for rest. 2 brief period in the fresh air.

Novella  n. (pl. -s) short novel or narrative story. [italian: related to *novel1]

Caisson  n. Watertight chamber for underwater construction work. [italian cassone]

Secondly  adv. 1 furthermore. 2 as a second item.

Projectile  —n. 1 missile, esp. Fired by a rocket. 2 bullet, shell, etc. —adj. 1 capable of being projected by force, esp. From a gun. 2 projecting or impelling.

Quiet  —adj. 1 with little or no sound or motion. 2 of gentle or peaceful disposition. 3 unobtrusive; not showy. 4 not overt; disguised. 5 undisturbed, uninterrupted; free or far from vigorous action. 6 informal (quiet wedding). 7 enjoyed in quiet (quiet smoke). 8 not anxious or remorseful. 9 not busy (it is very quiet at work). 10 peaceful (all quiet on the frontier). —n. 1 silence; stillness. 2 undisturbed state; tranquillity. —v. (often foll. By down) make or become quiet or calm.  be quiet (esp. In imper.) Cease talking etc.

Tadpole  n. Larva, esp. Of a frog, toad, or newt. [related to *toad, *poll]

Aspic  n. Savoury jelly used esp. To contain game, eggs, etc. [french, = *asp, suggested by the colours of the jelly]

Pacifier  n. 1 person or thing that pacifies. 2 us baby's dummy.

Modal  adj. 1 of mode or form, not of substance. 2 gram. A of the mood of a verb. B (of an auxiliary verb, e.g. Would) used to express the mood of another verb. 3 mus. Denoting a style of music using a particular mode. [latin: related to *mode]

Trivial  adj. 1 of small value or importance; trifling. 2 (of a person etc.) Concerned only with trivial things.  triviality n. (pl. -ies). Trivially adv. [latin trivialis commonplace, from trivium three-way street corner]

Classic  —adj. 1 first-class; of lasting value and importance. 2 very typical (a classic case). 3 a of ancient greek and latin literature, art, etc. B (of style) simple, harmonious. 4 famous because long-established. —n. 1 classic writer, artist, work, or example. 2 (in pl.) Ancient greek and latin. [latin classicus: related to *class]

Convector  n. Heating appliance that circulates warm air by convection.

Lineal  adj. 1 in the direct line of descent or ancestry. 2 linear.  lineally adv.

Rural  adj. In, of, or suggesting the country (rural seclusion). [latin rus rur- the country]

Thermionic  adj. Of electrons emitted from a very hot substance. [from *thermo-, *ion]

-fy  suffix forming: 1 verbs from nouns, meaning: a make, produce (pacify). B make into (deify; petrify). 2 verbs from adjectives, meaning ‘bring or come into a state’ (frenchify; solidify). 3 verbs in a causative sense (horrify; stupefy). [french -fier from latin facio make]

Plait  —n. Length of hair, straw, etc., in three or more interlaced strands. —v. 1 weave (hair etc.) Into a plait. 2 make by interlacing strands (plaited belt). [french pleit from latin plico fold]

Haemophiliac  n. (us hem-) person with haemophilia.

Circularize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) distribute circulars to.

Lapse  —n. 1 slight error; slip of memory etc. 2 weak or careless decline into an inferior state. 3 (foll. By of) passage of time. —v. (-sing) 1 fail to maintain a position or standard. 2 (foll. By into) fall back into an inferior or previous state. 3 (of a right or privilege etc.) Become invalid through disuse, failure to renew, etc. 4 (as lapsed adj.) That has lapsed. [latin lapsus from labor laps- slip]

Pedo-  us var. Of *paedo-.

Visitor  n. 1 person who visits. 2 migrant bird staying for part of the year.

Finial  n. Ornamental top or end of a roof, gable, etc. [anglo-french: related to *fine1]

Tumbler  n. 1 drinking-glass with no handle or foot. 2 acrobat. 3 part of a lock that holds the bolt until lifted by a key. 4 a kind of pigeon that turns over backwards in flight.

Totalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) collect into a total; find the total of.

Unseat  v. 1 remove from (esp. A parliamentary) seat. 2 dislodge from a seat, esp. On horseback.

Gleanings  n.pl. Things gleaned, esp. Facts.

Hefty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 (of a person) big and strong. 2 (of a thing) large, heavy, powerful.  heftily adv. Heftiness n. [heft weight: related to *heave]

Erogenous  adj. (of a part of the body) particularly sensitive to sexual stimulation. [greek (as *erotic), *-genous]

Rebind  v. (past and past part. Rebound) bind (esp. A book) again or differently.

Punctilious  adj. 1 attentive to formality or etiquette. 2 precise in behaviour.  punctiliously adv. Punctiliousness n. [italian: related to *punctilio]

Sciatic  adj. 1 of the hip. 2 of the sciatic nerve. 3 suffering from or liable to sciatica. [greek iskhion hip]

Matchstick  n. Stem of a match.

Statistics  n.pl. 1 (usu. Treated as sing.) Science of collecting and analysing significant numerical data. 2 such analysed data.  statistician n.

Brisket  n. Animal's breast, esp. As a joint of meat. [french]

Unsuccessful  adj. Not successful.  unsuccessfully adv.

Stadium  n. (pl. -s) athletic or sports ground with tiered seats for spectators. [greek stadion]

Sanskrit  —n. Ancient and sacred language of the hindus in india. —adj. Of or in this language. [sanskrit, = composed]

Disheveled  adj. (brit. Dishevelled) untidy; ruffled.  dishevelment n. [from *dis-, chevel ‘hair’, from latin capillus]

Poliomyelitis  n.  Infectious viral disease of the grey matter of the central nervous system with temporary or permanent paralysis. [greek polios grey, muelos marrow]

Superglue  n. Exceptionally strong glue.

Panelist  n. (brit. Panellist) member of a panel.

Internalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) psychol. Make (attitudes, behaviour, etc.) Part of one's nature by learning or unconscious assimilation.  internalization n.

Specie  n. Coin as opposed to paper money. [related to *species]

Embryo  n. (pl. -s) 1 a unborn or unhatched offspring. B human offspring in the first eight weeks from conception. 2 rudimentary plant in a seed. 3 thing in a rudimentary stage. 4 (attrib.) Undeveloped, immature.  in embryo undeveloped.  embryonic adj. [greek bruo grow]

Immolate  v. (-ting) kill or offer as a sacrifice.  immolation n. [latin, = sprinkle with meal]

Plenteous  adj. Literary plentiful. [french plentivous: related to *plenty]

Theorist  n. Holder or inventor of a theory.

Clergyman  n. Member of the clergy.

Renew  v. 1 revive; make new again; restore to the original state. 2 reinforce; resupply; replace. 3 repeat or re-establish, resume after an interruption (renewed our acquaintance). 4 (also absol.) Grant or be granted continuation of (a licence, subscription, lease, etc.). 5 recover (strength etc.).  renewable adj. Renewal n.

Attribute  —v. (-ting) (usu. Foll. By to) 1 regard as belonging to, written or said by, etc. (a poem attributed to milton). 2 ascribe to (a cause) (delays attributed to snow). —n. 1 esp. Characteristic quality ascribed to a person or thing. 2 object symbolizing or appropriate to a person, office, or status.  attributable adj. Attribution n. [latin tribuo allot]

Cost  —v. (past and past part. Cost) 1 be obtainable for (a sum of money); have as a price. 2 involve as a loss or sacrifice (it cost him his life). 3 (past and past part. Costed) fix or estimate the cost of. —n. 1 what a thing costs; price. 2 loss or sacrifice. 3 (in pl.) Legal expenses.  at all costs (or at any cost) whatever the cost or risk may be. [latin consto stand at a price]

Unwished  adj. (usu. Foll. By for) not wished for.

Tracery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 ornamental stone openwork, esp. In the upper part of a gothic window. 2 fine decorative pattern.

Roomy  adj. (-ier, -iest) having much room, spacious.  roominess n.

Candle  n. Cylinder or block of wax or tallow with a central wick which gives light when burning.  cannot hold a candle to is much inferior to. Not worth the candle not justifying cost or trouble. [latin candela]

Somebody  —pron. Some person. —n. (pl. -ies) important person.

Habit  n. 1 settled or regular tendency or practice (often foll. By of + verbal noun: has a habit of ignoring me). 2 practice that is hard to give up. 3 mental constitution or attitude. 4 dress, esp. Of a religious order. [latin habeo habit- have]

Olfactory  adj. Of the sense of smell (olfactory nerves). [latin oleo smell, facio make]

Advocate  —n. 1 (foll. By of) person who supports or speaks in favour. 2 person who pleads for another, esp. In a lawcourt. —v. (-ting) recommend by argument. [latin: related to *ad-, voco call]

Motif  n. 1 theme that is repeated and developed in an artistic work. 2 decorative design or pattern. 3 ornament sewn separately on a garment. [french: related to *motive]

Slippery  adj. 1 difficult to grasp, stand on, etc. Because smooth or wet. 2 unreliable, unscrupulous.  slipperiness n. [old english]

Opprobrious  adj. (of language) very scornful; abusive.

Deploy  v. 1 spread out (troops) into a line ready for action. 2 use (arguments, forces, etc.) Effectively.  deployment n. [latin plico fold]

Emulate  v. (-ting) 1 try to equal or excel. 2 imitate.  emulation n. Emulative adj. Emulator n. [latin aemulus rival]

Miff  v. Colloq. (usu. As miffed adj.) Offend. [origin uncertain]

Spearwort  n. Aquatic plant with narrow spear-shaped leaves and yellow flowers.

Fender  n. 1 low frame bordering a fireplace. 2 naut. Padding protecting a ship against impact. 3 us vehicle's bumper.

Protactinium  n.  Radioactive metallic element.  [german: related to *actinium]

Dolour  n. (us dolor) literary sorrow, distress.  dolorous adj. [latin dolor pain]

Yts  abbr. Youth training scheme.

Apsis  n. (pl. Apsides) either of two points on the orbit of a planet etc. Nearest to or furthest from the body round which it moves. [greek (h)apsis arch, vault]

Greenwood  n. A wood in summer.

Depute  v. (-ting) (often foll. By to) 1 delegate (a task, authority, etc.). 2 authorize as representative. [latin puto think]

Fauna  n. (pl. -s or -nae) animal life of a region or period. [latin fauna, name of a rural goddess]

Hut  n. Small simple or crude house or shelter. [french hutte from germanic]

Tilth  n. 1 tillage, cultivation. 2 tilled soil. [old english: related to *till3]

Loyal  adj. 1 (often foll. By to) faithful. 2 steadfast in allegiance etc.  loyally adv. Loyalty n. (pl. -ies). [latin: related to *legal]

Inform  v. 1 tell (informed them of their rights). 2 (usu. Foll. By against, on) give incriminating information about a person to the authorities. [latin: related to *form]

Lengthwise  —adv. Lengthways. —adj. Lying or moving lengthways.

Keelhaul  v. 1 drag (a person) under the keel of a ship as a punishment. 2 scold or rebuke severely.

Uht  abbr. Ultra heat treated (esp. Of milk, for long keeping).

Dirndl  n. 1 dress with a close-fitting bodice and full skirt. 2 full skirt of this kind. [german]

Coronation  n. Ceremony of crowning a sovereign or consort. [medieval latin: related to *corona]

Hydrosphere  n. Waters of the earth's surface.

Propose  v. (-sing) 1 (also absol.) Put forward for consideration or as a plan; suggest. 2 (usu. Foll. By to + infin., or verbal noun) intend; purpose (propose to open a café). 3 (usu. Foll. By to) offer oneself in marriage. 4 nominate (a person) as a member of a society, for an office, etc.  propose a toast (or somebody's health) ask people to drink to someone's health.  proposer n. [latin pono posit- place]

Flapper  n. 1 person apt to panic. 2 slang (in the 1920s) young unconventional woman.

Nadir  n. 1 part of the celestial sphere directly below an observer. 2 lowest point; time of deep despair. [arabic, = opposite]

Insectivore  n. 1 animal that feeds on insects. 2 plant which captures and absorbs insects.  insectivorous adj. [from *insect, latin voro devour]

Letterhead  n. 1 printed heading on stationery. 2 stationery with this.

Churlish  adj. Surly; mean.  churlishly adv. Churlishness n. [from *churl]

Spumante  n. Italian sparkling white wine. [italian, = sparkling]

Shortcoming  n. Deficiency; defect.

Directorate  n. 1 board of directors. 2 office of director.

Rebound  —v. 1 spring back after impact. 2 (foll. By upon) (of an action) have an adverse effect upon (the doer). —n. Act of rebounding; recoil, reaction.  on the rebound while still recovering from an emotional shock, esp. Rejection by a lover. [french rebonder: related to *bound1]

Simper  —v. 1 smile in a silly or affected way. 2 express by or with simpering. —n. Such a smile. [origin unknown]

Aromatherapy  n. Use of plant extracts and oils in massage.  aromatherapist n.

Misfit  n. 1 person unsuited to an environment, occupation, etc. 2 garment etc. That does not fit.

Witchery  n. = *witchcraft.

Ted  n. (also ted) colloq. Teddy boy. [abbreviation]

Denunciation  n. Denouncing; public condemnation. [latin: related to *denounce]

Fuss  —n. 1 excited commotion, bustle. 2 excessive concern about a trivial thing. 3 sustained protest or dispute. —v. 1 behave with nervous concern. 2 agitate, worry.  make a fuss complain vigorously.

Hotel  n. (usu. Licensed) establishment providing accommodation and meals for payment. [french: related to *hostel]

Electromagnet  n. Soft metal core made into a magnet by passing an electric current through a coil surrounding it.

Charisma  n. 1 power to inspire or attract others; exceptional charm. 2 divinely conferred power or talent.  charismatic adj. [greek kharis grace]

Handsaw  n. Saw worked by one hand.

Drystone  attrib. Adj. (of a wall etc.) Built without mortar.

Isbn  abbr. International standard book number.

Featherweight  n. 1 a weight in certain sports between bantamweight and lightweight, in amateur boxing 54–7kg. B sportsman of this weight. 2 very light person or thing. 3 (usu. Attrib.) Unimportant thing.

Freeze  —v. (-zing; past froze; past part. Frozen) 1 a turn into ice or another solid by cold. B make or become rigid from the cold. 2 be or feel very cold. 3 cover or become covered with ice. 4 (foll. By to, together) adhere by frost. 5 refrigerate (food) below freezing point. 6 a make or become motionless through fear, surprise, etc. B (as frozen adj) devoid of emotion (frozen smile). 7 make (assets etc.) Unrealizable. 8 fix (prices, wages, etc.) At a certain level. 9 stop (the movement in a film). —n. 1 period or state of frost. 2 fixing or stabilization of prices, wages, etc. 3 (in full freeze-frame) still film-shot.  freeze up obstruct or be obstructed by ice. [old english]

Newsworthy  adj. Topical; noteworthy as news.

Agile  adj. Quick-moving, nimble, active.  agility n. [latin agilis: related to *act]

Cranesbill  n. Wild geranium.

Reappraise  v. (-sing) appraise or assess again or differently.  reappraisal n.

Backstairs  —n.pl. Rear or side stairs of a building. —attrib. Adj. (also backstair) underhand; secret.

Ledge  n. Narrow horizontal or shelflike projection. [origin uncertain]

Scanner  n. 1 device for scanning or systematically examining all the parts of something. 2 machine for measuring radiation, ultrasound reflections, etc., from the body as a diagnostic aid.

Riches  n.pl. Abundant means; valuable possessions. [french richeise: related to *rich]

Bowdlerize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) expurgate (a book etc.).  bowdlerization n. [bowdler, name of an expurgator of shakespeare]

Sloven  n. Untidy or careless person. [origin uncertain]

Indignant  adj. Feeling or showing indignation.  indignantly adv. [latin dignus worthy]

Prognosticate  v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By that) foretell, foresee, prophesy. 2 (of a thing) betoken, indicate.  prognostication n. Prognosticator n. [medieval latin: related to *prognostic]

Devonian  —adj. Of the fourth period of the palaeozoic era. —n. This period. [devon in england]

Blimey  int. Coarse slang expression of surprise, contempt, etc. [(god) blind me!]

Clamour  (us clamor) —n. 1 loud or vehement shouting or noise. 2 protest, demand. —v. 1 make a clamour. 2 utter with a clamour.  clamorous adj. [latin: related to *claim]

Hypothermia  n. Abnormally low body-temperature. [from *hypo-, greek therme heat]

Bewilder  v. Perplex, confuse.  bewildering adj. Bewilderment n. [from *be-, obsolete wilder lose one's way]

Vacant  adj. 1 not filled or occupied. 2 not mentally active; showing no interest.  vacantly adv. [latin: related to *vacate]

Viewer  n. 1 person who views, esp. Television. 2 device for looking at film transparencies etc.

Jellyfish  n. (pl. Same or -es) marine animal with a jelly-like body and stinging tentacles.

Bogie  n. Wheeled undercarriage below a locomotive etc. [origin unknown]

Unprovable  adj. That cannot be proved.

Doorknob  n. Knob turned to open a door.

Superstructure  n. Structure built on top of another.

Seance  n. Meeting at which a spiritualist attempts to make contact with the dead. [french]

Blade  n. 1 cutting part of a knife etc. 2 flattened part of an oar, propeller, etc. 3 a flat narrow leaf of grass etc. B broad thin part of a leaf. 4 flat bone, e.g. In the shoulder. [old english]

Attainment  n. 1 (often in pl.) Accomplishment or achievement. 2 attaining.

Minor  —adj. 1 lesser or comparatively small in size or importance (minor poet). 2 mus. A (of a scale) having intervals of a semitone above its second, fifth, and seventh notes. B (of an interval) less by a semitone than a major interval. C (of a key) based on a minor scale. —n. 1 person under full legal age. 2 us student's subsidiary subject or course. —v. (foll. By in) us study (a subject) as a subsidiary. [latin, = less]

Nowhere  —adv. In or to no place. —pron. No place.  get nowhere make no progress. Nowhere near not nearly. [old english]

Cypress  n. Conifer with hard wood and dark foliage.  [greek kuparissos]

Outfall  n. Outlet of a river, drain, etc.

Engine  n. 1 mechanical contrivance of parts working together, esp. As a source of power (steam engine). 2 a railway locomotive. B = *fire-engine. [latin ingenium device]

Decentralize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 transfer (power etc.) From central to local authority. 2 reorganize to give greater local autonomy.  decentralization n.

Subconscious  —adj. Of the part of the mind which is not fully conscious but influences actions etc. —n. This part of the mind.  subconsciously adv.

Exchequer  n. 1 former government department in charge of national revenue. 2 royal or national treasury. 3 money of a private individual or group. [medieval latin scaccarium chessboard]

Usage  with reference to sense 1, the functions of this department in the uk now belong to the treasury, although the name formally survives, esp. In the title chancellor of the exchequer.

Dissolution  n. 1 dissolving or being dissolved, esp. Of a partnership or of parliament for a new election. 2 breaking up, abolition (of an institution). 3 death.

Hove  past of *heave.

Shower  —n. 1 brief fall of rain, snow, etc. 2 a brisk flurry of bullets, dust, etc. B sudden copious arrival of gifts, honours, etc. 3 (in full shower-bath) a cubicle, bath, etc. In which one stands under a spray of water. B apparatus etc. Used for this. C act of bathing in a shower. 4 us party for giving presents to a prospective bride etc. 5 slang contemptible person or group. —v. 1 discharge (water, missiles, etc.) In a shower. 2 take a shower. 3 (usu. Foll. By on, upon) lavishly bestow (gifts etc.). 4 descend in a shower.  showery adj. [old english]

Obsess  v. Fill the mind of (a person) continually; preoccupy.  obsessive adj. & n. Obsessively adv. Obsessiveness n. [latin obsideo obsess- besiege]

Pompon  n. (also pompom) 1 ornamental tuft or bobble on a hat, shoes, etc. 2 (often attrib.) Dahlia etc. With small tightly-clustered petals. [french]

Outdoor  attrib. Adj. 1 done, existing, or used out of doors. 2 fond of the open air (an outdoor type).

Drawl  —v. Speak with drawn-out vowel sounds. —n. Drawling utterance or way of speaking. [low german or dutch]

Angelica  n. Aromatic plant or its candied stalks. [medieval latin, = angelic (herb)]

Lutanist  var. Of *lutenist.

Folklore  n. Traditional beliefs and stories of a people; the study of these.

Caloric  adj. Of heat or calories.

Dory  n. (pl. Same or -ies) any of various edible marine fish, esp. The john dory. [french dorée = gilded]

Felony  n. (pl. -ies) serious, usu. Violent, crime.  felonious adj.

Perfection  n. 1 making, becoming, or being perfect. 2 faultlessness. 3 perfect person, thing, or example.  to perfection exactly; completely. [latin: related to *perfect]

Munch  v. Eat steadily with a marked action of the jaws. [imitative]

Divert  v. 1 a turn aside; deflect. B distract (attention). 2 (often as diverting adj.) Entertain; amuse. [latin: related to *diverse]

Bulkhead  n. Upright partition in a ship, aircraft, etc.

Spurge  n. Plant with an acrid milky juice. [latin expurgare to clean out]

Disquiet  —v. Make anxious. —n. Anxiety; uneasiness.

Fusillade  n. 1 period of continuous discharge of firearms. 2 sustained outburst of criticism etc.

Scallion  n. Esp. Us shallot; spring onion etc. [latin from ascalon in ancient palestine]

Hejira  var. Of *hegira.

Contrariwise  adv. 1 on the other hand. 2 in the opposite way. 3 perversely.

Forgive  v. (-ving; past forgave; past part. Forgiven) 1 cease to feel angry or resentful towards; pardon. 2 remit (a debt).  forgivable adj. [old english]

Saying  n. Maxim, proverb, etc.  go without saying be too obvious to need mention.

Infrequent  adj. Not frequent.  infrequently adv.

Honeyed  adj. (of words, flattery, etc.) Sweet, sweet-sounding.

Scholastic  adj. 1 of schools, education, etc.; academic. 2 hist. Of scholasticism. [greek: related to *school1]

Demurrer  n. Law objection raised or exception taken.

Finder  n. 1 person who finds. 2 small telescope attached to a large one to locate an object. 3 viewfinder.

Tartrazine  n. Brilliant yellow dye from tartaric acid, used to colour food etc.

Norm  n. 1 standard, pattern, or type. 2 standard amount of work etc. 3 customary behaviour etc. [latin norma carpenter's square]

Unneeded  adj. Not needed.

Success  n. 1 accomplishment of an aim; favourable outcome. 2 attainment of wealth, fame, or position. 3 successful thing or person. [latin: related to *succeed]

Fortify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 provide with fortifications. 2 strengthen physically, mentally, or morally. 3 strengthen (wine) with alcohol. 4 increase the nutritive value of (food, esp. With vitamins). [latin fortis strong]

Whitsun  —n. = *whitsuntide. —adj. = *whit. [whitsun day = whit sunday]

Grasping  adj. Avaricious.

That  —demons. Pron. (pl. Those) 1 person or thing indicated, named, or understood (i heard that; who is that in the garden?). 2 contrasted with this (this is much better than that). 3 (esp. In relative constructions) the one, the person, etc. (a table like that described above). 4  (pl. That) used instead of which or whom to introduce a defining clause (the book that you sent me; there is nothing here that matters). —demons. Adj. (pl. Those) designating the person or thing indicated, named, understood, etc. (cf. Sense 1 of pron.). —adv. 1 to such a degree; so (have done that much). 2 colloq. Very (not that good). —conj. Introducing a subordinate clause indicating: 1 statement or hypothesis (they say that he is better). 2 purpose (we eat that we may live). 3 result (am so sleepy that i cannot work).  all that very (not all that good). That is (or that is to say) formula introducing or following an explanation of a preceding word or words. That's that formula indicating conclusion or completion. [old english]

Usage  in sense 4 of the pronoun, that usually specifies or identifies something referred to, whereas who or which need not: compare the book that you sent me is lost with the book, which i gave you, is lost. That is often omitted in senses 1 and 3 of the conjunction: they say he is ill.

Attune  v. (-ning) 1 (usu. Foll. By to) adjust to a situation etc. 2 mus. Tune. [related to *tune]

Headshrinker  n. Slang psychiatrist.

Obsolescent  adj. Becoming obsolete.  obsolescence n. [latin soleo be accustomed]

Litchi  var. Of *lychee.

Unplanned  adj. Not planned.

Vcr  abbr. Video cassette recorder.

Indict  v. Accuse formally by legal process. [anglo-french: related to *in-2, *dictate]

Eternity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 infinite (esp. Future) time. 2 endless life after death. 3 being eternal. 4 colloq. (often prec. By an) a very long time. [latin: related to *eternal]

Thistly  adj. Overgrown with thistles.

Aroma  n. 1 esp. Pleasing smell, often of food. 2 subtle pervasive quality. [greek, = spice]

Brow  n. 1 forehead. 2 eyebrow. 3 summit of a hill etc. 4 edge of a cliff etc. [old english]

Inflow  n. 1 flowing in. 2 something that flows in.

Tussock  n. Clump of grass etc.  tussocky adj. [perhaps from dial. Tusk tuft]

Gestation  n. 1 a process of carrying or being carried in the uterus between conception and birth. B this period. 2 development of a plan, idea, etc.  gestate v. (-ting). [latin gesto carry]

Satan  n. The devil; lucifer. [hebrew, = enemy]

Sufficiency  n. (pl. -ies) (often foll. By of) adequate amount.

Choler  n. 1 hist. One of the four humours, bile. 2 poet. Or archaic anger, irascibility. [greek khole bile]

Quorum  n. Minimum number of members that must be present to constitute a valid meeting. [latin, = of whom]

Thing  n. 1 entity, idea, action, etc., that exists or may be thought about or perceived. 2 inanimate material object (take that thing away). 3 unspecified item (a few things to buy). 4 act, idea, or utterance (silly thing to do). 5 event (unfortunate thing to happen). 6 quality (patience is a useful thing). 7 person regarded with pity, contempt, or affection (poor thing!). 8 specimen or type (latest thing in hats). 9 colloq. One's special interest (not my thing). 10 colloq. Something remarkable (there's a thing!). 11 (prec. By the) colloq. A what is proper or fashionable. B what is needed (just the thing). C what is to be considered (the thing is, shall we go or not?). D what is important. 12 (in pl.) Personal belongings or clothing (where are my things?). 13 (in pl.) Equipment (painting things). 14 (in pl.) Affairs in general (not in the nature of things). 15 (in pl.) Circumstances, conditions (things look good). 16 (in pl. With a following adjective) all that is so describable (things greek).  do one's own thing colloq. Pursue one's own interests or inclinations. Have a thing about colloq. Be obsessed or prejudiced about. Make a thing of colloq. 1 regard as essential. 2 cause a fuss about. [old english]

Riff  n. Short repeated phrase in jazz etc. [abbreviation of *riffle]

Main  —adj. 1 chief, principal. 2 exerted to the full (by main force). —n. 1 principal duct etc. For water, sewage, etc. 2 (usu. In pl.; prec. By the) a central distribution network for electricity, gas, water, etc. B domestic electricity supply as distinct from batteries.  3 poet. High seas (spanish main).  in the main mostly. [old english]

Macadamia  n. Edible seed of an australian tree.  [macadam, name of a chemist]

Trinitrotoluene  n. (also trinitrotoluol) = *tnt.

Active  —adj. 1 marked by action; energetic; diligent (an active life). 2 working, operative (active volcano). 3 not merely passive or inert; positive (active support; active ingredients). 4 radioactive. 5 gram. Designating the form of a verb whose subject performs the action (e.g. Saw in he saw a film). —n. Gram. Active form or voice of a verb.  actively adv. [latin: related to *act]

Undesigned  adj. Unintentional.

Hepatitis  n. Inflammation of the liver. [related to *hepatic]

Rebuild  v. (past and past part. Rebuilt) build again or differently.

Ivory  n. (pl. -ies) 1 hard substance of the tusks of an elephant etc. 2 creamy-white colour of this. 3 (usu. In pl.) A article made of ivory. B slang thing made of or resembling ivory, esp. A piano key or a tooth. [latin ebur]

Sleazy  adj. (-ier, -iest) squalid, tawdry.  sleazily adv. Sleaziness n. [origin unknown]

Accordingly  adv. 1 as circumstances suggest or require (please act accordingly). 2 consequently (accordingly, he left the room).

Hospitality  n. Friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests or strangers.

Fungus  n. (pl. -gi or -guses) 1 mushroom, toadstool, or allied plant, including moulds, feeding on organic matter. 2 med. Spongy morbid growth.  fungal adj. Fungous adj. [latin]

Lorgnette  n. Pair of eyeglasses or opera-glasses on a long handle. [french lorgner to squint]

Nitwit  n. Colloq. Stupid person. [perhaps from *nit, *wit]

Smarten  v. (usu. Foll. By up) make or become smart.

Feminine  —adj. 1 of women. 2 having womanly qualities. 3 of or denoting the female gender. —n. Feminine gender or word.  femininity n. [latin: related to *female]

Aboard  adv. & prep. On or into (a ship, aircraft, etc.). [from *a2]

Pope  n. (also pope) head of the roman catholic church (the pope; we have a new pope). [greek papas patriarch]

Dispersion  n. 1 dispersing or being dispersed. 2 (the dispersion) = *diaspora.

Borax  n. Salt used in making glass and china, and as an antiseptic. [french ultimately from persian]

Woodruff  n. White-flowered plant with fragrant leaves.

Occupier  n. Person living in a house etc. As its owner or tenant.

Overpay  v. (past and past part. -paid) pay too highly or too much.  overpayment n.

Truism  n. Statement too hackneyed to be worth making, e.g. ‘nothing lasts for ever’.

Surfing  n. Sport of riding the surf on a board.

Coco  n. (pl. -s) coconut palm. [portuguese and spanish, = grimace]

Hangover  n. 1 severe headache etc. From drinking too much alcohol. 2 survival from the past.

Illness  n. 1 disease. 2 being ill.

Hereford  n. Animal of a breed of red and white beef cattle. [hereford in england]

Seepage  n. 1 act of seeping. 2 quantity that seeps out.

Incombustible  adj. That cannot be burnt.

Knew  past of *know.

Atrium  n. (pl. -s or atria) 1 a central court of an ancient roman house. B (usu. Skylit) central court rising through several storeys. 2 each of the two upper cavities of the heart. [latin]

Booking  n. Reservation or engagement.

Quicksand  n. (often in pl.) 1 area of loose wet sand that sucks in anything placed on it. 2 treacherous situation etc.

Croissant  n. Crescent-shaped breakfast roll. [french: related to *crescent]

Dilettante  n. (pl. Dilettanti or -s) dabbler in a subject.  dilettantism n. [italian dilettare *delight]

Scalawag  var. Of *scallywag.

Establishment  n. 1 establishing or being established. 2 a business organization or public institution. B place of business. C residence. 3 a staff of an organization. B household. 4 organized body permanently maintained. 5 church system organized by law. 6 (the establishment) social group with authority or influence and resisting change.

Distinctive  adj. Distinguishing, characteristic.  distinctively adv. Distinctiveness n.

Skinhead  n. Youth with a shaven head, esp. One of an aggressive gang.

Gooey  adj. (gooier, gooiest) slang 1 viscous, sticky. 2 sentimental. [from *goo]

Solstice  n. Either of the times when the sun is furthest from the equator. [latin solstitium ‘the sun standing still’]

Episcopacy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 government by bishops. 2 (prec. By the) the bishops.

Inexplicable  adj. That cannot be explained.  inexplicably adv.

Refill  —v. Fill again. —n. 1 thing that refills, esp. Another drink. 2 act of refilling.  refillable adj.

Resistor  n. Device having resistance to the passage of an electric current.

Dilatation  n. 1 dilating of the cervix, e.g. For surgical curettage. 2 dilation. [from *dilate]

Rising  —adj. 1 advancing to maturity or high standing (rising young lawyer). 2 approaching a specified age (rising five). 3 (of ground) sloping upwards. —n. Revolt or insurrection.

Separator  n. Machine for separating, e.g. Cream from milk.

Militate  v. (-ting) (usu. Foll. By against) have force or effect; tell. [latin: related to *military]

Usage  militate is often confused with mitigate.

Aquiline  adj. 1 of or like an eagle. 2 (of a nose) curved. [latin aquila eagle]

Accessible  adj. (often foll. By to) 1 reachable or obtainable; readily available. 2 easy to understand.  accessibility n.

Acetylene  n. Hydrocarbon gas burning with a bright flame, used esp. In welding.

Sanctity  n. Holiness, sacredness; inviolability. [latin sanctus holy]

Cubism  n. Style in art, esp. Painting, in which objects are represented geometrically.  cubist n. & adj.

Consignment  n. 1 consigning or being consigned. 2 goods consigned.

Shimmer  —v. Shine tremulously or faintly. —n. Tremulous or faint light. [old english]

Hateful  adj. Arousing hatred.

Clone  —n. 1 a group of organisms produced asexually from one stock or ancestor. B one such organism. 2 colloq. Person or thing regarded as identical to another. —v. (-ning) propagate as a clone.  clonal adj. [greek klon twig]

Containerize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) pack in or transport by container.  containerization n.

Sylph  n. 1 elemental spirit of the air. 2 slender graceful woman or girl.  sylphlike adj. [latin]

Somber  adj. (also brit. Sombre) dark, gloomy, dismal.  sombrely adv. Sombreness n. [latin sub ombra under shade]

Audiovisual  adj. (of teaching methods etc.) Using both sight and sound.

Unpack  v. 1 (also absol.) Open and empty (a package, luggage, etc.). 2 take (a thing) from a package etc.

Midwinter  n. Period of or near the winter solstice, about 22 dec. [old english]

Squeeze  —v. (-zing) 1 (often foll. By out) a exert pressure on, esp. To extract moisture etc. B extract (moisture) by squeezing. 2 reduce in size or alter in shape by squeezing. 3 force or push into or through a small or narrow space. 4 a harass or pressure (a person). B (usu. Foll. By out of) obtain by extortion, entreaty, etc. 5 press (a person's hand) in sympathy etc. —n. 1 squeezing or being squeezed. 2 close embrace. 3 crowd, crowded state. 4 small quantity produced by squeezing (squeeze of lemon). 5 restriction on borrowing, investment, etc., in a financial crisis.  put the squeeze on colloq. Coerce or pressure. [origin unknown]

Haemal  adj. (us hem-) of the blood. [greek haima blood]

Undeserving  adj. Not deserving.

Prelacy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 church government by prelates. 2 (prec. By the) prelates collectively. 3 office or rank of prelate. [anglo-french from medieval latin: related to *prelate]

Untutored  adj. Uneducated, untaught.

Sarsaparilla  n. 1 preparation of the dried roots of various plants, esp. Smilax, used to flavour some drinks and medicines and formerly as a tonic. 2 plant yielding this. [spanish]

Avionics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Electronics as applied to aviation. [from *aviation, *electronics]

Unmet  adj. (of a demand, goal, etc.) Not achieved or fulfilled.

Fourth  adj. & n. 1 next after third. 2 any of four equal parts of a thing.  fourthly adv. [old english: related to *four]

Unbolt  v. Release the bolt of (a door etc.).

Squall  —n. 1 sudden or violent wind, esp. With rain, snow, or sleet. 2 discordant cry; scream (esp. Of a baby). —v. 1 utter a squall; scream. 2 utter with a squall.  squally adj. [probably alteration of *squeal after *bawl]

Arborescent  adj. Treelike in growth or form.

Arbor  n. (brit. Arbour) shady garden alcove enclosed by trees etc. [latin herba herb: assimilated to latin arbor tree]

Confucian  adj. Of confucius or his philosophy.  confucianism n. [confucius, name of a chinese philosopher]

Peacemaker  n. Person who brings about peace.  peacemaking n. & adj.

Mailbag  n. Large sack for carrying mail.

Gastro-  comb. Form stomach. [greek gaster stomach]

Heaven  n. 1 place regarded in some religions as the abode of god and the angels, and of the blessed after death. 2 place or state of supreme bliss. 3 colloq. Delightful thing. 4 (usu. Heaven) god, providence (often as an exclamation or mild oath: heavens). 5 (the heavens) esp. Poet. The sky as seen from the earth, in which the sun, moon, and stars appear.  heavenward adv. (also heavenwards). [old english]

Squelch  —v. 1 a make a sucking sound as of treading in thick mud. B move with a squelching sound. 2 disconcert, silence. —n. Act or sound of squelching.  squelchy adj. [imitative]

Afterbirth  n. Placenta etc. Discharged from the womb after childbirth.

Comfit  n. Archaic sweet consisting of a nut etc. In sugar. [latin: related to *confection]

Sunlight  n. Light from the sun.

Tup  —n. Ram. —v. (-pp-) (of a ram) copulate with (a ewe). [origin unknown]

Alderman  n. Esp. Hist. Co-opted member of an english county or borough council, next in dignity to the mayor. [old english aldor chief, *man]

Bulldoze  v. (-zing) 1 clear with a bulldozer. 2 colloq. A intimidate. B make (one's way) forcibly.

Stoppage  n. 1 interruption of work owing to a strike etc. 2 (in pl.) Sum deducted from pay, for tax, national insurance, etc. 3 condition of being blocked or stopped.

Slipshod  adj. Careless, slovenly.

Eyelash  n. Each of the hairs growing on the edges of the eyelids.
