Approach  —v. 1 come near or nearer (to) in space or time. 2 tentatively propose to. 3 be similar or approximate to (approaching 5 million). 4 set about (a task etc.). —n. 1 act or means of approaching. 2 approximation. 3 technique (try a new approach). 4 golf stroke from the fairway to the green. 5 aeron. Part of a flight before landing. [latin prope near]

Nipper  n. 1 person or thing that nips. 2 claw of a crab etc. 3 colloq. Young child. 4 (in pl.) Any tool for gripping or cutting.

Horehound  n. Herbaceous plant yielding a bitter aromatic juice used against coughs etc. [old english, = hoary herb]

Enmity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 state of being an enemy. 2 hostility. [romanic: related to *enemy]

Shard  n. Broken piece of pottery or glass etc. [old english]

Irresistible  adj. Too strong, delightful, or convincing to be resisted.  irresistibly adv.

Er  abbr. Queen elizabeth. [latin elizabetha regina]

Totter  —v. 1 stand or walk unsteadily or feebly. 2 a (of a building etc.) Shake as if about to collapse. B (of a system of government etc.) Be about to fall. —n. Unsteady or shaky movement or gait.  tottery adj. [dutch]

Profitable  adj. 1 yielding profit. 2 beneficial.  profitability n. Profitably adv.

Gnat  n. Small two-winged biting fly. [old english]

Batsman  n. Person who bats, esp. In cricket.

Anaemic  adj. (us anemic) 1 of or suffering from anaemia. 2 pale, listless.

Parent  —n. 1 person who has or adopts a child; father or mother. 2 animal or plant from which others are derived. 3 (often attrib.) Source, origin, etc. —v. (also absol.) Be the parent of.  parental adj.  Parenthood n. [latin pario bring forth]

Paleo-  comb. Form (brit. Palaeo-) ancient; prehistoric. [greek palaios]

Photochemistry  n. The study of the chemical effects of light.

Dark  —adj. 1 with little or no light. 2 of deep or sombre colour. 3 (of a person) with dark colouring. 4 gloomy, dismal. 5 evil, sinister. 6 sullen, angry. 7 secret, mysterious. 8 ignorant, unenlightened. —n. 1 absence of light. 2 lack of knowledge. 3 dark area or colour, esp. In painting.  after dark after nightfall. The dark ages (or age) 1 period of european history from the 5th–10th c. 2 period of supposed unenlightenment. In the dark 1 lacking information. 2 with no light.  darkish adj. Darkly adv. Darkness n. [old english]

Economy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a community's system of wealth creation. B particular kind of this (a capitalist economy). C administration or condition of this. 2 a careful management of (esp. Financial) resources; frugality. B instance of this (made many economies). 3 sparing or careful use (economy of language). [greek oikonomia household management]

Fro  adv. Back (now only in to and fro: see *to). [old norse: related to *from]

Meadowsweet  n. Fragrant meadow and marsh plant with creamy-white flowers.

Chili  var. Of *chilli.

Easy  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 not difficult; not requiring great effort. 2 free from pain, trouble, or anxiety. 3 free from constraint; relaxed and pleasant. 4 compliant. —adv. With ease; in an effortless or relaxed manner. —int. Go or move carefully.  easy on the eye (or ear etc.) Colloq. Pleasant to look at (or listen to etc.). Go easy (foll. By with, on) be sparing or cautious. I'm easy colloq. I have no preference. Take it easy 1 proceed gently. 2 relax; work less.  easiness n. [french: related to *ease]

Makeweight  n. 1 small quantity added to make up the weight. 2 person or thing supplying a deficiency.

Elysium  n. 1 (also elysian fields) (in greek mythology) abode of the blessed after death. 2 place of ideal happiness.  elysian adj. [latin from greek]

Pas  n. (pl. Same) step, esp. In ballet. [french, = step]

Retrovirus  n. Any of a group of rna viruses which form dna during the replication of their rna, and so transfer genetic material into the dna of host cells. [from the initial letters of reverse transcriptase + *virus]

Reproduce  v. (-cing) 1 produce a copy or representation of. 2 cause to be seen or heard etc. Again (tried to reproduce the sound exactly). 3 produce further members of the same species by natural means. 4 refl. Produce offspring.  reproducible adj.

Stunning  adj. Colloq. Extremely attractive or impressive.  stunningly adv.

Hackneyed  adj. (of a phrase etc.) Made trite by overuse.

Hindustani  n. Language based on hindi, used as a lingua franca in much of india. [from *hindu, stan country]

Revolt  —v. 1 rise in rebellion. 2 a affect with strong disgust. B (often foll. By at, against) feel strong disgust. —n. 1 act of rebelling. 2 state of insurrection. 3 sense of disgust. 4 mood of protest or defiance. [italian: related to *revolve]

Monies  see *money 2.

Roadster  n. Open car without rear seats.

Evensong  n. Service of evening prayer in the church of england. [from *even2]

Mob  —n. 1 disorderly crowd; rabble. 2 (prec. By the) usu. Derog. The populace. 3 colloq. Gang; group. —v. (-bb-) crowd round in order to attack or admire. [latin mobile vulgus excitable crowd]

Groovy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 slang excellent. 2 of or like a groove.

Altogether  adv. 1 totally, completely. 2 on the whole. 3 in total.  in the altogether colloq. Naked. [from *all, *together]

Usage  note that altogether means ‘in total’, whereas all together means ‘all at once’ or ‘all in one place’. The phrases six rooms altogether (in total) and six rooms all together (in one place) illustrate the difference.

Bulimia  n. (in full bulimia nervosa) disorder in which overeating alternates with self-induced vomiting, fasting, etc. [greek bous ox, limos hunger]

Links  n.pl. (treated as sing. Or pl.) Golf-course. [old english, = rising ground]

Overcharge  v. (-ging) 1 charge too high a price to (a person). 2 put too much charge into (a battery, gun, etc.). 3 put excessive detail into (a description, picture, etc.).

Eatable  —adj. Fit to be eaten. —n. (usu. In pl.) Food.

Tenuous  adj. 1 slight, insubstantial (tenuous connection). 2 (of a distinction etc.) Oversubtle. 3 thin, slender, small. 4 rarefied.  tenuity n. Tenuously adv. [latin tenuis]

Apoplexy  n. Sudden paralysis caused by blockage or rupture of a brain artery; stroke. [greek apoplesso disable by stroke]

Blitz  colloq. —n. 1 a intensive or sudden (esp. Aerial) attack. B intensive period of work etc. (must have a blitz on this room). 2 (the blitz) german air raids on london in 1940. —v. Inflict a blitz on. [abbreviation of *blitzkrieg]

Early  —adj. & adv. (-ier, -iest) 1 before the due, usual, or expected time. 2 a not far on in the day or night, or in time (early evening; at the earliest opportunity). B prompt (early payment appreciated). 3 not far on in a period, development, or process of evolution; being the first stage (early english architecture; early spring). 4 forward in flowering, ripening, etc. (early peaches). —n. (pl. -ies) (usu. In pl.) Early fruit or vegetable.  earliness n. [old english: related to *ere]

Tufa  n. 1 porous limestone rock formed round mineral springs. 2 = *tuff. [italian: related to *tuff]

Chime  —n. 1 set of attuned bells. 2 sounds made by this. —v. (-ming) 1 (of bells) ring. 2 show (the time) by chiming. 3 (usu. Foll. By together, with) be in 

Rely  v. (-ies, -ied) (foll. By on, upon) 1 depend on with confidence or assurance. 2 be dependent on. [latin religo bind closely]

Necessitate  v. (-ting) make necessary (esp. As a result) (will necessitate some sacrifice).

Adjunct  n. 1 (foll. By to, of) subordinate or incidental thing. 2 gram. Word or phrase used to explain or amplify the predicate, subject, etc. [latin: related to *adjoin]

Jacket  n. 1 a short coat with sleeves. B protective or supporting garment (life-jacket). 2 casing or covering round a boiler etc. 3 = *dust-jacket. 4 skin of a potato. 5 animal's coat. [french]

Hinduism  n. Main religious and social system of india, including the belief in reincarnation, several gods, and a caste system.

Academia  n. The academic world; scholastic life.

Midwicket  n. Cricket position of a fielder on the leg side opposite the middle of the pitch.

Darwinian  —adj. Of darwin's theory of evolution. —n. Adherent of this.  darwinism n. Darwinist n. [darwin, name of a naturalist]

Equidistant  adj. At equal distances.

Complete  —adj. 1 having all its parts; entire. 2 finished. 3 total, in every way. —v. (-ting) 1 finish. 2 make complete. 3 fill in (a form etc.). 4 conclude the sale or purchase of property.  complete with having (as an important feature) (comes complete with instructions).  completely adv. Completeness n. Completion n. [latin: related to *complement]

Spoonfeed  v. (past and past part. -fed) 1 feed with a spoon. 2 give such extensive help etc. To (a person) that he or she need make no effort.

Workshop  n. 1 room or building in which goods are manufactured. 2 place or meeting for concerted discussion or activity (dance workshop).

Bloodless  adj. 1 without blood or bloodshed. 2 unemotional. 3 pale. 4 feeble.

Playboy  n. Wealthy pleasure-seeking man.

Psoriasis  n. Skin disease marked by red scaly patches. [greek psora itch]

Marvellous  adj. (us marvelous) 1 astonishing. 2 excellent.  marvellously adv. [french: related to *marvel]

Crankpin  n. Pin by which a connecting-rod is attached to a crank.

Whalebone  n. Elastic horny substance in the upper jaw of some whales.

Sulphonamide  n. (us sulfonamide) any of a class of antibiotic drugs containing sulphur. [german sulfon (related to *sulphur), amide a derivative of *ammonia]

Longshore  attrib. Adj. 1 existing on or frequenting the shore. 2 directed along the shore. [from along shore]

Affray  n. Breach of the peace by fighting or rioting in public. [anglo-french = ‘remove from peace’]

Unnoticeable  adj. Not easily seen or noticed.

Fussy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 inclined to fuss. 2 over-elaborate. 3 fastidious.  fussily adv. Fussiness n.

He  abbr. 1 his or her excellency. 2 his eminence. 3 high explosive.

Sewn  past part. Of *sew.

Endue  v. (also indue) (-dues, -dued, -duing) (foll. By with) provide (a person) with (qualities etc.). [latin induo put on clothes]

Construct  —v. 1 make by fitting parts together; build, form. 2 geom. Delineate (a figure). —n. Thing constructed, esp. By the mind.  constructor n. [latin struo struct- build]

Vamoose  v. Us slang depart hurriedly. [spanish vamos let us go]

Irremediable  adj. That cannot be remedied.  irremediably adv.

Bollocks  n. (also ballocks) coarse slang 1 (usu. As int.) Nonsense. 2 testicles. [old english: related to *ball1]

Reset  v. (-tt-; past and past part. Reset) set (a bone, gems, a clock etc.) Again or differently.

Snapshot  n. Casual or informal photograph.

Dissertation  n. Detailed discourse, esp. One submitted towards an academic degree. [latin disserto discuss]

Ministry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a government department headed by a minister. B building for this. 2 a (prec. By the) vocation, office, or profession of a religious minister. B period of tenure of this. 3 (prec. By the) body of ministers of a government or religion. 4 period of government under one prime minister. 5 ministering, ministration. [latin: related to *minister]

Crocus  n. (pl. -cuses) small plant with white, yellow, or purple flowers, growing from a corm. [latin from greek]

Leper  n. 1 person with leprosy. 2 person who is shunned. [greek lepros scaly]

Climacteric  n. Period of life when fertility and sexual activity are in decline. [greek: related to *climax]

Tub  —n. 1 open flat-bottomed usu. Round vessel. 2 tub-shaped (usu. Plastic) carton. 3 colloq. Bath. 4 colloq. Clumsy slow boat. —v. (-bb-) plant, bathe, or wash in a tub. [probably low german or dutch]

Reward  —n. 1 a return or recompense for service or merit. B requital for good or evil. 2 sum offered for the detection of a criminal, restoration of lost property, etc. —v. Give a reward to (a person) or for (a service etc.). [anglo-french reward(er) *regard]

Autocue  n. Propr. Screen etc. From which a speaker reads a television script.

Zeugma  n. Figure of speech using a verb or adjective with two nouns, to one of which it is strictly applicable while the word appropriate to the other is not used (e.g. With weeping eyes and [sc. Grieving] hearts) (cf. *syllepsis). [greek, = a yoking, from zugon yoke]

Keg  n. Small barrel. [old norse]

Heifer  n. Young cow, esp. One that has not had more than one calf. [old english]

Zing  colloq. —n. Vigour, energy. —v. Move swiftly, esp. With a high-pitched ringing sound. [imitative]

Stiffen  v. Make or become stiff.  stiffening n.

Disrespect  n. Lack of respect; discourtesy.  disrespectful adj. Disrespectfully adv.

Ginkgo  n. (pl. -s) tree with fan-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. [chinese, = silver apricot]

Mohair  n. 1 hair of the angora goat. 2 yarn or fabric from this. [ultimately from arabic, = choice]

Bonk  —v. 1 bang, bump. 2 coarse slang have sexual intercourse (with). —n. Instance of bonking (bonk on the head). [imitative]

Blather  (also blether) —n. Foolish talk. —v. Talk foolishly. [old norse]

Minus  —prep. 1 with the subtraction of (7 minus 4 equals 3). 2 below zero (minus 2°). 3 colloq. Lacking (returned minus their dog). —adj. 1 math. Negative. 2 electronics having a negative charge. —n. 1 = *minus sign. 2 math. Negative quantity. 3 colloq. Disadvantage. [latin, neuter of *minor]

Zero  n. (pl. -s) 1 figure 0; nought; nil. 2 point on the scale of a thermometer etc. From which a positive or negative quantity is reckoned. 3 (attrib.) No, not any (zero growth). 4 (in full zero-hour) a hour at which a planned, esp. Military, operation is timed to begin. B crucial moment. 5 lowest or earliest point (down to zero; the year zero).  zero in on (-oes, -oed) 1 take aim at. 2 focus one's attention on. [arabic: related to *cipher]

Basic  n. Computer programming language using familiar english words. [beginner's all-purpose symbolic instruction code]

Decanal  adj. 1 of a dean. 2 of the south side of a choir (where the dean sits). [latin: related to *dean1]

Donate  v. (-ting) give (money etc.), esp. To charity. [from *donation]

Sententious  adj. 1 pompously moralizing. 2 affectedly formal in style. 3 aphoristic; using maxims.  sententiousness n. [latin: related to *sentence]

Punchy  adj. (-ier, -iest) vigorous; forceful.

Jobless  adj. Unemployed.  joblessness n.

Weekday  n. Day other than sunday or saturday and sunday.

Greek  —n. 1 a native or national of greece. B person of greek descent. 2 language of greece. —adj. Of greece or its people or language; hellenic.  greek to me colloq. Incomprehensible to me. [old english ultimately from greek graikoi]

Ucca  abbr. Universities central council on admissions.

Decathlon  n. Athletic contest of ten events for all competitors.  decathlete n. [from *deca-, greek athlon contest]

Gamy  adj. (-ier, -iest) smelling or tasting like high game.

Hematite  n. (brit. Haem-) a ferric oxide ore. [latin: related to *haemal]

Errand  n. 1 short journey, esp. On another's behalf, to take a message, collect goods, etc. 2 object of such a journey. [old english]

Spongy  adj. (-ier, -iest) like a sponge, porous, elastic, absorbent.  sponginess n.

-crat  comb. Form member or supporter of a type of government etc.

Marquis  n. (pl. -quises) foreign nobleman ranking between duke and count. [french: related to *march2]

Fifth  adj. & n. 1 next after fourth. 2 any of five equal parts of a thing. 3 mus. Interval or chord spanning five consecutive notes in a diatonic scale (e.g. C to g).  fifthly adv. [old english: related to *five]

-ol  suffix in the names of alcohols or analogous compounds. [from *alcohol and latin oleum oil]

Crime  n. 1 a offence punishable by law. B illegal acts (resorted to crime). 2 evil act (crime against humanity). 3 colloq. Shameful act. [latin crimen]

Barony  n. (pl. -ies) domain or rank of a baron.

Misguided  adj. Mistaken in thought or action.  misguidedly adv. Misguidedness n.

Loudspeaker  n. Apparatus that converts electrical signals into sound.

Hilt  n. Handle of a sword, dagger, etc.  up to the hilt completely. [old english]

Springy  adj. (-ier, -iest) springing back quickly when squeezed, bent, or stretched; elastic.  springiness n.

Spin  —v. (-nn-; past and past part. Spun) 1 (cause to) turn or whirl round quickly. 2 (also absol.) A draw out and twist (wool, cotton, etc.) Into threads. B make (yarn) in this way. 3 (of a spider, silkworm, etc.) Make (a web, cocoon, etc.) By extruding a fine viscous thread. 4 (esp. Of the head) be dizzy through excitement etc. 5 tell or write (a story etc.). 6 (as spun adj.) Made into threads (spun glass; spun gold). 7 toss (a coin). 8 = spin-dry (*spin-drier). —n. 1 spinning motion; whirl. 2 rotating dive of an aircraft. 3  secondary twisting motion, e.g. Of a ball in flight. 4 colloq. Brief drive, esp. In a car.  spin out prolong. Spin a yarn tell a story. [old english]

Empathy  n. Ability to identify with a person or object.  empathetic adj. [as *pathos]

Congratulation  n. 1 congratulating. 2 (usu. In pl.) Expression of this.

Their  poss. Pron. (attrib.) Of or belonging to them. [old norse]

Meretricious  adj. Showily but falsely attractive. [latin meretrix prostitute]

Immediate  adj. 1 occurring or done at once (immediate reply). 2 nearest, next; direct (immediate vicinity; immediate future; immediate cause of death). 3 most pressing or urgent (our immediate concern).  immediacy n. Immediateness n. [latin: related to *in-1, *mediate]

Wank  coarse slang —v. Masturbate. —n. Act of masturbating. [origin unknown]

Slash  —v. 1 cut or gash with a knife etc. 2 (often foll. By at) deliver or aim cutting blows. 3 reduce (prices etc.) Drastically. 4 censure vigorously. —n. 1 slashing cut or stroke. 2 printing oblique stroke; solidus. 3 slang act of urinating. [origin unknown]

Shoddy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 poorly made. 2 counterfeit.  shoddily adv. Shoddiness n. [origin unknown]

Coolie  n. Unskilled native labourer in eastern countries. [perhaps from kuli, tribe in india]

Indirect  adj. 1 not going straight to the point. 2 (of a route etc.) Not straight. 3 a not directly sought (indirect result). B not primary (indirect cause).  indirectly adv.

Moonbeam  n. Ray of moonlight.

Suggestible  adj. 1 easily influenced. 2 capable of being suggested.  suggestibility n.

Arc  —n. 1 part of the circumference of a circle or other curve. 2 electr. Luminous discharge between two electrodes. —v. (arced; arcing) form an arc; move in a curve. [latin arcus bow]

Distinct  adj. 1 (often foll. By from) not identical; separate; different. 2 clearly perceptible. 3 unmistakable, decided (distinct advantage).  distinctly adv. [latin: related to *distinguish]

Mop  —n. 1 bundle of yarn or cloth or a sponge on the end of a stick, for cleaning floors etc. 2 similarly-shaped implement for various purposes. 3 thick mass of hair. 4 mopping or being mopped (gave it a mop). —v. (-pp-) 1 wipe or clean with or as with a mop. 2 a wipe tears or sweat etc. From (one's face etc.). B wipe away (tears etc.).  mop up 1 wipe up with or as with a mop. 2 colloq. Absorb. 3 dispatch; make an end of. 4  a complete the occupation of (a district etc.) By capturing or killing enemy troops left there. B capture or kill (stragglers). [origin uncertain]

Compiler  n. 1 person who compiles. 2 computing program for translating a programming language into machine code.

Deanery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 dean's house or position. 2 parishes presided over by a rural dean.

Cushion  —n. 1 bag stuffed with soft material, for sitting or leaning on etc. 2 protection against shock; measure to soften a blow. 3 padded rim of a billiard-table etc. 4 air supporting a hovercraft etc. —v. 1 provide or protect with cushion(s). 2 mitigate the adverse effects of. [latin culcita mattress]

Olivine  n. Mineral (usu. Olive-green) composed of magnesium-iron silicate.

Pastorate  n. 1 office or tenure of a pastor. 2 body of pastors.

Parcel  —n. 1 goods etc. Wrapped up in a package for posting or carrying. 2 piece of land. 3 quantity dealt with in one commercial transaction. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 (foll. By up) wrap as a parcel. 2 (foll. By out) divide into portions. [latin: related to *particle]

Corgi  n. (pl. -s) dog of a short-legged breed with a foxlike head. [welsh]

Submit  v. (-tt-) 1 (usu. Foll. By to) a cease resistance; yield. B refl. Surrender (oneself) to the control of another etc. 2 present for consideration. 3 (usu. Foll. By to) subject (a person or thing) to a process, treatment, etc. [latin mitto miss- send]

Attract  v. 1 (also absol.) (of a magnet etc.) Draw to itself or oneself. 2 arouse interest or admiration in. [latin traho draw]

Against  prep. 1 in opposition to (fight against crime). 2 into collision or in contact with (lean against the wall). 3 to the disadvantage of (my age is against me). 4 in contrast to (against a dark background). 5 in anticipation of (against his coming; against the cold). 6 as a compensating factor to (income against expenditure). 7 in return for (issued against payment of the fee).  against the grain see *grain. Against time see *time. [from *again, with inflectional -s]

Rotter  n. Slang nasty or contemptible person. [from *rot]

Unteachable  adj. (of a person, subject, etc.) Incapable of being taught.

Dawn  —n. 1 daybreak. 2 beginning or birth of something. —v. 1 (of a day) begin; grow light. 2 (often foll. By on, upon) begin to become obvious (to). [old english]

Unworn  adj. Not worn or impaired by wear.

Engraving  n. Print made from an engraved plate.

Monstrosity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 huge or outrageous thing. 2 monstrousness. 3 = *monster 3. [latin: related to *monstrous]

Intestate  —adj. Not having made a will before death. —n. Person who has died intestate.  intestacy n. [latin: related to *testament]

Home  —n. 1 a place where one lives; fixed residence. B dwelling-house. 2 family circumstances (comes from a good home). 3 native land. 4 institution caring for people or animals. 5 place where a thing originates, is kept, or is native or most common. 6 a finishing-point in a race. B (in games) place where one is safe; goal. 7 sport home match or win. —attrib. Adj. 1 a of or connected with one's home. B carried on, done, or made, at home. 2 in one's own country (home industries; the home market). 3 sport played on one's own ground etc. (home match). —adv. 1 to, at, or in one's home or country (go home; is he home yet?).

Metaphysics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) 1 branch of philosophy dealing with the nature of existence, truth, and knowledge. 2 colloq. Abstract talk; mere theory. [greek, as having followed physics in aristotle's works]

Creaky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 liable to creak. 2 a stiff or frail. B decrepit, outmoded.  creakiness n.

Pituitary  n. (pl. -ies) (also pituitary gland) small ductless gland at the base of the brain. [latin pituita phlegm]

Ominous  adj. 1 threatening. 2 of evil omen; inauspicious.  ominously adv. [latin: related to *omen]

Cummerbund  n. Waist sash. [hindustani and persian]

Reassemble  v. (-ling) assemble again or into a former state.  reassembly n.

Postcode  n. Group of letters and figures in a postal address to assist sorting.

Custard  n. Pudding or sweet sauce of eggs or flavoured cornflour and milk. [obsolete crustade: related to *crust]

Somehow  adv. 1 for some reason or other (somehow i don't trust him). 2 in some way; by some means.

Epicenter  n. (brit. Epicentre) 1 point at which an earthquake reaches the earth's surface. 2 central point of a difficulty. [greek: related to *centre]

Ultrasound  n. Ultrasonic waves.

Shingles  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Acute painful viral inflammation of the nerve ganglia, with a rash often encircling the body. [latin cingulum girdle]

Ow  int. Expressing sudden pain. [natural exclamation]

Him  pron. 1 objective case of *he (i saw him). 2 colloq. He (it's him again; taller than him). [old english, dative of *he]

Acetaldehyde  n. Colourless volatile liquid aldehyde. [from *acetic, *aldehyde]

Plumber  n. Person who fits and repairs the apparatus of a water-supply, heating, etc.

Gran  n. Colloq. Grandmother. [abbreviation]

Mineral  n. (often attrib.) 1 inorganic substance. 2 substance obtained by mining. 3 (often in pl.)  Artificial mineral water or similar carbonated drink. [french or medieval latin: related to *mine2]

Filial  adj. Of or due from a son or daughter.  filially adv. [latin filius, -a son, daughter]

Wink  —v. 1 (often foll. By at) close and open one eye quickly, esp. As a signal. 2 close and open (one or both eyes) quickly. 3 (of a light etc.) Twinkle; (of an indicator) flash on and off. —n. 1 act of winking. 2 colloq. Short sleep.  in a wink very quickly. Wink at purposely avoid seeing; pretend not to notice.  winker n. (in sense 3 of v.). [old english]

Rheumatics  n.pl. (treated as sing.; often prec. By the) colloq. Rheumatism.

Suspect  —v. 1 be inclined to think. 2 have an impression of the existence or presence of. 3 (often foll. By of) mentally accuse. 4 doubt the genuineness or truth of. —n. Suspected person. —adj. Subject to or deserving suspicion. [latin suspicio -spect-]

Dandelion  n. Wild plant with jagged leaves, a yellow flower, and a fluffy seed-head. [french dent-de-lion, = lion's tooth]

Jealousy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 jealous state or feeling. 2 instance of this. [french: related to *jealous]

Luster  n. (brit. Lustre) 1 gloss, shining surface. 2 brilliance, splendour. 3 iridescent glaze on pottery and porcelain.  lustrous adj. [latin lustro illumine]

Maneuver  (brit. Manoeuvre) —n. 1 planned and controlled movement of a vehicle or body of troops etc. 2 (in pl.) Large-scale exercise of troops, ships, etc. 3 agile or skilful movement. 4 artful plan. —v. (-ring) 1 move (a thing, esp. A vehicle) carefully. 2 perform or cause (troops etc.) To perform manoeuvres. 3 a (usu. Foll. By into, out of, etc.) Manipulate (a person, thing, etc.) By scheming or adroitness. B use artifice.  manoeuvrable adj. Manoeuvrability n. [medieval latin manu operor work with the hand]

Unearthly  adj. 1 supernatural, mysterious. 2 colloq. Absurdly early or inconvenient (unearthly hour).  unearthliness n.

Concise  adj. Brief but comprehensive in expression.  concisely adv. Conciseness n. Concision n. [latin caedo cut]

Stratify  v. (-ies, -ied) (esp. As stratified adj.) Arrange in strata or grades etc.  stratification n. [french: related to *stratum]

Silverware  n. Articles of or plated with silver.

Mural  —n. Painting executed directly on a wall. —adj. Of, on, or like a wall. [latin murus wall]

Gazelle  n. (pl. Same or -s) small graceful antelope. [arabic gazal]

Sponsor  —n. 1 person who pledges money to a charity etc. In return for another person fulfilling a sporting etc. Challenge. 2 a patron of an artistic or sporting activity etc. B company etc. Supporting a broadcast in return for advertising time. 3 person who introduces legislation. 4 godparent at a baptism or (esp. Rc ch.) Person who presents a candidate for baptism. —v. Be a sponsor for.  sponsorial adj. Sponsorship n. [latin spondeo spons- pledge]

Propinquity  n. 1 nearness in space; proximity. 2 close kinship. 3 similarity. [latin prope near]

Battleaxe  n. 1 large axe used in ancient warfare. 2 colloq. Formidable older woman.

Muniment  n. (usu. In pl.) Document kept as evidence of rights or privileges etc. [latin munio fortify]

Nicety  n. (pl. -ies) 1 subtle distinction or detail. 2 precision.  to a nicety with exactness.

Bony  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 thin with prominent bones. 2 having many bones. 3 of or like bone.  boniness n.

Grown  past part. Of *grow.

Derrick  n. 1 crane for heavy weights, with a movable pivoted arm. 2 framework over an oil well etc., holding the drilling machinery. [derrick, name of a hangman]

Annul  v. (-ll-) 1 declare invalid. 2 cancel, abolish.  annulment n. [latin nullus none]

Basketry  n. 1 art of weaving cane etc. 2 work so produced.

Herculean  adj. Having or requiring great strength or effort. [from the name hercules, latin alteration of greek herakles]

Outhouse  n. Small building adjoining or apart from a house.

Philosophy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 use of reason and argument in seeking truth and knowledge of reality, esp. Knowledge of the causes and nature of things and of the principles governing existence. 2 a particular system or set of beliefs reached by this. B personal rule of life. [greek: related to *philo-, sophia wisdom]

Gravimetry  n. Measurement of weight.  gravimetric adj.

Concept  n. General notion; abstract idea. [latin: related to *conceive]

Caretaker  n. 1 person employed to look after a house, building, etc. 2 (attrib.) Exercising temporary authority (caretaker government).

Futurism  n. 20th-century artistic movement departing from traditional forms and celebrating technology and dynamism.  futurist n. & adj.

Pirate  —n. 1 a seafaring robber attacking ships. B ship used by pirates. 2 (often attrib.) Person who infringes another's copyright or business rights or who broadcasts without official authorization (pirate radio station). —v. (-ting) reproduce (a book etc.) Or trade (goods) without permission.  piratical adj. [latin pirata from greek]

Heroin  n. Addictive analgesic drug derived from morphine, often used as a narcotic. [german: related to *hero, from the effect on the user's self-esteem]

Zed  n. Letter z. [greek *zeta]

Burlesque  —n. 1 a comic imitation, parody. B this as a genre. 2 us variety show, esp. With striptease. —adj. Of or using burlesque. —v. (-ques, -qued, -quing) parody. [italian burla mockery]

Abm  abbr. Anti-ballistic missile.

Messy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 untidy or dirty. 2 causing or accompanied by a mess. 3 difficult to deal with; awkward.  messily adv. Messiness n.

Immemorial  adj. Ancient beyond memory or record (from time immemorial).

Opponent  n. Person who opposes. [latin oppono opposit- set against]

Molten  adj. Melted, esp. Made liquid by heat. [from *melt]

Hit  —v. (-tt-; past and past part. Hit) 1 a strike with a blow or missile. B (of a moving body) strike with force (the plane hit the ground). C reach (a target etc.) With a directed missile (hit the wicket). 2 cause to suffer; affect adversely. 3 (often foll. By at, against) direct a blow. 4 (often foll. By against, on) knock (a part of the body) (hit his head). 5 achieve, reach (hit the right tone; can't hit the high notes). 6 colloq. A encounter (hit a snag). B arrive at (hit town). C indulge heavily in, esp. Liquor etc. (hit the bottle). 7 esp. Us slang rob or kill. 8 occur forcefully to (it only hit him later). 9 a propel (a ball etc.) With a bat etc. To score runs or points. B score in this way (hit a six). —n. 1 a blow, stroke. B collision. 2 shot etc. That hits its target. 3 colloq. Popular success.  hit back retaliate. Hit below the belt 1 esp. Boxing give a foul blow. 2 treat or behave unfairly. Hit the hay (or sack) colloq. Go to bed. Hit it off (often foll. By with, together) colloq. Get on well (with a person). Hit the nail on the head state the truth exactly. Hit on (or upon) find by chance. Hit out deal vigorous physical or verbal blows. Hit the road slang depart. Hit the roof see *roof. [old english from old norse]

Gavel  n. Hammer used for calling attention by an auctioneer, chairman, or judge. [origin unknown]

Anecdote  n. Short, esp. True, account or story.  anecdotal adj. [greek anekdota things unpublished]

Bowstring  n. String of an archer's bow.

Fisher  n. 1 animal that catches fish. 2 archaic fisherman. [old english]

Unclean  adj. 1 not clean. 2 unchaste. 3 religiously impure; forbidden.

Pigtail  n. Plait of hair hanging from the back of the head.

Bipartisan  adj. Of or involving two parties.

Impanel  var. Of *empanel.

Deficient  adj. (often foll. By in) incomplete or insufficient in quantity, quality, etc. [latin: related to *defect]

Paralyze  v. (brit. Paralyse) (-sing or -zing) 1 affect with paralysis. 2 render powerless; cripple. [greek: related to *para-1, luo loosen]

Hillside  n. Sloping side of a hill.

Filing  n. (usu. In pl.) Particle rubbed off by a file.

Ingraft  var. Of *engraft.

Name  —n. 1 word by which an individual person, family, animal, place, or thing is spoken of etc. 2 a (usu. Abusive) term used of a person etc. (called him names). B word denoting an object or esp. A class of objects etc. (what is the name of those flowers?). 3 famous person. 4 reputation, esp. A good one. —v. (-ming) 1 give a name to. 2 state the name of. 3 mention; specify; cite. 4 nominate.  have to one's name possess. In the name of as representing; by virtue of (in the name of the law). In name only not in reality. Make a name for oneself become famous.  nameable adj. [old english]

Recap  colloq. —v. (-pp-) recapitulate. —n. Recapitulation. [abbreviation]

Enteric  adj. Of the intestines.  enteritis n. [greek enteron intestine]

Taunt  —n. Insult; provocation. —v. Insult; provoke contemptuously. [french tant pour tant tit for tat, smart rejoinder]

Appellant  n. Person who appeals to a higher court. [latin appello address]

Armrest  n. = *arm1 3b.

Mild  —adj. 1 (esp. Of a person) gentle and conciliatory. 2 not severe or harsh. 3 (of the weather) moderately warm. 4 (of flavour etc.) Not sharp or strong. 5 tame, feeble; lacking vivacity. —n. Dark mild draught beer (cf. *bitter).  mildish adj. Mildness n. [old english]

Radiator  n. 1 device for heating a room etc., consisting of a metal case through which hot water or steam circulates. 2 engine-cooling device in a motor vehicle or aircraft.

Dago  n. (pl. -s) slang offens. Foreigner, esp. A spaniard, portuguese, or italian. [spanish diego = james]

Rigging  n. Ship's spars, ropes, etc.

Armchair  n. 1 chair with arm supports. 2 (attrib.) Theoretical rather than active (armchair critic).

Embrace  —v. (-cing) 1 a hold closely in the arms. B (absol., of two people) embrace each other. 2 clasp, enclose. 3 accept eagerly (an offer etc.). 4 adopt (a cause, idea, etc.). 5 include, comprise. 6 take in with the eye or mind. —n. Act of embracing, clasp.  embraceable adj. [latin: related to *brace]

Carve  v. (-ving) 1 produce or shape by cutting. 2 a cut patterns etc. In. B (foll. By into) form a pattern etc. From (carved it into a bust). 3 (absol.) Cut (meat etc.) Into slices.  carve out 1 take from a larger whole. 2 establish (a career etc.) Purposefully. Carve up 1 subdivide. 2  drive aggressively into the path of (another vehicle). [old english]

Handspring  n. Gymnastic feat consisting of a handstand, somersaulting, and landing in a standing position.

Unmerciful  adj. Merciless.  unmercifully adv.

Slept  past and past part. Of *sleep.

Spool  —n. 1 reel for winding magnetic tape, yarn, etc., on. 2 revolving cylinder of an angler's reel. —v. Wind on a spool. [french espole or germanic spole]

Adonis  n. Handsome young man. [latin, name of a youth loved by venus]

Stonewall  v. 1 obstruct (a discussion or investigation) with evasive answers etc. 2 cricket bat with excessive caution.

Deathblow  n. 1 blow etc. Causing death. 2 event etc. That destroys or ends something.

Usage  this term was replaced in 1975 by capital transfer tax and in 1986 by inheritance tax.

Bright  —adj. 1 emitting or reflecting much light; shining. 2 intense, vivid. 3 clever. 4 cheerful. —adv. Esp. Poet. Brightly.  brightly adv. Brightness n. [old english]

Unadulterated  adj. 1 pure. 2 complete, utter.

Fireproof  —adj. Able to resist fire or great heat. —v. Make fireproof.

Metonymy  n. Substitution of the name of an attribute or adjunct for that of the thing meant (e.g. Crown for king, the turf for horse-racing). [greek: related to *meta-, onuma name]

Weber  n. The si unit of magnetic flux. [weber, name of a physicist]

Ashamed  adj. (usu. Predic.) 1 embarrassed by shame (ashamed of myself). 2 (foll. By to + infin.) Hesitant, reluctant out of shame (am ashamed to say). [old english a- intensive prefix]

Pronominal  adj. Of, concerning, or being, a pronoun. [latin: related to *pronoun]

Ovine  adj. Of or like sheep. [latin ovis sheep]

Lengthy  adj. (-ier, -iest) of unusual or tedious length.  lengthily adv. Lengthiness n.

Aramaic  —n. Branch of the semitic family of languages, esp. The language of syria used as a lingua franca in the near east from the sixth century bc. —adj. Of or in aramaic. [greek aramaios of aram (hebrew name of syria)]

Edema  n. (brit. Oedema) accumulation of excess fluid in body tissues, causing swelling. [greek oideo swell]

Tranquillize  v. (us tranquilize, -ise) (-zing or -sing) make tranquil, esp. By a drug etc.

Raccoon  var. Of *racoon.

Vetch  n. Plant of the pea family used largely for fodder. [latin vicia]

Statuary  —adj. Of or for statues (statuary art). —n. (pl. -ies) 1 statues collectively. 2 making statues. 3 sculptor. [latin: related to *statue]

Important  adj. 1 (often foll. By to) of great effect or consequence; momentous. 2 (of a person) having high rank or authority. 3 pompous.  importance n. Importantly adv. [latin importo carry in, signify]

Eructation  n. Formal belching. [latin ructo belch]

Contaminate  v. (-ting) 1 pollute, esp. With radioactivity. 2 infect.  contaminant n. Contamination n. Contaminator n. [latin tamen- related to tango touch]

Feckless  adj. 1 feeble, ineffective. 2 unthinking, irresponsible. [scots feck from effeck var. Of *effect]

Sellotape  —n. Propr. Adhesive usu. Transparent tape. —v. (sellotape) (-ping) fix with sellotape. [from *cellulose]

Flamboyant  adj. 1 ostentatious; showy. 2 floridly decorated or coloured.  flamboyance n. Flamboyantly adv. [french: related to *flambé]

Respirator  n. 1 apparatus worn over the face to warm, filter, or purify inhaled air. 2 apparatus for maintaining artificial respiration.

Primal  adj. 1 primitive, primeval. 2 chief, fundamental. [latin: related to *prime1]

Pictograph  n. (also pictogram) 1 pictorial symbol for a word or phrase. 2 pictorial representation of statistics etc.  pictographic adj. [latin pingo pict- paint]

Hiatus  n. (pl. -tuses) 1 break or gap in a series or sequence. 2 break between two vowels coming together but not in the same syllable, as in though oft the ear. [latin hio gape]

Suds  n.pl. Froth of soap and water.  sudsy adj. [low german sudde or dutch sudse marsh, bog]

Suspend  v. 1 hang up. 2 keep inoperative or undecided for a time. 3 debar temporarily from a function, office, etc. 4 (as suspended adj.) (of particles or a body in a fluid) floating between the top and bottom. [latin suspendo -pens-]

Hallucinate  v. (-ting) experience hallucinations.  hallucinant adj. & n. [greek alusso be uneasy]

Oversleep  v. (past and past part. -slept) sleep beyond the intended time of waking.

Carrot  n. 1 a plant with a tapering orange-coloured root. B this as a vegetable. 2 incentive.  carroty adj. [greek karoton]

Uphold  v. (past and past part. Upheld) 1 confirm (a decision etc.). 2 support, maintain (a custom etc.).  upholder n.

Valance  n. (also valence) short curtain round the frame or canopy of a bedstead, above a window, etc. [anglo-french valer descend]

Telephony  n. Transmission of sound by telephone.

Sari  n. (pl. -s) length of cloth draped round the body, traditionally worn by women of the indian subcontinent. [hindi]

Simply  adv. 1 in a simple manner. 2 absolutely (simply astonishing). 3 merely (was simply trying to please).

Furnished  adj. (of a house etc.) Let with furniture.

Nosebag  n. Bag containing fodder, hung on a horse's head.

Far  (further, furthest or farther, farthest) —adv. 1 at, to, or by a great distance (far away; far off; far out). 2 a long way (off) in space or time (are you travelling far?). 3 to a great extent or degree; by much (far better; far too early). —adj. 1 remote; distant (far country). 2 more distant (far end of the hall). 3 extreme (far left).  as far as 1 right up to (a place). 2 to the extent that. By far by a great amount. A far cry a long way. Far from very different from being; almost the opposite of (far from being fat). Go far 1 achieve much. 2 contribute greatly. Go too far overstep the limit (of propriety etc.). So far 1 to such an extent; to this point. 2 until now. So (or in so) far as (or that) to the extent that. So far so good satisfactory up to now. [old english]

Platelet  n. Small colourless disc of protoplasm found in blood and involved in clotting.

Tundra  n. Vast level treeless arctic region with underlying permafrost. [lappish]

Camphorate  v. (-ting) impregnate or treat with camphor.

Intelligentsia  n. Class of intellectuals regarded as possessing culture and political initiative. [russian intelligentsiya]

Lubricious  adj. 1 slippery, evasive. 2 lewd.  lubricity n. [latin: related to *lubricate]

Trifle  —n. 1 thing of slight value or importance. 2 a small amount, esp. Of money. B (prec. By a) somewhat (a trifle annoyed). 3 dessert of sponge cake with custard, jelly, fruit, cream, etc. —v. (-ling) 1 talk or act frivolously. 2 (foll. By with) treat or deal with frivolously; flirt heartlessly with. [originally trufle from french = truf(f)e deceit]

Holiday  —n. 1 (often in pl.) Extended period of recreation, esp. Spent away from home or travelling; break from work. 2 day of festivity or recreation when no work is done, esp. A religious festival etc. —v. Spend a holiday. [old english: related to *holy, *day]

Fieldwork  n. 1 practical surveying, science, sociology, etc. Conducted in the natural environment. 2 temporary fortification.  fieldworker n.

Snuffer  n. Device for snuffing or extinguishing a candle.

Angry  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 feeling, showing, or suggesting anger (angry sky). 2 (of a wound etc.) Inflamed, painful.  angrily adv.

Praenomen  n. Ancient roman's first or personal name (e.g. Marcus tullius cicero). [latin: related to *pre-, *nomen]

Deport  v. 1 remove forcibly or exile to another country; banish. 2 refl. Behave (in a specified manner) (deported himself well).  deportation n. (in sense 1). [latin porto carry]

Overwrought  adj. 1 overexcited, nervous, distraught. 2 too elaborate.

Know  v. (past knew; past part. Known) 1 (often foll. By that, how, what, etc.) A have in the mind; have learnt; be able to recall (knows a lot about cars). B (also absol.) Be aware of (a fact) (i think he knows). C have a good command of (knew german; knows his tables).

Memorize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) commit to memory.

Footsore  adj. With sore feet, esp. From walking.

Visibility  n. 1 being visible. 2 range or possibility of vision as determined by the light and weather.

Consonance  n. Agreement, harmony. [latin sono *sound1]

Folio  —n. (pl. -s) 1 leaf of paper etc., esp. Numbered only on the front. 2 sheet of paper folded once making two leaves of a book. 3 book of such sheets. —adj. (of a book) made of folios, of the largest size.  in folio made of folios. [latin, ablative of folium leaf]

Exciting  adj. Arousing great interest or enthusiasm.  excitingly adv.

Rubbing  n.  Impression or copy made by rubbing.

Drool  v. 1 slobber, dribble. 2 (often foll. By over) admire extravagantly. [from *drivel]

Affiliation  n. Affiliating or being affiliated.

Sepulchral  adj. 1 of a tomb or interment. 2 funereal, gloomy. [latin: related to *sepulchre]

Zoroastrian  (also zarathustrian) —adj. Of zoroaster (or zarathustra) or the dualistic religious system taught by him. —n. Follower of zoroaster.  zoroastrianism n. [zoroaster, persian founder of the religion]

Pitchblende  n. Uranium oxide occurring in pitchlike masses and yielding radium. [german: related to *pitch2]

Suicide  n. 1 a intentional killing of oneself. B person who commits suicide. 2 self-destructive action or course (political suicide). [latin sui of oneself, *-cide]

Indulgent  adj. 1 lenient; ready to overlook faults etc. 2 indulging.  indulgently adv.

Parliamentarian  n. Member of a parliament, esp. An expert in its procedures.

Unpremeditated  adj. Not deliberately planned, unintentional.

Mishandle  v. (-ling) 1 deal with incorrectly or inefficiently. 2 handle roughly or rudely.

Dine  v. (-ning) 1 a eat dinner. B (foll. By on, upon) eat for dinner. 2 (esp. In phr. Wine and dine) entertain with food.  dine out dine away from home. [french diner as *dis-, latin jejunus fasting]

Domiciliary  adj. Formal (esp. Of a doctor's etc. Visit) to, at, or of a person's home. [medieval latin: related to *domicile]

Puce  adj. & n. Dark red or purple-brown. [latin pulex flea]

Contractual  adj. Of or in the nature of a contract.  contractually adv.

Mahogany  n. (pl. -ies) 1 reddish-brown tropical wood used for furniture. 2 its colour. [origin unknown]

Unpromising  adj. Not likely to turn out well.

Chasten  v. 1 (esp. As chastening, chastened adjs.) Subdue, restrain. 2 discipline, punish.

Subsume  v. (-ming) (usu. Foll. By under) include (an instance, idea, category, etc.) In a rule, class, etc. [latin sumo take]

Aquilegia  n. (usu. Blue-flowered) columbine. [latin]

Flu  n. Colloq. Influenza. [abbreviation]

Twopenny  attrib. Adj. 1 costing two pence. 2 colloq. Cheap, worthless.

Radioscopy  n. Examination by x-rays etc. Of objects opaque to light.

Undecided  adj. 1 not settled. 2 irresolute.

Museum  n. Building used for storing and exhibiting objects of historical, scientific, or cultural interest. [greek: related to *muse2]

Fay  n. Literary fairy. [latin fata pl., = goddesses of destiny]

Haberdasher  n. Dealer in dress accessories and sewing-goods.  haberdashery n. (pl. -ies). [probably anglo-french]

Rb  symb. Rubidium.

Terribly  adv. 1 colloq. Very, extremely (terribly nice). 2 in a terrible manner.

Delphic  adj. (also delphian) 1 obscure, ambiguous, or enigmatic. 2 of the ancient greek oracle at delphi.

Activate  v. (-ting) 1 make active. 2 chem. Cause reaction in. 3 make radioactive.

Rocketry  n. Science or practice of rocket propulsion.

Wildfowl  n. (pl. Same)  game-bird.

Auditor  n. Person who audits accounts. [french from latin]

Col  n. Depression in a chain of mountains. [latin collum neck]

Irreplaceable  adj. That cannot be replaced.

Uncut  adj. 1 not cut. 2 (of a book) with the pages sealed or untrimmed. 3 (of a book, film, etc.) Complete; uncensored. 4 (of esp. A diamond) not shaped. 5 (of fabric) with a looped pile.

Coverlet  n. Bedspread. [anglo-french: related to *cover, lit bed]

Silicon  n. Chem. Non-metallic element occurring widely in silica and silicates.

Troupe  n. Company or band, esp. Of artistes. [french, = *troop]

Testis  n. (pl. Testes) anat. & zool. Testicle. [latin, = witness (cf. *testicle)]

Bug  —n. 1 a any of various insects with mouthparts modified for piercing and sucking. B esp. Us small insect. 2 slang virus; infection. 3 slang concealed microphone. 4 slang error in a computer program or system etc. 5 slang obsession, enthusiasm, etc. —v. (-gg-) 1 slang conceal a microphone in. 2 slang annoy. [origin unknown]

Synoptic  adj. Of or giving a synopsis. [greek: related to *synopsis]

Attitudinize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) adopt (esp. Affected) attitudes; pose.

Mercurial  adj. 1 (of a person) volatile. 2 of or containing mercury. [latin: related to *mercury]

Indebted  adj. (usu. Foll. By to) owing gratitude or money.  indebtedness n. [french endetté: related to *debt]

Aesthetic  —adj. 1 of or sensitive to beauty. 2 artistic, tasteful. —n. (in pl.) Philosophy of beauty, esp. In art.  aesthetically adv. Aestheticism n.

Dinosaur  n. 1 extinct, often enormous, reptile of the mesozoic era. 2 unwieldy or unchanging system or organization. [greek deinos terrible, *saurian]

Judicious  adj. Sensible, prudent.  judiciously adv.

Untrustworthy  adj. Not trustworthy.  untrustworthiness n.

Hypertext  n. Provision of several texts on one computer system, with cross-references from one to another.

Bonanza  n. 1 source of wealth or prosperity. 2 large output (esp. Of a mine). [spanish, = fair weather]

Immunity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 ability of an organism to resist infection by means of antibodies and white blood cells. 2 (often foll. By from) freedom or exemption.

Backup  n. (often attrib.) 1 support; reserve (back-up team). 2 computing a making of spare copies of data for safety. B copy so made.

Cold  —adj. 1 of or at a low temperature. 2 not heated; cooled after heat. 3 feeling cold. 4 lacking ardour, friendliness, or affection. 5 a depressing, uninteresting. B (of colour) suggestive of cold. 6 a dead. B colloq. Unconscious. 7 (of a scent in hunting) grown faint. 8 (in games) far from finding what is sought. —n. 1 a prevalence of low temperature. B cold weather or environment. 2 infection of the nose or throat with sneezing, catarrh, etc. —adv. Unrehearsed.  in cold blood without emotion, deliberately. Out in the cold ignored, neglected. Throw (or pour) cold water on be discouraging about.  coldly adv. Coldness n. [old english]

Tempestuous  adj. Stormy; turbulent.  tempestuously adv.

Boulder  n. Large smooth rock. [scandinavian]

Unreel  v. Unwind from a reel.

Enquiry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 act of asking or seeking information. 2 = *inquiry.

Hawker  n. Person who travels about selling goods. [low german or dutch]

Assagai  var. Of *assegai.

Facetious  adj. Intending or intended to be amusing, esp. Inappropriately.  facetiously adv. [latin facetia jest]

Adjoin  v. Be next to and joined with. [latin jungo join]

Ongoing  adj. 1 continuing. 2 in progress.

Corridor  n. 1 passage giving access into rooms. 2 passage in a train giving access into compartments. 3 strip of territory of one state passing through that of another. 4 route which an aircraft must follow, esp. Over a foreign country. [french from italian]

Riband  n. Ribbon. [french riban]

Gawp  v. Colloq. Stare stupidly or obtrusively. [related to *yelp]

Farthingale  n. Hist. Hooped petticoat. [spanish verdugo rod]

Hangar  n. Building for housing aircraft etc. [french]

Blockhead  n. Stupid person.

Quantum  n. (pl. Quanta) 1 physics discrete amount of energy proportional to the frequency of radiation it represents. 2 a required or allowed amount. [latin quantus how much]

Ship  —n. 1 large seagoing vessel. 2 us aircraft. 3 spaceship. —v. (-pp-) 1 put, take, or send away in a ship. 2 a take in (water) over a ship's side etc. B lay (oars) at the bottom of a boat. C fix (a rudder etc.) In place. 3 a embark. B (of a sailor) take service on a ship. 4 deliver (goods) to an agent for forwarding.  ship off send away.

Glimpse  —n. (often foll. By of, at) 1 brief view or look. 2 faint transient appearance (glimpses of the truth). —v. (-sing) have a brief view of (glimpsed his face in the crowd). [related to *glimmer]

Objectionable  adj. 1 unpleasant, offensive. 2 open to objection.  objectionably adv.

Pejorative  —adj. Derogatory. —n. Derogatory word. [latin pejor worse]

Trifling  adj. 1 unimportant, petty. 2 frivolous.

Ignominious  adj. Shameful, humiliating.  ignominiously adv. [latin: related to *ignominy]

Mewl  v. 1 whimper. 2 mew like a cat. [imitative]

Scuffle  —n. Confused struggle or fight at close quarters. —v. (-ling) engage in a scuffle. [probably scandinavian: related to *shove]

Treadwheel  n. = *treadmill 1, 2.

Perihelion  n. (pl. -lia) point of a planet's or comet's orbit where it is nearest the sun's centre. [related to *peri-, greek helios sun]

Succour  (us succor) —n. Aid, esp. In time of need. —v. Give succour to. [latin succurro run to help]

Westerner  n. Native or inhabitant of the west.

Tvei  abbr. Technical and vocational educational initiative.

Portray  v. 1 make a likeness of. 2 describe in words.  portrayal n. Portrayer n. [french portraire -trait depict]

Auspicious  adj. Promising well; favourable.

Anathema  n. (pl. -s) 1 detested thing (is anathema to me). 2 ecclesiastical curse. [greek, = thing devoted (i.e. To evil)]

Purposeless  adj. Having no aim or plan.

Phrase  —n. 1 group of words forming a conceptual unit, but not a sentence. 2 idiomatic or short pithy expression. 3 mode of expression. 4 mus. Group of notes forming a distinct unit within a melody. —v. (-sing) 1 express in words. 2 mus. Divide (music) into phrases, esp. In performance.  phrasal adj. [greek phrasis from phrazo tell]

Droll  adj. Quaintly amusing; strange, odd.  drollery n. (pl. -ies). Drolly adv. [french]

Disproportion  n. Lack of proportion; being out of proportion.  disproportional adj. Disproportionally adv.

Ferroconcrete  —n. Reinforced concrete. —adj. Made of this.

Disjoint  v. 1 take apart at the joints. 2 (as disjointed adj.) Incoherent; disconnected. 3 disturb the working of; disrupt.

Concentrate  —v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By on) focus one's attention or thought. 2 bring together to one point. 3 increase the strength of (a liquid etc.) By removing water etc. 4 (as concentrated adj.) Intense, strong. —n. Concentrated substance. [latin: related to *centre]

Inviolate  adj. 1 not violated. 2 safe (from violation or harm).  inviolacy n.

Alluvial  —adj. Of alluvium. —n. Alluvium, esp. Containing a precious metal.

Flap  —v. (-pp-) 1 move or be moved up and down; beat. 2 colloq. Be agitated or panicky. 3 sway; flutter. 4 (usu. Foll. By away, off) strike (flies etc.) With flat object; drive. 5 colloq. (of ears) listen intently. —n. 1 piece of cloth, wood, etc. Attached by one side esp. To cover a gap, e.g. A pocket-cover, the folded part of an envelope, a table-leaf. 2 motion of a wing, arm, etc. 3 colloq. Agitation; panic (in a flap). 4 aileron. 5 light blow with something flat.  flappy adj. [probably imitative]

Sightless  adj. Blind.

Fellowship  n. 1 friendly association with others, companionship. 2 body of associates. 3 status or income of a fellow of a college or society.

Picayune  us colloq. —n. 1  small coin. 2 insignificant person or thing. —adj. Mean; contemptible; petty. [french picaillon]

Soot  n. Black powdery deposit from smoke. [old english]

Reload  v. (also absol.) Load (esp. A gun) again.

Accountable  adj. 1 responsible; required to account for one's conduct. 2 explicable, understandable.  accountability n.

Body  n. (pl. -ies) 1 whole physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or an animal, whether dead or alive. 2 = *trunk 2. 3 main or central part; bulk or majority (body of opinion). 4 a group regarded as a unit. B (usu. Foll. By of) collection (body of facts). 5 quantity (body of water). 6 piece of matter (heavenly body). 7 colloq. Person. 8 full or substantial quality of flavour, tone, etc.  in a body all together. [old english]

Intifada  n. Arab uprising. [arabic]

Luxury  n. (pl. -ies) 1 choice or costly surroundings, possessions, etc. 2 thing giving comfort or enjoyment but not essential. 3 (attrib.) Comfortable and expensive (luxury flat). [latin luxus abundance]

Affinity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 liking or attraction; feeling of kinship. 2 relationship, esp. By marriage. 3 similarity of structure or character suggesting a relationship. 4 chem. The tendency of certain substances to combine with others. [latin finis border] 

Flank  —n. 1 side of the body between ribs and hip. 2 side of a mountain, building, etc. 3 right or left side of an army etc. —v. (often in passive) be at or move along the side of (road flanked by mountains). [french from germanic]

Lacuna  n. (pl. Lacunae or -s) 1 gap. 2 missing portion etc., esp. In an ancient ms etc. [latin: related to *lake1]

Spunk  n. 1 colloq. Courage, mettle, spirit. 2 coarse slang semen. 3 touchwood. [origin unknown]

Rna  abbr. Ribonucleic acid.

Subject  —n. 1 a matter, theme, etc. To be discussed, described, represented, etc. B (foll. By for) person, circumstance, etc., giving rise to a specified feeling, action, etc. (subject for congratulation). 2 field of study. 3 logic & gram.

Psychosomatic  adj. 1 (of a bodily disorder) mental, not physical, in origin. 2 of the mind and body together.

Gothic  —adj. 1 of the goths. 2 in the style of architecture prevalent in w. Europe in the 12th–16th c., characterized by pointed arches. 3 (of a novel etc.) In a style popular in the 18th–19th c., with supernatural or horrifying events. 4 barbarous, uncouth. —n. 1 gothic language. 2 gothic architecture. [latin: related to *goth]

Electromagnetic  adj. Having both electrical and magnetic properties.  electromagnetically adv.

Both  —adj. & pron. The two, not only one (both boys; both the boys; both of the boys; i like both). —adv. With equal truth in two cases (is both hot and dry). [old norse]

Slang  —n. Very informal words, phrases, or meanings, not regarded as standard and often used by a specific profession, class, etc. —v. Use abusive language (to).  slangy adj. [origin unknown]

Stockinet  n. (also stockinette) elastic knitted fabric. [probably from stocking-net]

Infatuate  v. (-ting) (usu. As infatuated adj.) 1 inspire with intense usu. Transitory fondness or admiration. 2 affect with extreme folly.  infatuation n. [latin: related to *fatuous]

Frightful  adj. 1 a dreadful, shocking. B ugly. 2 colloq. Extremely bad. 3 colloq. Extreme (frightful rush).  frightfully adv.

Aureate  adj. Literary 1 golden. 2 resplendent. [latin aurum gold]

Rp  abbr. Received pronunciation.

Percolate  v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By through) a (of liquid etc.) Filter or ooze gradually. B (of an idea etc.) Permeate gradually. 2 prepare (coffee) in a percolator. 3 strain (a liquid, powder, etc.) Through a fine mesh etc.  percolation n. [latin colum strainer]

Woggle  n. Leather etc. Ring through which the ends of a scout's neckerchief are passed at the neck. [origin unknown]

Midst  —prep. Poet. Amidst. —n. Middle.  in the midst of among; in the middle of. In our (or your or their) midst among us (or you or them). [related to *mid]

Tokay  n. A sweet hungarian wine. [tokaj in hungary]

Metamorphic  adj. 1 of metamorphosis. 2  (of rock) transformed naturally, e.g. By heat or pressure.  metamorphism n. [from *meta-, greek morphe form]

Thumbprint  n. Impression of a thumb esp. For identification.

Glaciated  adj. 1 marked or polished by the action of ice. 2 covered by glaciers or ice sheets.  glaciation n. [glaciate freeze, from latin: related to *glacial]

Neo-  comb. Form 1 new, modern. 2 new form of. [greek neos new]

Premiss  n. Logic previous statement from which another is inferred. [var. Of *premise]

Ahead  adv. 1 further forward in space or time. 2 in the lead (ahead on points).

Shirtwaister  n. Woman's dress with a bodice like a shirt.

Camiknickers  n.pl. Women's knickers and vest combined. [from *camisole, *knickers]

Assort  v. 1 classify or arrange in sorts. 2 (usu. Foll. By with) suit or harmonize with. [french: related to *sort]

Crucial  adj. 1 decisive, critical. 2 very important.  crucially adv. [latin crux crucis cross]

Usage  the use of crucial in sense 2 should be restricted to informal contexts.

Marked  adj. 1 having a visible mark. 2 clearly noticeable (marked difference). 3 (of playing-cards) marked on their backs to assist cheating.  markedly adv.

Assure  v. (-ring) 1 (often foll. By of) a convince. B tell (a person) confidently (assured him all was well). 2 ensure; guarantee (a result etc.). 3 insure (esp. A life). 4 (as assured adj.) A guaranteed. B self-confident. [latin securus safe]

Dfm  abbr. Distinguished flying medal.

Infarct  n. Small area of dead tissue caused by an inadequate blood supply.  infarction n. [latin farcio farct- stuff]

Caesar  n. 1 title of roman emperors. 2 autocrat. [latin (c. Julius) caesar]

Disengage  —v. (-ging) 1 detach, loosen, release. 2 remove (troops) from battle etc. 3 become detached. 4 (as disengaged adj.) A at leisure. B uncommitted.  disengagement n.

Eglantine  n. Sweet-brier. [latin acus needle]

These  pl. Of *this.

Occult  adj. 1 involving the supernatural; mystical. 2 esoteric.  the occult occult phenomena generally. [latin occulo occult- hide]

Sabre  n. (us saber) 1 curved cavalry sword. 2 light tapering fencing-sword. [french from german sabel]

Brilliantine  n. Dressing for making the hair glossy. [french: related to *brilliant]

Lattice  n. 1 structure of crossed laths or bars with spaces between, used as a screen, fence, etc. 2 regular periodic arrangement of atoms, ions, or molecules.  latticed adj. [french lattis from latte *lath]

Realistic  adj. 1 regarding things as they are; following a policy of realism. 2 based on facts rather than ideals.  realistically adv.

Coot  n. 1 black aquatic bird with a white horny plate on its forehead. 2 colloq. Stupid person. [probably low german]

Gravitate  v. (-ting) 1 (foll. By to, towards) move or be attracted to. 2 a move or tend by force of gravity towards. B sink by or as if by gravity. [related to *grave2]

Identikit  n. (often attrib.) Propr. Picture of esp. A wanted suspect assembled from standard components using witnesses' descriptions. [from *identity, *kit]

Colonial  —adj. 1 of a colony or colonies. 2 of colonialism. —n. Inhabitant of a colony.

Playhouse  n. Theatre.

Antagonize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make hostile; provoke.

Halo  —n. (pl. -es) 1 disc or circle of light shown surrounding the head of a sacred person. 2 glory associated with an idealized person etc. 3 circle of white or coloured light round a luminous body, esp. The sun or moon. —v. (-es, -ed) surround with a halo. [greek halos threshing-floor, disc of the sun or moon]

Turpitude  n. Formal depravity, wickedness. [latin turpis disgraceful]

Interstitial  adj. Of, forming, or occupying interstices.  interstitially adv.

Kangaroo  n. (pl. -s) australian marsupial with strong hind legs for jumping. [aboriginal]

-ferous  comb. Form (usu. -iferous) forming adjectives with the sense ‘bearing’, ‘having’ (odoriferous). [latin fero bear]

Intermediary  —n. (pl. -ies) intermediate person or thing, esp. A mediator. —adj. Acting as mediator; intermediate.

Tracing  n. 1 traced copy of a drawing etc. 2 act of tracing.

Constructive  adj. 1 a tending to form a basis for ideas. B helpful, positive. 2 derived by inference.  constructively adv.

Custodian  n. Guardian or keeper.  custodianship n.

Rollmop  n. Rolled uncooked pickled herring fillet. [german rollmops]

Noise  —n. 1 sound, esp. A loud or unpleasant one. 2 series or confusion of loud sounds. 3 irregular fluctuations accompanying a transmitted signal. 4 (in pl.) Conventional remarks, or speechlike sounds without actual words (made sympathetic noises). —v. (-sing) (usu. In passive) make public; spread abroad (a person's fame or a fact). [latin *nausea]

Clerk  —n. 1 person employed to keep records, accounts, etc. 2 secretary or agent of a local council, court, etc. 3 lay officer of a church. —v. Work as clerk. [old english and french: related to *cleric]

Oxygen  n. Tasteless odourless gaseous element essential to plant and animal life. [greek oxus sharp, *-gen (because it was thought to be present in all acids)]

Polypropene  n. = *polypropylene.

Glib  adj. (glibber, glibbest) speaking or spoken quickly or fluently but without sincerity.  glibly adv. Glibness n. [obsolete glibbery slippery, perhaps imitative]

Wheelie  n. Slang stunt of riding a bicycle or motor cycle with the front wheel off the ground.

Unitarian  —n. 1 person who believes that god is one, not a trinity. 2 member of a religious body so believing. —adj. Of unitarians.  unitarianism n. [latin unitas *unity]

Needy  adj. (-ier, -iest) poor; destitute.  neediness n.

Debouch  v. 1 (of troops or a stream) come out into open ground. 2 (often foll. By into) (of a river, road, etc.) Merge into a larger body or area.  debouchment n. [french bouche mouth]

Customary  adj. In accordance with custom, usual.  customarily adv. Customariness n. [medieval latin: related to *custom]

Aussie  slang —n. 1 australian. 2 australia. —adj. Australian. [abbreviation]

Cenobite  n. (brit. Coenobite) member of a monastica community. [greek koinos bios common life]

Showbiz  n. Colloq. = *show business.

Evil  —adj. 1 morally bad; wicked. 2 harmful. 3 disagreeable (evil temper). —n. 1 evil thing. 2 wickedness.  evilly adv. [old english]

Dionysian  adj. Wildly sensual; unrestrained. [greek dionusos god of wine]

Timely  adj. (-ier, -iest) opportune; coming at the right time.  timeliness n.

Woodpecker  n. Bird that taps tree-trunks in search of insects.

Prehistoric  adj. 1 of the period before written records. 2 colloq. Utterly out of date.  prehistory n.

Virus  n. 1 microscopic organism often causing diseases. 2  = *computer virus. [latin, = poison]

Climb  —v. 1 (often foll. By up) ascend, mount, go or come up. 2 grow up a wall etc. By clinging or twining. 3 progress, esp. In social rank. —n. 1 ascent by climbing. 2 hill etc. Climbed or to be climbed.  climb down 1 descend, esp. Using hands. 2 withdraw from a stance taken up in an argument etc.  climber n. [old english]

Mania  n. 1 mental illness marked by excitement and violence. 2 (often foll. By for) excessive enthusiasm; obsession. [greek mainomai be mad]

Bushy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 growing thickly like a bush. 2 having many bushes.

Barre  n. Horizontal bar at waist level, used in dance exercises. [french]

Unlace  v. (-cing) 1 undo the lace(s) of. 2 unfasten or loosen in this way.

Exude  v. (-ding) 1 ooze out. 2 emit (a smell). 3 display (an emotion etc.) Freely.  exudation n. [latin sudo sweat]

Flab  n. Colloq. Fat; flabbiness. [imitative, or from *flabby]

Crosier  n. (also crozier) bishop's ceremonial hooked staff. [french croisier cross-bearer and crossier crook-bearer]

Sanguine  adj. 1 optimistic, confident. 2 (of the complexion) florid, ruddy.

Anesthetic  (brit. Anaes-)—n. Substance producing anesthesia. —adj.producing anesthesia

Jazz  —n. 1 rhythmic syncopated esp. Improvised music of black us origin. 2 slang pretentious talk or behaviour (all that jazz). —v. Play or dance to jazz.  jazz up brighten or enliven.  jazzer n. [origin uncertain]

Counterfeit  —adj. Made in imitation; not genuine; forged. —n. A forgery or imitation. —v. Imitate fraudulently; forge. [french]

Outburst  n. 1 verbal explosion of anger etc. 2 bursting out (outburst of steam).

Untranslatable  adj. That cannot be translated satisfactorily.

Mit  abbr. Massachusetts institute of technology.

Golosh  var. Of *galosh.

Sculler  n. 1 user of sculls. 2 boat for sculling.

Board  —n. 1 a flat thin piece of sawn timber, usu. Long and narrow. B material resembling this, of compressed fibres. C thin slab of wood etc. D thick stiff card used in bookbinding. 2 provision of regular meals, usu. With accommodation, for payment. 3 directors of a company; official administrative body. 4 (in pl.) Stage of a theatre. 5 side of a ship. —v. 1 go on board (a ship, train, etc.). 2 receive, or provide with, meals and usu. Lodging. 3 (usu. Foll. By up) cover with boards; seal or close.  go by the board be neglected or discarded. On board on or on to a ship, aircraft, oil rig, etc. Take on board consider, take notice of; accept. [old english]

Usage  see note at *die2.

Sciatica  n. Neuralgia of the hip and leg. [latin: related to *sciatic]

Adz  n. (brit adze) tool like an axe, with an arched blade at right angles to the handle. [old english]

Penny  n. (pl. For separate coins -ies, for a sum of money pence) 1 british coin and monetary unit equal to one-hundredth of a pound. 2 hist. British bronze coin and monetary unit equal to one-two-hundred-and-fortieth of a pound.  in for a penny, in for a pound exhortation to total commitment to an undertaking. Pennies from heaven unexpected benefits. The penny drops colloq. One understands at last. Penny wise and pound foolish mean in small expenditures but wasteful of large amounts. A pretty penny a large sum of money. Two a penny easily obtained and so almost worthless. [old english]

Vilify  v. (-ies, -ied) defame; malign.  vilification n. [latin: related to *vile]

Badminton  n. Game with rackets and a shuttlecock. [badminton in s. England]

Morse  —n. (in full morse code) code in which letters are represented by combinations of long and short light or sound signals. —v. (-sing) signal by morse code. [morse, name of an electrician]

In the approved, way. 2 utter or proclaim (a judgement, sentence, etc.) Officially, formally, or solemnly (i pronounce you man and wife). 3 state as one's opinion (pronounced the beef excellent). 4 (usu. Foll. By on, for, against, in favour of) pass judgement (pronounced for the defendant).  pronounceable adj. Pronouncement n. [latin nuntio announce]

Day  n. 1 time between sunrise and sunset. 2 a 24 hours as a unit of time. B corresponding period on other planets (martian day). 3 daylight (clear as day). 4 time during which work is normally done (eight-hour day). 5 a (also pl.) Historical period (in those days). B (prec. By the) present time (issues of the day). 6 prime of a person's life (have had my day; in my day). 7 a future time (will do it one day). 8 date of a specific festival or event etc. (graduation day; christmas day). 9 battle or contest (win the day).  all in a day's work part of the normal routine. At the end of the day when all is said and done. Call it a day end a period of activity. Day after day without respite. Day and night all the time. Day by day gradually. Day in, day out routinely, constantly. Not one's day day when things go badly (for a person). One of these days soon. One of those days day when things go badly. That will be the day colloq. That will never happen. [old english]

Mixed  adj. 1 of diverse qualities or elements. 2 containing persons from various backgrounds etc. 3 for persons of both sexes (mixed school). [latin misceo mix]

B (the channel) the english channel. 2 medium of communication; agency. 3 band of frequencies used in radio and television transmission, esp. By a particular station. 4 course in which anything moves. 5 a hollow bed of water. B navigable part of a waterway. 6 passage for liquid. 7 lengthwise strip on recording tape etc. —v.
