Booklet  n. Small book usu. With a paper cover.

Pasteboard  n. 1 stiff material made by pasting together sheets of paper. 2 (attrib.) Flimsy, unsubstantial.

Windmill  n. 1 mill worked by the wind acting on its sails. 2 toy consisting of a stick with curved vanes that revolve in a wind.  tilt at windmills attack an imaginary enemy.

Task  —n. Piece of work to be done. —v. Make great demands on (a person's powers etc.).  take to task rebuke, scold. [medieval latin tasca, probably = taxa *tax]

Coddle  v. (-ling) 1 treat as an invalid; protect attentively; pamper. 2 cook (an egg) in water below boiling point.  coddler n. [a dialect form of caudle invalids' gruel]

Role  n. (also rôle) 1 actor's part in a play, film, etc. 2 person's or thing's function. [french: related to *roll]

Handful  n. (pl. -s) 1 quantity that fills the hand. 2 small number or amount. 3 colloq. Troublesome person or task.

Goldsmith  n. Worker in gold.

Clean  —adj. 1 free from dirt or impurities, unsoiled. 2 clear; unused; pristine (clean air; clean page). 3 not obscene or indecent. 4 attentive to personal hygiene and cleanliness. 5 complete, clear-cut. 6 showing no record of crime, disease, etc. 7 fair (a clean fight). 8 streamlined; well-formed. 9 adroit, skilful. 10 (of a nuclear weapon) producing relatively little fallout. —adv. 1 completely, outright, simply. 2 in a clean manner. —v. Make or become clean. —n. Act or process of cleaning.  clean out 1 clean thoroughly. 2 slang empty or deprive (esp. Of money). Clean up 1 a clear away (a mess). B (also absol.) Put (things) tidy. C make (oneself) clean. 2 restore order or morality to. 3 slang acquire as or make a profit. Come clean colloq. Confess fully. Make a clean breast of see *breast. [old english]

Lukewarm  adj. 1 moderately warm; tepid. 2 unenthusiastic, indifferent. [old english (now dial.) Luke warm, *warm]

Paleontology  n. (brit. Palaeontology) the study of life in the geological past.  palaeontologist n. [greek on ont- being]

Al  symb. Aluminium.

Demonstrable  adj. Able to be shown or proved.  demonstrably adv.

Claw  —n. 1 a pointed nail on an animal's foot. B foot armed with claws. 2 pincers of a shellfish. 3 device for grappling, holding, etc. —v. Scratch, maul, or pull with claws or fingernails. [old english]

Allege  v. (-ging) 1 declare, esp. Without proof. 2 advance as an argument or excuse. [latin lis lit- lawsuit]

Contrast  —n. 1 a juxtaposition or comparison showing differences. B difference so revealed. 2 (often foll. By to) thing or person having different qualities. 3 degree of difference between the tones in a television picture or photograph. —v. (often foll. By with) 1 set together so as to reveal a contrast. 2 have or show a contrast. [italian from latin sto stand]

Outpace  v. (-cing) 1 go faster than. 2 outdo in a contest.

Snippet  n. 1 small piece cut off. 2 (usu. In pl.) A scrap of information etc. B short extract from a book etc.

Hajj  n. (also hadj) islamic pilgrimage to mecca. [arabic]

Disestablish  v. 1 deprive (a church) of state support. 2 terminate the establishment of.  disestablishment n.

Fishing  n. Catching fish.

Fruitful  adj. 1 producing much fruit. 2 successful, profitable.  fruitfully adv.

Friendship  n. Friendly relationship or feeling.

Blithe  adj. 1 cheerful, happy. 2 careless, casual.  blithely adv. [old english]

Engage  v. (-ging) 1 employ or hire (a person). 2 a (usu. In passive) occupy (are you engaged tomorrow?). B hold fast (a person's attention). 3 (usu. In passive) bind by a promise, esp. Of marriage. 4 arrange beforehand to occupy (a room, seat, etc.). 5 a interlock (parts of a gear etc.). B (of a gear etc.) Become interlocked. 6 a come into battle with. B bring (troops) into battle with. C come into battle with (an enemy etc.). 7 take part (engage in politics). 8 (foll. By that + clause or to + infin.) Undertake. [french: related to *gage1]

Envelope  n. 1 folded paper container for a letter etc. 2 wrapper, covering. 3 gas container of a balloon or airship.

Convalesce  v. (-cing) recover health after illness. [latin valeo be well]

Vest  —n. 1 undergarment worn on the trunk. 2 us & austral. Waistcoat. —v. 1 (foll. By with) bestow (powers, authority, etc.) On. 2 (foll. By in) confer (property or power) on (a person) with an immediate fixed right of future possession. 3 clothe (oneself), esp. In vestments. [latin vestis garment]

Coastguard  n. 1 member of a group of people employed to keep watch on coasts to save life, prevent smuggling, etc. 2 such a group.

Ranee  n. (also rani) (pl. -s) hist. Raja's wife or widow. [hindi]

Prologue  n. 1 preliminary speech, poem, etc., esp. Of a play. 2 (usu. Foll. By to) introductory event. [greek logos word]

Organza  n. Thin stiff transparent silk or synthetic dress fabric. [origin uncertain]

Tuppence  n. = *twopence. [phonetic spelling]

Contentment  n. Satisfied state; tranquil happiness.

Tent  n. 1 portable canvas etc. Shelter or dwelling supported by poles and cords attached to pegs driven into the ground. 2 tentlike enclosure, e.g. Supplying oxygen to a patient. [latin: related to *tend1]

Gabardine  n. (also gaberdine) 1 twill-woven cloth, esp. Of worsted. 2 raincoat etc. Made of this. [french gauvardine]

Glower  —v. 1 (often foll. By at) look angrily. 2 look dark or threatening. —n. Glowering look. [origin uncertain]

Garrote  (brit. Garrotte) —v. (-ting) execute or kill by strangulation, esp. With a wire collar. —n. Device used for this. [french or spanish]

Astatine  n. Radioactive element, the heaviest of the halogens. [greek astatos unstable]

Irreducible  adj. Not able to be reduced or simplified.  irreducibility n. Irreducibly adv.

Hippie  n. (also hippy) (pl. -ies) colloq. (esp. In the 1960s) person rejecting convention, typically with long hair, jeans, beads, etc., and taking hallucinogenic drugs. [from *hip4]

Uproar  n. Tumult; violent disturbance. [dutch, = commotion]

Churn  —n. 1 large milk-can. 2 butter-making machine. —v. 1 agitate (milk or cream) in a churn. 2 produce (butter) in a churn. 3 (usu. Foll. By up) upset, agitate.  churn out produce in large quantities. [old english]

Aerate  v. (-ting) 1 charge (a liquid) with carbon dioxide. 2 expose to air.  aeration n. [latin aer *air]

Lunar  adj. Of, like, concerned with, or determined by the moon. [latin luna moon]

Gastropod  n. (also gasteropod) mollusc that moves by means of a ventral muscular organ, e.g. A snail. [from *gastro-, greek pous pod- foot]

Scallop  (also scollop) —n. 1 edible mollusc with two fan-shaped ridged shells. 2 (in full scallop shell) single shell of a scallop, often used for cooking or serving food in. 3 (in pl.) Ornamental edging of semicircular curves. —v. (-p-) ornament with scallops.  scalloping n. (in sense 3 of n.). [french *escalope]

Dungaree  n. 1 coarse cotton cloth. 2 (in pl.) Overalls or trousers of this. [hindi]

Deduct  v. (often foll. By from) subtract, take away, or withhold (an amount, portion, etc.). [related to *deduce]

Palmetto  n. (pl. -s) small palm-tree. [spanish palmito diminutive of palma *palm1]

Overborne  past part. Of *overbear.

Roadway  n. 1 road. 2 part of a road intended for vehicles.

Blotch  —n. 1 discoloured or inflamed patch on the skin. 2 irregular patch of colour. —v. Cover with blotches.  blotchy adj. (-ier, -iest). [obsolete plotch, *blot]

Sliver  —n. Long thin piece cut or split off. —v. 1 break off as a sliver. 2 break or form into slivers. [old english]

Costermonger  n. Person who sells produce from a barrow. [costard large apple: related to *costal]

Footwork  n. Use or agility of the feet in sports, dancing, etc.

Enterprising  adj. Showing enterprise; resourceful, energetic.  enterprisingly adv.

Carpus  n. (pl. -pi) small bones forming the wrist in humans and similar parts in other mammals. [latin from greek]

Turnstile  n. Gate with revolving arms allowing people through singly.

Lanthanide  n. Any element of the lanthanide series. [german: related to *lanthanum]

Peculiar  adj. 1 strange; odd; unusual. 2 a (usu. Foll. By to) belonging exclusively (peculiar to the time). B belonging to the individual (in their own peculiar way). 3 particular; special (point of peculiar interest). [latin peculium private property, from pecu cattle]

Subhuman  adj. (of behaviour, intelligence, etc.) Less than human.

Editor  n. 1 person who edits. 2 person who directs the preparation of a newspaper or broadcast news programme or a particular section of one (sports editor). 3 person who selects or commissions material for publication. 4 computer program for entering and modifying textual data.  editorship n.

Determine  v. (-ning) 1 find out or establish precisely. 2 decide or settle; resolve. 3 be the decisive factor in regard to (demand determines supply).  be determined be resolved. [latin terminus boundary]

Lax  adj. 1 lacking care or precision. 2 not strict.  laxity n. Laxly adv. Laxness n. [latin laxus loose]

Reincarnation  n. Rebirth of a soul in a new body.  reincarnate v. (-ting). Reincarnate adj.

Fanciful  adj. 1 imaginary. 2 indulging in fancies.  fancifully adv.

Nitrify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 impregnate with nitrogen. 2 convert into nitrites or nitrates.  nitrification n. [french: related to *nitre]

Specious  adj. Plausible but wrong (specious argument). [latin: related to *species]

Nominalism  n. Doctrine that universals or general ideas are mere names.  nominalist n. Nominalistic adj.

Glamour  n. (us glamor) 1 physical, esp. Cosmetic, attractiveness. 2 alluring or exciting beauty or charm.  glamorous adj. Glamorously adv. [var. Of *grammar in obsolete sense ‘magic’]

Tidetable  n. Table indicating the times of high and low tides.

Doubt  —n. 1 uncertainty; undecided state of mind. 2 cynicism. 3 uncertain state. 4 lack of full proof or clear indication. —v. 1 feel uncertain or undecided about. 2 hesitate to believe. 3 call in question.  in doubt open to question. No doubt certainly; probably; admittedly. Without doubt (or a doubt) certainly. [latin dubito hesitate]

Underexpose  v. (-sing) expose (film) for too short a time etc.  underexposure n.

Grandmother  n. Female grandparent.

Moquette  n. Thick pile or looped material used for upholstery etc. [french]

Shift  —v. 1 (cause to) change or move from one position to another. 2 remove, esp. With effort. 3 slang a hurry. B consume (food or drink). 4 us change (gear) in a vehicle. —n. 1 act of shifting. 2 a relay of workers. B time for which they work. 3 a device, stratagem, or expedient. B trick or evasion. 4 woman's straight unwaisted dress or petticoat. 5 physics displacement of a spectral line. 6 key on a keyboard used to switch between lower and upper case etc. 7 us a gear lever in a vehicle. B mechanism for this.  make shift manage; get along somehow. Shift for oneself rely on one's own efforts. Shift one's ground take up a new position in an argument etc. [old english]

Dl  abbr. Decilitre(s).

Accelerator  n. 1 device for increasing speed, esp. The pedal controlling the speed of a vehicle's engine. 2 physics apparatus for imparting high speeds to charged particles.

Generality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 general statement or rule. 2 general applicability. 3 lack of detail. 4 (foll. By of) main body or majority.

Regretful  adj. Feeling or showing regret.  regretfully adv.

Dent  —n. 1 slight hollow as made by a blow or pressure. 2 noticeable adverse effect (dent in our funds). —v. 1 mark with a dent. 2 adversely affect. [from *indent]

Anneal  v. Heat (metal or glass) and cool slowly, esp. To toughen it. [old english ælan bake]

Deprive  v. (-ving) 1 (usu. Foll. By of) prevent from having or enjoying. 2 (as deprived adj.) Lacking what is needed for well-being; underprivileged.  deprival n. [latin: related to *privation]

Misadventure  n. 1 law accident without crime or negligence (death by misadventure). 2 bad luck. 3 a misfortune.

Yep  adv. & n. (also yup) us colloq. = *yes.

Extramarital  adj. (esp. Of sexual relations) occurring outside marriage.

Osteoporosis  n. Condition of brittle bones caused esp. By hormonal changes or deficiency of calcium or vitamin d.

Assuage  v. (-ging) 1 calm or soothe. 2 appease (an appetite).  assuagement n. [latin suavis sweet]

Vibrato  n. Rapid slight variation in musical pitch producing a tremulous effect. [italian: related to *vibrate]

Martingale  n. Strap(s) preventing a horse from rearing etc. [french, origin uncertain]

Platen  n. 1 plate in a printing-press which presses the paper against the type. 2 cylindrical roller in a typewriter etc. Against which the paper is held. [french platine: related to *plate]

Trichology  n. The study of hair.  trichologist n.

Dragonfly  n. Large insect with a long body and two pairs of transparent wings.

Swordsman  n. Person of (usu. Specified) skill with a sword.  swordsmanship n.

Hitherto  adv. Until this time, up to now.

Griffin  n. (also gryphon) fabulous creature with an eagle's head and wings and a lion's body. [latin gryphus from greek]

Tempest  n. Violent storm. [latin tempus time]

Digress  v. Depart from the main subject in speech or writing.  digression n. [latin digredior -gress-]

Sharpish  colloq. —adj. Fairly sharp. —adv. 1 fairly sharply. 2 quite quickly.

Tradescantia  n. (usu. Trailing) plant with large blue, white, or pink flowers. [tradescant, name of a naturalist]

Decry  v. (-ies, -ied) disparage, belittle.

Instance  —n. 1 example or illustration of. 2 particular case (that's not true in this instance). —v. (-cing) cite as an instance.  for instance as an example. In the first (or second etc.) Instance in the first (or second etc.) Place; at the first (or second etc.) Stage (of a proceeding). [french from latin instantia contrary example]

Rupee  n. Chief monetary unit of india, pakistan, etc. [hindustani]

Unsavory  adj. (brit. Unsavoury) 1 disgusting, unpleasant. 2 morally offensive.

Quietude  n. State of quiet.

Synopsis  n. (pl. Synopses) summary or outline. [greek opsis view]

Vexatious  adj. 1 causing vexation. 2 law (of litigation) lacking sufficient grounds and seeking only to annoy the defendant.

Cornelian  n. (also carnelian) dull red variety of chalcedony. [french]

Stethoscope  n. Instrument used in listening to the heart, lungs, etc. [greek stethos breast]

Umbelliferous  adj. (of a plant) bearing umbels, such as parsley and carrot.

Tt  abbr. 1 tourist trophy. 2 tuberculin-tested. 3 a teetotal. B teetotaller.

Unwitting  adj. 1 not knowing or aware (an unwitting offender). 2 unintentional.  unwittingly adv. [old english: related to *wit]

Uproarious  adj. 1 very noisy. 2 provoking loud laughter; very funny.  uproariously adv.

Zion  n. 1 ancient jerusalem; its holy hill. 2 a the jewish people or religion. B the christian church. 3 the kingdom of heaven. [hebrew siyôn]

Promo  n. (pl. -s) colloq. 1 (often attrib.) Promotion, advertising (promo video). 2 promotional video, trailer, etc. [abbreviation]

Crockery  n. Earthenware or china dishes, plates, etc. [related to *crock2]

Interlude  n. 1 a pause between the acts of a play. B something performed during this pause. 2 contrasting event, time, etc. In the middle of something (comic interlude). 3 piece of music played between other pieces etc. [medieval latin ludus play]

De-  prefix 1 forming verbs and their derivatives: a down, away (descend; deduct). B completely (denude). 2 added to verbs and their derivatives to form verbs and nouns implying removal or reversal (de-ice; decentralization). [latin]

Planner  n. 1 person who plans new towns etc. 2 person who makes plans. 3 list, table, etc., with information helpful in planning.

Wedding  n. Marriage ceremony. [old english: related to *wed]

Already  adv. 1 before the time in question (i knew that already). 2 as early or as soon as this (is back already). [from *all, *ready]

Stanch  v. (also staunch) 1 restrain the flow of (esp. Blood). 2 restrain the flow from (esp. A wound). [french estanchier]

Dank  adj. Disagreeably damp and cold.  dankly adv. Dankness n. [probably scandinavian]

Recalcitrant  adj. 1 obstinately disobedient. 2 objecting to restraint.  recalcitrance n. [latin recalcitro kick out, from calx heel]

Stingray  n. Broad flat-fish with a poisonous spine at the base of its tail.

Stung  past and past part. Of *sting.

Plentiful  adj. Abundant, copious.  plentifully adv.

Admiral  n. 1 a commander-in-chief of a navy. B high-ranking naval officer, commander. 2 any of various butterflies. [arabic: related to *amir]

Tranquil  adj. Calm, serene, undisturbed.  tranquillity n. Tranquilly adv. [latin]

Cloakroom  n. 1 room where outdoor clothes or luggage may be left. 2 euphem. Lavatory.

Resit  —v. (-tt-; past and past part. Resat) sit (an examination) again after failing. —n. 1 resitting of an examination. 2 examination specifically for this.

Visor  n. (also vizor) 1 movable part of a helmet covering the face. 2 shield for the eyes, esp. One at the top of a vehicle windscreen. [anglo-french viser: related to *visage]

Spigot  n. 1 small peg or plug, esp. In a cask. 2 device for controlling the flow of liquid in a tap. [related to *spike2]

Consign  v. (often foll. By to) 1 hand over; deliver. 2 assign; commit. 3 transmit or send (goods).  consignee n. Consignor n. [latin: related to *sign]

Unload  v. 1 (also absol.) Remove a load from (a vehicle etc.). 2 remove (a load) from a vehicle etc. 3 remove the ammunition from (a gun etc.). 4 colloq. Get rid of.

Remember  v. 1 (often foll. By to + infin. Or that + clause) keep in the memory; not forget. 2 (also absol.) Bring back into one's thoughts. 3 think of or acknowledge (a person), esp. In making a gift etc. 4 (foll. By to) convey greetings from (one person) to (another) (remember me to john). [latin: related to *memory]

Exclaim  v. 1 cry out suddenly. 2 (foll. By that) utter by exclaiming. [latin: related to *claim]

Earn  v. 1 bring in as income or interest. 2 be entitled to or obtain as the reward for work or merit.  earner n. [old english]

Necktie  n. Esp. Us = *tie n. 2.

Juggernaut  n. 1 large heavy lorry etc. 2 overwhelming force or object. [hindi jagannath, = lord of the world]

Unprovoked  adj. Without provocation.

Harness  —n. 1 equipment of straps etc. By which a horse is fastened to a cart etc. And controlled. 2 similar arrangement for fastening a thing to a person's body. —v. 1 a put a harness on. B (foll. By to) attach by harness to. 2 make use of (natural resources), esp. To produce energy.  in harness in the routine of daily work. [french harneis military equipment]

Fatwa  n. Legal decision or ruling by an islamic religious leader. [arabic]

Occur  v. (-rr-) 1 come into being as an event or process. 2 exist or be encountered in some place or conditions. 3 (foll. By to) come into the mind of. [latin occurro befall]

Fetus  n. (brit. Foetus) (pl. -tuses) unborn mammalian offspring, esp. A human embryo of eight weeks or more.  foetal adj. [latin fetus offspring]

Choreograph  v. Compose choreography for (a ballet etc.).  choreographer n.

Privative  adj. 1 consisting in or marked by loss or absence. 2 gram. Expressing privation. [latin: related to *private]

Quintuple  —adj. Fivefold; having five parts. —n. Fivefold number or amount. —v. (-ling) multiply by five. [latin quintus fifth]

Lyricism  n. Quality of being lyric.

Consortium  n. (pl. -tia or -s) association, esp. Of several business companies. [latin: related to *consort1]

Forecast  —v. (past and past part. -cast or -casted) predict; estimate beforehand. —n. Prediction, esp. Of weather.  forecaster n.

Transfer  —v. (-rr-) 1 (often foll. By to) a convey, remove, or hand over (a thing etc.). B make over the possession of (property, a ticket, rights, etc.) To a person. 2 change or move to another group, club, department, etc. 3 change from one station, route, etc., to another on a journey. 4 convey (a design) from one surface to another. 5 change (meaning) by extension or metaphor. —n. 1 transferring or being transferred. 2 design etc. Conveyed or to be conveyed from one surface to another. 3 football player etc. Who is transferred. 4 document effecting conveyance of property, a right, etc.  transferable adj. [latin fero lat- bear]

Terracotta  n. 1 a unglazed usu. Brownish-red earthenware. B statuette of this. 2 its colour. [italian, = baked earth]

Uncivil  adj. Ill-mannered; impolite.  uncivilly adv.

Tm  symb. Thulium.

Absolve  v. (-ving) (often foll. By from, of) set or pronounce free from blame or obligation etc. [latin: related to *solve]

Mixture  n. 1 process or result of mixing. 2 combination of ingredients, qualities, characteristics, etc. [latin: related to *mixed]

Dipsomania  n. Alcoholism.  dipsomaniac n. [greek dipsa thirst]

Expand  v. 1 increase in size or importance. 2 (often foll. By on) give a fuller account. 3 become more genial. 4 set or write out in full. 5 spread out flat.  expandable adj. [latin pando pans- spread]

Revoke  —v. (-king) 1 rescind, withdraw, or cancel. 2 cards fail to follow suit when able to do so. —n. Cards revoking.  revocable adj. Revocation n. [latin voco call]

Crystal  —n. 1 a transparent colourless mineral, esp. Rock crystal. B piece of this. 2 a highly transparent glass; flint glass. B articles of this. 3 crystalline piece of semiconductor. 4 aggregation of molecules with a definite internal structure and the external form of a solid enclosed by symmetrically arranged plane faces. —adj. (usu. Attrib.) Made of, like, or clear as crystal. [greek krustallos]

Judas  n. Traitor. [judas iscariot who betrayed christ]

Interrupt  v. 1 break the continuous progress of (an action, speech, person speaking, etc.). 2 obstruct (a person's view etc.).  interruption n. [latin: related to *rupture]

Disinfectant  —n. Substance that destroys germs etc. —adj. Disinfecting.

Sumo  n.  Japanese wrestling in which a wrestler is defeated by touching the ground with any part of the body except the soles of the feet or by moving outside the ring. [japanese]

Cupreous  adj. Of or like copper. [latin: related to *copper1]

Grunt  —n. 1 low guttural sound made by a pig. 2 similar sound. —v. 1 make a grunt. 2 make a similar sound, esp. To express discontent. 3 utter with a grunt. [old english, imitative]

Tabletop  n. Surface of a table.

Fen  n. 1 low marshy land. 2 (the fens) low-lying areas in cambridgeshire etc. [old english]

Vertebra  n. (pl. -brae) each segment of a backbone.  vertebral adj. [latin verto turn]

Untrue  adj. 1 not true. 2 (often foll. By to) not faithful or loyal. 3 deviating from an accepted standard.

Snub  —v. (-bb-) rebuff or humiliate with sharp words or coldness. —n. Act of snubbing. —adj. Short and blunt in shape. [old norse, = chide]

Trek  orig. S.afr. —v. (-kk-) 1 travel or make one's way arduously. 2 esp. Hist. Migrate or journey with one's belongings by ox-wagon. —n. 1 a long or arduous journey or walk (quite a trek to the launderette). B each stage of this. 2 organized migration of a body of people.  trekker n. [dutch, = draw]

Accuse  v. (-sing) (often foll. By of) charge with a fault or crime; blame. [latin accusare: related to *cause]

Agnail  n. Piece of torn skin at the root of a fingernail; resulting soreness. [old english, = tight (metal) nail, hard excrescence in flesh]

Oomph  n. Slang 1 energy, enthusiasm. 2 attractiveness, esp. Sex appeal. [origin uncertain]

Legalese  n. Colloq. Technical language of legal documents.

Scutter  v. & n. Colloq. Scurry. [perhaps an alteration of *scuttle2]

Doggerel  n. Poor or trivial verse. [apparently from *dog]

Creepy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Feeling or causing horror or fear.  creepily adv. Creepiness n.

Cud  n. Half-digested food returned to the mouth of ruminants for further chewing. [old english]

Pertinacious  adj. Stubborn; persistent (in a course of action etc.).  pertinacity n. [latin pertinax: related to *pertain]

Underfloor  attrib. Adj. Beneath the floor (underfloor heating).

Fiction  n. 1 non-factual literature, esp. Novels. 2 invented idea, thing, etc. 3 generally accepted falsehood (polite fiction).  fictional adj. Fictionalize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). [latin: related to *feign]

Reparation  n. 1 making amends. 2 (esp. In pl.) Compensation for war damages.

Legionary  —adj. Of a legion or legions. —n. (pl. -ies) member of a legion.

Chromatin  n. Chromosome material in a cell nucleus which stains with basic dyes. [greek: related to *chrome]

Solipsism  n. Philosophical theory that the self is all that exists or can be known.  solipsist n. [latin solus alone, ipse self]

Lyricist  n. Writer of (esp. Popular) lyrics.

Relationship  n. 1 state or instance of being related. 2 a connection or association (good working relationship). B colloq. Emotional (esp. Sexual) association between two people.

Derelict  —adj. 1 (esp. Of a property) dilapidated. 2 abandoned, ownerless. —n. 1 vagrant. 2 abandoned property. [latin: related to *relinquish]

Talus  n. (pl. Tali) ankle-bone supporting the tibia. [latin, = ankle]

Dorsal  adj. Of or on the back (dorsal fin). [latin dorsum back]

Incorrect  adj. 1 not correct or true. 2 improper, unsuitable.  incorrectly adv.

Cicely  n. (pl. -ies) flowering plant related to parsley and chervil. [greek seselis]

Septum  n. (pl. Septa) partition such as that between the nostrils or the chambers of a poppy-fruit or of a shell. [latin s(a)eptum from saepio enclose]

Hydrophobia  n. 1 aversion to water, esp. As a symptom of rabies in humans. 2 rabies, esp. In humans.  hydrophobic adj.

Eden  n. Place or state of great happiness, with reference to the abode of adam and eve at the creation. [hebrew, originally = delight]

Almond  n. 1 nutlike kernel of a fruit allied to the peach and plum. 2 tree bearing this. [greek amugdale]

Myxomatosis  n. Viral disease of rabbits. [greek muxa mucus]

Inoffensive  adj. Not objectionable; harmless.

Clarinet  n. Woodwind instrument with a single reed.  clarinettist n. (us clarinetist). [french diminutive of clarine, a kind of bell]

Confirm  v. 1 provide support for the truth or correctness of. 2 (foll. By in) encourage (a person) in (an opinion etc.). 3 establish more firmly (power, possession, etc.). 4 make formally valid. 5 administer the religious rite of confirmation to.  [latin: related to *firm1]

Microfiche  n. (pl. Same or -s) small flat piece of film bearing microphotographs of documents etc. [from *micro-, french fiche slip of paper]

Predicate  —v. 1  (also absol.) Assert (something) about the subject of a proposition. 2 (foll. By on) found or base (a statement etc.) On. —n. Gram. & logic what is said about the subject of a sentence or proposition etc. (e.g. Went home in john went home).  predicable adj. Predication n. [latin praedico -dicat- declare]

Interferon  n. Any of various proteins inhibiting the development of a virus in a cell etc.

Holly  n. (pl. -ies) evergreen shrub with prickly leaves and red berries. [old english]

Legerdemain  n. 1 sleight of hand. 2 trickery, sophistry. [french, = light of hand]

Hydrocarbon  n. Compound of hydrogen and carbon.

Ouija  n. (in full ouija board) propr. Board marked with letters or signs and used with a movable pointer to try to obtain messages at a seance. [french oui, german ja, yes]

Elephantine  adj. 1 of elephants. 2 a huge. B clumsy.

Warlock  n. Archaic sorcerer. [old english, = traitor]

Ass  n. (brit. Arse) coarse slang buttocks. [old english]

Megabuck  n. Us slang million dollars.

Forme  n. Printing body of type secured in a chase ready for printing. [var. Of *form]

Tour  —n. 1 a journey from place to place as a holiday; sightseeing excursion. B a walk round; inspection (made a tour of the garden). 2 spell of duty on military or diplomatic service. 3 series of performances, matches, etc., at different places. —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By through) make a tour. 2 make a tour of (a country etc.).  on tour (esp. Of a team, theatre company, etc.) Touring. [latin: related to *turn]

Fee  n. 1 payment made for professional advice or services etc. 2 a charge for a privilege, examination, admission to a society, etc. (enrolment fee). B money paid for the transfer to another employer of a footballer etc. 3 (in pl.) Regular payments (esp. To a school). 4 law inherited estate, unlimited (fee simple) or limited (fee tail) as to category of heir. [medieval latin feudum]

Ferret  —n. Small polecat used in catching rabbits, rats, etc. —v. 1 hunt with ferrets. 2 (often foll. By out, about, etc.) Rummage; search out (secrets, criminals, etc.). [latin fur thief]

Detractor  n. Person who criticizes unfairly.  detraction n.

Disuse  —n. Disused state. —v. (-sing) cease to use.

Feeling  —n. 1 a capacity to feel; sense of touch (lost all feeling). B physical sensation. 2 a (often foll. By of) emotional reaction (feeling of despair). B (in pl.) Emotional susceptibilities (hurt my feelings). 3 particular sensitivity (feeling for literature). 4 a opinion or notion (had a feeling she would). B general sentiment. 5 sympathy or compassion. 6 emotional sensibility or intensity (played with feeling). —adj. Sensitive, sympathetic; heartfelt.  feelingly adv.

Sirloin  n. Upper and choicer part of a loin of beef. [french: related to *sur-1, *loin]

Sheathe  v. (-thing) 1 put into a sheath. 2 encase; protect with a sheath.

Tactics  n.pl. 1 (also treated as sing.) Disposition of armed forces, esp. In warfare. 2 short-term procedure adopted in carrying out a scheme or achieving an end.  tactician n.

Tesla  n. Si unit of magnetic induction. [tesla, name of a scientist]

Incantation  n. Magical formula; spell, charm.  incantational adj. [latin canto sing]

Thurible  n. Censer. [latin thus thur- incense]

Thallium  n. Rare soft white metallic element. [greek thallos green shoot]

Playlet  n. Short play.

Imperil  v. (-ll-; us -l-) endanger.

Pyretic  adj. Of, for, or producing fever. [greek puretos fever]

Laughter  n. Act or sound of laughing. [old english]

Plaintive  adj. Expressing sorrow; mournful-sounding.  plaintively adv. [french: related to *plaint]

Vassal  n. 1 hist. Feudal tenant of land. 2 humble dependant.  vassalage n. [medieval latin vassallus retainer]

Indefinable  adj. That cannot be defined; mysterious.  indefinably adv.

Scapegoat  n. Person blamed for others' shortcomings (with ref. To lev. 16). [obsolete scape escape]

Ponce  slang —n. 1 man who lives off a prostitute's earnings; pimp. 2 offens. Homosexual or effeminate man. —v. (-cing) act as a ponce.  ponce about move about effeminately or ineffectually. [origin unknown]

Enact  v. 1 a ordain, decree. B make (a bill etc.) Law. 2 play (a part on stage or in life).  enactive adj.

Warpaint  n. 1 paint used to adorn the body before battle, esp. By n. American indians. 2 colloq. Make-up.

Barometer  n. 1 instrument measuring atmospheric pressure, used in meteorology. 2 anything which reflects change.  barometric adj. [related to *barograph]

Shopwalker  n. Supervisor in a large shop.

Perhaps  adv. It may be; possibly.

Unashamed  adj. 1 feeling no guilt. 2 blatant; bold.  unashamedly adv.

Earpiece  n. Part of a telephone etc. Applied to the ear.

Monger  n. (usu. In comb.) 1 dealer, trader (fishmonger). 2 usu. Derog. Promoter, spreader (warmonger; scaremonger). [latin mango dealer]

Precedence  n. 1 priority in time, order, importance, etc. 2 right of preceding others.  take precedence (often foll. By over, of) have priority (over).

Acrimonious  adj. Bitter in manner or temper.  acrimony n.

Enter  v. 1 go or come in or into. 2 come on stage (also as a direction: enter macbeth). 3 penetrate (bullet entered his arm). 4 write (name, details, etc.) In a list, book, etc. 5 register, record the name of as a competitor (entered for the long jump). 6 a become a member of (a society or profession). B enrol in a school etc. 7 make known; present for consideration (enter a protest). 8 record formally (before a court of law etc.). 9 (foll. By into) a engage in (conversation etc.). B subscribe to; bind oneself by (an agreement, contract, etc.). C form part of (a calculation, plan, etc.). D sympathize with (feelings). 10 (foll. By on, upon) a begin; begin to deal with. B assume the functions of (an office) or possession of (property). [latin intra within]

Effulgent  adj. Literary radiant.  effulgence n. [latin fulgeo shine]

-ful  comb. Form forming: 1 adjectives from a nouns, meaning full of or having qualities of (beautiful; masterful). B adjectives (direful). C verbs, meaning ‘apt to’ (forgetful). 2 nouns (pl. -fuls) meaning ‘amount that fills’ (handful; spoonful).

Retro  slang —adj. Reviving or harking back to the past. —n. Retro fashion or style.

Producer  n. 1 person who produces goods etc. 2 person who supervises the production of a play, film, broadcast, etc.

Anemometer  n. Instrument for measuring wind force. [greek anemos wind]

Unhygienic  adj. Not hygienic.

Fight  —v. (past and past part. Fought) 1 (often foll. By against, with) contend or contend with in war, battle, single combat, etc. 2 engage in (a battle, duel, etc.). 3 contend (an election); maintain (a lawsuit, cause, etc.) Against an opponent. 4 strive to achieve something or to overcome (disease, fire, etc.). 5 make (one's way) by fighting. —n. 1 a combat. B boxing-match. C battle. 2 conflict, struggle, or effort. 3 power or inclination to fight (no fight left).  fight back 1 counter-attack. 2 suppress (tears etc.). Fight for 1 fight on behalf of. 2 fight to secure. Fight a losing battle struggle without hope of success. Fight off repel with effort. Fight out (usu. Fight it out) settle by fighting. Fight shy of avoid. Put up a fight offer resistance. [old english]

Porous  adj. 1 full of pores. 2 letting through air, water, etc.  porosity n. [latin: related to *pore1]

Graven  past part. Of *grave3.

Nonchalant  adj. Calm and casual.  nonchalance n. Nonchalantly adv. [french chaloir be concerned]

Complicity  n. Partnership in wrongdoing. [french: related to *complex]

Uncombed  adj. (of hair or a person) not combed.

Pyramid  n. 1 monumental, esp. Stone, structure, with a square base and sloping triangular sides meeting at an apex, esp. An ancient egyptian royal tomb. 2 solid of this shape with esp. A square or triangular base. 3 pyramid-shaped thing or pile of things.  pyramidal adj. [greek puramis -mid-]

Knitwear  n. Knitted garments.

Refashion  v. Fashion again or differently.

Volley  —n. (pl. -s) 1 a simultaneous firing of a number of weapons. B bullets etc. So fired. 2 (usu. Foll. By of) torrent (of abuse etc.). 3 playing of a ball in tennis, football, etc., before it touches the ground. —v. (-eys, -eyed) return or send by or in a volley. [french volée from latin volo fly]

Strawberry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 pulpy red fruit with a seed-studded surface. 2 plant with runners and white flowers bearing this. [old english: related to *straw, for unknown reason]

Vomit  —v. (-t-) 1 eject (contents of the stomach) through the mouth; be sick. 2 (of a volcano, chimney, etc.) Eject violently, belch forth. —n. Matter vomited from the stomach. [latin]

Pintle  n. Pin or bolt, esp. One on which some other part turns. [old english]

Scrofula  n. Disease with glandular swellings, probably a form of tuberculosis.  scrofulous adj. [latin scrofa a sow]

Desperate  adj. 1 reckless from despair; violent and lawless. 2 a extremely dangerous, serious, or bad (desperate situation). B staking all on a small chance (desperate remedy). 3 (usu. Foll. By for) needing or desiring very much (desperate for recognition).  desperately adv. Desperateness n. Desperation n. [latin: related to *despair]

Genesis  n. 1 origin; mode of formation. 2 (genesis) first book of the old testament, with an account of the creation. [greek gen- be produced]

Nosh  slang —v. Eat. —n. 1 food or drink. 2 us snack. [yiddish]

Army  n. (pl. -ies) 1 organized armed land force. 2 (prec. By the) the military profession. 3 (often foll. By of) very large number (army of locusts). 4 organized civilian body (salvation army). [french: related to *arm2]

Underskirt  n. Petticoat.

Hinny  n. (pl. -ies) offspring of a female donkey and a male horse. [greek hinnos]

Molding  n. (brit. Moulding) 1 ornamentally shaped outline of plaster etc. As an architectural feature, esp. In a cornice. 2 similar feature in woodwork etc.

Convection  n. Heat transfer by upward movement of a heated and less dense medium. [latin veho vect- carry]

Clomp  var. Of *clump v. 2.

Encrust  v. 1 cover with or form a crust. 2 coat with a hard casing or deposit, sometimes for decoration. [french: related to *en-1]

Eyepiece  n. Lens or lenses to which the eye is applied at the end of an optical instrument.

Withdrawal  n. 1 withdrawing or being withdrawn. 2 process of ceasing to take an addictive drug etc., often with an unpleasant reaction (withdrawal symptoms). 3 = *coitus interruptus.

Proviso  n. (pl. -s) 1 stipulation. 2 clause containing this.  provisory adj. [latin, = it being provided]

Recopy  v. (-ies, -ied) copy again.

Endways  adv. (also endwise) 1 with end uppermost or foremost. 2 end to end.

Bantu  —n. (pl. Same or -s) 1 often offens. Member of a large group of central and southern african blacks. 2 group of languages spoken by them. —adj. Of these peoples or languages. [bantu, = people]

Aleatory  adj. Depending on chance. [latin alea *die2]

Roaster  n. 1 oven, dish, apparatus, etc. For roasting. 2 fowl, potato, etc. For roasting.

Windscreen  n. Screen of glass at the front of a motor vehicle.

Porker  n. Pig raised for food.

Chanter  n. Melody-pipe of bagpipes.

Professionalism  n. Qualities associated with a profession, esp. Competence, skill, etc.

Dado  n. (pl. -s) 1 lower, differently decorated, part of an interior wall. 2 plinth of a column. 3 cube of a pedestal between the base and the cornice. [italian: related to *die2]

Inanimate  adj. 1 not endowed with, or deprived of, animal life (an inanimate object). 2 spiritless, dull.

Inflexible  adj. 1 unbendable. 2 unbending.  inflexibility n. Inflexibly adv.

Pertain  v. 1 (foll. By to) a relate or have reference to. B belong to as a part, appendage, or accessory. 2 (usu. Foll. By to) be appropriate to. [latin pertineo belong to]

Hooded  adj. 1 having a hood. 2 (of an animal) having a hoodlike part (hooded crow).

And  conj. 1 a connecting words, clauses, or sentences, to be taken jointly (you and i). B implying progression (better and better). C implying causation (she hit him and he cried). D implying great duration (cried and cried). E implying a great number (miles and miles). F implying addition (two and two). G implying variety (there are books and books). 2 colloq. To (try and come). 3 in relation to (britain and the ec).  and/or either or both of two stated alternatives. [old english]

Osmium  n.  Heavy hard bluish-white metallic element. [greek osme smell]

Darling  —n. 1 beloved, lovable, or endearing person or thing. 2 favourite. —adj. 1 beloved, lovable. 2 colloq. Charming or pretty. [old english: related to *dear]

Pandemic  adj. (of a disease etc.) Widespread; universal. [greek demos people]

Glycolysis  n. Breakdown of glucose by enzymes with the release of energy.

Distribution  n. 1 distributing or being distributed. 2 a commercial dispersal of goods etc. B extent to which different classes etc. Share in a nation's total wealth etc.

Nurse  —n. 1 person trained to care for the sick or infirm and assist doctors or dentists. 2 = *nursemaid. —v. (-sing) 1 a work as a nurse. B attend to (a sick person). 2 feed or be fed at the breast. 3 hold or treat carefully. 4 a foster; promote the development of. B harbour (a grievance etc.). [latin: related to *nourish]

Feed  —v. (past and past part. Fed) 1 a supply with food. B put food into the mouth of. 2 give as food, esp. To animals. 3 (usu. Foll. By on) (esp. Of animals, or colloq. Of people) eat. 4 (often foll. By on) nourish or be nourished by; benefit from. 5 a keep (a fire, machine, etc.) Supplied with fuel etc. B (foll. By into) supply (material) to a machine etc. C (often foll. By into) (of a river etc.) Flow into a lake etc. D keep (a meter) supplied with coins to ensure continuity. 6 slang supply (an actor etc.) With cues. 7 sport send passes to (a player). 8 gratify (vanity etc.). 9 provide (advice, information, etc.) To. —n. 1 food, esp. For animals or infants. 2 feeding; giving of food. 3 colloq. Meal. 4 a raw material for a machine etc. B provision of or device for this.  feed back produce feedback. Feed up fatten. [old english]

Unmanageable  adj. Not easily managed or controlled.

Hempen  adj. Made of hemp.

Womanize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) chase after women; philander.  womanizer n.

Adduce  v. (-cing) cite as an instance or as proof or evidence.  adducible adj. [latin: related to *ad-, duco lead]

Bifurcate  —v. (-ting) fork. —adj. Forked; branched.  bifurcation n. [latin furca fork]

Wednesday  —n. Day of the week following tuesday. —adv. Colloq. 1 on wednesday. 2 (wednesdays) on wednesdays; each wednesday. [old english]

Retry  v. (-ies, -ied) try (a defendant or lawsuit) a second or further time.

Dreary  adj. (-ier, -iest) dismal, dull, gloomy.  drearily adv. Dreariness n. [old english]

Faithless  adj. 1 false, unreliable, disloyal. 2 without religious faith.

Confiscate  v. (-ting) take or seize by authority.  confiscation n. [latin: related to *fiscal]

Aware  predic. Adj. 1 (often foll. By of or that) conscious; having knowledge. 2 well-informed.  awareness n. [old english]

Usage  aware is also found used attributively in sense 2, as in ‘a very aware person’, but this should be avoided in formal contexts.

Mangy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 having mange. 2 squalid; shabby.

Oecd  abbr. Organization for economic cooperation and development.

Pennyroyal  n. Creeping kind of mint. [anglo-french puliol real royal thyme]

Impel  v. (-ll-) 1 drive, force, or urge. 2 propel. [latin pello drive]

Panic  —n. 1 sudden uncontrollable fear. 2 infectious fright, esp. In commercial dealings. —v. (-ck-) (often foll. By into) affect or be affected with panic (was panicked into buying).  panicky adj. [greek pan, rural god]

Madonna  n.  1 (prec. By the) the virgin mary. 2 (madonna) picture or statue of her. [italian, = my lady]

Continuo  n. (pl. -s) mus. Accompaniment providing a bass line, played usu. On a keyboard instrument. [italian]

Clog  —n. Shoe with a thick wooden sole. —v. (-gg-) 1 (often foll. By up) obstruct or become obstructed; choke. 2 impede. [origin unknown]

Dysphasia  n. Lack of coordination in speech, owing to brain damage. [greek dusphatos hard to utter]

Goblin  n. Mischievous ugly dwarflike creature of folklore. [anglo-french]

Chairman  n. (fem. Also chairwoman) 1 person chosen to preside over a meeting. 2 permanent president of a committee, board of directors, etc.

Compute  v. (-ting) 1 reckon or calculate. 2 use a computer.  computation n. [latin puto reckon]

Outset  n.  at (or from) the outset from the beginning.

Espalier  n. 1 lattice-work along which the branches of a tree or shrub are trained. 2 tree or shrub so trained. [french from italian]

Unconventional  adj. Unusual; unorthodox.  unconventionality n. Unconventionally adv.

Gable  n. 1 triangular upper part of a wall at the end of a ridged roof. 2 gable-topped wall.  gabled adj. [old norse and french]

Shitty  adj. (-ier, -iest) coarse slang 1 disgusting, contemptible. 2 covered with excrement.

Saving  —adj. (often in comb.) Making economical use of (labour-saving). —n. 1 anything that is saved. 2 an economy (a saving in expenses). 3 (usu. In pl.) Money saved. 4 act of preserving or rescuing. —prep. 1 except. 2 without offence to (saving your presence).

Data  n.pl. (also treated as sing., although the singular form is strictly datum) 1 known facts used for inference or in reckoning. 2 quantities or characters operated on by a computer etc. [latin data from do give]

Usage  (1) in scientific, philosophical, and general use, this word is usually considered to denote a number of items and is thus treated as plural with datum as the singular. (2) in computing and allied subjects (and sometimes in general use), it is treated as a mass (or collective) noun and used with words like this, that, and much, with singular verbs, e.g. Useful data has been collected. Some people consider use (2) to be incorrect but it is more common than use (1). However, data is not a singular countable noun and cannot be preceded by a, every, each, either, or neither, or be given a plural form datas.

Righteous  adj. (of a person or conduct) morally right; virtuous, law-abiding.  righteously adv. Righteousness n. [old english]

Irrational  adj. 1 illogical; unreasonable. 2 not endowed with reason. 3 math. Not commensurate with the natural numbers.  irrationality n. Irrationally adv.

Headdress  n. Covering for the head.

Farrow  —n. 1 litter of pigs. 2 birth of a litter. —v. (also absol.) (of a sow) produce (pigs). [old english]

Gala  n. Festive occasion or gathering (swimming gala). [ultimately from french gale rejoicing from germanic]

Huge  adj. 1 extremely large; enormous. 2 (of an abstract thing) very great.  hugeness n. [french ahuge]

Felon  n. Person who has committed a felony. [medieval latin fello]

Recitative  n. Musical declamation in the narrative and dialogue parts of opera and oratorio. [italian recitativo: related to *recite]

Joker  n. 1 person who jokes. 2 slang person. 3 playing-card used in some games.

Provocation  n. 1 provoking or being provoked (did it under severe provocation). 2 cause of annoyance.

Hint  —n. 1 slight or indirect indication or suggestion. 2 small piece of practical information. 3 very small trace; suggestion (a hint of perfume). —v. Suggest slightly or indirectly.  hint at give a hint of; refer indirectly to. Take a hint heed a hint. [obsolete hent grasp]

Flaming  adj. 1 emitting flames. 2 very hot (flaming june). 3 colloq. A passionate (flaming row). B expressing annoyance (that flaming dog). 4 bright-coloured.

Ravage  —v. (-ging) devastate, plunder. —n. 1 devastation. 2 (usu. In pl.; foll. By of) destructive effect. [french alteration from ravine rush of water]

Romanticize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 make romantic; exaggerate (romanticized account). 2 indulge in romantic thoughts or actions.

Particolored  adj. (brit. -coloured) of more than one colour. [related to *part, *colour]

Legislate  v. (-ting) make laws.  legislator n. [from *legislation]

Fretful  adj. Anxious, irritable.  fretfully adv.

Cute  adj. Colloq. 1 esp. Us attractive, quaint. 2 clever, ingenious.  cutely adv. Cuteness n. [shortening of *acute]

Bobtail  n. 1 docked tail. 2 horse or dog with this.

Yon  adj. & adv. Literary & dial. Yonder. [old english]

Strudel  n. Thin leaved pastry rolled round a filling and baked. [german]

Pubescence  n. 1 beginning of puberty. 2  soft down on plants, or on animals, esp. Insects.  pubescent adj. [latin: related to *pubes1]

Indisposed  adj. 1 slightly unwell. 2 averse or unwilling.  indisposition n.

Unwholesome  adj. 1 detrimental to physical or moral health. 2 unhealthy-looking.

Imp  n. 1 mischievous child. 2 small devil or sprite. [old english, = young shoot]

Churchman  n. Member of the clergy or of a church.

Graves  n. Light usu. White wine from graves in france.

Subculture  n. Distinct cultural group within a larger culture.

Fighter  n. 1 person or animal that fights. 2 fast military aircraft designed for attacking other aircraft.

Denomination  n. 1 church or religious sect. 2 class of measurement or money. 3 name, esp. A characteristic or class name.  denominational adj. [latin: related to *denominate]

Cunning  —adj. (-er, -est) 1 deceitful, clever, or crafty. 2 ingenious (cunning device). 3 us attractive, quaint. —n. 1 craftiness; deception. 2 skill, ingenuity.  cunningly adv. [old norse: related to *can1]

Compel  v. (-ll-) 1 force, constrain. 2 arouse irresistibly (compels admiration). 3 (as compelling adj.) Rousing strong interest, conviction, or admiration.  compellingly adv. [latin pello puls- drive]

Funerary  adj. Of or used at funerals.

Sandwich  —n. 1 two or more slices of bread with a filling. 2 layered cake with jam or cream. —v. 1 put (a thing, statement, etc.) Between two of another character. 2 squeeze in between others (sat sandwiched in the middle). [from the earl of sandwich]

Whortleberry  n. (pl. -ies) bilberry. [origin unknown]

Aspirin  n. (pl. Same or -s) 1 white powder, acetylsalicylic acid, used to reduce pain and fever. 2 tablet of this. [german]

Amperage  n. Strength of an electric current in amperes.

Visceral  adj. 1 of the viscera. 2 of feelings rather than reason.

Scintillate  v. (-ting) 1 (esp. As scintillating adj.) Talk cleverly; be brilliant. 2 sparkle; twinkle.  scintillation n. [latin: related to *scintilla]

Fiduciary  —adj. 1 a of a trust, trustee, or trusteeship. B held or given in trust. 2 (of paper currency) dependent on public confidence or securities. —n. (pl. -ies) trustee. [latin fiducia trust]

Suppose  v. (-sing) (often foll. By that) 1 assume; be inclined to think. 2 take as a possibility or hypothesis (suppose you are right; supposing you are right). 3 (in imper.) As a formula of proposal (suppose we try again). 4 (of a theory or result etc.) Require as a condition (that supposes we're on time). 5 (in imper. Or pres. Part. Forming a question) in the circumstances that; if (suppose he won't let you?). 6 (as supposed adj.) Presumed (his supposed brother). 7 (in passive; foll. By to + infin.) A be expected or required (was supposed to write to you). B (with neg.) Ought not; not be allowed to (you are not supposed to go in there).  i suppose so expression of hesitant agreement. [french: related to *pose]

Soviet  hist. —adj. Of the ussr or its people. —n. 1 citizen of the ussr. 2 (soviet) elected council in the ussr. 3 revolutionary council of workers, peasants, etc.  [russian]

Compartmental  adj. Of or divided into compartments or categories.

Colorful  adj. (brit. Colour-) 1 full of colour; bright. 2 full of interest; vivid.  colourfully adv.

Agrimony  n. (pl. -ies) perennial plant with small yellow flowers. [greek argemone poppy]

Enlighten  v. 1 (often foll. By on) inform (about a subject). 2 (as enlightened adj.) Progressive.

Embroider  v. 1 decorate (cloth etc.) With needlework. 2 embellish (a narrative).  embroiderer n. [anglo-french from germanic]

Cycad  n. Palmlike plant often growing to a great height. [greek koix egyptian palm]

Photosensitive  adj. Reacting to light.

Preventive  —adj. Serving to prevent, esp. Disease. —n. Preventive agent, measure, drug, etc.

Synth  n. Colloq. = *synthesizer.

Horsefly  n. Any of various biting insects troublesome esp. To horses.

Goal  n. 1 object of ambition or effort; destination. 2 a structure into or through which the ball has to be sent to score in certain games. B point won. 3 point marking the finish of a race. [origin unknown]

Opulent  adj. 1 wealthy. 2 luxurious. 3 abundant.  opulence n. [latin opes wealth]

Dative  gram. —n. Case expressing the indirect object or recipient. —adj. Of or in this case. [latin: related to *data]

Oxidize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 combine with oxygen. 2 make or become rusty. 3 coat (metal) with oxide.  oxidization n.

Spicy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of or flavoured with spice. 2 piquant; sensational, improper.  spiciness n.

Fleece  —n. 1 a woolly coat of a sheep etc. B wool sheared from a sheep at one time. 2 thing resembling a fleece, esp. Soft fabric for lining etc. —v. (-cing) 1 (often foll. By of) strip of money, valuables, etc.; swindle. 2 shear (sheep etc.). 3 cover as if with a fleece (sky fleeced with clouds).  fleecy adj. (-ier, -iest). [old english]

Lot  n. 1 colloq. (prec. By a or in pl.) A a large number or amount (a lot of people; lots of milk). B colloq. Much (a lot warmer; smiles a lot). 2 a each of a set of objects used to make a chance selection. B this method of deciding (chosen by lot). 3 share or responsibility resulting from it. 4 person's destiny, fortune, or condition. 5 (esp. Us) plot; allotment of land (parking lot). 6 article or set of articles for sale at an auction etc. 7 group of associated persons or things.  cast (or draw) lots decide by lots. Throw in one's lot with decide to share the fortunes of. The (or the whole) lot the total number or quantity. A whole lot colloq. Very much (is a whole lot better). [old english]

Usage  in sense 1a, a lot of is somewhat informal, but acceptable in serious writing, whereas lots of is not acceptable.

Irresolute  adj. 1 hesitant. 2 lacking in resoluteness.  irresolutely adv. Irresoluteness n. Irresolution n.

Cadaver  n. Esp. Med. Corpse. [latin cado fall]

Delicacy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being delicate (in all senses). 2 a choice food. [from *delicate]

Gardenia  n. Tree or shrub with large fragrant flowers. [garden, name of a naturalist]

Kc  abbr. King's counsel.

Pillar  n. 1 slender vertical structure of stone etc. Used as a support or for ornament. 2 person regarded as a mainstay (pillar of the faith). 3 upright mass of air, water, rock, etc.  from pillar to post (rushing etc.) From one place to another. [latin pila pillar]

Rib  —n. 1 each of the curved bones joined to the spine in pairs and protecting the chest. 2 joint of meat from this part of an animal. 3 supporting ridge, timber, rod, etc. Across a surface or through a structure. 4 knitting combination of plain and purl stitches producing a ribbed design. —v.

Intoxicant  —adj. Intoxicating. —n. Intoxicating substance.

Hoard  —n. Stock or store (esp. Of money or food). —v. Amass and store.  hoarder n. [old english]

Urine  n. Waste fluid secreted by the kidneys and discharged from the bladder. [latin urina]

Endeavor  (brit. Endeavour) —v. (foll. By to + infin.) Try earnestly. —n. Earnest attempt. [from *en-1, french devoir owe]

Diarrhea  n. (esp. Brit. Diarrhoea) condition of excessively frequent and loose bowel movements. [greek rheo flow]

Despoil  v. Literary (often foll. By of) plunder; rob; deprive.  despoliation n. [latin: related to *spoil]

Unprintable  adj. Too offensive or indecent to be printed.

Bottle  —n. 1 container, esp. Glass or plastic, for storing liquid. 2 amount filling it. 3 baby's feeding-bottle. 4 = *hot-water bottle. 5 metal cylinder for liquefied gas. 6 slang courage. —v. (-ling) 1 put into, or preserve in, bottles or jars. 2 (foll. By up) conceal or restrain (esp. A feeling).  hit the bottle slang drink heavily. [medieval latin: related to *butt4]

Unbuckle  v. (-ling) release the buckle of (a strap, shoe, etc.).

Snot  n. Slang nasal mucus. [probably low german or dutch: related to *snout]

Edible  adj. Fit to be eaten.  edibility n. [latin edo eat]

Raver  n. Colloq. Uninhibited pleasure-loving person.

Tired  adj. 1 weary; ready for sleep. 2 (of an idea etc.) Hackneyed.  tiredly adv. Tiredness n.

Pedigree  n. 1 (often attrib.) Recorded line of descent (esp. A distinguished one) of a person or pure-bred animal. 2 genealogical table. 3 colloq. ‘life history’ of a person, thing, idea, etc.  pedigreed adj. [pedegru from french pie de grue (unrecorded) crane's foot, a mark denoting succession in pedigrees]

Retell  v. (past and past part. Retold) tell again or differently.

Porpoise  n. Sea mammal of the whale family, with a blunt rounded snout. [latin porcus pig, piscis fish]

Razor  n. Instrument with a sharp blade used in cutting hair, esp. Shaving. [french rasor: related to *raze]

Cognition  n. 1 knowing, perceiving, or conceiving as an act or faculty distinct from emotion and volition. 2 result of this.  cognitional adj. Cognitive adj. [latin cognitio: related to *cognizance]

Prompt  —adj. Acting, made, or done with alacrity; ready (prompt reply). —adv. Punctually (at six o'clock prompt). —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By to, or to + infin.) Incite; urge (prompted them to action). 2 a (also absol.) Supply a forgotten word etc. To (an actor etc.). B assist (a hesitating speaker) with a suggestion. 3 give rise to; inspire (feeling, thought, action, etc.). —n. 1 a act of prompting. B thing said to prompt an actor etc. C = *prompter. 2 computing sign on a vdu screen to show that the system is waiting for input.  promptitude n. Promptly adv. Promptness n. [latin]

Fruiterer  n. Dealer in fruit.

Estonian  —n. 1 a native or national of estonia in eastern europe. B person of estonian descent. 2 language of estonia. —adj. Of estonia, its people, or language.

Reforest  v. = *reafforest.  reforestation n.

Flyer  n. (also flier) colloq. 1 airman or airwoman. 2 thing that flies in a specified way (poor flyer). 3 fast-moving animal or vehicle. 4 ambitious or outstanding person. 5 small handbill.

Guider  n. Adult leader of guides.

Hideaway  n. Hiding-place or place of retreat.

Versus  prep. Against (esp. In law and sport). [latin: related to *verse]

Roach  n. (pl. Same or -es) small freshwater fish of the carp family. [french]

Pastiche  n. 1 picture or musical composition from or imitating various sources. 2 literary or other work composed in the style of a well-known author etc. [latin pasta *paste]

Sprinkling  n. Small sparse number or amount.

Eec  abbr. European economic community.

Usage  ec is the more correct term.

Uncooked  adj. Not cooked; raw.

Paleozoic  (brit. Palaeozoic) —adj. Of an era of geological time marked by the appearance of plants and animals, esp. Invertebrates. —n. This era. [greek zoion animal]

Hereto  adv. Formal to this matter.

Southeaster  n. South-east wind.

Nip  n. Slang offens. Japanese person. [abbreviation of nipponese from japanese nippon japan]

Thermosphere  n. Region of the atmosphere beyond the mesosphere.

Underwrite  v. (-ting; past -wrote; past part. -written) 1 a sign and accept liability under (an insurance policy, esp. On shipping etc.). B accept (liability) in this way. 2 undertake to finance or support. 3  engage to buy all the unsold stock in (a company etc.).  underwriter n.

Ramc  abbr. Royal army medical corps.

Plank  —n. 1 long flat piece of timber. 2 item in a political or other programme. —v. 1 provide or cover with planks. 2 (usu. Foll. By down) colloq. A put down or deposit roughly or violently. B pay (money) on the spot.  walk the plank hist. Be made to walk blindfold along a plank over the side of a ship to one's death in the sea. [latin planca]

Neuron  n. (also neurone) nerve-cell.

Clash  —n. 1 a loud jarring sound as of metal objects struck together. B collision. 2 a conflict. B discord of colours etc. —v. 1 (cause to) make a clashing sound. 2 collide; coincide awkwardly. 3 (often foll. By with) a come into conflict or be at variance. B (of colours) be discordant. [imitative]

Timid  adj. (timider, timidest) easily frightened; apprehensive.  timidity n. Timidly adv. [latin timeo fear]

Neighborly  adj. (brit. Neighbourly) like a good neighbour; friendly; kind.  neighbourliness n.

Curate  n. Assistant to a parish priest. [medieval latin curatus: related to *cure]

Word  —n. 1 meaningful element of speech, usu. Shown with a space on either side of it when written or printed. 2 speech, esp. As distinct from action. 3 one's promise or assurance. 4 (in sing. Or pl.) Thing said, remark, conversation. 5 (in pl.) Text of a song or an actor's part. 6 (in pl.) Angry talk (have words). 7 news, message (send word). 8 command (gave the word to begin). —v. Put into words; select words to express.  in other words expressing the same thing differently. In so many words in those very words; explicitly. In a (or one) word briefly. My (or upon my) word exclamation of surprise etc. Take a person at his or her word interpret a person's words literally. Take a person's word for it believe a person's statement without investigation etc. The word (or word of god) the bible. Word for word in exactly the same or (of translation) corresponding words.  wordless adj. [old english]

Drawback  n. Disadvantage.

Consistent  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By with) compatible or in harmony. 2 (of a person) constant to the same principles.  consistently adv. [latin: related to *consist]

Decametre  n. (us -meter) metric unit of length, equal to 10 metres.

Kj  abbr. Kilojoule(s).

Passim  adv. Throughout; at several points in a book, article, etc. [latin]

Political  adj. 1 a of or concerning the state or its government, or public affairs generally. B of or engaged in politics. 2 taking or belonging to a side in politics. 3 concerned with seeking power, status, etc. (political decision).  politically adv. [latin: related to *politic]

Loophole  n. 1 means of evading a rule etc. Without infringing it. 2 narrow vertical slit in the wall of a fort etc.

Salvage  —n. 1 rescue of property from the sea, a fire, etc. 2 property etc. So saved. 3 a saving and use of waste materials. B materials salvaged. —v. (-ging) 1 save from a wreck etc. 2 retrieve from a disaster etc. (salvaged her pride).  salvageable adj. [latin: related to *save1]

Carbohydrate  n. Energy-producing organic compound of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen (e.g. Starch, sugar).

Retrace  v. (-cing) 1 go back over (one's steps etc.). 2 trace back to a source or beginning. 3 recall the course of (a thing) in one's memory.

Mancunian  —n. Native of manchester. —adj. Of manchester. [latin mancunium]

Rebut  v. (-tt-) 1 refute or disprove (evidence or a charge). 2 force or turn back; check.  rebuttal n. [anglo-french rebuter: related to *butt1]

Cologne  n. Eau-de-cologne or similar toilet water. [abbreviation]

Eavesdrop  v. (-pp-) listen to a private conversation.  eavesdropper n.

Insentient  adj. Not sentient; inanimate.

Recusant  —n. Person who refuses submission to an authority or compliance with a regulation, esp. Hist. One who refused to attend services of the church of england. —adj. Of or being a recusant.  recusancy n. [latin recuso refuse]

Topknot  n. Knot, tuft, crest, or bow of ribbon, worn or growing on the head.

Paederasty  var. Of *pederasty.

Propagate  v. (-ting) 1 a breed (a plant, animal, etc.) From the parent stock. B (refl. Or absol.) (of a plant, animal, etc.) Reproduce itself. 2 disseminate (a belief, theory, etc.). 3 transmit (a vibration, earthquake, etc.).  propagation n. [latin propago]

Statuette  n. Small statue.

Clientele  n. 1 clients collectively. 2 customers. [french and latin: related to *client]

Hothouse  n. 1 heated (mainly glass) building for rearing tender plants. 2 environment conducive to the rapid growth or development of something.

Trappings  n.pl. 1 ornamental accessories. 2 harness of a horse, esp. When ornamental. [trap from french drap cloth]

Subdivide  v. (-ding) divide again after a first division.  subdivision n.

Bonkers  predic. Adj. Slang crazy. [origin unknown]

Continuance  n. 1 continuing in existence or operation. 2 duration.

Renown  n. Fame, high distinction. [french renomer make famous]

Decoration  n. 1 decorating. 2 thing that decorates. 3 medal etc. Worn as an honour. 4 (in pl.) Flags, tinsel, etc., put up on a festive occasion.

Skulk  v. Move stealthily; lurk, hide. [scandinavian]

Confab  colloq. —n. = confabulation (see *confabulate). —v. (-bb-) = *confabulate. [abbreviation]

Unrewarding  adj. Not rewarding or satisfying.

Mandolin  n.  A kind of lute with paired metal strings plucked with a plectrum.  mandolinist n. [french from italian]

Paraffin  n. 1 inflammable waxy or oily hydrocarbon distilled from petroleum or shale, used in liquid form (also paraffin oil) esp. As a fuel. 2 chem. = *alkane. [latin, = having little affinity]

Flannelette  n. Napped cotton fabric like flannel.

Dais  n. Low platform, usu. At the upper end of a hall. [latin *discus disc, (later) table]

Eel  n. Snakelike fish. [old english]

Fecund  adj. 1 prolific, fertile. 2 fertilizing.  fecundity n. [latin]

Conjugation  n. Gram. System of verbal inflection.

Corkscrew  —n. 1 spiral device for extracting corks from bottles. 2 (often attrib.) Thing with a spiral shape. —v. Move spirally; twist.

Furlough  —n. Leave of absence, esp. Military. —v. Us 1 grant furlough to. 2 spend furlough. [dutch: related to *for-, *leave1]

Antipodes  n.pl. Places diametrically opposite to one another on the earth, esp. (also antipodes) australasia in relation to europe.  antipodean adj. & n. [greek, = having the feet opposite]

Relative  —adj. 1 considered in relation to something else (relative velocity). 2 (foll. By to) proportioned to (something else) (growth is relative to input). 3 implying comparison or contextual relation (‘heat’ is a relative word). 4 comparative (their relative merits). 5 having mutual relations; corresponding in some way; related to each other. 6 (foll. By to) having reference or relating to (the facts relative to the issue). 7 gram. A (of a word, esp. A pronoun) referring to an expressed or implied antecedent and attaching a subordinate clause to it, e.g. Which, who. B (of a clause) attached to an antecedent by a relative word. —n. 1 person connected by blood or marriage. 2 species related to another by common origin. 3 gram. Relative word, esp. A pronoun.  relatively adv. [latin: related to *refer]

Curriculum  n. (pl. -la) subjects included in a course of study. [latin, = course]

Pickax  n. (brit. Pickaxe) = *pick2 1. [french: related to *pike]

Fructose  n. Sugar in honey, fruits, etc. [latin: related to *fruit]

Rebel  —n. 1 person who fights against, resists, or refuses allegiance to, the established government. 2 person or thing that resists authority or control. —attrib. Adj. 1 rebellious. 2 of rebels. 3 in rebellion. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) (usu. Foll. By against) 1 act as a rebel; revolt. 2 feel or display repugnance. [latin: related to *re-, bellum war]

Worm  —n. 1 any of various types of creeping invertebrate animals with long slender bodies and no limbs. 2 larva of an insect, esp. In fruit or wood. 3 (in pl.) Intestinal parasites. 4 insignificant or contemptible person. 5 spiral part of a screw. —v. 1 (often refl.) Move with a crawling motion. 2 refl. (foll. By into) insinuate oneself into favour etc. 3 (foll. By out) obtain (a secret etc.) By cunning persistence. 4 rid (a dog etc.) Of worms. [old english]

Nth  see *n1.

Harrow  —n. Heavy frame with iron teeth dragged over ploughed land to break up clods etc. —v. 1 draw a harrow over (land). 2 (usu. As harrowing adj.) Distress greatly. [old norse hervi]

Panama  n. Straw hat with a brim and indented crown. [panama in central america]

Rip  abbr. May he, she, or they rest in peace. [latin requiesca(n)t in pace]

Trichinosis  n. Disease caused by hairlike worms usu. Ingested in meat. [greek thrix trikh- hair]

Schist  n. Layered crystalline rock. [greek skhizo to split]

Colleen  n. Ir. Girl. [irish cailín]

Closure  n. 1 closing. 2 closed state. 3 procedure for ending a debate and taking a vote. [latin: related to *close2]

Smoothie  n. Colloq., often derog. Smooth person.

Primp  v. 1 make (the hair, clothes, etc.) Tidy. 2 refl. Make (oneself) smart. [var. Of *prim]

Pigskin  n. 1 hide of a pig. 2 leather made from this.

Dribble  —v. (-ling) 1 allow saliva to flow from the mouth. 2 flow or allow to flow in drops. 3 (also absol.) Esp. Football & hockey move (the ball) forward with slight touches of the feet or stick. —n. 1 act of dribbling. 2 dribbling flow. [obsolete drib = *drip]

Inspiration  n. 1 a creative force or influence. B person etc. Stimulating creativity etc. C divine influence, esp. On the writing of scripture etc. 2 sudden brilliant idea.  inspirational adj.

Saurian  adj. Of or like a lizard. [greek saura lizard]

Dressy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. (of clothes or a person) smart, elaborate, elegant.  dressiness n.

Naturalism  n. 1 theory or practice in art and literature of realistic representation. 2 a theory of the world that excludes the supernatural or spiritual. B moral or religious system based on this.  naturalistic adj.

Confident  adj. Feeling or showing confidence; bold.  confidently adv. [italian: related to *confide]

Nictitate  v. (-ting) blink or wink.  nictitation n. [latin]

Late  —adj. 1 after the due or usual time; occurring or done after the proper time. 2 a far on in the day or night or in a specified period. B far on in development. 3 flowering or ripening towards the end of the season. 4 no longer alive; no longer having the specified status, former (my late husband; the late prime minister). 5 of recent date. —adv. 1 after the due or usual time. 2 far on in time. 3 at or till a late hour. 4 at a late stage of development. 5 formerly but not now (late of the scillies).  late in the day colloq. At a late stage in the proceedings.  lateness n. [old english]

Foreleg  n. Front leg of an animal.

Undulate  v. (-ting) (cause to) have a wavy motion or look.  undulation n. [latin unda wave]

Redpoll  n. Finch with a red forehead, similar to a linnet.

Zephyr  n.  Literary mild gentle breeze.  [greek, = west wind]

Cyclotron  n. Apparatus for the acceleration of charged atomic and subatomic particles revolving in a magnetic field.

Matchless  adj. Incomparable.

Conceivable  adj. Capable of being grasped or imagined.  conceivably adv.

Penicillin  n. Antibiotic, produced naturally by mould or synthetically. [latin penicillum: related to *pencil]

Foreigner  n. Person born in or coming from another country.

Pheasant  n. Long-tailed game-bird. [greek phasianos of phasis, name of a river associated with the bird]

Concern  —v. 1 a be relevant or important to. B relate to; be about. 2 (refl.; often foll. By with, about, in) interest or involve oneself. 3 worry, affect. —n. 1 anxiety, worry. 2 a matter of interest or importance to one. B interest, connection (has a concern in politics). 3 business, firm. 4 colloq. Complicated thing, contrivance. [latin cerno sift]

Hmso  abbr. Her (or his) majesty's stationery office.

Manuscript  —n. 1 text written by hand. 2 author's handwritten or typed text. 3 handwritten form (produced in manuscript). —adj. Written by hand. [medieval latin manuscriptus written by hand]

Subcontinent  n. Large land mass, smaller than a continent.

Stormy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of or affected by storms. 2 (of a wind etc.) Violent. 3 full of angry feeling or outbursts (stormy meeting).  stormily adv. Storminess n.

Undeveloped  adj. Not developed.

Transistor  n. 1 semiconductor device with three connections, capable of amplification in addition to rectification. 2 (in full transistor radio) portable radio with transistors. [from *transfer, *resistor]

Persecute  v. (-ting) 1 subject (a person etc.) To hostility or ill-treatment, esp. On grounds of political or religious belief. 2 harass, worry.  persecution n. Persecutor n. [latin persequor -secut- pursue]

Barren  adj. (-er, -est) 1 a unable to bear young. B (of land, a tree, etc.) Unproductive. 2 unprofitable, dull.  barrenness n. [french]

Knack  n. 1 acquired faculty or trick of doing a thing. 2 habit (a knack of offending people). [origin unknown]

Waterfowl  n. (usu. Collect. As pl.) Birds frequenting water.

Thanksgiving  n. 1 expression of gratitude, esp. To god. 2 (thanksgiving or thanksgiving day) fourth thursday in november (a national holiday in the us).

Fillet  —n. 1 a boneless piece of meat or fish. B (in full fillet steak) undercut of a sirloin. 2 ribbon etc. Binding the hair. 3 thin narrow strip or ridge. 4 narrow flat band between mouldings. —v. (-t-) 1 remove bones from (fish or meat) or divide into fillets. 2 bind or provide with fillet(s). [latin filum thread]

Milliard  n. One thousand million. [french mille thousand]

Usage  milliard is now largely superseded by billion.

Boarder  n. 1 person who boards, esp. At a boarding-school. 2 person who boards a ship, esp. An enemy.

Quibble  —n. 1 petty objection; trivial point of criticism. 2 evasion; argument relying on ambiguity. 3 archaic pun. —v. (-ling) use quibbles.  quibbling adj. [origin uncertain]

Sag  —v. (-gg-) 1 sink or subside, esp. Unevenly. 2 have a downward bulge or curve in the middle. 3 fall in price. —n. State or extent of sagging.  saggy adj. [low german or dutch]

Peal  —n. 1 a loud ringing of a bell or bells, esp. A series of changes. B set of bells. 2 loud repeated sound, esp. Of thunder, laughter, etc. —v. 1 (cause to) sound in a peal. 2 utter sonorously. [from *appeal]

Bumble  v. (-ling) 1 (foll. By on) speak in a rambling way. 2 (often as bumbling adj.) Be inept; blunder. [from *boom1]

Tearaway  n. Colloq. Unruly young person.

Supervise  v. (-sing) superintend, oversee.  supervision n. Supervisor n. Supervisory adj. [latin supervideo -vis-]

Hurrah  int. & n. (also hurray) exclamation of joy or approval. [earlier huzza, origin uncertain]

Only  —adv. 1 solely, merely, exclusively; and no one or nothing more besides (needed six only; is only a child). 2 no longer ago than (saw them only yesterday). 3 not until (arrives only on tuesday). 4 with no better result than (hurried home only to find her gone). —attrib. Adj. 1 existing alone of its or their kind (their only son). 2 best or alone worth considering (the only place to eat). —conj. Colloq. Except that; but (i would go, only i feel ill). [old english: related to *one]

Usage  in informal english only is usually placed between the subject and verb regardless of what it refers to (e.g. I only want to talk to you); in more formal english it is often placed more exactly, esp. To avoid ambiguity (e.g. I want to talk only to you). In speech, intonation usually serves to clarify the sense.

Auk  n. Black and white sea bird with short wings, e.g. The guillemot, puffin, etc. [old norse]

Moody  —adj. (-ier, -iest) given to changes of mood; gloomy, sullen. —n. (pl. -ies) colloq. Bad mood; tantrum.  moodily adv. Moodiness n. [related to *mood1]

Naturalist  n. 1 person who studies natural history. 2 adherent of naturalism.

Eclectic  —adj. Selecting ideas, style, etc., from various sources. —n. Eclectic person or philosopher.  eclectically adv. Eclecticism n. [greek eklego pick out]

Communicate  v. (-ting) 1 impart, transmit (news, heat, motion, feelings, disease, ideas, etc.). 2 succeed in conveying information. 3 (often foll. By with) relate socially; have dealings. 4 be connected (they have communicating rooms).  communicator n. Communicatory adj. [latin: related to *common]

Removal  n. 1 removing or being removed. 2 transfer of furniture etc. On moving house.

Adumbrate  v. (-ting) 1 indicate faintly or in outline. 2 foreshadow. 3 overshadow.  adumbration n. [latin: related to *ad-, umbra shade]

Depressant  —adj. Reducing activity, esp. Of a body function. —n. Depressant substance.

Pastille  n. Small sweet or lozenge. [french from latin]

Indecisive  adj. 1 (of a person) not decisive; hesitating. 2 not conclusive (an indecisive battle).  indecisively adv. Indecisiveness n.

Upright  —adj. 1 erect, vertical. 2 (of a piano) with vertical strings. 3 honourable or honest. —n. 1 upright post or rod, esp. As a structural support. 2 upright piano. [old english]

Kingpin  n. 1 main, large, or vertical bolt, esp. As a pivot. 2 essential person or thing.

Dissipation  n. 1 dissolute way of life. 2 dissipating or being dissipated.

Locus  n. (pl. Loci) 1 position or locality. 2 line or curve etc. Formed by all the points satisfying certain conditions, or by the defined motion of a point, line, or surface. [latin, = place]

Incorporate  —v. (-ting) 1 include as a part or ingredient (incorporated all the latest features). 2 (often foll. By in, with) unite (in one body). 3 admit as a member of a company etc. 4 (esp. As incorporated adj.) Form into a legal corporation. —adj. Incorporated.  incorporation n. [latin corpus body]

Revolver  n. Pistol with revolving chambers enabling several shots to be fired without reloading.

Freedman  n. Emancipated slave.

Persuade  v. (-ding) 1 (often foll. By of or that) cause (another person or oneself) to believe; convince. 2 (often foll. By to + infin.) Induce.  persuadable adj. Persuasible adj. [latin persuadeo -suas- induce]

Centiliter  n. (brit. Centilitre) 0.01 litre.

Humorist  n. Humorous writer, talker, or actor.

Mg  symb. Magnesium.

Chancellery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 chancellor's department, staff, or residence. 2 us office attached to an embassy or consulate.

Workman  n. 1 man employed to do manual labour. 2 person with regard to skill in a job (a good workman).

Crossbar  n. Horizontal bar, esp. That on a man's bicycle.

Respecting  prep. With regard to; concerning.

Neddy  n. (pl. -ies) colloq. 1 donkey. 2 (neddy) = *nedc. [pet form of edward]

Slick  —adj. Colloq. 1 a skilful or efficient. B superficially or pretentiously smooth and dexterous; glib. 2 sleek, smooth. —n. Large patch of oil etc., esp. On the sea. —v. Colloq. 1 (usu. Foll. By back, down) flatten (one's hair etc.). 2 (usu. Foll. By up) make sleek or smart.  slickly adv. Slickness n. [old english]

Trapdoor  n. Door in a floor, ceiling, or roof.

Residual  —adj. Left as a residue or residuum. —n. Residual quantity.

Octo-  comb. Form (also oct- before a vowel) eight. [see *octa-]

Milady  n. (pl. -ies) (esp. As a form of address) english noblewoman. [french from my lady]

Result  —n. 1 consequence, issue, or outcome of something. 2 satisfactory outcome (gets results). 3 end product of calculation. 4 (in pl.) List of scores or winners etc. In examinations or sporting events. —v. 1 (often foll. By from) arise as the actual, or follow as a logical, consequence. 2 (often foll. By in) have a specified end or outcome (resulted in a large profit). [latin resulto spring back]

Dun  —adj. Greyish-brown. —n. 1 dun colour. 2 dun horse. [old english]

Mischance  n. 1 bad luck. 2 instance of this. [french: related to *mis-2]

Diaphragm  n. 1 muscular partition between the thorax and abdomen in mammals. 2 = *dutch cap. 3 a photog. Plate or disc pierced with a circular hole to cut off marginal beams of light. B vibrating disc in a microphone, telephone, loudspeaker, etc. 4 device for varying the lens aperture in a camera etc. 5 thin sheet as a partition etc. [greek phragma fence]

Historical  adj. 1 of or concerning history (historical evidence). 2 (of the study of a subject) showing its development over a period. 3 factual, not fictional or legendary. 4 belonging to the past, not the present. 5 (of a novel etc.) Dealing with historical events.  historically adv.

Irrigate  v. (-ting) 1 a water (land) by means of channels etc. B (of a stream etc.) Supply (land) with water. 2 supply (a wound etc.) With a constant flow of liquid.  irrigable adj. Irrigation n. Irrigator n. [latin rigo moisten]

Tripod  n. 1 three-legged stand for a camera etc. 2 stool, table, or utensil resting on three feet or legs. [greek, = three-footed]

Terbium  n. Silvery metallic element of the lanthanide series. [ytterby in sweden]

Jobber  n. 1 person who jobs. 2 hist. Principal or wholesaler on the stock exchange.

Usage  up to oct. 1986 jobbers were permitted to deal only with brokers, not directly with the public. From oct. 1986 the name ceased to be in official use (see *broker 2).

Powwow  —n. Meeting for discussion (orig. Among n. American indians). —v. Hold a powwow. [algonquian]

Cranium  n. (pl. -s or -nia) 1 skull. 2 part of the skeleton enclosing the brain.  cranial adj. Craniology n. [medieval latin from greek]

Undated  adj. Without a date.

Unseeded  adj. Sport (of a player) not seeded.

Invoice  —n. Bill for usu. Itemized goods or services. —v. (-cing) 1 send an invoice to. 2 make an invoice of. [earlier invoyes pl. Of invoy: related to *envoy]

Famish  v. (usu. In passive) make or become extremely hungry.  be famished (or famishing) colloq. Be very hungry. [romanic: related to *famine]

Ming  n. (often attrib.) Chinese porcelain made during the ming dynasty (1368–1644).

Spirited  adj. 1 lively, courageous. 2 (in comb.) In a specified mood (high-spirited).  spiritedly adv.

Reimpose  v. (-sing) impose again, esp. After a lapse.
