Fox  —n. 1 a wild canine animal with a bushy tail and red or grey fur. B its fur. 2 cunning person. —v. 1 deceive, baffle, trick. 2 (usu. As foxed adj.) Discolour (leaves of a book etc.) With brownish marks.  foxlike adj. [old english]

Dewdrop  n. Drop of dew.

Medication  n. 1 = *medicine 2. 2 treatment using drugs.

Announcer  n. Person who announces, esp. In broadcasting.

Meiosis  n. (pl. Meioses) 1 cell division that results in gametes with half the normal chromosome number. 2 = *litotes. [greek meion less]

Overbid  —v. (-dd-; past and past part. -bid) make a higher bid than. —n. Bid that is higher than another, or higher than is justified.

Solidity  n. Being solid; firmness.

Unbar  v. (-rr-) 1 unlock, open. 2 remove a bar from (a gate etc.).

Sacrum  n. (pl. Sacra or -s) triangular bone between the two hip-bones. [latin os sacrum sacred bone]

Bayberry  n. (pl. -ies) fragrant n. American tree.

Cyanosis  n. Bluish skin due to oxygen-deficient blood.

English  —adj. Of england or its people or language. —n. 1 language of england, now used in the uk, us, and most commonwealth countries. 2 (prec. By the; treated as pl.) The people of england. [old english]

Farce  n. 1 a low comedy with a ludicrously improbable plot. B this branch of drama. 2 absurdly futile proceedings; pretence.  farcical adj. [latin farcio to stuff, used metaphorically of interludes etc.]

Maharanee  n. (also maharani) (pl. -s) hist. Maharaja's wife or widow. [hindi, = great ranee]

Carbine  n. Short rifle orig. For cavalry use. [french]

Scrotum  n. (pl. Scrota or -s) pouch of skin containing the testicles.  scrotal adj. [latin]

Chosen  past part. Of *choose.

Mn  symb. Manganese.

Metatarsus  n. (pl. -tarsi) 1 part of the foot between the ankle and the toes. 2 set of five bones in this.  metatarsal adj. [related to *meta-, *tarsus]

Reign  —v. 1 be king or queen. 2 prevail (confusion reigns). 3 (as reigning attrib. Adj.) (of a winner, champion, etc.) Currently holding the title etc. —n. 1 sovereignty, rule. 2 period during which a sovereign rules.

Pygmy  n. (also pigmy) (pl. -ies) (often attrib.) 1 member of a dwarf people of esp. Equatorial africa. 2 very small person, animal, or thing. 3 insignificant person. [latin from greek]

Statesman  n. (fem. Stateswoman) distinguished and capable politician or diplomat.  statesmanlike adj. Statesmanship n.

Mongolian  —n. 1 native or inhabitant of mongolia. 2 language of mongolia. —adj. Of or relating to mongolia or its people or language.

Quickie  n. Colloq. Thing done or made quickly.

Spiritual  —adj. 1 of the spirit or soul (spiritual relationship; spiritual home). 2 religious, divine, inspired. 3 refined, sensitive. —n. (also negro spiritual) religious song orig. Of american blacks.  spirituality n. Spiritually adv.

Lacquer  —n. 1 varnish made of shellac or a synthetic substance. 2 substance sprayed on the hair to keep it in place. —v. Coat with lacquer. [french lacre *lac]

Piquant  adj. 1 agreeably pungent, sharp, or appetizing. 2 pleasantly stimulating to the mind.  piquancy n. [french piquer prick]

Ramekin  n. 1 small dish for baking and serving an individual portion of food. 2 food served in this. [french ramequin]

Parfait  n. 1 rich iced pudding of whipped cream, eggs, etc. 2 layers of ice-cream, meringue, etc., served in a tall glass. [french parfait *perfect]

Washer  n. 1 person or machine that washes. 2 flat ring inserted at a joint to tighten it and prevent leakage or under the head of a screw etc., or under a nut, to disperse its pressure.

Hmg  abbr. Her (or his) majesty's government.

Avocado  n. (pl. -s) 1 (in full avocado pear) dark green edible pear-shaped fruit with yellowish-green creamy flesh. 2 tree bearing it. [spanish from aztec]

Reiterate  v. (-ting) say or do again or repeatedly.  reiteration n.

Precondition  n. Condition that must be fulfilled in advance.

Stooge  colloq. —n. 1 butt or foil, esp. For a comedian. 2 assistant or subordinate, esp. For routine or unpleasant work. —v. (-ging) 1 (foll. By for) act as a stooge for. 2 (foll. By about, around, etc.) Move about aimlessly. [origin unknown]

Satinwood  n. A kind of yellow glossy timber.

Athletic  adj. 1 of athletes or athletics. 2 physically strong or agile.  athletically adv. Athleticism n. [latin: related to *athlete]

Ghetto  n. (pl. -s) 1 part of a city occupied by a minority group. 2 hist. Jewish quarter in a city. 3 segregated group or area. [italian]

Materialize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 become actual fact; happen. 2 colloq. Appear or be present. 3 represent in or assume bodily form.  materialization n.

Cephalic  adj. Of or in the head. [greek kephale head]

Kgb  n. State security police of the former ussr. [russian abbreviation, = committee of state security]

Grease  —n. 1 oily or fatty matter, esp. As a lubricant. 2 melted fat of a dead animal. —v. (-sing) smear or lubricate with grease.  grease the palm of colloq. Bribe. [latin crassus (adj.) Fat]

Handbrake  n. Brake operated by hand.

Unpronounceable  adj. That cannot be pronounced.

Butane  n. Gaseous alkane hydrocarbon, used in liquefied form as fuel. [from *butyl]

Term  —n. 1 word for a definite concept, esp. Specialized (technical term). 2 (in pl.) Language used; mode of expression (in no uncertain terms). 3 (in pl.) Relation, footing (on good terms). 4 (in pl.) A stipulations (accepts your terms). B charge or price (reasonable terms). 5 a limited, usu. Specified, period (term of five years; in the short term). B period of weeks during which instruction is given or during which a lawcourt holds sessions. 6 logic word or words that may be the subject or predicate of a proposition. 7 math. A each of the quantities in a ratio or series. B part of an algebraic expression. 8 completion of a normal length of pregnancy. —v. Call, name (was termed a bigot).  bring to terms cause to accept conditions. Come to terms yield, give way. Come to terms with reconcile oneself to (a difficulty etc.). In terms of in the language peculiar to; referring to.  termly adj. & adv. [latin *terminus]

Zombie  n. 1 colloq. Person who acts mechanically or lifelessly. 2 corpse said to have been revived by witchcraft. [west african]

Pyrotechnics  n.pl. 1 art of making fireworks. 2 display of fireworks. 3 any brilliant display.  pyrotechnic adj.

Nasturtium  n. Trailing plant with edible leaves and bright orange, yellow, or red flowers. [latin]

Shelduck  n. (pl. Same or -s; masc. Sheldrake, pl. Same or -s) bright-plumaged wild duck. [probably from dial. Sheld pied, *duck1]

Scene  n. 1 place in which events, real or fictional, occur. 2 a incident, real or fictional. B description of this. 3 public display of emotion, temper, etc. (made a scene in the restaurant). 4 a continuous portion of a play in a fixed setting; subdivision of an act. B similar section of a film, book, etc. 5 a piece of scenery used in a play. B these collectively. 6 landscape or view. 7 colloq. A area of interest (not my scene). B milieu (well-known on the jazz scene).  behind the scenes 1 offstage. 2 secret; secretly. Set the scene describe the location of events. [greek skene tent, stage]

Irreligious  adj. Lacking or hostile to religion; irreverent.

Dromedary  n. (pl. -ies) one-humped (esp. Arabian) camel bred for riding. [greek dromas -ados runner]

Rationalism  n. Practice of treating reason as the basis of belief and knowledge.  rationalist n. & adj. Rationalistic adj.

Incommunicable  adj. That cannot be communicated.

Hanging  n. 1 execution by suspending by the neck. 2 (usu. In pl.) Draperies hung on a wall etc.

Grip  —v. (-pp-) 1 a grasp tightly. B take a firm hold, esp. By friction. 2 compel the attention of. —n. 1 a firm hold; tight grasp. B manner of grasping or holding. 2 power of holding attention. 3 a intellectual mastery. B effective control of one's behaviour etc. (lose one's grip). 4 a part of a machine that grips. B part by which a weapon etc. Is held. 5 = *hairgrip. 6 travelling bag.  come (or get) to grips with approach purposefully; begin to deal with. [old english]

Discourteous  adj. Lacking courtesy.  discourteously adv. Discourtesy n. (pl. -ies).

Chronometer  n. Time-measuring instrument, esp. One used in navigation. [from *chronology, *-meter]

Outflank  v. 1 extend beyond the flank of (an enemy). 2 outmanoeuvre, outwit.

Mu  n. 1 twelfth greek letter (m, m). 2 (m, as a symbol) = *micro- 2. [greek]

Demote  v. (-ting) reduce to a lower rank or class.  demotion n. [from *de-, *promote]

Pavlova  n. Meringue cake with cream and fruit. [pavlova, name of a ballerina]

Oversight  n. 1 failure to do or notice something. 2 inadvertent mistake. 3 supervision.

Retard  v. 1 make slow or late. 2 delay the progress or accomplishment of.  retardant adj. & n. Retardation n. [latin tardus slow]

Linage  n. 1 number of lines in printed or written matter. 2 payment by the line.

Houseman  n. Resident junior doctor at a hospital etc.

Pennywort  n. Wild plant with rounded leaves, growing esp. In marshy places.

Forethought  n. 1 care or provision for the future. 2 deliberate intention.

Pigmy  var. Of *pygmy.

Ethanal  n. = *acetaldehyde.

Lug  —v. (-gg-) 1 drag or carry with effort. 2 pull hard. —n. 1 hard or rough pull. 2 colloq. Ear. 3 projection on an object by which it may be carried, fixed in place, etc. [probably scandinavian]

Coal  n. 1 hard black rock, mainly carbonized plant matter, found underground and used as a fuel. 2 piece of this, esp. One that is burning.  coals to newcastle something brought to a place where it is already plentiful. Haul (or call) over the coals reprimand. [old english]

Infallible  adj. 1 incapable of error. 2 unfailing; sure to succeed. 3 (of the pope) incapable of doctrinal error.  infallibility n. Infallibly adv.

Ventilate  v. (-ting) 1 cause air to circulate freely in (a room etc.). 2 air (a question, grievance, etc.). 3 med. A oxygenate (the blood). B admit or force air into (the lungs).  ventilation n. [latin ventilo blow, winnow: related to *vent1]

Unscarred  adj. Not scarred or damaged.

Sojourn  —n. Temporary stay. —v. Stay temporarily. [french sojorner]

Criminology  n. The study of crime.  criminologist n.

Garrison  —n. Troops stationed in a town etc. To defend it. —v. (-n-) 1 provide with or occupy as a garrison. 2 place on garrison duty. [french garir defend, from germanic]

Accumulator  n. 1 rechargeable electric cell. 2 bet placed on a sequence of events, with the winnings and stake from each placed on the next.

Jcr  abbr. Junior common (or combination) room.

Placate  v. (-ting) pacify; conciliate.  placatory adj. [latin placo appease]

Ziggurat  n. Rectangular stepped tower in ancient mesopotamia, surmounted by a temple. [assyrian]

Failed  adj. Unsuccessful (failed actor).

Encapsulate  v. (-ting) 1 enclose in or as in a capsule. 2 express briefly, summarize.  encapsulation n. [related to *capsule]

Sodomite  n. Person who practises sodomy. [greek: related to *sodomy]

Botany  n. The study of plants.  botanic adj. Botanical adj. Botanist n. [greek botane plant]

Signboard  n. Board displaying a name or symbol etc. Outside a shop or hotel etc.

Yankee  n. Colloq. 1 often derog. = *yank. 2 us inhabitant of new england or of the northern states. [origin uncertain: perhaps from dutch janke, diminutive of jan john, as a nickname]

Rsc  abbr. Royal shakespeare company.

Traveller  n. (us traveler) 1 person who travels or is travelling. 2 travelling salesman. 3 gypsy.

Oligarchy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 government, or state governed, by a small group of people. 2 members of such a government.  oligarchic adj. Oligarchical adj.

Unceasing  adj. Not ceasing; continuous (unceasing effort).

Panegyric  n. Eulogy; speech or essay of praise. [greek agora assembly]

Anglicism  n. Peculiarly english word or custom. [latin anglicus: related to *angle]

Seasoning  n. Salt, herbs, etc. Added to food to enhance its flavour.

Splashdown  n. Landing of a spacecraft on the sea.  splash down v.

Rebuff  —n. 1 rejection of one who makes advances, proffers help, shows interest, makes a request, etc. 2 snub. —v. Give a rebuff to. [french from italian]

Inaugural  —adj. Of or for an inauguration. —n. Inaugural speech, lecture, etc. [french from latin auguro take omens: related to *augur]

Swell  —v. (past part. Swollen or swelled) 1 (cause to) grow bigger, louder, or more intense. 2 (often foll. By up) rise or raise up from the surrounding surface. 3 (foll. By out) bulge. 4 (of the heart etc.) Feel full of joy, pride, relief, etc. 5 (foll. By with) be hardly able to restrain (pride etc.). —n. 1 act or state of swelling. 2 heaving of the sea with unbreaking waves. 3 a crescendo. B mechanism in an organ etc. For producing a crescendo or diminuendo. 4 colloq. Dandy. 5 protuberance. —adj. Colloq. 1 esp. Us fine, excellent. 2 smart, fashionable.  have (or get) a swelled (or swollen) head be (or become) conceited. [old english]

Gnomon  n. Rod or pin etc. On a sundial, showing the time by its shadow. [greek, = indicator]

Magnetism  n. 1 a magnetic phenomena and their science. B property of producing these. 2 attraction; personal charm.

Hostage  n. Person seized or held as security for the fulfilment of a condition. [latin obses obsidis hostage]

Illicit  adj. Unlawful, forbidden.  illicitly adv.

Glengarry  n. (pl. -ies) brimless scottish hat cleft down the centre and with ribbons at the back. [glengarry in scotland]

Excrement  n. Faeces.  excremental adj. [latin: related to *excrete]

Abut  v. (-tt-) 1 (foll. By on) (of land) border on. 2 (foll. By on, against) (of a building) touch or lean upon (another). [anglo-latin butta strip of land: related to *butt1]

Prevalent  adj. 1 generally existing or occurring. 2 predominant.  prevalence n. [related to *prevail]

Quaint  adj. Attractively odd or old-fashioned.  quaintly adv. Quaintness n.  [french cointe from latin cognosco ascertain]

Bouncer  n. 1 slang doorman ejecting troublemakers from a dancehall, club, etc. 2 = *bumper 3.

Poster  n. 1 placard in a public place. 2 large printed picture.

Fortuitous  adj. Happening by esp. Lucky chance; accidental.  fortuitously adv. Fortuitousness n. Fortuity n. (pl. -ies). [latin forte by chance]

Scintilla  n. Trace. [latin, = spark]

Arbutus  n. Tree or shrub with clusters of flowers and strawberry-like berries. [latin]

Digital  adj. 1 of digits. 2 (of a clock, watch, etc.) Giving a reading by displayed digits. 3 (of a computer) operating on data represented by a series of digits. 4 (of a recording) with sound-information represented by digits for more reliable transmission.  digitally adv. [latin: related to *digit]

Cyclone  n. 1 winds rotating inwards to an area of low barometric pressure; depression. 2 violent hurricane of limited diameter.  cyclonic adj. [greek kukloma wheel]

Boyfriend  n. Person's regular male companion or lover.

Fossil  —n. 1 remains or impression of a (usu. Prehistoric) plant or animal hardened in rock. 2 colloq. Antiquated or unchanging person or thing. —attrib. Adj. Of or like a fossil; antiquated.  fossilize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). Fossilization n. [latin fodio foss- dig]

Complicate  v. (-ting) 1 make difficult or complex. 2 (as complicated adj.) Complex; intricate. [latin plico to fold]

Anxious  adj. 1 mentally troubled. 2 causing or marked by anxiety (anxious moment). 3 eager, uneasily wanting (anxious to please).  anxiously adv. [latin anxius]

Rapine  n. Rhet. Plundering. [latin: related to *rape1]

Lady  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a woman regarded as being of superior social status or as having refined manners. B (lady) title of peeresses, female relatives of peers, the wives and widows of knights, etc. 2 (often attrib.) Woman; female (ask that lady; lady butcher). 3 colloq. Wife, girlfriend. 4 ruling woman (lady of the house). 5 (the ladies or ladies') women's public lavatory. [old english, = loaf-kneader]

Chum  n. Colloq. Close friend.  chum up (-mm-) (often foll. By with) become a close friend (of).  chummy adj. (-ier, -iest). Chummily adv. Chumminess n. [abbreviation of chamber-fellow]

Alfalfa  n. Clover-like plant used for fodder. [arabic, = a green fodder]

Wintertime  n. Season or period of winter.

Pitiless  adj. Showing no pity (pitiless heat).  pitilessly adv.

Cession  n. 1 ceding. 2 territory etc. Ceded. [latin: related to *cede]

Obstruction  n. 1 obstructing or being obstructed. 2 thing that obstructs, blockage. 3 sport act of unlawfully obstructing another player.

Panacea  n. Universal remedy. [greek: related to *pan-, akos remedy]

-ery  suffix (also -ry) forming nouns denoting: 1 class or kind (greenery; machinery; citizenry). 2 employment; state or condition (dentistry; slavery). 3 place of work or cultivation or breeding (brewery; rookery). 4 behaviour (mimicry). 5 often derog. All that has to do with (popery). [french -erie]

Incisive  adj. 1 sharp. 2 clear and effective.

Unwarrantable  adj. Unjustifiable.  unwarrantably adv.

Luxuriate  v. (-ting) 1 (foll. By in) take self-indulgent delight in, enjoy as a luxury. 2 relax in comfort.

Amnesia  n. Loss of memory.  amnesiac n. [latin from greek]

Lea  abbr. Local education authority.

Baptistery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a part of a church used for baptism. B hist. Separate building used for baptism. 2 (in a baptist chapel) receptacle used for immersion.

Seize  v. (-zing) 1 (often foll. By on, upon) take hold of forcibly or suddenly. 2  take possession of forcibly or by legal power. 3 affect suddenly (panic seized us). 4 (often foll. By on, upon) take advantage of (an opportunity etc.). 5 (often foll. By on, upon) comprehend quickly or clearly. 6 (also seise) (usu. Foll. By of) law put in possession of.  seized (or seised) of 1 possessing legally. 2 aware or informed of. Seize up 1 (of a mechanism) become jammed. 2 (of part of the body etc.) Become stiff. [french saisir]

Feature  —n. 1 distinctive or characteristic part of a thing. 2 (usu. In pl.) Part of the face. 3 (esp. Specialized) article in a newspaper etc. 4 (in full feature film) main film in a cinema programme. —v. (-ring) 1 make a special display of; emphasize. 2 have as or be a central participant or topic in a film, broadcast, etc.  featureless adj. [latin factura formation: related to *fact]

Destruction  n. 1 destroying or being destroyed. 2 cause of this. [latin: related to *destroy]

Calcium  n. Soft grey metallic element occurring in limestone, marble, chalk, etc. [related to *calx]

Colossus  n. (pl. -ssi or -ssuses) 1 statue much bigger than life size. 2 gigantic or remarkable person etc. 3 imperial power personified. [latin from greek]

Wraparound  adj. (also wrapround) 1 (esp. Of clothing) designed to wrap round. 2 curving or extending round at the edges.

Hydrophilic  adj. 1 having an affinity for water. 2 wettable by water. [greek philos loving]

Panicle  n.  Loose branching cluster of flowers, as in oats. [latin paniculum diminutive of panus thread]

Interracial  adj. Between or affecting different races.

Metamorphose  v. (-sing) (often foll. By to, into) change in form or nature.

Mistrust  —v. 1 be suspicious of. 2 feel no confidence in. —n. 1 suspicion. 2 lack of confidence.  mistrustful adj. Mistrustfully adv.

Instill  v. (brit. Instil) (-ll-) (often foll. By into) 1 introduce (a feeling, idea, etc.) Into a person's mind etc. Gradually. 2 put (a liquid) into something in drops.  instillation n. Instilment n. [latin stillo drop]

Sensual  adj. 1 a of physical, esp. Sexual, pleasure. B enjoying or giving this, voluptuous. 2 showing sensuality (sensual lips).  sensualism n. Sensually adv. [latin: related to *sense]

Usage  sensual is sometimes confused with sensuous, which does not have the sexual overtones of sensual.

Sybarite  n. Self-indulgent or voluptuous person.  sybaritic adj. [sybaris, ancient city in s. Italy]

Tradesman  n. (fem. Tradeswoman) person engaged in trade, esp. A shopkeeper.

Appendicitis  n. Inflammation of the appendix.

Wintergreen  n. A kind of plant remaining green all winter.

Umlaut  n. 1 mark (¨) used over a vowel, esp. In germanic languages, to indicate a vowel change. 2 such a vowel change, e.g. German mann, männer, english man, men. [german]

Urology  n. The study of the urinary system.  urological adj.

Literacy  n. Ability to read and write. [latin littera letter]

Unusable  adj. Not usable.

Spellbind  v. (past and past part. Spellbound) 1 (esp. As spellbinding adj.) Hold the attention as if with a spell; entrance. 2 (as spellbound adj.) Entranced, fascinated.

Debt  n. 1 money etc. Owed (debt of gratitude). 2 state of owing (in debt; get into debt).  in a person's debt under obligation to a person. [latin debeo debit- owe]

Gaul  n. Inhabitant of ancient gaul. [french from germanic]

Assignee  n. Law person to whom a right or property is assigned.

Alpha  n. 1 first letter of the greek alphabet (a, a). 2 first-class mark for a piece of work etc.  alpha and omega beginning and end. [latin from greek]

Meager  adj. (brit. Meagre) 1 scant in amount or quality. 2 lean, thin. [anglo-french megre from latin macer]

Levitate  v. (-ting) 1 rise and float in the air (esp. With reference to spiritualism). 2 cause to do this.  levitation n. [latin levis light, after *gravitate]

Yorker  n. Cricket ball that pitches immediately under the bat. [probably with ref. To the practice of yorkshire cricketers]

Swordstick  n. Hollow walking-stick containing a blade that can be used as a sword.

Chub  n. (pl. Same) thick-bodied river fish. [origin unknown]

Interpenetrate  v. (-ting) 1 penetrate each other. 2 pervade.  interpenetration n.

Phonecard  n. Card containing prepaid units for use with a cardphone.

Reformatory  —n. (pl. -ies) us & hist. Institution for the reform of young offenders. —adj. Producing reform.

Aryan  —n. 1 speaker of any of the languages of the indo-european family. 2 improperly (in nazi ideology) non-jewish caucasian. —adj. Of aryans. [sanskrit]

Biological  adj. Of biology or living organisms.  biologically adv.

Potable  adj. Drinkable. [latin poto drink]

Frontal  adj. 1 of or on the front (frontal view; frontal attack). 2 of the forehead (frontal bone).

Coarsen  v. Make or become coarse.

Frenetic  adj. (also phrenetic) 1 frantic, frenzied. 2 fanatic.  frenetically adv. [greek phren mind]

Englishman  n. (fem. Englishwoman) person who is english by birth or descent.

Adherent  —n. Supporter. —adj. Sticking, adhering.  adherence n.

Salivate  v. (-ting) secrete saliva, esp. In excess.  salivation n. [latin salivare: related to *saliva]

Superintend  v. Supervise, direct.  superintendence n.

Newsy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Full of news.

Teletext  n. Computerized news and information service transmitted to the televisions of subscribers.

Negotiable  adj. 1 open to discussion. 2 able to be negotiated.

Mutton  n. Flesh of sheep as food. [medieval latin multo sheep]

Revolution  n. 1 forcible overthrow of a government or social order. 2 any fundamental change or reversal of conditions. 3 revolving. 4 a single completion of an orbit or rotation. B time taken for this. 5 cyclic recurrence. [latin: related to *revolve]

Ageless  adj. 1 never growing or appearing old. 2 eternal.

Litmus  n. Dye from lichens, turned red by acid and blue by alkali. [old norse, = dye-moss]

Painterly  adj. 1 characteristic of a painter or paintings; artistic. 2 (of a painting) lacking clearly defined outlines.

Devil  —n. 1 (usu. The devil) (in christian and jewish belief) supreme spirit of evil; satan. 2 a evil spirit; demon. B personified evil. 3 a wicked person. B mischievously clever person. 4 colloq. Person of a specified kind (lucky devil). 5 fighting spirit, mischievousness (devil is in him tonight). 6 colloq. Awkward thing. 7 (the devil or the devil) colloq. Used as an exclamation of surprise or annoyance (who the devil are you?). 8 literary hack. 9 junior legal counsel. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 cook (food) with hot seasoning. 2 act as devil for an author or barrister. 3 us harass, worry.  between the devil and the deep blue sea in a dilemma. A devil of colloq. Considerable, difficult, or remarkable. Devil's own colloq. Very difficult or unusual (the devil's own job). The devil to pay trouble to be expected. Speak (or talk) of the devil said when person appears just after being mentioned. [greek diabolos accuser, slanderer]

Workbox  n. Box for tools, needlework, etc.

Creditworthy  adj. Considered suitable to receive commercial credit.  creditworthiness n.

Nacho  n. (pl. -s) tortilla chip, usu. Topped with melted cheese and spices etc. [origin uncertain]

Wishbone  n. Forked bone between the neck and breast of a fowl often broken between two people, the longer portion entitling the holder to make a wish.

Popular  adj. 1 liked by many people. 2 a of or for the general public. B prevalent among the general public (popular fallacies). 3 (sometimes derog.) Adapted to the understanding, taste, or means of the people (popular science; the popular press).  popularity n. Popularly adv.

Cenotaph  n. Tomblike monument to a person whose body is elsewhere. [greek kenos empty, taphos tomb]

Auriferous  adj. Yielding gold. [latin aurifer from aurum gold]

Baboon  n. Large long-nosed african and arabian monkey. [french or medieval latin]

Describe  v. (-bing) 1 a state the characteristics, appearance, etc. Of. B (foll. By as) assert to be; call (described him as a liar). 2 a draw (esp. A geometrical figure). B move in (a specified way, esp. A curve) (described a parabola through the air). [latin scribo write]

Hawfinch  n. Large finch with a thick beak for cracking seeds. [from *haw1, *finch]

Rectangle  n. Plane figure with four straight sides and four right angles, esp. Other than a square.  rectangular adj. [french or medieval latin]

Hauteur  n. Haughtiness. [french]

Traditional  adj. 1 of, based on, or obtained by tradition. 2 (of jazz) in the style of the early 20th c.  traditionally adv.

Limousine  n. Large luxurious car. [french]

Sixer  n. 1 cricket hit for six runs. 2 brownie or cub in charge of a group of six.

Sahib  n. Hist. (in india) form of address to european man. [arabic, = lord]

Overtake  v. (-king; past -took; past part. -taken) 1 (also absol.) Catch up with and pass while travelling in the same direction. 2 (of misfortune etc.) Come suddenly upon.

Unconvinced  adj. Not convinced.

Delve  v. (-ving) 1 (often foll. By in, into) search or research energetically or deeply (delved into his pocket, his family history). 2 poet. Dig. [old english]

Dormouse  n. (pl. -mice) small mouselike hibernating rodent. [origin unknown]

Lux  n. (pl. Same)  the si unit of illumination. [latin]

Cartesian  —adj. Of descartes or his philosophy. —n. Follower of descartes. [latin cartesius descartes]

Spanking  —adj. 1 brisk. 2 colloq. Striking; excellent. —adv. Colloq. Very (spanking new). —n. Slapping on the buttocks.

Shifty  adj. Colloq. (-ier, -iest) evasive; deceitful.  shiftily adv. Shiftiness n.

Hung  past and past part. Of *hang.

Medlar  n. 1 tree bearing small brown apple-like fruits, eaten when decayed. 2 such a fruit. [french medler from greek mespile]

Drumstick  n. 1 stick for beating drums. 2 lower leg of a dressed fowl.

Oap  abbr. Old-age pensioner.

Prejudge  v. (-ging) form a premature judgement on (a person, issue, etc.).

Necessity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 indispensable thing. 2 pressure of circumstances. 3 imperative need. 4 want; poverty. 5 constraint or compulsion regarded as a natural law governing all human action.  of necessity unavoidably.

Mousetrap  n. 1 trap for catching mice. 2 (often attrib.) Colloq. Poor quality cheese.

Poet  n. (fem. Poetess) 1 writer of poems. 2 highly imaginative or expressive person. [greek poietes: related to *poem]

Fake  —n. False or counterfeit thing or person. —adj. Counterfeit; not genuine. —v. (-king) 1 make a fake or imitation of (faked my signature). 2 feign (a feeling, illness, etc.). [german fegen sweep]

Insufficient  adj. Not sufficient; inadequate.  insufficiency n. Insufficiently adv.

Investment  n. 1 investing. 2 money invested. 3 property etc. In which money is invested.

Pt  abbr. Physical training.

Troubadour  n. 1 singer or poet. 2 french medieval lyric poet singing of courtly love. [provençal trobar find, compose]

Subsoil  n. Soil immediately under the surface soil.

Expendable  adj. That may be sacrificed or dispensed with; not worth preserving or saving.

Dichromatic  adj. 1 two-coloured. 2 having vision sensitive to only two of the three primary colours.

Infilling  n. = *infill n.

Smelly  adj. (-ier, -iest) having a strong or unpleasant smell.  smelliness n.

Cabby  n. (also cabbie) (pl. -ies) colloq. Taxi-driver.

Confessor  n. Priest who hears confessions and gives spiritual counsel.

Palmistry  n. Fortune-telling from lines etc. On the palm of the hand.  palmist n.

Scholar  n. 1 learned person, academic. 2 holder of a scholarship. 3 person of specified academic ability (poor scholar).  scholarly adj. [latin: related to *school1]

Anomalous  adj. Irregular, deviant, abnormal. [greek an- not, homalos even]

Pansy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 cultivated plant with flowers of various rich colours. 2 colloq. Offens. A effeminate man. B male homosexual. [french pensée thought, pansy]

Discomfit  v. (-t-) disconcert, baffle, frustrate.  discomfiture n. [french: related to *dis-, *confection]

Usage  discomfit is sometimes confused with discomfort.

Somewhen  adv. Colloq. At some time.

Unbalanced  adj. 1 emotionally unstable. 2 biased (unbalanced report).

Surgery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 treatment of bodily injuries or disorders by incision or manipulation etc. As opposed to drugs. 2  place where or time when a doctor, dentist, etc., treats patients, or an mp, lawyer, etc., gives advice. [latin chirurgia, from greek kheir hand, ergo work]

Jagged  adj. 1 unevenly cut or torn. 2 deeply indented.  jaggedly adv. Jaggedness n.

Prong  n. Each of two or more projecting pointed parts at the end of a fork etc. [origin unknown]

Backside  n. Colloq. Buttocks.

-ory  suffix 1 forming nouns denoting a place (dormitory; refectory). 2 forming adjectives and nouns relating to or involving a verbal action (accessory; compulsory). [latin -orius, -orium]

Roofing  n. Material for a roof.

Engagement  n. 1 engaging or being engaged. 2 appointment with another person. 3 betrothal. 4 battle.

Perpendicular  —adj. 1 a (usu. Foll. By to) at right angles (to a given line, plane, or surface). B at right angles to the plane of the horizon. 2 upright, vertical. 3 (of a slope etc.) Very steep. 4 (perpendicular) archit. Of the third stage of english gothic (15th–16th c.) With vertical tracery in large windows. —n. 1 perpendicular line. 2 (prec. By the) perpendicular line or direction (is out of the perpendicular).  perpendicularity n. [latin perpendiculum plumb-line]

Decay  —v. 1 (cause to) rot or decompose. 2 decline or cause to decline in quality, power, etc. 3 (usu. Foll. By to) (of a substance) undergo change by radioactivity. —n. 1 rotten state; wasting away. 2 decline in health, quality, etc. 3 radioactive change. [latin cado fall]

Episiotomy  n. (pl. -ies) surgical cut made at the vaginal opening during childbirth, to aid delivery. [greek epision pubic region]

Whew  int. Expressing surprise, consternation, or relief. [imitative]

Skill  n. (often foll. By in) ability to do something well; technique, expertise. [old norse, = difference]

Capitalist  —n. 1 person investing or possessing capital. 2 advocate of capitalism. —adj. Of or favouring capitalism.  capitalistic adj.

Ignition  n. 1 mechanism for, or the action of, starting combustion in an internal-combustion engine. 2 igniting or being ignited.

Tardy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 slow to act, come, or happen. 2 delaying or delayed.  tardily adv. Tardiness n. [latin tardus slow]

Marketable  adj. Able or fit to be sold.  marketability n.

Seraglio  n. (pl. -s) 1 harem. 2 hist. Turkish palace. [italian serraglio from turkish]

Hairdo  n. (pl. -s) style of or act of styling the hair.

Politico  n. (pl. -s) colloq. Politician or political enthusiast. [spanish]

Trembly  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Trembling.

Unscramble  v. (-ling) make plain, decode, interpret (a scrambled transmission etc.).

Held  past and past part. Of *hold1.

Video  —adj. 1 of the recording (or reproduction) of moving pictures on magnetic tape. 2 of the broadcasting of television pictures. —n. (pl. -s) 1 such recording or broadcasting. 2 colloq. = *video recorder. 3 colloq. A film on videotape. —v. (-oes, -oed) record on videotape. [latin, = i see]

Virtuous  adj. 1 morally good. 2 archaic chaste.  virtuously adv. [latin: related to *virtue]

Fin  n. 1 (usu. Thin) flat external organ of esp. Fish, for propelling, steering, etc. (dorsal fin). 2 similar stabilizing projection on an aircraft, car, etc. 3 underwater swimmer's flipper.  finned adj. [old english]

Wanting  adj. 1 lacking (in quality or quantity); not equal to requirements. 2 absent, not supplied.

Standpipe  n. Vertical pipe extending from a water supply, esp. One connecting a temporary tap to the mains.

Shaker  n. 1 person or thing that shakes. 2 container for shaking together the ingredients of cocktails etc.

Waterspout  n. Gyrating column of water and spray between sea and cloud.

Certitude  n. Feeling of certainty. [latin: related to *certain]

Imagine  v. (-ning) 1 a form a mental image or concept of. B picture to oneself. 2 think of as probable (can't imagine he'd be so stupid). 3 guess (can't imagine what he is doing). 4 suppose (i imagine you'll need help).  imaginable adj. [latin imaginor] 

Confer  v. (-rr-) 1 (often foll. By on, upon) grant or bestow. 2 (often foll. By with) converse, consult.  conferrable adj. [latin confero collat- bring together]

Divvy  colloq. —n. (pl. -ies) dividend. —v. (-ies, -ied) (often foll. By up) share out. [abbreviation]

Winebibber  n. Tippler.

Policyholder  n. Person or body holding an insurance policy.

Sprig  —n. 1 small branch or shoot. 2 ornament resembling this, esp. On fabric. —v. (-gg-) ornament with sprigs (sprigged muslin). [low german sprick]

Rich  adj. 1 having much wealth. 2 splendid, costly, elaborate. 3 valuable (rich offerings). 4 copious, abundant, ample (rich supply of ideas). 5 (often foll. By in, with) (of soil or a region etc.) Fertile; abundant in resources etc. (rich in nutrients). 6 (of food or diet) containing much fat or spice etc. 7 (of the mixture in an internal-combustion engine) containing a high proportion of fuel. 8 (of colour, sound, or smell) mellow and deep, strong and full. 9 highly amusing or ludicrous; outrageous.  richness n. [old english and french]

Yucky  adj. (also yukky) (-ier, -iest) slang 1 messy, repellent. 2 sickly, sentimental.

Thumbnail  n. 1 nail of a thumb. 2 (attrib.) Concise (thumbnail sketch).

Icelander  n. 1 native or national of iceland. 2 person of icelandic descent.

Leftward  —adv. (also leftwards) towards the left. —adj. Going towards or facing the left.

Ticklish  adj. 1 sensitive to tickling. 2 (of a matter or person) difficult to handle.

Gizmo  var. Of *gismo.

Deceive  v. (-ving) 1 make (a person) believe what is false; purposely mislead. 2 be unfaithful to, esp. Sexually. 3 use deceit.  deceive oneself persist in a mistaken belief.  deceiver n.

Godson  n. Male godchild.

Needlecord  n. Fine-ribbed corduroy fabric.

Disturbance  n. 1 disturbing or being disturbed. 2 tumult; uproar; agitation.

Unsupervised  adj. Not supervised.

Commend  v. 1 praise. 2 entrust, commit. 3 recommend.  commendation n. [latin: related to *mandate]

Silky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 soft and smooth like silk. 2 suave.  silkily adv. Silkiness n.

Medallion  n. 1 large medal. 2 thing so shaped, e.g. A decorative panel etc. [italian: related to *medal]

Gt  n. High-performance saloon car. [italian gran turismo great touring]

Symbolize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 be a symbol of. 2 represent by symbols. [french: related to *symbol]

Trauma  n. (pl. Traumata or -s) 1 profound emotional shock. 2 physical injury. 3 physical shock syndrome following this.  traumatize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). [greek, = wound]

Godmother  n. Female godparent.

Sought  past and past part. Of *seek.

Veracious  adj. Formal 1 truthful by nature. 2 (of a statement etc.) True.  veracity n. [latin verax from verus true]

Paddy  n. (pl. -ies) colloq. Often offens. Irishman. [irish padraig patrick]

Antonym  n. Word opposite in meaning to another. [greek onoma name]

Rampart  n. 1 a defensive wall with a broad top and usu. A stone parapet. B walkway on top of this. 2 defence, protection. [french remparer fortify]

Decamp  v. 1 depart suddenly; abscond. 2 break up or leave camp.  decampment n. [french: related to *camp1]

Merganser  n. (pl. Same or -s) a diving duck. [latin mergus diver, anser goose]

Eligible  adj. 1 (often foll. By for) fit or entitled to be chosen (eligible for a rebate). 2 desirable or suitable, esp. For marriage.  eligibility n. [latin: related to *elect]

Melanoma  n. Malignant skin tumour.

Fetish  n. 1 psychol. Abnormal object of sexual desire. 2 a object worshipped by primitive peoples. B obsessional cause (makes a fetish of punctuality).  fetishism n. Fetishist n. Fetishistic adj. [portuguese feitiço charm]

Disbelieve  v. (-ving) be unable or unwilling to believe; be sceptical.  disbelief n. Disbelievingly adv.

Uncomprehending  adj. Not comprehending.

Weightless  adj. (of a body, esp. In an orbiting spacecraft etc.) Not apparently acted on by gravity.  weightlessness n.

Dumps  n.pl. (usu. In down in the dumps) colloq. Low spirits. [low german or dutch: related to *damp]

Dso  abbr. Distinguished service order.

Unscrew  v. 1 unfasten by removing a screw or screws. 2 loosen (a screw or screw-top).

Apophthegm  n. = *aphorism. [latin from greek]

Dimple  —n. Small hollow, esp. In the cheek or chin. —v. (-ling) form dimples (in).  dimply adj. [probably old english]

Swear  —v. (past swore; past part. Sworn) 1 a (often foll. By to + infin. Or that + clause) state or promise solemnly or on oath. B (cause to) take (an oath) (swore them to secrecy). 2 colloq. Insist (swore he was fit). 3 (often foll. By at) use profane or obscene language. 4 (foll. By by) a appeal to as a witness in taking an oath (swear by almighty god). B colloq. Have great confidence in (swears by yoga). 5 (foll. By to; usu. In neg.) Say certainly (could not swear to it). —n. Spell of swearing.  swear blind colloq. Affirm emphatically. Swear in induct into office etc. With an oath. Swear off colloq. Promise to abstain from (drink etc.). [old english]

Robot  n. 1 machine resembling or functioning like a human. 2 machine automatically completing a mechanical process. 3 person who acts mechanically.  robotic adj. Robotize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). [czech]

Papal  adj. Of a pope or the papacy. [medieval latin: related to *pope]

Affront  —n. Open insult. —v. Insult openly; offend, embarrass. [latin: related to *front]

Nobody  —pron. No person. —n. (pl. -ies) person of no importance.

Flautist  n. Flute-player. [italian: related to *flute]

Evolution  n. 1 gradual development. 2 development of species from earlier forms, as an explanation of their origins. 3 unfolding of events etc. (evolution of the plot). 4 change in the disposition of troops or ships.  evolutionary adj. [latin: related to *evolve]

Voluminous  adj. 1 (of drapery etc.) Loose and ample. 2 written or writing at great length. [latin: related to *volume]

Mufti  n. Civilian clothes (in mufti). [arabic]

Rada  abbr. Royal academy of dramatic art.

Seagull  n. = *gull1.

Fie  int. Archaic expressing disgust, shame, etc. [french from latin]

Syncopate  v. (-ting) 1 displace the beats or accents in (music). 2 shorten (a word) by dropping interior letters.  syncopation n. [latin: related to *syncope]

Cadmium  n. Soft bluish-white metallic element. [greek kadmia cadmean (earth)]

Banish  v. 1 condemn to exile. 2 dismiss (esp. From one's mind).  banishment n. [germanic: related to *ban]

Oaf  n. (pl. -s) 1 awkward lout. 2 stupid person.  oafish adj. Oafishly adv. Oafishness n. [old norse: related to *elf]

Plenitude  n. Literary 1 fullness, completeness. 2 abundance. [latin: related to *plenary]

Peace  n. 1 a quiet; tranquillity. B mental calm; serenity. 2 a (often attrib.) Freedom from or the cessation of war (peace talks). B (esp. Peace) treaty of peace between states etc. At war. 3 freedom from civil disorder.  at peace 1 in a state of friendliness. 2 serene. 3 euphem. Dead. Hold one's peace keep silent. Keep the peace prevent, or refrain from, strife. Make one's peace (often foll. By with) re-establish friendly relations. Make peace agree to end a war or quarrel. [latin pax pac-]

Noisome  adj. Literary 1 harmful, noxious. 2 evil-smelling. [from *annoy]

Caster  var. Of *castor.

Appetite  n. 1 natural craving, esp. For food or sexual activity. 2 (usu. Foll. By for) inclination or desire. [latin peto seek]

Sovereign  —n. 1 supreme ruler, esp. A monarch. 2 hist. British gold coin nominally worth £1. —adj. 1 supreme (sovereign power). 2 self-governing (sovereign state). 3 royal (our sovereign lord). 4 excellent; effective (sovereign remedy). 5 unmitigated (sovereign contempt). [french so(u)verain: -g- by association with reign]

Snorkel   —n. 1 breathing-tube for an underwater swimmer. 2 device for supplying air to a submerged submarine. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) use a snorkel. [german schnorchel]

Marshland  n. Land consisting of marshes.

Jut  —v. (-tt-) (often foll. By out, forth) protrude, project. —n. Projection. [var. Of *jet1]

Gunboat  n. Small vessel with heavy guns.

Turncoat  n. Person who changes sides.

Memento  n. (pl. -es or -s) souvenir of a person or event. [latin, imperative of memini remember]

Obstetrics  n.pl. (treated as sing.) Branch of medicine and surgery dealing with childbirth.  obstetric adj. [latin obstetrix midwife, from obsto be present]

Convict  —v. 1 (often foll. By of) prove to be guilty (of a crime etc.). 2 declare guilty by a legal process. —n. Chiefly hist. Person serving a prison sentence. [latin vinco vict- conquer]

Especial  adj. Notable. [latin: related to *special]

Rift  —n. 1 crack, split; break (in cloud etc.). 2 disagreement; breach. 3 cleft in earth or rock. —v. Tear or burst apart. [scandinavian: related to *riven]

Cadence  n. 1 rhythm; the measure or beat of a sound or movement. 2 fall in pitch of the voice. 3 tonal inflection. 4 close of a musical phrase. [latin cado fall]

Sulphuric  adj. (us sulfuric) chem. Containing sulphur with a valency of six.

Bourgeoisie  n. 1 capitalist class. 2 middle class. [french]

Brushwood  n. 1 undergrowth, thicket. 2 cut or broken twigs etc.

Gadget  n. Small mechanical device or tool.  gadgetry n. [origin unknown]

Skulduggery  n. Trickery; unscrupulous behaviour. [origin unknown]

Galaxy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 independent system of stars, gas, dust, etc., in space. 2 (the galaxy) milky way. 3 (foll. By of) brilliant company (galaxy of talent). [greek gala milk]

Ninety  adj. & n. (pl. -ies) 1 product of nine and ten. 2 symbol for this (90, xc, xc). 3 (in pl.) Numbers from 90 to 99, esp. The years of a century or of a person's life.  ninetieth adj. & n. [old english]

Alkali  n. (pl. -s) 1 a any of a class of substances that liberate hydroxide ions in water, usu. Form caustic or corrosive solutions, turn litmus blue, and have a ph of more than 7, e.g. Caustic soda.

Nanny  n. (pl. -ies) 1 child's nurse. 2 colloq. Grandmother. 3 (in full nanny-goat) female goat. [related to *nancy]

Translate  v. (-ting) 1 (also absol.) (often foll. By into) express the sense of (a word, text, etc.) In another language or in another, esp. Simpler, form. 2 be translatable, bear translation (does not translate well). 3 interpret (translated his silence as dissent). 4 move or change, esp. From one person, place, or condition, to another.  translatable adj. Translation n. Translator n. [latin: related to *transfer]

Sustenance  n. 1 nourishment, food. 2 means of support. [anglo-french: related to *sustain]

Advice  n. 1 recommendation on how to act. 2 information given; news. 3 formal notice of a transaction.

Fear  —n. 1 a panic or distress caused by a sense of impending danger, pain, etc. B cause of this. C state of alarm (in fear). 2 (often foll. By of) dread, awe (towards) (fear of heights). 3 danger (little fear of failure). —v. 1 feel fear about or towards. 2 (foll. By for) feel anxiety about (feared for my life). 3 (often foll. By that) foresee or expect with unease, fear, or regret (fear the worst; i fear that you are wrong). 4 (foll. By verbal noun) shrink from (feared meeting his ex-wife). 5 revere (esp. God).  for fear of (or that) to avoid the risk of (or that). No fear colloq. Certainly not! [old english]

Transcript  n. Written copy.

Blanch  v. 1 make or become white or pale. 2 a peel (almonds etc.) By scalding. B immerse (vegetables etc.) Briefly in boiling water. 3 whiten (a plant) by depriving it of light. [french: related to *blank]

Chartered  attrib. Adj. (of an accountant, engineer, librarian, etc.) Qualified member of a professional body that has a royal charter.

Drub  v. (-bb-) 1 beat, thrash. 2 defeat thoroughly.  drubbing n. [arabic daraba beat]

Bloke  n. Slang man, fellow. [shelta]

Demarcation  n. 1 marking of a boundary or limits. 2 trade-union practice of restricting a specific job to one union.  demarcate v. (-ting). [spanish marcar *mark1]

Deadly  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 causing or able to cause fatal injury or serious damage. 2 intense, extreme (deadly dullness). 3 (of aim etc.) True; effective. 4 deathlike (deadly pale). 5 colloq. Dreary, dull. —adv. 1 like death; as if dead (deadly faint). 2 extremely (deadly serious).

Bivouac  —n. Temporary open encampment without tents. —v. (-ck-) make, or camp in, a bivouac. [french, probably from german]

Debar  v. (-rr-) (foll. By from) exclude; prohibit (debarred from the club).  debarment n. [french: related to *bar1]

Krugerrand  n. S. African gold coin. [kruger, name of a s. African statesman]

Airbase  n. Base for military aircraft.

Divorce  —n. 1 legal dissolution of a marriage. 2 separation (divorce between thought and feeling). —v. (-cing) 1 a (usu. As divorced adj.) (often foll. By from) legally dissolve the marriage of. B separate by divorce. C end one's marriage with. 2 separate (divorced from reality). [latin: related to *diverse]

Sportsman  n. (fem. Sportswoman) 1 person who takes part in sport, esp. Professionally. 2 fair and generous person.  sportsmanlike adj. Sportsmanship n.

Tricolor  n. (brit. Tricolour) flag of three bands of different colours, esp. The french or irish national flags. [french: related to *tri-]

Phial  n. Small glass bottle, esp. For liquid medicine. [greek phiate broad flat dish]

Undeceive  v. (-ving) (often foll. By of) free (a person) from a misconception, deception, or error.

Interference  n. 1 act of interfering. 2 fading or disturbance of received radio signals. 3 physics combination of two or more wave motions to form a resultant wave in which the displacement is reinforced or cancelled.

Presage  —n. 1 omen, portent. 2 presentiment, foreboding. —v. (-ging) 1 portend, foreshadow. 2 give warning of (an event etc.) By natural means. 3 (of a person) predict or have a presentiment of. [latin praesagium]

Freebooter  n. Pirate. [dutch vrijbuiter: related to *free, *booty]

Vivarium  n. (pl. -ria or -s) 1 glass bowl etc. For keeping animals for scientific study. 2 enclosure for keeping animals in (nearly) their natural state. [latin]

Typical  adj. 1 serving as a characteristic example; representative (a typical english pub). 2 (often foll. By of) characteristic of a particular person, thing, or type (typical of him to refuse).  typicality n. Typically adv. [medieval latin: related to *type]

Chutney  n. (pl. -s) pungent condiment of fruits, vinegar, spices, etc. [hindi]

Doubloon  n. Hist. Spanish gold coin. [french or spanish: related to *double]

Doxology  n. (pl. -ies) liturgical hymn etc. Of praise to god.  doxological adj. [greek doxa glory]

Pibroch  n. Martial or funerary bagpipe music. [gaelic]

Cried  past and past part. Of *cry.

Banter  —n. Good-humoured teasing. —v. 1 tease. 2 exchange banter. [origin unknown]

Creed  n. 1 set of principles or beliefs. 2 system of religious belief. 3 (often the creed) formal summary of christian doctrine. [latin: related to *credo]

Po  abbr. 1 post office. 2 postal order. 3 petty officer. 4 pilot officer.

Uninterested  adj. Not interested; indifferent.

Reconnect  v. Connect again.  reconnection n.

Toastmaster  n. (fem. Toastmistress) person responsible for announcing toasts at a public occasion.

Effete  adj. Feeble, lanquid; effeminate.  effeteness n. [latin]

Graminivorous  adj. Feeding on grass, cereals, etc.

Inconceivable  adj. 1 that cannot be imagined. 2 colloq. Most unlikely.  inconceivably adv.

Farina  n. 1 flour or meal of cereal, nuts, or starchy roots. 2 starch.  farinaceous adj. [latin]

Wristlet  n. Band or ring to strengthen, guard, or adorn the wrist.

Jettison  —v. 1 a throw (esp. Heavy material) overboard to lighten a ship etc. B drop (goods) from an aircraft. 2 abandon; get rid of. —n. Jettisoning. [anglo-french getteson: related to *jet1]

Enroll  v. (brit. Enrol) (-ll-) 1 enlist. 2 a write the name of (a person) on a list. B incorporate as a member. C enrol oneself, esp. For a course of study.  enrolment n. [french: related to *en-1]

Headmaster  n. (fem. Headmistress) = *head teacher.

-ity  suffix forming nouns denoting: 1 quality or condition (humility; purity). 2 instance of this (monstrosity). [latin -itas]

Dispute  —v. (-ting) 1 debate, argue. 2 discuss, esp. Heatedly; quarrel. 3 question the truth or validity of (a statement etc.). 4 contend for (disputed territory). 5 resist, oppose. —n. 1 controversy; debate. 2 quarrel. 3 disagreement leading to industrial action.  in dispute 1 being argued about. 2 (of a workforce) involved in industrial action. [latin puto reckon]

Cloche  n. 1 small translucent cover for protecting outdoor plants. 2 (in full cloche hat) woman's close-fitting bell-shaped hat. [french, = bell, medieval latin clocca]

Prowess  n. 1 skill, expertise. 2 valour, gallantry. [french: related to *proud]

Earnest  adj. Intensely serious.  in earnest serious, seriously, with determination.  earnestly adv. Earnestness n. [old english]

Marquetry  n. Inlaid work in wood, ivory, etc. [french: related to *marque]

Impinge  v. (-ging) (usu. Foll. By on, upon) 1 make an impact or effect. 2 encroach.  impingement n. [latin pango pact- fix]

Proximity  n. Nearness in space, time, etc. (in close proximity). [latin: related to *proximate]

Paratrooper  n. Member of a body of paratroops.

Workpiece  n. Thing worked on with a tool or machine.

Giggle  —v. (-ling) laugh in half-suppressed spasms. —n. 1 such a laugh. 2 colloq. Amusing person or thing; joke (did it for a giggle).  giggly adj. (-ier, -iest). [imitative]

Compromise  —n. 1 settlement of a dispute by mutual concession. 2 (often foll. By between) intermediate state between conflicting opinions, actions, etc. —v. (-sing) 1 a settle a dispute by mutual concession. B modify one's opinions, demands, etc. 2 bring into disrepute or danger by indiscretion. [latin: related to *promise]

Waxwing  n. Any of various birds with tips like red sealing-wax to some wing-feathers.

Copal  n. Resin of a tropical tree, used for varnish. [spanish from aztec]

Softwood  n. Easily sawn wood of deciduous trees.

Palladium  n. Rare white metallic element used as a catalyst and in jewellery. [pallas, name of an asteroid]

Tabor  n. Hist. Small drum, esp. Used to accompany a pipe. [french]

Consideration  n. 1 careful thought. 2 thoughtfulness for others; being considerate. 3 fact or thing taken into account. 4 compensation; payment or reward.  in consideration of in return for; on account of. Take into consideration make allowance for. Under consideration being considered.

Division  n. 1 dividing or being divided. 2 dividing one number by another. 3 disagreement (division of opinion). 4 parl. Separation of members for counting votes. 5 one of two or more parts into which a thing is divided. 6 unit of administration, esp. A group of army brigades, regiments, or teams in a sporting league.  divisional adj.

Pigswill  n. Kitchen refuse and scraps fed to pigs.

Shipbuilder  n. Person, company, etc., that constructs ships.  shipbuilding n.

Angstrom  n. Unit of length equal to 10-10 metre. [ångström, name of a physicist]

Differentiate  v. (-ting) 1 constitute a difference between or in. 2 recognize as different; distinguish. 3 become different during development. 4 math. Calculate the derivative of.  differentiation n.

Indeclinable  adj. Gram. That cannot be declined; having no inflections.

Separate  —adj. Forming a unit by itself, existing apart; disconnected, distinct, or individual. —n. (in pl.) Trousers, skirts, etc. That are not parts of suits. —v. (-ting) 1 make separate, sever. 2 prevent union or contact of. 3 go different ways. 4 (esp. As separated adj.) Cease to live with one's spouse. 5 (foll. By from) secede. 6 a divide or sort into parts or sizes. B (often foll. By out) extract or remove (an ingredient etc.).  separately adv. Separateness n. [latin separo (v.)]

During  prep. Throughout or at some point in. [latin: related to *durable]

Whatsoever  adj. & pron. = *whatever.

Until  prep. & conj. = *till1. [earlier untill: un from old norse und as far as]

Usage  until, as opposed to till, is used esp. At the beginning of a sentence and in formal style, e.g. Until you told me, i had no idea; he resided there until his decease.

Udr  abbr. Ulster defence regiment.

Charlady  n. = *charwoman.

Toupee  n. Hairpiece to cover a bald spot. [french]

Extraditable  adj. 1 liable to extradition. 2 (of a crime) warranting extradition.

Instantaneous  adj. Occurring or done in an instant.  instantaneously adv.

Crossbreed  —n. 1 hybrid breed of animals or plants. 2 individual hybrid. —v. Produce by crossing.

Sienna  n. 1 a kind of earth used as a pigment. 2 its colour of yellowish-brown (raw sienna) or reddish-brown (burnt sienna). [siena in tuscany]

Geodesy  n. The study of the shape and area of the earth. [greek geodaisia]

Surmise  —n. Conjecture. —v. (-sing) (often foll. By that) infer doubtfully; guess; suppose. [latin supermitto -miss- accuse]

Altar  n. 1 table or flat block for sacrifice or offering to a deity. 2 communion table. [latin altus high]

Dissoluble  adj. That can be disintegrated, loosened, or disconnected.

Woodpile  n. Pile of wood, esp. For fuel.

Addressee  n. Person to whom a letter etc. Is addressed.

Overspread  v. (past and past part. -spread) 1 cover the surface of. 2 (as overspread adj.) (usu. Foll. By with) covered.

Debris  n. 1 scattered fragments, esp. Of wreckage. 2 accumulation of loose rock etc. [french briser break]

Immure  v. (-ring) 1 imprison. 2 refl. Shut oneself away. [latin murus wall]

Bowerbird  n. Australasian bird, the male of which constructs elaborate runs.

Prang   slang —v. 1 crash (an aircraft or vehicle). 2 damage by impact. 3 bomb (a target) successfully. —n. Act of pranging. [imitative]

Emigrant  —n. Person who emigrates. —adj. Emigrating.

Secret  —adj. 1 kept or meant to be kept private, unknown, or hidden. 2 acting or operating secretly. 3 fond of secrecy. —n. 1 thing kept or meant to be kept secret. 2 mystery. 3 effective but not generally known method (what's their secret?; the secret of success).  in secret secretly.  secretly adv. [latin secerno secret- separate]

Bold  adj. 1 confidently assertive; adventurous, brave. 2 impudent. 3 vivid (bold colours).  make (or be) so bold as to presume to; venture to.  boldly adv. Boldness n. [old english]

Smile  —v. (-ling) 1 have or assume a happy, kind, or amused expression, with the corners of the mouth turned up. 2 express by smiling (smiled a welcome). 3 give (a smile) of a specified kind (smiled a sardonic smile). 4 (foll. By on, upon) favour (fortune smiled on me). —n. 1 act of smiling. 2 smiling expression or aspect. [perhaps from scandinavian]

Vindicate  v. (-ting) 1 clear of blame or suspicion. 2 establish the existence, merits, or justice of (something disputed etc.). 3 justify by evidence or argument.  vindication n. Vindicator n. Vindicatory adj. [latin vindico claim]

Surname  n. Family name, usu. Inherited or acquired by marriage. [obsolete surnoun from anglo-french: related to *sur-1]

Slither  —v. Slide unsteadily. —n. Act of slithering.  slithery adj. [var. Of slidder: related to *slide]

Iniquity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 wickedness. 2 gross injustice.  iniquitous adj. [french from latin aequus just]

Unprotected  adj. Not protected.

Biosphere  n. Regions of the earth's crust and atmosphere occupied by living things. [german: related to *bio-]

Goth  n. 1 member of a germanic tribe that invaded the roman empire in the 3rd–5th c. 2 uncivilized or ignorant person. [old english gota and greek gothoi]

Gorgeous  adj. 1 richly coloured, sumptuous. 2 colloq. Very pleasant, splendid (gorgeous weather). 3 colloq. Strikingly beautiful.  gorgeously adv. [french]

Hagridden  adj. Afflicted by nightmares or anxieties.

Rehouse  v. (-sing) house elsewhere.

Busman  n. Bus driver.

Dressing  n. 1 putting one's clothes on. 2 a sauce, esp. Of oil and vinegar etc., for salads (french dressing). B sauce or stuffing etc. For food. 3 bandage, ointment, etc., for a wound. 4 size or stiffening used to coat fabrics. 5 compost etc. Spread over land.

Masquerade  —n. 1 false show, pretence. 2 masked ball. —v. (-ding) (often foll. By as) appear falsely or in disguise. [spanish máscara mask]

Alloy  —n. 1 mixture of two or more metals. 2 inferior metal mixed esp. With gold or silver. —v. 1 mix (metals). 2 debase by admixture. 3 moderate (pleasure alloyed with pain). [french: related to *ally]

Acre  n. Measure of land, 4,840 sq. Yds., 0.405 ha. [old english]

Wheelbarrow  n. Small handcart with one wheel and two shafts.

Misrule  —n. Bad government; disorder. —v. (-ling) govern badly.

Tough  —adj. 1 hard to break, cut, tear, or chew. 2 able to endure hardship; hardy. 3 unyielding, stubborn, difficult (it was a tough job). 4 colloq. A acting sternly; hard (get tough with). B (of circumstances, luck, etc.) Severe, hard. 5 colloq. Criminal or violent. —n. Tough person, esp. A ruffian.  toughen v. Toughness n. [old english]

Nonentity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 person or thing of no importance. 2 a non-existence. B non-existent thing. [medieval latin]

Coalman  n. Man who carries or delivers coal.

Centrifugal  adj. Moving or tending to move from a centre.  centrifugally adv. [from *centre, latin fugio flee]

Madame  n. 1 (pl. Mesdames) mrs or madam (used of or to a french-speaking woman). 2 (madame) = *madam 1. [french ma dame my lady]

Switchback  n. 1 ride at a fair etc., with extremely steep ascents and descents. 2 (often attrib.) Such a railway or road.

Unison  n. 1 concord (acted in perfect unison). 2  coincidence in pitch of sounds or notes (sung in unison). [latin sonus *sound1]

Else  adv. 1 (prec. By indefinite or interrog. Pron.) Besides (someone else; nowhere else; who else?). 2 instead (what else could i say?). 3 otherwise; if not (run, (or) else you will be late).  or else see *or1. [old english]

Comedian  n. 1 humorous entertainer. 2 comedy actor. 3 slang buffoon. [french]

Brandy  n. (pl. -ies) strong alcoholic spirit distilled from wine or fermented fruit juice. [dutch brandewijn]

Means  n.pl. 1 (often treated as sing.) Action, agent, device, or method producing a result (means of quick travel). 2 a money resources (live beyond one's means). B wealth (man of means).  by all means certainly. By means of by the agency etc. Of. By no means certainly not. [from *mean3]

Rodeo  n. (pl. -s) 1 exhibition of cowboys' skills in handling animals. 2 round-up of cattle on a ranch for branding etc. [spanish]

Grindstone  n. 1 thick revolving disc used for grinding, sharpening, and polishing. 2 a kind of stone used for this.  keep one's nose to the grindstone work hard and continuously.

Underplay  v. 1 make little of. 2 theatr. Underact.

Laze  —v. (-zing) 1 spend time idly. 2 (foll. By away) pass (time) idly. —n. Spell of lazing. [back-formation from *lazy]

Aitch  n. The letter h. [french ache]

Latch  —n. 1 bar with a catch and lever as a fastening for a gate etc. 2 spring-lock preventing a door from being opened from the outside without a key. —v. Fasten with a latch.  latch on (often foll. By to) colloq. 1 attach oneself (to). 2 understand. On the latch fastened by the latch (sense 1) only. [old english]

Accession  —n. 1 taking office, esp. As monarch. 2 thing added. —v. Record the addition of (a new item) to a library etc.

Laudanum  n. Solution prepared from opium. [perhaps from medieval latin]

Locomotion  n. Motion or the power of motion from place to place. [latin *locus, *motion]

Pothole  n. 1 deep hole or cave system in rock. 2 hole in a road surface.  potholer n. Potholing n.

Nurture  —n. 1 bringing up, fostering care. 2 nourishment. —v. (-ring) bring up; rear. [french: related to *nourish]

Cocker  n. (in full cocker spaniel) small spaniel with a silky coat. [related to *cock1]

Redevelop  v. Replan or rebuild (esp. An urban area).  redevelopment n.

Alehouse  n. Hist. Tavern.

Sepal  n. Division or leaf of a calyx. [perhaps from *separate, *petal]

Unforeseeable  adj. Not foreseeable.

Picaresque  adj. (of a style of fiction) dealing with the episodic adventures of rogues etc. [spanish pícaro rogue]

Usage  picaresque is sometimes used to mean ‘transitory’ or ‘roaming’, but this is considered incorrect in standard english.

Pastoral  —adj. 1 of shepherds, flocks, or herds. 2 (of land) used for pasture. 3 (of a poem, picture, etc.) Portraying (esp. Romanticized) country life. 4 of a pastor. —n. 1 pastoral poem, play, picture, etc. 2 letter from a pastor (esp. A bishop) to the clergy or people. [latin pastoralis: related to *pastor]

Bmx  n. 1 organized bicycle-racing on a dirt-track. 2 bicycle used for this. [abbreviation of bicycle moto-cross]

Champers  n. Slang champagne.

Untwine  v. (-ning) untwist, unwind.

Possible  —adj. 1 capable of existing, happening, being done, etc. 2 potential (a possible way of doing it). —n. 1 possible candidate, member of a team, etc. 2 highest possible score, esp. In shooting.

Preclude  v. (-ding) 1 (foll. By from) prevent. 2 make impossible. [latin praecludo: related to *close1]

Disincentive  n. Thing discouraging action, effort, etc.

Laurel  n. 1 = *bay2. 2 (in sing. Or pl.) Wreath of bay-leaves as an emblem of victory or poetic merit. 3 any of various plants with dark-green glossy leaves.  look to one's laurels beware of losing one's pre-eminence. Rest on one's laurels see *rest1. [latin laurus bay]

Dharma  n. Ind. 1 social custom; correct behaviour. 2 the buddhist truth. 3 the hindu moral law. [sanskrit, = decree, custom]

Champagne  n. 1 a white sparkling wine from champagne. B similar wine from elsewhere. 2 pale cream colour. [champagne, former province in e. France]

Usage  the use of this word in sense 1b is, strictly speaking, incorrect.

Rani  var. Of *ranee.

Volunteer  —n. Person who voluntarily undertakes a task or enters military etc. Service. —v. 1 (often foll. By to + infin.) Undertake or offer (one's services, a remark, etc.) Voluntarily. 2 (often foll. By for) be a volunteer. [french: related to *voluntary]

Omega  n. 1 last (24th) letter of the greek alphabet (w, w). 2 last of a series; final development. [greek o mega = great o]

Conversant  adj. (foll. By with) well acquainted with. [french: related to *converse1]

Sepulcher  (brit. Sepulchre) —n. Tomb, esp. Cut in rock or built of stone or brick. —v. (-ring) 1 place in a sepulchre. 2 serve as a sepulchre for. [latin sepelio bury]

Paratroops  n.pl. Parachute troops. [contraction]

Urea  n. Soluble nitrogenous compound contained esp. In urine. [french urée from greek ouron urine]

Bacchanal  —n. 1 drunken revelry or reveller. 2 priest or follower of bacchus. —adj. 1 of or like bacchus. 2 drunkenly riotous. [latin bacchus from greek, god of wine]

Hurry  —n. 1 great or eager haste. 2 (with neg. Or interrog.) Need for haste (there is no hurry; what's the hurry?). —v. (-ies, -ied) 1 move or act hastily. 2 cause to hurry.

Indention  n. 1 indenting, esp. In printing. 2 notch.

Proficient  adj. (often foll. By in, at) adept, expert.  proficiency n. Proficiently adv. [latin proficio -fect- advance]

Stonework  n. Masonry.

Ceaseless  adj. Without end.  ceaselessly adv.

Lifer  n. Slang person serving a life sentence.

Defiant  adj. Showing defiance; disobedient.  defiantly adv.

Feller  n. = *fellow 1.

Adulterer  n. (fem. Adulteress) person who commits adultery.

Ineffective  adj. Not achieving the desired effect or results.  ineffectively adv. Ineffectiveness n.

Herb  n. 1 any non-woody seed-bearing plant. 2 plant with leaves, seeds, or flowers used for flavouring, food, medicine, scent, etc.  herby adj. (-ier, -iest). [latin herba]

Ungovernable  adj. Uncontrollable, violent.

Stripy  adj. (-ier, -iest) striped.

Piazza  n. Public square or market-place. [italian: related to *place]

Aeon  n. (also eon) 1 long or indefinite period. 2 an age. [latin from greek]

Exocrine  adj. (of a gland) secreting through a duct. [greek krino sift]

Admit  v. (-tt-) 1 (often foll. By to be, or that + clause) acknowledge; recognize as true. 2 (foll. By to) confess to (a deed, fault, etc.). 3 allow (a person) entrance, access, etc. 4 take (a patient) into hospital. 5 (of an enclosed space) accommodate. 6 (foll. By of) allow as possible. [latin mitto miss- send]

Oast  n. Kiln for drying hops. [old english]

Heatwave  n. Period of unusually hot weather.

Authoritarian  —adj. Favouring or enforcing strict obedience to authority. —n. Authoritarian person.

Taffeta  n. Fine lustrous silk or silklike fabric. [french or medieval latin from persian]

Scrapie  n. Viral disease of sheep, characterized by lack of coordination.

Buttonhole  —n. 1 slit in cloth for a button. 2 flower etc. Worn in a lapel buttonhole. —v. (-ling) colloq. Accost and detain (a reluctant listener).

Costly  adj. (-ier, -iest) costing much; expensive.  costliness n.

Drew  past of *draw.

Musquash  n. = *muskrat. [algonquian]

Archidiaconal  adj. Of an archdeacon. [medieval latin]

Agoraphobia  n. Abnormal fear of open spaces or public places.  agoraphobic adj. & n. [greek agora market-place]

Fulfill  v. (brit. Fulfil) (-ll-) 1 carry out (a task, prophecy, promise, etc.). 2 a satisfy (conditions, a desire, prayer, etc.). B (as fulfilled adj.) Completely happy. 3 answer (a purpose).  fulfil oneself realize one's potential.  fulfilment n. [old english: related to *full1, *fill]

Vendetta  n. 1 blood feud. 2 prolonged bitter quarrel. [latin: related to *vindictive]

Clover  n. Trefoil fodder plant.  in clover in ease and luxury. [old english]

Dolby  n. Propr. Electronic noise-reduction system used esp. In tape-recording to reduce hiss. [name of its inventor]

Bitter  —adj. 1 having a sharp pungent taste; not sweet. 2 causing, showing, or feeling mental pain or resentment (bitter memories). 3 a harsh; virulent (bitter animosity). B piercingly cold. —n. 1 beer flavoured with hops and tasting slightly bitter. 2 (in pl.) Liquor flavoured esp. With wormwood, used in cocktails.  to the bitter end to the very end in spite of difficulties.  bitterly adv. Bitterness n. [old english]

Recreant  literary —adj. Craven, cowardly. —n. Coward. [medieval latin: related to *creed]

Cairngorm  n. Semiprecious form of quartz. [cairngorms, in scotland]

Mothball  n. Ball of naphthalene etc. Placed in stored clothes to deter moths.  in mothballs stored unused for a considerable time.

Cpu  abbr. Computing central processing unit.

Tubby  adj. (-ier, -iest) short and fat.  tubbiness n.

Hollow  —adj. 1 a having a cavity; not solid. B sunken (hollow cheeks). 2 (of a sound) echoing. 3 empty; hungry. 4 meaningless (hollow victory). 5 insincere (hollow laugh). —n. 1 hollow place; hole. 2 valley; basin. —v. (often foll. By out) make hollow; excavate. —adv. Colloq. Completely (beaten hollow).  hollowly adv. Hollowness n. [old english]

Publicity  n. 1 public exposure. 2 a advertising. B material used for this. [french: related to *public]

Taint  —n. 1 spot or trace of decay, infection, corruption, etc. 2 corrupt condition or infection. —v. 1 affect with a taint; become tainted. 2 (foll. By with) affect slightly. [latin: related to *tinge]

Filmsetting  n. Typesetting by projecting characters on to photographic film.  film-set v. Film-setter n.

Hyperactive  adj. (of a person) abnormally active.

Myrrh  n. Gum resin used in perfume, medicine, incense, etc. [latin myrrha from greek]

Heap  —n. 1 disorderly pile. 2 (esp. In pl.) Colloq. Large number or amount. 3 slang dilapidated vehicle. —v. 1 (foll. By up, together, etc.) Collect or be collected in a heap. 2 (foll. By with) load copiously with. 3 (foll. By on, upon) give or offer copiously (heaped insults on them). [old english]

Splendor  n. (brit. Splendour) dazzling brightness; magnificence. [latin splendeo shine]

Billboard  n. Large outdoor advertising hoarding.

Filter  —n. 1 porous device for removing impurities etc. From a liquid or gas passed through it. 2 = *filter tip. 3 screen or attachment for absorbing or modifying light, x-rays, etc. 4 device for suppressing unwanted electrical or sound waves. 5 arrangement for filtering traffic. —v. 1 (cause to) pass through a filter. 2 (foll. By through, into, etc.) Make way gradually. 3 (foll. By out) (cause to) leak. 4 allow (traffic) or (of traffic) be allowed to pass to the left or right at a junction. [germanic: related to *felt1]

Citizen  n. 1 member of a state, either native or naturalized. 2 inhabitant of a city. 3 us civilian.  citizenry n. Citizenship n. [anglo-french: related to *city]

Magazine  n. 1 illustrated periodical publication containing articles, stories, etc. 2 chamber holding cartridges to be fed automatically to the breech of a gun. 3 similar device in a slide projector etc. 4 military store for arms etc. 5 store for explosives. [arabic makazin]

Prolapse  —n. (also prolapsus) 1 forward or downward displacement of a part or organ. 2 prolapsed womb, rectum, etc. —v. (-sing) undergo prolapse. [latin: related to *lapse]

Adoptive  adj. Because of adoption (adoptive son). [latin: related to *adopt]

Barium  n. White soft metallic element. [from *baryta]

Weekend  n. 1 sunday and saturday or part of saturday. 2 this period extended slightly esp. For a holiday or visit etc.

Miscarriage  n. Spontaneous premature expulsion of a foetus from the womb.

Around  —adv. 1 on every side; all round; round about. 2 colloq. A in existence; available. B near at hand. 3 here and there (shop around). —prep. 1 on or along the circuit of. 2 on every side of. 3 here and there in or near (chairs around the room). 4 a round (church around the corner). B at a time near to (came around four o'clock).  have been around colloq. Be widely experienced.

Emerald  —n. 1 bright-green gem. 2 colour of this. —adj. Bright green. [greek smaragdos]

Lively  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 full of life; vigorous, energetic. 2 vivid (lively imagination). 3 cheerful. 4 joc. Exciting, dangerous (made things lively for him).  liveliness n. [old english]

Embargo  —n. (pl. -es) 1 order forbidding foreign ships to enter, or any ships to leave, a country's ports. 2 official suspension of an activity. —v. (-es, -ed) place under embargo. [spanish: related to *bar1]

Serf  n. 1 hist. Labourer who was not allowed to leave the land on which he worked. 2 oppressed person, drudge.  serfdom n. [latin servus slave]

Pseudo  adj. & n. (pl. -s) = *pseud.

Coast  —n. Border of land near the sea; seashore. —v. 1 ride or move, usu. Downhill, without the use of power. 2 make progress without much effort. 3 sail along the coast.  the coast is clear there is no danger of being observed or caught.  coastal adj. [latin costa side]

Blazer  n. Jacket without matching trousers, esp. Lightweight and often part of a uniform. [from *blaze1]

Yellow  —adj. 1 of the colour of buttercups, lemons, egg-yolks, etc. 2 having a yellow skin or complexion. 3 colloq. Cowardly. —n. 1 yellow colour or pigment. 2 yellow clothes or material. —v. Turn yellow.  yellowish adj. Yellowness n. Yellowy adj. [old english: related to *gold]

Millwright  n. Person who designs or builds mills.

Sforzando  mus. —adj. & adv. With sudden emphasis. —n. (pl. -s or -di) 1 suddenly emphasized note or group of notes. 2 increase in emphasis and loudness. [italian]

Kelvin  n. Si unit of thermodynamic temperature. [kelvin, name of a physicist]

Neptunium  n. Transuranic metallic element produced when uranium atoms absorb bombarding neutrons. [neptune, name of a planet]

Radio  —n. (pl. -s) 1 (often attrib.) A transmission and reception of sound messages etc. By electromagnetic waves of radio frequency. B apparatus for receiving, broadcasting, or transmitting radio signals. 2 a sound broadcasting (prefers the radio). B broadcasting station or channel (radio one). —v. (-es, -ed) 1 a send (a message) by radio. B send a message to (a person) by radio. 2 communicate or broadcast by radio. [short for radio-telegraphy etc.]

Repugnance  n. 1 antipathy; aversion. 2 inconsistency or incompatibility of ideas etc. [latin pugno fight]

Manifesto  n. (pl. -s) declaration of policies, esp. By a political party. [italian: related to *manifest]

Autocrat  n. 1 absolute ruler. 2 dictatorial person.  autocratic adj. Autocratically adv.

Choreography  n. Design or arrangement of a ballet etc.  choreographic adj. [greek khoreia dance]

Bustier  n. Strapless close-fitting bodice. [french]

Bargepole  n.  would not touch with a bargepole refuse to be associated or concerned with.

Foggy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 full of fog. 2 of or like fog. 3 vague, indistinct.  not have the foggiest colloq. Have no idea at all.  fogginess n. [perhaps from fog long grass]

Expectant  adj. 1 hopeful, expecting. 2 having an expectation. 3 pregnant.  expectantly adv.

Scaffold  n. 1 hist. Platform for the execution of criminals. 2 = *scaffolding. [romanic: related to *ex-1, *catafalque]

Pornography  n. 1 explicit representation of sexual activity in literature, films, etc., intended to stimulate erotic rather than aesthetic or emotional feelings. 2 literature etc. Containing this.  pornographic adj. [greek porne prostitute]

Misdoing  n. Misdeed.

Reboot  v. (often absol.) Computing boot up (a system) again.

Vasectomy  n. (pl. -ies) removal of part of each vas deferens, esp. For sterilization.

Habitual  adj. 1 done constantly or as a habit. 2 regular, usual. 3 given to a (specified) habit (habitual smoker).  habitually adv.

Wilderness  n. 1 desert; uncultivated region or garden area. 2 (foll. By of) confused assemblage. [old english: related to *wild, *deer]

Shemozzle  n. Slang 1 brawl or commotion. 2 muddle. [yiddish]

Hypocrite  n. Person given to hypocrisy.  hypocritical adj. Hypocritically adv.

Mighty  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 powerful, strong. 2 massive, bulky. 3 colloq. Great, considerable. —adv. Colloq. Very (mighty difficult).  mightily adv. Mightiness n. [old english: related to *might2]

Encephalograph  n. = *electroencephalograph.

Infinity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being infinite; boundlessness. 2 infinite number or extent. 3 infinite distance (gaze into infinity). 4 math. Infinite quantity.

Gout  n. Disease with inflammation of the smaller joints, esp. Of the toe.  gouty adj. [latin gutta drop]

Shah  n. Hist. Former monarch of iran. [persian]

Insouciant  adj. Carefree; unconcerned.  insouciance n. [french souci care]

Pitiful  adj. 1 causing pity. 2 contemptible.  pitifully adv.

Filch  v. Pilfer, steal. [origin unknown]

Tearful  adj. 1 crying or inclined to cry. 2 sad (tearful event).  tearfully adv.

Nitrite  n. Any salt or ester of nitrous acid. [from *nitre]

Elective  adj. 1 chosen by or derived from election. 2 (of a body) having the power to elect. 3 optional, not urgently necessary.

Cassock  n. Long usu. Black or red clerical garment.  cassocked adj. [french from italian]

Emollient  —adj. That softens or soothes the skin, feelings, etc. —n. Emollient substance. [latin mollis soft]

Corporation  n. 1 group of people authorized to act as an individual, esp. In business. 2 municipal authorities of a borough, town, or city. 3 joc. Large stomach.

Veg  n. Colloq. Vegetable(s). [abbreviation]

Cruse  n. Archaic earthenware pot. [old english]

Filtrate  —v. (-ting) filter. —n. Filtered liquid.  filtration n. [related to *filter]

Mistime  v. (-ming) say or do at the wrong time. [related to *mis-1]

Jp  abbr. Justice of the peace.

Linkage  n. 1 linking or being linked, esp. The linking of quite different political issues in negotiations. 2 link or system of links.

Elk  n. (pl. Same or -s) large deer of northern parts of europe, n. America, and asia. [old english]

Carefree  adj. Light-hearted; joyous.

Blockage  n. Obstruction.

Ciao  int. Colloq. 1 goodbye. 2 hello. [italian]

His  poss. Pron. 1 (attrib.) Of or belonging to him or himself (his house; his own business). 2 the one or ones belonging to or associated with him (it is his; his are over there).  of his of or belonging to him (friend of his). [old english, genitive of *he]

Lobworm  n. Large earthworm used as fishing-bait. [from *lob in obsolete sense ‘pendulous object’]

Extinction  n. 1 making or becoming extinct. 2 extinguishing or being extinguished. 3 total destruction or annihilation.

Imponderable  —adj. 1 not able to be estimated. 2 very light; weightless. —n. (usu. In pl.) Imponderable thing.  imponderability n. Imponderably adv.

Proprietary  adj. 1 a of or holding property (proprietary classes). B of a proprietor (proprietary rights). 2 held in private ownership. [latin proprietarius: related to *property]

Hereafter  —adv. From now on; in the future. —n. 1 the future. 2 life after death.

Overlord  n. Supreme lord.

Symptom  n. 1 physical or mental sign of disease. 2 sign of the existence of something.  symptomatic adj. [greek pipto fall]

Prosperity  n. Prosperous state; wealth; success.

Incur  v. (-rr-) bring on oneself (danger, blame, loss, etc.). [latin curro run]

Restock  v. (also absol.) Stock again or differently.

Inhabitant  n. Person etc. Who inhabits a place.

Mar  v. (-rr-) spoil; disfigure. [old english]

Fluorocarbon  n. Compound of a hydrocarbon with fluorine atoms.

Emancipate  v. (-ting) 1 free from social or political restraint. 2 (usu. As emancipated adj.) Free from the inhibitions of moral or social conventions. 3 free from slavery.  emancipation n. Emancipatory adj. [latin, = free from possession, from manus hand, capio take]

Atelier  n. Workshop or artist's studio. [french]

Teeter  v. Totter; move unsteadily. [dial. Titter]

Auditory  adj. Of hearing.

Weepie  n. Colloq. Sentimental or emotional film, play, etc.

Worthwhile  adj. That is worth the time, effort, or money spent.

Usage  see note at while.

Legate  n. Ambassador of the pope. [latin lego depute]

Nemesis  n. (pl. Nemeses) 1 retributive justice. 2 downfall caused by this. [greek, = retribution]

Rex  n. 1 (after the name) reigning king (george rex). 2 law the crown (rex v. Jones). [latin]

Emulsion  n. 1 fine dispersion of one liquid in another, esp. As paint, medicine, etc. 2 mixture of a silver compound in gelatin etc. For coating photographic plate or film. 3 emulsion paint. [latin mulgeo milk]

Rightful  adj. 1 a (of a person) legitimately entitled to (a position etc.) (rightful heir). B (of status or property etc.) That one is entitled to. 2 (of an action etc.) Equitable, fair.  rightfully adv. [old english]
