Alliteration  n. Repetition of the same letter or sound at the beginning of adjacent or closely connected words (e.g. Cool, calm, and collected).  alliterate v. (-ting). Alliterative adj. [latin: related to *letter]

Reclothe  v. (-thing) clothe again or differently.

Aa  abbr. 1 automobile association. 2 alcoholics anonymous. 3 anti-aircraft.

Mislay  v. (past and past part. -laid) accidentally put (a thing) where it cannot readily be found.

Tir  abbr. International road transport. [french transport international routier]

Divalent  adj. Chem. Having a valency of two.

Joyride  colloq. —n. Pleasure ride in esp. A stolen car. —v. (-ding; past -rode; past part -ridden) go for a joyride.  joyrider n.

Undine  n. Female water-spirit. [latin unda wave]

Ba  abbr. 1 bachelor of arts. 2 british airways.

Pressie  n. (also prezzie) colloq. Present, gift. [abbreviation]

Portentous  adj. 1 like or being a portent. 2 pompously solemn.

Pharmaceutics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) = *pharmacy 1.

Inmate  n. Occupant of a hospital, prison, institution, etc. [probably from *inn, *mate1]

Gammon  n. 1 bottom piece of a flitch of bacon including a hind leg. 2 ham of a pig cured like bacon. [french: related to *jamb]

Blacken  v. 1 make or become black or dark. 2 defame, slander.

Trot  n. Colloq. Usu. Derog. Trotskyite. [abbreviation]

Imagination  n. 1 mental faculty of forming images or concepts of objects or situations not existent or not directly experienced. 2 mental creativity or resourcefulness.

Tolerable  adj. 1 endurable. 2 fairly good.  tolerably adv. [latin: related to *tolerate]

Malmsey  n. A strong sweet wine. [low german or dutch from monemvasia in greece]

Road  n. 1 a way with a prepared surface, for vehicles, pedestrians, etc. B part of this for vehicles only (step out into the road). 2 one's way or route. 3 (usu. In pl.) Piece of water near the shore in which ships can ride at anchor.  any road dial. = *anyway 2, 3. Get out of the (or my etc.) Road dial. Stop obstructing a person. In the (or one's) road dial. Forming an obstruction. One for the road colloq. Final (esp. Alcoholic) drink before departure. On the road travelling, esp.

Corrupt  —adj. 1 dishonest, esp. Using bribery. 2 immoral; wicked. 3 (of a text etc.) Made unreliable by errors or alterations. —v. Make or become corrupt.  corruptible adj. Corruptibility n. Corruption n. Corruptive adj. Corruptly adv. Corruptness n. [latin rumpo rupt- break]

Definite  adj. 1 certain, sure. 2 clearly defined; not vague; precise.  definitely adv. [latin: related to *define]

Bunker  n. 1 container for fuel. 2 reinforced underground shelter. 3 sandy hollow in a golf-course. [origin unknown]

Contraceptive  —adj. Preventing pregnancy. —n. Contraceptive device or drug.

Rpo  abbr. Royal philharmonic orchestra.

Cognac  n. High-quality brandy, properly that distilled in cognac in w. France.

Uncorroborated  adj. (esp. Of evidence etc.) Not corroborated.

Lab  n. Colloq. Laboratory. [abbreviation]

Pithy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 (of style, speech, etc.) Terse and forcible. 2 of or like pith.  pithily adv. Pithiness n.

Toxemia  n. (brit. Toxaemia) 1 blood-poisoning. 2 increased blood pressure in pregnancy. [related to *toxic, greek haima blood]

Equipage  n. 1 archaic a requisites. B outfit. 2 hist. Carriage and horses with attendants. [french: related to *equip]

Compression  n. 1 compressing. 2 reduction in volume of the fuel mixture in an internal-combustion engine before ignition.

Reconsider  v. Consider again, esp. For a possible change of decision.  reconsideration n.

Curt  adj. Noticeably or rudely brief.  curtly adv. Curtness n. [latin curtus short]

Compulsive  adj. 1 compelling. 2 resulting or acting (as if) from compulsion (compulsive gambler). 3 irresistible (compulsive entertainment).  compulsively adv. [medieval latin: related to *compel]

Oxfam  abbr. Oxford committee for famine relief.

Tide  n. 1 a periodic rise and fall of the sea due to the attraction of the moon and sun. B water as affected by this. 2 time or season (usu. In comb.: whitsuntide). 3 marked trend of opinion, fortune, or events.  tide (-ding) over provide (a person) with what is needed during a difficult period. [old english, = *time]

Overspend  v. (past and past part. -spent) spend too much or beyond one's means.

Classical  adj. 1 a of ancient greek or roman literature or art. B (of a language) having the form used by ancient standard authors. 2 (of music) serious or conventional, or of the period from c.1750–1800. 3 restrained in style.  classicality n. Classically adv.

Editorial  —adj. 1 of editing or editors. 2 written or approved by an editor. —n. Article giving a newspaper's views on a current topic.  editorially adv.

Tope  v. (-ping) archaic or literary drink alcohol to excess, esp. Habitually.  toper n. [origin uncertain]

Eyesight  n. Faculty or power of seeing.

Oncogene  n. Gene which can transform a cell into a cancer cell. [greek ogkos mass]

Bandicoot  n. 1 catlike australian marsupial. 2 (in full bandicoot rat) destructive rat in india. [telugu, = pig-rat]

Consummate  —v. (-ting) 1 complete; make perfect. 2 complete (a marriage) by sexual intercourse. —adj. Complete, perfect; fully skilled.  consummation n. [latin summus utmost]

Disport  v. (often refl.) Play, frolic, enjoy oneself. [anglo-french porter carry, from latin]

Sapper  n. 1 person who digs saps. 2 soldier of the royal engineers (esp. As the official term for a private).

Appertain  v. (foll. By to) relate, belong, or be appropriate. [latin: related to *pertain]

Tinsmith  n. Worker in tin and tin plate.

Airy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 well-ventilated, breezy. 2 flippant, superficial. 3 light as air. 4 ethereal.  airily adv.

Anthropomorphism  n. Attribution of human characteristics to a god, animal, or thing.  anthropomorphic adj. [greek morphe form]

Crucifix  n. Model of a cross with the figure of christ on it. [latin cruci fixus fixed to a cross]

Unarmed  adj. Not armed; without weapons.

Froze  past of *freeze.

Ah  abbr. In the year of the hegira (ad 622); of the muslim era. [latin anno hegirae]

Facsimile  n. Exact copy, esp. Of writing, printing, a picture, etc. [latin, = make like]

Garlic  n. Plant of the onion family with a pungent bulb used in cookery.  garlicky adj. [old english, = spear-leek]

Stultify  v. (-ies, -ied) make ineffective or useless, esp. By routine.  stultification n. [latin stultus foolish]

Nympho  n. (pl. -s) colloq. Nymphomaniac. [abbreviation]

Circulatory  adj. Of circulation, esp. Of the blood.

Purulent  adj. Of, containing, or discharging pus.  purulence n. [latin: related to *pus]

Gather  —v. 1 bring or come together; accumulate. 2 pick or collect as harvest. 3 infer or deduce. 4 a increase (gather speed). B collect (gather dust). 5 summon up (energy etc.). 6 draw together in folds or wrinkles. 7 (often as gathering adj.) Come to a head (gathering storm).

Flyover  n. Bridge carrying one road or railway over another.

Bile  n. 1 bitter digestive fluid secreted by the liver. 2 bad temper; peevish anger. [latin bilis]

Standing  —n. 1 esteem or repute, esp. High; status. 2 duration (of long standing). —adj. 1 that stands, upright. 2 established, permanent (a standing rule; a standing army). 3 (of a jump, start, etc.) Performed with no run-up. 4 (of water) stagnant.

Animalism  n. 1 nature and activity of animals. 2 belief that humans are mere animals.

Unmannerly  adj. Ill-mannered.  unmannerliness n.

Slow  —adj. 1 a taking a relatively long time to do a thing (also foll. By of: slow of speech). B acting, moving, or done without speed, not quick. 2 not conducive to speed (slow route). 3 (of a clock etc.) Showing a time earlier than is correct. 4 (of a person) not understanding or learning readily. 5 dull, tedious. 6 slack, sluggish (business is slow). 7 (of a fire or oven) giving little heat. 8 photog. (of a film) needing long exposure. 9 reluctant; not hasty (slow to anger). —adv. Slowly (also in comb.: slow-moving traffic). —v. (usu. Foll. By down, up) 1 reduce one's speed or the speed of (a vehicle etc.). 2 reduce one's pace of life.  slowish adj. Slowly adv. Slowness n. [old english]

Roam  —v. 1 ramble, wander. 2 travel unsystematically over, through, or about. —n. Act of roaming; ramble.  roamer n. [origin unknown]

Stash  colloq. —v. (often foll. By away) 1 conceal; put in a safe place. 2 hoard. —n. 1 hiding-place. 2 thing hidden. [origin unknown]

Pally  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Friendly.

Fashion  —n. 1 current popular custom or style, esp. In dress. 2 manner of doing something. —v. (often foll. By into) make or form.  after (or in) a fashion to some extent, barely acceptably. In (or out of) fashion fashionable (or not fashionable). [latin factio: related to *fact]

Permutation  n. 1 one of the possible ordered arrangements or groupings of a set of things. 2 combination or selection of a specified number of things from a larger group, esp. Matches in a football pool. [latin permuto change thoroughly]

Pith  n. 1 spongy white tissue lining the rind of an orange etc. 2 essential part. 3 spongy tissue in the stems and branches of plants. 4 strength; vigour; energy. [old english]

Lam  v. (-mm-) slang thrash; hit. [perhaps scandinavian]

Marram  n. Shore grass that binds sand. [old norse, = sea-haulm]

Provoke  v. (-king) 1 (often foll. By to, or to + infin.) Rouse or incite (provoked him to fury). 2 call forth; instigate; cause (indignation, an inquiry, process, etc.). 3 (usu. Foll. By into + verbal noun) irritate or stimulate (a person) (provoked him into retaliating). 4 tempt; allure.

Intoxicate  v. (-ting) 1 make drunk. 2 excite or elate beyond self-control.  intoxication n. [medieval latin: related to *toxic]

Euphemism  n. 1 mild or vague expression substituted for a harsher or more direct one (e.g. Pass over for die). 2 use of such expressions.  euphemistic adj. Euphemistically adv. [greek pheme speaking]

Admissible  adj. 1 (of an idea etc.) Worth accepting or considering. 2 law allowable as evidence. [latin: related to *admit]

Chin  n. Front of the lower jaw.  keep one's chin up colloq. Remain cheerful. Take on the chin suffer a severe blow from; endure courageously. [old english]

Choral  adj. Of, for, or sung by a choir or chorus. [medieval latin: related to *chorus]

Caiman  var. Of *cayman.

Ultimate  —adj. 1 last or last possible, final. 2 fundamental, primary, basic (ultimate truths). —n. 1 (prec. By the) best achievable or imaginable. 2 final or fundamental fact or principle.  ultimately adv. [latin ultimus last]

Providential  adj. 1 of or by divine foresight or interposition. 2 opportune, lucky.  providentially adv.

Multifarious  adj. 1 many and various. 2 of great variety.  multifariousness n. [latin multifarius]

Shindig  n. Colloq. 1 lively noisy party. 2 = *shindy 1. [probably from *shindy]

Inoperable  adj. Surgery that cannot successfully be operated on.

Deny  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 declare untrue or non-existent. 2 repudiate or disclaim. 3 (often foll. By to) withhold (a thing) from (denied him the satisfaction; denied it to me).  deny oneself be abstinent. [latin: related to *negate]

Attention  n. 1 act or faculty of applying one's mind; notice (attention wandered; attract his attention). 2 consideration, care. 3 (in pl.) A courtesies. B sexual advances. 4 erect esp. Military attitude of readiness.

Frontispiece  n. Illustration facing the title-page of a book. [latin: related to *front, specio look]

Daw  n. = *jackdaw. [old english]

Captive  —n. Confined or imprisoned person or animal. —adj. 1 taken prisoner; restrained. 2 unable to escape (captive audience).  captivity n. [latin capio capt- take]

Circuitous  adj. 1 indirect. 2 going a long way round.

Braze  v. (-zing) solder with an alloy of brass and zinc. [french braser]

Collapse  —n. 1 falling down or in of a structure; folding up; giving way. 2 sudden failure of a plan etc. 3 physical or mental breakdown; exhaustion. —v. (-sing) 1 (cause to) undergo collapse. 2 colloq. Lie or sit down and relax, esp. After prolonged effort. 3 fold up.  collapsible adj. [latin labor laps- slip]

Fricative  —adj. (of a consonant) sounded by friction of the breath in a narrow opening. —n. Such a consonant (e.g. F, th). [latin frico rub]

Resonate  v. (-ting) produce or show resonance; resound.  resonator n. [latin: related to *resonant]

Venetian  —n. Native, citizen, or dialect of venice. —adj. Of venice. [from french or medieval latin venetia venice]

Rotary  —adj. Acting by rotation (rotary drill). —n. (pl. -ies) 1 rotary machine. 2 (rotary) (in full rotary international) worldwide charitable society of businessmen, orig. Entertaining in rotation. [medieval latin: related to *rota]

Angostura  n. Aromatic bitter bark used as a flavouring. [angostura (= ciudad bolívar) in venezuela]

Allergy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 adverse reaction to certain substances, esp. Particular foods, pollen, fur, or dust. 2 colloq. Antipathy. [greek allos other]

Unheeded  adj. Disregarded.

Hardback  —adj. Bound in boards covered with cloth etc. —n. Hardback book.

Earphone  n. Device applied to the ear to receive a radio etc. Communication.

Psalmody  n. Practice or art of singing psalms, hymns, etc., esp. In public worship. [greek: related to *psalm]

Manifest  —adj. Clear or obvious to the eye or mind. —v. 1 show (a quality or feeling) by one's acts etc. 2 show plainly to the eye or mind. 3 be evidence of; prove. 4 refl. (of a thing) reveal itself. 5 (of a ghost) appear. —n. Cargo or passenger list.  manifestation n. Manifestly adv. [latin manifestus]

Forepaw  n. Front paw of an animal.

Spendthrift  —n. Extravagant person. —adj. Extravagant.

Thorny  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 having many thorns. 2 problematic, causing disagreement.  thornily adv. Thorniness n. [old english: related to *thorn]

Bill  n. Slang = *old bill. [diminutive of william]

Citrus  n. (pl. -es) 1 tree of a group including the lemon, orange, and grapefruit. 2 (in full citrus fruit) fruit of such a tree. [latin]

Reredos  n. Ornamental screen covering the wall at the back of an altar. [anglo-french: related to *arrears, dos back]

Cutlass  n. Hist. Short sword with a slightly curved blade. [latin cultellus: related to *cutler]

Demonology  n. The study of demons etc.

Turmeric  n. 1 e. Indian plant of the ginger family. 2 its powdered rhizome used as a spice in curry etc. Or for yellow dye. [perhaps from french terre mérite]

Cider  n. Drink of fermented apple juice. [hebrew, = strong drink]

Southbound  adj. Travelling or leading southwards.

Matrimony  n. Rite or state of marriage.  matrimonial adj. [latin matrimonium: related to *mater]

Whiplash  n. Flexible end of a whip.

Haulage  n. 1 commercial transport of goods. 2 charge for this.

Unmanly  adj. Not manly.

Arrange  v. (-ging) 1 put into order; classify. 2 plan or provide for; take measures (arranged a meeting; arrange to see him; arranged for a taxi). 3 agree (arranged it with her). 4 mus. Adapt (a composition) for a particular manner of performance. [french: related to *range]

Reorder  —v. 1 order again. 2 put into a new order. —n. Renewed or repeated order for goods.

Respondent  —n. Defendant, esp. In an appeal or divorce case. —adj. In the position of defendant.

Haystack  n. (also hayrick) packed pile of hay with a pointed or ridged top.

Snapdragon  n. Plant with a two-lipped flower.

Platonism  n. Philosophy of plato or his followers.  platonist n.

Matriarch  n. Female head of a family or tribe.  matriarchal adj. [latin mater mother]

Template  n. Piece of thin board or metal plate etc., used as a pattern in cutting or drilling etc. [originally templet, diminutive of temple, device in a loom to keep the cloth stretched]

Writhe  v. (-thing) 1 twist or roll oneself about in or as in acute pain. 2 suffer mental torture or embarrassment (writhed with shame). [old english]

Unsightly  adj. Ugly.  unsightliness n.

Feral  adj. 1 wild; uncultivated. 2 (of an animal) escaped and living wild. 3 brutal. [latin ferus wild]

Care  —n. 1 worry, anxiety. 2 cause of this. 3 serious attention; caution. 4 a protection, looking after, charge. B = *child care. 5 thing to be done or seen to. —v. (-ring) 1 (usu. Foll. By about, for, whether) feel concern or interest. 2 (usu. Foll. By for) like, be fond of (don't care for jazz). 3 (foll. By to + infin.) Wish or be willing (would you care to try?).  care for provide for; look after. Care of at the address of. In care (of a child) in local authority care. Not care a damn etc. = not give a damn etc. (see *give). Take care 1 be careful. 2 (foll. By to + infin.) Not fail or neglect. Take care of 1 look after. 2 deal with, dispose of. [old english, = sorrow]

Recapture  —v. (-ring) 1 capture again; recover by capture. 2 re-experience (a past emotion etc.). —n. Act of recapturing.

Paste  —n. 1 any moist fairly stiff mixture, esp. Of powder and liquid. 2 dough of flour with fat, water, etc. 3 liquid adhesive used for sticking paper etc. 4 meat or fish spread (anchovy paste). 5 hard glasslike composition used for imitation gems. —v. (-ting) 1 fasten or coat with paste. 2 slang a beat or thrash. B bomb or bombard heavily.  pasting n. (esp. In sense 2 of v.). [latin pasta lozenge, from greek]

Scatterbrain  n. Person lacking concentration.  scatterbrained adj.

Yet  —adv. 1 as late as, or until, now or then (there is yet time; your best work yet). 2 (with neg. Or interrog.) So soon as, or by, now or then (it is not time yet; have you finished yet?). 3 again; in addition (more and yet more). 4 in the remaining time available (i will do it yet). 5 (foll. By compar.) Even (a yet more difficult task). 6 nevertheless; and or but in spite of that. —conj. But at the same time; but nevertheless. [old english]

Nedc  abbr. National economic development council.

Infamous  adj. Notoriously bad.  infamously adv. Infamy n. (pl. -ies).

Decorative  adj. Pleasing in appearance.  decoratively adv.

Grotesque  —adj. 1 comically or repulsively distorted. 2 incongruous, absurd. —n. 1 decorative form interweaving human and animal features. 2 comically distorted figure or design.  grotesquely adv. Grotesqueness n. [italian: related to *grotto]

Frequent  —adj. 1 occurring often or in close succession. 2 habitual, constant. —v. Attend or go to habitually.  frequently adv. [latin frequens -ent- crowded]

Cur  n. 1 mangy ill-tempered dog. 2 contemptible person. [perhaps from old norse kurr grumbling]

Sucrose  n. Sugar from sugar cane, sugar beet, etc. [french sucre *sugar]

Quintuplicate  —adj. 1 fivefold. 2 of which five copies are made. —v. (-ting) multiply by five.

Recoil  —v. 1 suddenly move or spring back in fear, horror, or disgust. 2 shrink mentally in this way. 3 rebound after an impact. 4 (foll. By on, upon) have an adverse reactive effect on (the originator). 5 (of a gun) be driven backwards by its discharge. —n. Act or sensation of recoiling. [french reculer from latin culus buttocks]

Animosity  n. (pl. -ies) spirit or feeling of hostility. [latin: related to *animus]

Spectral  adj. 1 of or like a spectre; ghostly. 2 of the spectrum or spectra.  spectrally adv.

Chocolate  —n. 1 a food preparation in the form of a paste or solid block made from ground cacao seeds and usu. Sweetened. B sweet made of or coated with this. C drink containing this. 2 deep brown. —adj. 1 made from chocolate. 2 deep brown. [aztec chocolatl]

Stack  —n. 1 (esp. Orderly) pile or heap. 2 = *haystack. 3 colloq. Large quantity (a stack of work; stacks of money). 4 a = *chimney-stack. B = *smokestack. C tall factory chimney. 5 stacked group of aircraft. 6 part of a library where books are compactly stored. 7 high detached rock, esp. Off the coast of scotland. —v. 1 pile in a stack or stacks. 2 a arrange (cards) secretly for cheating. B manipulate (circumstances etc.) To suit one. 3 cause (aircraft) to fly in circles while waiting to land. [old norse]

Grueling  adj. (brit. Gruelling) extremely demanding or tiring.

Caterwaul  —v. Make the shrill howl of a cat. —n. This noise. [from *cat, -waul imitative]

Corrosion  n. 1 corroding or being corroded. 2 corroded area.  corrosive adj. & n.

Cattle  n.pl. Large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, esp. Bred for milk or meat. [anglo-french catel: related to *capital]

Unembarrassed  adj. Not embarrassed.

Ability  n. (pl. -ies) 1 (often foll. By to + infin.) Capacity or power. 2 cleverness, talent. [french: related to *able]

User  n. Person who uses a thing.

Ruse  n. Stratagem, trick. [french]

Stateless  adj. Having no nationality or citizenship.

Glazier  n. Person whose trade is glazing windows etc.

Executor  n. (fem. Executrix) person appointed by a testator to administer his or her will.  executorial adj.

Seventeen  adj. & n. 1 one more than sixteen. 2 symbol for this (17, xvii, xvii). 3 size etc. Denoted by seventeen.  seventeenth adj. & n. [old english]

Ortolan  n.  European bunting, eaten as a delicacy. [latin hortus garden]

Veronal  n. Sedative drug. [german from verona in italy]

Mortality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being subject to death. 2 loss of life on a large scale. 3 a number of deaths in a given period etc. B (in full mortality rate) death rate.

Skyward  —adv. (also skywards) towards the sky. —adj. Moving skyward.

Mollycoddle  v. (-ling) coddle, pamper. [related to *moll, *coddle]

Humph  int. & n. Inarticulate sound of doubt or dissatisfaction. [imitative]

Bluegrass  n. A kind of instrumental country-and-western music.

Institutional  adj. 1 of or like an institution. 2 typical of institutions.  institutionally adv.

Lancastrian  —n. 1 native of lancashire or lancaster. 2 hist. Member or supporter of the house of lancaster in the wars of the roses. —adj. Of or concerning lancashire or lancaster, or the house of lancaster. [lancaster in lancashire]

Lasso  —n. (pl. -s or -es) rope with a noose at one end, esp. For catching cattle. —v. (-es, -ed) catch with a lasso. [spanish lazo: related to *lace]

Uneasy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 nervous, anxious. 2 disturbing (uneasy suspicion).  uneasily adv. Uneasiness n.

Perception  n. 1 act or faculty of perceiving. 2 (often foll. By of) intuitive recognition of a truth, aesthetic quality, etc.; way of seeing, understanding.  perceptual adj.

Whaler  n. Whaling ship or seaman.

Mouthful  n. (pl. -s) 1 quantity of food etc. That fills the mouth. 2 small quantity. 3 colloq. Long or complicated word or phrase.

Afro  —adj. (of hair) tightly-curled and bushy. —n. (pl. -s) afro hairstyle.

Peerless  adj. Unequalled, superb.

Wasteful  adj. 1 extravagant. 2 causing or showing waste.  wastefully adv.

Gangplank  n. Movable plank for boarding or disembarking from a ship etc.

Candidate  n. 1 person nominated for or seeking office, an award, etc. 2 person or thing likely to gain some distinction or position. 3 person entered for an examination.  candidacy n. Candidature n. [latin, = white-robed]

Secant  n. Math. 1 ratio of the hypotenuse to the shorter side adjacent to an acute angle (in a right-angled triangle). 2 line cutting a curve at one or more points. [french]

Secrete  v. (-ting) 1 (of a cell, organ, etc.) Produce and discharge (a substance). 2 conceal.  secretory adj. [from *secret]

Abusive  adj. Insulting, offensive.  abusively adv.

Animal  —n. 1 living organism, esp. Other than man, which feeds and usu. Has sense-organs and a nervous system and can move quickly. 2 brutish person. —adj. 1 of or like an animal. 2 bestial; carnal. [latin animalis having breath]

Stunk  past and past part. Of *stink.

Tomography  n. Method of radiography displaying details in a selected plane within the body. [greek tome a cutting]

Heliotrope  n. Plant with fragrant purple flowers. [greek: related to *helio-, trepo turn]

Binary  —adj. 1 of two parts, dual. 2 of the binary system. —n. (pl. -ies) 1 something having two parts. 2 binary number. [latin bini two together]

Annular  adj. Ring-shaped. [latin anulus ring]

Acidulous  adj. Somewhat acid.

Unhorse  v. (-sing) throw (a rider) from a horse.

Faze  v. (-zing) (often as fazed adj.) Colloq. Disconcert, disorientate. [origin unknown]

Squadron  n. 1 unit of the raf with 10–18 aircraft. 2 detachment of warships employed on a particular duty. 3 organized group etc., esp. A cavalry division of two troops. [italian squadrone: related to *squad]

Instrument  n. 1 tool or implement, esp. For delicate or scientific work. 2 (in full musical instrument) device for producing musical sounds. 3 a thing used in performing an action. B person made use of. 4 measuring-device, esp. In an aeroplane. 5 formal, esp. Legal, document. [latin instrumentum: related to *instruct]

Ninefold  adj. & adv. 1 nine times as much or as many. 2 consisting of nine parts.

Pentacle  n. Figure used as a symbol, esp. In magic, e.g. A pentagram. [medieval latin pentaculum: related to *penta-]

Postbox  n. Public box for posting mail.

Potash  n. An alkaline potassium compound. [dutch: related to *pot1, *ash1]

Concerned  adj. 1 involved, interested. 2 troubled, anxious.  be concerned (often foll. By in) take part.  concernedly adv. Concernedness n.

Tyro  var. Of *tiro.

Transfiguration  n. 1 change of form or appearance. 2 a christ's appearance in radiant glory to three of his disciples (matt. 17:2, mark 9:2–3). B (transfiguration) festival of christ's transfiguration, 6 august. [latin: related to *transfigure]

Keynote  n. 1 (esp. Attrib.) Prevailing tone or idea, esp. In a speech, conference, etc. 2 mus. Note on which a key is based.

Beyond  —prep. 1 at or to the further side of. 2 outside the scope or understanding of (beyond repair; it is beyond me). 3 more than. —adv. 1 at or to the further side. 2 further on. —n. (prec. By the) the unknown after death. [old english: related to *by, *yon]

Pneumatic  adj. 1 filled with air or wind (pneumatic tyre). 2 operated by compressed air (pneumatic drill). [greek pneuma wind]

Barnacle  n. 1 marine crustacean clinging to rocks, ships' bottoms, etc. 2 tenacious attendant or follower. [french or medieval latin]

Admonish  v. 1 reprove. 2 urge, advise. 3 (foll. By of) warn.  admonishment n. Admonition n. Admonitory adj. [latin moneo warn]

Spoiler  n. 1 retarding device on an aircraft, interrupting the air flow. 2 similar device on a vehicle to increase contact with the ground at speed.

Malfunction  —n. Failure to function normally. —v. Fail to function normally.

Gain  —v. 1 obtain or win (gain advantage; gain recognition). 2 acquire as profits etc., earn. 3 (often foll. By in) get more of, improve (gain momentum; gain in experience). 4 benefit, profit. 5 (of a clock etc.) Become fast; become fast by (a specified amount of time). 6 (often foll. By on, upon) come closer to a person or thing pursued. 7 a reclaim (land from the sea). B win (a battle). 8 reach (a desired place). —n. 1 increase of wealth etc.; profit, improvement. 2 (in pl.) Sums of money got by trade etc. 3 increase in amount.  gain ground 1 advance. 2 (foll. By on) catch up (a person pursued). [french from germanic]

Antediluvian  adj. 1 of the time before the flood. 2 colloq. Very old or out of date. [from *ante-, latin diluvium deluge]

Bramble  n. Wild thorny shrub, esp. The blackberry.  brambly adj. [old english]

Regrade  v. (-ding) grade again or differently.

Demise  —n. 1 death; termination. 2 law transfer of an estate, title, etc. By demising. —v. (-sing) law transfer (an estate, title, etc.) By will, lease, or death. [anglo-french: related to *dismiss]

Perennial  —adj. 1 lasting through a year or several years. 2 (of a plant) lasting several years. 3 lasting a long time or for ever. —n. Perennial plant.  perennially adv. [latin perennis from annus year]

Status  n. 1 rank, social position, relative importance. 2 superior social etc. Position. [latin: related to *stature]

Dysfunction  n. Abnormality or impairment of functioning.

Devilish  —adj. 1 of or like a devil; wicked. 2 mischievous. —adv. Colloq. Very.  devilishly adv.

Absolutely  adv. 1 completely, utterly. 2 in an absolute sense (god exists absolutely). 3  colloq. (used in reply) quite so; yes.

Ululate  v. (-ting) howl, wail.  ululation n. [latin]

Enhance  v. (-cing) intensify (qualities, powers, etc.); improve (something already good).  enhancement n. [anglo-french from latin altus high]

Allotropy  n. Existence of two or more different physical forms of a chemical element.  allotropic adj. [greek allos different, tropos manner]

Workaholic  n. Colloq. Person addicted to working.

Advancement  n. Promotion of a person, cause, or plan.

Interlard  v. (usu. Foll. By with) mix (writing or speech) with unusual words or phrases. [french]

Supertax  n. Additional tax on incomes above a certain level.

Peregrine  n. (in full peregrine falcon) a kind of falcon much used for hawking. [latin peregrinus foreign]

Threat  n. 1 declaration of an intention to punish or hurt if an order etc. Is not obeyed. 2 indication of something undesirable coming (threat of war). 3 person or thing as a likely cause of harm etc. [old english]

Db  abbr. Decibel(s).

Isinglass  n. 1 gelatin obtained from fish, esp. Sturgeon, and used in making jellies, glue, etc. 2 mica. [dutch huisenblas sturgeon's bladder]

Pact  n. Agreement; treaty. [latin pactum]

Peckish  adj. Colloq. Hungry.

Snowcap  n. Snow-covered mountain peak.  snowcapped adj.

Burdock  n. Plant with prickly flowers and docklike leaves. [from *bur, *dock3]

Sestet  n. 1 last six lines of a sonnet. 2 sextet. [italian sesto sixth]

Dressage  n. Training of a horse in obedience and deportment; display of this. [french]

Sale  n. 1 exchange of a commodity for money etc.; act or instance of selling. 2 amount sold (sales were enormous). 3 temporary offering of goods at reduced prices. 4 a event at which goods are sold. B public auction.  on (or for) sale offered for purchase. [old english]

Bargee  n. Person sailing a barge.

Punishment  n. 1 punishing or being punished. 2 loss or suffering inflicted in this. 3 colloq. Severe treatment or suffering.

Syndicate  —n. 1 combination of individuals or businesses to promote a common interest. 2 agency supplying material simultaneously to a number of newspapers etc. 3 group of people who gamble, organize crime, etc. 4 committee of syndics. —v. (-ting) 1 form into a syndicate. 2 publish (material) through a syndicate.  syndication n. [latin: related to *syndic]

Putrefy  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 become or make putrid; go bad. 2 fester, suppurate. 3 become morally corrupt.  putrefaction n. Putrefactive adj. [latin puter putris rotten]

Musculature  n. Muscular system of a body or organ.

Pikestaff  n. Wooden shaft of a pike.  plain as a pikestaff quite plain or obvious.

Jehad  var. Of *jihad.

Specialist  n. 1 person trained in a particular branch of a profession, esp. Medicine. 2 person who specially studies a subject or area.

Parrot  —n. 1 mainly tropical bird with a short hooked bill, often vivid plumage, and the ability to mimic the human voice. 2 person who mechanically repeats another's words or actions. —v. (-t-) repeat mechanically. [french, diminutive of pierre peter]

Suppliant  —adj. Supplicating. —n. Supplicating person. [latin: related to *supplicate]

Moony  adj. (-ier, -iest) listless; stupidly dreamy.

Burglary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 illegal entry with intent to commit theft, do bodily harm, or do damage. 2 instance of this.

Usage  before 1968 in english law, burglary was a crime under statute and common law; since 1968 it has been a statutory crime only; cf. *housebreaking.

Fatstock  n. Livestock fattened for slaughter.

Cumquat  var. Of *kumquat.

Shellfish  n. (pl. Same) 1 aquatic mollusc with a shell. 2 crustacean.

Rateable  adj. (also ratable) liable to rates.

Redraw  v. (past redrew; past part. Redrawn) draw again or differently.

Adze  n. (us adz) tool like an axe, with an arched blade at right angles to the handle. [old english]

Emotion  n. 1 strong instinctive feeling such as love or fear. 2 emotional intensity or sensibility (spoke with emotion). [french: related to *motion]

Slalom  n. 1 ski-race down a zigzag obstacle course. 2 obstacle race in canoes etc. [norwegian]

Publicize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) advertise; make publicly known.

Allude  v. (-ding) (foll. By to) refer to, esp. Indirectly or briefly. [latin: related to *ad-, ludo play]

Unturned  adj. 1 not turned over, round, away, etc. 2 not shaped by turning.

Expunge  v. (-ging) erase, remove (objectionable matter) from a book etc. [latin expungo prick out (for deletion)]

Tithe  —n. 1 one-tenth of the annual produce of land or labour, formerly taken as a tax for the church. 2 tenth part. —v. (-thing) 1 subject to tithes. 2 pay tithes. [old english, = tenth]

Foolhardy  adj. (-ier, -iest) rashly or foolishly bold; reckless.  foolhardily adv. Foolhardiness n.

Hyphen  —n. Sign (-) used to join words semantically or syntactically (e.g. Fruit-tree, pick-me-up, rock-forming), to indicate the division of a word at the end of a line, or to indicate a missing or implied element (as in man- and womankind). —v. = *hyphenate. [greek huphen together]

Unfit  adj. (often foll. By for, or to + infin.) Not fit.

Pusillanimous  adj. Formal cowardly, timid.  pusillanimity n. [church latin pusillanimis from pusillus very small, animus mind]

Supine  —adj. 1 lying face upwards. 2 inert, indolent. —n. Latin verbal noun used only in the accusative and ablative. [latin]

Showcase  —n. 1 glass case for exhibiting goods etc. 2 event etc. Designed to exhibit someone or something to advantage. —v. (-sing) display in or as if in a showcase.

Microclimate  n. Small localized climate, e.g. Inside a greenhouse.

Sensational  adj. 1 causing or intended to cause great public excitement etc. 2 dazzling; wonderful (you look sensational).  sensationalize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). Sensationally adv.

Haslet  n. Pieces of (esp. Pig's) offal cooked together, usu. As a meat loaf. [french hastelet]

Rapport  n. Relationship or communication, esp. When useful and harmonious. [latin porto carry]

Gangrene  n. Death of body tissue, usu. Resulting from obstructed circulation.  gangrenous adj. [greek gaggraina]

Hairspring  n. Fine spring regulating the balance-wheel in a watch.

Glaswegian  —adj. Of glasgow. —n. Native of glasgow. [after norwegian]

Sectional  adj. 1 a of a social group (sectional interests). B partisan. 2 made in sections. 3 local rather than general.  sectionally adv.

Bride  n. Woman on her wedding day and during the period just before and after it. [old english]

Powerhouse  n. 1 = *power station. 2 person or thing of great energy.

Abolition  n. Abolishing or being abolished.  abolitionist n.

Subtotal  n. Total of one part of a group of figures to be added.

Cornet  n. 1 brass instrument resembling a trumpet but shorter and wider. 2 conical wafer for holding ice-cream.  cornetist n. (also cornettist). [latin cornu: related to *corn2]

Reckoning  n. 1 counting or calculating. 2 consideration or opinion. 3 settlement of an account.

Bugle  —n. Brass military instrument like a small trumpet. —v. (-ling) 1 sound a bugle. 2 sound (a call etc.) On a bugle.  bugler n. [latin buculus young bull]

Diffuse  —adj. 1 spread out, not concentrated. 2 not concise, wordy. —v. (-sing) 1 disperse or spread widely. 2 intermingle by diffusion.  diffusible adj. Diffusive adj. [latin: related to *found3]

Glider  n. Light aircraft without an engine.

Chortle  —n. Gleeful chuckle. —v. (-ling) utter or express with a chortle. [probably from *chuckle, *snort]

Councillor  n. Member of a (esp. Local) council.

Arcadian  —n. Idealized country dweller. —adj. Poetically rural. [greek arkadia in the peloponnese]

Misjudge  v. (-ging) (also absol.) 1 judge wrongly. 2 have a wrong opinion of.  misjudgement n. (also -judgment).

Keratin  n. Fibrous protein in hair, feathers, hooves, claws, horns, etc. [greek keras kerat- horn]

Rasher  n. Thin slice of bacon or ham. [origin unknown]

Ranger  n. 1 keeper of a royal or national park, or of a forest. 2 member of a body of mounted soldiers. 3 (ranger) senior guide.

Fatten  v. Make or become fat.

Polka  —n. 1 lively dance of bohemian origin. 2 music for this. —v. (-kas, -kaed or -ka'd, -kaing) dance the polka. [czech pulka]

Paragon  n. (often foll. By of) model of excellence etc. [greek parakone]

Waif  n. 1 homeless and helpless person, esp. An abandoned child. 2 ownerless object or animal. [anglo-french, probably from scandinavian]

Troublesome  adj. Causing trouble, annoying.

Osmosis  n. 1 passage of a solvent through a semi-permeable partition into another solution. 2 process by which something is acquired by absorption.  osmotic adj. [greek osmos push]

Griddle  n. Circular iron plate placed over a source of heat for baking etc. [latin cratis hurdle]

Direction  n. 1 directing; supervision. 2 (usu. In pl.) Order or instruction. 3 line along which, or point to or from which, a person or thing moves or looks. 4 tendency or scope of a theme, subject, etc.

Indistinct  adj. 1 not distinct. 2 confused, obscure.  indistinctly adv.

Purely  adv. 1 in a pure manner. 2 merely, solely, exclusively.

Actinism  n. Property of short-wave radiation that produces chemical changes, as in photography. [greek aktis ray]

Statue  n. Sculptured figure of a person or animal, esp. Life-size or larger. [latin statua]

Marquess  n. British nobleman ranking between duke and earl. [var. Of *marquis]

Tc  symb. Technetium.

Interwar  attrib. Adj. Existing in the period between two wars.

Calendula  n. Plant with large yellow or orange flowers, esp. The marigold. [latin diminutive of kalendae]

Gallon  n. 1 measure of capacity equal to eight pints (4.5 litres; for wine, or us, 3.8 litres). 2 (in pl.) Colloq. Large amount. [french]

Inconsolable  adj. (of a person, grief, etc.) That cannot be consoled.  inconsolably adv.

Ast  abbr. Atlantic standard time.

Canteen  n. 1 a restaurant for employees in an office, factory, etc. B shop for provisions in a barracks or camp. 2 case of cutlery. 3 soldier's or camper's water-flask. [italian, = cellar]

Tester  n. 1 person or thing that tests. 2 bottle etc. Containing a cosmetic for trial in a shop.

Unchivalrous  adj. Not chivalrous.  unchivalrously adv.

Unsparing  adj. 1 lavish. 2 merciless.

Sugary  adj. 1 containing or like sugar. 2 excessively sweet or esp. Sentimental.  sugariness n.

Retiring  adj. Shy; fond of seclusion.

Reply  —v. (-ies, -ied) 1 (often foll. By to) make an answer, respond in word or action. 2 say in answer. —n. (pl. -ies) 1 replying (what did they say in reply?). 2 what is replied; response. [latin replico fold back]

Unfitting  adj. Not suitable, unbecoming.

Lens  n. 1 piece of a transparent substance with one or (usu.) Both sides curved for concentrating or dispersing light-rays esp. In optical instruments. 2 combination of lenses used in photography. 3 transparent substance behind the iris of the eye. 4 = *contact lens. [latin lens lent- lentil (from the similarity of shape)]

Southwester  n. South-west wind.

Suave  adj. Smooth; polite; sophisticated.  suavely adv. Suavity n. [latin suavis]

Steerage  n. 1 act of steering. 2 archaic cheapest part of a ship's accommodation.

Lank  adj. 1 (of hair, grass, etc.) Long and limp. 2 thin and tall. [old english]

Leech  n. 1 bloodsucking worm formerly much used medically. 2 person who sponges on others. [old english]

Ace  —n. 1 playing-card etc. With a single spot and generally signifying ‘one’. 2 a person who excels in some activity. B pilot who has shot down many enemy aircraft. 3 (in tennis) unreturnable stroke (esp. A service). —adj. Slang excellent.  within an ace of on the verge of. [latin as unity]

Upstate  us —n. Provincial, esp. Northern, part of a state. —attrib. Adj. Of this part. —adv. In or to this part.

Platform  n. 1 raised level surface, esp. One from which a speaker addresses an audience or one alongside the line at a railway station. 2 floor area at the entrance to a bus etc. 3 thick sole of a shoe. 4 declared policy of a political party. [french: related to *plate, *form]

Kaleidoscope  n. 1 tube containing mirrors and pieces of coloured glass etc. Producing changing reflected patterns when shaken. 2 constantly changing pattern, group, etc.  kaleidoscopic adj. [greek kalos beautiful, eidos form, *-scope]

Faithfully  adv. In a faithful manner.  yours faithfully formula for ending a formal letter when it begins ‘dear sir’ or ‘dear madam’.

Birdcage  n. Cage for birds.

Not  adv. Expressing negation, esp.: 1 (also n't joined to a preceding verb) following an auxiliary verb or be or (in a question) the subject of such a verb (i cannot say; she isn't there; am i not right?). 2 used elliptically for a negative phrase etc. (is she coming? — i hope not; do you want it? — certainly not!).  not at all (in polite reply to thanks) there is no need for thanks. Not half see *half. Not quite 1 almost. 2 noticeably not (not quite proper). [contraction of *nought]

Usage  the use of not with verbs other than auxiliaries or be is now archaic except with participles and infinitives (not knowing, i cannot say; we asked them not to come).

Acrostic  n. Poem etc. In which certain letters (usu. The first and last in each line) form a word or words. [greek akron end, stikhos row]

Restrain  v. 1 (often refl., usu. Foll. By from) check or hold in; keep in check, under control, or within bounds. 2 repress, keep down. 3 confine, imprison. [latin restringo -strict-]

Magical  adj. 1 of magic. 2 resembling, or produced as if by, magic. 3 wonderful, enchanting.  magically adv.

Sulfur  n. (brit. Sulphur) 1 pale-yellow non-metallic element burning with a blue flame and a suffocating smell. 2 pale greenish-yellow colour. [anglo-french from latin]

Goodbye  (us goodby) —int. Expressing good wishes on parting, ending a telephone conversation, etc. —n. (pl. -byes or us -bys) parting; farewell. [from god be with you!]

Termination  n. 1 terminating or being terminated. 2 induced abortion. 3 ending or result. 4 word's final syllable or letter.

Fug  n. Colloq. Close stuffy atmosphere.  fuggy adj. [origin unknown]

Mahlstick  var. Of *maulstick.

Underline  v. (-ning) 1 draw a line under (a word etc.) To give emphasis, indicate italic type, etc. 2 emphasize, stress.

Compartment  n. 1 space within a larger space, separated by partitions. 2 watertight division of a ship. 3 area of activity etc. Kept apart from others in a person's mind. [latin: related to *part]

Woven  past part. Of *weave1.

Alternator  n. Dynamo that generates an alternating current.

Undertaking  n. 1 work etc. Undertaken, enterprise (serious undertaking). 2 promise. 3  professional funeral management.

Mores  n.pl. Customs or conventions of a community. [latin, pl. Of mos custom]

Unbeaten  adj. 1 not beaten. 2 (of a record etc.) Not surpassed.

Colonize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 establish a colony in. 2 join a colony.  colonization n.

Buyer  n. 1 person employed to purchase stock for a large store etc. 2 purchaser, customer.

Quoit  n. 1 ring thrown to encircle an iron peg. 2 (in pl.) Game using these. [origin unknown]

Ignite  v. (-ting) 1 set fire to. 2 catch fire. 3 provoke or excite (feelings etc.). [latin ignio ignit- set on fire]

Purity  n. Pureness, cleanness.

Following  —prep. After in time; as a sequel to. —n. Supporters or devotees. —adj. That follows or comes after.  the following 1 what follows. 2 now to be given or named (answer the following).

Plenipotentiary  —n. (pl. -ies) person (esp. A diplomat) invested with full authority to act. —adj. Having this power. [latin: related to *plenary, *potent]

Historicism  n. 1 theory that social and cultural phenomena are determined by history. 2 belief that historical events are governed by laws.

Evangelist  n. 1 writer of one of the four gospels. 2 preacher of the gospel.  evangelistic adj.

Few  —adj. Not many (few doctors smoke). —n. (as pl.) 1 (prec. By a) some but not many (a few of his friends were there). 2 not many (few are chosen). 3 (prec. By the) a the minority. B the elect.  a good few colloq. Fairly large number. No fewer than as many as (a specified number). Not a few a considerable number. [old english]

Wrest  v. 1 wrench away from a person's grasp. 2 (foll. By from) obtain by effort or with difficulty. [old english]

Polychromatic  adj. 1 many-coloured. 2 (of radiation) containing more than one wavelength.  polychromatism n.

Gymnosperm  n. Any of a group of plants having seeds unprotected by an ovary, including conifers, cycads, and ginkgos. [greek gumnos naked]

Instinct  —n. 1 a innate pattern of behaviour, esp. In animals. B innate impulse. 2 intuition. —predic. Adj. (foll. By with) imbued, filled (with life, beauty, etc.).  instinctive adj. Instinctively adv. Instinctual adj. [latin stinguo prick]

Instruction  n. 1 (often in pl.) A order. B direction (as to how a thing works etc.). 2 teaching (course of instruction).  instructional adj.

Tricksy  adj. (-ier, -iest) full of tricks; playful.

Candystripe  n. Alternate stripes of white and a colour.  candystriped adj.

Refreeze  v. (-zing; past refroze; past part. Refrozen) freeze again.

Shillelagh  n. Irish cudgel. [shillelagh in ireland]

Stodge  n. Colloq. Heavy fattening food. [imitative, after stuff and podge]

Facile  adj. Usu. Derog. 1 easily achieved but of little value. 2 glib, fluent. [latin facio do]

Turntable  n. 1 circular revolving plate on which records are played. 2 circular revolving platform for turning a railway locomotive.

Rakish  adj. 1 dashing; jaunty. 2 dissolute.  rakishly adv. [from *rake2]

Trefoil  n. 1 leguminous plant with leaves of three leaflets, esp. Clover. 2 three-lobed ornamentation, esp. In tracery windows. [anglo-french: related to *tri-, *foil2]

Jailbird  n. (also gaolbird) prisoner or habitual criminal.

Hepta-  comb. Form seven. [greek]

Dependency  n. (pl. -ies) country or province controlled by another.

Assimilate  v. (-ting) 1 absorb or be absorbed, either physically or mentally. 2 (usu. Foll. By to, with) make like; cause to resemble.  assimilable adj. Assimilation n. Assimilative adj. Assimilator n. [latin similis like]

Shun  v. (-nn-) avoid; keep clear of. [old english]

Joggle  —v. (-ling) move in jerks. —n. Slight shake.

Conventicle  n. Esp. Hist. Secret or unlawful religious meeting, esp. Of dissenters. [latin: related to *convene]

Theologian  n. Expert in theology. [french: related to *theology]

Nominal  adj. 1 existing in name only; not real or actual. 2 (of a sum of money etc.) Very small. 3 of or in names (nominal and essential distinctions). 4 of, as, or like a noun.  nominally adv. [latin nomen name]

Ku  symb. Kurchatovium.

Impermissible  adj. Not allowable.

Geographical  adj. (also geographic) of geography.  geographically adv.

Fieldsman  n. Cricket, baseball, etc. Member (other than the bowler or pitcher) of the fielding side.

Prowl  —v. (often foll. By about, around) roam (a place) esp. Stealthily or restlessly or in search of prey, plunder, etc. —n. Act of prowling.  on the prowl prowling.  prowler n. [origin unknown]

Stocktaking  n. 1 making an inventory of stock. 2 review of one's position etc.

Meninges  n.pl. Three membranes enclosing the brain and spinal cord. [greek menigx membrane]

Comedown  n. 1 loss of status. 2 disappointment.

Unfertilized  adj. (also -ised) not fertilized.

Wait  —v. 1 a defer action or departure for a specified time or until some event occurs (wait a minute; wait till i come; wait for a fine day). B be expectant. 2 await (an opportunity, one's turn, etc.). 3 defer (a meal etc.) Until a person's arrival. 4 (usu. As waiting n.) Park a vehicle for a short time. 5 act as a waiter or attendant. 6 (foll. By on, upon) a await the convenience of. B serve as an attendant to. C pay a respectful visit to. —n. 1 period of waiting. 2 (usu. Foll. By for) watching for an enemy (lie in wait). 3 (in pl.) Archaic street singers of christmas carols.  wait and see await the progress of events. Wait up (often foll. By for) not go to bed until a person arrives or an event happens. You wait! Used to imply a threat, warning, etc. [germanic: related to *wake1]

Utensil  n. Implement or vessel, esp. For kitchen use. [medieval latin: related to *use]

Diagnostics  n. 1 (treated as pl.) Computing programs etc. Used to identify faults in hardware or software. 2 (treated as sing.) Science of diagnosing disease.

Astir  predic. Adj. & adv. 1 in motion. 2 out of bed.

Crank  —n. 1 part of an axle or shaft bent at right angles for converting reciprocal into circular motion or vice versa. 2 eccentric person. —v. Cause to move by means of a crank.  crank up start (a car engine) with a crank. [old english]

Eclipse  —n. 1 obscuring of light from one heavenly body by another. 2 loss of light, importance, or prominence. —v. (-sing) 1 (of a heavenly body) cause the eclipse of (another). 2 intercept (light). 3 outshine, surpass. [greek ekleipsis]

Enactment  n. 1 law enacted. 2 process of enacting.

Methinks  v. (past methought) archaic it seems to me. [old english: related to *me1, *think]

Gladden  v. Make or become glad.

Forensic  adj. 1 of or used in courts of law (forensic science; forensic medicine). 2 of or involving forensic science (sent for forensic examination). forensically adv. [latin forensis: related to *forum]

Usage  use of forensic in sense 2 is common but considered an illogical extension of sense 1 by some people.

Baton  n. 1 thin stick for conducting an orchestra etc. 2 short stick passed on in a relay race. 3 stick carried by a drum major. 4 staff of office. [french from latin]

Obeisance  n. 1 bow, curtsy, or other respectful gesture. 2 homage.  obeisant adj. [french: related to *obey]

Premenstrual  adj. Of the time shortly before each menstruation (premenstrual tension).

Stringy  adj. (-ier, -iest) like string, fibrous.  stringiness n.

Scary  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Frightening.

Temperamental  adj. 1 of temperament. 2 a (of a person) unreliable; moody. B colloq. (of esp. A machine) unreliable, unpredictable.  temperamentally adv.

Relevant  adj. (often foll. By to) bearing on or having reference to the matter in hand.  relevance n. [latin relevo: related to *relieve]

Skipper  —n. 1  captain of a ship or aircraft. 2 captain of a sporting team. —v. Be captain of. [low german or dutch schipper]

Actually  adv. 1 as a fact, really (not actually very rich). 2 strange as it may seem (he actually refused!).

Probity  n. Uprightness, honesty. [latin probus good]

Toast  —n. 1 sliced bread browned on both sides by radiant heat. 2 a person or thing in whose honour a company is requested to drink. B call to drink or an instance of drinking in this way. —v. 1 brown by radiant heat. 2 warm (one's feet, oneself, etc.) At a fire etc. 3 drink to the health or in honour of (a person or thing). [french toster roast]

Judicial  adj. 1 of, done by, or proper to a court of law. 2 having the function of judgement (judicial assembly). 3 of or proper to a judge. 4 impartial.  judicially adv. [latin judicium judgement]

Pyorrhoea  n. (us pyorrhea) 1 gum disease causing loosening of the teeth. 2 discharge of pus. [greek puon pus, rheo flow]

Evangelism  n. Preaching or spreading of the gospel.

Intermingle  v. (-ling) mix together; mingle.

Abscess  n. (pl. Abscesses) swelling containing pus. [latin: related to *ab-, *cede]

Dryly  var. Of *drily.

Synchronize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 (often foll. By with) make or be synchronous (with). 2 make the sound and picture of (a film etc.) Coincide. 3 cause (clocks etc.) To show the same time.  synchronization n.

Usage  synchronize should not be used in standard english to mean ‘coordinate’ or ‘combine’.

Mercifully  adv. 1 in a merciful manner. 2 fortunately (mercifully, the sun came out).

Headword  n. Word forming a heading.

Commodore  n. 1 naval officer above captain and below rear-admiral. 2 commander of a squadron or other division of a fleet. 3 president of a yacht-club. [french: related to *commander]

Nocturnal  adj. Of or in the night; done or active by night.  [latin nox noct- night]

Incandesce  v. (-cing) (cause to) glow with heat.

Utterance  n. 1 act of uttering. 2 thing spoken. 3 power or manner of speaking.

Geodesic  adj. (also geodetic) of geodesy.

Pierce  v. (-cing) 1 a (of a sharp instrument etc.) Penetrate. B (often foll. By with) make a hole in or through with a sharp-pointed instrument. C make (a hole etc.). 2 (as piercing adj.) (of a glance, sound, light, pain, cold, etc.) Keen, sharp, or unpleasantly penetrating. 3 (often foll. By through, into) force a way through or into, penetrate. [french percer from latin pertundo bore through]

Sherpa  n. (pl. Same or -s) member of a himalayan people living on the borders of nepal and tibet. [native name]

Anyway  adv. 1 in any way or manner. 2 at any rate. 3 to resume (anyway, as i was saying).

Disillusion  —v. Free from an illusion or mistaken belief. —n. Disillusioned state.  disillusionment n.

Courtier  n. Person who attends a sovereign's court. [anglo-french: related to *court]

Gale  n. 1 very strong wind or storm. 2 outburst, esp. Of laughter. [origin unknown]

Containment  n. Action or policy of preventing the expansion of a hostile country or influence.

Calix  var. Of *calyx.

Basilica  n. 1 ancient roman hall with an apse and colonnades, used as a lawcourt etc. 2 similar building as a christian church. [greek basilike (stoa) royal (portico)]

Withershins  var. Of *widdershins.

Birth  n. 1 emergence of a baby or young from its mother's body. 2 beginning (birth of civilization). 3 a ancestry (of noble birth). B high or noble birth; inherited position.  give birth to 1 produce (young). 2 be the cause of. [old norse]

Monochrome  —n. Photograph or picture done in one colour or different tones of this, or in black and white only. —adj. Having or using only one colour or in black and white only. [from *mono-, greek khroma colour]

Unkind  adj. Not kind; harsh, cruel.  unkindly adv. Unkindness n.

Value  —n. 1 worth, desirability, or utility, or the qualities on which these depend. 2 worth as estimated (set a high value on my time). 3 amount for which a thing can be exchanged in the open market. 4 equivalent of a thing. 5 (in full value for money) something well worth the money spent. 6 effectiveness (news value). 7 (in pl.) One's principles, priorities, or standards. 8 mus. Duration of a note. 9 math. Amount denoted by an algebraic term. —v. (-ues, -ued, -uing) 1 estimate the value of, esp. Professionally. 2 have a high or specified opinion of.  valueless adj. Valuer n. [french past part. Of valoir be worth, from latin valeo]

Vogue  n. 1 (prec. By the) prevailing fashion. 2 (often attrib.) Popular use (had a great vogue).  in vogue in fashion.  voguish adj. [french from italian]

Service  —n. 1 work, or the doing of work, for another or for a community etc. (often in pl.: the services of a lawyer). 2 work done by a machine etc. (has given good service). 3 assistance or benefit given. 4 provision or supplying of a public need, e.g. Transport, or (often in pl.) Of water, gas, electricity, etc. 5 employment as a servant. 6 state or period of employment (resigned after 15 years' service). 7 public or crown department or organization (civil service). 8 (in pl.) The armed forces.

Convoluted  adj. 1 coiled, twisted. 2 complex. [latin volvo volut- roll]

Coexist  v. (often foll. By with) 1 exist together. 2 (esp. Of nations) exist in mutual tolerance of each other's ideologies etc.  coexistence n. Coexistent adj.

Pharmacy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 preparation and (esp. Medicinal) dispensing of drugs. 2 pharmacist's shop, dispensary.

Roundel  n. 1 circular mark, esp. Identifying military aircraft. 2 small disc, esp. A medallion. [french rondel(le): related to *round]

Watchword  n. Phrase summarizing a guiding principle.

Meerschaum  n. 1 soft white clay-like substance. 2 tobacco-pipe with its bowl made from this. [german, = sea-foam]

Diabolism  n. 1 worship of the devil. 2 sorcery. [greek: related to *devil]

Philtre  n. (us philter) love-potion. [greek phileo to love]

Chilly  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 somewhat cold. 2 sensitive to the cold. 3 unfriendly; unemotional.

Rhyme  —n. 1 identity of sound between words or their endings, esp. In verse. 2 (in sing. Or pl.) Verse or a poem having rhymes. 3 use of rhyme. 4 word providing a rhyme. —v. (-ming) 1 a (of words or lines) produce a rhyme. B (foll. By with) act as or treat (a word) as a rhyme (with another). 2 make or write rhymes. 3 put or make (a story etc.) Into rhyme.  rhyme or reason sense, logic. [latin: related to *rhythm]

Overstep  v. (-pp-) pass beyond (a permitted or acceptable limit).  overstep the mark violate conventional behaviour etc.

Uninitiated  adj. Not initiated, admitted, or instructed.

Sickness  n. 1 being ill; disease. 2 vomiting or a tendency to vomit.

Tangent  n. 1 (often attrib.) Straight line, curve, or surface that meets a curve at a point, but does not intersect it. 2 ratio of two sides (other than the hypotenuse) opposite and adjacent to an acute angle in a right-angled triangle.  at a tangent diverging from a previous course or from what is relevant or central (go off at a tangent). [latin tango tact- touch]

Amatory  adj. Of sexual love. [latin amo love]

Protein  n. Any of a group of organic compounds composed of one or more chains of amino acids and forming an essential part of all living organisms. [greek protos first]

Nightcap  n. 1 hist. Cap worn in bed. 2 hot or alcoholic drink taken at bedtime.

Pillowcase  n. (also pillowslip) washable cover for a pillow.

Dull  —adj. 1 tedious; not interesting. 2 (of the weather) overcast. 3 (of colour, light, sound, etc.) Not bright, vivid, or clear. 4 (of a pain) indistinct; not acute (a dull ache). 5 slow-witted; stupid. 6 (of a knife-edge etc.) Blunt. 7 a (of trade etc.) Sluggish, slow. B listless; depressed. 8 (of the ears, eyes, etc.) Lacking keenness. —v. Make or become dull.  dullness n. Dully adv. [low german or dutch]

Tonnage  n. 1 ship's internal cubic capacity or freight-carrying capacity. 2 charge per ton on freight or cargo. [related to *ton]

Ramification  n. (usu. In pl.) 1 consequence. 2 subdivision of a complex structure or process. [french: related to *ramify]

Hyperbola  n. (pl. -s or -lae) plane curve produced when a cone is cut by a plane that makes a larger angle with the base than the side of the cone makes.  hyperbolic adj. [greek hyperbole, = excess: related to *hyper-, ballo throw]

Linger  v. 1 stay about. 2 (foll. By over, on, etc.) Dally (linger over dinner; lingered on the final note). 3 (esp. Of an illness) be protracted. 4 (often foll. By on) be slow in dying. [old english lengan: related to *long1]

Rosewood  n. Any of several fragrant close-grained woods used in making furniture.

Picnic  —n. 1 outing including an outdoor meal. 2 meal eaten out of doors. 3 (usu. With neg.) Colloq. Something agreeable or easily accomplished etc. —v. (-ck-) take part in a picnic. [french pique-nique]

Rump  n. 1 hind part of a mammal or bird, esp. The buttocks. 2 remnant of a parliament etc. [probably scandinavian]

Horticulture  n. Art of garden cultivation.  horticultural adj. Horticulturist n. [latin hortus garden, *culture]

Handhold  n. Something for the hand to grip on (in climbing etc.).

Prescriptive  adj. 1 prescribing, laying down rules. 2 arising from custom.

Glossary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 list or dictionary of technical or special words. 2 collection of glosses. [latin: related to *gloss2]

Defeatism  n. Excessive readiness to accept defeat.  defeatist n. & adj.

Pupa  n. (pl. Pupae) insect in the stage between larva and imago.  pupal adj. [latin, = doll]

Involuntary  adj. 1 done without exercising the will; unintentional. 2 (of a muscle) not under the control of the will.  involuntarily adv. Involuntariness n.

Eulogy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 speech or writing in praise of a person. 2 expression of praise. [latin from greek]

Emphasize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) put emphasis on, stress.

Meditative  adj. 1 inclined to meditate. 2 indicative of meditation, thoughtful.  meditatively adv. Meditativeness n.

Elementary  adj. 1 dealing with the simplest facts of a subject. 2 unanalysable.

Stairway  n. = *staircase.

Pinstripe  n. 1 (often attrib.) Narrow stripe in cloth (pinstripe suit). 2 (in sing. Or pl.) Pinstripe suit (came wearing his pinstripes).  pinstriped adj.

Mistrial  n. Trial rendered invalid by error.

Alms  n.pl. Hist. Donation of money or food to the poor. [greek eleemosune pity]

Lop  v. (-pp-) 1 a (often foll. By off, away) cut or remove (a part or parts) from a whole, esp. Branches from a tree. B remove branches from (a tree). 2 (often foll. By off) remove (items) as superfluous. [old english]

Permissive  adj. 1 tolerant or liberal, esp. In sexual matters. 2 giving permission.  permissiveness n. [french or medieval latin: related to *permit]

Swam  past of *swim.

Ancestral  adj. Belonging to or inherited from one's ancestors.

Smock  —n. 1 loose shirtlike garment often ornamented with smocking. 2 loose overall. —v. Adorn with smocking. [old english]

Kg  abbr. Knight of the order of the garter.

Gainful  adj. 1 (of employment) paid. 2 lucrative.  gainfully adv.

Bristle  —n. Short stiff hair, esp. One on an animal's back, used in brushes. —v. (-ling) 1 a (of hair) stand upright. B make (hair) do this. 2 show irritation. 3 (usu. Foll. By with) be covered or abundant (in).  bristly adj. (-ier, -iest). [old english]

Drab  adj. (drabber, drabbest) 1 dull, uninteresting. 2 of a dull brownish colour.  drably adv. Drabness n. [obsolete drap cloth]

Chronic  adj. 1 (esp. Of an illness) long-lasting. 2 having a chronic complaint. 3 colloq. Very bad; intense, severe. 4 colloq. Habitual, inveterate (a chronic liar).  chronically adv. [greek khronos time]

Usage  the use of chronic in sense 3 is very informal, and its use in sense 4 is considered incorrect by some people.

Unhand  v. Rhet. Or joc. Take one's hands off (a person); release.

Analyse  v. (us analyze) (-sing or -zing) 1 examine in detail; ascertain the constituents of (a substance, sentence, etc.). 2 psychoanalyse.

Mediterranean  adj.  Of the sea bordered by s. Europe, sw asia, and n. Africa, or its surrounding region (mediterranean cookery). [latin mediterraneus inland]

Inflammation  n. 1 inflaming. 2 bodily condition with heat, swelling, redness, and usu. Pain.

Warehouse   —n. 1 building in which goods are stored. 2 wholesale or large retail store. —v. (-sing) store temporarily in a repository.

Antenatal  adj. 1 before birth. 2 of pregnancy.

Scrounge  v. (-ging) (also absol.) Obtain by cadging.  on the scrounge scrounging.  scrounger n. [dial. Scrunge steal]

Inexperience  n. Lack of experience, knowledge, or skill.  inexperienced adj.

Courgette  n. Small vegetable marrow. [french]

Unjustified  adj. Not justified.

Courage  n. Ability to disregard fear; bravery.  courage of one's convictions courage to act on one's beliefs. [latin cor heart]

Briton  n. 1 inhabitant of s. Britain before the roman conquest. 2 native or inhabitant of great britain. [latin britto -onis]

Tomfool  —n. Foolish person. —attrib. Adj. Silly, foolish.

Fateful  adj. 1 important, decisive. 2 controlled by fate.  fatefully adv.

Shipshape  adv. & predic.adj. Trim, neat, tidy.

Proterozoic  geol. —adj. Of the later part of the precambrian era. —n. This time. [greek proteros former, zoe life]

Gordian  adj.  cut the gordian knot solve a problem by force or by evasion. [gordius king of phrygia, who tied a knot later cut by alexander the great]

Glutton  n. 1 greedy eater. 2 (often foll. By for) colloq. Person insatiably eager (glutton for work). 3 voracious animal of the weasel family.  gluttonous adj. Gluttonously adv. [latin gluttio *swallow1]

Catastrophe  n. 1 great and usu. Sudden disaster. 2 denouement of a drama.  catastrophic adj. Catastrophically adv. [greek strepho turn]

Zealot  n. Extreme partisan; fanatic.  zealotry n.

Mirth  n. Merriment, laughter.  mirthful adj. [old english: related to *merry]

Rhetorical  adj. 1 expressed artificially or extravagantly. 2 of the nature or art of rhetoric.  rhetorically adv. [greek: related to *rhetoric]

Spectacular  —adj. Striking, impressive, lavish. —n. Spectacular show.  spectacularly adv.

Roman  —adj. 1 of ancient rome, its territory, people, etc. 2 of medieval or modern rome. 3 = *roman catholic. 4 (roman) (of type) plain and upright, used in ordinary print. 5 (of the alphabet etc.) Based on the ancient roman system with letters a–z. —n. 1 citizen or soldier of the ancient roman republic or empire. 2 citizen of modern rome. 3 = *roman catholic. 4 (roman) roman type. [latin]

Glissade  —n. 1 controlled slide down a snow slope in mountaineering. 2 gliding step in ballet. —v. (-ding) perform a glissade. [french]

Vas  n. (pl. Vasa) vessel or duct. [latin, = vessel]

Dinky  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Neat and attractive; small, dainty. [scots dink]

Contiguous  adj. (usu. Foll. By with, to) touching; in contact.  contiguity n. [latin: related to *contact]

Callus  n. (pl. Calluses) 1 area of hard thick skin or tissue. 2 hard tissue formed round bone ends after a fracture. [latin]

Returnee  n. Person who returns home from abroad, esp. After war service.

Nit  n. 1 egg or young form of a louse or other parasitic insect. 2 slang stupid person. [old english]

Kamikaze  —n. Hist. 1 explosive-laden japanese aircraft deliberately crashed on a ship etc. During the war of 1939–45. 2 pilot of this. —attrib. Adj. 1 of a kamikaze. 2 reckless, esp. Suicidal. [japanese, = divine wind]

Nursery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a a room or place equipped for young children. B = *day nursery. 2 place where plants are reared for sale. [probably anglo-french: related to *nurse]

Eroticism  n. 1 erotic character. 2 use of or response to erotic images or stimulation.

Mountebank  n. 1 swindler; charlatan. 2 hist. Itinerant quack. [italian, = mount on bench]

Paper  —n. 1 material made in thin sheets from the pulp of wood etc., used for writing, drawing, or printing on, or as wrapping material etc. 2 (attrib.) A made of or using paper. B flimsy like paper. 3 = *newspaper. 4 a printed document. B (in pl.) Identification etc. Documents.

Resource  —n. 1 expedient or device. 2 (often in pl.) Means available; stock or supply that can be drawn on; asset. 3 (in pl.) Country's collective wealth. 4 skill in devising expedients (person of great resource). 5 (in pl.) One's inner strength, ingenuity, etc. —v. (-cing) provide with resources.  resourceful adj. (in sense 4). Resourcefully adv. Resourcefulness n. [french: related to *source]

Breviary  n. (pl. -ies) book containing the roman catholic daily office. [latin: related to *brief]

Bister  n. (brit. Bistre) brownish pigment from wood soot. [french]

Carnival  n. 1 a annual festivities including a parade through the streets in fancy dress. B festival preceding lent. 2 merrymaking. 3 us funfair or circus. [latin carnem levo put away meat]

Worship  —n. 1 a homage or service to a deity. B acts, rites, or ceremonies of this. 2 adoration, devotion. 3 (worship) (prec. By his, her, your) forms of description or address for a mayor, certain magistrates, etc. —v. (-pp-; us -p-) 1 adore as divine; honour with religious rites. 2 idolize or regard with adoration. 3 attend public worship. 4 be full of adoration.  worshipper n. [old english: related to *worth, *-ship]

Rebuke  —v. (-king) express sharp disapproval to (a person) for a fault; censure. —n. Rebuking or being rebuked. [anglo-french]

Demotivate  v. (-ting) (also absol.) Cause to lose motivation or incentive.  demotivation n.

Groundwater  n. Water found in soil or in pores, crevices, etc., in rock.

Yodel  —v. (-ll-; us -l-) sing with melodious inarticulate sounds and frequent changes between falsetto and normal voice in the manner of swiss mountain-dwellers. —n. Yodelling cry.  yodeller n. [german]

Resell  v. (past and past part. Resold) sell (an object etc.) After buying it.

Decency  n. (pl. -ies) 1 correct, honourable, or modest behaviour. 2 (in pl.) Proprieties; manners. [latin: related to *decent]

Signora  n. Title used of or to an italian-speaking esp. Married woman.

Brothel  n. Premises for prostitution. [originally = worthless fellow, from old english]

Opium  n. Drug made from the juice of a certain poppy, used esp. As an analgesic and narcotic. [latin from greek opion]

Pawnbroker  n. Person who lends money at interest on the security of personal property.

Geminate  —adj. Combined in pairs. —v. (-ting) 1 double, repeat. 2 arrange in pairs.  gemination n. [latin: related to *gemini]

Wad  —n. 1 lump of soft material used esp. To keep things apart or in place or to block a hole. 2 bundle of banknotes or documents. —v. (-dd-) 1 stop up or keep in place with a wad. 2 line, stuff, or protect with wadding. [origin uncertain]

Margin  —n. 1 edge or border of a surface. 2 blank border flanking print etc. 3 amount by which a thing exceeds, falls short, etc. (won by a narrow margin). 4 lower limit (his effort fell below the margin). —v. (-n-) provide with a margin or marginal notes. [latin margo -ginis]

Imf  abbr. International monetary fund.

Vulcanize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) treat (rubber etc.) With sulphur at a high temperature to strengthen it.  vulcanization n. [vulcan: related to *volcano]

True  —adj. (truer, truest) 1 in accordance with fact or reality (a true story). 2 genuine; rightly or strictly so called. 3 (often foll. By to) loyal, faithful. 4 (foll. By to) accurately conforming to (a type or standard) (true to form). 5 correctly positioned or balanced; upright, level. 6 exact, accurate (a true copy). —adv.

Indite  v. (-ting) formal or joc. 1 put (a speech etc.) Into words. 2 write (a letter etc.). [french: related to *indict]

Salutary  adj. Having a good effect. [latin: related to *salute]

Fogy  n. (also fogey) (pl. -ies or -eys) dull old-fashioned person (esp. Old fogy). [origin unknown]

Finis  n. End, esp. Of a book. [latin]

Mantelshelf  n. Shelf above a fireplace.

Baa  —v. (baas, baaed or baa'd) bleat. —n. Sheep's cry. [imitative]

Afterthought  n. Thing thought of or added later.

Antistatic  adj. Counteracting the effects of static electricity.

Unbounded  adj. Infinite (unbounded optimism).

Admirable  adj. Deserving admiration; excellent.  admirably adv. [latin: related to *admire]

Wakeful  adj. 1 unable to sleep. 2 (of a night etc.) Sleepless. 3 vigilant.  wakefully adv. Wakefulness n.

Lash  —v. 1 make a sudden whiplike movement. 2 beat with a whip etc. 3 (often foll. By against, down, etc.) (of rain etc.) Beat, strike. 4 criticize harshly. 5 rouse, incite. 6 (foll. By down, together, etc.) Fasten with a cord etc. —n. 1 sharp blow made by a whip etc. 2 flexible end of a whip. 3 eyelash.  lash out 1 speak or hit out angrily. 2 colloq. Spend money extravagantly. [imitative]

Scatty  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Scatterbrained.  scattily adv. Scattiness n.

-logist  comb. Form forming nouns meaning ‘person skilled in -logy’ (geologist).

Chauffeur  —n. (fem. Chauffeuse) person employed to drive a car. —v. Drive (a car or person) as a chauffeur. [french, = stoker]

Outlast  v. Last longer than.

Dour  adj. Severe, stern, obstinate. [probably gaelic dúr dull, obstinate]

Slunk  past and past part. Of *slink.

Grouch  colloq. —v. Grumble. —n. 1 discontented person. 2 fit of grumbling or the sulks.  grouchy adj. (-ier, -iest). [related to *grudge]

Bullshit  coarse slang —n. (often as int.) Nonsense; pretended knowledge. —v. (-tt-) talk nonsense or as if one has specialist knowledge (to).  bullshitter n. [from *bull3]

Misapprehend  v. Misunderstand (words, a person).  misapprehension n.

Pigheaded  adj. Obstinate.  pigheadedness n.

Nephritic  adj. 1 of or in the kidneys. 2 of nephritis. [greek nephros kidney]

Wether  n. Castrated ram. [old english]

Indemnify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 (often foll. By from, against) secure (a person) in respect of harm, a loss, etc. 2 (often foll. By for) exempt from a penalty. 3 compensate.  indemnification n. [latin indemnis free from loss]

Forgave  past of *forgive.

Feldspar  n. (also felspar) common aluminium silicate of potassium, sodium, or calcium.  feldspathic adj. [german feld field, spat(h) *spar3]

Boolean  adj. Denoting a system of algebraic notation to represent logical propositions. [boole, name of a mathematician]

Topic  n. Subject of a discourse, conversation, or argument. [greek topos place, commonplace]

Keel  —n. Main lengthwise member of the base of a ship etc. —v. 1 (often foll. By over) (cause to) fall down or over. 2 turn keel upwards.  on an even keel steady; balanced. [old norse]

Disfranchise  var. Of *disenfranchise.

Hypocaust  n. Space for underfloor hot-air heating in ancient roman houses. [from *hypo-, kaustos burnt]

Nu  n. Thirteenth letter of the greek alphabet (n, n). [greek]

Taker  n. Person who takes a bet, accepts an offer, etc.

Survey  —v. 1 view or consider as a whole. 2 examine the condition of (a building etc.). 3 determine the boundaries, extent, ownership, etc. Of (a district etc.). —n. 1 general view or consideration. 2 a act of surveying property. B statement etc. Resulting from this. 3 investigation of public opinion etc. 4 map or plan made by surveying. [latin: related to *super-, video see]

Discontinue  v. (-ues, -ued, -uing) 1 come or bring to an end (a discontinued line). 2 give up, cease from (doing something).  discontinuance n.

Predicant  hist. —adj. (of a religious order) engaged in preaching. —n. Predicant person, esp. A dominican. [latin: related to *predicate]

Condiment  n. Seasoning or relish for food. [latin condio pickle]

Wile  —n. (usu. In pl.) Stratagem, trick. —v. (-ling) (foll. By away, into, etc.) Lure. [perhaps from scandinavian]

Lounge  —v. (-ging) 1 recline comfortably; loll. 2 stand or move about idly. —n. 1 place for lounging, esp.: a a sitting-room in a house. B a public room (e.g. In a hotel). C a place in an airport etc. With seats for waiting passengers. 2 spell of lounging. [origin uncertain]

Voile  n. Fine semi-transparent fabric. [french, = *veil]

Underwear  n. Underclothes.

Plod  —v. (-dd-) 1 walk doggedly or laboriously; trudge. 2 work slowly and steadily. —n. Spell of plodding.  plodder n. [probably imitative]

Slum  —n. 1 house unfit for human habitation. 2 (often in pl.) Overcrowded and squalid district in a city. —v. (-mm-) visit slums, esp. Out of curiosity.  slum it colloq. Put up with conditions less comfortable than usual.  slummy adj. [originally cant] 

Shroud  —n. 1 wrapping for a corpse. 2 thing that conceals. 3 (in pl.) Ropes supporting a mast. —v. 1 clothe (a body) for burial. 2 cover or conceal. [old english, = garment]

Gypsum  n. Mineral used esp. To make plaster of paris. [greek gupsos]

Drat  colloq. —v. (-tt-) (usu. As int.) Curse (drat the thing!). —int. Expressing anger or annoyance.  dratted adj. [(go)d rot]

Satin  —n. Silk etc. Fabric glossy on one side. —adj. Smooth as satin.  satiny adj. [arabic zaituni]

Unbending  adj. 1 inflexible. 2 firm; austere.

Ringlet  n. Curly lock of esp. Long hair.  ringleted adj.

Team  —n. 1 set of players forming one side in a game. 2 two or more people working together. 3 set of draught animals. —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By up) join in a team or in common action (teamed up with them). 2 (foll. By with) match or coordinate (clothes). [old english]

Humpback  n. 1 a deformed back with a hump. B person with this. 2 whale with a dorsal fin forming a hump.  humpbacked adj.

Clangor  n. (brit. Clangour) prolonged clanging.  clangorous adj.

Metalliferous  adj. (of rocks) containing metal.

Salaam  —n. 1 (chiefly as a muslim greeting) peace! 2 muslim low bow with the right palm on the forehead. 3 (in pl.) Respectful compliments. —v. Make a salaam (to). [arabic]

Wagon  n. (also waggon) 1 four-wheeled vehicle for heavy loads. 2 railway vehicle, esp. An open truck. 3 tea trolley.  on the wagon (or water-wagon) slang teetotal. [dutch: related to *wain]

Digitize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) convert (data etc.) Into digital form, esp. For a computer.  digitization n.

Homework  n. 1 work to be done at home, esp. By a school pupil. 2 preparatory work or study.

Grocer  n. Dealer in food and household provisions. [anglo-french grosser from latin grossus *gross]

Bah  int. Expressing contempt or disbelief. [french]

Stimulant  —adj. Stimulating, esp. Bodily or mental activity. —n. Stimulant substance or influence. [latin: related to *stimulate]

Greed  n. Excessive desire, esp. For food or wealth. [from *greedy]

Gallinaceous  adj. Of the order including domestic poultry, pheasants, etc. [latin gallina hen]

Psv  abbr.  Public service vehicle.

Wealth  n. 1 riches. 2 being rich. 3 (foll. By of) abundance. [old english]

Wearisome  adj. Tedious; tiring by monotony or length.

Languor  n. 1 lack of energy; idleness. 2 soft or tender mood or effect. 3 oppressive stillness.  languorous adj.

Leftmost  adj. Furthest to the left.

Monstrous  adj. 1 like a monster; abnormally formed. 2 huge. 3 a outrageously wrong or absurd. B atrocious.  monstrously adv. Monstrousness n. [latin: related to *monster]

Muster  —v. 1 collect (orig. Soldiers) for inspection, to check numbers, etc. 2 collect, gather together. 3 summon (courage etc.). —n. Assembly of persons for inspection.  pass muster be accepted as adequate. [latin monstro show]

Surtax  n. Additional tax, esp. On high incomes. [french: related to *sur-1]

Encore  —n. 1 audience's demand for the repetition of an item, or for a further item. 2 such an item. —v. (-ring) 1 call for the repetition of (an item). 2 call back (a performer) for this. —int. Again, once more. [french, = once again]

Dispel  v. (-ll-) drive away; scatter (fears etc.). [latin pello drive]

Nib  n. 1 pen-point. 2 (in pl.) Shelled and crushed coffee or cocoa beans. [low german or dutch]

Devoid  predic. Adj. (foll. By of) lacking or free from. [french: related to *void]

Acceptable  adj. 1 worth accepting, welcome. 2 tolerable.  acceptability n. Acceptably adv. [french: related to *accept]

Inkstand  n. Stand for one or more ink bottles.

Untrained  adj. Not trained.

Coenobite  n. (us cenobite) member of a monastic community. [greek koinos bios common life]

Multicultural  adj. Of several cultural groups.  multiculturalism n.

Arbour  n. (us arbor) shady garden alcove enclosed by trees etc. [latin herba herb: assimilated to latin arbor tree]

Expressway  n. Us motorway.

Italicize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) print in italics.

Coachman  n. Driver of a horse-drawn carriage.

Burnous  n. Arab or moorish hooded cloak. [arabic from greek]

Tussle  —n. Struggle, scuffle. —v. (-ling) engage in a tussle. [originally scots and northern english, perhaps diminutive of touse: related to *tousle]

Duchy  n. (pl. -ies) territory of a duke or duchess; royal dukedom of cornwall or lancaster. [medieval latin ducatus: related to *duke]

Brother  n. 1 man or boy in relation to his siblings. 2 close male friend or associate. 3 (pl. Also brethren) a member of a male religious order, esp. A monk. B fellow christian etc. 4 fellow human being.  brotherly adj. [old english]

Consultant  n. 1 person providing professional advice etc. 2 senior medical specialist in a hospital.

Absorption  n. 1 absorbing or being absorbed. 2 mental engrossment.  absorptive adj.

Whistle  —n. 1 clear shrill sound made by forcing breath through a small hole between nearly closed lips. 2 similar sound made by a bird, the wind, a missile, etc. 3 instrument used to produce such a sound. —v. (-ling) 1 emit a whistle. 2 a give a signal or express surprise or derision by whistling. B (often foll. By up) summon or give a signal to (a dog etc.) By whistling. 3 (also absol.)
