A clock or watch). 3 a body of persons with a common object (peace movement). B campaign undertaken by them. 4 (in pl.) Person's activities and whereabouts. 5 mus. Principal division of a longer musical work. 6 motion of the bowels. 7 rise or fall in price(s) on the stock market. 8 progress.

Entirely  adv. 1 wholly. 2 solely.

Creek  n. 1 a inlet on a sea-coast. B short arm of a river. 2 esp. Us, austral., & nz tributary of a river; stream.  up the creek slang 1 in difficulties. 2 crazy. [old norse and dutch]

Monocular  adj. With or for one eye. [related to *monocle]

Symposium  n. (pl. -sia) 1 conference, or collection of essays, on a particular subject. 2 philosophical or other friendly discussion. [greek sumpotes fellow-drinker]

Superfine  adj. Commerce of extra quality. [latin: related to *fine1]

Distich  n. Verse couplet. [greek stikhos line]

Pamphlet  —n. Small usu. Unbound booklet or leaflet. —v. (-t-) distribute pamphlets to. [pamphilus, name of medieval poem]

Crystallography  n. Science of crystal formation and structure.  crystallographer n.

Sluggard  n. Lazy person. [related to *slug1]

Britannia  n. Personification of britain, esp. As a helmeted woman with shield and trident. [latin]

Ironwork  n. 1 things made of iron. 2 work in iron.

Rehearse  v. (-sing) 1 practise (a play, music, etc.) For later public performance. 2 hold a rehearsal. 3 train (a person) by rehearsal. 4 recite or say over. 5 give a list of, enumerate. [anglo-french: related to *hearse]

Cote  n. Shelter for animals or birds. [old english]

Abreast  adv. 1 side by side and facing the same way. 2 (foll. By of) up to date.

Woodlouse  n. (pl. -lice) small land crustacean with many legs.

Perforate  v. (-ting) 1 make a hole or holes through; pierce. 2 make a row of small holes in (paper etc.) So that a part may be torn off easily.  perforation n. [latin perforo pierce through]

Reservist  n. Member of the military reserve.

Karate  n. Japanese system of unarmed combat using the hands and feet as weapons. [japanese, = empty hand]

Stagnate  v. (-ting) be or become stagnant.  stagnation n.

Plinth  n. 1 lower square slab at the base of a column. 2 base supporting a vase or statue etc. [greek, = tile]

Speedometer  n. Instrument on a vehicle indicating its speed.

Pecuniary  adj. 1 of or concerning money. 2 (of an offence) entailing a money penalty. [latin pecunia money, from pecu cattle]

Indissoluble  adj. 1 that cannot be dissolved or broken up. 2 firm and lasting.  indissolubly adv.

Mustache  n. (brit. Moustache) hair left to grow on a man's upper lip. [greek mustax]

Unveil  v. 1 uncover (a statue etc.) Ceremonially. 2 reveal. 3 remove a veil from; remove one's veil.

Wrinkle  —n. 1 crease in the skin, esp. Caused by age. 2 similar mark in another flexible surface. 3 colloq. Useful tip or clever expedient. —v. (-ling) 1 make wrinkles in. 2 form wrinkles. [probably related to old english gewrinclod sinuous]

Bituminous  adj. Of or like bitumen.

Overrule  v. (-ling) 1 set aside (a decision etc.) By superior authority. 2 reject a proposal of (a person) in this way.

-lysis  comb. Form forming nouns denoting disintegration or decomposition (electrolysis). [greek lusis loosening]

Suture  —n. 1 stitching of the edges of a wound or incision. 2 thread or wire used for this. —v. (-ring) stitch (a wound or incision). [latin suo sut- sew]

Arab  —n. 1 member of a semitic people originating in saudi arabia and neighbouring countries, now widespread throughout the middle east. 2 horse of a breed orig. Native to arabia. —adj. Of arabia or the arabs (esp. With ethnic reference). [arabic araps]

Mannish  adj. 1 (of a woman) masculine in appearance or manner. 2 characteristic of a man.  mannishly adv.

Emotional  adj. 1 of or expressing emotions. 2 especially liable to emotion. 3 arousing emotion.  emotionalism n. Emotionally adv.

Usage  see note at emotive.

Couture  n. Design and manufacture of fashionable clothes. [french]

Odium  n. Widespread dislike or disapproval of a person or action. [latin, = hatred]

Styrene  n. Liquid hydrocarbon easily polymerized and used in making plastics etc. [greek sturax a resin]

Airscrew  n. Aircraft propeller.

Omnipotent  adj. Having great or absolute power.  omnipotence n. [latin: related to *potent]

Hydrate  —n. Compound in which water is chemically combined with another compound or an element. —v. (-ting) 1 combine chemically with water. 2 cause to absorb water.  hydration n. [french: related to *hydro-]

Gyroscope  n. Rotating wheel whose axis is free to turn but maintains a fixed direction unless perturbed, esp. Used for stabilization or with the compass in an aircraft, ship, etc.

Unlettered  adj. Illiterate; not well educated.

Therein  adv. Formal 1 in that place etc. 2 in that respect.

Intermediate  —adj. Coming between two things in time, place, order, character, etc. —n. 1 intermediate thing. 2 chemical compound formed by one reaction and then used in another. [latin intermedius]

Pulpit  n. 1 raised enclosed platform in a church etc. From which the preacher delivers a sermon. 2 (prec. By the) preachers collectively; preaching. [latin pulpitum platform]

Intone  v. (-ning) 1 recite (prayers etc.) With prolonged sounds, esp. In a monotone. 2 utter with a particular tone. [medieval latin: related to *in-2]

Akela  n. Adult leader of cub scouts. [name of the leader of the wolf-pack in kipling's jungle book]

Soluble  adj. 1 that can be dissolved, esp. In water. 2 solvable.  solubility n. [latin solvo solut- release]

Tramway  n. Rails for a tram.

Undercut  —v. (-tt-; past and past part. -cut) 1 sell or work at a lower price than. 2  strike (a ball) to make it rise high. 3 cut away the part below. 4 undermine. —n. Underside of sirloin.

Lour  v. (also lower) 1 frown; look sullen. 2 (of the sky etc.) Look dark and threatening. [origin unknown]

Podium  n. (pl. -s or podia) rostrum. [greek podion diminutive of pous pod- foot]

Slave  —n. 1 person who is owned by and has to serve another. 2 drudge, hard worker. 3 (foll. By of, to) obsessive devotee (slave of fashion). 4 machine, or part of one, directly controlled by another. —v. (-ving) (often foll. By at, over) work very hard. [french esclave from latin sclavus *slav (captive)]

Auxiliary  —adj. 1 subsidiary, additional. 2 giving help. —n. (pl. -ies) 1 auxiliary person or thing. 2 (in pl.) Foreign or allied troops in the service of a nation at war. 3 verb used to form tenses or moods of other verbs (e.g. Have in i have seen). [latin auxilium help]

Assembly  n. (pl. -ies) 1 assembling. 2 assembled group, esp. As a deliberative body. 3 assembling of components.

Conga  —n. 1 latin-american dance, with a line of dancers one behind the other. 2 tall narrow drum beaten with the hands. —v. (congas, congaed or conga'd, congaing) perform the conga. [spanish conga (feminine), = of the congo]

Passageway  n. Narrow path or way; corridor.

Peashooter  n. Small tube for blowing dried peas through as a toy.

Possibly  adv. 1 perhaps. 2 in accordance with possibility (cannot possibly go).

Corrugate  v. (-ting) (esp. As corrugated adj.) Form into alternate ridges and grooves, esp. To strengthen (corrugated iron).  corrugation n. [latin ruga wrinkle]

Stalagmite  n. Icicle-like deposit of calcium carbonate rising from the floor of a cave etc. [greek stalagma a drop]

Backspin  n. Backward spin making a ball bounce erratically.

Shalom  n. & int. Jewish salutation at meeting or parting. [hebrew]

Vineyard  n. Plantation of grapevines, esp. For wine-making.

Scabrous  adj. 1 rough, scaly. 2 indecent, salacious. [latin]

Taco  n. (pl. -s) mexican dish of meat etc. In a folded tortilla. [mexican spanish]

Doggy  —adj. 1 of or like a dog. 2 devoted to dogs. —n. (also doggie) (pl. -ies) pet name for a dog.

Panorama  n. 1 unbroken view of a surrounding region. 2 complete survey of a subject, series of events, etc. 3 picture or photograph containing a wide view. 4 continuous passing scene.  panoramic adj. [greek horama view]

Darkroom  n. Darkened room for photographic work.

Appendage  n. Thing attached; addition.

Garage  —n. 1 building for housing a vehicle. 2 establishment selling petrol etc., or repairing and selling vehicles. —v. (-ging) put or keep in a garage. [french]

Formaldehyde  n. Colourless pungent gas used as a disinfectant and preservative. [from *formic acid, *aldehyde]

Preternatural  adj. Extraordinary, exceptional; supernatural. [latin praeter beyond]

Headlamp  n. = *headlight.

Adventitious  adj. 1 accidental, casual. 2 added from outside. 3 biol. Formed accidentally or under unusual conditions. [latin: related to *advent]

Cassata  n. Ice-cream containing fruit and nuts. [italian]

Valve  n. 1 device controlling flow through a pipe etc., esp. Allowing movement in one direction only. 2 structure in an organ etc. Allowing a flow of blood etc. In one direction only. 3 = *thermionic valve. 4 device to vary the effective length of the tube in a trumpet etc. 5 half-shell of an oyster, mussel, etc.  valvular adj. [latin valva leaf of a folding door]

Tractable  adj. (of a person or material) easily handled; manageable.  tractability n. [latin tracto handle]

Divest  v. (usu. Foll. By of) 1 unclothe; strip. 2 deprive, rid. [latin: related to *vest]

Scorch  —v. 1 burn or discolour the surface of with dry heat. 2 become so discoloured etc. 3 (as scorching adj.) Colloq. A (of the weather) very hot. B (of criticism etc.) Stringent; harsh. —n. Mark made by scorching. [origin unknown]

Swiss  —adj. Of switzerland or its people. —n. (pl. Same) 1 native or national of switzerland. 2 person of swiss descent. [french suisse]

Mammal  n. Warm-blooded vertebrate of the class secreting milk to feed its young.  mammalian adj. & n. [latin mamma breast]

Polling  n. Registering or casting of votes.

Crisis  n. (pl. Crises) 1 time of danger or great difficulty. 2 decisive moment; turning-point. [greek, = decision]

Bovine  adj. 1 of cattle. 2 stupid, dull. [latin bos ox]

Expanse  n. Wide continuous area of land, space, etc.

Forelimb  n. Front limb of an animal.

Scouter  n. Adult leader of scouts.

Leftover  —n. (usu. In pl.) Surplus items (esp. Of food). —attrib. Adj. Remaining over, surplus.

Shalt  archaic 2nd person sing. Of *shall.

Disembarrass  v. 1 (usu. Foll. By of) relieve (of a load etc.). 2 free from embarrassment.  disembarrassment n.

Mad  adj. (madder, maddest) 1 insane; frenzied. 2 wildly foolish. 3 (often foll. By about, on) colloq. Wildly excited or infatuated. 4 colloq. Angry. 5 (of an animal) rabid. 6 wildly light-hearted.  like mad colloq. With great energy or enthusiasm.  madness n.  [old english]

Fanlight  n. Small, orig. Semicircular, window over a door or another window.

Wren  n. Member of the women's royal naval service. [from the abbreviation wrns]

Rucksack  n. Bag carried on the back, esp. By hikers. [german]

Dumbfound  v. Nonplus, make speechless with surprise. [from *dumb, *confound]

Pox  n. 1 virus disease leaving pock-marks. 2 colloq. = *syphilis. [alteration of pocks pl. Of *pock]

Assonance  n. Partial resemblance of sound between two syllables e.g. Sonnet, porridge, and killed, cold, culled.  assonant adj. [latin sonus sound]

Sail  —n. 1 piece of material extended on rigging to catch the wind and propel a boat or ship. 2 ship's sails collectively. 3 voyage or excursion in a sailing-boat. 4 ship, esp. As discerned from its sails. 5 wind-catching apparatus of a windmill. —v. 1 travel on water by the use of sails or engine-power. 2 begin a voyage (sails at nine). 3 a navigate (a ship etc.). B travel on (a sea). 4 set (a toy boat) afloat. 5 glide or move smoothly or in a stately manner. 6 (often foll. By through) colloq. Succeed easily (sailed through the exams).  sail close to the wind 1 sail as nearly against the wind as possible. 2 come close to indecency or dishonesty. Sail into colloq. Attack physically or verbally. Under sail with sails set. [old english]

Anticyclone  n. System of winds rotating outwards from an area of high pressure, producing fine weather.

Rework  v. Revise; refashion; remake.  reworking n.

Bloodstain  n. Stain caused by blood.  bloodstained adj.

Dengue  n. Infectious tropical viral fever. [w. Indian spanish from swahili]

Protozoan  —n. (also protozoon) (pl. Protozoa or -s) unicellular microscopic organism, e.g. The amoebae. —adj. (also protozoic) of this group. [from *proto-, greek zoion animal]

Rosy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 pink or red. 2 optimistic, hopeful (rosy future).  rosily adv. Rosiness n.

Keyboard  —n. 1 set of keys on a typewriter, computer, piano, etc. 2 electronic musical instrument with keys arranged as on a piano. —v. Enter (data) by means of a keyboard.  keyboarder n. (in sense 1 of n.). Keyboardist n. (in sense 2 of n.).

Semicolon  n. Punctuation mark (;) of intermediate value between a comma and full stop.

Farrier  n. Smith who shoes horses. [latin ferrum iron, horseshoe]

Glide  —v. (-ding) 1 move smoothly and continuously. 2 (of an aircraft or pilot) fly without engine-power. 3 pass gradually or imperceptibly. 4 go stealthily. 5 cause to glide. —n. Gliding movement. [old english]

Disturb  v. 1 break the rest, calm, or quiet of. 2 agitate; worry. 3 move from a settled position (disturbed my papers). 4 (as disturbed adj.) Emotionally or mentally unstable. [latin: related to *dis-, turba tumult]

Gaol  var. Of *jail.

Skyline  n. Outline of hills, buildings, etc. Against the sky.

Squawk  —n. 1 loud harsh cry, esp. Of a bird. 2 complaint. —v. Utter a squawk. [imitative]

Hemipterous  adj. Of the insect order including aphids, bugs, and cicadas, with piercing or sucking mouthparts. [greek pteron wing]

Declutch  v. Disengage the clutch of a motor vehicle.

Pulp  —n. 1 soft fleshy part of fruit etc. 2 soft thick wet mass, esp. From rags, wood, etc., used in paper-making. 3 (often attrib.) Cheap fiction etc., orig. Printed on rough paper. —v. Reduce to or become pulp.  pulpy adj. Pulpiness n. [latin]

Modish  adj.  Fashionable.  modishly adv.

Rediscover  v. Discover again.  rediscovery n. (pl. -ies).

Diva  n. (pl. -s) great woman opera singer; prima donna. [italian from latin, = goddess]

Outpost  n. 1 detachment posted at a distance from an army. 2 distant branch or settlement (outpost of empire).

Quatrain  n. Four-line stanza. [french quatre four]

Reflect  v. 1 (of a surface or body) throw back (heat, light, sound, etc.). 2  (of a mirror) show an image of; reproduce to the eye or mind. 3 correspond in appearance or effect to (their behaviour reflects their upbringing). 4 a (of an action, result, etc.) Show or bring (credit, discredit, etc.). B (absol.; usu. Foll. By on, upon) bring discredit on. 5 a (often foll. By on, upon) meditate on; think about. B (foll. By that, how, etc.) Consider; remind oneself. [latin flecto flex- bend]

Handgun  n. Small firearm held in and fired with one hand.

Idealism  n. 1 forming or pursuing ideals, esp. Unrealistically. 2 representation of things in ideal form. 3 system of thought in which objects are held to be in some way dependent on the mind.  idealist n. Idealistic adj. Idealistically adv.

Wasteland  n. 1 unproductive or useless area of land. 2 place or time considered spiritually or intellectually barren.

Affection  n. 1 goodwill, fond feeling. 2 disease; diseased condition.

Femur  n. (pl. -s or femora) thigh-bone.  femoral adj. [latin]

Serb  —n. 1 native of serbia in se europe. 2 person of serbian descent. —adj. = *serbian. [serbian srb]

Warhorse  n. 1 hist. Trooper's powerful horse. 2 colloq. Veteran soldier, politician, etc.

Mishmash  n. Confused mixture. [reduplication of *mash]

Fontanel  n. (brit. Fontanelle) membranous space in an infant's skull at the angles of the parietal bones. [latin fontanella little *fountain]

Here  —adv. 1 in or at or to this place or position (come here; sit here). 2 indicating a person's presence or a thing offered (my son here will show you; here is your coat). 3 at this point in the argument, situation, etc. (here i have a question). —n. This place (get out of here; lives near here; fill it up to here). —int. 1 calling attention: short for come here, look here, etc. (here, where are you going with that?). 2 indicating one's presence in a roll-call: short for i am here.  here goes! Colloq. Expression indicating the start of a bold act. Here's to i drink to the health of. Here we are colloq. Said on arrival at one's destination. Here we go again colloq. The same, usu. Undesirable, events are recurring. Here you are said on handing something to somebody. Neither here nor there of no importance. [old english]

Oratorio  n. (pl. -s) semi-dramatic work for orchestra and voices, esp. On a sacred theme. [church latin]

Stroppy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Bad-tempered; awkward to deal with. [origin uncertain]

Verso  n. (pl. -s) 1 left-hand page of an open book. 2 back of a printed leaf. [latin verso (folio) on the turned (leaf)]

Wnw  abbr. West-north-west.

Explicate  v. (-ting) 1 develop the meaning of (an idea etc.). 2 explain (esp. A literary text).  explication n. [latin explico -plicat- unfold]

Bronchial  adj. Of the bronchi (see *bronchus) or of the smaller tubes into which they divide.

Semester  n. Half-year course or term in (esp. Us) universities. [latin semestris from sex six, mensis month]

Backslide  v. (-ding; past -slid; past part. -slid or -slidden) return to bad habits etc.

Quadrille  n. 1 a kind of square dance. 2 music for this. [french]

Depreciate  v. (-ting) 1 diminish in value. 2 belittle.  depreciatory adj. [latin: related to *price]

Usage  depreciate is often confused with deprecate.

Palmate  adj. 1 shaped like an open hand. 2 having lobes etc. Like spread fingers. [latin palmatus: related to *palm2]

Picador  n. Mounted man with a lance in a bullfight. [spanish]

Dugout  n. 1 a roofed shelter, esp. For troops in trenches. B underground shelter. 2 canoe made from a tree-trunk.

Unnamed  adj. Not named.

Billposter  n. (also billsticker) person who pastes up advertisements on hoardings.

Holding  n. 1 tenure of land. 2 stocks, property, etc. Held.

Concerning  prep. About, regarding.

Piston  n. 1 sliding cylinder fitting closely in a tube in which it moves up and down, used in an internal-combustion engine to impart motion, or in a pump to receive motion. 2 sliding valve in a trumpet etc. [italian: related to *pestle]

Shad  n. (pl. Same or -s) large edible marine fish. [old english]

Archetype  n. 1 original model; prototype. 2 typical specimen.  archetypal adj. [greek tupon stamp]

Consul  n. 1 official appointed by a state to protect its citizens and interests in a foreign city. 2 hist. Either of two chief magistrates in ancient rome.  consular adj. Consulship n. [latin]

Aniline  n. Colourless oily liquid used in making dyes, drugs, and plastics. [german anil indigo, former source]

Rang  past of *ring2.

Entente  n. Friendly understanding between states. [french]

Bowling  n. The game of skittles, tenpin bowling, or bowls.

Strop  —n. Device, esp. A strip of leather, for sharpening razors. —v. (-pp-) sharpen on a strop. [low german or dutch]

Portakabin  n. Propr. Prefabricated room or small building. [from *portable, *cabin]

Headband  n. Band worn round the head as decoration or to confine the hair.

Transverse  adj. Situated, arranged, or acting in a crosswise direction.  transversely adv. [latin transverto -vers- turn across]

Gamecock  n. Cock bred and trained for cock-fighting.

Seizure  n. 1 seizing or being seized. 2 sudden attack, esp. Of epilepsy or apoplexy.

Transaction  n. 1 a piece of esp. Commercial business done. B transacting of business etc. 2 (in pl.) Published reports of discussions, papers read, etc., at the meetings of a learned society.

Valise  n. Us small portmanteau. [french from italian]

Footway  n. Path for pedestrians.

Farmstead  n. Farm and its buildings.

Serbian  —n. 1 dialect of the serbs. 2 = *serb. —adj. Of serbia.

Excuse  —v. (-sing) 1 try to lessen the blame attaching to (a person, act, or fault). 2 (of a fact) serve as a reason to judge (a person or act) less severely. 3 (often foll. By from) release (a person) from a duty etc. 4 forgive (a fault or offence). 5 (foll. By for) forgive (a person) for (a fault). 6 refl. Leave with apologies. —n. 1 reason put forward to mitigate or justify an offence. 2 apology (made my excuses).  be excused be allowed to leave the room etc. Or be absent. Excuse me polite preface to an interruption etc., or to disagreeing.  excusable adj. [latin causa accusation]

Teff  n. An african cereal. [amharic]

Substandard  adj. Of less than the required or normal quality or size.

Natural  —adj. 1 a existing in or caused by nature (natural landscape). B uncultivated (in its natural state). 2 in the course of nature (died of natural causes). 3 not surprising; to be expected (natural for her to be upset). 4 unaffected, spontaneous. 5 innate (natural talent for music). 6 not disguised or altered (as by make-up etc.). 7 likely or suited by its or their nature to be such (natural enemies; natural leader). 8 physically existing (the natural world). 9 illegitimate. 10 mus. (of a note) not sharpened or flattened (b natural). —n. 1 colloq. (usu. Foll. By for) person or thing naturally suitable, adept, etc. 2 mus. A sign denoting a return to natural pitch. B natural note.  naturalness n. [latin: related to *nature]

Shameful  adj. Disgraceful, scandalous.  shamefully adv. Shamefulness n.

Technocrat  n. Exponent or advocate of technocracy.  technocratic adj.

Finery  n. Showy dress or decoration. [from *fine1]

Pharaoh  n. 1 ruler of ancient egypt. 2 title of this ruler. [old english from church latin pharao, ultimately from egyptian]

Acacia  n. Tree with yellow or white flowers, esp. One yielding gum arabic. [latin from greek]

Substantiate  v. (-ting) prove the truth of (a charge, claim, etc.).  substantiation n.

Eightsome  n. (in full eightsome reel) lively scottish dance for eight people.

Tapeworm  n. Parasitic intestinal flatworm with a segmented body.

Magneto  n. (pl. -s) electric generator using permanent magnets (esp. For the ignition of an internal-combustion engine). [abbreviation of magneto-electric]

Bayonet  —n. 1 stabbing blade attachable to the muzzle of a rifle. 2 electrical fitting pushed into a socket and twisted. —v. (-t-) stab with bayonet. [french, perhaps from bayonne in sw france]

Financial  adj. Of finance.  financially adv.

Dainty  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 delicately pretty. 2 delicate or small. 3 (of food) choice. 4 fastidious; discriminating. —n. (pl. -ies) choice delicacy.  daintily adv. Daintiness n. [latin dignitas *dignity]

Vegetal  adj. Of or like plants. [medieval latin: related to *vegetate]

Reliable  adj. Of consistently good character or quality; dependable.  reliability n. Reliably adv.

Personally  adv. 1 in person (see to it personally). 2 for one's own part (speaking personally). 3 in a personal manner (took the criticism personally).

Recline  v. (-ning) assume or be in a horizontal or relaxed leaning position. [latin reclino]

Highball  n. Us drink of spirits and soda etc., served with ice in a tall glass.

Seismograph  n. Instrument that records the force, direction, etc., of earthquakes.  seismographic adj.

Grazing  n. Grassland suitable for pasturage.

Tattered  adj. In tatters.

Craven  adj. Cowardly, abject. [probably french cravanté defeated]

Razzmatazz  n. Colloq. 1 glamorous excitement, bustle. 2 spree. 3 insincere actions. [probably an alteration of *razzle-dazzle]

Equitation  n. Horsemanship; horse-riding. [latin equito ride a horse]

Attempt  —v. 1 (often foll. By to + infin.) Try to do or achieve (attempted to explain). 2 try to conquer (a mountain etc.). —n. (often foll. By at, on, or to + infin.) Attempting; endeavour (attempt at winning; attempt on his life). [latin tempto try]

Wield  v. Hold and use; command, exert (a weapon, tool, power, etc.). [old english]

Progenitor  n. 1 ancestor. 2 predecessor. 3 original. [latin progigno beget]

Really  adv. 1 in reality. 2 very (really useful). 3 indeed, i assure you. 4 expression of mild protest or surprise.

Suss  v. Slang (also sus) (-ss-) (usu. Foll. By out) 1 investigate, inspect. 2 work out; realize.  on suss on suspicion (of having committed a crime). [abbreviation]

Disquietude  n. Disquiet.

Husk  —n. 1 dry outer covering of some fruits or seeds. 2 worthless outside part of a thing. —v. Remove husk(s) from. [probably low german]

Indiscriminate  adj. Making no distinctions; done or acting at random (indiscriminate shooting).  indiscriminately adv.

Phagocyte  n. Leucocyte capable of engulfing and absorbing foreign matter. [greek phag- eat, kutos cell]

Sham  —v. (-mm-) 1 feign, pretend. 2 pretend to be. —n. 1 imposture, pretence. 2 bogus or false person or thing. —adj. Pretended, counterfeit. [origin unknown]

Tubing  n. Length of tube or quantity of tubes.

Covey  n. (pl. -s) 1 brood of partridges. 2 small group of people. [latin cubo lie]

Elision  n. Omission of a vowel or syllable in pronunciation (e.g. In we'll). [latin: related to *elide]

Lackluster  adj. (brit. Lacklustre) 1 lacking in vitality etc. 2 dull.

Toboggan  —n. Long light narrow sledge for sliding downhill over snow or ice. —v. Ride on a toboggan. [canadian french from algonquian]

Voltmeter  n. Instrument measuring electric potential in volts.

Reprehend  v. Formal rebuke; find fault with. [latin prehendo seize]

Petite  adj. (of a woman) of small and dainty build. [french, = little]

Hostile  adj. 1 of an enemy. 2 (often foll. By to) unfriendly, opposed.  hostilely adv. [latin: related to *host1]

Leopard  n. Large african or asian animal of the cat family with a black-spotted yellowish or all black coat, panther. [greek leon lion, pardos panther]

Sassenach  n. Scot. & ir. Usu. Derog. English person. [gaelic sasunnoch]

Undoubted  adj. Certain, not questioned.  undoubtedly adv.

Airer  n. Stand for airing or drying clothes etc.

Wireworm  n. Destructive larva of a kind of beetle.

Dna  abbr. Deoxyribonucleic acid, esp. Carrying genetic information in chromosomes.

Statute  n. 1 written law passed by a legislative body. 2 rule of a corporation, founder, etc., intended to be permanent. [latin statutum from statuo set up]

Denial  n. 1 denying the truth or existence of a thing. 2 refusal of a request or wish. 3 disavowal of a leader etc.

Ruc  abbr. Royal ulster constabulary.

Stilted  adj. 1 (of literary style etc.) Stiff and unnatural; bombastic. 2 standing on stilts.

Jabber  —v. 1 chatter volubly. 2 utter (words) in this way. —n. Chatter; gabble. [imitative]

Mindful  adj. (often foll. By of) taking heed or care; giving thought (to).  mindfully adv.

Inequitable  adj. Unfair, unjust.

Scrump  v. Colloq. Steal from an orchard or garden. [related to *scrumpy]

Prerequisite  —adj. Required as a precondition. —n. Prerequisite thing.

Usage  prerequisite is sometimes confused with perquisite which means ‘an extra profit, allowance, or right’.

Overlay  —v. (past and past part. -laid) 1 lay over. 2 (foll. By with) cover (a thing) with (a coating etc.). —n. Thing laid over another.

Cardiovascular  adj. Of the heart and blood-vessels.

Transponder  n. Device for receiving a radio signal and automatically transmitting a different signal. [from *transmit, *respond]

Electrolysis  n. 1 chemical decomposition by electric action. 2 destruction of tumours, hair-roots, etc., by this process.  electrolytic adj.

Conductance  n. Power of a specified material to conduct electricity.

Lung  n. Either of the pair of respiratory organs in humans and many other vertebrates. [old english: related to *light2]

Asthmatic  —adj. Of or suffering from asthma. —n. Asthmatic person.

Dithyramb  n. 1 wild choral hymn in ancient greece. 2 passionate or inflated poem etc.  dithyrambic adj. [latin from greek]

Singe  —v. (-geing) 1 burn superficially; scorch. 2 burn off the tips of (hair). —n. Superficial burn. [old english]

Undaunted  adj. Not daunted.

Gonorrhoea  n. (us gonorrhea) venereal disease with inflammatory discharge from the urethra or vagina. [greek, = semen-flux]

Frivolous  adj. 1 not serious, silly, shallow. 2 paltry, trifling.  frivolity n. (pl. -ies). Frivolously adv. Frivolousness n. [latin]

Doorstop  n. Device for keeping a door open or to prevent it from striking the wall.

Lateral  —adj. 1 of, at, towards, or from the side or sides. 2 descended from the sibling of a person in direct line. —n. Lateral shoot or branch.  laterally adv. [latin latus later- side]

Wedge  —n. 1 piece of tapering wood or metal etc. Driven between two objects or parts to secure or separate them. 2 anything resembling a wedge. 3 golf club with a wedge-shaped head. —v. (-ging) 1 secure or fasten with a wedge. 2 force open or apart with a wedge. 3 (foll. By in, into) pack or thrust (a thing or oneself) tightly in or into.  thin end of the wedge colloq. Thing of little importance in itself, but likely to lead to more serious developments. [old english]

Unlovely  adj. Not attractive; unpleasant.

Paragraph  —n. 1 distinct section of a piece of writing, beginning on a new often indented line. 2 symbol (usu. ) used to mark a new paragraph, or as a reference mark. 3 short item in a newspaper. —v. Arrange (a piece of writing) in paragraphs.  [greek: related to *para-1, *-graph]

Pusher  n. Colloq. Seller of illegal drugs.

Incorruptible  adj. 1 that cannot be corrupted, esp. By bribery. 2 that cannot decay.  incorruptibility n. Incorruptibly adv.

Unconcern  n. Calmness; indifference; apathy.  unconcerned adj. Unconcernedly adv.

Atmospherics  n.pl. 1 electrical atmospheric disturbance, esp. Caused by lightning. 2 interference with telecommunications caused by this.

Blue  —adj. (bluer, bluest) 1 having the colour of a clear sky. 2 sad, depressed. 3 pornographic (a blue film). 4 politically conservative. —n. 1 blue colour or pigment. 2 blue clothes or material (dressed in blue). 3 person who represents a university in a sport, esp. Oxford or cambridge. 4 conservative party supporter. —v. (blues, blued, bluing or blueing) 1 make blue. 2 slang squander.  once in a blue moon very rarely. Out of the blue unexpectedly. [french from germanic]

Forceps  n. (pl. Same) surgical pincers. [latin]

Niche  n. 1 shallow recess, esp. In a wall. 2 comfortable or apt position in life or employment. 3 position from which an entrepreneur exploits a gap in the market; profitable corner of the market. [latin nidus nest]

Rubicon  n. Boundary; point from which there is no going back. [rubicon, river on ancient frontier of italy]

Frigid  adj. 1 unfriendly, cold (frigid stare). 2 (of a woman) sexually unresponsive. 3 (esp. Of a climate or air) cold.  frigidity n. [latin frigus (n.) Cold]

Obdurate  adj. 1 stubborn. 2 hardened.  obduracy n. [latin duro harden]

Cranny  n. (pl. -ies) chink, crevice.  crannied adj. [french]

Lightning  —n. Flash of bright light produced by an electric discharge between clouds or between clouds and the ground. —attrib. Adj. Very quick. [from *lighten2]

Dollop  —n. Shapeless lump of food etc. —v. (-p-) (usu. Foll. By out) serve in dollops. [perhaps from scandinavian]

Gasoline  n. (also gasolene) us petrol.

Archbishop  n. Chief bishop of a province.

Miller  n. 1 proprietor or tenant of a mill, esp. A corn-mill. 2 person operating a milling machine. [related to *mill]

Distinction  n. 1 discriminating or distinguishing. 2 difference between two things. 3 thing that differentiates or distinguishes. 4 special consideration or honour (treat with distinction). 5 excellence (person of distinction). 6 title or mark of honour. [latin: related to *distinguish]

Briefcase  n. Flat document case.

Weeny  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Tiny. [from *wee1]

Pierrot  n. (fem. Pierrette) 1 white-faced entertainer in pier shows etc. With a loose white clown's costume. 2 french pantomime character so dressed. [french, diminutive of pierre peter]

Sacrosanct  adj. Most sacred; inviolable.  sacrosanctity n. [latin: related to *sacred, *saint]

Sperm  n. (pl. Same or -s) 1 = *spermatozoon. 2 semen. [greek sperma -mat-]

Tax  —n. 1 money compulsorily levied by the state or local authorities on individuals, property, or businesses. 2 (usu. Foll. By on, upon) strain, heavy demand, or burdensome obligation. —v. 1 impose a tax on. 2 deduct tax from (income etc.).

Conflict  —n. 1 a state of opposition. B fight, struggle. 2 (often foll. By of) clashing of opposed interests etc. —v. Clash; be incompatible. [latin fligo flict- strike]

Blackboard  n. Board with a smooth dark surface for writing on with chalk.

Incidental  —adj. (often foll. By to) 1 small and relatively unimportant, minor; supplementary. 2 not essential. —n. (usu. In pl.) Minor detail, expense, event, etc.

Hogshead  n. 1 large cask. 2 liquid or dry measure (about 50 gallons). [from *hog: the reason for the name is unknown]

Notelet  n. Small folded usu. Decorated sheet of paper for an informal letter.

Barbell  n. Iron bar with removable weights at each end, used for weightlifting.

Proscenium  n. (pl. -s or -nia) part of the stage in front of the curtain and the enclosing arch. [greek: related to *scene]

Afresh  adv. Anew; with a fresh beginning. [earlier of fresh]

Depress  v. 1 make dispirited or sad. 2 push down; lower. 3 reduce the activity of (esp. Trade). 4 (as depressed adj.) A miserable. B suffering from depression.  depressing adj. Depressingly adv. [latin: related to *press1]

Crutch  n. 1 usu. T-shaped support for a lame person fitting under the armpit. 2 support, prop. 3 crotch. [old english]

Bandanna  n. Large patterned handkerchief or neckerchief. [portuguese from hindi]

Eightfold  adj. & adv. 1 eight times as much or as many. 2 consisting of eight parts.

Loot  —n. 1 spoil, booty. 2 slang money. —v. 1 rob or steal, esp. After rioting etc. 2 plunder.  looter n. [hindi]

Reckless  adj. Disregarding the consequences or danger etc.; rash.  recklessly adv. Recklessness n. [old english reck concern oneself]

Dictator  n. 1 usu. Unelected omnipotent ruler. 2 omnipotent person in any sphere. 3 domineering person.  dictatorship n. [latin: related to *dictate]

Trapper  n. Person who traps wild animals, esp. For their fur.

Logarithm  n. One of a series of arithmetic exponents tabulated to simplify computation by making it possible to use addition and subtraction instead of multiplication and division.  logarithmic adj. Logarithmically adv. [greek logos reckoning, arithmos number]

Porky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 colloq. Fat. 2 of or like pork.

Bipartite  adj. 1 of two parts. 2 shared by or involving two parties. [latin bipartio divide in two]

Arrival  n. 1 arriving; appearance on the scene. 2 person or thing that has arrived.

Cosmetic  —adj. 1 beautifying, enhancing. 2 superficially improving or beneficial. 3 (of surgery or a prosthesis) imitating, restoring, or enhancing normal appearance. —n. Cosmetic preparation, esp. For the face.  cosmetically adv. [greek, = ornament]

C  v. (-ting; past wrote; past part. Written) 1 mark paper or some other surface with symbols, letters, or words. 2 form or mark (such symbols etc.).

Resort  —n. 1 place frequented esp. For holidays or for a specified purpose or quality (seaside resort; health resort). 2 a thing to which one has recourse; expedient, measure. B (foll. By to) recourse to; use of (without resort to violence). —v. 1 (foll. By to) turn to as an expedient (resorted to force). 2 (foll. By to) go often or in large numbers to.  in the (or as a) last resort when all else has failed. [french sortir go out]

Gearbox  n. 1 set of gears with its casing, esp. In a vehicle. 2 the casing itself.

Lawsuit  n. Bringing of a dispute, claim, etc. Before a lawcourt.

Upfront  colloq. —adv. (usu. Up front) 1 at the front; in front. 2 (of payments) in advance. —adj. 1 honest, frank, direct. 2 (of payments) made in advance.

Baccy  n. (pl. -ies) colloq. Tobacco. [abbreviation]

Unhallowed  adj. 1 not consecrated. 2 not sacred, wicked.

Tantalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 torment or tease by the sight or promise of the unobtainable. 2 raise and then dash the hopes of.  tantalization n. [tantalus, mythical king punished in hades with sight of water and fruit which drew back whenever he tried to reach them]

Unshackle  v. (-ling) 1 release from shackles. 2 set free.

Camber  —n. Convex surface of a road, deck, etc. —v. Build with a camber. [latin camurus curved]

Spittoon  n. Vessel to spit into.

Wonderland  n. 1 fairyland. 2 land of surprises or marvels.

Birch  —n. 1 tree with pale hard wood and thin peeling bark, bearing catkins. 2 bundle of birch twigs used for flogging. —v. Beat with a birch. [old english]

Hungry  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 feeling or showing hunger; needing food. 2 inducing hunger (hungry work). 3 craving (hungry for news).  hungrily adv. [old english]

Stowage  n. 1 stowing. 2 place for this.

Pill  n. 1 a ball or flat disc of solid medicine for swallowing whole. B (usu. Prec. By the) colloq. Contraceptive pill. 2 unpleasant or painful necessity. [latin pila ball]

Disorderly  adj. 1 untidy; confused. 2 riotous, unruly.  disorderliness n.

Halter  n. 1 headstall and rope for leading or tying up a horse etc. 2 a strap round the neck holding a dress etc. Up and leaving the shoulders and back bare. B (also halterneck) dress etc. Held by this. [old english]

Insult  —v. 1 speak to or treat with scornful abuse. 2 offend the self-respect or modesty of. —n. Insulting remark or action.  insulting adj. Insultingly adv. [latin insulto leap on, assail]

Deft  adj. Neat; dexterous; adroit.  deftly adv. Deftness n. [var. Of *daft = ‘meek’]

Eyeball  —n. Ball of the eye within the lids and socket. —v. Us slang look or stare (at).

Funny  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 amusing, comical. 2 strange, peculiar. 3 colloq. A slightly unwell. B eccentric.  funnily adv. Funniness n. [from *fun]

Rattling  —adj. 1 that rattles. 2 brisk, vigorous (rattling pace). —adv. Colloq. Remarkably (rattling good story).

Garb  —n. Clothing, esp. Of a distinctive kind. —v. (usu. In passive or refl.) Dress. [germanic: related to *gear]

Decalogue  n. Ten commandments. [greek: related to *deca-, logos word, reason]

Eighty  adj. & n. (pl. -ies) 1 eight times ten. 2 symbol for this (80, lxxx, lxxx). 3 (in pl.) Numbers from 80 to 89, esp. The years of a century or of a person's life.  eightieth adj. & n. [old english]

Vitriol  n. 1 sulphuric acid or a sulphate. 2 caustic or hostile speech or criticism. [latin vitrum]

Gamelan  n. 1 se asian orchestra mainly of percussion instruments. 2 type of xylophone used in this. [javanese]

Hussy  n. (pl. -ies) derog. Impudent or promiscuous girl or woman. [contraction of *housewife]

Ungraceful  adj. Lacking grace or elegance.  ungracefully adv.

Level  —n. 1 horizontal line or plane. 2 height or value reached; position on a real or imaginary scale (eye level; sugar level; danger level). 3 social, moral, or intellectual standard. 4 plane of rank or authority (talks at cabinet level). 5 instrument giving a line parallel to the plane of the horizon. 6 level surface. 7 flat tract of land. —adj. 1 flat and even; not bumpy. 2 horizontal. 3 (often foll. By with) a on the same horizontal plane as something else. B having equality with something else. 4 even, uniform, equable, or well-balanced. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 make level. 2 raze. 3 (also absol.) Aim (a missile or gun). 4 (also absol.; foll. By at, against) direct (an accusation etc.).  do one's level best colloq. Do one's utmost. Find one's level reach the right social, intellectual, etc. Position. Level down bring down to a standard. Level off make or become level. Level out make or become level. Level up bring up to a standard. On the level 1 honestly, without deception. 2 honest, truthful. On a level with 1 in the same horizontal plane as. 2 equal with. [latin diminutive of libra balance]

Eurodollar  n. Dollar held in a bank outside the us.

Dunk  v. 1 dip (food) into liquid before eating. 2 immerse. [german tunken dip]

Kappa  n. Tenth letter of the greek alphabet (k, k). [greek]

Ganglion  n. (pl. -lia or -s) structure containing an assemblage of nerve cells.  ganglionic adj. [greek]

Propylene  n.  Gaseous hydrocarbon used in the manufacture of chemicals. [from propyl, a univalent radical of propane]

Harmonium  n. Keyboard instrument in which the notes are produced by air driven through metal reeds by foot-operated bellows. [latin: related to *harmony]

Recorder  n. 1 apparatus for recording, esp. A video or tape recorder. 2 (also recorder) barrister or solicitor of at least ten years' standing, serving as a part-time judge. 3 wooden or plastic wind instrument with holes covered by the fingers. 4 keeper of records.

Kiln  n. Furnace or oven for burning, baking, or drying, esp. For calcining lime or firing pottery etc. [old english from latin culina kitchen]

Yoicks  int. Cry used by fox-hunters to urge on the hounds. [origin unknown]

Radiocarbon  n. Radioactive isotope of carbon.

Deactivate  v. (-ting) make inactive or less reactive.

Parlous  adj. Archaic or joc. Dangerous or difficult. [from perilous (*peril)]

Alike  —adj. (usu. Predic.) Similar, like. —adv. In a similar way.

Insofar  adv. = in so far (see *far).

Swore  past of *swear.

Tongs  n.pl. Implement with two arms for grasping coal, sugar, etc. [old english]

Winder  n. Winding mechanism, esp. Of a clock or watch.

Kitchenette  n. Small kitchen or cooking area.

Circuitry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 system of electric circuits. 2 equipment forming this.

Sensuality  n. (esp. Sexual) gratification of the senses.

Hubbub  n. 1 confused noise of talking. 2 disturbance. [perhaps of irish origin]

Glad  adj. (gladder, gladdest) 1 (predic.) Pleased. 2 expressing or causing pleasure (glad cry; glad news). 3 ready and willing (am glad to help).  be glad of find useful.  gladly adv. Gladness n. [old english]

Module  n. 1 standardized part or independent unit in construction, esp. Of furniture, a building, or an electronic system. 2 independent self-contained unit of a spacecraft. 3 unit or period of training or education.  modular adj. [latin: related to *modulus]

Mango  n. (pl. -es or -s) 1 tropical fruit with yellowish flesh. 2 tree bearing this. [tamil mankay]

Judaic  adj. Of or characteristic of the jews. [greek: related to *jew]

Unweaned  adj. Not yet weaned.

Ir-  prefix assim. Form of *in-1, *in-2 before r.

Fantail  n. Pigeon with a broad tail.

Stockpile  —n. Accumulated stock of goods etc. Held in reserve. —v. (-ling) accumulate a stockpile of.

Gaoler  var. Of *jailer.

Denude  v. (-ding) 1 make naked or bare. 2 (foll. By of) strip of (covering, property, etc.).  denudation n. [latin nudus naked]

Rewind  v. (past and past part. Rewound) wind (a film or tape etc.) Back.

Invite  —v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By to, or to + infin.) Ask (a person) courteously to come, or to do something. 2 make a formal courteous request for. 3 tend to call forth unintentionally. 4 a attract. B be attractive. —n. Colloq. Invitation. [latin invito]

Calices  pl. Of *calix.

Wooden  adj. 1 made of wood. 2 like wood. 3 a stiff, clumsy. B expressionless.  woodenly adv. Woodenness n.

Sawdust  n. Powdery wood particles produced in sawing.

Sportive  adj. Playful.

Kurchatovium  n. = *rutherfordium. [kurchatov, name of a russian physicist]

Cartouche  n. 1 scroll-like ornamentation. 2 oval ring enclosing the name and title of a pharaoh. [french: related to *cartoon]

Pedagogy  n. Science of teaching.

Octahedron  n. (pl. -s) solid figure contained by eight (esp. Triangular) plane faces.  octahedral adj. [greek]

Navigable  adj. 1 (of a river etc.) Suitable for ships to pass through. 2 seaworthy. 3 steerable.  navigability n. [latin: related to *navigate]

Flint  n. 1 a hard grey siliceous stone. B piece of this, esp. As a primitive tool or weapon. 2 piece of hard alloy used to give a spark. 3 anything hard and unyielding.  flinty adj. (-ier, -iest). [old english]

Swingeing  adj. 1 (of a blow) forcible. 2 huge or far-reaching (swingeing economies). [archaic swinge strike hard, from old english]

Uncomplicated  adj. Simple; straightforward.

Levee  n. Us 1 embankment against river floods. 2 natural embankment built up by a river. 3 landing-place. [french levée past part. Of lever raise: related to *levy]

Integument  n. Natural outer covering, as a skin, husk, rind, etc. [latin tego cover]

Pinnacle  n. 1 culmination or climax. 2 natural peak. 3 small ornamental turret crowning a buttress, roof, etc. [latin pinna *pin]

Supper  n. 1 late evening snack. 2 evening meal, esp. Light. [french souper]

Yb  symb. Ytterbium.

Stint  —v. 1 supply (food or aid etc.) Meanly or grudgingly. 2 (often refl.) Supply (a person etc.) In this way. —n. 1 limitation of supply or effort (without stint). 2 allotted amount of work (do one's stint). 3 small sandpiper. [old english]

Ripsaw  n. Coarse saw for sawing wood along the grain.

Drafty  adj. (brit. Draughty) (-ier, -iest) (of a room etc.) Letting in sharp currents of air.  draughtiness n.

Prefigure  v. Formal (-ring) represent or imagine beforehand.

Dizzy  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 a giddy. B feeling confused. 2 causing giddiness. —v. (-ies, -ied) 1 make dizzy. 2 bewilder.  dizzily adv. Dizziness n. [old english]

Songwriter  n. Writer of songs or the music for them.

Singular  —adj. 1 unique; outstanding; extraordinary, strange. 2 gram. (of a word or form) denoting a single person or thing. —n. Gram. 1 singular word or form. 2 the singular number.  singularity n. Singularly adv. [latin: related to *single]

Uncompromising  adj. Stubborn; unyielding.  uncompromisingly adv.

Commissionaire  n. Uniformed door-attendant. [french: related to *commissioner]

Warhead  n. Explosive head of a missile.

Neuro-  comb. Form nerve or nerves. [greek neuron nerve]

String  —n. 1 twine or narrow cord. 2 piece of this or of similar material used for tying or holding together, pulling, forming the head of a racket, etc. 3 length of catgut or wire etc. On a musical instrument, producing a note by vibration. 4 a (in pl.) Stringed instruments in an orchestra etc. B (attrib.) Of stringed instruments (string quartet). 5 (in pl.) Condition or complication (no strings attached). 6 set of things strung together; series or line. 7 tough side of a bean-pod etc. —v. (past and past part. Strung) 1 fit (a racket, violin, archer's bow, etc.) With a string or strings, or (a violin etc. Bow) with horsehairs etc. 2 tie with string. 3 thread on a string. 4 arrange in or as a string. 5  remove the strings from (a bean).  on a string under one's control. String along colloq. 1 deceive. 2 (often foll. By with) keep company (with). String out extend; prolong. String up 1 hang up on strings etc. 2 kill by hanging. 3 (usu. As strung up adj.) Make tense. [old english]

Flagon  n. 1 large bottle, usu. Holding a quart (1.13 litres), esp. Of wine, cider, etc. 2 large vessel for wine etc., usu. With a handle, spout, and lid. [latin flasco *flask]

Kaput  predic. Adj. Slang broken, ruined. [german]

Antarctic  —adj. Of the south polar regions. —n. This region. [latin: related to *arctic]

Celeriac  n. Variety of celery. [from *celery]

Oily  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of or like oil. 2 covered or soaked with oil. 3 (of a manner etc.) Fawning, unctuous, ingratiating.  oiliness n.

Deacon  n. (fem. (in senses 2 and 3) deaconess) 1 (in episcopal churches) minister below bishop and priest. 2 (in nonconformist churches) lay officer. 3 (in the early church) minister of charity. [greek diakonos servant]

Syllable  n. 1 unit of pronunciation forming the whole or part of a word and usu. Having one vowel sound often with consonant(s) before or after (e.g. Water has two, inferno three). 2 character(s) representing a syllable. 3 the least amount of speech or writing.  in words of one syllable plainly, bluntly. [greek sullabe]

Cable  —n. 1 encased group of insulated wires for transmitting electricity etc. 2 thick rope of wire or hemp. 3 cablegram. 4 (in full cable stitch) knitting stitch resembling twisted rope. —v. (-ling) transmit (a message) or inform (a person) by cablegram. [latin caplum halter, from arabic]

Cozy  (brit. Cosy) —adj. (-ier, -iest) comfortable and warm; snug. —n. (pl. -ies) cover to keep a teapot etc. Hot.  cosily adv. Cosiness n. [origin unknown]

Damselfly  n. Insect like a dragonfly but with wings folded when resting.

Background  n. 1 part of a scene or picture furthest from the observer. 2 (often attrib.) Inconspicuous position (kept in the background; background music). 3 person's education, social circumstances, etc. 4 explanatory or contributory information or events.

Restorative  —adj. Tending to restore health or strength. —n. Restorative medicine, food, etc.

Stoical  adj. Having or showing great self-control in adversity.  stoically adv.

Hamitic  —n. Group of african languages including ancient egyptian and berber. —adj. Of this group. [from the name ham (gen. 10:6 ff.)]

Blandish  v. Flatter; coax.  blandishment n. (usu. In pl.). [latin: related to *bland]

Hardtop  n. Car with a rigid (usu. Detachable) roof.

Saye  abbr. Save-as-you-earn.

Glam  adj. Colloq. Glamorous. [abbreviation]

Ohm  n. Si unit of electrical resistance. [ohm, name of a physicist]

Sardonic  adj. Bitterly mocking or cynical.  sardonically adv. [greek sardonios sardinian]

Panatella  n. Long thin cigar. [american spanish, = long thin biscuit]

Fortran  n. (also fortran) computer language used esp. For scientific calculations. [from formula translation]

Marlinspike  n. Pointed iron tool used to separate strands of rope etc. [marling from dutch marlen from marren bind]

Rot  —v. (-tt-) 1 (of animal or vegetable matter) lose its original form by the chemical action of bacteria, fungi, etc.; decay. 2 gradually perish or waste away (left to rot in prison). 3 cause to rot, make rotten. —n. 1 rotting; decay. 2 slang nonsense (talks rot). 3 decline in standards etc. (rot set in). —int. Expressing incredulity or ridicule. [old english]

Chatterbox  n. Talkative person.

Charade  n. 1 (usu. In pl., treated as sing.) Game of guessing a word from acted clues. 2 absurd pretence. [provençal charra chatter]

Elvish  see *elf.

Brainless  adj. Foolish.

Cagey  adj. (also cagy) (-ier, -iest) colloq. Cautious and non-committal.  cagily adv. Caginess n. [origin unknown]

Overdevelop  v. (-p-) 1 develop too much. 2 photog. Treat with developer for too long.

Unbleached  adj. Not bleached.

Bounder  n. Colloq. Cad.

Acquaint  v. (usu. Foll. By with) make aware of or familiar with (acquaint me with the facts).  be acquainted with have personal knowledge of; know slightly. [latin: related to *ad-, *cognizance]

Reunion  n. 1 reuniting or being reunited. 2 social gathering, esp. Of people formerly associated.

Strenuous  adj. 1 requiring or using great effort. 2 energetic.  strenuously adv. [latin]

Exult  v. Be joyful.  exultation n. Exultant adj. Exultantly adv. [latin ex(s)ulto from salio salt- leap]

Bight  n. 1 bay, inlet, etc. 2 loop of rope. [old english]

Quarterstaff  n. Hist. Stout pole 6–8 feet long, formerly used as a weapon.

Poetry  n. 1 art or work of a poet. 2 poems collectively. 3 poetic or tenderly pleasing quality. [medieval latin: related to *poet]

Pleat  —n. Fold or crease, esp. A flattened fold in cloth doubled upon itself. —v. Make a pleat or pleats in. [from *plait]

Butler  n. Principal manservant of a household. [french bouteille bottle]

Medic  n. Colloq. Medical practitioner or student. [latin medicus physician]

Forum  n. 1 place of or meeting for public discussion. 2 court or tribunal. 3 hist. Public square in an ancient roman city used for judicial and other business. [latin]

Veterinarian  n. Formal veterinary surgeon.

Week  n. 1 period of seven days reckoned usu. From midnight on saturday. 2 any period of seven days. 3 the six days between sundays. 4 a the five days monday to friday. B time spent working in this period (35-hour week; three-day week). [old english]

Roundworm  n. Worm with a rounded body.

Ragamuffin  n. Child in ragged dirty clothes. [probably from *rag1]

Fibroid  —adj. Of, like, or containing fibrous tissue or fibres. —n. Benign fibrous tumour growing in the womb.

Hegira  n. (also hejira) 1 muhammad's flight from mecca in ad 622. 2 muslim era reckoned from this date. [arabic hijra departure]

Egress  n. Formal 1 exit. 2 right of going out. [latin egredior -gress- walk out]

Bicameral  adj. (of a legislative body) having two chambers. [from *bi-, latin camera chamber]

Grapefruit  n. (pl. Same) large round usu. Yellow citrus fruit.

Ophthalmology  n. The study of the eye.  ophthalmologist n.

Cmg  abbr. Companion (of the order) of st michael and st george.

Peptic  adj. Concerning or promoting digestion. [greek peptikos able to digest]

Consultation  n. 1 meeting arranged to consult. 2 act or process of consulting.

Gatecrasher  n. Uninvited guest at a party etc.  gatecrash v.

Offering  n. 1 contribution or gift, esp. Of money. 2 thing offered as a sacrifice etc.

Burrow  —n. Hole or tunnel dug by a rabbit etc. As a dwelling or shelter. —v. 1 make a burrow. 2 make (a hole, one's way, etc.) (as) by digging. 3 (foll. By into) investigate, search. [apparently var. Of *borough]

Turbine  n. Rotary motor driven by a flow of water, steam, gas, wind, etc. [latin turbo -in- spinning-top, whirlwind]

Sortie  —n. 1 sally, esp. From a besieged garrison. 2 operational military flight. —v. (-ties, -tied, -tieing) make a sortie. [french]

Infrastructure  n. 1 a basic structural foundations of a society or enterprise. B roads, bridges, sewers, etc., regarded as a country's economic foundation. 2 permanent installations as a basis for military etc. Operations.

Hoop  —n. 1 circular band of metal, wood, etc., esp. As part of a framework. 2 ring bowled along by a child, or for circus performers to jump through. 3 arch through which balls are hit in croquet. —v. Bind or encircle with hoop(s).  be put (or go) through the hoop (or hoops) undergo rigorous testing. [old english]

Did  past of *do1.

Opinion  n. 1 unproven belief. 2 view held as probable. 3 what one thinks about something. 4 piece of professional advice (a second opinion). 5 estimation (low opinion of). [latin: related to *opine]

Reclassify  v. (-ies, -ied) classify again or differently.  reclassification n.

Lf  abbr. Low frequency.

Proponent  n. Person advocating a motion, theory, or proposal. [latin: related to *propose]

Filling  n. Material that fills a tooth, sandwich, pie, etc.

Greenfinch  n. Finch with green and yellow plumage.

Gamekeeper  n. Person employed to breed and protect game.

Balmy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 mild and fragrant; soothing. 2 slang = *barmy.  balmily adv. Balminess n.

Rho  n. Seventeenth letter of the greek alphabet (r, r). [greek]

Byword  n. 1 person or thing as a notable example (is a byword for luxury). 2 familiar saying.

Scut  n. Short tail, esp. Of a hare, rabbit, or deer. [origin unknown]

Poodle  n. 1 dog of a breed with a curly coat that is usually clipped. 2 servile follower. [german pudel]

Primula  n. Cultivated plant bearing primrose-like flowers in a wide variety of colours. [latin diminutive: related to *prime1]

Paki  n. (pl. -s) slang offens. Pakistani. [abbreviation]

Unilateralism  n. Unilateral disarmament.  unilateralist n. & adj.

Gigolo  n. (pl. -s) young man paid by an older woman to be her escort or lover. [french]

Microprocessor  n. Integrated circuit containing all the functions of a computer's central processing unit.

Floodlight  —n. Large powerful light (usu. One of several) to illuminate a building, sports ground, etc. —v. Illuminate with floodlights.  floodlit adj.

Entomb  v. 1 place in a tomb. 2 serve as a tomb for.  entombment n. [french: related to *tomb]

Jugoslav  var. Of *yugoslav.

Accumulate  v. (-ting) 1 acquire an increasing number or quantity of; amass, collect. 2 grow numerous; increase. [latin: related to *cumulus]

Albatross  n. 1 a long-winged, stout-bodied bird related to the petrel. B encumbrance. 2 golf score of three strokes under par at any hole. [alteration of alcatras, from spanish and portuguese alcatraz from arabic, = the jug]

Litigant  —n. Party to a lawsuit. —adj. Engaged in a lawsuit. [related to *litigate]

Cream  —n. 1 fatty part of milk. 2 its yellowish-white colour. 3 creamlike cosmetic etc. 4 food or drink like or containing cream. 5 (usu. Prec. By the) best part of something. —v. 1 take cream from (milk). 2 make creamy. 3 treat (the skin etc.) With cosmetic cream. 4 form a cream or scum. —adj. Pale yellowish white.  cream off take (esp. The best part) from a whole. [latin cramum and church latin chrisma oil for anointing]

Spermaceti  n. White waxy substance from the sperm whale, used for ointments etc. [medieval latin, = whale sperm]

Sine  n. Ratio of the side opposite a given angle (in a right-angled triangle) to the hypotenuse. [latin *sinus]

Wolf  —n. (pl. Wolves) 1 wild animal related to the dog, usu. Hunting in packs. 2 slang man who seduces women. —v. (often foll. By down) devour greedily.  cry wolf raise false alarms. Keep the wolf from the door avert starvation.  wolfish adj. [old english]

Lye  n. 1 water made alkaline with wood ashes. 2 any alkaline solution for washing. [old english]

Webbing  n. Strong narrow closely-woven fabric used for belts etc.

Stonecrop  n. Succulent rock-plant.

Subtend  v. (of a line) be opposite (an angle or arc). [latin: related to *tend1]

Melody  n. (pl. -ies) 1 single notes arranged to make a distinctive recognizable pattern; tune. 2 principal part in harmonized music. 3 musical arrangement of words. 4 sweet music, tunefulness. [greek melos song: related to *ode]

Farthing  n. Hist. Coin and monetary unit worth a quarter of an old penny. [old english: related to *fourth]

Usage  the farthing was withdrawn from circulation in 1961.

Waybill  n. List of passengers or parcels on a vehicle.

Pre-  prefix before (in time, place, order, degree, or importance). [latin prae before]

Macaw  n. Long-tailed brightly coloured american parrot. [portuguese macao]

Untangle  v. (-ling) disentangle.

Gosling  n. Young goose. [old norse: related to *goose]

Punter  n. Colloq. 1 person who gambles or lays a bet. 2 a customer or client; member of an audience. B prostitute's client.

Minion  n. Derog. Servile subordinate. [french mignon]

Anaesthetic  (us anes-) —n. Substance producing anaesthesia. —adj. Producing anaesthesia.

Telecast  —n. Television broadcast. —v. Transmit by television.  telecaster n.

Survive  v. (-ving) 1 continue to live or exist. 2 live or exist longer than. 3 remain alive after or continue to exist in spite of (a danger, accident, etc.).  survivor n. [anglo-french survivre from latin supervivo]

Holy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 morally and spiritually excellent or perfect, and to be revered. 2 belonging to or devoted to god. 3 consecrated, sacred. [old english: related to *whole]

Escritoire  n. Writing-desk with drawers etc. [french from latin scriptorium writing-room]

Shrink  —v. (past shrank; past part. Shrunk or (esp. As adj.) Shrunken) 1 make or become smaller, esp. From moisture, heat, or cold. 2 (usu. Foll. By from) recoil; flinch. —n. 1 act of shrinking. 2 slang psychiatrist. [old english]

Replant  v. 1 transfer (a plant etc.). 2 plant (ground) again.

Frith  var. Of *firth.

Ripper  n. 1 person or thing that rips. 2 murderer who mutilates the victims' bodies.

Trainer  n. 1 person who trains horses, athletes, footballers, etc. 2 aircraft or simulator used to train pilots. 3  soft running shoe.

Nail  —n. 1 small metal spike hammered in to join things together or as a peg or decoration. 2 horny covering on the upper surface of the tip of the human finger or toe. —v. 1 fasten with a nail or nails. 2 secure or get hold of (a person or thing). 3 keep (attention etc.) Fixed. 4 expose or discover (a lie or liar).  nail down 1 bind (a person) to a promise etc. 2 define precisely. 3 fasten (a thing) with nails. Nail in a person's coffin something thought to increase the risk of death. On the nail (esp. Of payment) without delay. [old english]

Hypoventilation  n. Abnormally slow breathing.

Tetralogy  n. (pl. -ies) group of four related novels, plays, operas, etc.

Handlebar  n. (usu. In pl.) Steering-bar of a bicycle etc.

Cadi  n. (pl. -s) judge in a muslim country. [arabic]

Recognition  n. Recognizing or being recognized. [latin: related to *recognize]

Linesman  n. Umpire's or referee's assistant who decides whether a ball has fallen within the playing area or not.

Inauspicious  adj. 1 ill-omened, not favourable. 2 unlucky.  inauspiciously adv. Inauspiciousness n.

Lo  int. Archaic look.  lo and behold joc. Formula introducing mention of a surprising fact. [old english]

Shambles  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) 1 colloq. Mess, muddle. 2 butcher's slaughterhouse. 3 scene of carnage. [pl. Of shamble table for selling meat]

Mongoloid  —adj. 1 characteristic of the mongolians, esp. In having a broad flat yellowish face. 2 (mongoloid) often offens. Having the characteristic symptoms of down's syndrome. —n. Mongoloid or mongoloid person.

Wept  past of *weep.

Provost  n. 1 head of some (esp. Oxbridge) colleges. 2 head of a cathedral chapter. 3 = *provost marshal. [latin propositus from pono place]

Contralto  n. (pl. -s) 1 lowest female singing-voice. 2 singer with this voice. [italian: related to *contra-, *alto]

Gaffer  n. 1 old fellow. 2 colloq. Foreman, boss. 3 chief electrician in a film or television production unit. [probably from *godfather]

Naturism  n. Nudism.  naturist n.

Inhabit  v. (-t-) dwell in; occupy.  inhabitable adj. [latin: related to *habit]

Marinade  —n. 1 mixture of wine, vinegar, oil, spices, etc., for soaking meat, fish, etc. Before cooking. 2 meat, fish, etc., so soaked. —v. (-ding) soak in a marinade. [spanish marinar pickle in brine: related to *marine]

Hostess  n. 1 woman who receives or entertains a guest. 2 woman employed to entertain customers at a nightclub etc. 3 stewardess on an aircraft etc. [related to *host2]

Americanism  n. Word etc. Of us origin or usage.

Rainbow  —n. Arch of colours formed in the sky by reflection, refraction, and dispersion of the sun's rays in falling rain or in spray or mist. —adj. Many-coloured. [old english: related to *rain, *bow1]

Ampulla  n. (pl. -pullae) 1 roman globular flask with two handles. 2 ecclesiastical vessel. [latin]

Careen  v. 1 turn (a ship) on one side for repair etc. 2 tilt, lean over. 3 swerve about. [latin carina keel]

Usage  sense 3 of careen is influenced by the verb career.

Gem  —n. 1 precious stone, esp. Cut and polished or engraved. 2 thing or person of great beauty or worth. —v. (-mm-) adorn with or as with gems. [latin gemma bud, jewel]

Gasometer  n. Large tank from which gas is distributed by pipes. [french gazomètre: related to *gas, *-meter]

Death  n. 1 irreversible ending of life; dying or being killed. 2 instance of this. 3 destruction; ending (death of our hopes). 4 being dead (eyes closed in death). 5 (usu. Death) personification of death, esp. As a skeleton. 6 lack of spiritual life.  at death's door close to death. Be the death of 1 cause the death of. 2 be annoying or harmful to. Catch one's death colloq. Catch a serious chill etc. Do to death 1 kill. 2 overdo. Fate worse than death colloq. Very unpleasant experience. Put to death kill or cause to be killed. To death to the utmost, extremely (bored to death).  deathlike adj. [old english]

Loser  n. 1 person or thing that loses, esp. A contest (is a bad loser). 2 colloq. Person who regularly fails.

Disinvest  v. Reduce or dispose of one's investment.  disinvestment n.

Birdlime  n. Sticky substance spread to trap birds.

Flop  —v. (-pp-) 1 sway about heavily or loosely. 2 (often foll. By down, on, into) fall or sit etc. Awkwardly or suddenly. 3 slang fail; collapse (play flopped). 4 make a dull soft thud or splash. —n. 1 flopping movement or sound. 2 slang failure. —adv. With a flop. [var. Of *flap]

Pent  adj. (often foll. By in, up) closely confined; shut in (pent-up feelings). [from *pen2]

Sacral  adj. 1 anat. Of the sacrum. 2 of or for sacred rites. [latin sacrum sacred]

Overshadow  v. 1 appear much more prominent or important than. 2 cast into the shade.

Administer  v. 1 manage (business affairs etc.). 2 a deliver or dispense, esp. Formally (a punishment, sacrament, etc.). B (usu. Foll. By to) direct the taking of (an oath). [latin: related to *ad-, *minister]

Drive  —v. (-ving; past drove; past part. Driven) 1 urge forward, esp. Forcibly. 2 a compel (was driven to complain). B force into a specified state (drove him mad). C (often refl.) Urge to overwork. 3 a operate and direct (a vehicle, locomotive, etc.). B convey or be conveyed in a vehicle. C be competent to drive (a vehicle) (does he drive?). D travel in a private vehicle. 4 (of wind etc.) Carry along, propel, esp. Rapidly (driven snow; driving rain). 5 a (often foll. By into) force (a stake, nail, etc.) Into place by blows. B bore (a tunnel etc.). 6 effect or conclude forcibly (drove a hard bargain; drove his point home). 7 (of power) operate (machinery). 8 (usu. Foll. By at) work hard; dash, rush. 9 hit (a ball) forcibly. —n. 1 journey or excursion in a vehicle. 2 a (esp. Scenic) street or road. B private road through a garden to a house. 3 a motivation and energy. B inner urge (sex-drive). 4 forcible stroke of a bat etc. 5 organized effort (membership drive). 6 a transmission of power to machinery, wheels, etc. B position of the steering-wheel in a vehicle (left-hand drive). C computing = *disk drive. 7 organized whist, bingo, etc. Competition.  drive at seek, intend, or mean (what is he driving at?). [old english]

Bastard  often offens. —n. 1 person born of an unmarried mother. 2 slang a unpleasant or despicable person. B person of a specified kind (poor, lucky, bastard). 3 slang difficult or awkward thing. —attrib. Adj. 1 illegitimate by birth. 2 unauthorized, counterfeit, hybrid.  bastardy n. (in sense 1 of n.). [french from medieval latin]

Mutate  v. (-ting) (cause to) undergo mutation.

Meanie  n. (also meany) (pl. -ies) colloq. Niggardly or small-minded person.

Ringside  n. Area immediately beside a boxing or circus ring etc. (often attrib.: ringside view).

Veronica  n. Speedwell. [medieval latin, probably from st veronica]

Dustcart  n. Vehicle collecting household refuse.

Applicator  n. Device for applying ointment etc.

Everlasting  —adj. 1 lasting for ever or for a long time. 2 (of flowers) keeping their shape and colour when dried. —n. 1 eternity. 2 everlasting flower.

Indoors  adv. Into or in a building.

Bullfight  n. Public baiting, and usu. Killing, of bulls.  bullfighter n. Bullfighting n.

Science  n. 1 branch of knowledge involving systematized observation and experiment. 2 a knowledge so gained, or on a specific subject. B pursuit or principles of this. 3 skilful technique. [latin scio know]

Leathery  adj. 1 like leather. 2 tough.

Knurl  n. Small projecting knob, ridge, etc. [low german or dutch]

Terrain  n. Tract of land, esp. In geographical or military contexts. [latin: related to *terrene]

Apprentice  —n. 1 person learning a trade by working in it for an agreed period at low wages. 2 novice. —v. (-cing) (usu. Foll. By to) engage as an apprentice (apprenticed to a builder).  apprenticeship n. [french apprendre learn]

Pendant  n. Hanging jewel etc., esp. One attached to a necklace, bracelet, etc. [french pendre hang]

Cooperate  v. (also co-operate) (-ting) 1 (often foll. By with) work or act together. 2 be helpful and do as one is asked. cooperation n. [related to *co-]

Hangman  n. 1 executioner who hangs condemned persons. 2 word-game for two players, with failed guesses recorded by drawing a representation of a gallows.

Pendent  adj. Formal 1 a hanging. B overhanging. 2 undecided, pending.  pendency n.

Equi-  comb. Form equal. [latin: related to *equal]

Liana  n. Climbing plant of tropical forests. [french]

Armor  (brit. Armour) —n. 1 protective usu. Metal covering formerly worn in fighting. 2 a (in full armour-plate) protective metal covering for an armed vehicle, ship, etc. B armed vehicles collectively. 3 protective covering or shell of an animal or plant. 4 heraldic devices. —v. (usu. Asarmoured adj.) Provide with protective covering, and often guns (armoured car; armoured train). [latin armatura: related to *arm2]

Unicycle  n. Single-wheeled cycle, esp. As used by acrobats.  unicyclist n.

Miaow  —n. Characteristic cry of a cat. —v. Make this cry. [imitative]
