Distressed  adj. 1 suffering from distress. 2 impoverished. 3 (of furniture, clothing, etc.) Aged, torn, etc. Artificially.

Owing  predic. Adj. 1 owed; yet to be paid. 2 (foll. By to) a caused by. B (as prep.) Because of.

Usage  the use of owing to as a preposition meaning ‘because of’ is entirely acceptable (e.g. Couldn't come owing to the snow), unlike this use of due to.

Swept  past and past part. Of *sweep.

Soulful  adj. Having, expressing, or evoking deep feeling.  soulfully adv.

Stile  n. Steps allowing people but not animals to climb over a fence or wall. [old english]

Dolphinarium  n. (pl. -s) public aquarium for dolphins.

Urinal  n. Place or receptacle for urination by men. [latin: related to *urine]

Enmesh  v. Entangle in or as in a net.

Triplicate  —adj. 1 existing in three examples or copies. 2 having three corresponding parts. 3 tripled. —n. Each of a set of three copies or corresponding parts. —v. (-ting) 1 make in three copies. 2 multiply by three.  in triplicate in three copies.  triplication n. [latin: related to *triplex]

Porch  n. Covered entrance to a building. [latin porticus]

Metacarpus  n. (pl. -carpi) 1 part of the hand between the wrist and the fingers. 2 set of five bones in this.  metacarpal adj. [related to *meta-, *carpus]

Laboratory  n. (pl. -ies) room, building, or establishment for scientific experiments, research, chemical manufacture, etc. [latin: related to *laborious]

Bod  n. Colloq. Person. [shortening of *body]

Tosa  n. Dog of a breed of mastiff, orig. Kept for dog-fighting. [japanese]

Wallop  colloq. —v. (-p-) 1 thrash; beat. 2 (as walloping adj.) Huge. —n. 1 heavy blow. 2 beer. [earlier senses ‘gallop’, ‘boil’, from french waloper from germanic: cf. *gallop]

Telly  n. (pl. -ies) colloq. 1 television. 2 television set. [abbreviation]

Continuous  adj. Uninterrupted, connected throughout in space or time.  continuously adv. [latin: related to *contain]

Usage  see note at continual.

Cardiograph  n. Instrument recording heart movements.  cardiographer n. Cardiography n.

Chary  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 cautious, wary. 2 sparing; ungenerous. [old english: related to *care]

Downturn  n. Decline, esp. In economic activity.

Rescind  v. Abrogate, revoke, cancel.  rescission n. [latin rescindo -sciss- cut off]

Testify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 (often foll. By to) (of a person or thing) bear witness; be evidence of (testified to the facts). 2 give evidence. 3 affirm or declare. [latin testificor from testis witness]

Pantihose  n. (usu. Treated as pl.) Us women's tights.

Magnesium  n. Silvery metallic element.

Phew  int. Expression of relief, astonishment, weariness, etc. [imitative]

Hexagon  n. Plane figure with six sides and angles.  hexagonal adj. [greek: related to *hexa-, -gonos angled]

Ad-  prefix (altered or assimilated before some letters) implying motion or direction to, reduction or change into, addition, adherence, increase, or intensification. [latin]

Deduce  v. (-cing) (often foll. By from) infer logically.  deducible adj. [latin duco duct- lead]

Invigilate  v. (-ting) supervise people taking an exam.  invigilation n. Invigilator n. [latin: related to *vigil]

Jackdaw  n. Grey-headed bird of the crow family.

Ordinance  n. 1 decree. 2 religious rite. [latin: related to *ordain]

Correlate  —v. (-ting) (usu. Foll. By with, to) have or bring into a mutual relation or dependence. —n. Each of two related or complementary things.  correlation n. [medieval latin correlatio]

Culminate  v. (-ting) (usu. Foll. By in) reach its highest or final point (culminate in war).  culmination n. [latin culmen top]

Encephalogram  n. = *electroencephalogram.

Flaky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of, like, or in flakes. 2 esp. Us slang crazy, eccentric.

Methadone  n. Narcotic analgesic drug used esp. As a substitute for morphine or heroin. [6-dimethylamino-4, 4-diphenyl-3-heptanone]

Sarge  n. Slang sergeant. [abbreviation]

Tricot  n. Knitted fabric. [french]

Swindle  —v. (-ling) (often foll. By out of) 1 cheat of money etc. 2 cheat a person of (money etc.) (swindled £200 out of him). —n. 1 act of swindling. 2 fraudulent person or thing.  swindler n. [back-formation from swindler from german]

Neutron  n. Elementary particle of about the same mass as a proton but without an electric charge. [from *neutral]

Bracelet  n. 1 ornamental band or chain worn on the wrist or arm. 2 slang handcuff.

Drawer  n. 1 person or thing that draws, esp. A cheque etc. 2 also lidless boxlike storage compartment, sliding in and out of a table etc. (chest of drawers). 3 (in pl.) Knickers, underpants.

Prissy  adj. (-ier, -iest) prim, prudish.  prissily adv. Prissiness n. [perhaps from *prim, *sissy]

Superhuman  adj. Exceeding normal human capability.

Antedate  v. (-ting) 1 precede in time. 2 assign an earlier than actual date to.

Leggy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 long-legged. 2 long-stemmed and weak.  legginess n.

Denounce  v. (-cing) 1 accuse publicly; condemn. 2 inform against. 3 announce withdrawal from (an armistice, treaty, etc.).  denouncement n. [latin nuntius messenger]

Qt  abbr. Quart(s).

Importune  v. (-ning) 1 pester (a person) with requests. 2 solicit as a prostitute.

Outfitter  n. Supplier of clothing.

Courteous  adj. Polite, considerate.  courteously adv. Courteousness n. [french: related to *court]

Fennel  n. Yellow-flowered fragrant herb used for flavouring. [latin fenum hay]

Wend  v.  wend one's way make one's way. [old english, = turn]

Blowpipe  n. 1 tube for blowing air through, esp. To intensify a flame or to blow glass. 2 tube for propelling poisoned darts etc. By blowing.

Subfusc  —adj. Formal dull; dusky. —n. Formal clothing at some universities. [latin fuscus dark brown]

Burr  —n. 1 a whirring sound. B rough sounding of the letter r. 2 (also bur) a rough edge on metal or paper. B surgeon's or dentist's small drill. 3 var. Of *bur 1, 2. —v. Make a burr. [imitative]

Cretin  n. 1 deformed and mentally retarded person, esp. As the result of thyroid deficiency. 2 colloq. Stupid person.  cretinism n. Cretinous adj. [french crétin: related to *christian]

Putty  —n. Cement of whiting and linseed oil, used for fixing panes of glass, filling holes, etc. —v. (-ies, -ied) cover, fix, join, or fill with putty. [french potée: related to *pot1]

Hence  adv. 1 from this time (two years hence). 2 for this reason (hence we seem to be wrong). 3 archaic from here. [old english]

Racketeer  n. Person who operates a dishonest business.  racketeering n.

Hemstitch  —n. Decorative stitch. —v. Hem with this stitch.

Coalface  n. Exposed working surface of coal in a mine.

Thingummy  n. (pl. -ies) (also thingumabob, thingumajig) colloq. Person or thing whose name one has forgotten or does not know.

Milometer  n. Instrument for measuring the number of miles travelled by a vehicle.

Commit  v. (-tt-) 1 do or make (a crime, blunder, etc.). 2 (usu. Foll. By to) entrust or consign for safe keeping or treatment. 3 send (a person) to prison. 4 pledge or bind (esp. Oneself) to a certain course or policy. 5 (as committed adj.) (often foll. By to) a dedicated. B obliged.  commit to memory memorize. Commit to paper write down. [latin committo -miss-]

Boo  —int. 1 expression of disapproval etc. 2 sound intended to surprise. —n. Utterance of boo, esp. To a performer etc. —v. (boos, booed) 1 utter boos. 2 jeer at by booing. [imitative]

Resin  —n. 1 adhesive substance secreted by some plants and trees. 2 (in full synthetic resin) organic compound made by polymerization etc. And used in plastics. —v. (-n-) rub or treat with resin.  resinous adj. [latin]

Dusky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 shadowy; dim. 2 dark-coloured; dark-skinned.  duskily adv. Duskiness n.

Magic  —n. 1 a supposed art of influencing or controlling events supernaturally. B witchcraft. 2 conjuring tricks. 3 inexplicable influence. 4 enchanting quality or phenomenon. —adj. 1 of magic. 2 producing surprising results. 3 colloq. Wonderful, exciting. —v. (-ck-) change or create by or as if by magic.  like magic very rapidly. Magic away cause to disappear as if by magic.  [greek magikos: related to *magus]

Anchovy  n. (pl. -ies) small strong-flavoured fish of the herring family. [spanish and portuguese anchova]

Dunce  n. Person slow at learning; dullard. [duns scotus, name of a philosopher]

Antepenultimate  adj. Last but two.

Broom  n. 1 long-handled brush for sweeping. 2 shrub with bright yellow flowers. [old english]

Tarzan  n. Colloq. Agile muscular man. [name of a character in stories by e. R. Burroughs]

Napkin  n. 1 piece of linen etc. For wiping the lips, fingers, etc. At meals. 2 baby's nappy. [french nappe from latin mappa *map]

Vortex  n. (pl. -texes or -tices) 1 whirlpool, whirlwind. 2 whirling motion or mass. 3 thing viewed as destructive or devouring (the vortex of society).  vortical adj. [latin: related to *vertex]

Ordure  n. Dung. [latin horridus: related to *horrid]

Establish  v. 1 set up (a business, system, etc.) On a permanent basis. 2 (foll. By in) settle (a person or oneself) in some capacity. 3 (esp. As established adj.) A achieve permanent acceptance for (a custom, belief, etc.). B place (a fact etc.) Beyond dispute. [latin stabilio make firm]

Winter  —n. 1 coldest and last season of the year. 2 (attrib.) Characteristic of or fit for winter. —v. (usu. Foll. By at, in) pass the winter. [old english]

Marabou  n. 1 large w. African stork. 2 its down as trimming etc. [french from arabic]

Repaper  v. Paper (a wall etc.) Again.

Themselves  pron. 1 emphat. Form of *they or *them. 2 refl. Form of *them.  be themselves act in their normal, unconstrained manner. By themselves see by oneself.

Impiety  n. (pl. -ies) 1 lack of piety or reverence. 2 act etc. Showing this.

Orchestrate  v. (-ting) 1 arrange or compose for orchestral performance. 2 arrange (elements) to achieve a desired result.  orchestration n.

Wreckage  n. 1 wrecked material. 2 remnants of a wreck. 3 act of wrecking.

Blinker  —n. 1 (usu. In pl.) Each of two screens on a bridle preventing lateral vision. 2 device that blinks. —v. 1 obscure with blinkers. 2 (as blinkered adj.) Having narrow and prejudiced views.

Unstained  adj. Not stained.

Soup  —n. Liquid food made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables. —v. (usu. Foll. By up) colloq. 1 increase the power of (an engine). 2 enliven (a souped-up version of the original).  in the soup colloq. In difficulties. [french]

Freighter  n. 1 ship or aircraft for carrying freight. 2 us freight-wagon.

Learner  n. 1 person who is learning a subject or skill. 2 (in full learner driver) person who is learning to drive but has not yet passed a driving test.

Taffrail  n. Rail round a ship's stern. [dutch taffereel panel]

Humus  n. Organic constituent of soil formed by the decomposition of vegetation. [latin, = soil]

Seaboard  n. 1 seashore or coastline. 2 coastal region.

Fourteen  adj. & n. 1 one more than thirteen. 2 symbol for this (14, xiv, xiv). 3 size etc. Denoted by fourteen.  fourteenth adj. & n. [old english: related to *four, *-teen]

Sitcom  n. Colloq. Situation comedy. [abbreviation]

Readership  n. 1 readers of a newspaper etc. 2 (also readership) position of reader.

Chic  —adj. (chic-er, chic-est) stylish, elegant. —n. Stylishness, elegance. [french]

Regardless  —adj. (foll. By of) without regard or consideration for. —adv. Without paying attention.

Mollusk  n. (brit. Mollusc) invertebrate with a soft body and usu. A hard shell, e.g. Snails and oysters. [latin molluscus soft]

Supertanker  n. Very large tanker ship.

Biped  —n. Two-footed animal. —adj. Two-footed.  bipedal adj. [latin bipes -edis]

Libra  n. 1 constellation and seventh sign of the zodiac (the scales). 2 person born when the sun is in this sign. [latin, = pound weight]

Pasta  n. Dried flour paste in various shapes (e.g. Lasagne or spaghetti). [italian: related to *paste]

Photolithography  n. Lithography using plates made photographically.

Fetter  —n. 1 shackle for the ankles. 2 (in pl.) Captivity. 3 restraint. —v. 1 put into fetters. 2 restrict. [old english]

Chartreuse  n. Pale green or yellow brandy-based liqueur. [chartreuse, monastery in s. France]

Shipwreck  —n. 1 a destruction of a ship by a storm, foundering, etc. B ship so destroyed. 2 (often foll. By of) ruin of hopes, dreams, etc. —v. 1 inflict shipwreck on. 2 suffer shipwreck.

Unprofessional  adj. 1 contrary to professional standards. 2 unskilled, amateurish.  unprofessionally adv.

Unclench  v. 1 release (clenched hands etc.). 2 (of hands etc.) Become relaxed or open.

Subsidy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 money granted esp. By the state to keep down the price of commodities etc. 2 any monetary grant. [latin subsidium help]

Clam  —n. Edible bivalve mollusc. —v. (-mm-) (foll. By up) colloq. Refuse to talk. [related to *clamp1]

Dealt  past and past part. Of *deal1.

Inaudible  adj. Unable to be heard.  inaudibly adv.

Ghosting  n. Appearance of a ‘ghost’ image in a television picture.

Preferential  adj. 1 of or involving preference. 2 giving or receiving a favour.  preferentially adv.

Codify  v. (-ies, -ied) arrange (laws etc.) Systematically into a code.  codification n. Codifier n.

Rekindle  v. (-ling) kindle again.

Latvian  —n. 1 a native or national of latvia in eastern europe. B person of latvian descent. 2 language of latvia. —adj. Of latvia, its people, or language.

Sincerely  adv. In a sincere manner.  yours sincerely formula for ending an informal letter.

Ending  n. 1 end or final part, esp. Of a story. 2 inflected final part of a word.

Unknowable  —adj. That cannot be known. —n. 1 unknowable thing. 2 (the unknowable) the postulated absolute or ultimate reality.

Souk  n.  Market-place in muslim countries. [arabic]

Liking  n. 1 what one likes; one's taste (is it to your liking?). 2 (foll. By for) regard or fondness; taste or fancy.

Bilateral  adj. 1 of, on, or with two sides. 2 affecting or between two parties, countries, etc.  bilaterally adv.

Sump  n. 1 casing holding the oil in an internal-combustion engine. 2 pit, well, hole, etc. In which superfluous liquid collects. [low german or dutch]

Helmet  n. Protective head-covering worn by a policeman, motor cyclist, etc. [french from germanic]

Official  —adj. 1 of an office or its tenure. 2 characteristic of officials and bureaucracy. 3 properly authorized. —n. Person holding office or engaged in official duties.  officialdom n. Officially adv.

Dialysis  n. (pl. Dialyses) 1 separation of particles in a liquid by differences in their ability to pass through a membrane into another liquid. 2 purification of the blood by this technique. [greek luo set free]

Cuddly  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 (of a person, toy, etc.) Soft and yielding. 2 given to cuddling.

Unease  n. Nervousness, anxiety.

Reflex  —adj. 1 (of an action) independent of the will, as an automatic response to the stimulation of a nerve. 2 (of an angle) exceeding 180°. —n. 1 reflex action. 2 sign or secondary manifestation (law is a reflex of public opinion). 3 reflected light or image. [latin: related to *reflect]

Ambient  adj. Surrounding.

Dm  abbr. Deutschmark.

Aqualung  n. Portable breathing-apparatus for divers. [latin aqua water]

Structuralism  n. Doctrine that structure rather than function is important.  structuralist n. & adj.

Obliging  adj. Accommodating, helpful.  obligingly adv.

Fugue  n. Piece of music in which a short melody or phrase is introduced by one part and taken up and developed by others.  fugal adj. [latin fuga flight]

Dietetic  adj. Of diet and nutrition. [greek: related to *diet1]

Spiritualism  n. Belief in, and supposed practice of, communication with the dead, esp. Through mediums.  spiritualist n. Spiritualistic adj.

Burette  n. (us buret) graduated glass tube with an end-tap for measuring liquid in chemical analysis. [french]

Shelve  v. (-ving) 1 put aside, esp. Temporarily. 2 put (books etc.) On a shelf. 3 fit with shelves. 4 (of ground etc.) Slope.  shelving n.

Zoo  n. Zoological garden. [abbreviation]

Telephonist  n. Operator in a telephone exchange or at a switchboard.

Mummify  v. (-ies, -ied) preserve (a body) as a mummy.  mummification n.

Wicket  n. 1 cricket a three stumps with the bails in position defended by a batsman. B ground between two wickets. C state of this. D instance of a batsman being got out (bowler has taken four wickets). 2 (in full wicket-door or -gate) small door or gate, esp. Beside or in a larger one or closing the lower part only of a doorway. [anglo-french wiket = french guichet]

Deface  v. (-cing) disfigure.  defacement n. [french: related to *face]

Heather  n. Any of various shrubs growing esp. On moors and heaths. [origin unknown]

Tantalum  n. Rare hard white metallic element.  tantalic adj. [related to *tantalize]

Ravioli  n. Small pasta envelopes containing minced meat etc. [italian]

Issue  —n. 1 a act of giving out or circulating shares, notes, stamps, etc. B quantity of coins, copies of a newspaper, etc., circulated at one time. C each of a regular series of a magazine etc. (the may issue). 2 a outgoing, outflow. B way out, outlet, esp. The place of the emergence of a stream etc. 3 point in question; important subject of debate or litigation. 4 result; outcome. 5 law children, progeny (without male issue). —v. (issues, issued, issuing) 1 literary go or come out. 2 a send forth; publish; put into circulation. B supply, esp. Officially or authoritatively (foll. By to, with: issued passports to them; issued them with passports). 3 a (often foll. By from) be derived or result. B (foll. By in) end, result. 4 (foll. By from) emerge from a condition.  at issue under discussion; in dispute. Join (or take) issue (foll. By with a person etc., about, on, over a subject) disagree or argue. [latin exitus: related to *exit]

Crayon  —n. Stick or pencil of coloured chalk, wax, etc. —v. Draw with crayons. [french craie chalk]

Captious  adj. Fault-finding. [latin: related to *caption]

Abyss  n. 1 deep chasm. 2 immeasurable depth (abyss of despair). [latin from greek, = bottomless]

Packer  n. Person or thing that packs, esp. A dealer who prepares and packs food.

Overestimate  —v. (-ting) form too high an estimate of. —n. Too high an estimate.  overestimation n.

Redeem  v. 1 recover by expenditure of effort or by a stipulated payment. 2 make a single payment to cancel (a regular charge or obligation). 3 convert (tokens or bonds etc.) Into goods or cash. 4 deliver from sin and damnation. 5 make up for; be a compensating factor in (has one redeeming feature). 6 (foll. By from) save from (a defect). 7 refl. Save (oneself) from blame. 8 purchase the freedom of (a person). 9 save (a person's life) by ransom. 10 save or rescue or reclaim. 11 fulfil (a promise).  redeemable adj. [latin emo buy]

Parson  n. 1 rector. 2 vicar; clergyman. [latin: related to *person]

Stocking  n. 1 long knitted covering for the leg and foot, of nylon, wool, silk, etc. 2 differently-coloured lower leg of a horse etc.  in one's stocking (or stockinged) feet without shoes. [from *stock]

Accept  v. 1 (also absol.) Willingly receive (a thing offered). 2 (also absol.) Answer affirmatively (an offer etc.). 3 regard favourably; treat as welcome (felt accepted). 4 believe, receive (an opinion, explanation, etc.) As adequate or valid. 5 take as suitable (does accept cheques). 6 undertake (an office or duty). [latin capio take]

Coffer  n. 1 large strong box for valuables. 2 (in pl.) Treasury, funds. 3 sunken panel in a ceiling etc. [latin cophinus basket]

Carol  —n. Joyous song, esp. A christmas hymn. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 sing carols. 2 sing joyfully. [french]

Unchecked  adj. 1 not checked. 2 unrestrained (unchecked violence).

Egghead  n. Colloq. Intellectual; expert.

Kennel  —n. 1 small shelter for a dog. 2 (in pl.) Breeding or boarding place for dogs. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) put into or keep in a kennel. [french chenil from latin canis dog]

Transmogrify  v. (-ies, -ied) joc. Transform, esp. In a magical or surprising manner.  transmogrification n. [origin unknown]

Carpet  —n. 1 a thick fabric for covering floor or stairs. B piece of this. 2 thing resembling this etc. (carpet of snow). —v. (-t-) 1 cover with or as with carpet. 2 colloq. Reprimand.  on the carpet colloq. 1 being reprimanded. 2 under consideration. Sweep under the carpet conceal (a problem or difficulty). [latin carpo pluck]

Mouth  —n. (pl. Mouths) 1 a external opening in the head, through which most animals take in food and emit communicative sounds. B (in humans and some animals) cavity behind it containing the means of biting and chewing and the vocal organs. 2 opening of a container, cave, trumpet, etc. 3 place where a river enters the sea. 4 an individual as needing sustenance (an extra mouth to feed). 5 colloq. A meaningless or ineffectual talk. B impudent talk; cheek. —v. (-thing) 1 say or speak by moving the lips but with no sound. 2 utter or speak insincerely or without understanding (mouthing platitudes).  put words into a person's mouth represent a person as having said something. Take the words out of a person's mouth say what another was about to say. [old english]

Correction  n. 1 correcting or being corrected. 2 thing substituted for what is wrong. 3 archaic punishment.  correctional adj. [latin: related to *correct]

Easygoing  adj. Placid and tolerant.

Timorous  adj. 1 timid. 2 frightened.  timorously adv. [medieval latin: related to *timid]

Lien  n. Law right to hold another's property until a debt on it is paid. [latin ligo bind]

Sung  past part. Of *sing.

Fulcrum  n. (pl. -s or -cra) point on which a lever is supported. [latin fulcio to prop]

Tempura  n. Japanese dish of fish, shellfish, etc., fried in batter. [japanese]

Grist  n. Corn to grind.  grist to the (or a person's) mill source of profit or advantage. [old english: related to *grind]

Layette  n. Set of clothing etc. For a newborn child. [french from dutch]

Unreason  n. Madness; chaos; disorder.

Cervix  n. (pl. Cervices) 1 necklike structure, esp. The neck of the womb. 2 the neck. [latin]

Dioxide  n. Oxide containing two atoms of oxygen in the molecule.

Menswear  n. Clothes for men.

Internee  n. Person interned.

What  —interrog. Adj. 1 asking for a choice from an indefinite number or for a statement of amount, number, or kind (what books have you read?). 2 colloq. = *which interrog.adj. (what book have you chosen?). —adj. (usu. In an exclamation) how great or remarkable (what luck!). —rel. Adj. The or any … that (will give you what help i can). —pron. (corresponding to the functions of the adj.) 1 what thing or things? (what is your name?; i don't know what you mean). 2 (asking for a remark to be repeated) = what did you say? 3 how much (what you must have suffered!). 4 (as rel. Pron.) That or those which; a or the or any thing which (what followed was worse; tell me what you think). —adv. To what extent (what does it matter?).  what about what is the news or your opinion of. What-d'you-call-it colloq. Substitute for a name not recalled. What ever what at all or in any way (what ever do you mean?) (see also *whatever). What for colloq. 1 for what reason? 2 severe reprimand (esp. Give a person what for). What have you (prec. By or or and) colloq. Anything else similar. What not (prec. By and) other similar things. What's-his (or -her or -its) -name colloq. Substitute for a name not recalled. What's what colloq. What is useful or important etc. What with colloq. Because of (usu. Several things). [old english]

Pyrrhic  adj. (of a victory) won at too great a cost. [pyrrhus of epirus, who defeated the romans in 279 bc, but suffered heavy losses]

Calx  n. (pl. Calces) powdery substance formed when an ore or mineral has been heated. [latin calx calc- lime]

Campanula  n. Plant with bell-shaped usu. Blue, purple, or white flowers. [diminutive: related to *campanology]

Fissure  —n. Crack or split, usu. Long and narrow. —v. (-ring) split, crack. [latin findo fiss- cleave]

Adopt  v. 1 legally take (a person) into a relationship, esp. Another's child as one's own. 2 choose (a course of action etc.). 3 take over (another's idea etc.). 4 choose as a candidate for office. 5 accept responsibility for the maintenance of (a road etc.). 6 accept or approve (a report, accounts, etc.).  adoption n. [latin: related to *ad-, *opt]

Tissue  n. 1 any of the coherent collections of specialized cells of which animals or plants are made (muscular tissue). 2 = *tissue-paper. 3 disposable piece of thin soft absorbent paper for wiping, drying, etc. 4 fine woven esp. Gauzy fabric. 5 (foll. By of) connected series (tissue of lies). [french tissu woven cloth]

Doh  abbr. Department of health.

Mover  n. 1 person, animal, or thing that moves or dances, esp. In a specified way. 2 person who moves a proposition. 3 (also prime mover) originator.

Indelible  adj. That cannot be rubbed out or removed.  indelibly adv. [latin deleo efface]

Coronary  —adj. Anat. Resembling or encircling like a crown. —n. (pl. -ies) = *coronary thrombosis. [latin: related to *corona]

Aldehyde  n. Chem. Any of a class of compounds formed by the oxidation of alcohols. [from *alcohol, *de-, *hydrogen]

Outstation  n. Remote branch or outpost.

Varnish  —n. 1  resinous solution used to give a hard shiny transparent coating. 2 similar preparation (nail varnish). 3 deceptive outward appearance or show. —v. 1 apply varnish to. 2 give a deceptively attractive appearance to. [french vernis, probably ultimately from berenice in cyrenaica]

Maternal  adj. 1 of or like a mother; motherly. 2 related through the mother (maternal uncle). 3 of the mother in pregnancy and childbirth.  maternally adv. [latin mater mother]

Missionary  —adj. Of or concerned with religious missions. —n. (pl. -ies) person doing missionary work. [latin: related to *mission]

Bohemian  —n. 1 native of bohemia, a czech. 2 (also bohemian) socially unconventional person, esp. An artist or writer. —adj. 1 of bohemia or its people. 2 (also bohemian) socially unconventional.  bohemianism n. [bohemia, part of czechoslovakia]

Combo  n. (pl. -s) slang small jazz or dance band. [abbreviation of *combination]

Grampus  n. (pl. -puses) a kind of dolphin with a blunt snout. [latin crassus piscis fat fish]

Rouse  v. (-sing) 1 (cause to) wake. 2 (often foll. By up, often refl.) Stir up, make or become active or excited (was roused to protest). 3 anger (terrible when roused). 4 evoke (feelings). [origin unknown]

Outbalance  v. (-cing) outweigh.

Trireme  n. Ancient greek warship, with three files of oarsmen on each side. [latin remus oar]

Merciful  adj. Showing mercy.  mercifulness n.

Foreshorten  v. Show or portray (an object) with the apparent shortening due to visual perspective.

Sputnik  n. Russian artificial satellite orbiting the earth. [russian]

Route  —n. Way or course taken (esp. Regularly) from one place to another. —v. (-teing) send, forward, or direct by a particular route. [french route road, from latin rupta (via)]

Fondle  v. (-ling) caress. [related to *fond]

Bothersome  adj. Causing bother.

Dismiss  v. 1 send away, esp. From one's presence; disperse. 2 terminate the employment of, esp. Dishonourably; sack. 3 put from one's mind or emotions. 4 consider not worth talking or thinking about; treat summarily. 5 law refuse further hearing to (a case). 6 cricket put (a batsman or side) out (usu. For a stated score).  dismissal n. [latin mitto miss- send]

Neighbourhood  n. (us neighborhood) 1 district; vicinity. 2 people of a district.  in the neighbourhood of roughly; about.

Undeclared  adj. Not declared.

Arrowroot  n. 1 nutritious starch. 2 plant yielding this.

Fiery  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 consisting of or flaming with fire. 2 bright red. 3 hot; burning. 4 a flashing, ardent (fiery eyes). B pugnacious; spirited (fiery temper).  fierily adv. Fieriness n.

Fragrant  adj. Sweet-smelling.

Loganberry  n. (pl. -ies) dark red fruit, hybrid of a blackberry and a raspberry. [logan, name of a horticulturalist]

Pyrethrum  n. 1 aromatic chrysanthemum. 2 insecticide from its dried flowers. [latin from greek]

Ferrel  var. Of *ferrule.

Calomel  n. Compound of mercury used as a cathartic. [greek kalos beautiful, melas black]

Fiddler  n. 1 fiddle-player. 2 slang swindler, cheat. 3 small n. American crab.

Crud  n. Slang 1 deposit of grease etc. 2 unpleasant person.  cruddy adj. (-ier, -iest). [var. Of *curd]

Harsh  adj. 1 unpleasantly rough or sharp, esp. To the senses. 2 severe, cruel.  harshen v. Harshly adv. Harshness n. [low german]

Chuckle  —v. (-ling) laugh quietly or inwardly. —n. Quiet or suppressed laugh. [chuck cluck]

Exemplar  n. 1 model. 2 typical or parallel instance. [latin: related to *example]

Learn  v. (past and past part. Learned or learnt) 1 gain knowledge of or skill in. 2 commit to memory. 3 (foll. By of) be told about. 4 (foll. By that, how, etc.) Become aware of. 5 receive instruction. 6 archaic or dial. Teach. [old english]

Wham  int. Colloq. Expressing forcible impact. [imitative]

Milfoil  n. Common yarrow with small white flowers. [latin: related to *mile, *foil2]

Barcarole  n. 1 gondoliers' song. 2 music imitating this. [italian barca boat]

Rarity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 rareness. 2 uncommon thing. [latin: related to *rare1]

Nightclub  n. Club providing refreshment and entertainment late at night.

Tetrameter  n. Prosody verse of four measures.

Teleprompter  n. Device beside a television or cinema camera that slowly unrolls a speaker's script out of sight of the audience.

Outface  v. (-cing) disconcert by staring or by a display of confidence.

Tantalus  n. Stand in which spirit-decanters may be locked up but visible. [see *tantalize]

Govern  v. 1 rule or control with authority; conduct the policy and affairs of. 2 influence or determine (a person or course of action). 3 be a standard or principle for. 4 check or control (esp. Passions). 5 gram. (esp. Of a verb or preposition) have (a noun or pronoun or its case) depending on it. [greek kubernao steer]

Climax  —n. 1 event or point of greatest intensity or interest; culmination. 2 orgasm. —v. Colloq. Reach or bring to a climax.  climactic adj. [greek, = ladder]

Proclaim  v. 1 (often foll. By that) announce or declare publicly or officially. 2 declare to be (king, a traitor, etc.). proclamation n. [latin: related to *claim]

Dicky  —n. (pl. -ies) colloq. False shirt-front. —adj. (-ier, -iest) slang unsound; unhealthy. [dicky, pet form of richard]

Squad  n. 1 small group sharing a task etc., esp. Of soldiers or policemen (drug squad). 2 sport team. [french escouade]

-decker  comb. Form having a specified number of decks or layers (double-decker).

Dog  —n. 1 four-legged flesh-eating animal akin to the fox and wolf, and of many breeds. 2 male of this, or of the fox or wolf. 3 colloq. A despicable person. B person of a specified kind (lucky dog). 4 mechanical device for gripping. 5 (in pl.; prec. By the) colloq. Greyhound-racing. —v. (-gg-) follow closely; pursue, track.  go to the dogs slang deteriorate, be ruined. Like a dog's dinner colloq. Smartly or flashily (dressed etc.). Not a dog's chance no chance at all. [old english]

Holocaust  n. 1 large-scale destruction, esp. By fire or nuclear war. 2 (the holocaust) mass murder of the jews by the nazis 1939–45. [greek holos whole, kaustos burnt]

Fabulous  adj. 1 incredible. 2 colloq. Marvellous. 3 legendary.  fabulously adv. [latin: related to *fable]

Parallel  —adj. 1 a (of lines or planes) continuously side by side and equidistant. B (foll. By to, with) (of a line or plane) having this relation (to or with another). 2 (of circumstances etc.) Precisely similar, analogous, or corresponding. 3 a (of processes etc.) Occurring or performed simultaneously. B computing involving the simultaneous performance of operations. —n. 1 person or thing precisely analogous to another. 2 comparison (drew a parallel between them). 3 (in full parallel of latitude) a each of the imaginary parallel circles of constant latitude on the earth's surface. B corresponding line on a map (49th parallel). 4 printing two parallel lines (||) as a reference mark. —v. (-l-) 1 be parallel, or correspond, to. 2 represent as similar; compare. 3 cite as a parallel instance.  in parallel (of electric circuits) arranged so as to join at common points at each end.  parallelism n. [greek, = alongside one another]

Sicken  v. 1 affect with disgust etc. 2 a (often foll. By for) show symptoms of illness. B (often foll. By at, or to + infin.) Feel nausea or disgust. 3 (as sickening adj.) A disgusting. B colloq. Very annoying.  sickeningly adv.

Vegetarian  —n. Person who does not eat meat or fish. —adj. Excluding animal food, esp. Meat (vegetarian diet).  vegetarianism n. [from *vegetable]

Planter  n. 1 manager or owner of a plantation. 2 container for house-plants.

Hairstyle  n. Particular way of arranging the hair.  hairstylist n.

Mantra  n. 1 hindu or buddhist devotional incantation. 2 vedic hymn. [sanskrit, = instrument of thought]

Pinch  —v. 1 a squeeze tightly, esp. Between finger and thumb. B (often absol.) (of a shoe etc.) Constrict painfully. 2 (of cold, hunger, etc.) Affect painfully. 3  slang a steal. B arrest. 4 (as pinched adj.) (of the features) drawn. 5 a (usu. Foll. By in, of, for, etc.) Stint. B be niggardly. 6 (usu. Foll. By out, back, down) remove (leaves, buds, etc.) To encourage bushy growth. —n. 1 act of pinching. 2 amount that can be taken up with fingers and thumb (pinch of snuff). 3 the stress caused by poverty etc.  at (or in) a pinch in an emergency. [french pincer]

Covert  —adj. Secret or disguised (covert glance). —n. 1 shelter, esp. A thicket hiding game. 2 feather covering the base of a bird's flight-feather.  covertly adv. [french: related to *cover]

Serif  n. Slight projection at the extremities of a printed letter (cf. *sanserif). [origin uncertain]

Quaver  —v. 1 (esp. Of a voice or sound) vibrate, shake, tremble. 2 sing or say with a quavering voice. —n. 1 mus. Note half as long as a crotchet. 2 trill in singing. 3 tremble in speech.  quavery adj. [probably imitative]

Condole  v. (-ling) (foll. By with) express sympathy with (a person) over a loss etc. [latin condoleo grieve with another]

Usage  condole is often confused with console1.

Funky  adj. (-ier, -iest) slang (esp. Of jazz or rock music) earthy, bluesy, with a heavy rhythm.

Nobility  n. (pl. -ies) 1 nobleness of character, mind, birth, or rank. 2 class of nobles, highest social class.

Antiphon  n. 1 hymn sung alternately by two groups. 2 versicle or phrase from this.  antiphonal adj. [greek phone sound]

Liqueur  n. Any of several strong sweet alcoholic spirits. [french]

Assortment  n. Diverse group or mixture.

Tumbrel  n. (also tumbril) hist. Open cart in which condemned persons were taken to the guillotine in the french revolution. [french tomber fall]

Stagger  —v. 1 (cause to) walk unsteadily. 2 shock, confuse. 3 arrange (events etc.) So that they do not coincide. 4 arrange (objects) so that they are not in line. —n. 1 tottering movement. 2 (in pl.) Disease, esp. Of horses and cattle, causing staggering. [old norse]

Descriptive  adj. Describing, esp. Vividly. [latin: related to *describe]

Numerate  adj. Acquainted with the basic principles of mathematics.  numeracy n. [latin numerus number, after literate]

Haze  n. 1 thin atmospheric vapour. 2 mental obscurity or confusion. [back-formation from *hazy]

Adjacent  adj. (often foll. By to) lying near; adjoining.  adjacency n. [latin jaceo lie]

Out  —adv. 1 away from or not in or at a place etc. (keep him out; get out; tide is out). 2 indicating: a dispersal away from a centre etc. (share out). B coming or bringing into the open (call out; will look it out for you). C need for attentiveness (watch out; listen out). 3 not in one's house, office, etc. (tell them i'm out). 4 to or at an end; completely (tired out; die out; fight it out; my luck was out; typed it out). 5 (of a fire, candle, etc.) Not burning. 6 in error (was 3% out). 7 colloq. Unconscious (is out cold). 8 (of a limb etc.) Dislocated (put his arm out). 9 (of a political party etc.) Not in office. 10 (of a jury) considering its verdict. 11 (of workers) on strike. 12 (of a secret) revealed. 13 (of a flower) open. 14 (of a book, record, etc.) Published, on sale. 15 (of a star) visible after dark. 16 no longer in fashion (turn-ups are out). 17 (of a batsman etc.) Dismissed from batting. 18 not worth considering (that idea is out). 19 (prec. By superl.) Colloq. Known to exist (the best game out). 20 (of a mark etc.) Removed (washed the stain out). —prep. Out of (looked out the window). —n. Way of escape. —v. Come or go out; emerge (murder will out).  out for intent on, determined to get. Out of 1 from within. 2 not within. 3 from among. 4 beyond the range of (out of reach). 5 so as to be without, lacking (was swindled out of his money; out of sugar). 6 from (get money out of him). 7 because of (asked out of curiosity). 8 by the use of (what did you make it out of?). Out of bounds see *bound2. Out of date see *date1. Out of order see *order. Out of pocket see *pocket. Out of the question see *question. Out of sorts see *sort. Out of this world see *world. Out of the way see *way. Out to determined to. [old english]

Usage  the use of out as a preposition, e.g. He walked out the room, is non-standard. Out of should be used.

Exert  v. 1 bring to bear, use (a quality, force, influence, etc.). 2 refl. (often foll. By for, or to + infin.) Use one's efforts or endeavours; strive.  exertion n. [latin exsero exsert- put forth]

Asp  n. Small venomous snake of north africa or southern europe. [greek aspis]

Antitetanus  adj. Effective against tetanus.

Wrongdoer  n. Person who behaves immorally or illegally.  wrongdoing n.

Fed  past and past part. Of *feed.  fed up (often foll. By with) discontented or bored.

Grenade  n. Small bomb thrown by hand (hand-grenade) or shot from a rifle. [french: related to *pomegranate]

Nutcase  n. Slang crazy person.

Hurt  —v. (past and past part. Hurt) 1 (also absol.) Cause pain or injury to. 2 cause mental pain or distress to. 3 suffer pain (my arm hurts). —n. 1 injury. 2 harm, wrong. [french hurter knock]

Restrict  v. 1 confine, limit. 2 withhold from general circulation or disclosure.  restriction n. [latin: related to *restrain]

Tabu  var. Of *taboo.

Interval  n. 1 intervening time or space. 2 pause or break, esp. Between the parts of a performance. 3 difference in pitch between two sounds.  at intervals here and there; now and then. [latin intervallum space between ramparts]

Blacking  n. Black polish, esp. For shoes.

Detestable  adj. Intensely disliked; hateful.

Contraflow  n. Transfer of traffic from its usual half of the road to the other half by borrowing one or more of the other half's lanes.

Noh  n. (also no) traditional japanese drama. [japanese]

Marrow  n. 1 large fleshy usu. Striped gourd eaten as a vegetable. 2 soft fatty substance in the cavities of bones. 3 essential part.  to the marrow right through. [old english]

Kir  n. Dry white wine with crème de cassis.

Bootleg  —adj. (esp. Of alcohol) smuggled, illicit. —v. (-gg-) illicitly make or deal in (alcohol etc.).  bootlegger n.

Impenetrable  adj. 1 not able to be penetrated. 2 inscrutable. 3 inaccessible to ideas, influences, etc.  impenetrability n. Impenetrableness n. Impenetrably adv.

Allied  adj. 1 (also allied) associated in an alliance. 2 connected or related.

Daredevil  —n. Recklessly daring person. —adj. Recklessly daring.  daredevilry n.

Sweep  —v. (past and past part. Swept) 1 clean or clear (a room or area etc.) (as) with a broom. 2 (often foll. By up) clean a room etc. In this way. 3 (often foll. By up) collect or remove (dirt etc.) By sweeping. 4 (foll. By aside, away, etc.) A push (as) with a broom. B dismiss abruptly. 5 (foll. By along, down, etc.) Carry or drive along with force. 6 (foll. By off, away, etc.) Remove or clear forcefully. 7 traverse swiftly or lightly. 8 impart a sweeping motion to. 9 swiftly cover or affect. 10 a glide swiftly; speed along. B go majestically. 11 (of landscape etc.) Be rolling or spacious. —n. 1 act or motion of sweeping. 2 curve in the road, sweeping line of a hill, etc. 3 range or scope. 4 = *chimney-sweep. 5 sortie by aircraft. 6 colloq. = *sweepstake.  make a clean sweep of 1 completely abolish or expel. 2 win all the prizes etc. In (a competition etc.). Sweep away abolish swiftly. Sweep the board 1 win all the money at stake. 2 win all possible prizes etc. Sweep under the carpet see *carpet. [old english]

Lardy  adj. Like lard.

Crenelate  v. (brit. Crenellate) (-ting) provide (a tower etc.) With battlements.  crenellation n. [french crenel embrasure]

Amphitheatre  n. Esp. Circular unroofed building with tiers of seats surrounding a central space. [greek amphi- round]

Corsage  n. Small bouquet worn by women. [french: related to *corpse]

Furnace  n. 1 enclosed structure for intense heating by fire, esp. Of metals or water. 2 very hot place. [latin fornax from fornus oven]

Asphyxia  n. Lack of oxygen in the blood, causing unconsciousness or death; suffocation.  asphyxiant adj. & n. [greek a- not, sphuxis pulse]

Inclusive  adj. 1 (often foll. By of) including. 2 including the limits stated (pages 7 to 26 inclusive). 3 including all or much (inclusive terms).  inclusively adv. Inclusiveness n.

Involution  n. 1 involving. 2 intricacy. 3 curling inwards. 4 part that curls inwards.

Overfill  v. Fill to excess or to overflowing.

Imam  n. 1 leader of prayers in a mosque. 2 title of various muslim leaders. [arabic]

Phosphorescence  n. 1 radiation similar to fluorescence but detectable after excitation ceases. 2 emission of light without combustion or perceptible heat.  phosphoresce v. (-cing). Phosphorescent adj.

Bitumen  n. Tarlike mixture of hydrocarbons derived from petroleum. [latin]

Restraint  n. 1 restraining or being restrained. 2 restraining agency or influence. 3 moderation; self-control. 4 reserve of manner. 5 confinement, esp. Because of insanity.

Strafe  v. (-fing) bombard; attack with gunfire. [german, = punish]

Curare  n. Extract of various plants, used by american indians to poison arrows. [carib]

Toward  prep. = *towards.

Witless  adj. Foolish, crazy. [old english: related to *wit]

Rosebowl  n. Bowl for cut roses, esp. As a prize in a competition.

Inquisitive  adj. 1 unduly curious; prying. 2 seeking knowledge.  inquisitively adv. Inquisitiveness n.

Prey  —n. 1 animal that is hunted or killed by another for food. 2 (often foll. By to) person or thing that is influenced by or vulnerable to (something undesirable) (prey to morbid fears). —v. (foll. By on, upon) 1 seek or take as prey. 2 (of a disease, emotion, etc.) Exert a harmful influence (it preyed on his mind). [latin praeda]

Doyen  n. (fem. Doyenne) senior member of a group. [french: related to *dean1]

Archdeacon  n. Church dignitary next below a bishop.  archdeaconry n. (pl. -ies).

Stoker  n. Person who tends a furnace, esp. On a steamship. [dutch]

Unsteady  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 not steady or firm. 2 changeable. 3 not uniform or regular.  unsteadily adv. Unsteadiness n.

Buzzer  n. Electrical buzzing device as a signal.

Shopkeeper  n. Owner or manager of a shop.

Sesame  n. 1 e. Indian plant with oil-yielding seeds. 2 its seeds.  open sesame magic phrase for opening a locked door or gaining access. [greek]

Decameter  n. (brit. -metre) metric unit of length, equal to 10 metres.

Decanter  n. Stoppered glass container for decanted wine or spirit.

Enrage  v. (-ging) make furious. [french: related to *en-1]

Byte  n. Computing group of eight binary digits, often representing one character. [origin uncertain]

Loin  n. 1 (in pl.) Side and back of the body between the ribs and the hip-bones. 2 joint of meat from this part of an animal. [french loigne from latin lumbus]

Microbiology  n. The study of micro-organisms.  microbiologist n.

Disputatious  adj. Argumentative.

Palpable  adj. 1 able to be touched or felt. 2 readily perceived.  palpably adv. [latin palpo caress]

Feel  —v. (past and past part. Felt) 1 a examine or search by touch. B (absol.) Have the sensation of touch (unable to feel). 2 perceive or ascertain by touch (feel the warmth). 3 experience, exhibit, or be affected by (an emotion, conviction, etc.) (felt strongly about it; felt the rebuke). 4 (foll. By that) have an impression (i feel that i am right). 5 consider, think (i feel it useful). 6 seem (air feels chilly). 7 be consciously; consider oneself (i feel happy). 8 (foll. By for, with) have sympathy or pity. 9 (often foll. By up) slang fondle sexually. —n. 1 feeling; testing by touch. 2 sensation characterizing a material, situation, etc. 3 sense of touch.  feel like have a wish or inclination for. Feel up to be ready to face or deal with. Feel one's way proceed cautiously. Get the feel of become accustomed to using. [old english]

Tomorrow  —adv. 1 on the day after today. 2 at some future time. —n. 1 the day after today. 2 the near future. [from *to, *morrow]

Gust  —n. 1 sudden strong rush of wind. 2 burst of rain, smoke, emotion, etc. —v. Blow in gusts.  gusty adj. (-ier, -iest). [old norse]

Incursion  n. Invasion or attack, esp. Sudden or brief.  incursive adj. [latin: related to *incur]

Stodgy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 (of food) heavy and glutinous. 2 dull and uninteresting.  stodgily adv. Stodginess n.

Excite  v. (-ting) 1 a rouse the emotions of (a person). B arouse (feelings etc.). C arouse sexually. 2 provoke (an action etc.). 3 stimulate (an organism, tissue, etc.) To activity. [latin cieo stir up]

Wriggle  —v. (-ling) 1 (of a worm etc.) Twist or turn its body with short writhing movements. 2 make wriggling motions. 3 (foll. By along, through, etc.) Go thus (wriggled through the gap). 4 be evasive. —n. Act of wriggling.  wriggle out of colloq. Avoid on a pretext.  wriggly adj. [low german wriggelen]

Fixative  —adj. Tending to fix or secure. —n. Fixative substance.

Linguist  n. Person skilled in languages or linguistics.

Underpart  n. Lower or subordinate part.

Playgroup  n. Organized regular meeting of preschool children for supervised play.

Lingerie  n. Women's underwear and nightclothes. [french linge linen]

Coed  colloq. —n. 1 school for both sexes. 2 esp. Us female pupil of a coed school. —adj. Coeducational. [abbreviation]

Surreptitious  adj. Done by stealth; clandestine.  surreptitiously adv. [latin surripio seize secretly]

Venal  adj. Corrupt; able to be bribed; involving bribery.  venality n. Venally adv. [latin venum thing for sale]

Usage  venal is sometimes confused with venial, which means ‘pardonable’.

Unwound  past and past part. Of *unwind.

Marvelous  adj. (brit. Marvellous) 1 astonishing. 2 excellent.  marvellously adv. [french: related to *marvel]

Loaded  adj. 1 slang a rich. B drunk. C us drugged. 2 (of dice etc.) Weighted. 3 (of a question or statement) carrying some hidden implication.

Weapon  n. 1 thing designed, used, or usable for inflicting bodily harm. 2 means for gaining the advantage in a conflict. [old english]

Turban  n. 1 man's headdress of fabric wound round a cap or the head, worn esp. By muslims and sikhs. 2 woman's hat resembling this.  turbaned adj. [persian: cf. *tulip]

Understood  past and past part. Of *understand.

Immerse  v. (-sing) 1 a (often foll. By in) dip, plunge. B submerge (a person). 2 (often refl. Or in passive; often foll. By in) absorb or involve deeply. 3 (often foll. By in) bury, embed. [latin mergo mers- dip]

Licence  n. (us license) 1 official permit to own or use something, do something, or carry on a trade. 2 permission. 3 liberty of action, esp. When excessive. 4 writer's or artist's deliberate deviation from fact, correct grammar, etc. (poetic licence). [latin licet it is allowed]

Torrid  adj. 1 a (of the weather) very hot and dry. B (of land etc.) Parched by such weather. 2 passionate, intense. [latin torreo tost- parch]

Touch  —v. 1 come into or be in physical contact with (a thing, each other, etc.). 2 (often foll. By with) bring the hand etc. Into contact with. 3 bring (two things) into mutual contact. 4 rouse tender or painful feelings in. 5 strike lightly. 6 (usu. With neg.) A disturb, harm, or affect. B have any dealings with. C consume, use (i don't touch alcohol). 7 concern. 8 a reach as far as, esp. Momentarily. B (usu. With neg.) Approach in excellence etc. (can't touch him for style). 9 modify (pity touched with fear). 10 (as touched adj.) Colloq. Slightly mad. 11 (usu. Foll.

Unskilful  adj. (us unskillful) not skilful.

Television  n. 1 system for reproducing on a screen visual images transmitted (usu. With sound) by radio signals or cable. 2 (in full television set) device with a screen for receiving these signals. 3 television broadcasting.  televisual adj.

Bats  predic. Adj. Slang crazy. [originally pl. Of *bat2]

Magma  n. (pl. -s) molten rock under the earth's crust, from which igneous rock is formed by cooling. [greek masso knead]

Porcelain  n. 1 hard fine translucent ceramic with a transparent glaze. 2 objects made of this. [italian diminutive of porca sow]

Punitive  adj. 1 inflicting or intended to inflict punishment. 2 (of taxation etc.) Extremely severe. [french or medieval latin: related to *punish]

Microwave  —n. 1 electromagnetic wave with a wavelength in the range 0.001–0.3m. 2 (in full microwave oven) oven using microwaves to cook or heat food quickly. —v. (-ving) cook in a microwave oven.

Fathom  —n. (pl. Often fathom when prec. By a number) measure of six feet, esp. In depth soundings. —v. 1 comprehend. 2 measure the depth of (water).  fathomable adj. [old english]

Redbrick  adj. (of a university) founded in the 19th or early 20th c.

Chatty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 fond of chatting. 2 resembling chat.  chattily adv. Chattiness n.

Cosmology  n. Science or theory of the universe.  cosmological adj. Cosmologist n. [from *cosmos, *-logy]

Chenille  n. 1 tufty velvety cord or yarn. 2 fabric of this. [french, = caterpillar, from latin canicula little dog]

Nine  adj. & n. 1 one more than eight. 2 symbol for this (9, ix, ix). 3 size etc. Denoted by nine. [old english]

Pleasure  n. 1 feeling of satisfaction or joy. 2 enjoyment. 3 source of pleasure or gratification. 4 one's will or desire (what is your pleasure?). 5 sensual gratification. 6 (attrib.) Done or used for pleasure. [french: related to *please]

Victor  n. Winner in a battle or contest. [latin vinco vict- conquer]

Djellaba  n. (also jellaba) loose hooded cloak (as) worn by arab men. [arabic]

Dewlap  n. Loose fold of skin hanging from the throat of cattle, dogs, etc. [from *dew, *lap1]

Cinderella  n. Person or thing of unrecognized or disregarded merit or beauty. [name of a girl in a fairy tale]

Guava  n. 1 edible pale orange fruit with pink flesh. 2 tree bearing this. [spanish]

Impassioned  adj. Filled with passion; ardent. [italian impassionato: related to *passion]

Impotent  adj. 1 powerless, ineffective. 2 (of a male) unable to achieve an erection or orgasm.  impotence n.

Prep  n. Colloq. 1 homework, esp. In boarding-schools. 2 period when this is done. [abbreviation of *preparation]

Track  —n. 1 a mark(s) left by a person, animal, vehicle, etc. B (in pl.) Such marks, esp. Footprints. 2 rough path, esp. One beaten by use. 3 continuous railway line. 4 a racecourse; circuit. B prepared course for runners etc. 5 a groove on a gramophone record. B section of a record, cd, or magnetic tape containing one song etc. C lengthwise strip of magnetic tape containing a single sequence of signals. 6 line of travel (track of the comet). 7 band round the wheels of a tank etc. 8 line of thought or action. —v. 1 follow the track of. 2 trace (a course, development, etc.) By vestiges. 3 (often foll. By back, in, etc.) (of a film or television camera) move in relation to the subject being filmed.  in one's tracks colloq. Where one stands, instantly (stopped him in his tracks). Keep (or lose) track of follow (or fail to follow) the course of. Make tracks colloq. Depart. Make tracks for colloq. Go in pursuit of or towards. Off the track away from the subject. Track down reach or capture by tracking.  tracker n. [french trac]

Pitchfork  —n. Long-handled two-pronged fork for pitching hay etc. —v. 1 throw with or as if with a pitchfork. 2 (usu. Foll. By into) thrust (a person) forcibly into a position, office, etc.

Sirup  n. (brit. Syrup) 1 a sweet sauce of sugar dissolved in boiling water. B similar fluid as a drink, medicine, etc. 2 condensed sugar-cane juice; molasses, treacle. 3 excessive sweetness of manner or style.  syrupy adj. [arabic sharab]

Loth  var. Of *loath.

Trans-  prefix 1 across, beyond. 2 on or to the other side of. 3 through. [latin]

Difficulty  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being difficult. 2 a difficult thing; problem, hindrance. B (often in pl.) Distress, esp. Financial (in difficulties). [latin difficultas: related to *faculty]

Threaten  v. 1 make a threat or threats against. 2 be a sign of (something undesirable). 3 (foll. By to + infin.) Announce one's intention to do an undesirable thing. 4 (also absol.) Warn of the infliction of (harm etc.).

Wordplay  n. Witty use of words, esp. Punning.

Stonewashed  adj. (esp. Of denim) washed with abrasives to give a worn or faded look.

Unloved  adj. Not loved.

Ignorant  adj. 1 (often foll. By of, in) lacking knowledge (esp. Of a fact or subject). 2 colloq. Uncouth.  ignorantly adv.

Multinational  —adj. 1 operating in several countries. 2 of several nationalities. —n. Multinational company.

Gms  abbr. Grant maintained status.

Fumble  —v. (-ling) 1 use the hands awkwardly, grope about. 2 handle clumsily or nervously (fumbled the ball). —n. Act of fumbling. [low german fummeln]

Cocksure  adj. Arrogantly confident. [from *cock1]

Humour  (us humor) —n. 1 a quality of being amusing or comic. B the expression of humour in literature, speech, etc. 2 (in full sense of humour) ability to perceive or express humour. 3 state of mind; inclination (bad humour). 4 (in full cardinal humour) hist. Each of the four fluids (blood, phlegm, choler, melancholy), thought to determine a person's physical and mental qualities. —v. Gratify or indulge (a person or taste etc.).  out of humour displeased.  humourless adj. [latin humor moisture]

Timeless  adj. Not affected by the passage of time.  timelessly adv. Timelessness n.

Hizbollah  var. Of *hezbollah.

Plaudit  n. (usu. In pl.) 1 round of applause. 2 expression of approval. [latin plaudite, imperative of plaudo plaus- clap]

Petty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 unimportant; trivial. 2 small-minded. 3 minor, inferior, on a small scale. 4 law (of a crime) of lesser importance.  pettily adv. Pettiness n. [french petit small]

Surrogate  n. 1 substitute. 2  deputy, esp. Of a bishop in granting marriage licences.  surrogacy n. [latin rogo ask]

Attorney  n. (pl. -s) 1 lawyer etc. Appointed to act for another in business or legal matters. 2 us qualified lawyer. [french atorner assign]

Unemotional  adj. Not emotional; lacking emotion.

Conversationalist  n. Person good at or fond of conversation.

Oft  adv. Archaic often. [old english]

Subscriber  n. 1 person who subscribes. 2 person hiring a telephone line.

Quim  n. Coarse slang female genitals. [origin unknown]

Hulking  adj. Colloq. Bulky; clumsy.

Bryony  n. (pl. -ies) climbing plant with red berries. [latin from greek]

Verbose  adj. Using more words than are needed.  verbosity n. [latin verbosus from verbum word]

Widow  —n. 1 woman who has lost her husband by death and not married again. 2 woman whose husband is often away on a specified activity (golf widow). —v. 1 make into a widow or widower. 2 (as widowed adj.) Bereft by the death of a spouse.  widowhood n. [old english]

Roadside  n. (often attrib.) Strip of land beside a road.

Slur  —v. (-rr-) 1 pronounce indistinctly with sounds running into one another. 2 mus. Perform (notes) legato. 3 archaic or us put a slur on (a person or a person's character). 4 (usu. Foll. By over) pass over (a fact, fault, etc.) Lightly. —n. 1 imputation of wrongdoing. 2 act of slurring. 3 mus. Curved line joining notes to be slurred. [origin unknown]

Nourish  v. 1 sustain with food. 2 foster or cherish (a feeling etc.).  nourishing adj. [latin nutrio to feed]

Elastic  —adj. 1 able to resume its normal bulk or shape after contraction, dilation, or distortion. 2 springy. 3 flexible, adaptable. —n. Elastic cord or fabric, usu. Woven with strips of rubber.  elastically adv. Elasticity n. [greek elastikos propulsive]

Dashing  adj. 1 spirited, lively. 2 showy.  dashingly adv. Dashingness n.

Incentive  —n. 1 motive or incitement. 2 payment or concession encouraging effort in work. —attrib. Adj. Serving to motivate or incite (incentive scheme). [latin incentivus that sets the tune]

Collectivize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) organize on the basis of collective ownership.  collectivization n.

Fishnet  n. (often attrib.) Open-meshed fabric (fishnet stockings).

Motown  n. Music with elements of rhythm and blues, associated with detroit. [motor town, = detroit in us]

Try  —v. (-ies, -ied) 1 make an effort with a view to success (often foll. By to + infin.; colloq. Foll. By and + infin.: tried to be on time; try and be early). 2 make an effort to achieve (tried my best). 3 a test by use or experiment. B test the qualities of. 4 make severe demands on (tries my patience). 5 examine the effectiveness of for a purpose (try cold water; have you tried kicking it?). 6 ascertain the state of fastening of (a door, window, etc.). 7  a investigate and decide (a case or issue) judicially. B (often foll. By for) subject (a person) to trial (tried for murder). 8 (foll. By for) apply or compete for; seek to reach or attain (try for a gold medal). —n. (pl. -ies) 1 effort to accomplish something. 2 rugby touching-down of the ball behind the opposing goal-line, scoring points and entitling the scoring side to a kick at the goal.  try one's hand test how skilful one is, esp. At the first attempt. Try it on colloq. Try to get away with an unreasonable request etc. Try on put on (clothes etc.) To see if they fit etc. Try out put to the test, test thoroughly. [originally = separate, distinguish, from french trier sift]

Usage  use of the verb try with and (see sense 1) is uncommon in negative contexts (except in the imperative, e.g. Don't try and get the better of me) and in the past tense.

Subjunctive  gram. —adj. (of a mood) expressing what is imagined, wished, or possible (e.g. If i were you; be that as it may). —n. This mood or form. [latin: related to *subjoin]

Award  —v. Give or order to be given as a payment or prize. —n. 1 thing or amount awarded. 2 judicial decision. [french]

Snog  slang —v. (-gg-) engage in kissing and caressing. —n. Period of this. [origin unknown]

Unstinted  adj. Not stinted.

Genial  adj. 1 jovial, sociable, kindly. 2 (of the climate) mild and warm; conducive to growth. 3 cheering.  geniality n. Genially adv. [latin: related to *genius]

Handrail  n. Narrow rail for holding as a support.

Effusion  n. 1 outpouring. 2 derog. Unrestrained flow of words. [latin: related to *effuse]

Climate  n. 1 prevailing weather conditions of an area. 2 region with particular weather conditions. 3 prevailing trend of opinion or feeling.  climatic adj. Climatically adv. [greek klima]

Centaur  n. Creature in greek mythology with the upper half of a man and the lower half of a horse. [latin from greek]

Infest  v. (esp. Of vermin) overrun (a place).  infestation n. [latin infestus hostile]

Departmental  adj. Of a department.  departmentally adv.

Flunkey  n. (also flunky) (pl. -eys or -ies) usu. Derog. 1 liveried footman. 2 toady; snob. 3 us cook, waiter, etc. [origin uncertain]

Invariable  adj. 1 unchangeable. 2 always the same. 3 math. Constant.  invariably adv.

Intellect  n. 1 a faculty of reasoning, knowing, and thinking. B understanding. 2 clever or knowledgeable person. [latin: related to *intelligent]

Territorial  —adj. 1 of territory or a district (territorial possessions; territorial right). 2 tending to defend one's territory. —n. (territorial) member of the territorial army.  territorially adv. [latin: related to *territory]

Inimical  adj. 1 hostile. 2 harmful.  inimically adv. [latin inimicus enemy]

Hyperbole  n. Exaggeration, esp. For effect.  hyperbolical adj.

Timekeeper  n. 1 person who records time, esp. Of workers or in a game. 2 a watch or clock as regards accuracy (a good timekeeper). B person as regards punctuality.  timekeeping n.

Cake  —n. 1 mixture of flour, butter, eggs, sugar, etc., baked in the oven and often iced and decorated. 2 other food in a flat round shape (fish cake). 3 flattish compact mass (cake of soap). —v. (-king) 1 form into a compact mass. 2 (usu. Foll. By with) cover (with a hard or sticky mass).  have one's cake and eat it colloq. Enjoy both of two mutually exclusive alternatives. A piece of cake colloq. Something easily achieved. Sell (or go) like hot cakes colloq. Be sold (or go) quickly; be popular. [old norse]

Obloquy  n. 1 being generally ill spoken of. 2 abuse. [latin obloquium contradiction, from loquor speak]

Lend  v. (past and past part. Lent) 1 (usu. Foll. By to) grant (to a person) the use of (a thing) on the understanding that it or its equivalent shall be returned. 2 allow the use of (money) at interest. 3 bestow or contribute (lends a certain charm).  lend an ear listen. Lend a hand help. Lend itself to (of a thing) be suitable for.  lender n. [old english: related to *loan]

Evening  n. End part of the day, esp. From about 6 p.m. To bedtime. [old english: related to *even2]

Goad  —v. 1 urge on with a goad. 2 (usu. Foll. By on, into) irritate; stimulate. —n. 1 spiked stick used for urging cattle forward. 2 anything that torments or incites. [old english]

Colorless  adj. (brit. Colour-) 1 without colour. 2 lacking character or interest.

Shove  —v. (-ving) 1 (also absol.) Push vigorously. 2 colloq. Put casually (shoved it in a drawer). —n. Act of shoving.  shove off 1 start from the shore in a boat. 2 slang depart. [old english]

Screwball  n. Us slang crazy or eccentric person.

Ingrowing  adj. (esp. Of a toenail) growing into the flesh.  ingrown adj.

Sober  —adj. (soberer, soberest) 1 not drunk. 2 not given to drink. 3 moderate, tranquil, sedate, serious. 4 not exaggerated. 5 (of a colour etc.) Quiet; dull. —v. (often foll. By down, up) make or become sober.  soberly adv. [french from latin]

Insolvent  —adj. Unable to pay one's debts; bankrupt. —n. Insolvent person.  insolvency n.

Redcurrant  n. 1 small red edible berry. 2 shrub bearing this.

Tolerate  v. (-ting) 1 allow the existence or occurrence of without authoritative interference. 2 endure (suffering etc.). 3 find or treat as endurable. 4 be able to take or undergo (drugs, treatment, etc.) Without adverse effects. [latin tolero]

Disharmony  n. Lack of harmony; discord.  disharmonious adj.

Scraper  n. Device for scraping, esp. Paint etc. From a surface.

Judaism  n. Religion of the jews.

Horsebox  n. Closed vehicle for transporting horse(s).

Cardphone  n. Public telephone operated by a machine-readable card instead of money.

Savant  n. (fem. Savante,) learned person. [french]

Tenfold  adj. & adv. 1 ten times as much or as many. 2 consisting of ten parts.

Carbide  n. 1 binary compound of carbon. 2 = *calcium carbide.

Crude  —adj. 1 a in the natural state; not refined. B unpolished; lacking finish. 2 a rude, blunt. B offensive, indecent. 3 inexact. —n. Natural mineral oil.  crudely adv. Crudeness n. Crudity n. [latin crudus raw]

Yarrow  n. Perennial plant, esp. Milfoil. [old english]

Imprecation  n. Formal oath, curse. [latin precor pray]

Princeling  n. Young or petty prince.

Huntsman  n. 1 hunter. 2 hunt official in charge of hounds.

Cassette  n. Sealed case containing magnetic tape, film etc., ready for insertion in a tape recorder, camera, etc. [french diminutive: related to *case2]

Denominator  n. Number below the line in a vulgar fraction; divisor. [latin nomen name]

Chignon  n. Coil of hair at the back of a woman's head. [french]

Compare  —v. (-ring) 1 (usu. Foll. By to) express similarities in; liken. 2 (often foll. By to, with) estimate the similarity of. 3 (often foll. By with) bear comparison. 4 gram. Form comparative and superlative degrees of (an adjective or adverb). —n. Literary comparison (beyond compare).  compare notes exchange ideas or opinions. [latin compar equal]

Usage  in current use, to and with are generally interchangeable, but with often implies a greater element of formal analysis.

Idealize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) regard or represent as ideal or perfect.  idealization n.

Cantaloup  n. (also cantaloupe) small round ribbed melon. [cantaluppi near rome, where it was first grown in europe]

Eyelid  n. Either of the folds of skin closing to cover the eye.

Epoch  n. 1 period of history etc. Marked by notable events. 2 beginning of an era. 3 geol. Division of a period, corresponding to a set of strata.  epochal adj. [greek, = pause]

Kilowatt  n. 1,000 watts.

Surtitle  n. Explanatory caption projected on to a screen above the stage during an opera.

Resilient  adj. 1 resuming its original shape after compression etc. 2 readily recovering from a setback.  resilience n. [latin: related to *salient]

Perform  v. 1 (also absol.) Carry into effect; do. 2 execute (a function, play, piece of music, etc.). 3  act in a play; play music, sing, etc.; execute tricks. 4 function.  performer n. [anglo-french: related to *per-, *furnish]

Microscopic  adj. 1 visible only with a microscope. 2 extremely small. 3 of or by means of a microscope.  microscopically adv.

Tannic  adj. Of tan (sense 3). [french tannique: related to *tannin]

Entice  v. (-cing) attract by the offer of pleasure or reward.  enticement n. Enticing adj. Enticingly adv. [french enticier probably from romanic]

Halogen  n. Any of the non-metallic elements (fluorine, chlorine, bromine, iodine, and astatine) which form a salt (e.g. Sodium chloride) when combined with a metal. [greek hals halos salt, *-gen]

Concert  n. 1 musical performance of usu. Several separate compositions. 2 agreement. 3 combination of voices or sounds. [italian: related to *concerto]

Suffrage  n. Right of voting in political elections. [latin suffragium]

Purlieu  n. (pl. -s) 1 person's bounds, limits, or usual haunts. 2 hist. Tract on the border of a forest. 3 (in pl.) Outskirts, outlying region. [anglo-french puralé from aller go]

Retail  —n. Sale of goods in small quantities to the public, and usu. Not for resale. —adj. & adv. By retail; at a retail price. —v. 1 sell (goods) by retail. 2 (often foll. By at, of) (of goods) be sold in this way (esp. For a specified price). 3  recount; relate details of.  retailer n. [french taillier cut: related to *tally]

Bombardier  n. 1 non-commissioned officer in the artillery. 2 us crew member in an aircraft who aims and releases bombs.

Unpopulated  adj. Not populated.

Anguish  n. 1 severe mental suffering. 2 pain, agony.  anguished adj. [latin angustia tightness]

Rarebit  n. = *welsh rabbit. [from *rare1]

Regulate  v. (-ting) 1 control by rule. 2 subject to restrictions. 3 adapt to requirements. 4 alter the speed of (a machine or clock) so that it works accurately.  regulator n. Regulatory adj. [latin: related to *regular]

Afterwards  adv. (us afterward) later, subsequently. [old english: related to *after, *-ward]

Smarm  —v. Colloq. 1 (often foll. By down) smooth, plaster flat (hair etc.). 2 be ingratiating. —n. Colloq. Obsequiousness. [dial.]

Natterjack  n. A kind of small toad. [perhaps from *natter]

Righto  int. Colloq. Expressing agreement or assent.

Valency  n. (pl. -ies) combining power of an atom measured by the number of hydrogen atoms it can displace or combine with. [latin valentia power]

Tulle  n. Soft fine silk etc. Net for veils and dresses. [tulle in france]

Operatics  n.pl. Production and performance of operas.

Alpine  —adj. Of mountainous regions or (alpine) the alps. —n. 1 plant growing in mountainous regions. 2 = *rock-plant. [latin: related to *alp]

Watery  adj. 1 containing too much water. 2 too thin in consistency. 3 of or consisting of water. 4 vapid, uninteresting. 5 (of colour) pale. 6 (of the sun, moon, or sky) rainy-looking. 7 (of eyes) moist; tearful. wateriness n.

Commemorate  v. (-ting) 1 preserve in memory by a celebration or ceremony. 2 be a memorial of.  commemoration n. Commemorative adj. [latin: related to *memory]

Floribunda  n. Plant, esp. A rose, bearing dense clusters of flowers. [related to *floret: cf. *moribund]

Overdue  adj. Past the due time for payment, arrival, return, etc.

Clubhouse  n. Premises of a (usu. Sporting) club.

Evasive  adj. 1 seeking to evade. 2 not direct in one's answers etc.  evasively adv. Evasiveness n.

Dray  n. Low cart without sides for heavy loads, esp. Beer-barrels. [related to *draw]

Precession  n. Slow movement of the axis of a spinning body around another axis. [latin: related to *precede]

Majorette  n. = *drum majorette. [abbreviation]

Bath  —n. (pl. -s) 1 a (usu. Plumbed-in) container for sitting in and washing the body. B its contents. 2 act of washing in it (have a bath). 3 (usu. In pl.) Public building with baths or a swimming-pool. 4 a vessel containing liquid for immersing something, e.g. A film for developing. B its contents. —v. 1 wash (esp. A baby) in a bath. 2 take a bath. [old english]

Rounder  n. 1 (in pl.; treated as sing.) Ball game in which players hit the ball and run through a round of bases. 2 complete run as a unit of scoring in rounders.

Incubator  n. Apparatus providing artificial warmth for hatching eggs, rearing premature babies, or developing micro-organisms.

Tool  —n. 1 implement used to carry out mechanical functions by hand or by machine. 2 thing used in an occupation or pursuit (tools of one's trade). 3 person merely used by another. 4 coarse slang penis. —v. 1 dress (stone) with a chisel. 2 impress a design on (leather). 3 (foll. By along, around, etc.) Slang drive or ride, esp. In a casual or leisurely manner. [old english]

Cautious  adj. Having or showing caution.  cautiously adv. Cautiousness n.

Maunder  v. 1 talk ramblingly. 2 move or act listlessly or idly. [origin unknown]

Outmatch  v. Be more than a match for.

Chiefly  adv. Above all; mainly but not exclusively.

Yang  n. (in chinese philosophy) the active male principle of the universe (cf. *yin).

Strongbox  n. Small strongly made chest for valuables.

Monkshood  n. Poisonous plant with hood-shaped flowers.

Pentecostal  adj. (of a religious group) emphasizing the divine gifts, esp. The power to heal the sick, and often fundamentalist.

Homology  n. Homologous state or relation; correspondence.

Manatee  n. Large aquatic plant-eating mammal. [spanish from carib]

Supernatural  —adj. Not attributable to, or explicable by, the laws of nature; magical; mystical. —n. (prec. By the) supernatural forces, effects, etc.  supernaturally adv.

Alluvium  n. (pl. -via) deposit of usu. Fine fertile soil left behind by a flood, esp. In a river valley. [latin luo wash]

Condign  adj. (of a punishment etc.) Severe and well-deserved. [latin dignus worthy]

Leprechaun  n. Small mischievous sprite in irish folklore. [irish lu small, corp body]

Storeman  n. Person in charge of a store of goods.

Storm  —n. 1 violent atmospheric disturbance with strong winds and usu. Thunder, rain, or snow. 2 violent political etc. Disturbance. 3 (foll. By of) a violent shower of missiles or blows. B outbreak of applause, hisses, etc. 4 a direct assault by troops on a fortified place. B capture by such an assault. —v. 1 attack or capture by storm. 2 (usu. Foll. By in, out of, etc.) Move violently or angrily (stormed out). 3 (often foll. By at, away) talk violently, rage, bluster.  take by storm 1 capture by direct assault. 2 rapidly captivate. [old english]

Naughty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 (esp. Of children) disobedient; badly behaved. 2 colloq. Joc. Indecent.  naughtily adv. Naughtiness n. [from *naught]

Whose  —interrog. Pron. Of or belonging to which person (whose is this book?). —interrog. Adj. Of whom or which (whose book is this?) —rel. Pron. Of whom; of which (the man, whose name was tim; the house whose roof was damaged).

Magnolia  n. 1 tree with dark-green foliage and waxy flowers. 2 creamy-pink colour. [magnol, name of a botanist]

Insubordinate  adj. Disobedient; rebellious.  insubordination n.

Flexitime  n. System of flexible working hours. [from *flexible]

Titmouse  n. (pl. Titmice) small active tit. [old english tit little, mase titmouse, assimilated to *mouse]

Hornbeam  n. Tree with a hard tough wood.

Inviolable  adj. Not to be violated or dishonoured.  inviolability n. Inviolably adv.

Wry  adj. (wryer, wryest or wrier, wriest) 1 distorted or turned to one side. 2 (of a face, smile, etc.) Contorted in disgust, disappointment, or mockery. 3 (of humour) dry and mocking.  wryly adv. Wryness n. [old english]

Mingle  v. (-ling) 1 mix, blend. 2 (often foll. By with) mix socially. [old english]

Honk  —n. 1 sound of a car horn. 2 cry of a wild goose. —v. (cause to) make a honk. [imitative]

Installment  n. (brit. Instalment) 1 any of several usu. Equal payments for something. 2 any of several parts, esp. Of a broadcast or published story. [anglo-french estaler fix]

Trike  n. Colloq. Tricycle. [abbreviation]

Bursary  n. (pl. -ies) grant, esp. A scholarship. [medieval latin: related to *bursar]

Glair  n. 1 white of egg. 2 adhesive preparation made from this. [french]

Administrator  n. Manager of a business, public affairs, or a person's estate.

Thankful  adj. 1 grateful, pleased. 2 expressive of thanks.

Worst  —adj. Most bad. —adv. Most badly. —n. Worst part or possibility (prepare for the worst). —v. Get the better of; defeat.  at its etc. Worst in the worst state. At worst (or the worst) in the worst possible case. Do your worst expression of defiance. Get the worst of it be defeated. If the worst comes to the worst if the worst happens. [old english: related to *worse]

Renegade  n. Person who deserts a party or principles. [medieval latin: related to *renege]

Firedog  n. Andiron.

Maniac  —n. 1 colloq. Person behaving wildly (too many maniacs on the road). 2 colloq. Obsessive enthusiast. 3  person suffering from mania. —adj. Of or behaving like a maniac.  maniacal adj. Maniacally adv.

Ny  abbr. Us new york.

Wore  past of *wear.

Glorious  adj. 1 possessing or conferring glory; illustrious. 2 colloq. Often iron. Splendid, excellent (glorious day; glorious muddle).  gloriously adv.

Lob  —v. (-bb-) hit or throw (a ball etc.) Slowly or in a high arc. —n. Such a ball. [probably low german or dutch]

Heliocentric  adj. 1 regarding the sun as centre. 2 considered as viewed from the sun's centre.

Achieve  v. (-ving) 1 reach or attain, esp. By effort (achieved victory; achieved notoriety). 2 accomplish (a feat or task). [french achever: related to *chief]

Fortune  n. 1 a chance or luck in human affairs. B person's destiny. 2 (in sing. Or pl.) Luck that befalls a person or enterprise. 3 good luck. 4 prosperity. 5 colloq. Great wealth.  make a (or one's) fortune become very rich. [latin fortuna]

Affirm  v. 1 assert, state as a fact. 2 law make a solemn declaration in place of an oath.  affirmation n. [latin: related to *firm1]

Realism  n. 1 practice of regarding things in their true nature and dealing with them as they are. 2 fidelity to nature in representation; the showing of life etc. As it is. 3 philos. Doctrine that abstract concepts have an objective existence.  realist n.

Homologous  adj. 1 a having the same relation, relative position, etc. B corresponding. 2 biol. (of organs etc.) Similar in position and structure but not necessarily in function. [from *homo-, greek logos ratio]

Thoroughbred  —adj. 1 of pure breed. 2 high-spirited. —n. Thoroughbred animal, esp. A horse.

Shrivel  v. (-ll-; us -l-) contract into a wrinkled or dried-up state. [perhaps from old norse]

Way  —n. 1 road, track, path, etc., for passing along. 2 course or route for reaching a place (asked the way to london; the way out). 3 method or plan for attaining an object. 4 style, manner (i like the way you dress). 5 person's chosen or habitual course of action. 6 normal course of events (that is always the way). 7 travelling distance; length traversed or to be traversed. 8 unimpeded opportunity or space to advance (make way). 9 advance in some direction; impetus, progress (under way). 10 being engaged in movement from place to place; time spent in this (on the way home). 11 specified direction (step this way). 12 colloq. Scope or range. 13 line of occupation or business. 14 specified condition or state (things are in a bad way). 15 respect (is useful in some ways). 16 (in pl.) Part into which a thing is divided (split it three ways). 17 (in pl.) Structure of timber etc. Down which a new ship is launched. —adv. Colloq. Far (way off).  by the way incidentally. By way of 1 by means of. 2 as a form of. 3 passing through. Come one's way become available to one. Get out of the (or my etc.) Way stop obstructing a person. Go out of one's way make a special effort. In a way to some extent. In the (or one's) way forming an obstruction. Lead the way act as guide or leader. Look the other way ignore what one should notice. On the (or one's) way 1 in the course of a journey etc. 2 having progressed. 3 colloq. (of a child) conceived but not yet born. On the way out colloq. Going out of fashion or favour. Out of the way 1 no longer an obstacle. 2 disposed of. 3 unusual. 4 (of a place) remote. [old english]

Pail  n. 1 bucket. 2 amount contained in this.  pailful n. (pl. -s). [old english]

Circumstantial  adj. 1 giving full details (circumstantial account). 2 (of evidence etc.) Indicating a conclusion by inference from known facts hard to explain otherwise.  circumstantiality n.

Wellington  n. (in full wellington boot) waterproof boot usu. Reaching the knee. [duke of wellington]

Landmark  n. 1 conspicuous object in a district, landscape, etc. 2 prominent and critical event etc.

Fulfil  v. (us fulfill) (-ll-) 1 carry out (a task, prophecy, promise, etc.). 2 a satisfy (conditions, a desire, prayer, etc.). B (as fulfilled adj.) Completely happy. 3 answer (a purpose).  fulfil oneself realize one's potential.  fulfilment n. [old english: related to *full1, *fill]

Trenchant  adj. (of style or language etc.) Incisive, terse, vigorous.  trenchancy n. Trenchantly adv. [french: related to *trench]

Columbine  n. Garden plant with purple-blue flowers like a cluster of doves. [latin columba dove]

Devilment  n. Mischief, wild spirits.

Bad  —adj. (worse, worst) 1 inadequate, defective (bad work, light). 2 unpleasant (bad weather). 3 harmful (is bad for you). 4 (of food) decayed. 5 colloq. Ill, injured (feeling bad today; a bad leg). 6 colloq. Regretful, guilty (feels bad about it). 7 serious, severe (a bad headache, mistake). 8 a morally unacceptable (bad man; bad language). B naughty. 9 not valid (a bad cheque). 10 (badder, baddest) esp. Us slang excellent. —n. Ill fortune; ruin. —adv. Us colloq. Badly.  not (or not so) bad colloq. Fairly good. Too bad colloq. Regrettable. [old english]

Unfailing  adj. Not failing or dwindling; constant; reliable.  unfailingly adv.

Conform  v. 1 comply with rules or general custom. 2 (foll. By to, with) comply with; be in accordance with. 3 (often foll. By to) be or make suitable. [latin: related to *form]

Loving  —adj. Feeling or showing love; affectionate. —n. Affection; love.  lovingly adv.
