Collateral  —n. 1 security pledged as a guarantee for the repayment of a loan. 2 person having the same ancestor as another but by a different line. —adj. 1 descended from the same ancestor but by a different line. 2 side by side; parallel. 3 a additional but subordinate. B contributory. C connected but aside from the main subject, course, etc.  collaterally adv. [latin: related to *lateral]

Victoriana  n.pl. Articles, esp. Collectors' items, of the victorian period.

-genous  comb. Form forming adjectives meaning ‘produced’ (endogenous).

Incubate  v. (-ting) 1 hatch (eggs) by sitting on them or by artificial heat. 2 cause (micro-organisms) to develop. 3 develop slowly. [latin cubo lie]

Parallelogram  n. Four-sided plane rectilinear figure with opposite sides parallel.

Licentious  adj. Sexually promiscuous. [latin: related to *licence]

Neglect  —v. 1 fail to care for or to do; be remiss about. 2 (foll. By to + infin.) Fail; overlook the need to. 3 not pay attention to; disregard. —n. 1 negligence. 2 neglecting or being neglected. 3 (usu. Foll. By of) disregard.  neglectful adj. Neglectfully adv. [latin neglego neglect-]

Unstinting  adj. Lavish; limitless.  unstintingly adv.

Gemstone  n. Precious stone used as a gem.

Governor  n. 1 ruler. 2 a official governing a province, town, etc. B representative of the crown in a colony. 3 executive head of each state of the us. 4 officer commanding a fortress etc. 5 head or member of the governing body of an institution. 6 official in charge of a prison. 7 a slang one's employer. B slang one's father. 8 mech. Automatic regulator controlling the speed of an engine etc.  governorship n.

Unselfish  adj. Concerned about others; sharing.  unselfishly adv. Unselfishness n.

Contractable  adj. (of a disease) that can be contracted.

Viking  n.  Scandinavian pirate and raider of the 8th–11th c. [old norse]

Tapir  n. Nocturnal central and s. American or malaysian hoofed mammal with a short flexible snout. [tupi]

Disprove  v. (-ving) prove false.

Animadvert  v. (foll. By on) literary criticize, censure.  animadversion n. [latin animus mind, *adverse]

Rockfall  n. Descent or mass of loose fallen rocks.

Divisive  adj. Causing disagreement.  divisively adv. Divisiveness n. [latin: related to *divide]

Myopia  n. 1 short-sightedness. 2 lack of imagination or insight.  myopic adj. Myopically adv. [greek muo shut, ops eye]

Tonsil  n. Either of two small organs, one on each side of the root of the tongue. [latin]

Worn  past part. Of *wear. —adj. 1 damaged by use or wear. 2 looking tired and exhausted.

Deliver  v. 1 a distribute (letters, goods, etc.) To their destination(s). B (often foll. By to) hand over. 2 (often foll. By from) save, rescue, or set free. 3 a give birth to (delivered a girl). B assist at the birth of or in giving birth (delivered six babies). 4 utter (an opinion, speech, etc.). 5 (often foll. By up, over) abandon; resign (delivered his soul up). 6 launch or aim (a blow etc.).  be delivered of give birth to. Deliver the goods colloq. Carry out an undertaking. [latin liber free]

Disadvantage  —n. 1 unfavourable circumstance or condition. 2 damage; loss. —v. (-ging) cause disadvantage to.  at a disadvantage in an unfavourable position or aspect.  disadvantageous adj.

Dying  attrib. Adj. Of, or at the time of, death (dying words).

Tremulous  adj. Trembling.  tremulously adv. [latin tremulus: related to *tremor]

Gunner  n. 1 artillery soldier (esp. As an official term for a private). 2 naut. Warrant-officer in charge of a battery, magazine, etc. 3 member of an aircraft crew who operates a gun.

Environs  n.pl. District round a town etc.

Cufic  var. Of *kufic.

Cyclist  n. Rider of a bicycle.

Sylviculture  var. Of *silviculture.

Prefect  n. 1 chief administrative officer of a district, esp. In france. 2 senior pupil in a school, helping to maintain discipline. [latin praeficio -fect- set in authority over]

Singhalese  var. Of *sinhalese.

Bike  colloq. —n. Bicycle or motor cycle. —v. (-king) ride a bike.  biker n. [abbreviation]

Measurement  n. 1 measuring. 2 amount measured. 3 (in pl.) Detailed dimensions.

Stopoff  n. Break in a journey.

Knight  —n. 1 man awarded a non-hereditary title (sir) by a sovereign. 2 hist. A man, usu. Noble, raised to honourable military rank after service as a page and squire. B military follower, attendant, or lady's champion in a war or tournament. 3 man devoted to a cause, woman, etc. 4 chess piece usu. Shaped like a horse's head. —v. Confer a knighthood on.  knighthood n. Knightly adj. Poet. [old english, originally = boy]

Unfinished  adj. Not finished; incomplete.

Miniskirt  n. Very short skirt.

Suffix  —n. Letter(s) added at the end of a word to form a derivative. —v. Append, esp. As a suffix. [latin figo fix- fasten]

Snafu  slang —adj. In utter confusion. —n. This state. [acronym of ‘situation normal: all fouled (or fucked) up’]

Shew  archaic var. Of *show.

Weird  adj. 1 uncanny, supernatural. 2 colloq. Queer, incomprehensible.  weirdly adv. Weirdness n. [old english wyrd destiny]

Acquisition  n. 1 thing acquired, esp. When useful. 2 acquiring or being acquired. [latin: related to *acquire]

Droppings  n.pl. 1 dung of animals or birds. 2 thing that falls or has fallen in drops.

Extol  v. (-ll-) praise enthusiastically. [latin tollo raise]

Bombazine  n. Twilled worsted dress-material. [greek bombux silk]

Unbelief  n. Lack of esp. Religious belief.  unbeliever n. Unbelieving adj.

Unskillful  adj. (brit. Unskilful) not skilful.

Ninepin  n. 1 (in pl.; usu. Treated as sing.) Game in which nine pins are bowled at. 2 pin used in this game.

Regent  —n. Person appointed to administer a state because the monarch is a minor or is absent or incapacitated. —adj. (after the noun) acting as regent (prince regent). [latin rego rule]

Hippopotamus  n. (pl. -muses or -mi) large african mammal with short legs and thick skin, living by rivers, lakes, etc. [greek hippos horse, potamos river]

Spyhole  n. Peep-hole.

Ventricle  n. 1 cavity in the body. 2 hollow part of an organ, esp. The brain or heart.  ventricular adj. [latin ventriculus diminutive of venter belly]

Australian  —n. 1 native or national of australia. 2 person of australian descent. —adj. Of australia.

Fortitude  n. Courage in pain or adversity. [latin fortis strong]

Gumption  n. Colloq. 1 resourcefulness, initiative. 2 common sense. [origin unknown]

However  adv. 1 a in whatever way (do it however you want). B to whatever extent (must go however inconvenient). 2 nevertheless.

Hebdomadal  adj. Formal weekly, esp. Meeting weekly. [greek hepta seven]

Reversion  n. 1 return to a previous state, habit, etc. 2 biol. Return to ancestral type. 3 legal right (esp. Of the original owner, or his or her heirs) to possess or succeed to property on the death of the present possessor. [latin: related to *reverse] 

Rickrack  var. Of *ricrac.

Jaywalk  v. Cross a road carelessly or dangerously.  jaywalker n.

Sundial  n. Instrument showing the time by the shadow of a pointer in sunlight.

Plant  —n. 1 a organism usu. Containing chlorophyll enabling it to live wholly on inorganic substances, and lacking the power of voluntary movement. B small organism of this kind, as distinguished from a shrub or tree. 2 a machinery, fixtures, etc., used in industry. B factory. 3 colloq. Something deliberately placed so as to incriminate another. —v. 1 place (seeds, plants, etc.) In soil for growing. 2 (often foll. By in, on, etc.) Put or fix in position. 3 (often refl.) Station (a person etc.), esp. As a spy. 4 cause (an idea etc.) To be established, esp. In another person's mind. 5 deliver (a blow, kiss, etc.) With a deliberate aim. 6 colloq. Place (something incriminating) for later discovery.   plant out transfer from a pot or frame to the open ground; set out (seedlings) at intervals.  plantlike adj. [latin planta]

Solitaire  n. 1 jewel set by itself. 2 ring etc. With this. 3 game for one player in which pegs etc. Are removed from a board by jumping others over them. 4 us = *patience 3. [french: see *solitary]

Pandemonium  n. 1 uproar; utter confusion. 2 scene of this. [place in hell in milton's paradise lost: related to *pan-, *demon]

Trash  —n. 1 esp. Us worthless or waste stuff; rubbish. 2 worthless person or persons. —v. Slang wreck, vandalize.  trashy adj. (-ier, -iest). [origin unknown]

Sad  adj. (sadder, saddest) 1 unhappy. 2 causing sorrow. 3 regrettable. 4 shameful, deplorable.  sadden v. Sadly adv. Sadness n. [old english]

Fundamentalism  n. Strict adherence to traditional religious beliefs or doctrines.  fundamentalist n. & adj.

Hydrant  n. Outlet (esp. In a street) with a nozzle for a hose, for drawing water from the main. [as *hydro-]

Ballpark  n. Us 1 baseball ground. 2 colloq. Sphere of activity, etc. 3 (attrib.) Colloq. Approximate.  in the right ballpark colloq. Approximately correct.

Chapman  n. Hist. Pedlar. [old english: related to *cheap, *man]

-ness  suffix forming nouns from adjectives, expressing: 1 state or condition, or an instance of this (happiness; a kindness). 2 something in a certain state (wilderness). [old english]

Etching  n. 1 print made from an etched plate. 2 art of producing these plates.

Encomium  n. (pl. -s) formal or high-flown praise. [greek komos revelry]

Robinia  n. Any of various n. American trees or shrubs, e.g. A locust tree or false acacia. [robin, name of a french gardener]

Sidelong  —adj. (esp. Of a glance) oblique. —adv. Obliquely.

Automobile  n. Us motor car. [french]

Swastika  n. 1 ancient symbol formed by an equal-armed cross with each arm continued at a right angle. 2 this with clockwise continuations as the symbol of nazi germany. [sanskrit]

Drawing  n. 1 art of representing by line with a pencil etc. 2 picture etc. Made thus.

Apr  abbr. Annual or annualized percentage rate (esp. Of interest on loans or credit).

Ultraviolet  adj. Of or using radiation with a frequency just beyond that of the violet end of the visible spectrum.

Publicist  n. Publicity agent or public relations officer.

Sanity  n. 1 being sane. 2 moderation. [latin sanitas: related to *sane]

Reconvert  v. Convert back to a former state.  reconversion n.

Patronymic  n. Name derived from the name of a father or ancestor (e.g. Johnson, o'brien, ivanovich). [greek pater father, onoma name]

Fiddling  adj. 1 petty, trivial. 2 colloq. = *fiddly.

Dominate  v. (-ting) 1 command, control. 2 be the most influential or obvious. 3 (of a high place) overlook.  domination n. [latin dominor from dominus lord]

Denarius  n. (pl. Denarii) ancient roman silver coin. [latin deni by tens]

Punnet  n. Small light basket or container for fruit or vegetables. [origin unknown]

Discountenance  v. (-cing) 1 disconcert. 2 refuse to approve of.

Babble  —v. (-ling) 1 a talk, chatter, or say incoherently or excessively. B (of a stream etc.) Murmur. 2 repeat or divulge foolishly. —n. 1 babbling. 2 murmur of voices, water, etc. [imitative]

Unremarkable  adj. Not remarkable; uninteresting, ordinary.

Chew  —v. Work (food etc.) Between the teeth. —n. 1 act of chewing. 2 chewy sweet.  chew on 1 work continuously between the teeth. 2 think about. Chew over 1 discuss, talk over. 2 think about. [old english]

Recital  n. 1 reciting or being recited. 2 concert of classical music given by a soloist or small group. 3 (foll. By of) detailed account of (connected things or facts); narrative.

Wittingly  adv. Aware of what one is doing; intentionally. [from *wit]

Restart  —v. Start again. —n. Act of restarting.

Outstanding  adj. 1 conspicuous because of excellence. 2 a (of a debt) not yet settled. B still to be dealt with (work outstanding).  outstandingly adv.

Mf  abbr. Mezzo forte.

Cave  —n. Large hollow in the side of a cliff, hill, etc., or underground. —v. (-ving) explore caves.  cave in 1 (cause to) subside or collapse. 2 yield, give up. [latin cavus hollow]

Pampas  n.pl. Large treeless plains in s. America. [spanish from quechua]

Schadenfreude  n. Malicious enjoyment of another's misfortunes. [german schaden harm, freude joy]

Evaluate  v. (-ting) 1 assess, appraise. 2 find or state the number or amount of.  evaluation n. [french: related to *value]

Excursion  n. Journey (usu. A day-trip) to a place and back, made for pleasure. [latin excurro run out]

Gunfight  n. Us fight with firearms.  gunfighter n.

Sorely  adv. Extremely (sorely tempted; sorely vexed).

Citadel  n. Fortress, usu. On high ground, protecting or dominating a city. [french citadelle]

Neck  —n. 1 a part of the body connecting the head to the shoulders. B part of a garment round the neck. 2 something resembling a neck; narrow part of a cavity, vessel, or object such as a bottle or violin. 3 length of a horse's head and neck as a measure of its lead in a race. 4 flesh of an animal's neck as food. 5 slang impudence. —v. Colloq. Kiss and caress amorously.  get it in the neck colloq. 1 be severely reprimanded or punished. 2 suffer a severe blow. Up to one's neck (often foll. By in) colloq. Very deeply involved; very busy. [old english]

Loony  slang —n. (pl. -ies) lunatic. —adj. (-ier, -iest) crazy.  looniness n. [abbreviation]

Malformation  n. Faulty formation.  malformed adj.

Moss  n. 1 small flowerless plant growing in dense clusters in bogs, on the ground, trees, stones, etc. 2 scot. & n.engl. Bog, esp. A peatbog.  mossy adj. (-ier, -iest). [old english]

Impressive  adj. Arousing respect, approval, or admiration.  impressively adv. Impressiveness n.

Refreshment  n. 1 refreshing or being refreshed. 2 (usu. In pl.) Food or drink.

Dividend  n. 1 share of profits paid to shareholders or to winners in a football pool etc. 2 number to be divided. 3 benefit from an action. [anglo-french: related to *divide]

Overreach  v. Outwit, cheat.  overreach oneself fail by attempting too much.

Accomplished  adj. Clever, skilled.

Regain  v. Obtain possession or use of after loss (regain consciousness).

Postman  n. (fem. Postwoman) person employed to deliver and collect letters etc.

Patent  —n. 1 official document conferring a right or title, esp. The sole right to make, use, or sell a specified invention. 2 invention or process so protected. —adj. 1  obvious, plain. 2 conferred or protected by patent. 3 a proprietary. B to which one has a proprietary claim. —v. Obtain a patent for (an invention).  patently adv. (in sense 1 of adj.). [latin pateo lie open]

Sam  abbr. Surface-to-air missile.

Catalan  —n. Native or language of catalonia in spain. —adj. Of catalonia. [french from spanish]

Blighter  n. Colloq. Contemptible or annoying person.

Muhammadan  n. & adj. (also mohammedan) = *muslim. [muhammad, name of a prophet]

Usage  the term muhammadan is not used by muslims, and is often regarded as offensive.

Dozy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 drowsy. 2 colloq. Stupid or lazy.

Family  n. (pl. -ies) 1 set of relations, esp. Parents and children. 2 a members of a household. B person's children. 3 all the descendants of a common ancestor. 4 group of similar objects, people, etc. 5 group of related genera of animals or plants.  in the family way colloq. Pregnant. [latin familia]

Falconry  n. Breeding and training of hawks.

Righten  v. Make right or correct.

Gimbals  n.pl. Contrivance of rings and pivots for keeping instruments horizontal in ships, aircraft, etc. [var. Of gimmal from french gemel double finger-ring]

Mohican  —adj. (of a hairstyle) with the head shaved except for a strip of hair from the middle of the forehead to the back of the neck, often worn in long spikes. —n. Such a hairstyle. [mohicans, n. American indian people]

Oblige  v. (-ging) 1 constrain, compel. 2 be binding on. 3 do (a person) a small favour, help. 4 (as obliged adj.) Indebted, grateful.  much obliged thank you. [latin obligo bind]

Ruler  n. 1 person exercising government or dominion. 2 straight usu. Graduated strip of wood, metal, or plastic used to draw or measure.

Minx  n. Pert, sly, or playful girl. [origin unknown]

Underused  adj. Not used to capacity.

Smote  past of *smite.

Poulterer  n. Dealer in poultry and usu. Game. [poulter: related to *poult]

Centilitre  n. (us centiliter) 0.01 litre.

Seer  n. 1 person who sees. 2 prophet; visionary.

Koala  n. (in full koala bear) small australian bearlike marsupial with thick grey fur. [aboriginal]

Automate  v. (-ting) convert to or operate by automation.

Whittle  v. (-ling) 1 (often foll. By at) pare (wood etc.) With repeated slicing with a knife. 2 (often foll. By away, down) reduce by repeated subtractions. [dial. Thwittle]

Photoelectric  adj. Marked by or using emissions of electrons from substances exposed to light.  photoelectricity n.

Quarterdeck  n. Part of a ship's upper deck near the stern, usu. Reserved for officers.

Didgeridoo  n. Long tubular australian aboriginal musical instrument. [imitative]

Usage  dice, rather than die, is now the standard singular as well as plural form in the games sense (one dice, two dice).

Sympathize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) (often foll. By with) 1 feel or express sympathy. 2 agree.  sympathizer n.

Micky  var. Of *mickey.

Exposition  n. 1 explanatory account. 2 explanation or commentary. 3 mus. Part of a movement in which the principal themes are presented. 4 large public exhibition. [latin: related to *expound]

Martyr  —n. 1 a person killed for persisting in a belief. B person who suffers for a cause etc. C person who suffers or pretends to suffer to get pity etc. 2 (foll. By to) colloq. Constant sufferer from (an ailment). —v. 1 put to death as a martyr. 2 torment.  martyrdom n. [greek martur witness]

Photography  n. The taking and processing of photographs.

Minoan  —adj. Of the bronze age civilization centred on crete (c.3000–1100 bc). —n. Person of this civilization. [minos, legendary king of crete]

Humidifier  n. Device for keeping the atmosphere moist in a room etc.

Swahili  n. (pl. Same) 1 member of a bantu people of zanzibar and adjacent coasts. 2 their language. [arabic]

Lifelike  adj. Closely resembling life or the person or thing represented.

Scan  —v. (-nn-) 1 look at intently or quickly. 2 (of a verse etc.) Be metrically correct. 3 a examine (a surface etc.) To detect radioactivity etc. B traverse (a particular region) with a radar etc. Beam. 4 resolve (a picture) into its elements of light and shade for esp. Television transmission. 5 analyse the metrical structure of (verse). 6 obtain an image of (part of the body) using a scanner. —n. 1 scanning. 2 image obtained by scanning. [latin scando climb, scan]

Crabby  adj. (-ier, -iest) irritable, morose.  crabbily adv. Crabbiness n.

Insomuch  adv. 1 (foll. By that) to such an extent. 2 (foll. By as) inasmuch. [originally in so much]

Mesolithic  adj. Of the part of the stone age between the palaeolithic and neolithic periods. [greek lithos stone]

Spam  n. Propr. Tinned meat made from ham. [spiced ham]

Technic  n. 1 (usu. In pl.) A technology. B technical terms, details, methods, etc. 2 technique. [greek tekhne art]

Payola  n. Esp. Us slang bribe offered for unofficial promotion of a product etc. In the media.

Incarnation  n. 1 a embodiment in (esp. Human) flesh. B (the incarnation) the embodiment of god in christ. 2 (often foll. By of) living type (of a quality etc.).

Equivocal  adj. 1 of double or doubtful meaning. 2 of uncertain nature. 3 (of a person etc.) Questionable.  equivocally adv. [latin voco call]

Mm  abbr. 1 messieurs. 2 military medal.

Chapel  n. 1 a place for private christian worship in a cathedral or large church, with its own altar. B this attached to a private house etc. 2 a place of worship for nonconformists. B chapel service.  3 members or branch of a printers' trade union at a place of work. [medieval latin cappa cloak: the first chapel was a sanctuary in which st martin's cloak (cappella) was preserved]

Phosphorus  n. Chem. Non-metallic element existing in allotropic forms, esp. As a whitish waxy substance burning slowly at ordinary temperatures and so luminous in the dark.  phosphoric adj. Phosphorous adj. [greek phos light, -phoros -bringing]

Putrid  adj. 1 decomposed, rotten. 2 foul, noxious. 3 corrupt. 4 slang of poor quality; contemptible; very unpleasant.  putridity n. [latin putreo rot (v.)]

Taciturn  adj. Saying little; uncommunicative.  taciturnity n. [latin: related to *tacit]

Marguerite  n. Ox-eye daisy. [latin margarita pearl]

Foresail  n. Principal sail on a foremast.

Factotum  n. (pl. -s) employee who does all kinds of work. [medieval latin: related to *fact, *total]

Microcosm  n. (often foll. By of) miniature representation, e.g. Mankind or a community seen as a small-scale model of the universe; epitome.  microcosmic adj. [from *micro-, *cosmos]

Microsecond  n. One-millionth of a second.

Emeritus  adj. Retired but retaining one's title as an honour (emeritus professor). [latin mereor earn]

Thermoelectric  adj. Producing electricity by a difference of temperatures.

Epidural  —adj. (of an anaesthetic) introduced into the space around the dura mater of the spinal cord. —n. Epidural anaesthetic. [from *epi-, *dura mater]

Meticulous  adj. 1 giving great attention to detail. 2 very careful and precise.  meticulously adv. Meticulousness n. [latin metus fear]

Sprain  —v. Wrench (an ankle, wrist, etc.), causing pain or swelling. —n. Such a wrench. [origin unknown]

Stylized  adj. (also -ised) painted, drawn, etc. In a conventional non-realistic style.

Binge  slang —n. Bout of excessive eating, drinking, etc.; spree. —v. (-ging) indulge in a binge. [probably dial., = soak]

Suborn  v. Induce by bribery etc. To commit perjury etc. [latin orno equip]

Faceless  adj. 1 without identity; characterless. 2 purposely not identifiable.

Trammel  —n. 1 (usu. In pl.) Impediment; hindrance (trammels of domesticity). 2 triple drag-net for fishing. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) hamper. [medieval latin tremaculum]

Funicular  —adj. (of a mountain railway) operating by cable with ascending and descending cars counterbalanced. —n. Funicular railway. [latin funiculus diminutive of funis rope]

Introduce  v. (-cing) 1 (foll. By to) make (a person or oneself) known by name to another, esp. Formally. 2 announce or present to an audience. 3 bring (a custom etc.) Into use. 4 bring (legislation) before parliament etc. 5 (foll. By to) initiate (a person) in a subject. 6 insert. 7 bring in; usher in; bring forward. 8 occur just before the start of. 9 put on sale for the first time. introducible adj. [latin duco lead]

Spiral  —adj. 1 coiled in a plane or as round a cylinder or cone. 2 having this shape. —n. 1 spiral curve or thing (spiral of smoke). 2 progressive rise or fall of two or more quantities alternately because each depends on the other(s). —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 move in a spiral course. 2 (of prices, wages, etc.) Rise or fall continuously.  spirally adv. [greek speira coil]

Launderette  n. (also laundrette) establishment with coin-operated washing-machines and driers for public use.

Abstract  —adj. 1 a of or existing in thought or theory rather than matter or practice; not concrete. B (of a word, esp. A noun) denoting a quality, condition, etc., not a concrete object. 2 (of art) achieving its effect by form and colour rather than by realism. —v. 1 (often foll. By from) extract, remove. 2 summarize. —n. 1 summary. 2 abstract work of art. 3 abstraction or abstract term. [latin: related to *tract1]

Cygnet  n. Young swan. [latin cygnus swan from greek]

Coitus  n. Sexual intercourse.  coital adj. [latin: related to *coition]

Hunger  —n. 1 a lack of food. B feeling of discomfort or exhaustion caused by this. 2 (often foll. By for, after) strong desire. —v. 1 (often foll. By for, after) crave or desire. 2 feel hunger. [old english]

Turquoise  —n. 1 semiprecious stone, usu. Opaque and greenish- or sky-blue. 2 greenish-blue colour. —adj. Of this colour. [french, = turkish]

Apace  adv. Literary swiftly. [french à pas]

Sumac  n. (also sumach) 1 shrub with reddish conical fruits used as a spice. 2 dried and ground leaves of this used in tanning and dyeing. [french from arabic]

Supervene  v. (-ning) formal occur as an interruption or change.  supervention n. [latin supervenio]

Impress  —v. 1 (often foll. By with) a affect or influence deeply. B affect (a person) favourably (was most impressed). 2 (often foll. By on) emphasize (an idea etc.) (must impress on you the need to be prompt). 3 a (often foll. By on) imprint or make (a mark). B mark (a thing) with a stamp, seal, etc. —n. 1 mark made by a seal, stamp, etc. 2 characteristic mark or quality.  impressible adj. [french: related to *press1]

For  —prep. 1 in the interest or to the benefit of; intended to go to (did it all for my country; these flowers are for you). 2 in defence, support, or favour of. 3 suitable or appropriate to (a dance for beginners; not for me to say). 4 in respect of or with reference to; regarding (usual for ties to be worn; ready for bed). 5 representing or in place of (mp for lincoln; here for my uncle). 6 in exchange with, at the price of, corresponding to (swapped it for a cake; give me £5 for it; bought it for £5; word for word). 7 as a consequence of (fined for speeding; decorated for bravery; here's £5 for your trouble). 8 a with a view to; in the hope or quest of; in order to get (go for a walk; send for a doctor; did it for the money). B on account of (could not speak for laughing). 9 to reach; towards (left for rome). 10 so as to start promptly at (meet at seven for eight). 11 through or over (a distance or period); during (walked for miles). 12 as being (for the last time; i for one refuse). 13 in spite of; notwithstanding (for all your fine words). 14 considering or making due allowance in respect of (good for a beginner). —conj. Because, since, seeing that.  be for it colloq. Be about to be punished etc. For all (that) in spite of, although. For ever for all time (cf. *forever). [old english reduced form of *fore]

Destine  v. (-ning) (often foll. By to, for, or to + infin.) Appoint; preordain; intend (destined him for the navy).  be destined to be fated or preordained to. [french from latin]

Verve  n. Enthusiasm, vigour, spirit. [french]

Furcate  —adj. Forked, branched. —v. (-ting) fork, divide.  furcation n. [latin: related to *fork]

Tonsillitis  n. Inflammation of the tonsils.

Tarmac  —n. Propr. 1 = *tarmacadam. 2 runway etc. Made of this. —v. (tarmac) (-ck-) apply tarmacadam to. [abbreviation]

Urgent  adj. 1 requiring immediate action or attention. 2 importunate.  urgency n. Urgently adv. [french: related to *urge]

Pederast  n. (also paederast) man who engages in pederasty.

Jute  n. 1 fibre from the bark of an e. Indian plant, used esp. For sacking, mats, etc. 2 plant yielding this. [bengali]

Wholefood  n. Food which has not been unnecessarily processed or refined.

Homograph  n. Word spelt like another but of different meaning or origin (e.g. *pole1, *pole2).

Quondam  attrib. Adj. That once was, sometime, former. [latin adv., = formerly]

Apotheosis  n. (pl. -theoses) 1 elevation to divine status, deification. 2 glorification of a thing; sublime example (apotheosis of chivalry). [greek theos god]

Commensurate  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By with) coextensive. 2 (often foll. By to, with) proportionate.

Craftsman  n. (fem. Craftswoman) 1 skilled worker. 2 person who practises a craft.  craftsmanship n.

Dubiety  n. Literary doubt. [latin: related to *dubious]

Mottle  v. (-ling) (esp. As mottled adj.) Mark with spots or smears of colour. [back-formation from *motley]

Always  adv. 1 at all times; on all occasions. 2 whatever the circumstances. 3 repeatedly, often. [from *all, *way]

Acceptance  n. 1 willingness to accept. 2 affirmative answer to an invitation etc. 3 approval, belief (found wide acceptance).

Injustice  n. 1 lack of fairness. 2 unjust act.  do a person an injustice judge a person unfairly. [french from latin: related to *in-1]

Reseal  v. Seal again.  resealable adj.

Carburettor  n. (us carburetor) apparatus in an internal-combustion engine for mixing petrol and air to make an explosive mixture.

Caenozoic  var. Of *cenozoic.

Semiquaver  n. Mus. Note equal to half a quaver.

Ludicrous  adj. Absurd, ridiculous, laughable.  ludicrously adv. Ludicrousness n. [latin ludicrum stage play]

Stage  —n. 1 point or period in a process or development. 2 a raised platform, esp. For performing plays etc. On. B (prec. By the) theatrical profession, drama. C scene of action. 3 a regular stopping-place on a route. B distance between two of these. 4 astronaut. Section of a rocket with a separate engine. —v. (-ging) 1 present (a play etc.) On stage. 2 arrange, organize (staged a demonstration). [french estage, ultimately from latin sto stand]

Joint  —n. 1 place at which two or more things or parts of a structure are joined; device for joining these. 2 point at which two bones fit together. 3 division of an animal carcass as meat. 4 slang restaurant, bar, etc. 5 slang marijuana cigarette. 6 geol. Crack in rock. —adj. 1 held, done by, or belonging to, two or more persons etc. (joint mortgage; joint action). 2 sharing with another (joint author; joint favourite). —v. 1 connect by joint(s). 2 divide at a joint or into joints.  out of joint 1 (of a bone) dislocated. 2 out of order.  jointly adv. [french: related to *join]

Madden  v. 1 make or become mad. 2 irritate.  maddening adj. Maddeningly adv.

Christmas  n. 1 (also christmas day) annual festival of christ's birth, celebrated on 25 dec. 2 period around this.  christmassy adj. [old english: related to *christ, *mass2]

Keynesian  adj. Of the economic theories of j. M. Keynes, esp. Regarding state intervention in the economy.

Experiential  adj. Involving or based on experience.  experientially adv.

Samarium  n. Metallic element of the lanthanide series. [ultimately from samarski, name of an official]

Boche  n. Slang derog. German, esp. A soldier. [french]

Manger  n. Box or trough for horses or cattle to feed from. [latin: related to *mange]

Ineradicable  adj. That cannot be rooted out.

Fatherly  adj. Like or of a father.

-wise  suffix forming adjectives and adverbs of manner (clockwise; lengthwise) or respect (moneywise).

Usage  more fanciful phrase-based combinations, such as employment-wise (= as regards employment) are restricted to informal contexts.

Spinner  n. 1 spin bowler. 2 person or thing that spins, esp. A manufacturer engaged in cotton-spinning. 3 revolving bait.

Fishy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of or like fish. 2 slang dubious, suspect.  fishily adv. Fishiness n.

Threnody  n. (pl. -ies) song of lamentation or mourning. [greek]

Trinitarian  —n. Believer in the trinity. —adj. Of this belief.  trinitarianism n.

Philo-  comb. Form (also phil- before a vowel or h) denoting a liking for what is specified. [greek philos friend]

Pocketful  n. (pl. -s) as much as a pocket will hold.

Pondweed  n. Aquatic plant growing in still water.

Foretell  v. (past and past part. -told) 1 predict, prophesy. 2 indicate the approach of.

Rage  —n. 1 fierce or violent anger. 2 fit of this. 3 violent action of a natural force. —v. (-ging) 1 be full of anger. 2 (often foll. By at, against) speak furiously or madly. 3 (of wind, battle, etc.) Be violent; be at its height. 4 (as raging adj.) Extreme, very painful (raging thirst; raging headache).  all the rage very popular, fashionable. [latin *rabies]

Era  n. 1 system of chronology reckoning from a noteworthy event (christian era). 2 large period, esp. Regarded historically. 3 date at which an era begins. 4 major division of geological time. [latin, = number (pl. Of aes money)]

Dugong  n. (pl. Same or -s) asian sea-mammal. [malay]

Loquat  n. 1 small yellow egg-shaped fruit. 2 tree bearing it. [chinese]

Lawrencium  n. Artificially made transuranic metallic element. [lawrence, name of a physicist]

Croak  —n. Deep hoarse sound, esp. Of a frog. —v. 1 utter or speak with a croak. 2 slang die. [imitative]

Invitation  n. 1 inviting or being invited. 2 letter or card etc. Used to invite.

Peri-  prefix round, about. [greek]

Above  —prep. 1 over; on the top of; higher than; over the surface of (head above water; above the din). 2 more than (above twenty people). 3 higher in rank, importance, etc., than. 4 a too great or good for (not above cheating). B beyond the reach of (above my understanding; above suspicion). —adv. 1 at or to a higher point; overhead (the floor above; the sky above). 2 earlier on a page or in a book (as noted above). —adj. Preceding (the above argument). —n. (prec. By the) preceding text (the above shows).  above all most of all, more than anything else. Above oneself conceited, arrogant. [old english: related to *a2]

Foe  abbr. Friends of the earth.

Gdr  abbr. Hist. German democratic republic.

Tremolo  n. Tremulous effect in music. [italian: related to *tremulous]

Lament  —n. 1 passionate expression of grief. 2 song etc. Of mourning etc. —v. (also absol.) 1 express or feel grief for or about. 2 (as lamented adj.) Used to refer to a recently dead person.  lament for (or over) mourn or regret. [latin lamentor]

Unicef  abbr. United nations children's (orig. International children's emergency) fund.

Coordinate  (also co-ordinate) —v. (-ting) 1 cause (parts, movements, etc.) To function together efficiently. 2 work or act together effectively. —adj. Equal in rank or importance. —n. 1 math. Each of a system of values used to fix the position of a point, line, or plane. 2 (in pl.) Matching items of clothing.  coordination n. Coordinator n. [latin ordino: related to *order]

Walkabout  n. 1 informal stroll among a crowd by a visiting dignitary. 2 period of wandering in the bush by an australian aboriginal.

Lappet  n. 1 small flap or fold of a garment etc. 2 hanging piece of flesh. [from *lap1]

Upwardly  adv. In an upward direction.

Retainer  n. 1 fee for securing a person's services. 2 faithful servant (esp. Old retainer). 3 reduced rent paid to retain unoccupied accommodation. 4 person or thing that retains.

Honest  —adj. 1 fair and just; not cheating or stealing. 2 free of deceit and untruthfulness; sincere. 3 fairly earned (an honest living). 4 blameless but undistinguished. —adv. Colloq. Genuinely, really. [latin honestus]

Impolitic  adj. Inexpedient, unwise.  impoliticly adv.

Granary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 storehouse for threshed grain. 2 region producing, and esp. Exporting, much corn. [latin: related to *grain]

Pouch  —n. 1 small bag or detachable outside pocket. 2 baggy area of skin under the eyes etc. 3 a pocket-like receptacle of marsupials. B similar structure in various animals, e.g. In the cheeks of rodents. —v. 1 put or make into a pouch. 2 take possession of; pocket. [french: related to *poke2]

Larkspur  n. Plant with a spur-shaped calyx.

Flown  past part. Of *fly1.

Rhinestone  n. Imitation diamond. [river rhine in germany]

Bindweed  n. 1 convolvulus. 2 honeysuckle or other climber.

Certainly  adv. 1 undoubtedly. 2 (in answer) yes; by all means.

Witter  v. (often foll. By on) colloq. Chatter annoyingly or on trivial matters. [origin unknown]

Impressionism  n. 1 style or movement in art concerned with conveying the effect of natural light on objects. 2 style of music or writing seeking to convey esp. Fleeting feelings or experience.  impressionist n. Impressionistic adj.

Woodcutter  n. Person who cuts timber.

Motorman  n. Driver of an underground train, tram, etc.

Distill  v. (brit. Distil) (-ll-) 1 purify or extract the essence from (a substance) by vaporizing and condensing it and collecting the resulting liquid. 2 extract the essential meaning of (an idea etc.). 3 make (whisky, essence, etc.) By distilling raw materials. 4 fall or cause to fall in drops.  distillation n. [latin: related to *de-, stillo drip]

Tulip  n. 1 bulbous spring-flowering plant with showy cup-shaped flowers. 2 its flower. [turkish tul(i)band *turban (from its shape), from persian]

Snooty  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Supercilious; conceited; snobbish.  snootily adv. [origin unknown]

Undeserved  adj. Not deserved.  undeservedly adv.

Coiffure  n. Hairstyle. [french]

Pantaloons  n.pl. (esp. Women's) baggy trousers gathered at the ankles. [french from italian]

Victual  —n. (usu. In pl.) Food, provisions. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 supply with victuals. 2 obtain stores. 3 eat victuals. [latin victus food]

Polytechnic  —n. College offering courses in many (esp. Vocational) subjects up to degree level. —adj. Giving instruction in various vocational or technical subjects. [greek tekhne art]

Pour  v. 1 (usu. Foll. By down, out, over, etc.) Flow or cause to flow esp. Downwards in a stream or shower. 2 dispense (a drink) by pouring. 3 rain heavily. 4 (usu. Foll. By in, out, etc.) Come or go in profusion or rapid succession (the crowd poured out; letters poured in). 5 discharge or send freely. 6 (often foll. By out) utter at length or in a rush (poured out their story). [origin unknown]

Antic  n. (usu. In pl.) Foolish behaviour or action. [italian antico *antique]

Encumber  v. 1 be a burden to. 2 hamper. [french from romanic]

Apocryphal  adj. Of doubtful authenticity.

Dpp  abbr. Director of public prosecutions.

Intonation  n. 1 modulation of the voice; accent. 2 intoning. 3 accuracy of musical pitch. [medieval latin: related to *intone]

Skeptical  adj. (brit. Sceptical) inclined to doubt accepted opinions; critical; incredulous.  sceptically adv.

Countervail  v. Literary 1 counterbalance. 2 (often foll. By against) oppose, usu. Successfully. [latin valeo have worth]

Anchorman  n. Coordinator, esp. As compère in a broadcast.

Pulmonary  adj. 1 of the lungs. 2 having lungs or lunglike organs. 3 affected with or susceptible to lung disease. [latin pulmo -onis lung]

Educationist  n. (also educationalist) expert in educational methods.

Eland  n. (pl. Same or -s) large african antelope. [dutch]

Rompers  n. Pl. (also romper suit) young child's one-piece garment covering the legs and trunk.

Recumbent  adj. Lying down; reclining. [latin cumbo lie]

Unspeakable  adj. 1 that cannot be expressed in words. 2 indescribably bad.  unspeakably adv.

Teeny  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Tiny. [var. Of *tiny]

Valor  n. (brit. Valour) courage, esp. In battle.  valorous adj. [latin valeo be strong]

Steeplejack  n. Repairer of tall chimneys, steeples, etc.

Phallus  n. (pl. Phalli or phalluses) 1 (esp. Erect) penis. 2 image of this as a symbol of natural generative power.  phallic adj. [latin from greek]

Guess  —v. 1 (often absol.) Estimate without calculation or measurement. 2 form a hypothesis or opinion about; conjecture; think likely. 3 conjecture or estimate correctly. 4 (foll. By at) make a conjecture about. —n. Estimate, conjecture.  i guess colloq. I think it likely; i suppose. [origin uncertain]

Insecure  adj. 1 a unsafe; not firm. B (of a surface etc.) Liable to give way. 2 uncertain; lacking confidence.  insecurity n.

Scorpion  n. 1 arachnid with pincers and a jointed stinging tail. 2 (the scorpion) zodiacal sign or constellation scorpio.

Catchment  n. Collection of rainfall.

Totally  adv. Completely.

Masterpiece  n. 1 outstanding piece of artistry or workmanship. 2 person's best work.

Creosote  —n. 1 dark-brown oil distilled from coal tar, used as a wood-preservative. 2 oily fluid distilled from wood tar, used as an antiseptic. —v. (-ting) treat with creosote. [greek kreas flesh, soter preserver, because of its antiseptic properties]

Propaganda  n. 1 organized propagation of a doctrine by use of publicity, selected information, etc. 2 usu. Derog. Ideas etc. So propagated.  propagandist n. & adj. Propagandize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). [latin: related to *propagate]

Lucre  n. Derog. Financial gain. [latin lucrum gain]

Gibberish  n. Unintelligible or meaningless speech; nonsense.

Solemnity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being solemn. 2 rite, ceremony.

Offensive  —adj. 1 causing offence; insulting. 2 disgusting. 3 a aggressive, attacking. B (of a weapon) for attacking. —n. Aggressive action, attitude, or campaign.  offensively adv. Offensiveness n.

Whinchat  n. Small songbird.

Menace  —n. 1 threat. 2 dangerous thing or person. 3 joc. Pest, nuisance. —v. (-cing) threaten.  menacingly adv. [latin minax from minor threaten]

Bigamy  n. (pl. -ies) crime of marrying while still married to another person.  bigamist n. Bigamous adj. [greek gamos marriage]

Handiwork  n. Work done or a thing made by hand, or by a particular person. [old english]

Irrelevant  adj. (often foll. By to) not relevant.  irrelevance n. Irrelevancy n. (pl. -ies).

Protium  n. Ordinary isotope of hydrogen. [latin: related to *proto-]

Serenade  —n. 1 piece of music performed at night, esp. Beneath a lover's window. 2 orchestral suite for a small ensemble. —v. (-ding) perform a serenade to.  serenader n. [italian: related to *serene]

Fermium  n. Transuranic artificial radioactive metallic element. [fermi, name of a physicist]

Mechanics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) 1 branch of applied mathematics dealing with motion etc. 2 science of machinery. 3 routine technical aspects of a thing (mechanics of local government).

Gaiety  n. (us gayety) 1 being gay; mirth. 2 merrymaking. 3 bright appearance. [french: related to *gay]

Shrewd  adj. Astute; clever and judicious.  shrewdly adv. Shrewdness n. [perhaps from obsolete shrew to curse, from *shrew]

Glutamate  n. Salt or ester of glutamic acid, esp. A sodium salt used to enhance the flavour of food.

Stela  n. (pl. Stelae) (also stele) archaeol. Upright slab or pillar usu. Inscribed and sculpted, esp. As a gravestone. [latin and greek]

Frisk  —v. 1 leap or skip playfully. 2 slang search (a person) for a weapon etc. By feeling. —n. 1 playful leap or skip. 2 slang frisking of a person. [french frisque lively]

Abortive  adj. Fruitless, unsuccessful.

Soap  —n. 1 cleansing agent yielding lather when rubbed in water. 2 colloq. = *soap opera. —v. Apply soap to. [old english]

Leak  —n. 1 a hole through which matter passes accidentally in or out. B matter passing through thus. C act of passing through thus. 2 a similar escape of electrical charge. B charge that escapes. 3 disclosure of secret information. —v. 1 a pass through a leak. B lose or admit through a leak. 2 disclose (secret information). 3 (often foll. By out) become known.  have (or take) a leak slang urinate.  leaky adj. (-ier, -iest). [low german or dutch]

Dermis  n. 1 (in general use) the skin. 2 layer of living tissue below the epidermis. [from *epidermis]

Lucrative  adj. Profitable.  lucratively adv. Lucrativeness n. [latin: related to *lucre]

Decompression  n. 1 release from compression. 2 gradual reduction of high pressure on a deep-sea diver etc.

Autocracy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 rule by an autocrat. 2 dictatorship. [greek kratos power]

Pledge  —n. 1 solemn promise. 2 thing given as security against a debt etc. 3 thing put in pawn. 4 thing given as a token of favour etc., or of something to come. 5 drinking of a person's health, toast. 6 solemn promise to abstain from alcohol (sign the pledge). —v. (-ging) 1 a deposit as security. B pawn. 2 promise solemnly by the pledge of (one's honour, word, etc.). 3 bind by a solemn promise. 4 drink to the health of.  pledge one's troth see *troth. [french plege]

Handstand  n. Supporting oneself on one's hands with one's feet in the air.

Overfly  v. (-flies; past -flew; past part. -flown) fly over or beyond (a place or territory).

Ogre  n. (fem. Ogress) 1 man-eating giant in folklore. 2 terrifying person.  ogreish adj. (also ogrish). [french]

Tableau  n. (pl. -x) 1 picturesque presentation. 2 group of silent motionless people representing a scene on stage. [french, = picture, diminutive of *table]

Temperance  n. 1 moderation, esp. In eating and drinking. 2 (often attrib.) Abstinence, esp. Total, from alcohol (temperance hotel). [latin: related to *temper]

Horology  n. Art of measuring time or making clocks, watches, etc.  horological adj. [greek hora time]

Helical  adj. Having the form of a helix.

Outpouring  n. (usu. In pl.) Copious expression of emotion.

Brisling  n. Small herring or sprat. [norwegian and danish]

Triathlon  n. Athletic contest of three events for all competitors. [from *tri- after *decathlon]

Auto  n. (pl. -s) us colloq. Car. [abbreviation of *automobile]

Harmony  n. (pl. -ies) 1 combination of simultaneously sounded musical notes to produce chords and chord progressions, esp. As creating a pleasing effect. 2 a apt or aesthetic arrangement of parts. B pleasing effect of this. 3 agreement, concord.  in harmony 1 in agreement. 2 (of singing etc.) Producing chords; not discordant. [greek harmonia joining]

Baptize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 administer baptism to. 2 give a name or nickname to.

Fealty  n. (pl. -ies) 1 hist. Fidelity to a feudal lord. 2 allegiance. [latin: related to *fidelity]

Unfunny  adj. (-ier, -iest) failing to amuse.

Espadrille  n. Light canvas shoe with a plaited fibre sole. [provençal: related to *esparto]

Shibboleth  n. Long-standing formula, doctrine, or phrase, etc., held to be true by a party or sect. [hebrew (judg. 12:6)]

Delft  n. (also delftware) glazed, usu. Blue and white, earthenware. [delft in holland]

Etiquette  n. Conventional rules of social behaviour or professional conduct. [french: related to *ticket]

Fall  —v. (past fell; past part. Fallen) 1 go or come down freely; descend. 2 (often foll. By over) come suddenly to the ground from loss of balance etc. 3 a hang or slope down. B (foll. By into) (of a river etc.) Discharge into. 4 a sink lower; decline, esp. In power, status, etc. B subside. 5 occur (falls on a monday). 6 (of the face) show dismay or disappointment. 7 yield to temptation. 8 take or have a particular direction or place (his eye fell on me; accent falls on the first syllable). 9 a find a place; be naturally divisible. B (foll. By under, within) be classed among. 10 come by chance or duty (it fell to me to answer). 11 a pass into a specified condition (fell ill). B become (fall asleep). 12 be defeated or captured. 13 die. 14 (foll. By on, upon) a attack. B meet with. C embrace or embark on avidly. 15 (foll. By to + verbal noun) begin (fell to wondering). —n. 1 act of falling. 2 that which falls or has fallen, e.g. Snow. 3 recorded amount of rainfall etc. 4 overthrow (fall of rome). 5 a succumbing to temptation. B (the fall) adam's sin and its results. 6 (also fall) us autumn. 7 (esp. In pl.) Waterfall etc. 8 wrestling-bout; throw in wrestling.  fall about colloq. Be helpless with laughter. Fall away 1 (of a surface) incline abruptly. 2 become few or thin; gradually vanish. 3 desert. Fall back retreat. Fall back on have recourse to in difficulty. Fall behind 1 be outstripped; lag. 2 be in arrears. Fall down (often foll. By on) colloq. Fail. Fall for colloq. Be captivated or deceived by. Fall foul of come into conflict with. Fall in 1 take one's place in military formation. 2 collapse inwards. Fall in with 1 meet by chance. 2 agree with. 3 coincide with. Fall off 1 become detached. 2 decrease, deteriorate. Fall out 1 quarrel. 2 (of the hair, teeth, etc.) Become detached. 3 mil. Come out of formation. 4 result; occur. Fall over backwards see *backwards. Fall over oneself colloq. 1 be eager. 2 stumble through haste, confusion, etc. Fall short be deficient. Fall short of fail to reach or obtain. Fall through fail; miscarry. Fall to begin, e.g. Eating or working. [old english]

Pram  n. Four-wheeled conveyance for a baby, pushed by a person on foot. [abbreviation of *perambulator]

Laureate  —adj. Wreathed with laurel as a mark of honour. —n. = *poet laureate.  laureateship n. [related to *laurel]

Uncharacteristic  adj. Not characteristic.  uncharacteristically adv.

Concave  adj. Curved like the interior of a circle or sphere.  concavity n. [latin: related to *cave]

Cheque  n. 1 written order to a bank to pay the stated sum from the drawer's account. 2 printed form on which this is written. [from *check]

Countermeasure  n. Action taken to counteract a danger, threat, etc.

Within  —adv. 1 inside. 2 indoors. 3 in spirit (pure within). —prep. 1 inside. 2 a not beyond or out of. B not transgressing or exceeding. 3 not further off than (within three miles; within ten days).  within one's grasp close enough to be obtained.

Glee  n. 1 mirth; delight. 2 part-song for three or more (esp. Male) voices. [old english]

Subaquatic  adj. Underwater.

Reformation  n. 1 reforming or being reformed, esp. A radical change for the better in political, religious, or social affairs. 2 (the reformation) hist. 16th-c. Movement for the reform of abuses in the roman church ending in the establishment of the reformed or protestant churches.

Indeterminable  adj. That cannot be ascertained or settled.  indeterminably adv.

Somnambulism  n. Sleepwalking.  somnambulant adj. Somnambulist n. [latin somnus sleep, ambulo walk]

Pied  adj. Particoloured. [from *pie2]

Unpalatable  adj. (of food, an idea, suggestion, etc.) Disagreeable, distasteful.

Tanh  abbr. Hyperbolic tangent.

Entrap  v. (-pp-) 1 catch in or as in a trap. 2 beguile.  entrapment n. [related to *en-1]

Hedgehog  n. Small insect-eating mammal with a piglike snout and a coat of spines, rolling itself up into a ball when attacked.

Extradite  v. (-ting) hand over (a person accused or convicted of a crime) to the foreign state etc. In which the crime was committed.  extradition n. [french: related to *tradition]

Shirr  —n. Elasticated gathered threads in a garment etc. Forming smocking. —v. Gather (material) with parallel threads.  shirring n. [origin unknown]

Soak  —v. 1 make or become thoroughly wet through saturation. 2 (of rain etc.) Drench. 3 (foll. By in, up) absorb (liquid, knowledge, etc.). 4 refl. (often foll. By in) steep (oneself) in a subject etc. 5 (foll. By in, into, through) (of liquid) go or penetrate by saturation. 6 colloq. Extort money from. 7 colloq. Drink heavily. —n. 1 act of soaking; prolonged spell in a bath. 2 colloq. Hard drinker. [old english]

Pintail  n. Duck or grouse with a pointed tail.

Extrapolate  v. (-ting) (also absol.) Calculate approximately from known data etc. (others which lie outside the range of those known).  extrapolation n. [from *extra-, *interpolate]

Hostel  n. 1 house of residence or lodging for students, nurses, etc. 2 = *youth hostel. [medieval latin: related to *hospital]

Calypso  n. (pl. -s) w. Indian song with improvised usu. Topical words and a syncopated rhythm. [origin unknown]

Vouch  v. (foll. By for) answer for, be surety for (will vouch for the truth of this; can vouch for him). [french vo(u)cher summon, invoke]

Impunity  n. Exemption from punishment, bad consequences, etc.  with impunity without punishment etc. [latin poena penalty]

Bronchus  n. (pl. -chi) either of the two main divisions of the windpipe. [latin from greek]

Edam  n. Round dutch cheese with a red rind. [edam in holland]

Wobble  —v. (-ling) 1 sway from side to side. 2 stand or go unsteadily; stagger. 3 waver, vacillate. —n. State or instance of wobbling. [cf. Low german wabbeln]

Disassociate  v. (-ting) = *dissociate.  disassociation n.

Pu  symb.  Plutonium.

Superpower  n. Extremely powerful nation.

Inguinal  adj. Of the groin. [latin inguen groin]

Aggressor  n. Person or party that attacks without provocation.

Coachwork  n. Bodywork of a road or rail vehicle.

Reliquary  n. (pl. -ies) esp. Relig. Receptacle for a relic or relics. [french reliquaire: related to *relic]

Presidency  n. (pl. -ies) 1 office of president. 2 period of this.

Sensibility  n. (pl. -ies) 1 capacity to feel. 2 a sensitiveness. B exceptional degree of this. 3 (in pl.) Tendency to feel offended etc.

Usage  sensibility should not be used in standard english to mean ‘possession of good sense’.

Ache  —n. 1 continuous dull pain. 2 mental distress. —v. (-ching) suffer from or be the source of an ache. [old english]

Vorticist  n.  Futuristic painter, writer, etc., of a school based on the so-called ‘vortices’ of modern civilization.  vorticism n.

Lactation  n. 1 secretion of milk. 2 suckling. [latin: related to *lactic]

Scamp  n. Colloq. Rascal; rogue. [probably dutch]

Czar  var. Of *tsar

Reissue  —v. (-ues, -ued, -uing) issue again or in a different form. —n. New issue, esp. Of a previously published book.

Son  n. 1 boy or man in relation to his parent(s). 2 male descendant. 3 (foll. By of) male member of a family, etc. 4 male descendent or inheritor of a quality etc. (sons of freedom). 5 form of address, esp. To a boy. [old english]

Kingfisher  n. Small bird with brightly coloured plumage, diving for fish etc.

Downpour  n. Heavy fall of rain.

Protector  n. (fem. Protectress) 1 person or thing that protects. 2 hist. Regent ruling during the minority or absence of the sovereign.  protectorship n.

Rend  v. (past and past part. Rent) archaic tear or wrench forcibly. [old english]

Unwonted  adj. Not customary or usual.

Sanitarium  n. (pl. -s or -ria) us = *sanatorium. [related to *sanitary]

Forthcoming  adj. 1 coming or available soon. 2 produced when wanted. 3 (of a person) informative, responsive.

Finish  —v. 1 a (often foll. By off) bring or come to an end or the end of; complete; cease. B (usu. Foll. By off) colloq. Kill; vanquish. C (often foll. By off, up) consume or complete consuming (food or drink). 2 treat the surface of (cloth, woodwork, etc.). —n. 1 a end, last stage, completion. B point at which a race etc. Ends. 2 method, material, etc. Used for surface treatment of wood, cloth, etc. (mahogany finish).  finish up (often foll. By in, by) end (finished up by crying). Finish with have no more to do with, complete using etc. [latin finis end]

Whet  v. (-tt-) 1 sharpen (a tool). 2 stimulate (the appetite or a desire etc.). [old english]

Cabriole  n. A kind of esp. 18th-c. Curved table or chair leg. [french: related to *capriole]

Manna  n. 1 substance miraculously supplied as food to the israelites in the wilderness (exod. 16). 2 unexpected benefit (esp. Manna from heaven). [old english ultimately from hebrew]

Rouge  —n. Red cosmetic for colouring the cheeks. —v. (-ging) 1 colour with or apply rouge. 2 become red, blush. [latin rubeus red]

Radium  n. Radioactive metallic element orig. Obtained from pitchblende etc., used esp. In radiotherapy.

Gruesome  adj. Horrible, grisly, disgusting.  gruesomely adv. [scandinavian]

Swordplay  n. 1 fencing. 2 repartee; lively argument.

Signet  n. Small seal. [french or medieval latin: related to *sign]

Unpasteurized  adj. (also -ised) not pasteurized.

Advise  v. (-sing) 1 (also absol.) Give advice to. 2 recommend (advised me to rest). 3 (usu. Foll. By of, or that + clause) inform. [latin: related to *ad-, video vis- see]

Isle  n. Poet. (and in place-names) island, esp. A small one. [french ile from latin insula]

Senate  n. 1 legislative body, esp. The upper and smaller assembly in the us, france, etc. 2 governing body of a university or (us) a college. 3 ancient roman state council. [latin senatus from senex old man]

Biannual  adj. Occurring etc. Twice a year.

Gauss  n. (pl. Same) unit of magnetic flux density. [gauss, name of a mathematician]

Shirk  v. (also absol.) Avoid (duty, work, etc.).  shirker n. [german schurke scoundrel]

Escarpment  n. Long steep slope at the edge of a plateau etc. [french from italian: related to *scarp]

Weedy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 weak, feeble. 2 having many weeds.

Etch  v. 1 a reproduce (a picture etc.) By engraving it on a metal plate with acid (esp. To print copies). B engrave (a plate) in this way. 2 practise this craft. 3 (foll. By on, upon) impress deeply (esp. On the mind).  etcher n. [dutch etsen]

Partner  —n. 1 person who shares or takes part with another or others, esp. In a business. 2 companion in dancing. 3 player (esp. One of two) on the same side in a game. 4 either member of a married or unmarried couple. —v. Be the partner of. [alteration of parcener joint heir]

Unapproachable  adj. 1 inaccessible. 2 (of a person) unfriendly.

Reupholster  v. Upholster anew.

Botch  (also bodge) —v. 1 bungle; do badly. 2 patch clumsily. —n. Bungled or spoilt work. [origin unknown]

Narrative  —n. Ordered account of connected events. —adj. Of or by narration.

Impetigo  n. Contagious skin infection forming pimples and sores. [latin impeto assail]

Miocene  geol. —adj. Of the fourth epoch of the tertiary period. —n. This epoch. [greek meion less, kainos new]

Saltpetre  n. (us saltpeter) white crystalline salty substance used in preserving meat and in gunpowder. [latin sal petrae, = salt of rock]

Mishit  —v. (-tt-; past and past part. -hit) hit (a ball etc.) Badly. —n. Faulty or bad hit.

Preach  v. 1  (also absol.) Deliver (a sermon); proclaim or expound (the gospel etc.). 2 give moral advice in an obtrusive way. 3 advocate or inculcate (a quality or practice etc.).  preacher n. [latin praedico proclaim]

Dangerous  adj. Involving or causing danger.  dangerously adv.

Unorganized  adj. (also -ised) not organized.

Orris  n. 1 a kind of iris. 2 = *orris root. [alteration of *iris]

Intermezzo  n. (pl. -mezzi or -s) 1 a short connecting instrumental movement in a musical work. B similar independent piece. 2 short light dramatic or other performance inserted between the acts of a play. [italian]

Collectivism  n. Theory and practice of collective ownership of land and the means of production.  collectivist n. & adj.

Women  pl. Of *woman.

Practise  v. (us practice) (-sing or us -cing) 1 perform habitually; carry out in action. 2 do repeatedly as an exercise to improve a skill; exercise oneself in or on (an activity requiring skill). 3 (as practised adj.) Experienced, expert. 4 (also absol.) Be engaged in (a profession, religion, etc.). [latin: related to *practical]

Succinct  adj. Brief; concise.  succinctly adv. Succinctness n. [latin cingo cinct- gird]

Occupation  n. 1 person's employment or profession. 2 pastime. 3 occupying or being occupied. 4 taking or holding of a country etc. By force.

Cid  abbr. Criminal investigation department.

Shriek  —n. Shrill scream or sound. —v. Make or utter in a shriek. [old norse]

Decoke  colloq. —v. (-king) decarbonize. —n. Process of this.

Offend  v. 1 cause offence to, upset. 2 displease, anger. 3 (often foll. By against) do wrong; transgress.  offender n. Offending adj. [latin offendo offens- strike against, displease]

Nitroglycerin  n. (brit. Nitroglycerine) explosive yellow liquid made by reacting glycerol with a mixture of concentrated sulphuric and nitric acids.

Sextet  n. 1 mus. A composition for six performers. B the performers. 2 any group of six. [alteration of *sestet after latin sex six]

Watercourse  n. 1 brook or stream. 2 bed of this.

Starkers  predic. Adj. Slang stark naked.

Durex  n. Propr. Condom. [origin uncertain]

Splenetic  adj. Bad-tempered; peevish.  splenetically adv. [latin: related to *spleen]

Internal  adj. 1 of or situated in the inside or invisible part. 2 of the inside of the body (internal injuries). 3 of a nation's domestic affairs. 4 (of a student) attending a university etc. As well as taking its examinations. 5 used or applying within an organization. 6 a intrinsic. B of the mind or soul.  internality n. Internally adv. [medieval latin internus internal]

Suitcase  n. Case for carrying clothes etc., with a handle and a flat hinged lid.

Ever  adv. 1 at all times; always (ever hopeful; ever after). 2 at any time (have you ever smoked?; nothing ever happens). 3 (used for emphasis) in any way; at all (how ever did you do it?). 4 (in comb.) Constantly (ever-present). 5 (foll. By so, such) colloq. Very; very much (ever so easy; thanks ever so).  did you ever? Colloq. Did you ever hear or see the like? Ever since throughout the period since. [old english]

Usage  when ever is used with a question word for emphasis it is written separately (see sense 2). When used with a relative pronoun or adverb to give it indefinite or general force, ever is written as one word with the relative pronoun or adverb, e.g. However it's done, it's difficult.

Squeak  —n. 1 short high-pitched cry or sound. 2 (also narrow squeak) narrow escape. —v. 1 make a squeak. 2 utter (words) shrilly. 3 (foll. By by, through) colloq. Pass narrowly. 4 slang turn informer. [imitative: related to *squeal, *shriek]

Acuity  n. Sharpness, acuteness. [medieval latin: related to *acute]

Leverage  n. 1 action or power of a lever. 2 power to accomplish a purpose.

Usage  the pronunciation is american because the practice takes place mainly in the us.

Understeer  n. Tendency of a vehicle not to turn sharply enough.

Foremost  —adj. 1 most notable, best. 2 first, front. —adv. Most importantly (first and foremost). [old english]

Vulva  n. (pl. -s)  external female genitals. [latin]

Graph  —n. Diagram showing the relation between variable quantities, usu. Of two variables, each measured along one of a pair of axes. —v. Plot or trace on a graph. [abbreviation of graphic formula]

Footnote  n. Note printed at the foot of a page.

Pantile  n. Curved roof-tile. [from *pan1]

Sore  —adj. 1 (of a part of the body) painful. 2 suffering pain. 3 aggrieved, vexed. 4 archaic grievous or severe (in sore need). —n. 1 inflamed place on the skin or flesh. 2 source of distress or annoyance. —adv. Archaic grievously, severely.  soreness n. [old english]

Areola  n. (pl. -lae) circular pigmented area, esp. Around a nipple.  areolar adj. [latin diminutive of *area]

Activity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being active; busy or energetic action. 2 (often in pl.) Occupation or pursuit (outdoor activities). 3 = *radioactivity.

Window  n. 1 a opening in a wall etc., usu. With glass to admit light etc. B the glass itself. 2 space for display behind the window of a shop. 3 window-like opening. 4 opportunity to learn from observation. 5 transparent part in an envelope showing an address. 6 vdu display showing a particular part of the data.  windowless adj. [old norse, = wind-eye]

Wonder  —n. 1 emotion, esp. Admiration, excited by what is unexpected, unfamiliar, or inexplicable. 2 strange or remarkable thing, specimen, event, etc. 3 (attrib.) Having marvellous or amazing properties etc. (wonder drug; wonder woman). —v. 1 be filled with wonder or great surprise. 2 (foll. By that) be surprised to find. 3 desire or be curious to know (i wonder what the time is).  i shouldn't wonder colloq. I think it likely. No (or small) wonder one cannot be surprised. Work (or do) wonders 1 do miracles. 2 be remarkably effective. [old english]

Fickle  adj. Inconstant, changeable, disloyal.  fickleness n. Fickly adv. [old english]

Stark  —adj. 1 sharply evident (in stark contrast). 2 desolate, bare. 3 absolute (stark madness). —adv. Completely, wholly (stark naked).  starkly adv. Starkness n. [old english]

Crustacean  —n. Esp. Aquatic arthropod with a hard shell, e.g. The crab, lobster, and shrimp. —adj. Of crustaceans.

Hunt  —v. 1 (also absol.) A pursue and kill (wild animals, esp. Foxes, or game) for sport or food. B use (a horse or hounds) for hunting. C (of an animal) chase (its prey). 2 (foll. By after, for) seek, search. 3 (of an engine etc.) Run alternately too fast and too slow. 4 scour (a district) for game. 5 (as hunted adj.) (of a look etc.) Terrified as if being hunted. —n. 1 practice or instance of hunting. 2 a association of people hunting with hounds. B area for hunting.  hunt down pursue and capture.  hunting n. [old english]

Inexpert  adj. Unskilful; lacking expertise.

Inconstant  adj. 1 fickle, changeable. 2 variable, not fixed.  inconstancy n. (pl. -ies).

Crossing  n. 1 place where things (esp. Roads) cross. 2 place for crossing a street etc. 3 journey across water.

Sacred  adj. 1 a (often foll. By to) dedicated to a god. B connected with religion (sacred music). 2 safeguarded or required esp. By tradition; inviolable. [latin sacer holy]

Cockatoo  n. Crested parrot. [dutch from malay]

Typify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 be typical of. 2 represent by or as a type or symbol.  typification n. [latin: related to *type]

Pg  abbr. (of a film) classified as suitable for children subject to parental guidance.

Serum  n. (pl. Sera or -s) 1 liquid that separates from a clot when blood coagulates, esp. Used for inoculation. 2 watery fluid in animal bodies. [latin, = whey]

Emaciate  v. (-ting) (esp. As emaciated adj.) Make abnormally thin or feeble.  emaciation n. [latin macies leanness]

Foxhound  n. A kind of hound bred and trained to hunt foxes.

Nicotine  n. Poisonous alkaloid present in tobacco. [french from nicot, introducer of tobacco into france]

Ruminate  v. (-ting) 1 meditate, ponder. 2 chew the cud.  rumination n. Ruminative adj. [latin rumen throat]

Loud  —adj. 1 strongly audible, noisy. 2 (of colours etc.) Gaudy, obtrusive. —adv. Loudly.  out loud aloud.  loudish adj. Loudly adv. Loudness n. [old english]

Unfasten  v. 1 make or become loose. 2 open the fastening(s) of. 3 detach.

Imperial  adj. 1 of or characteristic of an empire or similar sovereign state. 2 a of an emperor. B majestic, august; authoritative. 3 (of non-metric weights and measures) statutory in the uk, esp. Formerly (imperial gallon).  imperially adv. [latin imperium dominion]

Iconostasis  n. (pl. -stases) (in the eastern church) screen bearing icons. [greek: related to *icon]

Dyslexia  n. Abnormal difficulty in reading and spelling.  dyslectic adj. & n. Dyslexic adj. & n. [greek lexis speech]

Enjoyable  adj. Pleasant.  enjoyably adv.

Fontanelle  n. (us fontanel) membranous space in an infant's skull at the angles of the parietal bones. [latin fontanella little *fountain]

Longshoreman  n. Us docker.

Crucify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 put to death by fastening to a cross. 2 persecute, torment. 3 slang defeat thoroughly; humiliate. [french: related to *crucifix]

Who  abbr. World health organization.

Usable  adj. That can be used.

Sop  —n. 1 thing given or done to pacify or bribe. 2 piece of bread etc. Dipped in gravy etc. —v. (-pp-) 1 (as sopping adj.) Drenched (came home sopping; sopping wet clothes). 2 (foll. By up) soak or mop up. [old english]

Erbium  n. Metallic element of the lanthanide series. [ytterby in sweden]

Quasar  n. Astron. Starlike object with a large redshift. [from quasi-stellar]

Trim  —v. (-mm-) 1 a make neat or of the required size or form, esp. By cutting away irregular or unwanted parts. B set in good order. 2 (foll. By off, away) cut off (unwanted parts). 3 ornament, decorate. 4 adjust the balance of (a ship or aircraft) by arranging its cargo etc. 5 arrange (sails) to suit the wind. 6  a associate oneself with currently prevailing views, esp. To advance oneself. B hold a middle course in politics or opinion. 7 colloq. A rebuke sharply. B thrash. C get the better of in a bargain etc. —n. 1 state of readiness or fitness (in perfect trim). 2 ornament or decorative material. 3 trimming of a person's hair. —adj. (trimmer, trimmest) 1 neat or spruce. 2 in good order; well arranged or equipped. [old english, = make firm]

Overstrung  adj. 1  (of a person, nerves, etc.) Too highly strung. 2  (of a piano) with strings in sets crossing each other obliquely.

Unappreciative  adj. Not appreciative.

Trapeze  n. Crossbar suspended by ropes as a swing for acrobatics etc. [latin: related to *trapezium]

Herbarium  n. (pl. -ria) 1 systematically arranged collection of dried plants. 2 book, room, etc. For these.

Coda  n. 1 mus. Final additional passage of a piece or movement. 2 concluding section of a ballet. [latin cauda tail]

Cereal  —n. 1 a grain used for food. B wheat, maize, rye, etc. Producing this. 2 breakfast food made from a cereal. —adj. Of edible grain. [latin ceres goddess of agriculture]

Elate  v. (-ting) (esp. As elated adj.) Make delighted or proud.  elatedly adv. Elation n. [latin effero elat- raise]

Hydraulics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Science of the conveyance of liquids through pipes etc., esp. As motive power.

Rubato  n. Mus. (pl. -s or -ti) temporary disregarding of strict tempo. [italian, = robbed]

Ophthalmia  n. Inflammation of the eye. [greek ophthalmos eye]

Parlance  n. Vocabulary or idiom of a particular subject, group, etc. [french from parler speak]

Manhood  n. 1 state of being a man. 2 a manliness; courage. B a man's sexual potency. 3 men of a country etc.

Ecliptic  n. Sun's apparent path among the stars during the year.

Unicorn  n. Mythical horse with a single straight horn. [latin cornu horn]

Curium  n. Artificial radioactive metallic element. [m. And p. Curie, name of scientists]

Milli-  comb. Form thousand, esp. Denoting a factor of one thousandth. [latin mille thousand]

Trickle  —v. (-ling) 1 (cause to) flow in drops or a small stream. 2 come or go slowly or gradually (information trickles out). —n. Trickling flow. [probably imitative]

Impala  n. (pl. Same or -s) small african antelope. [zulu]

Blacksmith  n. Smith who works in iron.

Paleface  n. Name supposedly used by n. American indians for the white man.

Stomach  —n. 1 a internal organ in which digestion occurs. B any of several such organs in animals. 2 lower front of the body. 3 (usu. Foll. By for) a appetite. B inclination. —v. 1 find palatable. 2 endure (usu. With neg.: cannot stomach it). [greek stoma mouth]

Olympic  —adj. Of the olympic games. —n.pl. (the olympics) olympic games. [greek from olympia in s. Greece]

Rejoinder  n. What is said in reply; retort. [anglo-french: related to *rejoin2]

Sumptuous  adj. Rich, lavish, costly.  sumptuously adv. Sumptuousness n. [latin: related to *sumptuary]

Wryneck  n. Small woodpecker able to turn its head over its shoulder.

Scurvy  —n. Disease caused by a deficiency of vitamin c. —adj. (-ier, -iest) paltry, contemptible.  scurvily adv. [from *scurf]

Jargon  n. 1 words or expressions used by a particular group or profession (medical jargon). 2 debased or pretentious language. [french]

Hire  —v. (-ring) 1 purchase the temporary use of (a thing) (hired a van). 2 esp. Us employ (a person). —n. 1 hiring or being hired. 2 payment for this.  for (or on) hire ready to be hired. Hire out grant the temporary use of (a thing) for payment.  hireable adj. Hirer n. [old english]

Pipe  —n. 1 tube of metal, plastic, etc., used to convey water, gas, etc. 2 a narrow tube with a bowl at one end containing tobacco for smoking. B quantity of tobacco held by this. 3  a wind instrument of a single tube. B any of the tubes by which sound is produced in an organ. C (in pl.) = *bagpipes. 4 tubular organ, vessel, etc. In an animal's body. 5 high note or song, esp. Of a bird. 6 a boatswain's whistle. B sounding of this. 7 cask for wine, esp. As a measure, usu. = 105 gal. (about 477 litres). —v. (-ping) 1 a convey (oil, water, gas, etc.) By pipes. B provide with pipes. 2 play (a tune etc.) On a pipe or pipes. 3 (esp. As piped adj.) Transmit (recorded music etc.) By wire or cable. 4 (usu. Foll. By up, on, to, etc.) Naut. A summon (a crew). B signal the arrival of (an officer etc.) On board. 5 utter in a shrill voice. 6 decorate or trim with piping. 7 lead or bring (a person etc.) By the sound of a pipe or pipes.  pipe down colloq. Be quiet or less insistent. Pipe up begin to play, sing, speak, etc.  pipeful n. (pl. -s). [latin pipo chirp]

Bunch  —n. 1 things gathered together. 2 collection; lot (best of the bunch). 3 colloq. Group; gang. —v. 1 make into a bunch; gather into close folds. 2 form into a group or crowd. [origin unknown]

Enchanter  n. (fem. Enchantress) person who enchants, esp. By using magic.

Futon  n. Japanese quilted mattress used as a bed; this sold with a low wooden frame, often convertible into a couch. [japanese]

Probable  —adj. (often foll. By that) that may be expected to happen or prove true; likely (the probable explanation; it is probable that they forgot). —n. Probable candidate, member of a team, etc.  probably adv. [latin: related to *prove]

Boogie  v. (-ies, -ied, -ieing) slang dance to pop music.

Liaison  n. 1 communication or cooperation. 2 illicit sexual relationship. [french lier bind: see *liable]

Godless  adj. 1 impious; wicked. 2 without a god. 3 not recognizing god.  godlessness n.

Aright  adv. Rightly.

Payable  adj. That must or may be paid; due (payable in april).

Pharmacopoeia  n. 1 book, esp. One officially published, containing a list of drugs with directions for use. 2 stock of drugs. [greek pharmakopoios drug-maker]

Numerator  n. Number above the line in a vulgar fraction showing how many of the parts indicated by the denominator are taken (e.g. 2 in 2/3). [latin: related to *number]

Phantom  —n. 1 ghost, apparition, spectre. 2 mental illusion. —attrib. Adj. Illusory. [greek phantasma]

Collective  —adj. Of, by, or relating to a group or society as a whole; joint; shared. —n. 1 cooperative enterprise; its members. 2 = *collective noun.  collectively adv.

Smorgasbord  n. Various esp. Savoury dishes as hors d'œuvres or a buffet meal. [swedish]

Copula  n. (pl. -s) connecting word, esp. Part of the verb be connecting subject and predicate. [latin]

Ore  n. Solid rock or mineral from which metal or other valuable minerals may be extracted. [old english]

Boll  n. Round seed-vessel of cotton, flax, etc. [dutch]

Einsteinium  n. Artificial radioactive metallic element. [einstein, name of a physicist]

Porn  (also porno) —n. Colloq. Pornography. —attrib. Adj. Pornographic. [abbreviation]

Bicarb  n. Colloq. = *bicarbonate 2. [abbreviation]

Maximum  —n. (pl. -ma) highest possible amount, size, etc. —adj. Greatest in amount, size, etc. [latin maximus greatest]

Medicinal  adj. (of a substance) healing.  medicinally adv.

Obelisk  n. Tapering usu. Four-sided stone pillar as a monument or landmark. [greek diminutive: related to *obelus]

Nomenclature  n. 1 person's or community's system of names for things. 2 terminology of a science etc. [latin nomen name, calo call]

Pretzel  n. Crisp knot-shaped salted biscuit. [german]

Refresh  v. 1 give new spirit or vigour to. 2 revive (the memory), esp. By consulting the source of one's information.  refreshing adj. Refreshingly adv. [french: related to *fresh]

Caviar  n. (brit. Caviare) pickled roe of sturgeon or other large fish. [italian from turkish]

Miniaturize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) produce in a smaller version; make small.  miniaturization n.

Idiosyncrasy  n. (pl. -ies) attitude, behaviour, or opinion peculiar to a person; anything highly individual or eccentric.  idiosyncratic adj. Idiosyncratically adv. [greek idios private, sun with, krasis mixture]

Stewardess  n. Female steward, esp. On a ship or aircraft.

Unification  n. Unifying or being unified.  unificatory adj.

Onset  n. 1 attack. 2 impetuous beginning.

Loggia  n. Open-sided gallery or arcade. [italian, = *lodge]

Answerable  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By to, for) responsible (answerable to them for any accident). 2 that can be answered.

Empty  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 containing nothing. 2 (of a house etc.) Unoccupied or unfurnished. 3 (of a vehicle etc.) Without passengers etc. 4 a hollow, insincere (empty threats). B without purpose (an empty existence). C vacuous (an empty head). 5 colloq. Hungry. —v. (-ies, -ied) 1 remove the contents of. 2 (often foll. By into) transfer (contents). 3 become empty. 4 (of a river) discharge itself. —n. (pl. -ies) colloq. Empty bottle etc.  emptiness n. [old english]

Ouzo  n. (pl. -s) greek aniseed-flavoured spirit. [greek]

Curacy  n. (pl. -ies) curate's office or tenure of it.

Jockey  —n. (pl. -s) rider in horse-races, esp. Professional. —v. (-eys, -eyed) 1 trick, cheat, or outwit. 2 (foll. By away, out, into, etc.) Manoeuvre (a person).  jockey for position manoeuvre for advantage. [diminutive of *jock]

Nicker  n. (pl. Same) slang pound sterling. [origin unknown]

Ester  n. Chem. A compound produced by replacing the hydrogen of an acid by an organic radical. [german]

Conical  adj. Cone-shaped.

Elect  —v. (usu. Foll. By to + infin.) 1 choose. 2 choose by voting. —adj. 1 chosen. 2 select, choice. 3 (after the noun) chosen but not yet in office (president elect). [latin eligo elect- pick out]

Spineless  adj. 1 having no spine; invertebrate. 2 lacking resolve, feeble.

Lacrimal  var. Of *lachrymal.

Crispbread  n. 1 thin crisp biscuit of crushed rye etc. 2 these collectively (packet of crispbread).

Fir  n. 1 (in full fir-tree) evergreen coniferous tree with needles growing singly on the stems. 2 its wood.  firry adj. [old norse]

Hers  poss. Pron. The one or ones belonging to or associated with her (it is hers; hers are over there).  of hers of or belonging to her (friend of hers).

Cabal  n. 1 secret intrigue. 2 political clique. [french from latin]

Ichneumon  n. 1 (in full ichneumon fly) small wasp depositing eggs in or on the larva of another as food for its own larva. 2 mongoose noted for destroying crocodile eggs. [greek from ikhnos footstep]

Gamin  n. 1 street urchin. 2 impudent child. [french]

Blackcap  n. Small warbler, the male of which has a black-topped head.

Negation  n. 1 absence or opposite of something actual or positive. 2 act of denying. 3 negative statement. 4 negative or unreal thing.

Oldie  n. Colloq. Old person or thing.

Envisage  v. (-ging) 1 have a mental picture of (a thing not yet existing). 2 imagine as possible or desirable. [french: related to *visage]

Lamplight  n. Light from a lamp.

Jitterbug  —n. 1 nervous person. 2 hist. Fast popular dance. —v. (-gg-) hist. Dance the jitterbug.

Armband  n. Band worn around the upper arm to hold up a shirtsleeve, or as identification, or to aid swimming.

Shudder  —v. 1 shiver, esp. Convulsively, from fear, cold, etc. 2 feel strong repugnance, fear, etc. (shudder at the thought). 3 vibrate. —n. 1 act of shuddering. 2 (in pl.; prec. By the) colloq. State of shuddering. [low german or dutch]

Equilateral  adj. Having all its sides equal in length.

Dolt  n. Stupid person.  doltish adj. [apparently related to obsolete dol = *dull]

Why  —adv. 1 for what reason or purpose (why did you do it?; i do not know why you came). 2 (prec. By reason etc.) For which (the reasons why i did it). —int. Expressing: 1 surprised discovery or recognition (why, it's you!). 2 impatience (why, of course i do!). 3 reflection (why, yes, i think so). 4 objection (why, what is wrong with it?).  whys and wherefores reasons; explanation. [old english: related to *what]

Preliminary  —adj. Introductory, preparatory. —n. (pl. -ies) (usu. In pl.) 1 preliminary action or arrangement (dispense with the preliminaries). 2 preliminary trial or contest. [latin limen threshold]

Tyrian  —adj. Of ancient tyre in phoenicia. —n. Native or citizen of tyre. [latin tyrus tyre]

Conscientious  adj. Diligent and scrupulous.  conscientiously adv. Conscientiousness n. [medieval latin: related to *conscience]

Cuisine  n. Style or method of cooking. [french]

-osity  suffix forming nouns from adjectives in -ose and -ous (verbosity; curiosity). [latin -ositas]

Overweight  —adj. Above an allowed or suitable weight. —n. Excess weight; preponderance.

Furl  v. 1 roll up and secure (a sail etc.). 2 become furled. [french ferler]

Plunge  —v. (-ging) 1 (usu. Foll. By in, into) a thrust forcefully or abruptly. B dive. C (cause to) enter a condition or embark on a course impetuously (they plunged into marriage; the room was plunged into darkness). 2 immerse completely. 3 a move suddenly and dramatically downward. B (foll. By down, into, etc.) Move with a rush (plunged down the stairs). 4 colloq. Run up gambling debts. —n. Plunging action or movement; dive.  take the plunge colloq. Take a decisive step. [romanic: related to *plumb]

Planking  n. Planks as flooring etc.

Taxation  n. Imposition or payment of tax. [latin: related to *tax]

Uncaring  adj. Neglectful, lacking compassion.

Ecumenical  adj. 1 of or representing the whole christian world. 2 seeking worldwide christian unity.  ecumenically adv. Ecumenism n. [greek oikoumenikos of the inhabited earth]
