Broach  —v. 1 raise for discussion. 2 pierce (a cask) to draw liquor. 3 open and start using. —n. 1 bit for boring. 2 roasting-spit. [latin broccus projecting]

Hardihood  n. Boldness, daring.

Attenuate  v. (-ting) 1 make thin. 2 reduce in force, value, etc.  attenuation n. [latin tenuis thin]

Discharge  —v. (-ging) 1 release (a prisoner); allow (a patient, jury) to leave. 2 dismiss from office or employment. 3 fire (a gun etc.). 4 throw; eject. 5 emit, pour out (pus etc.). 6 (foll. By into) (of a river etc.) Flow into (esp. The sea). 7 a carry out (a duty or obligation). B relieve oneself of (a debt etc.). C relieve (a bankrupt) of residual liability. 8 law cancel (an order of court). 9 release an electrical charge from. 10 a relieve (a ship etc.) Of cargo. B unload (cargo). —n. 1 discharging or being discharged. 2 certificate of release, dismissal, etc. 3 matter discharged; pus etc. 4 release of an electric charge, esp. With a spark.

Backwoods  n.pl. 1 remote uncleared forest land. 2 remote region.  backwoodsman n.

Filofax  n. Propr. A type of loose-leaf personal organizer. [from *file1, *fact]

Shallot  n. Onion-like plant with a cluster of small bulbs. [french: related to *scallion]

Marzipan  —n. Paste of ground almonds, sugar, etc., used in confectionery. —v. (-nn-) cover with marzipan. [german from italian]

Futuristic  adj. 1 suitable for the future; ultra-modern. 2 of futurism.

Antiquity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 ancient times, esp. Before the middle ages. 2 great age. 3 (usu. In pl.) Relics from ancient times. [latin: related to *antique]

Unpaid  adj. (of a debt or a person) not paid.

Trowel  n. 1 small flat-bladed tool for spreading mortar etc. 2 scoop for lifting small plants or earth. [latin trulla]

Sequester  v. 1 (esp. As sequestered adj.) Seclude, isolate. 2 = *sequestrate. [latin sequester trustee]

Hornet  n. Large wasp capable of inflicting a serious sting. [low german or dutch]

Gondola  n. 1 light flat-bottomed boat used on venetian canals. 2 car suspended from an airship or balloon, or attached to a ski-lift. [italian]

Skateboard  —n. Short narrow board on two pairs of trucks, for riding on while standing. —v. Ride on a skateboard.  skateboarder n.

Egotism  n. 1 self-conceit. 2 selfishness.  egotist n. Egotistic adj. Egotistical adj. Egotistically adv.

Usage  see note at egoism.

Robbery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 act of robbing. 2  colloq. Excessive charge or cost.

Improper  adj. 1 unseemly; indecent. 2 inaccurate, wrong.  improperly adv.

Historic  adj. 1 famous or important in history or potentially so (historic moment). 2 gram. (of a tense) used to narrate past events.

Haggard  adj. Looking exhausted and distraught. [french hagard]

Tonne  n. = *metric ton. [french: related to *ton]

Skylark  —n. Lark that sings while soaring. —v. Play tricks, frolic.

Posture  —n. 1 relative position of parts, esp. Of the body; carriage, bearing. 2 mental attitude. 3 condition or state (of affairs etc.). —v. (-ring) 1 assume a mental or physical attitude, esp. For effect. 2 pose (a person).  postural adj. [latin: related to *posit]

Loath  predic. Adj. (also loth) disinclined, reluctant (loath to admit it). [old english]

Wigwam  n. N. American indian's hut or tent. [ojibwa]

Mockingbird  n. Bird that mimics the notes of other birds.

Linchpin  n. 1 pin passed through an axle-end to keep a wheel in position. 2 person or thing vital to an organization etc. [old english lynis = axle-tree]

Bruiser  n. Colloq. 1 large tough-looking person. 2 professional boxer.

Poplar  n. Tall slender tree with a straight trunk and often tremulous leaves. [latin populus]

Phonology  n. The study of sounds in language or a particular language; a language's sound system.  phonological adj.

Biosynthesis  n. Production of organic molecules by living organisms.  biosynthetic adj.

Weary  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 very tired after exertion or endurance. 2 (foll. By of) no longer interested in, tired of. 3 tiring, tedious. —v. (-ies, -ied) make or grow weary.  wearily adv. Weariness n. [old english]

Dartboard  n. Circular target in darts.

Experiment  —n. Procedure adopted in the hope of success, or for testing a hypothesis etc., or to demonstrate a known fact. —v. (often foll. By on, with) make an experiment.  experimentation n. Experimenter n. [latin: related to *experience]

Buttock  n. 1 each of the two fleshy protuberances at the rear of the human trunk. 2 corresponding part of an animal. [butt ridge]

Designedly  adv. On purpose.

Pancake  n. 1 thin flat cake of fried batter usu. Rolled up with a filling. 2 flat cake of make-up etc.

Impure  adj. 1 adulterated. 2 dirty. 3 unchaste.

Jinx  colloq. —n. Person or thing that seems to cause bad luck. —v. (esp. As jinxed adj.) Subject to bad luck. [perhaps var. Of jynx wryneck, charm]

Jeroboam  n. Wine bottle of 4–12 times the ordinary size. [jeroboam in the old testament]

Remonstrate  v. (-ting) (foll. By with) make a protest; argue forcibly.  remonstrance n. Remonstration n. [medieval latin monstro show]

Gryphon  var. Of *griffin.

Roughly  adv. 1 in a rough manner. 2 approximately (roughly 20 people).  roughly speaking approximately.

Enumerate  v. (-ting) 1 specify (items). 2 count.  enumeration n. Enumerative adj. [latin: related to *number]

Dissimulate  v. (-ting) dissemble.  dissimulation n. [latin: related to *dissemble]

Binomial  —n. Algebraic expression of the sum or the difference of two terms. —adj. Of two terms. [greek nomos part]

Catatonia  n. 1 schizophrenia with intervals of catalepsy and sometimes violence. 2 catalepsy.  catatonic adj. & n. [greek: related to *cata-, *tone]

Amoeba  n. (pl. -s) microscopic aquatic amorphous one-celled organism.  amoebic adj. [greek, = change]

Greenfly  n. 1 green aphid. 2 these collectively.

Cognoscente  n. (pl. -ti) connoisseur. [italian]

Randy  adj. (-ier, -iest) eager for sexual gratification, lustful.  randily adv. Randiness n. [perhaps related to *rant]

Gemini  n. (pl. -s) 1 constellation and third sign of the zodiac (the twins). 2 person born when the sun is in this sign. [latin, = twins]

Cannery  n. (pl. -ies) canning-factory.

Cringe  v. (-ging) 1 shrink in fear; cower. 2 (often foll. By to) behave obsequiously. [related to *crank]

Mastery  n. 1 control, dominance. 2 (often foll. By of) comprehensive knowledge or skill.

Varicoloured  adj. (us varicolored) 1 variegated in colour. 2 of various colours. [latin varius *various]

Diatom  n. One-cell alga found as plankton and forming fossil deposits. [greek, = cut in half]

Percentile  n. Statistics 1 each of 99 points at which a range of data is divided to make 100 groups of equal size. 2 each of these groups.

Telesales  n.pl. Selling by telephone.

Mode  n. 1 way in which a thing is done. 2 prevailing fashion or custom. 3 mus. Any of several types of scale. [french and latin modus measure]

Slaughter  —v. 1 kill (animals) for food or skins or because of disease. 2 kill (people) ruthlessly or on a great scale. 3 colloq. Defeat utterly. —n. Act of slaughtering.  slaughterer n. [old norse: related to *slay]

Nucleus  n. (pl. Nuclei) 1 a central part or thing round which others are collected. B kernel of an aggregate or mass. 2 initial part meant to receive additions. 3 central core of an atom. 4 large dense part of a cell, containing the genetic material. [latin, = kernel, diminutive of nux nuc- nut]

Kept  past and past part. Of *keep.

Strap  —n. 1 strip of leather etc., often with a buckle, for holding things together etc. 2 narrow strip of fabric worn over the shoulders as part of a garment. 3 loop for grasping to steady oneself in a moving vehicle. 4 (the strap) punishment by beating with a leather strap. —v. (-pp-) 1 (often foll. By down, up, etc.) Secure or bind with a strap. 2 beat with a strap.  strapless adj. [dial., = *strop]

Pinko  adj. (pl. -s) esp. Us slang socialist.

Ukulele  n. Small four-stringed hawaiian guitar. [hawaiian]

Receiver  n. 1 person or thing that receives. 2 part of a machine or instrument that receives something (esp. The part of a telephone that contains the earpiece). 3 (in full official receiver) person appointed by a court to administer the property of a bankrupt or insane person, or property under litigation. 4 radio or television receiving apparatus. 5 person who receives stolen goods.

Prussian  —adj. Of prussia, or esp. Its rigidly militaristic tradition. —n. Native of prussia. [prussia, former german state]

Utmost  —attrib. Adj. Furthest, extreme, greatest. —n. Utmost point or degree etc.  do one's utmost do all that one can. [old english, = outmost]

Undercoat  n. 1 a layer of paint under a topcoat. B paint for this. 2 animal's under layer of hair etc.

Solution  n. 1 solving or means of solving a problem. 2 a conversion of a solid or gas into a liquid by mixture with a liquid. B state resulting from this. 3 dissolving or being dissolved.

Lurcher  n. Crossbred dog, usu. A working dog crossed with a greyhound. [related to *lurk]

Contrary  —adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By to) opposed in nature or tendency. 2  perverse, self-willed. 3 (of a wind) unfavourable, impeding. 4 opposite in position or direction. —n. (prec. By the) the opposite. —adv. (foll. By to) in opposition or contrast (contrary to expectations).  on the contrary expressing denial of what has just been implied or stated. To the contrary to the opposite effect.  contrariness n. [latin: related to *contra-]

Government  n. 1 act or manner of governing. 2 system by which a state is governed. 3 a body of persons governing a state. B (usu. Government) particular ministry in office. 4 the state as an agent.  governmental adj.

Westernize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) influence with, or convert to, the ideas and customs etc. Of the west.

Imprint  —v. 1 (often foll. By on) impress firmly, esp. On the mind. 2 a (often foll. By on) make a stamp or impression of (a figure etc.) On a thing. B make an impression on (a thing) with a stamp etc. —n. 1 impression, stamp. 2 printer's or publisher's name etc. Printed in a book.

Usage  see note at imprimatur.

Indoctrinate  v. (-ting) teach to accept a particular belief uncritically.  indoctrination n.

Headbanger  n. Slang 1 person who shakes his or her head violently to the rhythm of music; fan of loud music. 2 crazy or eccentric person.

Glare  —v. (-ring) 1 look fiercely or fixedly. 2 shine dazzlingly or oppressively. —n. 1 a strong fierce light, esp. Sunshine. B oppressive public attention (glare of publicity). 2 fierce or fixed look. 3 tawdry brilliance. [low german or dutch]

Expeditious  adj. Acting or done with speed and efficiency.

Disregard  —v. 1 ignore. 2 treat as unimportant. —n. Indifference; neglect.

Hooker  n. 1 rugby player in the front row of the scrum who tries to hook the ball. 2 slang prostitute.

Medicament  n. = *medicine 2.

Voodoo  —n. Religious witchcraft as practised esp. In the w. Indies. —v. (-doos, -dooed) affect by voodoo; bewitch. [dahomey]

Incise  v. (-sing) 1 make a cut in. 2 engrave. [latin caedo cut]

Nectarine  n. Smooth-skinned variety of peach. [from *nectar]

Damascene  —v. (-ning) decorate (metal) by etching or inlaying esp. With gold or silver. —n. Design or article produced in this way. —adj. Of this process. [damascus in syria]

Bint  n. Slang, usu. Offens. Girl or woman. [arabic]

Susceptible  adj. 1 impressionable, sensitive, emotional. 2 (predic.) A (foll. By to) liable or vulnerable to. B (foll. By of) allowing; admitting of (proof etc.).  susceptibly adv. [latin suscipio -cept- take up]

Egoism  n. 1 self-interest as the moral basis of behaviour. 2 systematic selfishness. 3 = *egotism.  egoist n. Egoistic adj. Egoistical adj. Egoistically adv.

Usage  the senses of egoism and egotism overlap, but egoism alone is used as a term in philosophy and psychology to mean self-interest (often contrasted with altruism).

Very  —adv. 1 in a high degree (did it very easily). 2 in the fullest sense (foll. By own or superl. Adj.: do your very best; my very own room). —adj. Actual; truly such (the very thing we need; his very words; the very same).  not very in a low degree, far from being. Very good (or well) formula of consent or approval. Very high frequency (in radio) 30-300 megahertz. Very reverend title of a dean. [latin verus true]

Songster  n. (fem. Songstress) 1 singer. 2 songbird.

Sushi  n. Japanese dish of balls of cold rice topped with raw fish etc. [japanese]

Horde  n. Usu. Derog. Large group, gang. [turkish ordu camp]

Quest  —n. 1 search or seeking. 2 thing sought, esp. By a medieval knight. —v. (often foll. By about) go about in search of something (esp. Of dogs seeking game). [latin quaero quaesit- seek]

Kudu  n. (also koodoo) (pl. Same or -s) african antelope with white stripes and corkscrew-shaped ridged horns. [xhosa]

Spermicide  n. Substance able to kill spermatozoa.  spermicidal adj.

Twilit  adj. Dimly illuminated by twilight.

Marsh  n. (often attrib.) Low watery land.  marshy adj. (-ier, -iest). Marshiness n. [old english]

-ician  suffix forming nouns denoting persons skilled in subjects having nouns usu. Ending in -ic or -ics (magician; politician). [french -icien]

Turbid  adj. 1 (of a liquid or colour) muddy, thick; not clear. 2 (of style etc.) Confused, disordered.  turbidity n. [latin turba crowd]

Usage  turbid is sometimes confused with turgid which means ‘swollen, inflated; pompous’.

Pincers  n.pl. 1 (also pair of pincers) gripping-tool resembling scissors but with blunt jaws. 2 front claws of lobsters and some other crustaceans. [related to *pinch]

Fiddle  —n. 1 colloq. Or derog. Stringed instrument played with a bow, esp. A violin. 2 colloq. Cheat or fraud. 3 fiddly task. —v. (-ling) 1 a (often foll. By with, at) play restlessly. B (often foll. By about) move aimlessly; waste time. C (usu. Foll. By with) adjust, tinker; tamper. 2 slang a cheat, swindle. B falsify. C get by cheating. 3 play (a tune) on the fiddle.  as fit as a fiddle in very good health. Play second (or first) fiddle take a subordinate (or leading) role. [old english]

Adobe  n. 1 sun-dried brick. 2 clay for making these. [spanish]

Commanding  adj. 1 exalted, impressive. 2 (of a position) giving a wide view. 3 (of an advantage etc.) Substantial (commanding lead).

Deadlock  —n. 1 state of unresolved conflict. 2 lock requiring a key to open or close it. —v. Bring or come to a standstill.

Unedifying  adj. Distasteful, degrading.

Thai  —n. (pl. Same or -s) 1 a native or national of thailand. B person of thai descent. 2 language of thailand. —adj. Of thailand. [thai, = free]

Earthy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of or like earth or soil. 2 coarse, crude (earthy humour).  earthiness n.

Food  n. 1 a substance taken in to maintain life and growth. B solid food (food and drink). 2 mental stimulus (food for thought). [old english]

Concord  n. Agreement, harmony.   concordant adj. [latin cor cord- heart]

Gambit  n. 1 chess opening in which a player sacrifices a piece or pawn to secure an advantage. 2 opening move in a discussion etc. 3 trick or device. [italian gambetto tripping up]

Dismantle  v. (-ling) 1 take to pieces; pull down. 2 deprive of defences or equipment.

Sisyphean  adj. (of toil) endless and fruitless like that of sisyphus (who endlessly pushed a stone uphill in hades). [latin from greek]

Brewery  n. (pl. -ies) factory for brewing beer etc.

Fermentation  n. 1 breakdown of a substance by yeasts and bacteria etc., esp. Of sugar in making alcohol. 2 agitation, excitement.  fermentative adj. [latin: related to *ferment]

Infection  n. 1 a infecting or being infected. B instance of this; disease. 2 communication of disease, esp. By air, water, etc.

Scalar  math. & physics —adj. (of a quantity) having only magnitude, not direction. —n. Scalar quantity. [latin: related to *scale3]

Gecko  n. (pl. -s) tropical house-lizard. [malay]

Flews  n.pl. Hanging lips of a bloodhound etc. [origin unknown]

Unbearable  adj. Unendurable.  unbearably adv.

Cistus  n. Shrub with large white or red flowers. [latin from greek]

Cruciform  adj. Cross-shaped. [latin crux crucis cross]

Paralyse  v. (us paralyze) (-sing or -zing) 1 affect with paralysis. 2 render powerless; cripple. [greek: related to *para-1, luo loosen]

Buster  n. Esp. Us slang mate; fellow. [from *bust2]

Enjoy  v. 1 take pleasure in. 2 have the use or benefit of. 3 experience (enjoy good health).  enjoy oneself experience pleasure.  enjoyment n. [french]

Lechery  n. Excessive sexual desire.

Deceased  formal —adj. Dead. —n. (usu. Prec. By the) person who has died, esp. Recently.

Foundation  n. 1 a solid ground or base beneath a building. B (usu. In pl.) Lowest part of a building, usu. Below ground level. 2 material base. 3 basis, underlying principle. 4 a establishing (esp. An endowed institution). B college, hospital, etc. So founded; its revenues. 5 (in full foundation garment) woman's supporting undergarment, e.g. A corset. [latin: related to *found2]

Sideline  n. 1 work etc. Done in addition to one's main activity. 2 (usu. In pl.) A line bounding the side of a hockey-pitch etc. B space next to these where spectators etc. Sit.  on the sidelines not directly concerned.

Wombat  n. Burrowing plant-eating australian marsupial. [aboriginal]

Lackey  n. (pl. -s) 1 servile follower; toady. 2 footman, manservant. [catalan alacay]

Discontinuous  adj. Lacking continuity; intermittent.  discontinuity n.

Soldier  —n. 1 member of an army. 2 (in full common soldier) private or nco in an army.  3 colloq. Finger of bread for dipping into egg. —v. Serve as a soldier.  soldier on colloq. Persevere doggedly.  soldierly adj. [french soulde, originally = soldier's pay]

Snicker  n. & v. = *snigger. [imitative]

Combings  n.pl. Hairs combed off.

Hickory  n. (pl. -ies) 1 n. American tree yielding wood and nutlike edible fruits. 2 the tough heavy wood of this. [virginian pohickery]

Perceptible  adj. Capable of being perceived by the senses or intellect.  perceptibility n. Perceptibly adv. [latin: related to *perceive]

Wheatear  n. Small migratory bird. [related to *white, *arse]

Trolley  n. (pl. -s) 1  table, stand, or basket on wheels or castors for serving food, transporting luggage etc., gathering purchases in a supermarket, etc. 2  low truck running on rails. 3 (in full trolley-wheel) wheel attached to a pole etc. Used for collecting current from an overhead electric wire to drive a vehicle. [dial., perhaps from *troll2]

Reunify  v. (-ies, -ied) restore (esp. Separated territories) to a political unity.  reunification n.

Less  —adj. 1 smaller in extent, degree, duration, number, etc. 2 of smaller quantity, not so much (less meat). 3 colloq. Fewer (less biscuits). —adv. To a smaller extent, in a lower degree. —n. Smaller amount, quantity, or number (will take less; for less than £10). —prep. Minus (made £1,000 less tax). [old english]

Usage  the use of less to mean ‘fewer’, as in sense 3, is regarded as incorrect in standard english.

Equiangular  adj. Having equal angles.

Unputdownable  adj. Colloq. (of a book) compulsively readable.

Mildly  adv. In a mild fashion.  to put it mildly as an understatement.

Detection  n. 1 detecting or being detected. 2 work of a detective.

Exiguous  adj. Scanty, small.  exiguity n. [latin]

Brownie  n. 1 (in full brownie guide) junior guide. 2 (brownie) small square of chocolate cake with nuts. 3 (brownie) benevolent elf.

Rotor  n. 1 rotary part of a machine. 2 rotary aerofoil on a helicopter, providing lift. [related to *rotate]

Unfrequented  adj. Not frequented.

Tawdry  adj. (-ier, -iest) showy but worthless; gaudy.  tawdrily adv. Tawdriness n. [tawdry lace from st audrey's lace]

Causation  n. 1 act of causing. 2 = *causality.

Encyclopedic  adj. (also -paedic) (of knowledge or information) comprehensive.

Marigold  n. Plant with golden or bright yellow flowers. [mary (probably the virgin), gold (dial.) Marigold]

Preferable  adj. To be preferred; more desirable.  preferably adv.

Playful  adj. 1 fond of or inclined to play. 2 done in fun.  playfully adv. Playfulness n.

Shortening  n. Fat for pastry.

Trampoline  —n. Strong fabric sheet connected by springs to a horizontal frame, used for gymnastic jumping. —v. (-ning) use a trampoline. [italian trampolino]

Rosin  —n. Resin, esp. In solid form. —v. (-n-) rub (esp. A violin bow etc.) With rosin. [alteration of *resin]

Saracen  n.  Hist. Arab or muslim at the time of the crusades. [greek sarakenos]

Copperplate  n. 1 a polished copper plate for engraving or etching. B print made from this. 2 ornate style of handwriting.

Rowan  n. (in full rowan-tree) 1 scot. & n.engl. Mountain ash. 2 (in full rowan-berry) its scarlet berry. [scandinavian]

Aerial  —n. Device for transmitting or receiving radio waves. —adj. 1 by or from the air; involving aircraft (aerial attack). 2 existing in the air. 3 of or like air. [greek: related to *air]

Sign  —n. 1 thing indicating a quality, state, future event, etc. (sign of weakness). 2 mark, symbol, etc. 3 gesture or action conveying an order etc. 4 signboard; signpost. 5 each of the twelve divisions of the zodiac. —v. 1 a (also absol.) Write (one's name) on a document etc. As authorization. B sign (a document) as authorization. 2 communicate by gesture (signed to me to come). 3 engage or be engaged by signing a contract etc. (see also sign on, sign up).  sign away relinquish (property etc.) By signing. Sign in 1 sign a register on arrival. 2 get (a person) admitted by signing a register. Sign off 1 end work, broadcasting, etc. 2 withdraw one's claim to unemployment benefit after finding work. Sign on 1 agree to a contract etc. 2 employ (a person). 3 register as unemployed. Sign out sign a register on departing. Sign up 1 engage (a person). 2 enlist in the armed forces. 3 enrol. [latin signum]

Proportion  —n. 1 a comparative part or share (large proportion of the profits). B comparative ratio (proportion of births to deaths). 2 correct or pleasing relation of things or parts of a thing (has fine proportions; exaggerated out of all proportion). 3 (in pl.) Dimensions; size (large proportions). 4 math. Equality of ratios between two pairs of quantities, e.g. 3:5 and 9:15. —v. (usu. Foll. By to) make proportionate (proportion the punishment to the crime). [latin: related to *portion]

Selection  n. 1 selecting or being selected. 2 selected person or thing. 3 things from which a choice may be made. 4 evolutionary process by which some species thrive better than others.

Edgy  adj. (-ier, -iest) irritable; anxious.  edgily adv. Edginess n.

Hue  n. 1 colour, tint. 2 variety or shade of colour. [old english]

Coefficient  n. 1 math. Quantity placed before and multiplying an algebraic expression. 2 physics multiplier or factor by which a property is measured (coefficient of expansion). [related to *co-, *efficient]

-ment  suffix 1 forming nouns expressing the means or result of verbal action (abridgement; embankment). 2 forming nouns from adjectives (merriment; oddment). [latin -mentum]

Lunation  n. Interval between new moons, about 291/2 days. [medieval latin: related to *lunar]

Vigor  n. (brit. Vigour) 1 physical or mental strength or energy. 2 healthy growth. 3 forcefulness; trenchancy, animation.  vigorous adj. Vigorously adv. [french from latin vigeo be lively]

Cupric  adj. Of copper.

Venom  n. 1 poisonous fluid of esp. Snakes. 2 malignity; virulence.  venomous adj. Venomously adv. [latin venenum]

Aught  n. Archaic anything. [old english]

Woe  n. 1 affliction; bitter grief. 2 (in pl.) Calamities.  woe betide see *betide. Woe is me alas. [old english]

Bouillon  n. Clear broth. [french bouillir to boil]

Iffy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Uncertain; dubious.

Cutler  n. Person who makes or deals in knives etc. [latin cultellus diminutive: related to *coulter]

Sneer  —n. Contemptuous smile or remark. —v. 1 (often foll. By at) smile or speak derisively. 2 say with a sneer.  sneering adj. Sneeringly adv. [origin unknown]

Thousand  adj. & n. (pl. Thousands or (in sense 1) thousand) (in sing. Prec. By a or one) 1 ten hundred. 2 symbol for this (1,000, m, m). 3 (in sing. Or pl.) Colloq. Large number.  thousandfold adj. & adv. Thousandth adj. & n. [old english]

Oddment  n. 1 odd article; something left over. 2 (in pl.) Miscellaneous articles.

Mislead  v. (past and past part. -led) cause to infer what is not true; deceive. misleading adj. [old english]

Sharpshooter  n. Skilled marksman.

Litany  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a series of supplications to god recited by a priest etc. With set responses by the congregation. B (the litany) that in the book of common prayer. 2 tedious recital (litany of woes). [greek litaneia prayer]

Merit  —n. 1 quality of deserving well. 2 excellence, worth. 3 (usu. In pl.) A thing that entitles one to reward or gratitude. B intrinsic rights and wrongs (merits of a case).  —v. (-t-) deserve. [latin meritum value, from mereor deserve]

Appraisal  n. Appraising or being appraised.

Tweezers  n.pl. Small pair of pincers for taking up small objects, plucking out hairs, etc. [originally tweezes pl. Of obsolete tweeze, a case for small instruments]

Thaw  —v. 1 (often foll. By out) pass from a frozen into a liquid or unfrozen state. 2 (usu. Prec. By it as subject) (of the weather) become warm enough to melt ice etc. 3 become warm enough to lose numbness etc.

Piteous  adj. Deserving or arousing pity; wretched.  piteously adv. Piteousness n. [romanic: related to *pity]

Hematology  n. (brit. Haem-) the study of the blood.  haematologist n.

July  n. (pl. Julys) seventh month of the year. [latin julius caesar]

Geriatrics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Branch of medicine or social science dealing with the health and care of old people.  geriatrician n.

Marine  —adj. 1 of, found in, or produced by the sea. 2 a of shipping or naval matters (marine insurance). B for use at sea. —n. 1 soldier trained to serve on land or sea. 2 country's shipping, fleet, or navy (merchant marine). [latin mare sea]

Zeppelin  n. Large dirigible german airship of the early 20th c. [count f. Von zeppelin, name of an airman]

Rotavator  n. (also rotovator) propr. Machine with a rotating blade for breaking up or tilling the soil. [from *rotary, *cultivator]

Online  computing —adj. Directly connected, so that a computer immediately receives an input from or sends an output to a peripheral process etc.; carried out while so connected or under direct computer control. —adv. With the processing of data carried out simultaneously with its production; while connected to a computer; under direct computer control.

Calorie  n. (pl. -ies) unit of quantity of heat, the amount needed to raise the temperature of one gram (small calorie) or one kilogram (large calorie) of water by 1 °c. [latin calor heat]

Bastinado  —n. Beating with a stick on the soles of the feet. —v. (-es, -ed) punish in this way. [spanish baston stick]

Homophobia  n. Hatred or fear of homosexuals.  homophobe n. Homophobic adj.

Quisling  n. Traitor, collaborator. [quisling, name of a norwegian officer and collaborator with the nazis]

Stringent  adj. (of rules etc.) Strict, precise; leaving no loophole for discretion.  stringency n. Stringently adv. [latin: related to *strict]

Incapacitate  v. (-ting) make incapable or unfit.

Tousle  v. (-ling) 1 make (esp. The hair) untidy. 2 handle roughly. [dial. Touse]

Polysyllable  n. Polysyllabic word.

Storey  n. (pl. -s) 1 = *floor n. 3. 2 thing forming a horizontal division.  -storeyed adj. (in comb.). [anglo-latin: related to *history, perhaps originally meaning a tier of painted windows]

Instability  n. 1 lack of stability. 2 unpredictability in behaviour etc.

Odd  adj. 1 strange, remarkable, eccentric. 2 casual, occasional (odd jobs; odd moments). 3 not normally considered; unconnected (in some odd corner; picks up odd bargains). 4 a (of numbers) not integrally divisible by two, e.g. 1, 3, 5. B bearing such a number (no parking on odd dates). 5 left over when the rest have been distributed or divided into pairs (odd sock). 6 detached from a set or series (odd volumes). 7 (appended to a number, sum, weight, etc.) Somewhat more than (forty odd; forty-odd people). 8 by which a round number, given sum, etc., is exceeded (we have 102 – do you want the odd 2?).  oddly adv. Oddness n. [old norse oddi angle, point, third or odd number]

Moire  n. (in full moire antique) watered fabric, usu. Silk. [french: related to *mohair]

Rife  predic. Adj. 1 of common occurrence; widespread. 2 (foll. By with) abounding in. [old english, probably from old norse]

Maim  v. Cripple, disable, mutilate. [french mahaignier]

Verb  n. Word used to indicate action, a state, or an occurrence (e.g. Hear, be, happen). [latin verbum word]

Seemly  adj. (-ier, -iest) in good taste; decorous.  seemliness n. [old norse: related to *seem]

Remainder  —n. 1 residue. 2 remaining persons or things. 3 number left after division or subtraction. 4 copies of a book left unsold when demand has almost ceased. —v. Dispose of (a remainder of books) at a reduced price. [anglo-french: related to *remain]

Debonair  adj. 1 cheerful, self-assured. 2 pleasant-mannered. [french]

Anion  n. Negatively charged ion.  anionic adj. [greek ana up, *ion]

Paling  n. 1 fence of pales. 2 pale.

Rapist  n. Person who commits rape.

Nuts  predic. Adj. Slang crazy, mad. be nuts about (or on) colloq. Be very fond of. [pl. Of *nut]

Won  past and past part. Of *win.

Moonshot  n. Launching of a spacecraft to the moon.

Bung  —n. Stopper, esp. For a cask. —v. 1 stop with a bung. 2 slang throw.  bunged up blocked up. [dutch]

Monarch  n. Sovereign with the title of king, queen, emperor, empress, or equivalent.  monarchic adj. Monarchical adj. [greek: related to *mono-, arkho rule]

Temptation  n. 1 tempting or being tempted; incitement, esp. To wrongdoing. 2 attractive thing or course of action. 3 archaic putting to the test.

Bandstand  n. Outdoor platform for musicians.

Couscous  n. N. African dish of crushed wheat or coarse flour steamed over broth, often with meat or fruit added. [french from arabic]

Vicarage  n. Vicar's house.

Goitre  n. (us goiter) morbid enlargement of the thyroid gland. [latin guttur throat]

Deposit  —n. 1 a money in a bank account. B anything stored for safe keeping. 2 a payment made as a pledge for a contract or as an initial part payment for a thing bought. B returnable sum paid on the hire of an item. 3 a natural layer of sand, rock, coal, etc. B layer of accumulated matter on a surface. —v. (-t-) 1 a put or lay down (deposited the book on the shelf). B (of water etc.) Leave (matter etc.) Lying. 2 a store or entrust for keeping. B pay (a sum of money) into a bank account. 3 pay (a sum) as part of a larger sum or as a pledge for a contract. [latin pono posit- put]

Dissyllable  var. Of *disyllable.

Repulsion  n. 1 aversion, disgust. 2 physics tendency of bodies to repel each other.

Grits  n.pl. 1 coarsely ground grain, esp. Oatmeal. 2 oats that have been husked but not ground. [old english]

Oxhide  n. 1 hide of an ox. 2 leather from this.

Vinous  adj. 1 of, like, or due to wine. 2 addicted to wine. [latin vinum wine]

Canyon  n. (also cañon) deep gorge. [spanish cañón tube]

Citation  n. 1 citing; passage cited. 2 mil. Mention in dispatches. 3 description of the reasons for an award.

Sedum  n. Fleshy-leaved plant with yellow, pink, or white flowers, e.g. The stonecrop. [latin, = houseleek]

Gallic  adj. 1 french or typically french. 2 of gaul or the gauls. [latin gallicus]

Canister  n. 1 small container for tea etc. 2 cylinder of shot, tear-gas, etc., exploding on impact. [greek kanastron wicker basket]

Suggestive  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By of) hinting (at). 2 (of a remark, joke, etc.) Indecent.  suggestively adv.

Bioengineering  n. 1 the application of engineering techniques to biological processes. 2 the use of artificial tissues, organs, etc. To replace parts of the body, e.g. Artificial limbs, pacemakers, etc.

Intercourse  n. 1 communication or dealings between individuals, nations, etc. 2 = *sexual intercourse. [latin: related to *course]

Undeniable  adj. Indisputable; certain.  undeniably adv.

Gearwheel  n. Toothed wheel in a set of gears.

Amendment  n. Minor alteration or addition in a document, resolution, etc.

Dunlin  n. Red-backed sandpiper. [probably from *dun]

Disagree  v. (-ees, -eed, -eeing) (often foll. By with) 1 hold a different opinion. 2 (of factors) not correspond. 3 upset (onions disagree with me).  disagreement n.

Congenial  adj. 1 (often foll. By with, to) pleasant because like-minded. 2 (often foll. By to) suited or agreeable.  congeniality n. Congenially adv. [from *com-, *genial]

Extenuate  v. (often as extenuating adj.) Make (guilt or an offence) seem less serious by reference to another factor.  extenuation n. [latin tenuis thin]

Kiddie  n. (also kiddy) (pl. -ies) slang = *kid1 n. 3.

Despite  prep. In spite of. [latin: related to *despicable]

Course  —n. 1 onward movement or progression. 2 direction taken (changed course). 3 stretch of land or water for races; golf-course. 4 series of lessons etc. In a particular subject. 5 each successive part of a meal. 6 sequence of medical treatment etc. 7 line of conduct. 8 continuous horizontal layer of masonry, brick, etc. 9 channel in which water flows. —v. (-sing) 1 (esp. Of liquid) run, esp. Fast. 2 (also absol.) Use hounds to hunt (esp. Hares).  in course of in the process of. In the course of during. Of course naturally; as is or was to be expected; admittedly. [latin cursus: related to *courier]

Rambling  adj. 1 wandering. 2 disconnected, incoherent. 3 (of a house, street, etc.) Irregularly arranged. 4 (of a plant) straggling, climbing.

Journalist  n. Person writing for or editing newspapers etc.  journalistic adj.

Connection  n. (also connexion) 1 connecting or being connected. 2 point at which two things are connected. 3 link, esp. By telephone. 4 connecting train etc. 5 (often in pl.) Relative or associate, esp. One with influence. 6 relation of ideas.

Satsuma  n. Variety of tangerine. [satsuma, province in japan]

Amity  n. Friendship. [latin amicus friend]

Swatch  n. 1 sample, esp. Of cloth. 2 collection of samples. [origin unknown]

Newcomer  n. 1 person who has recently arrived. 2 beginner in some activity.

Carvel  var. Of *caravel.

Exceptional  adj. 1 forming an exception; unusual. 2 outstanding.  exceptionally adv.

Usage  see note at exceptionable.

Abide  v. (-ding; past abided or rarely abode) 1 (usu. In neg.) Tolerate, endure (can't abide him). 2 (foll. By by) a act in accordance with (abide by the rules). B keep (a promise). 3 archaic remain, continue. [old english a- intensive prefix, *bide]

Libertine  —n. Licentious person, rake. —adj. Licentious. [latin, = freedman, from liber free]

Mead  n. Alcoholic drink of fermented honey and water. [old english]

Asian  —n. 1 native of asia. 2 person of asian descent. —adj. Of asia. [latin from greek]

Liquidizer  n. (also -iser) machine for liquidizing foods.

Maid  n. 1 female servant. 2 archaic or poet. Girl, young woman. [abbreviation of *maiden]

Normative  adj. Of or establishing a norm. [latin: related to *norm]

Seaway  n. 1 inland waterway open to seagoing ships. 2 ship's progress. 3 ship's path across the sea.

Figment  n. Invented or imaginary thing. [latin: related to *feign]

Receivership  n. 1 office of official receiver. 2 state of being dealt with by a receiver (esp. In receivership).

Regime  n. (also régime) 1 method or system of government. 2 prevailing order or system of things. 3 regimen. [french: related to *regimen]

Serial  —n. (also attrib.) Story etc. Published, broadcast, or shown in instalments. —adj. 1 of, in, or forming a series. 2 mus. Using transformations of a fixed series of notes (see *series 4).  serially adv. [from *series]

Notorious  adj. Well-known, esp. Unfavourably.  notoriety n. Notoriously adv. [latin notus known]

Tarot  n. (often attrib.) 1 (in sing. Or pl.) A pack of mainly picture cards used in fortune-telling. B any game played with a similar pack of 78 cards. 2 any card from a tarot pack. [french]

Tarsus  n. (pl. Tarsi) 1 bones of the ankle and upper foot. 2 shank of a bird's leg.  [greek]

Unesco  abbr. (also unesco) united nations educational, scientific, and cultural organization.

Organize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 a give an orderly structure to, systematize. B make arrangements for (a person or oneself). 2 initiate, arrange for. 3 (often absol.) A enlist (a person or group) in a trade union, political party, etc. B form (a trade union etc.). 4 (esp. As organized adj.) Make organic; make into living tissue.  organizer n. [latin: related to *organ]

Domino  n. (pl. -es) 1 any of 28 small oblong pieces marked with 0–6 pips in each half. 2 (in pl.) Game played with these. 3 loose cloak with a mask. [french, probably as *dominion]

Otherwise  —adv. 1 or else; in different circumstances (hurry, otherwise we'll be late). 2 in other respects (is otherwise very suitable). 3 in a different way (could not have acted otherwise). 4 as an alternative (otherwise known as jack). —adj. (predic.) Different (the matter is quite otherwise). [old english: related to *wise2]

Usage  see note at other.

Space  —n. 1 a continuous expanse in which things exist and move. B amount of this taken by a thing or available. 2 interval between points or objects. 3 empty area (make a space). 4 a outdoor urban recreation area (open space). B large unoccupied region (wide open spaces). 5 = *outer space. 6 interval of time (in the space of an hour). 7 amount of paper used in writing, available for advertising, etc. 8 a blank between printed, typed, or written words, etc. B piece of metal providing this. 9 freedom to think, be oneself, etc. (need my own space). —v. (-cing) 1 set or arrange at intervals. 2 put spaces between. 3 (as spaced adj.) (often foll. By out) slang euphoric, esp. From taking drugs.  space out spread out (more) widely.  spacer n. [latin spatium]

Pimiento  n. (pl. -s) = *sweet pepper. [see *pimento]

Descent  n. 1 act or way of descending. 2 downward slope. 3 lineage, family origin. 4 decline; fall. 5 sudden attack.

Yttrium  n. Metallic element resembling the lanthanides. [related to *ytterbium]

Indiarubber  n. Rubber for erasing pencil marks etc.

Hostility  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being hostile, enmity. 2 state of warfare. 3 (in pl.) Acts of warfare.

Clearing  n. Open area in a forest.

Riviera  n. Coastal subtropical region, esp. That of se france and nw italy. [italian, = sea-shore]

Urinate  v. (-ting) discharge urine.  urination n.

Unpolitical  adj. Not concerned with politics.

Anthropocentric  adj. Regarding mankind as the centre of existence. [greek anthropos man]

Unformed  adj. 1 not formed; undeveloped. 2 shapeless.

Unicameral  adj. Having a single legislative chamber. [related to *chamber]

Squirt  —v. 1 eject (liquid etc.) In a jet. 2 be ejected in this way. 3 splash with a squirted substance. —n. 1 a jet of water etc. B small quantity squirted. 2 syringe. 3 colloq. Insignificant but self-assertive person. [imitative]

Surgeon  n. 1 medical practitioner qualified in surgery. 2 naval or military medical officer.

Geography  n. 1 science of the earth's physical features, resources, climate, population, etc. 2 features or arrangement of an area, rooms, etc.  geographer n. [latin from greek]

Brand  —n. 1 a particular make of goods. B identifying trade mark, label, etc. 2 (usu. Foll. By of) characteristic kind (brand of humour). 3 identifying mark burned esp. On livestock. 4 iron used for this. 5 piece of burning or charred wood. 6 stigma; mark of disgrace. 7 poet. Torch. —v. 1 mark with a hot iron. 2 stigmatize (branded him a liar). 3 impress unforgettably. 4 assign a trademark etc. To. [old english]

Sidereal  adj. Of the constellations or fixed stars. [latin sidus sider- star]

Patronage  n. 1 patron's or customer's support. 2 right or control of appointments to office, privileges, etc. 3 condescending manner.

Vouchsafe  v. (-fing) formal 1 condescend to grant. 2 (foll. By to + infin.) Condescend.

Catalogue  (us catalog) —n. 1 complete alphabetical or otherwise ordered list of items, often with a description of each. 2 extensive list (catalogue of disasters). —v. (-logues, -logued, -loguing; us -logs, -loged, -loging) 1 make a catalogue of. 2 enter in a catalogue. [greek lego choose]

Assiduous  adj. 1 persevering, hard-working. 2 attending closely.  assiduity n. Assiduously adv. [latin: related to *assess]

(in christian belief) marks like those on christ's body after the crucifixion, appearing on the bodies of certain saints etc. [greek stigma -mat- brand, dot]

By over, up) become covered with frost. 2 a cover with or as with frost. B injure (a plant etc.) With frost. 3 make (glass) non-transparent by roughening its surface. [old english: related to *freeze]

Hi  int. Calling attention or as a greeting.

Sept  n. Clan, esp. In ireland. [alteration of *sect]

Overrun  v. (-nn-; past -ran; past part. -run) 1 swarm or spread over. 2 conquer (a territory) by force. 3 (usu. Absol.) Exceed (an allotted time).

Fasten  v. 1 make or become fixed or secure. 2 (foll. By in, up) lock securely; shut in. 3 (foll. By on, upon) direct (a look, thoughts, etc.) Towards. 4 (foll. By on, upon) a take hold of. B single out. 5 (foll. By off) fix with a knot or stitches.  fastener n. [old english: related to *fast1]

Sym-  prefix assim. Form of *syn- before b, m, p.

Mademoiselle  n. (pl. Mesdemoiselles) 1 miss or madam (used of or to an unmarried french-speaking woman). 2 (mademoiselle) a young frenchwoman. B french governess. [french ma my, demoiselle *damsel]

Color  (brit. Colour) —n. 1 sensation produced on the eye by rays of light when resolved as by a prism into different wavelengths. 2 one, or any mixture, of the constituents into which light can be separated as in a spectrum or rainbow, sometimes including (loosely) black and white. 3 colouring substance, esp. Paint. 4 use of all colours in photography etc. 5 a pigmentation of the skin, esp. When dark. B this as ground for discrimination. 6 ruddiness of complexion. 7 (in pl.) Appearance or aspect (saw them in their true colours). 8 (in pl.) A coloured ribbon or uniform etc. Worn to signify membership of a school, club, team, etc. B flag of a regiment or ship. 9 quality, mood, or variety in music, literature, etc. 10 show of reason; pretext (lend colour to; under colour of). —v. 1 apply colour to, esp. By painting, dyeing, etc. 2 influence. 3 misrepresent, exaggerate. 4 take on colour; blush.  show one's true colours reveal one's true character or intentions. [latin color]

Stopwatch  n. Watch that can be stopped and started, used to time races etc.

Gray  (brit. Grey) —adj. 1 of a colour intermediate between black and white. 2 dull, dismal. 3 a (of hair) turning white with age etc. B having grey hair. 4 anonymous, unidentifiable. —n. 1 a grey colour or pigment. Pay  —v. (past and past part. Paid) 1 (also absol.) Give (a person etc.) What is due for services done, goods received, debts incurred, etc. (paid him in full). 2 a give (a usu. Specified amount) for work done, a debt, etc. (they pay £6 an hour). B (foll. By to) hand over the amount of (a debt, wages, etc.) To (paid the money to the assistant). 3 a give, bestow, or express (attention, a compliment, etc.) (paid them no heed). B make (a visit) (paid a call on their uncle). 4 (also absol.) (of a business, attitude, etc.) Be profitable or advantageous to (a person etc.). 5 reward or punish (shall pay you for that). 6 (usu. As paid adj.) Recompense (work, time, etc.) (paid holiday). 7 (usu. Foll. By out, away) let out (a rope) by slackening it. —n. Wages.  in the pay of employed by. Pay back 1 repay. 2 punish or have revenge on. Pay for 1 hand over the money for. 2 bear the cost of. 3 suffer or be punished for (a fault etc.). Pay in pay (money) into a bank etc. Account. Pay its (or one's) way cover costs. Pay one's last respects attend a funeral to show respect. Pay off 1 dismiss (workers) with a final payment. 2 colloq. Yield good results; succeed. 3 pay (a debt) in full. Pay one's respects make a polite visit. Pay through the nose colloq. Pay much more than a fair price. Pay up pay the full amount (of). Put paid to colloq. 1 deal effectively with (a person). 2 terminate (hopes etc.).  payee n. [latin paco appease: related to *peace]

Repute  —n. Reputation. —v. (as reputed adj.) 1 be generally considered (is reputed to be the best). 2 passing as, but probably not (his reputed father).  reputedly adv. [latin puto think]

Geode  n. 1 cavity lined with crystals. 2 rock containing this. [greek geodes earthy]

Intermittent  adj. Occurring at intervals; not continuous.  intermittently adv. [latin mitto miss- let go]

Restructure  v. (-ring) give a new structure to; rebuild; rearrange.

Machete  n. Broad heavy knife, esp. Of central america. [spanish from latin]

Fondue  n. Dish of melted cheese. [french, = melted: related to *fuse1]

Leash  —n. Strap for holding a dog etc.; lead. —v. 1 put a leash on. 2 restrain.  straining at the leash eager to begin. [french lesse: related to *lease]

Mallow  n. Plant with hairy stems and leaves and pink or purple flowers. [latin malva]

Portend  v. 1 foreshadow as an omen. 2 give warning of. [latin portendo: related to *pro-1, *tend1]

Heartbreak  n. Overwhelming distress.  heartbreaking adj. Heartbroken adj.

Tights  n.pl. 1 thin close-fitting wool or nylon etc. Garment covering the legs, feet, and the lower part of the torso, worn by women and girls. 2 similar garment worn by a dancer, acrobat, etc.

Pincushion  n. Small pad for holding pins.

Showy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 brilliant; gaudy. 2 striking.  showily adv. Showiness n.

Ok  (also okay) colloq. —adj. (often as int.) All right; satisfactory. —adv. Well, satisfactorily. —n. (pl. Oks) approval, sanction. —v. (ok's, ok'd, ok'ing) approve, sanction. [originally us: probably abbreviation of orl (or oll) korrect, jocular form of ‘all correct’]

Demonstration  n. 1 (foll. By of) show of feeling etc. 2 (esp. Political) public meeting, march, etc. 3 the exhibiting etc. Of specimens or experiments in esp. Scientific teaching. 4 proof by logic, argument, etc. 5 mil. Display of military force.

Dishonorable  adj. (brit. Dishonourable) 1 causing disgrace; ignominious. 2 unprincipled.  dishonourably adv.

Piranha  n. Voracious s. American freshwater fish. [portuguese]

Closet  —n. 1 small room. 2 cupboard. 3 = *water-closet. 4 (attrib.) Secret (closet homosexual). —v. (-t-) shut away, esp. In private conference or study. [french diminutive: related to *close2]

Microfilm  —n. Length of film bearing microphotographs of documents etc. —v. Photograph on microfilm.

Index  —n. (pl. Indexes or indices) 1 alphabetical list of subjects etc. With references, usu. At the end of a book. 2 = *card index. 3 measure of prices or wages compared with a previous month, year, etc. (retail price index). 4 math. Exponent of a number. 5 pointer, sign, or indicator. —v. 1 provide (a book etc.) With an index. 2 enter in an index. 3 relate (wages etc.) To a price index.  indexation n. (in sense 3 of v.). [latin]

Scribble  —v. (-ling) 1 write or draw carelessly or hurriedly. 2 joc. Be an author or writer. —n. 1 scrawl. 2 hasty note etc. [latin scribillo diminutive: related to *scribe]

Wing  —n. 1 each of the limbs or organs by which a bird etc. Is able to fly. 2 winglike structure supporting an aircraft. 3 part of a building etc. Extended in a certain direction. 4 a forward player at either end of a line in football, hockey, etc. B side part of a playing-area. 5 (in pl.) Sides of a theatre stage. 6 polarized section of a political party in terms of its views. 7 flank of a battle array. 8 the part of a vehicle over a wheel. 9 air-force unit of several squadrons or groups. —v. 1 travel or traverse on wings. 2 wound in a wing or an arm. 3 equip with wings. 4 enable to fly; send in flight.  on the wing flying, in flight. Take under one's wing treat as a protégé. Take wing fly away.  winged adj. Winglike adj. [old norse]

Trudge  —v. (-ging) 1 go on foot, esp. Laboriously. 2 traverse (a distance) in this way. —n. Trudging walk. [origin unknown]

Melanin  n. Dark pigment in the hair, skin, etc., causing tanning in sunlight. [greek melas black]

Recycle  v. (-ling) convert (waste) to reusable material.  recyclable adj.

Lesser  adj. (usu. Attrib.) Not so great as the other(s) (lesser evil; lesser mortals).

Salesperson  n. Salesman or saleswoman.

Narcissus  n. (pl. -cissi) any of several flowering bulbs, including the daffodil. [latin from greek]

Sulfate  n. (brit. Sulphate) salt or ester of sulphuric acid. [latin *sulphur]

Embody  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 make (an idea etc.) Actual or discernible. 2 (of a thing) be a tangible expression of. 3 include, comprise.  embodiment n.

Gazump  v. Colloq. 1 raise the price of a property after accepting an offer from (a buyer). 2 swindle. [origin unknown]

Roundelay  n. Short simple song with a refrain. [alteration of french rondelet diminutive: related to *roundel]

Killer  n. 1 a person, animal, or thing that kills. B murderer. 2 colloq. A impressive, formidable, or excellent thing. B hilarious joke.

Pirouette  —n. Dancer's spin on one foot or the point of the toe. —v. (-tting) perform a pirouette. [french, = spinning-top]

Plaice  n. (pl. Same) marine flat-fish used as food. [latin platessa]

Luscious  adj. 1 richly sweet in taste or smell. 2 (of style) over-rich. 3 voluptuously attractive. [perhaps related to *delicious]

Interactive  adj. 1 reciprocally active. 2 (of a computer or other electronic device) allowing a two-way flow of information between it and a user.  interactively adv.

Gaggle  n. 1 flock of geese. 2 colloq. Disorganized group of people. [imitative]

Skittle  n.  1 pin used in skittles. 2 (in pl.; usu. Treated as sing.) Game of trying to bowl down usu. Nine wooden pins. [origin unknown]

Straddle  v. (-ling) 1 a sit or stand across (a thing) with the legs spread. B be situated on both sides of. 2 part (one's legs) widely. [from *stride]

Murrain  n. Infectious disease of cattle. [anglo-french moryn]

Knoll  n. Hillock, mound. [old english]

Smidgen  n. (also smidgin) colloq. Small bit or amount. [perhaps from smitch in the same sense]

Unguarded  adj. 1 incautious, thoughtless (unguarded remark). 2 not guarded.

Bone  —n. 1 any piece of hard tissue making up the skeleton in vertebrates. 2 (in pl.) A skeleton, esp. As remains. B body. 3 material of bones or similar material, e.g. Ivory. 4 thing made of bone. 5 (in pl.) Essentials (the bones of an agreement). 6 strip of stiffening in a corset etc. —v. (-ning) 1 remove the bones from. 2 stiffen with bone etc.  bone up (often foll. By on) colloq. Study intensively. Have a bone to pick (usu. Foll. By with) have cause for dispute (with a person). Make no bones about 1 be frank about. 2 not hesitate or scruple.  boneless adj. [old english]

Islam  n. 1 the religion of the muslims, proclaimed by muhammad. 2 the muslim world.  islamic adj. [arabic, = submission (to god)]

Prefer  v. (-rr-) 1 (often foll. By to, or to + infin.) Like better (prefers coffee to tea). 2 submit (information, an accusation, etc.) For consideration. 3 promote or advance (a person). [latin praefero -lat-]

Franc  n. Unit of currency of france, belgium, switzerland, etc. [french: related to *frank]

Urn  n. 1 vase with a foot and usu. A rounded body, used esp. For the ashes of the dead. 2 large vessel with a tap, in which tea or coffee etc. Is made or kept hot. [latin urna]

Peon  n. Spanish american day-labourer. [portuguese and spanish: related to *pawn1]

Preceptor  n. Teacher, instructor.  preceptorial adj. [latin: related to *precept]

Gaiter  n. Covering of cloth, leather, etc., for the lower leg. [french guêtre]

Lawful  adj. Conforming with or recognized by law; not illegal.  lawfully adv. Lawfulness n.

Transubstantiation  n. Rc ch. Conversion of the eucharistic elements wholly into the body and blood of christ. [medieval latin: related to *trans-, *substance]

Modem  n. Combined device for modulation and demodulation, e.g. Between a computer and a telephone line. [portmanteau word]

Choice  —n. 1 a act of choosing. B thing or person chosen. 2 range from which to choose. 3 power or opportunity to choose. —adj. Of superior quality. [germanic: related to *choose]

Ammonia  n. 1 pungent strongly alkaline gas. 2 (in general use) solution of ammonia in water. [as *sal ammoniac]

Agm  abbr. Annual general meeting.

Ligament  n. Band of tough fibrous tissue linking bones. [latin ligo bind]

Conferment  n. Conferring of a degree, honour, etc.

Bluebottle  n. Large buzzing fly; blowfly.

Unconquerable  adj. Not conquerable.

Appurtenance  n. (usu. In pl.) Belonging; accessory. [latin pertineo belong to]

-or  suffix forming nouns denoting esp. An agent (actor; escalator) or condition (error; horror). [latin]

Weevil  n. Destructive beetle feeding esp. On grain. [low german]

Omnivorous  adj. 1 feeding on both plant and animal material. 2 reading, observing, etc. Everything that comes one's way.  omnivore n. Omnivorousness n. [latin voro devour]

Resist  —v. 1 withstand the action or effect of. 2 stop the course or progress of. 3 abstain from (pleasure, temptation, etc.). 4 strive against; try to impede; refuse to comply with (resist arrest). 5 offer opposition; refuse to comply. —n. Protective coating of a resistant substance.  resistible adj. [latin sisto stop]

Valium  n. Propr. Drug diazepam used as a tranquillizer. [origin uncertain]

Anorexia  n. Lack of appetite, esp. (in full anorexia nervosa) an obsessive desire to lose weight by refusing to eat.  anorexic adj. & n. [greek an- without, orexis appetite]

Concertina  —n. Musical instrument like an accordion but smaller. —v. (-nas, -naed or -na'd, -naing) compress or collapse in folds like those of a concertina.

Claret  n. 1 red wine, esp. From bordeaux. 2 purplish-red. [french: related to *clarify]

Harmonica  n. Small rectangular musical instrument played by blowing and sucking air through it.

Ht  abbr. High tension.

Umber  —n. 1 natural pigment like ochre but darker and browner. 2 colour of this. —adj. Of this colour. [latin umbra shadow]

Grizzly  —adj. (-ier, -iest) grey, grey-haired. —n. (pl. -ies) (in full grizzly bear) large variety of brown bear, found in n. America and n. Russia.

Sailplane  n. Glider designed for sustained flight.

Weigh  v. 1 find the weight of. 2 balance in the hands to guess or as if to guess the weight of. 3 (often foll. By out) take a definite weight of (a substance); measure out (a specified weight) (weigh out the flour; weigh out 6 oz). 4 a estimate the relative value, importance, or desirability of. B (foll. By with, against) compare. 5 be equal to (a specified weight). 6 have (esp. A specified) importance; exert an influence. 7 (often foll. By on) be heavy or burdensome (to); be depressing (to).  weigh down 1 bring down by exerting weight. 2 be oppressive to. Weigh in (of a boxer before a contest, or a jockey after a race) be weighed. Weigh in with colloq. Advance (an argument etc.) Boldly. Weigh out (of a jockey) be weighed before a race. Weigh up colloq. Form an estimate of. Weigh one's words carefully choose the way one expresses something. [old english, = carry]

Impasse  n. Deadlock. [french: related to *pass1]

Imperishable  adj. Not able to perish, indestructible.

Wane  —v. (-ning) 1 (of the moon) decrease in apparent size. 2 decrease in power, vigour, importance, size, etc. —n. Process of waning.  on the wane waning; declining. [old english]

Phony  var. Of *phoney.

Fingernail  n. Nail of each finger.

Intestine  n. (in sing. Or pl.) Lower part of the alimentary canal.  intestinal adj. [latin intus within]

Doubtless  adv. Certainly; probably.

Juncture  n. 1 critical convergence of events; point of time (at this juncture). 2 joining-point. 3 joining.

Chopper  n. 1 a short axe with a large blade. B butcher's cleaver. 2 colloq. Helicopter. 3 colloq. Type of bicycle or motor cycle with high handlebars.

Cannibal  n. Person or animal that eats its own species.  cannibalism n. Cannibalistic adj. [spanish from carib]

Marriage  n. 1 legal union of a man and a woman for cohabitation and often procreation. 2 act or ceremony marking this. 3 particular such union (a happy marriage). 4 intimate union, combination. [french marier *marry]

Orbicular  adj. Formal circular or spherical. [latin orbiculus diminutive of orbis ring]

Freebie  n. Colloq. Thing given free of charge.

Fiscal  —adj. Of public revenue. —n. 1 legal official in some countries. 2 scot. = *procurator fiscal. [latin fiscus treasury]

Trustworthy  adj. Deserving of trust; reliable.  trustworthiness n.

Scapular  —adj. Of the shoulder or shoulder-blade. —n. Short monastic cloak.

Palate  n. 1 structure closing the upper part of the mouth cavity in vertebrates. 2 sense of taste. 3 mental taste; liking. [latin palatum]

Metric  adj. Of or based on the metre. [french: related to *metre1]

Jurisprudence  n. Science or philosophy of law.  jurisprudential adj.

Woodcock  n. Game-bird related to the snipe.

Anemic  adj. (brit. Anaemic) 1 of or suffering from anemia. 2 pale, listless.

Film  —n. 1 thin coating or covering layer. 2 strip or sheet of plastic etc. Coated with light-sensitive emulsion for exposure in a camera. 3 a story, episode, etc., on film, with the illusion of movement. B (in pl.) The cinema industry. 4 slight veil or haze etc. 5 dimness or morbid growth affecting the eyes. —v. 1 make a photographic film of (a scene, story, etc.). 2 cover or become covered with or as with a film. [old english]

Deliberative  adj. (esp. Of an assembly etc.) Of or for deliberation or debate.

Demob  colloq. —v. (-bb-) demobilize. —n. Demobilization. [abbreviation]

Firth  n. (also frith) 1 narrow inlet of sea. 2 estuary. [old norse: related to *fiord]

Foothill  n. Any of the low hills at the base of a mountain or range.

Cowrie  n. 1 tropical mollusc with a bright shell. 2 its shell as money in parts of africa and s. Asia. [urdu and hindi]

Splendid  adj. 1 magnificent, sumptuous. 2 impressive, glorious, dignified (splendid isolation). 3 excellent; fine.  splendidly adv. [latin: related to *splendour]

Processor  n. Machine that processes things, esp.: 1 = *central processor. 2 = *food processor.

Unavoidable  adj. Inevitable.  unavoidably adv.

Pomander  n. 1 ball of mixed aromatic substances. 2 container for this. [anglo-french from medieval latin]

Imprimatur  n. 1 rc ch. Licence to print (a religious book etc.). 2 official approval. [latin, = let it be printed]

Usage  imprimatur is sometimes confused with sense 2 of imprint.

Applaud  v. 1 express strong approval, esp. By clapping. 2 commend, approve (a person or action). [latin applaudo clap hands]

Democracy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a government by the whole population, usu. Through elected representatives. B state so governed. 2 classless and tolerant society. [greek demokratia rule of the people]

Longitude  n. 1 angular distance east or west from a standard meridian such as greenwich to the meridian of any place. 2 angular distance of a celestial body, esp. Along the ecliptic. [latin longitudo length, from longus long]

Thieve  v. (-ving) 1 be a thief. 2 steal (a thing). [old english: related to *thief]

Brindled  adj. (esp. Of domestic animals) brown or tawny with streaks of another colour. [scandinavian]

Casework  n. Social work concerned with studying a person's family and background.  caseworker n.

Bunny  n. (pl. -ies) 1 child's name for a rabbit. 2 (in full bunny girl) club hostess, waitress, etc., wearing rabbit ears and tail. [dial. Bun rabbit]

Smallholding  n.  Agricultural holding smaller than a farm.

Clueless  adj. Colloq. Ignorant, stupid.

Titivate  v. (-ting) (often refl.) Colloq. Smarten up; put the finishing touches to.  titivation n. [earlier tidivate, perhaps from *tidy after cultivate]

Interstate  adj. Existing or carried on between states, esp. Those of the us.

Leukaemia  n. (us leukemia) malignant disease in which the bone-marrow etc. Produces too many leucocytes. [greek leukos white, haima blood]

Scrambler  n. Device for scrambling telephone conversations.

Excellence  n. Outstanding merit or quality. [latin: related to *excel]

Obituary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 notice of a death or deaths. 2 account of the life of a deceased person. 3 (attrib.) Of or serving as an obituary. [latin obitus death]

Factitious  adj. 1 specially contrived. 2 artificial. [latin: related to *fact]

Milliner  n. Person who makes or sells women's hats.  millinery n. [milan in italy]

Population  n. 1 inhabitants of a place, country, etc. 2 total number of these or any group of living things.

Basket  n. 1 container made of interwoven cane, reed, wire, etc. 2 amount held by this. 3 the goal in basketball, or a goal scored. 4 econ. Group or range (of currencies). [french]

Commando  n. (pl. -s) 1 unit of shock troops. 2 member of this. [portuguese: related to *command]

Ossicle  n. Small bone or piece of bonelike substance. [latin diminutive: related to *osseous]

Gown  n. 1 loose flowing garment, esp. A woman's long dress. 2 official robe of an alderman, judge, cleric, academic, etc. 3 surgeon's overall. [latin gunna fur]

Superabundant  adj. Abounding beyond what is normal or right.  superabundance n. [latin: related to *super-, *abound]

Figurehead  n. 1 nominal leader. 2 wooden bust or figure at a ship's prow.

Complimentary  adj. 1 expressing a compliment. 2 given free of charge.

Dramatize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 turn (a novel etc.) Into a play. 2 make a dramatic scene of. 3 behave dramatically.  dramatization n.

Convulse  v. (-sing) 1 (usu. In passive) affect with convulsions. 2 cause to laugh uncontrollably.  convulsive adj. Convulsively adv. [latin vello vuls- pull]

Consequently  adv. & conj. As a result; therefore.

Report  —v. 1 a bring back or give an account of. B state as fact or news, narrate or describe or repeat, esp. As an eyewitness or hearer etc. C relate as spoken by another. 2 make an official or formal statement about. 3 (often foll. By to) bring (an offender or offence) to the attention of the authorities. 4 (often foll. By to) present oneself to a person as having returned or arrived. 5 (also absol.) Take down word for word, summarize, or write a description of for publication. 6 make or send in a report. 7 (foll. By to) be responsible to (a superior etc.). —n. 1 account given or opinion formally expressed after investigation or consideration. 2 description, summary, or reproduction of a scene, speech, law case, etc., esp. For newspaper publication or broadcast. 3 common talk; rumour. 4 way a person or thing is spoken of (hear a good report of you). 5 periodical statement on (esp. A school pupil's) work, conduct, etc. 6 sound of a gunshot etc.  reportedly adv. [latin porto bring]

Tether  —n. Rope etc. Confining a grazing animal. —v. Tie with a tether.  at the end of one's tether at the limit of one's patience, resources, etc. [old norse]

Pertinent  adj. (often foll. By to) relevant.  pertinence n. Pertinency n. [latin: related to *pertain]

Triceps  n. Muscle (esp. In the upper arm) with three points of attachment at one end. [latin caput head]

Priory  n. (pl. -ies) monastery governed by a prior or nunnery governed by a prioress. [anglo-french and medieval latin: related to *prior]

Therapy  n. (pl. -ies) non-surgical treatment of disease or disability.  therapist n. [greek therapeia healing]

Anticlockwise  adj. & adv. Moving in a curve opposite in direction to the hands of a clock.

Gag  —n. 1 thing thrust into or tied across the mouth, esp. To prevent speaking or crying out. 2 joke or comic scene. 3 parliamentary closure. 4 thing restricting free speech. —v. (-gg-) 1 apply a gag to. 2 silence; deprive of free speech. 3 choke, retch. 4 make gags as a comedian etc. [origin uncertain]

Centi-  comb. Form 1 one-hundredth. 2 hundred. [latin centum 100]

Oligocene  —adj. Of the third geological epoch of the tertiary period. —n. This epoch. [greek oligos little, kainos new]

Aster  n. Plant with bright daisy-like flowers. [greek, = star]

Teller  n. 1 person working at the counter of a bank etc. 2 person who counts votes. 3 person who tells esp. Stories (teller of tales).

Wisdom  n. 1 experience and knowledge together with the power of applying them. 2 prudence; common sense. 3 wise sayings. [old english: related to *wise1]

Chinaman  n. 1 archaic or derog. (now usu. Offens.) Native of china. 2 cricket ball bowled by a left-handed bowler that spins from off to leg.

Zen  n. Form of buddhism emphasizing meditation and intuition. [japanese, = meditation]

Free  —adj. (freer; freest) 1 not a slave or under another's control; having personal rights and social and political liberty. 2 (of a state, its citizens, etc.) Autonomous; democratic. 3 a unrestricted; not confined or fixed. B not imprisoned. C released from duties etc. D independent (free agent). 4 (foll. By of, from) a exempt from (tax etc.). B not containing or subject to (free of preservatives; free from disease). 5 (foll. By to + infin.) Permitted; at liberty to. 6 costing nothing. 7 a clear of duties etc. (am free tomorrow). B not in use (bathroom is free). 8 spontaneous, unforced (free offer). 9 available to all. 10 lavish (free with their money). 11 frank, unreserved. 12 (of literary style) informal, unmetrical. 13 (of translation) not literal. 14 familiar, impudent. 15 (of stories etc.) Slightly indecent. 16 chem. Not combined (free oxygen). 17 (of power or energy) disengaged, available. —adv. 1 freely. 2 without cost or payment. —v. (frees, freed) 1 make free; liberate. 2 (foll. By of, from) relieve from. 3 disentangle, clear.  for free colloq. Free of charge, gratis. Free on board (or rail) without charge for delivery to a ship or railway wagon.  freely adv. [old english]

Overdo  v. (-doing; 3rd sing. Present -does; past -did; past part. -done) 1 carry to excess, go too far. 2 (esp. As overdone adj.) Overcook.  overdo it (or things) colloq. Exhaust oneself.

Input  —n. 1 what is put in or taken in. 2 place where energy, information, etc., enters a system. 3 action of putting in or feeding in. 4 contribution of information etc. —v. (inputting; past and past part. Input or inputted) (often foll. By into) 1 put in. 2 supply (data, programs, etc., to a computer etc.).

Disincline  v. (-ning) make unwilling or reluctant.  disinclination n.

Howsoever  adv. Formal 1 in whatsoever way. 2 to whatsoever extent.

Brunt  n. Chief impact of an attack, task, etc. (esp. Bear the brunt of). [origin unknown]

Miscast  v. (past and past part. -cast) allot an unsuitable part to (an actor) or unsuitable actors to (a play etc.).

Dolmen  n. Megalithic tomb with a large flat stone laid on upright ones. [french]

Instalment  n. (us installment) 1 any of several usu. Equal payments for something. 2 any of several parts, esp. Of a broadcast or published story. [anglo-french estaler fix]

Maty  var. Of *matey.

Adept  —adj. (foll. By at, in) skilful. —n. Adept person. [latin adipiscor adept- attain]

Ponder  v. 1 think over; consider. 2 muse, be deep in thought. [latin pondero weigh]

Aeronautics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Science or practice of motion in the air.  aeronautic adj. Aeronautical adj. [from *aero-, *nautical]

Serviette  n. Table-napkin. [french: related to *serve]

Condominium  n. 1 joint rule or sovereignty. 2 us building containing individually owned flats. [latin dominium lordship]

Recess  —n. 1 space set back in a wall. 2 (often in pl.) Remote or secret place. 3 temporary cessation from work, esp. Of parliament. —v. 1 make a recess in. 2 place in a recess. 3 us take a recess; adjourn. [latin recessus: related to *recede]

Christen  v. 1 baptize as a sign of admission to the christian church. 2 give a name to. 3 colloq. Use for the first time.  christening n. [latin: related to *christian]

Optional  adj. Not obligatory. optionally adv.

Photon  n. Quantum of electromagnetic radiation energy, proportional to the frequency of radiation. [after electron]

Respray  —v. Spray again (esp. A vehicle with paint). —n. Act of respraying.

Undermine  v. (-ning) 1 injure (a person, reputation, health, etc.) Secretly or insidiously. 2 wear away the base of (banks were undermined). 3 make an excavation under.

Culinary  adj. Of or for cooking. [latin culina kitchen]

Palpitation  n. 1 throbbing, trembling. 2 (often in pl.) Increased rate of heartbeat due to exertion, agitation, or disease.

Stratosphere  n. Layer of atmosphere above the troposphere, extending to about 50 km from the earth's surface.  stratospheric adj. [from *stratum]

Altercate  v. (-ting) (often foll. By with) dispute, wrangle.  altercation n. [latin]

Hernia  n. Protrusion of part of an organ through the wall of the body cavity containing it. [latin]

Pickaback  var. Of *piggyback.

Tcp  abbr. Propr. A disinfectant and germicide. [trichlorophenylmethyliodasalicyl]

Weight  —n. 1 force experienced by a body as a result of the earth's gravitation. 2 heaviness of a body regarded as a property of it. 3 a quantitative expression of a body's weight. B scale of such weights (troy weight). 4 body of a known weight for use in weighing or weight training. 5 heavy body, esp. As used in a mechanism etc. 6 load or burden. 7 influence, importance. 8 athletics = *shot1 7. —v. 1 a attach a weight to. B hold down with a weight. 2 (foll. By with) impede or burden.  throw one's weight about (or around) colloq. Be unpleasantly self-assertive. Worth one's weight in gold very useful or helpful. [old english]

Raiment  n. Archaic clothing. [arrayment: related to *array]

Undismayed  adj. Not dismayed.

Paternoster  n. Lord's prayer, esp. In latin. [latin pater noster our father]

Phylactery  n. (pl. -ies) small leather box containing hebrew texts, worn by jewish men at prayer. [greek phulasso guard]

Transmigrate  v. (-ting) 1 (of the soul) pass into a different body. 2 migrate.  transmigration n. [latin]

Gazette  —n. 1 newspaper (used in the title). 2 official publication with announcements etc. —v. (-tting) announce or name in an official gazette. [french from italian]

Cop  slang —n. 1 police officer. 2 capture or arrest (it's a fair cop). —v. (-pp-) 1 catch or arrest (an offender). 2 receive, suffer. 3 take, seize.  cop it get into trouble; be punished. Cop out 1 withdraw; give up. 2 go back on a promise. Not much cop of little value or use. [french caper seize]

International  —adj. 1 existing or carried on between nations. 2 agreed on or used by all or many nations. —n. 1 a contest, esp. In sport, between teams representing different countries. B member of such a team. 2 (international) any of four successive associations for socialist or communist action.  internationality n. Internationally adv.

Orthodox  adj. 1 holding usual or accepted opinions, esp. On religion, morals, etc. 2 generally approved, conventional (orthodox medicine). 3 (also orthodox) (of judaism) strictly traditional.  orthodoxy n. [greek doxa opinion]

Cortisone  n. Hormone used esp. In treating inflammation and allergy. [abbreviation of chemical name]

Bray  —n. 1 cry of a donkey. 2 harsh sound like this. —v. 1 make a bray. 2 utter harshly. [french braire]

Rind  n. Tough outer layer or covering of fruit and vegetables, cheese, bacon, etc. [old english]

Aquarium  n. (pl. -s) tank of water for keeping and showing fish etc. [latin aquarius of water]

Consolidate  v. (-ting) 1 make or become strong or secure. 2 combine (territories, companies, debts, etc.) Into one whole.  consolidation n. Consolidator n. [latin: related to *solid]

Bundle  —n. 1 things tied or fastened together. 2 set of nerve fibres etc. 3 slang large amount of money. —v. (-ling) 1 (usu. Foll. By up) tie or make into a bundle. 2 (usu. Foll. By into) throw or move carelessly. 3 (usu. Foll. By out, off, away, etc.) Send away hurriedly.  be a bundle of nerves (or fun etc.) Be extremely nervous (or amusing etc.). Go a bundle on slang admire; like. [low german or dutch]

Incubation  n. 1 incubating. 2 period between infection and the appearance of the first symptoms.

Satanic  adj. Of or like satan; hellish; evil.  satanically adv.

Bier  n. Movable frame on which a coffin or corpse rests. [old english]

Prig  n. Self-righteous or moralistic person.  priggish adj. Priggishness n. [origin unknown]

Macintosh  var. Of *mackintosh.

Lunacy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 insanity. 2 mental unsoundness. 3 great folly. [latin: related to *lunar]

Unsustainable  adj. That cannot be sustained.

Dispatch  (also despatch) —v. 1 send off to a destination or for a purpose. 2 perform (a task etc.) Promptly; finish off. 3 kill, execute. 4 colloq. Eat quickly. —n. 1 dispatching or being dispatched. 2 a official written message, esp. Military. B news report to a newspaper etc. 3 promptness, efficiency. [italian dispacciare or spanish despachar]

Slipway  n. Ramp for building ships or landing boats.

Imperialism  n. 1 imperial rule or system. 2 usu. Derog. Policy of dominating other nations by acquiring dependencies etc.  imperialist n. & adj. Imperialistic adj.

Snowfall  n. 1 fall of snow. 2 amount of this.

Castrato  n. (pl. -ti) hist. Castrated male soprano or alto singer. [italian: related to *castrate]

Grammarian  n. Expert in grammar or linguistics.

Unaffected  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By by) not affected. 2 free from affectation.  unaffectedly adv.

Hubby  n. (pl. -ies) colloq. Husband. [abbreviation]

Raft  n. Flat floating structure of timber or other materials for conveying persons or things. [old norse]

Cupboard  n. Recess or piece of furniture with a door and (usu.) Shelves.

Embarrass  v. 1 make (a person) feel awkward or ashamed. 2 (as embarrassed adj.) Encumbered with debts. 3 encumber.  embarrassment n. [italian imbarrare bar in]

Sola  n. Pithy-stemmed e. Indian swamp plant. [urdu]

Artillery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 heavy guns used in land warfare. 2 branch of the army using these.  artilleryman n. [french artiller equip]

Canal  n. 1 artificial inland waterway. 2 tubular duct in a plant or animal. [latin canalis]

Fibril  n. Small fibre. [diminutive of *fibre]

Tabby  n. (pl. -ies) 1  grey or brownish cat with dark stripes. 2 a kind of watered silk. [french from arabic]

Backchat  n. Colloq. Verbal insolence.

Aquatint  n. Etched print resembling a water-colour. [italian acqua tinta coloured water]

Blaspheme  v. (-ming) 1 use religious names irreverently; treat a religious or sacred subject irreverently. 2 talk irreverently about; use blasphemy against. [greek blasphemeo]

Ophidian  —n. Member of a suborder of reptiles including snakes. —adj. 1 of this order. 2 snakelike. [greek ophis snake]

Macro-  comb. Form 1 long. 2 large, large-scale. [greek makros long]

Unhook  v. 1 remove from a hook or hooks. 2 unfasten the hook(s) of.

Accommodating  adj. Obliging, compliant.

Urbane  adj. Suave; elegant.  urbanity n. [latin: related to *urban]

Scrutinize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) subject to scrutiny.

Applied  adj. Practical, not merely theoretical (applied science).

Proofread  v. (past and past part. -read) read and correct (printer's proofs).  proofreader n.

Explode  v. (-ding) 1 a expand suddenly with a loud noise owing to a release of internal energy. B cause (a bomb etc.) To explode. 2 give vent suddenly to emotion, esp. Anger. 3 (of a population etc.) Increase suddenly or rapidly. 4 show (a theory etc.) To be false or baseless. 5 (as exploded adj.) (of a drawing etc.) Showing the components of a mechanism somewhat separated but in the normal relative positions. [latin explodo -plos- hiss off the stage]

Electrolyse  v. (us -yze) (-sing, us -zing) subject to or treat by electrolysis.

Residence  n. 1 process of residing or being resident. 2 a place where a person resides. B house, esp. One of pretension.  in residence living or working at a specified place, esp. For the performance of duties (artist in residence).

Mismanage  v. (-ging) manage badly or wrongly.  mismanagement n. [from *mis-1]

Turbulent  adj. 1 disturbed; in commotion. 2 (of a flow of air etc.) Varying irregularly. 3 restless; riotous.  turbulence n. Turbulently adv. [latin turba crowd]

Unsolved  adj. Not solved.

Cabin  n. 1 small shelter or house, esp. Of wood. 2 room or compartment in an aircraft or ship for passengers or crew. 3 driver's cab. [french from latin]

Happy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 feeling or showing pleasure or contentment. 2 a fortunate; characterized by happiness. B (of words, behaviour, etc.) Apt, pleasing.  happily adv. Happiness n.

Nymphomania  n. Excessive sexual desire in a woman.  nymphomaniac n. & adj. [from *nymph, *-mania]

Dote  v. (-ting) (foll. By on) be excessively fond of.  dotingly adv. [origin uncertain]

System  n. 1 complex whole; set of connected things or parts; organized body of things. 2 a set of organs in the body with a common structure or function. B human or animal body as a whole. 3 method; scheme of action, procedure, or classification. 4 orderliness. 5 (prec. By the) prevailing political or social order, esp. Regarded as oppressive.  get a thing out of one's system colloq. Get rid of a preoccupation or anxiety. [greek sustema -mat-]

Thee  objective case of *thou1.

Shipper  n. Person or company that ships goods. [old english]

Ecclesiastic  —n. Clergyman. —adj. = *ecclesiastical. [greek ekklesia church]

Deciliter  n. (brit. -litre) metric unit of capacity, equal to 0.1 litre.

Wretched  adj. (wretcheder, wretchedest) 1 unhappy, miserable; unwell. 2 of bad quality; contemptible. 3 displeasing, hateful.  wretchedly adv. Wretchedness n.

Lynch  v. (of a mob) put (a person) to death without a legal trial.  lynching n. [originally us, after lynch, 18th-c. Justice of the peace in virginia]

Upcurved  adj. Curved upwards.

Savor  (brit. Savour) —n. 1 characteristic taste, flavour, etc. 2 hint of a different quality etc. In something. —v. 1 appreciate and enjoy (food, an experience, etc.). 2 (foll. By of) imply or suggest (a specified quality). [latin sapor]

Description  n. 1 a describing or being described. B representation, esp. In words. 2 sort, kind (no food of any description). [latin: related to *describe]

Sinus  n. Cavity of bone or tissue, esp. In the skull connecting with the nostrils. [latin, = bosom, recess]

Fuzz  n. 1 fluff. 2 fluffy or frizzed hair. 3 slang a (prec. By the) the police. B police officer. [probably low german or dutch]

Clubland  n. Area where there are many nightclubs.

Relict  n. Object surviving in its primitive form. [french relicte: related to *relic]

Unbiased  adj. (also unbiassed) impartial.

Lottery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 means of raising money by selling numbered tickets and giving prizes to the holders of numbers drawn at random. 2 thing whose success is governed by chance. [dutch: related to *lot]

Bolshevik  —n. 1 hist. Member of the radical faction of the russian social democratic party becoming the communist party in 1918. 2 russian communist. 3 any revolutionary socialist. —adj. 1 of the bolsheviks. 2 communist.  bolshevism n. Bolshevist n. [russian, = member of the majority]

Rhododendron  n. (pl. -s or -dra) evergreen shrub with large clusters of bell-shaped flowers. [greek rhodon rose, dendron tree]

Accent  —n. 1 particular (esp. Local or national) mode of pronunciation. 2 distinctive feature or emphasis (accent on speed). 3 prominence given to a syllable by stress or pitch. 4 mark on a letter or word to indicate pitch, stress, or vowel quality. —v. 1 emphasize (a word or syllable etc.). 2 write or print accents on (words etc.). 3 accentuate. [latin cantus song]

Verruca  n. (pl. Verrucae or -s) wart or similar growth, esp. On the foot. [latin]
