Entry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a going or coming in. B liberty to do this. 2 place of entrance; door, gate, etc. 3 passage between buildings. 4 a item entered in a diary, list, etc. B recording of this. 5 a person or thing competing in a race etc. B list of competitors. [romanic: related to *enter]

Commonality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 sharing of an attribute. 2 common occurrence. 3 = *commonalty. [var. Of *commonalty]

Gunpowder  n. Explosive made of saltpetre, sulphur, and charcoal.

Lamppost  n. Tall post supporting a street-light.

Orientate  v. (-ting) = *orient v. [apparently from *orient]

Contrapuntal  adj. Mus. Of or in counterpoint.  contrapuntally adv. [italian]

Screenwriter  n. Person who writes for the cinema.

Contract  —n. 1 written or spoken agreement, esp. One enforceable by law. 2 document recording this. —v. 1 make or become smaller. 2 a (usu. Foll. By with) make a contract. B (often foll. By out) arrange (work) to be done by contract. 3 become affected by (a disease). 4 enter into (marriage). 5 incur (a debt etc.).  6 draw together (the muscles, brow, etc.), or be drawn together.  contract in (or out) choose to enter (or not to enter) a scheme or commitment. [latin contractus: related to *tract1]

Dixie  n. Southern states of the us. [origin uncertain]

Outsider  n. 1 non-member of some group, organization, profession, etc. 2 competitor thought to have little chance.

Ceiling  n. 1 upper interior surface of a room or other compartment. 2 upper limit. 3 maximum altitude a given aircraft can reach. [origin uncertain]

Tidy  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 neat, orderly. 2 (of a person) methodical. 3 colloq. Considerable (a tidy sum). —n. (pl. -ies) 1 receptacle for holding small objects etc. 2 esp. Us cover for a chair-back etc. —v. (-ies, -ied) (also absol.; often foll. By up) put in good order; make (oneself, a room, etc.) Tidy.  tidily adv. Tidiness n. [originally = timely etc., from *tide]

Bongo  n. (pl. -s or -es) either of a pair of small drums usu. Held between the knees and played with the fingers. [american spanish]

Comparison  n. 1 comparing. 2 illustration or example of similarity. 3 capacity for being likened (there's no comparison). 4 (in full degrees of comparison) gram. Positive, comparative, and superlative forms of adjectives and adverbs.  bear (or stand) comparison (often foll. By with) be able to be compared favourably. Beyond comparison 1 totally different in quality. 2 greatly superior; excellent.

Muzzle  —n. 1 projecting part of an animal's face, including the nose and mouth. 2 guard, usu. Of straps or wire, put over an animal's nose and mouth to stop it biting or feeding. 3 open end of a firearm. —v. (-ling) 1 put a muzzle on. 2 impose silence on. [medieval latin musum]

Porphyry  n. (pl. -ies) hard rock composed of crystals of white or red feldspar in a red matrix.  porphyritic adj. [greek: related to *purple]

Deadpan  adj. & adv. Lacking expression or emotion.

Usage  sign language is the preferred term in official use.

Vermicide  n. Drug that kills intestinal worms. [latin vermis worm]

Modification  n. 1 modifying or being modified. 2 change made.  modificatory adj. [latin: related to *modify]

Lashings  n.pl. Colloq. (foll. By of) plenty.

Statistic  n.  Statistical fact or item. [german: related to *state]

Throe  n. (usu. In pl.) Violent pang, esp. Of childbirth or death.  in the throes of struggling with the task of. [old english, alteration of original throwe, perhaps by association with woe]

Reject  —v. 1 put aside or send back as not to be used, done, or complied with etc. 2 refuse to accept or believe in. 3 rebuff or withhold affection from (a person). 4 show an immune response to (a transplant) so that it fails. —n. Thing or person rejected as unfit or below standard.  rejection n. [latin rejicio -ject- throw back]

Retrospective  —adj. 1 looking back on or dealing with the past. 2 (of a statute etc.) Applying to the past as well as the future. —n. Exhibition, recital, etc. Showing an artist's development over his or her lifetime.  retrospectively adv.

Misinform  v. Give wrong information to, mislead.  misinformation n. [from *mis-1]

Chilblain  n. Painful itching swelling on a hand, foot, etc., caused by exposure to cold. [from *chill, blain inflamed sore, blister]

Crescent  —n. 1 curved sickle shape as of the waxing or waning moon. 2 thing of this shape, esp. A street forming an arc. —adj. Crescent-shaped. [latin cresco grow]

Geisha  n. (pl. Same or -s) japanese woman trained to entertain men. [japanese]

Familiar  —adj. 1 a (often foll. By to) well known. B often met (with). 2 (foll. By with) knowing a thing well. 3 (often foll. By with) well acquainted (with a person). 4 informal, esp. Presumptuously so. —n. 1 close friend. 2 (in full familiar spirit) supposed attendant of a witch etc.  familiarity n. Familiarly adv. [latin: related to *family]

Mandamus  n.  Judicial writ issued as a command to an inferior court, or ordering a person to perform a public or statutory duty. [latin, = we command]

Awesome  adj. Inspiring awe; dreaded.

Expat  n. & adj. Colloq. Expatriate. [abbreviation]

Motorist  n. Driver of a car.

Bb  abbr. Double-black (pencil-lead).

Spokeshave  n. Tool for planing curved surfaces. [from *spoke1]

Tympanum  n. (pl. -s or -na) 1 middle ear. 2 eardrum. 3 archit. A vertical triangular space forming the centre of a pediment. B similar space over a door between the lintel and the arch. [greek tumpanon drum]

Dirham  n. Principal monetary unit of morocco and the united arab emirates. [arabic]

Logo  n. (pl. -s) emblem of an organization used in its display material etc. [abbreviation of logotype from greek logos word]

Fund  —n. 1 permanently available stock (fund of knowledge). 2 sum of money, esp. Set apart for a purpose. 3 (in pl.) Money resources. —v. 1 provide with money. 2 make (a debt) permanent at fixed interest.  in funds colloq. Having money to spend. [latin fundus bottom]

Coequal  adj. & n. Archaic or literary equal.

Percentage  n. 1 rate or proportion per cent. 2 proportion.

Unyielding  adj. 1 not yielding. 2 firm, obstinate.

Credential  n. (usu. In pl.) 1 certificates, references, etc., attesting to a person's education, character, etc. 2 letter(s) of introduction. [medieval latin: related to *credence]

Therapeutic  adj. 1 of, for, or contributing to, the cure of disease. 2 soothing, conducive to well-being.  therapeutically adv. [greek therapeuo wait on, cure]

Overture  n. 1 orchestral piece opening an opera etc. 2 composition in this style. 3 (usu. In pl.) A opening of negotiations. B formal proposal or offer. [french: related to *overt]

Ginger  —n. 1 a hot spicy root usu. Powdered for use in cooking, or preserved in syrup, or candied. B plant having this root. 2 light reddish-yellow. 3 spirit, mettle. —adj. Of a ginger colour. —v. 1 flavour with ginger. 2 (foll. By up) enliven.  gingery adj. [old english and french, ultimately from sanskrit]

Steadfast  adj. Constant, firm, unwavering.  steadfastly adv. Steadfastness n. [old english: related to *stead]

Palaeolithic  adj. (us paleolithic) of the early part of the stone age. [greek lithos stone]

Excel  v. (-ll-) 1 surpass. 2 be pre-eminent. [latin excello be eminent]

Myna  n. (also mynah, mina) talking bird of the starling family. [hindi]

Catalyze  v. (brit. -yse) produce (a reaction) by catalysis.

Hypothesize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) form or assume a hypothesis.

Devilry  n. (pl. -ies) 1 wickedness; reckless mischief. 2 black magic.

Pteridophyte  n. Flowerless plant, e.g. Ferns, club-mosses, etc. [greek pteris fern]

Nuthatch  n. Small bird which climbs up and down tree-trunks.

Aggro  n. Slang 1 aggressive hostility. 2 trouble, difficulty. [abbreviation of aggravation or aggression]

Discompose  v. (-sing) disturb the composure of.  discomposure n.

Rookie  n. Slang new recruit. [corruption of recruit]

Curling  n. Game resembling bowls, played on ice with round flat stones.

Juvenilia  n.pl. Author's or artist's youthful works.

Sauce  —n. 1 liquid or viscous accompaniment to a dish. 2 something adding piquancy or excitement. 3 colloq. Impudence, impertinence, cheek. —v. (-cing) colloq. Be impudent to; cheek. [latin salsus salted]

Copse  n. = *coppice. [shortened form]

Grievous  adj. 1 (of pain etc.) Severe. 2 causing grief. 3 injurious. 4 flagrant, heinous.  grievously adv. [french: related to *grieve]

Aspire  v. (-ring) (usu. Foll. By to or after, or to + infin.) Have ambition or a strong desire. [latin aspiro breathe upon]

Happening  n. 1 event. 2 improvised or spontaneous theatrical etc. Performance.

Ironware  n. Articles made of iron.

Ivf  abbr. In vitro fertilization.

Forehand  n. 1 (in tennis etc.) Stroke played with the palm of the hand facing forward. 2 (attrib.) (also forehanded) of or made with a forehand.

Bog  —n. 1 a wet spongy ground. B stretch of this. 2 slang lavatory. —v. (-gg-) (foll. By down; usu. In passive) impede (bogged down by snow).  boggy adj. (-ier, -iest). [irish or gaelic bogach]

Conjecture  —n. 1 formation of an opinion on incomplete information; guessing. 2 guess. —v. (-ring) guess. [latin conjectura from jacio throw]

Effeminate  adj. (of a man) womanish in appearance or manner.  effeminacy n. Effeminately adv. [latin femina woman]

Decorum  n. Polite dignified behaviour. [as *decorous]

Skipjack  n. (in full skipjack tuna) (pl. Same or -s) small striped pacific tuna used as food. [from *skip1, *jack]

Roll  —v. 1 (cause to) move or go in some direction by turning on an axis (ball rolled under the table; rolled the barrel into the cellar). 2 a make cylindrical or spherical by revolving between two surfaces or over on itself (rolled a newspaper). B make thus (rolled a cigarette). C gather into a mass or shape (rolled the dough into a ball; rolled himself into a ball). 3 (often foll. By along, by, etc.) (cause to) move, advance, or be conveyed on or (of time etc.) As if on wheels etc. (bus rolled past; rolled the tea trolley; years rolled by; rolled by in his car). 4 flatten or form by passing a roller etc. Over or by passing between rollers (roll the lawn; roll pastry). 5 rotate (his eyes rolled; he rolled his eyes). 6 a wallow (dog rolled in the dust). B (of a horse etc.) Lie on its back and kick about. 7 (of a moving ship, aircraft, vehicle, or person) sway to and fro sideways or walk unsteadily (rolled out of the pub). 8 a undulate (rolling hills; rolling mist). B carry or propel with undulations (river rolls its waters to the sea). 9 (cause to) start functioning or moving (cameras rolled). 10 sound or utter with vibrations or a trill (thunder rolled; rolls his rs). —n. 1 rolling motion or gait; undulation (roll of the hills). 2 a spell of rolling (roll in the mud).

Mulligatawny  n. Highly seasoned soup orig. From india. [tamil, = pepper-water]

Curator  n. Keeper or custodian of a museum etc.  curatorship n. [anglo-latin: related to *cure]

Apeman  n. Extinct primate held to be the forerunner of present-day man.

Outdo  v. (-doing; 3rd sing. Present -does; past -did; past part. -done) exceed, excel, surpass.

Zone  —n. 1 area having particular features, properties, purpose, or use (danger zone; smokeless zone). 2 well-defined region of more or less beltlike form. 3 area between two concentric circles. 4 encircling band of colour etc. 5 archaic belt, girdle. —v. (-ning) 1 encircle as or with a zone. 2 arrange or distribute by zones. 3 assign as or to a particular area.  zonal adj. [greek zone girdle]

Rabies  n. Contagious viral disease of esp. Dogs, transmissible through saliva to humans etc. And causing madness; hydrophobia. [latin: related to *rabid]

Unrepresented  adj. Not represented.

Numskull  n. Stupid person. [from *numb]

Dibble  ?n. (also dibber) hand tool for making holes for planting. ?v. (-ling) sow, plant, or prepare (soil) with a dibble. [origin uncertain]

Probate  n. 1 official proving of a will. 2 verified copy of a will with a certificate as handed to executors. [latin probo *prove]

Statistical  adj. Of statistics.  statistically adv.

Backdate  v. (-ting) 1 make retrospectively valid. 2 put an earlier date to than the actual one.

Blind  —adj. 1 lacking the power of sight. 2 a without adequate foresight, discernment, or information (blind effort). B (often foll. By to) unwilling or unable to appreciate a factor etc. (blind to argument). 3 not governed by purpose or reason (blind forces). 4 reckless (blind hitting). 5 a concealed (blind ditch). B closed at one end. 6 (of flying) using instruments only. 7 cookery (of a flan case etc.) Baked without a filling. —v. 1 deprive of sight. 2 rob of judgement; deceive; overawe. 3 slang go recklessly. —n. 1 screen for a window; awning. 2 thing used to hide the truth. 3 obstruction to sight or light. —adv. Blindly.  blindly adv. Blindness n. [old english]

Corvette  n. 1 small naval escort-vessel. 2 hist. Warship with one tier of guns. [french from dutch]

Soundtrack  n. 1 the sound element of a film or videotape. 2 recording of this made available separately. 3 any single track in a multi-track recording.

-tron  suffix physics forming nouns denoting: 1 elementary particle (positron). 2 particle accelerator. [from *electron]

Upfield  adv. In or to a position nearer to the opponents' end of a field.

Slot  —n. 1 slit in a machine etc. For a thing, esp. A coin, to be inserted. 2 slit, groove, etc. For a thing. 3 allotted place in a schedule, esp. In broadcasting. —v. (-tt-) 1 (often foll. By in, into) place or be placed (as if) into a slot. 2 provide with slots. [french esclot hollow of breast]

Overview  n. General survey.

Roan  —adj. (of esp. A horse) having a coat thickly interspersed with hairs of another colour. —n. Roan animal. [french]

Yup  var. Of *yep.

Mandala  n. Circular figure as a religious symbol of the universe. [sanskrit]

Pneumonia  n. Inflammation of one or both lungs. [greek pneumon lung]

Herbaceous  adj. Of or like herbs.

Ungenerous  adj. Mean.  ungenerously adv.

Diode  n. 1 semiconductor allowing the flow of current in one direction only and having two terminals. 2 thermionic valve having two electrodes. [from *di-1, *electrode]

Southern  adj.  Of or in the south.  southernmost adj.

Ymca  abbr. Young men's christian association.

Progressive  —adj. 1 moving forward. 2 proceeding step by step; cumulative (progressive drug use). 3 a favouring rapid political or social reform. B modern; efficient (a progressive company). 4 (of disease, violence, etc.) Increasing in severity or extent. 5 (of taxation) increasing with the sum taxed. 6 (of a card-game, dance, etc.) With periodic changes of partners. 7 gram. (of a tense) expressing action in progress, e.g. Am writing, was writing. —n. (also progressive) advocate of progressive political policies.  progressively adv. [french or medieval latin: related to *progress]

Lah  n. (also la) mus. Sixth note of a major scale. [latin labii, word arbitrarily taken]

Dramatics  n.pl. (often treated as sing.) 1 performance of plays. 2 exaggerated behaviour.

Whisky  n. (ir. & us whiskey) (pl. -ies or -eys) spirit distilled esp. From malted grain, esp. Barley or rye. [abbreviation of usquebaugh from gaelic, = water of life]

Encaustic  —adj. (of painting etc.) Using pigments mixed with hot wax, which are burned in as an inlay. —n. 1 art of encaustic painting. 2 product of this. [greek: related to *caustic]

Monocle  n. Single eyeglass.  monocled adj. [latin: related to *mono-, oculus eye]

Kidnap  v. (-pp-; us -p-) 1 abduct (a person etc.), esp. To obtain a ransom. 2 steal (a child).  kidnapper n. [from *kid1, nap = *nab]

Trivalent  adj. Chem. Having a valency of three.  trivalency n.

Stillbirth  n. Birth of a dead child.

Underseal  —v. Seal the underpart of (esp. A vehicle against rust etc.). —n. Protective coating for this.

Mollusc  n. (us mollusk) invertebrate with a soft body and usu. A hard shell, e.g. Snails and oysters. [latin molluscus soft]

Crabwise  adv. & attrib.adj. Sideways or backwards.

Tonsure  —n. 1 shaving of the crown of the head or the entire head, esp. Of a person entering the priesthood or a monastic order. 2 bare patch made in this way. —v. (-ring) give a tonsure to. [latin: related to *tonsorial]

Intervene  v. (-ning) 1 occur in time between events. 2 interfere; prevent or modify events. 3 be situated between things. 4 come in as an extraneous factor. [latin venio vent- come]

Attrition  n. 1 gradual wearing down (war of attrition). 2 abrasion, friction. [latin tero trit- rub]

Yield  —v. 1 produce or return as a fruit, profit, or result. 2 give up; surrender, concede. 3 a (often foll. By to) surrender; submit; defer to. B (as yielding adj.) Compliant; submissive; soft and pliable. 4 (foll. By to) give right of way to (other traffic). 5 (foll.

Sideburns  n.pl. = *sideboards. [earlier burnsides, after general burnside (d. 1881)]

Bibulous  adj. Tending to drink alcohol. [latin bibo drink]

Claimant  n. Person making a claim, esp. In a lawsuit, or claiming state benefit.

Biopsy  n. (pl. -ies) examination of severed tissue for diagnosis. [greek bios life, opsis sight]

Relive  v. (-ving) live (an experience etc.) Over again, esp. In the imagination.

Contagion  n. 1 a spreading of disease by bodily contact. B contagious disease. 2 moral corruption. [related to *contact]

Sprinkler  n. Device for sprinkling a lawn or extinguishing fires.

Chutzpah  n. Slang shameless audacity. [yiddish]

Costing  n. Estimation of cost(s).

Designate  —v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By as) appoint to an office or function. 2 specify (designated times). 3 (often foll. By as) describe as; style. 4 serve as the name or symbol of. —adj. (after the noun) appointed to office but not yet installed. [latin: related to *design]

Plum  n. 1 a small sweet oval fleshy fruit with a flattish pointed stone. B tree bearing this. 2 reddish-purple colour. 3 raisin used in cooking. 4 colloq. Something prized (often attrib.: plum job).  have a plum in one's mouth have an affectedly rich voice. [latin: related to *prune1]

Canton  —n. Subdivision of a country, esp. Of switzerland. —v. Put (troops) into quarters. [french, = corner: related to *cant2]

Rebroadcast  —v. (past -cast or -casted; past part. -cast) broadcast again. —n. Repeat broadcast.

Prepaid  past and past part. Of *prepay.

Serried  adj. (of ranks of soldiers etc.) Close together. [french serrer to close]

Condemn  v. 1 express utter disapproval of. 2 a find guilty; convict. B (usu. Foll. By to) sentence to (a punishment). 3 pronounce (a building etc.) Unfit for use. 4 (usu. Foll. By to) doom or assign (to something unpleasant).  condemnation n. Condemnatory adj. [latin: related to *damn]

Neuter  —adj. 1 neither masculine nor feminine. 2 (of a plant) having neither pistils nor stamen. 3 (of an insect) sexually undeveloped. —n. 1 neuter gender or word. 2 a non-fertile insect, esp. A worker bee or ant. B castrated animal. —v. Castrate or spay. [latin]

Bicentennial  esp. Us —n. Bicentenary. —adj. Occurring every two hundred years.

Dunderhead  n. Stupid person. [origin unknown]

Originate  v. (-ting) 1 cause to begin; initiate. 2 have as an origin; begin.  origination n. Originator n.

Blink  —v. 1 shut and open the eyes quickly. 2 (often foll. By back) prevent (tears) by blinking. 3 shine unsteadily, flicker. —n. 1 act of blinking. 2 momentary gleam or glimpse.  blink at 1 look at while blinking. 2 ignore, shirk. On the blink slang not working properly; out of order. [dutch, var. Of *blench]

Crossfire  n. 1 firing in two crossing directions simultaneously. 2 a attack or criticism from all sides. B combative exchange of views etc.

Pointless  adj. Lacking purpose or meaning; ineffective, fruitless.  pointlessly adv. Pointlessness n.

Totalitarian  adj. Of a one-party form of government requiring complete subservience to the state.  totalitarianism n.

Dingle  n. Deep wooded valley or dell. [origin unknown]

Tailplane  n. Horizontal aerofoil at the tail of an aircraft.

Formalin  n. Solution of formaldehyde in water.

Diary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 daily record of events or thoughts. 2 book for this or for noting future engagements. [latin dies day]

Fulminant  adj. 1 fulminating. 2 (of a disease etc.) Developing suddenly. [latin: related to *fulminate]

Lousy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 colloq. Very bad; disgusting; ill (feel lousy). 2 (often foll. By with) colloq. Well supplied, teeming. 3 infested with lice.  lousily adv. Lousiness n.

Ashore  adv. Towards or on the shore or land.

Tourmaline  n. Mineral of various colours used as a gemstone. [french from sinhalese]

Technique  n. 1 mechanical skill in art. 2 skilful manipulation of a situation, people, etc. 3 manner of artistic execution in music, painting, etc. [french: related to *technic]

Mortgage  —n. 1 a conveyance of property to a creditor as security for a debt (usu. One incurred by the purchase of the property). B deed effecting this. 2 sum of money lent by this. —v. (-ging) convey (a property) by mortgage.  mortgageable adj. [french, = dead pledge: related to *gage1]

Indefinitely  adv. 1 for an unlimited time (was postponed indefinitely). 2 in an indefinite manner.

Maths  n. Colloq. Mathematics. [abbreviation]

Rumour  (us rumor) —n. (often foll. By of or that) general talk, assertion, or hearsay of doubtful accuracy (heard a rumour that you are leaving). —v. (usu. In passive) report by way of rumour (it is rumoured that you are leaving).

Replace  v. (-cing) 1 put back in place. 2 take the place of; succeed; be substituted for. 3 find or provide a substitute for. 4 (often foll. By with, by) fill up the place of.

Magistrate  n. 1 civil officer administering the law. 2 official conducting a court for minor cases and preliminary hearings. [latin: related to *master]

Hello  (also hallo, hullo) —int. Expression of informal greeting, or of surprise, or to call attention. —n. (pl. -s) cry of ‘hello’. [var. Of earlier hollo]

Enthrall  v. (brit. Enthral) (-ll-) captivate, please greatly.  enthralment n. [from *en-1, *thrall]

Crass  adj. Gross; grossly stupid.  crassly adv. Crassness n. [latin crassus thick]

Stabling  n. Accommodation for horses.

Rainy  adj. (-ier, -iest) (of weather, a climate, day, etc.) In or on which rain is falling or much rain usually falls. [old english: related to *rain]

Facility  n. (pl. -ies) 1 ease; absence of difficulty. 2 fluency, dexterity. 3 (esp. In pl.) Opportunity or equipment for doing something. [latin: related to *facile]

Personify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 represent (an abstraction or thing) as having human characteristics. 2 symbolize (a quality etc.) By a figure in human form. 3 (usu. As personified adj.) Be a typical example of; embody (she personifies youthful arrogance; he was niceness personified).  personification n.

Secretariat  n. 1 administrative office or department. 2 its members or premises. [medieval latin: related to *secretary]

Handbook  n. Short manual or guidebook.

Dauntless  adj. Intrepid, persevering.

Polyanthus  n. (pl. -thuses) flowering plant cultivated from hybridized primulas. [greek anthos flower]

Trader  n. 1 person engaged in trade. 2 merchant ship.

Instruct  v. 1 teach (a person) a subject etc.; train. 2 (usu. Foll. By to + infin.) Direct; command. 3 law a employ (a lawyer). B inform.  instructor n. [latin instruo -struct- build, teach]

Soundproof  —adj. Impervious to sound. —v. Make soundproof.

Buoy  —n. 1 anchored float as a navigation mark etc. 2 lifebuoy. —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By up) a keep afloat. B encourage, uplift. 2 (often foll. By out) mark with a buoy. [dutch, perhaps from latin boia collar]

Privacy  n. 1 a being private and undisturbed. B right to this. 2 freedom from intrusion or public attention.

Boy  —n. 1 male child, son. 2 young man. 3 male servant etc. —int. Expressing pleasure, surprise, etc.  boyhood n. Boyish adj. [origin uncertain]

Nitrate  —n. 1 any salt or ester of nitric acid. 2 potassium or sodium nitrate as a fertilizer. —v. (-ting) treat, combine, or impregnate with nitric acid.  nitration n. [french: related to *nitre]

Toxin  n. Poison produced by a living organism.

Churl  n. 1 ill-bred person. 2 archaic peasant. [old english, = man]

Heinous  adj. Utterly odious or wicked. [french haïr hate]

Biathlon  n. Athletic contest in skiing and shooting or cycling and running. [from *bi-, after *pentathlon]

Without  —prep. 1 not having or feeling or showing. 2 with freedom from. 3 in the absence of. 4 with neglect or avoidance of. 5 archaic outside. —adv. Archaic or literary 1 outside. 2 out of doors. [old english: related to *with, *out]

Choker  n. Close-fitting necklace.

Cousin  n. 1 (also first cousin) child of one's uncle or aunt. 2 person of a kindred race or nation. [latin consobrinus]

Usage  there is often some confusion as to the difference between cousin, first cousin, second cousin, first cousin once removed, etc. For definitions see cousin, second cousin and remove v. 5.

Pessary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 device worn in the vagina to support the uterus or as a contraceptive. 2 vaginal suppository. [latin from greek]

Volt  n. Si unit of electromotive force, the difference of potential that would carry one ampere of current against one ohm resistance. [volta, name of a physicist]

Endogenous  adj. Growing or originating from within.

Stalinism  n. Centralized authoritarian form of socialism associated with stalin.  stalinist n. & adj. [stalin, a soviet statesman]

Macaque  n. A kind of monkey, e.g. The rhesus monkey and barbary ape, with prominent cheek-pouches. [portuguese, = monkey]

Salacious  adj. 1 indecently erotic. 2 lecherous.  salaciousness n. Salacity n. [latin salax -acis: related to *salient]

Unite  v. (-ting) 1 join together; combine, esp. For a common purpose or action (united in their struggle). 2 join in marriage. 3 (cause to) form a physical or chemical whole (oil will not unite with water). [latin unio -it- from unus one]

Ungreen  adj. Not concerned with the protection of the environment; harmful to the environment.

Guttering  n. 1 gutters of a building etc. 2 material for gutters.

Springer  n. Small spaniel of a breed used to spring game.

Ruche  n. Frill or gathering of lace etc.  ruched adj. [french, = beehive]

Inuit  n. (also innuit) (pl. Same or -s) n. American eskimo. [eskimo inuit people]

Connive  v. (-ving) 1 (foll. By at) disregard or tacitly consent to (a wrongdoing). 2 (usu. Foll. By with) conspire.  connivance n. [latin conniveo shut the eyes]

Hrt  abbr. Hormone replacement therapy.

Virtually  adv. In effect, nearly, almost.

Understaffed  adj. Having too few staff.

Glassware  n. Articles made of glass.

Skylight  n. Window in a roof.

Flick  —n. 1 a light sharp blow with a whip etc. B sudden release of a bent digit, esp. To propel a small object. 2 sudden movement or jerk, esp. Of the wrist in throwing etc. 3 colloq. A cinema film. B (in pl.; prec. By the) the cinema. —v. 1 (often foll. By away, off) strike or move with a flick (flicked the ash off). 2 give a flick with (a whip etc.).  flick through 1 turn over (cards, pages, etc.). 2 a turn over the pages etc. Of, by a rapid movement of the fingers. B glance through (a book etc.). [imitative]

Thermal  —adj. 1 of, for, or producing heat. 2 promoting the retention of heat (thermal underwear). —n. Rising current of warm air (used by gliders etc. To gain height).  thermally adv. [french: related to *therm]

Pity  —n. 1 sorrow and compassion for another's suffering. 2 cause for regret (what a pity!). —v. (-ies, -ied) feel (often contemptuous) pity for.  take pity on help out of pity for.  pitying adj. Pityingly adv. [latin: related to *piety]

Lebanese  —adj. Of lebanon. —n. (pl. Same) 1 native or national of lebanon. 2 person of lebanese descent.

Ghoul  n. 1 person morbidly interested in death etc. 2 evil spirit or phantom. 3 spirit in muslim folklore preying on corpses.  ghoulish adj. Ghoulishly adv. [arabic]

Modernism  n. Modern ideas or methods, esp. In art.  modernist n. & adj.

Phut  n. Dull abrupt sound as of impact or an explosion.  go phut colloq. (esp. Of a plan) collapse, break down. [perhaps from hindi phatna to burst]

Commotion  n. Confused and noisy disturbance, uproar. [latin: related to *com-]

Harbinger  n. 1 person or thing that announces or signals the approach of another. 2 forerunner. [germanic: related to *harbour]

Search  —v. 1 (also absol.) Look through or go over thoroughly to find something. 2 examine or feel over (a person) to find anything concealed. 3 probe (search one's conscience). 4 (foll. By for) look thoroughly in order to find. 5 (as searching adj.) (of an examination) thorough; keenly questioning (searching gaze). 6 (foll. By out) look for; seek out. —n. 1 act of searching. 2 investigation.  in search of trying to find. Search me! Colloq. I do not know.  searcher n. Searchingly adv. [anglo-french cerchier]

Aide  n. 1 aide-de-camp. 2 esp. Us assistant. [french]

Presbytery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 eastern part of a chancel. 2 body of presbyters, esp. A court next above a kirk-session. 3 house of a roman catholic priest.

Moth  n. 1 nocturnal insect like a butterfly but without clubbed antennae. 2 insect of this type breeding in cloth etc., on which its larva feeds. [old english]

Gantry  n. (pl. -ies) structure supporting a travelling crane, railway or road signals, rocket-launching equipment, etc. [probably gawn, a dial. Form of *gallon, + *tree]

Counselor  n. (brit. Counsellor) 1 adviser. 2 person giving professional guidance on personal problems. 3 us barrister.

Blood  —n. 1 usu. Red fluid circulating in the arteries and veins of animals. 2 bloodshed, esp. Killing. 3 passion, temperament. 4 race, descent, parentage (of the same blood). 5 relationship; relations (blood is thicker than water). 6 dandy. —v. 1 give (a hound) a first taste of blood. 2 initiate (a person).  in one's blood inherent in one's character. [old english]

Diver  n. 1 person who dives, esp. Working under water. 2 diving bird.

Mogul  n. 1 colloq. Important or influential person. 2 (mogul) hist. A mongolian. B (often the great mogul) emperor of delhi in the 16th–19th c. [persian and arabic: related to *mongol]

Junction  n. 1 joint; joining-point. 2 place where railway lines or roads meet. 3 joining. [latin: related to *join]

Arithmetic  —n. 1 science of numbers. 2 use of numbers; computation. —adj. (also arithmetical) of arithmetic. [greek arithmos number]

Inhaler  n. Device for administering an inhalant, esp. To relieve asthma.

Snp  abbr. Scottish national party.

Conservancy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 body controlling a port, river, etc., or preserving the environment. 2 official environmental conservation. [latin: related to *conserve]

Orca  n. Any of various cetaceans, esp. The killer whale. [latin]

Chemical  —adj. Of, made by, or employing chemistry or chemicals. —n. Substance obtained or used in chemistry.  chemically adv. [french or medieval latin: related to *alchemy]

Lewd  adj. 1 lascivious. 2 obscene. [old english, originally = lay, vulgar]

Adjure  v. (-ring) (usu. Foll. By to + infin.) Beg or command.  adjuration n. [latin adjuro put to oath: related to *jury]

-fold  suffix forming adjectives and adverbs from cardinal numbers, meaning: 1 in an amount multiplied by (repaid tenfold). 2 with so many parts (threefold blessing). [originally = ‘folded in so many layers’]

Turbofan  n. Jet engine in which a turbine-driven fan provides additional thrust.

Cut  —v. (-tt-; past and past part. Cut) 1 (also absol.) Penetrate or wound with a sharp-edged instrument. 2 (often foll. By into) divide or be divided with a knife etc. 3 trim or detach by cutting. 4 (foll. By loose, open, etc.) Loosen etc. By cutting. 5 (esp. As cutting adj.) Wound (cutting remark). 6 (often foll. By down) reduce (wages, time, etc.) Or cease (services etc.). 7 a make (a coat, gem, key, record, etc.) By cutting. B make (a path, tunnel, etc.) By removing material. 8 perform, make (cut a caper; cut a sorry figure). 9 (also absol.) Cross, intersect. 10 (foll. By across, through, etc.) Traverse, esp. As a shorter way (cut across the grass). 11 a deliberately ignore (a person one knows). B renounce (a connection). 12 esp. Us deliberately miss (a class etc.). 13 cards a divide (a pack) into two parts. B do this to select a dealer etc. 14 a edit (film or tape). B (often in imper.) Stop filming or recording. C (foll. By to) go quickly to (another shot). 15 switch off (an engine etc.). 16 chop (a ball). —n. 1 cutting. 2 division or wound made by cutting. 3 stroke with a knife, sword, whip, etc. 4 a reduction (in wages etc.). B cessation (of power supply etc.). 5 removal of lines etc. From a play, film, etc. 6 wounding remark or act. 7 style of hair, garment, etc. Achieved by cutting. 8 particular piece of butchered meat. 9 colloq. Commission; share of profits. 10 stroke made by cutting. 11 deliberate ignoring of a person. 12 = *woodcut.  a cut above colloq. Noticeably superior to. Be cut out (foll. By for, or to + infin.) Be suited. Cut across 1 transcend (normal limitations etc.). 2 see sense 10 of v. Cut and run slang run away. Cut back 1 reduce (expenditure etc.). 2 prune (a tree etc.). Cut both ways 1 serve both sides of an argument etc. 2 (of an action) have both good and bad effects. Cut a corner go across it. Cut corners do perfunctorily or incompletely, esp. To save time. Cut a dash make a brilliant show. Cut a person dead deliberately ignore (a person one knows). Cut down 1 a bring or throw down by cutting. B kill by sword or disease. 2 see sense 6 of v. 3 reduce the length of (cut down trousers to make shorts). 4 (often foll. By on) reduce consumption (cut down on beer). Cut a person down to size colloq. Deflate a person's pretensions. Cut in 1 interrupt. 2 pull in too closely in front of another vehicle. Cut it fine allow very little margin of time etc. Cut it out (usu. In imper.) Slang stop doing that. Cut one's losses abandon an unprofitable scheme. Cut no ice slang have no influence. Cut off 1 remove by cutting. 2 a (often in passive) bring to an abrupt end or (esp. Early) death. B intercept, interrupt. C disconnect (a person on the telephone). 3 a prevent from travelling. B (as cut off adj.) Isolated or remote. 4 disinherit. Cut out 1 remove from inside by cutting. 2 make by cutting from a larger whole. 3 omit. 4 colloq. Stop doing or using (something) (cut out chocolate). 5 (cause to) cease functioning (engine cut out). 6 outdo or supplant (a rival). Cut short interrupt; terminate. Cut one's teeth on acquire experience from.

Unprejudiced  adj. Not prejudiced.

Choirboy  n. (fem. Choirgirl) boy singer in a church choir.

Waggle  v. (-ling) colloq. Wag.

Uppish  adj. Colloq. Uppity.

Overwind  v. (past and past part. -wound) wind (a watch etc.) Beyond the proper stopping point.

Lugsail  n. Four-cornered sail on a yard. [probably from *lug]

Parterre  n. 1 level space in a formal garden occupied by flower-beds. 2 us pit of a theatre. [french, = on the ground]

Hotchpotch  n. (also hodgepodge) confused mixture or jumble, esp. Of ideas. [french hochepot shake pot]

Should  v.aux. (3rd sing. Should) past of *shall, used esp.: 1 in reported speech (i said i should be home soon). 2 a to express obligation or likelihood (i should tell you; you should have read it; they should have arrived by now). B to express a tentative suggestion (i should like to add). 3 a expressing the conditional mood in the 1st person (i should have been killed if i had gone). B forming a conditional clause (if you should see him).

Evildoer  n. Sinner.  evildoing n.

Informant  n. Giver of information.

Dreadlocks  n.pl. Rastafarian hairstyle with hair hanging in tight braids on all sides.

Undertone  n. 1 subdued tone or colour. 2 underlying quality or feeling.

Lateen  adj. (of a ship) rigged with a lateen sail. [french voile latine latin sail]

Shoo  —int. Exclamation used to frighten away animals etc. —v. (shoos, shooed) 1 utter the word ‘shoo!’. 2 (usu. Foll. By away) drive away by shooing. [imitative]

Wheeze  —v. (-zing) 1 breathe with an audible whistling sound. 2 utter with this sound. —n. 1 sound of wheezing. 2 colloq. Clever scheme.  wheezy adj. (-ier, -iest). Wheezily adv. Wheeziness n. [probably from old norse, = hiss]

Tv  abbr. Television.

Micrometer  n. Gauge for accurate small-scale measurement.

Subsection  n. Division of a section.

Unfrozen  past part. Of *unfreeze.

Snitch  slang —v. 1 steal. 2 (often foll. By on) inform on a person. —n. Informer. [origin unknown]

Spacious  adj. Having ample space; roomy.  spaciously adv. Spaciousness n. [latin: related to *space]

Unfix  v. Release, loosen, or detach.

Frump  n. Dowdy unattractive woman.  frumpish adj. Frumpy adj. (-ier, -iest). [perhaps dial. Frumple wrinkle]

Toecap  n. (usu. Strengthened) outer covering of the toe of a boot or shoe.

Bloom  —n. 1 a flower, esp. Cultivated. B state of flowering (in bloom). 2 one's prime (in full bloom). 3 a healthy glow of the complexion. B fine powder on fresh fruit and leaves. —v. 1 bear flowers; be in flower. 2 be in one's prime; flourish. [old norse]

Pmt  abbr. Premenstrual tension.

Unbidden  adj. Not commanded or invited (arrived unbidden).

Photogenic  adj. 1 looking attractive in photographs. 2 biol. Producing or emitting light.

Coaxial  adj. 1 having a common axis. 2 electr. (of a cable or line) transmitting by means of two concentric conductors separated by an insulator.

Septet  n. 1 mus. A composition for seven performers. B the performers. 2 any group of seven. [latin septem seven]

Eventful  adj. Marked by noteworthy events.  eventfully adv.

Hydropathy  n. (medically unorthodox) treatment of disease by water.  hydropathic adj. [related to *pathos]

Glandular  adj. Of a gland or glands.

Talcum  n. 1 = *talc 2. 2 (in full talcum powder) powdered talc for toilet use, usu. Perfumed. [medieval latin: see *talc]

Floorcloth  n. Cloth for washing the floor.

Tectonics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Study of the earth's large-scale structural features (see *plate tectonics).

Groats  n.pl. Hulled or crushed grain, esp. Oats. [old english]

Cum  prep. (usu. In comb.) With, combined with, also used as (bedroom-cum-study). [latin]

Jailbreak  n. (also gaolbreak) escape from jail.

Underground  —adv. 1 beneath the ground. 2 in or into secrecy or hiding. —adj. 1 situated underground. 2 secret, subversive. 3 unconventional (underground literature). —n. 1 underground railway. 2 secret subversive group or activity.

Paramilitary  —adj. (of forces) organized on military lines. —n. (pl. -ies) member of an unofficial paramilitary organization, esp. In n. Ireland.

Stylus  n. (pl. -luses) 1 sharp needle following a groove in a gramophone record and transmitting the recorded sound for reproduction. 2 pointed writing tool. [latin: related to *style]

Vanity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 conceit about one's appearance or attainments. 2 futility, unsubstantiality, unreal thing (the vanity of human achievement). 3 ostentatious display. [latin: related to *vain]

Limerick  n. Humorous five-line verse with a rhyme-scheme aabba. [origin uncertain]

Accordion  n. Musical reed instrument with concertina-like bellows, keys, and buttons.  accordionist n. [italian accordare to tune]

Exaction  n. 1 exacting or being exacted. 2 a illegal or exorbitant demand; extortion. B sum or thing exacted.

Increase  —v. (-sing) make or become greater or more numerous. —n. 1 growth, enlargement. 2 (of people, animals, or plants) multiplication. 3 amount or extent of an increase.  on the increase increasing. [latin cresco grow]

Zillion  n. Colloq. Indefinite large number. [probably after million]

Straight  —adj. 1 extending uniformly in the same direction; not bent or curved. 2 successive, uninterrupted (three straight wins). 3 ordered; level; tidy (put things straight). 4 honest, candid. 5 (of thinking etc.) Logical. 6 (of theatre, music, etc.) Serious, classical, not popular or comic. 7 a unmodified. B (of a drink) undiluted. 8 colloq. A (of a person etc.) Conventional, respectable. B heterosexual. 9 direct, undeviating. —n. 1 straight part, esp. The concluding stretch of a racetrack. 2 straight condition. 3 sequence of five cards in poker. 4 colloq. Conventional person; heterosexual. —adv. 1 in a straight line; direct. 2 in the right direction. 3 correctly.  go straight (of a criminal) become honest. Straight away immediately. Straight off colloq. Without hesitation.  straightish adj. Straightness n. [originally a past part. Of *stretch]

Architrave  n. 1 (in classical architecture) main beam resting across the tops of columns. 2 moulded frame around a doorway or window. [italian archi- *arch-, latin trabs beam]

Exhort  v. (often foll. By to + infin.) Urge strongly or earnestly.  exhortation n. Exhortative adj. Exhortatory adj. [latin exhortor encourage]

Sloop  n. Small one-masted fore-and-aft rigged vessel. [dutch sloep]

Unlimited  adj. Unrestricted; enormous (unlimited expanse).

Gramophone  n. = *record-player. [inversion of phonogram: as *phono-, *-gram]

Positivism  n. Philosophical system recognizing only facts and observable phenomena.  positivist n. & adj.

Birdbrain  n. Colloq. Stupid or flighty person.  birdbrained adj.

Grapeshot  n. Hist. Small balls used as charge in a cannon and scattering when fired.

Orphanage  n. Home for orphans.

Tartare  adj. (in phr. Sauce tartare) = *tartar sauce. [french]

Reassign  v. Assign again or differently.  reassignment n.

Invertebrate  —adj. (of an animal) not having a backbone. —n. Invertebrate animal.

Labrador  n. Retriever of a breed with a black or golden coat. [labrador in canada]

Minesweeper  n. Ship for clearing explosive mines from the sea.

Floss  —n. 1 rough silk of a silkworm's cocoon. 2 silk thread used in embroidery. 3 = *dental floss. —v. (also absol.) Clean (teeth) with dental floss.  flossy adj. [french floche]

Function  —n. 1 a proper or necessary role, activity, or purpose. B official or professional duty. 2 public or social occasion. 3 math. Quantity whose value depends on the varying values of others. —v. Fulfil a function, operate. [latin fungor funct- perform]

Overarm  adj. & adv. With the hand above the shoulder (bowl overarm; overarm service).

Feasible  adj. Practicable, possible.  feasibility n. Feasibly adv. [latin facio do]

Usage  feasible should not be used to mean ‘possible’ or ‘probable’ in the sense ‘likely’. ‘possible’ or ‘probable’ should be used instead.

Define  v. (-ning) 1 give the meaning of (a word etc.). 2 describe or explain the scope of (define one's position). 3 outline clearly (well-defined image). 4 mark out the boundary of.  definable adj. [latin finis end]

Stank  past of *stink.

Forbore  past of *forbear1.

Existentialism  n. Philosophical theory emphasizing the existence of the individual as a free and self-determining agent.  existentialist n. & adj.

Hurl  —v. 1 throw with great force. 2 utter (abuse etc.) Vehemently. —n. Forceful throw. [imitative]

Shuffle  —v. (-ling) 1 (also absol.) Drag (the feet) in walking etc. 2 (also absol.) Rearrange or intermingle (esp. Cards or papers). 3 a prevaricate, be evasive. B keep shifting one's position. —n. 1 act of shuffling; shuffling walk or movement. 2 change of relative positions. 3 shuffling dance.  shuffle off remove, get rid of. [low german]

Gimmick  n. Trick or device, esp. To attract attention or publicity.  gimmickry n. Gimmicky adj. [origin unknown]

Tree  —n. 1 perennial plant with a woody self-supporting main stem or trunk and usu. Unbranched for some distance above the ground. 2 piece or frame of wood etc. For various purposes (shoe-tree). 3 = *family tree. —v. (trees; treed) force to take refuge in a tree.

Monolingual  adj. Speaking or using only one language.

Disobedient  adj. Disobeying; rebellious.  disobedience n. Disobediently adv.

Butyl  n. The univalent alkyl radical c4h9. [latin butyrum *butter]

Monumental  adj. 1 a extremely great; stupendous (monumental effort). B (of a work of art etc.) Massive and permanent. 2 of or serving as a monument.  monumentally adv.

Worthy  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 deserving respect, estimable (lived a worthy life). 2 entitled to (esp. Condescending) recognition (a worthy old couple). 3 a (foll. By of or to + infin.) Deserving (worthy of a mention). B (foll. By of) adequate or suitable to the dignity etc. Of (words worthy of the occasion). —n. (pl. -ies) 1 worthy person. 2 person of some distinction.  worthily adv. Worthiness n.

Expend  v. Spend or use up (money, time, etc.). [latin pendo pens- weigh]

Tangly  adj. (-ier, -iest) tangled.

Portable  —adj. 1 easily movable, convenient for carrying. 2 (of a right, opinion, etc.) Capable of being transferred or adapted in altered circumstances (portable pension). —n. Portable version of an item, e.g. A television.  portability n. [latin porto carry]

Female  —adj. 1 of the sex that can give birth or produce eggs. 2 (of plants) fruit-bearing. 3 of women or female animals or plants. 4 (of a screw, socket, etc.) Hollow to receive an inserted part. —n. Female person, animal, or plant. [latin diminutive of femina woman, assimilated to male]

Coeducation  n. Education of pupils of both sexes together.  coeducational adj.

Wattage  n. Amount of electrical power expressed in watts.

Turmoil  n. 1 violent confusion; agitation. 2 din and bustle. [origin unknown]

Modulus  n. (pl. Moduli) math. Constant factor or ratio. [latin, = measure: related to *mode]

Guernsey  n. (pl. -s) 1 one of a breed of dairy cattle from guernsey in the channel islands. 2 (guernsey) type of thick woollen sweater.

Wardship  n. Tutelage.

Indicatory  adj. (often foll. By of) indicative.

Dose  —n. 1 single portion of medicine. 2 experience of something (dose of flu, laughter). 3 amount of radiation received. 4 slang venereal infection. —v. (-sing) treat with or give doses of medicine to. [greek dosis gift]

Impurity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 being impure. 2 impure thing or part.

Cycle  —n. 1 a recurrent round or period (of events, phenomena, etc.). B time needed for this. 2 a physics etc. Recurrent series of operations or states. B electr. = *hertz. 3 series of related songs, poems, etc. 4 bicycle, tricycle, etc. —v. (-ling) 1 ride a bicycle etc. 2 move in cycles. [greek kuklos circle]

Disapprobation  n. Formal disapproval.

Forebear  n. (also forbear) (usu. In pl.) Ancestor. [from *fore, obsolete beer: related to *be]

Tried  past and past part. Of *try.

Argent  n. & adj. Heraldry silver; silvery-white. [latin argentum]

Demist  v. Clear mist from (a windscreen etc.).  demister n.

Combe  var. Of *coomb.

Deputize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) (usu. Foll. By for) act as deputy.

Thorium  n. Chem. Radioactive metallic element. [thor, name of scandinavian god of thunder]

Baryon  n. Heavy elementary particle (i.e. A nucleon or a hyperon). [greek barus heavy]

Reading  n. 1 a act of reading (reading of the will). B matter to be read (made exciting reading). 2 (in comb.) Used for reading (reading-lamp; reading-room). 3 literary knowledge. 4 entertainment at which a play, poems, etc., are read. 5 figure etc. Shown by a recording instrument. 6 interpretation or view taken (what is your reading of the facts?).

Ant  n. Small usu. Wingless insect living in complex social colonies and proverbial for industry. [old english]

Crowbar  n. Iron bar with a flattened end, used as a lever.

Instrumentality  n. Agency or means.

Unbreakable  adj. Not breakable.

Birthstone  n. Gem popularly associated with the month of one's birth.

Aggressive  adj. 1 given to aggression; hostile. 2 forceful, self-assertive.  aggressively adv.

Presto  mus. —adv. & adj. In quick tempo. —n. (pl. -s) presto passage or movement. [latin praestus quick]

Feces  n.pl. (brit. Faeces) waste matter discharged from the bowels.  faecal adj. [latin]

Mostly  adv. 1 mainly. 2 usually.

Gamble  —v. (-ling) 1 play games of chance for money. 2 a bet (a sum of money) in gambling. B (often foll. By away) lose by gambling. 3 risk much in the hope of great gain. 4 (foll. By on) act in the hope of. —n. 1 risky undertaking. 2 spell of gambling.  gambler n.

Devolve  v. (-ving) 1 (foll. By on, upon, etc.) Pass (work or duties) or be passed to (a deputy etc.). 2 (foll. By on, to, upon) (of property etc.) Descend to.  devolvement n. [latin volvo volut- roll]

Magnet  n. 1 piece of iron, steel, alloy, ore, etc., having the properties of attracting iron and of pointing approximately north and south when suspended. 2 lodestone. 3 person or thing that attracts. [greek magnes -etos of magnesia: related to *magnesia]

Coextensive  adj. Extending over the same space or time.

Telegram  n. Message sent by telegraph and delivered in printed form.

Usage  since 1981 telegram has not been in uk official use, except for international messages. See also telemessage.

Feet  pl. Of *foot.

Bangle  n. Rigid bracelet or anklet. [hindi bangri]

Corner  —n. 1 place where converging sides or edges meet. 2 projecting angle, esp. Where two streets meet. 3 internal space or recess formed by the meeting of two sides, esp. Of a room. 4 difficult position, esp. One with no escape. 5 secluded place. 6 region or quarter, esp. A remote one. 7 action or result of buying or controlling the whole stock of a commodity. 8 boxing & wrestling corner of the ring where a contestant rests between rounds. 9 football & hockey free kick or hit from the corner of a pitch. —v. 1 force into a difficult or inescapable position. 2 establish a corner in (a commodity). 3 (esp. Of or in a vehicle) go round a corner. [latin: related to *corn2]

Depository  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a storehouse. B store (of wisdom, knowledge, etc.). 2 = *depositary. [latin: related to *deposit]

Guilt  n. 1 fact of having committed a specified or implied offence. 2 feeling of having done wrong. [old english]

Rattan  n. 1 climbing palm with long thin jointed pliable stems, used for furniture etc. 2 piece of rattan stem used as a walking-stick etc. [malay]

Gypsy  n. (also gipsy) (pl. -ies) member of a nomadic people of europe and n. America, of hindu origin with dark skin and hair. [from *egyptian]

Geocentric  adj. 1 considered as viewed from the earth's centre. 2 having the earth as the centre.  geocentrically adv.

Heathen  —n. 1 person not belonging to a predominant religion, esp. Not a christian, jew, or muslim. 2 person regarded as lacking culture or moral principles. —adj. 1 of heathens. 2 having no religion. [old english]

Gymnastics  n.pl. (also treated as sing.) 1 exercises performed in order to develop or display physical agility. 2 other forms of physical or mental agility.

Topless  adj. 1 without a top. 2 a (of clothes) having no upper part. B (of esp. A woman) bare-breasted. C (of a place) where women go topless; employing bare-breasted women.

Scoop  —n. 1 spoon-shaped object, esp.: a a short-handled deep shovel for loose materials. B a large long-handled ladle for liquids. C the excavating part of a digging-machine etc. D an instrument for serving ice-cream etc. 2 quantity taken up by a scoop. 3 scooping movement. 4 exclusive news item. 5 large profit made quickly. —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By out) hollow out (as if) with a scoop. 2 (usu. Foll. By up) lift (as if) with a scoop. 3 forestall (a rival newspaper etc.) With a scoop. 4 secure (a large profit etc.), esp. Suddenly. [low german or dutch]

Quiz  —n. (pl. Quizzes) 1 test of knowledge, esp. As entertainment. 2 interrogation, examination. —v. (-zz-) examine by questioning. [origin unknown]

Knotty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 full of knots. 2 puzzling (knotty problem).

Tenter  n. Machine for stretching cloth to dry in shape. [medieval latin tentorium: related to *tend1]

Teredo  n. (pl. -s) bivalve mollusc that bores into submerged timbers of ships etc. [latin from greek]

Fixity  n. Fixed state; stability; permanence.

Wither  v. 1 (often foll. By up) make or become dry and shrivelled. 2 (often foll. By away) deprive of or lose vigour or freshness. 3 (esp. As withering adj.) Blight with scorn etc.  witheringly adv. [apparently var. Of *weather]

Cyanide  n. Highly poisonous substance used in the extraction of gold and silver.

Meson  n. Elementary particle believed to help hold nucleons together in the atomic nucleus. [from *meso-]

Rectal  adj. Of or by means of the rectum.

Enamel  —n. 1 glasslike opaque ornamental or preservative coating on metal etc. 2 a smooth hard coating. B a kind of hard gloss paint. C cosmetic simulating this, esp. Nail varnish. 3 hard coating of a tooth. 4 painting done in enamel. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) inlay, coat, or portray with enamel.

Passbook  n. Book issued to an account-holder recording deposits and withdrawals.

Forego  var. Of *forgo.

Mandarin  n. 1 (mandarin) official language of china. 2 hist. Chinese official. 3 powerful person, esp. A top civil servant. 4 (in full mandarin orange) = *tangerine 1. [hindi mantri]

Blessed  adj. (also poet. Blest) 1 holy. 2 euphem. Cursed (blessed nuisance!). 3 rc ch. Beatified.  blessedness n.

Oligarch  n. Member of an oligarchy. [greek oligoi few]

Funfair  n. Fair with amusements and sideshows.

Inducement  n. Attractive offer; incentive; bribe.

Diamond  n. 1 very hard transparent precious stone of pure crystallized carbon. 2 rhombus. 3 a playing-card of the suit denoted by a red rhombus. B (in pl.) This suit. [greek: related to *adamant]

Rambutan  n. 1 red plum-sized prickly fruit. 2 e. Indian tree bearing this. [malay]

Please  v. (-sing) 1 be agreeable to; make glad; give pleasure. 2 (in passive) a (foll. By to + infin.) Be glad or willing to (am pleased to help). B (often foll. By about, at, with) derive pleasure or satisfaction (from). 3 (with it as subject) be the inclination or wish of (it did not please him to attend). 4 think fit (take as many as you please). 5 used in polite requests (come in, please).  if you please if you are willing, esp. Iron. To indicate unreasonableness (then, if you please, we had to pay). Please oneself do as one likes.  pleased adj. Pleasing adj. [french plaisir from latin placeo]

Adder  n. Small venomous snake, esp. The common viper. [old english, originally nadder]

Isomorphic  adj. (also isomorphous) exactly corresponding in form and relations. [from *iso-, greek morphe form]

Springboard  n. 1 flexible board for leaping or diving from. 2 source of impetus.

Abstain  v. 1 (usu. Foll. By from) refrain from indulging (abstained from smoking). 2 decline to vote. [latin teneo tent- hold]

Repudiate  v. (-ting) 1 a disown, disavow, reject. B refuse dealings with. C deny. 2 refuse to recognize or obey (authority or a treaty). 3 refuse to discharge (an obligation or debt).  repudiation n. [latin repudium divorce]

Usage  see note at refute.

Breach  —n. 1 (often foll. By of) breaking or non-observation of a law, contract, etc. 2 breaking of relations; quarrel. 3 opening, gap. —v. 1 break through; make a gap in. 2 break (a law, contract, etc.).  step into the breach help in a crisis, esp. As a replacement. [germanic: related to *break]

Accursed  adj. 1 under a curse. 2 colloq. Detestable, annoying. [old english a- intensive prefix, *curse]

-itis  suffix forming nouns, esp.: 1 names of inflammatory diseases (appendicitis). 2 colloq. With ref. To conditions compared to diseases (electionitis). [greek]

Physique  n. Bodily structure and development. [french: related to *physic]

Lascivious  adj. 1 lustful. 2 inciting to lust.  lasciviously adv. [latin]

Reran  past of *rerun.

Furnishings  n.pl. Furniture and fitments in a house, room, etc.

Interdisciplinary  adj. Of or between more than one branch of learning.

Shoestring  n. 1 shoelace. 2 colloq. Small esp. Inadequate amount of money.

Offbeat  —adj. 1 not coinciding with the beat. 2 eccentric, unconventional. —n. Any of the unaccented beats in a bar.

Programme  (us program) —n. 1 list of events, performers, etc. At a public function etc. 2 radio or television broadcast. 3 plan of events (programme is dinner and an early night). 4 course or series of studies, lectures, etc. 5 (usu. Program) series of coded instructions for a computer etc. —v. (-mm-; us -m-) 1 make a programme of. 2 (usu. Program) express (a problem) or instruct (a computer) by means of a program.  programmable adj. Programmatic adj. Programmer n. (in sense 5 of n.). [greek grapho write]

Underwhelm  v. Joc. Fail to impress. [alteration of *overwhelm]

Mimetic  adj. Of or practising imitation or mimicry. [greek mimetikos: see *mimeograph]

Ctc  abbr.  City technology college.

Forage  —n. 1 food for horses and cattle. 2 searching for food. —v. 1 search for food; rummage. 2 collect food from. 3 get by foraging. [germanic: related to *fodder]

Faun  n. Latin rural deity with goat's horns, legs, and tail. [latin faunus]

Wainscoting  n. 1 wainscot. 2 material for this.

Gloat  —v. (often foll. By over etc.) Look or consider with greed, malice, etc. —n. Act of gloating. [origin unknown]

Conveyor  n. (also conveyer) person or thing that conveys.

Deceit  n. 1 deception, esp. By concealing the truth. 2 dishonest trick. [latin capio take]

Pony  n. (pl. -ies) horse of any small breed. [perhaps from french poulenet foal]

Cockpit  n. 1 a compartment for the pilot (and crew) of an aircraft or spacecraft. B driver's seat in a racing car. C space for the helmsman in some yachts. 2 arena of war or other conflict. 3 place for cock-fights.

Brigantine  n. Two-masted ship with a square-rigged foremast and a fore-and-aft rigged mainmast. [french or italian: related to *brigand]

Veritable  adj. Real; rightly so called (a veritable feast).  veritably adv. [french: related to *verity]

Epilogue  n. 1 short piece ending a literary work. 2 speech addressed to the audience by an actor at the end of a play. [greek logos speech]

Lane  n. 1 narrow road. 2 division of a road for a stream of traffic. 3 strip of track etc. For a competitor in a race. 4 path regularly followed by a ship, aircraft, etc. 5 gangway between crowds of people. [old english]

Foolish  adj. Lacking good sense or judgement; unwise.  foolishly adv. Foolishness n.

Splenic  adj. Of or in the spleen. [latin from greek: related to *spleen]

Lame  —adj. 1 disabled in the foot or leg. 2 a (of an excuse etc.) Unconvincing; feeble. B (of verse etc.) Halting. —v. (-ming) make lame; disable.  lamely adv. Lameness n. [old english]

Interdependent  adj. Dependent on each other.  interdependence n.

Nor  conj. And not; and not either (neither one thing nor the other; can neither read nor write). [contraction of obsolete nother: related to *no2, *whether]

Syphilis  n. Contagious venereal disease.  syphilitic adj. [syphilus, name of a character in a poem of 1530]

Exemplary  adj. 1 fit to be imitated; outstandingly good. 2 serving as a warning. 3 illustrative. [latin: related to *example]

Dot  abbr. Department of transport.

Infill  —n. 1 material used to fill a hole, gap, etc. 2 filling gaps (esp. In a row of buildings). —v. Fill in (a cavity etc.).

Lampshade  n. Translucent cover for a lamp.

Crouch  —v. Lower the body with limbs close to the chest; be in this position. —n. Crouching; crouching position. [old norse: related to *crook]

Diaspora  n. 1 the dispersion of the jews after their exile in 538 bc. 2 the dispersed jews. [greek]

Aside  —adv. To or on one side; away, apart. —n. Words spoken aside, esp. Confidentially to the audience by an actor.

Minaret  n. Slender turret next to a mosque, from which the muezzin calls at hours of prayer. [french or spanish from turkish from arabic]

Clutter  —n. 1 crowded and untidy collection of things. 2 untidy state. —v. (often foll. By up, with) crowd untidily, fill with clutter. [related to *clot]

Pants  n.pl. 1 underpants or knickers. 2 us trousers.  bore (or scare etc.) The pants off colloq. Bore, scare, etc., greatly. With one's pants down colloq. In an embarrassingly unprepared state. [abbreviation of *pantaloons]

Preamble  n. 1 preliminary statement. 2 introductory part of a statute or deed etc. [latin: related to *amble]

Nutrient  —n. Substance that provides essential nourishment. —adj. Serving as or providing nourishment. [latin nutrio nourish]

Dada  n. Early 20th-c. Artistic and literary movement repudiating conventions.  dadaism n. Dadaist n. & adj. Dadaistic adj. [french dada hobby-horse]

Paint  —n. 1 pigment, esp. In liquid form, for colouring a surface. 2 this as a dried film or coating (paint peeled off). —v. 1 a cover (a wall, object, etc.) With paint. B apply paint of a specified colour to (paint the door green). 2 depict (an object, scene, etc.) In paint; produce (a picture) thus. 3 describe vividly (painted a gloomy picture). 4 joc. Or archaic a apply make-up to (the face, skin, etc.). B apply (a liquid to the skin etc.).  paint out efface with paint. Paint the town red colloq. Enjoy oneself flamboyantly. [latin pingo pict-]

Deteriorate  v. (-ting) become worse.  deterioration n. [latin deterior worse]

Tumor  n. (brit. Tumour) a swelling, esp. From an abnormal growth of tissue.  tumorous adj. [latin tumeo swell]

Latter  adj. 1 a second-mentioned of two, or last-mentioned of three or more. B (prec. By the; usu. Absol.) The second- or last-mentioned person or thing. 2 nearer the end (latter part of the year). 3 recent. 4 of the end of a period, the world, etc. [old english, = later]

Usage  the use of latter to mean ‘last mentioned of three or more’ is considered incorrect by some people.

Stagey  var. Of *stagy.

Uncured  adj. 1 not cured. 2 (of pork etc.) Not salted or smoked.

Reagent  n. Chem. Substance used to cause a reaction, esp. To detect another substance.

Carousel  n. 1 us merry-go-round. 2 rotating luggage delivery system at an airport etc. [french from italian]

Granivorous  adj. Feeding on grain. [latin: related to *grain]

Lychee  n. (also litchi, lichee) 1 sweet white juicy fruit in a brown skin. 2 tree, orig. From china, bearing this. [chinese]

Infantry  n. (pl. -ies) body of foot-soldiers; foot-soldiers collectively. [italian infante youth, foot-soldier]

Stamp  —v. 1 a bring down (one's foot) heavily, esp. On the ground. B (often foll. By on) crush or flatten in this way. C walk heavily. 2 a impress (a design, mark, etc.) On a surface. B impress (a surface) with a pattern etc. 3 affix a postage or other stamp to. 4 assign a specific character to; mark out. —n. 1 instrument for stamping. 2 a mark or design made by this. B impression of an official mark required to be made on deeds, bills of exchange, etc., as evidence of payment of tax. 3 small adhesive piece of paper indicating that payment has been made, esp. A postage stamp. 4 mark or label etc. On a commodity as evidence of quality etc. 5 act or sound of stamping the foot. 6 characteristic mark or quality.  stamp on 1 impress (an idea etc.) On (the memory etc.). 2 suppress.

Diminuendo  mus. —n. (pl -s) gradual decrease in loudness. —adv. & adj. Decreasing in loudness. [italian: related to *diminish]

Restyle  v. (-ling) reshape; remake in a new style.

Follower  n. 1 supporter or devotee. 2 person who follows.

Maiolica  n. (also majolica) white tin-glazed earthenware decorated with metallic colours or enamelled. [italian, from the former name of majorca]

Unanswered  adj. Not answered.

Activism  n. Policy of vigorous action, esp. For a political cause.  activist n.

Wrote  past of *write.

Message  n. 1 communication sent by one person to another. 2 exalted or spiritual communication. 3 (in pl.) Scot., ir., & n.engl. Shopping.  get the message colloq. Understand (a hint etc.). [latin mitto miss- send]

Act  —n. 1 something done; a deed. 2 process of doing (caught in the act). 3 item of entertainment. 4 pretence (all an act). 5 main division of a play etc. 6 a decree of a legislative body. B document attesting a legal transaction. —v. 1 behave (acted wisely). 2 perform an action or function; take action (act as referee; brakes failed to act; he acted quickly). 3 (also foll. By on) have an effect (alcohol acts on the brain). 4 a perform a part in a play, film, etc. B pretend. 5 a play the part of (acted othello; acts the fool). B perform (a play etc.). C portray (an incident) by actions.  act for be the (esp. Legal) representative of. Act of god natural event, e.g. An earthquake. Act up colloq. Misbehave; give trouble (car is acting up). Get one's act together slang become properly organized; prepare. Put on an act colloq. Make a pretence. [latin ago act- do]

Cornflake  n. 1 (in pl.) Breakfast cereal of toasted maize flakes. 2 flake of this cereal.

Stranglehold  n. 1 throttling hold in wrestling. 2 deadly grip. 3 complete control.

Yachtsman  n. (fem. Yachtswoman) person who sails yachts.

Acclaim  —v. 1 welcome or applaud enthusiastically. 2 hail as (acclaimed him king). —n. Applause, welcome, public praise. [latin acclamo: related to *claim]

Oubliette  n. Secret dungeon with a trapdoor entrance. [french oublier forget]

Maybe  adv. Perhaps. [from it may be]

Trend  —n. General direction and tendency (esp. Of events, fashion, or opinion). —v. 1 bend or turn away in a specified direction. 2 have a general tendency. [old english]

Sway  —v. 1 (cause to) lean or move unsteadily from side to side. 2 oscillate; waver. 3 a control the motion or direction of. B influence; rule over. —n. 1 rule, influence, or government (hold sway). 2 swaying motion. [origin uncertain]

Heater  n. Stove or other heating device.

Remorse  n. 1 deep regret for a wrong committed. 2 compunction; compassion, mercy (without remorse). [medieval latin mordeo mors- bite]

Unnerve  v. (-ving) deprive of confidence etc.

Electron  n. Stable elementary particle with a charge of negative electricity, found in all atoms and acting as the primary carrier of electricity in solids.

December  n. Twelfth month of the year. [latin decem ten, originally 10th month of roman year]

Possibility  n. (pl. -ies) 1 state or fact of being possible. 2 thing that may exist or happen. 3 (usu. In pl.) Capability of being used; potential (have possibilities). [latin posse be able]

Roundhead  n. Hist. Member of the parliamentary party in the english civil war.

Unappealing  adj. Unattractive.

Milage  var. Of *mileage.

Pullulate  v. (-ting) 1 (of a seed, shoot, etc.) Bud, sprout. 2 swarm, teem. 3 develop; spring up. 4 (foll. By with) abound.  pullulation n. [latin pullulo sprout]

Sentry  n. (pl. -ies) soldier etc. Stationed to keep guard. [perhaps from obsolete centrinel, var. Of *sentinel]

Cenozoic  (also cainozoic, caenozoic) —adj. Of the most recent geological era, marked by the evolution and development of mammals etc. —n. This era. [greek kainos new, zoion animal]

Refectory  n. (pl. -ies) dining-room, esp. In a monastery or college. [latin reficio renew]

Footbrake  n. Foot-operated brake on a vehicle.

Synchronic  adj. Concerned with a subject as it exists at one point in time.  synchronically adv. [from *syn-, greek khronos time]

Guzzle  v. (-ling) eat or drink greedily. [probably french gosiller from gosier throat]

Sneeze  —n. Sudden loud involuntary expulsion of air from the nose and mouth caused by irritation of the nostrils. —v. (-zing) make a sneeze.  not to be sneezed at colloq. Worth having or considering. [old english]

Noiseless  adj. Making little or no noise.  noiselessly adv.

Barbarism  n. 1 barbaric state or act. 2 non-standard word or expression.

Triumphalism  n. Excessive exultation over the victories of one's own party etc.  triumphalist adj. & n.

Untiring  adj. Tireless.  untiringly adv.

Hectogram  n. (also hectogramme) metric unit of mass equal to 100 grams.

Spotter  n. 1 (often in comb.) Person who spots people or things (train-spotter). 2 (in full spotter plane) aircraft used to locate enemy positions etc.

Prophet  n. (fem. Prophetess) 1 teacher or interpreter of the supposed will of god. 2 a person who foretells events. B spokesman; advocate (prophet of the new order). 3 (the prophet) muhammad. [greek prophetes spokesman]

Bacillus  n. (pl. Bacilli) rod-shaped bacterium, esp. One causing disease.  bacillary adj. [latin, diminutive of baculus stick]

Formless  adj. Without definite or regular form.  formlessness n.

Synthetic  —adj. 1 made by chemical synthesis, esp. To imitate a natural product. 2 affected, insincere. —n. Synthetic substance.  synthetically adv.

Worshipful  adj. (also worshipful) archaic (esp. In old titles of companies or officers) honourable, distinguished.

Asinine  adj. Like an ass, esp. Stupid or stubborn.  asininity n. [latin asinus ass]

Airline  n. Public air transport system or company.

Telegraphic  adj. 1 of or by telegraphs or telegrams. 2 economically worded.  telegraphically adv.

Indent  —v. 1 make or impress marks, notches, dents, etc. In. 2 start (a line of print or writing) further from the margin than others. 3 draw up (a legal document) in duplicate. 4 a (often foll. By on, upon a person, for a thing) make a requisition. B order (goods) by requisition. —n. 1 a order (esp. From abroad) for goods. B official requisition for stores. 2 indented line. 3 indentation. 4 indenture. [latin dens dentis tooth]

Snowstorm  n. Heavy fall of snow, esp. With a high wind.

Exalt  v. 1 raise in rank or power etc. 2 praise highly. 3 (usu. As exalted adj.) Make lofty or noble (exalted aims; exalted style).  exaltation n. [latin altus high]

Repent  v. 1 (often foll. By of) feel deep sorrow about one's actions etc. 2 (also absol.) Wish one had not done; resolve not to continue (a wrongdoing etc.).  repentance n. Repentant adj. [latin paeniteo]

Monkey  —n. (pl. -eys) 1 any of various primates, including marmosets, baboons etc., esp. A small long-tailed kind. 2 mischievous person, esp. A child.  —v. (-eys, -eyed) 1 (often foll. By with) tamper or play mischievous tricks. 2 (foll. By around, about) fool around. [origin unknown]

Pallor  n. Paleness. [latin palleo be pale]

Transship  v. (-pp-)  transfer from one ship or form of transport to another.  transshipment n.

Herbivore  n. Animal that feeds on plants.  herbivorous adj. [latin voro devour]

Harlequin  —n. (harlequin) name of a mute character in pantomime, usu. Masked and dressed in a diamond-patterned costume. —attrib. Adj. In varied colours. [french]

Pique  —v. (piques, piqued, piquing) 1 wound the pride of, irritate. 2 arouse (curiosity, interest, etc.). —n. Resentment; hurt pride. [french: related to *piquant]

Servant  n. 1 person employed to do domestic duties, esp. In a wealthy household. 2 devoted follower or helper. [french: related to *serve]

Ionize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) convert or be converted into an ion or ions.  ionization n.

Peptide  n. Biochem. Compound consisting of two or more amino acids bonded in sequence. [greek peptos cooked]

Disproportionate  adj. 1 out of proportion. 2 relatively too large or small etc.  disproportionately adv.

Monolith  n. 1 single block of stone, esp. Shaped into a pillar etc. 2 person or thing like a monolith in being massive, immovable, or solidly uniform.  monolithic adj. [greek lithos stone]

Wort  n. 1 archaic (except in names) plant (liverwort). 2 infusion of malt before it is fermented into beer. [old english]

Sweetcorn  n. Sweet-flavoured maize kernels.

Retinue  n. Body of attendants accompanying an important person. [french: related to *retain]

Leonine  adj. 1 like a lion. 2 of or relating to lions. [latin: related to *leo]

Untamed  adj. Not tamed, wild.

Qua  conj. In the capacity of. [latin, = in the way in which]

Ungulate  —adj. Hoofed. —n. Hoofed mammal. [latin ungula hoof, claw]

Ploy  n. Cunning manoeuvre to gain advantage. [origin unknown]

Jellaba  var. Of *djellaba.

Mystic  —n. Person who seeks by contemplation etc. To achieve unity with the deity, or who believes in the spiritual apprehension of truths that are beyond the understanding. —adj. = *mystical.  mysticism n. [greek mustes initiated person]

Knives  pl. Of *knife.

Trestle  n. 1 supporting structure for a table etc., consisting of two frames fixed at an angle or hinged, or of a bar with two divergent pairs of legs. 2 (in full trestle-table) table of a board or boards on trestles etc. 3 (in full trestle-work) open braced framework to support a bridge etc. [latin transtrum cross-beam]

Timberline  n. Line or level above which no trees grow.

Assuming  adj. Arrogant, presumptuous.

Malfeasance  n.  Formal misconduct, esp. In an official capacity. [french: related to *mal-]

Skeptic  n. (brit. Sceptic) 1 person inclined to doubt accepted opinions. 2 person who doubts the truth of religions. 3 philosopher who questions the possibility of knowledge.  scepticism n. [greek skeptomai observe]

Draconian  adj. (of laws) very harsh, cruel. [drakon, name of an athenian lawgiver]

Intellectual  —adj. 1 of or appealing to the intellect. 2 possessing a highly developed intellect. 3 requiring the intellect. —n. Intellectual person.  intellectuality n. Intellectualize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). Intellectually adv.

Whitewash  —n. 1 solution of quicklime or whiting for whitening walls etc. 2 means employed to conceal mistakes or faults. —v. 1 cover with whitewash. 2 attempt to clear the reputation of by concealing facts.

Unvoiced  adj. 1 not spoken. 2 (of a consonant etc.) Not voiced.

Dogged  adj. Tenacious; grimly persistent.  doggedly adv. Doggedness n.

Overhaul  —v. 1 thoroughly examine the condition of and repair if necessary. 2 overtake. —n. Thorough examination, with repairs if necessary.

Popish  adj. Derog. Roman catholic.

Store  —n. 1 quantity of something kept available for use. 2 (in pl.) A articles gathered for a particular purpose. B supply of, or place for keeping, these. 3 a = *department store. B esp. Us shop. C (often in pl.) Shop selling basic necessities. 4 warehouse for keeping furniture etc. Temporarily. 5 device in a computer for keeping retrievable data. —v. (-ring) 1 (often foll. By up, away) accumulate for future use. 2 put (furniture etc.) In a store. 3 stock or provide with something useful. 4 keep (data) for retrieval.  in store 1 kept in readiness. 2 coming in the future. 3 (foll. By for) awaiting. Set store by consider important. [french estore(r) from latin instauro renew]

Transportation  n. 1 conveying or being conveyed. 2 a system of conveying. B esp. Us means of this. 3 hist. Deportation of convicts.

Curette  —n. Surgeon's small scraping-instrument. —v. (-tting) clean or scrape with this.  curettage n. [french: related to *cure]

Malign  —adj. 1 (of a thing) injurious. 2 (of a disease) malignant. 3 malevolent. —v. Speak ill of; slander.  malignity n. [latin malus bad]

Lobster  n. 1 marine crustacean with two pincer-like claws. 2 its flesh as food. [latin locusta lobster, *locust]

Painful  adj. 1 causing bodily or mental pain. 2 (esp. Of part of the body) suffering pain. 3 causing trouble or difficulty; laborious (painful climb).  painfully adv.

Cormorant  n. Diving sea bird with black plumage. [latin corvus marinus sea-raven]

Fiberglass  n. (brit. Fibreglass) 1 fabric made from woven glass fibres. 2 plastic reinforced by glass fibres.

Slung  past and past part. Of *sling1.

Croquet  —n. 1 lawn game in which wooden balls are driven through hoops with mallets. 2 act of croqueting a ball. —v. (croqueted; croqueting) drive away (an opponent's ball) by placing and then striking one's own against it. [perhaps a dial. Form of french crochet hook]

Intent  —n. Intention; purpose (with intent to defraud). —adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By on) a resolved, determined. B attentively occupied. 2 (esp. Of a look) earnest; eager.  to all intents and purposes practically; virtually.  intently adv. Intentness n. [latin intentus]

Lining  n. Material which lines a surface etc.

Scuba  n. (pl. -s) aqualung. [acronym of self-contained underwater breathing apparatus]

Icelandic  —adj. Of iceland. —n. Language of iceland.

Clearway  n. Main road (other than a motorway) on which vehicles may not normally stop.

Linguistics  n. The study of language and its structure.

Turner  n. Person who works with a lathe.

Marginalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make or treat as insignificant.  marginalization n.

Prompter  n. Person who prompts actors.

Understudy  esp. Theatr. —n. (pl. -ies) person ready to take on another's role etc. When required. —v. (-ies, -ied) 1 study (a role etc.) Thus. 2 act as an understudy to.

Oxygenate  v. (-ting) supply, treat, or mix with oxygen; oxidize.

Cowardice  n. Lack of bravery.

Pimento  n. (pl. -s) 1 tree native to jamaica. 2 berries of this, usu. Crushed for culinary use; allspice. 3 = *pimiento. [latin: related to *pigment]

Croesus  n. Person of great wealth. [name of a king of ancient lydia]

Chaperon  —n. Person, esp. An older woman, ensuring propriety by accompanying a young unmarried woman on social occasions. —v. Act as chaperon to.  chaperonage n. [french from chape cope: related to *cape1]

Bargain  —n. 1 a agreement on the terms of a sale etc. B this from the buyer's viewpoint (a bad bargain). 2 cheap thing. —v. (often foll. By with, for) discuss the terms of a sale etc. (bargained with me; bargain for the table).  bargain for (or colloq. On) be prepared for; expect. Bargain on rely on. Into the bargain moreover. [french from germanic]

Na  symb. Sodium.

Unshakeable  adj. Firm; obstinate.  unshakeably adv.

Unrelenting  adj. Not abating, yielding, or relaxing; unmerciful.  unrelentingly adv.

Cherish  v. 1 protect or tend lovingly. 2 hold dear, cling to (hopes, feelings, etc.). [french cher dear, from latin carus]

Cochineal  n. 1 scarlet dye used esp. For colouring food. 2 insects whose dried bodies yield this. [latin coccinus scarlet, from greek]

Km  abbr. Kilometre(s).

Buttercup  n. Wild plant with yellow cup-shaped flowers.

Plop  —n. Sound as of a smooth object dropping into water without a splash. —v. (-pp-) fall or drop with a plop. —adv. With a plop. [imitative]

Sorrowful  adj. Feeling, causing, or showing sorrow.  sorrowfully adv.

Mucous  adj. Of or covered with mucus.  mucosity n. [latin mucosus: related to *mucus]

Sawtooth  adj. (also sawtoothed) serrated.

Revisionism  n. Often derog. Revision or modification of an orthodoxy, esp. Of marxism.  revisionist n. & adj.

Acronym  n. Word formed from the initial letters of other words (e.g. Laser, nato). [greek akron end, onoma name]

Antimatter  n. Matter composed solely of antiparticles.

Raring  adj. Colloq. Enthusiastic, eager (raring to go). [participle of rare, dial. Var. Of *roar or *rear2]

Brocade  —n. Rich fabric woven with a raised pattern. —v. (-ding) weave in this way. [italian brocco twisted thread]

Publication  n. 1 a preparation and issuing of a book, newspaper, etc. To the public. B book etc. So issued. 2 making something publicly known. [latin: related to *public]

Evidential  adj. Of or providing evidence.

Paid  past and past part. Of *pay.

Humor  (brit. Humour) —n. 1 a quality of being amusing or comic. B the expression of humour in literature, speech, etc. 2 (in full sense of humour) ability to perceive or express humour. 3 state of mind; inclination (bad humour). 4 (in full cardinal humour) hist. Each of the four fluids (blood, phlegm, choler, melancholy), thought to determine a person's physical and mental qualities. —v. Gratify or indulge (a person or taste etc.).  out of humour displeased.  humourless adj. [latin humor moisture]

Oilskin  n. 1 cloth waterproofed with oil. 2 a garment of this. B (in pl.) Suit of this.

Hyperglycemia  n. (brit. Hyperglycaemia) excess of glucose in the bloodstream. [from *hyper-, greek glukus sweet, haima blood]

Siskin  n. Yellowish-green songbird. [dutch]

Waylay  v. (past and past part. Waylaid) 1 lie in wait for. 2 stop to talk to or rob.

-sion  see *-ion.

Ilex  n. (pl. -es) 1 tree or shrub of the genus including the common holly. 2 holm-oak. [latin]

Unswept  adj. Not swept.

Pallbearer  n. Person helping to carry or escort a coffin at a funeral.
