Crescendo  —n. (pl. -s) 1 mus. Gradual increase in loudness. 2 progress towards a climax. —adv. & adj. Increasing in loudness. [italian: related to *crescent]

Usage  crescendo is sometimes wrongly used to mean the climax itself rather than progress towards it.

Episcopate  n. 1 the office or tenure of a bishop. 2 (prec. By the) the bishops collectively. [church latin: related to *bishop]

Forefront  n. 1 leading position. 2 foremost part.

Christendom  n. Christians worldwide.

Candlestick  n. Holder for one or more candles.

Sacristy  n. (pl. -ies) room in a church where vestments, sacred vessels, etc., are kept. [medieval latin: related to *sacred]

Opposition  n. 1 resistance, antagonism. 2 being hostile or in conflict or disagreement. 3 contrast, antithesis. 4 a group or party of opponents or competitors. B (the opposition) chief parliamentary party opposed to that in office. 5 act of placing opposite. 6 diametrically opposite position of two celestial bodies. [latin: related to *position]

Greenery  n. Green foliage or growing plants.

Mainland  n. Large continuous extent of land, excluding neighbouring islands.

Southpaw  colloq. —n. Left-handed person, esp. In boxing. —adj. Left-handed.

Pleach  v. Entwine or interlace (esp. Branches to form a hedge). [latin: related to *plexus]

Grammatical  adj. Of or conforming to the rules of grammar.  grammatically adv.

Constrict  v. Make narrow or tight; compress.  constriction n. Constrictive adj. [latin: related to *constrain]

Dashboard  n. Instrument panel of a vehicle or aircraft.

Valetudinarian  —n. Person of poor health or who is unduly anxious about health. —adj. Of a valetudinarian.  valetudinarianism n. [latin valetudo health]

Compunction  n. 1 pricking of conscience. 2 slight regret; scruple. [church latin: related to *point]

Careerist  n. Person predominantly concerned with personal advancement.

Luxuriant  adj. 1 growing profusely. 2 exuberant. 3 florid.  luxuriance n. Luxuriantly adv. [latin: related to *luxury]

Usage  luxuriant is sometimes confused with luxurious.

Subdue  v. (-dues, -dued, -duing) 1 conquer, subjugate, or tame. 2 (as subdued adj.) Softened; lacking in intensity; toned down. [latin subduco]

Bookbinder  n. Person who binds books for a living.  bookbinding n.

Predict  v. (often foll. By that) foretell, prophesy.  predictor n. [latin praedico -dict- foretell]

Unspoken  adj. 1 not expressed in speech. 2 not uttered as speech.

Ballet  n. 1 dramatic or representational style of dancing to music. 2 particular piece or performance of ballet.  balletic adj. [french: related to *ball2]

Origan  n. (also origanum) wild marjoram.  [latin from greek]

Nominative  gram. —n. Case expressing the subject of a verb. —adj. Of or in this case.

Bishopric  n. Office or diocese of a bishop.

Egyptian  —adj. Of egypt. —n. 1 native of egypt. 2 language of the ancient egyptians.

Fpa  abbr. Family planning association.

Walk  —v. 1 a progress by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once. B (of a quadruped) go with the slowest gait. 2 a travel or go on foot. B take exercise in this way. 3 traverse on foot at walking speed, tread the floor or surface of. 4 cause to walk with one (walk the dog). —n. 1 a act of walking, the ordinary human gait. B slowest gait of an animal. C person's manner of walking. 2 a distance which can be walked in a (usu. Specified) time (ten minutes' walk from here). B excursion on foot. 3 place or track intended or suitable for walking.  walk all over colloq. 1 defeat easily. 2 take advantage of. Walk away from 1 easily outdistance. 2 refuse to become involved with. Walk away with colloq. = walk off with. Walk into colloq. 1 encounter through unwariness. 2 get (a job) easily. Walk off with colloq. 1 steal. 2 win easily. Walk on air feel elated.

Structure  —n. 1 a constructed unit, esp. A building. B way in which a building etc. Is constructed. 2 framework (new wages structure). —v. (-ring) give structure to; organize. [latin struo struct- build]

Abroad  adv. 1 in or to a foreign country or countries. 2 widely (scatter abroad). 3 in circulation (rumour abroad).

Fishery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 place where fish are caught or reared. 2 industry of fishing or breeding fish.

Exegesis  n. (pl. Exegeses) critical explanation of a text, esp. Of scripture.  exegetic adj. [greek hegeomai lead]

Casemate  n. 1 embrasured room in a fortress wall. 2 armoured enclosure for guns on a warship. [french and italian]

Alright  adv. = all right (see *all).

Usage  although widely used, alright is still non-standard and is considered incorrect by many people.

Praise  —v. (-sing) 1 express warm approval or admiration of. 2 glorify (god) in words. —n. Praising; commendation. [french preisier from latin pretium price]

Arson  n. Crime of deliberately setting fire to property.  arsonist n. [latin ardeo ars- burn]

Minstrel  n. 1 medieval singer or musician. 2 (usu. In pl.) Entertainer with a blacked face singing ostensibly black songs in a group. [related to *minister]

Alkyne  n. Chem. Unsaturated aliphatic hydrocarbon containing a triple bond and having the general formula cnh2n-2, including acetylene.

Eyebright  n. Plant used as a remedy for weak eyes.

Apostolate  n. 1 position or authority of an apostle. 2 leadership in reform.

Suitable  adj. (usu. Foll. By to, for) well-fitted; appropriate.  suitability n. Suitably adv.

Cuboid  —adj. Cube-shaped; like a cube. —n. Geom. Rectangular parallelepiped.

Assessor  n. 1 person who assesses (esp. For tax or insurance). 2 legal adviser on technical questions.

Repeat  —v. 1 say or do over again. 2 recite, rehearse, or report (something learnt or heard). 3 recur; appear again. 4 (of food) be tasted after being swallowed due to belching. —n. 1 a repeating. B thing repeated (often attrib.: repeat prescription). 2 repeated broadcast. 3 mus. A passage intended to be repeated. B mark indicating this. 4 pattern repeated in wallpaper etc.  repeat itself recur in the same form. Repeat oneself say or do the same thing over again.  repeatable adj. Repeatedly adv. [latin peto seek]

Pillbox  n. 1 shallow cylindrical box for holding pills. 2 hat of a similar shape. 3 mil. Small partly underground enclosed concrete fort.

Jobbery  n. Corrupt dealing.

Analyst  n. 1 person skilled in (esp. Chemical or computer) analysis. 2 psychoanalyst.

Perpetrate  v. (-ting) commit (a crime, blunder, or anything outrageous).  perpetration n. Perpetrator n. [latin perpetro perform]

European  —adj. 1 of or in europe. 2 originating in, native to, or characteristic of europe. —n. 1 a native or inhabitant of europe. B person descended from natives of europe. 2 person favouring european integration. [greek europe europe]

Applause  n. 1 approval shown by clapping the hands. 2 warm approval.

Ethic  —n. Set of moral principles (the quaker ethic). —adj. = *ethical. [greek: related to *ethos]

Ferment  —n. 1 excitement, unrest. 2 a fermentation. B fermenting-agent. —v. 1 undergo or subject to fermentation. 2 excite; stir up. [latin fermentum: related to *fervent]

Inset  —n. 1 a extra section inserted in a book etc. B small map etc. Within the border of a larger one. 2 piece let into a dress etc. —v. (insetting; past and past part. Inset or insetted) 1 put in as an inset. 2 decorate with an inset.

Committee  n. 1 body of persons appointed for a special function by (and usu. Out of) a larger body. 2 (committee) house of commons sitting as a committee. [from *commit, *-ee]

Painting  n. 1 process or art of using paint. 2 painted picture.

Arbitrate  v. (-ting) decide by arbitration.

Chef  n. (usu. Male) cook, esp. The chief cook in a restaurant. [french]

Igneous  adj. 1 of fire; fiery. 2 (esp. Of rocks) volcanic. [latin ignis fire]

Blacklist  —n. List of people in disfavour etc. —v. Put on a blacklist.

Punish  v. 1 inflict retribution on (an offender) or for (an offence). 2 colloq. Inflict severe blows on (an opponent). 3 tax, abuse, or treat severely or improperly.  punishable adj. Punishing adj. [latin punio]

Superior  —adj. 1 in a higher position; of higher rank. 2 a high-quality (superior leather). B supercilious (had a superior air). 3 (often foll. By to) better or greater in some respect. 4  written or printed above the line. —n. 1 person superior to another esp. In rank. 2 head of a monastery etc. (mother superior).  superiority n. [latin comparative of superus above]

Supererogation  n. Doing more than duty requires. [latin supererogo pay in addition]

Marcasite  n. 1 yellowish crystalline iron sulphide. 2 crystals of this used in jewellery. [arabic markashita]

Vignette  n. 1 short description, character sketch. 2 book illustration not in a definite border. 3 photograph etc. With the background shaded off. [french, diminutive: related to *vine]

Diopter  n. (brit. Dioptre) unit of refractive power of a lens. [greek: related to *dia-, opsis sight]

Sooth  n. Archaic truth. [old english]

Predecessor  n. 1 former holder of an office or position with respect to a later holder. 2 ancestor. 3 thing to which another has succeeded. [latin decessor: related to *decease]

Scream  —n. 1 loud high-pitched cry of fear, pain, etc. 2 similar sound or cry. 3 colloq. Hilarious occurrence or person. —v. 1 emit a scream. 2 speak or sing (words etc.) In a screaming tone. 3 make or move with a screaming sound. 4 laugh uncontrollably. 5 be blatantly obvious. [old english]

Apparent  adj. 1 readily visible; obvious. 2 seeming.  apparently adv. [latin: related to *appear]

Doldrums  n.pl. (usu. Prec. By the) 1 low spirits. 2 period of inactivity. 3 equatorial ocean region with little or no wind. [perhaps after dull, tantrum]

Swordfish  n. (pl. Same or -es) large marine fish with swordlike upper jaw.

Slink  v. (past and past part. Slunk) (often foll. By off, away, by) move in a stealthy or guilty manner. [old english]

Teetotal  adj. Of or advocating total abstinence from alcohol.  teetotalism n. Teetotaller n. [reduplication of *total]

Void  —adj. 1 empty, vacant. 2 (of a contract etc.) Invalid, not legally binding (null and void). —n. Empty space, vacuum. —v. 1 render void. 2 excrete; empty (the bowels etc.).  void of lacking, free from. [french]

Debauchee  n. Debauched person.

Ribcage  n. Wall of bones formed by the ribs round the chest.

Superstar  n. Extremely famous or renowned actor, musician, etc.

Detonate  v. (-ting) set off (an explosive charge); be set off.  detonation n. [latin tono thunder]

Vigour  n. (us vigor) 1 physical or mental strength or energy. 2 healthy growth. 3 forcefulness; trenchancy, animation.  vigorous adj. Vigorously adv. [french from latin vigeo be lively]

Serendipity  n. Faculty of making happy discoveries by accident.  serendipitous adj. [coined by horace walpole]

Hemophilia  n. (brit. Haem-) hereditary failure of the blood to clot normally with the tendency to bleed severely from even a slight injury. [greek haima blood, philia loving]

Restore  v. (-ring) 1 bring back to the original state by rebuilding, repairing, etc. 2 bring back to health etc. 3 give back to the original owner etc. 4 reinstate. 5 replace; put back; bring back to a former condition. 6 make a representation of the supposed original state of (a ruin, extinct animal, etc.).  restorer n. [latin restauro]

Absenteeism  n. Absenting oneself from work or school etc., esp. Frequently or illicitly.

Thrall  n. Literary 1 (often foll. By of, to) slave (of a person, or of a power or influence). 2 slavery (in thrall).  thraldom n. [old english from old norse]

Torment  —n. 1 severe physical or mental suffering. 2 cause of this. —v. 1 subject to torment. 2 tease or worry excessively.  tormentor n. [latin tormentum: related to *tort]

Commonwealth  n. 1 independent state or community, esp. A democratic republic. 2 (the commonwealth) a association of the uk with states that were previously part of the british empire. B republican government of britain 1649–60. 3 federation of states.

Frighten  v. 1 fill with fright (the bang frightened me; frightened of dogs). 2 (foll. By away, off, out of, into) drive by fright.  frightening adj. Frighteningly adv.

Paye  abbr. Pay-as-you-earn.

Cancan  n. Lively stage-dance with high kicking. [french]

Backfire  v. (-ring) 1 (of an engine or vehicle) ignite or explode too early in the cylinder or exhaust. 2 (of a plan etc.) Rebound adversely on its originator.

Retractile  adj. Capable of being retracted.

Running  —n. 1 action of runners in a race etc. 2 way a race etc. Proceeds. —adj. 1 continuous (running battle). 2 consecutive (three days running). 3 done with a run (running jump).  in (or out of) the running (of a competitor) with a good (or poor) chance of success. Make (or take up) the running take the lead; set the pace. Take a running jump (esp. As int.) Slang go away.

Exfoliate  v. (-ting) 1 come off in scales or layers. 2 throw off layers of bark.  exfoliation n. [latin folium leaf]

Repulse  —v. (-sing) 1 drive back by force of arms. 2 a rebuff. B refuse. —n. 1 repulsing or being repulsed. 2 rebuff. [latin: related to *repel]

Eventual  adj. Occurring in due course, ultimate.  eventually adv. [from *event]

Loch  n. Scot. Lake or narrow inlet of the sea. [gaelic]

Recount  v. 1 narrate. 2 tell in detail. [anglo-french reconter: related to *re-, *count1]

Windlass  n. Machine with a horizontal axle for hauling or hoisting. [old norse, = winding-pole]

Prelate  n. High ecclesiastical dignitary, e.g. A bishop. [latin: related to *prefer]

Menagerie  n. Small zoo. [french: related to *ménage]

Handbag  n. Small bag carried esp. By a woman.

Songbird  n. Bird with a musical call.

Outwork  n. 1 advanced or detached part of a fortification. 2 work done off the premises of the firm etc. Which supplies it.  outworker n. (in sense 2).

Headman  n. Chief man of a tribe etc.

Fever  —n. 1 a abnormally high temperature, often with delirium etc. B disease characterized by this (scarlet fever). 2 nervous excitement; agitation. —v. (esp. As fevered adj.) Affect with fever or excitement. [latin febris]

Courtesy  n. (pl. -ies) courteous behaviour or act.  by courtesy of with the formal permission of. [french: related to *courteous]

Chubby  adj. (-ier, -iest) plump and rounded. [from *chub]

Mung  n. (in full mung bean) leguminous indian plant used as food. [hindi mung]

Pair  —n. 1 set of two people or things used together or regarded as a unit. 2 article (e.g. Scissors, trousers, or pyjamas) consisting of two joined or corresponding parts. 3 a engaged or married couple. B mated couple of animals. 4 two horses harnessed side by side (coach and pair). 5 member of a pair in relation to the other (cannot find its pair). 6 two playing-cards of the same denomination. 7 either or both of two mps etc. On opposite sides agreeing not to vote on certain occasions. —v. 1 (often foll. By off) arrange or be arranged in couples. 2 a join or be joined in marriage. B (of animals) mate. [latin paria: related to *par]

Hysteric  n. 1 (in pl.) A fit of hysteria. B colloq. Overwhelming laughter (we were in hysterics). 2 hysterical person.

Catalyst  n. 1 substance that does not itself change, but speeds up a chemical reaction. 2 person or thing that precipitates change.

Front  —n. 1 side or part most prominent or important, or nearer the spectator or direction of motion (front of the house). 2  a line of battle. B ground towards an enemy. C scene of actual fighting. 3 a activity compared to a military front. B organized political group. 4 demeanour, bearing. 5 forward or conspicuous position. 6 a bluff. B pretext. 7 person etc. As a cover for subversive or illegal activities. 8 promenade. 9 forward edge of advancing cold or warm air. 10 auditorium of a theatre. 11 breast of a garment (spilt food down his front). —attrib. Adj. 1 of the front. 2 situated in front. —v. 1 (foll. By on, to, towards, upon) have the front facing or directed towards. 2 (foll. By for) slang act as a front or cover for. 3 provide with or have a front (fronted with stone). 4 lead (a band, organization, etc.).  in front in an advanced or facing position. In front of 1 ahead of, in advance of. 2 in the presence of. [latin frons front- face]

Moralize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 (often foll. By on) indulge in moral reflection or talk. 2 make moral or more moral.  moralization n.

Fervent  adj. Ardent, intense (fervent admirer).  fervency n. Fervently adv. [latin ferveo boil]

Questionable  adj. Doubtful as regards truth, quality, honesty, wisdom, etc.

Harpy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 mythological monster with a woman's head and body and a bird's wings and claws. 2 grasping unscrupulous person. [greek harpuiai snatchers]

Realm  n. 1 formal kingdom. 2 domain (realm of myth). [latin *regimen]

Chide  v. (past chided or chid; past part. Chided or chidden) archaic scold, rebuke. [old english]

Carmine  —adj. Of vivid crimson colour. —n. 1 this colour. 2 carmine pigment made from cochineal. [probably from latin carmesinum *crimson]

Debilitate  v. (-ting) enfeeble, enervate.  debilitation n. [latin debilis weak]

Cistercian  —n. Monk or nun of the order founded as a stricter branch of the benedictines. —adj. Of the cistercians. [french cîteaux in france]

Hangnail  n. = *agnail.

Cowslip  n. Primula with small yellow flowers. [obsolete slyppe dung]

Shenanigan  n. (esp. In pl.) Colloq. Mischievous or dubious behaviour, carryings-on. [origin unknown]

Insignificant  adj. 1 unimportant. 2 meaningless.  insignificance n.

Lone  attrib. Adj. 1 solitary; without companions. 2 isolated. 3 unmarried, single (lone parent). [from *alone]

Marijuana  n. (also marihuana) dried leaves etc. Of hemp, smoked in cigarettes as a drug. [american spanish]

Desuetude  n. Formal state of disuse (fell into desuetude). [latin suesco be accustomed]

Elevate  v. (-ting) 1 raise, lift up. 2 exalt in rank etc. 3 (usu. As elevated adj.) Raise morally or intellectually. [latin levo lift]

Oiled  adj. Slang drunk.

Hegemony  n. Leadership, esp. By one state of a confederacy. [greek hegemon leader]

Souse  —v. (-sing) 1 immerse in pickle or other liquid. 2 (as soused adj.) Colloq. Drunk. 3 (usu. Foll. By in) soak (a thing) in liquid. —n. 1 a pickle made with salt. B us food in pickle. 2 plunge or drench in water. [french sous]

Understate  v. (-ting) 1 express mildly or in a restrained way. 2 represent as less than it actually is.  understatement n.

Nil  n. Nothing; no number or amount (esp. As a score in games). [latin]

Legatee  n. Recipient of a legacy. [latin lego bequeath]

Starlit  adj. 1 lit by stars. 2 with stars visible.

Backstreet  —n. Side-street, alley. —attrib. Adj. Illicit; illegal (backstreet abortion).

Acorn  n. Fruit of the oak, with a smooth nut in a cuplike base. [old english]

Judo  n. Sport derived from ju-jitsu. [japanese, = gentle way]

Prelim  n. Colloq. 1 preliminary university examination. 2 (in pl.) Pages preceding the main text of a book. [abbreviation]

Sheepish  adj. Embarrassed or shy; ashamed.  sheepishly adv.

Countable  adj. 1 that can be counted. 2 gram. (of a noun) that can form a plural or be used with the indefinite article.

Reform  —v. 1 make or become better by the removal of faults and errors. 2 abolish or cure (an abuse or malpractice). —n. 1 removal of faults or abuses, esp. Moral, political, or social. 2 improvement made or suggested.  reformative adj.

Cyclamate  n. Former artificial sweetener. [chemical name]

Possess  v. 1 hold as property; own. 2 have (a faculty, quality, etc.). 3 occupy or dominate the mind of (possessed by the devil; possessed by fear).  be possessed of own, have. What possessed you? An expression of incredulity.  possessor n. [latin possideo possess-]

Skive  v. (-ving) (often followed by off) slang evade work; play truant.  skiver n. [old norse]

Admittedly  adv. As must be admitted.

Nepotism  n. Favouritism shown to relatives in conferring offices. [italian nepote nephew]

Dinghy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 small boat carried by a ship. 2 small pleasure-boat. 3 small inflatable rubber boat. [hindi]

Amble  —v. (-ling) move at an easy pace. —n. Such a pace. [latin ambulo walk]

Hoary  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 a (of hair) grey or white with age. B having such hair; aged. 2 old and trite (hoary joke). [old english]

Inconsequent  adj. 1 irrelevant. 2 lacking logical sequence. 3 disconnected.  inconsequence n.

Pajamas  n.pl. (brit. Pyjamas) 1 suit of loose trousers and jacket for sleeping in. 2 loose trousers worn by both sexes in some asian countries. 3 (pyjama) (attrib.) Of either part of a pair of pyjamas (pyjama jacket). [urdu, = leg-clothing]

Gipsy  var. Of *gypsy.

Determination  n. 1 firmness of purpose; resoluteness. 2 process of deciding or determining.

Multiplier  n. Quantity by which a given number is multiplied.

Competence  n. (also competency) 1 ability; being competent. 2 income large enough to live on. 3 legal capacity.

Shape  —n. 1 effect produced by a thing's outline. 2 external form or appearance. 3 specific form or guise (in the shape of an excuse). 4 good or specified condition (back in shape; in poor shape). 5 person or thing seen in outline or indistinctly. 6 mould or pattern. 7 moulded jelly etc. 8 piece of material, paper, etc., made or cut in a particular form. —v. (-ping) 1 give a certain shape or form to; fashion, create. 2 influence (one's life, course, etc.). 3 (usu. Foll. By up) show signs of developing; show promise. 4 (foll. By to) adapt or make conform.  in any shape or form in any form at all (don't like jazz in any shape or form). Take shape take on a definite form. [old english]

Superego  n. (pl. -s) psychol. Part of the mind that acts as a conscience and responds to social rules.

Relate  v. (-ting) 1 narrate or recount. 2 (usu. Foll. By to, with) connect (two things) in thought or meaning; associate. 3 (foll. By to) have reference to. 4 (foll. By to) feel connected or sympathetic to. [latin: related to *refer]

Touchdown  n. Act of touching down by an aircraft.

Phonetics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) 1 vocal sounds. 2 the study of these.  phonetician n.

Compassion  n. Pity inclining one to help or be merciful. [church latin: related to *passion]

Unaccompanied  adj. 1 not accompanied. 2 mus. Without accompaniment.

Avatar  n. (in hindu mythology) descent of a deity etc. To earth in bodily form. [sanskrit, = descent]

Sudanese  —adj. Of sudan. —n. (pl. Same) 1 native, national, or inhabitant of sudan. 2 person of sudanese descent. [sudan in ne africa]

Bronze  —n. 1 alloy of copper and tin. 2 its brownish colour. 3 thing of bronze, esp. A sculpture. —adj. Made of or coloured like bronze. —v. (-zing) make or become brown; tan. [french from italian]

Unpointed  adj. 1 having no point or points. 2 not punctuated. 3 (of brickwork etc.) Not pointed.

Woodland  n. (often attrib.) Wooded country, woods.

Pittance  n. Very small allowance or remuneration. [romanic: related to *pity]

Thane  n. Hist. 1 man who held land from an english king or other superior by military service. 2 man who held land from a scottish king and ranked with an earl's son; chief of a clan. [old english]

Maritime  adj. 1 connected with the sea or seafaring (maritime insurance). 2 living or found near the sea. [latin: related to *marine]

Initial  —adj. Of or at the beginning. —n. Initial letter, esp. (in pl.) Those of a person's names. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) mark or sign with one's initials.  initially adv. [latin initium beginning]

Spinet  n. Hist. Small harpsichord with oblique strings. [italian spinetta]

Connect  v. 1 (often foll. By to, with) join (two things, or one thing with another). 2 be joined or joinable. 3 (often foll. By with) associate mentally or practically. 4 (foll. By with) (of a train etc.) Be timed to arrive with another, so passengers can transfer. 5 put into communication by telephone. 6 a (usu. In passive; foll. By with) associate with others in relationships etc. B be meaningful or relevant. 7 colloq. Hit or strike effectively. [latin necto nex- bind]

Style  —n. 1 kind or sort, esp. In regard to appearance and form (elegant style of house). 2 manner of writing, speaking, or performing. 3 distinctive manner of a person, artistic school, or period. 4 correct way of designating a person or thing. 5 superior quality or manner (do it in style). 6 fashion in dress etc. 7 pointed tool for scratching or engraving. 8 bot. Narrow extension of the ovary supporting the stigma. —v. (-ling) 1 design or make etc. In a particular (esp. Fashionable) style. 2 designate in a specified way. [latin stilus]

Spend  v. (past and past part. Spent) 1 pay out (money). 2 a use or consume (time or energy). B use up (material etc.). 3 (as spent adj.) Having lost its original force or strength; exhausted.  spend a penny colloq. Go to the lavatory.  spender n. [latin: related to *expend]

Prolactin  n. Hormone that stimulates milk production after childbirth. [from *pro-1, *lactation]

Pushy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Excessively self-assertive.  pushily adv. Pushiness n.

Me  abbr. Myalgic encephalomyelitis, a condition with prolonged flu-like symptoms and depression.

Cognizant  adj. (foll. By of) formal having knowledge or being aware of.

Impassable  adj. Not able to be traversed.  impassability n. Impassableness n. Impassably adv.

Jujube  n. Small flavoured jelly-like lozenge. [greek zizuphon]

Hysteresis  n. Phenomenon whereby changes in an effect lag behind changes in its cause. [greek husteros coming after]

Nebula  n. (pl. Nebulae) cloud of gas and dust seen in the night sky, sometimes glowing and sometimes appearing as a dark silhouette.   nebular adj. [latin, = mist]

Sprung  see *spring.

Mice  pl. Of *mouse.

Firelight  n. Light from a fire in a fireplace.

Peduncle  n. Stalk of a flower, fruit, or cluster, esp. A main stalk bearing a solitary flower or subordinate stalks.  peduncular adj. [related to *pedometer, *-uncle]

Waterside  n. Edge of a sea, lake, or river.

Outgrowth  n. 1 offshoot. 2 natural product or development.

Leuco-  comb. Form white. [greek leukos white]

Terrazzo  n. (pl. -s) smooth flooring-material of stone chips set in concrete. [italian, = terrace]

Wring  —v. (past and past part. Wrung) 1 a squeeze tightly. B (often foll. By out) squeeze and twist, esp. To remove liquid. 2 break by twisting. 3 distress, torture. 4 extract by squeezing. 5 (foll. By out, from) obtain by pressure or importunity; extort. —n. Act of wringing.  wring one's hands clasp them as a gesture of distress. Wring the neck of kill (a chicken etc.) By twisting its neck. [old english]

Ibo  n. (also igbo) (pl. Same or -s) 1 member of a black people of se nigeria. 2 their language. [native name]

Bannister  var. Of *banister.

Abysmal  adj. 1 colloq. Extremely bad (abysmal food). 2 profound, utter (abysmal ignorance).  abysmally adv. [latin: related to *abyss]

Swansong  n. Person's last work or act before death or retirement etc.

Bikini  n. (pl. -s) two-piece swimsuit for women. [bikini, pacific atoll]

Jcb  n. Propr. Mechanical excavator with a shovel and a digging arm. [j. C. Bamford, name of the makers]

Breadfruit  n. 1 fruit which resembles new bread when roasted. 2 tropical evergreen tree bearing it.

Violate  v. (-ting) 1 disregard; break (an oath, treaty, law, etc.). 2 treat (a sanctuary etc.) Profanely; disrespect. 3 disturb (a person's privacy etc.). 4 rape.  violable adj. Violation n. Violator n. [latin violo]

Measureless  adj. Not measurable; infinite.

Protract  v. (often as protracted adj.) Prolong or lengthen.  protraction n. [latin traho tract- draw]

Shawl  n. Large usu. Rectangular piece of fabric worn over the shoulders or head, or wrapped round a baby. [urdu from persian shal]

Squalor  n. Filthy or squalid state. [latin]

Saintly  adj. (-ier, -iest) very holy or virtuous.  saintliness n.

Version  n. 1 account of a matter from a particular point of view. 2 book etc. In a particular edition or translation (authorized version). 3 form or variant. [latin verto vers- turn]

Alongside  —adv. At or to the side. —prep. Close to the side of.

Cursive  —adj. (of writing) with joined characters. —n. Cursive writing. [medieval latin, = running: related to *current]

Clamor  (brit. Clamour) —n. 1 loud or vehement shouting or noise. 2 protest, demand. —v. 1 make a clamour. 2 utter with a clamour.  clamorous adj. [latin: related to *claim]

Simpleton  n. Gullible or halfwitted person.

Stoup  n. 1 basin for holy-water. 2 archaic flagon, beaker. [old norse]

Contention  n. 1 dispute or argument; rivalry. 2 point contended for in an argument. [latin: related to *contend]

Census  n. (pl. -suses) official count of population etc. [latin: related to *censor]

Yeti  n. = *abominable snowman. [tibetan]

Ernie  n. Device for drawing prize-winning numbers of premium bonds. [electronic random number indicator equipment]

Habitat  n. Natural home of an animal or plant. [latin, = it dwells]

Addicted  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By to) dependent on a drug etc. As a habit. 2 devoted to an interest.  addiction n.

Escapee  n. Person who has escaped.

Housekeeping  n. 1 management of household affairs. 2 money allowed for this. 3 operations of maintenance, record-keeping, etc., in an organization.

Grout  —n. Thin fluid mortar. —v. Provide or fill with grout. [origin uncertain]

Pippin  n. 1 apple grown from seed. 2 red and yellow eating apple. [french]

Concomitant  —adj. (often foll. By with) accompanying; occurring together. —n. Accompanying thing.  concomitance n. [latin comes comit- companion]

Yeoman  n. 1 esp. Hist. Man holding and cultivating a small landed estate. 2 member of the yeomanry force.  yeomanly adj. [from earlier yoman, yeman, etc., probably = young man]

Fuze  var. Of *fuse2.

Alpaca  n. 1 shaggy s. American mammal related to the llama. 2 its wool; fabric made from this. [spanish from quechua]

Loveless  adj. Unloving or unloved or both.

Gatepost  n. Post at either side of a gate.

Ml  abbr. 1 millilitre(s). 2 mile(s).

Rodent  n. Mammal with strong incisors and no canine teeth, e.g. The rat, mouse, squirrel, beaver, and porcupine. [latin rodo gnaw]

Impresario  n. (pl. -s) organizer of public entertainment, esp. A theatrical etc. Manager. [italian]

Guiltless  adj. (often foll. By of an offence) innocent.

Roadblock  n. Barrier set up on a road in order to stop and examine traffic.

The  —adj. (called the definite article) 1 denoting person(s) or thing(s) already mentioned, under discussion, implied, or familiar (gave the man a wave). 2 describing as unique (the thames). 3 a (foll. By defining adj.) Which is, who are, etc. (edward the seventh). B (foll. By adj. Used absol.) Denoting a class described (from the sublime to the ridiculous). 4 best known or best entitled to the name (with the stressed: do you mean the kipling?). 5 indicating a following defining clause or phrase (the book that you borrowed). 6 a indicating that a singular noun represents a species etc. (the cat is a mammal). B used with a noun which figuratively represents an occupation etc. (went on the stage). C (foll. By the name of a unit) a, per (5p in the pound). —adv. (preceding comparatives in expressions of proportional variation) in or by that (or such a) degree; on that account (the more the merrier; the more he has the more he wants). [old english]

Rookery  n. (pl. -ies) colony of rooks, penguins, or seals.

Subgroup  n. Subset of a group.

Inactive  adj. 1 not active. 2 not operating. 3 indolent.  inactivity n.

Indo-  comb. Form indian; indian and.

Hmi  abbr. Her (or his) majesty's inspector (of schools).

Complication  n. 1 a involved or confused condition or state. B complicating circumstance; difficulty. 2 (often in pl.) Disease or condition aggravating or arising out of a previous one. [latin: related to *complicate]

Arabic  —n. Semitic language of the arabs. —adj. Of the arabs (esp. Their language or literature).

Sas  abbr. Special air service.

Democrat  n. 1 advocate of democracy. 2 (democrat) (in the us) member of the democratic party.

Whence  formal —interrog. Adv. From what place? —conj. 1 to the place from which (return whence you came). 2 (often prec. By place etc.) From which. 3 and thence (whence it follows that). [old english: related to *when]

Usage  the use of from whence rather than simply whence (as in the place from whence they came), though common, is generally considered incorrect.

Tailcoat  n. Man's coat with a long divided flap at the back, worn as part of formal dress.

Celesta  n. Small keyboard instrument with steel plates struck to give a bell-like sound. [french: related to *celestial]

Monopolist  n. Person who has or advocates a monopoly.  monopolistic adj.

Undermanned  adj. Having an insufficient crew or staff.

Actuality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 reality. 2 (in pl.) Existing conditions.

Rsj  abbr. Rolled steel joist.

Wean  v. 1 accustom (an infant or other young mammal) to food other than (esp. Its mother's) milk. 2 (often foll. By from, away from) disengage (from a habit etc.) By enforced discontinuance. [old english, = accustom]

Hypnotic  —adj. 1 of or producing hypnosis. 2 inducing sleep. —n. Hypnotic drug or influence.  hypnotically adv. [greek: related to *hypnosis]

Jeweller  n. (us jeweler) maker of or dealer in jewels or jewellery.

Catsuit  n. Close-fitting garment with trouser legs, covering the whole body.

Conflate  v. (-ting) blend or fuse together (esp. Two variant texts into one).  conflation n. [latin flo flat- blow]

Bane  n. 1 cause of ruin or trouble. 2 poet. Ruin. 3 archaic (except in comb.) Poison (ratsbane).  baneful adj. [old english]

Basalt  n. A dark volcanic rock.  basaltic adj. [latin basaltes from greek]

Specimen  n. 1 individual or sample taken as an example of a class or whole, esp. In experiments etc. 2 sample of urine for testing. 3 colloq. Usu. Derog. Person of a specified sort. [latin specio look]

Hooves  pl. Of *hoof.

Tier  n. Row, rank, or unit of a structure, as one of several placed one above another (tiers of seats).  tiered adj. [french tire from tirer draw, elongate]

Nettle  —n. 1 plant with jagged leaves covered with stinging hairs. 2 plant resembling this. —v. (-ling) irritate, provoke. [old english]

Attraction  n. 1 a attracting or being attracted. B attractive quality (can't see the attraction in it). C person or thing that attracts. 2 physics tendency of bodies to attract each other.

Lesion  n. 1 damage. 2 injury. 3 morbid change in the functioning or texture of an organ etc. [latin laedo laes- injure]

Aspersion  n.  cast aspersions on attack the reputation of. [latin aspergo besprinkle]

Saraband  n. 1 slow stately spanish dance. 2 music for this. [spanish zarabanda]

Kidney  n. (pl. -s) 1 either of two organs in the abdominal cavity of vertebrates which remove nitrogenous wastes from the blood and excrete urine. 2 animal's kidney as food. [origin unknown]

Vernier  n. Small movable graduated scale for obtaining fractional parts of subdivisions on a fixed scale. [vernier, name of a mathematician]

Governance  n. 1 act or manner of governing. 2 function of governing. [french: related to *govern]

Pepper  —n. 1 hot aromatic condiment from the dried berries of certain plants. 2 anything pungent. 3 a capsicum plant, grown as a vegetable. B its fruit. —v. 1 sprinkle or treat with or as if with pepper. 2 pelt with missiles. [sanskrit pippali]

Piggyback  (also pickaback) —n. Ride on the back and shoulders of another person. —adv. On the back and shoulders of another person. [origin unknown]

Cesspit  n. (also cesspool) covered pit for the temporary storage of liquid waste or sewage. [origin uncertain]

Ms  abbr. 1 (pl. Mss) manuscript. 2 multiple sclerosis.

Nightspot  n. Nightclub.

Knotgrass  n. Wild plant with creeping stems and small pink flowers.

Yogi  n. (pl. -s) devotee of yoga. [hindustani: related to *yoga]

Remade  past and past part. Of *remake.

Baggage  n. 1 luggage. 2 portable army equipment. 3 joc. Or derog. Girl or woman. 4 mental encumbrances. [french]

Embroidery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 art of embroidering. 2 embroidered work. 3 inessential ornament. 4 fictitious additions (to a story etc.).

Forewoman  n. 1 female worker with supervisory responsibilities. 2 president and spokeswoman of a jury.

Lodestar  n. 1 star used as a guide in navigation, esp. The pole star. 2 a guiding principle. B object of pursuit. [from *lode in obsolete sense ‘way, journey’]

Gymnasium  n. (pl. -s or -sia) room or building equipped for gymnastics. [greek gumnos naked]

Subway  n. 1 pedestrian tunnel beneath a road etc. 2 esp. Us underground railway.

Callow  adj. Inexperienced, immature. [old english, = bald]

Mutant  —adj. Resulting from mutation. —n. Mutant organism or gene.

Sleep  —n. 1 natural recurring condition of suspended consciousness, with the eyes closed and the muscles relaxed. 2 period of sleep (had a sleep). 3 state like sleep; rest, quiet, death. —v. (past and past part. Slept) 1 a be in a state of sleep. B fall asleep. 2 (foll. By at, in, etc.) Spend the night. 3 provide beds etc. For (house sleeps six). 4 (foll. By with, together) have sexual intercourse, esp. In bed. 5 (foll. By on) put off (a decision) until the next day. 6 (foll. By through) fail to be woken by. 7 be inactive or dead. 8 (foll. By off) remedy by sleeping.  get to sleep manage to fall asleep. Go to sleep 1 begin to sleep. 2 (of a limb) become numb. Put to sleep 1 anaesthetize. 2 put down (an animal). Sleep around colloq. Be sexually promiscuous. Sleep in sleep later than usual in the morning. [old english]

Semitropical  adj. = subtropical (*subtropics).

Commodious  adj. Roomy.

Chyle  n. Milky fluid of food materials formed in the intestine after digestion. [greek khulos juice]

Quiche  n. Savoury flan. [french]

Bingo  n. Gambling game in which each player has a card with numbers to be marked off as they are called. [origin uncertain]

Redress  —v. 1 remedy or rectify (a wrong or grievance etc.). 2 readjust, set straight again. —n. 1 reparation for a wrong. 2 (foll. By of) redressing (a grievance etc.).  redress the balance restore equality. [french: related to *dress]

Sax  n. Colloq. Saxophone. [abbreviation]

Architectonic  adj. 1 of architecture. 2 of the systematization of knowledge.

Pilot  —n. 1 person who operates the controls of an aircraft. 2 person qualified to take charge of a ship entering or leaving harbour. 3 (usu. Attrib.) Experimental undertaking or test (pilot scheme). 4 guide. —v. (-t-) 1 act as a pilot of. 2 conduct or initiate as a pilot. [greek pedon]

Atoll  n. Ring-shaped coral reef enclosing a lagoon. [maldive]

Architecture  n. 1 design and construction of buildings. 2 style of a building. 3 buildings etc. Collectively.  architectural adj.

Jitter  colloq. —n. (the jitters) extreme nervousness. —v. Be nervous; act nervously.  jittery adj. Jitteriness n. [origin unknown]

Arty  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Pretentiously or affectedly artistic.

Tamil  —n. 1 member of a people of south india and sri lanka. 2 language of this people. —adj. Of this people or language. [native name]

Inhospitable  adj. 1 not hospitable. 2 (of a region etc.) Not affording shelter, favourable conditions, etc.  inhospitably adv.

Suttee  n. Esp. Hist. 1 hindu custom of a widow's suicide on her husband's funeral pyre. 2 widow undergoing this. [sanskrit sati faithful wife]

Superannuation  n. 1 pension. 2 payment towards this.

Confetti  n. Small bits of coloured paper thrown by wedding guests at the bride and groom. [italian]

Southward  —adj. & adv. (also southwards) towards the south. —n. Southward direction or region.

Unusual  adj. 1 not usual. 2 remarkable.  unusually adv.

Sartorial  adj. Of men's clothes or tailoring.  sartorially adv. [latin sartor tailor]

Provided  conj. (often foll. By that) on the condition or understanding that.

Unban  v. (-nn-) remove prohibited status from; allow.

Diabolical  adj. (also diabolic) 1 of the devil. 2 devilish; inhumanly cruel or wicked. 3 extremely bad, clever, or annoying.  diabolically adv. [latin: related to *devil]

Nexus  n. (pl. Same) connected group or series. [latin necto nex- bind]

Oilcloth  n. Fabric, esp. Canvas, waterproofed with oil or another substance.

Nephew  n. Son of one's brother or sister or of one's spouse's brother or sister. [latin nepos]

Groom  —n. 1 person employed to take care of horses. 2 = *bridegroom. 3 mil. Any of certain officers of the royal household. —v. 1 a curry or tend (a horse). B give a neat appearance to (a person etc.).

Maggot  n. Larva, esp. Of the housefly or bluebottle.  maggoty adj. [perhaps an alteration of maddock, from old norse]

Ira  abbr. Irish republican army.

Deb  n. Colloq. Débutante. [abbreviation]

Pugnacious  adj. Quarrelsome; disposed to fight.  pugnaciously adv. Pugnacity n. [latin pugnax -acis from pugno fight]

Comma  n. Punctuation mark (,) indicating a pause or break between parts of a sentence etc. [greek, = clause]

Snood  n. Ornamental hairnet, worn usu. At the back of the head. [old english]
