Dealings  n.pl. Contacts, conduct, or transactions.

Undersized  adj. Smaller than average.

Social  —adj. 1 of society or its organization, esp. Of the relations of people or classes of people. 2 living in organized communities. 3 needing companionship; gregarious. —n. Social gathering, esp. Of a club.  socially adv. [latin: related to *sociable]

Unstitch  v. Undo the stitches of.

Tributary  —n. (pl. -ies) 1 river or stream flowing into a larger river or lake. 2 hist. Person or state paying or subject to tribute. —adj. 1 (of a river etc.) That is a tributary. 2 hist. A paying tribute. B serving as tribute. [latin: related to *tribute]

Menopause  n. 1 ceasing of menstruation. 2 period in a woman's life (usu. 45–55) when this occurs.  menopausal adj. [greek men month, *pause]

Nurseryman  n. Owner of or worker in a plant nursery.

Assumption  n. 1 assuming. 2 thing assumed. 3 (assumption) reception of the virgin mary bodily into heaven.

Imprecise  adj. Not precise.  imprecisely adv. Impreciseness n. Imprecision n.

Fervour  n. (us fervor) passion, zeal. [latin: related to *fervent]

Wasp  n. (also wasp) us usu. Derog. Middle-class american white protestant. [white anglo-saxon protestant]

Ashlar  n. 1 large square-cut stone used in building; masonry made of these. 2 thin slabs of masonry used for facing walls. [latin axis board]

Tarty  adj. Colloq. (-ier, -iest) (esp. Of a woman) vulgar, gaudy; promiscuous. [from *tart2]

Undisguised  adj. Not disguised; open.

Cahoots  n.pl.  in cahoots slang in collusion. [origin uncertain]

Sentence  —n. 1 statement, question, exclamation, or command containing or implying a subject and predicate (e.g. I went; come here!). 2 a decision of a lawcourt, esp. The punishment allotted to a convicted criminal.

Inboard  —adv. Within the sides or towards the centre of a ship, aircraft, or vehicle. —adj. Situated inboard.

Recross  v. Cross again.

Epaulette  n. (us epaulet) ornamental shoulder-piece on a coat etc., esp. On a uniform. [french épaule shoulder]

Radiology  n. The study of x-rays and other high-energy radiation, esp. As used in medicine.  radiologist n.

Dentition  n. 1 type, number, and arrangement of teeth in a species etc. 2 teething.

Croupier  n. Person running a gaming-table, raking in and paying out money etc. [french: related to *croup2]

Exit  —n. 1 passage or door by which to leave a room etc. 2 act or right of going out. 3 place where vehicles can leave a motorway etc. 4 actor's departure from the stage. —v. (-t-) 1 go out of a room etc. 2 leave the stage (also as a direction: exit macbeth). [latin exeo exit- go out]

Jove  n. (in roman mythology) jupiter.  by jove! Exclamation of surprise etc. [latin jupiter jov-]

Verity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a fundamental truth. 2 archaic truth. [latin veritas truth]

Brandish  v. Wave or flourish as a threat or display. [french from germanic]

Slime  n. Thick slippery mud or sticky substance produced by an animal or plant. [old english]

Womb  n. Organ of conception and gestation in a woman and other female mammals. [old english]

Alley  n. (pl. -s) 1 narrow street or passageway. 2 enclosure for skittles, bowling, etc. 3 walk or lane in a park etc. [french aller go]

Hesitant  adj. Hesitating; irresolute.  hesitance n. Hesitancy n. Hesitantly adv.

Immediately  —adv. 1 without pause or delay. 2 without intermediary. —conj. As soon as.

Premature  adj. 1 a occurring or done before the usual or proper time (a premature decision). B too hasty. 2 (of a baby) born (esp. Three or more weeks) before the end of gestation.  prematurely adv. [latin: related to *pre-, *mature]

Lope  —v. (-ping) run with a long bounding stride. —n. Long bounding stride. [old norse: related to *leap]

Autumn  n. 1 (often attrib.) Season between summer and winter. 2 time of incipient decline.  autumnal adj. [latin autumnus]

Congruent  adj. 1 (often foll. By with) suitable, agreeing. 2 geom. (of figures) coinciding exactly when superimposed.  congruence n. Congruency n. [latin congruo agree]

Somersault   —n. Leap or roll with the body turning through a circle. —v. Perform this. [french sobre above, saut jump]

Grid  n. 1 grating. 2 system of numbered squares printed on a map and forming the basis of map references. 3 network of lines, electric-power connections, gas-supply lines, etc. 4 pattern of lines marking the starting-places on a motor-racing track. 5 perforated electrode controlling the flow of electrons in a thermionic valve etc. 6 arrangement of town streets in a rectangular pattern. [from *gridiron]

Lose  v. (-sing; past and past part. Lost) 1 be deprived of or cease to have, esp. By negligence. 2 be deprived of (a person) by death. 3 become unable to find, follow, or understand (lose one's way). 4 let or have pass from one's control or reach (lost my chance; lost his composure). 5 be defeated in (a game, lawsuit, battle, etc.). 6 get rid of (lost our pursuers; lose weight). 7 forfeit (a right to a thing). 8 spend (time, efforts, etc.) To no purpose.

Train  —v. 1 a (often foll. By to + infin.) Teach (a person, animal, oneself, etc.) A specified skill, esp. By practice. B undergo this process (trained as a teacher). 2 bring or come to physical efficiency by exercise, diet, etc. 3 (often foll. By along, up) guide the growth of (a plant). 4 (usu. As trained adj.) Make (the mind, eye, etc.) Discerning through practice etc. 5 (often foll. By on) point or aim (a gun, camera, etc.) At an object etc. —n. 1 series of railway carriages or trucks drawn by an engine. 2 thing dragged along behind or forming the back part of a dress, robe, etc. 3 succession or series of people, things, events, etc. (train of thought). 4 body of followers; retinue.  in train properly arranged or directed.  trainee n. [latin traho draw]

Chupatty  var. Of *chapatti.

Hike  —n. 1 long walk, esp. In the country for pleasure. 2 rise in prices etc. —v. (-king) 1 go for a hike. 2 walk laboriously. 3 (usu. Foll. By up) hitch up (clothing etc.); become hitched up. 4 (usu. Foll. By up) raise (prices etc.).  hiker n. [origin unknown]

Girlie  adj. Colloq. (of a magazine etc.) Depicting young women in erotic poses.

Ebb  —n. Movement of the tide out to sea. —v. (often foll. By away) 1 flow out to sea; recede. 2 decline (life was ebbing away). [old english]

Poise  —n. 1 composure, self-possession. 2 equilibrium. 3 carriage (of the head etc.). —v. (-sing) 1 balance; hold suspended or supported. 2 be balanced or suspended. [latin pendo pens- weigh]

Laplander  n. Native or inhabitant of lapland; lapp. [as *lapp]

Meagre  adj. (us meager) 1 scant in amount or quality. 2 lean, thin. [anglo-french megre from latin macer]

Treachery  n. (pl. -ies) violation of faith or trust; betrayal.

Uneven  adj. 1 not level or smooth. 2 of variable quality etc. 3 (of a contest) unequal.  unevenly adv. Unevenness n.

Coax  v. 1 persuade gradually or by flattery. 2 (foll. By out of) obtain (a thing from a person) thus. 3 manipulate (a thing) carefully or slowly. [obsolete cokes a fool]

Technetium  n. Artificially produced radioactive metallic element. [greek tekhnetos artificial]

Harmonic  —adj. Of or relating to harmony; harmonious. —n. Mus. Overtone accompanying (and forming a note with) a fundamental at a fixed interval.  harmonically adv.

Postage  n. Charge for sending a letter etc. By post.

Encode  v. (-ding) put into code.

Suspicion  n. 1 unconfirmed belief; distrust. 2 suspecting or being suspected. 3 (foll. By of) slight trace of.  above suspicion too obviously good etc. To be suspected. Under suspicion suspected. [latin: related to *suspect]

Whinge  v. (-geing or -ging) colloq. Whine; grumble peevishly. [old english]

Hang  —v. (past and past part. Hung except in sense 7) 1 a secure or cause to be supported from above, esp. With the lower part free. B (foll. By up, on, on to, etc.) Attach by suspending from the top. 2 set up (a door etc.) On hinges. 3 place (a picture) on a wall or in an exhibition. 4 attach (wallpaper) to a wall. 5 (foll. By on) colloq. Blame (a thing) on (a person) (can't hang that on me). 6 (foll. By with) decorate by suspending pictures etc. (hall hung with tapestries). 7 (past and past part. Hanged) a suspend or be suspended by the neck with a noosed rope until dead, esp. As a form of capital punishment. B as a mild oath (hang the expense). 8 let droop (hang one's head). 9 suspend (meat or game) from a hook and leave until dry, tender, or high. 10 be or remain hung (in various senses). 11 remain static in the air. 12 (often foll. By over) be present or imminent, esp. Oppressively or threateningly (a hush hung over the room). 13 (foll. By on) a be contingent or dependent on (everything hangs on his reply). B listen closely to (hangs on my every word). —n. Way a thing hangs or falls.  get the hang of colloq. Understand the technique or meaning of. Hang about (or around) 1 a stand about or spend time aimlessly; not move away. B linger near (a person or place). 2 (often foll. By with) colloq. Associate with. Hang back show reluctance to act or move. Hang fire be slow in taking action or in progressing. Hang heavily (or heavy) (of time) seem to pass slowly. Hang in us colloq. 1 persist, persevere. 2 linger. Hang on 1 (often foll. By to) continue to hold or grasp. 2 (foll. By to) retain; fail to give back. 3 colloq. A wait for a short time. B (in telephoning) not ring off during a pause in the conversation. 4 colloq. Continue; persevere. Hang out 1 suspend from a window, clothes-line, etc. 2 a protrude downwards (shirt hanging out). B (foll. By of) lean out of (a window etc.). 3 slang frequent or live in a place. Hang together 1 make sense. 2 remain associated. Hang up 1 hang from a hook etc. 2 (often foll. By on) end a telephone conversation by replacing the receiver (he hung up on me). 3 (usu. In passive, foll. By on) slang be a psychological problem or obsession for (is hung up on her father). Not care (or give) a hang colloq. Not care at all. [old english] 

Leatherette  n. Propr. Imitation leather.

Canonize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 a declare officially to be a saint, usu. With a ceremony. B regard as a saint. 2 admit to the canon of scripture. 3 sanction by church authority.  canonization n. [medieval latin: related to *canon]

Soggy  adj. (-ier, -iest) sodden, saturated; too moist (soggy bread).   sogginess n. [dial. Sog marsh]

Felicitous  adj. Formal apt; pleasantly ingenious; well-chosen.

Detainee  n. Person kept in custody, esp. For political reasons.

Artificial  adj. 1 not natural (artificial lake). 2 imitating nature (artificial flowers). 3 affected, insincere.  artificiality n. Artificially adv. [latin: related to *artifice]

Poem  n. 1 metrical composition, usu. Concerned with feeling or imaginative description. 2 elevated composition in verse or prose. 3 something with poetic qualities (a poem in stone). [greek poieo make]

Masonry  n. 1 a stonework. B work of a mason. 2 (masonry) freemasonry.

Vulcanology  n. The study of volcanoes.  vulcanological adj. Vulcanologist n.

Clandestine  adj. Surreptitious, secret. [latin]

Canalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 provide with or convert into a canal or canals. 2 channel.  canalization n. [french: related to *canal]

Glacial  adj. 1 of ice. 2 geol. Characterized or produced by ice. [latin glacies ice]

Baksheesh  n. Gratuity, tip. [persian]

Iris  n. 1 circular coloured membrane behind the cornea of the eye, with a circular opening (pupil) in the centre. 2 plant of a family with bulbs or tuberous roots, sword-shaped leaves, and showy flowers. 3 adjustable diaphragm for regulating the size of a central hole, esp. For the admission of light to a lens. [greek iris iridos rainbow]

Soapy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of or like soap. 2 containing or smeared with soap. 3 unctuous, flattering.  soapily adv. Soapiness n.

Undisturbed  adj. Not disturbed or interfered with.

Adapt  v. 1 a (foll. By to) fit, adjust (one thing to another). B (foll. By to, for) make suitable for a purpose. C modify (esp. A text for broadcasting etc.). 2 (also refl., usu. Foll. By to) adjust to new conditions.  adaptable adj. Adaptation n. [latin: related to *ad-, *apt]

Err  v. 1 be mistaken or incorrect. 2 do wrong; sin. [latin erro stray]

Hebraic  adj. Of hebrew or the hebrews.

Cluck  —n. Guttural cry like that of a hen. —v. Emit cluck(s). [imitative]

Kaffir  n. 1 hist. Member or language of a s. African people of the bantu family. 2 s.afr. Offens. Any black african. [arabic, = infidel]

Silversmith  n. Worker in silver.

Newsreel  n. Short cinema film of recent events.

Capo  n. (pl. -s) device fitted across the strings of a guitar etc. To raise their pitch equally. [italian capo tasto head stop]

Enamour  v. (us enamor) (usu. In passive; foll. By of) inspire with love or delight. [french amour love]

Banquet  —n. Sumptuous, esp. Formal, feast or dinner. —v. (-t-) attend, or entertain with, a banquet; feast. [french diminutive of banc bench]

Molest  v. 1 annoy or pester (a person). 2 attack or interfere with (a person), esp. Sexually.  molestation n. Molester n. [latin molestus troublesome]

Herald  —n. 1 official messenger bringing news. 2 forerunner, harbinger. 3 a hist. Officer responsible for state ceremonial and etiquette. B official concerned with pedigrees and coats of arms. —v. Proclaim the approach of; usher in.  heraldic adj. [french from germanic]

Ecology  n. 1 the study of the relations of organisms to one another and to their surroundings. 2 the study of the interaction of people with their environment.  ecological adj. Ecologically adv. Ecologist n. [greek oikos house]

Revival  n. 1 reviving or being revived. 2 new production of an old play etc. 3 revived use of an old practice, style, etc. 4 a reawakening of religious fervour. B campaign to promote this.

Discreditable  adj. Bringing discredit; shameful.  discreditably adv.

Vicar  n. Clergyman of a church of england parish where he formerly received a stipend rather than tithes: cf. *rector 1. [latin vicarius substitute: related to *vice3]

Paramount  adj. 1 supreme; most important. 2 in supreme authority. [anglo-french par by, amont above: see *amount]

Consult  v. 1 seek information or advice from. 2 (often foll. By with) refer to a person for advice etc. 3 take into account (feelings, interests, etc.).  consultative adj. [latin consulo consult- take counsel]

Dowel  —n. Cylindrical peg for holding structural components together. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) fasten with a dowel. [low german]

Topiary  —adj. Concerned with or formed by clipping shrubs, trees, etc. Into ornamental shapes. —n. Topiary art. [greek topos place]

Tsar  n. (also czar) (fem. Tsarina) hist. Title of the former emperors of russia.  tsarist n. (usu. Attrib.). [latin caesar]

Congregate  v. (-ting) collect or gather into a crowd. [latin grex greg- flock]

Swift  —adj. 1 quick, rapid. 2 prompt. —n. Swift-flying migratory bird with long wings.  swiftly adv. Swiftness n. [old english]

Gravity  n. 1 a force that attracts a body to the centre of the earth etc. B degree of intensity of this. C gravitational force. 2 property of having weight. 3 a importance, seriousness. B solemnity. [latin: related to *grave2]

Grim  adj. (grimmer, grimmest) 1 of stern or forbidding appearance. 2 harsh, merciless. 3 ghastly, joyless (has a grim truth in it). 4 unpleasant, unattractive.  grimly adv. Grimness n. [old english]

Battledore  n. Hist. 1 (in full battledore and shuttlecock) game played with a shuttlecock and rackets. 2 racket used in this. [perhaps from provençal batedor beater]

Renationalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) nationalize again (an originally nationalized and more recently privatized industry etc.).  renationalization n.

Sinuous  adj. Having many curves; undulating.  sinuosity n. [latin: related to *sinus]

Exacting  adj. 1 making great demands. 2 requiring much effort.

Stagy  adj. (also stagey) (-ier, -iest) theatrical, artificial, exaggerated.

April  n. Fourth month of the year. [latin]

Unmake  v. (-king; past and past part. Unmade) undo; destroy, depose, annul.

Burble  v. 1 talk ramblingly. 2 make a bubbling sound. [imitative]

Budge  v. (-ging) (usu. With neg.) 1 move slightly. 2 (cause to) change an opinion.  budge up (or over) make room for another person by moving. [french bouger]

Gaffe  n. Blunder; indiscreet act or remark. [french]

Plagiarize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 (also absol.) Take and pass off (another's thoughts, writings, etc.) As one's own. 2 pass off the thoughts etc. Of (another person) as one's own.  plagiarism n. Plagiarist n. Plagiarizer n. [latin plagiarius kidnapper]

Encamp  v. Settle in a (esp. Military) camp.  encampment n.

Flavoring  n. (brit. Flavouring) substance used to flavour food or drink.

Unlike  —adj. 1 not like; different from. 2 uncharacteristic of (greed is unlike her). 3 dissimilar, different. —prep. Differently from (acts quite unlike anyone else).

Romanticism  n. (also romanticism) adherence to a romantic style in art, music, etc.

Esprit  n. Sprightliness, wit.  esprit de corps devotion to and pride in one's group. [french: related to *spirit]

Earful  n. (pl. -s) colloq. 1 prolonged amount of talking. 2 strong reprimand.

Neurosurgery  n. Surgery on the nervous system, esp. The brain or spinal cord.  neurosurgeon n. Neurosurgical adj.

Gnarled  adj. (of a tree, hands, etc.) Knobbly, twisted, rugged. [var. Of knarled: related to *knurl]

Exhaustive  adj. Thorough, comprehensive.  exhaustively adv. Exhaustiveness n.

Fibreboard  n. (us fiberboard) board of compressed wood or other plant fibres.

Brickyard  n. Place where bricks are made.

Fibrous  adj. Of or like fibres.

Stately  adj. (-ier, -iest) dignified; imposing.  stateliness n.

Cowboy  n. 1 (fem. Cowgirl) person who tends cattle, esp. In the western us. 2 colloq. Unscrupulous or incompetent person in business.

Capacitor  n. Device able to store electric charge.

Polish  —adj. 1 of poland. 2 of the poles or their language. —n. Language of poland.

Unsigned  adj. Not signed.

Flange  n. Projecting flat rim etc., for strengthening or attachment. [origin uncertain]

Destitute  adj. 1 without food, shelter, etc. 2 (usu. Foll. By of) lacking (destitute of friends).  destitution n. [latin]

Preserve  —v. (-ving) 1 keep safe or free from decay etc. 2 maintain (a thing) in its existing state. 3 retain (a quality or condition). 4 treat (food) to prevent decomposition or fermentation. 5 keep (game etc.) Undisturbed for private use. —n. (in sing. Or pl.) 1 preserved fruit; jam. 2 place where game etc. Is preserved. 3 sphere of activity regarded as a person's own.  preservation n. [latin servo keep]

Donation  n. 1 donating or being donated. 2 thing, esp. Money, donated. [latin donum gift]

Pease  n.pl. Archaic peas. [latin pisa]

Borne  past part. Of *bear1. —adj. (in comb.) Carried by (airborne).

Nought  n. 1 digit 0; cipher. 2 poet. Or archaic nothing. [old english: related to *not, *aught]

Inattentive  adj. 1 not paying attention. 2 neglecting to show courtesy.  inattention n. Inattentively adv.

Derivation  n. 1 deriving or being derived. 2 a formation of a word from another or from a root. B tracing of the origin of a word. C statement of this.

Continual  adj. Constantly or frequently recurring; always happening.  continually adv. [french: related to *continue]

Usage  continual is often confused with continuous. Continual is used of something that happens very frequently (e.g. There were continual interruptions), while continuous is used of something that happens without a pause (e.g. Continuous rain all day).

Undefined  adj. Not defined; vague, indefinite.

Connubial  adj. Of marriage or the relationship of husband and wife. [latin nubo marry]

Soda  n. 1 compound of sodium in common use. 2 (in full soda water) effervescent water used esp. With spirits etc. As a drink. [perhaps from latin sodanum from arabic]

Slight  —adj. 1 a small; insignificant. B inadequate. 2 slender, frail-looking. 3 (in superl.) Any whatever (if there were the slightest chance). —v. Treat disrespectfully; ignore. —n. Act of slighting.  slightly adv. Slightness n. [old norse]

Pier  n. 1 a structure built out into the sea, a lake, etc., as a promenade and landing-stage. B breakwater. 2 a support of an arch or of the span of a bridge; pillar. B solid masonry between windows etc. [latin pera]

Nickel  n. 1 silver-white metallic element, used esp. In magnetic alloys. 2 colloq. Us five-cent coin. [german]

Splatter  —v. Splash esp. With a continuous noisy action; spatter. —n. Noisy splashing sound. [imitative]

Racetrack  n. 1 = *racecourse. 2 track for motor racing.

Upland  —n. (usu. In pl.) Higher or inland parts of a country. —adj. Of these parts.

Squalid  adj. 1 filthy, dirty. 2 mean or poor in appearance. [latin]

Cruise  —v. (-sing) 1 a travel by sea for pleasure, calling at ports. B sail about. 2 travel at a relaxed or economical speed. 3 achieve an objective, esp. Win a race etc. With ease. 4 slang search for a sexual (esp. Homosexual) partner in bars, streets, etc. —n. Cruising voyage. [dutch: related to *cross]

Surely  adv. 1 with certainty or safety (slowly but surely). 2 as an appeal to likelihood or reason (surely that can't be right).

Relation  n. 1 a the way in which one person or thing is related or connected to another. B connection, correspondence, contrast, or feeling prevailing between persons or things (bears no relation to the facts; enjoyed good relations for many years). 2 relative. 3 (in pl.) A (foll.

Linseed  n. Seed of flax. [old english: related to *line1]

Appellative  adj. 1 naming. 2 gram. (of a noun) designating a class, common.

Profiteer  —v. Make or seek excessive profits, esp. Illegally or on the black market. —n. Person who profiteers.

Hawthorn  n. Thorny shrub with small dark-red berries. [related to *haw1]

Penultimate  adj. & n. Last but one. [latin paenultimus from paene almost, ultimus last]

Wo  abbr. Warrant-officer.

Paediatrics  n.pl. (treated as sing.) (us pediatrics) branch of medicine dealing with children and their diseases.  paediatric adj. Paediatrician n. [from *paedo-, greek iatros physician]

Autopilot  n. = *automatic pilot.

Honorable  adj. (brit. Honourable) 1 deserving, bringing, or showing honour. 2 (honourable) title indicating distinction, given to certain high officials, the children of certain ranks of the nobility, and (in the house of commons) to mps.  honourably adv.

Stricken  adj. Overcome with illness or misfortune etc. [archaic past part. Of *strike]

Wrath  n. Literary extreme anger. [old english: related to *wroth]

Inflection  n. (also inflexion) 1 inflecting or being inflected. 2 a inflected word. B suffix etc. Used to inflect. 3 modulation of the voice.  inflectional adj. [latin: related to *inflect]

Solicitor  n. Lawyer qualified to advise clients and instruct barristers. [french: related to *solicit]

Casing  n. Protective or enclosing cover or material.

Crotchety  adj. Peevish, irritable.

Plo  abbr. Palestine liberation organization.

Turret  n. 1 small tower, esp. Decorating a building. 2 low flat usu. Revolving armoured tower for a gun and gunners in a ship, aircraft, fort, or tank. 3 rotating holder for tools in a lathe etc.  turreted adj. [french diminutive: related to *tower]

Gusher  n. 1 oil well from which oil flows without being pumped. 2 effusive person.

Unparliamentary  adj. Contrary to proper parliamentary usage.

Straitened  adj. Of or marked by poverty.

Godchild  n. Person in relation to his or her godparent.

Ingratitude  n. Lack of due gratitude.

Fecal  us var. Of faecal (*feces).

Shortcrust  n. (in full shortcrust pastry) a type of crumbly pastry.

Dower  n. 1 widow's share for life of a husband's estate. 2 archaic dowry. [latin dos dowry]

Appendix  n. (pl. -dices) 1 tissue forming a tube-shaped sac attached to the large intestine. 2 addition to a book etc. [latin: related to *append]

Reputation  n. 1 what is generally said or believed about a person's or thing's character (reputation for honesty; reputation of being a crook). 2 state of being well thought of; respectability (lost its reputation). [latin: related to *repute]

Voyeur  n. 1 person who derives sexual pleasure from secretly observing others' sexual activity or organs. 2 (esp. Covert) spectator.  voyeurism n. Voyeuristic adj. [french voir see]

Whoopee  int. Expressing exuberant joy.  make whoopee colloq. 1 have fun, make merry. 2 make love. [imitative]

Sorghum  n. Tropical cereal grass. [italian sorgo]

Pimpernel  n. = *scarlet pimpernel. [latin piper *pepper]

Gerontology  n. The study of old age and the process of ageing. [greek geron geront- old man]

Specific  —adj. 1 clearly defined (a specific purpose). 2 relating to a particular subject; peculiar. 3 exact, giving full details (was specific about his wishes). 4 archaic (of medicine etc.) Having a distinct effect in curing a certain disease. —n. 1 archaic specific medicine or remedy. 2 specific aspect or factor (discussed specifics; from the general to the specific).  specifically adv. Specificity n. [latin: related to *species]

Stirrup  n. Metal loop supporting a horse-rider's foot. [old english, = climbing-rope]

Stolen  past part. Of *steal.

Unprepared  adj. Not prepared; not ready.

Plenum  n. Full assembly of people or a committee etc. [latin, neuter of plenus full]

Overdose  n. Excessive dose of a drug etc.

Reformat  v. (-tt-) format anew.

Tigress  n. Female tiger.

Calling  n. 1 profession or occupation. 2 vocation.

Scuff  —v. 1 graze or brush against. 2 mark or wear out (shoes) in this way. 3 shuffle or drag the feet. —n. Mark of scuffing. [imitative]

Torture  —n. 1 infliction of severe bodily pain, esp. As a punishment or means of persuasion. 2 severe physical or mental suffering. —v. (-ring) subject to torture.  torturer n. Torturous adj. [latin tortura twisting: related to *tort]

Ostensive  adj. Directly showing.

Dsm  abbr. Distinguished service medal.

Winner  n. 1 person etc. That wins. 2 colloq. Successful or highly promising idea etc.

Vulnerable  adj. 1 easily wounded or harmed. 2 (foll. By to) exposed to damage, temptation, etc.  vulnerability n. Vulnerably adv. [latin vulnus -er- wound]

Constituency  n. (pl. -ies) 1 body of voters who elect a representative. 2 area so represented.

Remark  —v. 1 (often foll. By that) a say by way of comment. B archaic take notice of; regard with attention. 2 (usu. Foll. By on, upon) make a comment. —n. 1 written or spoken comment; anything said. 2 a noticing (worthy of remark). B commenting (let it pass without remark). [french remarquer: related to *mark1]

Chassis  n. (pl. Same) 1 base-frame of a motor vehicle, carriage, etc. 2 frame to carry radio etc. Components. [latin: related to *case2]

-fic  suffix (usu. As -ific) forming adjectives meaning ‘producing’, ‘making’ (prolific; pacific). [latin facio make]

Biotin  n. Vitamin of the b complex, found in egg-yolk, liver, and yeast. [greek bios life]

Fragile  adj. 1 easily broken; weak. 2 delicate; not strong.  fragility n. [latin: related to *fracture]

Onside  adj. (of a player in a field game) not offside.

Turboprop  n. 1 jet engine in which a turbine is used as in a turbojet and also to drive a propeller. 2 aircraft powered by this. [from *prop3]

Fluster  —v. 1 make or become nervous or confused (he flusters easily). 2 bustle. —n. Confused or agitated state. [origin unknown]

Unidentified  adj. Not identified.

Tiff  n. Slight or petty quarrel. [origin unknown]

Ph  n. Measure of the acidity or alkalinity of a solution. [german potenz power, h (symbol for hydrogen)]

Journal  n. 1 newspaper or periodical. 2 daily record of events; diary. 3 book in which transactions and accounts are entered. 4 part of a shaft or axle that rests on bearings. [latin diurnalis *diurnal]

Swimmingly  adv. Colloq. Smoothly, without impediment.

Pedometer  n. Instrument for estimating distance walked by recording the number of steps taken. [latin pes ped- foot: related to *-meter]

Depression  n. 1 extreme melancholy, often with a reduction in vitality and physical symptoms. 2 econ. Long period of slump. 3 lowering of atmospheric pressure; winds etc. Caused by this. 4 hollow on a surface. 5 pressing down.

Pillow  —n. 1 soft support for the head, esp. In bed. 2 pillow-shaped block or support. —v. Rest on or as if on a pillow. [latin pulvinus cushion]

Shortly  adv. 1 (often foll. By before, after) soon. 2 in a few words; curtly. [old english]

Natty  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Trim; smart.  nattily adv. [cf. *neat]

Suit  —n. 1 set of matching clothes, usu. A jacket and trousers or skirt. 2 (esp. In comb.) Clothes for a special purpose (swimsuit). 3 any of the four sets (spades, hearts, diamonds, clubs) making up a pack of cards. 4 lawsuit. 5 a petition, esp. To a person in authority. B archaic courting a woman (paid suit to her). —v. 1 go well with (a person's appearance etc.). 2 (also absol.) Meet the demands or requirements of; satisfy; agree with. 3 make fitting; accommodate; adapt. 4 (as suited adj.) Appropriate; well-fitted (not suited to be a nurse).  suit oneself do as one chooses. [anglo-french siute]

Coloration  n. (also colouration) 1 appearance as regards colour. 2 act or mode of colouring. [latin: related to *colour]

Express  —v. 1 represent or make known in words or by gestures, conduct, etc. 2 refl. Communicate what one thinks, feels, or means. 3 esp. Math. Represent by symbols. 4 squeeze out (liquid or air). 5 send by express service. —adj. 1 operating at high speed. 2 also definitely stated. 3 delivered by a specially fast service. —adv. 1 at high speed. 2 by express messenger or train. —n. 1 express train etc. 2 us service for the rapid transport of parcels etc.  expressible adj. Expressly adv. (in sense 2 of adj.). [latin exprimo -press- squeeze out]

Bma  abbr. British medical association.

Freeway  n. Us motorway.

Mongoose  n. (pl. -s) small flesh-eating civet-like mammal. [marathi]

Tomato  n. (pl. -es) 1 glossy red or yellow pulpy edible fruit. 2 plant bearing this. [ultimately from mexican tomatl]

Soutane  n. Cassock worn by a roman catholic priest. [french from italian sotto under]

Feat  n. Remarkable act or achievement. [latin: related to *fact]

Tinkle  —v. (-ling) (cause to) make a succession of short light ringing sounds. —n. 1 tinkling sound. 2 colloq. Telephone call.  tinkly adj. [imitative]

Ga  symb. Gallium.

Mitt  n. 1 (also mitten) glove with only two compartments, one for the thumb and the other for all four fingers. 2 glove leaving the fingers and thumb-tip exposed. 3 slang hand or fist. 4  baseball glove. [latin: related to *moiety]

Ballroom  n. Large room for dancing.

Lyre  n. Ancient u-shaped stringed instrument. [greek lura]

Sarcophagus  n. (pl. -phagi) stone coffin. [greek, = flesh-consumer]

Nightfall  n. End of daylight.

Soundbox  n. The hollow body of a stringed musical instrument, providing resonance.

Podgy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 short and fat. 2 plump, fleshy.  podginess n. [podge short fat person]

Midway  adv. In or towards the middle of the distance between two points.

Quandary  n. (pl. -ies) 1 perplexed state. 2 practical dilemma. [origin uncertain]

Lpo  abbr. London philharmonic orchestra.

Opencast  adj. (of a mine or mining) with removal of the surface layers and working from above, not from shafts.

Phosphor  n. Synthetic fluorescent or phosphorescent substance. [latin *phosphorus]

Species  n. (pl. Same) 1 class of things having some common characteristics. 2 group of animals or plants within a genus, differing only slightly from others and capable of interbreeding. 3 kind, sort. [latin specio look]

Ballistic  adj. Of projectiles.

Untie  v. (untying) 1 undo (a knot, package, etc.). 2 release from bonds or attachment.

Udi  abbr. Unilateral declaration of independence.

Roadworks  n.pl. Construction, repair, etc. Of roads.

Vide  v. (in imper.) See, consult (a passage in a book etc.). [latin video see]

Entropy  n. 1 physics measure of the disorganization or degradation of the universe, resulting in a decrease in available energy. 2 physics measure of the unavailability of a system's thermal energy for conversion into mechanical work. [greek: related to *en-2, trope transformation]

Inexcusable  adj. That cannot be excused or justified.  inexcusably adv.

Hysterical  adj. 1 of or affected with hysteria. 2 uncontrollably emotional. 3 colloq. Extremely funny.  hysterically adv.

Workable  adj. That can be worked, will work, or is worth working.  workability n.

Milch  adj. Giving milk. [old english: related to *milk]

Mortgager  n. (also mortgagor) debtor in a mortgage.

Upswing  n. Upward movement or trend.

Revere  v. (-ring) hold in deep and usu. Affectionate or religious respect. [latin vereor fear]

Rissole  n. Cake of spiced minced meat, coated in breadcrumbs and fried. [french]

Potential  —adj. Capable of coming into being or action; latent. —n. 1 capacity for use or development. 2 usable resources. 3 physics quantity determining the energy of mass in a gravitational field or of charge in an electric field.  potentiality n. Potentially adv. [latin: related to *potent]

Procrustean  adj. Seeking to enforce uniformity ruthlessly or violently. [greek prokroustes, name of a robber who fitted his victims to a bed by stretching them or cutting bits off them]

Terminus  n. (pl. -ni or -nuses) 1 station at the end of a railway or bus route. 2 point at the end of a pipeline etc. [latin, = end, limit, boundary]

Czech  —n. 1 native or national of czechoslovakia. 2 one of the two official languages of czechoslovakia. —adj. Of czechoslovakia, its people, or language. [bohemian cech]

Adrenal  —adj. 1 at or near the kidneys. 2 of the adrenal glands. —n. (in full adrenal gland) either of two ductless glands above the kidneys, secreting adrenalin. [from *ad-, *renal]

Dickens  n. (usu. Prec. By how, what, why, etc., the) colloq. (esp. In exclamations) deuce; the devil (what the dickens is it). [probably the name dickens]

Overact  v. Act (a role) in an exaggerated manner.

Tenth  adj. & n. 1 next after ninth. 2 any of ten equal parts of a thing.  tenthly adv.

Pillage  —v. (-ging) (also absol.) Plunder, sack. —n. Pillaging, esp. In war. [french piller plunder]

Predatory  adj. 1 (of an animal) preying naturally upon others. 2 plundering or exploiting others.

Teasel  n. (also teazel, teazle) 1 plant with large prickly heads that are dried and used to raise the nap on woven cloth. 2 other device used for this purpose.  teaseler n. [old english: related to *tease]

Uefa  abbr. Union of european football associations.

Appraise  v. (-sing) 1 estimate the value or quality of. 2 set a price on (esp. Officially). [earlier apprize, assimilated to *praise]

Summation  n. 1 finding of a total. 2 a summing-up.

Reticence  n. 1 avoidance of saying all one knows or feels, or more than is necessary. 2 disposition to silence; taciturnity.  reticent adj. [latin reticeo keep silent]

Chickweed  n. Small weed with tiny white flowers.

Muscadet  n. 1 a dry white wine from the loire region of france. 2 variety of grape used for this. [muscadet grape]

Interlink  v. Link or be linked together.

Marocain  n. Fabric of ribbed crêpe. [french, = moroccan]

Startle  v. (-ling) shock or surprise. [old english]

Hebrew  —n. 1 member of a semitic people orig. Centred in ancient palestine. 2 a their language. B modern form of this, used esp. In israel. —adj. 1 of or in hebrew. 2 of the hebrews or the jews. [hebrew, = one from the other side of the river]

Samurai  n. (pl. Same) 1 japanese army officer. 2 hist. Member of a japanese military caste. [japanese]

Vaccinate  v. (-ting) inoculate with a vaccine to immunize against a disease.  vaccination n. Vaccinator n.

Taster  n. 1 person employed to test food or drink by tasting. 2 small sample.

Clatter  —n. Sound as of hard objects struck together. —v. (cause to) make a clatter. [old english]

Weathercock  n. 1 weather-vane in the form of a cock. 2 inconstant person.

Supernumerary  —adj. 1 in excess of the normal number; extra. 2 engaged for extra work. 3 (of an actor) appearing on stage but not speaking. —n. (pl. -ies) supernumerary person or thing. [latin: related to *number]

Dalmatian  n. Large white spotted short-haired dog. [dalmatia in croatia]

Chest  n. 1 large strong box. 2 a part of the body enclosed by the ribs. B front surface of the body from the neck to the bottom of the ribs. 3 small cabinet for medicines etc.  get a thing off one's chest colloq. Disclose a secret etc. To relieve one's anxiety about it. [latin cista]

Herr  n. (pl. Herren) 1 title of a german man; mr. 2 german man. [german]

Dinette  n. Small room or alcove for eating meals.

Cellulose  n. 1 carbohydrate forming plant-cell walls, used in textile fibres. 2 (in general use) paint or lacquer consisting of esp. Cellulose acetate or nitrate in solution. [latin: related to *cell]

Botulism  n. Poisoning caused by a bacillus in badly preserved food. [latin botulus sausage]

Fellatio  n. Oral stimulation of the penis. [latin fello suck]

Convey  v. 1 transport or carry (goods, passengers, etc.). 2 communicate (an idea, meaning, etc.). 3 transfer the title to (a property). 4 transmit (sound etc.).  conveyable adj. [latin via way]

Hoick  v. Colloq. (often foll. By out) lift or pull, esp. With a jerk. [perhaps var. Of *hike]

Usage  this phrase is often preceded by the, which is, strictly speaking, unnecessary, since hoi means ‘the’.

Postbag  n. = *mailbag.

Oversew  v. (past part. -sewn or -sewed) sew (two edges) with stitches passing over the join.

Henna  —n. 1 tropical shrub. 2 reddish dye made from it and used to colour hair. —v. (hennaed, hennaing) dye with henna. [arabic]

Perturb  v. 1 disturb mentally; agitate. 2 throw into confusion or disorder.  perturbation n. [french from latin]

Bluish  adj. Fairly blue.

Clothier  n. Seller of men's clothes.

Overtax  v. 1 make excessive demands on. 2 tax too heavily.

Endear  v. (usu. Foll. By to) make dear.  endearing adj.

Expansion  n. 1 expanding or being expanded. 2 enlargement of the scale or scope of a business.

Aghast  predic. Adj. Filled with dismay or consternation. [past part. Of obsolete (a)gast frighten]

Worldwide  —adj. Occurring in or known in all parts of the world. —adv. Throughout the world.

Micro  n. (pl. -s) colloq. 1 = *microcomputer. 2 = *microprocessor.

Conversation  n. 1 informal spoken communication. 2 instance of this. [latin: related to *converse1]

Daub  —v. 1 spread (paint etc.) Crudely or roughly. 2 coat or smear (a surface) with paint etc. 3 paint crudely or unskilfully. —n. 1 paint etc. Daubed on a surface. 2 plaster, clay, etc., esp. Coating laths or wattles to form a wall. 3 crude painting. [latin: related to *de-, *alb]

Bacchic  adj. = *bacchanal adj.

Cotter  n. 1 bolt or wedge for securing parts of machinery etc. 2 (in full cotter pin) split pin that can be opened after passing through a hole. [origin unknown]

Prestel  n. Propr. Computerized visual information system operated by british telecom. [from *press1, *telecommunication]

Foundry  n. (pl. -ies) workshop for or business of casting metal.

Naevus  n. (us nevus) (pl. Naevi) 1 raised red birthmark. 2 = *mole2. [latin]

Watch  —v. 1 keep the eyes fixed on. 2 keep under observation; follow observantly. 3 (often foll. By for) be in an alert state; be vigilant. 4 (foll. By over) look after; take care of. —n. 1 small portable timepiece for carrying on the wrist or in a pocket. 2 state of alert or constant observation or attention. 3 naut. A usu. Four-hour spell of duty. B (in full starboard or port watch) each of the halves into which a ship's crew is divided to take alternate watches. 4 hist. Watchman or watchmen.  on the watch for waiting for (an anticipated occurrence). Watch it (or oneself) colloq. Be careful. Watch out (often foll. By for) be on one's guard.  watcher n. (also in comb.). [old english: related to *wake1]

Trotskyism  n. Political principles of l. Trotsky, esp. As urging worldwide socialist revolution.  trotskyist n. Trotskyite n. Derog.

Vex  v. 1 anger, irritate. 2 archaic grieve, afflict. [latin vexo afflict]

Blusher  n. Rouge.

Kneecap  —n. 1 convex bone in front of the knee. 2 protective covering for the knee. —v. (-pp-) slang (of a terrorist) shoot (a person) in the knee or leg as a punishment.

Bluebell  n. Woodland plant with bell-shaped blue flowers.

-cide  suffix 1 person or substance that kills (regicide; insecticide). 2 killing of (infanticide). [latin caedo kill]

Allow  v. 1 (often foll. By to + infin.) Permit. 2 assign a limited amount etc. (was allowed £500). 3 (usu. Foll. By for) provide or set aside for a purpose; add or deduct in consideration (allow £50 for expenses; allow for wastage). [originally = commend, from french: related to *ad-, latin laudo praise, loco place]

Coppice  n. Area of undergrowth and small trees. [medieval latin: related to *coup]

Peanut  n. 1 plant of the pea family bearing pods underground that contain seeds used for food and oil. 2 seed of this. 3 (in pl.) Colloq. Paltry thing or amount, esp. Of money.

Overenthusiasm  n. Excessive enthusiasm.  overenthusiastic adj. Overenthusiastically adv.

Character  n. 1 collective qualities or characteristics that distinguish a person or thing. 2 a moral strength. B reputation, esp. Good reputation. 3 a person in a novel, play, etc. B part played by an actor; role. 4 colloq. Person, esp. An eccentric one. 5 printed or written letter, symbol, etc. 6 written description of a person's qualities. 7 characteristic (esp. Of a biological species).  in (or out of) character consistent (or inconsistent) with a person's character.  characterless adj. [greek kharakter]

Dungeon  n. Underground prison cell. [earlier donjon keep of a castle; ultimately from latin dominus lord]

Cryptogam  n. Plant with no true flowers or seeds, e.g. Ferns, mosses, and fungi.  cryptogamous adj. [as *crypt, greek gamos marriage]

Devastate  v. (-ting) 1 lay waste; cause great destruction to. 2 (often in passive) overwhelm with shock or grief.  devastation n. [latin vasto lay waste]

Credibility  n. 1 being credible. 2 reputation, status.

Incomplete  adj. Not complete.

Cancer  n. 1 a malignant tumour of body cells. B disease caused by this. 2 evil influence or corruption. 3 (cancer) a constellation and fourth sign of the zodiac (the crab). B person born when the sun is in this sign.  cancerous adj. Cancroid adj. [latin, = crab]

Spore  n. Reproductive cell of many plants and micro-organisms. [greek spora seed]

Appetizing  adj. (also -ising) stimulating the appetite, esp. For food; tasty.

Credulous  adj. Too ready to believe; gullible.  credulity n. Credulously adv. [latin: related to *credo]

Usage  credulous is sometimes confused with credible.

Owt  n. Colloq. Or dial. Anything. [var. Of *aught]

Mending  n. 1 action of repairing. 2 things, esp. Clothes, to be mended.

Tailor  —n. Maker of clothes, esp. Men's outer garments to measure. —v. 1 make (clothes) as a tailor. 2 make or adapt for a special purpose. 3 work as or be a tailor. [anglo-french taillour: related to *tail2]

Baobab  n. African tree with a massive trunk and large pulpy fruit. [probably african dial.]

Steppe  n. Level grassy unforested plain. [russian]

Uneaten  adj. Left not eaten.

Catalepsy  n. Trance or seizure with unconsciousness and rigidity of the body.  cataleptic adj. & n. [greek lepsis seizure]

Bupa  abbr. British united provident association, a private health insurance organization.

Postmaster  n. (fem. Postmistress) official in charge of a post office.

Preclinical  adj. Of the first, chiefly theoretical, stage of a medical education.

Picky  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Excessively fastidious.

Hygiene  n. 1 conditions or practices, esp. Cleanliness, conducive to maintaining health. 2 science of maintaining health.  hygienic adj. Hygienically adv. Hygienist n. [greek hugies healthy]

Paean  n. (us pean) song of praise or triumph. [latin from greek]

Mezzotint  n. 1 method of printing or engraving in which a plate is roughened by scraping to produce tones and halftones. 2 print so produced. [italian: related to *mezzo, *tint]

Gardener  n. Person who gardens, esp. For a living.

Deerstalker  n. Soft cloth peaked cap with ear-flaps.

Agelong  adj. Existing for a very long time.

Unabashed  adj. Not abashed.

Unchallengeable  adj. Not challengeable; unassailable.

Vision  n. 1 act or faculty of seeing, sight. 2 thing or person seen in a dream or trance. 3 mental picture (visions of hot toast). 4 imaginative insight. 5 statesmanlike foresight. 6 beautiful person etc. 7 television or cinema picture, esp. Of specified quality (poor vision). [latin video vis- see]

Fatigue  —n. 1 extreme tiredness. 2 weakness in metals etc. Caused by repeated stress. 3 a non-military army duty. B (in pl.) Clothing worn for this. —v. (-gues, -gued, -guing) cause fatigue in. [latin fatigo exhaust]

Cumulative  adj. 1 increasing or increased progressively in amount, force, etc. (cumulative evidence). 2 formed by successive additions (learning is a cumulative process).  cumulatively adv.

Sigma  n. Eighteenth letter of the greek alphabet (s, s, or, when final, v). [latin from greek]

Novelist  n. Writer of novels.

Diplomat  n. 1 member of a diplomatic service. 2 tactful person.

Pettish  adj. Peevish, petulant; easily put out. [from *pet2]

Finn  n. Native or national of finland; person of finnish descent. [old english]

Sonnet  n. Poem of 14 lines with a fixed rhyme-scheme and, in english, usu. Ten syllables per line. [french sonnet or italian sonetto]

Poppadam  n. (also poppadom, popadam) ind. Thin, crisp, spiced bread eaten with curry etc. [tamil]

Understand  v. (past and past part. -stood) 1 perceive the meaning of (words, a person, a language, a subject, etc.) (understood you perfectly; cannot understand algebra). 2 perceive the significance or cause of (do not understand why he came). 3 (often absol.) Sympathize with, know how to deal with (quite understand your difficulty; ask her, she understands). 4 (often foll. By that or absol.) Infer, take as implied (am i to understand that you refuse?; he is old, i understand).

Meadow  n. 1 piece of grassland, esp. One used for hay. 2 low marshy ground, esp. Near a river.  meadowy adj. [old english]

Foible  n. Minor weakness or idiosyncrasy. [french: related to *feeble]

Footsie  n. = *ft-se. [respelling of *ft-se]

Pervert  —v. 1 turn (a person or thing) aside from its proper use or nature. 2 misapply (words etc.). 3 lead astray from right conduct or (esp. Religious) beliefs; corrupt. 4 (as perverted adj.) Showing perversion. —n. Perverted person, esp. Sexually. [latin verto vers- turn]

Fortnightly  —adj. Done, produced, or occurring once a fortnight. —adv. Every fortnight. —n. (pl. -ies) fortnightly magazine etc.

Brit  n. Colloq. British person. [abbreviation]

Dipstick  n. Rod for measuring the depth of esp. Oil in a vehicle's engine.

Germane  adj. (usu. Foll. By to) relevant (to a subject). [var. Of *german]

Rationalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 (often foll. By away) offer a rational but specious explanation of (one's behaviour or attitude). 2 make logical and consistent. 3  make (a business etc.) More efficient by reorganizing it to reduce or eliminate waste.  rationalization n.

Particular  —adj. 1 relating to or considered as one thing or person as distinct from others; individual (in this particular case). 2 more than is usual; special (took particular care).

Disjunction  n. Separation.

Marten  n. Weasel-like carnivore with valuable fur. [dutch from french]

Pommel  —n. 1 knob, esp. At the end of a sword-hilt. 2 upward projecting front of a saddle. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) = *pummel. [latin pomum apple]

Tendentious  adj. Derog. Calculated to promote a particular cause or viewpoint; biased; controversial.  tendentiously adv. Tendentiousness n.

Attendance  n. 1 attending or being present. 2 number present (high attendance).

Yucca  n. Subtropical white-flowered plant with swordlike leaves, often grown as a house-plant. [carib]

Perfidy  n. Breach of faith; treachery.  perfidious adj. [latin perfidia from fides faith]

Cramp  —n. 1 painful involuntary muscular contraction. 2 (also cramp-iron) metal bar with bent ends for holding masonry etc. Together. —v. 1 affect with cramp. 2 (often foll. By up) confine narrowly. 3 restrict. 4 fasten with a cramp.  cramp a person's style prevent a person from acting freely or naturally. [low german or dutch]

Sexton  n. Person who looks after a church and churchyard, often acting as bell-ringer and gravedigger. [french segerstein from latin sacristanus]

Oblivion  n. State of having or being forgotten. [latin obliviscor forget]

Ambuscade  n. & v. (-ding) = *ambush.

August  n. Eighth month of the year. [latin augustus, first roman emperor]

Currently  adv. At the present time; now.

Saveloy  n. Seasoned dried smoked sausage. [italian cervellata]

Angelic  adj. Of or like an angel.  angelically adv.

Handshake  n. Clasping of a person's hand as a greeting etc.

Ketchup  n. (us catsup) spicy esp. Tomato sauce used as a condiment. [chinese]

Sealant  n. Material for sealing, esp. To make airtight or watertight.

Oratory  n. (pl. -ies) 1 art of or skill in public speaking. 2 small private chapel.  oratorical adj. [french and latin oro speak, pray]

Explicable  adj. That can be explained.

Grandstand  n. Main stand for spectators at a racecourse etc.

Fitful  adj. Spasmodic or intermittent.  fitfully adv.

Suffer  v. 1 undergo pain, grief, damage, etc. 2 undergo, experience, or be subjected to (pain, loss, grief, defeat, change, etc.). 3 tolerate (does not suffer fools gladly). 4 (usu. Foll. By to + infin.) Archaic allow.  sufferer n. [latin suffero]

Pressing  —adj. 1 urgent. 2 urging strongly (pressing invitation). —n. 1 thing made by pressing, e.g. A gramophone record. 2 series of these made at one time. 3 act of pressing (all at one pressing).  pressingly adv.

Saddleback  n. 1 roof of a tower with two opposite gables. 2 hill with a concave upper outline. 3 black pig with a white stripe across the back.  saddlebacked adj.

Leguminous  adj. Of the family of plants with seeds in pods (e.g. Peas and beans).

Australasian  adj. Of australasia, including australia and the islands of the sw pacific.

Flooring  n. Material of which a floor is made.

Rhenium  n. Rare metallic element occurring naturally in molybdenum ores. [latin rhenus rhine]

Ordain  v. 1 confer holy orders on. 2 decree, order. [latin ordino: related to *order]

Tuxedo  n. (pl. -s or -es) us 1 dinner-jacket. 2 suit of clothes including this. [tuxedo park in us]

Unclassified  adj. 1 not classified. 2 (of state information) not secret.

Prebend  n. 1 stipend of a canon or member of chapter. 2 portion of land or tithe from which this is drawn.  prebendal adj. [latin praebeo grant]

Conceal  v. 1 keep secret. 2 hide.  concealment n. [latin celo hide]

Acclamation  n. 1 loud and eager assent. 2 (usu. In pl.) Shouting in a person's honour.

Excrescence  n. 1 abnormal or morbid outgrowth on the body or a plant. 2 ugly addition.  excrescent adj. [latin cresco grow]

Seaworthy  adj. Fit to put to sea.  seaworthiness n.

Enclave  n. Territory of one state surrounded by that of another. [latin clavis key]

Unanswerable  adj. 1 irrefutable (unanswerable case). 2 unable to be answered (unanswerable question).

Banister  n. (also bannister) (usu. In pl.) Uprights and handrail beside a staircase. [corruption of *baluster]

Usage  see note at baluster.

Grummet  var. Of *grommet.

Young  —adj. (younger; youngest) 1 not far advanced in life, development, or existence; not yet old. 2 a immature, inexperienced. B youthful. 3 of or characteristic of youth (young love). 4 representing young people (young farmers). 5 a distinguishing a son from his father (young george). B as a familiar or condescending form of address (listen, young lady). 6 (younger) distinguishing one person from another of the same name (the younger pitt). —n. (collect.) Offspring, esp. Of animals.  youngish adj. [old english]

Assault  —n. 1 violent physical or verbal attack. 2 law threat or display of violence against a person. —v. Make an assault on.  assault and battery law threatening act resulting in physical harm to a person. [latin: related to *assail]

Hero  n. (pl. -es) 1 person noted or admired for nobility, courage, outstanding achievements, etc. 2 chief male character in a play, story, etc. [greek heros]

Pluvial  adj. 1 of rain; rainy. 2 geol. Caused by rain. [latin pluvia rain]

Radii  pl. Of *radius.

Cowl  n. 1 monk's cloak. 2 hood-shaped covering of a chimney or ventilating shaft. [latin cucullus]

Scarab  n. 1 a sacred dung-beetle of ancient egypt. B a kind of beetle. 2 ancient egyptian gem cut in the form of a beetle. [latin scarabaeus from greek]

Coptic  —n. Language of the copts. —adj. Of the copts.

Verse  n. 1 poetry. 2 stanza of a poem or song. 3 each of the short numbered divisions of the bible. 4 poem. [latin versus: related to *versatile]

Cower  v. Crouch or shrink back in fear or distress. [low german]

Anonymous  adj. 1 of unknown name or authorship. 2 without character; featureless.  anonymity n. [greek an- without, onoma name]

Vestry  n. (pl. -ies) church room or building for keeping vestments etc. In.

Calorific  adj. Producing heat.

Unique  adj. 1 being the only one of its kind; having no like, equal, or parallel. 2 remarkable (unique opportunity).  uniquely adv. [latin unicus from unus one]

Usage  in sense 1, unique cannot be qualified by adverbs such as absolutely, most, and quite. The use of unique in sense 2 is regarded as incorrect by some people.

Psychosis  n. (pl. -choses) severe mental disorder with loss of contact with reality. [greek: related to *psyche]

Wiseacre  n. Person who affects a wise manner. [dutch wijsseggher soothsayer]

Lessee  n. (often foll. By of) person holding a property by lease. [french: related to *lease]

Extricate  v. (-ting) (often foll. By from) free or disentangle from a difficulty etc.  extricable adj. Extrication n. [latin tricae perplexities]

Telegraphy  n. Communication by telegraph.

Along  —prep. Beside or through (part of) the length of. —adv. 1 onward, into a more advanced state (come along; getting along nicely). 2 with oneself or others (bring a book along). 3 beside or through part or the whole length of a thing.  along with in addition to; together with. [old english, originally adj. = facing against]

Parish  n. 1 area having its own church and clergyman. 2 (in full civil parish) local government district. 3 inhabitants of a parish. [latin parochia from greek oikos dwelling]

Parthenogenesis  n. Reproduction without fertilization, esp. In invertebrates and lower plants. [greek parthenos virgin]

Dropper  n. Device for releasing liquid in drops.

Shrew  n. 1 small mouselike long-nosed mammal. 2 bad-tempered or scolding woman.  shrewish adj. (in sense 2). [old english]

Purgative  —adj. 1 serving to purify. 2 strongly laxative. —n. 1 purgative thing. 2 laxative. [latin: related to *purge]

Unexplained  adj. Not explained.

Bubbly  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 having or like bubbles. 2 exuberant. —n. Colloq. Champagne.

Reword  v. Express in different words.

Slipstream  n. Current of air or water driven back by a revolving propeller or a moving vehicle.

Exact  —adj. 1 accurate; correct in all details (exact description). 2 precise. —v. 1 demand and enforce payment of (money etc.). 2 demand; insist on; require.  exactness n. [latin exigo exact- require]

Lucid  adj. 1 expressing or expressed clearly. 2 sane.  lucidity n. Lucidly adv. Lucidness n. [latin lux luc- light]

Arabian  —adj. Of or relating to arabia (esp. In geographical contexts) (arabian desert). —n. Native of arabia.

Usage  in the sense ‘native of arabia’, the usual term is now arab.

Hush  —v. Make or become silent or quiet. —int. Calling for silence. —n. Expectant stillness or silence.  hush up suppress public mention of (an affair). [husht, an obsolete exclamation, taken as a past part.]

Rocket  —n. 1 cylindrical firework or signal etc. Propelled to a great height after ignition. 2 engine operating on the same principle, providing thrust but not dependent on air intake. 3 rocket-propelled missile, spacecraft, etc. 4 slang severe reprimand. —v. (-t-) 1 a move rapidly upwards or away. B increase rapidly (prices rocketed). 2 bombard with rockets. [french roquette from italian]

Enshrine  v. (-ning) 1 enclose in a shrine. 2 protect, make inviolable.  enshrinement n.

Collide  v. (-ding) (often foll. By with) come into collision or conflict. [latin collido -lis- clash]

Pursuivant  n.  Officer of the college of arms below a herald. [french: related to *pursue]

Unreliable  adj. Not reliable; erratic.  unreliability n.

Goodly  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 handsome. 2 of imposing size etc.  goodliness n. [old english]

Dissemble  v. (-ling) 1 be hypocritical or insincere. 2 disguise or conceal (a feeling, intention, etc.). [latin simulo *simulate]

Unwind  v. (past and past part. Unwound) 1 draw out or become drawn out after having been wound. 2 colloq. Relax.

Laconic  adj. Terse, using few words.  laconically adv. [greek lakon spartan]

Colourless  adj. (us color-) 1 without colour. 2 lacking character or interest.

Reformulate  v. (-ting) formulate again or differently.  reformulation n.

Lithograph  —n. Lithographic print. —v. Print by lithography. [greek lithos stone]

Assert  v. 1 declare, state clearly. 2 refl. Insist on one's rights. 3 enforce a claim to (assert one's rights). [latin assero -sert-]

Halftone  n. Photographic illustration in which various tones of grey are produced from small and large black dots.

Telekinesis  n. Supposed paranormal force moving objects at a distance.  telekinetic adj. [greek kineo move]

Whilst  adv. & conj. While. [from *while]

Malefactor  n. Criminal; evil-doer.  malefaction n. [latin male badly, facio fact- do]

Irreverent  adj. Lacking reverence.  irreverence n. Irreverently adv.

Unadvised  adj. 1 indiscreet; rash. 2 without advice.  unadvisedly adv.

Rigger  n. 1 worker on an oil rig. 2 person who rigs or who arranges rigging.

Yawn  —v. 1 open the mouth wide and inhale, esp. When sleepy or bored. 2 gape, be wide open. —n. 1 act of yawning. 2 colloq. Boring idea, activity, etc. [old english]

Trusty  —adj. (-ier, -iest) archaic or joc. Trustworthy (a trusty steed). —n. (pl. -ies) prisoner given special privileges for good behaviour.

Appal  v. (-ll-) 1 greatly dismay or horrify. 2 (as appalling adj.) Colloq. Very bad, shocking. [french apalir grow pale: related to *pale1]

Papery  adj. Like paper in thinness or texture.

Vaseline  n. Propr. Type of petroleum jelly used as an ointment etc. [german wasser water, greek elaion oil]

Shiatsu  n. Japanese therapy in which pressure is applied, chiefly with fingers and hands, to specific points on the body. [japanese, = finger pressure]

Freshwater  attrib. Adj. (of fish etc.) Not of the sea.

Founder  v. 1 (of a ship) fill with water and sink. 2 (of a plan etc.) Fail. 3 (of a horse or its rider) stumble, fall lame, stick in mud etc. [related to *found2]

Padre  n. Chaplain in the army etc. [italian, spanish, and portuguese, = father, priest]

Microsurgery  n. Intricate surgery using microscopes.

Sophomore  n. Us second-year university or high-school student. [sophum, obsolete var. Of *sophism]

Insulin  n. Hormone regulating the amount of glucose in the blood, the lack of which causes diabetes. [latin insula island]

Pigmentation  n. 1 natural colouring of plants, animals, etc. 2 excessive colouring of tissue by the deposition of pigment.

Comprehension  n. 1 a understanding. B text set as a test of understanding. 2 inclusion.

Testaceous  adj.  Having a hard continuous shell.

Decade  n. 1 period of ten years. 2 series or group of ten. [greek: related to *deca-]

Usage  the second pronunciation given, with the stress on the second syllable, is considered incorrect by some people, even though it is much used in broadcasting.

Rota  n. List of duties to be done or names of people to do them in turn; roster. [latin, = wheel]

Somnolent  adj. 1 sleepy, drowsy. 2 inducing drowsiness.  somnolence n. [latin: related to *somnambulism]

Counterpoise  —n. 1 counterbalance. 2 state of equilibrium. —v. (-sing) counterbalance. [latin pensum weight]

Kopek  (also kopeck) var. Of *copeck.

Rev  colloq. —n. (in pl.) Number of revolutions of an engine per minute. —v. (-vv-) 1 (of an engine) revolve; turn over. 2 (also absol.; often foll. By up) cause (an engine) to run quickly. [abbreviation]

Colloquialism  n. 1 colloquial word or phrase. 2 use of these.

Limelight  n. 1 intense white light used formerly in theatres. 2 (prec. By the) the glare of publicity.

Identity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a condition of being a specified person or thing. B individuality, personality (felt he had lost his identity). 2 identification or the result of it (mistaken identity; identity card). 3 absolute sameness (identity of interests). 4 algebra a equality of two expressions for all values of the quantities. B equation expressing this. [latin identitas from idem same]

Mecca  n. Place one aspires to visit. [mecca, muslim holy city in arabia]

Cantabile  mus. —adv. & adj. In smooth flowing style. —n. Cantabile passage or movement. [italian, = singable]

Flipper  n. 1 broad flat limb of a turtle, penguin, etc., used in swimming. 2 similar rubber foot attachment for underwater swimming. 3 slang hand.

Mistral  n. Cold n or nw wind in s. France. [latin: related to *master]

Hispanic  —adj. 1 of spain or spain and portugal. 2 of spain and other spanish-speaking countries. —n. Spanish-speaking person living in the us. [latin hispania spain]

Winning  —adj. 1 having or bringing victory. 2 attractive (winning smile). —n. (in pl.) Money won.  winningly adv.

Zn  symb. Zinc.

Breast  —n. 1 a either of two milk-secreting organs on a woman's chest. B corresponding part of a man's body. 2 a chest. B corresponding part of an animal. 3 part of a garment that covers the breast. 4 breast as a source of nourishment or emotion. —v. 1 contend with. 2 reach the top of (a hill).  make a clean breast of confess fully. [old english]

Fondant  n. Soft sugary sweet. [french = melting: related to *fuse1]

Rant  —v. Speak loudly, bombastically, violently, or theatrically. —n. Piece of ranting.  rant and rave express anger noisily and forcefully. [dutch]

Sensation  n. 1 feeling in one's body (sensation of warmth). 2 awareness, impression (sensation of being watched). 3 a intense interest, shock, etc. Felt among a large group. B person, event, etc., causing this. 4 sense of touch. [medieval latin: related to *sense]

Cytoplasm  n. Protoplasmic content of a cell apart from its nucleus.  cytoplasmic adj.

Warren  n. 1 network of rabbit burrows. 2 densely populated or labyrinthine building or district. [anglo-french warenne from germanic]

Anchor  —n. 1 heavy metal weight used to moor a ship or a balloon. 2 stabilizing thing. —v. 1 secure with an anchor. 2 fix firmly. 3 cast anchor. 4 be moored by an anchor. [greek agkura]

Hypermedia  n. Provision of several media (e.g. Audio, video, and graphics) on one computer system, with cross-references from one to another (often attrib.: hypermedia database).

Rule  —n. 1 compulsory principle governing action. 2 prevailing custom or standard; normal state of things. 3 government or dominion (under british rule). 4 graduated straight measure; ruler. 5 code of discipline of a religious order. 6 order made by a judge or court with reference to a particular case only. 7 printing thin line or dash. —v. (-ling) 1 dominate; keep under control. 2 (often foll. By over) have sovereign control of (rules over a vast kingdom). 3 (often foll. By that) pronounce authoritatively. 4 a make parallel lines across (paper). B make (a straight line) with a ruler etc.  as a rule usually. Rule out exclude; pronounce irrelevant or ineligible. Rule the roost be in control. [latin regula]

Monopolize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 obtain exclusive possession or control of (a trade or commodity etc.). 2 dominate or prevent others from sharing in (a conversation etc.).  monopolization n. Monopolizer n.

Slavic  adj. & n. = *slavonic.

Trembler  n. Automatic vibrator for making and breaking an electrical circuit.

Forbidding  adj. Stern, threatening.  forbiddingly adv.

Optician  n. 1 maker, seller, or prescriber of spectacles and contact lenses etc. 2 person trained in the detection and correction of poor eyesight. [medieval latin: related to *optic]

Innovate  v. (-ting) bring in new methods, ideas, etc.; make changes.  innovation n. Innovative adj. Innovator n. Innovatory adj. [latin novus new]

Caliph  n. Esp. Hist. Chief muslim civil and religious ruler.  caliphate n. [arabic, = successor (of muhammad)]

Oxonian  —adj. Of oxford or oxford university. —n. 1 member of oxford university. 2 native or inhabitant of oxford. [oxonia latinized name of ox(en)ford]

Overcrowd  v. (usu. As overcrowded adj.) Fill beyond what is usual or comfortable.  overcrowding n.

Debacle  n. (brit. Débâcle) 1 a utter defeat or failure. B sudden collapse. 2 confused rush or rout. [french]

Virology  n. The study of viruses.  virologist n.

Pastorale  n. (pl. -s or -li) musical work with a rustic theme or atmosphere. [italian: related to *pastoral]

Dirigible  —adj. Capable of being guided. —n. Dirigible balloon or airship. [related to *direct]

Loathsome  adj. Arousing hatred or disgust; repulsive.

Impartial  adj. Treating all alike; unprejudiced, fair.  impartiality n. Impartially adv.

Shiest  superl. Of *shy1.

Circa  prep. (preceding a date) about. [latin]

Lastly  adv. Finally; in the last place.

Schoolroom  n. Room used for lessons.

Repopulate  v. (-ting) populate again or increase the population of.

Voiceless  adj. 1 dumb, speechless. 2 uttered without vibration of the vocal cords (e.g. F, p).

Turning  n. 1 a road that branches off another. B place where this occurs. 2 a use of a lathe. B (in pl.) Chips or shavings from a lathe.

Agog  predic. Adj. Eager, expectant. [french gogue fun]

Vino  n. Slang wine, esp. Of an inferior kind. [italian, = wine]

Unrest  n. Disturbed or dissatisfied state (industrial unrest).

Float  —v. 1 a (cause to) rest or move on the surface of a liquid. B set (a stranded ship) afloat. 2 colloq. A move in a leisurely way. B (often foll. By before) hover before the eye or mind. 3 (often foll. By in) move or be suspended freely in a liquid or gas. 4 a start or launch (a company, scheme, etc.). B offer (stock, shares, etc.) On the stock market. 5 commerce cause or allow to have a fluctuating exchange rate. 6 circulate or cause (a rumour or idea) to circulate. —n. 1 thing that floats, esp.: a a raft. B a light object as an indicator of a fish biting or supporting a fishing-net. C a hollow structure enabling an aircraft to float on water. D a floating device on water, petrol, etc., controlling the level. 2 small esp. Electrically-powered vehicle or cart (milk float). 3 decorated platform or tableau on a lorry in a procession etc. 4 a supply of loose change in a shop, at a fête, etc. B petty cash. 5 theatr. (in sing. Or pl.) Footlights. 6 tool for smoothing plaster.  floatable adj. [old english]

Bother  —v. 1 trouble; worry, disturb. 2 (often foll. By about, with, or to + infin.) Take the time or trouble (didn't bother to tell me; shan't bother with dessert). —n. 1 a person or thing that bothers. B minor nuisance. 2 trouble, worry. —int. Expressing irritation. [irish bodhraim deafen]

Treasurer  n. Person in charge of the funds of a society etc.

Pinnate  adj. (of a compound leaf) having leaflets on either side of the leaf-stalk. [latin pinnatus feathered: related to *pinnacle]

Dioptre  n. (us diopter) unit of refractive power of a lens. [greek: related to *dia-, opsis sight]

L  abbr. (also l.) 1 left. 2 line. 3 litre(s).

Auricle  n. 1 each atrium of the heart. 2 external ear of animals.  auricular adj. [related to *auricula]

Unsupported  adj. Not supported.

Selfsame  adj. (prec. By the) very same, identical.

Percussion  n. 1  a (often attrib.) Playing of music by striking instruments with sticks etc. (percussion instrument). B such instruments collectively. 2  gentle tapping of the body in medical diagnosis. 3 forcible striking of one esp. Solid body against another.  percussionist n. Percussive adj. [latin percutio -cuss- strike]

Facilitate  v. (-ting) ease (a process etc.).  facilitation n. [italian: related to *facile]

Floatation  var. Of *flotation.

Equation  n. 1 equating or making equal; being equal. 2 statement that two mathematical expressions are equal (indicated by the sign =). 3 formula indicating a chemical reaction by means of symbols.

Eldorado  n. (pl. -s) 1 imaginary land of great wealth. 2 place of abundance or opportunity. [spanish el dorado the gilded]

Crone  n. Withered old woman. [dutch croonje carcass]

Pleasurable  adj. Causing pleasure.  pleasurably adv.

Gauze  n. 1 thin transparent fabric of silk, cotton, etc. 2 fine mesh of wire etc.  gauzy adj. (-ier, -iest). [french from gaza in palestine]

Gutter  —n. 1 shallow trough below the eaves of a house, or a channel at the side of a street, to carry off rainwater. 2 (prec. By the) poor or degraded background or environment. 3 open conduit. 4 groove. —v. (of a candle) burn unsteadily and melt away rapidly. [latin gutta drop]

Fitting  —n. 1 trying-on of a garment etc. For adjustment before completion. 2 (in pl.) Fixtures and fitments of a building. —adj. Proper, becoming, right.  fittingly adv.

Heterosexual  —adj. Feeling or involving sexual attraction to the opposite sex. —n. Heterosexual person.  heterosexuality n.

Lanthanum  n. Metallic element, first of the lanthanide series. [greek lanthano escape notice]

Uncomplimentary  adj. Insulting.

Disciplinarian  n. Enforcer of or believer in firm discipline.

Misuse  —v. (-sing) 1 use wrongly; apply to the wrong purpose. 2 ill-treat. —n. Wrong or improper use or application.

Gradation  n. (usu. In pl.) 1 stage of transition or advance. 2 a certain degree in rank, intensity, etc. B arrangement in such degrees.  gradational adj. [latin: related to *grade]

Antichrist  n. Enemy of christ.  antichristian adj.

Rafter  n. Each of the sloping beams forming the framework of a roof. [old english]

Raucous  adj. Harsh-sounding, loud and hoarse.  raucously adv. Raucousness n. [latin]

Artless  adj. 1 guileless, ingenuous. 2 natural. 3 clumsy.  artlessly adv.

Shipping  n. 1 transport of goods etc. 2 ships, esp. A navy.

Chat  —v. (-tt-) talk in a light familiar way. —n. 1 pleasant informal talk. 2 any of various songbirds.  chat up colloq. Chat to, esp. Flirtatiously or with an ulterior motive. [shortening of *chatter]

Baptism  n. Symbolic admission to the christian church, with water and usu. Name-giving.  baptismal adj. [greek baptizo baptize]

Waistline  n. Outline or size of a person's body at the waist.

Theory  n. (pl. -ies) 1 supposition or system of ideas explaining something, esp. One based on general principles independent of the particular things to be explained (atomic theory; theory of evolution). 2 speculative (esp. Fanciful) view (one of my pet theories). 3 abstract knowledge or speculative thought (all very well in theory). 4 exposition of the principles of a science etc. (the theory of music). 5 collection of propositions to illustrate the principles of a mathematical subject (probability theory). [greek: related to *theorem]

Omnipresent  adj. Present everywhere.  omnipresence n. [latin: related to *present1]

Autoimmune  adj. (of a disease) caused by antibodies produced against substances naturally present in the body.

Harebell  n. Plant with pale-blue bell-shaped flowers.

Underpin  v. (-nn-) 1 support from below with masonry etc. 2 support, strengthen.

Boredom  n. State of being bored. [from *bore2]

Psychiatry  n. The study and treatment of mental disease.  psychiatric adj.  Psychiatrist n. [from *psycho-, greek iatros physician]

Lazybones  n. (pl. Same) colloq. Lazy person.

Domicile  —n. 1 dwelling-place. 2 law a place of permanent residence. B residing. —v. (-ling) (usu. As domiciled adj.) (usu. Foll. By at, in) settle in a place. [latin domus home]

Nhs  abbr. National health service.

Remand  —v. Return (a prisoner) to custody, esp. To allow further inquiry. —n. Recommittal to custody.  on remand in custody pending trial. [latin remando]

Consecutive  adj. 1 a following continuously. B in an unbroken or logical order. 2 gram. Expressing a consequence.  consecutively adv. [latin sequor secut- follow]

Judicature  n. 1 administration of justice. 2 judge's position. 3 judges collectively. [medieval latin judico judge]

Sum  —n. 1 total resulting from addition. 2 amount of money (a large sum). 3 a arithmetical problem. B (esp. Pl.) Colloq. Arithmetic work, esp. Elementary. —v. (-mm-) find the sum of.  in sum in brief. Sum up 1 (esp. Of a judge) give a summing-up. 2 form or express an opinion of (a person, situation, etc.). 3 summarize. [latin summa]

E-  prefix see *ex-1 before some consonants.

Despondent  adj. In low spirits, dejected.  despondence n. Despondency n. Despondently adv. [latin: related to *sponsor]

Glebe  n. Piece of land as part of a clergyman's benefice and providing income. [latin gl(a)eba clod, soil]

Misapply  v. (-ies, -ied) apply (esp. Funds) wrongly.  misapplication n.

Calends  n.pl. (also kalends) first of the month in the ancient roman calendar. [latin kalendae]

Malthusian  adj. Of malthus's doctrine that the population should be restricted so as to prevent an increase beyond its means of subsistence.  malthusianism n. [malthus, name of a clergyman]

Embellish  v. 1 beautify, adorn. 2 enhance with fictitious additions.  embellishment n. [french bel, *beau]

Unpin  v. (-nn-) unfasten or detach by removing or opening a pin or pins.

Grasshopper  n. Jumping and chirping insect.

Amicable  adj. (esp. Of an arrangement, relations, etc.) Friendly.  amicably adv. [latin amicus friend]

Gingham  n. Plain-woven cotton cloth, esp. Striped or checked. [dutch from malay]

Classicism  n. 1 following of a classic style. 2 classical scholarship. 3 ancient greek or latin idiom.  classicist n.

Psychoanalysis  n. Treatment of mental disorders by bringing repressed fears and conflicts into the conscious mind over a long course of interviews.  psychoanalyse v. (-sing). Psychoanalyst n. Psychoanalytic adj. Psychoanalytical adj.

Decoy  —n. Person or thing used as a lure; bait, enticement. —v. Lure, esp. Using a decoy. [dutch]

Revolting  adj. Disgusting, horrible.  revoltingly adv.

Lighthouse  n. Tower etc. Containing a beacon light to warn or guide ships at sea.

Cinquefoil  n. 1 plant with compound leaves of five leaflets. 2 archit. Five-cusped ornament in a circle or arch. [latin: related to *cinque, folium leaf]

Souvenir  n. Memento of an occasion, place, etc. [french]

Ichthyosaurus  n. (also ichthyosaur) (pl. -sauruses or -saurs) extinct marine reptile with four flippers and usu. A large tail. [greek ikhthus fish, sauros lizard]

Mortuary  —n. (pl. -ies) room or building in which dead bodies are kept until burial or cremation. —attrib. Adj. Of death or burial. [medieval latin mortuus dead]

Tempi  pl. Of *tempo.

Wimp  n. Colloq. Feeble or ineffectual person.  wimpish adj. [origin uncertain]

Teazel  (also teazle) var. Of *teasel.

Hydrotherapy  n. Use of water, esp. Swimming, in the treatment of arthritis, paralysis, etc.

Continental  adj. 1 of or characteristic of a continent. 2 (continental) of or characteristic of mainland europe.

Mahonia  n. Evergreen shrub with yellow bell-shaped flowers. [french or spanish]

Greenhorn  n. Inexperienced person; new recruit.

Pole  n. 1 native or national of poland. 2 person of polish descent. [german from polish]

Usage  the spelling is north pole and south pole when used as geographical designations.

Pea  n. 1 a hardy climbing plant with edible seeds growing in pods. B its seed. 2 similar plant (sweet pea; chick-pea). [from *pease taken as a plural]

Moderate  —adj. 1 avoiding extremes; temperate in conduct or expression. 2 fairly large or good. 3 (of the wind) of medium strength. 4 (of prices) fairly low. —n. Person who holds moderate views, esp. In politics. —v. (-ting) 1 make or become less violent, intense, rigorous, etc. 2 (also absol.) Act as moderator of or to.  moderately adv. Moderateness n. [latin]

Barnstorm  v. Tour rural areas as an actor or political campaigner.  barnstormer n.

Untalented  adj. Not talented.

Turd  n. Coarse slang 1 lump of excrement. 2 contemptible person. [old english]

Ohp  abbr. Overhead projector.

Tabulator  n. 1 person or thing that tabulates. 2 device on a typewriter etc. For advancing to a sequence of set positions in tabular work.

It  abbr. Information technology.

Townsman  n. (fem. Townswoman) inhabitant of a town.

Garfish  n. (pl. Same or -es) fish with a long spearlike snout. [old english, = spear-fish]

Tenure  n. 1 condition, or form of right or title, under which (esp. Real) property is held. 2 (often foll. By of) a holding or possession of an office or property. B period of this. 3 guaranteed permanent employment, esp. As a teacher or lecturer.  tenured adj. [latin teneo]

Elusive  adj. 1 difficult to find or catch. 2 difficult to remember. 3 avoiding the point raised.  elusiveness n.

Unregenerate  adj. Obstinately wrong or bad.

Moll  n. Slang 1 gangster's female companion. 2 prostitute. [pet form of mary]

Sec  adj. (of wine) dry. [french]

Interest  —n. 1 a concern; curiosity (have no interest in fishing). B quality exciting curiosity etc. (this book lacks interest). 2 subject, hobby, etc., in which one is concerned. 3 advantage or profit (it is in my interest to go). 4 money paid for the use of money lent. 5 a thing in which one has a stake or concern (business interests). B financial stake (in an undertaking etc.). C legal concern, title, or right (in property). 6 a party or group with a common interest (the brewing interest). B principle or cause with which this is concerned. —v. 1 excite the curiosity or attention of. 2 (usu. Foll. By in) cause (a person) to take a personal interest. 3 (as interested adj.) Having a private interest; not impartial or disinterested. [latin, = it matters]

Lip  —n. 1 either of the two fleshy parts forming the edges of the mouth-opening. 2 edge of a cup, vessel, etc., esp. The part shaped for pouring from. 3 colloq. Impudent talk. —v. (-pp-) 1 touch with the lips; apply the lips to. 2 touch lightly.  lipped adj. (also in comb.). [old english]

Barograph  n. Barometer equipped to record its readings. [greek baros weight]

Discovery  n. (pl. -ies) 1 discovering or being discovered. 2 person or thing discovered.

Unchaperoned  adj. Without a chaperone.

Reline  v. (-ning) put a new lining in (a garment etc.).

Meteorite  n. Fallen meteor, or fragment of natural rock or metal from outer space.

Customer  n. 1 person who buys goods or services from a shop or business. 2 colloq. Person of a specified kind (awkward customer). [anglo-french: related to *custom]

Democratic  adj. 1 of, like, practising, or being a democracy. 2 favouring social equality.  democratically adv.

Austral  adj. 1 southern. 2 (austral) of australia or australasia. [latin auster south]

Software  n. Programs for a computer.

Monotheism  n. Doctrine that there is only one god.  monotheist n. Monotheistic adj.

Sting  —n. 1 sharp wounding organ of an insect, snake, nettle, etc. 2 a act of inflicting a wound with this. B the wound itself or the pain caused by it. 3 painful quality or effect. 4 pungency, vigour. 5 slang swindle. —v. (past and past part. Stung) 1 a wound or pierce with a sting.
