B be able to sting. 2 feel or give a tingling physical or sharp mental pain. 3 (foll. By into) incite, esp. Painfully (stung into replying). 4 slang swindle, charge exorbitantly.  sting in the tail unexpected final pain or difficulty. [old english]

Minatory  adj. Formal threatening, menacing. [latin minor threaten]

Computer  n. Electronic device for storing and processing data, making calculations, or controlling machinery.

Vow  —n. Solemn, esp. Religious, promise (monastic vows; marriage vows). —v. 1 promise solemnly. 2 archaic declare solemnly. [french vou(er): related to *vote]

Shaddock  n. 1 largest citrus fruit, with a thick yellow skin and bitter pulp. 2 tree bearing these. [capt. Shaddock, who introduced it to the w. Indies in the 17th c.]

Leaden  adj. 1 of or like lead. 2 heavy or slow. 3 lead-coloured.

Lunate  adj. Crescent-shaped.

Negotiate  v. (-ting) 1 (usu. Foll. By with) confer in order to reach an agreement. 2 arrange (an affair) or bring about (a result) by negotiating. 3 find a way over, through, etc. (an obstacle, difficulty, etc.). 4 convert (a cheque etc.) Into money.  negotiation n. Negotiator n. [latin negotium business]

-ise  var. Of *-ize.

Usage  see note at -ize.

Coupe  n. (brit. Coupé) car with a hard roof, two doors, and usu. A sloping rear. [french couper cut]

Paneling  n. (brit. Panelling) 1 panelled work. 2 wood for making panels.

Amharic  —n. Official and commercial language of ethiopia. —adj. Of this language. [amhara, region of ethiopia]

Multiply  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 (also absol.) Obtain from (a number) another that is a specified number of times its value (multiply 6 by 4 and you get 24). 2 increase in number, esp. By procreation. 3 produce a large number of (instances etc.). 4 a breed (animals). B propagate (plants). [latin multiplico: related to *multiplex]

Freehand  —adj. (of a drawing etc.) Done without special instruments. —adv. In a freehand manner.

Furnish  v. 1 provide (a house, room, etc.) With furniture. 2 (often foll. By with) supply. [french from germanic]

Marquee  n. Large tent for social functions etc. [french marquise]

Backcloth  n. 1 painted cloth at the back of a stage. 2 background to a scene or situation.

Pipsqueak  n. Colloq. Insignificant or contemptible person or thing. [imitative]

Titchy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Very small. [titch small person, from tich, name of a comedian]

Vaulting  n. Arched work in a vaulted roof or ceiling.

Blend  —v. 1 mix together as required. 2 become one. 3 (often foll. By with, in) mingle; mix thoroughly. 4 (esp. Of colours) merge imperceptibly; harmonize. —n. Mixture. [old norse]

Effective  adj. 1 producing the intended result. 2 impressive, striking. 3 actual, existing. 4 operative.  effectively adv. Effectiveness n.

Crapulent  adj. Suffering the effects of drunkenness.  crapulence n. Crapulous adj. [latin crapula inebriation]

Leasehold  n. 1 holding of property by lease. 2 property held by lease.  leaseholder n.

Particularize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) (also absol.) 1 name specially or one by one. 2 specify (items).  particularization n.

Rectilinear  adj.  1 bounded or characterized by straight lines. 2 in or forming a straight line. [latin: related to *rectify]

Scornful  adj. (often foll. By of) contemptuous.  scornfully adv.

Disrupt  v. 1 interrupt the continuity of; bring disorder to. 2 break apart.  disruption n. Disruptive adj. Disruptively adv. [latin: related to *rupture]

Alsatian  n. Large dog of a breed of wolfhound (also called *german shepherd). [latin alsatia alsace]

Change  —n. 1 a making or becoming different. B alteration or modification. 2 a money exchanged for money in larger units or a different currency. B money returned as the balance of that given in payment. 3 new experience; variety (need a change). 4 substitution of one thing for another (change of scene). 5 (in full change of life) colloq. Menopause. 6 (usu. In pl.) One of the different orders in which bells can be rung. —v. (-ging) 1 undergo, show, or subject to change; make or become different. 2 a take or use another instead of; go from one to another (change one's socks; changed trains). B (usu. Foll. By for) give up or get rid of in exchange (changed the car for a van). 3 give or get money in exchange for. 4 put fresh clothes or coverings on. 5 (often foll. By with) give and receive, exchange. 6 change trains etc. 7 (of the moon) arrive at a fresh phase.  change down engage a lower gear. Change gear engage a different gear. Change hands 1 pass to a different owner. 2 substitute one hand for the other. Change one's mind adopt a different opinion or plan. Change over change from one system or situation to another.

Progesterone  n. A steroid hormone which stimulates the preparation of the uterus for pregnancy and maintains the uterus in the event of fertilization. [german: related to *pro-1, *gestation]

Brainwave  n. 1 (usu. In pl.) Electrical impulse in the brain. 2 colloq. Sudden bright idea.

Bitchy  adj. (-ier, -iest) slang spiteful.  bitchily adv. Bitchiness n.

Azimuth  n. Angular distance from a north or south point of the horizon to the intersection with the horizon of a vertical circle passing through a given celestial body.  azimuthal adj. [french from arabic]

Pouter  n. A kind of pigeon that is able to inflate its crop.

Marital  adj. Of marriage or marriage relations. [latin maritus husband]

Grandsire  n. Archaic grandfather.

Depilate  v. (-ting) remove hair from.  depilation n. [latin pilus hair]

Exile  —n. 1 expulsion from one's native land or (internal exile) native town etc. 2 long absence abroad. 3 exiled person. —v. (-ling) send into exile. [french from latin]

Gen  slang —n. Information. —v. (-nn-) (foll. By up) gain or give information. [probably general information]

Spatter  —v. Splash or scatter in drips. —n. 1 splash. 2 pattering. [imitative]

Disable  v. (-ling) 1 deprive of an ability or function. 2 (often as disabled adj.) Physically incapacitate.  disablement n.

Pang  n. (often in pl.) Sudden sharp pain or painful emotion. [obsolete pronge]

Molehill  n. Small mound thrown up by a mole in burrowing.  make a mountain out of a molehill overreact to a minor difficulty.

Waxen  adj. 1 smooth or pale like wax. 2 archaic made of wax.

Specification  n. 1 act of specifying. 2 (esp. In pl.) Detail of the design and materials etc. Of work done or to be done. [medieval latin: related to *specify]

Creak  —n. Harsh scraping or squeaking sound. —v. 1 make a creak. 2 a move stiffly or with a creaking noise. B be poorly constructed (plot creaks). [imitative]

Heavenly  adj. 1 of heaven; divine. 2 of the heavens or sky. 3 colloq. Very pleasing; wonderful.

Schematic  —adj. Of or as a scheme or schema; diagrammatic. —n. Diagram, esp. Of an electronic circuit.  schematically adv.

Sino-  comb. Form chinese; chinese and (sino-american). [greek sinai the chinese]

Emigrate  v. (-ting) leave one's own country to settle in another.  emigration n. [latin: related to *migrate]

Smashing  adj. Colloq. Excellent, wonderful.

Ramadan  n. Ninth month of the muslim year, with strict fasting from sunrise to sunset. [arabic]

Rhodium  n.  Hard white metallic element used in making alloys and plating jewellery. [greek rhodon rose]

Unfavourable  adj. (us unfavorable) not favourable; adverse, hostile.  unfavourably adv.

Multiplicand  n. Quantity to be multiplied by another.

Burin  n. 1 tool for engraving copper or wood. 2 archaeol. Chisel-pointed flint tool. [french]

Fortissimo  mus. —adj. Very loud. —adv. Very loudly. —n. (pl. -s or -mi) very loud playing or passage. [italian, superlative of *forte2]

Subzero  adj. (esp. Of temperature) lower than zero.

Weed  —n. 1 wild plant growing where it is not wanted. 2 thin weak-looking person or horse. 3 (prec. By the) slang a marijuana. B tobacco. —v. 1 a clear (an area) of weeds. B remove unwanted parts from. 2 (foll. By out) a sort out and remove (inferior or unwanted parts etc.). B rid of inferior parts, unwanted members, etc. 3 cut off or uproot weeds. [old english]

Millworker  n. Factory worker.

Loll  v. 1 stand, sit, or recline in a lazy attitude. 2 hang loosely. [imitative]

Defence  n. (us defense) 1 defending, protection. 2 means of this. 3 (in pl.) Fortifications. 4 justification, vindication. 5 defendant's case or counsel in a lawsuit. 6 defending play or players.  defenceless adj. Defencelessly adv. Defencelessness n. [related to *defend]

Malevolent  adj. Wishing evil to others.  malevolence n. Malevolently adv. [latin volo wish]

Saturday  —n. Day of the week following friday. —adv. Colloq. 1 on saturday. 2 (saturdays) on saturdays; each saturday. [latin: related to *saturnalia]

Inferno  n. (pl. -s) 1 raging fire. 2 scene of horror or distress. 3 hell. [italian: related to *infernal]

Demography  n. The study of the statistics of births, deaths, disease, etc.  demographic adj. Demographically adv. [greek demos the people, *-graphy]

Passive  adj. 1 acted upon, not acting. 2 showing no interest or initiative; submissive. 3 chem. Not active; inert. 4 gram. Indicating that the subject undergoes the action of the verb (e.g. In they were seen).  passively adv. Passivity n. [latin: related to *passion]

Senna  n. 1 cassia. 2 laxative from the dried pod of this. [arabic]

Unpleasing  adj. Not pleasing.

Conjectural  adj. Based on conjecture.

November  n. Eleventh month of the year. [latin novem nine, originally the 9th month of the roman year]

Reinforce  v. (-cing) strengthen or support, esp. With additional personnel or material or by an increase of numbers or quantity or size etc. [french renforcer]

Blanket  —n. 1 large esp. Woollen sheet used as a bed-covering etc. 2 thick covering mass or layer. —attrib. Adj. Covering everything; inclusive. —v. (-t-) 1 cover. 2 stifle, suppress. [french: related to *blank]

Taproom  n. Room in a pub serving drinks on tap.

Setter  n. Dog of a long-haired breed trained to stand rigid when scenting game.

Carboy  n. Large globular glass bottle usu. In a frame. [persian]

Semicircle  n. Half of a circle or of its circumference.  semicircular adj.

Spirant  —adj. Uttered with a continuous expulsion of breath. —n. Such a consonant. [latin spiro breathe]

Hymen  n. Membrane at the opening of the vagina, usu. Broken at the first occurrence of sexual intercourse. [greek humen membrane]

Acrobat  n. Entertainer performing gymnastic feats.  acrobatic adj. Acrobatically adv. [greek akrobates from akron summit, baino walk]

Lib  n. Colloq. (in names of political movements) liberation. [abbreviation]

Cowardly  adj. 1 of or like a coward; lacking courage. 2 (of an action) done against one who cannot retaliate.

Draper  n. Dealer in textile fabrics.

Imbalance  n. 1 lack of balance. 2 disproportion.

Evaporate  v. (-ting) 1 turn from solid or liquid into vapour. 2 (cause to) lose moisture as vapour. 3 (cause to) disappear.  evaporable adj. Evaporation n. [latin: related to *vapour]

Intaglio  n. (pl. -s) 1 gem with an incised design. 2 engraved design. [italian: related to *in-2, *tail2]

Lanyard  n. 1 cord worn round the neck or the shoulder, to which a knife etc. May be attached. 2 naut. Short rope or line used for securing, tightening, etc. [french laniere, assimilated to *yard1]

Raving  —n. (usu. In pl.) Wild or delirious talk. —adj. & adv. Colloq. As an intensifier (a raving beauty; raving mad).

Erysipelas  n. Disease causing fever and a deep red inflammation of the skin. [latin from greek]

Calciferol  n. Vitamin (d2) promoting calcium deposition in the bones. [related to *calx]

Stun  v. (-nn-) 1 knock senseless; stupefy. 2 bewilder, shock. [french: related to *astonish]

Wrick  var. Of *rick2.

Supercharge  v. (-ging) 1 (usu. Foll. By with) charge (the atmosphere etc.) With energy, emotion, etc. 2 use a supercharger on.

Honour  (us honor) —n. 1 high respect, public regard. 2 adherence to what is right or an accepted standard of conduct. 3 nobleness of mind, magnanimity (honour among thieves). 4 thing conferred as a distinction, esp. An official award for bravery or achievement. 5 privilege, special right (had the honour of being invited). 6 a exalted position. B (honour) (prec. By your, his, etc.) Title of a circuit judge etc. 7 (foll. By to) person or thing that brings honour (an honour to her profession). 8 a chastity (of a woman). B reputation for this. 9 (in pl.) Specialized degree course or special distinction in an examination. 10 (in card-games) the four or five highest-ranking cards. 11 golf the right of driving off first. —v. 1 respect highly. 2 confer honour on. 3 accept or pay (a bill or cheque) when due.  do the honours perform the duties of a host to guests etc. In honour of as a celebration of. On one's honour (usu. Foll. By to + infin.) Under a moral obligation. [latin honor repute]

Quadriplegia  n.  Paralysis of all four limbs.  quadriplegic adj. & n. [from *quadri-, greek plege a blow]

Girder  n. Iron or steel beam or compound structure for bridge-building etc.

Henchman  n. Usu. Derog. Trusted supporter. [old english hengst horse, *man]

Bandolier  n. (also bandoleer) shoulder belt with loops or pockets for cartridges. [dutch or french]

Scholasticism  n. Hist. Medieval western church philosophy.

Lowest  adj. (superl. Of *low1) least high in position or status.

Midfield  n. Football central part of the pitch, away from the goals.  midfielder n.

Backdrop  n. = *backcloth.

Spotty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 marked with spots. 2 patchy, irregular.  spottiness n.

Rangefinder  n. Instrument for estimating the distance of an object to be shot at or photographed.

Scimitar  n. Curved oriental sword. [french and italian]

Twice  adv. 1 two times; on two occasions. 2 in double degree or quantity (twice as good). [old english: related to *two]

Expect  v. 1 a regard as likely. B look for as appropriate or one's due (i expect cooperation). 2 colloq. Think, suppose.  be expecting colloq. Be pregnant (with). [latin specto look]

Erstwhile  —adj. Former, previous. —adv. Archaic formerly. [related to *ere]

Frame  —n. 1 case or border enclosing a picture, window, door, etc. 2 basic rigid supporting structure of a building, vehicle, etc. 3 (in pl.) Structure of spectacles holding the lenses. 4 human or animal body, esp. As large or small. 5 a established order or system (the frame of society). B construction, build, structure. 6 temporary state (esp. In frame of mind). 7 single complete image on a cinema film or transmitted in a series of lines by television. 8 a triangular structure for positioning balls in snooker etc. B round of play in snooker etc. 9 boxlike structure of glass etc. For protecting plants. 10 us slang = *frame-up. —v. (-ming) 1 a set in a frame. B serve as a frame for. 2 construct, put together, devise. 3 (foll. By to, into) adapt or fit. 4 slang concoct a false charge or evidence against; devise a plot against. 5 articulate (words). [old english, = be helpful]

Coincide  v. (-ding) 1 occur at the same time. 2 occupy the same portion of space. 3 (often foll. By with) agree or be identical. [latin: related to *incident]

Overkill  n. 1 excess of capacity to kill or destroy. 2 excess.

Unsex  v. Deprive (a person, esp. A woman) of the qualities of her or his sex.

Cartwheel  n. 1 wheel of a cart. 2 circular sideways handspring with arms and legs extended.

Aviary  n. (pl. -ies) large cage or building for keeping birds. [latin avis bird]

Limn  v. Archaic paint. [french luminer from latin lumino *illuminate]

Vocalist  n. Singer.

Village  n. 1 country settlement, larger than a hamlet and smaller than a town. 2 self-contained village-like community within a city etc. (greenwich village; olympic village).  villager n. [latin: related to *villa]

Binding  —n. Thing that binds, esp. The covers, glue, etc., of a book. —adj. Obligatory.

Fireman  n. 1 member of a fire brigade. 2 person who tends a steam engine or steamship furnace.

Cocoon  —n. 1 silky case spun by insect larvae for protection as pupae. 2 protective covering. —v. Wrap or coat in a cocoon. [provençal coca shell]

Whereby  conj. By what or which means.

Bide  v. (-ding)  bide one's time wait for a good opportunity. [old english]

Gasbag  n. Slang idle talker.

Toy  —n. 1 plaything. 2 thing regarded as providing amusement. 3 (usu. Attrib.) Diminutive breed of dog etc. —v. (usu. Foll. By with) 1 trifle, amuse oneself, flirt. 2 move a thing idly. [origin unknown]

Ephemera  n.pl. Things of only short-lived relevance. [latin: related to *ephemeral]

Inaccessible  adj. 1 not accessible. 2 (of a person) unapproachable.  inaccessibility n.

Tachograph  n. Device in a vehicle recording speed and travel time. [greek takhos speed]

Ancestor  n. 1 person, animal, or plant from which another has descended or evolved. 2 prototype or forerunner. [latin ante- before, cedo go]

More  —adj. Greater in quantity or degree; additional (more problems than last time; bring some more water). —n. Greater quantity, number, or amount (more than three people; more to it than meets the eye). —adv. 1 to a greater degree or extent. 2 forming the comparative of adjectives and adverbs, esp. Those of more than one syllable (more absurd; more easily).  more and more to an increasing degree. More of to a greater extent. More or less approximately; effectively; nearly. What is more as an additional point. [old english]

Coloured  (us colored) —adj. 1 having colour. 2 (coloured) often offens. A wholly or partly of non-white descent. B s.afr. Of mixed descent. —n. 1 (coloured) often offens. A coloured person. B s.afr. Person of mixed descent. 2 (in pl.) Coloured clothing etc. For washing.

Reaffirm  v. Affirm again.  reaffirmation n.

Seminar  n. 1 small discussion class at a university etc. 2 short intensive course of study. 3 conference of specialists. [german: related to *seminary]

Sulpha  n. (us sulfa) any of various sulphonamides (often attrib.: sulpha drug). [abbreviation]

Rejoice  v. (-cing) 1 feel great joy. 2 be glad. 3 (foll. By in, at) take delight. [french rejoir: related to *joy]

Passable  adj. 1 barely satisfactory; adequate. 2 (of a road, pass, etc.) That can be traversed.  passably adv.

Copperhead  n. Venomous n. American or australian snake.

Action  n. 1 process of doing or acting (demanded action). 2 forcefulness or energy. 3 exertion of energy or influence (action of acid on metal). 4 deed, act (not aware of his actions). 5 (the action) a series of events in a story, play, etc. B slang exciting activity (missed the action). 6 battle, fighting (killed in action). 7 a mechanism of an instrument. B style of movement of an animal or human. 8 lawsuit.  out of action not working. [latin: related to *act]

Fidget  —v. (-t-) 1 move or act restlessly or nervously. 2 be or make uneasy. —n. 1 person who fidgets. 2 (usu. In pl.) Restless movements or mood.  fidgety adj. [obsolete or dial. Fidge twitch]

Cause  —n. 1 a thing that produces an effect. B person or thing that occasions or produces something. C reason or motive. 2 adequate reason (show cause). 3 principle, belief, or purpose. 4 a matter to be settled at law. B case offered at law (plead a cause). —v. (-sing) be the cause of, produce, make happen. [latin causa]

Twelve  adj. & n. 1 one more than eleven. 2 symbol for this (12, xii, xii). 3 size etc. Denoted by twelve. 4 twelve o'clock. 5 (the twelve) the apostles. [old english]

Reindeer  n. (pl. Same or -s) subarctic deer with large antlers. [old norse]

Warbler  n. Bird that warbles.

Prepossess  v. 1 (usu. In passive) (of an idea, feeling, etc.) Take possession of (a person). 2 a prejudice (usu. Favourably and spontaneously). B (as prepossessing adj.) Attractive, appealing.  prepossession n.

Annelid  n. Segmented worm, e.g. The earthworm. [latin anulus ring]

Germinate  v. (-ting) 1 sprout, bud, or develop. 2 cause to do this.  germination n. Germinative adj. [latin: related to *germ]

Coating  n. 1 layer of paint etc. 2 material for coats.

Operetta  n. 1 light opera. 2 one-act or short opera. [italian, diminutive of *opera1]

Delicate  adj. 1 a fine in texture, quality, etc.; slender, slight. B (of a colour, flavour, etc.) Subtle, hard to discern. 2 susceptible; weak, tender. 3 a requiring tact; tricky (delicate situation). B (of an instrument) highly sensitive. 4 deft (delicate touch). 5 modest. 6 (esp. Of actions) considerate.  delicately adv. [latin]

Ratiocinate  v. (-ting) literary reason, esp. Using syllogisms.  ratiocination n. [latin: related to *ratio]

Angular  adj. 1 having sharp corners or (of a person) features. 2 forming an angle. 3 measured by angle (angular distance).  angularity n. [latin: related to *angle1]

Dialectics  n. (treated as sing. Or pl.) = *dialectic n. 1.

Fridge  n. Colloq. = *refrigerator. [abbreviation]

Annulate  adj. Marked with or formed of rings.

Alarm  —n. 1 warning of danger etc. 2 a warning sound or device. B = *alarm clock. 3 apprehension (filled with alarm). —v. 1 frighten or disturb. 2 warn.  alarming adj. Alarmingly adv. [italian all'arme! To arms]

Wraf  abbr. Women's royal air force.

Jurist  n. Expert in law.  juristic adj.

Bumper  n. 1 horizontal bar at the front or back of a motor vehicle, reducing damage in a collision. 2 (usu. Attrib.) Unusually large or fine example (bumper crop). 3 cricket ball rising high after pitching. 4 brim-full glass.

Gyrocompass  n. Compass giving true north and bearings from it by means of a gyroscope.

Continuum  n. (pl. -nua) thing having a continuous structure. [latin: related to *continuous]

Espionage  n. Spying or use of spies. [french: related to *spy]

Fricassee  —n. Pieces of meat served in a thick sauce. —v. (fricassees, fricasseed) make a fricassee of. [french]

Sepulchre  (us sepulcher) —n. Tomb, esp. Cut in rock or built of stone or brick. —v. (-ring) 1 place in a sepulchre. 2 serve as a sepulchre for. [latin sepelio bury]

Spaghetti  n. Pasta in long thin strands. [italian]

Co  abbr. Commanding officer.

Epidemic  —n. Widespread occurrence of a disease in a community at a particular time. —adj. In the nature of an epidemic. [greek epi against, demos the people]

Graceless  adj. Lacking grace, elegance, or charm.

Broccoli  n. Brassica with greenish flower-heads. [italian]

Spaceman  n. (fem. Spacewoman) astronaut.

Ritualism  n. Regular or excessive practice of ritual.  ritualist n. Ritualistic adj. Ritualistically adv.

Loveable  var. Of *lovable.

Splutter  —v. 1 a speak, say, or express in a choking manner. B emit spitting sounds. 2 speak rapidly or incoherently. —n. Spluttering speech or sound. [from *sputter]

Prickle  —n. 1 small thorn. 2 hard-pointed spine of a hedgehog etc. 3 prickling sensation. —v. (-ling) affect or be affected with a sensation of multiple pricking. [old english]

Calcite  n. Natural crystalline calcium carbonate. [latin: related to *calx]

Skewer  —n. Long pin designed for holding meat together while cooking. —v. Fasten together or pierce (as) with a skewer. [origin uncertain]

Snowblower  n. Machine that clears snow by blowing.

Supercargo  n. (pl. -es) officer in a merchant ship managing sales etc. Of cargo. [spanish sobrecargo]

Laudable  adj. Commendable.  laudability n. Laudably adv.

Usage  laudable is sometimes confused with laudatory.

Perspire  v. (-ring) sweat. [latin spiro breathe]

Emplacement  n. 1 putting in position. 2 platform for guns. [french: related to *place]

Countryman  n. (fem. Countrywoman) 1 person living in a rural area. 2 (also fellow-countryman) person of one's own country.

Filibuster  —n. 1 obstruction of progress in a legislative assembly, esp. By prolonged speaking. 2 esp. Us person who engages in this. —v. Act as a filibuster (against).  filibusterer n. [dutch: related to *freebooter]

Rumba  n. 1 latin american ballroom dance orig. From cuba. 2 music for this. [american spanish]

Hygroscopic  adj. 1 of the hygroscope. 2 (of a substance) tending to absorb moisture from the air.

Election  n. 1 electing or being elected. 2 occasion of this.

Esplanade  n. 1 long open level area for walking on, esp. Beside the sea. 2 level space separating a fortress from a town. [latin planus level]

Farmhouse  n. House attached to a farm.

Telemetry  n. Process of recording the readings of an instrument and transmitting them by radio.  telemeter n.

Hazel  n. 1 hedgerow shrub bearing round brown edible nuts. 2 greenish-brown. [old english]

Olive  —n. 1 small oval hard-stoned fruit, green when unripe and bluish-black when ripe. 2 tree bearing this. 3 its wood. 4 olive green. —adj. 1 olive-green. 2 (of the complexion) yellowish-brown. [latin oliva from greek]

Nuance  n. Subtle shade of meaning, feeling, colour, etc. [latin nubes cloud]

Whiz  (also whizz) —n. Sound made by a body moving through the air at great speed. —v. (-zz-) move with or make a whiz. [imitative]

Aluminum  n. (brit. Aluminium) silvery light and malleable metallic element resistant to tarnishing by air.

Uplift  —v. 1 raise. 2 (esp. As uplifting adj.) Elevate morally or emotionally. —n. 1 colloq. Elevating influence. 2 support for the bust etc.

Rainproof  adj. Impervious to rain.

Absolute  —adj. 1 complete, utter (absolute bliss). 2 unconditional (absolute authority). 3 despotic (absolute monarch). 4 not relative or comparative (absolute standard). 5 gram. A (of a construction) syntactically independent of the rest of the sentence, as in dinner being over, we left the table. B (of an adjective or transitive verb) without an expressed noun or object (e.g. The deaf, guns kill). 6 (of a legal decree etc.) Final. —n. Philos. (prec. By the) that which can exist independently of anything else. [latin: related to *absolve]

Communication  n. 1 a communicating or being communicated. B information etc. Communicated. C letter, message, etc. 2 connection or means of access. 3 social dealings. 4 (in pl.) Science and practice of transmitting information.

Certify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 attest; attest to, esp. Formally. 2 declare by certificate. 3 officially declare insane. [latin certus]

Sw  abbr. 1 south-west. 2 south-western.

Salvo  n. (pl. -es or -s) 1 simultaneous discharge of guns etc. 2 round of applause. [italian salva]

Ipa  abbr. International phonetic alphabet.

Literate  —adj. Able to read and write; educated. —n. Literate person.

Contemporary  —adj. 1 living or occurring at the same time. 2 of approximately the same age. 3 modern in style or design. —n. (pl. -ies) contemporary person or thing. [medieval latin: related to *contemporaneous]

Mujahidin  n.pl. (also mujahedin, -deen) guerrilla fighters in islamic countries, esp. Muslim fundamentalists. [persian and arabic: related to *jihad]

Rightward  —adv. (also rightwards) towards the right. —adj. Going towards or facing the right.

Reuse  —v. (-sing) use again. —n. Second or further use.  reusable adj.

Undershot  adj. 1 (of a water-wheel) turned by water flowing under it. 2 (of a lower jaw) projecting beyond the upper jaw.

Conjunctivitis  n. Inflammation of the conjunctiva.

Payroll  n. List of employees receiving regular pay.

Kismet  n. Destiny, fate. [turkish from arabic]

Independent  —adj. 1 a (often foll. By of) not depending on authority or control. B self-governing. 2 a not depending on another person for one's opinions or livelihood. B (of income or resources) making it unnecessary to earn one's living. 3 unwilling to be under an obligation to others. 4 acting independently of any political party. 5 not depending on something else for its validity etc. (independent proof). 6 (of broadcasting, a school, etc.) Not supported by public funds. —n. Person who is politically independent.  independence n. Independently adv.

Uncontested  adj. Not contested.

Cf  symb. Californium.

Oven  n. Enclosed compartment for heating or cooking food etc. [old english]

Memoir  n. 1 historical account etc. Written from personal knowledge or special sources. 2 (in pl.) Autobiography, esp. Partial or dealing with specific events or people. 3 essay on a learned subject. [french mémoire: related to *memory]

Hafnium  n. Silvery lustrous metallic element. [latin hafnia copenhagen]

Mousse  n. 1 a dessert of whipped cream, eggs, etc., usu. Flavoured with fruit or chocolate. B meat or fish purée made with whipped cream etc. 2 foamy substance applied to the hair to enable styling. [french, = froth]

Scouse  colloq. —n. 1 liverpool dialect. 2 (also scouser) native of liverpool. —adj. Of liverpool. [from *lobscouse]

Convention  n. 1 a general agreement on social behaviour etc. By implicit majority consent. B a custom or customary practice. 2 conference of people with a common interest. 3 a formal agreement, esp. Between states. [latin: related to *convene]

Marjoram  n. Aromatic herb used in cookery. [french from medieval latin]

Purple  —n. 1 colour between red and blue. 2 (in full tyrian purple) crimson dye obtained from some molluscs. 3 purple robe, esp. Of an emperor or senior magistrate. 4 scarlet official dress of a cardinal. 5 (prec. By the) position of rank, authority, or privilege. —adj. Of a purple colour. —v. (-ling) make or become purple.  purplish adj. [greek porphura, a shellfish yielding dye]

Scilicet  adv. That is to say (used esp. In explanation of an ambiguity). [latin]

Cripple  —n. Permanently lame person. —v. (-ling) 1 make a cripple of; lame. 2 disable, weaken, or damage seriously (crippled by strikes). [old english]

Prepuce  n. 1 = *foreskin. 2 fold of skin surrounding the clitoris. [latin praeputium]

Obtrude  v. (-ding) 1 be or become obtrusive. 2 (often foll. By on, upon) thrust (oneself, a matter, etc.) Importunately forward.  obtrusion n. [latin obtrudo thrust against]

Commence  v. (-cing) formal begin. [latin: related to *com-, *initiate]

Notwithstanding  —prep. In spite of; without prevention by. —adv. Nevertheless. [from *not, *withstand]

Sphinx  n. 1 (sphinx) (in greek mythology) winged monster with a woman's head and a lion's body, whose riddle oedipus guessed. 2 antiq. A ancient egyptian stone figure with a lion's body and a human or animal head.

Triumph  —n. 1 a state of victory or success (returned in triumph). B a great success or achievement. 2 supreme example (a triumph of engineering). 3 joy at success; exultation (triumph in her face). 4 processional entry of a victorious general into ancient rome. —v. 1 (often foll. By over) gain a victory; be successful. 2 (of an ancient roman general) ride in triumph. 3 (often foll. By over) exult.  triumphal adj. [french from latin]

Usage  triumphal, meaning ‘of or used in celebrating a triumph’ as in triumphal arch should not be confused with triumphant meaning ‘victorious’ or ‘exultant’.

Inconvenience  —n. 1 lack of ease or comfort; trouble. 2 cause or instance of this. —v. (-cing) cause inconvenience to.

Arrowhead  n. 1 pointed tip of an arrow. 2 water-plant with arrow-shaped leaves.

Bistre  n. (us bister) brownish pigment from wood soot. [french]

Too  adv. 1 to a greater extent than is desirable or permissible (too large). 2 colloq. Very (not too sure). 3 in addition (i'm coming too). 4 moreover (food was bad, and expensive too).  none too rather less than (feeling none too good). Too bad see *bad. Too much intolerable. Too much for 1 more than a match for. 2 beyond what is endurable by. Too right see *right. [stressed form of *to]

Fencing  n. 1 set of, or material for, fences. 2 sword-fighting, esp. As a sport.

Plastic  —n. 1 synthetic resinous substance that can be given any shape. 2 (in full plastic money) colloq. Credit card(s). —adj. 1 made of plastic. 2 capable of being moulded; pliant, supple. 3 giving form to clay, wax, etc.  plasticity n. Plasticize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). Plasticizer n. (also -iser). Plasticky adj. [greek: related to *plasma]

Leukemia  n. (brit. Leukaemia) malignant disease in which the bone-marrow etc. Produces too many leucocytes. [greek leukos white, haima blood]

Exhume  v. (-ming) dig up (esp. A buried corpse).  exhumation n. [latin humus ground]

Special  —adj. 1 a exceptional. B peculiar; specific. 2 for a particular purpose. 3 for children with special needs (special school). —n. Special constable, train, edition of a newspaper, dish on a menu, etc.  specially adv. Specialness n. [latin: related to *species]

Atomizer  n. (also -iser) = *aerosol 1.

Wigeon  var. Of *widgeon.

Xerox  —n. Propr. 1 machine for copying by xerography. 2 copy thus made. —v. (xerox) reproduce by this process.

Seeing  conj. (usu. Foll. By that) considering that, inasmuch as, because.

Nippy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. 1 quick, nimble. 2 chilly. [from *nip1]

Physicist  n. Person skilled in physics.

Muscovite  —n. Native or citizen of moscow. —adj. Of moscow. [from muscovy, principality of moscow]

Shorty  n. (also shortie) (pl. -ies) colloq. Person or garment shorter than average.

Entire  adj. 1 whole, complete. 2 unbroken. 3 unqualified, absolute. 4 in one piece; continuous. [latin: related to *integer]

Geology  n. 1 science of the earth's crust, strata, origin of its rocks, etc. 2 geological features of a district.  geological adj. Geologically adv. Geologist n.

Esquire  n. 1 (usu. As abbr. Esq.) Title added to a man's surname when no other title is used, esp. As a form of address for letters. 2 archaic = *squire. [french from latin scutum shield]

Stateroom  n. 1 state apartment. 2 large private cabin in a passenger ship.

Flippant  adj. Frivolous; disrespectful; offhand.  flippancy n. Flippantly adv. [from *flip1]

Savour  (us savor) —n. 1 characteristic taste, flavour, etc. 2 hint of a different quality etc. In something. —v. 1 appreciate and enjoy (food, an experience, etc.). 2 (foll. By of) imply or suggest (a specified quality). [latin sapor]

Asset  n. 1 useful or valuable person or thing. 2 (usu. In pl.) Property and possessions, esp. That can be set against debts etc. [french asez from latin ad satis to enough]

Cubical  adj. Cube-shaped.

Analgesic  —adj. Relieving pain. —n. Analgesic drug.

Pug  n. (in full pug-dog) dog of a dwarf breed with a broad flat nose and wrinkled face. [origin unknown]

Mattress  n. Stuffed, or air- or water-filled cushion the size of a bed. [arabic almatrah]

Assemblage  n. 1 assembling. 2 assembled group.

Ostentation  n. 1 pretentious display of wealth etc. 2 showing off.  ostentatious adj. Ostentatiously adv.

Athirst  predic. Adj. Poet. 1 (usu. Foll. By for) eager. 2 thirsty.

Downright  —adj. 1 plain, straightforward. 2 utter (downright nonsense). —adv. Thoroughly (downright rude).

Sn  symb. Tin. [latin tannun]

Keepsake  n. Souvenir, esp. Of a person.

-phobe  comb. Form forming nouns denoting a person with a specified fear or aversion (xenophobe). [greek phobos fear]

Ample  adj. (ampler, amplest) 1 a plentiful, abundant, extensive. B euphem. Large, stout. 2 more than enough.  amply adv. [latin amplus]

Rood  n. 1 crucifix, esp. One raised on a rood-screen. 2 quarter of an acre. [old english]

Rigid  adj. 1 not flexible; unbendable. 2 (of a person, conduct, etc.) Inflexible, unbending, harsh.  rigidity n. Rigidly adv. Rigidness n. [latin rigidus from rigeo be stiff]

Wit  n. 1 (in sing. Or pl.) Intelligence; quick understanding. 2 a unexpected combining or contrasting of ideas or expressions. B power of giving pleasure by this. 3 person possessing such power.  at one's wit's (or wits') end utterly at a loss or in despair. Have (or keep) one's wits about one be alert. Live by one's wits live by ingenious or crafty expedients, without a settled occupation. Out of one's wits mad. To wit that is to say, namely. [old english]

Repossess  v. Regain possession of (esp. Goods on which payment is in arrears).  repossession n.

Fm  abbr. 1 field marshal. 2 frequency modulation.

Medieval  adj. (also mediaeval) 1 of the middle ages. 2 colloq. Old-fashioned. [latin medium aevum middle age]

Critic  n. 1 person who criticizes. 2 person who reviews literary, artistic, etc. Works. [latin criticus from greek krites judge]

Votive  adj. Offered or consecrated in fulfilment of a vow (votive offering). [latin: related to *vote]

Enthusiast  n. Person full of enthusiasm. [church latin: related to *enthusiasm]

Trimaran  n. Vessel like a catamaran, with three hulls side by side. [from *catamaran]

-cy  suffix denoting state, condition, or status (idiocy; captaincy). [latin -cia, greek -kia]

Rad  n. Unit of absorbed dose of ionizing radiation. [from radiation absorbed dose]

Bookcase  n. Cabinet of shelves for books.

Garnet  n. Glassy silicate mineral, esp. A red kind used as a gem. [medieval latin granatum *pomegranate]

Whisk  —v. 1 (foll. By away, off) a brush with a sweeping movement. B take suddenly. 2 whip (cream, eggs, etc.). 3 convey or go (esp. Out of sight) lightly or quickly. 4 wave or lightly brandish. —n. 1 whisking action or motion. 2 utensil for whisking eggs or cream etc. 3 bunch of grass, twigs, bristles, etc., for removing dust or flies. [scandinavian]

Dubbin  n. (also dubbing) thick grease for softening and waterproofing leather. [see *dub1 3]

Yack  slang —n. Trivial or unduly persistent conversation. —v. Engage in this. [imitative]

Skilful  adj. (us skillful) (often foll. By at, in) having or showing skill.  skilfully adv.

Crinoline  n. 1 hist. Stiffened or hooped petticoat. 2 stiff fabric of horsehair etc. Used for linings, hats, etc. [french from latin crinis hair, linum thread]

Turki  —adj. Of a group of languages and peoples including turkish. —n. This group.  turkic adj. [persian: related to *turk]

Contraction  n. 1 contracting or being contracted. 2 med. Shortening of the uterine muscles during childbirth. 3 shrinking, diminution. 4 shortened form of a word or words (e.g. He's).

Crispy  adj. (-ier, -iest) crisp.  crispiness n.

Annals  n.pl. 1 narrative of events year by year. 2 historical records.  annalist n. [latin annus year]

Lawgiver  n. Person who formulates laws; legislator.

Flavor  (brit. Flavour) —n. 1 mingled sensation of smell and taste (cheesy flavour). 2 characteristic quality (romantic flavour). 3 (usu. Foll. By of) slight admixture (flavour of failure). —v. Give flavour to; season.  flavourless adj. Flavoursome adj. [french]

Loan  —n. 1 thing lent, esp. A sum of money. 2 lending or being lent. —v. Lend (money, works of art, etc.).  on loan being lent. [old english]

Tutti  mus. —adj. & adv. With all voices or instruments together. —n. (pl. -s) such a passage. [italian, pl. Of tutto all]

Instrumentation  n. 1 a provision or use of instruments. B instruments collectively. 2 a arrangement of music for instruments. B the particular instruments used in a piece.

Orienteering  n. Competitive sport in which runners cross open country with a map, compass, etc. [swedish]

Lovesick  adj. Languishing with love.

Digest  —v. 1 assimilate (food) in the stomach and bowels. 2 understand and assimilate mentally. 3 summarize. —n. 1 periodical synopsis of current literature or news. 2 methodical summary, esp. Of laws.  digestible adj. [latin digero -gest-]

Pyrexia  n. Med. = *fever. [greek purexis]

Coroner  n. Official holding inquests on deaths thought to be violent or accidental. [anglo-french: related to *crown]

Tome  n. Heavy book or volume. [greek temno cut]

Knapsack  n. Soldier's or hiker's usu. Canvas bag carried on the back. [german knappen bite, *sack1]

Jeans  n.pl. Casual esp. Denim trousers. [earlier geane fustian, = material from genoa]

Infix  v. Fasten or fix in.

Marriageable  adj. Free, ready, or fit for marriage.  marriageability n.

Brighten  v. Make or become brighter.

Bureau  n. (pl. -x or -s) 1 a desk with drawers and usu. An angled hinged top. B us chest of drawers. 2 a office or department for specific business. B government department. [french, originally = baize]

Bluestocking  n. Usu. Derog. Intellectual or literary woman. [18th-c. Blue stocking society]

Showgirl  n. Female singer and dancer in musicals, variety shows, etc.

Antibody  n. (pl. -ies) a blood protein produced in response to and then counteracting antigens. [translation of german antikörper]

Cultivar  n. Plant variety produced by cultivation. [from *cultivate, *variety]

Lave  v. (-ving) literary 1 wash, bathe. 2 (of water) wash against; flow along. [latin lavo wash]

Barnyard  n. Area around a barn.

Yardstick  n. 1 standard of comparison. 2 measuring rod a yard long, usu. Divided into inches etc.

Ocher  n. (brit. Ochre) 1 earth used as yellow, brown, or red pigment. 2 pale brownish-yellow colour.  ochreous adj. [greek okhra]

Pun  —n. Humorous use of a word or words with two or more meanings; play on words. —v. (-nn-) (foll. By on; also absol.) Make a pun or puns with (words). [origin unknown]

Fibrositis  n. Rheumatic inflammation of fibrous tissue. [from *fibre, *-itis]

Prudential  adj. Of or showing prudence.  prudentially adv.

Sa  abbr. 1 salvation army. 2 south africa. 3 south australia.

Replay  —v. Play (a match, recording, etc.) Again. —n. Replaying of a match, recorded incident in a game, etc.

Willy  n. (also willie) (pl. -ies) colloq. Penis. [diminutive of william]

Eggcup  n. Cup for holding a boiled egg.

Prosaic  adj. 1 like prose, lacking poetic beauty. 2 unromantic; dull; commonplace.  prosaically adv. [latin: related to *prose]

Minefield  n. 1 area planted with explosive mines. 2 colloq. Hazardous subject or situation.

Dictate  —v. (-ting) 1 say or read aloud (material to be written down or recorded). 2 state or order authoritatively or peremptorily. —n. (usu. In pl.) Authoritative instruction or requirement (dictates of conscience, fashion).  dictation n. [latin dicto from dico say]

Coalition  n. 1 temporary alliance, esp. Of political parties. 2 fusion into one whole. [medieval latin: related to *coalesce]

Numismatic  adj. Of or relating to coins or medals. [greek nomisma coin]

Fr  symb. Francium.

Granulate  v. (-ting) 1 form into grains. 2 roughen the surface of.  granulation n.

Pinpoint  —n. 1 point of a pin. 2 something very small or sharp. 3 (attrib.) Precise, accurate. —v. Locate with precision.

Styptic  —adj. Checking bleeding. —n. Styptic substance. [greek stupho contract]

Cabriolet  n. 1 car with a folding top. 2 light two-wheeled one-horse carriage with a hood. [french: related to *capriole]

Negroid  —adj. (of physical features etc.) Characteristic of black people. —n. Black.

Bilingual  —adj. 1 able to speak two languages. 2 spoken or written in two languages. —n. Bilingual person.  bilingualism n. [latin lingua tongue]

Chablis  n. (pl. Same) very dry white wine from chablis in e. France.

Hashish  n. Resinous product of hemp, smoked or chewed as a narcotic. [arabic]

Starve  v. (-ving) 1 (cause to) die of hunger or suffer from malnourishment. 2 colloq. Feel very hungry (i'm starving). 3 a suffer from mental or spiritual want. B (foll. By for) feel a strong craving for. 4 (foll. By of) deprive of. 5 compel by starving (starved into surrender).  starvation n. [old english, = die]

Macula  n. (pl. -lae) dark, esp. Permanent, spot in the skin.  maculation n. [latin, = spot, mesh]

Repast  n. Formal 1 meal. 2 food and drink for this. [latin repasco -past- feed]

Strangle  v. (-ling) 1 squeeze the windpipe or neck of, esp. So as to kill. 2 hamper, suppress.  strangler n. [latin strangulo]

Histrionic  —adj. (of behaviour) theatrical, dramatic. —n. (in pl.) Insincere and dramatic behaviour designed to impress. [latin histrio actor]

Malaise  n. 1 general bodily discomfort or lassitude. 2 feeling of unease or demoralization. [french: related to *ease]

Gutless  adj. Colloq. Lacking courage or energy.

Methought  past of *methinks.

Supergrass  n. Colloq. Police informer implicating many people.

Bine  n. 1 twisting stem of a climbing plant, esp. The hop. 2 flexible shoot. [dial. Form of *bind]

Myrtle  n. Evergreen shrub with shiny leaves and white scented flowers. [greek murtos]

Delphinium  n. (pl. -s) garden plant with tall spikes of usu. Blue flowers. [greek: related to *dolphin]

Naphtha  n. Inflammable hydrocarbon distilled from coal etc. [latin from greek]

Trencherman  n. Person who eats well, or in a specified manner.

Venereal  adj. 1 of sexual desire or intercourse. 2 of venereal disease. [latin venus veneris sexual love]

Carbonaceous  adj. 1 consisting of or containing carbon. 2 of or like coal or charcoal.

Normal  —adj. 1 conforming to a standard; regular, usual, typical. 2 free from mental or emotional disorder. 3 geom. (of a line) at right angles, perpendicular. —n. 1 a normal value of a temperature etc. B usual state, level, etc. 2  line at right angles.  normalcy n. Esp. Us. Normality n. [latin normalis: related to *norm]

Culture  —n. 1 a intellectual and artistic achievement or expression (city lacking in culture). B refined appreciation of the arts etc. (person of culture). 2 customs, achievements, etc. Of a particular civilization or group (chinese culture). 3 improvement by mental or physical training. 4 cultivation of plants; rearing of bees etc. 5 quantity of micro-organisms and nutrient material supporting their growth. —v. (-ring) maintain (bacteria etc.) In suitable growth conditions. [latin: related to *cultivate] 

Carnation  —n. 1 clove-scented pink. 2 rosy-pink colour. —adj. Rosy-pink. [italian: related to *carnal because of the flesh-colour]

Corny  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. 1 banal. 2 feebly humorous. 3 sentimental.  cornily adv. Corniness n. [from *corn1]

Trading  n. Act of engaging in trade.

Shallow  —adj. 1 of little depth. 2 superficial, trivial. —n. (often in pl.) Shallow place.  shallowness n. [old english]

Clangour  n. (us clangor) prolonged clanging.  clangorous adj.

Latchkey  n. (pl. -s) key of an outer door.

Dauphin  n. Hist. Eldest son of the king of france. [french from latin delphinus *dolphin, as a family name]

Protection  n. 1 a protecting or being protected; defence. B thing, person, or animal that protects. 2 (also protectionism) theory or practice of protecting home industries. 3 colloq. A immunity from violence etc. Obtained by payment to gangsters etc. B (in full protection money) money so paid.  protectionist n. & adj.

Tipper  n. (often attrib.) Road haulage vehicle that tips at the back to discharge its load.

Comity  n. (pl. -ies) formal 1 courtesy, friendship. 2 a association of nations etc. B (in full comity of nations) mutual recognition by nations of the laws and customs of others. [latin comis courteous]

Postprandial  adj. Formal or joc. After dinner or lunch. [latin prandium a meal]

Encyclical  —adj. For wide circulation. —n. Papal encyclical letter. [greek: related to *cycle]

Wherefore  —adv. Archaic 1 for what reason? 2 for which reason. —n. See *why.

Changeling  n. Child believed to be substituted for another.

Horror  —n. 1 painful feeling of loathing and fear. 2 a (often foll. By of) intense dislike. B (often foll. By at) colloq. Intense dismay. 3 a person or thing causing horror. B colloq. Bad or mischievous person etc. 4 (in pl.; prec. By the) fit of depression, nervousness, etc. —attrib. Adj. (of films etc.) Designed to interest by arousing feelings of horror.

Relativity  n. 1 being relative. 2 physics a (special theory of relativity) theory based on the principle that all motion is relative and that light has a constant velocity. B (general theory of relativity) theory extending this to gravitation and accelerated motion.

Incunabulum  n. (pl. -la) 1 early printed book, esp. From before 1501. 2 (in pl.) Early stages of a thing. [latin, (in pl.) = swaddling-clothes]

Shellac  —n. Resin used for making varnish. —v. (-ck-) varnish with shellac. [from *shell, *lac]

Flashy  adj. (-ier, -iest) showy; gaudy; cheaply attractive.  flashily adv. Flashiness n.

Askance  adv. Sideways or squinting.  look askance at regard suspiciously. [origin unknown]

Praseodymium  n.  Soft silvery metallic element of the lanthanide series. [greek prasios green]

Boule  n. (also boules pronunc. Same) french form of bowls played on rough ground. [french]

Cobber  n. Austral. & nz colloq. Companion, friend. [origin uncertain]

Freeman  n. 1 person who has the freedom of a city etc. 2 person who is not a slave or serf.

Give  —v. (-ving; past gave; past part. Given) 1 transfer the possession of freely; hand over as a present; donate. 2 a transfer temporarily; provide with (gave him the dog to hold; gave her a new hip). B administer (medicine). C deliver (a message). 3 (usu. Foll. By for) make over in exchange or payment. 4 a confer; grant (a benefit, honour, etc.). B accord; bestow (love, time, etc.). C pledge (gave his word). 5 a perform (an action etc.) (gave a jump; gave a performance; gave an interview). B utter; declare (gave a shriek; gave the batsman out). 6 (in passive; foll. By to) be inclined to or fond of (is given to boasting; is given to strong drink). 7 yield to pressure; collapse. 8 yield as a product or result (gives an average of 7). 9 a consign, put (gave him into custody). B sanction the marriage of (a daughter etc.). 10 devote; dedicate (gave his life to the cause). 11 present; offer; show; hold out (gives no sign of life; gave her his arm; give me an example). 12 impart; be a source of; cause (gave me a cold; gave me trouble; gave much pain). 13 concede (i give you the benefit of the doubt). 14 deliver (a judgement etc.) Authoritatively. 15 provide (a party, meal, etc.) As host. 16 (in past part.) Assume or grant or specify (given the circumstances; in a given situation; given that we earn so little). 17 (absol.) Colloq. Tell what one knows. —n. Capacity to yield or comply; elasticity.  give and take 1 exchange of words, ideas, blows, etc. 2 ability to compromise. Give away 1 transfer as a gift. 2 hand over (a bride) to a bridegroom. 3 reveal (a secret etc.). Give the game (or show) away reveal a secret or intention. Give in 1 yield; acknowledge defeat. 2 hand in (a document etc.) To an official etc. Give it to a person colloq. Scold or punish. Give me i prefer (give me greece any day). Give off emit (fumes etc.). Give oneself up to 1 abandon oneself to (despair etc.). 2 addict oneself to. Give on to (or into) (of a window, corridor, etc.) Overlook or lead into. Give or take colloq. Accepting as a margin of error in estimating. Give out 1 announce; emit; distribute. 2 be exhausted. 3 run short. Give over 1 colloq. Stop or desist. 2 hand over. 3 devote. Give rise to cause. Give a person to understand inform or assure. Give up 1 resign; surrender. 2 part with.

Influx  n. Flowing in, esp. Of people or things into a place. [latin: related to *flux]

Loadstone  var. Of *lodestone.

Deliberation  n. 1 careful consideration; discussion. 2 careful slowness.

Embed  v. (also imbed) (-dd-) (esp. As embedded adj.) Fix firmly in a surrounding mass.

Anklet  n. Ornament or fetter worn round the ankle.

Undermentioned  adj. Mentioned later in a book etc.

Conversational  adj. 1 of or in conversation. 2 colloquial.  conversationally adv.

Hades  n. (in greek mythology) the underworld. [greek, originally a name of pluto]

Sealskin  n. 1 skin or prepared fur of a seal. 2 (often attrib.) Garment made from this.

Trustful  adj. Full of trust or confidence.  trustfully adv.

Transparent  adj. 1 allowing light to pass through so that bodies can be distinctly seen. 2 a (of a disguise, pretext, etc.) Easily seen through. B (of a quality etc.) Evident; obvious. 3 easily understood; frank.  transparently adv. [latin pareo appear] 

Puppet  n. 1 small figure moved esp. By strings as entertainment. 2 person controlled by another.  puppetry n. [var. Of *poppet]

Forefoot  n. Front foot of an animal.

Expensive  adj. Costing or charging much.  expensively adv. Expensiveness n.

Adipose  adj. Of fat; fatty (adipose tissue).  adiposity n. [latin adeps fat]

Naff  adj. Slang 1 unfashionable. 2 rubbishy. [origin unknown]

Festschrift  n. (also festschrift) (pl. -en or -s) collection of writings published in honour of a scholar. [german, = festival-writing]

Telethon  n. Exceptionally long television programme, esp. To raise money for charity. [from *tele-, *marathon]

Diesel  n. 1 (in full diesel engine) internal-combustion engine in which heat produced by the compression of air in the cylinder ignites the fuel. 2 vehicle driven by a diesel engine. 3 fuel for a diesel engine. [diesel, name of an engineer]

Candlewick  n. 1 thick soft cotton yarn. 2 tufted material from this.

Laodicean  half-hearted, esp. In religion or politics. [laodicea in asia minor (rev. 3:16)]

Hemp  n. 1 (in full indian hemp) asian herbaceous plant. 2 its fibre used to make rope and stout fabrics. 3 narcotic drug made from the hemp plant. [old english]

Silviculture  n. (also sylviculture) cultivation of forest trees. [latin silva a wood: related to *culture]

Discipline  —n. 1 a control or order exercised over people or animals, e.g. Over members of an organization. B system of rules for this. 2 training or way of life aimed at self-control and conformity. 3 branch of learning. 4 punishment. —v. (-ning) 1 punish. 2 control by training in obedience. [latin disciplina from disco learn]

Regarding  prep. About, concerning; in respect of.

Muck  —n. 1 colloq. Dirt or filth; anything disgusting. 2 farmyard manure. 3 colloq. Mess. —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By up) colloq. A bungle (a job). B make dirty or untidy. 2 (foll. By out) remove manure from.  make a muck of colloq. Bungle. Muck about (or around) colloq. 1 potter or fool about. 2 (foll. By with) fool or interfere with. Muck in (often foll. By with) colloq. Share tasks etc. Equally. [scandinavian]

Kauri  n. (pl. -s) coniferous new zealand tree yielding timber and resin. [maori]

Requisite  —adj. Required by circumstances; necessary to success etc. —n. (often foll. By for) thing needed (for some purpose). [latin: related to *require]

Pock  n. (also pock-mark) small pus-filled spot on the skin, esp. Caused by chickenpox or smallpox.  pock-marked adj. [old english]

Millennium  n. (pl. -s or millennia) 1 period of 1,000 years, esp. That of christ's prophesied reign on earth (rev. 20:1–5). 2 (esp. Future) period of happiness and prosperity.  millennial adj. [latin mille thousand]

Cyrillic  —adj. Of the alphabet used by the slavonic peoples of the orthodox church, now used esp. For russian and bulgarian. —n. This alphabet. [st cyril, d. 869]

Ursine  adj. Of or like a bear. [latin ursus bear]

Boxy  adj. (-ier, -iest) cramped.

Ridicule  —n. Derision, mockery. —v. (-ling) make fun of; mock; laugh at. [latin rideo laugh]

Ungird  v. Release the girdle, belt, etc. Of.

Spokesman  n. (fem. Spokeswoman) person speaking for a group etc. [from *spoke2]

Sulfuric  adj. (brit. Sulphuric) chem. Containing sulphur with a valency of six.

Polemic  —n. 1 forceful verbal or written controversy or argument. 2 (in pl.) Art or practice of controversial discussion. —adj. (also polemical) involving dispute; controversial.   polemicist n. [greek polemos war]

Muscat  n. 1 sweet usu. Fortified white wine made from musk-flavoured grapes. 2 this grape. [provençal: related to *musk]

Terminal  —adj. 1 a (of a condition or disease) fatal. B (of a patient) dying. 2 of or forming a limit or terminus (terminal station). —n. 1 terminating thing; extremity. 2 terminus for trains or long-distance buses. 3 = *air terminal.

Trombone  n. Brass wind instrument with a sliding tube.  trombonist n. [french or italian tromba *trumpet]

Stretcher  n. 1 two poles with canvas etc. Between, for carrying a person in a lying position. 2 brick etc. Laid along the face of a wall.

Calabash  n. 1 gourd-bearing tree of tropical america. 2 such a gourd, esp. As a vessel for water, etc. [french from spanish]

Prophecy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a prophetic utterance, esp. Biblical. B prediction of future events. 2 faculty, practice, etc. Of prophesying (gift of prophecy). [greek: related to *prophet]

Guildhall  n. Meeting-place of a medieval guild; town hall.

Unleaded  adj. (of petrol etc.) Without added lead.

Hireling  n. Usu. Derog. Person who works (only) for money.

Extent  n. 1 space over which a thing extends. 2 range, scope, degree. [anglo-french: related to *extend]

Unpublished  adj. Not published.

Dentine  n. (us dentin) hard dense tissue forming the bulk of a tooth.

Copt  n. 1 native egyptian in the hellenistic and roman periods. 2 native christian of the independent egyptian church. [french from arabic]

Conjoin  v. Formal join, combine.

Philately  n. The study and collecting of postage stamps.  philatelist n. [greek ateles tax-free]

Overcook  v. Cook too much or for too long.

Fissile  adj. 1 capable of undergoing nuclear fission. 2 tending to split. [latin: related to *fissure]

Folder  n. Folding cover or holder for loose papers.

Liberal  —adj. 1 abundant, ample. 2 giving freely, generous. 3 open-minded. 4 not strict or rigorous. 5 for the general broadening of the mind (liberal studies). 6 a favouring moderate political and social reform. B (liberal) of or characteristic of liberals. —n. 1 person of liberal views. 2 (liberal) supporter or member of a liberal party.  liberalism n. Liberality n. Liberally adv. [latin liber free]

Usage  in the uk the name liberal was discontinued in official political use in 1988 when the party regrouped to form the social and liberal democrats. In 1989 this name was officially replaced by liberal democratic party.

Usage  see note at liberal.

Umbrella  n. 1 collapsible cloth canopy on a central stick, used against rain, strong sun, etc. 2 protection, patronage. 3 (often attrib.) Coordinating agency (umbrella organization). [italian diminutive: related to *umbra]

Incommensurable  adj. (often foll. By with) 1 not commensurable. 2 having no common factor, integral or fractional.  incommensurability n.

Fought  past and past part. Of *fight.

Progeny  n. 1 offspring; descendant(s). 2 outcome, issue. [latin: related to *progenitor]

Muffin  n. 1 light flat round spongy cake, eaten toasted and buttered. 2 us similar round cake made from batter or dough. [origin unknown]

Sackcloth  n. 1 coarse fabric of flax or hemp used for sacks. 2 clothing for penance or mourning (esp. Sackcloth and ashes).

Greave  n. (usu. In pl.) Armour for the shin. [french, = shin]

Headland  n. Promontory.

Compliment  —n. 1 a polite expression of praise. B act implying praise. 2 (in pl.) A formal greetings accompanying a present etc. B praise. —v. (often foll. By on) congratulate; praise. [latin: related to *complement]

Hemi-  comb. Form half. [greek, = latin semi-]

Provincial  —adj. 1 of a province or provinces. 2 unsophisticated or uncultured. —n. 1 inhabitant of a province or the provinces. 2 unsophisticated or uncultured person.  provincialism n.

Stubby  adj. (-ier, -est) short and thick.

Nervous  adj. 1 easily upset, timid, highly strung. 2 anxious. 3 affecting the nerves. 4 (foll. By of + verbal noun) afraid (am nervous of meeting them).  nervously adv. Nervousness n.

Deviate  v. (-ting) (often foll. By from) turn aside or diverge (from a course of action, rule, etc.).  deviation n. [latin via way]

Vulgarian  n. Vulgar (esp. Rich) person.

Denote  v. (-ting) 1 (often foll. By that) be a sign of; indicate; mean. 2 stand as a name for; signify.  denotation n. [latin: related to *note]

Hawser  n. Thick rope or cable for mooring or towing a ship. [french, haucier hoist, from latin altus high]

Rutherfordium  n. Artificial metallic element. [rutherford, name of a physicist]

Constitute  v. (-ting) 1 be the components or essence of; compose. 2 a amount to (this constitutes a warning). B formally establish (constitutes a precedent). 3 give legal or constitutional form to. [latin constituo establish]

Innumerate  adj. Having no knowledge of basic mathematics.  innumeracy n.

Nautilus  n. (pl. Nautiluses or nautili) cephalopod mollusc with a spiral shell, esp. (pearly nautilus) one having a chambered shell. [greek nautilos: related to *nautical]

Potassium  n. Soft silver-white metallic element. [from *potash]

Binnacle  n. Case for a ship's compass. [latin habitaculum dwelling]

Argumentation  n. Methodical reasoning; arguing.

Bourgeois  often derog. —adj. 1 a conventionally middle-class. B materialistic. 2 capitalist. —n. (pl. Same) bourgeois person. [french]

Cdt  abbr. Craft, design, and technology.

Parliamentary  adj. 1 of a parliament. 2 enacted or established by a parliament. 3 (of language, behaviour, etc.) Polite.

Vivace  adv. Mus. In a lively manner. [latin: related to *vivacious]

Example  n. 1 thing characteristic of its kind or illustrating a general rule. 2 person, thing, or piece of conduct, in terms of its fitness to be imitated. 3 circumstance or treatment seen as a warning to others. 4 problem or exercise designed to illustrate a rule.  for example by way of illustration. [latin exemplum: related to *exempt]

Ladyship  n.  her (or your) ladyship respectful form of reference or address to a lady.

Wonted  attrib. Adj. Habitual, usual.

Lice  pl. Of *louse.

Sympathetic  adj. 1 of or expressing sympathy. 2 pleasant, likeable. 3 (foll. By to) favouring (a proposal etc.).  sympathetically adv.

Unseasonable  adj. 1 not seasonable. 2 untimely, inopportune.  unseasonably adv.

Mannerly  adj. Well-mannered, polite.

Willing  adj. 1 ready to consent or undertake. 2 given or done etc. By a willing person.  willingly adv. Willingness n.

Sse  abbr. South-south-east.

Disperse  v. (-sing) 1 go, send, drive, or scatter widely or in different directions. 2 send to or station at different points. 3 disseminate. 4 chem. Distribute (small particles) in a medium. 5 divide (white light) into its coloured constituents.  dispersal n. Dispersive adj. [latin: related to *dis-, *sparse]

Patrol  —n. 1 act of walking or travelling around an area, esp. Regularly, for security or supervision. 2 guards, police, etc. Sent out on patrol. 3 a troops sent out to reconnoitre. B such reconnaissance. 4 unit of six to eight scouts or guides. —v. (-ll-) 1 carry out a patrol of. 2 act as a patrol. [german patrolle from french]

Lunch  —n. Midday meal. —v. 1 take lunch. 2 entertain to lunch. [shortening of *luncheon]

Muffle  v. (-ling) 1 (often foll. By up) wrap or cover for warmth, or to deaden sound. 2 (usu. As muffled adj.) Stifle (an utterance). [perhaps french moufle thick glove, *muff1]

Tempera  n. 1 method of painting using an emulsion, e.g. Of pigment with egg-yolk and water, esp. On canvas. 2 this emulsion. [italian]

Involuted  adj. Complicated, abstruse.

Undistinguished  adj. Not distinguished; mediocre.

Posh  colloq. —adj. Smart; upper-class. —adv. In an upper-class way (talk posh).  posh up smarten up.  poshly adv. Poshness n. [perhaps from slang posh a dandy, money]

Ambit  n. Scope, extent, or bounds. [latin: related to *ambience]

Floaty  adj. (esp. Of fabric) light and airy. [from *float]

Pursuance  n. (foll. By of) carrying out or observance (of a plan, idea, etc.).

Woodbine  n. Honeysuckle.

Midden  n. 1 dunghill. 2 refuse heap. [scandinavian: related to *muck]

Anticlerical  adj. Opposed to clerical influence, esp. In politics.

Wreak  v. 1 (usu. Foll. By upon) give play to (vengeance or one's anger etc.). 2 cause (damage etc.) (wreak havoc). [old english, = avenge]

Everyone  pron. Everybody.

Ectomorph  n. Person with a lean body. [greek morphe form]

Dancehall  n. Public hall for dancing.

Flexion  n. (us flection) 1 bending or being bent, esp. Of a limb or joint. 2 bent part; curve. [latin flexio: related to *flex1]

Passenger  n. 1 (often attrib.) Traveller in or on a vehicle (other than the driver, pilot, crew, etc.) (passenger seat). 2 colloq. Idle member of a team, crew, etc. [french passager: related to *passage]

Indeed  —adv. 1 in truth; really. 2 admittedly. —int. Expressing irony, incredulity, etc.

Bleak  adj. 1 exposed, windswept. 2 dreary, grim. [old norse]

Vizor  var. Of *visor.

Hum  —v. (-mm-) 1 make a low steady continuous sound like a bee. 2 sing with closed lips. 3 utter a slight inarticulate sound. 4 colloq. Be active (really made things hum). 5 colloq. Smell unpleasantly. —n. 1 humming sound. 2 colloq. Bad smell.  hum and haw (or ha) hesitate; be indecisive. [imitative]

Ullage  n. 1 amount by which a cask etc. Falls short of being full. 2 loss by evaporation or leakage. [french from latin]

Cheddar  n. A kind of firm smooth cheese. [cheddar in somerset]

Gangue  n. Valueless earth etc. In which ore is found. [german: related to *gang]

Representative  —adj. 1 typical of a class. 2 containing typical specimens of all or many classes (representative sample). 3 a consisting of elected deputies etc. B based on representation by these (representative government). 4 (foll. By of) serving as a portrayal or symbol of. —n. 1 (foll. By of) sample, specimen, or typical embodiment of. 2 a agent of a person or society. B commercial traveller. 3 delegate; substitute. 4 deputy etc. In a representative assembly. [french or medieval latin: related to *represent1]

Immunodeficiency  n. Reduction in normal immune defences.

Pillion  n. Seating for a passenger behind a motor cyclist.  ride pillion travel seated behind a motor cyclist. [gaelic pillean small cushion]

Sire  —n. 1 male parent of an animal, esp. A stallion. 2 archaic form of address to a king. 3 archaic father or male ancestor. —v. (-ring) (esp. Of an animal) beget. [french from latin senior *senior]

Minestrone  n. Soup containing vegetables and pasta, beans, or rice. [italian]

Bandmaster  n. Conductor of a band.

Bittern  n. Wading bird of the heron family. [french butor from latin butio]

Easterner  n. Native or inhabitant of the east.

Dude  n. Slang 1 fellow. 2 us dandy. 3 us city-dweller staying on a ranch. [german dial. Dude fool]

Nan  n. (also nana, nanna) colloq. Grandmother. [childish pronunciation]

Oviduct  n. Tube through which an ovum passes from the ovary.

Rather  adv. 1 by preference (would rather not go). 2 (usu. Foll. By than) more truly; as a more likely alternative (is stupid rather than dishonest). 3 more precisely (a book, or rather, a pamphlet). 4 slightly, to some extent (became rather drunk). 5  (as an emphatic response) assuredly (did you like it? – rather!).  had rather would rather. [old english comparative of rathe early]

Habitation  n. 1 inhabiting (fit for habitation). 2 house or home.

Carotene  n. Orange-coloured pigment found in carrots, tomatoes, etc., acting as a source of vitamin a. [latin: related to *carrot]

Quadruplet  n. Each of four children born at one birth.

Affair  n. 1 matter, concern, or thing to be attended to (that is my affair). 2 a celebrated or notorious happening. B colloq. Thing or event (puzzling affair). 3 = *love affair. 4 (in pl.) Public or private business. [french à faire to do]

Emit  v. (-tt-) give or send out (heat, light, a smell, sound, etc.); discharge.  emission n. [latin emitto emiss-]

Vie  v. (vies; vied; vying) (often foll. By with) compete; strive for superiority. [probably french: related to *envy]

Pretentious  adj. 1 making an excessive claim to merit or importance. 2 ostentatious.  pretentiously adv. Pretentiousness n.

Dotage  n. Feeble-minded senility (in his dotage).

Meningitis  n. (esp. Viral) infection and inflammation of the meninges.

Trilobite  n. A kind of fossil marine arthropod. [from *tri-, greek lobos lobe]

Prison  n. 1 place of captivity, esp. A building to which persons are committed while awaiting trial or for punishment. 2 custody, confinement. [latin prehendo seize]

Hapless  adj. Unlucky.

Oakum  n. Loose fibre obtained by picking old rope to pieces and used esp. In caulking. [old english, = off-comb]

Ugli  n. (pl. -lis or -lies) propr. Mottled green and yellow hybrid of a grapefruit and a tangerine. [from *ugly]

Demonetize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) withdraw (a coin etc.) From use.  demonetization n. [french: related to *de-, *money]

Philippic  n. Bitter verbal attack. [greek from philip ii of macedon]

Febrile  adj. Of fever; feverish. [latin febris fever]

Nightgown  n. = *nightdress.

Peruse  v. (-sing) 1 read or study carefully. 2 joc. Read or look at desultorily. perusal n. [originally = ‘use up’]

Recognize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 identify as already known. 2 realize or discover the nature of. 3 (foll. By that) realize or admit. 4 acknowledge the existence, validity, character, or claims of. 5 show appreciation of; reward. 6 (foll. By as, for) treat.  recognizable adj. [latin recognosco]

Yeah  adv. Colloq. Yes. [a casual pronunciation of *yes]

Circumlocution  n. 1 a roundabout expression. B evasive talk. 2 verbosity.  circumlocutory adj.

Unconsidered  adj. 1 not considered; disregarded. 2 not premeditated.

Copious  adj. 1 abundant. 2 producing much.  copiously adv. [latin copia plenty]

Undiscriminating  adj. Lacking good judgement.

Occupant  n. Person who occupies, esp. Lives in, a place etc.  occupancy n. (pl. -ies). [latin: related to *occupy]

Defoliate  v. (-ting) destroy the leaves of (trees or plants).  defoliant n. Defoliation n. [latin: related to *foil2]

Backstage  adv. & adj. Behind the scenes.

Thymus  n. (pl. Thymi) lymphoid organ situated in the neck of vertebrates. [greek]

Hemorrhoids  n.pl. (brit. Haem-) swollen veins in the wall of the anus; piles. [greek haima blood, -rhoos -flowing]

Placard  —n. Large notice for public display. —v. Set up placards on (a wall etc.). [french from dutch placken glue (v.)]

Vatican  n. Palace or government of the pope in rome. [name of a hill in rome]

Polythene  n. A tough light plastic. [from *polyethylene]

Pessimism  n. 1 tendency to be gloomy or expect the worst. 2 philos. Belief that this world is as bad as it could be or that all things tend to evil.  pessimist n. Pessimistic adj. Pessimistically adv. [latin pessimus worst]

Plausible  adj. 1 (of a statement etc.) Reasonable or probable. 2 (of a person) persuasive but deceptive.  plausibility n. Plausibly adv. [latin: related to *plaudit]

Tallboy  n. Tall chest of drawers.

Servicewoman  n. Woman in the armed forces.

Distract  v. 1 (often foll. By from) draw away the attention of. 2 bewilder, perplex. 3 (as distracted adj.) Confused, mad, or angry. 4 amuse, esp. To divert from pain etc. [latin: related to *dis-, traho tract- draw]

Minded  adj. 1 (in comb.) A inclined to think in some specified way, or with a specified interest (mathematically minded; fair-minded; car-minded). B having a specified kind of mind (high-minded). 2 (usu. Foll. By to + infin.) Disposed or inclined.

Hydrofoil  n. 1 boat equipped with planes for lifting its hull out of the water to increase its speed. 2 such a plane.

Seventy  adj. & n. (pl. -ies) 1 seven times ten. 2 symbol for this (70, lxx, lxx). 3 (in pl.) Numbers from 70 to 79, esp. The years of a century or of a person's life.  seventieth adj. & n. [old english]

Emery  n. Coarse corundum for polishing metal etc. [greek smeris polishing powder]

Irrecoverable  adj. Not able to be recovered or remedied.  irrecoverably adv.

Menu  n. 1 list of dishes available in a restaurant etc., or to be served at a meal. 2 computing list of options displayed on a vdu. [latin: related to *minute2]

Offertory  n. (pl. -ies) 1 offering of the bread and wine at the eucharist. 2 collection of money at a religious service. [church latin: related to *offer]

Teacher  n. Person who teaches, esp. In a school.

Paradise  n. 1 (in some religions) heaven. 2 place or state of complete happiness. 3 (in full earthly paradise) abode of adam and eve; garden of eden.  paradisaical adj. Paradisal adj. Paradisiacal adj. Paradisical adj. [greek paradeisos]

Haul  —v. 1 pull or drag forcibly. 2 transport by lorry, cart, etc. 3 turn a ship's course. 4 colloq. (usu. Foll. By up) bring for reprimand or trial. —n. 1 hauling. 2 amount gained or acquired. 3 distance to be traversed (a short haul).  haul over the coals see *coal. [french haler from old norse hala]

Fitted  adj. 1 made to fit closely or exactly (fitted carpet). 2 provided with built-in fittings etc. (fitted kitchen). 3 built-in (fitted cupboards).

Tapas  n.pl. (often attrib.) Small savoury esp. Spanish dishes. [spanish]

Unwieldy  adj. (-ier, -iest) cumbersome or hard to manage, owing to size, shape, etc.  unwieldily adv. Unwieldiness n. [wieldy active, from *wield]

Carving  n. Carved object, esp. As a work of art.

Iud  abbr. Intrauterine (contraceptive) device.

Replacement  n. 1 replacing or being replaced. 2 person or thing that replaces another.

Polymath  n. Person of great or varied learning. [greek manthano math- learn]

Defiance  n. Open disobedience; bold resistance. [french: related to *defy]

Med  n. Colloq. Mediterranean sea. [abbreviation]

Topmast  n. Mast next above the lower mast.

Wadding  n. Soft fibrous material used in quilt-making etc., or to pack fragile articles.

Confederation  n. 1 union or alliance, esp. Of states. 2 confederating or being confederated.

Biplane  n. Aeroplane with two sets of wings, one above the other.

Retired  adj. 1 having retired from employment. 2 withdrawn from society or observation; secluded.

Cucumber  n. 1 long green fleshy fruit, used in salads. 2 climbing plant yielding this. [french from latin]

Tactful  adj. Having or showing tact.  tactfully adv.

Prearrange  v. (-ging) arrange beforehand.  prearrangement n.

Pentagram  n. Five-pointed star. [greek: see *penta-, *-gram]

Patten  n. Hist. Shoe or clog with a raised sole or set on an iron ring, for walking in mud etc. [french patin]

Lookout  n. 1 watch or looking out (on the lookout). 2 a observation-post. B person etc. Stationed to keep watch. 3 prospect (it's a bad lookout). 4 colloq. Person's own concern (that's your lookout).

Cystitis  n. Inflammation of the bladder usu. Causing frequent painful urination.

Lemonade  n. 1 drink made from lemon juice. 2 synthetic substitute for this.

Submissive  adj. Humble, obedient.  submissively adv. Submissiveness n.

Foreknow  v. (past -knew, past part. -known) literary know beforehand.  foreknowledge n.

Niggard  n. Stingy person. [probably of scandinavian origin]

Centreboard  n. (us centerboard) board lowered through a boat's keel to prevent leeway.

Frostbite  n. Injury to body tissues due to freezing.  frostbitten adj.

Homely  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 simple, plain, unpretentious. 2 us (of facial appearance) plain, unattractive. 3 comfortable, cosy.  homeliness n.

Password  n. Prearranged selected word or phrase securing recognition, admission, etc.

Seamstress  n. (also sempstress) woman who sews, esp. For a living. [old english: related to *seam]

Tonsillectomy  n. (pl. -ies) surgical removal of the tonsils.

Emf  abbr. (also e.m.f.) Electromotive force.

Taffy  n. (pl. -ies) colloq. Often offens. Welshman. [a supposed pronunciation of davy = david]

Arse  n. (us ass) coarse slang buttocks. [old english]

Unmoved  adj. 1 not moved. 2 constant in purpose. 3 unemotional.

October  n. Tenth month of the year. [latin octo eight, originally the 8th month of the roman year]

Blowzy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 coarse-looking; red-faced. 2 slovenly. [obsolete blowze beggar's wench]

Ballistics  n.pl. (usu. Treated as sing.) Science of projectiles and firearms.

Poultice  —n. Soft medicated usu. Heated mass applied to the body and kept in place with muslin etc., to relieve soreness and inflammation. —v. (-cing) apply a poultice to. [latin puls pottage]

Effluence  n. 1 flowing out of light, electricity, etc. 2 that which flows out. [latin fluo flux- flow]

Thine  poss. Pron. Archaic 1 (predic. Or absol.) Of or belonging to thee. 2 (attrib. Before a vowel) = *thy. [old english]

Serviceman  n. 1 man in the armed forces. 2 man providing service or maintenance.

Tablecloth  n. Cloth spread over a table, esp. For meals.

Psyche  n. The soul, spirit, or mind. [latin from greek]

Have  —v. (-ving; 3rd sing. Present has; past and past part. Had) 1 as an auxiliary verb with past part. Or ellipt., to form the perfect, pluperfect, and future perfect tenses, and the conditional mood (has, had, will have, seen; had i known, i would have gone; yes, i have). 2 own or be able to use; be provided with (has a car; had no time). 3 hold in a certain relationship (has a sister; had no equals). 4 contain as a part or quality (box has a lid; has big eyes). 5 a experience (had a good time, a shock, a pain). B be subjected to a specified state (had my car stolen; book has a page missing). C cause (a person or thing) to be in a particular state or take particular action (had him sacked; had us worried; had my hair cut; had a copy made; had them to stay). 6 a engage in (an activity) (have an argument, sex). B hold (a meeting, party, etc.). 7 eat or drink (had a beer). 8 (usu. In neg.) Accept or tolerate; permit to (i won't have it; won't have you say that). 9 a feel (have no doubt; has nothing against me). B show (mercy, pity, etc.). C (foll. By to + infin.) Show by action that one is influenced by (a feeling, quality, etc.) (have the sense to stop). 10 a give birth to (offspring). B conceive mentally (an idea etc.). 11 receive, obtain (had a letter from him; not a ticket to be had). 12 be burdened with or committed to (has a job to do). 13 a have obtained (a qualification) (has six o levels). B know (a language) (has no latin). 14 slang a get the better of (i had him there). B (usu. In passive) cheat, deceive (you were had). 15 coarse slang have sexual intercourse with. —n. 1 (usu. In pl.) Colloq. Person with wealth or resources. 2 slang swindle.  had best see *best. Had better see *better. Have got to colloq. = have to. Have had it colloq. 1 have missed one's chance. 2 have passed one's prime. 3 have been killed, defeated, etc. Have it 1 (foll. By that) maintain that. 2 win a decision in a vote etc. 3 colloq. Have found the answer etc. Have it away (or off) coarse slang have sexual intercourse. Have it in for colloq. Be hostile or ill-disposed towards. Have it out (often foll. By with) colloq. Attempt to settle a dispute by argument. Have on 1 wear (clothes). 2 have (an engagement). 3 colloq. Tease, hoax. Have to be obliged to, must. Have up colloq. Bring (a person) before a judge, interviewer, etc. [old english]

Contravene  v. (-ning) 1 infringe (a law etc.). 2 (of things) conflict with.  contravention n. [latin venio come]

Fielder  n. = *fieldsman.

Huguenot  n. Hist. French protestant. [french]

Nick  —n. 1 small cut or notch. 2 slang a prison. B police station. 3 colloq. Condition (in good nick). —v. 1 make a nick or nicks in. 2 slang a steal. B arrest, catch.  in the nick of time only just in time. [origin uncertain]

Woo  v. (woos, wooed) 1 court; seek the hand or love of. 2 try to win (fame, fortune, etc.). 3 seek the favour or support of. 4 coax or importune.  wooer n. [old english]

Refrangible  adj. That can be refracted. [latin: related to *refract]

Brooch  n. Ornamental hinged pin. [french broche: related to *broach]

Sharp  —adj. 1 having an edge or point able to cut or pierce. 2 tapering to a point or edge. 3 abrupt, steep, angular. 4 well-defined, clean-cut. 5 a severe or intense. B (of food etc.) Pungent, acid. 6 (of a voice etc.) Shrill and piercing. 7 (of words or temper etc.) Harsh. 8 acute; quick to understand. 9 artful, unscrupulous. 10 vigorous or brisk. 11 mus. Above the normal pitch; a semitone higher than a specified pitch (c sharp). —n. 1 mus. A note a semitone above natural pitch. B sign indicating this. 2 colloq. Swindler, cheat. —adv. 1 punctually (at nine o'clock sharp). 2 suddenly (pulled up sharp). 3 at a sharp angle. 4 mus. Above true pitch (sings sharp).  sharply adv. Sharpness n. [old english]

Harmonious  adj. 1 sweet-sounding; tuneful. 2 forming a pleasing or consistent whole. 3 free from disagreement or dissent.  harmoniously adv.

Agate  n. Hard usu. Streaked chalcedony. [greek akhates]

Whitewood  n. Pale wood, esp. Prepared for staining etc.

Concubine  n. 1 literary or joc. Mistress. 2 (among polygamous peoples) secondary wife.  concubinage n. [latin cubo lie]

Unthread  v. Take the thread out of (a needle etc.).
