Clerestory  n. (pl. -ies) upper row of windows in a cathedral or large church, above the level of the aisle roofs. [clear storey]

Drown  v. 1 kill or die by submersion in liquid. 2 submerge; flood; drench. 3 deaden (grief etc.) By drinking. 4 (often foll. By out) overpower (sound) with louder sound. [probably old english]

Pyjamas  n.pl. (us pajamas) 1 suit of loose trousers and jacket for sleeping in. 2 loose trousers worn by both sexes in some asian countries. 3 (pyjama) (attrib.) Of either part of a pair of pyjamas (pyjama jacket). [urdu, = leg-clothing]

Bonded  adj. 1 stored in or for storing in bond (bonded whisky, warehouse). 2 (of a debt) secured by bonds.

Magnitude  n. 1 largeness. 2 size. 3 importance. 4 a degree of brightness of a star. B class of stars arranged according to this (of the third magnitude).  of the first magnitude very important. [latin magnus great]

Alyssum  n. Plant with small usu. Yellow or white flowers. [greek, = curing madness]

Fanfare  n. Short showy or ceremonious sounding of trumpets etc. [french]

Kickstand  n. Rod for supporting a bicycle or motor cycle when stationary.

Coral  —n. Hard red, pink, or white calcareous substance secreted by marine polyps for support and habitation. —adj. 1 red or pink, like coral. 2 made of coral. [greek korallion]

Disentangle  v. (-ling) free or become free of tangles or complications.  disentanglement n.

Delicatessen  n. 1 shop selling esp. Exotic cooked meats, cheeses, etc. 2 (often attrib.) Such foods. [french: related to *delicate]

Subscription  —n. 1 a act of subscribing. B money subscribed. 2 membership fee, esp. Paid regularly. —attrib. Adj. Paid for mainly by advance sales of tickets (subscription concert).

Donut  n. (brit. Doughnut) small fried cake of sweetened dough.

Facial  —adj. Of or for the face. —n. Beauty treatment for the face.  facially adv.

Civilization  n. (also -isation) 1 advanced stage or system of social development. 2 peoples of the world that are regarded as having this. 3 a people or nation (esp. Of the past) regarded as an element of social evolution (inca civilization).

Pashto  —n. Language of afghanistan, parts of pakistan, etc. —adj. Of or in this language. [pashto]

Psychopath  n. 1 mentally deranged person, esp. Showing abnormal or violent social behaviour. 2 mentally or emotionally unstable person.  psychopathic adj.

Treaty  n. (pl. -ies) 1 formal agreement between states. 2 agreement between parties, esp. For the purchase of property. [latin: related to *treat]

Defray  v. Provide money for (a cost or expense).  defrayal n. Defrayment n. [medieval latin fredum fine]

Felspar  var. Of *feldspar.

Stammer  —v. 1 speak haltingly, esp. With pauses or rapid repetitions of the same syllable. 2 (often foll. By out) utter (words) in this way. —n. 1 tendency to stammer. 2 instance of stammering. [old english]

Lemming  n. Small arctic rodent reputed to rush into the sea and drown during migration. [norwegian]

Parricide  n. 1 murder of a near relative, esp. Of a parent. 2 person who commits parricide.  parricidal adj. [latin: see *parent, *pater, *-cide]

Swipe  colloq. —v. (-ping) 1 (often foll. By at) hit hard and recklessly. 2 steal. —n. Reckless hard hit or attempted hit. [perhaps var. Of *sweep]

Yiddish  —n. Language used by jews in or from europe, orig. A german dialect with words from hebrew etc. —adj. Of this language. [german jüdisch jewish]

Xmas  n. Colloq. = *christmas. [abbreviation, with x for the initial chi of greek khristos christ]

Lisp  —n. Speech defect in which s is pronounced like th in thick and z is pronounced like th in this. —v. Speak or utter with a lisp. [old english]

Foliage  n. Leaves, leafage. [french feuillage from feuille leaf]

Reveille  n. Military waking-signal. [french réveillez wake up]

Inertia  n. 1 physics property of matter by which it continues in its existing state of rest or motion unless an external force is applied. 2 a inertness, lethargy. B tendency to remain unchanged (inertia of the system).  inertial adj. [latin: related to *inert]

Saver  n. 1 person who saves esp. Money. 2 (often in comb.) Thing that saves (time etc.). 3 cheap (esp. Off-peak) fare.

Schottische  n. 1 a kind of slow polka. 2 music for this. [german, = scottish]

Steward  —n. 1 passengers' attendant on a ship, aircraft, or train. 2 official supervising a meeting, show, etc. 3 person responsible for supplies of food etc. For a college or club etc. 4 property manager. —v. Act as a steward (of).  stewardship n. [old english, = house-warden]

Advisory  adj. Giving advice (advisory body).

Cent  n. 1 a one-hundredth of a dollar or other decimal currency unit. B coin of this value. 2 colloq. Very small amount. [latin centum 100]

Hotelier  n. Hotel-keeper.

Driblet  n. Small quantity.

Weaver  n. 1 person who weaves fabric. 2 (in full weaver-bird) tropical bird building elaborately woven nests.

Virtue  n. 1 moral excellence; goodness. 2 particular form of this. 3 (esp. Female) chastity. 4 good quality (has the virtue of speed). 5 efficacy (no virtue in such drugs).  by (or in) virtue of on account of, because of. [latin: related to *virile]

Vapour  n. (us vapor) 1 moisture or other substance diffused or suspended in air, e.g. Mist, smoke. 2  gaseous form of a substance. 3 medicinal inhalant.  vaporous adj. Vapoury adj. [latin vapor steam]

Scenery  n. 1 natural features of a landscape, esp. When picturesque. 2 painted backcloths, props, etc., used as the background in a play etc. [italian: related to *scenario]

Wop  n. Slang offens. Italian or other s. European. [origin uncertain]

Capstan  n. 1 thick revolving cylinder for winding a cable etc. 2 revolving spindle carrying the spool on a tape recorder. [provençal]

Marble  —n. 1 crystalline limestone capable of taking a polish, used in sculpture and architecture. 2 (often attrib.) A anything of marble (marble clock). B anything like marble in hardness, coldness, etc. (her features were marble). 3 a small, esp. Glass, ball as a toy. B (in pl.; treated as sing.) Game using these. 4 (in pl.) Slang one's mental faculties (he's lost his marbles). 5 (in pl.) Collection of sculptures (elgin marbles). —v. (-ling) 1 (esp. As marbled adj.) Stain or colour (paper, soap, etc.) To look like variegated marble. 2 (as marbled adj.) (of meat) striped with fat and lean. [latin marmor from greek]

Yashmak  n. Veil concealing the face except the eyes, worn by some muslim women. [arabic]

Quizzical  adj. Expressing or done with mild or amused perplexity.  quizzically adv.

Broomstick  n. Handle of a broom.

Mascara  n. Cosmetic for darkening the eyelashes. [italian, = mask]

Retexture  v. (-ring) treat (material, a garment, etc.) So as to restore its original texture.

Immortal  —adj. 1 a living for ever; not mortal. B divine. 2 unfading. 3 famous for all time. —n. 1 a immortal being. B (in pl.) Gods of antiquity. 2 person, esp. An author, remembered long after death.  immortality n. Immortalize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). Immortally adv.

Armistice  n. Truce, esp. Permanent. [latin arma arms, sisto make stand]

Umbra  n. (pl. -s or -brae) total shadow, esp. That cast on the earth by the moon during a solar eclipse. [latin, = shadow]

Occasional  adj. 1 happening irregularly and infrequently. 2 made or meant for, or acting on, a special occasion.  occasionally adv.

Circulate  v. (-ting) 1 be in circulation; spread. 2 a put into circulation. B send circulars to. 3 move about among guests etc. [latin: related to *circle]

Reflexology  n. Massage through points on the feet, hands, and head, to relieve tension and treat illness.  reflexologist n.

Pantheon  n. 1 building in which illustrious dead are buried or have memorials. 2 the deities of a people collectively. 3 temple dedicated to all the gods. [greek theion divine]

Spurious  adj. Not genuine, fake. [latin]

Arterial  adj. 1 of or like an artery. 2 (esp. Of a road) main, important. [french: related to *artery]

Scarlet  —adj. Of brilliant red tinged with orange. —n. 1 scarlet colour or pigment. 2 scarlet clothes or material (dressed in scarlet). [french escarlate]

Longhand  n. Ordinary handwriting.

Ponderable  adj. Literary having appreciable weight or significance. [latin: related to *ponder]

Archaeology  n. (us archeology) study of ancient cultures, esp. By the excavation and analysis of physical remains.  archaeological adj. Archaeologist n. [greek arkhaiologia ancient history]

Clonk  —n. Abrupt heavy sound of impact. —v. 1 make this sound. 2 colloq. Hit. [imitative]

Dental  adj. 1 of the teeth or dentistry. 2 (of a consonant) produced with the tongue-tip against the upper front teeth (as th) or the ridge of the teeth (as n, s, t). [latin dens dent- tooth]

Human  —adj. 1 of or belonging to the species homo sapiens. 2 consisting of human beings (the human race). 3 of or characteristic of humankind, esp. As being weak, fallible, etc. (is only human). 4 showing warmth, sympathy, etc. (is very human). —n. Human being. [latin humanus]

Manage  v. (-ging) 1 organize; regulate; be in charge of. 2 succeed in achieving; contrive (managed to come; managed a smile; managed to ruin the day). 3 (often foll. By with) succeed with limited resources etc.; be able to cope. 4 succeed in controlling. 5 (often prec. By can etc.) A cope with (couldn't manage another bite). B be free to attend on or at (can manage monday). 6 use or wield (a tool etc.).  manageable adj. [latin manus hand]

Overweening  adj. Arrogant, presumptuous.

Surveyor  n. Person who surveys land and buildings, esp. For a living.

Tessellation  n. Close arrangement of polygons, esp. In a repeated pattern.

Lavatorial  adj. Of or like lavatories; (esp. Of humour) relating to excretion.

Observation  n. 1 observing or being observed. 2 power of perception. 3 remark, comment. 4 thing observed by esp. Scientific study.  observational adj.

Intensity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 intenseness. 2 amount of some quality, e.g. Force, brightness, etc.

Spectre  n. (us specter) 1 ghost. 2 haunting presentiment (spectre of war). [latin spectrum from specio look]

Voice  —n. 1 a sound formed in the larynx and uttered by the mouth, esp. By a person speaking, singing, etc. B power of this (lost her voice). 2 a use of the voice; spoken or written expression (esp. Give voice). B opinion so expressed. C right to express an opinion. D medium for expression. 3 gram. Set of verbal forms showing whether a verb is active or passive. —v. (-cing) 1 express. 2 (esp. As voiced adj.) Utter with vibration of the vocal cords (e.g. B, d).  in good voice singing or speaking well or easily. With one voice unanimously. [latin vox voc-]

Datum  see *data.

Bulwark  n. 1 defensive wall, esp. Of earth. 2 protecting person or thing. 3 (usu. In pl.) Ship's side above deck. [low german or dutch]

Lakh  n. Ind. (usu. Foll. By of) hundred thousand (rupees etc.). [hindustani lakh]

Ragtime  n. Form of highly syncopated early jazz, esp. For the piano.

Treatment  n. 1 process or manner of behaving towards or dealing with a person or thing. 2 medical care or attention. 3 manner of treating a subject in literature or art. 4 (prec. By the) colloq. The customary way of dealing with a person, situation, etc. (got the full treatment).

Consensus  n. (often foll. By of; often attrib.) General agreement or opinion. [latin: related to *consent]

Ovulate  v. (-ting) produce ova or ovules, or discharge them from the ovary.  ovulation n. [related to *ovum]

Retarded  adj. Backward in mental or physical development.

Hyperventilation  n. Abnormally rapid breathing.  hyperventilate v. (-ting).

Puritan  —n. 1 (puritan) hist. Member of a group of english protestants who sought to simplify and regulate forms of worship after the reformation. 2 purist member of any party. 3 strict observer of religion or morals. —adj. 1 (puritan) hist. Of the puritans. 2 scrupulous and austere in religion or morals.  puritanism n. [latin: related to *pure]

Mushroom  —n. 1 edible fungus with a stem and domed cap. 2 pinkish-brown colour of this. —v. Appear or develop rapidly. [french mousseron from latin]

Skittish  adj. 1 lively, playful. 2 (of a horse etc.) Nervous, inclined to shy. [perhaps related to *skit]

Destination  n. Place a person or thing is bound for. [latin: related to *destine]

Felicitate  v. (-ting) formal congratulate.  felicitation n. (usu. In pl.). [latin felix happy]

Foxy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 foxlike. 2 sly or cunning. 3 reddish-brown.  foxily adv. Foxiness n.

Cordless  adj. (of a hand-held electrical device) usable without a power cable because working from an internal source of energy or battery.

Supportive  adj. Providing (esp. Emotional) support or encouragement.  supportively adv. Supportiveness n.

Bracket  —n. 1 (esp. Angled) support projecting from a vertical surface. 2 shelf fixed to a wall with this. 3 each of a pair of marks () [] {} enclosing words or figures. 4 group or classification (income bracket). —v. (-t-) 1 enclose in brackets. 2 group or classify together. [latin bracae breeches]

Vanadium  n. Hard grey metallic element used to strengthen steel. [old norse vanadís name of the scandinavian goddess freyja]

Forthright  adj. 1 outspoken; straightforward. 2 decisive. [old english]

Debit  —n. 1 entry in an account recording a sum owed. 2 sum recorded. 3 total of such sums. 4 debit side of an account. —v. (-t-) 1 (foll. By against, to) enter on the debit side of an account (debit £50 to my account). 2 (foll. By with) charge (a person) with a debt (debited me with £500). [latin debitum *debt]

Restrictive  adj. Restricting. [french or medieval latin: related to *restrict]

Quartz  n. Silica in various mineral forms. [german from slavonic]

Monocotyledon  n. Flowering plant with one cotyledon.  monocotyledonous adj.

Penthouse  n. (esp. Luxurious) flat on the roof or top floor of a tall building. [latin: related to *append]

Revenue  n. 1 a income, esp. A substantial one. B (in pl.) Items constituting this. 2 state's annual income from which public expenses are met. 3 department of the civil service collecting this. [french revenu from latin revenio return]

Listeria  n. Any of several bacteria infecting humans and animals eating contaminated food. [lister, name of a surgeon]

Fairing  n. Streamlining structure added to a ship, aircraft, vehicle, etc.

-seater  comb. Form having a specified number of seats.

Electronics  n.pl. (treated as sing.) Science of the movement of electrons in a vacuum, gas, semiconductor, etc., esp. In devices in which the flow is controlled and utilized.

Earthly  adj. 1 of the earth or human life on it; terrestrial. 2 (usu. With neg.) Colloq. Remotely possible (is no earthly use; there wasn't an earthly reason).  not an earthly colloq. No chance or idea whatever.

Gravimeter  n. Instrument measuring the difference in the force of gravity between two places. [latin: related to *grave2]

Divan  n. Low couch or bed without a back or ends. [ultimately from persian divan bench]

Decidedly  adv. Undoubtedly, undeniably.

Tuft  n. Bunch or collection of threads, grass, feathers, hair, etc., held or growing together at the base.  tufted adj. Tufty adj. [probably french tofe]

Uncross  v. 1 remove from a crossed position. 2 (as uncrossed adj.) (of a cheque) not crossed.

Albumin  n. Water-soluble protein found in egg-white, milk, blood, etc.  albuminous adj.

Ointment  n. Smooth greasy healing or cosmetic preparation for the skin. [latin unguo anoint]

Except  —v. Exclude from a general statement, condition, etc. —prep. (often foll. By for) not including; other than (all failed except him; is all right except that it is too long). —conj. Archaic unless (except he be born again). [latin excipio -cept- take out]

Parapsychology  n. The study of mental phenomena outside the sphere of ordinary psychology (hypnosis, telepathy, etc.).

Either  —adj. & pron. 1 one or the other of two (either of you can go; you may have either book). 2 each of two (houses on either side of the road). —adv. & conj. 1 as one possibility (is either right or wrong). 2 as one choice or alternative; which way you will (either come in or go out). 3 (with neg.) A any more than the other (if you do not go, i shall not either). B moreover (there is no time to lose, either). [old english]

Goldcrest  n. Tiny bird with a golden crest.

Calculus  n. (pl. -luses or -li) 1 particular method of mathematical calculation or reasoning. 2 stone or mineral mass in the body. [latin, = small stone (used on an abacus)]

Vacuole  n. Tiny space in an organ or cell, containing air, fluid, etc. [latin vacuus empty]

Scanty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of small extent or amount. 2 barely sufficient.  scantily adv. Scantiness n.

Anaemia  n. (us anemia) deficiency of red blood cells or their haemoglobin, causing pallor and weariness. [greek, = want of blood]

Scrimp  v. Skimp. [origin unknown]

Mileage  n. (also milage) 1 number of miles travelled, esp. By a vehicle per unit of fuel. 2 colloq. Profit, advantage.

Recondite  adj. 1 (of a subject or knowledge) abstruse, out of the way, little known. 2 (of an author or style) dealing in abstruse knowledge or allusions, obscure. [latin recondo -dit- put away]

Mitre  (us miter) —n. 1 tall deeply-cleft headdress worn by bishops and abbots, esp. As a symbol of office. 2 joint of two pieces of wood etc. At an angle of 90°, such that the line of junction bisects this angle. —v. (-ring) 1 bestow a mitre on. 2 join with a mitre. [greek mitra turban]

Tenantry  n. Tenants of an estate etc.

Naafi  abbr. 1 navy, army, and air force institutes. 2 canteen for servicemen run by the naafi.

Landowner  n. Owner of (esp. Much) land.  landowning adj. & n.

Karma  n. Buddhism & hinduism person's actions in previous lives, believed to decide his or her fate in future existences. [sanskrit, = action, fate]

Inglenook  n. Space within the opening on either side of a large fireplace. [perhaps gaelic aingeal fire, light]

Monsignor  n. (pl. -nori) title of various roman catholic priests and officials. [italian: related to *monseigneur]

Dare  —v. (-ring; 3rd sing. Present usu. Dare before an expressed or implied infinitive without to) 1 (foll. By infin. With or without to) have the courage or impudence (to) (dare he do it?; if they dare to come; how dare you?). 2 (usu. Foll. By to + infin.) Defy or challenge (i dare you to own up). —n. 1 act of daring. 2 challenge, esp. To prove courage.  i dare say 1 (often foll. By that) it is probable. 2 probably; i grant that much. [old english]

Puny  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 undersized. 2 weak, feeble. [french puisné born afterwards]

Sackbut  n. Early form of trombone. [french]

Methodical  adj. Characterized by method or order.  methodically adv.

Boneshaker  n. Decrepit or uncomfortable old vehicle.

Disputable  adj. Open to question; uncertain.  disputably adv.

Khz  abbr. Kilohertz.

Electrify  v. (-ies, -ied) 1 charge with electricity. 2 convert to the use of electric power. 3 cause sudden excitement (news was electrifying).  electrification n.

Gaunt  adj. 1 lean, haggard. 2 grim, desolate.  gauntness n. [origin unknown]

Cancel  v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 revoke or discontinue (an arrangement). 2 delete (writing etc.). 3 mark (a ticket, stamp, etc.) To invalidate it. 4 annul; make void. 5 (often foll. By out) neutralize or counterbalance. 6 math. Strike out (an equal factor) on each side of an equation etc.  cancellation n. [latin: related to *chancel]

Trendy  colloq.; often derog. —adj. (-ier, -iest) fashionable. —n. (pl. -ies) fashionable person.  trendily adv. Trendiness n.

Passionate  adj. Dominated, displaying, or caused by strong emotion.  passionately adv.

Reverence  —n. 1 revering or being revered. 2 capacity for revering. —v. (-cing) regard or treat with reverence. [latin: related to *revere]

Infidelity  n. (pl. -ies) unfaithfulness, esp. Adultery. [latin: related to *infidel]

Bifid  adj. Divided by a deep cleft into two parts. [latin findo cleave]

Earplug  n. Piece of wax etc. Placed in the ear to protect against water, noise, etc.

Indorse  var. Of *endorse.

Workhouse  n. Hist. Public institution for the poor of a parish.

Distaff  n. Cleft stick holding wool or flax for spinning by hand. [old english]

Forecourt  n. 1 part of a filling-station with petrol pumps. 2 enclosed space in front of a building.

Tetanus  n. Bacterial disease causing painful spasm of the voluntary muscles. [greek teino stretch]

Scramble  —v. (-ling) 1 clamber, crawl, climb, etc., esp. Hurriedly or anxiously. 2 (foll. By for, at) struggle with competitors (for a thing or share). 3 mix together indiscriminately. 4 cook (eggs) by stirring them in a pan over heat. 5 change the speech frequency of (a broadcast transmission or telephone conversation) so as to make it unintelligible without a decoding device. 6 (of fighter aircraft or pilots) take off quickly in an emergency or for action. —n. 1 act of scrambling. 2 difficult climb or walk. 3 (foll. By for) eager struggle or competition. 4 motor-cycle race over rough ground. 5 emergency take-off by fighter aircraft. [imitative]

Ashy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 = *ashen. 2 covered with ashes.

Rickety  adj. 1 insecure, shaky. 2 suffering from rickets.  ricketiness n.

Pedalo  n. (pl. -s) pedal-operated pleasure-boat.

Tuck  —v. 1 (often foll. By in, up) a draw, fold, or turn the outer or end parts of (cloth or clothes etc.) Close together so as to be held; push in the edge of (a thing) so as to confine it (tucked his shirt into his trousers). B push in the edges of bedclothes around (a person) (came to tuck me in). 2 draw together into a small space (tucked its head under its wing). 3 stow (a thing) away in a specified place or way (tucked it in a corner; tucked it out of sight). 4 make a stitched fold in (cloth etc.). —n. 1 flattened usu. Stitched fold in cloth etc. 2 colloq. Food, esp. Cakes and sweets (also attrib.: tuck box).  tuck in colloq. Eat heartily. Tuck into (or away) colloq. Eat (food) heartily (tucked into their dinner; could really tuck it away). [low german or dutch]

Calendar  —n. 1 system fixing the year's beginning, length, and subdivision. 2 chart etc. Showing such subdivisions. 3 timetable of dates, events, etc. —v. Enter in a calendar; register (documents). [latin: related to *calends]

Hatchback  n. Car with a sloping back hinged at the top to form a door.

Sauna  n. 1 period spent in a special room heated very hot, to clean the body. 2 such a room. [finnish]

Catalpa  n. Tree with long pods and showy flowers. [n. American indian]

Volcano  n. (pl. -es) 1 mountain or hill from which lava, steam, etc. Escape through openings in the earth's crust. 2 volatile situation. [latin volcanus vulcan, roman god of fire]

Cheery  adj. (-ier, -iest) cheerful.  cheerily adv. Cheeriness n.

Antiquarian  —adj. Of or dealing in antiques or rare books. —n. Antiquary.  antiquarianism n.

Misconstrue  v. (-strues, -strued, -struing) interpret wrongly.  misconstruction n.

Tailspin  n. 1 spin by an aircraft with the tail spiralling. 2 state of chaos or panic.

Windcheater  n. Wind-resistant jacket.

Immunize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make immune, usu. By inoculation.  immunization n.

Seigneur  n. Feudal lord.  seigneurial adj. [french from latin senior *senior]

Reappoint  v. Appoint to a position previously held.  reappointment n.

Misconceive  v. (-ving) 1 (often foll. By of) have a wrong idea or conception. 2 (as misconceived adj.) Badly planned, organized, etc.   misconception n. [from *mis-1]

Agitate  v. (-ting) 1 disturb or excite (a person or feelings). 2 (often foll. By for, against) campaign, esp. Politically (agitated for tax reform). 3 shake briskly.  agitation n. Agitator n. [latin agito: related to *act]

Epistemology  n. Philosophy of knowledge.  epistemological adj. [greek episteme knowledge]

Lagging  n. Material used to lag a boiler etc. Against loss of heat.

Purler  n. Colloq. Headlong fall. [purl overturn]

Academic  —adj. 1 scholarly, of learning. 2 of no practical relevance; theoretical. —n. Teacher or scholar in a university etc.  academically adv.

Commination  n. Literary threatening of divine vengeance.  comminatory adj. [latin: related to *menace]

Cheap  —adj. 1 low in price; worth more than its cost. 2 charging low prices; offering good value. 3 of poor quality; inferior. 4 costing little effort and hence of little worth. —adv. Cheaply.  on the cheap cheaply.  cheaply adv. Cheapness n. [old english, = price, bargain]

Hydroelectric  adj. 1 generating electricity by water-power. 2 (of electricity) so generated.  hydroelectricity n.

Injure  v. (-ring) 1 harm or damage. 2 do wrong to. [back-formation from *injury]

Horrific  adj. Horrifying.  horrifically adv.

Ligneous  adj. 1 (of a plant) woody. 2 of the nature of wood. [latin lignum wood]

Department  n. 1 separate part of a complex whole, esp.: a a branch of administration (housing department). B a division of a school, college, etc., by subject (physics department). C a section of a large store (hardware department). 2 colloq. Area of special expertise. 3 administrative district, esp. In france. [french: related to *depart]

Smirk  —n. Conceited or silly smile. —v. Give a smirk. [old english]

Saddlery  n. (pl. -ies) saddler's goods, trade, or premises.

Farad  n. Si unit of capacitance. [faraday, name of a physicist]

Predate  v. (-ting) precede in time.

Unexpurgated  adj. (esp. Of a text etc.) Complete.

Reservoir  n. 1 large natural or artificial lake as a source of water supply. 2 receptacle for fluid. 3 supply of information etc. [french: related to *reserve]

Buckwheat  n. Seed of a plant related to rhubarb, used to make flour, or as an alternative to rice. [dutch, = beech-wheat]

Subsequent  adj. (usu. Foll. By to) following, esp. As a consequence.  subsequently adv. [latin sequor follow]

Available  adj. 1 at one's disposal, obtainable. 2 a (of a person) free, not committed. B able to be contacted.  availability n.

Oc  abbr. Officer commanding.

Anything  pron. Any thing; thing of any sort.  anything but not at all.

Disputant  n. Person in a dispute.

Haven  n. 1 refuge. 2 harbour, port. [old english]

Axolotl  n. Newtlike salamander, which in natural conditions retains its larval form of life. [nahuatl, = water-servant]

Witch  n. 1 sorceress, woman supposed to have dealings with the devil or evil spirits. 2 old hag. 3 fascinating girl or woman. [old english]

Pax  n. 1 kiss of peace. 2 (as int.) Slang call for a truce (used esp. By schoolchildren). [latin, = peace]

Stipulate  v. (-ting) demand or specify as part of a bargain etc.  stipulation n. [latin stipulari]

Neath  prep. Poet. Beneath. [from *beneath]

Forestall  v. 1 prevent by advance action. 2 deal with beforehand. [from *fore-, *stall1]

Breastbone  n. Thin flat vertical bone in the chest between the ribs.

Torchlight  n. Light of a torch or torches.  torchlit adj.

Melodious  adj. 1 of, producing, or having melody. 2 sweet-sounding.  melodiously adv. Melodiousness n. [french: related to *melody]

Poltroon  n. Spiritless coward.  poltroonery n. [italian poltro sluggard]

Downhill  —adv. In a descending direction. —adj. Sloping down, declining. —n. 1 downhill race in skiing. 2 downward slope.  go downhill colloq. Deteriorate.

Delusion  n. 1 false belief, hope, etc. 2 hallucination.  delusive adj. Delusory adj. [related to *delude]

Outside  —n. 1 external side or surface; outer parts. 2 external appearance; outward aspect. 3 position on the outer side (gate opens from the outside). —adj. 1 a of, on, or nearer the outside; outer. B not in the main building (outside toilet). 2 not belonging to a particular group or organization (outside help). 3 (of a chance etc.) Remote; very unlikely. 4 (of an estimate etc.) The greatest or highest possible (the outside price). 5 (of a player in football etc.) Positioned nearest to the edge of the field (outside left). —adv. 1 on or to the outside. 2 in or to the open air. 3 not within, enclosed, or included. 4 slang not in prison. —prep. 1 not in; to or at the exterior of. 2 external to, not included in, beyond the limits of.  at the outside (of an estimate etc.) At the most. From the outside from an objective or impartial standpoint.

Chapter  n. 1 main division of a book. 2 period of time (in a person's life etc.). 3 a canons of a cathedral or members of a religious community. B meeting of these. [latin diminutive of caput head]

Want  —v. 1 a (often foll. By to + infin.) Desire; wish for possession of; need (wants a drink; wants it done immediately). B require to be attended to; need (garden wants weeding). C (foll. By to + infin.) Colloq. Ought; should (you want to be careful). 2 (usu. Foll. By for) lack; be deficient. 3 be without or fall short by. 4 (as wanted adj.) (of a suspected criminal etc.) Sought by the police. —n. 1 (often foll. By of) lack, absence, or deficiency (could not go for want of time). 2 poverty; need. [old norse]

Misprision  n. Law 1 (in full misprision of a felony or of treason) deliberate concealment of one's knowledge of a crime, treason, etc. 2 wrong action or omission. [anglo-french: related to *mis-2, prendre take]

Recast  —v. (past and past part. Recast) 1 cast again (a play, net, votes, etc.). 2 put into a new form; improve the arrangement of. —n. 1 recasting. 2 recast form.

Versatile  adj. 1 adapting easily to different subjects or occupations; skilled in many subjects or occupations. 2 having many uses.  versatility n. [latin verto vers- turn]

Abandoned  adj. 1 deserted, forsaken. 2 unrestrained, profligate.

Caa  abbr. Civil aviation authority.

Forgather  v. Assemble; associate. [dutch]

Serialize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) publish or produce in instalments.  serialization n.

Thermo-  comb. Form heat. [greek]

Slipper  n. Light loose soft indoor shoe.

Panchromatic  adj.  (of a film etc.) Sensitive to all visible colours of the spectrum.

Principled  adj. Based on or having (esp. Praiseworthy) principles of behaviour.

Forenoon  n. Morning.

Kea  n. New zealand parrot with brownish-green and red plumage. [maori, imitative]

Headlight  n. 1 strong light at the front of a vehicle. 2 beam from this.

Planchette  n. Small board on castors with a pencil, said to write spirit messages when a person's fingers rest lightly on it. [french diminutive: related to *plank]

Sip  —v. (-pp-) drink in small mouthfuls. —n. 1 small mouthful of liquid. 2 act of taking this. [perhaps var. Of *sup1]

Abominate  v. (-ting) detest, loathe.  abomination n. [latin: related to *abominable]

Anthracite  n. Hard type of coal burning with little flame and smoke. [greek: related to *anthrax]

Kolkhoz  n. Collective farm in the ussr. [russian]

Heteromorphic  adj. (also heteromorphous) biol. Of dissimilar forms.  heteromorphism n.

Blond  (of a woman usu. Blonde) —adj. (of a person, hair, or complexion) light-coloured, fair. —n. Blond person. [latin blondus yellow]

Kinsman  n. (fem. Kinswoman) 1 blood relation. 2 relation by marriage.

Usage  use of kinsman in sense 2 is considered incorrect by some people.

Republican  —adj. 1 of or constituted as a republic. 2 characteristic of a republic. 3 advocating or supporting republican government. —n. 1 person advocating or supporting republican government. 2 (republican) a us supporter of the republican party. B ir. Supporter of the ira or sinn féin.  republicanism n.

Transom  n. 1 horizontal bar of wood or stone across a window or the top of a door. 2 us = *transom window. [french traversin: related to *traverse]

Gay  —adj. 1 light-hearted, cheerful. 2 brightly coloured. 3 colloq. Homosexual. 4 colloq. Careless, thoughtless (gay abandon). —n. Colloq. (esp. Male) homosexual.  gayness n. [french]

Usage  sense 3 is generally informal in tone, but is favoured by homosexual groups.

Exhilarate  v. (often as exhilarating adj. Or exhilarated adj.) Enliven, gladden; raise the spirits of.  exhilaration n. [latin hilaris cheerful]

Sevenfold  adj. & adv. 1 seven times as much or as many. 2 consisting of seven parts.

Scroll  —n. 1 roll of parchment or paper, esp. Written on. 2 book in the ancient roll form. 3 ornamental design imitating a roll of parchment. —v. (often foll. By down, up) move (a display on a vdu screen) to view earlier or later material. [originally (sc)rowle *roll]

Stationary  adj. 1 not moving. 2 not meant to be moved. 3 unchanging. [latin: related to *station]

Acetate  n. 1 salt or ester of acetic acid, esp. The cellulose ester. 2 fabric made from this.

Palace  n. 1 official residence of a sovereign, president, archbishop, or bishop. 2 splendid or spacious building. [latin palatium]

Inexpensive  adj. Not expensive.

Mattock  n. Agricultural tool like a pickaxe, with an adze and a chisel edge. [old english]

Lancer  n. 1 hist. Soldier of a cavalry regiment armed with lances. 2 (in pl.) A quadrille. B music for this.

Pattern  —n. 1 repeated decorative design on wallpaper, cloth, etc. 2 regular or logical form, order, etc. (behaviour pattern). 3 model, design, or instructions for making something (knitting pattern). 4 excellent example, model (pattern of elegance). 5 wooden or metal shape from which a mould is made for a casting.  6 random combination of shapes or colours. —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By after, on) model (a thing) on a design etc. 2 decorate with a pattern. [from *patron]

Fracas  n. (pl. Same) noisy disturbance or quarrel. [french from italian]

Largely  adv. To a great extent (largely my own fault).

Overprice  v. (-cing) price too highly.

Edit  v. (-t-) 1 assemble, prepare, or modify (written material for publication). 2 be editor of (a newspaper etc.). 3 take extracts from and collate (a film etc.) To form a unified sequence. 4 a prepare (data) for processing by a computer. B alter (a text entered in a word processor etc.). 5 a reword in order to correct, or to alter the emphasis. B (foll. By out) remove (a part) from a text etc. [latin edo edit- give out]

Melodeon  n. (also melodion) 1 small organ similar to the harmonium. 2 small german accordion. [from *melody, *harmonium]

Necessitarian  —n. Person who holds that all action is predetermined and free will is impossible. —adj. Of such a person or theory.  necessitarianism n.

Forbade  (also forbad) past of *forbid.

Longitudinal  adj. 1 of or in length. 2 running lengthwise. 3 of longitude.  longitudinally adv.

Monad  n. 1 the number one; unit. 2 philos. Ultimate unit of being (e.g. A soul, an atom, a person, god).  monadic adj. [greek monas -ados unit]

Rephrase  v. (-sing) express differently.

Columnist  n. Journalist contributing regularly to a newspaper etc.

Tease  —v. (-sing) (also absol.) 1 a make fun of playfully, unkindly, or annoyingly; irritate. B allure, esp. Sexually, while withholding satisfaction. 2 pick (wool etc.) Into separate fibres. 3 dress (cloth) esp. With teasels. —n. 1 colloq. Person fond of teasing. 2 act of teasing (only a tease).  tease out separate by disentangling. [old english]

Comfy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Comfortable. [abbreviation]

Crumple  —v. (-ling) (often foll. By up) 1 crush or become crushed into creases or wrinkles. 2 collapse, give way. —n. Crease or wrinkle. [obsolete crump curl up]

Winnow  v. 1 blow (grain) free of chaff etc. By an air-current. 2 (foll. By out, away, from, etc.) Get rid of (chaff etc.) From grain. 3 sift, examine (evidence etc.). [old english: related to *wind1]

Incognito  —predic. Adj. & adv. With one's name or identity kept secret. —n. (pl. -s) 1 person who is incognito. 2 pretended identity. [italian, = unknown: related to *in-1, *cognition]

Flood  —n. 1 a overflowing or influx of water, esp. Over land; inundation. B the water that overflows. 2 outpouring; torrent (flood of tears). 3 inflow of the tide (also in comb.: flood-tide).

Outnumber  v. Exceed in number.

Hockey  n. Team game with hooked sticks and a small hard ball. [origin unknown]

Those  pl. Of *that.

Usage  thou has now been replaced by you except in some formal, liturgical, dialect, and poetic uses.

Eloquent  adj. 1 having eloquence. 2 (often foll. By of) expressive.  eloquently adv.

Plush  —n. Cloth of silk or cotton etc., with a long soft nap. —adj. 1 made of plush. 2 colloq. = *plushy.  plushly adv. Plushness n. [latin: related to *pile3]

Ibis  n. (pl. -es) wading bird with a curved bill, long neck, and long legs. [greek, from egyptian]

Ken  —n. Range of knowledge or sight (beyond my ken). —v. (-nn-; past and past part. Kenned or kent) scot. & n.engl. 1 recognize at sight. 2 know. [old english, = make known: related to *can1]

Quiff  n.  1 man's tuft of hair, brushed upward over the forehead. 2 curl plastered down on the forehead. [origin unknown]

Ballerina  n. Female ballet-dancer. [italian: related to *ball2]

Singlet  n. Sleeveless vest. [after doublet]

Rooster  n. Domestic cock.

Vso  abbr. Voluntary service overseas.

Aglow  predic. Adj. Glowing.

Lamina  n. (pl. -nae) thin plate or scale.  laminar adj. [latin]

Offing  n. More distant part of the sea in view.  in the offing not far away; likely to appear or happen soon. [probably from *off]

Mullah  n. Muslim learned in theology and sacred law. [ultimately arabic mawla]

Bond  —n. 1 thing or force that unites or (usu. In pl.) Restrains. 2 binding agreement. 3 commerce certificate issued by a government or a company promising to repay borrowed money at a fixed rate of interest. 4 adhesiveness. 5 law deed binding a person to make payment to another. 6 chem. Linkage between atoms in a molecule. —v. 1 hold or tie together. 2 connect or reinforce with a bond. 3 place (goods) in bond.

Cleaner  n. 1 person employed to clean rooms etc. 2 establishment for cleaning clothes etc. 3 device or substance for cleaning.  take a person to the cleaners slang 1 defraud or rob a person. 2 criticize severely.

Vermouth  n. Wine flavoured with aromatic herbs. [german: related to *wormwood]

Reprobate  n. Unprincipled or immoral person. [latin: related to *prove]

Infant  n. 1 a child during the earliest period of its life. B schoolchild below the age of seven years. 2 (esp. Attrib.) Thing in an early stage of its development. 3 law person under 18.  infancy n. [latin infans unable to speak]

Gargantuan  adj. Gigantic. [from the name gargantua, a giant in rabelais]

Aureole  n. (also aureola) 1 halo or circle of light, esp. In a religious painting. 2 corona round the sun or moon. [latin, = golden (crown)]

Model  —n. 1 representation in three dimensions of an existing person or thing or of a proposed structure, esp. On a smaller scale (often attrib.: model train). 2 simplified description of a system etc., to assist calculations and predictions. 3 figure in clay, wax, etc., to be reproduced in another material. 4 particular design or style, esp. Of a car. 5 a exemplary person or thing. B (attrib.) Ideal, exemplary. 6 person employed to pose for an artist or photographer or to wear clothes etc. For display. 7 garment etc. By a well-known designer, or a copy of this. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 a fashion or shape (a figure) in clay, wax, etc. B (foll. By after, on, etc.) Form (a thing in imitation of). 2 a  act or pose as a model. B (of a person acting as a model) display (a garment). [latin: related to *mode]

Mono  colloq. —adj. Monophonic. —n. Monophonic reproduction. [abbreviation]

Gradual  adj. 1 progressing by degrees. 2 not rapid, steep, or abrupt.  gradually adv. [latin: related to *grade]

Reverse  —v. (-sing) 1 turn the other way round or up or inside out. 2 change to the opposite character or effect. 3 (cause to) travel backwards. 4 make (an engine etc.) Work in a contrary direction. 5 revoke or annul (a decree, act, etc.). —adj. 1 backwards or upside down. 2 opposite or contrary in character or order; inverted. —n. 1 opposite or contrary (the reverse is the case). 2 contrary of the usual manner (printed in reverse). 3 piece of misfortune; disaster; defeat. 4 reverse gear or motion. 5 reverse side. 6 side of a coin etc. Bearing the secondary design. 7 verso of a printed leaf.  reverse arms hold a rifle with the butt upwards. Reverse the charges have the recipient of a telephone call pay for it.  reversal n. Reversible adj. [latin verto vers- turn]

Wastrel  n. Good-for-nothing person.

Lotus  n. 1 legendary plant inducing luxurious languor when eaten. 2 a kind of water lily etc., esp. Used symbolically in hinduism and buddhism. [greek lotos]

Mourning  n. 1 expressing of sorrow for a dead person, esp. By wearing black clothes. 2 such clothes.

Piecrust  n. Baked pastry crust of a pie.

Ogee  n. S-shaped line or moulding. [apparently from *ogive]

Stepladder  n. Short folding ladder with flat steps.

Jalousie  n. Slatted blind or shutter to keep out rain etc. And control light. [french: related to *jealousy]

Telex  (also telex) —n. International system of telegraphy by teleprinters using the public telecommunications network. —v. Send, or communicate with, by telex. [from *teleprinter, *exchange]

Lovage  n. Herb used for flavouring etc. [french levesche from latin ligusticum ligurian]

Liquefy  v. (-ies, -ied) make or become liquid.  liquefaction n. [latin: related to *liquid]

Ou  abbr. 1 open university. 2 oxford university.

Swine  n. (pl. Same) 1 formal or us pig. 2 colloq. (pl. Same or -s) a contemptible person. B unpleasant or difficult thing.  swinish adj. [old english]

Centesimal  adj. Reckoning or reckoned by hundredths. [latin centum 100]

Tiny  adj. (-ier, -iest) very small or slight.  tinily adv. Tininess n. [origin unknown]

Unblock  v. Remove an obstruction from.

Bizarre  adj. Strange; eccentric; grotesque. [french]

Memory  n. (pl. -ies) 1 faculty by which things are recalled to or kept in the mind. 2 a this in an individual (my memory is failing). B store of things remembered (deep in my memory). 3 recollection; remembrance, esp. Of a person etc.; person or thing remembered (memory of better times; his mother's memory). 4 storage capacity of a computer etc. 5 posthumous reputation (his memory lives on; of blessed memory). 6 length of remembered time of a specific person, group, etc. (within living memory). 7 remembering (deed worthy of memory).  from memory as remembered (without checking). In memory of to keep alive the remembrance of. [latin memoria from memor mindful]

Particularly  adv. 1 especially, very. 2 specifically (particularly asked for you). 3 in a particular or fastidious manner.

Math  n. Us colloq. Mathematics. [abbreviation]

Aurora  n. (pl. -s or aurorae) luminous phenomenon, usu. Of streamers of light in the night sky above the northern (aurora borealis) or southern (aurora australis) magnetic pole. [latin, = dawn, goddess of dawn]

Kraal  n. S.afr. 1 village of huts enclosed by a fence. 2 enclosure for cattle or sheep. [afrikaans from portuguese curral, of hottentot origin]

Tipple  —v. (-ling) 1 drink intoxicating liquor habitually. 2 drink (liquor) repeatedly in small amounts. —n. Colloq. Alcoholic drink.  tippler n. [origin unknown]

Piddle  v. (-ling) 1 colloq. Urinate. 2 (as piddling adj.) Colloq. Trivial; trifling. 3 (foll. By about, around) work or act in a trifling way. [origin unknown]

Swivel  —n. Coupling between two parts enabling one to revolve without turning the other. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) turn on or as on a swivel. [old english]

Damnable  adj. Hateful, annoying.  damnably adv.

Jetty  n. (pl. -ies) 1 pier or breakwater to protect or defend a harbour, coast, etc. 2 landing-pier. [french jetee: related to *jet1]

Aqua  n. The colour aquamarine. [abbreviation]

Persuasive  adj. Good at persuading.  persuasively adv. Persuasiveness n. [french or medieval latin: related to *persuade]

Regardful  adj. (foll. By of) mindful of.

Tunic  n. 1 close-fitting short coat of police or military etc. Uniform. 2 loose often sleeveless garment reaching to the knees. [latin]

Annunciation  n. 1 announcement, esp. (annunciation) that made by the angel gabriel to mary. 2 festival of this. [latin: related to *announce]

Prestige  n. 1 respect or reputation derived from achievements, power, associations, etc. 2 (attrib.) Having or conferring prestige.  prestigious adj. [latin praestigiae juggler's tricks]

Absolutism  n. Principle or practice of absolute government.  absolutist n.

Lectern  n. 1 stand for holding a book in a church etc. 2 similar stand for a lecturer etc. [latin lectrum from lego read]

Unrepeatable  adj. 1 that cannot be done, made, or said again. 2 too indecent to repeat.

Pushing  adj. 1 pushy. 2 predic. Colloq. Having nearly reached (a specified age).

Reggae  n. W. Indian style of music with a strongly accented subsidiary beat. [origin unknown]

Deleterious  adj. Harmful. [latin from greek]

Codependency  n. Addiction to a supportive role in a relationship.  codependent adj. & n.

Kitchenware  n. Cooking utensils.

Could  past of *can1. —v. Colloq. Feel inclined to (i could murder him).

Countermove  n. Move or action in opposition to another.

Conjunctive  adj. 1 serving to join. 2 gram. Of the nature of a conjunction.

Growl  —v. 1 a (often foll. By at) make a low guttural sound, usu. Of anger. B murmur angrily. 2 rumble. 3 (often foll. By out) utter with a growl. —n. 1 growling sound. 2 angry murmur. 3 rumble. [probably imitative]

Minuet  —n. 1 slow stately dance for two in triple time. 2 music for this, often as a movement in a suite etc. —v. (-t-) dance a minuet. [french diminutive]

Noblewoman  n. Peeress.

Stockjobber  n.  = *jobber 2.

Accommodation  n. 1 lodgings. 2 adjustment, adaptation. 3 convenient arrangement; settlement, compromise.

Confession  n. 1 a act of confessing. B thing confessed. 2 (in full confession of faith) declaration of one's beliefs or principles.

Flashlight  n. 1 light giving an intense flash, used for night or indoor photography. 2 us electric torch.

Titbit  n. (us tidbit) 1 dainty morsel. 2 piquant item of news etc. [perhaps from dial. Tid tender]

Absurd  adj. Wildly illogical or inappropriate; ridiculous.  absurdity n. (pl. -ies). Absurdly adv. [latin: related to *surd]

Testament  n. 1 will (esp. Last will and testament). 2 (usu. Foll. By to) evidence, proof (is testament to his loyalty). 3 bibl. A covenant, dispensation. B (testament) division of the bible (see *old testament, *new testament). [latin testamentum will: related to *testate]

Fill  —v. 1 (often foll. By with) make or become full. 2 occupy completely; spread over or through. 3 block up (a cavity in a tooth); drill and put a filling into (a decayed tooth). 4 appoint a person to hold or (of a person) hold (a post). 5 hold (an office). 6 carry out or supply (an order, commission, etc.). 7 occupy (vacant time). 8 (of a sail) be distended by wind. 9 (usu. As filling adj.) (esp. Of food) satisfy, satiate. —n. 1 as much as one wants or can bear (eat your fill). 2 enough to fill something.  fill the bill be suitable or adequate. Fill in 1 complete (a form, document, etc.). 2 a complete (a drawing etc.) Within an outline. B fill (an outline) in this way. 3 fill (a hole etc.) Completely. 4 (often foll. By for) act as a substitute. 5 occupy oneself during (spare time). 6 colloq. Inform (a person) more fully. 7 slang thrash, beat. Fill out 1 enlarge to the required size. 2 become enlarged or plump. 3 us fill in (a document etc.). Fill up 1 make or become completely full. 2 fill in (a document etc.). 3 fill the petrol tank of (a car etc.). [old english]

Stevedore  n. Person employed in loading and unloading ships. [spanish estivador]

Holography  n. The study or production of holograms.

Outbreak  n. Sudden eruption of anger, war, disease, fire, etc.

Optical  adj. 1 of sight; visual. 2 of or according to optics. 3 aiding sight.  optically adv.

Unenviable  adj. Not enviable.

Abc  n. 1 the alphabet. 2 rudiments of a subject. 3 alphabetical guide.

Separatist  n. Person who favours separation, esp. Political independence.  separatism n.

Lobbyist  n. Person who lobbies an mp etc., esp. Professionally.

Brash  adj. Vulgarly self-assertive; impudent.  brashly adv. Brashness n. [dial.]

Impudent  adj. Impertinent.  impudence n. Impudently adv. [latin pudeo be ashamed]

Errant  adj. 1 erring. 2 literary or archaic travelling in search of adventure (knight errant).  errantry n. (in sense 2). [from *err: sense 2 ultimately from latin iter journey]

Nominee  n. Person who is nominated.

Concentration  n. 1 concentrating or being concentrated. 2 mental attention. 3 something concentrated. 4 weight of a substance in a given amount of material.

Dahlia  n. Large-flowered showy garden plant. [dahl, name of a botanist]

Cymbal  n. Concave disc, struck usu. With another to make a ringing sound.  cymbalist n. [latin from greek]

Prose  —n. 1 ordinary written or spoken language not in verse. 2 passage of prose, esp. For translation into a foreign language. 3 dull or matter-of-fact quality (prose of existence). —v. (-sing) talk tediously. [latin prosa from oratio straightforward (discourse)]

Treatise  n. A written work dealing formally and systematically with a subject. [anglo-french: related to *treat]

Noon  n. Twelve o'clock in the day, midday. [latin nona (hora) ninth (hour): originally = 3 p.m.]

Repository  n. (pl. -ies) 1 place where things are stored or may be found, esp. A warehouse or museum. 2 receptacle. 3 (often foll. By of) a book, person, etc. Regarded as a store of information etc. B recipient of secrets etc. [latin: related to *repose2]

Viaduct  n. Long bridge, esp. A series of arches, carrying a road or railway across a valley or hollow. [latin via way, after *aqueduct]

Migrant  —adj. Migrating. —n. Migrant person or animal, esp. A bird.

Consist  v. 1 (foll. By of) be composed; have as ingredients. 2 (foll. By in, of) have its essential features as specified. [latin sisto stop]

Awol  abbr. Colloq. Absent without leave.

Zippy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Lively, speedy.

Snowy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of or like snow. 2 (of the weather etc.) With much snow.

Mastitis  n. Inflammation of the breast or udder. [greek mastos breast]

Dentate  adj. Bot. & zool. Toothed; with toothlike notches.

Pinhole  n. 1 hole made by a pin. 2 hole into which a peg fits.

Deputation  n. Delegation. [latin: related to *depute]

Unladylike  adj. Not ladylike.

Uncoordinated  adj. 1 not coordinated. 2 clumsy.

Unroll  v. 1 open out from a rolled-up state. 2 display or be displayed like this.

Suburb  n. Outlying district of a city. [latin urbs city]

Spindly  adj. (-ier, -iest) long or tall and thin; thin and weak.

Cru  n. 1 french vineyard or wine region. 2 grade of wine. [french crû grown]

Chrysoprase  n. Apple-green variety of chalcedony. [greek khrusos gold, prason leek]

Craze  —v. (-zing) 1 (usu. As crazed adj.) Make insane (crazed with grief). 2 produce fine surface cracks on (pottery glaze etc.); develop such cracks. —n. 1 usu. Temporary enthusiasm (craze for skateboarding). 2 object of this. [perhaps from old norse]

Joule  n. Si unit of work or energy. [joule, name of a physicist]

Definition  n. 1 a defining. B statement of the meaning of a word etc. 2 distinctness in outline, esp. Of a photographic image. [latin: related to *define]

Spoon  —n. 1 a utensil with a bowl and a handle for lifting food to the mouth, stirring, etc. B spoonful, esp. Of sugar. 2 spoon-shaped thing, esp. (in full spoon-bait) a revolving metal fish-lure. —v. 1 (often foll. By up, out) take (liquid etc.) With a spoon. 2 hit (a ball) feebly upwards. 3 colloq. Kiss and cuddle.  spoonful n. (pl. -s). [old english]

Schema  n. (pl. Schemata or -s) synopsis, outline, or diagram. [greek skhema -at- form, figure]

Underlying  pres. Part. Of *underlie.

Plangent  adj. Literary 1 loud and reverberating. 2 plaintive. [latin: related to *plaint]

Cacophony  n. (pl. -ies) harsh discordant sound.  cacophonous adj. [greek kakos bad, phone sound]

Protractor  n. Instrument for measuring angles, usu. In the form of a graduated semicircle.

Repertory  n. (pl. -ies) 1 performance of various plays for short periods by one company. 2 repertory theatres collectively. 3 store or collection, esp. Of information, instances, etc. 4 = *repertoire. [latin reperio find]

Gad  v. (-dd-) (foll. By about) go about idly or in search of pleasure. [obsolete gadling companion]

Jacobite  n. Hist. Supporter of james ii after his flight, or of the stuarts.

Rehang  v. (past and past part. Rehung) hang again or differently.

Preview  —n. Showing of a film, play, exhibition, etc., before it is seen by the general public. —v. See or show in advance.

Effuse  v. (-sing) 1 pour forth (liquid, light, etc.). 2 give out (ideas etc.). [latin fundo fus- pour]

Meta-  comb. Form 1 denoting change of position or condition (metabolism). 2 denoting position: a behind, after, or beyond (metaphysics). B of a higher or second-order kind (metalanguage). [greek meta with, after]

Celebrate  v. (-ting) 1 mark with or engage in festivities. 2 perform (a rite or ceremony). 3 praise publicly.  celebration n. Celebrator n. Celebratory adj. [latin celeber renowned]

Spadework  n. Hard preparatory work.

Inconclusive  adj. (of an argument, evidence, or action) not decisive or convincing.

Chronicle  —n. Register of events in order of occurrence. —v. (-ling) record (events) thus. [greek khronika: related to *chronic]

Evoke  v. (-king) inspire or draw forth (memories, a response, etc.).  evocation n. [latin voco call]

Mezzo  mus. —adv. Half, moderately. —n. (in full mezzo-soprano) (pl. -s) 1 female singing-voice between soprano and contralto. 2 singer with this voice. [latin medius middle]

Folkweave  n. Rough loosely woven fabric.

Chihuahua  n. Dog of a very small smooth-haired breed. [chihuahua in mexico]

Deniable  adj. That may be denied.

Conscript  —v. Summon for compulsory state (esp. Military) service. —n. Conscripted person.  conscription n. [latin scribo write]

Syringa  n. 1 = *mock orange. 2 lilac or similar related plant. [related to *syringe]

Uncover  v. 1 remove a cover or covering from. 2 disclose (uncovered the truth).

Supplicate  v. (-ting) literary 1 petition humbly to (a person) or for (a thing). 2 (foll. By to, for) make a petition.  supplicant adj. & n. Supplication n. Supplicatory adj. [latin supplico]

Fortunate  adj. 1 lucky. 2 auspicious.  fortunately adv. [latin fortunatus: related to *fortune]

Bushman  n. 1 traveller or dweller in the australian bush. 2 (bushman) member or language of a s.african aboriginal people.

Nestle  v. (-ling) 1 (often foll. By down, in, etc.) Settle oneself comfortably. 2 press oneself against another in affection etc. 3 (foll. By in, into, etc.) Push (a head or shoulder etc.) Affectionately or snugly. 4 lie half hidden or embedded. [old english]

Proselytize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) (also absol.) Convert or seek to convert from one belief etc. To another.

Percale  n. Closely woven cotton fabric. [french]

Sieve  —n. Perforated or meshed utensil for separating solids or coarse material from liquids or fine particles, or for pulping. —v. (-ving) sift. [old english]

Soli  pl. Of *solo.

Harvest  —n. 1 a process of gathering in crops etc. B season of this. 2 season's yield. 3 product of any action. —v. Gather as harvest, reap. [old english]

Transference  n. 1 transferring or being transferred. 2 psychol. Redirection of childhood emotions to a new object, esp. To a psychoanalyst.

Malay  —n. 1  member of a people predominating in malaysia and indonesia. 2  their language. —adj. Of this people or language.  malayan n. & adj.  [malay malayu]

Tourniquet  n. Device for stopping the flow of blood through an artery by constriction. [french]

Eaglet  n. Young eagle.

Conceptual  adj. Of mental conceptions or concepts.  conceptually adv.

Fat  —n. 1 natural oily or greasy substance found esp. In animal bodies. 2 part of meat etc. Containing this. —adj. (fatter, fattest) 1 corpulent; plump. 2 containing much fat. 3 fertile. 4 a thick (fat book). B substantial (fat cheque). 5 colloq. Iron. Very little; not much (a fat chance; a fat lot). —v. (-tt-) make or become fat.  the fat is in the fire trouble is imminent. Kill the fatted calf celebrate, esp. At a prodigal's return (luke 15). Live off (or on) the fat of the land live luxuriously.  fatless adj. Fatness n. Fattish adj. [old english]

Daily  —adj. Done, produced, or occurring every day or every weekday. —adv. 1 every day. 2 constantly. —n. (pl. -ies) colloq. 1 daily newspaper. 2 cleaning woman.

Deflate  v. (-ting) 1 empty (a tyre, balloon, etc.) Of air, gas, etc.; be so emptied. 2 (cause to) lose confidence or conceit. 3 a subject (a currency or economy) to deflation. B pursue this as a policy. [from *de-, *inflate]

Unconcealed  adj. Not concealed; obvious.

Amuck  var. Of *amok.

Intrude  v. (-ding) (foll. By on, upon, into) 1 come uninvited or unwanted. 2 force on a person. [latin trudo trus- thrust]

Conceited  adj. Vain.  conceitedly adv.

Periwig  n. Esp. Hist. Wig. [alteration of *peruke]

Poltergeist  n. Noisy mischievous ghost, esp. One causing physical damage. [german]

Counterpart  n. 1 person or thing like another or forming the complement or equivalent to another. 2 duplicate.

Portrait  n. 1 drawing, painting, photograph, etc. Of a person or animal, esp. Of the face. 2 description in words.  portraitist n. [french: related to *portray]

Legging  n. (usu. In pl.) 1  close-fitting knitted trousers for women or children. 2 stout protective outer covering for the lower leg.

Bionic  adj. Having electronically operated body parts or the resulting superhuman powers. [from *bio- after *electronic]

Nutcracker  n. (usu. In pl.) Device for cracking nuts.

Hybrid  —n. 1 offspring of two plants or animals of different species or varieties. 2 thing composed of diverse elements, e.g. A word with parts taken from different languages. —adj. 1 bred as a hybrid. 2 heterogeneous.  hybridism n. [latin]

Support  —v. 1 carry all or part of the weight of; keep from falling, sinking, or failing. 2 provide for (a family etc.). 3 strengthen, encourage. 4 bear out; tend to substantiate. 5 give help or approval to (a person, team, sport, etc.); further (a cause etc.). 6 speak in favour of (a resolution etc.). 7 (also absol.) Take a secondary part to (a principal actor etc.); perform a secondary act to (the main act) at a pop concert etc. —n. 1 supporting or being supported. 2 person or thing that supports. 3 secondary act at a pop concert etc. in support of so as to support. [latin porto carry]

Iguana  n. Large american, w. Indian, or pacific lizard with a dorsal crest. [spanish from carib iwana]

Forswear  v. (past forswore; past part. Forsworn) 1 abjure; renounce. 2 (as forsworn adj.) Perjured.  forswear oneself perjure oneself. [old english]

Slinky  adj. (-ier, -iest) (of a garment) close-fitting and sinuous.

Elide  v. (-ding) omit (a vowel or syllable) in pronunciation. [latin elido elis- crush out]

Scabbard  n. Hist. Sheath of a sword etc. [anglo-french]

Pineapple  n. 1 large juicy tropical fruit with yellow flesh and tough segmented skin. 2 plant bearing this. [from *pine1, *apple]

Cosine  n. Ratio of the side adjacent to an acute angle (in a right-angled triangle) to the hypotenuse.

Divulge  v. (-ging) disclose, reveal (a secret etc.).  divulgence n. [latin divulgo publish]

Temerity  n. Rashness; audacity. [latin temere rashly]

Honeydew  n. 1 sweet sticky substance excreted by aphids on leaves and stems. 2 variety of melon.

Phonic  adj. Of sound; of vocal sounds. [greek phone voice]

Whirr  —n. Continuous rapid buzz or soft clicking sound. —v. (-rr-) make this sound. [scandinavian]

Unverified  adj. Not verified.

Fervid  adj. Ardent, intense.  fervidly adv. [latin: related to *fervent]

Cladding  n. Covering or coating on a structure or material etc.

Gassy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 a of or like gas. B full of gas. 2 colloq. Verbose.

Trout  n. (pl. Same or -s) fish related to the salmon, valued as food. [latin tructa]

Ding  —v. Make a ringing sound. —n. Ringing sound. [imitative]

Wet  —adj. (wetter, wettest) 1 soaked or covered with water or other liquid. 2 (of the weather etc.) Rainy. 3 (of paint etc.) Not yet dried. 4 used with water (wet shampoo). 5 colloq. Feeble, inept. —v. (-tt-; past and past part. Wet or wetted) 1 make wet. 2 a urinate in or on (wet the bed).

Distinguished  adj. 1 eminent; famous. 2 dignified.

Profound  adj. (-er, -est) 1 having or demanding great knowledge, study, or insight (profound treatise; profound doctrines). 2 intense, unqualified, thorough (a profound sleep; profound indifference). 3 deep (profound crevasses).  profoundly adv. Profoundness n. Profundity n. (pl. -ies). [latin profundus]

Brethren  see *brother.

Countersign  —v. Add a signature to (a document already signed by another). —n. 1 password spoken to a person on guard. 2 mark used for identification etc. [italian: related to *sign]

Milky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 of, like, or mixed with milk. 2 (of a gem or liquid) cloudy; not clear.  milkiness n.

Halfway  —adv. 1 at a point midway between two others (halfway to rome). 2 to some extent, more or less (is halfway acceptable). —adj. Situated halfway (reached a halfway point).

Stockholder  n. Owner of stocks or shares.

Hacker  n. 1 person or thing that hacks or cuts roughly. 2 colloq. A person whose hobby is computing or computer programming. B person who uses a computer to gain unauthorized access to a computer network.

Person  n. 1 individual human being. 2 living body of a human being (found on my person). 3 gram. Any of three classes of personal pronouns, verb-forms, etc.: the person speaking (first person); the person spoken to (second person); the person spoken of (third person). 4 (in comb.) Used to replace -man in offices open to either sex (salesperson). 5 (in christianity) god as father, son, or holy ghost.  in person physically present. [latin: related to *persona]

Sickle  n. Short-handled tool with a semicircular blade, used for reaping etc. [old english]

Milt  n. 1 spleen in mammals. 2 sperm-filled reproductive gland or the sperm of a male fish. [old english]

Roister  v. (esp. As roistering adj.) Revel noisily; be uproarious.  roisterer n. [latin: related to *rustic]

Petrodollar  n. Notional unit of currency earned by a petroleum-exporting country.

Corkage  n. Charge made by a restaurant etc. For serving a customer's own wine etc.

Pto  abbr. Please turn over.

Whither  archaic —adv. 1 to what place or state? 2 (prec. By place etc.) To which. —conj. 1 to the or any place to which (go whither you will). 2 and thither. [old english]

Milliliter  n. (brit. -litre) one-thousandth of a litre (0.002 pint).

Cultivator  n. 1 mechanical implement for breaking up the ground etc. 2 person or thing that cultivates.

Momentary  adj. Lasting only a moment; transitory.  momentarily adv. [latin: related to *moment]

Admission  n. 1 acknowledgement (admission of error). 2 a process or right of entering. B charge for this (admission is £5).

Unskilled  adj. Lacking, or (of work) not needing, special skill or training.

Achievement  n. 1 something achieved. 2 act of achieving.

Textile  —n. 1 (often in pl.) Fabric, cloth, or fibrous material, esp. Woven. 2 fibre, yarn. —adj. 1 of weaving or cloth (textile industry). 2 woven (textile fabrics). [latin: related to *text]

Naked  adj. 1 without clothes; nude. 2 without its usual covering. 3 undisguised (the naked truth). 4 (of a light, flame, sword, etc.) Unprotected or unsheathed.  nakedly adv. Nakedness n. [old english]

Wight  n. Archaic person. [old english, = thing, creature]

Unspecific  adj. Not specific; general, inexact.

Faint  —adj. 1 indistinct, pale, dim. 2 weak or giddy. 3 slight. 4 feeble; timid. 5 (also feint) (of paper) with inconspicuous ruled lines. —v. 1 lose consciousness. 2 become faint. —n. Act or state of fainting.  faintly adv. Faintness n. [french: related to *feign]

Terrine  n. 1 pâté or similar food. 2 earthenware vessel, esp. For pâté. [latin terra earth]

Upgrade  v. (-ding) 1 raise in rank etc. 2 improve (equipment etc.).

Cozen  v. Literary 1 cheat, defraud. 2 beguile. 3 act deceitfully.  cozenage n. [cant]

Clubbable  adj. Sociable; fit for club membership.

Intolerable  adj. That cannot be endured.  intolerably adv.

Haricot  n. (in full haricot bean) variety of french bean with small white seeds dried and used as a vegetable. [french]

Produce  —v. (-cing) 1 manufacture or prepare (goods etc.). 2 bring forward for consideration, inspection, or use (will produce evidence). 3 bear, yield, or bring into existence (offspring, fruit, a harvest, etc.). 4 cause or bring about (a reaction, sensation, etc.). 5 geom. Extend or continue (a line). 6 supervise the production of (a play, film, broadcast, record, etc.). —n. 1 a what is produced, esp. Agricultural products collectively (dairy produce). B amount of this. 2 (often foll. By of) result (of labour, efforts, etc.).  producible adj. [latin duco duct- lead]

Seedling  n. Young plant raised from seed rather than from a cutting etc.

Tone  —n. 1 musical or vocal sound, esp. With reference to its pitch, quality, and strength. 2 (often in pl.) Modulation of the voice expressing a particular feeling or mood (a cheerful tone). 3 manner of expression in writing or speaking. 4 mus. A musical sound, esp. Of a definite pitch and character. B interval of a major second, e.g. C–d. 5 a general effect of colour or of light and shade in a picture. B tint or shade of a colour. 6 prevailing character of the morals and sentiments etc. In a group. 7 proper firmness of the body. 8 state of good or specified health. —v. (-ning) 1 give the desired tone to. 2 modify the tone of. 3 (often foll. By to) attune. 4 (foll. By with) (esp. Of colour) be in harmony with.  tone down make or become softer in tone. Tone up make or become stronger in tone.  toneless adj. Tonelessly adv. Toner n. [greek tonos from teino stretch]

Quicklime  n. = *lime1.

Profession  n. 1 vocation or calling, esp. Learned or scientific (medical profession). 2 people in a profession. 3 declaration or avowal.  the oldest profession colloq. Prostitution.

Revolve  v. (-ving) 1 (cause to) turn round, esp. On an axis; rotate. 2 move in a circular orbit. 3 ponder (a problem etc.) In the mind. 4 (foll. By around) have as its chief concern; be centred upon (his life revolves around his job). [latin revolvo -volut-]

Castrate  v. (-ting) 1 remove the testicles of; geld. 2 deprive of vigour.  castration n. [latin castro]

Choosy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Fastidious.  choosiness n.

Pressure  —n. 1 a exertion of continuous force on or against a body by another in contact with it. B force exerted. C amount of this (expressed by the force on a unit area) (atmospheric pressure). 2 urgency (work under pressure). 3 affliction or difficulty (under financial pressure). 4 constraining influence (put pressure on us). —v. (-ring) (often foll. By into) apply (esp. Moral) pressure to; coerce; persuade. [latin: related to *press1]

Compete  v. (-ting) 1 take part in a contest etc. 2 (often foll. By with, against a person, for a thing) strive. [latin peto seek]

Smokestack  n. 1 chimney or funnel of a locomotive or steamer. 2 tall chimney.

Hydrocephalus  n. Accumulated fluid in the brain, esp. In young children.  hydrocephalic adj. [greek kephale head]

Leaves  pl. Of *leaf.

Inadmissible  adj. That cannot be admitted or allowed.  inadmissibility n. Inadmissibly adv.

Fab  adj. Colloq. Fabulous, marvellous. [abbreviation]

Sill  n. Slab of stone, wood, or metal at the foot of a window or doorway. [old english]

Re  abbr. 1  religious education. 2 royal engineers.

Lutenist  n. (also lutanist) lute-player. [related to *lute1]

Elasticated  adj. (of fabric) made elastic by weaving with rubber thread.

Homey  adj. (also homy) (-mier, -miest) suggesting home; cosy.

Mikado  n. (pl. -s) hist. Emperor of japan. [japanese, = august door]

Flutter  —v. 1 flap (the wings) in flying or trying to fly. 2 fall quiveringly (fluttered to the ground). 3 wave or flap quickly. 4 move about restlessly. 5 (of a pulse etc.) Beat feebly or irregularly. —n. 1 act of fluttering. 2 tremulous excitement (caused a flutter). 3 slang small bet, esp. On a horse. 4 abnormally rapid heartbeat. 5 rapid variation of pitch, esp. Of recorded sound. [old english]

Edelweiss  n. Alpine plant with white flowers. [german, = noble-white]

Overbear  v. (past -bore; past part. -borne) 1 (as overbearing adj.) A domineering, bullying. B overpowering. 2 bear down by weight, force, or emotion. 3 repress by power or authority.

Archean  (brit. Archaean) —adj. Of the earliest geological era. —n. This time. [greek arkhaios ancient]

Lord  —n. 1 master or ruler. 2 hist. Feudal superior, esp. Of a manor. 3 peer of the realm or person with the title lord. 4 (lord) (often prec. By the) god or christ. 5 (lord) a prefixed as the designation of a marquis, earl, viscount, or baron, or (to the christian name) of the younger son of a duke or marquis. B (the lords) = *house of lords. —int. (lord, good lord, etc.) Expressing surprise, dismay, etc.  lord it over domineer. [old english, = bread-keeper: related to *loaf1, *ward]

Witty  adj. (-ier, -iest) showing esp. Verbal wit.  wittily adv. Wittiness n. [old english: related to *wit]

Motherly  adj. Kind or tender like a mother.  motherliness n.

Cornice  n. Ornamental moulding, esp. Round a room just below the ceiling or as the topmost part of an entablature. [french from italian]

Compline  n. 1 last of the canonical hours of prayer. 2 service during this. [latin: related to *comply]

Underweight  —adj. Below normal weight. —n. Insufficient weight.

Maker  n. 1 person who makes. 2 (maker) god.

Apologize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make an apology, express regret.

Saint  —n. (abbr. St or s; pl. Sts or ss) 1 holy or (in some churches) formally canonized person regarded as worthy of special veneration. 2 very virtuous person. —v. (as sainted adj.) Saintly.  sainthood n. Saintlike adj. [latin sanctus holy]

Saddle  —n. 1 seat of leather etc. Strapped on a horse etc. For riding. 2 bicycle etc. Seat. 3 joint of meat consisting of the two loins. 4 ridge rising to a summit at each end. —v. (-ling) 1 put a saddle on (a horse etc.). 2 (foll. By with) burden (a person) with a task etc.  in the saddle 1 mounted. 2 in office or control. [old english]

Antiknock  n. Substance added to motor fuel to prevent premature combustion.

Liege  usu. Hist. —adj. Entitled to receive, or bound to give, feudal service or allegiance. —n. 1 (in full liege lord) feudal superior or sovereign. 2 (usu. In pl.) Vassal, subject. [medieval latin laeticus, probably from germanic]

Shoehorn  n. Curved implement for easing the heel into a shoe.

Cross  —n. 1 upright post with a transverse bar, as used in antiquity for crucifixion. 2 a (the cross) cross on which christ was crucified. B representation of this as an emblem of christianity. C = *sign of the cross. 3 staff surmounted by a cross, carried in a religious procession. 4 thing or mark like a cross, esp. Two short intersecting lines (+ or x). 5 cross-shaped military etc. Decoration. 6 a hybrid. B crossing of breeds etc. 7 (foll. By between) mixture of two things. 8  crosswise movement, pass in football, etc. 9 trial or affliction. —v. 1 (often foll. By over) go across. 2 intersect; (cause to) be across (roads cross; cross one's legs). 3 a draw line(s) across. B mark (a cheque) with two parallel lines to indicate that it cannot be cashed. 4 (foll. By off, out, through) cancel etc. By drawing lines across. 5 (often refl.) Make the sign of the cross on or over. 6 a pass in opposite or different directions. B (of letters etc.) Be sent at the same time. C (of telephone lines) be connected to an unwanted conversation. 7 a cause to interbreed. B cross-fertilize (plants). 8 oppose or thwart (crossed in love). —adj. 1 (often foll. By with) peevish, angry. 2 (usu. Attrib.) Transverse; reaching from side to side. 3 (usu. Attrib.) Intersecting. 4 (usu. Attrib.) Contrary, opposed, reciprocal.  at cross purposes misunderstanding; conflicting. Cross one's fingers (or keep one's fingers crossed) 1 put one finger across another to ward off bad luck. 2 trust in good luck. Cross one's heart make a solemn pledge, esp. By crossing one's front. Cross one's mind occur to one, esp. Transiently. Cross swords (often foll. By with) argue or dispute. Cross wires (or get one's wires crossed) 1 become wrongly connected by telephone. 2 have a misunderstanding. On the cross diagonally.  crossly adv. Crossness n. [latin crux]

Hydrogen  n. Tasteless odourless gas, the lightest element, occurring in water and all organic compounds.  hydrogenous adj. [french: related to *hydro-, *-gen]

Inapplicable  adj. (often foll. By to) not applicable or relevant.  inapplicability n.

Winepress  n. Press in which grapes are squeezed in making wine.

Fallacy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 mistaken belief. 2 faulty reasoning; misleading argument.  fallacious adj. [latin fallo deceive]

Resonant  adj. 1 (of sound) echoing, resounding; continuing to sound; reinforced or prolonged by reflection or vibration. 2 (of a body, room, etc.) Tending to reinforce or prolong sounds, esp. By vibration. 3 (often foll. By with) (of a place) resounding.  resonance n. [latin: related to *resound]

Religion  n. 1 belief in a superhuman controlling power, esp. In a personal god or gods entitled to obedience and worship. 2 expression of this in worship. 3 particular system of faith and worship. 4 life under monastic vows. 5 thing that one is devoted to. [latin religio bond]

Disarmament  n. Reduction by a state of its armaments.

Awhile  adv. For a short time. [a while]

Scarcity  n. (pl. -ies) (often foll. By of) lack or shortage, esp. Of food.

Intermix  v. Mix together.

Web  n. 1 a woven fabric. B amount woven in one piece. 2 complex series (web of lies). 3 cobweb, gossamer, or a similar product of a spinning creature. 4 membrane between the toes of a swimming animal or bird. 5 large roll of paper used in printing. 6 thin flat connecting part in machinery etc.  webbed adj. [old english]

Flame  —n. 1 a ignited gas. B portion of this (flame flickered; burst into flames). 2 a bright light or colouring. B brilliant orange-red colour. 3 a strong passion, esp. Love (fan the flame). B colloq. Sweetheart. —v. (-ming) 1 (often foll. By away, forth, out, up) burn; blaze. 2 (often foll. By out, up) a (of passion) break out. B (of a person) become angry. 3 shine or glow like flame. [latin flamma]

Tamp  v. Ram down hard or tightly. [tampion stopper for gun-muzzle, from french tampon]

Immense  adj. 1 extremely large; huge. 2 considerable (immense difference).  immenseness n. Immensity n. [latin metior mens- measure]

Hominoid  —adj. Like a human. —n. Animal resembling a human.

Tidbit  n. (brit. Titbit) 1 dainty morsel. 2 piquant item of news etc. [perhaps from dial. Tid tender]

Relay  —n. 1 fresh set of people etc. Substituted for tired ones. 2 supply of material similarly used. 3 = *relay race. 4 device activating an electric circuit etc. In response to changes affecting itself. 5 a device to receive, reinforce, and transmit a message, broadcast, etc. B relayed message or transmission. —v. Receive (a message, broadcast, etc.) And transmit it to others. [french relai from latin laxo: see *lax]

Offence  n. (us offense) 1 illegal act; transgression. 2 upsetting of feelings, insult; umbrage (give offence; take offence). 3 aggressive action. [related to *offend]

Stoneground  adj. (of flour) ground with millstones.

Callosity  n. (pl. -ies) area of hard thick skin. [latin: related to *callous]

Adamant  adj. Stubbornly resolute; unyielding.  adamantly adv. [greek adamas adamant- untameable]

Consume  v. (-ming) 1 eat or drink. 2 destroy. 3 preoccupy, possess (consumed with rage). 4 use up.  consumable adj. & n. [latin consumo -sumpt-]

Charioteer  n. Chariot-driver.

Remote  adj. (remoter, remotest) 1 far away, far apart, distant. 2 isolated; secluded. 3 distantly related (remote ancestor). 4 slight, faint (a remote hope; not the remotest chance). 5 aloof; not friendly.  remotely adv. Remoteness n. [latin remotus: related to *remove]

Carcinogen  n. Substance producing cancer.  carcinogenic adj. [related to *carcinoma]

Unconstrained  adj. Not constrained or compelled.

Lordship  n. 1 (usu. Lordship) title used in addressing or referring to a man with the rank of lord (your lordship; his lordship). 2 (foll. By over) dominion, rule.

Unpracticed  adj. (brit. Unpractised) 1 not experienced or skilled. 2 not put into practice.

Nibble  —v. (-ling) 1 (foll. By at) a take small bites at. B take cautious interest in. 2 eat in small amounts. 3 bite at gently, cautiously, or playfully. —n. 1 act of nibbling. 2 very small amount of food. [low german or dutch]

Diagram  n. Outline drawing, plan, or graphic representation of a machine, structure, process, etc.  diagrammatic adj. Diagrammatically adv. [greek: related to *-gram]

Incorporeal  adj. Without physical or material existence.  incorporeally adv. Incorporeity n.

Reapply  v. (-ies, -ied) apply again, esp. Submit a further application (for a position etc.).  reapplication n.

Abta  abbr. Association of british travel agents.

Nous  n. 1 colloq. Common sense; gumption. 2 philos. Mind, intellect. [greek]

Chromium  n. Metallic element used as a shiny decorative or protective coating.

Pascal  n. 1  si unit of pressure. 2 (pascal) computing programming language used esp. In education. [pascal, name of a scientist]

Solenoid  n. Cylindrical coil of wire acting as a magnet when carrying electric current. [french from greek solen tube]

Therefore  adv. For that reason; accordingly, consequently.

Livable  var. Of *liveable.

Synovia  n. Physiol. Viscous fluid lubricating joints etc.  synovial adj. [medieval latin]

Indulgence  n. 1 indulging or being indulgent. 2 thing indulged in. 3 rc ch. Remission of punishment still due after absolution. 4 privilege granted.

Mitigate  v. (-ting) make less intense or severe.  mitigation n. [latin mitis mild]

Flay  v. 1 strip the skin or hide off, esp. By beating. 2 criticize severely. 3 peel off (skin, bark, peel, etc.). 4 extort money etc. From. [old english]

Moneylender  n. Person who lends money at interest.

Manservant  n. (pl. Menservants) male servant.

Undetected  adj. Not detected.

Insobriety  n. Intemperance, esp. In drinking.

Trawl  —v. 1 fish with a trawl or seine. 2 a catch by trawling. B (often foll. By through) search thoroughly (trawled her memory for their names). —n. 1 act of trawling. 2 (in full trawl-net) large wide-mouthed fishing-net dragged by a boat along the sea bottom. [probably dutch traghel drag-net]

Decision  n. 1 act or process of deciding. 2 resolution made after consideration (made my decision). 3 (often foll. By of) a settlement of a question. B formal judgement. 4 resoluteness. [latin: related to *decide]

Cage  —n. 1 structure of bars or wires, esp. For confining animals or birds. 2 similar open framework, esp. A lift in mine etc. —v. (-ging) place or keep in a cage. [latin cavea]

Gnome  n. 1 a dwarfish legendary spirit or goblin living underground. B figure of this as a garden ornament. 2 (esp. In pl.) Colloq. Person with sinister influence, esp. Financial (gnomes of zurich).  gnomish adj. [french]

Guideline  n. Principle directing action.

Colt  n. 1 young male horse. 2 sport inexperienced player.  coltish adj. [old english]

Halm  var. Of *haulm.

Related  adj. Connected, esp. By blood or marriage.

Chiropody  n. Treatment of the feet and their ailments.  chiropodist n. [greek pous podos foot]

Fulmar  n. Arctic sea bird related to the petrel. [old norse: related to *foul, mar gull]

Catchy  adj. (-ier, -iest) (of a tune) easy to remember, attractive.

Zilch  n. Esp. Us slang nothing. [origin uncertain]

Finalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) put into final form; complete.  finalization n.

Mongolism  n. = *down's syndrome.
