Usage  the term down's syndrome is now preferred.

Conger  n. (in full conger eel) large marine eel. [greek goggros]

Maquis  n. (pl. Same) 1 french resistance movement during the german occupation (1940–45). 2 member of this. [french, = brushwood]

Overate  past of *overeat.

Unlatch  v. 1 release the latch of. 2 open in this way.

Weighting  n. Extra allowance paid in special cases.

Birthright  n. Inherited, esp. Property, rights.

Undetectable  adj. Not detectable.

Centipede  n. Arthropod with a segmented wormlike body and many legs. [latin pes ped- foot]

Remembrance  n. 1 remembering or being remembered. 2 a memory or recollection. 3 keepsake, souvenir. 4 (in pl.) Greetings conveyed through a third person. [french: related to *remember]

Legend  n. 1 a traditional story; myth. B these collectively. 2 colloq. Famous or remarkable event or person. 3 inscription. 4 explanation on a map etc. Of symbols used. [latin legenda what is to be read]

Underhand  adj. 1 deceitful; crafty; secret. 2 sport, esp. Cricket underarm.

Mesozoic  —adj. Of the geological era marked by the development of dinosaurs, and the first mammals, birds, and flowering plants. —n. This era. [greek zoion animal]

Onscreen  adj. & adv. Within the range of a film camera etc; when being filmed.

Doorbell  n. Bell on a door rung by visitors to signal arrival.

Equine  adj. Of or like a horse. [latin equus horse]

Tablespoon  n. 1 large spoon for serving food. 2 amount held by this.  tablespoonful n. (pl. -s).

Twang  —n. 1 sound made by a plucked string or released bowstring. 2 nasal quality of a voice. —v. (cause to) emit this sound.  twangy adj. [imitative]

Breadcrumb  n. Small fragment of bread, esp. (in pl.) For use in cooking.

Choir  n. 1 regular group of singers, esp. In a church. 2 part of a cathedral or large church between the altar and nave. [latin: related to *chorus]

Circumcise  v. (-sing) cut off the foreskin or clitoris of.  circumcision n. [latin caedo cut]

Newsprint  n. Low-quality paper on which newspapers are printed.

Peritoneum  n. (pl. -s or -nea) membrane lining the cavity of the abdomen.  peritoneal adj. [greek peritonos stretched around]

Signalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 make noteworthy or remarkable. 2 indicate.

Goon  n. Slang 1 stupid person. 2 esp. Us ruffian hired by racketeers etc. [origin uncertain]

Retying  pres. Part. Of *retie.

Triceratops  n. Dinosaur with three sharp horns on the forehead and a wavy-edged collar round the neck. [greek, = three-horned face]

Rummage  —v. (-ging) 1 search, esp. Unsystematically. 2 (foll. By out, up) find among other things. —n. Rummaging. [french arrumage from arrumer stow cargo]

Altitude  n. Height, esp. Of an object above sea level or above the horizon. [latin altus high]

Reprimand  —n. (esp. Official) rebuke. —v. Administer this to. [latin: related to *repress]

Large  adj. 1 of relatively great size or extent. 2 of the larger kind (large intestine). 3 comprehensive. 4 pursuing an activity on a large scale (large farmer).  at large 1 at liberty. 2 as a body or whole. 3 at full length, with all details.  largeness n. Largish adj. [latin largus copious]

Neigh  —n. Cry of a horse. —v. Make a neigh. [old english]

Basal  adj. Of, at, or forming a base.

Suzerain  n. 1 hist. Feudal overlord. 2 archaic sovereign or state partially controlling another state that is internally autonomous.  suzerainty n. [french]

Flier  var. Of *flyer.

Parasite  n. 1 organism living in or on another and feeding on it. 2 person exploiting another or others.  parasitic adj. Parasitically adv. Parasitism n. [greek: related to *para-1, sitos food]

Fireclay  n. Clay used to make fire-bricks.

Portuguese  —n. (pl. Same) 1 a native or national of portugal. B person of portuguese descent. 2 language of portugal. —adj. Of portugal, its people, or language. [medieval latin]

Exordium  n. (pl. -s or -dia) introductory part, esp. Of a discourse or treatise. [latin exordior begin]

Affliction  n. 1 distress, suffering. 2 cause of this.

Partook  past of *partake.

Bard  n. 1 poet. Poet. 2 a hist. Celtic minstrel. B prizewinner at an eisteddfod.  bardic adj. [celtic]

Tervalent  adj. Having a valency of three. [from *tercentenary, *valence1]

People  —n.pl. Except in sense 2. 1 persons in general or of a specified kind (people don't like rudeness; famous people). 2 persons composing a community, tribe, race, nation, etc. (a warlike people; peoples of the commonwealth). 3 (the people) a the mass of people in a country etc. Not having special rank or position. B these as an electorate. 4 parents or other relatives (my people disapprove). 5 a subjects, armed followers, etc. B congregation of a parish priest etc. —v. (-ling) (usu. Foll. By with) 1 fill with people, animals, etc.; populate. 2 (esp. As peopled adj.) Inhabit. [latin populus]

Negligence  n. 1 lack of proper care and attention. 2 culpable carelessness.  negligent adj. Negligently adv. [latin: related to *neglect]

Air  —n. 1 mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen surrounding the earth. 2 earth's atmosphere; open space in it; this as a place for flying aircraft. 3 a distinctive impression or manner (air of mystery). B (esp. In pl.) Pretentiousness (gave himself airs). 4 tune. 5 light wind. —v. 1 expose (clothes, a room, etc.) To fresh air or warmth to remove damp. 2 express and discuss publicly (an opinion, question, grievance, etc.).  by air by or in an aircraft. In the air 1 (of opinions etc.) Prevalent. 2 (of plans etc.) Uncertain. On (or off) the air being (or not being) broadcast. [greek aer]

Maize  n. 1 cereal plant of n. America. 2 cobs or grain of this. [french or spanish]

Newsflash  n. Single item of important news, broadcast urgently and often interrupting other programmes.

Flageolet  n. Small flute blown at the end. [french from provençal]

Disgorge  v. (-ging) 1 eject from the throat. 2 pour forth.  disgorgement n.

Quantitative  adj. 1 of quantity as opposed to quality. 2 measured or measurable by quantity.

Approval  n. 1 approving. 2 consent; favourable opinion.  on approval (of goods supplied) returnable if not satisfactory.

Glimmer  —v. Shine faintly or intermittently. —n. 1 feeble or wavering light. 2 (also glimmering) (usu. Foll. By of) small sign (of hope etc.). [probably scandinavian]

Ruin  —n. 1 destroyed, wrecked, or spoiled state. 2 downfall or elimination (ruin of my hopes). 3 complete loss of one's property or position (bring to ruin). 4 (in sing. Or pl.) Remains of a building etc. That has suffered ruin. 5 cause of ruin (the ruin of us). —v. 1 a bring to ruin (extravagance has ruined me). B spoil, damage. 2 (esp. As ruined adj.) Reduce to ruins.  in ruins completely wrecked (hopes were in ruins). [latin ruo fall]

Mews  n. (treated as sing.) Stabling round a yard etc., now used esp. For housing. [originally sing. Mew ‘cage for hawks’: french from latin muto change]

Silica  n. Silicon dioxide, occurring as quartz etc. And as a main constituent of sandstone and other rocks.  siliceous adj. [latin silex -lic- flint]

Converge  v. (-ging) 1 come together or towards the same point. 2 (foll. By on, upon) approach from different directions.  convergence n. Convergent adj. [latin vergo incline]

Sentimental  adj. 1 of or showing sentiment. 2 showing or affected by emotion rather than reason.  sentimentalism n. Sentimentalist n. Sentimentality n. Sentimentalize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). Sentimentally adv.

Cicerone  n. (pl. -roni pronunc. Same) person who guides sightseers. [latin cicero, name of a roman statesman]

Gripe  —v. (-ping) 1 colloq. Complain. 2 affect with gastric pain. —n. 1 (usu. In pl.) Colic. 2 colloq. Complaint. 3 grip, clutch. [old english]

Monastery  n. (pl. -ies) residence of a community of monks. [latin monasterium from greek monazo alone]

Kindness  n. 1 being kind. 2 kind act.

Laughable  adj. Ludicrous; amusing.  laughably adv.

Market  —n. 1 gathering of buyers and sellers of provisions, livestock, etc. 2 space for this. 3 (often foll. By for) demand for a commodity etc. (no market for sheds). 4 place or group providing such a demand. 5 conditions etc. For buying or selling; rate of purchase and sale (market is sluggish). 6 = *stock market. —v. (-t-) 1 offer for sale, esp. By advertising etc. 2 archaic buy or sell goods in a market.  be in the market for wish to buy. Be on the market be offered for sale. Put on the market offer for sale.  marketer n. Marketing n. [latin mercor buy]

Bq  abbr. Becquerel.

Eager  adj. Keen, enthusiastic (eager to learn; eager for news).  eagerly adv. Eagerness n. [latin acer keen]

Encounter  —v. 1 meet unexpectedly. 2 meet as an adversary. —n. Meeting by chance or in conflict. [latin contra against]

Efta  n. (also efta) european free trade association. [abbreviation]

Ratatouille  n. Dish of stewed onions, courgettes, tomatoes, aubergines, and peppers. [french dial.]

Flak  n. 1 anti-aircraft fire. 2 adverse criticism; abuse. [german, fliegerabwehrkanone, ‘aviator-defence-gun’]

Affix  —v. 1 attach, fasten. 2 add in writing. —n. 1 addition. 2 gram. Prefix or suffix. [latin: related to *fix]

Signpost  —n. 1 post on a road etc. Indicating direction etc. 2 indication, guide. —v. Provide with a signpost or signposts.

Entangle  v. (-ling) 1 catch or hold fast in a snare, tangle, etc. 2 involve in difficulties. 3 complicate.  entanglement n.

Concretion  n. 1 hard solid mass. 2 forming of this by coalescence. [latin: related to *concrete]

Imbroglio  n. (pl. -s) 1 confused or complicated situation. 2 confused heap. [italian: related to *in-2, *broil]

Chastise  v. (-sing) 1 rebuke severely. 2 punish, esp. By beating.  chastisement n.

Disk  var. Of *disc (esp. Us & computing).

Ridgeway  n. Road or track along a ridge.

Predilection  n. (often foll. By for) preference or special liking. [latin praediligo prefer]

Curd  n. (often in pl.) Coagulated acidic milk product made into cheese or eaten as food. [origin unknown]

Carioca  n. 1 brazilian dance like the samba. 2 music for this. [portuguese]

Viscountess  n. 1 viscount's wife or widow. 2 woman holding the rank of viscount.

Pudendum  n. (pl. Pudenda) (usu. In pl.) Genitals, esp. Of a woman. [latin pudeo be ashamed]

Unambitious  adj. Not ambitious.

Coastline  n. Line of the seashore, esp. With regard to its shape.

Dough  n. 1 thick mixture of flour etc. And liquid for baking. 2 slang money.  doughy adj. (-ier, -iest). [old english]

Premarital  adj. Existing or (esp. Of sexual relations) occurring before marriage.

Accident  n. 1 unfortunate esp. Harmful event, caused unintentionally. 2 event that is unexpected or without apparent cause.  by accident unintentionally. [latin cado fall]

Conceit  n. 1 personal vanity; pride. 2 literary a far-fetched comparison. B fanciful notion. [from *conceive]

Dal  var. Of *dhal.

Fertilizer  n. (also -iser) substance added to soil to make it more fertile.

Mastectomy  n. (pl. -ies) surgical removal of a breast. [greek mastos breast]

Lecher  n. Lecherous man. [french lechier live in debauchery]

Whirligig  n. 1 spinning or whirling toy. 2 merry-go-round. 3 revolving motion.

Factor  n. 1 circumstance etc. Contributing to a result. 2 whole number etc. That when multiplied with another produces a given number. 3 a business agent. B scot. Land-agent, steward. C agent, deputy. [latin: related to *fact]

Charm  —n. 1 power or quality of delighting, arousing admiration, or influencing; fascination, attractiveness. 2 trinket on a bracelet etc. 3 object, act, or word(s) supposedly having magic power. —v. 1 delight, captivate. 2 influence or protect as if by magic (a charmed life). 3 obtain or gain by charm (charmed his way into the bbc).  charmer n. [latin carmen song]

Fruity  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 a of fruit. B tasting or smelling like fruit. 2 (of a voice etc.) Deep and rich. 3 colloq. Slightly indecent or suggestive.  fruitily adv. Fruitiness n.

Classy  adj. (-ier, -iest) colloq. Superior, stylish.  classily adv. Classiness n.

Villainy  n. (pl. -ies) wicked behaviour or act. [french: related to *villain]

Stratigraphy  n. Geol. & archaeol. 1 relative position of strata. 2 the study of this.  stratigraphic adj. [from *stratum]

Ax  (brit. Axe) —n. 1 chopping-tool with a handle and heavy blade. 2 (the ax) dismissal (of employees); abandonment of a project etc. —v. (axing) cut (esp. Costs or staff) drastically; abandon (a project).  an ax to grind private ends to serve. [old english]

Sweetbread  n. Pancreas or thymus of an animal, esp. As food.

Quarter  —n. 1 each of four equal parts into which a thing is divided. 2 period of three months. 3 point of time 15 minutes before or after any hour. 4 a 25 us or canadian cents. B coin for this. 5 part of a town, esp. As occupied by a particular class (residential quarter). 6 a point of the compass. B region at this. 7 direction, district, or source of supply (help from any quarter). 8 (in pl.) A lodgings. B accommodation of troops etc. 9 a one fourth of a lunar month. B moon's position between the first and second (first quarter) or third and fourth (last quarter) of these. 10 a each of the four parts into which a carcass is divided. B (in pl.) = *hindquarters. 11 mercy towards an enemy etc. On condition of surrender. 12 a grain measure equivalent to 8 bushels. B one-fourth of a hundredweight. C colloq. One-fourth of a pound weight. 13 each of four divisions on a shield. —v. 1 divide into quarters. 2 hist. Divide (the body of an executed person) in this way. 3 a put (troops etc.) Into quarters. B provide with lodgings. 4 heraldry place (coats of arms) on the four quarters of a shield. [latin quartarius: related to *quart]

Titled  adj. Having a title of nobility or rank.

Jacinth  n. Reddish-orange zircon used as a gem. [latin: related to *hyacinth]

Anatomy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 science of animal or plant structure. 2 such a structure. 3 analysis.  anatomical adj. Anatomist n. [greek ana- up, temno cut]

Flake  —n. 1 small thin light piece of snow etc. 2 thin broad piece peeled or split off. 3 dogfish etc. As food. —v. (-king) (often foll. By away, off) 1 take off or come away in flakes. 2 sprinkle with or fall in flakes.  flake out colloq. Fall asleep or drop from exhaustion; faint. [origin unknown]

Barbiturate  n. Soporific or sedative drug from barbituric acid. [german, from the name barbara]

Entitle  v. (-ling) 1 (usu. Foll. By to) give (a person) a just claim or right. 2 give a title to.  entitlement n. [latin: related to *title]

Spectroscope  n. Instrument for recording spectra for examination.  spectroscopic adj. Spectroscopy n.

Jamboree  n. 1 celebration. 2 large rally of scouts. [origin unknown]

Riposte  —n. 1 quick retort. 2 quick return thrust in fencing. —v. (-ting) deliver a riposte. [italian: related to *respond]

Overprotective  adj. Excessively protective.

Nonetheless  adv. (also none the less) nevertheless.

Succubus  n. (pl. -buses or -bi) female demon formerly believed to have sexual intercourse with sleeping men. [latin, = prostitute]

Thulium  n. Metallic element of the lanthanide series. [latin thule region in the remote north]

Slog  —v. (-gg-) 1 hit hard and usu. Wildly. 2 work or walk doggedly. —n. 1 hard random hit. 2 a hard steady work or walk. B spell of this. [origin unknown]

Zoom  —v. 1 move quickly, esp. With a buzzing sound. 2 cause an aeroplane to mount at high speed and a steep angle. 3 (often foll. By in or in on) (of a camera) change rapidly from a long shot to a close-up (of). 4 (of prices etc.) Rise sharply. —n. 1 aeroplane's steep climb. 2 zooming camera shot. [imitative]

Truncheon  n. Short club carried by a police officer. [french tronchon stump: related to *trunk]

Mid  attrib. Adj. (usu. In comb.) The middle of (mid-air; mid-june). [old english]

Moan  —n. 1 long murmur expressing physical or mental suffering or pleasure. 2 low plaintive sound of wind etc. 3 colloq. Complaint; grievance. —v. 1 make a moan or moans. 2 colloq. Complain, grumble. 3 utter with moans.  moaner n. [old english]

Singsong  —n. Informal singing party. —adj. Monotonously rising and falling. [from *sing, *song]

Carafe  n. Glass container for water or wine. [french from arabic]

Mistook  past of *mistake.

Perimeter  n. 1 a circumference or outline of a closed figure. B length of this. 2 outer boundary of an enclosed area. [greek: related to *-meter]

Woman  n. (pl. Women) 1 adult human female. 2 the female sex. 3 colloq. Wife or girlfriend. 4 (prec. By the) feminine characteristics (brought out the woman in him). 5 (attrib.) Female (woman doctor). 6 (in comb.) Woman of a specified nationality, skill, etc. (englishwoman; horsewoman). 7 colloq. Charwoman. [old english]

Roller  n. 1 a revolving cylinder for smoothing, spreading, crushing, stamping, hanging a towel on, etc., used alone or in a machine. B cylinder for diminishing friction when moving a heavy object. 2 small cylinder on which hair is rolled for setting. 3 long swelling wave.

Crampoon  n. (brit. Crampon) (usu. In pl.) Spiked iron plate fixed to a boot for climbing on ice. [french: related to *cramp]

Infuriate  v. Make furious; irritate greatly.  infuriating adj. Infuriatingly adv. [medieval latin: related to *fury]

Tabernacle  n. 1 hist. Tent used as a sanctuary by the israelites during the exodus. 2 niche or receptacle, esp. For the eucharistic elements. 3 nonconformist meeting-house. [latin: related to *tavern]

Defend  v. (also absol.) 1 (often foll. By against, from) resist an attack made on; protect. 2 uphold by argument. 3 conduct a defence in a lawsuit. 4 compete to retain (a title etc.) In a contest.  defender n. [latin defendo -fens-]

Factorize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) resolve into factors.  factorization n.

Parenting  n. (skill of) bringing up children.

Flagellate  v. (-ting) scourge, flog.  flagellation n.

Diptych  n. Painting, esp. An altarpiece, on two hinged panels closing like a book. [greek, = pair of writing-tablets, from ptukhe fold]

Mellifluous  adj. (of a voice etc.) Pleasing, musical, flowing.  mellifluously adv. Mellifluousness n. [latin mel honey, fluo flow]

Pointer  n. 1 thing that points, e.g. The index hand of a gauge. 2 rod for pointing to features on a chart etc. 3 colloq. Hint. 4 dog of a breed that on scenting game stands rigid looking towards it. 5 (in pl.) Two stars in the great bear in line with the pole star.

Handkerchief  n. (pl. -s or -chieves) square of cloth for wiping one's nose etc.

Evanescent  adj. Quickly fading.  evanescence n.

Impassible  adj. 1 impassive. 2 incapable of feeling, emotion, or injury.  impassibility n. Impassibly adv. [latin patior pass- suffer]

Zither  n. Stringed instrument with a flat soundbox, placed horizontally and played with the fingers and a plectrum. [latin: related to *guitar]

Alkane  n. Chem. Saturated aliphatic hydrocarbon having the general formula cnh2n+2, including methane and ethane.

Playfellow  n. Playmate.

Pettifog  v. (-gg-) 1 practise legal trickery. 2 quibble or wrangle about trivial points. [origin unknown]

Strange  adj. 1 unusual, peculiar, surprising, eccentric. 2 (often foll. By to) unfamiliar, foreign. 3 (foll. By to) unaccustomed. 4 not at ease.  strangely adv. Strangeness n. [french estrange from latin extraneus]

Indignity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 humiliating treatment or quality. 2 insult.

Chamberlain  n. 1 officer managing a royal or noble household. 2 treasurer of a corporation etc. [germanic: related to *chamber]

Charlatan  n. Person falsely claiming knowledge or skill.  charlatanism n. [italian, = babbler]

Knowing  adj. 1 suggesting that one has inside information (a knowing look). 2 showing knowledge; shrewd.

Ag  symb. Silver. [latin argentum]

Archaic  adj. 1 a antiquated. B (of a word etc.) No longer in ordinary use. 2 of an early period of culture.  archaically adv. [greek arkhe beginning]

Rotation  n. 1 rotating or being rotated. 2 recurrence; recurrent series or period; regular succession. 3 the growing of different crops in regular order to avoid exhausting the soil.  rotational adj.

Gunrunner  n. Person engaged in the illegal sale or importing of firearms.  gunrunning n.

Intervention  n. 1 intervening. 2 interference, esp. By a state. 3 mediation.

Radioactivity  n. Spontaneous disintegration of atomic nuclei, with the emission of usu. Penetrating radiation or particles.

Peatbog  n. Bog composed of peat.

Repot  v. (-tt-) move (a plant) to another, esp. Larger, pot.

Calumny  n. (pl. -ies) slander; malicious representation.  calumnious adj. [latin]

Shammy  n. (pl. -ies) (in full shammy leather) colloq. = *chamois 2. [representing corrupted pronunciation]

Sluice  —n. 1 (also sluice-gate, sluice-valve) sliding gate or other contrivance for regulating the volume or flow of water. 2 water so regulated. 3 (sluice-way) artificial water-channel, esp. For washing ore. 4 place for rinsing. 5 act of rinsing. —v. (-cing) 1 provide or wash with a sluice or sluices. 2 rinse, esp. With running water. 3 (foll. By out, away) wash out or away with a flow of water. 4 (of water) rush out (as if) from a sluice. [french escluse]

Slop  —v. (-pp-) 1 (often foll. By over) spill over the edge of a vessel. 2 wet (the floor etc.) By slopping. —n. 1 liquid spilled or splashed. 2 sloppy language. 3 (in pl.) Dirty waste water or wine etc. From a kitchen, bedroom, or prison vessels. 4 (in sing. Or pl.) Unappetizing weak liquid food.  slop about move about in a slovenly manner. Slop out carry slops out (in prison etc.). [old english]

Suite  n. 1 set, esp. Of rooms in a hotel etc. Or a sofa and armchairs. 2 mus. Set of instrumental pieces performed as a unit. [french: related to *suit]

Sympathy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a sharing of another's feelings. B capacity for this. 2 a (often foll. By with) sharing or tendency to share (with a person etc.) In an emotion, sensation, or condition. B (in sing. Or pl.) Compassion or commiseration; condolences. 3 (often foll. By for) approval. 4 (in sing. Or pl.; often foll. By with) agreement (with a person etc.) In opinion or desire.  in sympathy (often foll. By with) having, showing, or resulting from sympathy. [greek, = fellow-feeling]

Unfading  adj. Never fading.

Gigantic  adj. Huge, giant-like.  gigantically adv. [latin: related to *giant]

Strapping  adj. Large and sturdy.

Lad  n. 1 boy, youth. 2 colloq. Man. [origin unknown]

Firewood  n. Wood as fuel.

Sikh  n. Member of an indian monotheistic sect. [hindi, = disciple]

Escapism  n. Pursuit of distraction and relief from reality.  escapist n. & adj.

Pleb  n. Colloq. Usu. Derog. = *plebeian 2.  plebby adj. [abbreviation of *plebeian]

Iambic  prosody —adj. Of or using iambuses. —n. (usu. In pl.) Iambic verse.

Affiliate  —v. (-ting) (foll. By to, with) attach, adopt, or connect as a member or branch. —n. Affiliated person etc. [latin: related to *filial]

Tarsal  —adj. Of the ankle-bones. —n. Tarsal bone. [from *tarsus]

Chapatti  n. (also chapati, chupatty) (pl. Chapat(t)is or chupatties) flat thin cake of unleavened bread. [hindi]

Croft  —n. 1 enclosed piece of (usu. Arable) land. 2 small rented farm in scotland or n. England. —v. Farm a croft; live as a crofter. [old english]

Prude  n. Excessively (often affectedly) squeamish or sexually modest person.  prudery n. Prudish adj. Prudishly adv. Prudishness n. [french: related to *proud]

Vendor  n. Law seller, esp. Of property. [anglo-french: related to *vend]

Playwright  n. Person who writes plays.

Reinforcement  n. 1 reinforcing or being reinforced. 2 thing that reinforces. 3 (in pl.) Reinforcing personnel or equipment etc.

Ikon  var. Of *icon.

Scandalmonger  n. Person who habitually spreads scandal.

Fagot  n. (brit. Faggot) 1  ball of seasoned chopped liver etc., baked or fried. 2 bundle of sticks etc. 3 slang offens. A unpleasant woman. B us male homosexual. [french from italian]

Dumpling  n. 1 ball of dough boiled in stew or containing apple etc. 2 small fat person. [dump small round object]

Caveman  n. 1 prehistoric person living in caves. 2 crude person.

Sepsis  n. Septic condition. [greek: related to *septic]

Surly  adj. (-ier, -iest) bad-tempered; unfriendly.   surliness n. [obsolete sirly haughty: related to *sir]

Institute  —n. 1 society or organization for the promotion of science, education, etc. 2 its premises. —v. (-ting) 1 establish; found. 2 initiate (an inquiry etc.). 3 (usu. Foll. By to, into) appoint (a person) as a cleric in a church etc. [latin statuo set up]

Disinformation  n. False information, propaganda.

Blowfly  n. Bluebottle.

Unchristian  adj. Contrary to christian principles, esp. Uncaring or selfish.

Exonerate  v. (-ting) (often foll. By from) free or declare free from blame etc.  exoneration n. [latin onus oner- burden]

Contraption  n. Machine or device, esp. A strange or cumbersome one. [origin unknown]

An  see *a1.

Cackle  —n. 1 clucking of a hen etc. 2 raucous laugh. 3 noisy chatter. —v. (-ling) 1 emit a cackle. 2 chatter noisily.  [imitative]

Clay  n. 1 stiff sticky earth, used for making bricks, pottery, etc. 2 poet. Substance of the human body.  clayey adj. [old english]

Resound  v. 1 (often foll. By with) (of a place) ring or echo. 2 (of a voice, instrument, sound, etc.) Produce echoes; go on sounding; fill a place with sound. 3 a (of a reputation etc.) Be much talked of. B (foll. By through) produce a sensation. 4 (of a place) re-echo (a sound). [latin: related to *sound1]

Cumin  n. (also cummin) 1 plant with aromatic seeds. 2 these as flavouring. [greek kuminon]

Unresisting  adj. Not resisting.

Riffle  —v. (-ling) 1 (often foll. By through) leaf quickly through (pages). 2 a turn (pages) in quick succession. B shuffle (playing-cards), esp. By flexing and combining the two halves of a pack. —n. 1 act of riffling. 2 us a shallow disturbed part of a stream. B patch of waves or ripples. [perhaps var. Of *ruffle]

Decimetre  n. (us -meter) metric unit of length, equal to 0.1 metre.

Rickshaw  n. (also ricksha) light two-wheeled hooded vehicle drawn by one or more persons. [abbreviation of jinrickshaw from japanese]

Dispassionate  adj. Free from emotion; impartial.  dispassionately adv.

Finnan  n. (in full finnan haddock) smoke-cured haddock. [findhorn, findon, in scotland]

Sexual  adj. Of sex, the sexes, or relations between them.  sexuality n. Sexually adv.

Royalist  n. Supporter of monarchy, or hist. Of the royal side in the english civil war.  royalism n.

Noxious  adj. Harmful, unwholesome. [latin noxa harm]

Debatable  adj. Questionable; disputable. [related to *debate]

Boozer  n. Colloq. 1 habitual drinker. 2 public house.

Visionary  —adj. 1 given to seeing visions or to fanciful theories. 2 having vision or foresight. 3 not real, imaginary. 4 not practicable. —n. (pl. -ies) visionary person.

Perpetuate  v. (-ting) 1 make perpetual. 2 preserve from oblivion.  perpetuation n. Perpetuator n. [latin perpetuo]

Shapely  adj. (-ier, -iest) pleasing in appearance, elegant, well-proportioned.  shapeliness n.

Misfortune  n. 1 bad luck. 2 instance of this.

High  —adj. 1 a of great vertical extent (high building). B (predic.; often in comb.) Of a specified height (one inch high; waist-high). 2 a far above ground or sea level etc. (high altitude). B inland, esp. When raised (high asia). 3 extending above the normal level (jersey with a high neck). 4 a of exalted quality (high minds). B lavish; superior (high living; high fashion). 5 of exalted rank (high society; is high in the government). 6 a great; intense; extreme; powerful (high praise; high temperature). B greater than normal (high prices). C extreme or very traditional in religious or political opinion (high tory). 7 performed at, to, or from a considerable height (high diving; high flying). 8 (often foll. By on) colloq. Intoxicated by alcohol or esp. Drugs. 9 (of a sound etc.) Of high frequency; shrill. 10 (of a period, age, time, etc.) At its peak (high noon; high summer; high renaissance). 11 a (of meat etc.) Beginning to go bad; off. B (of game) well-hung and slightly decomposed. —n. 1 high, or the highest, level or figure. 2 area of high pressure; anticyclone. 3 slang euphoric state, esp. Drug-induced (am on a high). —adv. 1 far up; aloft (flew the flag high). 2 in or to a high degree. 3 at a high price. 4 (of a sound) at or to a high pitch.  high opinion of favourable opinion of. On high in or to heaven or a high place. On one's high horse colloq. Acting arrogantly. [old english]

Ketone  n. Any of a class of organic compounds including propanone (acetone). [german keton, alteration of aketon *acetone]

Noel  n. Christmas. [latin: related to *natal]

Tennis  n. Game in which two or four players strike a ball with rackets over a net stretched across a court. [probably french tenez take! (as a server's call)]

Disgust  —n. Strong aversion; repugnance. —v. Cause disgust in.  disgusting adj. Disgustingly adv. [french or italian: related to *dis-, *gusto]

Legality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 lawfulness. 2 (in pl.) Obligations imposed by law.

Spinal  adj. Of the spine. [latin: related to *spine]

Sublet  —n. = *sublease n. —v. (-tt-; past and past part. -let) = *sublease v.

Scrumptious  adj. Colloq. 1 delicious. 2 delightful. [origin unknown]

Trumpery  —n. (pl. -ies) 1 worthless finery. 2 worthless thing; rubbish. —adj. Showy but worthless; trashy; shallow. [french tromperie deceit]

Core  —n. 1 horny central part of certain fruits, containing the seeds. 2 central or most important part of anything (also attrib.: core curriculum). 3 inner central region of the earth. 4 part of a nuclear reactor containing fissile material. 5 hist. Structural unit in a computer, storing one bit of data (see *bit4). 6 inner strand of an electric cable. 7 piece of soft iron forming the centre of an electromagnet or induction coil. —v. (-ring) remove the core from.  corer n. [origin unknown]

Autoclave  n. Sterilizer using high-pressure steam. [latin clavus nail or clavis key]

Initiative  n. 1 ability to initiate things; enterprise (lacks initiative). 2 first step. 3 (prec. By the) power or right to begin.  have the initiative esp. Mil. Be able to control the enemy's movements. [french: related to *initiate]

Drink  —v. (past drank; past part. Drunk) 1 a (also absol.) Swallow (liquid). B swallow the contents of (a vessel). 2 take alcohol, esp. To excess. 3 (of a plant, sponge, etc.) Absorb (moisture). 4 bring (oneself etc.) To a specified condition by drinking. 5 wish (a person good health etc.) By drinking (drank his health). —n. 1 a liquid for drinking. B draught or specified amount of this. 2 a alcoholic liquor. B portion, glass, etc. Of this. C excessive use of alcohol (took to drink). 3 (the drink) colloq. The sea.  drink in listen eagerly to. Drink to toast; wish success to. Drink up (also absol.) Drink all or the remainder of.  drinkable adj. Drinker n.

Unmistakable  adj. Clear, obvious, plain.  unmistakably adv.

Prerogative  n. Right or privilege exclusive to an individual or class. [latin praerogo ask first]

Jump  —v. 1 rise off the ground etc. By sudden muscular effort in the legs. 2 (often foll. By up, from, in, out, etc.) Move suddenly or hastily (jumped into the car). 3 jerk or twitch from shock or excitement etc. 4 a change, esp. Advance in status or rise, rapidly (prices jumped). B cause to do this. 5 (often foll. By about) change the subject etc. Rapidly. 6 pass over (an obstacle etc.) By jumping. 7 skip (a passage in a book etc.). 8 cause (a horse etc.) To jump. 9 (foll. By to, at) reach (a conclusion) hastily. 10 (of a train) leave (the rails). 11 pass (a red traffic-light etc.). 12 get on or off (a train etc.) Quickly, esp. Illegally or dangerously. 13 attack (a person) unexpectedly. —n. 1 act of jumping. 2 sudden jerk caused by shock or excitement. 3 abrupt rise in amount, value, status, etc. 4 obstacle to be jumped. 5 a sudden transition. B gap in a series, logical sequence, etc.  jump at accept eagerly. Jump bail fail to appear for trial having been released on bail. Jump down a person's throat colloq. Reprimand or contradict a person fiercely. Jump the gun colloq. Begin prematurely. Jump on colloq. Attack or criticize severely. Jump out of one's skin colloq. Be extremely startled. Jump the queue take unfair precedence. Jump ship (of a seaman) desert. Jump to it colloq. Act promptly. One jump ahead one stage further on than a rival etc. [imitative]

Unshaven  adj. Not shaved.

Clan  n. 1 group of people with a common ancestor, esp. In the scottish highlands. 2 large family as a social group. 3 group with a strong common interest. [gaelic]

Unused  adj. 1  a not in use. B never having been used. 2  (foll. By to) not accustomed.

Starlight  n. Light of the stars.

Okra  n. Tall, orig. African plant with long ridged seed-pods used for food. [west african native name]

Smell  —n. 1 faculty of perceiving odours. 2 quality in substances that is perceived by this. 3 unpleasant odour. 4 act of inhaling to ascertain smell. —v. (past and past part. Smelt or smelled) 1 perceive or examine by smell. 2 emit an odour; stink. 3 seem by smell to be (smells sour). 4 (foll. By of) a emit the odour of (smells of fish). B be suggestive of (smells of dishonesty). 5 perceive; detect (smell a bargain). 6 have or use a sense of smell.  smell a rat suspect trickery etc. Smell out detect by smell or investigation. [old english]

Ideally  adv. 1 in ideal circumstances. 2 according to an ideal.

Reality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 what is real or existent or underlies appearances. 2 (foll. By of) the real nature of. 3 real existence; state of being real. 4 resemblance to an original.  in reality in fact. [medieval latin or french: related to *real1]

Cheesed  adj. Slang (often foll. By off) bored, fed up. [origin unknown]

Implausible  adj. Not plausible.  implausibility n. Implausibly adv.

Dopey  adj. (also dopy) (dopier, dopiest) colloq. 1 half asleep or stupefied as if by a drug. 2 stupid.  dopily adv. Dopiness n.

Pursuit  n. 1 act of pursuing. 2 occupation or activity pursued.  in pursuit of pursuing. [french: related to *suit]

Third  adj. & n. 1 next after second. 2 each of three equal parts of a thing.  thirdly adv. [old english: related to *three]

Colour  (us color) —n. 1 sensation produced on the eye by rays of light when resolved as by a prism into different wavelengths. 2 one, or any mixture, of the constituents into which light can be separated as in a spectrum or rainbow, sometimes including (loosely) black and white. 3 colouring substance, esp. Paint. 4 use of all colours in photography etc. 5 a pigmentation of the skin, esp. When dark. B this as ground for discrimination. 6 ruddiness of complexion. 7 (in pl.) Appearance or aspect (saw them in their true colours). 8 (in pl.) A coloured ribbon or uniform etc. Worn to signify membership of a school, club, team, etc. B flag of a regiment or ship. 9 quality, mood, or variety in music, literature, etc. 10 show of reason; pretext (lend colour to; under colour of). —v. 1 apply colour to, esp. By painting, dyeing, etc. 2 influence. 3 misrepresent, exaggerate. 4 take on colour; blush.  show one's true colours reveal one's true character or intentions. [latin color]

Prevent  v. (often foll. By from + verbal noun) stop from happening or doing something; hinder; make impossible (the weather prevented me from going).  preventable adj. (also preventible). Prevention n. [latin praevenio -vent- hinder]

Usage  the use of prevent without ‘from’ as in prevented me going is informal. An acceptable alternative is prevented my going.

Battledress  n. Everyday uniform of a soldier.

Naturalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 admit (a foreigner) to citizenship. 2 successfully introduce (an animal, plant, etc.) Into another region. 3 adopt (a foreign word, custom, etc.).  naturalization n.

Binoculars  n.pl. Instrument with a lens for each eye, for viewing distant objects.

Virginity  n. State of being a virgin.

Mendelian  adj. Of mendel's theory of heredity by genes. [mendel, name of a botanist]

Emissary  n. (pl. -ies) person sent on a diplomatic mission. [latin: related to *emit]

Meteoric  adj. 1 rapid; dazzling (meteoric rise to fame). 2 of meteors.  meteorically adv.

Nato  abbr. (also nato) north atlantic treaty organization.

Lav  n. Colloq. Lavatory. [abbreviation]

Succor  (brit. Succour) —n. Aid, esp. In time of need. —v. Give succour to. [latin succurro run to help]

Pancreas  n. Gland near the stomach supplying digestive fluid and secreting insulin.  pancreatic adj. [greek kreas flesh]

Indulge  v. (-ging) 1 (often foll. By in) take pleasure freely. 2 yield freely to (a desire etc.). 3 (also refl.) Gratify the wishes of. 4 colloq. Take alcoholic liquor. [latin indulgeo give free rein to]

Reintroduce  v. (-cing) introduce again.  reintroduction n.

Unattended  adj. 1 (usu. Foll. By to) not attended. 2 (of a person, vehicle, etc.) Alone.

Centennial  —adj. 1 lasting for a hundred years. 2 occurring every hundred years. —n. Us = *centenary n. [latin centum 100: cf. *biennial]

Metallize  v. (also -ise; us metalize) (-zing or -sing) 1 render metallic. 2 coat with a thin layer of metal.

Plankton  n. Chiefly microscopic organisms drifting in the sea or fresh water. [greek, = wandering]

Copywriter  n. Person who writes or prepares advertising copy for publication.

Cocotte  n. Small fireproof dish for cooking and serving an individual portion. [french]

Trident  n. Three-pronged spear. [latin dens dent- tooth]

Campanile  n. Bell-tower (usu. Free-standing), esp. In italy. [italian campana ‘bell’, from latin]

Customize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make or modify to order; personalize.

Paintbrush  n. Brush for applying paint.

Commie  n. Slang derog. Communist. [abbreviation]

Peroxide  —n. 1 a = *hydrogen peroxide. B (often attrib.) Solution of hydrogen peroxide used esp. To bleach the hair. 2 compound of oxygen with another element containing the greatest possible proportion of oxygen. —v. (-ding) bleach (the hair) with peroxide. [from *per-, *oxide]

Call  —v. 1 a (often foll. By out) cry, shout; speak loudly. B (of a bird etc.) Emit its characteristic sound. 2 communicate with by telephone or radio. 3 summon. 4 (often foll. By at, in, on) pay a brief visit. 5 order to take place (called a meeting). 6 name; describe as. 7 regard as (i call that silly). 8 rouse from sleep. 9 (foll. By for) demand. 10 (foll. By on, upon) appeal to (called on us to be quiet). 11 name (a suit) in bidding at cards. 12 guess the outcome of tossing a coin etc. —n. 1 shout, cry. 2 a characteristic cry of a bird etc. B instrument for imitating it. 3 brief visit. 4 a act of telephoning. B telephone conversation. 5 a invitation, summons. B vocation. 6 need, occasion (no call for rudeness). 7 demand (a call on one's time). 8 signal on a bugle etc. 9 option of buying stock at a fixed price at a given date. 10 cards a player's right or turn to make a bid. B bid made.  call in 1 withdraw from circulation. 2 seek the advice or services of. Call off 1 cancel (an arrangement). 2 order (an attacker or pursuer) to desist. Call out 1 summon to action. 2 order (workers) to strike. Call the shots (or tune) colloq. Be in control; take the initiative. Call up 1 telephone. 2 recall. 3 summon to military service. On call ready or available if required. [old english from old norse]

Manhole  n. Covered opening in a pavement, sewer, etc. For workmen to gain access.

Overcome  v. (-ming; past -came; past part. -come) 1 prevail over, master, be victorious. 2 (usu. As overcome adj.) A make faint (overcome by smoke). B (usu. Foll. By with, by) make weak or helpless (overcome with grief).

Toxic  adj. 1 poisonous. 2 of poison.  toxicity n. [greek toxikon poison for arrows]

Nullify  v. (-ies, -ied) neutralize, invalidate.  nullification n.

Cup  —n. 1 small bowl-shaped container for drinking from. 2 a its contents. B = *cupful. 3 cup-shaped thing. 4 flavoured wine, cider, etc., usu. Chilled. 5 cup-shaped trophy as a prize. 6 one's fate or fortune (a bitter cup). —v. (-pp-) 1 form (esp. The hands) into the shape of a cup. 2 take or hold as in a cup.  one's cup of tea colloq. What interests or suits one. [medieval latin cuppa]

Transatlantic  adj. 1 beyond the atlantic, esp.: a american. B us european. 2 crossing the atlantic.

Participant  n. Participator.

Denture  n. Removable artificial tooth or teeth.

Diagnose  v. (-sing) make a diagnosis of (a disease, fault, etc.).

Preplan  v. (-nn-) plan in advance.

Codeine  n. Alkaloid derived from morphine, used to relieve pain. [greek kodeia poppy-head]

Sightly  adj. Attractive to look at.

Suppurate  v. (-ting) 1 form pus. 2 fester.  suppuration n. [latin: related to *pus]

Doss  v. 1 (often foll. By down) slang sleep roughly or in a doss-house. 2 (often foll. By about, around) spend time idly. [probably originally = ‘seat-back cover’: from latin dorsum back]

Pariah  n. 1 social outcast. 2 hist. Member of a low caste or of no caste in s. India. [tamil]

Sleeper  n. 1 person or animal that sleeps. 2 horizontal beam supporting a railway track. 3 a sleeping-car. B berth in this. 4 ring or stud worn in a pierced ear to keep the hole open.

Imperious  adj. Overbearing, domineering.  imperiously adv. Imperiousness n.

Jilt  v. Abruptly reject or abandon (esp. A lover). [origin unknown]

Dismount  v. 1 a alight from a horse, bicycle, etc. B unseat. 2 remove (a thing) from its mounting.

Uncouth  adj. Uncultured, rough. [old english, = unknown]

Eardrum  n. Membrane of the middle ear.

Unforced  adj. 1 easy, natural. 2 not compelled or constrained.

Raffia  n. 1 palm-tree native to madagascar. 2 fibre from its leaves, used for weaving and for tying plants etc. [malagasy]

Ultimatum  n. (pl. -s) final statement of terms, the rejection of which could cause hostility etc. [latin: related to *ultimate]

Busby  n. (pl. -ies) tall fur hat worn by hussars etc. [origin unknown]

Collocate  v. (-ting) juxtapose (a word etc.) With another.  collocation n. [latin: related to *locus]

Ketch  n. Small two-masted sailing-boat. [probably from *catch]

Interface  —n. 1 surface forming a boundary between two regions. 2 means or place of interaction between two systems etc.; interaction (the interface between psychology and education). 3 esp. Computing apparatus for connecting two pieces of equipment so that they can be operated jointly. —v. (-cing) (often foll. By with) 1 connect with (another piece of equipment etc.) By an interface. 2 interact.

Usage  the use of the noun and verb in sense 2 is deplored by some people.

Italic  —adj. 1 a of the sloping kind of letters now used esp. For emphasis and in foreign words. B (of handwriting) compact and pointed like early italian handwriting. 2 (italic) of ancient italy. —n. 1 letter in italic type. 2 this type. [latin italicus: related to *italian]

Backbone  n. 1 spine. 2 chief support. 3 firmness of character.

Mote  n. Speck of dust. [old english]

Candid  adj. 1 frank; open. 2 (of a photograph) taken informally, usu. Without subject's knowledge.  candidly adv. Candidness n. [latin candidus white]

Kneeler  n. 1 cushion for kneeling on. 2 person who kneels.

Canny  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 shrewd, worldly-wise; thrifty. 2 scot. & n.engl. Pleasant, agreeable.  cannily adv. Canniness n. [from *can1]

Trunk  n. 1 main stem of a tree. 2 body without the limbs and head. 3 large box with a hinged lid for luggage, storage, etc. 4 us boot of a car. 5 elephant's elongated prehensile nose. 6 (in pl.) Men's close-fitting shorts worn for swimming etc. [latin truncus cut short]

Dekko  n. (pl. -s) slang look, glance. [hindi]

Dusk  n. Darker stage of twilight. [old english]

Trencher  n. Hist. Wooden or earthenware platter for serving food. [anglo-french: related to *trench]

Incautious  adj. Heedless, rash.  incautiously adv.

Shrapnel  n. 1 fragments of an exploded bomb etc. 2 shell containing pieces of metal etc., timed to burst short of impact. [shrapnel, name of the inventor of the shell]

Liable  predic. Adj. 1 legally bound. 2 (foll. By to) subject to. 3 (foll. By to + infin.) Under an obligation. 4 (foll. By to) exposed or open to (something undesirable). 5 (foll. By to + infin.) Apt, likely (it is liable to rain). 6 (foll. By for) answerable. [french lier bind, from latin ligo]

Usage  use of liable in sense 5, though common, is considered incorrect by some people.

Hottentot  n. 1 member of a sw african negroid people. 2 their language. [afrikaans]

Crux  n. (pl. Cruxes or cruces) decisive point at issue. [latin, = cross]

Echelon  n. 1 level in an organization, in society, etc.; those occupying it (often in pl.: upper echelons). 2 wedge-shaped formation of troops, aircraft, etc. [french, = ladder, from latin scala]

Tramp  —v. 1 a walk heavily and firmly. B go on foot, esp. A distance. 2 a cross on foot, esp. Wearily or reluctantly. B cover (a distance) in this way. 3 (often foll. By down) tread on; trample; stamp on. 4 live as a tramp. —n. 1 itinerant vagrant or beggar. 2 sound of a person, or esp. People, walking, marching, etc. 3 long walk. 4 slang derog. Promiscuous woman. [germanic]

Kelter  var. Of *kilter.

Dramatist  n. Writer of dramas.

Pogrom  n. Organized massacre (orig. Of jews in russia). [russian]

Wicker  n. Plaited osiers etc. As material for baskets etc. [scandinavian]

Unsurpassed  adj. Not surpassed.

Jackrabbit  n. Us large prairie hare.

Earl  n. British nobleman ranking between marquis and viscount.  earldom n. [old english]

Resettle  v. (-ling) settle again or elsewhere.  resettlement n.

Equestrian  —adj. 1 of horse-riding. 2 on horseback. —n. Rider or performer on horseback.  equestrianism n. [latin equestris from equus horse]

Strife  n. Conflict; struggle. [french estrif: related to *strive]

Dosh  n. Slang money. [origin unknown]

Swedish  —adj. Of sweden, its people, or language. —n. Language of sweden.

Syllabic  adj. Of or in syllables.  syllabically adv.

Diameter  n. 1 straight line passing through the centre of a circle or sphere to its edges; length of this. 2 transverse measurement; width, thickness. 3 unit of linear magnifying power. [greek: related to *-meter]

Troglodyte  n. Cave-dweller. [greek trogle hole]

Backing  n. 1 a support, esp. Financial or moral. B material used for a thing's back or support. 2 musical accompaniment, esp. To a pop singer.

Tattle  —v. (-ling) prattle, chatter, gossip. —n. Gossip; idle talk. [flemish tatelen, imitative]

Catchpenny  attrib. Adj. Intended merely to sell quickly; superficially attractive.

Fidelity  n. 1 faithfulness, loyalty. 2 strict accuracy. 3 precision in sound reproduction (high fidelity). [latin fides faith]

Phenol  n. 1 hydroxyl derivative of benzene. 2 any hydroxyl derivative of an aromatic hydrocarbon. [french]

-cyte  comb. Form mature cell (leucocyte). [greek kutos vessel]

Spoilsport  n. Person who spoils others' enjoyment.

Syncretize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) attempt, esp. Inconsistently, to unify or reconcile differing schools of thought.  syncretic adj. Syncretism n. [greek]

Cuirass  n. Armour breastplate and back-plate fastened together. [latin corium leather]

Shod  past and past part. Of *shoe.

Specialty  n. (pl. -ies) esp. Us = *speciality.

Unreal  adj. 1 not real. 2 imaginary. 3 slang incredible.  unreality n.

Eureka  int. I have found it! (announcing a discovery etc.). [greek heureka]

Landslip  n. = *landslide 1.

Varicose  adj. (esp. Of a vein etc.) Permanently and abnormally dilated. [latin varix varicose vein]

Any  —adj. 1 a one, no matter which, of several (cannot find any answer). B some, no matter how much or many or of what sort (if any books arrive; have you any sugar?). 2 a minimal amount of (hardly any difference). 3 whichever is chosen (any fool knows). 4 an appreciable or significant (did not stay for any length of time; has any amount of money). —pron. 1 any one (did not know any of them). 2 any number or amount (are any of them yours?). —adv. (usu. With neg. Or interrog.) At all (is that any good?). [old english ænig: related to *one, *-y1]

Shortfall  n. Deficit.

Interdict  —n. 1 authoritative prohibition. 2 rc ch. Sentence debarring a person, or esp. A place, from ecclesiastical functions and privileges. —v. 1 prohibit (an action). 2 forbid the use of. 3 (usu. Foll. By from + verbal noun) restrain (a person). 4 (usu. Foll. By to) forbid (a thing) to a person.  interdiction n. Interdictory adj. [latin dico say]

Bullring  n. Arena for bullfights.

Amen  int. (esp. At the end of a prayer etc.) So be it. [church latin from hebrew, = certainly]

Unedited  adj. Not edited.

Polygamy  n. Practice of having more than one wife or (less usu.) Husband at once.  polygamist n. Polygamous adj. [greek gamos marriage]

Disencumber  v. Free from encumbrance.

Shush  —int. Hush! —v. 1 quieten (a person or people) by saying “shush”. 2 fall silent. [imitative]

Uncontaminated  adj. Not contaminated.

Porridge  n. 1 dish of oatmeal or cereal boiled in water or milk. 2 slang imprisonment. [alteration of *pottage]

Retune  v. (-ning) 1 tune (a musical instrument) again or differently. 2 tune (a radio etc.) To a different frequency.

Multitude  n. 1 (often foll. By of) great number. 2 large gathering of people; crowd. 3 (the multitude) the common people. [french from latin]

Checkpoint  n. Place, esp. A barrier or entrance, where documents, vehicles, etc., are inspected.

Misunderstand  v. (past and past part. -understood) 1 understand incorrectly. 2 misinterpret the words or actions of (a person).

Convert  —v. 1 (usu. Foll. By into) change in form or function. 2 cause (a person) to change belief etc. 3 change (moneys etc.) Into others of a different kind. 4 make structural alterations in (a building) for a new purpose. 5 (also absol.) Rugby score extra points from (a try) by a successful kick at the goal. —n. (often foll. By to) person converted to a different belief etc. [latin verto vers- turn]

Hirsute  adj. Hairy. [latin]

Primogeniture  n. 1 fact of being the first-born child. 2 (in full right of primogeniture) right of succession belonging to the first-born. [medieval latin: related to *prime1, latin genitura birth]

Herein  adv. Formal in this matter, book, etc.

Electrolyze  v. (brit. -yse) (-zing, brit. -sing) subject to or treat by electrolysis.

Ferry  —n. (pl. -ies) 1 boat or aircraft etc. For esp. Regular transport, esp. Across water. 2 place or service of ferrying. —v. (-ies, -ied) 1 convey or go in a ferry. 2 (of a boat etc.) Cross water regularly. 3 transport, esp. Regularly, from place to place.  ferryman n. [old norse]

Knacker  —n. Buyer of useless horses etc. For slaughter, or of old houses, ships, etc. For the materials. —v. Slang (esp. As knackered adj.) Exhaust, wear out. [origin unknown]

Fastening  n. Device that fastens something; fastener.

Bleary  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 dim; blurred. 2 indistinct. [low german]

Deepen  v. Make or become deep or deeper.

Nod  —v. (-dd-) 1 incline one's head slightly and briefly in assent, greeting, or command. 2 let one's head fall forward in drowsiness; be drowsy. 3 incline (one's head). 4 signify (assent etc.) By a nod. 5 (of flowers, plumes, etc.) Bend downwards and sway. 6 make a mistake due to a momentary lack of alertness or attention. —n. Nodding of the head.  nod off colloq. Fall asleep. [origin unknown]

Kin  —n. One's relatives or family. —predic. Adj. Related. [old english]

Relic  n. 1 object that is interesting because of its age or association. 2 part of a dead holy person's body or belongings kept as an object of reverence. 3 surviving custom or belief etc. From a past age. 4 memento or souvenir. 5 (in pl.) What has survived. 6 (in pl.) Dead body or remains of a person. [latin reliquiae remains: related to *relinquish]

Electro-  comb. Form of, by, or caused by electricity.

Decongestant  n. Medicine etc. That relieves nasal congestion.

Nevermore  adv. At no future time.

Gallstone  n. Small hard mass forming in the gall-bladder.

Moonlight  —n. 1 light of the moon. 2 (attrib.) Lit by the moon. —v. (-lighted) colloq. Have two paid occupations, esp. One by day and one by night.  moonlighter n.

Hemal  adj. (brit. Haem-) of the blood. [greek haima blood]

Cetacean  —n. Marine mammal, e.g. The whale. —adj. Of cetaceans. [greek ketos whale]

Vibration  n. 1 vibrating. 2 (in pl.) A mental, esp. Occult, influence. B atmosphere or feeling communicated.

Formulate  v. (-ting) 1 express in a formula. 2 express clearly and precisely.  formulation n.

Humerus  n. (pl. -ri) bone of the upper arm.  humeral adj. [latin, = shoulder]

Mayday  n. International radio distress-signal. [representing pronunciation of french m'aidez help me]

Ovi-  comb. Form egg, ovum. [from *ovum]

Sixfold  adj. & adv. 1 six times as much or as many. 2 consisting of six parts.

Slippage  n. Act or an instance of slipping.

Unamused  adj. Not amused.

Amaryllis  n. Bulbous plant with lily-like flowers. [greek, a girl's name]

Bliss  n. 1 perfect joy. 2 being in heaven.  blissful adj. Blissfully adv. [old english]

Sermonize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) moralize (to).

Credible  adj. Believable or worthy of belief. [latin: related to *credo]

Usage  credible is sometimes confused with credulous.

Kalends  var. Of *calends.

Hazard  —n. 1 danger or risk. 2 source of this. 3 golf obstacle, e.g. A bunker. —v. 1 venture (hazard a guess). 2 risk. [arabic az-zahr chance, luck]

Odometer  n. Us = *milometer. [greek hodos way]

Glycerine  n. (also glycerol, us glycerin) thick sweet colourless liquid used as medicine, ointment, etc., and in explosives. [greek glukeros sweet]

Nose  —n. 1 organ above the mouth of a human or animal, used for smelling and breathing. 2 a sense of smell. B ability to detect a particular thing (a nose for scandal). 3 odour or perfume of wine etc. 4 front end or projecting part of a thing, e.g. Of a car or aircraft. —v. (-sing) 1 (usu. Foll. By about, around, etc.) Pry or search. 2 (often foll. By out) a perceive the smell of, discover by smell. B detect. 3 thrust one's nose against or into. 4 make one's way cautiously forward.  by a nose by a very narrow margin.

Repine  v. (-ning) (often foll. By at, against) fret; be discontented. [from *pine2, after repent]

Prospect  —n. 1 a (often in pl.) Expectation, esp. Of success in a career etc. (job with no prospects). B something one expects (don't relish the prospect of meeting him). 2 extensive view of landscape etc. (striking prospect). 3 mental picture. 4 possible or probable customer, subscriber, etc. —v. (usu. Foll. By for) explore, search (esp. A region) for gold etc.  prospector n. [latin: related to *prospectus]

Midriff  n. Front of the body just above the waist. [old english, = mid-belly]

Attentive  adj. 1 concentrating; paying attention. 2 assiduously polite.  attentively adv. Attentiveness n.

Skyscraper  n. Very tall building.

Snack  n. 1 light, casual, or hurried meal. 2 small amount of food eaten between meals. [dutch]

Commendable  adj. Praiseworthy.  commendably adv.

Nova  n. (pl. Novae or -s) star showing a sudden burst of brightness and then subsiding. [latin, = new]

Medal  n. Commemorative metal disc etc., esp. Awarded for military or sporting prowess. [latin: related to *metal]

Crupper  n. 1 strap looped under a horse's tail to hold the harness back. 2 hindquarters of a horse. [french: related to *croup2]

Dextrose  n. Form of glucose. [latin dextra on or to the right]

Reme  abbr. Royal electrical and mechanical engineers.

Diction  n. Manner of enunciation in speaking or singing. [latin dictio from dico dict- say]

Airwoman  n. Woman pilot or member of an aircraft crew, esp. In an air force.

Airtight  adj. Impermeable to air.

Erase  v. (-sing) 1 rub out; obliterate. 2 remove all traces of. 3 remove recorded material from (magnetic tape or disk). [latin rado ras- scrape]

Lamp  n. 1 device for producing a steady light, esp.: a an electric bulb, and usu. Its holder. B an oil-lamp. C a gas-jet and mantle. 2 device producing esp. Ultraviolet or infrared radiation. [greek lampas torch]

Mincemeat  n. Mixture of currants, sugar, spices, suet, etc.  make mincemeat of utterly defeat.

Liaise  v. (-sing) (foll. By with, between) colloq. Establish cooperation, act as a link. [back-formation from *liaison]

Incontestable  adj. That cannot be disputed.  incontestably adv.

Scoot  v. (esp. In imper.) Colloq. Depart quickly, flee. [origin unknown]

Omit  v. (-tt-) 1 leave out; not insert or include. 2 leave undone. 3 (foll. By verbal noun or to + infin.) Fail or neglect. [latin omitto omiss-]

Pica  n. 1 unit of type-size (1/6 inch). 2 size of letters in typewriting (10 per inch). [latin: related to *pie2]

Sadism  n. 1 colloq. Enjoyment of cruelty to others. 2 sexual perversion characterized by this.  sadist n. Sadistic adj. Sadistically adv. [de sade, name of an author]

Swirl  —v. Move, flow, or carry along with a whirling motion. —n. 1 swirling motion. 2 twist or curl.  swirly adj. [perhaps from low german or dutch]

Godly  adj. (-ier, -iest) pious, devout.  godliness n.

Redbreast  n. Colloq. Robin.

Coomb  n. (also combe) 1 valley on the side of a hill. 2 short valley running up from the coast. [old english]

Sexism  n. Prejudice or discrimination, esp. Against women, on the grounds of sex.  sexist adj. & n.

Undoing  n. 1 ruin or cause of ruin. 2 reversing of an action etc. 3 opening or unfastening.

Fun  —n. 1 lively or playful amusement. 2 source of this. 3 mockery, ridicule (figure of fun). —attrib. Adj. Colloq. Amusing, enjoyable (a fun thing to do).  for fun (or for the fun of it) not for a serious purpose. In fun as a joke, not seriously. Make fun of (or poke fun at) ridicule, tease. [obsolete fun, fon: related to *fond]

Usage  the use of fun as an attributive adjective is common in informal use, but is considered incorrect by some people.

Lustre  n. (us luster) 1 gloss, shining surface. 2 brilliance, splendour. 3 iridescent glaze on pottery and porcelain.  lustrous adj. [latin lustro illumine]

Gravel  —n. 1 mixture of coarse sand and small stones, used for paths etc. 2 med. Aggregations of crystals formed in the urinary tract. —v. (-ll-; us -l-) lay or strew with gravel. [french diminutive, perhaps of grave shore]

Operculum  n. (pl. -cula) 1 fish's gill-cover. 2 any of various other parts covering or closing an aperture in an animal or plant. [latin operio cover (v.)]

Browse  —v. (-sing) 1 read desultorily or look over goods for sale. 2 (often foll. By on) feed on leaves, twigs, etc. —n. 1 twigs, shoots, etc. As fodder. 2 act of browsing. [french brost bud]

Insufferable  adj. 1 intolerable. 2 unbearably conceited etc.  insufferably adv.

Hither  adv. Formal to or towards this place. [old english]

Homeward  —adv. (also homewards) towards home. —adj. Going towards home.

Simultaneous  adj. (often foll. By with) occurring or operating at the same time.  simultaneity n. Simultaneously adv. [latin simul at the same time]

Tendency  n. (pl. -ies) (often foll. By to, towards) leaning or inclination. [medieval latin: related to *tend1]

Orphan  —n. Child whose parents are dead. —v. Bereave (a child) of its parents. [latin from greek, = bereaved]

Waveband  n. Range of radio wavelengths between certain limits.

Blossom  —n. 1 flower or mass of flowers, esp. Of a fruit-tree. 2 promising stage (blossom of youth). —v. 1 open into flower. 2 mature, thrive. [old english]

Uncooperative  adj. Not cooperative.

Carthusian  —n. Monk of a contemplative order founded by st bruno. —adj. Of this order. [latin: related to *chartreuse]

Descendant  n. Person or thing descended from another. [french: related to *descend]

Mustang  n. Small wild horse of mexico and california. [spanish]

Immobile  adj. 1 not moving. 2 unable to move or be moved.  immobility n.

Calyx  n. (pl. Calyces or -es) (also calix) 1 sepals forming the protective case of a flower in bud. 2 cuplike cavity or structure. [greek, = husk]

Vitaminize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) add vitamins to.

Fraternity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 religious brotherhood. 2 group with common interests, or of the same professional class. 3 us male students' society. 4 brotherliness. [latin: related to *fraternal]

Variant  —adj. 1 differing in form or details from a standard (variant spelling). 2 having different forms (forty variant types). —n. Variant form, spelling, type, etc.

Corrode  v. (-ding) 1 a wear away, esp. By chemical action. B decay. 2 destroy gradually. [latin rodo ros- gnaw]

Stillborn  adj. 1 born dead. 2 abortive.

Prehensile  adj. Zool. (of a tail or limb) capable of grasping. [latin prehendo -hens- grasp]

Haggis  n. Scottish dish of offal boiled in a sheep's stomach with suet, oatmeal, etc. [origin unknown]

Gallop  —n. 1 fastest pace of a horse etc., with all the feet off the ground together in each stride. 2 ride at this pace. —v. (-p-) 1 a (of a horse etc. Or its rider) go at a gallop. B make (a horse etc.) Gallop. 2 read, talk, etc., fast. 3 progress rapidly (galloping inflation). [french: related to *wallop]

Finch  n. Small seed-eating bird, esp. A crossbill, canary, or chaffinch. [old english]

Quadrilateral  —adj. Having four sides. —n. Four-sided figure.

Hibernate  v. (-ting) (of an animal) spend the winter in a dormant state.  hibernation n. [latin hibernus wintry]

Mesdemoiselles  pl. Of *mademoiselle.

Switch  —n. 1 device for completing and breaking an electric circuit. 2 a transfer, change-over, or deviation. B exchange. 3 flexible shoot cut from a tree. 4 light tapering rod. 5 us railway points. —v. 1 (foll. By on, off) turn (an electrical device) on or off. 2 change or transfer. 3 exchange. 4 whip or flick with a switch.  switch off colloq. Cease to pay attention. [low german]

Pelf  n. Derog. Or joc. Money; wealth. [french: related to *pilfer]

Immature  adj. 1 not mature. 2 undeveloped, esp. Emotionally. 3 unripe.  immaturely adv. Immaturity n.

Gunman  n. Man armed with a gun, esp. When committing a crime

Hooray  int. = *hurrah.

Selfish  adj. Concerned chiefly with one's own interests or pleasure; actuated by or appealing to self-interest.  selfishly adv. Selfishness n.

Chemist  n. 1 dealer in medicinal drugs etc. 2 expert in chemistry. [french: related to *alchemy]

Icon  n. (also ikon) 1 painting of christ etc., esp. In the eastern church. 2 image or statue. 3 symbol on a vdu screen of a program, option, or window, esp. For selection.  iconic adj. [greek eikon image]

Curmudgeon  n. Bad-tempered person.  curmudgeonly adj. [origin unknown]

Voluptuous  adj. 1 of, tending to, occupied with, or derived from, sensuous or sensual pleasure. 2 (of a woman) curvaceous and sexually desirable.  voluptuously adv. [latin voluptas pleasure]

Kind  —n. 1 race, species, or natural group of animals, plants, etc. (human kind). 2 class, type, sort, variety. 3 natural way, fashion, etc. (true to kind). —adj. (often foll. By to) friendly, generous, or benevolent.  in kind 1 in the same form, likewise (was insulted and replied in kind). 2 (of payment) in goods or labour, not money. 3 character, quality (differ in degree but not in kind). Kind of colloq. To some extent (i kind of expected it). A kind of loosely resembling (he's a kind of doctor). [old english]

Usage  in sense 2 of the noun, these kinds of is usually preferred to these kind of.

Indolent  adj. Lazy; averse to exertion.  indolence n. Indolently adv. [latin doleo suffer pain]

Bless  v. (past and past part. Blessed, poet. Blest) 1 ask god to look favourably on, esp. By making the sign of the cross over. 2 consecrate (food etc.). 3 glorify (god). 4 attribute one's good luck to (stars etc.); thank. 5 (usu. In passive) make happy or successful (blessed with children).  bless me (or my soul) exclamation of surprise etc. Bless you! Exclamation of endearment, gratitude, etc., or to a person who has just sneezed. [old english]

Inland  —adj. 1 in the interior of a country. 2 carried on within a country. —adv. In or towards the interior of a country.

Wroth  predic. Adj. Archaic angry. [old english]

February  n. (pl. -ies) second month of the year. [latin februa purification feast]

Plosive  —adj. Pronounced with a sudden release of breath. —n. Plosive sound. [from *explosive]

Consanguineous  adj. Descended from the same ancestor; akin.  consanguinity n. [latin sanguis blood]

Extinguish  v. 1 cause (a flame, light, etc.) To die out. 2 destroy. 3 terminate. 4 wipe out (a debt).  extinguishable adj.

Archiepiscopal  adj. Of an archbishop. [church latin from greek]

Outflow  n. 1 outward flow. 2 amount that flows out.

Kraut  n. Slang offens. German. [shortening of *sauerkraut]

Receptive  adj. Able or quick to receive impressions or ideas.  receptively adv. Receptiveness n. Receptivity n. [french or medieval latin: related to *receive]

Coterie  n. Exclusive group of people sharing interests. [french]

Pixel  n. Any of the minute areas of uniform illumination of which an image on a display screen is composed. [abbreviation of picture element]

Laundress  n. Woman who launders, esp. Professionally.

Hopeful  —adj. 1 feeling hope. 2 causing or inspiring hope. 3 likely to succeed, promising. —n. Person likely to succeed.

Southerly  —adj. & adv. 1 in a southern position or direction. 2 (of a wind) from the south. —n. (pl. -ies) such a wind.

Tridentine  adj. Of the council of trent, held at trento in italy 1545–63, esp. As the basis of roman catholic orthodoxy. [medieval latin tridentum trento]

Unwrap  v. (-pp-) 1 remove the wrapping from. 2 open, unfold. 3 become unwrapped.

Uptight  adj. Colloq. 1 nervously tense or angry. 2 us rigidly conventional.

Dealer  n. 1 trader in (esp. Retail) goods (car-dealer; dealer in tobacco). 2 player dealing at cards. 3 jobber on the stock exchange.

Usage  in sense 3, this name has been merged with broker since oct. 1986 (see *broker 2, *jobber 2).

Wanker  n. Coarse slang contemptible or ineffectual person.

Fraternize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) (often foll. By with) 1 associate; make friends. 2 enter into friendly relations with enemies etc.  fraternization n. [french and latin: related to *fraternal]

Moldy  adj. (brit. Mouldy) (-ier, -iest) 1 covered with mould. 2 stale; out of date. 3 colloq. Dull, miserable.  mouldiness n.

Robe  —n. 1 a long loose outer garment. B (often in pl.) This worn as an indication of rank, office, profession, etc. 2 esp. Us dressing-gown. —v. (-bing) clothe in a robe; dress. [french]

Mischievous  adj. 1 (of a person) disposed to mischief. 2 (of conduct) playful; malicious. 3 harmful.  mischievously adv. Mischievousness n.

Verdict  n. 1 decision of a jury in a civil or criminal case. 2 decision; judgement. [anglo-french verdit from ver true, dit saying]

Cinematography  n. Art of making films.  cinematographer n. Cinematographic adj.

History  n. (pl. -ies) 1 continuous record of (esp. Public) events. 2 a the study of past events, esp. Human affairs. B total accumulation of past events, esp. Relating to human affairs or a particular nation, person, thing, etc. 3 eventful past (this house has a history). 4 (foll. By of) past record (had a history of illness). 5 a systematic or critical account of or research into past events etc. B similar record or account of natural phenomena. 6 historical play.  make history do something memorable. [greek historia inquiry]

Hydroponics  n. Growing plants without soil, in sand, gravel, or liquid, with added nutrients. [greek ponos labour]

Thunderclap  n. 1 crash of thunder. 2 something startling or unexpected.

Waterproof  —adj. Impervious to water. —n. Waterproof garment or material. —v. Make waterproof.

Taro  n. (pl. -s) tropical plant with tuberous roots used as food. [polynesian]

Tiller  n. Bar fitted to a boat's rudder to turn it in steering. [anglo-french telier weaver's beam]

Conch  n. 1 thick heavy spiral shell of various marine gastropod molluscs. 2 any such gastropod. [latin concha]

Sergeant  n. 1 non-commissioned army or raf officer next below warrant-officer. 2 police officer below inspector. [french sergent from latin serviens -ent- servant]

Credence  n. Belief.   give credence to believe. [medieval latin: related to *credo]

Bade  see *bid.

Rampant  adj. 1 unchecked, flourishing excessively. 2 rank, luxuriant. 3 (placed after the noun) heraldry (of an animal) standing on its left hind foot with its forepaws in the air (lion rampant). 4 violent, fanatical.  rampancy n. [french: related to *ramp]

Scarp  —n. Steep slope, esp. The inner side of a ditch in a fortification. —v. Make perpendicular or steep. [italian scarpa]

Dismay  —n. Intense disappointment or despair. —v. Fill with dismay. [french from germanic: related to *dis-, *may]

Lassitude  n. 1 languor. 2 disinclination to exert oneself. [latin lassus tired]

Akin  predic. Adj. 1 related by blood. 2 similar.

Tuberose  n. Plant with scented white funnel-like flowers.

Feu  scot. —n. 1 perpetual lease at a fixed rent. 2 land so held. —v. (feus, feued, feuing) grant (land) on feu. [french: related to *fee]

Toxaemia  n. (us toxemia) 1 blood-poisoning. 2 increased blood pressure in pregnancy. [related to *toxic, greek haima blood]

Crummy  adj. (-ier, -iest) slang dirty, squalid; inferior, worthless.  crumminess n. [var. Of *crumby]

Aisle  n. 1 the part of a church on either side of the nave, divided from it by pillars. 2 passage between rows of pews, seats, etc. [latin ala wing]

Miasma  n. (pl. -mata or -s) archaic infectious or noxious vapour. [greek, = defilement]

Heptagon  n. Plane figure with seven sides and angles.  heptagonal adj. [greek: related to *hepta-, -gonos angled]

Pond  n. Small body of still water. [var. Of *pound3]

Reptile  n. 1 cold-blooded scaly animal of a class including snakes, lizards, crocodiles, turtles, tortoises, etc. 2 mean, grovelling, or repulsive person.  reptilian adj. & n. [latin repo rept- creep]

Conurbation  n. Extended urban area, esp. Consisting of several towns and merging suburbs. [latin urbs city]

Hyacinth  n. 1 bulbous plant with racemes of bell-shaped (esp. Purplish-blue) fragrant flowers. 2 purplish-blue. [greek huakinthos]

Provide  v. (-ding) 1 supply, furnish (provided me with food; provided a chance). 2 a (usu. Foll. By for, against) make due preparation. B (usu. Foll. By for) take care of a person etc. With money, food, etc. (provides for a large family). 3 (usu. Foll. By that) stipulate in a will, statute, etc.  provider n. [latin provideo -vis- foresee]

Gmt  abbr. Greenwich mean time.

Toluene  n. Colourless aromatic liquid hydrocarbon derivative of benzene, used in the manufacture of explosives etc. [tolu in colombia]

Twitcher  n. Colloq. Bird-watcher seeking sightings of rare birds.

Uglify  v. (-ies, -ied) make ugly.

Scold  —v. 1 rebuke (esp. A child). 2 find fault noisily. —n. Archaic nagging woman.  scolding n. [probably old norse]

Sandy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 having much sand. 2 a (of hair) reddish. B sand-coloured.  sandiness n.

Crosswind  n. Wind blowing across one's path etc.

Hackle  n. 1 a (in pl.) Erectile hairs on an animal's neck, rising when it is angry or alarmed. B feather(s) on the neck of a domestic cock etc. 2 steel comb for dressing flax.  make one's hackles rise cause one to be angry or indignant. [old english]

Pethidine  n. Synthetic soluble analgesic used esp. In childbirth. [perhaps from the chemical piperidine]

Netball  n. Team game in which goals are scored by throwing a ball through a high horizontal ring from which a net hangs.

Recur  v. (-rr-) 1 occur again; be repeated. 2 (foll. By to) go back in thought or speech. 3 (as recurring adj.) (of a decimal fraction) with the same figure(s) repeated indefinitely (1.66 recurring). [latin curro run]

Kw  abbr. Kilowatt(s).

Fornicate  v. (-ting) archaic or joc. (of people not married to each other) have sexual intercourse.  fornication n. Fornicator n. [latin fornix brothel]

Mummer  n. Actor in a traditional mime. [french momeur: cf. *mum2]

Gaucho  n. (pl. -s) cowboy from the s. American pampas. [spanish from quechua]

Shrank  past of *shrink.

Chow  n. 1 slang food. 2 dog of a chinese breed with long woolly hair. [chinese chow-chow]

Palatal  —adj. 1 of the palate. 2 (of a sound) made by placing the tongue against the hard palate (e.g. Y in yes). —n. Palatal sound.

Intercept  v. 1 seize, catch, or stop (a person or thing) going from one place to another. 2 (usu. Foll. By from) cut off (light etc.).  interception n. Interceptive adj. Interceptor n. [latin intercipio -cept- from capio take]

Gopher  n. American burrowing rodent, ground-squirrel, or burrowing tortoise. [origin uncertain]

Jobcentre  n. Local government office advertising available jobs.

Anthill  n. Moundlike nest built by ants or termites.

Creative  adj. 1 inventive, imaginative. 2 able to create.  creatively adv. Creativeness n. Creativity n.

Masterful  adj. 1 imperious, domineering. 2 masterly.  masterfully adv.

Usage  masterful is normally used of a person, whereas masterly is used of achievements, abilities, etc.

Birdie  n. 1 colloq. Little bird. 2 golf hole played in one under par.

Rummy  n. Card-game played usu. With two packs. [origin unknown]

Chappie  n. Colloq. = *chap1.

Sixpence  n. 1 sum of six esp. Old pence. 2 hist. Coin worth this.

Proper  adj. 1 a accurate, correct (gave him the proper amount). B fit, suitable, right (at the proper time). 2 decent; respectable, esp. Excessively so (not quite proper). 3 (usu. Foll. By to) belonging or relating (respect proper to them). 4 (usu. Placed after the noun) strictly so called; genuine (this is the crypt, not the cathedral proper). 5 colloq. Thorough; complete (a proper row). [latin proprius one's own]

Distaste  n. (usu. Foll. By for) dislike; aversion.  distasteful adj. Distastefully adv. Distastefulness n.

Thyroid  n. (in full thyroid gland) 1 large ductless gland in the neck of vertebrates, secreting a hormone which regulates growth and development. 2 extract prepared from the thyroid gland of animals and used in treating goitre etc. [greek thureos oblong shield]

Lifetime  n. Duration of a person's life.

Seductress  n. Female seducer. [obsolete seductor male seducer: related to *seduce]

Underprice  v. (-cing) price lower than what is usual or appropriate.

Alchemy  n. Medieval chemistry, esp. Seeking to turn base metals into gold.  alchemist n. [arabic]

Piquet  n. Card-game for two players with a pack of 32 cards. [french]

Moonshine  n. 1 foolish or unrealistic talk or ideas. 2 slang illicitly distilled or smuggled alcohol.

Rumble  —v. (-ling) 1 make a continuous deep resonant sound as of distant thunder. 2 (foll. By along, by, past, etc.) (esp. Of a vehicle) move with a rumbling noise. 3 (often absol.) Slang find out the esp. Discreditable truth about. —n. Rumbling sound. [probably dutch rommelen]

Invocation  n. 1 invoking or being invoked, esp. In prayer. 2 summoning of supernatural beings, e.g. The muses, for inspiration. 3 eccl. The words ‘in the name of the father’ etc. Used to preface a sermon etc.  invocatory adj. [latin: related to *invoke] 

Jockstrap  n. Support or protection for the male genitals, worn esp. In sport. [slang jock genitals]

Canter  —n. Horse's pace between a trot and a gallop. —v. Go or make go at a canter. [canterbury gallop of medieval pilgrims]

Stupid  adj. (stupider, stupidest) 1 unintelligent, foolish (a stupid fellow). 2 typical of stupid persons (stupid mistake). 3 uninteresting, boring. 4 in a stupor.  stupidity n. (pl. -ies). Stupidly adv. [latin: related to *stupendous]

Needful  adj. Requisite.  needfully adv.

Patrician  —n. Hist. Member of the nobility in ancient rome. —adj. 1 aristocratic. 2 hist. Of the ancient roman nobility. [latin patricius: related to *pater]

Unrequited  adj. (of love etc.) Not returned.

Vac  n. Colloq. 1 vacation. 2 vacuum cleaner. [abbreviation]

Consternation  n. Anxiety, dismay. [latin sterno throw down]

Headlong  adv. & adj. 1 with the head foremost. 2 in a rush.

Select  —v. Choose, esp. With care. —adj. 1 chosen for excellence or suitability. 2 (of a society etc.) Exclusive. [latin seligo -lect-]

Escapade  n. Piece of reckless behaviour. [french from provençal or spanish: related to *escape]

Centerfold  n. (brit. Centrefold) centre spread of a magazine etc., esp. With nude photographs.

Connector  n. Thing that connects.

Sulfurous  adj. (brit. Sulphurous) 1 of or like sulphur. 2 chem. Containing sulphur with a valency of four.

Palpitate  v. (-ting) pulsate, throb, tremble. [latin palpito frequentative of palpo touch gently]

-acy  suffix forming nouns of state or quality (accuracy; piracy), or an instance of it (conspiracy; fallacy). [french -acie, latin -acia, -atia, greek -ateia]

Concurrent  adj. 1 (often foll. By with) existing or in operation at the same time or together. 2 (of three or more lines) meeting at or tending towards one point. 3 agreeing, harmonious.  concurrence n. Concurrently adv.

Nematode  n. Worm with a slender unsegmented cylindrical shape. [greek nema thread]

Graphite  n. Crystalline allotropic form of carbon used as a lubricant, in pencils, etc.  graphitic adj. [german graphit from greek grapho write]

Elixir  n. 1 a alchemist's preparation supposedly able to change metals into gold or (in full elixir of life) to prolong life indefinitely. B remedy for all ills. 2 aromatic medicinal drug. [latin from arabic]

Saccharine  adj. Excessively sentimental or sweet.

Penumbra  n. (pl. -s or -brae) 1 partly shaded region around the shadow of an opaque body, esp. That around the shadow of the moon or earth in an eclipse. 2 partial shadow.  penumbral adj. [latin paene almost, *umbra]

Thyme  n. Any of several herbs with aromatic leaves. [greek thumon]

Atom  n. 1 a smallest particle of a chemical element that can take part in a chemical reaction. B this as a source of nuclear energy. 2 minute portion or thing (atom of pity). [greek atomos indivisible]

Maladminister  v. Manage badly or improperly.  maladministration n.

Interloper  n. 1 intruder. 2 person who interferes in others' affairs, esp. For profit. [after landloper vagabond, from dutch loopen run]

Typesetter  n. Printing 1 person who composes type. 2 composing-machine.  typesetting n.

Shorthorn  n. Animal of a breed of cattle with short horns.

Vicissitude  n. Literary change, esp. Of fortune. [latin: related to *vice3]

Bouzouki  n. (pl. -s) greek form of mandolin. [modern greek]

Clinical  adj. 1 of or for the treatment of patients. 2 dispassionate, coolly detached. 3 (of a room, building, etc.) Bare, functional.  clinically adv. [greek: related to *clinic]

Alter  v. Make or become different; change.  alteration n. [latin alter other]

Characteristic  —adj. Typical, distinctive. —n. Characteristic feature or quality.  characteristically adv.

Slut  n. Derog. Slovenly or promiscuous woman.  sluttish adj. [origin unknown]

Vocation  n. 1 a strong feeling of suitability for a particular career. B this regarded as a divine call to a career in the church. 2 employment, trade, profession.  vocational adj. [latin voco call]

Dram  n. 1 small drink of spirits, esp. Whisky. 2 = *drachm. [latin drama: related to *drachm]

Isochronous  adj. 1 occurring at the same time. 2 occupying equal time.

Teat  n. 1 mammary nipple, esp. Of an animal. 2 rubber nipple for sucking from a bottle. [french from germanic]

Toadstool  n. Fungus, usu. Poisonous, with a round top and slender stalk.

Forgo  v. (also forego) (-goes; past -went; past part. -gone) go without; relinquish. [old english]

Depopulate  v. (-ting) reduce the population of.  depopulation n.

Fastness  n. Stronghold. [old english]

Touchy  adj. (-ier, -iest) apt to take offence; over-sensitive.  touchily adv. Touchiness n.
