Goggle  —v. (-ling) 1 a (often foll. By at) look with wide-open eyes. B (of the eyes) be rolled about; protrude. 2 roll (the eyes). —adj. (usu. Attrib.) (of the eyes) protuberant or rolling. —n. (in pl.) Spectacles for protecting the eyes. [probably imitative]

Asbestos  n. 1 fibrous silicate mineral. 2 this as a heat-resistant or insulating material. [greek, = unquenchable]

Gaolbird  var. Of *jailbird.

Merciless  adj. Showing no mercy.  mercilessly adv.

Necromancy  n. 1 divination by supposed communication with the dead. 2 magic.  necromancer n. [from *necro-, mantis seer]

Unsettled  adj. 1 restless, disturbed; unpredictable, changeable. 2 open to change or further discussion. 3 (of a bill etc.) Unpaid.

Astigmatism  n. Eye or lens defect resulting in distorted images.  astigmatic adj. [from *a-, *stigma]

Thrown  past part of *throw.

Ska  n. A kind of fast orig. Jamaican pop music. [origin unknown]

Weighty  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 heavy. 2 momentous. 3 (of utterances etc.) Deserving consideration. 4 influential, authoritative.  weightily adv. Weightiness n.

Depot  n. 1 a storehouse, esp. For military supplies. B headquarters of a regiment. 2 a place where vehicles, e.g. Buses, are kept. B us railway or bus station. [french: related to *deposit]

Lederhosen  n.pl. Leather shorts as worn by some men in bavaria etc. [german, = leather trousers]

Attend  v. 1 a be present (at) (attended the meeting). B go regularly to (attends church). 2 escort. 3 a (often foll. By to) turn or apply one's mind. B (foll. By to) deal with (attend to the matter). [latin tendo stretch]

Selenium  n. Non-metallic element occurring naturally in various metallic sulphide ores. [greek selene moon]

Timepiece  n. Clock or watch.

Gabble  —v. (-ling) talk or utter unintelligibly or too fast. —n. Fast unintelligible talk. [dutch, imitative]

Halve  v. (-ving) 1 divide into two halves or parts; share equally between two. 2 reduce by half. 3 golf use the same number of strokes as one's opponent in (a hole or match).

Periodic  adj. Appearing or occurring at intervals.  periodicity n.

Translucent  adj. Allowing light to pass through; semi-transparent.  translucence n. Translucency n. [latin luceo shine]

Airhead  n. Slang stupid or foolish person.

Coralline  —n. Seaweed with a hard jointed stem. —adj. Of or like coral. [french and italian: related to *coral]

Headroom  n. Space or clearance above a vehicle, person's head, etc.

Dreamland  n. Ideal or imaginary land.

Nephritis  n. Inflammation of the kidneys.

Unconfined  adj. Not confined; boundless.

Laborious  adj. 1 needing hard work or toil. 2 (esp. Of literary style) showing signs of toil.  laboriously adv. [latin: related to *labour]

Photograph  —n. Picture formed by means of the chemical action of light or other radiation on sensitive film. —v. (also absol.) Take a photograph of (a person etc.).  photographer n. Photographic adj. Photographically adv.

Quinquereme  n. Ancient roman galley with five files of oarsmen on each side. [latin quinque five, remus oar]

Devoted  adj. Loving; loyal.  devotedly adv.

Spurt  —v. 1 (cause to) gush out in a jet or stream. 2 make a sudden effort. —n. 1 sudden gushing out, jet. 2 short burst of speed, growth, etc. [origin unknown]

Ne  abbr. 1 north-east. 2 north-eastern.

Ludo  n. Simple board-game played with dice and counters. [latin, = i play]

Snappish  adj. 1 curt; ill-tempered; sharp. 2 inclined to snap.

Scruple  —n. 1 (often in pl.) Moral concern. 2 doubt caused by this. —v. (-ling) (foll. By to + infin.; usu. With neg.) Hesitate because of scruples. [latin]

Prenatal  adj. Of the period before childbirth.

Luncheon  n. Formal lunch. [origin unknown]

Plot  —n. 1 defined and usu. Small piece of land. 2 interrelationship of the main events in a play, novel, film, etc. 3 conspiracy or secret plan. —v. (-tt-) 1 make a plan or map of. 2 (also absol.) Plan or contrive secretly (a crime etc.). 3 mark on a chart or diagram. 4  make (a curve etc.) By marking out a number of points. 5  provide (a play, novel, film, etc.) With a plot.  plotter n. [old english and french complot]

Hesitate  v. (-ting) 1 show or feel indecision or uncertainty; pause in doubt (hesitated over her choice). 2 be reluctant (i hesitate to say so).  hesitation n. [latin haereo haes- stick fast]

Ellipsoid  n. Solid of which all the plane sections through one axis are circles and all the other plane sections are ellipses.

Irreversible  adj. Not reversible or alterable.  irreversibly adv.

Resume  v. (-ming) 1 begin again or continue after an interruption. 2 begin to speak, work, or use again; recommence. 3 get back; take back (resume one's seat). [latin sumo sumpt- take]

Collywobbles  n.pl. Colloq. 1 rumbling or pain in the stomach. 2 apprehensive feeling. [from *colic, *wobble]

Penetrate  v. (-ting) 1 a find access into or through. B (usu. Foll. By with) imbue with; permeate. 2 see into, find out, or discern. 3 see through (darkness, fog, etc.). 4 be absorbed by the mind. 5 (as penetrating adj.) A having or suggesting sensitivity or insight. B (of a voice etc.) Easily heard through or above other sounds; piercing.  penetrable adj. Penetrability n. Penetration n. Penetrative adj. [latin]

Unfortunately  adv. 1 (qualifying a sentence) it is unfortunate that. 2 in an unfortunate manner.

Globe  n. 1 a (prec. By the) the earth. B spherical representation of it with a map on the surface. 2 spherical object, e.g. A fish-bowl, lamp, etc. [latin globus]

Approachable  adj. 1 friendly, easy to talk to. 2 able to be approached.

Rottweiler  n. Black-and-tan dog noted for ferocity. [rottweil in germany]

Phosphate  n. Salt or ester of phosphoric acid, esp. Used as a fertilizer. [french: related to *phosphorus]

Bait  —n. 1 food used to entice prey. 2 allurement. —v. 1 harass, torment, or annoy (a person or chained animal). 2 put bait on (a hook, trap, etc.). [old norse]

Chalice  n. 1 goblet. 2 eucharistic cup. [latin *calix]

Suspension  n. 1 suspending or being suspended. 2 springs etc. Supporting a vehicle on its axles. 3 substance consisting of particles suspended in a medium.

Marchioness  n. 1 wife or widow of a marquess. 2 woman holding the rank of marquess. [medieval latin: related to *march2]

Mesosphere  n. Region of the atmosphere from the top of the stratosphere to an altitude of about 80 km.

Reparable  adj. (of a loss etc.) That can be made good. [latin: related to *repair1]

Retention  n. 1 retaining or being retained. 2 condition of retaining bodily fluid (esp. Urine) normally evacuated. [latin: related to *retain]

Untrammelled  adj. Not trammelled, unhampered.

Stepfather  n. Male step-parent.

Reprieve  —v. (-ving) 1 remit or postpone the execution of (a condemned person). 2 give respite to. —n. 1 a reprieving or being reprieved. B warrant for this. 2 respite. [repry from french reprendre -pris take back]

Sundae  n. Ice-cream with fruit, nuts, syrup, etc. [perhaps from *sunday]

Complexion  n. 1 natural colour, texture, and appearance of the skin, esp. Of the face. 2 aspect, character (puts a different complexion on the matter). [latin: related to *complex]

Ecstasy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 overwhelming joy or rapture. 2 slang type of hallucinogenic drug.  ecstatic adj. Ecstatically adv. [greek ekstasis standing outside oneself]

Cheeseburger  n. Hamburger with cheese in or on it.

Exactitude  n. Exactness, precision.

Pentateuch  n. First five books of the old testament. [greek teukhos book]

Chairperson  n. Chairman or chairwoman.

Puzzle  —n. 1 difficult or confusing problem. 2 problem or toy designed to test knowledge or ingenuity. —v. (-ling) 1 confound or disconcert mentally. 2 (usu. Foll. By over etc.) Be perplexed (about). 3 (usu. As puzzling adj.) Require much mental effort (puzzling situation). 4 (foll. By out) solve or understand by hard thought.  puzzlement n. [origin unknown]

Pendulous  adj. Hanging down; drooping and swinging.  [latin pendulus from pendeo hang]

Amenable  adj. 1 responsive, docile. 2 (often foll. By to) answerable to law etc. [french: related to *ad-, latin mino drive animals]

Unprincipled  adj. Lacking or not based on moral principles.

Plethora  n. Over-abundance. [greek, = fullness]

Animalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) make (a person) bestial, sensualize.

Misdemeanor  n. (brit. Misdemeanour) 1 misdeed. 2  hist indictable offence less serious than a felony. [from *mis-1]

Gorse  n. Spiny yellow-flowered shrub; furze.  gorsy adj. [old english]

Crikey  int. Slang expression of astonishment. [from *christ]

Hoax  —n. Humorous or malicious deception. —v. Deceive (a person) with a hoax. [probably a shortening of hocus in *hocus-pocus]

Nimby  —adj. Objecting to the siting of unpleasant developments in one's own locality. —n. (pl. -ies) person who so objects. [not in my back yard]

Superfluity  n. (pl. -ies) 1 state of being superfluous. 2 superfluous amount or thing. [latin fluo to flow]

Crook  —n. 1 hooked staff of a shepherd or bishop. 2 a bend, curve, or hook. B hooked or curved thing. 3 colloq. Rogue; swindler; criminal. —v. Bend, curve. [old norse]

Californium  n. Artificial radioactive metallic element. [california in us, where first made]

Palimpsest  n. 1 writing-material or manuscript on which the original writing has been effaced for re-use. 2 monumental brass turned and re-engraved on the reverse side. [greek palin again, psestos rubbed]

Untether  v. Release (an animal) from a tether.

Nuisance  n. Person, thing, or circumstance causing trouble or annoyance. [french, = hurt, from nuire nuis- injure, from latin noceo to hurt]

Vegetate  v. (-ting) 1 live an uneventful or monotonous life. 2 grow as plants do. [latin vegeto animate]

Nz  abbr. New zealand.

Chomp  v. = *champ1. [imitative]

Latecomer  n. Person who arrives late.

Renunciation  n. 1 renouncing or giving up. 2 self-denial.

Subsidize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 pay a subsidy to. 2 partially pay for by subsidy.

Transputer  n. Microprocessor with integral memory designed for parallel processing. [from *transistor, *computer]

Untruthful  adj. Not truthful.  untruthfully adv.

Stunner  n. Colloq. Stunning person or thing.

Edifice  n. Building, esp. An imposing one. [latin aedis dwelling]

Lacy  adj. (-ier, -iest) of or resembling lace fabric.

Solan  n. (in full solan goose) large gooselike gannet. [old norse]

Pretension  n. 1 (often foll. By to) a assertion of a claim. B justifiable claim. 2 pretentiousness. [medieval latin: related to *pretend]

Rayon  n. Textile fibre or fabric made from cellulose. [from *ray1]

Obverse  n. 1 counterpart, opposite. 2 side of a coin or medal etc. Bearing the head or principal design. 3 front, proper, or top side of a thing. [latin obverto obvers- turn towards]

Trug  n. Shallow oblong garden-basket usu. Of wood strips. [perhaps a dial. Var. Of *trough]

Stool  n. 1 single seat without a back or arms. 2 = *footstool. 3 (usu. In pl.) = *faeces. [old english]

Fettle  n. Condition or trim (in fine fettle). [old english]

Progression  n. 1 progressing. 2 succession; series. [latin: related to *progress]

Bag  —n. 1 soft open-topped receptacle. 2 a piece of luggage. B woman's handbag. 3 (in pl.; usu. Foll. By of) colloq. Large amount (bags of time). 4 slang derog. Woman. 5 animal's sac. 6 amount of game shot by one person. 7 (usu. In pl.) Baggy skin under the eyes. 8 slang particular interest (folk music is not my bag). —v. (-gg-) 1 colloq. A secure (bagged the best seat). B (often in phr. Bags i) colloq. Claim as being the first (bags i go next). 2 put in a bag. 3 (cause to) hang loosely; bulge.  in the bag colloq. Achieved, secured.  bagful n. (pl. -s). [origin unknown]

Condensation  n. 1 condensing or being condensed. 2 condensed liquid (esp. Water on a cold surface). 3 abridgement. [latin: related to *condense]

Heartily  adv. 1 in a hearty manner. 2 very (am heartily sick of it).

Falsity  n. Being false.

Levant  n. (prec. By the) archaic eastern mediterranean countries. [french, = point of sunrise, from latin levo lift]

Workaday  adj. Ordinary, everyday, practical.

Comrade  n. 1 associate or companion in some activity. 2 fellow socialist or communist.  comradely adj. Comradeship n. [spanish: related to *chamber]

Keystroke  n. Single depression of a key on a keyboard, esp. As a measure of work.

Cantankerous  adj. Bad-tempered, quarrelsome.  cantankerously adv. Cantankerousness n. [origin uncertain]

Assist  v. (often foll. By in + verbal noun) help.  assistance n. [latin assisto stand by]

Communal  adj. 1 shared between members of a group or community; for common use. 2 (of conflict etc.) Between esp. Ethnic or religious communities.  communally adv. [latin: related to *commune1]

Overshoe  n. Outer protective shoe worn over an ordinary one.

Pedal  —n. Lever or key operated by foot, esp. In a vehicle, on a bicycle, or on some musical instruments (e.g. The organ). —v. (-ll-; us -l-) 1 operate the pedals of a bicycle, organ, etc. 2 propel (a bicycle etc.) With the pedals. —adj. Of the foot or feet. [latin pes ped- foot]

Ppm  abbr. Parts per million.

Methyl  n. Univalent hydrocarbon radical ch3, present in many organic compounds. [greek methu wine, hule wood]

Heating  n. 1 imparting or generation of heat. 2 equipment used to heat a building etc.

Gybe  v. (us jibe) (-bing) 1 (of a fore-and-aft sail or boom) swing across. 2 cause (a sail) to do this. 3 (of a ship or its crew) change course so that this happens. [dutch]

Unlearn  v. (past and past part. Unlearned or unlearnt) 1 forget deliberately. 2 rid oneself of (a habit, false information, etc.).

Entourage  n. People attending an important person. [french]

Diddums  int. Often iron. Expressing commiseration. [= did 'em, i.e. Did they (tease you etc.)?]

Spiritless  adj. Lacking vigour.

Ns  abbr. New style.

Wrns  abbr. Women's royal naval service.

Pedicure  n. 1 care or treatment of the feet, esp. The toenails. 2 person practising this for a living. [latin pes ped- foot, cura care]

Solicit  v. (-t-) 1 seek (esp. Business) repeatedly or earnestly. 2 (also absol.) Accost as a prostitute.  solicitation n. [latin sollicitus anxious]

Stutter  —v. 1 stammer, esp. By involuntary repetition of the initial consonants of words. 2 (often foll. By out) utter (words) in this way. —n. Act or habit of stuttering. [dial. Stut]

Horrendous  adj. Horrifying.  horrendously adv. [latin: related to *horrible]

Guinea  n. 1 hist. Sum of 21 old shillings (£1.05). 2 hist. Former british gold coin first coined for the african trade. [guinea in w. Africa]

Simplicity  n. Fact or condition of being simple.

Forebode  v. (-ding) 1 be an advance sign of, portend. 2 (often foll. By that) have a presentiment of (usu. Evil).

Teak  n. 1 a hard durable timber. 2 large indian or se asian deciduous tree yielding this. [portuguese from malayalam]

Microphotograph  n. Photograph reduced to a very small size. [from *micro-]

Furry  adj. (-ier, -iest) like or covered with fur.

Was  1st & 3rd sing. Past of *be.

Mimic  —v. (-ck-) 1 imitate (a person, gesture, etc.) Esp. To entertain or ridicule. 2 copy minutely or servilely. 3 resemble closely. —n. Person skilled in imitation.  mimicry n. [greek mimikos: related to *mime]

Precaution  n. Action taken beforehand to avoid risk or ensure a good result.  precautionary adj. [latin: related to *caution]

Fuzzy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 like fuzz, fluffy. 2 blurred, indistinct.  fuzzily adv. Fuzziness n.

Innate  adj. Inborn; natural.  innately adv. [latin natus born]

Diplomacy  n. 1 a management of international relations. B skill in this. 2 tact. [french: related to *diplomatic]

Commentator  n. 1 person who provides a commentary. 2 person who comments on current events. [latin]

Prevail  v. 1 (often foll. By against, over) be victorious or gain mastery. 2 be the more usual or predominant. 3 exist or occur in general use or experience. 4 (foll. By on, upon) persuade. [latin praevaleo: related to *avail]

Paedophile  n. (us pedophile) person who displays paedophilia.

Galvanize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 (often foll. By into) rouse forcefully, esp. By shock or excitement (was galvanized into action). 2 stimulate by or as by electricity. 3 coat (iron) with zinc to protect against rust.  galvanization n. [galvani, name of a physiologist]

Speedy  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 rapid. 2 done without delay; prompt.  speedily adv. Speediness n.

Ban  —v. (-nn-) forbid, prohibit, esp. Formally. —n. Formal prohibition (ban on smoking). [old english, = summon]

Opaline  adj. Opal-like, opalescent.

Traumatic  adj. 1 of or causing trauma. 2 colloq. Distressing (traumatic experience).  traumatically adv. [greek: related to *trauma]

Buckshee  adj. & adv. Slang free of charge. [corruption of *baksheesh]

Vivid  adj. 1 (of light or colour) strong, intense. 2 (of a memory, description, the imagination, etc.) Clear, lively, graphic.  vividly adv. Vividness n. [latin]

Bonny  adj. (-ier, -iest) esp. Scot. & n.engl. 1 a physically attractive. B healthy-looking. 2 good, pleasant. [perhaps from french bon good]

Omnibus  —n. 1 formal bus. 2 volume containing several literary works previously published separately. —adj. 1 serving several purposes at once. 2 comprising several items. [latin, = for all]

Entwine  v. (-ning) twine round, interweave.

Maelstrom  n. 1 great whirlpool. 2 state of confusion. [dutch]

Cavy  n. (pl. -ies) small s. American rodent, esp. The guinea pig. [latin from galibi]

Invigorate  v. (-ting) give vigour or strength to.  invigorating adj. [medieval latin: related to *vigour]

Authenticate  v. (-ting) establish as true, genuine, or valid.  authentication n.

Generalize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) 1 a speak in general or indefinite terms. B form general notions. 2 reduce to a general statement. 3 infer (a rule etc.) From particular cases. 4 bring into general use.  generalization n.

Fivefold  adj. & adv. 1 five times as much or as many. 2 consisting of five parts.

Derecognize  v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing) cease to recognize the status of (esp. A trade union).  derecognition n.

Barrel  —n. 1 cylindrical usu. Convex container. 2 its contents. 3 measure of capacity (30 to 40 gallons). 4 cylindrical tube forming part of an object, e.g. A gun or a pen. —v.

Casserole  —n. 1 covered dish for cooking food in the oven. 2 food cooked in this. —v. (-ling) cook in a casserole. [greek kuathion little cup]

Cement  —n. 1 powdery substance of calcined lime and clay, mixed with water to form mortar or used in concrete. 2 similar substance. 3 uniting factor or principle. 4 substance used in filling teeth, doing hip replacements, etc. —v. 1 a unite with or as with cement. B establish or strengthen (a friendship etc.). 2 apply cement to. 3 line or cover with cement.  cementation n. [latin caedo cut]

Untainted  adj. Not tainted.

Plural  —adj. 1 more than one in number. 2 gram. (of a word or form) denoting more than one. —n. Gram. 1 plural word or form. 2 plural number. [latin: related to *plus]

Filler  n. 1 material used to fill a cavity or increase bulk. 2 small item filling space in a newspaper etc.

Worse  —adj. 1 more bad. 2 (predic.) In or into worse health or a worse condition (is getting worse). —adv. More badly; more ill. —n. 1 worse thing or things (you might do worse than accept). 2 (prec. By the) worse condition (a change for the worse).  none the worse (often foll. By for) not adversely affected (by). The worse for wear 1 damaged by use. 2 injured. Worse luck unfortunately. Worse off in a worse (esp. Financial) position. [old english]

Aerodrome  n. Small airport or airfield. [from *aero-, greek dromos course]

Onerous  adj. Burdensome.  onerousness n. [latin: related to *onus]

Deforest  v. Clear of forests or trees.  deforestation n.

Raillery  n. Good-humoured ridicule. [french raillerie: related to *rail2]

Ineluctable  adj. Inescapable, unavoidable. [latin luctor strive]

Pean  n. (brit. Paean) song of praise or triumph. [latin from greek]

Proto-  comb. Form first. [greek protos]

Silkworm  n. Caterpillar that spins a cocoon of silk.

Glue  —n. Adhesive substance. —v. (glues, glued, gluing or glueing) 1 fasten or join with glue. 2 keep or put very close (eye glued to the keyhole).  gluey adj. (gluier, gluiest). [latin glus: related to *gluten]

Minuscule  adj. Colloq. Extremely small or unimportant. [latin diminutive: related to *minus]

Unstated  adj. Not stated or declared.

Salvia  n. Garden plant of the sage family with red or blue flowers. [latin, = *sage1]

Sceptic  n. (us skeptic) 1 person inclined to doubt accepted opinions. 2 person who doubts the truth of religions. 3 philosopher who questions the possibility of knowledge.  scepticism n. [greek skeptomai observe]

Mouldy  adj. (us moldy) (-ier, -iest) 1 covered with mould. 2 stale; out of date. 3 colloq. Dull, miserable.  mouldiness n.

Migraine  n. Recurrent throbbing headache often with nausea and visual disturbance. [greek hemikrania: related to *hemi-, *cranium]

Sconce  n. Wall-bracket for a candlestick or light-fitting. [latin (ab)sconsa covered (light)]

Mediaeval  var. Of *medieval.

Bannock  n. Scot. & n.engl. Round flat loaf, usu. Unleavened. [old english]

Toot  —n. Short sharp sound as made by a trumpet. —v. 1 sound (a trumpet etc.) With a short sharp sound. 2 give out such a sound. [probably imitative]

Blockade  —n. Surrounding or blocking of a place by an enemy to prevent entry and exit. —v. (-ding) subject to a blockade.

Lack  —n. (usu. Foll. By of) want, deficiency. —v. Be without or deficient in. [low german or dutch]

Pyro-  comb. Form 1 denoting fire. 2 denoting a mineral etc. Changed under the action of heat, or fiery in colour. [greek pur fire]

Inflict  v. (usu. Foll. By on) 1 deal (a blow etc.). 2 often joc. Impose (suffering, oneself, etc.) On (shall not inflict myself on you any longer).  infliction n. Inflictor n. [latin fligo flict- strike]

Weightlifting  n. Sport of lifting heavy weights.  weightlifter n.

Hearthrug  n. Rug laid before a fireplace.

Chinless  adj. Colloq. Weak or feeble in character.

Indifferent  adj. 1 (foll. By to) showing indifference or lack of interest. 2 neither good nor bad. 3 of poor quality or ability.  indifferently adv.

Pennyworth  n. As much as can be bought for a penny.

Firecracker  n. Us explosive firework.

Expectorant  —adj. Causing expectoration. —n. Expectorant medicine.

Crossword  n. (also crossword puzzle) printed grid of squares and blanks for vertical and horizontal words to be filled in from clues.

Javanese  —n. (pl. Same) 1 a native of java. B person of javanese descent. 2 language of java. —adj. (also javan) of java, its people, or its language. [java in indonesia]

Vintner  n. Wine-merchant. [anglo-latin from french, ultimately from latin vinetum vineyard, from vinum wine]

Tipstaff  n. 1 sheriff's officer. 2 metal-tipped staff carried as a symbol of office. [from *tip1]

Icing  n. 1 coating of sugar etc. On a cake or biscuit. 2 formation of ice on a ship or aircraft.  icing on the cake inessential though attractive addition or enhancement.

Dairy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 place for processing, distributing, or selling milk and its products. 2 (attrib.) Of, containing, or used for, dairy products (and sometimes eggs) (dairy cow). [old english]

Vagrant  —n. Unemployed itinerant. —adj. Wandering, roving.  vagrancy n. [anglo-french]

Ghee  n. Indian clarified butter. [hindi from sanskrit]

Null  adj. 1 (esp. Null and void) invalid. 2 non-existent. 3 without character or expression.  nullity n. [latin nullus none]

Professional  —adj. 1 of, belonging to, or connected with a profession. 2 a skilful, competent. B worthy of a professional (professional conduct). 3 engaged in a specified activity as one's main paid occupation (professional boxer). 4 derog. Engaged in a specified activity, esp. Fanatically (professional agitator). —n. Professional person.  professionally adv.

Undercarriage  n. 1 wheeled retractable structure beneath an aircraft, used for landing etc. 2 supporting frame of a vehicle.

Shamble  —v. (-ling) walk or run awkwardly, dragging the feet. —n. Shambling gait. [perhaps related to *shambles]

Intersection  n. 1 intersecting. 2 place where two roads intersect. 3 point or line common to lines or planes that intersect.

Script  —n. 1 text of a play, film, or broadcast. 2 handwriting; written characters. 3 type imitating handwriting. 4 alphabet or system of writing. 5 examinee's written answers. —v. Write a script for (a film etc.). [latin scriptum from scribo write]

Forestry  n. Science or management of forests.

Imposing  adj. Impressive, formidable, esp. In appearance.

Sludge  n. 1 thick greasy mud or sediment. 2 sewage.  sludgy adj. [cf. *slush]

Dickensian  adj. 1 of the 19th-c. Novelist dickens or his work. 2 resembling situations in dickens's work, esp. Poverty.

Unscripted  adj. (of a speech etc.) Delivered impromptu.

Permeate  v. (-ting) 1 penetrate throughout; pervade; saturate. 2 (usu. Foll. By through, among, etc.) Diffuse itself.  permeation n. [latin permeo pass through]

Unutterable  adj. Inexpressible; beyond description.  unutterably adv.

Interfere  v. (-ring) 1 (usu. Foll. By with) a (of a person) meddle; obstruct a process etc. B (of a thing) be a hindrance. 2 (usu. Foll. By in) intervene, esp. Without invitation or necessity. 3 (foll. By with) euphem. Molest or assault sexually. 4 (of light or other waves) combine so as to cause interference. [latin ferio strike]

Octa-  comb. Form (also oct- before a vowel) eight. [latin octo, greek okto eight]

Whitehead  n. Colloq. White or white-topped skin-pustule.

Biff  slang —n. Sharp blow. —v. Strike (a person). [imitative]

Cinema  n. 1 theatre where films are shown. 2 a films collectively. B art or industry of producing films.  cinematic adj. [french: related to *kinematics]

Hideous  adj. 1 very ugly, revolting. 2 colloq. Unpleasant.  hideosity n. (pl. -ies). Hideously adv. [anglo-french hidous]

Supposition  n. 1 thing supposed. 2 act of supposing.

Coracle  n. Small boat of wickerwork covered with watertight material. [welsh]

Auger  n. Tool with a screw point for boring in wood. [old english]

Class  —n. 1 any set of persons or things grouped together, or graded or differentiated from others esp. By quality (first class; economy class). 2 division or order of society (upper class). 3 colloq. Distinction, high quality. 4 a group of students taught together. B occasion when they meet. C their course of instruction. 5 division of candidates by merit in an examination. 6 biol. Next grouping of organisms below a division or phylum. —v. Assign to a class or category.  in a class of (or on) its (or one's) own unequalled.  classless adj. [latin classis assembly]

Gloom  n. 1 darkness; obscurity. 2 melancholy; despondency. [origin unknown]

Working  —attrib. Adj. 1 a engaged in work (working mother; working man). B while so engaged (all his working life; in working hours). 2 functioning or able to function (working model). —n. 1 activity of work. 2 functioning. 3 mine or quarry. 4 (usu. In pl.) Machinery, mechanism.

Personage  n. Person, esp. Of rank or importance.

Reminiscence  n. 1 remembering things past. 2 (in pl.) Collection in literary form of incidents and experiences remembered. [latin reminiscor remember]

Duckweed  n. Any of various plants growing on the surface of still water.

Lovat  n. & adj. Muted green. [lovat in scotland]

Tricky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 requiring care and adroitness (tricky job). 2 crafty, deceitful.  trickily adv. Trickiness n.

Mound  n. 1 raised mass of earth, stones, etc. 2 heap or pile; large quantity. 3 hillock. [origin unknown]

Blindfold  —v. Cover the eyes of (a person) with a tied cloth etc. —n. Cloth etc. So used. —adj. & adv. 1 with eyes covered. 2 without due care. [originally blindfelled = struck blind]

Dryad  n. Wood nymph. [greek drus tree]

Wrong  —adj. 1 mistaken; not true; in error. 2 unsuitable; less or least desirable (the wrong road; a wrong decision). 3 contrary to law or morality (it is wrong to steal). 4 amiss; out of order, in a bad or abnormal condition (something wrong with my heart; has gone wrong). —adv. (usually placed last) in a wrong manner or direction; with an incorrect result (guessed wrong). —n. 1 what is morally wrong. 2 unjust action (suffer a wrong). —v. 1 treat unjustly. 2 mistakenly attribute bad motives to.  do wrong sin. Do wrong to malign or mistreat (a person). Get wrong 1 misunderstand (a person etc.). 2 obtain an incorrect answer to. Get (or get hold of) the wrong end of the stick misunderstand completely. Go wrong 1 take the wrong path. 2 stop functioning properly. 3 depart from virtuous behaviour. In the wrong responsible for a quarrel, mistake, or offence. On the wrong side of 1 out of favour with (a person). 2 somewhat more than (a stated age). Wrong side out inside out. Wrong way round in the opposite or reverse of the normal or desirable orientation or sequence etc.  wrongly adv. Wrongness n. [old english]

Novelty  n. (pl. -ies) 1 newness. 2 new or unusual thing or occurrence. 3 small toy or trinket. [related to *novel2]

Gurgle  —v. (-ling) 1 make a bubbling sound as of water from a bottle. 2 utter with such a sound. —n. Gurgling sound. [probably imitative]

Archery  n. Shooting with a bow and arrows, esp. As a sport.

Bimetallic  adj. Using or made of two metals. [french]

Destiny  n. (pl. -ies) 1 a fate. B this regarded as a power. 2 particular person's fate etc. [french from latin]

Apt  adj. 1 appropriate, suitable. 2 tending (apt to break down). 3 clever; quick to learn. [latin aptus fitted]

Likely  —adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 probable; such as may well happen or be true. 2 to be reasonably expected (not likely to come now). 3 promising; apparently suitable (a likely spot). —adv. Probably.  not likely! Colloq. Certainly not, i refuse. [old norse: related to *like1]

Morale  n. Confidence, determination, etc. Of a person or group. [french moral: related to *moral]

Ladle  —n. Deep long-handled spoon used for serving liquids. —v. (-ling) (often foll. By out) transfer (liquid) with a ladle. [old english]

Forty  adj. & n. (pl. -ies) 1 four times ten. 2 symbol for this (40, xl, xl). 3 (in pl.) Numbers from 40 to 49, esp. The years of a century or of a person's life.  fortieth adj. & n. [old english: related to *four]

Scrummage  n. Rugby massed forwards on each side pushing to gain possession of the ball thrown on the ground between them. [related to *scrimmage]

Deafen  v. (often as deafening adj.) Overpower with noise or make deaf by noise, esp. Temporarily.  deafeningly adv.

Tasteless  adj. 1 lacking flavour. 2 having, or done in, bad taste.  tastelessly adv. Tastelessness n.

Splodge  colloq. —n. Daub, blot, or smear. —v. (-ging) make a splodge on.  splodgy adj. [alteration of *splotch]

Slaughterhouse  n. Place for the slaughter of animals as food.

Astute  adj. Shrewd.  astutely adv. Astuteness n. [latin astus craft]

Scam  n. Us slang trick, fraud. [origin unknown]

Group  —n. 1 number of persons or things located close together, or considered or classed together. 2 number of people working together etc. 3 number of commercial companies under common ownership. 4 ensemble playing popular music. 5 division of an air force etc. —v. 1 form or be formed into a group. 2 (often foll. By with) place in a group or groups. [italian gruppo]

Bathysphere  n. Vessel for deep-sea observation. [greek bathus deep, *sphere]

Tillage  n. 1 preparation of land for growing crops. 2 tilled land.

Roadworthy  adj. Fit to be used on the road.  roadworthiness n.

Noddy  n. (pl. -ies) 1 simpleton. 2 tropical sea bird. [origin unknown]

Lough  n. Ir. Lake, arm of the sea. [irish: related to *loch]

Automat  n. Us 1 slot-machine. 2 cafeteria dispensing food and drink from slot-machines. [french: related to *automaton]

Menstruation  n. Process of discharging blood etc. From the uterus, usu. At monthly intervals from puberty to menopause.

Injunction  n. 1 authoritative order. 2 judicial order restraining a person or body from an act, or compelling redress to an injured party. [latin: related to *enjoin]

Respiration  n. 1 a breathing. B single breath in or out. 2 biol. (in living organisms) the absorption of oxygen and the release of energy and carbon dioxide. [latin spiro breathe]

Mourner  n. Person who mourns, esp. At a funeral.

Airplane  n. Us = *aeroplane.

Virago  n. (pl. -s) fierce or abusive woman. [latin, = female warrior]

Battle  —n. 1 prolonged fight between armed forces. 2 difficult struggle; contest (battle for supremacy; battle of wits). —v. (-ling) engage in battle; fight.  half the battle key to the success of an undertaking. [latin battuo beat]

Different  adj. 1 (often foll. By from or to) unlike, of another nature. 2 distinct, separate. 3 unusual.  differently adv.

Usage  in sense 1, different from is more widely acceptable than different to, which is common in less formal use.

Extravagant  adj. 1 spending money excessively. 2 excessive; absurd. 3 costing much.  extravagance n. Extravagantly adv. [latin vagor wander]

Countermand  —v. 1 revoke (a command). 2 recall by a contrary order. —n. Order revoking a previous one. [latin: related to *mandate]

Confounded  attrib. Adj. Colloq. Damned.

Dicta  pl. Of *dictum.

Sprinkle  —v. (-ling) 1 scatter in small drops or particles. 2 (often foll. By with) subject to sprinkling with liquid etc. 3 (of liquid etc.) Fall on in this way. 4 distribute in small amounts. —n. (usu. Foll. By of) 1 light shower. 2 = *sprinkling. [origin uncertain]

Std  abbr. Subscriber trunk dialling.

Serious  adj. 1 thoughtful, earnest. 2 important, demanding consideration. 3 not negligible; dangerous, frightening (serious injury). 4 sincere, in earnest, not frivolous. 5 (of music, literature, etc.) Intellectual in content or appeal; not popular.  seriously adv. Seriousness n. [latin seriosus]

Eliminate  v. (-ting) 1 remove, get rid of. 2 exclude from consideration. 3 exclude from a further stage of a competition through defeat etc.  elimination n. Eliminator n. [latin limen limin- threshold] (-ting) 1 remove, get rid of. 2 exclude from consideration. 3 exclude from a further stage of a competition through defeat etc.  elimination n. Eliminator n. [latin limen limin- threshold]

Conifer  n. Tree usu. Bearing cones.  coniferous adj. [latin: related to *cone]

Screenplay  n. Film script.

Revivify  v. (-ies, -ied) restore to animation, vigour, or life.  revivification n. [latin: related to *vivify]

Electrician  n. Person who installs or maintains electrical equipment for a living.

Forwent  past of *forgo.

Concatenation  n. Series of linked things or events. [latin catena chain]

Industrialism  n. System in which manufacturing industries are prevalent.

Incredible  adj. 1 that cannot be believed. 2 colloq. Amazing, extremely good.  incredibility n. Incredibly adv.

Euphony  n. (pl. -ies) 1 pleasantness of sound, esp. Of a word or phrase. 2 pleasant sound.  euphonious adj. [greek phone sound]

Tariff  n. 1 table of fixed charges (hotel tariff). 2 a duty on a particular class of goods. B list of duties or customs due. [arabic, = notification]

Seedsman  n. Dealer in seeds.

Redo  v. (redoing; 3rd sing. Present redoes; past redid; past part. Redone) 1 do again. 2 redecorate.

Rawhide  n. 1 untanned hide. 2 rope or whip of this.

Escape  —v. (-ping) 1 (often foll. By from) get free of restriction or control. 2 (of gas etc.) Leak. 3 succeed in avoiding punishment etc. 4 get free of (a person, grasp, etc.). 5 avoid (a commitment, danger, etc.). 6 elude the notice or memory of (nothing escapes you; name escaped me). 7 (of words etc.) Issue unawares from (a person etc.). —n. 1 act or instance of escaping. 2 means of escaping (often attrib.: escape hatch). 3 leakage of gas etc. 4 temporary relief from unpleasant reality. [latin cappa cloak]

Equatorial  adj. Of or near the equator.

Outstay  v. Stay longer than (one's welcome etc.).

Unimpressed  adj. Not impressed.

Nothing  —n. 1 not anything (nothing has been done). 2 no thing (often foll. By compl.: i see nothing that i want). 3 person or thing of no importance. 4 non-existence; what does not exist. 5 no amount; nought. —adv. Not at all, in no way.  be (or have) nothing to do with 1 have no connection with. 2 not be involved or associated with. For nothing 1 at no cost. 2 to no purpose. Have nothing on 1 be naked. 2 have no engagements. Nothing doing colloq. 1 no prospect of success or agreement. 2 i refuse. [old english: related to *no1, *thing]

Pentagon  n. 1 plane figure with five sides and angles. 2 (the pentagon) a pentagonal washington headquarters of the us forces. B leaders of the us forces.  pentagonal adj. [greek pentagonon: related to *penta-]

Backlash  n. 1 violent, usu. Hostile, reaction. 2 sudden recoil in a mechanism.

Unimaginable  adj. Impossible to imagine.

Neckline  n. Edge or shape of a garment-opening at the neck.

Fatality  n. (pl. -ies) 1 death by accident or in war etc. 2 fatal influence. 3 predestined liability to disaster.

Hectic  adj. 1 busy and confused; excited. 2 feverish.  hectically adv. [greek hektikos habitual]

Squeegee  n. Rubber-edged implement on a handle, for cleaning windows etc. [squeege, alteration of *squeeze]

Florentine  —adj. Of florence in italy. —n. Native or citizen of florence. [latin]

Thank  —v. 1 express gratitude to (thanked him for the present). 2 hold responsible (you can thank yourself for that). —n. (in pl.) 1 gratitude. 2 expression of gratitude. 3 (as a formula) thank you (thanks for your help).  thank goodness (or god or heavens etc.) Colloq. Expression of relief etc. Thanks to as the result of (thanks to my foresight; thanks to your obstinacy). Thank you polite formula expressing gratitude. [old english]

Polymer  n. Compound of one or more large molecules formed from repeated units of smaller molecules.  polymeric adj. Polymerize v. (also -ise) (-zing or -sing). Polymerization n. [greek polumeros having many parts]

Loss  n. 1 losing or being lost. 2 thing or amount lost. 3 detriment resulting from losing.  at a loss (sold etc.) For less than was paid for it. Be at a loss be puzzled or uncertain. [probably back-formation from *lost]

Licorice  var. Of *liquorice.

Vitreous  adj. Of or like glass. [latin vitrum glass]

Wigging  n. Colloq. Reprimand. [origin uncertain]

Lilo  n. (also li-lo propr.) (pl. -s) type of inflatable mattress. [from lie low]

Stopcock  n. Externally operated valve regulating the flow through a pipe etc.

Handcart  n. Small cart pushed or drawn by hand.

Ductile  adj. 1 (of metal) capable of being drawn into wire; pliable. 2 easily moulded. 3 docile.  ductility n. [latin: related to *duct]

Mw  abbr. 1 megawatt(s). 2 medium wave.

Frisson  n. Emotional thrill. [french]

Theoretician  n. Person concerned with the theoretical aspects of a subject.

Expansible  adj. That can be expanded.

Never  adv. 1 a at no time; on no occasion; not ever. B colloq. As an emphatic negative (i never heard you come in). 2 not at all (never fear). 3 colloq. (expressing surprise) surely not (you never left the door open!).  well i never! Expressing great surprise. [old english, = not ever]

Risky  adj. (-ier, -iest) 1 involving risk. 2 = *risqué.  riskily adv. Riskiness n.

Thundering  adj. Colloq. (esp. As an intensifier) huge (a thundering nuisance; a thundering great bruise).

Cosmogony  n. (pl. -ies) 1 origin of the universe. 2 theory about this. [greek -gonia -begetting]

Psychopathy  n. Psychopathic or psychologically abnormal behaviour.

Unfledged  adj. 1 (of a person) inexperienced. 2 (of a bird) not yet fledged.

Thin  —adj. (thinner, thinnest) 1 having opposite surfaces close together; of small thickness or diameter. 2 (of a line) narrow or fine. 3 made of thin material (thin dress). 4 lean; not plump. 5 not dense or copious (thin hair). 6 of slight consistency. 7 weak; lacking an important ingredient (thin blood; a thin voice). 8 (of an excuse etc.) Flimsy or transparent. —adv. Thinly (cut the bread very thin). —v. (-nn-) 1 (often foll. By down) make or become thin or thinner. 2 (often foll. By out) make or become less dense or crowded or numerous.  have a thin time colloq. Have a wretched or uncomfortable time. Thin on the ground few in number. Thin on top balding.  thinly adv. Thinness n. Thinnish adj. [old english]

Meteoroid  n. Small body that becomes visible as it passes through the earth's atmosphere as a meteor.

Wraith  n. 1 ghost. 2 spectral appearance of a living person supposed to portend that person's death. [origin unknown]

Kwh  abbr. Kilowatt-hour(s).

Asymmetry  n. Lack of symmetry.  asymmetric adj. Asymmetrical adj. [greek]

Sleet  —n. 1 snow and rain falling together. 2 hail or snow melting as it falls. —v. (prec. By it as subject) sleet falls (it is sleeting).  sleety adj. [old english]

Downstream  adv. & adj. In the direction in which a stream etc. Flows.

Animus  n. Animosity, ill feeling. [latin, = spirit, mind]

Rescript  n. 1 roman emperor's or pope's written reply to an appeal for a decision. 2 official edict or announcement. [latin rescribo -script- reply in writing]

Andante  mus. —adv. & adj. In a moderately slow tempo. —n. Such a passage or movement. [italian, = going]

Boardroom  n. Room in which a board of directors etc. Meets regularly.

Calabrese  n. Variety of broccoli. [italian, = calabrian]

By of) degree, extent, or amount (a measure of wit). 5 factor determining evaluation etc. (sales are the measure of popularity). 6 (usu. In pl.) Suitable action to achieve some end. 7 legislative bill, act, etc. 8 prescribed extent or quantity. 9 poetic metre. 10 mineral stratum (coal measures). —v. (-ring) 1 ascertain the extent or quantity of (a thing) by comparison with a known standard. 2 be of a specified size. 3 ascertain the size of (a person) for clothes. 4 estimate (a quality etc.) By some criterion. 5 (often foll. By off) mark (a line etc. Of a given length). 6 (foll. By out) distribute in measured quantities. 7 (foll. By with, against) bring (oneself or one's strength etc.) Into competition with.  beyond measure excessively. For good measure as a finishing touch. In some measure partly. Measure up 1 take the measurements (of). 2 (often foll.

Forsythia  n. Shrub with bright yellow flowers in early spring. [forsyth, name of a botanist]

Mucker  n. Slang friend, mate. [probably from muck in: related to *muck]

Ortho-  comb. Form 1 straight. 2 right, correct. [greek orthos straight]

By at) a try to seize. B take (an offer etc.) Eagerly. —n. 1 act of snatching. 2 fragment of a song or talk etc. 3 us slang kidnapping. 4 short spell of activity etc. [related to *snack]

Rsa  abbr. 1 royal society of arts. 2 royal scottish academy; royal scottish academician.

Contemplate  v. (-ting) 1 survey visually or mentally. 2 regard (an event) as possible. 3 intend (he is not contemplating retiring). 4 meditate.  contemplation n. [latin]

Cloudburst  n. Sudden violent rainstorm.

Cox  —n. Coxswain, esp. Of a racing-boat. —v. Act as cox (of). [abbreviation]

Improbable  adj. 1 unlikely. 2 difficult to believe.  improbability n. Improbably adv.

Positive  —adj. 1 explicit; definite, unquestionable (positive proof). 2 (of a person) convinced, confident, or overconfident in an opinion. 3 a absolute; not relative. B gram. (of an adjective or adverb) expressing a simple quality without comparison. 4 colloq. Downright (it was a positive miracle). 5 constructive (positive thinking). 6 marked by the presence and not absence of qualities (positive reaction). 7 esp. Philos. Dealing only with matters of fact; practical. 8 tending in a direction naturally or arbitrarily taken as that of increase or progress. 9 greater than zero. 10 electr. Of, containing, or producing the kind of electrical charge produced by rubbing glass with silk; lacking electrons. 11 (of a photographic image) showing lights and shades or colours unreversed. —n. Positive adjective, photograph, quantity, etc.  positively adv. Positiveness n. [latin: related to *position]

Mastiff  n. Dog of a large strong breed with drooping ears. [latin mansuetus tame]

Merchantable  adj. Saleable, marketable.

Chaste  adj. 1 abstaining from extramarital, or from all, sexual intercourse. 2 pure, virtuous. 3 simple, unadorned.  chastely adv. Chasteness n. [latin castus]

Archangel  n. Angel of the highest rank.

Repugnant  adj. 1 extremely distasteful. 2 contradictory.

Algebra  n. Branch of mathematics that uses letters etc. To represent numbers and quantities.  algebraic adj. [ultimately from arabic al-jabr, = reunion of broken parts]

Darnel  n. Grass growing in cereal crops. [origin unknown]

Def  adj. Slang excellent. [perhaps from *definite or *definitive]

Instructive  adj. Tending to instruct; enlightening.

Trying  adj. Annoying, vexatious; hard to endure.
